stone sayde wayes myght suffycyently knowen waygoers traueyllers countres hereafter ensuyth fyrst iiii wayes named fosse whyche stretchyd oute southe north begynneth dayes beganne corner totnesse cornewayle passed forth deuynshyre somersetshyre forth tutbury vpon cotteswolde besyde couetre vnto leycestre thennes wylde playnes towarde newerke endyth cytye lyncoln second waye named watlyngstrete stretcheth ouer thwarte ye wayes fosse southest northest beganne douer passeth myddell kente ouer thamys besyde london weste westmynster forth saynte albany weste syde dunstable stratford towceter south kyllyngburne kyllebourn athicston vnto gylbertes hyll named wrekyn forth seuarn passynge besyde wrokceter forth vnto stratton myddell walys vnto place called cardycan ye irysh se thyrde waye named ermyngstrete whyche stretcheth weste northweste vnto eest southeest bygynneth menema whych saynt dauies lande weste walys stretcheth forth vnto south hampton fourth last waye called called kykenyldis strete stretcheth forth worceter wycombe birmyngham lychefyld derby chesterfyeld yorke forth vnto tymmouth ye whych suffycyetly made grauted confermed suche priuyleges grauted duuallo fader whych priuyleges lawes hym made yt desyrous know let hym rede ouer ye traslacyon ye holy gildas made mulmutius lawes brytyshe speche latyne shall se circumstaunce euery thynge whyle belyn thus occupyed aboute nedes land brother brenne beyng sayde prouynce gallia takynge sore mynde hys expulsyon naturall coutre hauynge comforte myght attayn former dignite lastely resorted wyth xii persones onely accompanyed vnto duke ruler prouynce countre ye shall vnderstande dayes testyfyeth eutropi wryters gallis occupyed dyuers countres therfore titus liuius whych wrote ye actes dedes romayns made disstynccyon gallis nameth brene ladde beseigyd cytye rome ye capitoyll cenonenses galli name gallis coutre cytye cena stode yet doth testyfyeth authour cronica cronicaru countre italy named day etruria whiche cytye affermen sayde authours fyrste buylded foresayde gallis ye tyme brenne beyng theyr duke leder commynge incarnacyon cryste iii hundred lxxx vi yeres whyche maketh yere worlde folowynge accompte worke iiii thousand viii hundred xiii yeres yt foloweth ye story brenne comen presence duke named myne authour gaufride segin duke alebrog whyche vnderstande duke armorica named lytell brytayne policronica englyshe cronycle suffycyently declared shewed vnto hym aduersyte trouble ye sayd duke receyued hym courte personable well maneryd hauyng great experyence hawkynge huntynge propertyes apperteynynge gentylman hym shorte whyle especyall fauour noble man hys courte meane wherof lastly maryed doughter vpon condycyon yf dyed wythout issuemale shuld ruler ye countre yf yt happened hym haue heyre male yt withstadyng ayde helpe hym recouer lande loste whych condycyons well suerly vpon duke partye assent ye noble lade assured said duke within copas ye yere dyed whose deth conuenyent terme yt knowen duchesse wyfe wyth chyld lordes brene dyd homage became men whych lordes wynne theyr loues departed mych tresour shortly theyr assente gadered great armye hast sayled britayne make new warre vppon brother belyne certayn tyme landed whose landyng belyne enfourmed haste gaderyd brytons great nomber made towarde hym hys mortall enemye moder two brethern named conuuena englysh boke cornewey consyderynge ye mortall hateryd attwene two chylder partye theyr persones moderly naturall pyty went attwene two sonnes vsyd dyscrete maner moderly copassyon shewyng brestes demeanures length accorded whych accorde bretherne theyr lordes frendes sped vnto troynouant london many thynges orderyd made weale ye land codescended agreed lede theyr hostes gallia subdue sayde countre goodly haste might ppare ye iourney toke shyppyng sayled parte gallia brennyng wastynge ye conntre without pyty wytnessyth myn authour gaufryde shorte whyle subdued great parte gallia italy germania entend leue farther cesse myn authour gaufrid myche varieth writer authority eutropius titus liui dyd great dilygence writynge ye dedys actes romayns peple dwellyng dayes italia gallia germania sayd gaufryde sayth yt tyme belyn brenne made warre italye gabius porsena day consules rome sayeng farre dyscordaunt vnto foresayd authours afferme tyme whenne brene besegyd rome claudi emilius lucius lucretius consulis furius camillus ye tyme dictatour rome none lyke vnto cosules many yeres trouth yt sayde ii bretherne dyd many great actes ye forenamed countres accordynge wyth sayeng ye sayd gaufride referreth dedys bothe bretherne forenamed titus liui spekyth brenne onely yt shall dele touched hereafter wherefore folowe moste wryters belyn hadde dwelled certayne tyme wyth hys brother brenne partyes agrement belyn retourned britayn brenne remayned xxxi chapiter belinus belyn retourned brytayne repayred olde cytyes buyldyd vppon ryuer uske cytye called yt caeruske nere vnto ryuer seuerne city namyd ye cyty legios mych ye legion romaynes lodgyd wythin ye citye yt called caerleon carleon also buylded hauen wyth gate ouer wythin troynouat ye summer pynacle wheron set vessell brasse closyd asshes brent body dede gate long called belyns belin gate day yt called belyngesgate whyle belinus thus occupyed brytayne broder brenne desyrous wynne fame honoure buylded italy partes gallia cytyes townes folowynge mediolana mylleyn lubardy papya papy burgamum sena comum briria uerona uincentia cremona mantua whyche cytyes townes buylded gallis leste new repayred tyme brenne theyr leder duke yt wryters wold meane comum cremona buylded brenne dede policronica wytnessyth senons whych meaneth ye gallis dwellyng aboute cytye sena ye ledyng brenus ouercame romaynes xi myle rome ryuer albia chasyd rome toke city vnto capitoll leyd syege ye capitol vppon nyght whyle wardeyns ye capitoll slepte ye freshemen gallys waye vnder erth came capitoll lykely haue wonne noble romayne named mallius manlius torquatus awoke cryeg noyse gander gaders manlius awakyng romaynes put gallys whych cause ye romayns long tyme helde feste gander ye fyrst daye iune neuerthelesse afterwarde called inos feste mych thought iuno ye goddes influence gyuen grace vnto gander shuld theyr noyse awake romayns yet gallis frenchman held ye romayns short yt copelled gyue vnto bren theyr duke thousand poude weyght gold therof wytnesse tit liuius sayth ye sayd liui ye gallis slewe senatours many nomber whych fyrste supposed hadde ben goddes bycause theyr ryche apparell whych sat shortly forenamyd furius camillus whiche called agayne fro citye ardea outlawed comontye rome nede made agayne dictatour pursued brenne people theym gaue batayll sleynge great multytude wanne golde iewellys tyme ye gallis hadde wonne romaynes whyche dede done wytnessyth foresayd titus liuius yere buyldyng rome iii hundred lxv whych yere worlde folowynge accompt worke foure thousand viii hundred xxxv crystys incarnacyon kepynge accompt iii hundred lxiiii yt foloweth storye brenne thus dyscomfyted romaynes tourned people towarde macedones grekes dyuyded people two hostes wherof reteyned yt one hym sent countre called gallacia gallogreci lastly galates brenne ouercame macedon theyr duke sosten spoyled goddes theyr temple sayde game ryche goddes muste gyue men somedele theyre rychesse also spoyled temple god apolyne delphicus standynge hyll mounte parnasus wherfore testifyeth wryter policarpus people countre prayed god helpe sodaynly erth beganne quake great parte hyll fell vpon hoste gallis slew ensued fyll grounde hayle stone suche greatnesse yt yt slew one great parte sayde hoste duke brennus sore wounded wher fyll suche dyspayre slew hym self owne swerde man shall wonder though thys apolyn toke wreche spoyled goddes theyr temple god sufferyd apolyn destroy many nacyons theyr trespass euyll lyuynge yt certayne spyrytes eyre may vse theyr shrewdnes mysbyleue vse euyll dedes grace wythdrawen maner men wherfore spirites haue power hurte greue syns haue shewed vnto fyne ende brennus shall nowe retourne style vnto brother belynus whyche towched endeuoryd hym aboute weale hys lande brytayne people duryng ye tyme reygne executyng many notable dedes whyche length tyme ouer passe lastely dyed buryed sayde belius belinus gate wythin troynouante london reygned wyth brother alone concordauce wryters xxvi yeres leuyng hym sonne called gurguyntus gurguynt brabtruc aftersome wryters gurguynt barberous whyche meane gurguynt wyth red berde xxxii chapiter gurguintus gurguynt sonne belyne made kynge lande brytayne yere worlde foure mviii hundred xxxiiii englyshe cronycle named corynbratus corynbatus whych myche trybute grau ted guilthdak kyng demark vnto kynges brytayne perpetuyty denayed arrayed army nauye sayled denmarke wasted harmed countre wyth iron fyre wyse length kynge denmarke wyth assent baronage graunted paye contynue foresayde tribute yerely thousande poude whyche vyctorye thus hadde danys wyth great tryumphe retourned towarde britayn kepynge hys course encountred wyth nauye xxx sayle besyde yle orchades full men woman whyche flote chyefe captayne called moste wryters bartholomew whyche brought vnto kynges presence shewyd wyth people putte exyled countre spayne named balenses sayled longe tyme vppon see ende fynde prynce wold gyue dwellynge place become subiectys holde theyr lande hym besechynge kynge haue compassyon graunt place enhabyte shulde lenger dwell theyr shyppes cosyderyng theyr vytayle spent reason theyr long lyeng vpon ye see whych request thus made theyr captayne kyng aduyse baron graunted vnto voyde waste countre whyche farthest ile iles towarde weste whych yle sayth englyshe cronycle named irelande name theyr captayn called englyshe cronycle irlamal wyll knowe fyrste cause namynge yle irlande lette hym rede xxxii xxxiii chapytres fyrste boke policronica shall fynd ye certaynly ye fyrst namynge therof many thynges touchynge ye sayd yle whych ouerpasse length ye mater shall suffyciently enfourmed also thynges yt foloweth story gurguintus retourned lande britayne ordeyned stablyshed kepte ye lawes made forefaders exersysyd iustyce subiectes guyded lande well nobly terme moste wryters xix yeres dyed buryed newe troye london caerleon leuynge hym sonne named myne authoure guynthelinus named guyntellius xxxiii chapiter guinthelin guintellius ye sonne gurguintus made kynge brytayne yere world iiii thousande viii hundred liii named englyshe cronycle gwentolyne whyche guyded lande brytons great mekenesse sobernesse hadde also noble wyfe called marcia instructe lerned many scyeces whych amonge noble dedys done studyed broughte forth certayne good conuenyent lawe amonge brytons whyche named longe marcyan lawe lawe yt thought good necessary aluredus whyche longe kynge englande translated oute bretyshe saxon speche yt called translacyon saxon tonge marthehelage whych meane lawe marcia woma wysdome committed gouernaunce lande myche wytnessyth myne authoure gaufryde reygned quene brytayne certayne tyme husbande dede yeres reygne accompted yeres husbande wyth yeres sonne sisillius tyme asserteyned deputed sette yt foloweth whe guinhelinus hadde reygned well mekely terme xxvi yeres dyed buryed newe troy london leuyng hym son named sisillius cecilius xxxiiii chapiter sisillius cecili sonne guynthelinus made kynge brytayne yere world iiii thousande viii hundred lxxix englysh cronycle named seyzyl whych mencion worthy memory made al yt gaufryde meaneth yt sisillius vii yeres age father dyed wherfore charge realme committed vnto marcia moder guyded yt well suffycyently tyll sayde sonne came lawfull age resygnyd hym ye rule whyche contynued longe reygned gaufryde expressyth wherfore folowe sayenge forenamed authoure called floure historyes affermeth hym reygne onely vii yeres yt englyshe boke sayeth reygned xv yeres whyche agreeth well wyth concordaunce historyes tymes sisillius gaufryde wytnessyth left sonne named kymarus whome englysh boke nameth kymor xxxv chapiter rimarus sonne sisillius made kynge brytayne yere worlde iiii thousande viii hundred lxxx vi englyshe boke called kymor yt whych made mencyon nother hys tyme reygne dedes partye wryters reherse moste breuest shorteste maner yt kimar reygned elani elani morindus ye old cronycle whych haue tyme spoken sayth kymarus nameth kymarch elani wylde yonge man lyued hys pleasure wherfore dysporte huntynge euyll willers slayne whe hadde ruled skarsly iii yeres xxxvi chapiter elanius sonne kymar wytnessyth foresayde floure cronycles broder kimarus sayth gaufride made kynge brytayne yere worlde foure thousand viii hundred lxxx ix whyche englyshe boke named howan also mecyon made memory nother acte reygn forenamed olde cronycle sayth kymarus elanius one persone reygned sayde abouesayd writer called floure hystoryes sayth reygned fully two yeres xxxvii chapiter morindus bastarde sonne elanius sayth gaufryde made kynge brytayne ye yere ye world foure thousande viii hundred lxxx xi whych englyshe cronicle called morwith witnesseth gaufryde goten vppon concubyne elanius named tanguestela man worthy fame dedys chyualry ouercome wrath cruelnesse yt lyghtly slew men hym tened angred also beauteouse persone lyberall gyftes wyth meruelouse strength mych pere wythin realm man noble byrthe tyme came brytayne prynce oute countre called mauritania whyche countre dayes assygned strabo ye wryter betwene kyngdomes hungary beame whych prynce wyth cruell fyers people wasted lad britayne iron fyre wythout pytye wherof morindus beynge warned haste gaderyd people hym mette faught wyse chasyd sayde prynce agayne see toke many sowdyours prysoners whyche satysfyeng cruelnesse tyranny caused put deth syght dyuerse maners tormentes heedynge fleynge brennynge cruell execucyons lastely testyfyeth guydo de columpna morindus walkynge rydynge vppon see stronde espyed woderfull monstre whych corage knyght hod thought sle maly corage force assayled monstre beste fyghtyng wyth yt certayne tyme conclusyon deuoured swalowyd sayd monstre reygned moste wryters terme viii yeres leuynge hym wytnessyth gaufryde fyue sonnes wherof fyrste named gorbomanus secunde archygallo thyrde elidurus fourth uigenius nigenius fyfte yongest peredurus xxxviii chapiter gorbamanus fyrste sonne morind made king brytayne yere world foure thousande viii hundred lxxx xviii englyshe cronycle y named granbodyan whyche testifyeth gaufryde iuste ryghtwyse man ye goddes people yelded eyther partye y say goddes yelded due reuerence sacrifyce people iustyce equyte renewed repayred olde temple thorough realme buylded newe tyme welth plente realme mych predecessours dayes fynally ye great sorow brytons taken wyth sykenesse dyed wythout issue body hadde reygned moste wryters terme xi yeres xxxix chapiter archigallo seconde sonne morindus broder vnto gorbomanus made kynge brytayne yere ye worlde foure thousande ix hundred x englyshe boke named artogayll whyche folowed nothynge workes brother gaue hym selfe discencyon stryfe imagyned cause agayne noble put theyr goodes dygnytyes theyr place sette ordeyne vnnoble rude byrthe maner ryche synystre wrongfull meanes plucked theyr ryches goodes whyche inordynate meanes enryched hym self impoueryshed subiectes whyche condycyons lordes subiectes murmuryd agaynst hym lastly one assent toke verely depryuyd hym honour kyngly dygnyte hadde reygned moste concordaunce wryters fyue yeres xl chapiter elid ru thyrde sonne morindus brother archigallo one assent brytons made kynge brytayne yere worlde iiiimix hundred xv ye englyshe cronycle named hisider esodyr became myld benygne brytons gaue hym surname called hym elidure ye meke amoge dedys mekenes vpon daye dysporte huntynge wode nere vnto caerbrak yorke called calater wryters caltras fande elder brother archigallo late kynge maskelyng wandrynge thykest woode whome louyngly charytably secrete maner conueyed vnto owne mancyo ye cytye named aldud acliut affermeth myn authour gaufryde thentent brynge brother former dygnytye foloweth sayd elidurus fayned hym selfe syke haste sente messagers aboute realme gather assemble baron lade daye assemble comyn lordes accordynge commaundement present called one one honour secrete cubycle chamber wyse dyscrete wordes well benygne louynge maner wordes countenaunce apperteynyng royall power dygnyty gat graunte sayd lordes shuld ayde stregth hym theyr power brynge hys brother archigallo former honour regally graut lordes made assembled counsayll brytons caerbrank yorke caused suche meanes made comons conclusion sayd elidurus hadde ruled lande v yeres kynge resygned crowne kyngly power vnto sayde brother archigallo xli chapiter archigallo thus restored kyngly dygnyte remembred well euyl lyfe tyme ladde punishement suffred ye wherfore eschewynge lyke daunger chaunged hys olde condicyons became good ryghtwyse man mynystryng people equyte iustyce bare hym nobly agayne lordes ruler vnder hym landes belouyd dradde hys subiectes contynued duryng terme naturall lyfe fynally payde dette nature hadde reygned nowe lastly moste wryters x yeres buryed sayth sayde olde cronycle caerbranke yorke xlii chapiter elidurus named agayne one assent ye brytons made kynge yere worlde iiii thousande ix hundred xxx two yonger bretherne uigenius peredurus hauynge hym indignacyon vertue good gouernauce well fauoured brytons malyce conspyryd agayne hym gatheryd army soudiours made felde wyth hym felde toke hym commauded hym vnto towre troynouat sayth gaufryde prysoner sauely kepte hadde reygned nowe laste space wytnesseth old cronycle ii yeres xliii chapiter uigenius peredurus ye yongest sonnes morind bretherne elidurus sayde ioyntly made kynges brytayne yere worlde foure thousande ix hundred xxxii two bretherne named ye engleshe cronycle higanius petytur whych testyfyeth gaufryde departed ye land betwene yt ye land water huber westwarde fyll uigenius nigeni part land also albania scotlande fyll vnto peredurus saynge guydo de columna uigenius nigeni kyng alonely peredurus whych sayth helde brother elidurus pryson owne assent myche elidurus wyllyng kynge affermeth sayde guydo peredurus cruell tyrannous britayns slew entreated ye lordes moste cruell maner wherfore became odyous rebelled agaynst hym slew hym sayeng contraryeth enpugnyth myne authoure gaufryde sayeng yt uigeni dyed reygned vii yeres whose deth peredurus seasyd lande owne rule ruled yt wyth great sobernesse wyse excelled preysed aboue brethern elidur clene forgoten brytons englysh cronycle also sayth peredurus founded town pikeryng fynally taken wyth sodayne sykenesse whereof dyed reygned wyth brother alone accorde moste wryters ix yeres leuynge hym chylde heyr xliiii chapiter elidur named soone peredurus dede myche next heyre crowne taken forth pryson made thyrde tyme kynge brytayne yere ye world iiii thousande ix hundred xli whyche tyme vsyd hym selfe contynued styll mynystrynge persones ryght iustyce dayes lyfe lastely beynge good age dyed whe reygned moste concordaunce wryters iiii yeres leuynge hym son named gorbonianus gorbomanus wytnesseth olde cronycle englyshe cronycle ye fore named elidurus buryed caerleyl karlele xlv chapiter ye shall vnderstande yt deth foresayde elidure wryters storye brytons wryten dyuersly one varyeth greatly ye name also tyme theyre reygnes wold aske long tyme reherse order dyuersytye one also reders ye mater therof shulde small pleasure wherfore suche ben desyrous knowe ye tyme season passed betwene laste yere elidurus fyrst yere lud whych passe tyme reygned britayne xxxii writer xxxiii kyng let hym loke table ye begynnynge worke shall se conceyt ye declaracyon ye yeres passed spent betwene forsayd two kynges elidurus lud prayege hym shall loke sayde draught yf haue poynte erryd theyr goodnes wolde wyth good delyberacyon correcte amende yt semeth al authours haue redde seen guydo de columna reherseth breuely passetyme sayde kynges therfore purpose reherse sayenge hath left yt v latyn xlvi chapiter gorbonian gorbomanus sonne regny sonne elidure made kynge brytayne yere worlde foure thousande ix hundred xlv succedyd margan marga emerian brother ye sayd margan whyche emerianus depryuyd cruelnes hym reygned xx kynges successyuely one whyche sayth myn authour guydo mencyon made eyther theyr rudenesse ellys crueltye dyscordaunte meanes maners vsed ye tyme theyr reygnes whyche mysorder clerkes disdayned wryte put memory next laste foresayd xx kynges succedyd blegabridus connynge musycyan whyche excellence facultye called brytons god glemen blegabrid thus kyng dyed succeded ix kynges whome former cosyderacyon nother name tyme reygne put memory laste whyche ix kynges agremet wryters named hely whych hely wryters reygned xl yeres bare vii monethes whych xxxiii kynges tymes passed flowed say laste yere elidure vnto last yere foresayde hely fornamed table apperyth hudred lxxxvi yeres whyche sayde hely lefte hym iii sonnes named lud cassibellanus neurius xlvii chapiter lud eldeste sonne hely made kyng brytayn yere ye worlde v thousand hundred xxxi honourable dedes edyfyed new temple repayred olde also repayred olde cytyes townes specyally cytye troynouant causyd many buyldynges made gyrde sayde citye wyth strong wall lyme stone weste parte sayde walle arreryd fayre stronge gate commauded called luddys gate whych daye clepyd ludde gate loued myche cytye vsed myche moste lye reason wherof yt called caerlud luddys towne corrupcyon shortynge speche yt named london whych name daye remayneth abydeth lud also wytnessyth gaufryde stroge myghty army subduynge enymyes also lyberall gyftes plentuouse houshold yt myche loued drad britos hadde contynued hys reygn great honour ye terme xi yeres dyed buryed gate called portlud ludgate leuynge hym wytnessyth gaufryde two sonnes androgeus temancius tenancius xlviii chapiter cassibellan brother lud made kyng brytayn yere worlde v thousand hundred xlii myche ii sonnes named lud yonge insuffycyent take hand great charge wytnessyth olde cronycle also authour floure historyes thys cassybellan made kynge ruler protectour lande tyme nonage foresayde brethern yt myne authour gaufryde sayth yt cassibellan sette authorite became noble lyberall name sprange farre exercysynge iustyce brytons ought hym fauour eyther neuewes yt cheryshed brought theym forth accordyng theyr byrth came vnto yeres dyscrecyon gaue androge cytye london wyth dukedome erledome kent temancius dukedome cornewayll season caius iuli whyche moste commonly called iulius cesar sente senate rome felowe consull wyth lucius bubulus gallia nowe called fraunce subdue vnto empyre rome whyche iulius beyng vppon see syde ouercome gallis beholdyng whyte clyues rockes brytayne enquyred countre people dwelled therin suffycyently enfourmed commodytyes therof great wyll brynge sayde countre vnder yocke romaynes mych dayes great parte worlde tributary rome sayth myne authour fyrste exorted briton writyng messagers gyue trybute vnto rome wherfore cassybellan hauynge indygnacyon wrote vnto hym sharpe short answeres shewyng euery noble man bounde specyally kepe coutre seruage kepe subiectes myght enioy lybertye franchise whyche obserue wold vttermost power myght wyth answere iulius beynge nothynge cotentyd hast made redy nauy people sayled towarde brytayne whe romaynes comyn nere land brytayne shuld haue landed ye brytons pyght sharpe stake longe vppon bankes causyd theym wynne lande wyth great daunger longe theyr landynge cassibellan wyth stronge hoste briton encountred romaynes gyuynge yeldyng suche fyght batayll fayne resorte theyr shyppes theyr suertye wyth standyng ye witnesseth gaufride iulius hadde renewed knyghtes also ryggyd nauye came agayne seconde tyme entendynge subdue land empyre rome tyme manhode kynge brytons manfully knyghtly wythstaden chasyd seconde tyme lyke wise ouercome compelled flee wythout honoure whych vyctory thus twyes obteyned brytons cassibellan entendynge gyue thanke vnto goddes rewarde hys knyghtes goodly haste caused assemble made lordes knyghtes cytye caerlud london dew obseruaunces done theyr goddes ye vse theyr pagan lawes great solemne feste holden kynge wolde come wyth moste lyberalytye plentye necessarye feste encrease kynges honoure comforte dilectacion lordes beynge present maner kyn game dayes exercysed vsed contynewynge whyche feste two noble yonge knyghtes amonge hapened assey eyther wrastlyng wherof one neuew kyng cassibellan named hirelda ye named euelinus allyed vnto androgeus erle duke london meane wrastlynge dyuysyon vnfyttynge wordes fyll betwene two yonge knyghtes yt wordes ensued stroke meane wherof partyes take eyther syde whyche ranne gyder great malyce eyther part many diuers hurte wounded among whome hirelda neuew kynge slayne whych caused great dysturbaunce courte amonge lordes knowlege deth hirelda brought vnto ye kyng therwyth greatly amoued entendynge dewe iustice hadde mynystred thaduyce baron causyd forenamed cosyn androgeus euelinus sommoned appere hym hys counsayll acquyte hym suche cryme hym layde deth hirelda slayne euelinus cousayll androgeus wythstode commaundement shortly sayde androgeus euelyne departed courte wythoute takynge leue kynge kynge dysdaynynge demeanure androge dyuers monycyons hym gyuen gathered knightes made warre vpon androgeus wherfore cosyderyng many way meanes thought yt power wythstand kynges great indignacyon sent letter vnto caius iuli cesar shewynge hym circumstaunce mater aduoydynge hym gylt besought prayed moste humble wyse wolde shortly retourne wyth army brytayne wyth hole power shuld redy ayde helpe hym agayne brytons message iulius glad haste made towarde brytayne wyth great power ye wynde fauourable yt short tyme message drew nere ye land affermeth myne authour gaufryde wold lande ferynge treason androgeus receyued fro hym hostage sonne named scena wyth xxx moste noble lordshyppe done landed wyth helpe ayde androgeus wherof cassibellan hadde warnynge haste made towarde romaynes valey nere vnto dorobernia named canterbury foude hoste ye said iuli lodged androge power whych knowlege eyther wyth theyr habyllemetes warre eyther greued tyll legth host mette hande hand faught vygerously wise many fell eyther partye brytons sayth gaufryde hadde longe foughten knyghtly defended romaynes androge peple came wynge brytons sharpely assayled constreyned forsake feld place yt kepte whiche flyght dyscoforted fynally fledde gaue place romaynes pursued slewe withoute pytye cassibellan wyth brytons lefte fayne gette place suerty reste tyll myght newly prouyde wyth stande theyr enemyes fynally wryters agre iulius helde kyng shorte vnytye concorde fayne become trybutary romaynes paye yerely certayne trybute whych gaufryd affermeth iii thousande poud sayde trybute set suertye sayd romaynes wyth yt contented iulius hadde accomplyshed wyll pleasure thynges hym thought necessary androgeus departed lande spedde hym towarde rome soone agayn ye ye senatours made emperour tribute thus grauted cassibellan hadde reygned kynge britayne fully viii yeres xlix chapiter begynnynge trybute payde cassibellan vnto romayns shuld seme concordaunce wryters vpon xl viii yeres crystes incarnacyon l profe fyrste sayenge haue shewed conceyte tabyll named whych remytte correccyon haue fyte vndertandynge calculynge hystoryes tymes make ende seconde parte worke yeldynge grace oure moste consolatryce moste blessed virgyne lady saynt mary whyche agayne salute wyth seconde forsayde vii ioyes whyche begynneth gaude sponsa chara dei c ioyous thou spouse god moste whyche lyke sonne moste clerest syght daye shyneth moste clere worlde illumynest meanes full ryght thorowe vertue thy full myght causest worlde resplendissaunt meane thy pea full habundaunt seconde parte accompted last yere dyscorde brytons ende ix yere cassybellan includeth yeres iii hundred lxxx iii thyrde parte l chapiter thus maye vnderstande apoyntmet made cassibellan contynued styll kynge gouernour land brytayn whyche moste cocordaunce writer hadde reygned made trybutarye vppon ix yeres whyche sayde ix yeres made yere worlde folowynge thaccompte expressyd fyue thousand hu dred l reygned thagremet writer kyng lande fully vii yeres graute ye tribute reygned vppon xvi yeres li chapiter nowe haue shewyd iulius cesar ayde helpe androgeus erle kent made land brytayn trybutarye romaynes cassibelan ben kyng sayd lande vppon ix yeres whych ix yeres haue sette ende seconde parte worke x yere cassibellan fyrst yere thyrde parte sayde worke writer testyfye cassibellan contynued departynge iulius kyng terme space vii yeres declared tyme ye whych vii yeres none noble acte dede hym put memory wrytynge wold thynke caius iulius cesar hadde thorough helpe androgeus erle kent eldest sonne lud thus sayde subdued cassibellan sayd iulius wold haue restoryd sayde androgeus crowne brytayne ryghtfull inherytauce clerely haue expelled put oute sayd cassibellan kyngly dygnyty answereth olde cronycle sayth cassibellan sonne hely eldeste sonne lud reason wherof fyrste made kyng ryghtfull heyre contynued durynge hys lyfe kynge brytayne whych hadde reygned ix yeres trybutary vii yeres affermeth sayde olde cronicle xvi yeres dyed wythoute issue buryed caerbranke yorke lii chapiter temanci tenancius yongest sonne lud affermeth gaufryde made kyng ye brytos yere world fyue thousande hundred lvii named englyshe cronycle tormace kynge sayde boke affermeth elder brother whych sayde boke named androgen affyrmaunce sayd englyshe cronycle made kynge foresayd gaufryde testyfyen myche androgeus feryd euer hated ye brytons treason wroughte agaynst kyng lande therfore chase go caius iulius rome rather kyng thought wolde neuer haue hym theyr loue fauoure yt foloweth ye storye tenacius ruled land great dylygence iustyce defended lande well knyghtly agayne alyautis straugers payde trybute romaynes cassibellan graunted lastly dyed reygned wryters xxiii yeres buryed caerlud london leuynge hym sonne whyche called kymbeline liii chapiter kymbelinus kymbelyne sonne tenancius ye brytos made kynge yere worlde v thousande hundred lxxx man wytnesseth guydo brought vp rome amonge romaynes made knyght suche fauoure lyberty pay trybute hym lytell memorye made excepte wryters agreen ye season kynge sauyoure cryste iesus incarnate moste blessyd virgine lady saynt mary shulde accorde historyes xix yere reygne reygne kymbelyn authours wryte dyuersly yt shewe yeres fewe whych accord wyth tyme cronycles authour hystorye called floure historyes wytnessyth yt reygned xxxv yeres whyche sayeng lyst se ye table rehersed shall haue knowlege sayd auctoure accordeth beste wyth storyes cronycles kymbelyne reygned gloryously ouer ye brytons season expressyd dyed buryed caerlud london leuynge hym two sonnes named guyderius aruiragus haue shewed vnto ye later chapyter yt criste incarnate xix yere kymbelyne whyche maketh yere worlde saye fro fyrste creacyon adam incarnacyon v thousande hundred lxxx xix whyche accompt approuyd holy isodore beda cryste incarnate yere ye world expressed no flood ii thousande ix hundred lvii abraham ii thousande xvii dauid kyng israell thousande lxxv trasmygracyon iewes babylon v hudred lxxx x brute entred britayne xi hundred xxxvi alexander great nere vppon iii hundred xxv buyldynge rome vii hu dred xxix begynnyng ye xlii yere octauius augustus emperour rome liiii chapiter guyderius fyrste sonne kymbalyne beganne reygne ouer briton yere worlde v thousande cc xvi yere cristes incarnacyon ye xvii yere man welthy trusted mych stregth thought romayns hadde forenamed trybute wronge therfore knyghtly courage denyed romaynes sayde trybute wherfore claudi whych vncle vnto caius caligula iiii emperour rome came brytayne great armye romaynes wytnessyth policronica co queryd wanne agayne sayde trybute wythout great fyght yt done also subdued yles orchades orkeys whych stande beyonde scotlad within great occean tourned agayne rome vi moneth came then cronycle englande also gaufryde saye hoste romaynes captayne named hame hamo whych entendynge hurte destruccyon ye brytons chaunged shelde armure dyd vppon hym armure britayne meane briton mysclad entred thyckest hoste lastely vnto place kynge guyderius faught shortly slewe kynge aruiragus seynge sodayne myschyefe ende yt brytons shulde gyue backe hastely causyd hym selfe armed wyth cognysaunce kynge kyng cotynued fyght wyth mahode romaynes put flyght thus accorde wryters guyderius slayne foresayde hamo hadde reygned ouer brytons concordaunce hystoryes xxviii yeres leuyng hym none heyre body guyde lande deth lv chapiter aruiragus yongest sonne kymbelyne brother guyderius slayn ordeyned kyng brytons yere lorde xliiii englyshe boke named armager whyche shewed well knyghtly maynteyned warre agayne romayns slew forenamed hamo nere vnto hauen porte see hym slayne threwe gobet meale see skyll haue longe tyme called hamos hauen whych daye called southampton yt foloweth viii chapyter iiii boke policronicon claudius dyuers happes batayll toke aruirag grace brought doughter gennissa name rome maried vnto aruiragus wolde make place ye maryage solemne therfore called towne mariage claudiocestria name whych called bretyshe tunge caerleon glouernia duke demecia hyght glorio nowe towne named glouceter otherwyse telleth englyshe cronycle sayth armager scomfyted claudius compelled hym gyue doughter genissa ge nen sayde armager wyfe wyth condycyon romayns shulde neuer daye clayme trybute brytayne excepte alonely feawte whyche sayenge appereth doutefull dyuers cause wherof one sayde armager shulde constrayne claudius gyue doughter hym myche sayde armager hadde neuer seen sayde gennen tyme knewe co uersacyon meruayle yt shulde force father gyue hym wyfe hadde cast loue vnto tyme one reason sayde cronycle testyfyeth hadde maryed sayd gennen london crowned kynge englande wold thinke ouercome claudius surmytted wold fyrste haue crowned hym selfe kyng haue maried doughter reason yt certifyeth strenger former sayenge policronica lykelyhode claudius wold suffer hym crowned kyng tyll hadde full perfourmed promyse maryage doughter yt myne authoure gaufryde varyeth myche englyshe cronicle thynke ye doynge toke example homer wrote dedis actes grekes whyche shewed put memory noble actes done specyally recuyll boke made hym syege troye dedys concernynge theyr dyshonoure hyd yt mych myght lyke maner many writer passe ouer gaufride bryton shewed beste brytons yt foloweth solemnysacyon maryage whyche honour finyshed claudius sente certayne legyons knyghtes irlande rule countre retourned hym selfe rome lvi chapiter longe departynge claudius yt aruiragus rode aboute realme wyth great dylygence repayred cytyes townes decayed broken wyth strength romaynes entreated subiectes wyth suche iustyce good order loued drad hym progenitours tracte tyme made hym welthy meane welthynes ensued pryde yt hym thought great shame vnder rule guydynge ye romayns wherfore lastly denyed tribute grau ted wherof knowlege came vnto ye senate rome hast sent duke rome called uespasyan wyth certayne legyons subdue aruiragus ye shall vnderstand legyon knyghtes vi thousande vi hundred lxvi uespasyan landed brytayne testyfyeth polycronica spedde hym shorte whyle subdued aruiragus empyre causyd hym graunte payment foresayde trybute done sayth gaufride entreatye quene gennissa constraynt coaccyon uespasyan hadde thus recoueryd trybute also made subiecte empyre yle see lyenge vpon southsyde britayne called yle weyght retourned rome aruiragus thus secondely brought vnder yocke ye romayns became mylde towarde whyle lyued payed hys trybute wyth lesse grudge contynued hym theyr fauours suche wyse theym well beloued lastely dyed hadde ruled brytos well nobly terme xxx yeres buryed caerglon caerleon claudiocestria glouceter leuynge hym sonne named marius lvii chapiter marius sonne aruirag ordeyned kynge brytons yere lorde lxxiiii cronycle englande named westmer whych marius wytnessyth gaufryde excellent wyse man guyded brytons moste honourably grete prosperyte welthe tyme reygne mari duke kynge nacyon called pyctes whych wytnessyth uirgilius descendyd people called olde tymes scythis also named gothis hunys foresayde leder pictes named gaufryde londricus landed wyth great nauy prouynce albania called scotlande yt beganne waste iron wyth fyre wherof whe marius warned haste assembled knyghtes made towarde enymyes gaue vnto stronge batayll whych lodricus rodic slayne great parte people slayne remembraunce whyche vyctorye kynge marius lette arrere great stone commaunded grauen marii victoria whych meane victorye marius wyllyam malmesburye sayth stone arered mynde marius consull rome englyshe cronycle sayth batayll foughte place whyche called stanysmore stone set countre aboute longe called westmaria nowe westmerlande yt foloweth story resydue people lodricus whyche fledde felde vnderstode theyr hedde captayne slayne made hu ble request vnto ye kynge yt wolde accepte vnto grace wold graunt theym lande countre dwell whych grau ted vnto place ferre ende scotlande whyche named myne authoure cathenesia sayd scythis pictes fyrst inhabyted myche brytons dysdayned gyue vnto theyr doughters maryage therfore acqueynted wyth iryshe men maryed theyr doughters grewe proces great people allyaunce attwene iryshe theyr countre wytnessyth policronycon ye xxxvii chapyter hys fyrste boke called irlande pictauia lastely scotlande marius thus subdued enemyes attendyd sette mynde common wele lande subiectes contynued ye resydue lyfe great tranquillite reste lastely payde naturall tribute buryed caerleyll leuyng hym sonne named coill coyll whe hadde reygned moste wryters lii yeres lviii chapiter coyllus sonne marius deth father made kynge brytons yere oure lordes incarnacyon hu dred xxvi hys infancy noryshed brought vppe amonge romaynes italia rome reason wherof theym louynge kynde vnto hym myche knewe power romayns great auoydyng warre daunger payde vnto foresayde trybute duryng lyfe coillus also wytnessyth gaufryde lyberall man gyftes reason wherof obteyned great loue noble also co mon authours haue coyll made towne colchester whych daye fayre town shyre essex ascrybe yt coell coill kynge nexte asclepeodotus coillus hadde reygned soueraygne peace ye terme liiii yeres dyed buryed caerbrank yorke lefte hym sonne whyche named lucius lucy lix chapiter lucius lucy sonne coillus made kynge brytons yere oure lorde hundred lxxx whych actes dedes goodnes folowed forefaders suche wyse men beloued drad litell none acte notable put memorye excepte wryters agree lucius sent eleutherius pope rome certayne pystles letter prayeng hym briton myght receyued fayth crystes chyrche wherof pope beynge ioyous gladde sente brytayne two noble clerkes named faganus dunianus fugacius dimianus two good vertuous clerkes honourably receyued lucius whych theyr good doctryne vertuous example gyuynge couertyd kynge great parte brytons myche authours wryters wryte dyuersly ye tyme receyuynge fayth lucius one varyeth greatly therfore haue shewed forenamed table yt shall vnder correccyon appere yt fayth receyued lucius affermeth petrus pictauiens viii yere reygne sayde lucius yt yere cristes incarnacion hundred lxxxviii whych lucye fayth thus hym receyued aduyce foresayde clerkes wyth instruccyons sent theym foresayde pope eleuthery instituted ordeyned partye archeflamynys flamynys whyche meane archbysshoppes bysshoppes pagan lawe whyche daye nomber wytnessyth gaufryde iii archeflamynys xxviii flamynys made ordeyned archebyshoppes byshoppes ye chyrch criste foloweth archeflamynys byshoppes constytuted lx chapiter fyrste archeflamynys see rule iurysdyccyo wytnessyth gaufride policronica london seconde yorke thyrde caerurst kaerglon glouceter iii archbyshopes subiecte foresayd xxviii flamynys byshoppes archebyshoppes see london subiecte cornewayll myddel england vnto humber archebyshoppes see yorke subiecte northumberlande bowe humber wyth scotlande thyrde archbyshoppes see whych glowceter subiecte walys whych prouynce walys vii byshoppes ben iiii ye daye seuaru departed brytayne cambria walys tyme saxon rule lande brytayne testyfyeth wylhelmus de pontific yt saynt gregory graunted vnto london pryuylege archbishoppes see neuerthelesse saynt austayn wyth sent englande foresayde gregorye tourned archebyshoppes see london caunterbury deth saint gregory meanes prayer kyng egbert ethelbert cytyzeyns burgesys caunterbury yt hath contynued daye except tyme offa kynge mercia mercheryk dyspleasure hadde cytezeyns caunterburye byname toke theym dygnyte worshypped adulphe bysshop lychefelde wyth pall caunterbury assent adryan fyrste name pope neuerthelesse tyme kenulphus whyche longe kynge sayde mercia mercheryk yt agayne restoryd caunterbury worshyp ye see yorke hath endured alwaye yet dothe though scotland withdrawe fro subieccyon archbyshoppes see caerglon glowceter tourned fro thes menenia whych ye west syde demecia vppon iryshe see whiche called saynt dauids lande prouynce dayes saynt dauid vnto dayes sampson bysshop sat xxiii byshoppes sayde sampsons dayes archebyshop fyll mortalyte thorowe walys yelowe euyll called iaundyes myche people therof dyed wherfore sayde sampson toke wyth hym pall sayled armorita lytell brytayne bysshoppe dolence dolences tyme vnto fyrst henry tyme kyng englande hadde sytten menenia saynte dauids xxi byshoppes wythoute pall whether yt lacke connynge ellys pouerty asserteyned neuerthelesse alwaye tyme sayde sampson vnto foresayde henry fyrste tyme byshoppes wale sacred ye byshoppe menenia saynte dauids archebyshop menenia tymes sacred ye bysshoppes walys suffragan made profession obieccyon chyrche dayes byshoppes yt sat compelled sacred canterbury token whyche subieccyon bonyface archbyshoppe cauterbury legate crosse sange euery cathedrall chyrche walys solemne masse whyche done sayde boniface tyme henry seconde beynge kynge englande ye shall vnderstade ben two prymates archbysshoppes englande walys one y caunterburye yorke prymate caunterburye ben subiecte xiii byshoppes england iiii walys prymate yorke hath two suffragan englad byshoppes caerleyll durham wyll instructe order chauges bysshoppes see englande lette hym rede ouer liiliiilvlvi lvii chapyters fyrste boke polycronycon te holy bedys work whyche compyled mater called historia anglicana shall haue euery thyng sette clerely truely contynewe processe lucius wytnessyth myne authoure gaufride hadde y sayde stablyssyd orderyd foresayde archeflamyns flamyns also confermed pope endowed wyth landes possessyons tyme occupyed gyuen maynteynynge vpholdynge pagan rytes lawe vsyd tyme temple idollys thorough land causyd dedycate iesu criste sayntes honoured wyth myche great large gyftes done moste accorde wryters ye terme xii yeres dyed buryed ye cytye claudiocestre glouceter without heyre body grewe great damage brytons shalbe shewed lucius yt shewed table hangynge vpon wall north syde yle backe quere saynte paules chyrche london sayde lucius reygned ouer brytons lxxvii yeres ouer authoure cronica cronicarum testyfyeth lucius receyued fayth assembled great hoste brytons sayled ouer gallia fraunce then countres passynge becia cytye called augusta subdued many enymyes crystes fayth many vertuouse dedys restyd good peace suster called emerita sayth said authour also martyred cristes sake sayeng doute assoyled foresayde table ye begynnyng worke yt shall apere reygned xii yeres aboue shewed myche luci endeth tyme lyne britos lande daye ruled dele romayns therfore ende thyrd parte worke ye good spede haue hyderto ende inpetre grace accomplyshyng ye dele worke salute moste blessyd lady wyth thyrd ioye foresayde vii ioyes whyche begynneth gaude splendens va virtutum c hayle glad thou vessell moste shynynge vertues grace whose commaundement hole courte heuen euer byddynge thou also arte amonge ment moste benygne happy euery good entent dygne moder iesu moste excellence honoured glorye theyr assystence thyrde parte accompted ende ix yere cassibellan laste yere lucius includeth yeres two hudred xli trouth yt affermyn wryters deth forenamed luci mych body remayned non heyre brytons amonge selfe fyll great dystaunce warre whyche warre trouble endured greate dystourbaunce lande howe longe certayne sette wryter haue seen excepte englyshe cronycle sayth yt endured l yeres whych sayeng vnder correccyo stande wyth concordauce writer yt playnly declared foresayde table also yt shall appere sayde dyscorde amonge briton contynued onely xv yeres whyche terme xv yeres expyred clerely shall shewed seuerus beynge emperour rome beganne domynyon ouer lande brytayne ye shall nowe vnderstande ye laste yere discorde yere lorde two hundred vii reason wherof yt foloweth sayde xv yeres ioyned vnto foresayde thyrde parte thyrde part coteyneth includeth yeres ii hundred lvi pthus endeth thyrde parte fovrth parte lxi chapiter seuer romayn daye emperour rome begane rule lande brytayn yere lordes incarnacyon ii hudred viii whych wytnesseth gaufryde tyme sent senate rome two legyons knyghtes brytayne appease warre stryfe amonge also wythstade pictes enymyes whych dayly inuaded land dyuers wryters agree seuer made emperoure yere crystes incarnacyon hudred lxxx xv ruled sayd empyre wryters xvi yeres whych rule yt shuld appere shuld take gouernour realme brytayne xii yere empyre sayde man subdued parthis arabis named particus sent sayde senate rome brytayne causyd made coste commoute walle turues great stake length wytnes syth policronica hundred xii myles xviii chapyter iiii boke apperyth wall exposycyon sayde polycronica began ryuer tyne enduryd scottyshe see ende lordshyp deira vnto sayde scottyshe see wryters durham see beforesayde yt foloweth pictes theyr leder fulgenius issued albany scotlande lande brytayne destroyed myche ye coutre beyonde durham wherfore seuerus hoste brytons romaynes mette wyth sayde fulgenius place nere vnto yorke sore fyght sayd seuerus slayn hadde ruled lande moste concordaunce wryters ye terme v yeres buryed yorke leuynge behynde hym two sonnes one named geta bassianus lxii chapiter bassianus sonne seuerus moders syde bryton beganne rule lande britayne yere cirstes incarnacyon two hundred xii man spekyth nothynge englyshe cronycle trouth yt wytnessyth gaufride ye deth seuer stryfe arose betwene brytons romaynes beynge wythin land brytayne common helde theyr kynge bassianus myche borne bryton woman vpon party lyke maner romayns alowed geta theyr kyng descended romayne far ther affermeth forenamed gaufryde dyscencyon batayll hadde betwene sayd two bretherne ye whych geta slayn bassianus remayned kynge lande fro sayeng varyeth greatly eutropius wryte cronycles rome yt witnessed geta slayn cytye named edessa faught agayne parthiens bassianus succedyd fader dignyte emperoure ye sayde cronycle rome testyfyed also called marcus aurelius antonnius caracalla man ryght euyll condycyon vnreasonable lechery yt laye stepdame named iuliana weddyd dyd many cruell dedys lastely slayne forenamed cytye edessa ben emperour vpo vii yeres tyme bassianus thus kynge brytayne one named carassius bryton lowe byrthe valyant hardy mercyall dedys purchaced senate rome kepynge ye costes brytayne wythstade malyce straungers pictes meane carassius drewe vnto hym many knyghtes specyally brytons promysynge yt wold make hym kyng wolde clerely delyuer seruytude ye romaynes thorough ye briton wytnessyth gaufryde rebelled agayne bassianus wyth theyr duke leder carassius arreryd agayne hym dedely warre meane wherof bassianus slayne hadde ruled land moste concordaunce vi yeres lxiii chapiter carassius briton vnknowen byrth brytos made ruler yere lord ii hundred xviii whych touched senate rome deputed substytute ruler vnder romaynes yt shewed theyr cronycles absence whyle bassianus emperour rome kynge brytayne occupyed aboute nedes empyre carassius power withstande pictes fauoure bare towarde aydyng hym agayne romayns gaue countre albania called scotlande ye shall vnderstande yt ment scotlande wytnessyth policronica parte yt gyue thus pictes south parte albania beganne twede enduryd scottysh see kynde pictes somwhat shewed story marius shall shewed conueniet place bothe theyr ofsprynge maners yt foloweth story whe romaynes hadde knolege deth bassianus anon sent duke fro rome named alectus iii legyons knyghtes slee carassius subdue brytons empyre whyche alectus fortune fauourable chased carassius lastely slew hym hadde ruled brytons accorde wryters viii yeres iacobus philipp authour boke named supplementu cronicarum sayth tyme maximianus maxymyan surnamed herculeus dioclecyan dalmatheus emperoures rome harde carassi taken vpon hym ye purpure onely reserued emperours also yt ruled realm brytayne synguler vse furthermore credybly enfourmed narset substytute hadde occupyed eest la de wyth cruell batayll prynces great coutre affrica many also instygacyon leuyng one named achilleus hadde subdued countre grece whych sayde nouellys tydynges two emperours ende refourme sayde rebellyons chase vnto two noble men whyche one named galerius co stancius cesars felowes rule empyre yt done sayd ii cesars sent great power one ito affrica ye egypte forenamed maximyan came wyth great power people britayne ouercame sayde carassius gyle strength sayde carassius ruled brytons sayth forenamed authour iacob philippus terme x yeres whyche sayeng appereth errour dyuersytie tyme yeres moste accorde wryters also affyrmacyon sayde iacobus philippus sayde emperoures dioclesian maxymyan ruled empyre rome aboute yere crystes incarnacyon two hundred lxxxx carassi ruler britayne long tyme bassianus emperour rome ye reygned aboute yere lorde two hundred xiii testyfyeth polycrocon also boke frenche called la mere de hystoryes whyche maye englyshed ye moder hystoryes sayth carassius fyrste treasourer hygh offycer amoge romayns reason wherof sought great abundaunce ryches fyll reason therof fauoure senatours rome fynally made senatour became man great authorytye myche bassianus emperoure made hym protector cytye countre alexandrye supprysyd wyth suche pryde exercysed tyranny vnlefull meanes excedynge maner countre waxed wery conspired deth wherfore punyshemet done vpon enymyes feryng sequell reuengement left countre retourned vnto rome season restyd senate rome assygned sternesse vnto rule brytayne wyth ayde iii legyos knyghtes beynge garnyshed wyth abyly mentes warre entred yle brytayne wyth great trauayle subdued empyre contynued lyues tyme emperour bassianus sone assertayned ye emperour slayne edessa story bassian shewed thynkynge amonge romaynes shuld growe stryfe dyssencyon electyon new emperour reason whych stryfe myght rather lyue farre fro wythout correctyon confederyd wyth scottes certayne briton slew many romaynes suche thought wolde consent treason meane fynally made kynge brytayne contynued affermeth sayde authour accompte fyrst hauyng rule vnder romaynes vnto tyme yt slayne alectus viii yeres wythout exercysynge olde accustomed tyrannyes vnsyttynge condycyons lxiiii chapiter alectus duke consull rome sent sayd senate begane rule brytons yere lorde ii hundred xxvi englysh cronycle named allec whych whe restoryd lande subieccyon rome pursued certayne brytos fauoured carassi agayne romayns doynge vsed exercysyd many tyrannyes exaccyons reason wherof fyll greate grudge ye brytons wherfore entendynge oppresse subdue power romaynes purchasyd excyted noble man ye briton called asclepiodotus duke cornewayle whyche gatheryd great hoste brytons made warre vppon romaynes chasyd coutre cou tre towne towne lastly alectus wyth romayns drew hym london kept hym suertye wherof beynge warned asclepiodotus brytons came nere vnto sayde cytye meanes prouocacyon eyther partye vsed lastely ye romaynes issued oute cytye gaue batayll brytons fyght many fyll eyther partye ye party ye romaynes amonge whyche also slayne alect wherfore captayn romaynes called liuius gallus aduertysynge myschyef great dauger romayns drewe backe cytye romaynes lefte lyue defendyd yt wyth theyr power thus appereth alectus slayne brytons whyche accorde writer whe ruled lande vnder ye romaynes terme vi yere lxv chapiter asclepiodotus duke cornewayle sayth gaufryde sayeng eutropius beda presydente pretory rome began domynyon ouer brytons yere lorde two hundred xxxii whych sayde wyth brytons gyrt cytye london wyth stronge syege kepte forsayde liuius gallus romayns streyte holde finally affermyth myne authour gaufride knyghtly force violece entred sayde cytye slewe ye forenamyd liuius gallus nere vnto broke daye rynnynge hym threwe sayd broke reason wherof long yt called gallus wallus broke day ye strete tyme ranne sayde broke nowe called walbroke hadde thus venquyshed romayns helde lande certayn tyme peasyble wyse ruled brytos wyth good iustyce rewardynge exaltynge good men punysshynge euyll whyle styrynge dysclaunderous dyuylyshe person grudge arreryd attwene kynge duke land called coill coillus whyche duke erle kaercolym colchester wherof cause apparaunt great people assembled party fynally mette feld faughte great stronge batayll whyche asclepiodotus slayne reygned concordaunce history affermaunce olde cronycle space xxx yeres lxvi chapiter coelus erle colchester began hys domynyon ouer brytons yere incarnacyon cryste ii houdred lxii englyshe boke called coyll whiche guyded lande pleasure brytons certayne tyme wytnesseth gaufryde senate rome vnder standynge deth asclepiodotus ioyous deth hym myche hadde euer ben enemye ye empyre mych dayes great dyssencyon amonge selfe wytnesseth ye cronycle rome coude conuenyently sende armye knyghtes warre vppon coelus wherfore contynued ye longer reste good pea cronycle regestred within monastery saynt alboon sayd holy martyr suffered passyo yere lorde ii houndred lxxx vi whych shulde xxiiii yere present kynge thys dyscordeth suche wryters affermen holy man martyred x persecucyon vnder dioclesian maximian emperours neuerthelesse length sente ye senate noble wyse man called constancius whiche affermeth forenamed auctour tyme subdued empyre great part coutre spayne sayenge dysagreeth wrytynge eutropius cou tre spayne subdued hym tyll yt emperour foloweth whan constancius arryued brytayne army anone coelus assembled brytons dredyd strength fame thys constacius sent hym enbassad affyrmynge vnto hym codycyons peace wyth graunte paymentes trybute whych denyed ellys meaneth polycroni wythin moneth landynge constancius coelus dede wherfore brytons haue peace wyllyd knyghte take wyfe heleyn doughter coelus wyth possessyon lande britayne hym graunted sayde coelus dyed ruled brytons accorde wryters xxvii yeres lxvii chapiter constancius senatoure rome sayth policronica beganne rule brytons yere oure lorde two hundred lxxx ix shewed maryed heleyn doughter coelus last kyng brytayne ye shall vnderstande constancius fyrste maryed vnto theodora stepdoughter herculeus maximian syx sonnes heleyn secode wyfe whyche fayrest maydens therewyth lerned suffycyenly lettred also noted many writer captyue prysoner romaynes constantius lytell memorye lefte bretyshe englishe cronycles excepte receyued foresayde heleyn sonne named constantinus whyche knyghtly marcyall dedys called constantyne great noble dedys vyctoryous duke shuld hydde costantius therfore shall folowe story rome whych sayth myche tyme dioclesianus maximianus beynge emperours many coutres rebellyd agayne empyre therfore sayde emperoures admyttyd constantius one galerius cesars whych dignyte next authoryte emperours ye empyre dayes guyded two emperours two cesars constatius wytnessyth policronica made subiecte empyre almaynes slewe theym one daye lx thousande many vyctoryous dedys sayde ii emperours theyr free wylles resygned gyuen ouer imperiall dygnyte thys sayde constantius forenamed felowe galeri made emperours yt wytte galerius emperour iliricum whyche named grecia grece wyth eest lades costanti hadde hym west landes helde hym contente wyth gallia fraunce spayne britayn graunted italia vnto galerius afore sayd subdued countre spayne touched storye coelus parte gallia soiourned abode lande brytayne guydynge rulynge wyth great sobernesse ordeyned sonne gotten vpon helayne rule gallia spayne make story apparant open ye reader also ye herers noted dioclesianus dioclesian beganne empyre ouer romaynes moste wryters yere lorde two hundred lxxx vii emperour xx yeres costantius sent brytayne senate sayde seconde yere ye sayde dioclesian yere oure lorde two hundred lxxx ix whyche constancius due maner spedde nedes empyre subduynge land brytayne sayde retourned agayn rome shortely made cesar contynued lyfe y touchyd tyme beyng thus cesar rule brytayne vnder ye emperour blessyd holy prothomartyr brytayn saynt alboon uerolan martyred x persecucyon chyrche wytnessyth policronicon whyche persecucyon beganne testyfye eusebi beda xviii yere forenamed emperours dioclesian maximyan endured x yeres say ye eest vnder dioclesian weste vnder yan whyche sharpe feruent wythin ye space one moneth dyuers place worlde xvii thousande holy men woman martyred crystes fayth sayde emperours left resygned theyr imperyall dygnytye adde pryuate lyfe sayde constancius wyth felowe galerius departyd empyre betwene touched reygned ruler brytayn terme xvii yeres emperoure emperour weste partye empyre kynge brytayn xii yeres ye sayd costantius reygned ouer brytayne xxx yeres lastely dyed buryed yorke leuyng hym ye foresayd son called costantin without mo mecyon made lxviii chapiter constantinus sonne co stancius heleyne doughter kynge coelus yere lord iii hudred xix made kynge brytayne antoninus archbyshop florence wryter hystoryes sheweth fyrst chapiter ix tytle worke called antonini costantine made emperour beganne rule empyre yere lordes incarnacyon iii hundred ix sayeng also affermeth uyncet historyall authours wherof cause yt sayde authours accopt yeres reygne constancius folow accopte galerius felowe constancius whych reygned emperour iii yeres rule yt muste nedis folowe constantyne began empyre sayd antoninus wytnessyth folowynge ye accompt yt shulde varye pursue contynue ye storye constantyne yt foloweth yt tyme decease constancius fader occupyed warres gallia tie whose deth certayn terme ruled brytayne landes whyche fader helde due maner yt yt ye daye mysereant pagan yet vsed tyrannyes compelled brytons refuse lawe worshyppe idollys tyrauntes dayes vsed whyle constantyne ruled thus weste parte empyre one maxentius whych son herculeus maximian somtyme felowe empyre dioclesian shewed knyghtes pretory declared emperour maxentius worste men testyfyeth eusebius fyrst began mekely wynne therby loue fauour stablysshed authorite exercysed tyrany pursued crystyens wyth kynde torment also expulsed putte rome honour hys fader hercule maximian yt entedyd agayne haue ben emperour ye tyranny maxetius co stantyne wyttyng assembled great hoste brytons gallis oppresse malyce sayde maxentius rule guyde lad brytane absence deputed ordeyned myght called octauius whych polycronica nameth duke iewessis named west saxon sayde constantyne peparyd voyage betoke lande brytayne vnto sayd octauius spedde hym vppon iourney towarde sayde iourney sawe slepe sygne crosse shynynge fyrmament yt hadde ben brennyng lyght fyre aungell standynge therby sayenge constantyne toicanata meane constantyne token thou shalte wynne vyctorye awoke called vysyon mynde tolde vnto secretes whose counsayll commaunded sygne crosse peynted set baners penons knyghtes lxix chapiter constantyne thus ordeyned sygne crosse spedde hym forth towarde ye sayd tyrante maxentius mette hym brydge called ponte miluium loge fyght chasyd sayd maxentius great parte hoste drowned water sayde brydge reygned emperour vpo v yeres victory thus sayde constantyne wente vnto rome receyued ye senate wyth moste triumphe caused signe crosse peynted ryght hades image whyche senatours old tyme areryd worshyp theyr vyctoryes vnder foot image causyd wryten signe token lyuynge god maye ouercomen soone constatyne conuertyd pagan lawe vnto crystes fayth vertue ye blessed uernacle haue ben good doctryne blessyd pope saint siluester first name whyche made pope ye yere folowynge crystes incarnacyon iii hundred xiii constantyne opened prysons desstroyed temple false goddes dedycate worshyppe god sayntes also opened tofore shytte kepte close causyd dyuyne seruyce sayd gaue chyrche rome fyrste possessyons also ordeyned ye bysshoppe rome shulde hedde byshoppes obedyent vnto hym also bare claye vppon shoulder foundacyon saynt peter chyrch wytnessyth policronica fyrste indowement chyrch dyuers thynges shewed reherseth gwaldus cambrens saynt hierom whych ouer passe lengthynge tyme worke whyle constantyne thus occupyed rome hys moder heleyne beyng ferre hym herynge become crysten man sent vnto hym letter recommendacyon forsaken worshyppynge idollys dyspreysed hym worshypped man nayled vppon crosse receyte letter wrote answere moder shulde suffycyently proue byleued worshypped hym fyrste creatour maker worlde onely man also god man diuers poyntes touchyng fayth whych ouerpasse resonynge profe thys assygned vii score iewes siluester wyth certayne nomber crysten clerkes dyspute artycles crystes fayth dyuers myracles shewed good profe made holy scrypture sayde iewes confounded sayde heleyne conuerted vnto fayth crystes chyrche traueyled soon hierusalem industrye labour fande oute holy crosse iii nayles oure lorde nayled wyth crosse wherof lefte parte dele brought vnto bizancium nowe called constantyne noble whyche cytye sayde constantyne greatly augmentyd wyth excellent buyldynge therin also caused arcryd chyrch meruaylous beautye named yt sophia emperour hadde receyued foresayde parte cro wyth iii nayles authours put two sayde nayles brydell horse whych vsed batayll thyrde caste caused caste wytnessyth saynt ambrose swalowe see called mare adriaticu whych swalowe tyme peryllous vnnethes shyppe escapyd daunger garnysshed crosse wyth many ryche stone freyt wyth golde great reuerece conueyde rome dyuerse hystories declaryd costantyne remoued emperyall see vnto cytye constantyne noble partye kepte emperyall honoure emperours lyke wyse hym reason wherof emperours longe called emperours constantyne noble man myghty mercyall feates hys dedys hys honoure addycyon putte name called great myght power constantyne great also fyrste crysten emperoure dyd many notable actes weale crystes fayth amonge whyche seuen noted forenamed antoninus ix tytle ye second part worke named wherof fyrste cryste shulde worshypped god thorough cyty rome seconde iesu cryste spake blasphemy shulde greuously punyshed thyrde persone dyd iniurye wronge crysten man shuld depryuyd put ye losse halfe goodes fourth lyke emperour rome hede teporall prynces byshoppe pope rome hed byshoppes fyfte persone fledde chyrche sauegarde suerty shuld defended peryll daunger syxte man shuld presume buyld temple chyrche wythin cytye towne wythout specyall lycence byshoppe seuenth euery prynce shulde gyue x parte possessyons buyldyng meynteynyng chirches whyche lawe fyrste executed wyth pykax mattoke owne hande brake groude standeth saint peter chyrche xii cophyns trey full erth bare away vpon shulders wytnessyth foresayde antoninus manyfolde good dedys fyll heresye called ariannys heresy meane wherof blynded became enymye cristes chyrch secuted cryste men exyled ye pope siluester meane ye sayde siluester fledde cyte fere wytnessyth iacobus philippus wryters constantyne smyten wyth euyll lepry curynge wherof iii thousand chyldren brought theperours paleys slayne yt blood myght bathed clesyd lepry saw childern moders sorowyng moued wyth pytye sayd dygnitye thepyre cometh myldnesse yt demyd shuld dye ye sleeth chyld batayll crueltye sle many innocentes wylfully yet better yt v dye saue chylders lyues gette cruell lyfe ye deth many innocentes myldnesse redde saynt peter poule apperyd hym nyght folowynge warnyng hym sende agayne siluestre ye pope shulde hym restoryd perfytte helthe whyche done heled legende sayntes bereth wytnesse thus haue shewed part dedys constantyne whych yf shulde cotynue hole processe reygne endured emperoure space xxx yeres shulde therof make large volume concernyth nothynge thentent worke touchynge lande brytayne therfore woll retourne style octauius haue made log digressyo lxx chapiter passetyme whyle constantyne occupyed hym nedes thempyre aboue shewed octauius beynge lieutenant lande brytayne vnder constantyne ruled lande pleasure brytons certayne tyme perceyued fauoure constantyne farre hym castynge also mynde ye sayd constantyne beyng emperour wold myght lyghtly retourne britayn therfore helpe affynyte fredes withstode romaynes lefte brytayne constantyne vsurpyd rule domynyon ye lande wherof whe certayntie came ye knowlege co stantyne hast sent brytayne duke named trahern whyche vncle vnto heleyne moder constantyne trahern arryued brytayne iii legion knyghtes anon octauius made towarde hym wyth hys brytons wyth hym mette nere citye called kaerperis called porte chestre porchestre verely felde nere vnto cytye kaerguent y called wynchester whych felde named maesurian ii hostes mette wyth great ire fough ten longe whyle ye ende trahern compelled forsake felde drewe wyth romaynes towarde albania scotlande wherof octauius beyng warned folowed hym countre westmerlande gaue vnto hym seconde batayll octauius chasyd trahern vyctour whych pursued octauius egerly copelled hym forsake lande britayne sayle countre norway sauegarde yt longe sayde octauius gaderyd newe people brytons norway redy retourne agayn britayne whych tyme testyfyeth myne authour gaufryde erle brytayne entyerly loued octauius treason slewe sayd trahern lytell landynge sayde octauius whyche shortly subdued romaynes ye lande owne vse shuld moste concordaunce wryters whe constantyne wyth also ayde trahern hadde ruled lande brytayne terme x yeres lxxi chapiter octaui duke ye iessis otherwyse westsaxons beganne reygne ouer brytons yere lorde iii hundred xxix englyshe boke called octauian whych testyfyeth gaufryde gaderyd shorte whyle great plentye treasoure rychesse feryd man ruled lande peasyble wyse hym actes left lytell memorye excepte fallen age counsayll brytons sent vnto rome noble yonge man aliy heleyne moder vnto constantyne called maximian playnly shalbe shewed yt aduysed hym make one conan meryadok cosyne kynge hym instat labour caradok duke cornewayll octauius lastly sent vnto rome mauryce sonne forenamed caradok brynge conuey sayd maximianus brytayne mary onely doughter octauius reason therof enioy ye realme brytayne maximian auctour named maximius whych wytnessyth gaufride sonne leonyne brother heleyne vncle vnto co stantyne great whych saynge affermeth also iacobus philipp authour boke called supplementum cronicarum wherin nameth sayde maximianus knyght bryton blood foloweth forenamed maurice spedde nedes yt came presence maximian shewed theffecte message sayd maximianus hym graunted haste prepared voyage brytayne shortly couenient cupany landed southampton wherof beynge warned conan meryadok wyth certayne knyghtes affinytye purposed haue frayed sayd maximian haue destressed hym mych wel knewe hym shuld pu rule lande thys purpose let commaundement kynge otherwyse yt sayd maximianus coueyed safely kynges presence shortly wyth consent partye lordes gaue doughter vnto sayde maximianus wyth possessyon yle brytayne whyche mariage solemnysed endyd sayde octaui dyed shortly howe long reygned none foresayde authours testystye excepte dyuers agre yt contynued reygne tyll ye tyme gracyan ualentinyan ruled empyre whyche beganne reygne yere lorde iii hu dred lxxx ii whyche reason yt muste folowe sayd octauius reygned leest liiii yeres lxxii chapiter maximian maximi ye son leonine cosyn germayn constantyne great made kynge bryton yere oure lorde iii hundred lxxx ii thys englyshe boke named maximian whych testyfyeth gaufryde stalworth myghty handes cruell pursued somdele cristen therfore wryters called maximian tyrant attwene conan named stryfe debate dyuers conflyctes attwene foughten whyche eyther spedde dyuersly yt lastely made frendes maximian reygned season quyete gaderyd rychesse treasour wyth grudge lastely moued exyted warre vpon galles thorow whych cou cell wyth great hoste brytos sayled armorica called lytell brytayne bare hym knyghtly subdued countre vnto lordshyp gaue sayde countre conan meryadok hold hym kynge great brytayn euer commaunded sayde lande called lytell brytayne vyctory knyghtes proclamed hym emperour thorough beynge exaltyd pryde passed farther landes emprye vyctoryously subdued great parte gallia fraunce germania thys dede dyuers authours accompt hym false periuryd wherfore yt shulde seme departynge fro rome sworne vnto gracian ualentynyane emperours shuld neuer clayme part empyre also brekynge othe chalengyd blamed saynt martyne byshop turon answered compelled knyghtes take vppon hym emperour ellys shuld haue ben slayne neuerthelesse sayde byshoppe shewed vnto hym vntrouth shuld longe prospere reygne worde brought vnto emperours maximian wyth harde bataylles thus subdued gallia germania gracian wyth great hoste came resyste hym harde ye marciall dedes maximian drade fled backe citye lugdun lyos frauce sayde gracian slayne brother ualentinian compelled flee constantyne noble maximian haue strength wythstade enimyes made sonne named uictour felowe emperour whyle maximian warred thus italy conan meryadoke sayde maximian gyuen land lytell brytayne mych knyghtes wyll mary doughters frenschmen rather haue wyues theyr owne blood therfore conan sent messagers vnto dionotus duke cornewayll chyfe ruler brytayne wyllynge hym sende doughter ursula wyth certayne nomber virgyns coupled hym knightes maryage soone prepared accordyng ye request conan foresayd ursula accopanyed wyth xi thousande vyrgyns sent sayde father towarde lytell brytayne witnesseth englyshe cronycle gaufryde also policronica yt shuld appere sayeng antoninus iacob philippus writer ursula company shulde sent forth mych brytayne maryed aboute tyme tyme marcianus beynge emperoure whyche began empyre accorde wryters yere lord iiii hundred li martyrdome maydens dyuers authours wryte dyuersly wherfore remytte wyll haue farther vnderstadyng mater vnto ye legende saynts redde yerely chyrche maye suffycyenly taught enformed lxxiii chapiter shewed maximian beynge occupyed warres italy two duke named gwanus melga whych gaufryde testyfyeth sent gracian ualentinian emperours punyshe subdue brytons fauoured party maximian warred sore vpon costes great brytayne occupyed great parte albania wherof maximian knowlege sente great brytayne knyght captayn named gracianus gracyan whyche wyth two legyons knyghtes bare hym knyghtly shorte processe chasyd sayd ii duke irlande helde lande brytayne good peace behalfe maximianus whyle maximian contynuyng warre agayn empyre entendynge emperour theodocius named elder emperour eest parte world herynge deth gracyan chasynge ualentynyan wyth great power spedde hym towarde sayd maximian shortely citye italy named aquilia toke sayde maximian hym behedded knowlege deth maximian comen gracyan rule mych brytayn seasyd land made hym selfe strength kynge brytayne whe maximian gouerned accorde wryters space viii yeres lxxiiii chapiter gracianus whych gaufryde called municeps yt maye taken hyred waged knyght ye keper gyftes berynge chyef rule cytye beganne rule brytons yere oure lorde iii hundred lxxx x whych exercysyd tyranny exaccyon vppon subiectes wonder full hatered amonge brytons amonge cast sought many wayes meanes hys destruccyon dyuers meanes escapyd theyr daungers punysshed greuously suche fautours wherfore lastly sayth gaufryde fyll vpon hym hole assent kylled hym reygned verely vsurped terme iiii yeres lxxv chapiter gracian thus slayne brytons forsayd gwanus melga knowynge brytons wythout hed ruler assembled also people retourned mych brytayne wastynge brennynge euery syde destroyed greate plenty brytons wytnessyth gaufryde policronica sayth whan romayns knewe deth gracyan sent knyght called constantyne haue rule brytayne countrees demed enemye empyre harme athes hym done fraunce wherfore commaundement honorius emperour knyght erle called constancius sente agayne forenamed constantine slewe hym place towne called arelet thys brytos agayne vexed pictes straunge nacyons reason wherof costrained sende agayne rome requyrynge ayde vppon condycyon shuld alway subiecte vnto rome whyche request promesse thus herde senate honorius aforenamed sent britayne wyth legyon knyghtes whyche vi thousande vi houndred lxvi legyon helpe brytons chasyd ye foresayde pictes enemyes taughte brytos make walle ouerthwart lande see see y meane water humber scottyshe see ordeyned wardeynes kepars wall retourned rome thys wall testyfyeth policronica made turuys strechyd pemilton penulton vnto ye citye acliut acliud thys wall small strength enemyes named dystroyed certayne partyes sayd wall ouerrode countre toke grete prayes dayly dyd myche harme done tyme wherfore brytons constrayned seke newe socour romayns dyd foloaynes sende legion whyche agayne chased sayd pictes enemyes made wall stone thycknesse viii fote heyght xii fote selfe place seuerus made dyke wall turfes yt done romaynes comforted exorted brytons manly corageous wythstande theyr enemyes shewyng forther shuld truste theyr owne strengthe myche romayns beynge ferre myght lyghtly come ferre wyth armye knyghtes also wythout great coste trauayle whyche monycyon exortacyon thus gyuen brytons mouth archebysshop london wyth instruccyons apperteynynge feytes warre sayde romaynes toke leue ye brytons though shulde ye tyme retourne ito britayne longe romayns thus departyd pictes scottes beganne breke theyr denes caues two nacyons authours shulde seme one declaracion ranulphe lviii chapyter fyrste boke shulde appere two maner people last dwellyd twoo sondry countres pictes northsyde scotlad beda ye southsyde whiche conteyneth galeway lodeway scottes ledyng theyr duke renda shulde possede irland yt arme northe parte see passynge deyra shuld departe pictes tyme ye saxos ruled lande ye scottes maner treason slew mighty men ruler pictes kepte countre theyr owne two nacyons dyscorde maners clothynge fayth couetyse shedynge mannes blood one sayde pictes scottes entred lande brake ye walle made slewe wardeyns therof spoyled robbed coutres chased cruelly common comfortlesse meane wherof briton brought suche daunger myserye eyther robbed slewe ouer ye groude vntylled vnsowen wherof ensued great scarcytye hunger hunger ensued deth thus one mychyef came deth vpon deth sorow vpon sorow whych fyll vpo stryfe medlyd wyth great huger whych mysery wyse cotynuynge chyef toke aduyse amonge selfe fynally concludyd remedye myschyef wolde sende vnto aecius beynge kynge fraunce whyche aecius mayster chyualry honori emperour occupyed warres parte gallia aecius sent writyng wherof theffecte thy manhode aecius vnderstanden mysery brytons whyche straunge nacyons chase vnto see see dryueth v agayne straunge nacyons ensew two maner carayns ye one violece ye enemyes swerd wilfull drownyng theyr wrytynge vayne sayd aecius yet romaynes hadde refuge comfort whyle hunger encreased people ouerset theyr enymyes many yolden toke partye agayne theyr neyghbours ye power dwelled farther wythin lande defendyd theyr beste maner lastely noble wysest specyally ye archbyshop london wyth lande kepte counsayll lo whyche yt concludyd yt embassade shulde made vnto kynge lytell brytayne impetre aske hym ayde comforte theyr great necessyte whyche ambassade sayde archebyshop appoynted chyef pryncypall whych named gaufryde guethelinus ye englyshe cronycle gosseleyne sayde byshoppe wyth vnto hym assygned spedde shorte conuenyent tyme came vnto presence aldroen kynge lytell brytayn hym declaryd effecte theyr message whyche hauynge compassyon lamentable request made vnto hym sayde ambassade aduyse taken hys lordes grauted vnto bysshop vppon condycyon yf god sent victory theyr enemyes shulde crowne hys brother kynge great brytayne whyche entendyd sende thyder wyth conuenyent armye whyche condycyon sayde bysshoppe wyth gladly acceptyd fermely grauted thus apparant vnto lande longe without hedde gouernoure whyche length tyme authours determyned longe shorte lytell certentye therof lefte wherfore haue shewed dryuen certayne reason myne opynyon dull mynde table expressed wherin shall appere vnder correccyon sayd season tyme land beynge without kynge rekyn laste yere gracian vnto fyrste yere constantyne next ensuynge fully xxxix yere finit tribvyvm ye shall also forthermore vnderstande endeth fynally ye trybute domynyon romaynes thys daye trybute payed romayn prynce dayes ruled thys lande brytayne whyche trybute domynyon endured ix yere cassybellan vnto tyme seuerus terme two houndred lv yeres tyme seuerus vnto fyrste yere gracyan houndred lxxx iii yeres fyrst yere gracyan vnto laste yere thys mysery xliii yeres yere iulius cesar made fyrste thys ile brytayne trybutary vnto empyre vnto last yere ende thys foresayd misery flowyd iiii houndred xxxi yeres polycronyca sayth romaynes ruled trybute lande iiii houndred lxx yeres whyche sayeng full lyke true yf ende theyr dominyon determyned ye laste departyng romayns thys lande thus ende iiii parte thys worke myche fornamed gracian laste romayne kynges yt reygned myche brytayne trybute day payed vnto romaynes wherfore gyuynge thankes moste blessyd vyrgyne lady saynte mary good exployte spede thys tyme opteyne moste habundaut grace perfourmaunce reste dele humblenesse salute wyth iiii ioye forenamed vii ioyes begynneth gaude nexu voluntatis c excellent pryncesse quene celestyall ioyous glad thou eternally knot charyte dygnyte pryncypall art hyghest ioyned celestyally thou may impetre necessary thy seruauntes thou virgyn moste pure thy swetteste ihesu optayne sure thys iiii parte accompted ye fyrste yere seuerus vnto last ende yere thys misery includeth yeres cc xxvi thus endeth fourth parte fyft parte lxxvi chapiter accordynge promyse made ye begynnynge thys worke shall brynge shewe vnto begynnynge reygne ye kinges frauce set suche direct order shalbe apparant reder shalbe certaynly knowe kyng reygned frauce whan kyng reygned englande also shall somdele touche actes dedys sayde kynges fraunce yt cronycles bothe realmes shall worke appere name prynces one reygned englande fraunce perfourmauce fyrste noted subuercyon troye grekes ye begynnyng work shewyd dyuers troyans beyng vnder rule noble lygnage helenus sonne pryamus eneas anthenorus serchyd ye worlde landyd dyuers coutrees helen grece grecia eneas italia italy amog whych noble one named turchus named franco cosyn germayns turchus sonne troylus fraco francio sonne ector sayd two cosyns serchyng theyr aduenture many dyuers daungers ieopardyes passyd see lastly landed coutre called tracea tracia grece wyth theyr copany enhabyted nere vnto ryuer called dion hadde contynued season tyme turchus departed wyth certayne troyans fro hys sayd cosyn francio sayled countre called faso lesse wyth hys people dwelled longe tyme whyche faso shulde countre sithia thys turchus dyscendyd sayth ye fre che cronycle iiii maner people saye austrogothis ipogothis wandalis norman fracio fraco remoued wyth hys company countree named pannoma whyche countree shuld seme parte hungery ioynynge nere nere vnto ryuer called thanais buylded cytye named sicambria reason wherof longe called sicambri also named franci sayth frenche cronycle thys man francio turpinus wrote gestes greate charles sayth whan charles hadde made countre spayne subiecte retourned fraunce made bonde dwellynge aboute nere vnto paris gallia fre wourshyppe saynte denis saynt iamys galis vppon condycyon shulde yerely offre foure penny thys worke saynt denis churche reason wherof named franci men freed fore bond policronica saith named franci ualentynyan emperour fyersnes euer came name called franci frenschemen sayd peple also named long tyme galli trybutaries rome vnder theyr rule tyll tyme ualentinyan emperour aboute yere cryste iii houdreth lxvi thys ualentinyan hauynge rule west parte ye world made warre vppon people called aleynys dwelled nere vnto
