forenamed gallis aleynys egre fyghte ouer yt closyd wyth fennys marrys romaynes myghte wynne force wherof often rebellyd agayne empyre wherfore ende ualentinyan consyderynge fyersnes ye gallis wyth theyr nere dwellynge vnto sayd aleynys couenauted yf wolde subdue sayde people shulde haue releace x yeres trybute whyche couenaut well suffycyently confermed gallis shorte whyle theyr knyghthode polycy subdued vtterly chased sayd aleynys whyche dede contynued foresayde x yeres wythout payenge trybute whyche x yeres ronne expyred ye romaynes agayn claymed former accustomed trybute answered yt redemed sayd tribute price theyr blood ought charged suche trybute wyth whych answere romaynes beynge sore dyscontentyd made newe warre vpon ye sayd sicabris whyche warre sicambris gallis worse chasyd theyr citye sicambria wytnessyth polycronica drewe nere vnto water ryne grewe shorte processe suche multytude suche strength shorte whyle ledynge theyr iii duke named marcomirus somom symon genebaur warred vppon landes empyre subiecte vnto ye wherof theodosius surnamed yonger emperour beynge warned anone sente ii duke wyth greate hoste subdue sayde gallis sicambris defendyd knyghtly yt sayde duke chasyd wytnessyth mayster robert gagwyne greate nomber romaynes slayne lxxvii chapiter victory thus opteyned sicambris waxed stronge wan almaynes dyuers townes stronge holdes wythin germania opteyned famous cytye named treueris wytnessyth aucthour cronica cronicarum fyrst foundyd tyme patryarche abraham incarnacyo cryst thousande ix houndred lxv yeres dayly wan vpon nacyos adioynynge tyll came ryuer seyn restyd buylded countre mych named selfe franci men freed daunger empyre rome theyr land named fraunce whyche syns tyme greatly encreasyd daye countre great welth honoure conteyneth many prouynces lordshyppes affyrmaus policronica touchyd ye xxvii chapyter hys fyrste boke shewed gallia fraunce name gallia whytenesse people thys gallia fraunce hath north syde germania eest ryuer ryne southest alpis hyghe mountaynes west see occean whyche called brytannicum gallicu whyche meane englyshe see frenche see yt departyth englande fraunce south see myddell eerth yt wassheth prouynce narbon tyme iulius cesar gallia departed thre diuers happes befell land countre land stretcheth ryne seyn called gallia belgica whyche fraunce countre stretcheth seyn ye ryuer leyr called gallia lugdunensis wherof ouer parte hyght named burgundia burgoyne nether parte nestria normandye countre stretcheth fro ryuer leyr ryuer geround called gallia aquitania whych guyan stretcheth eest riuer roon vnto west occean wherof ouer parte therof hyght celtica whyche meane heuenly hyghe mountaynes therin water gerounde see middell eerth mou taynes called mote pireni great hylles spayne clepyd gallia narbonensis parte therof called gothia uasconia whyche meane gascoyne gallia closyd aboute wyth thre noble water wyth ryuer ryne north syde wyth ryuer roone eest wyth brytyshe occean ye weste gallia fraunce ben many noble cytyes wherof parys hed pryncypall whyche fyrst foundacyon clepyd parydes parides troyane departed troy wyth eneas wytnessyth carinus wryters history frenche cronycle sayth fyrst fouded ye sycambris named lutecia incarnacyon cryste iii hundred lxxx xv yeres whyle forenamed marcomyrus chyefe hedde gouernour beauty name also mynde paris sonne pryame kynge troye whych lynyally descendyd therfore chaunged name commaunded yt called paris gallia also prouynces lordshyppes folowynge braban flaundres normandye pycardye brytayn lesse poytowe gascoyne guyan tolowse burgoyne angeo mayne prouynce champayne aluerne whyche sygnouries lordeshippes belonged apperteyned vnto crowne fraunce yt dyuers theym hath ben gyuen oute maryage otherwyse kynge fraunce claymeth chyef lorde theym daye hath possessyon excepte burgoyne flaundres braban normandye whyche trybutarye vnto kynge englande yt folowyth sayde gallis frenchman hadde thus co quered foresayde countres parte theym lesse made theym vnto sayde gallis trybutary forenamed marcomyrus theyr chyef hedde gouernour closyd cytyes wyth stronge walles buylded stronge holdes castelles dyed leuyng hym sonne garnyshed wyth knyghtly vertue named pharamundus pharamonde francio lxxviii chapiter pharamund son marcomyrus beforenamed deth said fader made ordeyned fyrst kyng frenchman agrement hystoryes also affermeth mayster robert gagwyne yere lordes incarnacion foure hudred xx worlde ye creacyon fyrste adam folowynge accompte thys worke shewed fyue thousande vi hundred xix brute beganne domynyon thys yle brytayne thousande fyue hudred lvi yere mysery brytons xxvi pharamundus lytell thynge lefte memory excepte myne authoure gagwyne testyfyfyeth made certayne lawes whyche longe tyme enduryd name lawes vse derke englyshe vnderstandynge therfore ouerpasse theym folowe story whych affermeth sayde pharamonde hadde ruled frenchme well nobly space xi yeres dyed lefte hym sonne named clodio crinitus capellatus lxxix chapiter clodio ye son pharamonde made kyng fraunce yere lorde iiii hudred xxxi xxxvii yere foresayd mysery brytons sayd surnamed crinitus capellat reason wherof kynges frenchman longe tyme called criniti augment hys lordshyppe made warre vpon people called turynges great sore fyght made legth subiecte hym countre sayth freche cronycle parte almayne thys daye tyme clodio reygne romaynes land gallia frauce theyr rule whyche lyeth ye ryuer leyr vnto ye ryuer ryne whyche called gallia lugdunensis hadde thus subdued turynges sent espyes ouer ryne se strength inhabyted countre reporte hym brought sayde espyes countre fertyll ryche people therof small defence army ouer spred countre shortely beseged cytyes cambrey turney wanne ye cytye turney certayn nomber romaynes whyche manfully defendyd towne longe tyme ceyued myght lenger holde towne manfully issued gaue frenchman harde batayll fortune theym frowarde dystressyd whyche countres townes thus goten clodio wyth vyctoryous dedes hym done lastely dyed ruled frechmen xix yeres wythout issue body anglia nowe lette v retourne vnto tharchbyshop lodon brytons beyng britayne lesse whych vppon promyse rehersed receyued albroenus kynge lytell brytayne brother named constantyne ye whych wyth certayne nomber knyghtes shortly laded totnesse mych brytayne gaderyd floure ye brytos whyche theyre landynge hydde dyuerse place lande whose power marcyall knyghthod enymyes lande shedfully chasyd vtterly cofounded whyche victorye thus britos obteyned one mynde conueyde theyr chefetayne constantyne vnto towne kaercegent nowe called cicestre crowned hym accordynge promyse made vnto brother kynge yle brytayne lxxx chapiter constantinus brother aldroenus kynge lytell brytayn crowned kyng myche brytayne yere oure lorde foure hundred xxxiii thyrde yere clodio kynge fraunce whyche guyded lande suche manhode polyce kepte yt daunger enymyes tyme hys lyfe helde yt god quyete reste thys costantyne lytell mynde made lefte wrytynge excepte receyuyd wyfe thre sonnes whyche named constante aurely co stantius aurelius ambrosius uter whyche surnamed pendragon sawe perceyuyd eldest sonne named constat dull insolent wytte therfore made hym monke monasterye saynte amphyabyll wynchester whyche monasterye daye called saynte suythynes abbey two bretherne betoke vnto guethelinus archbyshoppe noryshe brynge forth courte costantyne witnesseth gaufryde pict myche loued greatly fauouryd constantyne myghte tymes come kynges presence whyche beyng erraunt traytoure sechynge conuenyent tyme execute detestable treason secrete meane slewe kynge chamber hadde ben kyng moste wryters tenne yeres lxxxi chapiter constantius sonne constantyne meane uortigernus made kynge brytayne yere lorde foure hundred xliii touched myche fader thought apt take great charge gouerne lande hym became relygious man monastery named wryters meane sayd constante pure deuocyon hadde god saynt amphiabyl made hym selfe monke vnwyttynge kynge fader frendes maner euer became monke trouth uortigerus uortigernus ye deth constantyne founde suche meanes taken abbey crowned kynge brytayne meane wherof sayde uortiger rule land constante hadde onely name uortyger consyderynge innocencye myldenes kyng cast mynde myght kynge hym selfe amonge meanes founde haue aboute ye kynges persone hundred pictes scottes ye whych ordeyned garde kynges persone done bare hym wyse agayne pictes meanes great gyftes otherwyse length uortyger fauoure feryd saye openly uortyger worthy kyng constant whyle uortyger gatte possessyon kynges treasour hym co maunded done though therat murmured grudge euer ryght wronge fauoured foresayd pictes scottes whyche length perceyuynge corrupte mynde sawe conuenyent tyme fyll vpon kynge hym slewe murderyd whych cruell dede theym done presentyd hed constante vnto uortiger beyng london wherof ware ende brytons shulde thynke dede done agayne mynde wyll wepte made semblaunt sorowe heuenes causyd sayde hundred knyghtes taken haste theym dome lawe ye lad heddyd reason wherof taken culpable innocent kynges deth kynges deth knowen suche persones hadde kepyng two yonger bretherne aurelius uter haste sauegarde fledde lytell brytayne kept theym tyll yt pleasyd god ortherwyse purueye theym thus ye haue herd kynge constante slayne hadde reygned moste wryters fyue yere lxxxii chapiter uortigernus duke ye iuesses uortiger erle iewesses called westsaxons made kynge brytayne yere lorde iiii hundred xlviii xviii yere clodio kyng frauce whych ye deth constant strength otherwise made kynge ruled land wythout trouble yt longe pictes whych hauyng knowlege deth iudgemet theyr knightes kynsmen inuaded north partes lande doynge therin great harme domage ouer many dyuerse great brytons perceyuyng kyng constant murderyd wythout consent sayde uortyger rebelled agayne hym dayly sent say led ouer lytell brytayne ayde assystence foresayde chyldern constant whyche putte sayde uortiger great vnrestfulnesse wyst knewe myght putte truste confydence wyth perturbauces medled plenty corne frute yt lyke therof ben sene many yeres passyd wherwyth ioyned lechery pestylence many incoueniences ye vice accopted small none offence reygned onely temporalty also spiritualtie hedes ye euery turned poynt spere agaynst trewe innocent man comons gaue dronkenes ydelnes thorough ensued fyghtynge stryfe mych enuy foresayd myschyues ensued mych mortalyte deth men lyuyng scantly suffysed countres bury dede ouer ye kyng hard beset ye forenamed enymyes costrayned affermyth policronica sende paynems saxos helpe withstand enemyes defende lande also dayly ferid landyng aurely uther uortyger thus beynge beset wyth many aduersytyes vysytynge hys lande beynge dyuerse cause hym mouyng dorobernia caunterbury tydynges came hym arryuynge thre longe shyppes full armed men yle tenet wherof fyrst made countenaunce though hadde ben doute whether ben two brethern constant none whe blowen aboute yt none enymyes anon caused leders brought vnto presence freynynge theym cause theyr landyng theyr nacyon countre whych answered vnto kynge sayd coutre germany put theyr countre maner sorte lot sodry tymes vsed sayde lande whyche vsed myche people therin encreasyd faste wythoute prouysyon coutre shuld suffyce people whych suche foloweth sondry tymes sayd cou tre replenyshed people prynces ruler therof wolde assemble certayne place call theym lusty yonge folkes whych wold chose certayne nomber appoynte certayne duke leders thyng necessary warre garnyshed wold comaunde serche theyr adueture wynne lande theyr knyghthode myght inhabyte theselfe whych vse custome thus longe vsyd fallen theyr lotte theyr fore faders done theym wherfore syns fortune brought land besought kyng wold take seruyce wold redy fyght ye defence countre kyng hadde enquyred farther foude two leders named hengist horsus theyr people called saxon kynge thus beyng asserteyned maner straugers gentyle pagan law sayde heuy sory myscreantes ioyous glad theyr commynge myche nede suche sowdyours defende hym lande agayne enymyes receyued hys wage seruyce wytnessed gaufryde mo wryters lxxxiii chapiter beda holy man sayth uortyger sent saxos stronge men armes hadde lande dwelle whych came thre longe shyppes called obylas receyued place hym dwell eest syde brytayne called yle tenet besyde kent guillelmus de regibus writer hystoryes ayth saxon came oute germany wyll wynne worshyppe lande lotte compulsyon also worshypped dayes god named woden goddesse named frya worshyppe whyche god thyrde feryall daye weke named wodnesd aye whyche daye call wednysdaye worshyppe sayde goddes called fyfth daye friys daye whyche call frydaye foresayde people came thre maner people thre maner name say saxos anglys iewetes saxon came eest saxon westsaxons south saxon ye anglys came eest anglys myddell angl merceys whyche helde myddell england stretcheth westwarde toward ryuer dee besyde chestre seuern besyde shroysbury forth brystowe eestwarde toward see southwarde thamys forth london northwarde humber tourned downewarde westward ryuer mercea forth weste see iewetys come kentyshmen men yle weyght fyrst comyng saxos great britayn authours party varrey wherfore table named shall appere vnder correccyon forenamed hengistus horsus wyth theyr company fyrst landed foresayde yle great brytayne yere lorde iiii hundred l thyrd yere uortiger yt foloweth saxon wyth kynges power bete downe enymyes sayde defendyd land knyghtly wyse kyng hadde saxon great loue fauour whyche fauour hengistus wel apperceyuyng vpon season sawe conuenyent tyme axed kynge myche grounde hyde bull beste wolde compare kynge hym graunted whyche graunt sayde hengyste ende winne large groude causyd sayd bestes skyn cut small slender thonge mette large great circuyte grounde vpon whyche shortly buylded sette large stronge castell reason whych thonge sayd castell log afternamed thonge castell whyche sette agrement wryters countre lyndesey thyse tydynges sprange germania plentye fatnes lande brytayne wyth commodytyes perteynyng meane wherof saxon dayely drewe sayde lande conuenauted brytons briton shuld entende theyr worldlynes necessaryes ye saxon theyr sowdiours shulde defende land incursyon enymyes whych brytons shulde gyue competent mete wage sonde hengiste came wyth xvi sayles ronowen doughter sayd hengist mayden excellet beaute whose commyng hengiste vpon daye besought kyng yt wold se castell whyche newely edyfyed whose request kyng agreable day assygned came ye sayd castell ioyously receyued amoge passetymes sayde ronowe wyth cuppe golde full wyne presentyd kynge salutynge sayeng wassayle kynge whych tyme herd lyke salutacyon yet vnderstode ment axed fader mente worde wassayle yt answered hengist yt salutacyon good gladnesse kynge shuld drynke ioynynge vnto answere drynke hayl wherfore kyng enfourmed toke cuppe maydens hand drank beheld weche suche maner wounded darte blynde god cupide neuer coude wythdrawe loue ye wenche lastely instygacyon deuyll axed maryage fader force therof wytnessyth policronica put hym laufull wyfe whyche tyme receyued iii noble sonnes called uortimerus ca agrinus pascentius kyng gaue vnto hengistus lord shyppe kent though garangonus erle therof therat grudged wyth many brytons ye kynge maryed woman vncought beleue well nere brytons forsoke hym workes neuerthelesse well noble coforted kynge euyll doyng whych meane vnlefull dedys dayly vsyd fayth cryste began sore apalle ouer heresye called arianes heresy began sprynge brytayn two holy byshoppes named germanus lupus gaufryde wytnessyd came brytayne refourme kynge yt erred waye trouth holy man saynt germayn uincent historyall sayth vpon euenynge weder passynge cold snowe fyll faste axed lodgyng kyng brytayne hym comperys whych denyed syttyng vnder bushe feld kynges herdmen passyd seynge byshop wyth company sittyng weder desyred hym house take poore lodgynge wherof bysshoppe beynge glad fayne yode vnto house sayd herdman whyche receyued hym wyth glad chere hym company wysled wyfe kyll onely calfe dresse yt gestes souper ye also done holy man souped called hym hostes wyllynge desyrynge shulde dylygently gader gyder bone deed calfe gaderyd wrappe gyder wythin skynne sayde calfe lay stall racke nere vnto dame whych done accordyng commaundement holy man shortly calfe restoryd lyfe forth wyth e e haye wyth dame ye racke whych meruayle housholde greatly astonyed yeldyd thankynge vnto almyghty god holy byshoppe uppon morowe holy bysshoppe toke wyth hym herdman yode vnto presence ye kynge axed hym sharpe wyse ouer nyght hadde denyed hym lodgynge wherwyth kyng aba hed hadde power gyue vnto holy man answere saynt germayne sayde hym charge name lorde god thou thyne departe paleys resygne yt rule thy lande hym worthy rome thou arte whyche thyng power diuyne obserued done sayde herdman holy byshoppes authoryte sette ye dygnyte descendyd kynges brytayne lxxxiiii chapiter thys story also confermed antonin archebysshoppe florence lengthe hym shewyd xvii chapyter ix day seconde part hys worke called som antonini euer thys story fyrste wryten thynke none discended walshmen yet theyr blode come pryamys blode herdman excepte fetche theyr lyne dauyd holy kynge prophete thys storye semeth fame credence wryters tell thys story done region powys buly theyr kynge also mych foresayd authour maketh mencyon brytayne lesse doutefull whyther thys happe fyll one regyon yt lyfe saynte germayne y redde sayde saynte germayne deposyd uortiger enhaunced herdman declared affermeth polycronica foloweth ye story saynte germayne hadde restoryd parte brytayne trewe fayth retourned fraunce fro whens comen thys sayde sayenge shuld appere dyscorde cronycles day fayth cryste receyued fraunce clerely shall appere wherfore bysshoppe crystes fayth myghte kepe see fraunce also affermeth iacobus phylyppus holy remigius fyrst yt tourned frauce crystes relygyon moste concorde wryters yere lorde iiii hundred lxxx xix xv yere reygne clodoueus lewys fyrste crysten kyng ye realme frauce furnysshe perfourme story uortiger nedefull necessary retourne mater lefte shewe moche brytons wythdrewe uortyger therfore constrayned holde wyth hym saxon whose counsayle sent octa sonne hengyst ye whych brought wyth hym company saxon lordes britayne sawe consyderyd greate multytude saxon theyr dayly repayre thys lande assembled togyder shewed kyng inconuenience ieopardy myght ensue hym hys lande reason greate power straungers aduertysed hym aduoydyng greter daunger expelle put hys realme parte vayne uortyger bare suche mynde saxon reason hys wyfe preferred loue loue hys owne naturall kynnesmen frendes wherfore brytons one wyll mynde crowned theyr kynge uortimerus eldest sonne uortyger depryued hym kyngly dygnyte whe hadde reygned moste concorde hystoryes xvi yeres lxxxv chapiter meroneus next allie vnto clodio last kyng frauce mych clodeo remayned none issue made kyng frau ce ye yere lorde iiii hundred l seconde yere yere uortiger kynge brytayne whyche stronge marcyall hys dedes vnto ryght profytable realme amonge notable dedes hym done slewe one day hunes whyche commaundement atti inuadyd dystroyed dyuers countres italy germany hundreth lxxx thousande wytnessyd mayster robert gagwine compyler gaderer actes dedes frenshmen thys forenamed attila kynge hunes led one hoost ii hundred thousand men warre testyfyeth policronica dyuers baytayles hym wonne came ye feldes called catulyntes whyche conteyned hundred legys length lxx brede wherof euery lege conteyneth iii englysshe myles whyche feldes playnes encountred wyth power romaynes whose ayde ye kyng fraunce meroneus kynge duke burgoyne longe fyghte slayne bothe sydes foresayde hundred lxxx thousand whyche nomber sayde kynge duke burgoyne one playnly shewed xxxiii chapiter iiii boke sayd polycronicon wyth wonder whyche ouerpasse thys meroneus dyscendyd kynges frensshemen tyll tyme pepyn whyche father vnto charles greate emperour fynally dyed thys meroneus reygned moste wryters x yeres leuynge hym sonne named chylderych hylderych lxxxvi chapiter chyldericus hildericus sonne meroneus ordeyned kyng fraunce yere oure lorde god iiii hundred lx xii yere uortiger kyng brytayne whiche ensued thynge warres hys father allyed hym wyth vyce cruelnesse suche exterme wyse became odyble vnto hys subiectes wherfore said childerich perceyuyng murmur grudge among people ferynge hys sodayne distruccyon cousayled wyth frend lorde hys named guynomadus guynemeus whose counsayle auoydynge greater paryll auoyded secretely hys lande yode vnto kynge thurynges named besygne ioyously receyued departynge kynge ye sayd guynemeus toke pece golde brake two peces wherof ye one pece delyuered vnto kynge pece kepte hym self sayenge kynge whan euer receyued hym pece golde shulde sure restored agayne hys regally dygnyte kynge departed lande frenshmen one assent chase theyr gouernour hed romayne named gylf whyche daye hadde parte gallia fraunce hys rule behofe romaynes whyche parte named nowe named soisons wha thys gilf stablyssed authoryte forenamed guynemeus behauyd hym suche wyse towarde thys gylf hym specyall fauour aboue noble fraunce wolde execute thynge charge wythout hys counsayll wherof sayd guynemeus beynge ware remembrynge myght restore chylderych former dygnyte aduysed sayde gill sette greuous taskys vpon frenschmen enfourmynge hym yf grudged shuld punyshe myghtyeste reason wherof shulde fere whyche thus done accordynge forsayde counsayll shortely brynge purpose better sayde guynemeus accused certayne ruler fraunce suche well knewe great enymyes vnto chylderych whych caused taken sent vnto gill gill vpon dyd sharpe execucyon whyche perseuered frenschmen remedy complayned theym guynemeus hym answered greatly meruayled theyr vnstastablenesse hadde chosen kynge sodaynly wolde haue hym deposed shewynge furthermore must cal agayn childerich exercysyd lyfe voluptuousnesse lyuynge ellys muste dwell vnder kynge whyche cruell full blood shedynge wyth dyuerse exhortacyons cocernynge agayn callynge childerych fourmer dygnyte whyche length omytte passe ouer meane whyche exhortacyon childerich secretly sent receyued trustye frende foresayde pece golde spedde hym hastely fraunce agayne foresayde guynemeus lykewyse sped hym met castell countre champion wyth allyed gaderyd great hoste made towarde foresayde gill gillion whych hauynge knowlege sayde conspyracye ordeyned armye knyghtes yode agayne enymyes ouerset compelled sauegarde fle countre soisons beforenamed endyd naturall lyfe childerych agayne restoryd made kynge childerych thus restoryd vnto regally subdued soone saxon prynce named onager besegyd cytye orleaunce yt receyued vnto subieccyon passyd ryuer leyr subdued sygnory countre angeo mayne fame childerich brought vnto basyna wyfe besygne kyng turryng anon forsoke owne lorde sped fraunce presence childerich receyued wyth gladnes frayned cause commynge answeryd knewe vnderstode hym vertue honour ye day lyuyng therefore comyn vnto hym contynue remanaunt lyfe copany addyng also therunto yf countre knew better wolde serche see lande haue hym lord husbande assured pere besought hym accepte company lxxxvii chapiter childerych puttynge parte forgettynge kyndenesse hym shewyd housbande besynge maryed sayde basina yet beynge pagan fyrste nyght comen shulde go bedde exorted hym yt shulde yt nyght absteyn fro fleshly lykyng watche gate paleys make reporte suche vysyons sawe yt nyght agreable standynge sawe fyrst multitude vnycornes lyon lybardes passyng foreby paleys gate wythin shorte space tyme sawe great company berys wolues renyng thyrdly lastly sawe multytude dogges small rauenous bestes whyche hys syghte fyll vppon ii companyes vtterly deuoured hadde sene fyne vision lytell astonyed returned hys wyfe shewynge hadde sene sayd syr ye shal receyue son whyche hys dedes shall noble honourable lyke ye vnycornes lyon shewyd ye fyrst vysyon whyche shall discende one sonne whyche shall rauenous shall set hys mynde pyllage rauyne lyke vnto rauenous wolfe hym shall come chylde chyldern shall suche insolency wastynge lyke rauenous hounde stroyeth wastyth maye tere wyth hys teeth shall person wast destroye theyr folyes noble men hath purchased theyr handes multytude whyche ye sawe small rauenous bestes betokeneth comon people whyche dayes lacke good wyse prynce shall renne eyther vppon robbe e eche thys exposycyon kyng somdele troubled yet reioysed issue shuld come body foloweth whan thys chylderych hadde ouercomen baytayles almayne subdued hys empyre lastly dyed reygned wyth viii yeres allowed hys reygne tyme exyled wyth resydue reygned xxiiii yeres leuyng hym sonne begotten vpon forenamed basina called clodio moste wryters clodoueus anglia lxxxviii chapiter uortimerus eldest sonne uortiger assent brytos made kyng brytayn yere lorde iiii hundred lxiiii iiii yere chylderic kynge fraunce whych hast pursued saxon gaue vnto great batayle vppon ryuer darwent hadde vyctory secundaryly faught wi h vppon foord called epi ord agliffhorp whych fyght catrignus brother uortimer horsus brother hengyst cosyn long fyght attwene ii eyther slewe whyche fyght also brytons vyctours thyrd batayle faught nere vnto see syde also brytons chasyd ye saxos compelled take yle wyghte theyr suertye batayle wytnesseth alfredus wonne vertue prayer holy byshop saynt germayne myght ye brytons holy man sawe ye brytons gyue backe helde hys handes towarde heuen cryed thryse alleluya whyche vnderstadyng mych saye saue v good lorde thorough whyche prayer briton dyuyne helpe obteyned ye victory theyr enimyes fourth batayll nere vnto moore called cole moore whych long sore foughten saxon reason sayde moore closyd parte theyr hoste strongly brytons myght winne vnto dauger theyr shot yt fynally chasyd many costraynt drowned swalowed sayde moore ouer besyde foure pryncypall bataylles uortimerus wyth saxon dyuers conflictes kent thetfoord northfolke essex nere vnto colchestre lefte tyll byrafte parte possessyons tyme wonne kepte onely yle thanet whych uortymer ofte greuyd nauy hadde ronowen doughter hengiste apperceyued great myschy f fader saxos mraciall knyghthode uortymer sought suche meanes shortly testyfyeth gaufryde uortimer poysoned ruled briton moste concorde wryters seuen yeres lxxxix chapiter uortigernus fader uortymerus last dede agayn restoryd kyngdome myche brytayne yere oure lordes incarnacyon foure hudred lxxi xi yere childericus kyng fraunce whyche tyme reygne sonne uortimer restyd hym coutre cambria walys passe tyme writer buyldyd stroge castel place called generon gwayneren west syde walys nere vnto riuer gwana hyll vpon hyll called cloarcius olde cronycle spoken sayth uortiger kept somwhat vnder rule certayne tutours hym assygned ye towne caerlegion chester demeaned hym well towarde hys sonne aydynge hym wyth hys counsayll otherwyse brytons cast hym fauoure deth uortimer made hym agayne kynge longe uortiger thus set authoryte hengist percyd land great multytude saxon wherof herynge uortyger haste assembled brytons made towarde hengistus hadde experyence great hoste brytons ordeyned meanes treaty pea lastly yt concluded certayne ber brytons many saxon shuld vpon maye day assemble vppon playne ambrii called salesbury whyche daye certaynly prefyxyd hengistus vsynge new maner treason chargyd saxon appoynted eche shulde putte secretely longe knyfe theyr hose suche season gaue watche worde nempnyth sexis eueryche shulde drawe hys knyfe slee bryton sparynge one except uortiger ye kyng ye day appointed kynge wyth certayne brytons ware purposed treason came peasyble wyse ye place assygned fande redy hengistus wyth hys saxon whyche due obeysaunce made vnto kynge receyued hym coutenauce loue tyme comunycacyon hengiste beynge mynded execute former purposed treason shewed watche word reason wherof anon brytons slayne shepe amonge woluys hauynge maner wepyn defede self excepte yt myght manhode strength get knyfe enymye amonge nomber brytons erle called edoll edolf erle caerlegion chestre ye whych seynge felowes frendes thus murdered affermeth myne authoure gaufryde manhode wanne stake hedge ellys wyth whyche knyghtly sauyd owne lyfe slewe saxon xvii fledde cytye towne ambry nowe named salysburye whyche treason thus executyd kynge remayned wyth hengistus prysoner takynge uortyger sleynge lordes brytayne authoure called guillelmus de regibus sayth hengist agreed wyth uortyger hys brytons shulde enioye castell hym made wyth certayn lande therunto adioynynge hym saxos dwell vpon sayde agrement suerly stablyshed hengiste entendynge treason desyred kynge wyth certayn nomber lordes come hym dyner wythin sayde castell whych ye kynge graunted daye assygned kyng lordes came sayde thongcastell dyner wyth well honourably receyued also deyntely serued kynge lordes theyr moste myrth hengiste commaunded yt owne knyghtes shuld falle varyauce among selfe whych done remenaunt saxon yt partynge frayes shulde fall vppon briton slee theym oute take onely kynge whyche done lyke ye haue harde deuysed kynge holden prysoner xc chapiter hengistus hauynge kynge prysoner great parte ruler britayne thus sayd subdued deale exalted pryde compellyd kynge gyue vnto hym wytnessyth policronica thre prouynces eest parte brytayne whych thre prouynces shuld ket southsaxon sussex eestanglys whych meane norff suff affermeth authoure floure hystoryes guydo de columna sayth foresayde thre prouynces kent eestsaxon essex eestanglys norff suff whyche sayde prouynces hengist possessyd suffred kynge go lybertye hengiste beganne lordshyppe ouer prouynce kent sent saxos beweld two prouynces saye eestanglys eestsaxons tyll hadde sente kynnesmen yt ente dyd gyue sayd uynces vnto kyngdome kent begynnyth xci chapiter thus hengistus beynge possessyon prouynce kent comaunded hys saxon call yt hengistus lande wherof authours meane hole lande brytayn toke fyrst name englande sayeng shall appere cotrary shalbe shewed hereafter storye egbert kynge westsaxons whych subdued ye parte kyngedomes saxos made one monarchye co maundyd lande called anglia saxon anglys whych corrupcyon speche called englande people englyshemen lordshyppe kyngedome kent begynnyng vnder hengiste yere oure lorde moste concordaunce wryters reason ye time iiii hudred lxxvi fyfte yere uortygers last reygne denys accopt kyngdome begynne yere lord foure hundred lv allowe begynnynge therof hengistus fyrst gyft reason uortyger maryed doughter lordeshyppe conteyned countre stretcheth eest occean vnto ryuer thamys vpon southeest southerye vppon weste london vpon northeest thamys aforesayd eestsaxon nowe essex lordshyppe conteyned also yle thanet whyche lordshyppe kyngdome endured moste wryters tyme fyrste yere reygne hengiste tyll xxv yere egbert named terme iii hundred xlii yeres folowynge accompte whyche season sayde egbert kynge westsaxons subdued baldredus kynge kent ioyned yt hys owne kyngdome al yt authoure policronica affermeth yt endure space thre hundred lxviii vnder xv kynges wherof baldredus laste whyche folowyth nere vnto accompt denys named fyrste crysten kyng lordshippe ethelbertus ethelbert whyche receyued fayth cryste holy man saynt austayne augustayne nere yere lordes incarnacyon foure hundred lxxx xvi whyche ethelbert caused soone edyfyed monastery saynt peter paule eestsyde ende cytye dorobernia caunterbury gaue vnto austayn successours byshoppes caunterbury place byshoppes see chrystes chyrche wythin sayd cytye endowed many ryche possessios hengiste saxon whyche ruled xvii pryncypates brytayne shall shewed called moste wryters regulus whyche meane oure vulgare speche small lytell kynges hengist accompted lyttell kynge whyche hadde thus rule foresayde iii prouynces sent mo saxon gatheryd yt sparkled abrode yt prouynces fayth chryste quenchyd slepe hengist wyth octa son gaderyd great stregth saxos faught wyth brytons ouercame brytons chasyd suche wyse hengiste kepte lordesshyppe peace warre space xxiiii yeres moste wryters testyfye xcii chapiter nowe lette v retourne agayne uortiger ye sawe saxon suche wyse encrease theyr strength brytons dayly dyscreace writeth myne authour gaufryde yt saxon rule london yorke lincolne lindecoln kaerguet wynchester wyth good townes wherfore affermeth sayd gaufryde kyng fere ye saxos also deale warned commyng ii bretherne aurely uter sonnes constantyne therfore consyderynge many great daungers fledde cambria walys helde hym suertye wytnessyth sayde gaufryde buylded castel mynded ye buyldynge impediment therof also gettynge byrthe merlyne prophecyes made longe worke whyche passe ouer dyuerse consyderacyons retourne agayne uortiger trouth yt whyle uortygernus thus besyed walys forenamed brethern aurely uter preparyd theyr nauy men army passed see landed totnesse sayth englysh cronycle wherof brytons ware disparklyd seueryd many coutres drewe hasty wyse sayde bretherne sawe hadde competent nomber knyghtes made towarde walys dystresse uortyger wherof beynge warned myche well knewe yt myght make sufficyet defence stregth knyghtes therfore garnyshed castell wyth strength men vytayll entendynge sauegarde hym selfe meane vayne sayde two bretherne wyth theyr armye besegyd sayd castell fynally many assautes wyth wylde fyre consumed sayde castell wyth uortiger therin hym yt redde shulde lye owne doughter truste ye kynges shulde come blood whyche dede accursyd saynte germayne lastely ended lyfe hefore expressed hadde reygned nowe laste ix yeres xciii chapiter aurelius ambrosius seconde sonne costantyne brother constancius slayne treason uortyger kynge made brytons yere oar lorde iiii hundred lxxx one xxi yere childeric kynge fraunce thys yt sayd hard dyuysion land brytayne betwene uortiger saxon maner saxos subdued brytons goodly haste wyth ayde kynge lytell brytayne spedde hym thys lande aboue sayde vyctory hadde uortiger spedde hym towarde yorke affermeth gaufride chasyd saxon helde cytye wyth octa osca sonne hengist toke sayde octa kepte hym prysoner somwhat tyme howe yt treason keper otherwyse brake pryson wyth fader gaderyd great hoste mette aurelius brytons place called crekynford foughten stronge myghty batayll ye losse partyes losse fyll saxos slayne foure duke iiii thousande men dele chasyd theyr great daunger yet wytstandynge hengiste contynued lordshyppe kent aurelius ambrose whyche englyshe cronycle nameth aurilambrose kepte countre called logiers myddell englande wyth walys chasyd saxon dwelled ye ii forsayd prouynces eest saxon eest anglis countres seconde kyngdome xciiii chapiter passe tyme saxo named ella wyth thre sonnes called symen symon plettynger cissa came wyth thre shyppes called obilas landed south parte brytayne slewe many brytons place named cuneueshore chased many vnto wood called andresleger occupyed ye countre inhabyted hym saxon wythin sayde prouynce makyng hym selfe kyng lorde therof reason wherof might power sayd prouynce countre named ye kyngdome lordshyp southsaxons whyche concorde wryters shuld haue begynnyng xxxii yere fyrst comyng hegist folowynge ye accompte shuld yere lorde iiii hundred lxxxii seconde yere aurely kynge brytayne kyngdome lordshippe eestsyde kent south see yle wyght west hampsyre northe southrey conteyned wytnessyth guydo southampton somersetshyre deuenshyre cornewayl whyche sayde kyngdome ethelbaldus ethelwald iiii kynge fyrste crysten kynge thys kyngdome endured shorteste season kyngdomes passyd soonest yt endured aboue hundred xii yeres vnder v vii kynges moste xcv chapiter returne left aurely whyche ye haue harde helde occupyed myddell parte brytayne wyth ca bria walys dyd hys dylygence repayre ruynous place well temple caused ye seruyce god sayde done whyche meane saxon greatly decayde thorough brytayne aureli beseged saxon ye hyll badon badowe slewe many theym dayly saxon encreasyd landed myche brytayn shall appere shortely saxon named porth landed wyth two sone haue southsex whome authours meane ye haue called portismouth whyche kepeth name day lykewyse came lande dyuers place britayne aurelius wyth many conflyctys bataylles whych spedde dyuersly somtyme vyctour season ouer set wryte hym ye englyshe cronicle ye helpe merlyn shuld fetche great stone standynge vpon playne salysburye called stone henge oute irlande caused theym sette nowe stande remembraunce brytons slayne buryed tyme communycacyon hengiste saxon storye uortiger touchyd polycronica alledgyth yt honour vnto uter pendragon brother tyme aurelius wytnessyth also ye sayde policronica dyed hengist bed reygned ouer ye kentysh saxon xxiiii yeres whose deth octa osca sonne ruled ye sayd kyngdome xxiiii yeres yt brytyshe bokes also cronycles enlande sheweth aurelius batayll slayne hengiste toke vnto grace octa son gaue vnto hym dwellynge place countre galewey hym saxos lefte lyue semeth true mater shall ensue also touchyd pictes scottes tyme myserye brytons yt foloweth octa nother augmented mynyshed lordshyp helde hym therwyth contented fader hym lefte yt lastely ende reygne aurely pascentius yongest son uortiger whiche ye deth fader fledde irland fere aurely purchasyd ayde guilamour kyng irlade wyth great armye inuadyd thys lande brytayne countre walys takynge cytye menenia wastynge sayd cou tre wyth iron fyre season tyme aureli laye syke cytye kaerguent wynchester whych cause desyred hys brother uter gather hoste britos appease ye malice pascencius adheretis whych accordyngly preparyd hoste length ouercame hoste pasce cius slewe hym forenamed guillamour fyght whyle season uter thus gone agayne pascentius saxon strauger feynynge hym bryton connyng man physyke intycemet pascencius came vnto aurely lay syke subtyle false meanes purchasyd fauour wyth yt nyghe vnto prynce put truste mynystre medycines vnto kyng named writer coppa eoppa whyche espyed tyme couenyent brynge false purpose gaue aureli pocyon enpoysoned vyolence wherof shortely dede hadde reygned moste wryters vppon xix yeres thyrde fyfte xcvi chapiter tyme ye reygne aurelius wytnesseth authour policronica ye kyngdome eestanglis began vnder saxon named uffa yere lorde iiii hundred lxxx xii xi yere aurelius whych kyngdome conteyned norlf suff nowe called hadde eest north sydes see northweste cambryge shyre weste saynte edmundes dytche hertfordshyre southe essex lordshyppe called fyrste uffynys lordshyp kynges therof named uffynys authoures people fynally named eest anglys fyrst cristen kyng pryncypate redwaldus thyrde kynge stedfaste belonged relygyon sonne named corpwaldus stedfaste whyche slayne mysbyleuynge man crystes fayth wryte guydo sayth sebertus fyrste cristen kynge lordshyppe made saynt poulys chyrch lo vnder xii kynges endured tyll martyrdome blessyd saynte edmunde laste kynge therof whych martyred nere yere lord viii hudred lxix whyche reason yt shuld folowe kyngdome shulde endure terme iiiclxxvii yeres lordshyp dayes elman thetforde chyfe towne guydo lordeshyppe shulde begynne yere grace v hundred lxx shuld yt endure ii hundred iiii score xix yeres francia xcvii chapiter clodoueus sonne childericus hildericus named deth fader ordeyned kynge fraunce ye yere oure lorde iiii hundred lxxx iiii thyrde yere aurelius kyng brytayne wryters named clodoue lowys whyche shortely realme authorysyd kynge heryng reporte beaute grete vertue clotildis neuewe cundebald kynge ruler burgoyne sente vnto hym knyght named aurelius treat maryage betwene kynge clotyld crotild cundebald fere loue assentyd cause wherof myn authour sayth yt thys crotyld enherytour vnto sayde lande burgoyne reason yt maryage shuld recouer ryghte put hym rule therof crotild day receyuyd fayth cryste co tynuynge relygyon maryed clodoueus paynym endured certayne tyme yet left enduce tourne lorde fayth myghte certayn tyme delyueryd sonne whyche meanes holy man remigius byshop raynes quene crotyld crystyned named clodomerus whych dyed wyth shorte processe yt happe kyng sayd goddes dyscontented wyth hym suffred chylde crystyned wrathe therof taken fro hym chylde quene takynge kynges sayenge pacyence conceyued seconde sonne whyche also kynges agrement also baptysed also certayne tyme vexed wyth greuous sekenes suche wyse yt lykely haue dyed wherfore kynge impacyent blamed ye relygyon wyfe moste impacyent maner whych sayenges quene toke pacyetly put confidence god remigeus prayed effectuously chylde restored vnto perfyte helth thus clodoueus perseuerynge erronyous lawe made warre vppon almaynes whych warre beynge one daye occupyed fyght agayne hys enymyes wyth hys people put werse wherof whan clodoue ware hauyng greate drede hym selfe called mynde often exortacyon hys wyfe greate vertue goddes lawe sodaynly lyfte eyen towarde heuen sayde god whyche clotylde wyfe doth honoure helpe yf daye may passe thys daunger opteyne vyctory shall euer worshyp wyth true fayth whyche prayer skantly fynysshed frenchemen dyuyne power vnyed knyt togyther knyghtly wythstode theyr enemyes shorte whyle opteyned vyctory whyche vyctory ye kynge greate tryumphe retourned fraunce wherof whan clotylde warned anone receyued hym wyth ioye gladnes thankynge lord god great vyctory ye forsaken hys idolatrye becomen seruaunt ye onely god fourmer worlde xcviii chapiter longe yt blessyd remigius sent whyche enfourmed kynge suffycyently fayth cryst vppon eester daye folowynge wyth great solempnyte baptysed kynge tyme solempnysacyon doynge holy crysine oyle neglygence mynysters otherwyse lackynge doue discendyng heuen brought becke byll vyoll fylled wyth oyle moste swetest sauour delyuered saynt remigius construed done vertue ye holy ghost wyth thys holy oyle whan kyng anoynted surplusage therof kept moste reuerence haue herde reported oyle kept cytye reynes parys yt neuer fayleth wasteth al ryghtfull enherytours ye crowne fraunce therwyth theyr coronacyo anoynted happen myghty vsurpe ye crowne myghte bysshoppe cometh thys holy oyle fyndeth yt vyoll glasse drye ellys thys reporte euery man maye gyue credence hym lyketh fande wryten gospell yet boke holy scrypture foloweth thys solepnyte done kynge hadde certeyne wordes people exortynge leue theyr idolatrye byleue cryste hys fayth whose myghte power onely hadde venquysshed hys enemyes whyche exortacyo meanes holy bysshop remigius myche people conuertyd baptysed kyng buylded certeyne newe monasteryes dedycat olde temple idollys honoure crystes sayntes among ye one nere vnto cytye parys honour apostle peter paule wytnessed mayster robert gagwyne dayes frenche kynges vsed bere theyr armes iii tody thys clodoueus receyued crystes relygyon iii floure de lyse sente hym dyuyne power sette shylde asure whyche syns ye tyme hath ben borne frenche kynges sayd authour myndeth also monastery fraunce called monastery saynte bartylmewe somtyme kepte clothe redde sylke whyche named aurysflambe borne baner felde agayne barbaris hethen people vertue wherof frenche prynces wan many vyctoryes whan thys precyous relyke aurysflabe borne agayne crysten prynces vertue therof seasyd lastly lost yet lyke therof kepte saynt denys greate reuerence bysshoppes abbottes place foloweth ye storye whan clodoueus hadde set hys realme due order clotyld callyng mynde treason done fader also wrongfull wythholdynge ryghtfull enherytaunce vncle cundebalde exorted lorde clodoueus sende embassade requyre restytucyon sayde ryght yt whych sone done whan kynge receyued answere yt sayd cundebalde wolde restore sayd ryghte hys wyfe goodly wyse prepared armye made warre vppon sayd cundebalde greate waste dystruccyon coutre clodoueus fynally besegyd hym cytye toke sayd cytye strength sayd cundebalde wythin ye prysoner medyacyon frendes greate gyftes wyth also yerely trybute payed clodoueus sayd cundebalde releaced sette lybertye xcix chapiter voyage thus spedde orderyd kynge lefte behynde hym armye v thousand knyghtes vnder gydyng gu defyll brother foresayd cundebalde retourned fraunce sone kynges departynge cundebalde cotrary promyse made gaderyd power knyghtes made warre vppon hys sayde brother lastly beseged hym cytye uienne vppon eyther parte skyrmysshes assautes great people slayne yt ende cundebalde wanne cytye hys brother therein beynge afterwarde behedyd thys tyme great discencyon grewe atwene clodoueus kynge gothys called alericus whyche varyauce agremet bothe partyes put iugement theodorycus kyng longobardes italyas whyche sayde cause well suffycyently argued debatyd hym hys cousayle fynally gaue sentence yt knyght clodoueus shulde stande vppon hylle holdynge spere vpryghte hys hande kynge gothys shuld throwe lay mych syluer shulde processe couer poynt sayd spere whyche sentence testyfyeth mayster robert gagwyne gothis despysed sayenge suffycyent syluer wythin theyr land perfourme sayd sentence despyte certeyne gothys espyenge prynce frauce named paterne beynge assocyate wyth dyuerse frenshmen lofte chamber whyche paterne ben solycytour frenshe kynge ye foresayd mater sayde gothys crafty false meanes caused floorth sayd chamber falle whyche meane sayde paterne greuously hurte many lykewise slayne wherof whan clodoueus wrytynge beynge therwyth greatly amoued also bycause ye gothys dysobeyde foresayd awarde gadered shortly greate hoste certeyne offerynges done saynt martyn wyth also passyng ryuer uian myracle ledynge harte lastly came syghte hys enemyes thenne clodoueus lodged hys hoost nere vnto monastery saint hillary nyght ye batayle receyued token vyctory whyche passe ouer vppon morne set hys people araye made towarde hys enemyes mette wyth felde called noglodien nere vnto ye ryuer cleue clyue sore longe fyght slewe abouesayde alaricus kynge gothys sayth myne authour wyth hys owne hande shulde seme discorde tyme wyth wryters cronica cronicarum iacobus philippus testyfye thys alaricus dede many yeres shulde kynge gothys theyr sayenge tyme yt honorius brother vnto archadius emperour whyche aboute yere lord iiii hudred ix began hys empyre wherfore mayster robert gagwyne meaneth kynge gothys alaric sayd authours also affyrmen alaricus dyed sodayne sykenesse cytye named cesancia wha reygned moste wryters vi yere foloweth ye story whan clodoueus thus opteyned vyctory gothys set countre guyan order sped hym agayne fraunce comen countre turon encoutred wyth embassadours themperours anastasius presented sayd emperour wyth gyftes greate pryce honour also admytted consull rome whyche dayes dygnyte moste honour whyche done remytted sayd embassade wyth great gyftes sayenge affyrmed wryters whych shewe honour hym done mych ouercomen gothys enemyes crystes fayth name kynges name reygned ouer gothys thys besynesse ouerpassed clodoueus contynued hys iourney tyll came monastery chyrche faynt martyn wyth great deuocyon accordyng hys former promysse offered stede occupyed iourney agayne gothys entended occupye sayd hors yf hadde lyke nede redemed hym wyth competent summe golde yet hors myghte remoued ye kyng added hundreth pecys golde dayes named golden shyllynges receyued hys stede wherfore kynge sayd game saynt martyn good helper nede costelewe thus thys noble fyrste crysten prynce cotynued hys lyfe noble marcyall dedys augmentynge hys kyngdome knyghtly batayles worldy prouysyons lastly dyed goddes visytacyo stedfastnes fayth whan hadde reygned xxx yeres leuyng hym iiii sonnes clotylde hys wyfe saye clodomyrus chyldebertus theodoricus clotharius latarius buryed ye monastery nere vnto parys hadde buylded wyth suche epytaphy superscripcyon vppon hys tumbe shalbe shewed procede declaryng foresayd epitaphy mych haue hard dyuers hold opynyon fayth cryste receyued fraunce receyued lande brytayne therfore shall note tyme clodoueus fyrst toke baptyme whyche ranulphe monke testyfye xv yere hys reygne nere whyche ye yere lord iiiiclxxx xix wherby yt apperyth consyderynge tyme luci fyrst cryste prynce euer brytayne shewed cristes fayth longe tyme honoured brytayn honoured fraunce excepte suche holde forsayd opynyo accompte fyrste comyng crystes fayth brytayne ye fyrste conuersyon saxon whenne yt prechyd holy monke saynt augustyne hys felowes whych purpose foresayde epitaphy superscrypcyon foloweth diues opum virtute potens clarus que triumpho condidit haue sedem rex clodoueus idem patricius magno subsimis fulsit honore pfemis amore dei contempsit credere nusso lumen qui varijs horrent potenta figuris mox pur gatus aquis christi fonte renatus fragrantem gessit infulso crisinate crinem exemplu que dedit sequitur quod plurima tur gentisis populi spreto que errore suorum doctorem cultura deum verum que parentem hijs felix meritis superauit gesta priorum semper concilio castris bellis que tremendus hortatu dux ipse bonus ac pectore fortis costructas acies formauit gmine primus whyche verse maye thus expouned moder tuge foloweth riche goodes stronge vertue triumphe shynynge kyng clodoueus temple buyste stone fader comon profete clad honour excellynge replenyshed goddes loue despysed hys olde foon hys pagaun lawe wyth straunge fygurs echone purgid holy water cristes font born new holy crisine enointed floured vertue dew example gyuyng hym foloweth many man forsakyng theyr errour theyr fals goddes techynge honour one god thus merytes excelled parentall thorough cousayle made citye castell thrall noble duke therwith grete might front batayle euer fyrst knyght anglia c chapiter vter laste yongest sonne costantyne brother aurelius made kyng britayn yere lorde v huudred euen xvi yere clodoueus kynge fraunce thys y touched surnamed pendrago cause therof wytnessyth ye englysshe cronycle mych merlyn lykened hym vnto drago vnder sterre apperynge firmament wherof made long processe gaufryde brytyshe boke also affermed whych semeth lytell credece trought uter sayde made kynge enamowryd vppon duke wyfe cornewayll named igwarne igorne optayn vnlefull lust sought many dyuers meanes ye lastly made warre vpo husbade named garol gorleis legth slew ye sayde duke castell called tyntagell standynge cornewayle maryed wyfe receyued noble knyght arthur doughter named amye sayth englyshe cronycle lefte wryter authoryte remembraunce thys uter testifye helpe merlyne shulde fetche corium gigantum otherwyse called stone henge irlad haue shewed story aurelius gaufryde y shewed uter also shulde wynne forsayde ladye enchauntement merlyn whych comely chrysten relygyon gyue suche fantastycall illusyons mynde credence wherfore passe ouer leuynge mater whych also y rehersyd warre betwene uter osca sonne hengyste mych dyscordaunt vnto wryters fynally conclude thys uter pendragon dyed force venym hadde ruled thys yle brytayne full terme xvi yeres buryed brother aurely corium gigantum stone henge leuynge hym forenamed sonne puyssaunt arthur francia ci chapiter lotharius clotharius yongest sonne clodoue made kynge parte fraunce called soisons ye yere lorde v hundred xiiii xiiii yere uter kynge myche brytayne ye shall vnderstande deth clodoueus laste kyng fraunce lande hym dyuyded hys foure sonnes say eldest sonne clodomirus appoynted lordshyppe orlyaunce theodoricus seconde sonne austracye childebertus ye thyrd son myddell frauce countre lyenge paris lothayr aboue sayd lordshyppe soisons whyche sayd lordshyppes eyther possessyd theyr subiettes called kynges contynued good reste certayne tyme whyche season clotyld theyr moder berynge mynde vnnaturall deth parentes wylled sonnes venge theyr deth whych deth testyfyeth uincent historyall also antoninus forme folowynge gundenchus graud father clotildis iiii sonnes saye cundebaldus gondigisillus hilpericus godomarus iiii sonnes gundenchus besette lande burgoyne gondigisill godomar dyed wherfore land burgoyne fyll cundebaldus hilpericus cundebaldus couetyse hole lordeshyp slew brother hilpericus fastened great stone necke wyfe cast depe water hys ii doughters wherof eldest hyght trona exyled poore wede clothynge yonger kepte seruage wythin owne courte whyche shewed maryed agayne hys wyll vnto clodoue fader lothari yt foloweth lotharius sonne clotild made sharpe warre vpon sigismonde sonne cundebaldus whyche dede whyche warre eldest sonne clodomyrus slayne leuyng hym iii sonnes named theobaldus guntherus guntharre clodoaldus whych iii sonnes toke tuycyon guydynge brother maynteyned warre agayn yt burgoynios wyse ye finally obteyned ye ryght porcyon theyr moder clotilde thys warre fynyshed burgoyne childebertus thyrd sonne herynge almarcus kyng spayne mysse entreated suster made warre vppon hym lastly hym subdued sette suster former estate whyle said childebert thus spayne occupyed theodorus brother toke hym cytye hym belongyng called moutclere slewe knyghtes childebertus lefte kepe sayd cytye myscheuous dede arose gret debate betwene two bretherne medyacyon frendes legth accordyd theodorus sought new meanes dyspleasure agayne sayde brother well treason wyse whyche childebert polycye wysedome wyth good fortune escapyd childebertus castynge mynde myght wynne hym patrymony lordeshyp lately beloged vnto eldest broder clodomyrus toke counsayle brother clotharius wyse yt gyder one assent sent vnto theyr moder clotyld theyr neuewes childern theyr brother nothynge mystrustynge theym sent sayde childern vnto sayd ii brethern wythin shorte tyme theyr commyng vnto theyr sayde vncles testifyeth mayster robert gagwyne also freche cronicle lotharius tyranously wyth sworde slew two ye sayde childern thyrde fledde sauegarde vnto suche hym fauouryd agayne taken compelled make solemne othe yt shulde become relygyous man neuer clayme part ryght enherytaunce vnlefull meane ii brothern obteyned hole lordshyppe orleaunce partyd reuennues thereof betwene enduryd whyle passe ouer sorowe clotylde made childern sonne clodomyrus also orderyng yongest son called clodoaldus whyche escaped daunger vncles shewed whyche wolde aske longe season cii chapiter long seconde brother kynge duke austracy dyed goddes visytacyon leuynge hym sonne named theodobertus whyche two foresayde vncles greuously warred loge tract tyme whyche defendyd thorough marciall knighthode dyuers meanes hadde sought peace myght purchase founde suche meanes ryche gyftes otherwyse wane fauoure vncle childebert cherysshyd hym frende fyll vnkyndnes betwene childebert lotharius myche eyther assembled great hoste subdue one forenamed theodobertus made ye power myght ayde assyste chyldebert vppon bothe partyes great multytude knyghtes armed redy fyght clotilde herynge mortall warre betwene two sonnes also consyderynge lykelyhode great effusyon mannes blood myghte ensue reason ioynynge foresayd two hostes hast yode vnto sepulture shryne saynt martyn wyth due deuocyon made specyall prayer besechynge god blessyd saynt sende heuenly power let impedyment yt sayd hostes shuld ioyne batayll meane whyche prayer sayde two hostes preparyng haue ronne gyther sodeynly fyll suche tempeste wynde hayll wyth thunder lyghtnynge bothe hostes greuously beten sayde tempeste wederynge eyther mynde myght defende selfe daunger said wederyng ouer testyfyeth ye aboue named authour eyther hostes thought theyr myndes chased theyr enimies wyse eyther fledde longe space eyther sent meanes treatyse eyther length confermed peace betwene whyche peace surely partyes assured childebert excytyd brother warre vppon people countre called terra conens prouynce spayn besegyd cytye saragounce otherwise called augusta fynally kept cytesyns shorte appeace theyr enimyes caused byshoppe cytye open sepulchre saynt uyncent gyue lotharius parte holy martyr bodye yet notwythstandynge though syege wythdrawen cytye sparyd yet countre aboute pylled wasted wythoute pyte wyth great rychesse praye retourned fraunce paris childebert soone builded monastery worshyppe god saynt uincent foresayd relyke sette reueretly kepte whych monastery daye called saynt germayns de pree thys whyle saye happe two brethern newly malygned agayne theyr neuewe theodobert son theyr brother theodorich entendyd malyce byreue hym lordeshyppe austracy entent gatheryd theyr people warre vpon sayde theodobert wherof ye sayd theodobert ware consyderynge coude shortely assemble people wythstande malyce sayd vncles lowly good maner rode agayne peasyble wise behaued hym well worde dede alonely forgaue hys trespasse also sente hym gayne great rychesse gyftes soone thys tyme dyed clo tilde wife clodoueus great pompe two sonnes buryed sayde husbande shortly dyed theodobert aforenamed leuynge hym sonne named theobalde thys passe tyme lotherius hys wyfe r ceyued vii sonnes two doughters whyche cramyris eldest sonne sente guyan haue rule therof vnder father contrary hys father mynde oppressyd inhabytauntes therof wyth greuous exaccyons tribute wherfore hys father beynge dyscontent called hym then cramyris wyth beynge sore amoued great angre departed father courte yode vnto childebert hys vncle excytynge hym make warre vppon hys father imagynynge fals occasyons bryng two brethern dystaunce made solemne othe vncle durynge hys lyfe shuld stregth party agayn owne father whyche assuraunce thus made chyldebert preparyd hys hoste warre agayne brother lothari ye sayd lothari beynge warned lette haddde sent agayne hys enymyes two sonnes hys named gunthranus aribert whyle two fonnes made toward childebert whyle made great waste countre champayne takynge great pry returned hys owne countre myddell fraunce wherof herynge forenamed guntranus hys brother also guyan moued warre cramyr spedde thyder wyth theyr people dydde nothynge worthye memorye laude thys season dyed forsayde chyldeberte brother lotharius wythout heyre hadde ruled myddell fraunce xivii yeres sayeth frenche cronycle enterred ye monastery saint uyncent otherwyse called saynte germayne de pree ciii chapiter deth childebert myche dyed without heyre lotharius forenamed seasyd myddell fraunce possessyon hadde somdele sette yt order forgetynge innaturall rebellyon hys son cramyris chase vnto hym puryd company knyghtes competent nomber haste made toward guyan ye sayd cramyr abydynge harde comynge father agayn hym chosyn armye withdrewe hym vttermost partyes fraunce requyryd ayde kynge duke partye adioynynge named gonobalde hym promised ayde power lotharius affinyte beyng warned pursued sayde gonobalde sharpely constrayned hym length take chyrch saynte martyne holde yt sauegarde lotharius assayd dyuerse meanes well fayre promyse wordes manasses myght get sayde gonobalde oute holy place set chyrche fyre brent duke shortely reedifyed made better maner yt hadde ben cramyris thus dispoynted ye ayde gonobalde fledde lyttell brytayne requyred ayde erle therof named cenabutus comforte yt sayde erle assembled great hoste wythstand father wherof father beynge asserteyned drewe towarde hym hostes nere sent messagers ye father entreate peace lotharius included many harde condycyons wythin sayde peace writersmeane cramyris desyred vnlefull desyres father sayd treaty myght take none effecte truste brytons strength vtterly bent trye cause dynt swerde lotharius hauynge experiece fortune batayl victory doutfull vncertayne therfore made hys prayer god besechynge hym ayde agayne innaturall obstynate rebellyon sonne whych prayer endyd commaunded name god sette vppon enymyes whyche mette grete ire shortly ye grene feld dyed perfyght redde many knyghtes vpon partyes laye slayne gruntynge vppon erthe father comfortynge callynge vpon knyghtes vppon one parte son vpon knyghtes vpon parte eyther entendynge ye deth vtter destruccyon eche thus batayll hangynge suspence whether vyctorye shuld turne sodeynly briton gaue backe gaue place frenchemen wyth french partye beyng coforted enforced yt briton wyth sharpe fyght compelled forsake felde toke theym flyght frenchemen chasyd slewe wythout mercy whyche chase cramyris wyth hys wyfe chyldern taken presentyd vnto lotharius whyche shortly settynge parte faderly loue compassion pytye causyd great fyre made whyche commaunded caste sayde cramyris also hys wyfe chyldern wytnessyth frenche cronycle enclosyd house house gether consumyd wyth fyre thus moste cruell father without pyte chastysyd ye inobedyent son example lernyng bere dewe obedyece vnto theyr parentes vyctory cruell chastysement executed lothari retourned fraunce sepulcre shryne saynte martyne yeldynge god hym thankes thys vyctorye offeryd many ryche gyftes spedde hym soisons kynge fraunce excepte lordshyppe austracy whyche theobald sonne brother son theodorich helde father theobald theodobert lotharius seynge hys lande reste quyetnesse gaue hym huntynge chace wylde bestes game great vse amog freche prynces whyche dysporte beyng one daye greatly trauayled caught surfet whyche ensued mortall sykenes dyed shortely hadde reygned specifyed ouer lordshyppe soysons terme l wynter full buryed soisons great pompe leuynge hym foure sonnes gu thranus aribertus chilpericus sigebertus testyfyed mayster robert gagwyne saynte radegunde borne countre thurynge pagan father named bernigarius wyfe lothar whose vertuous lyfe antonin boke called sm antonini viii chapyter xii tytle seconde parte worke shewyth copedyously anglia ciiii chapiter arthur sonne uter pendragon strepelynge xv yeres age beganne reygne kynge brytayne yere oure lorde v hundred xvii thyrde yere lotharius kynge fraunce parte therof declared arthure gaufryde recyted longe storye alowed englysh cronycle whyche wryters y greatly dyscordaunte yet authours agreen noble victoryous dedys fayne wolde declare fame noble prynce comforte folowe marcyall dedis myght somwhat iustly fye reporte authoure authoryte doute bycause sayenge ranulphe monke chestre whyche vouchyth yt vppon wyllyam wryter hystoryes kynges y rehersed length vi chapyter v boke policronico open euery man y desyrous knowe sayde reporte opynyon whyche legth therof ouerpasse somwhat honour great champyon thys arthur shall lay vnto reder may wyth authoryte shewe vnto herers ther wyth gladde welsheman shuld descede noble vyctour whych many dedys honour executed dayes testyfyeth polycronycon arthur faught xii table batayllis agayne saxon victour wherfore fyrste vpon ryuer cleuy iiii nexte foughten vpon ryuer douglys rynneth vnder town wygan vpon ten myles ryuer merse lancashyre vi batayll vppon ryuer called bassa vii besyde lyncoln wood called celidon viii ix foughten yorke x nycolf towne whyche named warwyk wryters xi bathe longe besegyd cerdicus kynge westsaxons xii last place called badon babowe hyll slewe many saxon notwythstandynge myght clerely voyde lande kepte theyr coutes possessyd kente southerey norff authours testyfy held countres trybutaryes vnto arthure thys noble warryour wytnessyth holy gildas slew hande one daye ye helpe ladye saynte marye whose picture bare peynted shelde hundred xl saxon whyche shelde called prydwen swerd called caliboure spere called ron brytyshe tunge speche thyrde fourth cv chapiter v yere arthur agrement moste wryters beganne lord shyppe westsaxos vnder ye saxon called cerdicus kenricus hys sonne denys wytnesse lordshyppe kyngdome shulde haue begynnynge lxxi yere fyrste commynge hengiste yere oure lorde fyue hundred xxii agreeth wyth v yere arthure aforesayde thys lordshyppe conteyned weste countre englande wylt wyltshyre somersetshyre berk dors deuonshyre cornewayll hadde eest syde southampton ye north thamys famouse ryuer south weste see occean foresayde cerdicus whyche authours named childricus laded fyrst cerdyshore nowe called yermouth hauen towne countre norff helpe saxon inhabyted countre called eest anglys sayd cerdicus legth obteyned foresayde countre named yt westsaxon westsaxonia reygned therin lorde kyng certayne yeres kenric sonne hym fyrste chrysten kynge prouynce named kyngilsus couertyd meanes blessed man berinus byshoppe dorchester quichelinus brother foresayd kyngilsus gaue sayd cytye make hys see also receyued baptyme sayde berinus guydo wytnessyth sayde quichelinus gaue byshoppe wynchester vii myles compasse lande buylde byshoppes see whyche accomplyshed finyshed kenwalcus son thys kyngdome enduryd longeste whyche vii nomber vi besyde thys wryters accompte terme duraunce thys kyngdome cerdicus egbert laste yere aluredus guydo accomptyth enduraunce thys kyngdome fyrste yere cerdicus vnto laste yere edwarde cofessour reason wherof yt shuld endure fyue hundred liiii yeres moste accordyngly yt shulde rekened fyrst yere cerdicus laste yere aluredus made one monarchye vii kyngdomes tyme dyd flowe passe thre hudred lxxviii yeres cvi chapiter nowe wyl returne vnto arthur whych longe tyme dwelled warre mortall batayll wyth ye saxos meane theyr dayly repayre lande whyche also alyed pictes nacyons made theyr partye strenger ye meane yet arthur marciall knyghthod brought theym suche frame accopted chyef lord brytayne fynally hadde longe tyme maynteyned hys warres agayne saxon specyally agayne cerdicus childricus kyng westesaxons fynall concorde gaue vnto sayde cerdicus testyfyeth policronica vi chapyter v boke two cou tres hampshyre somerset hadde sette hys lande quietnesse betoke rule therof vnto hys neuewe mordred wyth chosyn armye sayled sayth gaufryde vnto frauce reporte gaufryde wrought wonder wryters frenche cronycles touche nothynge suche notable dedes yet wryters romaynes mynde nothynge suche actes done agayne theyr consull emperoure called gaufryde lucius hybert therfore wyll spare longe mater remyttyng welshemen touchynge ye processe vnto sayd gaufride wyll folowe policronicon sayth mych forenamed mordred desyrous kynge feryd dele myght cerdicus kyng westsaxons therfore drewe hym sayde cerdicus great gyftes townes castelles meanes thorough sayd cerdicus hym assented mordred london crowned kyng brytayn cerdicus vse pagas wynchester called kaerguent crowned kyng westsaxons relacyo came arthur treason wrought neuewe mordred haste made towarde brytayn yt redde englyshe cronycle laded sandwyche mette mordred hys people whych gaue vnto hym strong batayll tyme landyng loste many knyghtes famouse knyghte gawyne yet withstandyng arthur legth wane lande chasyd enymyes enterynge cosyn gawyn knyghtes slayne sette forwarde hoste pursue enymyes mordred thus beynge ouersette vncle see syde withdrewe hym wynchester beynge furnysshed newe soudyours gaue vnto arthur sayth gaufryde ye secode fyghte wherin also mordred put worse constrayned flee thyrdely lastely sayde mordred faught wyth vncle arthur besydes glastynbury longe daungerouse fyght mordred slayn ye victorious arthur wounded vnto deth buryed vale aualon besyde glastynbury beforesayde laste ende buryenge arthur brytyshe bokes tolde many fable oppresse ye errours brytons ye thynke byleue yt arthur yet lyueth policroniconshe forenamed chapyter v boke yt secode henryes tyme kynge englande bonys sayd arthur gwaynour wyfe fouden traslated forsayde chyrch glastynbury newe buryed yere lord xi hundred lxxx specially yt noted xxiii chapyter vii boke policronicon aboue sayde wherfore coclusyon fyne noble warryour shewed slayne wounded deth hadde reygned ouer briton ye terme xxvi yeres wyllynge deth constantyne son cador duke cornewayle mych bodye remayned none heyre shulde heyre enheryte land mych britayn deth anglia cvii chapiter constantinus son cador duke cornewayle assent brytons crowned kynge myche brytayne yere crystes incarnacyon fyue hudred xliii xix yere lotharius kynge fraunce nere kynnesman vnto arthur two sonnes mordred greuously vexed myche claymed lande ryghte tytle theyr father yt betwene hym foughten many sondry bataylles wherof nother place tyme left conuenyent memorye yet name sayde two sonnes dyuerse authours agreen forsayde batayllys thus foughten fynylly two sonnes mordred constrayned pure force seche strong holdes theyr refuge wherfore one toke london wynchester wherof constantyne beynge warned lefte tyll slayne one wythin monastery saynte amphiabil wynchester wythin temple chyrche london whych temple named gaufryde hous freres ye sayeng doutefull day yt supposed none hous freres within london longe tyme constantine hadde thus subdued enymyes thought hymselfe maner suertye regyon fortune hadde enuyed glory arreryd agayne hym owne kynnesman named aurelius conanus whych agayn hym made mortall batayll finally last slewe hym ye felde hadde reygned accorde wryters iii yeres whych huryed stone hyenge sepulture uter pedragon wyth great solemnytye cviii chapiter aurelius conanus cosyn constantync last named crowned kyng brytayne yere lord v hundred xlvi xxxii yere lothari named kynge fraunce noble lyberall man cherysshed suche loued stryfe dyscencyon wyth lande gaue lyghte credence yt accused yt ryght wronge testyfyeth gaufryde toke strength vncle whyche ryght shulde haue ben kyng caste hym strong pryson ew tyrannously ii sonnes sayd vncle reioysed reygne shorte whyle wytnessyth sayde gaufryde hadde reygned two yeres dyed yt sonde god otherwyse leuynge sonne named uortiporius hath authoure boke named floure hystoryes uortiporius speketh nothynge englyshe cronycle telleth two kynges shulde reygne nexte constantyne one wherof one nameth adelbryght edyll wherunto none writer agreeth except nameth kynges saxon aboute tyme reygned kent soone ethelbert athelbert whyche myghte taken adelbryght whyche named edylf myght taken ella kynge southsaxons ella shulde concorde wryters lyuynge tyme myght wyth conuenyency accorde yt shulde kynge deira northuberlande named ella whyche reygned aboute tyme season two kynges sayde englyshe cronycle telleth longe processe whych fynde none authour authoryte wryteth speketh passe yt ouer ye shall also furthermore vnderstande daye brytons dayly dyscreasyd lordshyppe rule wythin brytayne drewe towarde cambyr walys countre chestre chyefe theyr lordshyp wythin brytayne dayly saxon landed wyth companyes occupyed ye princypall partes ye shortely shall appere fyfthe kyngdome saxon cix chapiter tyme reygne fore named aurelius conanus wytnessyth polycronica guido beganne kyngdome lordshyp brenicia vnder saxon named ida yere lorde v hundred xlvii seconde laste yere sayd conanus thys lordshyp north parte brytayne grewe short whyle fynally named kyngdome northumberlande ye shall vnderstande lordshyp fyrste deuyded two kyngdomes wherof fyrste aboue sayde called brenicia deyra meris markis kyngdome northuberlande easte west occean see south ryuer humber downwarde towarde weste endys ye shyres notynghm derby vnto ryuer merse mercia north scottysshe see whyche called forth scottysh brettyshe werde southsyde thys lordshyppe called deyra whyche nowe called bysshopryke durham north syde called brenicia whyche departyd seuered ryuer tyne deyra conteyned lande humber ryuer tyne brenicia included countree tyne scottysshe see brenicia regned fyrste aboue sayd ida ida deyra regned fyrste ella whych lordshyppes began bothe within iii yeres processe tyme bothe one named kyngdome northumberlande whych contynued somwhyle vnder one kynge somewhyle vnder two terme iii hundred xxi yeres sayth ranulphe munke chester furth contynued ye name vnder saxon dane tyll comynge edredus brother ethelstane son edwarde ye elder whiche edredus ix last yere hys reygne ioyned thys hys owne kyngdome reaso shulde seme thys kyngdome endured vnder name vpon iiii hundred ix yeres fyrste crysten prynce thys kyngdome named edwynus receyued fayth saynt paulyne testyfyeth guydo thys lordshyppe also included shyres countrees nowe called yorke notyngham shyre snothyngham shyre derby shyre ye bysshopryke durham copelande amonge many kynges yt reygned thys lordshyppe whych wryters nomber xxiii reygned one accopted viii kynge guydo named ethelfrid sonne ethelricus whych ethelfridus destroyed mo brytons ye kynges saxos fader saint oswold oswi slewe also many brytos batayle agayn besyde kaerlegyon chester two thousande hudred monkes house bangor y testyfyed polycronicon x chapyter hys v boke whyche monkes comen thyder praye good spede brytons ouer thys forsayde nomber monkes l fled whereby wyth theyr leder named brucyuall sauyd suche nomber monkes one house myghte demyd wonder sayd policronica wyth guydo wryters affermyn house bangor dayes party thre tymes vii hundred monkes whych lyued trauayle theyr handes onely forenamed oswye oswolde kynge thys prouynce whych gaue wyth hys doughter elfleda nonne xii lordshyppes ye chyrche buylde wyth xii monasteryes whereof vi sayde lordshyppes brenicia vi deyra sayth guydo also ranulphe hys v boke polycronyca xvi chapyter affermyth cx chapiter uortipori sonne aureli conanus opynyon sayd ordeyned kynge brytayne yere lorde v hundred xlviii xxxiiii yere clotharius thenne kynge fraunce whych lytell memory lefte cronycler wryter excepte yt guydo testyfyeth hym vyctoryous knyght shewyng breefly sondry batayles scomfyted saxon defendyd hys lande brytons ye daunger saxon alyed wyth tyme reygne thys kynge saxon named ella son iffus began reygne ye south syde kyngdome northumberlande called deyra touchyd chapyter sayde kyngdome yt foloweth whan uortiporius hadde ruled brytons knyghtly terme iiii yeres dyed put hys fader leuynge none heyre hys body myche wryters agreen kynges westsaxon length subdued kyngdomes made hole land mych brytayne one kyngdome monarchye well brytons saxon fayled lefte onely excepted therfore entende brynge name euerych kyng westsaxon fro fyrst cerdycus chyldricus ioyne wyth kynges brytons long hereafter ye sayd brytons contynued theyr reygne wythin parte brytayne cxi chapiter malgo duke brytons neuewe aureli conanus sayth authour floure hystories bega reigne ouer brytons yere oure lorde v hundred lii xxxviii yere clotharius styll kynge fraunce also xv yere kenricus sonne cerdicus seconde kyng westsaxo aforesayd accomptyng xv yeres reygne hys fader guydo allowyth thys malgo ye accorde wryters make mencyon ye comlyest moost personable man brytons lyuyng therewyth endowed knyghtly manhode whyche wythstode ye saxon kepte damaged lande whyche possessyon wytnessyth gaufryde hys manhode subdued ye iles iseland orchades orkeys norway wyth tyme reygne thys malgo reygned lordshyp kyngdome kent ethelbertus whych wytnessyth polycronyco assembled hoste hys knyghtes gaue batayle vnto ceawlmus sonne kenricus kyng westsaxon cause whereof y expressyd thys batayle ye fyrste batayle foughten twene saxon opteyned lande dwellynge brytayne whyche foughten place called wylbaldowne fyghte slayne ii duke ethelbertus hym selfe people chasyd also ytys wytnessyd sayde polycronica ye yere folowynge cutwolfus brother ceawim named faughte strongely agayn brytons bedforde berafte iiii cytyes townes named liganbroght egelsborgth besyngton euysham retorne agayn malgo kynge brytons authour floure historyes sayth wythstandynge many vertues whyche god endowed hym wyth lastely forgate god sakynge vertue gaue hym sondry vice synnes wherof odible synnes sodomy one wherfore fell hym great secucyo hys enemyes saxon sodele shewyd ensueth longe forenamed batayle done bedforde foresayd cutwolfus dyed yet hys sayd brother ceawlm couetouse worshyppe maynteyned hys warre agayne brytons made newe voyage agayne made scomfyture toke ye famous cytyes bathe glouceter w rceter whyche shulde ye meanynge ranulfe yere reygne thys malgo xxix thys spekyth nothynge cronycle england maketh hys processe kynge named cortyf whyche yt shulde seme rehersall folowynge makyth gurmunde careticus ruled brytos nexte deth thys malgo tyme cometh playnly yt shall appere foloweth aboute xxxiii yere thys malgo ceawlmus named gadered hys saxon foughte wyth brytons place called fechanlege longe fyght ceawlmus chasyd brytons wan vyctory hys brother called cutha slayne ye fyght made greate sorowe thus latter dayes malgo beynge oppressyd pursued hys enemyes lastly dyed hadde reygned moste cocorde storyes xxxv yeres francia cxii chapiter chilperic iii son lotharius clotharius named bega hys reygne ouer ye parte frauce called soysons yere oure lorde god v hundred lxiiii xiiii yere malgo kynge brytayne thys beyng content wyth suche hys fader hym set soone obsequy enterremet fader fynysshed spedde hym vnto parys possessyd hym hys faders treasoure wherof iii bretherne beyng warned purchasyd fredshyp noble fraunce vnwetynge theyr sayd broder hadde entre paris lykely haue takyn hym yf soner escaped thys incouenyence grete disce cyon lykely haue growen twene iiii bretherne hadde ben mediacyon frendes vpon bothe partyes whyche good polityke wayes length pacyfied varyauces amonge concluded fynall pea yt eyther sayd bretherne shuld hold hym co tent porcyo assygned theyr fader saye eldest brother named aribert wryters cherebris shulde falle countrey lyenge paris called mydle fraunce guntranus shulde falle prouynce orleaunce thys chylpericus prouynce soysons sygebertus yongest brother shulde belonge countrey mees austracy whych lordshyp begynneth champeyne affyrmeth frenche cronicle stretchyth lordshyp prouynce lorayne vppon one parte almayne vppo part cocorde agremet thus fynysshed eyther ye sayd brethern depted vnto per lordshyp shulde discribe maners condycyons iiii prynces expresse ye vnlauful lechery eldest brother aribertus refusyng hys laufull wyfe ingebryda ingeberta rauyshement wyues virgyns hym done yet vnstablenesse lyuyng also ye seconde brother guntran vertues vyces shuld therof make longe worke wherfore brynge story couenyece thus begynne trouth thys chilpericus hilpericus toke wyfe doughter kynge spayne called athanahild whose name golsanda whyche hyr handmayden mayde called fredegunda whyche passyng beaute shappe body hyr ioyned subtyll wyt euyll condycyons contrary hyr lady maysters symple vertuous condycyos yongest brother named sigebert coupled mariage syster sayde golsanda named brunechildis ye frensh cronicle brunecheuste woman peruers wycked codicyo shall appere foloweth chilperich within shorte tyme thus maryed vnto golsanda caste vnlaufull loue vnto hyr woman fredeguda reason wherof fell suche vnkyndnesse bytwene ye lastly fouden chamber dede strangelyd wyth corde whych done hande hyr housbande testyfyeth ye frenche boke secondly maryed nother wyfe named audouera woman great byrth myne authour yet ye frenche cronycle declaryth progeny ye co tynued kepte hyr hyr honour yet withdrew hys vnlaufull loue fro ye forenamed fredegud thys passetyme cause warre moued bytwene sigebert yonger brother men countrey sweuy whyche sayde sigebert requyred ayde hys brother chilperich whose request haste assembled hys people spedde hym towarde hys brother leuynge hys wyfe greate wyth chylde kepynge soresayde fredegunde whyche wyfe testyfyeth frenche booke hadde receyued iii sonnes named theodobertus meronens clodoueus longe chilperiche sayd ayde brother departed wyfe delyueryd doughter thys chylde shulde confermed byshoppe fredegunde entendynge make deuorce betwene chilperich wife subtyle false coniectoure counsayled quene shulde honoure conferme childe quene trustyng counsayle supposynge counsayle hadde ben beste confermed owne chylde cxiii chapiter whyle kynge wyth brother occupyed warre agayne suytzers men sweuy bare knyghtly subdued theyr enymyes retourned theyr countres wherof fredegunde ware secrete maner mette kynge shewyd hym demeanure wyfe nothyng crafty workyng wherewyth kyng greuously dyscontente shewynge outwarde contenaunce sayd yf true shuld hym deuorcyd shulde quene stede kynge commynge paleys quene entet accepted presence knowynge malicyous workynge fredegude brought armes yonge baby whych moder bothe naturally spirytually welcommed ye kyng lorde ryght humble maner salutynge hym wyth wordes co forte kyng beynge warned symple demeanure authours wryte glad hadde occasyon fynde mater displeasure blamed greuous maner commaunded presence tyme cou sayle spyrytuall men causyd hym deuorcyd wyth yonge doughter put house relygyon whyche gaue possessyons fyndyng yonge doughter named childeynda chilperic hadde thus fynyshed foresayde besynesse shortely toke wyfe fornamed fredegud without grudge hys lordes longe maryage stryfe discencyon fell betwene chilpericus sigebert hys brother whyche grewe certayne lande chilpericus claymed haue hys brother afore sayde chilpericus assembled hys knyghtes made warre vppon lande hys brother sigebert whyche besyed lyke warre agayne people called hunes reason wherof chilperic hadde fordell wan strength cytye reynys yt longe sigebert warned brother vnkyndnesse wherfore hys enymyes hym somdele subdued went wyth hys armye countre soysons belongynge brother chilperic warred lykewyse lande hys brother dyd length toke ye
