cytye soysons therin eldest son chilperic named theodobert helde hym prysoner chilpericus herynge scomfyture people takynge sonne agayne hys brother feruently amoued caste mynde wayes meanes howe myghte reuenge hym vppon hys brother yt vayne brother tyme auauntage hym well apperceyuyd better meane treaty peace meane wherof shortly obteyned sonne daunger wyth thynges concernynge profyte assurynge hys sayde brother solemne othe daye shuld neuer armes yet warrey brother cocorde vnite due maner fynyshed suffycyently counsayles stablysshed yet chilpericus beynge alwayes mynded reuengyd vpon brother sigebert sent yongest sonne named clodoueus caused hym warre vpon cytye called burdeaux pronice neustria called norma dye manhode captayne sigebert named singulphus sayd clodoueus ouer comen compelled voyde countre fledde paris thys happe chilpericus fyryd malyce hast commaunded hys forenamed sonne theodobert wyth great armye inuade sayd coutrey neustria normandye whyche accordynge hys father commaundement spedde thyder hys extorte myghte power toke many cytyes stronge holdes sparynge chyrches howses relygyon nunnes robbed spoyled countre moste cruell wyse lastly persecucion thus done cheuetayne duke named gundoaldus erldome poitowe assembled great power wythstode theodobert fynally slew hym playne batayll great parte hys people wherof herynge chilpericus gatheryd great hoste yode countrey champayne wastynge destroyenge countrey wyth fyre iron vttermoste hys power length toke cytye reynes spoylyd yt wythout mercy cxiiii chapiter sigebertus aduertysynge castynge hys mynde innaturall dysposycyo brother perceyuyng well entendyd hys vtter destruccyon uyded beste maner wythstande malyce brynge continued malyce fynall ende gatheryd hym puysant power sped hym towarde sayd brother wherof chilpericus beynge aduertysed hys couert meanes sought way entreaty peace suche wyse hostes mette peace concluded two bretherne thus accordyd condescendyd shorte tyme make warre vppon theyr brother gunthranus lorde orleaunce whyche sygnory daye belonged countrey prouynce burgoyne cause warre expressyd except yt enuyed theyr brother haue great lordshyp medyatours partes great aray purueyed sydes concorde peace concludyd temple saynt lowpe ye cytye trois uyncent sayd peace fynyshed sayd iii brethern syght departyd frendes eyther theym peace somtyme contentyth saudyours specially delyte pyllage robbery ryght amonge knightes sigebert spronge great rumoure sayeng co tente rewardyd theyr great laboure trauayle accordynge theyr desert specyally ye fyrst iourney ii hadde agayne brother chilpericus thynkynge peace wyth hym made nothyng honorable consyderyng ye great doublenesse vntrouth hym prouyd whyche excytyd sygebert theym breke boudes peace make newe warre vpon hym lyke maner euyll dysposyd person agreable warre peace vppon party chilpericus murmured lykewise thought haue ben better rewarded sygebert theyr maister therfore lefte hym yode ye hoste sygeberte whose eueytynge report sygebert kyndelyd sette vppon brother chilpericus hauynge notycyon hys brother purpose wyth also murmoure departynge hys knyghtes hauynge somme mystruste anon wyth wyfe chyldren chefe hys treasoure went vnto ye cyty tourney entedyng kepe theyr hys sauegarde sygebert knew therof nothyng pursuynge hym foude slow foloweth streyght closyd hym wythin sayde cytye stronge syege chilpericus maner dyspayred ye welfare hym hys fredegunde replenyshed iniquyte called two wycked persones promysed vnto theym great gyftes yf wolde venym otherwyse slee brother sigebert whyche two felowes dysceyued wyth fayre speche great gyftes sayde fredegunda toke vppon theym vnlefull charge theyr subtell false imagynacyon brought theyr cursed purpose ende theyr owne confusyon wounded kynge sygebert deth wolde haue escapyd kynges knyghtes espyeng theyr treason fell soone vppon hewed ye deth kynge knowen great noyse crye areryd hoste meane wherof kynges deth blowen cytye cere chilpericus wherof lytell ameruayled wolde yt geue ferme credence tyll enfourmed hys wyfe fredegunde hyr subtyle workynge longe knyghtes captaynes hoste sygebert presentyd vnto chylpericus besegynge hym hys grace pardon whych gladly accepted hadde sette hys charge order commaunded prouysyon made beryenge hys sayd brother wythin monasterye saynte medarde soysons besynesse kyngely maner fynyshed endyd exylyd brunechyeldys childebert wyfe sonne hys brother sygebert vnto cytye roane takynge theym great treasour possessyd shortly sonne sygebert helpe gun debolde gundealde duke poy towe named delyueryd daunger sayde chilperycus sent owne lordeshyppe austracye whych father sygebert lorde thys passetyme hadde sent hys sonne meroneus coutrey called buturynges appeace certayne rebellyons areysyd hard deth vncle sygebert beynge hys wyfe bruncchyelde cytye roane sette parte charge father sped hym streyght thyder kepynge companye wyth whome toke suche consolacoin pleasure lastely maryed kepte hys wyfe hys father therof warned feryd leste counsayle hys sayde wyfe wolde arryse agayne hym wherfore haste assembled hys people spedde hym towarde roane tydynges came meroneus conunynge hys father wyth great araye vupurucyed strength knightes resyste hys father hys moste suertye fled wyth hys vnlefull wyfe temple chyrche saynte martyne takynge pryuylege therof theyr defence chilpericus hadde temptyd many sondry meanes haue sayde pryuylege myghte wythout brekynge brynge aboute hys cautelouse purpose made theym assuryd promyse yf wyllfully wolde renounce sayde place putte theym hys grace wolde vtterlye pardon theyr trespace suffer theym tyme contynue theyr lyfe gether man wyfe uppon whyche promyse sayd merone wyth wyfe renou ced sayde pryuylege putte theym hole kynges mercy whyche receyuyd wyth contenaunce loue fauoure theym festyd cherysshyd louyngly space two dayes onely thyrde daye feaste fynyshed sent sonne vnto parys vnder sure guydes causyd hym professyd house relygyon meanes hys vncle gunthranus taken then restoryd hys former knyghthode whych father hym newly pursued costrayned hym take hys sauegarde ye chyrche saynt martyne turon warned fader perforce wold take hym then fledde vnto cytye champayne accompanyed wyth vi seruauntes onely great fere taken suche despayre obteyne grace hys father causyd one sayde vi persones slee hym wyth hys sworde foresayd bruncchyeldis hys wyfe put sure kepynge cxv chapiter chilperic beynge asserteyned doth hys sonne meroneus sure kepyng brunechieldis thoughte hymselfe somdele assuryd ye mystruste yt many tymes inquieted hym yet quiete reste shortly ye peple turon rebellyd agayne agayn sent son clodoueus noble man courte named desideri ye sent gyde counsayloure sayd son vpon party enymyes captayne kynge gunthranus mych said gunthranus claymed parte landes turon captayne named momelues heryng comynge foresayd hoste wyth chosen copany made taward gaue vnto clodoueus great sharpe fyght without great losse men wanne hym felde compellyd hym forsake countre thus chilperyche wrapped warre trouble worlde sometyme wyth ryght whyle wyth wronge tyme wanne worshyppe whyle loste wherof tell cyrcumstaunce thynke yt shulde tedyouse bothe reders also ye herers wherfore passe ouer abrydgynge shortynge somedele storye foloweth within ye storye chylpericus intycemet fredegunde wrongfully tormentyd archebyshoppe roan named breteste hym sufferaunce many vylanyes exyled whych god sent vnto hym correccyom takynge awaye sodeyne deth chyldern fredegunde began knowe god toke great repentaunce promysynge god amendement lyfe thentent might haue prayer comyn people stand state grace fyrst releasyd greuous trybute imposicyon hadde lately sette vpon vynes thorough regyon done reedyfyed olde chyrches made newe endowed great possessyons ouer thys releuyd greatly ye poore people enlargynge lyberall almes became humble meke tyme ryght sterne cruell lyke ofte happeneth hote loue soone colde thys sodayne deuocyon soone aswaged lyke hys trouble began aswage prosperyte encrease ryght hys olde codycyons beganne hym reuyue quycken length retourned hys olde accustomed vyces tyme pleople called longobardes italyans warred sore vppon landes empyre wherfore mauricius beynge emperour constantyne noble mych tought frenche kynges myght lesse coste payne subdue myght beyng farre therfore sent hym great sume golde wyth letter recommendacyon exortyng hym defence chyrche rome assemble hys people withstande ye sayd longobardes sease ther tyll hadde expellyd theym landes empyre whyche somme golde goodly receyuyd promysynge bryngers therof wyth dylygence shulde execute vttermoste power accomplyshe requeste emperoure accordynge parcell sayde promyse assembled great people made towarde sayde longobardes sayde longobardes ferynge ye great myght made meane entreaty offrynge hym great summes money reason wherof lefte theym reste retourned fraunce mauricius vnderstandyng yt foresayde enymyes remayned styll foresayde landes contynued theyr malice sent agayne chilpericus requyryng hym performe promyse ellys restore hys money whych take ye perfourmaunce vayne wolde neyther execute one legth affermeth myne authour goddes ordynaunce compelled restore sayde money great parte therof meane suster wyth chylde prysoner sayde emperour whyche suster tyme maryed vnto kynge spayne cxvi chapiter chilpericus thus encreasynge vyce dyshonoure lastely repugned agayne god fell detestable heresye arianes commauded certayne artycles touchyng deuysyon trynyte prechyd thorough hys regyon holy byshoppe towres withstode precepte blamed hym greuously dede yt sayd bysshop named gregory wyth great assystence byshoppes fraunce hadde great laboure remoue hym sayde opynyon many crymes passed chilpericus fredegunde whyche euer encreasyd peruerse malycyouse purpose soughte many vnlefull meanes howe myghte brynge confusyon thyrd sonne husbonde knowynge well ye whyle leuyd chyldern shulde neuer enheryte crowne fraunce purpose brynge many dyuerse wayes attemted whyche longe reherse fynally causyd hym wrongfully accusyd meane therof caste pryson beynge hyred felon sle hym shewyd husbande yt sayde clodoueus hadde stayne hym selfe profe wherof hadde appoynted foresayde murderer leue sworde styckyng hym thoughe hadde wylfully slayne hym selfe vppon sworde whyche kynge sawe demed hym gylty offense putte vppon hym ye haue harde sonne sygeberte named childebert delyuered handes chilpericus vncle meanes gundoald duke erle poitowe whyche tyme growen mannes stature ruled daye enherytaunce austracye wythout great stryfe betwene hym hys sayde vncle whych long wryte ye cyrcu staunce therof wherof daye somdele vndyscussyd yt thys daye vsyd eyther frendes tyme vncle chyldebert called guthran sought occasyon agayne hym cause byshop named theodor byshop marsill marsyle ye put see guthranus receyuyd chyldebert hym agayne restoryd sayde see marsyle whych gunthrane sore amoued entendyd make warre vpon hym medyatours somdeale appeasyd sette quyete vppon certeyne condycyons obserued also perfourmed vpon party gunthranus whyche vppon syde kept performed wherfore request hym made reformacyon poyntes answere agayne receyuyd reformacyon chyldebert haue hys partye strenger also well knewe hys vncle chilpericus bare towarde sayde gunthranus fraternall loue therfore sente vnto hym noble man hys courte named gyllon requiryng hym ayde agayne hys vncle whych manyseasons well broken promyse agayne hym nowe hadde agayne childebert chilpe riche beynge ryght fayne assentyd desyre gyllon haste preparyd theyr hostes two sondry companyes inuadyd countres orleaunce wherof gunthranus kynge ruler ye inhabytauntes prouynce defendyd theym stronge maner yt theyr enymyes hadde theym lytell auauntage whyche meane season gunthran assembled myghty hoste spedde hym towarde enymyes place called mediolan supprysed parte hys sayd enymies drewe nere great nomber bothe hostes made preparacyon bothe sydes haue foughten tyme ye haue often harde discrete wyse men fyght put meanes accorde founden nowe tyme labour good wise prelate kynnesmen sette vnyte departed without great shedyng crysten bloode passetyme deth whych sparyth creature berafte chilperic sonne borne fredegude named theodorus whyche kynge also quene toke great heuynesse yt propte redy euyll cast mynde thys chylde slayne poyson purposed malyce whyche lastely accusyd baylyfe lefe offycer called monuole diuers wytches sorseresses shuld imagyne chyldes deth whych payned tormetyd wyse lastly sayde wytches confessed hadde destroyed chylde wythoute consente sayde monuole wherfore caused sayde sorceress dye cruell deth fyre otherwyse sayde baylyffe tourmentyd dyed soone frenche cronycle sayth meane takynge way lyfe kynges chylde chyld sayde monuole restoryd helth whych great ieoperdye whyche folys beleue thys sorow heuenesse chilpericus fredegunde hys wyfe somdele aswaged byrthe son shortly borne ye sayd fredegunde whych kyng lette call lotharius clotharius ioye wherof kyng lette open prysones suffred prysoners goo theyr lyberte specyally suche concerned cause touchynge hym selfe dette otherwyse thynges cocernyng hys honoure lyke dame fortune accustomed medle ioyes thys world wyth bytternesse dyd chilperic nowe great tranquillyte reste thought haue ladde resydue lyfe pleasure deynly word brought vnto hym hys brother gunthranus hys neuewe childebert allyed fermely accorded make warre vppon hym whych assemblyd great army wherfore haste commaunded treasour chyfe iewellys cytye cambria wyth wyfe frendes entended co tynue resydue lyfe yt done spedde hym thyder haste fortyfyed sayde cytye wyse feryd lytle nothynge hys enymyes kepte hym wythin sayde cytye certayne tyme whe sawe hard commynge sayd broder neuewe walkyd large sportyd hym haukynge chase wylde bestes wolues whych dayes greatly vsyd kynges fraunce yet contynued uppon day purposyd towarde dysporte thyng redy preparyd quene thought veryly gone oute paleys happe tell quene yode chaber rested vppon bedde lyeng kynge passyd wyth lytle wande whych bare hande maner game strake quene yt vppon backe quene supposynge kynge ben gone felde lokyng vp sayd laundrye dareste thou thus stryke laundrye great man kynges courte hadde ben peramoure quene longe tyme kynge herynge wordes made semblaunt hadde herde passyd hys waye cxvii chapiter fredegunda apperceyuynge seynge yt kyng whome hadde thus sayde sore abasshed great fere agony longe season coniected mynde remedy myght fynde mishappe lastely dyuely shely determyned sle sayd husbande lorde brynge sent haste sayde laundrye shewed hym order cyrcumstaunce foresayde mater wherafter stryke suche fere wytte counsayle faylyd hym deuyse case remedy wherfore quene fully determyned execute detestable cursyd purpose sayde hym boldely laudry thou seest well yt case brought strayte poynt thou muste thynke destroy lord husbande ellys thou muste shamefully confounded whyche thou well knowest owne moste regarded therfore dyspose counsayll thou knowest well kynge accustomed come late hys dysporte wherfore prouyde certayne thou well trustyst euenynge retourneth aspye thy tyme fall vppon hym sodeynly rydde hym make crye sende serch thou woldest take homicydes cause thyne co panye flee fro though thou shuldest pursue laundry heryng cursyd cousayll alowed well therunto assentyd incontynently went aboute perfourmaunce hadde purueyde accessaryes towarde nyght assemblyd gyuynge informacyon yt mischyef shuld behaue thyng takynge assuryd othes kepyng cousayle kyng mysdemynge thynge thys conspyred treason toke delectacyon pleasoure folowynge hys game loste myche hys company towarde nyght tyme accustomed wyth fewe accopanyed drewe homewarde wherof laundry beyng warned met kynge salutynge hym sayng comen wyth hys company codute hym home mych douted garnyshed meyneyall seruautes shuld lenger make delaye farther reharsall thys matyer tell cyrcumstaunce thys purposyd treason fynally kynge nere hys paleys reherseth frenche cronycle wythin courte hys paleys lyght hys horse sodeynly wounded herte streyght fell erth dede whyche murder thus commytted greate crye areryd kynge y slayne yt thys laundrye made great haste called certeyne person attende vppon ye corp whyle wyth pursued suche dempte gylty thys offence lastly retourned sayd thys dede done knyghtes chyldebert whych derkenes nyght escapyd shewe vayne dissymuled sorowe yt fredegund made kynge lettyng tyme euery wyse man knoweth well suche ben disposycyon fayne ryghte well suche semblable casys purpose kynge thus slayne tyme nother quene yet laundrye suspectyd prouysyon made enterryng ye corp whyche shortly shypped next ryuer conuayed vnto saynt germayns de pree spoken wyth greate solepnyty buryed hadde regned sayde xxiiii yeres leuynge hym son mynded called clotharius lotharius thus affermyth myn authour mayster robert gagwyne endyd chylperych myserably lyfe whiche pryde mysery tyme cotynued lyfe cherysshed frende hys ende fande frendes thys gaue patrymony ye chyrche lewde symple clerkys enmye holy relygyous place fauored suche lately bene conuerted fayth dyd cotynued holy lyfe longe season therin gaue vnto person rule crystes chyrche amonge whyche one perfyght lyuyng byshop parys garnysshed hys tobe cpytaphy meter foloweth ecclesiae specusum patriae vigor ara reorum et pater medicus pastor amor que gregit gernianus virtuti fide corde ore beatus carne tenet tumulum mentis honore posunt vir cui dura nihil nocuerunt fata sepulchri viuit enim nam mors quam tulit ipsa timet creuit ad hue pocius iustus post funera nam qu fictile va fucrat gemma superba micat huius ope ac meritu mutis data verba loquutur redditus caecis praedicatore dy nunc vir apostolicus rapiens de carne tropheum iure triumphale confidet arce throni whych verse mother tunge maye thus expounded meter foloweth myrrour chyrche countrey strength compassyon gylty shewynge mercy fader leche herde louer length hys people cosyn vertue allye fayth herte eke mouth holy flesshe holdyth thys sepulture spyryte heuen euer endure thys nothynge noyed faute sepulture lyueth southly deth whyche drede hath hym hense tane yet hoped sure thys ryghtwyse man though somtyme ladde bryttell vessell whych myth erth cladde somewhyle felle yet ofte rose anone wherfore shyneth doth orient stone helpe meryte hath dumbe hys speche thys blessyd man blynde hys syghte restoryd god thys daye doth v teche flesshe hath gotten fyght vpperhande wyth tryumphant myght vertue wherof lyke conquerour hygh heuyn nowe fytteth tower thus maye ye well apperceyue knowe erthly men fauoure woll wryte nowe shewyth thys superscrypcyo god thyng manyfestyd knowen nothynge hym hyd whatsoeuer erthly man wryteth demyth premysses remytte anglia cxviii chapiter careticus lareticus yt wrytynge guydo nother yt progeny yet addicyon honour wryters hym reme bred began rule brytons yere lord v hundred iiii score vi sayde authour recordyth ye xxii yere chylperyche kynge fraunce also ix yere ceawlmus kynge westsaxons thys wytnessyth wryters louer cyuyle batayle worst men yt odible god subiectes suche wyse excyted saxon warre vpon hym testyfyeth guydo chasyd hym cytye cytye towne towne tyll berafte hym parte suche lande hys predeces soure malgo holde hym polycronyco gaufryde adde vnto sayen yt mych saxon knew discensyon betwene careticus hys brytons haste sent irelande kynge called gurmundus affrican ye wryters named two person gurmudus affrican rehersall ranulfe monke chester maketh ye xxiii chapyter hys fyrste boke polycronyco shulde seme shuld named gurmundus whyche hys meanynge shulde warre brytayne fraunce whyle hys brother turgecius regned kyng irelande sayd chapyter lengthe declared whyche fayd gurmundus strength ye saxon warred sore agayne brytos lastly sayd careticus fayne take towne kaersegent called sichester therein besegyd hym wyth hys brytons certeyne tyme dayly skyrmysshes assautes loste mych hys people careticus season assayed prouyd strength enemyes sawe encreasyd hys knyghtes lassed mynysshed sodenly lefte towne certeyne brytons toke ouer seuarne water walys callyd cabria whych shuld moste accorde wryters ye iii yere ye reygne caretic thys tyme meaneth antoninus great gregory beyuge monke pope sawe rome childyrn anglis saxon sell rome whe aryd coutrey answered hym named anglis sayde ye alleluya shulde songe cou tree fayre chylderne borne alleluya iiii score viii chapyter rehersyd y take ye exposycyo saynt austayne ayde helpe god ment louynge praysynge god hym ye laude thankes shulde gyuen vnto sendyth men fayre frewte wherfore shalbe shewyd sayd gregory beynge pope sent yt holy man austayne wyth preache sayde anglis fayth cryste retourne careticus englysh cronycle nameth cortife trouth wyth brytons dryuen cambria walis yet lefte contynually make reyses assautes vppon saxon nexte hym adioynaunte thys tyme soone ruled ethelfridus north saxon wytnesseth foresayde authour guydo began reygne deira brenicia yere oure lorde vclxxx xiii ethelfridus son ethelricus ye pursued sore brytons slewe great nomber ye monkes towne bangor rehersyd c ix chapyter worke whyche dayly warred vpon brytons brytons vpon hym destroyed subuerted myche crystes fayth wyth helpe ye foresayd gurmunde thorough loegria myddle england mych bysshoppes london yorke wyth mynysters chyrche wyth goodes relykes myght cary fled dyuerse countrees theyr chyrchdores shytte ellys occupyed worship theyr fals goddes thus fayth endured brytayne tyme luci fyrst crysten kynge brytayne tyll thys daye nere vppon season iiiic yeres odde well nere extyncte thorough lande ye forenamed gurmude fynysshed hys tyrannye wythin land brytayne sayled fraunce slayne wytnessyth polycronyco ye french cronycle speketh nothyng man duryng thys persecucyon wytnessyth guydo chyrche monastery buylded uerolamy nowe called saynte albanes sayde myscreauntes beten downe whyche buylded brytos honoure ye holy prothomartyr saynt albo diuerse many whyche loste memory duryng also trouble bytwene saxon brytos lordshyp kyngdome eest saxon began take place shalbe shewed cxix chapiter thys tyme also accorde moste wryters wytnessyth polycronyca ethelbert reygned kent knyghthode greate myghte bare hym behaued hym victoryously enlarged hys kyngdome boundys humbyr tyme gregory whyche hys notable dedes surnamed great made pope rome whych touchyd precedynge chapyter hauynge compassyon coutre whens fayre chylderne came seyne shulde inhabyte wyth pagan people mysbyleue sent brytayne holy man austayne wyth hys bretherne preche anglis fayth cryste wytnessyth antoninus iii chapyter xii tytle hys foresayde worke austayn iii dayes iourney gone passed suche sodeyne fere entryd hym hys feloushyppe turned agayne gregory coforted sayd co pany sent wyth letter bysshop arelatensis wyllynge hym helpe ayde austayne hym nedyd tenoure whyche letter sent ethelbert kynge kent wyth theyr answeres wryte questyons regester gregory bokes beda austayne thus comfortyd sped iourney landed eest syde kent ile thauet wyth xl felowes wherof interpretours cowde speke langages nere vnto place named holy austayne landed stode dayes manoyre palayes sayd kyng ethelbert wherof thys daye appere somme ruynous walles called inhabytaunces ile rychbourgh apparent betwene ile towne sandwych vpon myle halfe sayd towne eestwarde caunterbury austayne landed sent sayde interpretours vnto ethelberte sayenge yt sent rome hele saluacyon kynge hys realme kynge tyme herde fayth cryst hadde wyfe sayth polycronycon french woman cristened receyued hyr vppon condycyon shuld suffer hyr lyue hyr lawe certeyne tyme ye kyng spoke austayne without ye house maner hys lawe agayn comyng arreryd baner ye crucifyx sange ye lateny preachyd hym worde god ye kyng sayd fayre ye promyse vncowth new may soone assent ye comen farre sake ye shalbe fayre entreatyd haue thynge yt necessary graunte leue torne people ye maye receyued thys cofort kynge went wyth processyo cytye dorobernia cauterbury syngynge alleluya lad theyr lyues holy faders dyd begynnynge chyrch fastyng prayeng watchyng preachynge worde helth sange mass crystened couertyd ye eest syde cytie old chyrch saynt martyne vnto tyme yt kyng couertyd length kyng well consyderyd couersacyo holy lyfe austayn felowes harde gladly lastly theyr good exortacyos gostly loue couertyd crystened ye yere lorde moste accorde wryters vc lxxx xvi xxxvi yere hys reygne affermeth policronicon gaue austayne place bishoppes see cristes chyrche dorobernia buylded abbey saynte peter paule eest syde sayde cytye austayne kynges kent buryed place nowe called saynte augustyne thys whyle augustyne saylyd fraunce byshoppe arelatens hym sacryd archebyshoppe holy gregory certyfyed good expedycyon augustyne sent mo helper melyt iust paulinus bokes relykes holy sayntes answeres saynte augustynes questyons suche goodes fell chyrche shulde deuyded foure te meane fyrste shuld go housholde byshoppes house charge seconde clergy thyrde amendemet chyrches fourth relyfe poore people dedys mercye austayne hadde baptyzed great part kyngdome kent made two archebyshoppes comaundement saynte gregorye wytnessyth polycronicon one london porke helpe ethelbert assembled gatheryd together byshoppes doctoures brytayne dysperkled place assemble callyd longe austeyns oke whych expowned austeyns stregth marche wykeres westsaxons thys place charged sayd byshoppes yt shulde wyth hym preache worde god anglys also shuld amog selfe amende certayne errours vsyd chyrche specyally kepynge theyr ester tyde agayne byshoppes brytayne helde opynyon tyll austayne hys prayer shewyd myracle blynde angle saxon whyche myracle shewed ye sayd byshoppes applyed wyll austayne cause theym sayd myghte leue custome whych longe hadde continued wythout assent hadde vsyd gatheryd synode whyche came seuen byshoppes brytons wyth wysest famouse abbey bangor fyrste toke cou sayle holy man heremyte whether shulde obedyent austayne heremyte sayd yf ye fynde hym humble meke crystes dyscyple belonged yt shulde assent hym whych mekenesse shulde perceyue hym yf theyr commynge synode councell arose agayne sayde byshoppes entred ye sayde synode austayne sate styll chayre remouyd wherfore wroth dysdaynyd hym wolde obey hys requestes sayd syns ye woll assente hestes generally assent ye specyally thre thynges fyrste yt ye kepe ester daye due fourme tyme yt ordeynyd seconde ye geue crystendome chyldern maner yt vsed chyrche rome thyrde ye preache vnto anglys word god fore tymes haue exhorted deale shall suffer amende refourme wythin selfe wold therof saynt augustyne sayde vnto warned maner inspyracyon syns wold receyue peace theyr bretherne shulde receyue warre wreche whyche put experyence ethelfrydus kynge northumberlande longe yt tell cyrcumstauce lyfe blessyd man wherfore passe ouer lastly whe hadde one daye crystyned x thousande saxon anglys weste ryuer called swale besyde yorke knewe shuld shortely dye ordeyned successour named laurence whyle lyued state holy chyrche brytayn yet rude boystous yt doynge folowed ensample peter fyrst pope whyche made clement lyfe helper successour also augustyne made mellitus bysshop london eestsaxos whych moste wryters newly entred lande ryuer thamys departed theym kent dyed buryed ye monastery rehersed wythoute wally dorobernia caunterburye cxx chapiter ethelbertus confermyd fayth among costly dedys beganne foundacyon paulys chyrche wythin cytye london ordeyned yt bysshoppes see london archbyshoppes see tyme london augustyne ethelbert prayer ye cytezyns dorobernia traslated sayde cytye lix chapyter thys treatyse yt length declared buyldynge thys chyrche saynt paule dyuerse opynyons ben wryters testyfye yt buylded begonne buylde sygebertus kynge eestanglys veryly kynge eestsaxos eestsex ethelbert also fouded chyrche sayne andrew cytye dorubres kent nowe called rochester whyche iustus byshoppe ordeyned saynt albane ye tyme season forenamed ethelfrydus whyche englyshe cronycle named elfryde foughte wyth brytons cytye legyscestre chestre slew brytons great nomber whyche tyme season great nomber monkes bangor also assembled pray good spede brytons wherof ethelfrydus warned fell also vppon theym flewe theym tyme wytnessyth dyuers authours xxi hudred yt shewyd c ix chapyter boke forenamed ethelbert excyted dweller cytezen london make chyrche chapell worshyp saynte peter west ende london called thorney towne westmynster whyche tyme forgrowen wyth bush b eres excedyngly sayde cytezen ganne buylded fyrst chyrche westmynster ye honour saynt peter whych saynt edwarde cofessour enlarged new buylded thyrde henry reygned kynge england yt newe edyfyed made yt beauteous monastery rychely endowed bothe wyth possessyon relykes ryche iewellys shewyd englyshe cronycle englande thys ethelbert shulde slayne fyghte betwene hym ethelfryde kynge northumberlande policronicon sayth dyed went heuen hadde reygned ouer lordshyppe kent lvi yeres xxi yere hadde receyuyd crystendome kyngdome eestsaxons cxxi chapiter durynge also foresayde persecucyon ye brytos ruler specyally named beganne reygne eestsaxons wytnessyth policronicon vnder sebertus theyr fyrste kynge nere yere lordes incarnacyon vi hundred xiiii yt guydo de columna sayth yt beganne nere tyme season kyngdome eestanglys beganne folowe polycronicon leyeth holy beda authour myche worke kyngdome whych meane essex hadde eest syde see weste myddelsex london southe cyuer thamys north suffolke endured moste wryters terme two hundred odde yeres sayeng policronica yt shuld endure ouer two hundred yeres neuerthelesse yt shulde appere storye edwarde elder sonne aluredus yt yt shulde cotynue vnder danys wyse tyll viii yere reygne reason yt shulde endure two hundred lxxx xiii yeres contynuauce therof doutfull iustly determyned myche wryters dyuers opynyons begynnyng therof ye polycronycon li chapyter hys fyrste boke sayth yt began vnder sebertus vnder x kynges tyll egbertus kynge westsaxons subdued yt ioyned yt owne kyngedome fyrste crysten kynge thys lordshyppe forenamed sebertus conuertyd meanes mellitus byshoppe london sayth guydo hys sayeng thys sebertus shulde thyrd kynge essex wryters agreen kynges thys lordshyp comynly named vnder kynges subiecte kynges chefely vnto kynges mercia mercheryke retourne agayn vnto brytons whyche season occupyed parte cornewayl countres cambria uenedocia whyche called northwalys ad demecea whych called southwalys held makynge assautes vpon saxon touchyd whyle one coste whyle vnder sondrye duke witnessyth gaufryde also englysh cronycle whych contynued moste accorde tyme accorde thys hystorye wyth terme xxiiii yeres ouer aboue thre yeres alowed reygne careticus aforesayd fyrste yere caretycus laste xxiiii yeres expyryd flowyd xxvii yeres whyche tyme brytons one assent chase theyr hedde ruler duke uenedocia southwalys named cadwanus francia cxxii chapiter clotharius lotharius sonne chilpericus second yt name made kynge parte frau ce ye yere oure lorde v hundred lxxx viii ii yere careticus kynge brytons thys clotharius reporte mayster robert gagwyne notyd descendyd clodoue lowis fyrste crystened kynge fraunce expressely sonne chilpericus myche cronycle chilperych haue shewed somwhat dedys fredegund wyfe chylperiche therfore entende declarynge thys story clothayre expresse remanaunte shorte wyse goodly may fyrst ye shall vnderstad thys fredegunde shewed causyd lorde slayne ferynge length vntrouth shulde dyscoueryd wyth goodes shorte tyme yode vnto paris monasterye house ladye held wold suerty also son sayd clotharius shuld streger domynyon kingdome therfore sent messenger vnto gunthranus kynge orleaunce brother lorde chilperich requyryng hym fauoure ayde wolde goodnesse tutour defendour yonge sonne clotharius whych denyenge requeste fredegunde spedde towarde paris haste wyth assent noble realme toke gydynge yonge kynge whose aduyse comaundement sayde clotharius conueyd shewyd thorough many chefe cytyes lande lykewyse gunthranus wyth bysyed theym selfe strength lotharius hys ryghte euen noble frauce meanes brunechyeldis wyfe tyme sygebert yongest sonne lothayre fyrst whyche sygebert receyued hys sayde wyfe two sonnes named chilperich chyldebert whych two chilperich suruyued dyd theyr entent promote chyldebert porcyon hys father chilpericus father lotharius occupyed deth sigebert forenamed dyscordeth frenche cronycle fro myne authour gagwyne yt sayd ye brunechield assent wold theyr meanes haue pferred bastard son forenamed sygebert called theodoric kyngdome frauce authour sayth theodorich son childeric afore named whyche sonne sygebert folowe mayster gagwyne childebert whych ye former sayeng rehersyd yt c xiiii chapiter treatyse delyueryd ye handes chilperich vncle meanes erle poytow named gudebald small copany came vnto paris ye cyteses kept ye soon sent noble man named gillon ambassadours vnto guthran among thynges hym requyred axed fredegud suffer deth subtylty caused murdred bothe sygebert father theyr kynge also chilpericus owne husbande yt vtterly denyed wherfore sayd gyllon sayd vnto guthranus syr kynge knowe thou certayne synnes thou haste refused peace offeryd thy neuewe deth thy brother shall cleu thy hedde wyth wordes kynge beynge greatly amoued commaunded ambassadours putte oute court strete fylthe ordoure caste vppon theym enymytyes varyaunces thus kyndelyng betwene two kinges gunthranus soone sent fredegunde neustria normandy caused kepte farre ye citye roan whyther came many noble men frauce cofortynge also mouynge trouble promysynge ayde vttermoste theyr power fredegunde apperceyuyd great fauoure brunechyelde stode noble orleaunce fraunce enuyenge welth honoure called homycyde felon called holderyche sayde fredegude pmysyd great treasour yf coude venyme otherwyse brynge deth sayde brunechieldis meane whych promyse grauted brynge entent shortely drewe vnto court sayde brunechyeldis fyll suche famylyaryte wyth dyuerse courte came many season psence ye quene happe saye lastely taken suspeccyon tormentyd pyned co fessyd ye cause thyder comyng sent ye cyrcustaunce matter whych cofessyon made betyn arrayed moste vyle maner sent agayn fredegud comen presence shewed tourment suffred cause incontynet fulfyllyng malycyous purpose commaunded handes fete shulde stryken lette go ende yt shulde thought desyred hym besynesse aboute thys tyme season arose yonge corner fraunce whych subtyle wytte named hym selfe sonne fyrst lotharius brother vnto gunthran synystre meanes crafty gatte fauoure lordes guyan theyr assystence held occupyed great parte therof somdele hys counsay le gunthranus hys espyes disclosyd sayde yonge man beyng named gudoaldus sent vnto gunthranus ambassade requyryd hym restoryd porcyon hys faders goodes addyng therto yf denyed sayde gundoaldus wolde wyth strong armye repayre gwyan get hys ryght wyth strength bryng shulde also haue great ayde chyldebert neuewe aboue named whan kynge gunthranus leyser herde message dysdaynyng comaunded sette vppon horse backes theyr facys towarde tayle betynge vylanye dryuen thorough town long daye appoyntyd betwene gunthranus childebert whych day prynces met great companyes lordes whe sette theyr counsayll gunthran comaunded foresayd messyngers gundoaldus brought fore agayne recyte theyr foresayde message whych done shewyd furthermore sayd gundoalde tyme dispoyled doughter chil peryche named rygonde rychesse wyth conueyed went towarde spayne maryed whyche lordes childebert counsayll whyche vnto sayde two prynces thought trewe myche sayde lordes accusyd absent great counsayll cxxiii chapiter many great actes concludyd thys counsayll betwene two foresayd prynces gunthranus open audyence admytted hys neuewe chyldebert heyre mych none heyre hys bodye commyttynge rule therof hym toke hym ate shewyd hym whych noble shulde take counsayll whyche shuld refuse specyally warnyd hym well ware hys moder brunechyeldis knewe great vntrouthe subtylty also gyllon bysshoppe whyche also sayde trusted thus aduertysed hys neuewe retourned vnto place cou sayll theyr counsayllys certayn thynges concernyng comone wele sette order done sayde counsayll fynyshed purueyauce theyr dyner pronyded prynces wyth theyr baronye went vnto dyner season whych dyner sayde gunthranus sayde vnto ye great nomber lordes beynge presente ye lordes noble fraunce whych haue euer ben true dere myn neuew whyche myne heyre haue allowed ordeynyd whome praye honoure wyth true fayth vnto hym obedyent kyng ye great worthynesse hym come great hope whyche allyed wyth myght vertue augmentacyon wordes shortely restored hym cytyes chilpericus hys lyfe holden hym soone eyther moste humble louynge maner departyd thys peace betwene two prynces thus stablysshyd fame ranne wyde wherfore certayne lordes beyng vppon partye gundoaldus refused hym went vnto party gunthranus soone wyth hys people gu doaldus resortyd vnto cytye ouer ryuer gerounde named conuena strength therof thought abyde hys fortune wherof gunthranus warned goodly spede made thyder warde layd hys people nere vnto sayde cytye espyed stregth therof knew well yt daungerous obteyn vsyd gyle stregth myghte preuayle deuysed forged certayn letter name brunechyeldys wherin fayned sayde brunechyeldys shulde desyre gundoaldus hasty wyse resorte vnto cytye burdeaux whyche fraude gundoaldus thynge suspectynge commaundyd hys treasoure wyth hys stuffe vnder saufe gydynge thyderward conueyed wherof knightes gunthran hauyng knowlege stronge copany made ouer fore sayd water geroude layde watche encountred sayde people caryed sayde treasure stuffe parforce toke knyghtes gundoaldus presentyd vnto gunthranus lyke ye haue harde certeyne lordes hoste gundoalde fled vnto hoste gunthranus thys passe tyme iiii capytaynes ruler hoste gunthranus fled vnto gundoalde yt whych myne authour nameth desiderius mommolus bladascus sagyttaryus whyche iiii theyr comynge gundoalde stode fauour theyr counsayle myche aduysed gyded longe ye knyghtes gunthranus thus wonne ye foresayd treasoure stuffe gundoald sore pursued fayne close hym wyth stronge cytye whyche lendegylsus mayster hoste gu thranus assayled dyuerse feates warre wynne wha saw hys labour lost cautelously fande meane speke secretly one foresayde iiii capytaynes named mommolus wyth hym treatyd betrayenge ye cytye whyche many longe exhortacyons wyth assurauce theyr lyues grautyd vnto sayd treason whereof maner shulde thus thys sayd mommolus wyth forenamed bladascus affynyte shulde set fyre olde temple wythin yt citye people ye citye besyed quenche fyre sayde mommolus wyth hys adherentes open gate let lyndegylsus hys knyghtes yet thys treason set parte momolus goeth godoalde sheweth hym greate daunger standeth enemyes wherfore counsayled hym wyth ruler hym go vnto tentys gunthranus yelde vnto hys grace mercy also entent shuld shewe proue indubytate son fyrste clothayre whyche kynge hoste doutfull bycause fled whan gundoaldus ley soure harde counsayle mommole gyuynge hym credence mych hys counsayle tymes fortheryd hys cause also comfort reportyd haue meanes lyndegylsus named settyng parte fere wyth certayne nomber peasyble wyse issued cytye whan lyttell space gone ii erles gunthranus hoste named bole boson receyued hym delyuered hym power lyndegylsus mommole retourned wyth confederey vnto ye citye closed faste gate bytwene ye citye pauyllyons guthranus lytell coppyd hyll heyght whereof whan gundoalde comen sayd boso hym sodeynly threwe downe rollynge downe hyll great stone strake hed vyolece wherof forthwith slayne dede mommole whych towched reentred citye fyrste dyspoyled goodes sayd gundoalde fell vpon citesyns robbed spoyled lyke maner sparynge prestes brente chyrches temple house without pytye whyche done sped hym vnto tentys lyndegylsus beynge sure sauegarde sayde momole hys copany murmoure hys knyghtes veryly wolde knowen prouyded deth theym commaunded sayde momole wyth hys adherentes tary without come prese hys knyghtes tyll somedele pacyfyed whiche done without strife beganne quarell wyth hym hys whe lyndegylse sawe momole company somdele withdrawe fro pauylyon made token hys knyghtes whereby knowyng mynde fell vpon slewe hym sagyttarius one foresayde iiii company whyche myne authour reporteth byshoppe fledde haue sauegarded hym self flyght slayne whe enymyes thus brought lyfe gunthranus commauded goodes sayde mommole broughte vnto hys tresorye whyche great valure egallye deuyded betwene hym childebert hys neuewe longe certayne token fygures appered fyrmament astronomer iuged fyne prynce whyche yere shewyd true sayd gunthranus dyed vpon yere folowyng sayd fygures sygnes hadde ben kyng orleaunce terme xxxvii yeres buryed wyth great pompe cytye cabylon wythin prouynce burgoyne ye monastery saynte marke whyche buylded lefte hys heyre kyngdome neuewe foresayde chyldebert cxxiiii chapiter childebertus hauyng rule possessyon hys owne enherytaunce y saye austracy also orleaunce castynge mynde howe myghte reuenged fredegunde ye shewed c xiii chapyter lybell slewe hys father sygebert called vnto hym olde frende councelloure gundebald erle poytowe co maunded yt shuld power inuade countre soysons whyche rule clotharius wherof fredegunde beyng warned assembled ye lordes countrey exhorted wythstande malyce theyr enymyes shewynge furthermore thynge shuld iustyce equyte consyderynge theyr kynge clotharius yet tender age hadde yet knyghtely prowesse defende hym self lande longe exhortacyon made wyth sonne prepared go agayne sayde enymyes thynge warre preparyd redy wyth great army made toward hoste gundebalde knewe nere vnto hoste commaundyd captaynes reste fortyfye people vppon te brekyng enymyes agayne nyghte called laundry olde paramoure wyth wyllyng dede nyght wolde manfully set vppon partye myche sayde certaynly enfourmed espies sayde enymyes sore weryed reason dayes laboure whose counseyll sayde laundry wyth wrought supprysed theyr enymyes vnwarelye theym slewe parte chasyd remanaunt done spedde vnto champayne nere vnto reynes spoyled brent parte countre thys feat warre thus compassyd subtyle wytte fredegunde nere place called truet childebert entendyd certentye hadde ouerthrowe gundebalde haue made newe warre vppon fredegunde let meane longobardis whyche made warre vpon hym whyche warre hadde somdeale entent shuld yf mauricius emperour consta tyne noble kept promesse hym made ye warre party endyd retourned hys owne countree shortly also hys wyfe dyed wythout suspeccyon venym leuyng hym two sone named theodobert theodorych gyuynge eldest lordshyppe austraci yonger prouynce burgoyne thys tyme hunes brake theyr place warryd vpo certeyne partyes myddle fraunce dyd therein greate harme lastly meanes greate gyftes receyued left countre drewe towarde soysons agayne fredegude gaderyng grete powar sent clotharius hyr sonne kynge entent defende sayd hunes shulde inuade theyr countrees shortly bothe hostes mette felde longe sharpe fyght frenchman vyctours chased hunes suche wyse parte slayne taken whyche vyctory fredegunde made excedynge ioye hyr son clothayre receyued hym greate pleasure excedynge gyftes whyche passyd longe whyle fell syke dyed buryed hyr housbonde chylperich whan forenamed bretherne knowlege deth fredegude exhortacyon styryng brunechieldis theyr graundmother callyng mynde wronges theyr auncesters done fredegund somdele lothayre assembled greate powar met wyth lothayre hys powar ryuer arrune aruene ye place sore fyght many slayne cource ryuer let multytude caryens dede bodyes yt therein caste parte fell knyghtes lothayre yt forcyd forsake feld then flee cyty meleon then parys sayde bretherne folowed compelled hym make pea theyr pleasure effecte pea theodobert ye elder brother two shuld enioye lande lyeng bytwene ryuer seyn leyr vnto bryttysh occean see lytell brytayne theodorich yonger brother haue lande sayd ryuer seyn vnto ryuer isayr brynk see clothayr shuld remayne xii prouinces sayd two ryuers isayr seyne flowen thorough whyche pea thus confermed grauted theodobert neustria normandye belonged sent thyder cheuetayne hys court called berthalde defende sayde countre clothayre thys former accorde beynge nothynge contentyd sent sonne merone vnder gydynge laundry prefect ruler hys paleys neustria warre countrey mych berthalde sawe well lakked power wythstande great host therfore toke cytye orleaunce tyll gaderyd company laundry seasyd parte ye coutrey cam wally cytye dyuerse wordes reproche excyted ye sayde berthalde gyue batayll hym playne felde whych refusyd inequalyte nomber knyghtes offeryd issue ye cytye fyght wyth laundry hande hand wyth myght assuryd agayne people whyche offer laundrye refusyd longe bothe kynges wyth great hostes drewe countrey ryuer stampis mette betwene foughten stronge batayll polycye theodobert lothary putte disuautage whyle sayde lotharye coueyeng hys people ouer ryuer narowe passage theodobert beganne fyersly kepte passage streyt peple clotharye came two partes theym felde neuerthelesse fyght co tynued longe season whyche tyme berthalde encountred many tymes laundrye prouoked hym batayll euer refusyd lastly seynge knowyng well shuld wynne great worsshyppe also profyte yf myght slee take laudry therfore put hym selfe daunger hys enymys fynally slayn theodobert pursuyng lotharye comfortynge knyghtes bare hym well causyd enimyes lese grounde length put flyght whyche foloweth gate parys great damage ye people lothary chase taken meroneus sonne clotharye wyth many laundry goten wythin cytye theodobert thus goten vyctory hys enemyes lyste lenger tary season shortly retourned hys countre court theodorich broder theodobert day dwellynge italian named prothadi whyche myne authour sayth paramour vnto brunechyeld sayd brunechyeld hyr meanes exalted poore estate vnto hyghe authoryte whyche subtyle far castynge wytte therwyth excedynge couetous greate fauour kynge hys lordes odyous hatefull vnlefull meanes hym noble comons lande vsed yll condycyons bad counceyll brunechyelde thys prothadi vsed within ye court theodobert bannysshed well hys lande hys courte wherfore euer malygned agayne theodobert execucyon theyr malicious purpose tolde vnto theodoryche hys enemy brother theodobert wythdrawen hym chefe hys faders treasoure alledgyng also sonne chyldebert hys fader gotten gardener wyllyd hym therfore sende vnto hym aske restytucyon sayde goodes whyche wycked counceyle theodoryche lad sent vnto hys brother suche wyse vexyd styryd hym dedely malice kyndelyd betwene myche eyther assembled great hostes lastely met nere vnto towne named carysse sayde hostes beynge redy haue runne togyders lordes theodoberte demeaned vnto hym theyr wyse counsayle agreed sende hys brother haue comunicacyon pea whan embassade comen pauylyon theodoryche shewyd vnkyndnesse thys warre wyth ieopardy myghte ensue anone foresayde prothadius toke vppon hym answere sayd requysyte lyghtly graunte pea necessary attempte wyll enemye batayle whether woll agreable condescende desyres whyche wordes thus expressyd hym anone party lordes dysdayned conspyryd wythin selfe howe myghte putte hym deth forthwyth arose amonge murmur ye kynge apperceyued well entendyd harme prothadius whyche called vnto hym knyght named uselyne chargynge hym go vnto lordes commaundynge wyse shulde harme prothadius whyche uselyne beynge mynde sayd kynge wolde shulde slee prothayde whyche message done ranne haste hym slewe sate playenge dyce table wyth one peter physicyon done hoolly ranne vnto ye kynges tent besechyng hym take dyspleasure ye deth euyll man well knowe enemye frendshyp pea theodoryche apperceyued well cowde reuenge hys deth wythout ponyshemet multytude therfore toke pacience suffred offence passe vnpunysshed whyche man thus murdered bothe prynces without notable acte deted eyther hys countree cxxv chapiter thys daye theodoryche taken wyfe yt hys concubyne receyued two sonnes therfore thaduertysement hys frendes set hys mynde mary noble woman soone sent certeyne ambassadours vnto berthric kyng spayne wyllyng graute vnto hym memberge doughter mariage whiche vppon certeyne condicyons perfourmed wyth greate ryches hym shortly sent maryed certayn tyme well entreated cheryshed season rone spent brunechyeld turned kynges mynde quene lastely wyth suche treasoure iewellys receyued sent home agayn whych iniury berthricus father toke herte greuously shortly sente hys messenger vnto clothary kyng soysons requiryng hym ayde warre vppon theodoriche hadde done vnto hym great dyspleasure rather ye warre sayde theodoryche wyth brother lately made agayne hym whyche wyth theyr strengthes myghte well reuenge whome clotharius grauted haue hys party stronger sente vnto hys neuewe theodobert brother theodoriche styre hym agayne hys sayde brother wherof berthricus hadde receyuyd knowlege hys sayde messenger sent vnto agon king longobardys veryly adoaldus v kynge alboynus requyryng hym lyke maner desyrous wreche made faste sure promyse gyue ayde vttermoste power theodoryche warned cospyracy iiii kynges entendyd warre ioyntly vppon hym therwyth greatly amoued prouyded hys defence best maner theodobert trustyng appoyntmet made assembled great hoste made spede fyrst toward ye place bytwene theym appoynted whyche nere ye castell salas preparacyon made towarde batayle meane founde forenamed two bretherne shulde mete eyther wyth acco panyed wyth x thousand knyghtes theodobertus enter ynge dysceyue hys sayd brother force hym graute pleasure broughte wyth hym ferre aboue ye nober wherfore theodoricus beynge ouersette wyth strength graunted brother wyll whych ouer certeyne thynges appoyntementes concluded bytwene berthricus hym theodobert shulde holde hym heyres two lordshippes called champayne turon whych conclusyon fynysshed eyther takynge leue departyd vnto theyr countreys wythout greate vnrestfulnesse sayde theodorych berynge mynde wronge doynge hys brother wherfore shortly made meanes hys neuewe clothayre desyrynge hym wolde assyste hys brother agayne hym suffer hys quarell demyd dynt swerde bytwene theym two requeste lothayre aduyse saynte columbane munke irelande beynge costes graunted french cronicle sayth warned thys foresayd holy munke abbot shulde medle bytwene sayd two bretherne myche yt prouyded god shuld heyre bothe whan theodorych receyued thys answere gaderyd stregth spedde hym vppon hys iourney cytye langresse then uerdune uerdoune theodoberte hauynge knowlege hys malycyouse brother purpose gaderyd austracy greate hoste sped hym tyll came cytye toull bothe hostes shortely met feldes playnes nere cytye foughte stronge batayle slayne greate people vppon bothe sydes parte vppon syde theodobert wherfore fynally compelled forsake felde fled vnto coleyne gaderyng newe powar fought agayne wyth hys brother whyche fyght lyke fortune agayn chasyd hys grete shame losse theodoricus hys mortall enemye folowed fyrynge wastynge countreys went myche inhabytauntes coutreys fell hym besechynge grace offence one man wolde destroye many innocentes assurynge hym forthermore wolde become hys lyegemen holde theyr lande hym euer whyche request sayde gladly wolde graunte theyr petycyon yf wolde presente hym hedde hys brother whych answere theodorych receyued amonge selfe appoynted certayne persones moste apte theyr purpose wyllyd theym go vnto theodobert execute theyr entent whyche sped theyr iourney tyll came presence theodobert shewyd vnto hym yf wolde agreable departe wyth suche stuffe iewellys hys faders theodoryche myghte partener therof shulde haue perfyght amyte rest wyth hym whyche wordes gyuynge confydence truste called wyth hym sayde persones brought ye howses sayd stuffe iewellys lay whyle busyed deuyde appoynte ye porcyon hys one sayde person slewe hym sodeynly one agrement strake hys hed secrete wyse caused yt conueyed vnto hys brother whan theodoryche hadde receyued hed hys brother sped hym coleyne treason wrought receyued cytye hys possessyon wyth ye kyngdome austracy hys brother belongynge ordred hys nedes hys mynde wyth two sonnes excedynge fayre doughter theodobert spedde hym vnto mees chefe cytye austracy wyth hym met hys graundmoder brunechyelde whyche perseuerynge malyce myschefe caused ye sayd two sonnes shortly slayn theodorych restoryd delyuered vnto clothayre lades hym promysed theodoryche thus endynge hys warre whyche longe season spent hys tyme kepynge concubynes nowe rauyshed wyth beaute brother doughter whyche hadde brought coleyne doyng brunechyeld wythstode wyth power mayde e e hys kynne whych beyng herfore dyscotent sayde thou wycked false woman dyd thou make beleue theodobert sonne father sonne gardyner cause hast thou caused secute brother lastely lee hym whyche wordes wolde haue slayne yf lordes hadde ben letted whyche dede forgotten vngoodly woman euer imagyned howe myght brynge theodoryche lyfe lastely hyryd hym consent iniquyte vpon season came stew bayn axyd drynke ye force wherof poysoned yed soone whe reygned xviii yeres howe yt antoninus vi chapyter xii tytle seconde parte hys worke sayth brent wyth fyre dyuyne power cxxvi chapiter haue shewed vnto fyne ende two bretherne reason whose deth hole pryncypate fraunce fell vnto abouenamed clothayr shall expresse vnto dedys hym done hadde rule onely yt ye forenamed brunechyelde malygned euer agayn lothayr fortherauce malyce behauyd wise wyth ruler lordes austracy caused admytte owne named sygebert ryghtfull enherytoure lande good experyence theyll dysposycyon woman therfore sent two nobleman lande name pepyn arnold vnto clothayre willynge hym sende hastely prouynce whyche message two lordes reported clotharius shortely spedde hym austracy castell called cathomat lodgyd hym hys people whereof herynge brunechielde sent vnto hym gaue vnto hym monicyon shuld voyde land myche sygebert eldest sonne theodoryche therof ryghtefull enherytour ye haue harde theodoryche vsyd lemmans whyche receyued foure sonnes yt say sygebert corbe chyldebert merone wherfore ye foresayde brunechyelde entendynge dystourbe lothayre lande fortyfyed sayd sygebert clayme lande austracye clothayre hadde receyued knowlege maundemet brunechielde bruncheuste sent answere wolde assemble lordes austracy demed theym whyther thys land belonged hym sygebert ferynge sentence excyted people prouynce germanye strength partye wyth people myght make sayde countre austracy bryng sente one garnery albon garnery hadde suspeccyon shuld fauour ye partye lothayre wherfore albone hys felowe sente letter shulde put sayde garnery away whe albone ouer rad letter brake yt peces threwe theym hym afterwarde frende garneryes gaderyd peces ioyned theym conceyuyd sentence letter forthwyth shewyd yt vnto garnery garnery perceyued malycyous entent brunechielde kepte yt secrete hym selfe secrete meanes caused germanyes shuld take partye wyth brunechyelde done retourned burgoyne wyth co panye solycyted lordes burgoyne abhorred crudelite woman garnery hadde thys wyse compassed hys mater sent vnto lothayr shewyd yf myght haue hys grace safecondute wolde come hym shew hym thynges concernynge hys aduauntage whyche graunted clothayre counsayle ye sayd garnery assembled power shortly sente strenght theym champayne cathaloyne yt shewed sigebert hadde gatheryd great strenghtys forsoke party sigebert many noble austracye amonge whyche myne authoure nameth rucco sigoldus enulanus yelded mercy clothayre shortly hostes clothayre sygebert mette garnerye token betwene hym dyuerse captaynes sygebert assygned ye sayd captaynes wyth theyr people wythdrewe sygebert wyth hys two bretherne corbo meroneus gaue backe whyle came ryuer sigoune lytle resystence foresayde two bretherne taken frenche cronicle sayth foure brethern taken yt mayster gagwyn sayth sygeberte vertue hys horse escapyd daye seen soone thys victory brunechyeldes also frenche cronycle y named bruneheuste broughte prysoner vnto presence lothayre wyth suster theodoryche whych garnery gerney hadde taken tentes enymyes lotharius forthwyth commauded corbon behedded preseruyd meroneus mych hym godfather euer cheryshed hym kynnesman lotharius thus hauyng ye victory enimyes made great ioy hadde somedeale sette countrey quyete toke aduyse hys lordes howe shulde demeaned wyth brunechielde hadde ben authoryce manyfolde mychyefes crymynous ded whych one cosent mynde condescendyd agreed shuld put moste paynfull vyle deth fynally fore betynges sette vppon horse conueyed thorough hoste men myghte beholde se brought agayn ye kynges presence kynge rehersed vnto longe processe murdurs conspyracis wycked dedes affermynge hadde ben occasyon cause deth x prynces besyde meane persones whe hadde sayde hys pleasure commaunded bounden wylde horse tayle hedde drawen whyle dede iudgement executed lycence kynge buryed house relygyon wythin cytye hosdon osdon tyme hadde buyldyd honoure saynte martyne besyde many lyfe buyldyd dyuerse place endowyng wyth great ryche possessyons cxxvii chapiter thus dame fortune fauoured partye lotharius kyngdome whyche hadde tyme clodoueus lewes cotynued vnder iiii gouernours ruler partye nowe fallen hym hadde vnder obeysaunce rule anon thys lotharius made garnery prefecte mayster hys paleys releasyd vnto longebardes lombardes trybute xii thousand pounde yerely payde kynges frannce whych fyrst sette vppon theym gunthranus hys vncle thys whyle hys encreace wordely ioye receyuyd hys wyfe bergeruda sonne whych named dagobertus whyche came couenable age betoke lore arnolde byshoppe fyrste wyfe lotharius ded maryed seconde named sichilde receyued chyld named yt haybert dagobert fyrste sonne comen lawfull age vsuell custome prynces fraunce gaue hym myche chase wylde bestys chaunce one daye folowed chace hert tryed yt sore yt broughte hym bay place called strete catulyen whyche strete old lytle chapell whyche forsayde herte entred helde hym yt great nomber houndes folowed hym ye chapell dore none theym wold enter stode bayenge dagobertus came behelde maner houndes dyd coude cause entre chapel myghte thus departed wythout doynge season wythout great meru lynge hys mynde longe clothayr cosyderynge frowardnesse growyng sonne dagobert assygned hym tutour lerner worldely knyghtely maners whose name sadragesyle sonne shulde haue hym awe fere kyng gaue vnto sayde tutoure dukedome guyan yt one daye cause thys sadragesyle wold haue chastyzed dagobert wherof beyng ware associated vnto hym certayne wanton persones bete mayster way dyspyte caused berd hys tutour shauen whyche dede lothayre agayne hym greuously dyspleasyd greatire haste sente hys sonne dagobert feryng punyshement wythdrewe hym went vnto forenamed chapell trustyng veryly wheretofore beste shewid comforte holy prayer shulde comforted tyll suche tyme myghte atteyne vnto grace hys father ye shall vnderstande tyme hadde experyence wonder shewyd herte lerned holy martyr saynte denys hys two felowes rusticus eleutherius shulde buryed wythin sayde chapell whych martyryd persecucyon domycyane emperour aboute yere crystes incarnacyon lxxx xvi honoure ye whych martyr foresayd poore chapell arreryd witnessyth frenche cronycel meanes deuout french man whose name y expressyd thus dagobert thys chapell abydynge prayer fyrste nyght beyng slepe apperyd vnto hym iii olde faders sayenge vnto hym yonge man martyr whyche many yeres passyd slayne fayth cryste buryed thys place catula good woman whyche place duely suffyciently honoured yet people frauce hath v due reuerece worshyppe therfore thou art myghte power remembre v helpe thys place otherwyse buyldyd whych shall longe thou shalte take thys dreme fantasye dygge hereafter thys grounde thou shalte fynde oure thre bodyes hole vncorrupt vppon eueryche v name letter fresshely wryten thys vanyshed awaye dagobert awoke called well mynde thys vysyon promysed inwardely betwene god hym yf recouncylyd hys father hym hadde promysed wolde fulfyll hadde desyryd thys father beynge warnyd dagobert thys chapell sent vnto place certayne hys knyghtes pull take hym then per force came wythin myle ye sayde chapell astonyed myghte go one fote forwarde beste coude hadde long stryue oute preuaylynge retournyd kynge shewed hym ye trouthe thynge done kynge beynge dyscontent wyth theyr reporte blamed theym sayde feryd hys sonne whyche cause hadde fayned excuse incontynently sente forth company delte wyth lyke maner ye lothari somdele troubled wyth reporte seruauntes consyderyd chapell nere vnto paris lay comaundyd horse brought wolde proue mater hym selfe lyke seruauntes seruyd euen became hym myghte go ryde frowarde sydewarde towarde chapell myght wyse atteyne knowen ye kyng cosydered well yt handyworke god wherfore fayre easy meanes called home son recouncylyd hym forgaue trespace accordyth legende lyfe saynte denys wyth shall folowe storye dagobert thys reconcylyacyon lotharius ordeyned vnder hym hys sonne dagobert ruler sygnory austracye whyther yt elacyon hys owne mynde badde counsayll shortely rebellyd agayne hys father wolde haue reteyned prouynce owne vse thys chosen xii noble men frauce arbytre deme betwene father son whyche lordes longe debated mater fayre entreatyse contentyd father gaue vnto sonne sayde lordshyppe austracy soone thys accorde clothayre made warre vppon gothis saxon length subdued yt knowe lyke sayde saxon inuadyd myche brytayne englande lykewyse warryd fraunce lastely subdued prouynce neustria named yt theym normandye storye charlis symple shall euydently appere thys vyctorye saxon y made longe rehersayll howe lastly clothayre hadde slayne kynge ruler theym named berthrande yode countrey germanye slewe man chylde passyd ye length hys swerde dedes lothayre done myght make longe worke passe ouer yt foloweth lothayre hadde set countrey reste assembled hys lordes cytye towne called traacas trecas dyuers mater dyscussyd endyd axed theym perfyte allegeaunce fydelite hym hys heyres kepte wyche sayde lordes fyrmely promysed assuryd commaundyd eueryche theym repayre theyr owne countreys soone made assemble hys byshoppes spyrytuall men cytye towne troy whose counsayllys orderyd thynges mater concernynge wele chyrche shortly vexyd greuous sekenes wherof fynally dyed hadde reygned moste wryters xliii yeres leuynge heyre forenamed dagobert whyche enterryd hys fader wyth great pope abbey saynt uincent wythoute wally paris whiche abbey thys daye called saynte germaynes foresayde yeres accomptyd reygne lothayre accomptyd fyrste daye ordeyned kynge soysons vnto daye hys deth wherof reygnyd wryters ouer parte xxvii yeres ouerall frauce xvi yeres whyche make full xliii yeres anglia cxxviii chapiter cadwanus cadwan whyche guydo y named duke uenedoyce northwalys one assente britos lastly made theyr souerayne gouernour yere lorde vi hundred xiii xxv yere seconde clothayre kynge fraunce also fyrst yere colwolphus kynge westsoxons accomptynge reygne ceawlmus kynge sayde westsaxons xxxi yeres colricus nexte succedynge hym v yeres ye haue hard dyscorde trouble amonge brytons tyme careticus laste kynge longe reason wher saxos wanne land rehersyd c xx chapyter howe ethelfryde kynge northumberlande ouer set brytons cytye chestre forcyd take ouer seuarne walys chase thys eadwane theyr duke leder whyche putte authoryte assembled hys brytons came agayne britayne gaue batayll vnto sayde ethelfryde whych spedde dyuersly season saxon wanne brytons brytons held chestre good townes whych hadde recoueryd sene theyr last commynge shulde seme meanynge policronica thys cadwan cedwall shulde length slee sayde ethelfryde osricus bothe kynges brennicia deyra guydo also gaufryde wytnessen thys cadwan better ethelfryde medyatours yt agreed ethelfryd shulde enioye lande ouer beyonde humber vnto scotlande cadwan shulde haue lande humber towarde sowthe whyche sayenge agreeth englyshe cronycle affermynge also shulde sonne brucyuall kynge leyceter whych wryters testyfyed also shewed ye sayde accorde betwene ethelfryde cadwan confyrmed contynued durynge lyfe cadwan two especiall louers frendes durynge reygne cadwan two sonnes colric kyngilsus quichillynus deth theyr father brother colwolphus ruled ioyntly pryncypate westsaxons whyche theyr begynnynge faught agayn brytons ampton besyde oxynford wanne towne holdes whyche brytons yt coutre occupyed agrement wryters cadwan co flycte yet medlyd hym farre within ye land yt shuld seme guydo brytons shulde copany shulde lyue vnder trybute saxon ye whych manhode yt hard reported cadwan rebelled agayn ye saxon foloweth whe cadwan thus contynued amite wyth ethelfryde chaunge fell ethelfryde hatered otherwise put fro hym hys wyfe beynge great wyth chylde toke hym wherfore thys woman beynge reedlesse callyng mynde ye great loue betwene husbande cadwan went vnto hym specyally besoughte hym recoenyle lorde husbande myght restoryd hys company cadwan many meanes requestis myght bryng therfore tenderynge necessyte kepte hys owne courte tyll lyghted whyche tyme brought fourth man chylde lette call edwyn soone wyfe cadwan delyueryd sonne father callyd cadwalyn authour floure hystoryes sayth yt two chyldern long borne tyme whych shuld seme true myche cadwalyn lawfull age beweld lande whe father dyed coude yf hadde nowe borne affermeth policronycon yt shulde seme lyke fable rehersayll gaufride maketh ende hys boke well cadwalyn edwyn cyrcustaunce mater rehersyd whych varyeth wryters tyme also mater somdeale hystorye hereof made mencyon also cotynuauce storye giraldus cambrens seyen edwyn sonne elle ella kynge deyra whyche persecutyd ethelfridus named kynge prouynces meane brennicia deyra sore compellyd flee redwaldus kynge gestanglys whyche mede fere sayde ethelfride lastely consentynge haue betrayed edwyn whyche daunger sayde edwyn delyueryd warnynge frende hys escape edwyn satte vppon time great study alone straunger apperyd hym sodeynly sayde know well cause thy thought heuynes therfore yf thyn enymyes slayne thou restoryd vnto thy kyngdome sette better maner thy forefather woldyst thou admytte one thy frende assent rede cousayll yes trewly sayd edwyn surely fastely promise man layd hand vpon edwynes hedde sayde hym edwyn token broughte haue thou mynde tyme trybulacyon promyse thou haste made anon thys spoken man vanyshed syght sodeynly conuenyent season edwyn assemblyd hys hoste gaue batayll vnto ethelfryde countrey mercia eest ryuer idle slewe hym fyghte wyth great nober knyghtes seasyd possessyon foresayde pryncypates kynge northumberlande terme xvii yeres ye shall vnderstande forenamed ethelfride hadde iii sonnes whyche mynded besyde fyrste eldest named eaufricus seconde oswaldus thyrde oswye fyrst lawfull age myght helpe shyft hym selfe oswald xii yeres age oswy farre yonger wherfore theyr wardeyns immediatly theyr faders deth sente theym armorica lytell brytayne brought vppe veryly albania scotlande cxxix chapiter aboute tyme season wytnessen policronica guydo began kyngdome lordshyp mercia vnder stronge paynym saxon called penda whyche mercia mercherike conteyned huntyngdon shyre hertfortshyre gloucetershyre wyth dyuers grettest largeste closyd ye west syde wyth ryuer dee stretchynge chestre seuarne shrouesburye brystowe eest yt closyd wyth see occean south thamys vnto london north ye ryuer hober hys begynnynge vnder fore named penda accorde dyuerse authours wytnessyth yere oure lordes incarnacyon vi hundred xxvi fyrste commynge hengyste hundred lxxvi yeres yt fyrste kyng dyuerse opynyons ben wherof cause maye myche lordshyppe fyrst begynnyng departyd iii say fyrst called eest mercia ii named myddell mercia iii weste mercia yt brought one pryncypate called mercherike wryter myddell englande thys lordshyppe fyrste crysten kynge called wolpherus sonne forenamed penda kynges thys kyngdome mercia whych xviii nomber testyfyeth policronica offa moste myght power shall playnly appere lordshippe endured reken moste certaynly tyll yere oure lorde viii hundred lxxvi whych yere alurede alhered kynge westsaxons ioyned yt vnto owne kyngdome whych accompte shulde two hundred l yeres yt accompte endurauce therof last yere burdredus putte dane whyche rekenynge yt shulde endure iiii yeres lesse wryters accopte terme therof whyle tyme edward called elder whych deth fader alured put dane sayde lordshyppe ioyned yt agayne westsaxon accompte yt shulde laste ii hundred lxxx yeres odde ye shall also vnderstande kyngdome reygned dyuerse holy kynges whyche nowe alowed chyrche sayntes offa kenelphus kenelm hereafter somedeale shall appere haue seen old regyster within chyrche poulys london wherin y conteyned many thynges concernynge fyrst foundacyon chyrch wyth certayne olde cronycles thys lande amonge whyche yt notyd tyme season cadwan kynge ruler brytons moment tyme reygned dyuers partes lande vii kynges vnder wryten fyrste sybertus kynge eestsaxons essex redwaldus kynge eestanglys norff suff ethelbertus kyng ket ethelwald kynge southsex kyngylsus kynge westsaxons penda kynge mercheryke ethelfridus kynge north coutre northumb whyche regyster worke accordyth yf story cadwan careticus cadwall duely serchyd cxxx chapiter lette v retourne perfourmauce story cadwan dedes done dayes xiiii yere reygne quincellinus brother vnto kyngylsus kynge hym c xxviii chapyter touchyd ruled ye westsaxos sent vpon eester day swerdman sle edwyn kyng northumberland swerdeman came cytye besyde water darwent derbysshyre wayted tyme lastly fand kynge smally accompanyed entended haue ronne thorough kynge wyth sworde enuenemed one lilla kynges trusty seruaunt dysgarnysshed shylde wepyn defende mayster starte betwene knyg sword stryken thorough body dyed kynge wounded stroke wouded thyrde take confessyd sent worke treason knyght secondly wounded dyed kynge laye longe syke helyd nyght folowynge quene delyuered doughter whyche kyng edwyn caused crystened paulinus ye bysshop toke wolde fulfylle suche promyse made named enfleda halowed vnto god whytsontyde kyng beynge scantly hole wounde assembled hoste made towarde kynges westsaxon greate sore fyghte venquysshed theyr hoste edwyn thys vyctory thynges gyuen hym god helthe worlde forgate former promesse lytell mynde therof excepte preachyng paulinus forsoke maumetrye excuse sayde myghte clerely renye olde lawe forefaders hadde kepte longe sodeynly crystened without authoryte good aduyse hys counceyle also receyued letter exhortacyon co forte take baptyme ye v boniface tha pope whiche also sent quene lyke letter myrrour garnysshed syluer combe iuory kyng shyrte wrought sodry place letter golde preuayled nothynge paulin made specyall prayer god shewed hym reuelacyon token gyuen edwyn tyme trybulacyon knowlege hadde paulinus shortly came vnto kyng layeng hande hys hed frayned hym whyther lyke remebrau ce lyke token whyche whan kynge hadde confessyd holy bysshoppe sayde vnto hym lo thou hast ouercomen thyne enemyes wonne thy kyngdome holdest moste large wyse therfore perfourme thy promesse trew hym hath holpen thy longe kynge assemblyd hys counceyll theyr agremet sayd paulinus byshop yorke baptysed wythin sayde cytye xi yere hys reygne yere grace testifyeth guido vicxxvii fyrste crysten kyng reygned coutrey hym many hys lordes subiectes also crystened sayd paulinus flamyns bysshoppes theyr false goddes turned crystes faythe token wherof armed knyghtes bestrode good horse theyr lawe myghte vse none armoure ryde onely mare tyme forthwardes term vi yeres durynge lyfe kynge edwyn paulinus crystened contynuelly bothe prouynces deyra brenicia ryuers gweuy swala whyche vsed hys fontes preached shyre lyndesey buylded chyrche stone lyndecoln lyncolne thys tyme great peace kyngdome edwyne woman myghte haue gone one towne without grefe noyaunce refresshynge waye goer edwyn ordeyned clere wellys cuppes dysshes iron brasse fastened postes standynge sayd wellys sydes man hardy take awaye cuppes kept good iustyce knyghtely hys dedes fyrste wanne ile eubonia called ile man hys meanes orpewaldus corpewaldus sonne redwaldus kynge eest anglis norphis touchyd edwyn fledde socoure conuerted true fayth greate parte men hym edwyn excellyd ye kynges enuyed hym specyally penda kynge mercia whyche excyted cadwan kynge brytons agayne hym two assemblyd great hoste agayne edwyn lastly met palce called hatfelde sharpe fyght bothe sydes edwyne slayne whan reygned ouer ye northumbris xvii yeres yere lorde sayth guydo vic xxxiii two kynges cadwan cedwalla penda hadde thus ouercomen kynge hym slayne mych hys people became cruell men countrey destroyed therin mych people men woman chyldren well religyous wherfore paulinus archebysshop beholdyng theyr cruelnesse toke quene enfleda hyr doughter fled water kent bysshoprych rochester voyde reason romanus last bysshop adreynte paulyne ordeyned made bysshop see dyed also lefte paull affyrmeth policronycon archebysshoppes see yorke voyde xxx yeres ye quene whyche named etherberga became menchon sayled gallia fraunce wherein abbaye called brydgence bryggence lyued holy lyfe dyed hyr doughter enfleda cotynued hyr professyon afterwarde abbesse strenshalt vale whitby deth edwyn osrycus sonne elfric brother ethelfridus toke vppon hym kynge deyra eaufricus eldest sonne ethelfrida c xxviii chapiter touched made kyng brennicia whyche turned fro crystes fayth became myscreautes whych goddes wrech fell vpon short whyle bothe slayne ye yere folowynge ye fornamed cadwan penda whan sayde two kynges thus slayne oswalde second sonne ethelfrid began reygne ouer prouynce brennicia chefe kyngdome northumberlande rule deira lyke wyse wherof whan cadwan cedwalla ware gathered hys brytons thoughte slee oswalde hadde slayne brother eaufricus oswald whan warned greate strength thys cadwan made prayer god besoughte hym mekely helpe withstande enemyes yode prayer arreryd crosse tre whyche knelyd longe whyle felde whyche longe called heuynfelde thys daye greate worshyppe place nere vnto town chyrche agustalde brennicia whyche chyrche buylded oswalde wynnyng batayle spones crosse tolde many wounders whiche ouer passe oswalde prayed saluacyon hys people two hostes met felde named tha denysborne denyslake foughten stronge batayle fynally cadwan whyche polycronyca nameth cedwalla slayne people chasyd farre excedynge nomber oswaldus hoste whanne sayde cadwan reygned ouer brytons moste accorde wryters also tyme terme xxii yeres leuynge hym son affermeth gaufryde named cadwallus cadwalyn francia cxxxi chapiter dagobertus fyrste name sonne clothayr rehersed beganne reygne ouer hole monarchye fraunce yere lorde vi hundred xxxi xviii yere cadwan kynge brytons tyme hys faders deth prouynce austracy gyuen hym fader shewed cxxvii chapyter precedynge anone worde came hym hys faders decease sped hym well accompanyed frauce comen cyty reynes thyder came vnto hym many noble well burgoyne partyes fraunce dyd vnto hym feauty homage shewed cxxvi chapyter thys worke clothayre seconde wyfe sonne named heybert claymed parte kyngdome fraunce ye began make styrynge good polycy meanes one brunulphe vncle sayd haybert brother sichyld hys moder mater appeased vnto hym certeyne cytyes assygned wyth landes guyan whiche cotentyd ordeyned tholouse chefe cytye hys pryncypate peace confermed dagobert quiete terme iii yeres folowyng iiii yere gascoynes rebelled agayn hym whych hys manhode shortly subdued whan set lande quyetnesse called mynde ye promyse tyme hadde made saynt denys hys felowes wherfore great solempnite caused groud holy bodyes laye openyd wyth great reuerece taken vp upon whych bodyes fand fresshely wryten eyther theyr name myghte perfyghtely knowe one caused layd sumptuouse shryne ouer sayd place buylded royall mynster lyme stone conueryd plate syluer stede sclate leade assygned vnto ye prestes mynysters therof greate ryche possessyons goodly temple suche beautye outwarde shulde lacke garnysshynge within therfore causyd hangynges made hange within temple whiche tapettes suche scruyd quere garnyshed set dyuerse stone dayes vsed foresayde place shryne holy martyr bodyes laye ordeyned cheste truke clene syluer entet yt iewelles ryche gyftes offered ye holy sayntes shulde therin kept vse mynysters ye place ouer endowed yt place many greate lybertyes pryuyleges place thus fynysshed caused crosse golde made garnysshed moste precyous stone greate bygnesse value caused set ouer hyghe aulter wythin sayde monastery translacyon blessyd sayntes shulde wytnessyth freche cronycle v yere reygne sayd dagobert made ye yere lorde vicxxxvi wha clerely honour due reuerence fynysshed tha vysyted cyrcued lande mynystrynge iustyce person ordeyned meanes bylles supplicacyon cause mater poore men myghte come knowlege meane wherof gate great loue fauour comons amonge hys many notable dedes one dede hym commytted whyche somdeale longe blemysshyd hys honour without iudgement processe lawes caused slayne forenamed brunulphe vncle vnto haybert hys brother malyce yt bare hym fauouryng ye sayd haybertis party thys kynge deuorsyd wyfe named gertrude bareyne broughte forthe frute maryed fayre wenche named ranetrude whyche receyued conuenyent tyme son named sigebert chyld told whan brought holy bysshoppe amandus confermed beyng age xl dayes bysshoppe sayd ouer hym certeyne prayer concernynge offyce confyrmacyon none cyrcumstauntes neglygece gaue answere vnto ye bysshop conuenyent tyme chylde dyuyne power sayde amen lowde maner people standynge myghte well vnder stande whereof bysshoppe people hougely ameruayled foloweth dagobert thys passetyme ruled noble man fraunce properly prouynce austracy named frenche booke saynte arnulphe bysshoppe mees pepyn whyche ruler kynges paleys whyche season also hys lande greate honour prosperyte tyll deth forenamed arnulphe whych dyed season kyng beganne alter chaunge co dycyons hurte hys comons hys lande cxxxii chapiter dagobertus yt exercised hym honour vertue beganne exercise iniustyce tyrannye pyllynge hys common exaccyons trybutes suche wyse dwellyd outwarde partyes hys realme nere vnto turkys straunge landes nacions fayne vnder rule theym theyr owne naturall prynce howe euer bare hym agayne hys subiectes pyllynge takyng myght yet euer hadde fauour saynt denys gaue hym myghte purchace yt wyth ryght otherwyse contynuynge whyche season went countrey poytiers robbyd spoyled chyrche saynte hyllary many great iewellys toke wyth hym bodye blessyd man causyd yt hadde monasterye saynt denys shrynyd hym done destroyed cou trey poytiers wyth iron fyre wally cytye made playne wyth grounde yt cruelty terrour people shewyd eryd stretys sayde cytye sewe theym wythsalte sygne token wolde haue cytye subuertyd euer whyche ruyne thys daye appereth olde cytye stode called ye olde poytiers standyth nowe called newe cytye poytiers cause thys destruccion citye countre sayeth mayster roberte gagwyne ye erle poytiers rebellyd agayne kynge thus man whylome lambe turned tygre ouer hys cruelnesse gyuen sensuall luste hys body myche rode hadde folowynge hym company strumpettes besyde suche kept dyuerse place realme appareylyd fed lyke vnto quenes thys rule vyces vsyd kynge pepyn mayster paleys put great wyte blame dyuerse lordes lande thynkynge hys counsayle sufferaunce kyng lad guyded ye fyrst pepyn seconde mayster placys tyme seconde reygne fyrste theodoricus surnamed uetul breuis whyche meane old lytle ye iii pepyn son carolus marcellus fyrste pepyn graundefader seconde moders syde seconde graunsyr iii ye mannes syde whyche thyrde pepyn hole assent frenchman ordeyned kyng frauce shall appere father vnto kynge named charlis great emperour rome whyche pepyns descendyd blood austracye hadde great possessyons wythin prouynce forenamed pepyn vnderstode grudge murmour lordes whyche bare agayne hym kynges demeanour theyr aduyces toke vnto hym nother great lorde named martyn vnto hym assystent ouer caused ye blessyd man amandus accompany ye kynge whose cousayle kyng somdeale refrayned hym vyce good byshop hym aduertysed tyme heybart kynges halfe brother dyed also hys son shortly named chilperych reason whose dethes lordshyp countrey tholouse fell possessyon dagobert longe people called asclauons sclauons made warre vpon coutrey austracy also called bulgaris ioyne vppon parte austracy tydynges dagobert lerned sped hym austracy assembled myghtye hoste knyghtes sped tyll came nere hys enymyes ye sayd sclauons hauynge knowlege kynges great hoste agreed oratours hym sent contynue trybute tyme payde ye yerely fyue hudred ox thorough ye warre appesyd tyme newe allyaunce vpon partyes confermed whych
