peace thus stablysshyd ye kyng made son sigebert kynge ruler lordshyp austracy assygnynge hym bisshop colayn named cunbert erle palatyne named agasyle hys tutours ruler contynuynge yeres youth done ye kyng retourned frauce soone receyued hys wyfe sonne named clodoueus whych many wryters called lodouicus lowes thys lowes father couenable tyme gaue countyes burgoyne neustria normandy kynge graunted house saynte denys fayre kepte yerely moneth iune felde nere vnto sayde monasterye marchaunte paris good towne shulde sell marchaundyse onely fayre wyth many customes great auauncement house kynge hadde subdued gascoynes brytons armorica lytle brytayne assembled multytude bysshoppes dedycate halowe monasterye saynte denys moste solemne wyse great myracle shewyd clensyng leper lazar durynge nyght laye wythin sayde chyrch beyng deuoute prayer sawe sauyour cryste accompanyed wyth peter paule also holy martyr saynte denys wyth hys two felowes entre chyrche one wyndowes halowed sayde chyrch whyche came sayd lazar commaunded hym shew vnto byshoppes yt proper person hadde halowed sayd chyrche token knowlege ye hadde receyued hys helthe recorde trouth mater sauyour cryste wytnessyth mayster robert gagwyn also frenche cronicle drewe skynne face sayde lazar threwe yt agayne stone yt remayneth thys daye sene whyche token dagobert byshoppes vppon morne behelde sawe beynge greatly ameruaylyd laft forther besynesse touchynge dedyfyenge sayde chyrche thys myracle great concurse people yerely vi kalendis marche comyth wyth great deuocyon vnto ye sayd monastery makyng theyr oblacions fermly beleuyng sayde chyrch halowed crystes hand dagobert besynesse wyth fyted endyd called great counsayll lordes spyrytuall teporall hys cytye biguage beyng set betwene ii sonnes sigebert clodoueus made long preposycyon oracyon concernynge allegyaunce whyche exhorted hys lordes owe bere hym terme lyfe hys two sonnes beynge prensent exhorted ii sonnes charitably loue shulde moste fraternall wyse contynue theyr lyues whyche preposycyon fynyshed presence made testament hadde causyd wryten iiii sondry skynnes endentyd rad sealyd wyth certayn theyr sealys wherof one wyllyd kept treasory saynt denys ii treasorye cytye lyon iii tresory mees austracy whyche howe named lorayne iiii kynges tresorye kynge orderyd hys matiers som deale hys purpose dyssoluyd thys counsayll comaundyd eueryche estate vnto hys owne countre somwhat besyed wyth rebellyon forenamed brytos gascoynes mater whyche passe ouer length tyme kynge lastely syke flyx brought hys desyre vnto monastery saynte denys commytted hys wyse nantyld wyth son clodoue vnto guydyng tuycyon noble man frauce mayster hys paleys named agaynus dyed reygned xiiii yeres buryed great pompe forenamed monastery dagobert reported myne authour also frenche cronycle besyde wryters holy ancre heremyte fraunce beynge medytacyons shuld se company fendes whyche beyng see shuld haue amonge theym bote soule dagobert conueyenge yt towarde payne thys spiryte ceasyd crye call saynt denis felowes helpe whyche lastely came clad whyte vestymentes delyuered soule paynes enymyes conueyed vnto euerlastynge ioy length wyth cyrcustaunce yt y declared bokys beforesayde anglia cxxxiii chapiter cadwallus cadwalyne sonne cadwan lastely spoken ye cronycle mych britayn testyfyeth guydo gaufryde beganne hys reygne ouer brytons yere crystes incarnacyon vi hundred xxxv ye fyrst yere fyrst dagobert kyng fraunce also xii yere kyngilsus quichillinus kynges westsaxon cadwallus stronge myghty warryd strongly vpon saxos nere vnto hym wanne castels townes droue theym backe lande towarde london wherof herynge penda kynge mercia assembled saxos made towarde cadwall ende dystressyd fayn seche purchace fauoure cadwal lyue vnder tribute penda great fauour cadwall myche yt toke parte wyth cadwall agayne saxon kynges shall appere thys tyme kyngylsus one kynges westsaxons doctryne ye blessyd man berin couertyd ye ryght beleue cristyned hym citye dortyke dorchester oswald kynge northumberland hys godfather weddyd doughter afterwarde cytye geuen byshop ende shuld ordeyne hys see sayde berin sat xiiii yeres buryed tyll beda bishop wynchester traslatyd body ye citye wynchester yt chanos dorchester saye sayd bodye holy beryne taken then nother stede hym yet toke therof beer wonder worke stadyth day ouer graue ye holy man fyrst buryed shuld seme cytye dorchester called dorset thys see tyme wyllyam conqueroure chaunged lyncolne thys tyme sigebertus segebertus kynge eestenglande norfolke whyche reygned next brother corpwaldus ordeyned letter lernyd set scolys dyuerse place kyngdome ordeyned ouer schole maysters pedagoges somtyme hadde seen fraunce whyche sygebert conuertyd crystes fayth doctryne holy man named felix ye fyrste acqueynted wyth frauce burgoyne whych felix came soone acqueyntaunce eestanglia norfolke kynge made hym byshop duwyche nowe called thetford lastelye kynge betoke hys kyngdome vnto hys neuew egritus became munke abbay whych hym selfe buyldyd penda kynge mercia warryd coutrey sayde sygebert agayne hys wyll pulled oute sayde monastery went armes testyfye vnarmyd wyth whyte rod hys hande nycely slayne well nere hoste knyghtes came wyth hym feld rehersayll apperyth dyscorde wryters begynnyng sayd kyngdome eestanglis yf yt true beganne wytnessyth policronycon iiii chapyter hys fyfte boke yere grace iiii hudred lxxx xii also haue shewed lxxx xvi chapyter worke myght yt agree wyth conuenyency tyme sygebert sebert shulde reygne kynge dayes nowe mynded wherfore ye sayenge guydo concordaunte whyche shewyth kyngdome haue begynnynge yere grace vc lxx ende forsayd chapyter yt shortly touched yt foloweth story deth sigebert anna made kyng eestanglis durynge reygne sigebertus befell woder yt tolde holy man furce shewed legth xiii chapiter v boke policronicon aforesayd xiii tytle vi chapyter ii parte ye famous worke called summa antonini season reygned began reygne cursyd secte ye detestable false prophete machomet ye syns ye tyme hath enfected yt hath enfectyd ii pricipall te ye world asia affrica part ye third named europa dayly wynneth vpon crysten peple great lades possession aboute vii yere thys forenamed cadwall kynge briton reygned kent saxon kyng named ercombertus whyche pryncypate xx yeres nobly amonge hys famous dedys reuyued quyckened agayne fayth cryste place hys kyngedome sore appallyd destroyed temple false goddes thorough countrey ordeyned aduyse clergye tyme lente fasted wedded doughter anna kynge eestanglis named sexburga receyuyd doughter named eukengoda ye whyche menchon nunne abbey brydgence fraunce mynded ethelburga ye wyfe somtyme edwyn kynge northoumberlande serued god hundred xxx chapyter precedynge yt y shewed eyther abbesse place though dayes many abbey thys yle myche brytayne yet many men woman sayled landes frauce burgoyne place conuersacyon lyuynge countres fame perfeccyon vsyd thys yle brytayne thys tyme yt viii yere cadwall dyed kyngylsus kyng westsaxons reygned brother alone xxxi yeres kenwalcus sonne kynge hym ye ye begynnyng reygne wolde crystyned forsoke hys wyfe doughter peda toke hym nother wherfore penda aduengynge hys doughter gatheryd hys hoste chasyd kynwalcus kyngdome kept hym then iii yeres whyche season anna kynge eestanglis conuertyd feyth cryste cristyned felix aforenamed byshoppe duwyke thetforde recoueryd hys kyngdome ayde assystence sayde anna kenwalcus restoryd hys lande made byshoppes see kaerguent wynchestre ordeyned byshop named agilbert frenche man byrthe called irlad sytten certayn tyme put thes ne wote cause place set named wyn wyn sayeth policronicon towne wynchester toke ye name declaryth ye liii chapyter fyrst boke yt wynnes cytye also putthens leutherius byshop leutherius succedyd cedda theodorus archbyshop caunterbury ordeyned two byshoppes prouynce westsaxo one wynchester subiecte two coutreys southrey south hampshyre see ordeyned shyreborne subiecte vi coutreys saye berkshyre wyltshyre somersetshyre dorsetshyre deuenshyre cornewayll wyllyam co querours tyme ye see shyreborne tourned salysbury see ramysburye longe kenwalcus warreyd kyng brytons whyche fought hym place called wyght gosneborough ouercomyn cadwall assembled newe hoste brytons mette wyth kenwalcus place called hyll pent longe fyghte brytons putte flyghte ye haue harde blessyd man oswall son ethelfryde ordeyned kynge northumberlande whyche contynued hys lyfe iustyce vertue kynge terme ix yeres penda kynge mercia hym crysten men great disdayne enuye ix yere cadwall made warre vppon oswald slew hym feld callyd meserfeld hys deth god shewed hym many myracles one yere deth oswy yonger brother recoueryd kyngdome buryed hed chyrcheyarde lyndesar bodye conueyed pagan deuyded sundry peces yt sayde hed nowe durham betwene saynt cutberttus armes parte ye bodye whyche longe founden abbay burdeaux ostrida doughter oswy quene mercia straugnesse made ruler hous receyte relykes tyll myracle dyuyne token shewyd sayde bodye bone brought glowceter hous chanos one hys armes peterboroughe hole fleshe fell haue tellen whan oswy season rulyd hys kyngdome fande vnlefull meanes slee oswyn kynge deyra oswyn son eaufrycus eldest brother oswalde whyche oswyn good condycyon wyth meke mylde thys oswyn slayn consent neuewe oswy oswy toke hym felow kyngdome broders sonne odylwaldus son oswalde thys oswalde gaue vnto cedda byshoppe whynchester named groude place north coutrey hygh hylles called lastyngaye buylde vpon abbay buyldyd taught brother chymbyllus shuld rule place peda kynge mercia forgate strengthynge fauourynge anna kynge eestanglys shewyd kenwalchus hys doughters husband enymye gaderyd power knyghtes yode agayne sayde anna slewe hym playne batayll yere one botulphus buyldyd abbay besyde lindecolne lincolne place hyght canno wytnessyth beda iiii chapiter thyrd boke thys yere whych shuld xxi yere ye reygne cadwall penda thys former vyctory supprysyd wyth great pryde came wyth hys hoste boundes northumland entendynge slee oswy slayne brother oswalde wherof whe oswy ware assemblyd hys knyghtes made towarde hym affynyte maryage ye betwene theyr chyldren shall shewed cause oswy offeryd hym many great offer entente haue hym refused batayll haue hadde peace hym oswy perceyued obstynacye pryde peda saw reasonable offer myghte hym wynne peace sayde sen thys paynym receyue gyftes proffer haue offeryd hym shall offer hym receyue theym anon made hys auowe vnto god yf myght haue vyctory enymyes shuld offer doughter elfleda hym wyth suffycyent possessyons buylde xii abbayes ioyned batayll sayde penda coutrey ledis farre yorke sore foughten yt lyke therof seen many yeres beforne fynally penda slayne xxx chefe captayns hym yet thryes people oswy hadde scaped shot swerde partye drowned ryuer wynwed whyche nere vnto place batayll among prysoners taken felde wyfe penda one sonnes vncle named egfridus oswy yelded hys thankes god accordynge hys former promyse offryd hys doughter elfleda enfleda age iii yeres vnto god toke lore hylda abbesse hertsey hertis iland sayde hylda remoued abbaye stremshalte vale whitby xxx myle yorke abbesse ye sayd elfleda also oswy promysed gaue landes rente buyld xii abbey wherof vi prouynce brenicia vi prouynce deyra fornamed penda hadde dyuerse sonnes accorde wryters meane wolfer weda egfridus besyde mynded seconde sonne weda oswy beforetyme maryed doughter cosent penda fader whyche weda helpe oswy made kynge south mercia whyche lordshyp seueryd northe mercia ryuer trent conteyned recorde holy beda fyue thousande housholdes weda also promysed maryed sayd doughter oswy shulde become crysten man whyche perfourmyd deth father hadde scantly reygned thre yeres ouer sayd southmercis treason hys wyfe slayne kyngdome fell wolferus brother whyche hadde weddyd doughter ercombert kynge kent named ermenylda wolferus shortly crystyned accopted fyrste cristened kyng reygned mercia fader keneredus holy virgyne menchon wereburga yt longe spake kenwalcus kynge westsaxons yt noted hadde ouercomen brytons shewyd tyme perfyted byshoppes see kaerguent wynchester besyed hym accordyng wyll kyngylsus hys father gaue sustentacyon sayd see lande whyche laye wythin vii myles sayde cytye affermeth authoure floure hystoryes fynyshed yt somdele hys purpose let man thynke buylded yt nowe nother yt none ben daye standynge monastery paleys yt haue ben sen day alteryd new chauged clerely throwe downe new buylded yt many stande vppon theyr fyrste foundacyon thys yet dothe soone kenwalcus endyd worke made warre vppon wolfer mercia iourney fortune hym fauourable loste thereby wan nothynge hys entent long ercombert kynge kent dyed son egbert kyng hym ix yere soone thereafter fell great mortalyte sekenesse thys lande brytayne whyche cotynued encreasyd durynge ye lyfe cadwall kyng brytons cadwaldyr hys successour sonne writer whyche season begynnynge mortalyte sekenesse dyed many byshoppes lande myche uitalcanus beynge pope ordeyned theodorus archbysshoppe cauterbury haue ye rule chyrches brytayne somwhat tyme benet good fauour wyth kyng ofwy dyscendyd ryche kynne forsoke seruyce house hys kynred became crystes seruaunt went v sythes rome came agayne euery tyme brought wyth hym relykes bokes crystes lore lastely made munke buyldyd ii abbey one ouer agayn ye vppon ryuer wyre renneth countrey benet fyrst yt brought crafte glasyng lande abbot foresayde abbayes toke hys lore beda vii yeres age taughte hym durynge hys lyfe vertue pacyence thys holy munke byshoppe benet myghte make longe rehersayll holynes lyfe declaryd legende sayntes bokes authoryte lengthynge tyme ouer passe yt wyll retourne agayne oswy whyche longe reygned ouer northumbers made cedda abbotte lastyngay archbishoppe yorke wyll skyll put wylfrida archbishop see yt longe cedda depryued dygnyte authoryte tharchebisshop theodorus depryuyd dyuerse tyme whych came theyr benefyces agayne ordynaunce holy lawes crystes chyrche made hym great instaunce thys byshoppe westsaxons xxx yere reygne cadwall cissa father ine kynge westsaxons buyldyd ye abbey abyndon dayes munkes clergye brytayne set theyr myndes serue god worlde herte wombe wherfore hadde great reuerence honour yt receyuyd wyth worshyp went ye stretys wayes men sawe wold ronne desyre blessynges well hym myght gyue vnto possessyons buyldyd house chyrches encreasyd ryches worldly treasoure dyscreaced heuenly treasour dayes aluredus somdeale beganne sythen tyme hath spronge pleasure god wherof comytted pleasure plyed nothynge worldely gaue prechynge techynge worde sauyour folowyd lyfe preachyd gyuynge good example ouer voyde couetyse receyuyd possessyons yf yt perforce cxxxv chapiter oswy kynge northumberlande dyed edfrydus sonne kyng hym xv yeres hys fader reygned wyth hys felowes oswynus odyswalde xxviii yeres edfrydus egfrydus wyfe holy woman ethelfryde yt wyfe tonbert prynce south eyrwayes whyche whan egfrydus hadde holden xii yeres hys wyfe myghte whyle haue leue hyr deale wyth hyr carnally prayer great gyfte gaue hyr lycence menchyon colud vnder aebba awnte vnto hym remened ely abbesse lyued greate penaunce abstynence dyed ben vii yere abesse kenwalcus kynge weste saxon dyed yere reygne cadwall kyng brytos xxxix regned ouer xxx yeres hys sonne kenewinus succedyd hym sexburga hys mother wyfe hys fader ruled prouynce one yere cedda bysshop westsaxons dyed hys deken wenfrede hys successoure whan put abbot medapstede called peterboroughe bysshop hym sone tyme dyed wyna bysshop lodon bysshop erkenwald whych brother ethelburga alborough menchen abbesse berkynge essex thys holy bysshop erkenwalde foundyd monasteryes chertsey southery berkynge afore sayde whyche place hath ben preserued sen ye fyrst foundacyon chertsey throwen downe dane reedyfyed edgar kynge englande foloweth deth wolpherus kyng mercia reygned hys brother etheldredus wyfe wolpherus named ermenilda made menchon ely wereburga doughter also made nonne trikyngham dyed hamburgam laye erth iii hundred yeres hole sounde conueyde chester thys etheldredus kynge mercia iii holy doughters yt say mylburga myldreda mylguida sonne great holynesse named meresyn wryters forsayde chyldren shulde chyldren wolpherus etheldrede wolpherus also ii holy susters named kynedda kyneswyda bothe nonnes buryed peterborough saynte ethelwolde buyldyd abbey maydens ye haue harde wylfryd put ye see yorke wherefore went rome complayned hym agathon pope well allowed thynges kynge theodorus protectours frendes retourned without spedynge hys cause wherfore retourned vnto south saxon buylded abbey silesey preachyd south saxon xv yeres conuertyd myche people shewed greate wonder ye terme iii yeres hys commynge fell rayne vppon grounde hys prayer god sent rayne groude began burgen wax grene yt bareyn dryed lacke water also taught crafte fysshynge egfrydus kynge northumberlande claymed lande etheldrede kynge mercia helde whyche dyuerse assembles treaty bytwene dyssoluyd wythout agremet wherefore eyther ty gathered hys stregth met vppon playne nere vnto ye ryuer trent foughte bytwene longe sharpe fyght whiche among great nombre bothe party slayn ye brother egfryde named elswynus edfryde egfryde better batayle meanes peace agayn treatyd yt fynally edfryde great summes money recompencement brother deth restyd sayd ii kynges accorded batayll take prisoner knyght egfryde hys takynge solde one fryson knyghtes ethelfryde fryson thentent haue prysoner shortelyer redemed kept hym bandes iron prysoner brother preest vertuous man delyuere brother prayed dayly meane whose prayer ofte ye sayd preste sang masse often bandes iron lousyd prysoner duryng tyme masse whyche cotynued tyll clerely delyuered hys raunson payde thys yere apperyd stella comata blasynge sterre whyche betokeneth deth mortalyte ye people yere folowynge dyed ye epedemye sykenesse holy abbe ely saynt etheldrede hyr suster sexburga somtyme hadde ben wyfe ercobert kyng kent hyr successoure thys yere also dyed helda ye holy abbesse whythy spoken whiche neuew edwyne lately kynge northu berlande thys abbey also bretherne vnder rule hylda dayes ben syo vnder abbesse wherfore sondry made bisshoppes besa wylfryde amonge bretherne one named cedman man greate perfeccyon ye inspyracyon taught make dytyes songes moue men deuocion wherin passyd dayes soone thys tyme theodor dyuerse cause kepte synode counceyll bysshoppes men chyrche hatfelde authoryte whych counceyll deuyded prouynce mercia sexwolphus ruled alone v bysshopryches one chestre seconde worcetyr ye thyrd lychefelde fourth cedema lyndesey v dorchester xlvi yere reygne cadwall kenewynus kynge westsaxons occasyon warre agayne ye brytons met nere vnto west see sharpe skyrmysshe ye brytos chasyd soone egfrydus kynge northumberlande made warre vpon pyctes scottes bycause fauouryd greatly ye cest anglis agayne hym lastly colour fleyng backe brought edfryde streyte amonge hylles mountaynes slewe hym grete part people deth bastard brother hys named alfridus notus kynge northumberlande reygned xviii yeres wytnessyth willyam wryter storyes kynges shortly dyed cadwall cadwalyne kynge brytos hadde reygned testyfyeth galfryde guydo xlviii yeres nother polycronyca none authours authoryte policronica allegyd shewyth lyke actes thys cadwall galfryde doth yet shuld buryed terrour fere saxon image brasse set hym vppon horse ouer west gate londo called ludgate yet chyrche saynt martyne stondynge shulde buyldyd brytons ende pray sayd cadwall hys frendes ye cadwaladrus whych beda named cedwalla shulde hys sonne ye sayd gaufryde affermed francia cxxxvi chapiter clodoueus ye yonger sonne dagobert nautylda hys wyfe beganne hys reygne ouer myddell parte fraunce partes therof yere lorde vicxlv x yere cadwall kynge brytons hys elder brother sigebert made kynge austracy lorayne accordynge wyll dagobert theyr fader thys sayd wryters called lowes guyded hys mother cou seyle agaynus mayster hys paleys fader hys lyfe commytted hym thys daye yonge age dyscrecyon shortly made kynge suche porcyon belonged ryght hys brother sigebert thyrd hys faders treasour iewelles hym delyuered whych dystrybucyon made sped hym orleaunce thyder called hym lordes burgoyne receyued feauty homage ordeyned hys leutenaunte deputye noble burgonyon named flantas gaue hym mariage neuew hys mother nautylda named ranebert due charge hym gyuen guydyng sayd countrey sent hym lordes burgoyn wythin season tyme wilibaldus great man birth myght enuyed flantas suche wyse hym dysdaynynge began dystourbe countrey kynges peace wherof herynge clodoueus hast commaunded sayd wilibaldus appere hym whyle wilibaldus sent erle bysshop ye kynges courte purchace hym frendys kynge whyle slayne gyle hys enemy flantas iiii yere reygne clodoueus dyed mother nautylda woman great wisdome vertuous condicion honorably buryed dagobert hyr husbande church saynt denys soone ensued scarcety corne whete greynes excedynge pryce rate money nowe currat quarter whete worth ii markes halfe meane scarcitye myche poore people famisshed dyed defaut wherefore kyng entendyng remedy nedy people causyd ye house church saynt denys fader tyme coueryd plate syluer rased coueryd lede syluer dystributyd amonge poore comos socoure agayn great huge famyn reygned ded somedeale withstanden agulphus abbot place tyme viii yere reygne firste pepyn ruled house sigebert kyng austracy dyed soone dyed agaynus mayster paleys clodoueus ii princis eyther countreys rulyd great dole sorowe theym made deth sayd pri ci noble man cosyn dagoberte late kynge chosen mayster paleys clodoueus thus kynge clodoueus otherwyse called lowes contynued reygne great peace prosperyte tyll lastly fell mide wolde vysyte ye sepulcre saynt denys done certayne obseruauces made prayer wolde nedely se holy relykes handle wyth doynge whereof semed holy martyr contentyd immedyately ensued suche derknes kynge aboute hym wyth greately astonyed aferde mych kyng loste vse reason wente hym selfe two yeres folowynge wryten authours kynge handelyd body saynte denys rabbysshely brake one armes frenche booke mayster roberte gagwyne sayen yt dysseueryd one armes sayd holy body whych whan somdele restoryd hys helthe closyd golde precyous stoones restored sayd monasterye lyued vppon two yeres folowynge amendyd lyke vnto hys former beynge yt lastly dyed whan reygned syke hole ye terme xvi yeres without vyce glotony lechery excedyng aueryce buryed hys parentes monasterye forenamed leuynge hym thre sonnes named clotharius chyldericus theodorych whose deth hys wyfe named batylde became nonne monastery corbye tyme newly renued reedyfyed ended holy lyfe cxxxvii chapiter clotharius eldest sonne clodoueus ordeyned kynge fraunce yere lordes incarnacyon vi hundred lxii xxvi yere cadwall kynge brytos whych anone somwhat stablysshed made mayster hys palayes myghty man tyrannous condycyon named eboryn shall appere hys condycyons ensuynge whan tyme conuenyent expressement shall come thys clotharius lefte nothyng wrytynge worthy memory excepte frenche cronicle sayth reygned iiii yeres cxxxviii chapiter theodoricus second sonne clodoueus beganne hys reygne ouer frenchemen yere grace vi hundred lxvi xxx yere cadwall kynge brytons whych couceyll lordes sent yonger brother chylderych lordshyp austracy lorayne guyde coutrey wyth ayde assystence wolphanus noble man ye countrey sigeberte laste kynge prouynce tyme dede wythout heyre hys body theodorych gaue hym slowth rest gouernauce realme power mayster ye paleys whych styll contynuynge forenamed eboryne whyche among cruell dedys hym done emprysoned holy bishoppe oston called leodegayr lastely many tormentes vylanyes hym done raced hys eyen oute hys hedde dede wyth many kynges dyshonour momysyd layd ye kynges charge myche kynge kept paleys except ye one season yere moneth may shulde broughte wyth great pompe place people shulde behold hym gyue offer vnto gyftes returne vnto ye paleys yt broughte fro reste yere folowynge meane wherof eboryn dyd hym lykynge vexyd troubled people greuously wherfore one assent ye lordes assembled theym authoryte depryued kynge dignytye closyd hym monastery contynue resydue hys lyfe hadde borne name kynge wythout execucyon acte therunto belongynge iii yeres cruell eboryn exyled luxon luxunborgh prouynce burgoyne departe then vppon payn hys lyfe cxxxix chapiter childericus hildericus thyrde sonne clodoueus sent rule prouynce austracy ordeyned kynge fraunce yere grace vi hundred lxix xxxiii yere cadwal named whyche dede sayde lordes shortely repended chylderych yonge lyght maners oppressyd subiectes greuously vsed lawes hys progenytours hys pleasure wyll wold nothynge aduertised ruled wolphanus named ye whyche tyme assigned hym hys counceyllour guyde augmentynge malyce caused noble realme named bolyde wythout gylte trespace greuous offence doynge bounden stake betyn tyll yelded spyrite ye whych crueltye lordes wyth co mon murmuryd sore agayne hym ferynge lyke punyssyon wythout deseruynge wherfore conspyryd agaynste hym moste specyally two noble men byrth myghte named iugebert amabert two wyth awayted theyr tyme season whe myght fynde tyme coueniet bryng ye kyng lyfe vpon daye yt kyng wyfe small companye wyth theym wood theyr dysporte game sayde two lordes accompanyed purposely fell vppon hym slewe hym hys wyfe also great wyth chyld ye ranne betwene lord ye entent haue sauyd lord husbande dynt ye sworde whyche dede done ye sayde childeriche reygned ouer frenchemen moste wryters two yeres cxl chapiter theodoricus deposyd lordes frauce agayne restoryd hys former dygnyty yere lorde vi hu dred lx xi xxxv yere cadwall forenamed therof eboryn warned anon drew vnto kynges presence whose fauour hys owne strength agayne restoryd former dignytie honour lyke authorite tyme ben gatheryd hym great strength chasyd lyndesyle mayster paleys vnto place named boccauyle shortly possessyd kynges treasorye season eboryn faynynge loue amytye vnto sayde lyndesyle trayterouslye slewe hym eboryne thus delyuerid lidesyle thought myght better exercyse olde tyranny wylfull actes exylyd dyuerse prelate men chyrche sette theyr place suche hym lyked wherof noble fraunce beynge aduertysed specyally martyne pepyn two noble regyon called assystece wythstande tyrannye eboryne whyche yf yt myghte sufferyd shulde destroye comonwele lande pepyn whyche rehersayle made c xxxii chapyter shulde seconde name surnamed uetulus breuis also yet conuenyency tyme yt semeth one man ruled tyme dagobert nowe yt frenche cronycle meaneth two sondry persones wyth forenamed martyne assembled great hoste gaue batayll vnto sayde eboryn theyr harme loste felde coacted flee one cytye laon austracye eboryne whych amonge vsed accustomyd treason vnder dyssymyled loue slew sayde martyne slayne lyndesyle thys tyme flouryd harmefreditus nere kynnesman holy byshop leodegayre eboryn martyred shewyd whyche harmefreditus berynge mynde passyon hys sayde kynnesman waytyd tyme slewe sayde eboryne whose deth dyssencyon grewe amog frenche men admyssyon mayster paleys yt sayde varyaunce one graccon chosen admytted yt longe gyllomarus sonne putte hys father rule therof thys hadde whyle occupyed dyed sodayne deth succedyd agayne hys father graccon garacon whyche also dyed shortely beganne newe questyons amonge noble frauce offyce lastely chase man lowe byrth vnmete rome named bethayr barthayr pepyn whych season ye coutrey austracy harde contrauersies dyuerse opynyons frenche men assembled stroge hoste spedde hym towarde kynge entendynge haue rule hym rather suche lesse authoryte honoure wherof kynge beynge warned prouysyon barthayer foresayde gatheryd hys armye mette pepyn sharpe fyghte betwene bothe hostes hadde barthayre slayne kyng chasyd finally forced admyt pepyn mayster gouernour paleys mych pepyn rule austracy myght well ouerse bothe charge therfore purueyed vnder hym substitute named nordobert whyle returned austracy lorayne shortly dyed kynge hadde borne ye name therof terme xix yeres leuynge hym two sonnes named clodoueus childebertus anglia cxl chapiter cadwaladrus ye reuerente beda named cedwalla beganne aryse rule brytons also westsaxons yere grace vi hundred lxxx thre ye xii yere theodoricus kynge fraunce also last yere kenewinus kentwinus kynge westsaxon gaufryde authours wyth ye englyshe cronicle called sonne cedwall wyllyam wrote actes dedys kynges sayth sonne kenebryght descendyd lynyally blode cerdic fyrste kynge westsaxons cadwaladyr cedwalla made warre vpon lothari kyng kent destroyed myche prouynce wan yle wyght gaue fourth parte therof vnto saynte wylfryde whyche sayde iiii parte accompted iii hundred housholdes whyle calwaladyr besyed one parte kent brother named mulkyn wyth certayn knyghtes beseged lastely brente nother parte therof reuengement wherof cadwaladyr new destroyed parte sayde prouynce contynuynge whyche warre lotharius forenamed wouded dyed edricus kynge ye whych reygned shorte season aboute tyme saynte cutbert byshop hogulstald durham byshop lyndefarn lastely rufusyd became anker yle farne dyed ile called holy ilande cadwaladyr made warre vppon athelwold kynge southsaxons southsex slewe hym playne batayll made hys prouynce thrall hym thys agreeth ye former sayeng rehersyd lxxx xiiii chapyter worke precedynge yt sayde kyngdome southsaxons enduryd hundred xii yeres whyche reason ethelwolde athelwolde shulde season kyng southsaxos terme hundred xii yeres expyrd lxxx viii yeres daye ye shall vnderstande yt forsayde terme hundred xii yeres ment contynuaunce kyngedome subdued kynges therof named vnder kynges ethelwold yt foloweth cadwaladyr hadde ruled brytons also westsaxons terme thre yeres wytnessyth ranulphe munke chester pure deuocyon renouncyd pompe pryde worlde yode pylgrymage rome fyrst sergius pope confyrmyd made white munke contynued hys lyfe tyme perfyte holynes thys cadwaladyr cedwalla many dyuers opynyons wryten authours hys reygne also contynuaunce therof ouer tyme whe forsoke hys lande wherin great varyaunce haue shewed table begynnyng symple worke shuld seme two name shulde sounde sondry persones wherof co trary certayned foresayde ranulphe sayeth cadwaladr cedwalla one persone whyche laste kyng briton westsaxons also mych ioyned next vnto cambria walys shuld bryng cause auoydynge thys lande cadwaladyr rehersyd gaufryde yt wolde aske longe tracte tyme also yt apperyth doutefull yt testyfyed authour policronycon consyderynge great nomber authours whyche sought allegyd authoryte yt shewyth fyrste chapyter fyrst boke specyally syns holy gyldas bede amonge sayde authours accomptyd ye whych dyd great dilygence serchynge dedes actes brytons aungellis monycyon hym geuen also prophecye merlyn brytons shulde recouer lande tyll relykes cadwaladyr wyth holy saintes brought hyther rome hold part beleue though many welshemen yt wherfore folowe moste authoryte sayde cadwaladyr reygned thre yeres went rome lastely dyed buryed chyrche saynt peter epythaphye superscrypcyon vppon toumbe foloweth metyr culmen opus sobolem pollencia regna triumphos eximias proceros moenia castra lares quae que patrum virtu quae congesserat ipse cadwald armipotens linquit amore dei whyche versys may englysshed maner foloweth worshypfull ryches kynred triumphes assuryd plenteous welth wyth clothes rychly dyghte house castellys townes strogly muryd honour whyche hys parentes myght ownes marcyall vertuous knyghte cadwalde stronge descendyd kynges bloode crystes loue renouncyd hys good thus endeth lyfe rule brytons nowe called welshemen whych toke name theyr duke leder sayth guydo called wallo guallo ellys quene walys named galaes walaes ye name came first onw called welshe yt somtyme named brytons brutons descendyd fyrste troyans brute lastely du wallo moliuncius molmucius duwallo yt gretly mynglyd medelyd wyth nacyos romayns pictes redyng premiss ye may wel perceyue know englyshe theyr begynnyng named saxos anglis yet myche welchme extolle hougely theyr blode allyauce fetchyng yt fro pryam eneas regarded lytle progeny lynyall descent ye saxos anglis therfore ye entet kele somwhat theyr hygh corage oppsse ty brutyshe blast bryng ye sayng guydo ye auauce blode dyssent saxos farre aboue briton yt ar descendyd goddes men immortall briton clayme ofsprynge come men mortall moste alowed honour yf thynke vppon eneas vntrouth treason folowe foresayde authour guydo sayth woden saxon taken theyr orygynall ye sonne frealoffe sonne fredewolfe sonne flyn son flokwald son geta sonne minos nexte honour pluto god hell chefe iudge infernall iurisdyccyon therfore ye welshe men nurture lere dyspyse saxos ben god nere thus apperyth conueyaunce worke yt last thyrd yere cadwaldyr ye yere grace vi hundred lxxx vi maketh yere ye worlde v thousand viii hudred lxxx v reason yt apperyth briton rule land party reken fro fyrst comynge duke leader brute space thousande viii hundred xxii yeres thus ende fyfte parte worke consyderacyon rehersyd briton kynges day reygned none realme saxon anglis began fully haue domynyon therof wherfore tyme haue vsed done party specyfyed agayn salute gyue thankes moste excellet virgyn lady saynt mary v ioyes forenamed seuen ioyes begynnynge gaude mater miserorum c thou mother wretch disconsolate hayll glad god worldes presente state done worshyppe rewarde shall wyth condygne meryte passynge temporall heuen stallyd wyth moste felicyte euermore reygne thy sonne th v parte accompted laste yere mysery brytons fyrste yere constantyne brother kynge armorica vnto thyrd last yere cadwaladyr includyth yeres ccliii thus endyth fyfte parte sexte parte cadwaladyr thus departyd ye londe authours meane lande brytayne great dyscensyon meane brytons saxon terme xi yeres ouer mortalyte spoken encreasyd hugely therewyth great hunger famyne ouer sprad lande occasion one people realme wonderfully mynyshed lassed ferforthly wytnessyth gaufryde also englyshe cronycle quycke bodyes suffysed bury ye ded mych spekyth muke chester authours shewyd forsayde table whych remytte correccyon lerned onely englyshe reders fortherly declaryd therfore sayd folow sayd ranulph muke chester sayth iewe iue kynge westsaxons next ye forenamed cadwaladyr whych shall fyrst shew story successours hym kyngedome subdued lastly kyngedomes somdeale touche kyngdomes lordshyppes tyme conuenyente shall requyre expressynge storyes sayd westsaxon kynges tyll lande brought agayne one monarchye dyuysyon sayde kyngdomes stande somdeale farte asonder reders yt somwhat paynfull serche eueryche therfore haue sette compasse folowyng yt maye appere reder begynnynge eueryche theym howe longe season tyme eyther sayde kyngdomes contynued enduryd name also euery kyngdome parte thys lande euery lordshyp stablyshed tyme sette cxli chapiter iue iewe discendyd blode saxon ruler kyng westsaxons nexte ye forenamed cadwaladyr renounced pompe worlde whyche folowe opynyon policronicon began hys reygne yere grace vi hundred lxxx vii xvi yere seconde theodoricus kynge frauce ruled westsaxons knyghtly maynteyned warre agayn kentyshe saxon yt men dorobernia caunterbury grauntyd vnto hym haue peace also recompensement deth mulkynge brother cadwaladyr slayne shewed precedynge chapyter sayde kentyshe saxon gaue vnto hym sayd consyderacyos thre thousande pounde ye yere reygne iue holy man cutlake ye xxiiii yere age renouncyd pope pryde worlde toke ye order munkes abbay repyndon iii yere wet crowlande lad whyle holy ankers lyfe dyd many myracles fynally buryed whyche yle place hys buryenge standeth nowe fayre abbay whyche greate resorte gestes thyther drawyth good frendely chere gestes receyue take sayd place hath purchasyd surname named crowlande curteys whyche place good fame lyeth also holy confessoure neotus somtyme dyscyple erkenwalde byshoppe london xi yere reygne iue befell wounder meruayle y tolde bryghtwaldus whyche hadde ben longe whyle ded restoryd lyfe agayne tolde many thynges great wonder many men whereby causyd great almys many dedes charyte executyd dysposycyon hys owne goodes agremet wyfe went vnto ye abbay maylroos great holynes contynued resydue lyfe xvi yere reygne iue etheldredus mynded c xxxv chapiter kyng mercia forsoke wordly honour became munke bardeney hadde longe tyme rulyd men mercia myddell anglys hys brother kenredus kynge hym whych also reygned fyue yeres lefte kyngdome vnto colredus sonne hys vncle wyth offa sonne iue kynge westsaxons wyth egwinus byshop wykcies wyke whych see worceter wyth thys forsayde companye kenredus yode vnto rome pilgrimage endyd life aboute xviii yere reygne iue dyed holy byshop aldelme whyche fyrste munke abbot malmesbury laste byshoppe hym yt writen styryd gostly enymy synne fleshe torment hym selfe hys body wolde holde within bedde hym fayre mayden longe tyme myght say ouer hole sauter yt holynesse artycle saynt benettis lore yor yet dyuerse inconuenyence moste alowyd holy doctours amonge many vertuous holy dedys ranulph muke chester hys holynes sprange wyde sergius fyrste name beynge pope sente hym rome whyche season beynge sayde sergius accusyd defamed gettynge chylde whyche ix daye sayde chyldes age brought holy aldelme crystyned vertue whose prayer sayde chylde answered vnto certayn questyons cleryd pope cryme yt put vppon hym nere xxiii yere iue colredus kynge mercia cause variaunce betwene ine vnremembred myn authour assembled hys knyghtes began warre vppon hym wherof ye hauynge knowlege lykewyse gatheryd power lastely met theyr harmes place called wodynsburgth longe fyght eyther sped vnhappely yt knowen whether hoste hadde moste domage nere ye xxv yere iue wytnessyth holy beda saynte iohan beuerlay bysshoppe yorke dyed buryed porche mynster deyrwood beuerlay iewe iue callynge mynde counsayll holy aldelme yt beforetyme cousaylyd hym buylde abbay glastenbury began sayd worke xxxii yere reygne founded abbaye whyche contynued prosperously tyll ye comynge ye danis whose cruelty yt sore blemyshed afterward helpe saynt dunstane tymes edmond edgare yt agayne suffycyently repayred cotynued tyll comyng norma season yt agayne besette wyth hard happes daye yt standeth place great welthe honour yt folowyth iue ruled westsaxons nobly terme xxxvii yeres assyduate labour hys holy wyfe ethelburga longe laboured hym leue world coude brynge purpose vpon season kyng restyd fayre paleys rychely behanged vpon morne then departed commaundement caused sayd paleys replenysshyd wyth kynd fylth dunge hogges vyle bestes layde well ye chamber house offyce knewe thys paleys thus deformyd besought kynge vysyte sayde paleys broughte hym therunto sayde hym praye lorde behold house ryche tappet clothes gold silke ryche apparell left thys daye delyces plesaunt seruytours costly dyshes lately seruyd wyth passyd gone lorde lyke maner shall passe sodenly ye se worldely thynges ben passyd oure bodyes whych ben delycately kepyd shall fall turne fylth ye erthe wherfore haue mynde wordes tyme haue often shewyd told busy purchase paleys ye euer shal endure ioy wythout transmutacyon meane wordes quene turnyd ye kynges mynd shortly resygned gouernaunce kyngdome vnto ethellardus neuewe loue cryste toke vpon hym habyte poore man settynge parte pompe pryde thys worlde accompanyed hym felowshyp poore men yode vnto rome pylgrymage wyth great deuocyon hadde ben kynge westsaxons sayde xxxvii yeres whose departyng foresayde etheldreda hys wyfe went vnto barkynge vii mylys fro london abbay erkenwalde foundyd contynued ended holy lyfe whe hadde ben abbesse place certayn tyme sayd testifyed wyllyam wryter kynges iue fyrste kynge grauntyd peny euery fyre house thorow realm payed courte rome whych daye called rome stote peter pen yet payed many place englande yt graunted cause shewed yt shall shewyd francia cxlii chapiter clodoueus ye thyrd ye name son secod theodoricus beganne domynyon ouer realme fraunce yere grace vi hondred lxxx x thyrd yere iue kyng westsaxons clodoueus wryters lefte maner memorye soundynge good euyll pepyn named contynued master paleys tyme reygne ye sayd clodoueus whych hadde borne name space iii yeres dyed wythoute yssue buryed father reason whose deth sayde kyngedome fell successyon vnto hys brother childebert cxliii chapiter childebertus second sonne theodoryche brother clodoueus foresayde began domynyon ouer ye realme frauce yere grace vi hundred lxxx xiii vi yere iue kynge westsaxons tyme whose reygne also foresayde pepyn contynued chefe ruler kynges house yt ye charge ouerseyng realme set hys place subst tute depute sonne grimonart thys pepyn contrary lawe chyrche helde besyde hys lawfull wyfe called ple trude woma named alpayd whyche holy bysshop treet named lamberte blamynge rebukynge sayde pepyn brother forenamed alpayde whyche called dodon dodoin slayne martyred yere lorde vi hundred lxxx xii testyfyeth antoninus vi chapyter iii tytle seconde parte hys worke called summa antonini affermeth sayde antoninus also frenche cronycle sayde pepyn receyued sayd alpayde sonne named charlys whyche charlys surnamed marcellus ryghte profytable realme fraunce shall appere foresayd kyng chyldebert nothynge lefte wrytyng worthy memory excepte receyued hys wyfe sonne named dagobert kepte name kynge ye terme xvii yeres sayth cronycle french dyed buryed abbey caus ye chyrch chapell sait stephan cxliiii chapiter dagobert seconde name sonne chyldebert named began reygne ouer frenchman yere grace vii hundred x xxiii iue kynge westsaxons whyche vnder rule plectrude wyfe pepyn dede theodowald mayster paleys thys plectrude shewed stepmother charlys sonne pepyn alpayde wherfore berynge malyce sayd charlys caused hym holden prysoner wythin coleyne prysoner remaynynge foresayd theoldowalde exercysed suche tyranny putte vpon people suche exaccyons ye dyscensyon grewe bytwene hym lordes frauce dyuers coflyctes skyrmysshes amonge noble fraunce partyes taken vpon eyther sydes whereby kynges partye length wekyd fynally sayd theoldowalde depryued hys rome one rangafredus made mayster ye paleys whyche beynge accompanyed conuenyent strength toke hym kynge coueyed hym thorow forest charbonur tyll came vnto ye ryuer mense ye passetyme forenamed charlys beynge aboue sayde prysoner fauoure hys kepars otherwyse brake pryson escapyd shortly dyed kynge whan hadde reygned borne name kynge hys progenytours hadde done ye terme xi yeres leuyng hym nother chylde knowynge nere lye whyche cause mysorder tytle fraunce afterwarde shall appere cxlv chapiter danyell ye frenchman named chilperich assente made kynge yere grace vii hundred xxi xxxiiii yere iue kynge westsaxons thus testyfyeth mayster robert gagwyne also frenche cronycle preste clerke wysedome cherysshed tyme kynges paleys ye whyche tyme season sufferyd hys crowne ouer growen ellys antoninus danyell ye deth dagobert mych lefte hym none ye royall blode frenchemen supposynge hym apte ye rule lond suche experyence tyme hym proued kepte hym secrete certeyne tyme tyll heyre fully growen declared hym brother dagobert chaungyd hys name called hym chylperych one assente admytted hym kynge fraunce charles spoken sonne pepyn beynge escapyd daunger prysonement sought compassyd maner wayes myghte obteyne rome sometyme hys fader occupyed thys brynge effecte purchasyd hym yonglynge fayre goodly maners stature named clothayre sayd descendyd ye royall blode fraunce meane wherof shorte tyme gaderyd hym greate strength wherof heryng chylperych commaunded rangafrede assemble hys knyghtes wythstode purpose charlys soone bothe hostes mette nere vnto forenamed ryuer mense foughte strong cruell batayle ye whych rangafrede vyctor compellyd charles forsake felde shortly afterward assemblyd gaderyd agayne togyder suche dysperklyd fought efte wyth sayde rangafrede place called ablane whyche batayle wyth great dyffyculte charlys lastly wyctour chasyd rangafrede hys hoste greatly demynysshed lassyd thyrdly two hostes met felde called wyne felde also present sayd danyell chilperych hauynge hys ayde amonge prynces duke gascoyne fought sore cruell batayle wherof lastly vyctor sayde charlys constrayned kyng wyth sayde duke fle vnto orleaunce takynge wyth suche treasoure belonged kynge fled then vnto duchye gascoyne whan charlys conceyued kynge escapyd hys daunger knewe raganfrede cyty aungies sped thether haste compassyd citye wyth stronge syege fynally obteyned cytye wyth therin longe charlys shewed vnto raga frede suche benyuolence set hys lyberte fredome next yere folowyng duke gascoyn mynded hauyng parfyte informacyon ambassade otherwyse charlys entedyd make sharpe cruell warre vpon gascoynes fauouryd kepte wyth danyell chilperych auoydyng sayde dauger warre shorte tyme sent vnto charlys vnder certayne condycyons bytwene agreed sayd chylperyche wyth al treasour iewellys crowne fraunce belongyd thys passetyme season dyed forenamed clothayre charles made kyng wherfore restfulnesse ye realme allowed forenamed chylperyche kyng mayster kynges paleys predecessours ruled land frauce charlys hauynge thus rule gouernaunce ruled well substancyally defended yt enemyes durynge lyfe sayd chylperyche whych chylperych whan contynued kynge terme v yeres dyed buryed sayth frenche cronycle ye citye noen noyen wythout issue hys body anglia cxlvi chapiter ethelardus neuew iue began hys reygne ouer westsaxons yere grace vii hundred xxiiii thyrde yere danyell otherwyse called chylperyche kynge fraunce thys wryters named etheldredus tyme hys reygne ofric kynge reygned northumberlande holy beda wrote story called historia anglicana verely hys successoure colwoifus whyche beda hys workes ranulphe muke chester sheweth compedyous processe xxiii chapyter hys v boke called policronycon forsayd ofricus named englyshe cronycle osbryght whyche sayde cronycle rehersed longe worke se authour authoryte afferme therfore thys worke passe ouer shulde appere also meanynge polycronycon thys tyme dyed etheldredus touchyd kyng mercia whan longe tyme ruled countrey lastlye renouncyd pompe thys worlde shorne munke bardony ye soresayd ethelarde kyng westsaxon lefte memory actes dedes hym done agree many wryters dyed whan hadde reygned v yeres wythout issue hys body northumberlande ye forenamed ofricus reygned colwolphus egbertus oswolph oswolphe reygned ethelbald ethelwalde dyuers authours name kynges contynuaunce theyr reygnes dyuersly sundryly report wryte francia cxlvii chapiter theodoricus whyche mayster robert gagwyne alowed sonne ye seconde dagobert began hys reygne ouer ye frenchman yere grace vii hundred xxvi seconde yere ethelardus kyng westsaxos hys yonge tender age fosteryd norysshed house nonnys woman clothynge lastly espyed cosent charlys mayster paleys admytted kynge whych solempnyte fynysshed charlys herynge rebellyon people called sweuys swetesers assembled hoste lastly subdued whyche done turned hym toward part almaynes lyke wyse ouercame retourned fraunce wyth greate tryumphe ryches hadde wonne two iourneyes longe afterward charlys thus subdued foresayde people almayne wyth also greate parte germany tydyng came hym yt endo duke gascoyne rebelled agayne ye kyng frauce wherfore goodly haste preparyd hys armye sped hym gascoyne made cruell warre short tyme damagyd greatly countrey held duke endo streyte compellyd hyde hym secrete place countreye greate serche myghte founde wherfore settynge cou trey restfulnesse retourned hym fraunce whan endo sure retourne charlys fraunce mych prouyd marcyall knyghthode hym knew well myghte hym selfe wythstand hys knyghtly power therefore allyed hym wyth kynge spayne beyng pagan myscreaunt named abyderamus excyted styred hym make warre vppon lande fraunce promysynge hym onely vyctory also londe hym hys heyres euer uppon comforte whyche promyse also ayde sayde endo thys forenamed arbyderamus thrystyng crysten mannys blode entendynge vtter desolacyon destruccyon realme fraunce assemblyd excedynge hooste people wyth theyr wyues chyldren catayle entryd londe fraunce wan enioyed theyr owne processe came vnto cytye burdeaux whych certayne tyme ye cytesens defendyd sayde myscreautes wan theyr possessyon dystroyed people thereof theyr chyrches temple then passyng countreye wastynge wyth iron wyth fyre lastly came vnto poytiers whyche cytye ye haue harde story fyrste dagoberte c xxxii chapyter hym subuertyd thys daye newely reedyfyed thys cytye also possessyd lyke maner dalte wyth burdeaux dyd wyth thys sparynge holy place saynt hyllary dyd vnto yt greate shame vylany then yode vnto tower wastynge sleynge people wythout mercy waye passyd wasted cytye done whyche passetyme charlys herynge cruelte arbideramus assembled hys power shortly met hym nere vnto tower bare hym knyghtely slewe paganys excedynge nomber accordaunt wyth reason se testyfyed many wryters yt boldeth expresse nomber whyche iii hundred iiii score v thousande odde frenchemen slayne xv hundred onely whyche vyctoryous acte sayde charlys obteyned surname called day carolus martellus whyche meane charles hamer lyke hamer maketh metallys plyable charlys made hys foe enemy pliable hestis hamer cutteth breketh dysseueryth iron harde metallys dyd thys charlys dysmeber cut breke enemyes frauce thorough high prowesse shewyd bokes called cronica cronicarum supplementum cronicarum policronica vyctory obteyned charlis sarasins inhabytauns incolers spayne yssuyd africa warryd hadde wonne great countreys spayne whyche accordaunt wyth hystoryes plegys rehersayllys name kynges spayne fynde kynge name yt foloweth story charlis martell hadde thus obteyned vyctory comauded ye pillage brought one place done deuyded amonge hys knyghtes shortly endo knowlegynge hys offence sekyng meanes mercy agayne restoryd lande gascoyne cxlviii chapiter charles martell hauynge duke gascoyne thus recou cylyd sent hym wyth certayne knyghtes agayn reste sayd sarazyns whyche hys man hode oppressyd subdued clerely voydyd lande theym soone vpon beganne burgonyons rebelle made sharpe warre vpon frenchemen nexte adioynaunte dyd vnto countrey inhabitautes great harme warre sayde martell therin toke great payne without great payne lastely yt appeasyd subduyd tyme whyche warre contynuynge endo rehersyd duke gascoyne dyed wherfore charlis sette prouynce order due obeysaunce yode thether beynge busyed nedes tydynges hym broughte wandalys ben kynde lynage hunys touched hadde entred land wyth houge power wastynge countrey approchyd ye citye senos sen yt enuyroned beclypped wyth stronge syege vertue strength archbyshop ye cytye named ebe ebbe obbo wyth assystence cytezyns sayde cytye defendyd delyueryd power fayde wandalys power abbatyd subduyd manyfolde incurcyons assautys enymyes rebellyon countrees subiecte crowne fraunce treasour fraunce specyally ye temporall people sore minyshed wastyd wherfore defence lande charlis martell made requeste spirituall men great dyffyculte hadde yt graunted myght leuy certayne dymys wage therwith soudyours prepayre necessaryes ye warre thys opinyon writer fyrste tyme euery spirytuall mannes money wythin ye realme occupyed temporall vse wherfore yt reported dyuerse cronyclars sayde charlis ded sene byshoppe orleaunce named ethereus great payne tourment charlis moued hoste towarde burgonyons agayn newe styred exhortyd dyuerse persones newe rebellyon comynge thyther dyd execucyon vppon suche person founde culpable without batayll sette country agayne quyet retourned frauce rested longe harde worde almaynes whyche dwellyd ouer beyonde ryuer called ryne brake ouer fraunce people named ye frenche boke sesues ye dyd great domage vpon countreys adioynynge sayde ryuer yt long theym chasyd subduyd wyth al nother people called hunis gothys hadde also vaynquyshed whych seconde scofyture assocyat vnto theym kinge longobardes namyd luytprandus whose assystens power forsayde gothis wan citye auygnon stronge holdes great hurte frenche men season charlis greued wyth sykenesse therfore sent brother named chyldebert wythstande sayde enymyes ye whyche bare hym manfully chasyd sayde enymyes thys saynge dyscordyth wyth authours whyche shewen betwene charlis luytprandus contynuall amyte frendshyppe myche luytprandus ayded assysted sayde charlis auoyde ye sarasins entryd countrey fraunce called gallia cisalpina tyme fraunce thus wrapped harde happes batayllys dyed kyng theodoricus hadde occupied name onely kynge xiiii yeres anglia cxlix chapiter cutbertus neuew ethelard began reygne ouer ye westsaxos yere grace vii hudred xxix thyrde yere seconde theodoricus kyng fraunce tyme whose reygn colwolphus reygned northumberland whome story ethelarde touched holy beda wrote story called historia anglicana ii yere reygne cutberte apperyd fyrmament ii blasynge starrys ii starris wyth crestes caste yt brennynge brondes towarde northe vi yere reygn cutbert dyed foresayde holy beda tyme made wrote lxxviii bokes ouer besyde manyfold workes vertue vsyd lyfe tyme y told hym later dayes blynd brought ye frawde leder vnto great hepe stonys whych leder shewyd hym assemble men woman thether comyn hym preache word god thynkynge hys reporte true anon wyth great deuocyon beganne collacyon therof came ende stonys dyuyne power lykenesse great multytude people sayd amen sayng antoninus deo gratias noble lernynge excellent connynge fyrste sergius pope rome sent assoyle qstyons made pope vniuersyte also connyng apparent bokes whyche wrote super genesim super thobiam super esdriam su neemiam wyth whyche wolde aske longe tracte tyme reherse wyth also omelies made vppon gospellys passe ouer dede buryed ye abbay gyruy yt comynyng restyth wyth saynte cutbert durham ix yere kynges reygne holy vyrgyne saynt fredeswide dyed yt sayde vylanye shulde haue ben done kynge oxynford kynges england season syns haue sparyd entre towne drede myshappe wyll knowe cyrcu staunce mater holynesse lyfe lette hym serche workes holy gyldas shall suffycyently informed soone thys tyme season colwolphus kynge northu berlande reygned viii yeres resygned domynyon cosyn egbertus shorne monke abbay geruy wryters abbay lyndesar holy ylande thus mych lytle shewyd dedis cutbert kynge westsaxons therfore haue made rehersayll chynges done tyme hym nothynge lefte wrytynge worthy remembryd mynded sauynge often many tymes made warre vppon ethelwalde kynge mercia spedde therin diuersly lastely dyed reygned moste wryters xvi yeres francia cxlix chapiter hilderic childericus ye second name sonne theodoricus began reygne ouer frenshemen ye yere lordes incarnacyon vii hudred xl xi yere cutbertus kynge westsaxons whych dulnesse hys enormytes hym exercysed lytle thynge actes dedes put memorye ye haue story theodoryche harde puyssaunt stronge dedys charlis martell whyche styll durynge lyfe cotynued great honour great suertye realme frauce great terrour fere theyr enymyes wherof reherse cyrcumstaunce yt wolde occupye longe tyme wherfore shortely conclude lastely hys manyfolde trauayllys susteyned weale realme fraunce dyed leuynge hym thre sonnes wytte charlemayne pepyn gryffon whyche bequethed possession goodes yongest named gryffon helde hym contentyd wyth suche bequest hys father hym gaue therfore made warre vppon hys two bretherne whyche behaued theym wysely wythout notable batayll toke theyr sayde brother putte hym safe kepynge done sayde two bretherne assemblyd theyr knyghtes spedde theym agayn hanualde duke guyan rebellyng agayn crown frauce whych duke countrey brought vnder theyr fyrste obeysaunce whyche victorye sayde coutrey obteyned sayd two bretherne spedde cytye poytyers aduyse noble lande consyderynge vnablenesse hilderyche ye kynge vnsuffycyent rule great charge dyuyded lande fraunce betwene theym eyther shuld vnder kynge rule gouerne suche porcyon appoynted whyche porcyon charlmayne herynge dyuysyon stryfe amonge almaynes thynge belongynge hys charge spedde hym thyther haste parte countrey wastyd spoylyd dyuerse theyr stronge holdys caste playne wyth erthe brought theym due subieccyon soone went agayne bauarys ye whyche knyghtely strength appeased lykewyse whyche tyme season pepyn hys brother occupyed defendynge partyes fraunce foresayde charlmayne steryd dyuyne inspyracyon authours meane tyme hadde auowyd sodeynely renouncyd gaue ouer worldely prosperyte domynyon pure deuocyon yode rome pope named zacharias wyth honour ioy receyuyd hym shorne munke dwelled season abbaye hym selfe buylded mounte sarapte sawe dayly drewe hym many great lordes fraunce meane wherof lette hys dyuyne seruyce contemplacyon therfore yode then mounte cassyne endyd naturall lyfe whose thus departynge gyuynge ouer sayde charlemayne pepyn onely ruler toke vppon hym charge hole realme thys passe tyme gryffon yonger brother enlargyd prysone fauoure hys bretherne assygned suche possessyons hym demed suffycyent lede honorable lyfe yt sawe hys brother pepyn hadde rule nothynge dysdayned hys sayde brother thoughte lenger contynue maner partener rule lande charlemayne hys brother hadde ben brynge hys purpose fledde vnto saxon whyche shall appere named norman prynce theym made alyaunce wyth theyr ayde mouyd warre agayne brother assembled stronge hoste wherof pepyn beynge warnyd gaderyd hys people passynge thorow came ryuer sunaha latyne tonge smussaha gryffon sped hym tyll came ryuer called onacre whe ii hostes thus nere meanes treatye soughte partyes durynge whych communycacyon gryffon hauynge susspeccyon saxon parte leste wold betraye hym yelde hym handes brother made tyme sleyght agrement shortly departyd sayd saxos fled bauarys bayon allyeng hym wyth dyuerse noble baron fraunce vexyd distourbed sore duke lorde countrey called tassylon lastly dysceasyd hym lordshyppe wherof pepyn beynge warned spedde hym thyther wyth great strength bare hym better brother restoryd sayd tassylon vnto right retourned frauce ledynge wyth hym brother gryffon prysoner ye long medyatours sayde gryffon reconcilyd brother shuld cotent haue cause vary broder assygned hym wytnessyth ye frech cronicle xii erldomes realme fraunce wyth whyche bounteous gyfte beynge cotente selfe yere fled vnto ye duke guyan named gayffer wyth hym newly conspyred agayne sayde brother lastely slayne shall appere pepyn consyderynge hys mynde daunger trouble hys father hym ruled lande tyme lyke agony trouble kynge whome belonged charge kepte hys paleys folowed delytes pleasure wythoute takynge payne wherfore consyderynge premysses reformacyon sent hys ambassade pope beynge zacharye named askyng hys aduyse whether yt necessary welfull realme frauce shulde admytted kyng dyd nothynge applye hys mynde pleasure hys bodye wythout cure charge takynge vppon hym guydynge lande people toke upon charge payne defence lande kepynge people due subieccyon pope answeryd wrote vnto pepyn beste worthy moste profytable realme admyttyd kynge ruled well comynaltye iustyce prudence enymyes therof defendyth subdueth polycy manhode whyche answere thus receyued frome pope declared vnto lordes baron realme anone one assente mynde procedyd went deposynge puttynge downe theyr kynge gouernour hylderyche shorte space closyd hym monastery house relygyon hadde ben occupyer kynges rome name onely x yeres done frenche men electyd chase pepyn theyr souerayne kynge whyche hilderyche childerych endyd lyfe progeny meroneus whome frenche kynges lynyally descendyd contynuaunce tyme foloweth meroneus x yeres childericus xxiiii yeres clodoueus xxx yeres dagobertus xiiii yeres clodoueus xvi yeres clotharius iiii yeres theodoricus iii yeres childericus ii yeres lotharius l yeres chilpericus xxiiii yeres lotharius xliii yeres clodoueus iii yeres childebertus xvii yeres dagobertus xi yeres danyel v yeres theodoricus xiiii yeres theodoricus xix yeres hildericus x yeres anglia cl chapiter sigebert sigbertus cosyne cutbert laste kynge westsaxons beganne reygne ouer ye sayd saxon yeres ye incarnacyon cryst vii hudred xlv v yere hilderic kyng fraunce cruell tyrannous subiectes turnyd theyr lawes customes fore father owne wyll pleasure ye one noble men dominyon somdele sharply aduertysed chauge maners behaue hym prudently towarde pleople therfore malycyously caused hym putte cruell deth tyme egbertus yonger wylfryde made archbyshoppe yorke whyche brought agayn thyther pall predecessours hadde forgone syns tyme fyrst paulin lefte see fled rochester kent lefte sayd pall egbert brother vnto egbert kyng northumberlad whose assystence comforte dyd many thynges weale ye see made noble library yt folowyth myche kyng sygebert contynued malyce cruell condycyons subiectes conspired agayn hym putte hym kyngely dygnyte yt fell great desolacyon mysery wyse yt founden wood desolate place wandryng alone without coforte beyng founde swyne herd vylayne tyme belongyng erle cobran yt tyme wyckydly slayn auengement sayd lordes deth slew hym ye sayd place sayd sigebertus thus depryued fro al houour whe writer reygned tyrannysed ii yeres cli chapiter kenulphus lyne blode cerdicus fyrst kyng westsaxons began hys domynyon ouer sayde westsaxons yere grace vii hundred xlviii vii yere hildericus kynge fraunce vertue thys man passyd fame hadde agrement westsaxons depryued sygebert theyr kynge fro authorite regally fyrst appeasyd dyuers murmur grudgis kyndelyd among subiectes set lordshyp great quyetnesse rest touchynge theyr ciuyle dyscorde viii yere reygne kenulphus offa slewe tyraunt named beoruredus yt slayne ethelwald kyng mercia whose deth sayde offa neuew sayd ethelwald reygned kynge prouynce offa tolde many notable dedes wherof somwhat entende shew hadde warre wyth northumbres tyme subdued also warre wyth etheldrede kynge eest anglys wyth egbert otherwyse called pren kynge kent whome toke prysoner led hym bounden wyth hym mercia vyctoryes offa buylded chyrch wychcom tyme whyche buyldynge presens xiii byshoppes many great estatys kynge offa enlargyd sayde egbert imprysonement token wherof people beynge present made exclamacyon ioye gladnesse chyrche therof range thys kynge offa hadde suche dyspleasure vnto cytyzens caunterburye remoued archbyshoppes see agremente fyrste adryane pope vnto lychefelde also chased brytons welshme walys made famouse dyke betwene walys vtter bondys mercia mydle englande whyche day named offedyche buyldyd chyrch whych longe tyme called offekyrke offa also angelycall inspyracyon translatyd holy prothomartyr saynt albone fyrst founder famous monasterye ouer holy bodye whyche syns fyrste foundacyon hath sondry tymes ben perished hurt danys newely syns tyme reedyfyed holy albon martyred apperyth lxvii chapyter storye costantius yere lorde two hundred lxxx xvii whych reason shuld lye translatyd ouer foure hundred lx yeres offa also maried one hys doughters bryghtricus kynge westsaxons tyme varyaunce betwene hym freche men passage marchauntes forboden therfore sente famouse doctour anselmus vnto charlis great kynge fraunce comon meanes peace whyche charlis hadde thys anselmus suche fauour became hys discyple retourne kenelphus yt whyche tyme often warre wyth offa hym many conflyctes lastely agreed xi yere thys kenelph egbert kynge northumbres renouncyd kyngly dignyte became munke lastely sayde offa reygned ouer mercia xxxix yeres sayth guydo lefte kyngdome hys sonne also named kenelphus yode rome kenulph kynge westsaxon kepte strongely hys lordshyp agayn ye power enymyes hadde subiectes due order obedyence lastly kenulph supprysed wyth loue woma kept merton hauntyd secretly stode wyth honour wherof hauynge knowlege kynnesman sygebert late kyng entendynge reuege deposynge kynnesma awayted tyme beset house kenulphe paramour smally accopanyed soone kenulph espyed enymyes serte vppon whych sayth policronicon lxxx nober fought longe whyle ende slayn clyto clyton enymye longe worde sprang kynges deth wherfore offric beynge mayster kynges knyghtes toke wyth hym certayn sayde chyualry pursued vpon sayd murderer lastly encountred wyth slewe sayde clyto theyr captayne parte companye done retourned merton toke corp kenulphe great solemnyte co ueyed yt vnto wynchester yt reuerece enterryd whe hadde ruled westsaxons yt hym englyshe cronycle maketh mencyon xxxi yeres francia clii chapiter pipinus secod sonne charlis martell began reygne ouer ye frenchemen ye yere grace vii hundred l seconde yere kenulphus kyng westsaxons ye haue harde elected honoure assent pope zachary consent noble frauce confermyd seconde stephan satte pope fyrste yere reygne saxon otherwyse called danys normannys beganne warre vppon hym whyche encountred ryuer isayr knyghtly ouercame chased brought fynally vnder subieccyon returnynge countrey fraunce word brought deth brother gryffon whych sayde fledde vnto gayferus duke guyan helde hym ende haue caused people guyan haue rebellid make warre agayne brother pepyn wherof consyderyd malycyous vnstable condycyons hym auoydyng daunger theyr countrey meanes myght ensue fell sodeynly vppon hym slew hym pepyn retourned fraunce aduyse remigius byshoppe roan amendyd state chyrche causyd goddes seruyce songe tyme hadde ben wyth lytle deuocyon reuerence done vtteryd spyrytuall thynges mysorderyd caused sette better forme shortly stepha aboue named confyrmed pepyn heyres kynges fraunce hym axyd ayde assystence wythstade power aystulphus kyng longobardes ye warryd vppon certayne landes belongyng vnto chirch rome whyche kenge pepyn hym good wyll grautid begynnynge nexte yere folowynge wyth great hoste enteryd boundes italy made sharpe cruell warre defence wherof sayde aystulphus made beste prouysyon defendyd ye straytes moutaynes ye frenche men shuld haue entre hys lande gaue vnto enymyes stronge fyghte yt wyth people forcyd gyue backe hys refuge toke ye citie papye wherof pepyn hauynge informacyon beclyppyd ye sayd cytye wyth strong syege aystulph season defended hys cytye saw experiece dayly enimyes encreace power mynyshe feble auoydynge extreme daunger sought meanes peace suche wyse pursued finally hadde peace hym graunted vppon condycyon daye lymytted shuld restore ye pope ryght chirch belongynge hym helde tyme hadde wytholden wyth thynges concernynge sayde peace perfourmaunce sayde condycyos deliueryd immediatly good hostage pledgys whyche peace thus substancially confermed pepyn wyth hoste wyth great tryumphe retourned fraunce wythstandyng assuryd peace confyrmacyon othe cyrcumstaunce shewyd nexte yere folowynge trustynge vppon better fortune warre denyed reuokyd former grauntes refused hadde fyrmyly promysed vnstablenes vntrouth remedy pope newe made requeste vnto pepyn wythout longe taryeng resembled knightes made good sped towarde italy wythout dau ger passyd mountaynes fynally besyeged aystulphus wythin ye foresayd cytye papy meane wherof lastly constrayned restore certayne cyties possessyons tyme taken pope whych agrement endyd perfyted wythin shorte terme sayde aistulphus beynge hys dysporte huntynge fell hys horse horse vyolence wherof brosyd dyed shortly whan ruled longobardes lumbardys italyans viii yeres vyctory thus obteyned pepyn lordes prynces dwellyd aboute hym feryd drad hym sought hym allyaunce amyte amonge whych tassylon duke bayon spoken newly hadde conspyred agayn hym yelded hym kyng became hys trewe lyege man swore hym hys two sonnes feawte saxon whyche frenche boke named soysons coude neuer hold cotent without dystorbynge frenchemen wherfore kynge pepyn assembled greate hoste made towarde wyth dyuerse conflyctes batayles length dryuen aske peace vpo condicyo yerely shuld yelde vnto kynge fraunce iii hundred good horse waye trybute done retourned frauce immedyatly ordeyned aduyse hys counceyle courte counceyle ye whiche day called ye parlyamet frauce lyke vnto courte requestes day holden england yt mych greater resort people therwyth veray delayous mych haue herde credyble person say one mater hath hanged dysputacyon ouer xx yeres whych parlyament daye kepte parys roan two place lande iudges thys counceyll parlyament deputyd kynges coste euery place kepte hudred person one foloweth gayfer duke guyan mynded wyll reason set trybute imposycyon vppon spyrytuall landes wythin hys lande wythout agrement clergy wherfore byshoppes redresse remedy coplayned vnto kynge pepyn pepyn sent vnto hym monestynge hym fayre goodly maner shuld exchew forbere doyng duke wolde abstayne kynges comau dement shorte whyle assembled hys army entred territory guyan wastynge spoylynge countrey shorte whyle put duke suche fere fayne aplye hym ye kynges mynde pleasure bound hym restore clergy taken extort power whan sayde duke assuryd ye kinges retorne frauce gathered strength knyghtes sent theym cytye chalours burgoyne dyd cowde myghte domage towne countrey whych season kynge towne cytye called dury whyther whyche towne tydynges brought hym vntrew dealynge thys foresayd duke wyth beynge sore dyscontent retournyd wyth people guya therein bete downe many strong holdys castlellys toke wone length burbon cancaruyle cleremout then wasting coutrey wyth iron fyre yode tyll came lymoges ye wynter came hande kyng ease sauegard people strengthyd foresayde cytyes townes holdes wonne yode place called cause caus kepte hys crystmasse ester whan new season come forgettynge hys former purpose reentryd foresayd duchy guyan wastynge londe hadde done toke strength cytyes burgies towrs whyche season tyme duke wolde neuer apere playne felde kepte hym strong holdes one wone fled another thys warre thus contynuynge countreye people sore empouerysshed wherfore lastly consyderynge obstynacy theyr duke wyth also greate daunger stode murderyd theyr sayde duke yelded coutrey kynges obeysauce wyth suche treasure iewelles sayd duke belonged pepyn offerd great parte vnto saynte denys thys warre thus ended wyth many notable workes whereof rehersall order wolde aske longe tracte tyme thys vyctoryous prynce pepyn vexed wyth greuous sykenesse wherfore haste sped hym vnto saynt martynes made certayne oblacyons prayer then hys sykenesse encreasyng conueyed vnto parys shortly dyed reygned kynge terme xviii yeres leuynge ii sonnes say charle mayne charlys cliiii chapiter carolomanus charlys sonnes pepyn bega theyr reygne ioyntly ouer frenchman yere lorde vii hundred lxviii xx yere kenulphe kynge westesaxons charlemayne parte myddell fraunce charlys austracy wyth ye deale frauce ye elder brother charlemayne lytell lefte memory dyed whan reygned lytell ouer ii yeres wherfore charlys fell hole realme fraunce whyche noble ioyously admytted longe hunyldys pepyn hys lyfe hadde ordeyned ruler guyan rebellyd agayne kynge wherfore charlys preparyd anone hys armye sped hym thyder processe tyme constrayned sayd hunyld forsake countrey hys tuycyon flee vnto lupus duke gascoyne wherfore charlys beynge aduertysed sent hys message sayd lupus wyllynge commaundyng hym spedy maner shulde sende hym hys rebell hunyldus el wolde hys army inuade spoyle people coutrey uppon resceyt message lupus couceyll condescendyd kynges pleasure yt causyd hunyldus submyt hym vnto kynges grace mercy wherewyth kynge well contentyd vppon assuraunce taken sayd hunyldus yt shulde good aberynge toward kyng clerely forgaue vnto hym hys former offence set countrey rule order retornyd fraunce hym soone came embassade fyrste adryan pope requyrynge hym ayde agayne desyderi tha kyng longobardys whyche taken chyrche rome many cytyes possessyons charlys acceptyng pope request began warre agayne sayde desyderius sente vnto hym embassade wyllynge requyrynge hym honorable wyse restore vnto chyrche rome suche possessyons chyrche tyme hadde taken yet withhelde also refrayne hym suche warre dayly made vppon londys sayd chyrche sawe frute ensue ye message made prouysyon thyng nedefull iourney shortly passed mountaynes wythout batayle processe co strayned desyderi take cytye uercyle hadde refresshed hys italyans gaue vnto frenchemen sharpe cruell batayle ende desyderius compellyd forsake felde fled forenamed cytye papy kepte hym shall appere longe whyle shewe somewhat foresayde batayle ye shall vnderstande greate occysyo men yt slayne place called longe mortaria meane vulgare mother tonge place deth fyghte slayne amonge two knyghtes greately famyd amys amylyon fable reportyd bycause lyke semblaunt two knyghtes wytnessyth frenche story also antoninus brought vppe court foresayde charles wyth hym well cherysshed fynally slayne buryed wryters two chappellys whyche foresayde place buylded praye greate multytude soules knyghtes slayne desyrous knowe hole lyfe two foresayd knyghtes let hym ouerse thyrde chapyter xiiii tytle antoninus shall fynde compendyous goodly story whyche length ouerpasse retorne style agayne charlys whan ware desyderius taken thys cytye papy greatly strengthyd men vytell wyse well vnderstode yt myghte shortly wonne therfore layde stronge syege wyth ouersyght sure wyse capytayns yode rome vysyte holy apostle peter poule also speke wyth pope dyuers mater taryed greate parte wynter folowynge retorned vnto papy whych yet delyueryd gyue vp longe retorne cytye wonne wherein takyn prysoner sayde desyderius wyth hys wyfe chyldren whyche make shorte processe length forcyd hym restore vnto pope possessyons tyme hadde taken hys chyrche addyd vnto two cytyes spoletys beneuent fynally depryued hym kyngely honoure ladde hym prysoner fraunce prysoner exyle hys naturall countreye kepte hym cytye lyon wytnessyth cronica cronicarum iacobus philippus agremet pope gaue kyngdome vnto pypynus hys son whych cotynued french men rule possessyon ouer terme two hundred yeres thys vyctoryous dede thus obteyned charlis forenamed pope grauted vnto hym many great pryuyleges amonge nomber whereof one pope durynge lyfe charlys shulde wyse electid chosyn tyll came hym commaundement go eleccyon also graunted vnto hym inuestyture benefyces spyrytuall whyche grauntes pryuyleges confermed authorysed synode hundreth liii bysshoppes kepte fraunce comaundement foresayd adryan thys charlys longe tedyous tell hole hys actes dedes wherfore entende towche parte theym deale remitte yt haue desyre knowlege vnto bokes turpyn egyueaux chaplayne sayde charlys ellys sayd bysshop turpyn whyche wrote longe worke hys vertuous dedes clv chapiter charlys marcyall retorne frauce without loge taryeng sped hym agayne forenamed people called soysons saxon whyche newly rebellyd warryd sharpely vppon fought wyth sondry batayles amonge whyche two ben specyally noted whereof one foughten place called onacre ryuer esam hesayre whyche two batayls saxon loste moch theyr people sore feblysshed fayne shortely put mercy charlys reason wherof bonde vnto certayne lawes ordynaunces wherof specyally one pryncypall fro daye forth shulde renounce forsake theyr worshyppynge idollys fals goddes beleue fayth crystes chyrch wyth many performynge whyche couenauntes kyng toke good pledgys hostage ouer ende mynysshe make lesse theyr strengthe chase x thousande moste apte men warrys conueyed wyth hym fraunce hadde clothed mantell baptyme takynge assuryd othe trewe hym hys heyres inhabyted dyuers place realme whyche people affermeth myne authoure descendyd flemmynges brabaders thus endyd warre saxon soysons hadde contynued terme many yeres passyd forthwyth assent aduyse hys counceyle preparyd abilymentes ordynaunce warre go agayne ye hunys yt wonne great groud spayne bryng war ye effectuall ende chase xii perys wryters called dozeperys kynges whiche vi byshoppes vi temporall lordes whyche byshoppes thre named duke whych archbyshops iii erlys byshoppes temporall lordes thre duke thre erlys saye duke burgoyne duke neustria normandy duke guyan iii erlys erle palantyne ye erle tholons erle champayn yt whyche also writer afferme ye famouse knyghtes rowland olyuer ii roulad erle palatyne olyuer erle tholous charlis prepared thynges necessary gret iourney fyrste made pylgrymage vnto saynte denys offerd ryche great gyftes procedyd towarde iourney fyrste besyegyd citye called papilona whych iii monethes subdued obeysaunce cytye stode entre spayne montaynes callyd monte pyreni obteynynge whyche cytye myracle saynt iamys sayth antoninus charlis commauded crystes fayth wolde conuertyd shuld sauyd passe sentence sworde hadde wonne ye fyrste cytye wanne coutrey adioynynge reason wherof caste great fere vnto myscreantis wan stregth appoyntemet became trybutaryes coutres prouynces hereafter ensuynge saye wytnessyth uyncet historyall antoninus ye land laudeluffe land pardis lande castyll lande maurys prouynce nauerne countrey portyngall lade byscaye lande palarge destroyed idollis buyldyd chyrches monasteryes brought partye crystes relygyon moste specyally chyrche saynt iamys buylded copostella wyth sumptuous coste gaue vnto great possessyons maynteynyng diuyne seruyce god mynysters ye ouer treasour gate foresayd countreys buyldyd many dyuerse chyrches well place longe yt tell cyrcu staunce vyage vyctoryes wherfore passe ouer charlys hadde sped hys nedys good wyll retourne fraunce whych retorne carlis castynge dought parell treason gauelon knyght ruler gascoyn ye gauelon hadde receyuyd paynym kynge named marsyll great ryche gyftes betraye hoste charlis dysceyuyd shewyth thys gauelon better compasse brynge effecte purpose aduised charlis wyth certayne people passe porte cesayre leue behynde hym rerewarde rouland olyuer wyth xx thousande resydue hoste kynge passyd wyth hoste gaue warnynge vnto forenamed marsyll shulde close sayde rowlande place callyd rounceuale whych accordyng false counsayll hoste lx thousande mo beclyppyd rowlande people euery syde fell vppon cryste men slew wythoute mercy pytye whyche fyght wythstandynge great slaughter made sarasyns fynally slayne sayd rowlande olyuer many noble fraunce gauelon scapyd wythoute punyshement taken wyth hym condescedyng put moste cruell deth cytye aquisgrany thys great vyctory charlis subduynge spayn dyuers opynyons frenche cronycle antoninus agreen shuld charlis ennoynted emperour rome mayster robert gaywyn say yt emperour thus victoryous prynce retournynge fraunce subdued tha diuerse coutreys gallia narbonensis campania champayn beneuentana whych one mynde hadde rebellyd agayne hym aboute xxxi yere reygne moste wryters agre certayne person italy conspyred agayn leo iii pope rome hym vngoodly entreatyd lastely escapyng theyr daunger came vnto charlis requyryd hym hys cofort ayde wherof daungerous well serchyd vnderstode ye pope susteyned wrong wyth dylygence spedde hym thyther subdued ye pope enimies restoryd sayd pope hys former dignyte dede done ye defence chyrch rome sayd pope leo leon sacryd enoyntyd emperour rome clvi chapiter charlis thus sacryd emperour yere oure lord viii hundred one hadde accomplyshed hys nedys weale chyrch pope wyth great gyftes retourned fraunce tyme soone witnessyth frenche cronycle landed fraunce famous clerkes alcinnus albinus rabanus iohannes discyples beda whych charlis receyued wyth great honour theyr cou saylys instytuted ordeyned fyrst scole paris papia italy minded wherfore yt shulde seme sayde alcinnus sent entreatyse peace betwene two realmes fraunce great britayn storye kenulphus shewyd tyme season many great noble dedis done sayd charlis sonnes capytaynes vnder hym commaundement personage noble prynce shuld mynde therfore dyuerse authours testyfye yt fayre welfaryng body sterne loke face body viii fote long armes legges well lengthed strengthed proporcyon body face spane brede berde long hys strength wonder tolde wold one mele ete hole hare two hennes hole gose lyke quatyte mete drynke ther litle wyne mynglyd water amonge notable dedis made brydge ouer ryuer ryne v hudred pace longe cytye magunce buylded wytnessyth antonin many abbayes monasteryes ben letter crosse row abc front eyther ye sayd abbayes tyme theyr fou dacion pight set letter gold value hundred pounde turnoys whych nere value englysh money curraunt xx mark poude turnoys mych lyke iisviiid starlyng poud parysyen nere vppon xld starlyng standyth certaynte hyghtynge lowynge theyr coynes also buylded new reedyfyed cytye aquisgrany endowyd chyrch lady wyth many great gyftes precyouse relyques whyche yet remayne daye whych cytye nere aboute vsyd myche abyde lye great dedes vyctoryes deserued named charlis ye great great myght honour yet yt wythstadynge meke lowly herte mylde gracyous poore mercyfull wretch nedy sette sonnes lerne wel letter marcyall knyghtly featys doughter set spynnynge woll worke expert spechys neded none interpretours explane expresse hym ye message straunge ambassatours tyme dyner meales vsyd haue red hym lesson pystles specyally workes saynte austayne de ciuitate dei hym nothynge dyscommendyd helde doughter longe
