vnmaryed noble man charlis iii yeres deth hadde peace wyth countreys well suche obeysaunt vnto ye empyre longed domynyon frauce tyme reste amonge goodly vertuous dedys made hys testamet dystrybuted temporall mouable goodes iii te wherof two part gaue ye maynteynynge bishoppes mynysters chyrch reparacion chyrches necessary maynteynynge dyuyne seruyce god also ayde fedynge poore nedy people thyrde parte hys chyldren allye ye shall vnderstande charlis treasory specyally noted hys iewellys iiii table bordes wherof thre syluer fourth gold one graue lykenes cytye co stantyne noble whych bequath chyrche rome grauen wrought lykenysse cytye rome gaue byshop reynes chyrche thyrd table syluer wherin grauen mappa mundi fourth gold gaue sonnes many thynges causys exaltyng ye fame prynce among one specyally remembryd myn authoure gagwyne kynge percye rulynge great parte ye orient sent vnto charlis ambassad honorable wyth many ryche presentis amonge whyche horologe clocke laten wonder artyfycyall makyng euery oure daye nyghte sayd clocke shuld stryke image horse backe apperyd sondry place departid agayn meane certayne vyces sente hym also tentys ryche sylke balme naturall certayne olyfauntys requyrynge hym amyty frendshyppe lyke wyse dyd emperour co stantyne noble yt thathe mynde well contentyd pope ye wyse dyuyded empyre sette suche man myghte rome therof thys charlis dyuers wyues seconde named eldegard receyued iii sonnes say lewys pepyn charlis ye whyche pepyn made kynge longobardes italy shewyd thys great conqueroure shulde holde lenger processe lyke shewyd notable dedys myght make great volume yf shuld shew clerenesse circustaunce euery coquest tyme acheuyd deth sone egall lastly toke dymme dauce ben kynge fraunce brother alone xlvii yeres whyche ruled empyre shewyth xiiii yeres ye yere age sayen frenche cronycles lxxii buryed aquisgrany wyth great pompe ye yere lordes incarnacyon viii hundred xv wyth superscripcyon vppon toumbe carolus magne christianissimi imperatoris romanoru corpus sub hoc sepulchro conditu est may englished folowith charlis great emperour moste crysten rome bodye hyd thys toumbe wythin forenamed sonnes charlys suruyued ye eldest lewys name two pepin charlys dyed theyr father anglia clvii chapiter brigthricus blood cerdic fyrst kyng westsaxons descedyd beganne hys reygne ouer sayd saxon yere oure lorde vii hundred lxxviii x yere charlis great kynge fraunce tyme hadde maryed one doughters offa kynge mercia touchyd whose ayde power put hys rule egbert sonne alcumundus whyche egbert daye vnder kynge ruler lordshyppe westsaxon whyche egbert descendyd ye blood holy genulphus whome som parte storye y declared xxv chapyter v boke policronica thus brigthricus expulsyd saylyd fraunce exercysyd hymselfe featys warre wyth knyghtes charlys courte durynge lyfe sayde brigthricus ii yere thys brigthricus sene great brytayne wonder syghte sodeynly men walked ye strete crossys lyke vnto blood fell vppon theyr clothes blood fell heuen lyke droppes rayne exposytours betokened commynge dane lande whyche entryd shortely wytnessyth polycronica aboute ix yere brigthricus danys fyrste entryd lande defence wherof thys sayde kynge sent forth hys stewarde housholde wyth smalle company whych shortly slayn strength brygthricus kynges saxon copellyd voyde land tyme season brigthricus thus well knyghtly rulynge land wyfe named ethelburga wyth hym cotentyd oughte soughte dyuerse wayes meanes myghte brynge lorde oute lyfe fynally poysoned hym wyth many hys housholde meyny wherfore ferynge punyshement fledde fraunce suche fredshyppe hadde well cheryshed charlis courte surnamed great yt told whan hadde informacyon vnstablenes woman condycyons season beynge wydowar vppon season passynge tyme wyth sayde nowe put youre choyse whyther ye wyll haue vnto wedded lorde ellys sonne stadyng presence hym chose hym shall haue enioye husbande chase ye son lefte father sayde kynge yf thou haddest chosen thou shuldest haue hadde sonne thou haste forsaken thou shalt haue nother v closyd abbey processe lewde man kept company voydyd place demeaned vycyously processe tynie fell pouerte dyed great penurye myserye whyche mysse demeanure woman innaturally slayne lorde husbande kyng anglis specially westsaxons wolde suffer wyues callyd sueuys yet suffer sette place great honour kyngely sete long tyme thus shewyd impoysonynge wyfe dyed ye kynge brigthricus ruled ye westsaxos concorde writer terme xvii yeres clviii chapiter egbertus sonne alcumu shewyd began hys reygne ouer westsaxons ye yere grace vii hundred lxxx xv ye xxvii yere charlis great kynge fraunce thys sayde dryuen oute lande britayne ye stregth brigthricus hauynge knowlege hys deth spedde fraunce knyghtely wyse hym demeaned obteyned regiment gouernaunce aboue sayde kynge bernulphus kynge mercia egbert derysyon made therof dyuerse scoffys iapynge rymes yt susteyned time somdeale stablysshed hadde prouyd myndes hartis subiectes lastly assembled knyghtes gaue hym batayll place called elyndome prouynce hampton yt fyght great dyuersyte nomber vi viii agayne one yet egbert victory knyghtes lene megre pale longe brethed myghte endure fyghte bernulphus knyghtes fatte corpulent shorte brethed soone ouercome swet shorte labour noted deth offa kyng mercia middell englande whome somwhat touched story kenulph reygned son egfert egfert reygned kenulfus kewolfus ye kenwolphus father ye holy martyr kenelme ii fayre vyrgyns ouindred burgenulda ermenilda kenwolfus succedyd foresayd kenelme kenelme reygned colwolphus hym succedyd bernulphus named retourne agayne egbert whych sayd ouercome bernulphus seasyd lordshyppe hys hande done made war vppon kentyshe saxon legth lyke wyse obteyned vyctorye wytnessyth polycronica also subdued northumbrys caused kynges thre kyngdomes lyue vnder hym trybutaryes ioyned hys kyngedome testyfyeth authour floure hystories thys egbert also wanne ye brytons walshemen towne chester hadde kepte possessyon tyll daye whych vyctoryes thus hym obteyned shortely called counsayll lordes wynchester theyr aduysys crowned kyng chese lorde lande fore thys daye called brytayne sente oute costes thys lande commaundementes commyssyons chargyng straytly day forthward saxon shulde called anglys lande anglia xxiiii yere reygne egbert whyche shulde yere lord meaneth policronica viii hundred xix kenelmus mynded son kenwolfus admytted kynge mercia beynge chyld age vii yeres whyche treason syster ouendreda slayne thycke wood tyraunt callid hesbertus hys bodye founde pyller sonne beame lyght dyuyne shone bodye towarde heuen y also redde hym coluer bare scrowle wryten englyshe vsed lette yt fall hyr vppon aulter saynte peter rome wherof wordes clense cowbacch kenelme kenebern lyeth vnder thorne hewyd beweuyd whyche meane englyshe vsyd clent cow vale vnder thorne lyeth kenelmus hedlesse slayne fraude holy body founde borne towarde place sepulture forenamed syster entendynge derysyon vylanye done corp lenyd oute wyndowe corp shulde passe bryng malycyouse purpose aboute note sorcery ment redde psalme sauter begynnynge deus laudem bacward entente incontynently fell blynde eyen dystylled dropes blood fell vppon sauter boke token goddes wretche boke remayne thys daye sene holynes thys martyr vertue ye legede sayntes reportyth surplusage xxix yere reygne egbert englyshe cronycle edbryght danys wyth great hoste enteryd seconde tyme thys londe spoyled yle shepey kent nere kent wherof herynge kynge egbert assembled hys people met wyth theym place callyd carrum wanne fyghte lytell worshyppe danys compellyd knyghtes forsake felde presumpcyon ye vyctorye drewe westwarde made confederey wyth weste brytons liued seruage whose power assayllyd egbertus landes dyd myche harme many placys hys domynyon ellys thys daye contynuallye abydynge one place realme englande tyll ye tyme harde kynytus laste kynge danys blood many theym maryed englishe woman many nowe ben tyme passed called englyshe men dyscendyd theym yt many sondry tymes dryuen lande chasyd fro one countrey nother ye shall yet wythstadyng euer gaderyd newe strengthes power abode styll wythin lande kynge danys people dyscended dyuerse opynyons wryters whych passe ouer mych entende shewe somewhat theym worke folowynge folowyth storye tyme contynuyng persecucion foresayd paganys dane egbert edbryght dyed whe hadde well nobly ruled westsaxons parte englande terme wryters xxxvii yeres buryed wynchester sayth guydo lefte hym sonne named athenulphus francia clix chapiter lodouicus ye fyrst name sonne charlis great began hys reygne ouer ye realme frau ce also empyre ouer romaynes yere grace viii hu dred xv xx yere egbertus kynge westsaxons thys mekenesse callyd lewys mylde meke tyme hys father decease occupyed guyan whych tyme hadde rule domynyon commaundement father aduertised faders deth anon sped hym toward aquisgrani yt ye xxx day hys departyng guyan came vnto foresayde cytye mette wyth noble baron frauce fyrst medled toke vpon hym cure charge hys owne besynes deuocyon causyd great obseruaunces myche dyuyne seruyce done aboute sepulture father whyche obseruaunce prayer fynyshed endyd ye sayde lewes commaundyd come hym dyuerse ambassadours fro dyuerse prynces sent vnto hys father charlis theym gaue answer concernyng theyr legacyos messagis proceded vnto nedes realm ye weale therof people wherein beynge besyed worde brought hym ambassad royall yt comen michael emperour constantyne noble agayne whyche sent certayne hys lordes receyue wyth honour bryng vnto hys presence whose commynge entente presente hym wyth certayne ryche gyftes desyre hym amyte frendshyppe also soone came vnto hym messenger beneuetanys offerynge vnto magnyfycence obligacyons bondes true lyeges paye hym yerely way trybute vi thousande ducates gold ducate sondry valuys leste value iiisiiid ob beste iiiisviid soysons saxon dyuerse condycyon beganne murmoure rebell agayne lowys wherfore wolde assemble people agayne theym sent thyder certayne persones know ye cause theyr rebellyon enfourmed yt takynge awaye certayne lades possessyons hys father restored agayne sayde landes recouncylyd countrey subieccyon dede lordes grudged sayde myldenes vsyd people suche obstynacy sternesse haue forcyd dynte sworde haue lyued due obedyence thys passetyme dyed pope stephan fourth name whose deth elected dygnyte fyrste pascall wythout co sente knowlege lowys somdeale dyscontentynge mynde pleasure shorte tyme receyued wordes presentes sayde pope well satysfyed pleasyd day frauce vsyd prestes men chyrche precyouse shewynge vesture golden riche starynge gyrdelles rynges ornamentes gold sayde lowys purchasyd pope correccyon suche vsyd suche dysordynate apparell causyd theym vse browne sad colour accordynge theyr honoures sadnes lowys hadde thre sonnes saye lothayre whome made felowe empyre pepyn seconde whome made duke guyan lowys thyrde betoke rule bayton yongeste sonne worde broughte bernarde ruler italy assembled great power wyth ye aydes two captaynes named iylys reyner whyche charlis great lyfe greatly fauouryd occupyed ye stregthys mountaynes entendyd kepe countrey italye subieccyon father emperoure wherof gyuynge father knowlege strong power gaderyd well father lothayre sonne sped theym towarde mountayns sayde bernarde ware emperours commyng wyth great strength consyderyd lacke power mayntayn purpose wyth also great mercy pytye knew emperour submytted hym holy hys grace mercy dyscoueryd hym authours rebellyon whyche thys lowys causyd vnder safe kepynge hadde vnto cytye aquisgrany whyche rebellys byshop mylayne byshop cremoun bysshoppe orleaunce kynge passed wynter folowyng foresayde cytye lastely caused broughte hym foresayde transgressours examyned cyrcumstaunce foresayd treason remytted rygour lowes processe condemnyd deth many temporall men emperour hauynge compassion forenamed bernarde myche sonne pepyn laste kynge italy nere kynnesman transmutyd sentence deth vnto perpetuyte pryson losynge hys syghte sayde bernarde reyner chase rather dye lyue pryson wyth deformyte passyd dinte sworde beheddyd within nere sayd cytye aquisgrani sayde bysshoppes depryued theyr dygnyteys put pryuate house relygyon whyle thys lewys occupyed lytell brytayne subduynge countrey lothayre eldest sonne thys lewys sent rule lode ye empyre bare hym ryght nobly executed dyuers actes weale empyre thys season ii frendes hys father hys certeyne crymes put moste cruelly condepned vyle deth cytye rome wherof heryng lothayre beyng cytye papy sent worde therof hys father hasty wyse lyke haue turnyd ye pope greate trowble yf polytyke wyse meanes shortly pacifyed mater one foresayd two persones condempned scrybe pope donar ye shall vnderstande thys lewys hadde two wyues fyrste forenamed thre sonnes seconde receyued son named hym charlys whan came mannes stature surnamed charlys ye bolde loued entyerly thys charlys wold often kysse hym presence brethern whych enuyed theyr sayd brother also dysdayned theyr father shall appere thus processe tyme lewys gaue vnto thys charlys coutrey neustria normady causyd greate dyscencyon amonge bretherne also thys cause lotharius toke partye agayne hys father clx chapiter thys seconde wyfe lewys named indith ye accusyd pope within suche degre allyaunce hyr husbonde myghte lawfully contynewe hys wyfe wherfore contrary wyll leuys laboure bysshoppes lordes frauce deuorcyd hym put house nonnys straytly kepte lewys tyme susteyned thys iniuryes ye ende yt myght know whyther sonnes fauoured cause processe tyme whan hadde experyence hys frendes hys sonnes tha assembled hym strong hoste recoueryd hys wyfe malgre hys enmyes whych dede lothayre wyth dyuers baron fraunce assemblyd theyr people entendyd depryue lewys imperyall kyngly dygnyte wherfore lewys ferynge hys sonne hys assystens also entent myghte assemble strength ye empyre yode vnto magunce hadde purueyed garnysshed hys retynewe retornyd toward fraunce met wyth hys enemyes subdued kepte hys iourney tyll came aquysgrany restyd hym hys people thus contynuynge thys dyssencyon sonnes sent wrytyng pope beynge named gregory ye fourth requyrynge hym ayde counceyle deuyse concorde peace bytwene theyr fader whose request cause naturall charyte quyckenyd bytwene father hys iii sonnes came hys proper persone fraunce endeuoryd hym vttermoste hys wyttes agree sayd party tyme entreaty made pope saye cause many lordes partye lowys forsooke hym fled sonys partye emperoure great feere hym selfe hys parson whan lewys seen frendes thus tyme hys nede refuse flee frome hym lefte hym great feere dauger straugers thoughte better hym put hym selfe vnder rule tuycion hys owne chyldren abyde doute sayde strau gers wherfore sent vnto sayd sonnes requyrynge theym prouyde safegarde assurynge person oppressyd murdryd within shorte space message sent theym withoute answere agayne receyuyd rode towarde theym smally accompanyed lothayre hys brother hauynge warnynge homble wyse encountred hym receyued hym vppon theyr knee coueyed hym wyth reuerece vnto theyr pauylyon tent begynnyng peace stablysshed bytwene hym satysfye theyr myndes refused forenamed indith closyd place relygyon called torton testyfyeth myne authour mayster robert gagwyne frenche boke sayth thys dede done frederyke bysshoppe utryke fore pyteously slayne fauoured ye quene wythout concent wytnessyth sayd cronycle whan lewys thys thynges agreed vnto hys sonnes thought hym self surete theyr amyte fauours sodeynly coueyed vnto monastery saynt medrid sayth frenche boke conueyed towne called frenche melanguy wyth hys yonge sonne charlys done sayd thre sonnes deuyded theyr father possessyons amonge theym thre saye lothayre eldeste porcyon londes empyre pepyn countrey guyan lewys yongest fell countrey bayon whyche mysery emperour whan pope beholden seen wyth greate mornynge retorned iuly vnto rome tyme prysonemet emperour sayd lewys made dyteys pystelles greate sorowe lamentacyon ensample erthlye prynces entent hys sonnes shulde hym haue compassyon pytye whyche ouer passe length tyme rather tyme prysonemet edwarde seconde callyd carnaruan hym made lyke co playnt tyme place comyth entende expresse parte therof whan lewys thus season remayned pryson myche comons shulde thynke thys shuld done authoryte ye thre sonnes onely therfore causyd cousayle callyd cytye compeyne theyr meanes labour causyd theyr father authoryte spyrytuall temporall lordys discharged rule domynyon well empyre realme frau ce authoryte sayd cousayle parliament caused hym renouce hys temporall habyte become munke monastery saynt matke lefte sonne lothayre sure watche kepynge full often seen wha erthlye power man faylyth wekyth god hys greate mercy repentaunt synner grace callyth hym hys dyuyne power aydeth strengtheth dyd thys lewys thys mysery trybulacyon thus hym fallen peple dyuerse placys londe murmured grudgyd sore agayne innaturall dealynge sonnes agayne theyr father dayes greate ruler fraunce named guyllyam stuarde constable lande ye wyth one egebard edgare man greate byrth alyaunce cousayled togyder enlargyng ye emperour lastly wyth ayde theyr frendes assembled greate peple drewe vnto ii noble men burgoyne called barnarde gueryn whyche sometyme ben well cherysshed wyth emperoure lewys thys season lothayre restyd hym ye partye aquysgrany whan harde assemblynge foresayd lordes sped hym towarde parys whan thyther comen foresayd lordes sent vnto hym two noble men rowlande gantelyne whych made request vnto lothayre name lordes wolde lyke hym restore hys father vnto hys former dygnyte wyth thynges concernynge theyr legacyon whyche two lordes lothayre gaue answere hys father restorynge hys fyrste former dygnyte man lyuynge wolde therof fayne wolde ye deposyng hym done hole authoryte ye land wherfore yf shulde agayne restoryd must authoryte hym onely yt myghte knowe hys benyuolece fauour bare towarde hys father wylled stonde parte whyle co munycacyon lordes ye mater reason wherof fere fauour emperour shortly put hys lybertye restoryd hys fyrst honoure dygnyte great honoure conueyed cytye towne called ciriciake met wyth hym hys two sone pepyn lewys restyd hym certayne dayes makyng feest ioye rode vnto aquysgrany restyd season whych tyme hys beyng brought vnto hym ye place ben prisoner wyfe indyth whan lothari knewe hys father hyr agayne receyued contrary hys mynde pleasure wrath dyspleasure entryd countrey burgoyne made sharpe cruell warre executed therin many spoylynges inordynate dedys whyche cruelty wythstande let hys father wyth hys sonne pepyn wyth greate hoste sped hym thyder warde anone knowlege therof mystrustyng stregth yelded hym vnto faders grace mercy meke fader receyued forgaue hym hys trespasse hym dyuerse hys lordes taken assuryd othes suretyes tha sent sayd lothayre italy certayne nomber knyghtes defende countrey daunger enemyes strengthynge straytes mountaynes wyth thynges orderyd done weale hys realme lewys toke vpon hym ryde hys lande thentent myghte somwhat enformed rule hys offycers countreys ruled ruler found mysgouernaunce punysshed executers therof well ye bysshoppes farre authoryte behalfe stretchyd indith consyderynge emperoure fell greate age hyr sonne charlis name yet suffycyent landes possessyons maynteyne estate wyth compassed many wayes hyr mynde myghte acheue hyr entent brynge good purpose fynally counceyll hyr frendes ye ende purchase loue fauour lothayre axed hyr lorde husbonde sayd lothayre myghte tutour gyder hys yonge sonne charles request ye emperour glad graunted hyr hyr peticion fell soone certayne messenger came emperoure lothayre hys sonne whych whan lewys gyuen answere mater sent fore gyue vnto instruccyons sent forthe agayne certeyne wylle sayd sonne come vnto hym goodly wyse myght season excusyd hym sykenesse whan recouered fayned excuse thys meane tyme worde brougth emperoure hys sonne lothayre greued ye chyrch rome takyn certeyne possessyons wherewyth lewys beynge amoued sent vnto hys sonne comaundynge hym sharpe wordes yt shulde haue mynde othe hym made shulde exchewynge dyspleasure make restytucyo thynges hadde taken chyrch whyche comaundement lothayre promysed obey wyse lewys determyned haue gone vnto rome haue sene ye sayd promesse fulfylled also haue spoken wyth pope dyuers mater nedefull chyrche lette occasyon dane normannes yt newly inuaded lode frauce whyche shortly expellyd droue hys londys done emperour yode vnto aquysgrany frendes indith noble fraunce emperour gaue vnto hys yongest sonne charlis porcyo ye empyre whyche shall clerely appere soone counsayle holdyn cirycyake namyd presence son lewys gaue hym order knyghthode adournyd hym wyth kynges clothynge ouer thys presence many lordes fraunce gaue sayde charlys hole countrey neustria named normandye whyche honoure gyftes though hys moder ioyous gladde yet hys brother lewys therewyth nothynge contentyd whyche indith hyr frendes well apperceyuyd knowen wherefore tyme done newe made request vnto hyr lorde husband wolde hys moste especyall grace graunte vnto hyr lothayre myghte haue gouernaunce hyr sonne charlys whych hym seconde tyme graunted uppon whyche graunte thus made emperour sent vnto hys son lothayre pleasaut letter wyllyng hym goodly hast resorte vnto hys court obeyenge hys father commaundement retourned fraunce shortly receyte said letter came vnto father citye uernayse whome ioyously receyued hadde season dwellyd emperour gaue vnto hym coutrey austracy whyche countrey shall shewyd thys lotharius story name named lorayne parte sayde prouynce countrey stretchyd towarde hungrye sayde lowys gaue vnto yongest son charlys immedyatly thys gyftes many lordes confermyd emperoure presence sayd lordes toke charlys hande delyueryd hym vnto brother lothayre wyllynge straytly chargynge hym shulde take hym vnto cure hym curyouse wolde vnto hys chyld guyde hym possessyons father shulde guyde chylde charlys commaunded shulde take obey hym father loue worshyppe hym brother ye whych vppon eyther partye promysyd obseruyd shortly sayd lothayr brother charlys toke congy father mother returned agayn italy tyme dyed pepyn seconde sonne lewys duke guyan whych yf shuld expressyd putte father great trouble vexacyon wherfore hym made lesse mournynge left hym son named pepyn whome somwhat storye spekyth wyll retourne lewys thyrde sonne emperoure clxi chapiter trouth yt whe yonger brother lewys sawe bountye father largely extende towarde two brethern hym nothynge therwyth mynde greatly dyscontent yt tyme kepte yt secrete hym selfe departyd hys father returnyd owne lordshyppe gaderyd myghty power began make warre vpon dweller nere ryne wherfore emperour wyth conuenyent power approchyd vnto citye dodayng sent then vnto hys sayde sonne wordes reconcylyacyon meane wherof sayde lowes put hym holy grace hys father hym reconcyled without shedynge mannys blood whyle emperour besyde citye cleremout countye auerne set dyreccion amonge gascoynes opynyons reryd amonge theym sonne pepyn lately kynge duke dyscessyd whyche son aboue sayde also named pepyn taken great payne labour thyther hym tydynges newly brought hys sayde sonne lewys hadde wyth ye saxon soysons thorynges made alliaunce entryd germany therin made warre moste cruell wyse wyth whyche tydynges lowis greuously passyoned hys great age meane thys vnkynde anger fyxyd sykenes lefte hym whyle lyued yet thys wythstandyng lyke strong hartyd knyght shewyd forth good comfortable cou tenaunce hadde knyghtly wyse preparyd thynge necessarye warre spedde hym towarde almayne contynued hys iourney tyll came vnto thorynge season restyd hym people tyll myght better assuryd sonne lewys restyd hym sonne hauynge knowlege great power hys father also beynge despayre purchasynge mercy consyderyng many offence fled coutrey sclauony costes retourned bayon bauery escapyd daunger hys father emperoure beyng surely enformyd scape hys sonne helde iourney tyll came magouce came vnto cytye uermayse called counsayle lordes spyrytuall temporall ordeyned dyuerse thynges state empyre entendyd haue done sykenesse increasyd sore hym space xl day toke temporall sustenaunce tyme vsyd often take blessed sacrament often sayde strengthyd bothe soule bodye sent lothayre come vnto hym whyche wythoute taryenge obeyed commaundemet abode styll wyth hym lewys policronicon maketh shorte rehersall sayth fyrste wyfe named hermyngarde iii sonnes lothayre pepyn lewys fyrst beyng felowe father empyre crowned pope pascall vpon ester daye also kyng italy pepyn made duke gascoyne guyan lewys made ruler bauary second wife named indyth doughter ye duke bayon hadde charlis ballyd whome gaue countrey burgoyn sayd policronica sayth lewys mylde often troubled hys men tyll delte wyth sharpely wysely ruled people straytly also shewyd lewys promotyd yonge man named frederyke see utryke hym hadde gyuen sadde good exhortacyon shuld folowe stablenes hys antecessours shulde purpose sothe trouth wythoute excepcyon persones punyshe mysdoers well ryche poore sayde byshoppe shulde answere hym saye beseche thy magestye syr emperour take pacyence maye dysclose thynge hath long walowed turned mynde say thy plesure sayd emperour praye thy syr emperour shewe thy mynde whyther accordynge attame thys fyshe presente fyrste hedde tayle emperour answered shortely sayd hedde fyshe shall fyrste attamyd yt lorde emperoure sayd byshoppe crysten fayth maye cause cease thyne erroure thy subiectes boldyd folowe thy mysdoynge wherfore fyrste forsake thou thy vnlawefull wedloke thou haste made wyth indyth thy nere kynnes woman meane wordes kyng reconcylyd lefte company wyfe tyll hadde purchasyd lycence pope emperour forgaue sayde byshop trespassys woman hyred two knyghtes slewe hym vestymentes hadde ended hys masse thys empresse falsely accused wronge cryme made menchon yere emperoure delyueryd habyte hadde suffycyently prouyd sayde cryme false retorne lefte wha lewys longe lyen thys agonyous sykenes knewe well amendyd nothynge feblyd commaundyd iewellys broughte hym wherof hys owne hand haue parte vnto chyrche rome lotharius sonne presente gaue crowne sworde commaundynge hym straytly vppon blessynge shuld haue honour hys moder indith charlis brother shulde owe true loue amyte shuld hym lades deffende vttermoste power lordes spirituall temporall specyally archebysshoppe meaws made lamentable requeste emperoure sonne lewys wolde accepte hym grace mercye forgyue hym hys insolente wanton wylde dedys wherof emperour harde fell suche wepynge myghte speke good whyle hadde refrayned hym therof remembryd ye lordes many great benefytes yt done hym innaturall vnkyndnes sayd lewys agayn shewyd vnto hym often tymes perdoned vnkynd sonnes trespasse finally wythstandyng ye oure perfyte charite wyth hym forgaue hym trusted forgyuen prayenge lordes present specyally chargynge ye sayd byshop wold shew vnto hys sayd son great daunger agaynst god dyspleasures done specially cause abrygement shortynge hys dayes brynge story effect wherof yf shuld declare special tyes therof wolde aske longe tyme ye shall vnderstand ii storyes great charlis lewys occupye frenche leuys great scantelyn ouer lxiiii wherfore conclude yt dyed lyke good crysten prynce ben emperour rome kynge fraunce terme xxvi yeres buryed wyth great solemnyte meaws mettis hys mother hyldegarde sayth mayster robert gaguyne yere hys age lxiiii leuynge hym foresayde thre sonnes lothayre lewys charlys ballyd anglia clxii chapiter adeulpus ethelwolphus son egbertus beganne hys reygne ouer westesaxons anglys yere oure lordes incarnacyon viii hundred xxxii xvii yere lewys mylde kynge fraunce thys youth wyllynge preste enteryd order subdeacon dyspensacyon pascall fyrst name pope maryed osburga woman lowe byrthe whome hadde foure sonnes meane ethelwalde ethelbert etheldrede alurede whyche theyr father reygned kynges englad one shall appere adeulphus hadde certayne tyme ben kyng went rome toke wyth hym yongest sonne alurede alphrede taryed space yere whyche season repayred saxon scole whyche tyme founden offa kynge mercia guydo sayeth veryly iue kynge westsaxons sayth authoure floure historyes graunted euery house kyngdome peny storye shewyd thys scole sore decayed house therof lately brent whyche thys adeulphus newely repayred sette yt better order yt vsyd thys kynge also refourme greuouse correccyons sawe executyd englyshe men spyrytuall offensys werynge iron guyues graunted euery fyre house hys lande iue foresayde hadde done whyche sayenge yt shulde seme two kynges shuld grauntyd vnto rome ii euery fyre house thorough theyr lande maye vnderstande thys rome scot y gaderyd euery house peny wythout wherfore yt muste folowe yt mysse taken wryters allege dede one kynge yt yt maye stande reason iue made fyrste graunte kynge confermyd authoure cronica cronycarum sayth thys adeulphus graunted saynte peter sayde peter pen spekyth word iue none also shewyd kynge policronica shulde acquytynge chyrches englad maner kynges trybute payed yerely rome thre hundred markes y meane saynte peter chyrche hundred markes lyghte saynt paule hundred marke popys treasorye hundred marke ouer thys hys pure deuocyon offred god saynte peter x parte hys moueable goodes also one cronycler sayth thys kynge founded fyrste vnyuersytye oxynforde whyche lykely done offa kynge mercia myche day flowred famouse clerke alcumus albinus whych sayth frenche cronycle fyrste fou der scole parys papya shewyd ye story charlys great thyrd chapyter sayde storye adeulphus hadde thus sped hys besynes pylgrymage rome retournyd fraunce tyme kyng lande charlys ballyd ioyouslye receyued hadde dysportyd hym season spousyd doughter sayde charlys xx yere reygne sayde adeulphus testyfyeth policronica xxx chapiter v boke whych shuld yere reygne sayde charlis xi mariage nothynge touchyd frenche cronycle adeulphus takynge leue kynge toke shyppynge landed englande wyth wyfe indyth name contrary law made ye tyme brigthricus sette wyfe kynges trowne magnyfyed lyke quene lordes lande arose agayne hym pullyd hym great parte domynyon made eldeste sonne ruler therof whyche done reproche ethelburga whyche slew lorde brigthricus shewyd lastly mater appeasyd kyngly honour restoryd tyme bertulph kyng mercia slewe wyckydly holy tyme penthecoste saynte wyl stone whose holy bodye buryed repyngedo ye place thys holy wylstone slayne stode pyller lyghte xxx dayes yere folowynge dyed sayde bertulphus whose deth burdredus made kynge mercia myddell englande whyche tyme hadde spousyd doughter kynge adeulphus later dayes thys adeulphus danys dyd myche harme lyndesey also kent frome then came london robbed spoyled cytye wherfore adeulphus gaderyd people lastely mette wyth southerey vppon downe called oclea dyscomfyted theym wythoute shedynge great plente anglis blood forsyd take see landed eest anglia shall appere lastely dyed thys good kynge adeulphus ethelwolph hadde ruled hys subictes nobly accorde moste wrytes fully xxii yere buryed wynchester leuynge hym four sonny aforesayde francia clxiii chapiter charlys ye yongeste son lewys mylde began hys reygne ouer chefe part frau ce ye yere lorde ix hundred xli ix yere adeulphus kynge westsaxons whyche sayd surnamed ballyd anon father buryed brother lothayre whome father ye fore behaue harde comyttyd ye guydynge charlys entysynge brother lewys malygned agayn charlis sought many wayes put hym landes father gyuen hym sayd lothayr deth father emperour lewys yonger brother duke knyght bayon charlis yongest parte pryncypall porcyon fraunce whych called myddell fraunce therfore ii bretherne specially lewys malygned greuously agayne hym wherof charlis beynge somdeale infourmed bare hym wysely egally subiectes hadde theyr loues fauours trustyd alway theyr good ayde shulde power wythstande theyr vnkynde malyce lyke hydde fyre processe breketh oute shewyth great lyght flammy blase euen dyd thys couerde malyce laste breke oute great ire ope wrath foure yeres passyd sayde two bretherne oute defyaunce groundely cause warre assygned assembled great hoste suche lyke thys daye hadde ben sene entryd lymyttes kynge charlys charlis assembled ye haste hys lordes requyred theyr aydes counsayll wythstande malyce hys bretherne hadde knowelege theyr good myndes anon theyr knyghtes gaderyd thynge redy fyghte nowe thys whyle two bretherne wyth theyr peple comen place callyd fountayns fou tanet charlis spedde hym hostes nere eyther partye made prouysyon subdue enymye bataylles bothe partyes orderyd assygned theyr standardes capytaynes wynges set moste auauntage shuld lenger processe ordynaunce make fynally shote arblasters beganne sydes whyche ouer threwe many horse man specyally fore rydars putte theym selfe prese wyth theyr longe sharpe launcys wynne fyrste brunte felde pytye yt beholde goodly bryght armyd knyghtes lyeg walowynge wyth theyr great stedys felde wyth dedly woundes gapynge agayne son yt slayne fyrst encountre shote spent speres shateryd hostes ranne gyther wyth rowlandes songe shorte whyle grene felde dyed perfyte redde heddes armes legges trunkys ded mennys bodyes lyenge thycke floures growe tyme maye floryshynge medowys myserable pyteouse yt beholde persones halfe lyuynge halfe ded theyr grysely woundes pyteously gronynge cryenge wythoute comforte shewyd rygoure wythoute mercy crueltyes wythout compassyon thus duryd mortall fyghte longe season doutefull yt knowe whyche partye hadde thauautage howbeit charlys putte afterdeale ii meanes fyrste mych charlis entendyd haue forborne reuerence hygh feste daye ascensyon oure lorde daye haue foughten seconde farre lesse nomber whyche two cause dysauautage standynge yet conclusyon wanne honoure iourney wythoute great losse hys peple many noble lande frenche boke rehersith name v vnknowen passe theym ouer yet testyfyed many wryters slayne daye mo frencheman slayn felde euer day wherof nomber expressyd yt great lothayre forced take aquisgrany safegard lewys ellys charlys wyth small copany hym lefte folowed bretherne costrayned lothayre forsake ye citye then go vnto lyon cytye ye standeth day vtter border frauce uyenne ye citye uyen shortly came vnto hym hys brother lewys two assembled newe hoste whych passetyme charlis comynge towarde hys bretherne messyngers mette hym sent bretherne comon peace fynally accordyd realme fraunce shulde dyuyded iii father dysposyd yt meane lothayr shuld enioy ouer landes belongyng empyre countrey austracy whych processe tyme called lothayre lotharingia whyche meane lorayne name lewys shulde remayne prouynce germany wyth coutrey buyan benery charlys shulde remayne countrey called myddell chefe fraunce wyth prouynces normandy burgoyne whyche sayde myddle frauce reportyd space ye occean brytayne ryuer mawze whyche concorde thus fermely stablyshed fynyshed eyther toke theyr departynge resorted vnto theyr owne lordshyppes lothayre dyed shortely leuynge hym thre sonnes named lewys lothayre charlis deth lothayre taken temporall deth yt sayd yt forsoke trauayle ye world became munke abbaye pruny lyued solytary lyfe many yeres clxiiii chapiter charlis ye ballyd thus beyng peaseble possessyon chefe parte realme fraunce guydynge yt wyth sobernes indifferet iustyce well drad also beloued subiectes processe tyme vpon viii yeres lothayr abouesayd renouncyd pompe worlde dyed fyrste charlys yongest son thre foresayd lothayre dyed lothayre second sonne sayde lewys onely suruyued whych father enoynted emperour charlis kynge fraunce knewe certaynely deth two forsayde brethern yssu anon assembled power entred prouynce austracy lorayne brother lothayre hadde gyuen lothayre sonne shorte whyle crowned hym kynge prouynce wythin chyrche saynte stephan cytye meaws chefe cyty lordshyppe kyngdome wyth whyche dede lewys brother kynge germany bayon dyscontentyd thynkyng hym selfe ryghtfull enheritour charlis myche ye elder brother also brother fyrste lothayre father mother charlis halfe brother father syde onely ye sayd lewys sent charlys ballyd certayn messyngers gyuynge hym monycyon shulde call memory couenauntes betwene theym tyme stablyshed shulde meddell hym haue wythin landes cosyn lately deed vnto tyme yt determyned theyr bothe counsayles whyther theym hadde better ryght obseruyd vppon payne exco munycacyon cursyng lewys well sene brother charlis nothyng absteyned hym occupyenge forenamed countrey therfore gaderyd armye warre vppon sayde brother whych passe tyme charlys toke second wyfe woman namyd rychent ricent whyche tyme hadde vsyd co cubyne paramoure soone danys norman inuadyd landes charlys whych tyme fayne appease please wyth ryche gyftes pleasure charlys receyued brother seconde ambassade message whyche shewyd vnto hym excepte wold voyde knyghtes strengthes sette put dyuerse place lande austracy shuld sure haue sayd brother enymy haste wolde entre lande wyth great force warre wheruppon suche answere sente theyr agrementes mater hadde suche comunycacyon fynally yt agreed sayde landes shulde egally departyd betwene whyche conclusyon perfyted lewys wyth people retournyd germany yt longe lewys repented hym hys agrement newe legacyons made vppon partyes lastely wyth myche payne newly agreed whyche agrement accorde fynyshed lewys emperour sonne fyrste lothayre sente ambassade fornamed bretherne admonestynge warnyng nother one ye shulde intermyt wyth foresayde landes myche ryghte therof belonged next heyre brother degre forther answere deferryd charlys brother lewis sayth myne authour gaue ouer parte shortly lewys ye emperour passe tyme charlys sonne charlis ballyd hys fyrste wyfe whome father made ruler countrey called belge hadde rulyd hym insolently done countrey dyuerse outragiouse dedes whyche beyng coplayned brought vnto father hym commaundyd pryson shortely deliueryd ye requeste noble frauce kept father courte contynued shorte whyle wythin lytle season father beynge lyon departyd ye sayde courte gaderyd hym wylde company euyll dysposyd person went agayne sayd countrey belge dyd harme done season contynuyd long whyle lastly taken caste agayne pryson longe punyshement reued syght sent vnto monastery corbenyke safely kepte length entycemet vncle lewys kynge germany treason two mukes ye place scapyd then fledde vnto sayd lewys vncle tyme charlys father occupyed defence danys normannys strength wonne citye angyers done therein myche harme whome kynge closyd wythin sayd cytye wyth stronge syege fynally compellyd theym seke meany peace kynges pleasure whych peace cocludyd sayd danys auoydyd kynge repossessyd sayde cytye longe tydynges brought vnto charlis deth lewys emperoure knowlege wherof kynge sent hys sonne named lewys austracy haue rule ye guydynge ye countrey thynges ordered ye weale hys realme wyth stronge company men army passyd ye mou taynes italy towarde rome lewys hys brother kynge germanye beynge therof warnyd sent haste hys sonne lewys wyth stronge hoste lette hys passage fere meane sayd lewys yeldyd hym hys vncle charlys ballyd wherewith father beyng greuously dyspleasyd sent hys seconde sonne namyd charlo withstande passage sayd charlys thys fere cause sawe myghte preuayle agayne hys vncle retornyd hym agayne hys father whose retorne mych sayd lewys kyng germany well perceyued hys brother charlys paste daunger nomber ioyned vnto sonnes hoste entryd ye londe frauce domagynge vttermoste hys power whyche season charlys ballyd kepte iourney toward rome wherof heryng viii iohn pope sent agayne hym certayn persones honoure welcomyd hym augustus emperour hys comynge thyther sayde pope receyued hym wyth greate reuerence crowned hym wyth imperyall dyademe denouncyd hym emperoure clxv chapiter charlys ye ballyd thus beyng authorysed emperour exersyd hym tyme nedys chyrche rome toke hys leue pope retorned vnto papye cytye italy callynge generall counceyle lordes empire theyr aduyses prouyded ordered dyuerse thynges weale ye sayd empyre ouer theyr agrementes ordeyned hys lyeu tenaunt debyte sayde empyre hys absence noble man brother hys wyfe recent named besonne beson assygned hym people thought necessarye conuenyent whan charlys sped hys nedys papye hyed hym fraunce came wythin terrytory therof word brought hym hys brother lewys retorned hys owne countreye wythout greate domage done realme fraunce processe emperoure came parys receyued cytesens wyth moste tryumphe ioye kepte hys eester tyde saynte denys longe charlys thus returnyd frauce receyued messenger fro hys brother kynge germany name claymed part empyre hys ryghte enherytaunce whiche answere tyme deferryd pleasaunte wordes nexte worde yt hadde sayd brother dede buryed chyrche saynte nazer frankeborught wherof wha charlys ascerteyned anone yode vnto fou tenays sent hys messenger lordes countrey commau dynge shulde meete hym cytye mettes thys foresayd lewys lefte hym two sonnes named lewys charlon towched whych deuyded bytwene theyr father patrymony lewys germany charlon hadde bayon thys lewys ferynge hys vncle charlys gaderyd hym stronge power saxon thorynges tyme theyr assemble sent ambassade certeyne byshhoppes temporall lordes vnto hys vncle charlys prayeng hym hys loue fauour wyth requestes hym made whyche myghte purchase graunte wherof whan retornyd hauynge knowlege ye sayde lewys incontinently wyth hoste drewe nere vnto ryne thys lewys couert work assemblynge hys people hys vncle therof wyttynge purueyed hys people faste vppon syde wyth hoste redy fyghte sayd lewys whan lewys ware ye great power emperour hadde assembled made haste passe ye water houed caused people falle vnto prayer charlys also ferynge hys neuewe vnder colour sent alegacyon entreaty durynge whyche entreaty emperour contrary hys honoure led peple secrete waye thynkyng haue fallen vpon neuew sodeynly meane haue dystressyd hym lewys beynge ware hys vncles treason prouyded hys peple kepte suche araye receyued theyr foo men vpon theyr speres poyntes theyr great damage greate rayne tedyousnesse harde strayte wayes whych hadde passyd hadde sore tyred weryed fresshe fyersnesse theyr enemyes whyche thoughte shulde haue take slepynge vnpurueyed abasshed wyse soone ouercomen fled felde shepe fle fro wolfe meane whych flyght great slaughter made many noble greate estate frauce slayne taken prysoners emperoure hym selfe scapyd wyth greate daunger prysoners take nere spoyled yt fayne take vyne leues couer wyth theyr secrete mebres ye shall vnderstand thys warre bytwene emperoure charlys ballyd hys brother sonne lewys prouynce austracy lorayne whyche somtyme belonged emperoure lothayr halfe brother charlys whych countreye thys batayle medyatours set order emperoure wyth great trauayle came town called tyguy lewys kepte hys waye dandonyquyke then ayes chapell whyle dane norman knowynge charlys occupyed warre agayne hys neuewe apparayled stronge hoste entred ofte landes fraunce charlys ye tyme letted wyth chargeable busynesse therfore sent noble man agayne called comarde vnto ryuer sayne wythstande sayde enemyes also hym gyuen counceyle haue wyth comunicacyon make peace yf myghte thys trouble immedyatly ioyned another tyme season cytye belongyng chyrch rome rebellyd wherfore wythstand theyr malyce pope beynge iohn viii name sent messenger charlys defence sayd lode soone pope haste sayd emperoure ellys quycke deputye named assemble italyans people adioynaut came downe cytye papye taryed emperours comynge charlys tha beset trowbles assembled hys knyghtes sped hym towarde italy whan passyd mountaynes worde brought hym pope beynge papy wherfore sped hym thyder dylygence thys tyme season charlone brother lewys sonne lewys kynge germany whyche charlone shewyd duke bayon bayory gaderyd stronge hoste entred boundes italy wherof herynge ye pope emperour sayd beynge papye busyed great counceyle dissoluyd pope incontynetly toke leue emperour departyd agayne rome charlys wyth great power gaderyd well italyans hys owne people made towarde hys neuewe wherof herynge sayde charlone turned agayne waye comen tyll came hys owne countrey sayth myne authour also ye french boke verely charlone kepyng togyther hys hoste hauynge fauour dyuers lordes italye emperoure charlys remouyd ye cytye mantue grudged wyth feuer remedy wherof toke pocyon physycyon iewe named sedechias whyche intoxicat meane whych venemous pocyon dyed shortly whan hadde reygned kynge emperoure moste accorde writer ye space xxxvii yeres wherof reygned emperoure iii yeres leuynge hym sonne named lewys whyche shewed ruler cou trey austracy lorayne whan thys charlys dede hys frendes entendynge haue caryed corp fraunce causyd seryd enoynted wyth ryche precyous bawmes oyntmentes aromatykes myghte stoppe intolerable ayre hys body fayne bury hym uercyle wythin monastery saynt euseby laye ouer vii yeres taken vp conueyed saynt denys frauce honorably buryed clxvi chapiter tyme thys charlys ballyd wytnessen many wryters began erledome flaunders whyche euer dayes ruler therof called forester kynge frau ce whyche erledome hys begynnynge thys meane ye haue harde story adeulphus kynge westsaxons hys retornynge rome maryed doughter charlys ye ballyd named indith indyth deth sayde husbonde retornyd flaunders towarde fraunce thynkynge passe wythout daunger bycause sayde countrey vnder obedyence father dayes ruler forester partyes noble yonge amerous man callyd bawdewyne whyche herynge great beautye thys indith gaue attendaunce vppon receyued hys best maner makyng chere hym possyble fynally cast hyr suche loue whan supposed departe haue gone fraunce delayed mater suche curteys wyse maner wan fauour made greate haste departe frome hym moste authours agre kepte hyr perforce whan charlys hadde wyttynge bawdewyne thus helde hys doughter indith sent hym straytly chargynge hym sende home hys doughter holpe mater tha purchasyd agayn hym censure holy chyrch accursed sayd bawdewyne whan kynge conceyued yonge man hadde suche loue indyth sette punysshement also certeynly enformed hyr harte gyuen vnto hym processe ye meane bysshoppes frendes sayd bawdewine agreed shulde take hyr wyfe name hyr dowar shulde holde enioye sayd countre flau ders wolde haue hys doughter honoured creatyd sayde bawdewyne erle commaunded hym called daye erle flauders also shewyd frenche cronycle wryters thre dayes hys deth hys spiryte shulde rauysshed hys body vnto place payne turment thys charlys ledynge aungell shulde se hylles mountaynes brenne pyttes full sulphyr pytche hote boylynge lede whyche paynes sayde charlys shulde se many hys progenytours bysshoppes counceyled prynces debate stryfe gaue counceyle rayse theyr subiectys vnlefull taskys imposycyons wyth many thynges whyche passe ouer length mater anglia clxvii chapiter ethelwaldus ethelwoldus ye eldeste sonne adeulphus began hys reygne ouer westesaxons ouer ye partye englande yere lorde viii hundred lv x yere charlys ballyd kynge fraunce whyche became vnhappy maryed ye woman whyche hys father hadde somtyme kepte holden hys concubyne wytnessyth ye authour ye floure hystoryes polycronycon sayth wedded stepmoder whyche dysaccordyth wyth sayenge wryters testifye stepmoder maryed bawdewyn erle flauders ye story charlys last shewyd thys ethelwolde though expressyd hap dyed whan hadde reygned one yere sayth polycronyca another cronycle beryth wytnesse slayne martyr hungar hubba prynces danys thys tyme holy kynge saynt edmund cotynued reygne ouer eest anglis norfolke clxviii chapiter ethelbertus seconde sonne adeulph began reygn ouer partye englande yere lorde viii hundred lvi xi yere charlis ye ballid kynge fraunce whose tyme danys wyth strengthes entred ye west part land robbed spoyled coutrey theym tyll came wynchester toke cytye strength dyd therin wold kynge made suche prouysyon hym duke forcyd forsake cytye yode toward theyr shippes fought wyth great parte theym slayne taken kynge nothynge ellys lefte memory shewyd dyed reygned moste wryters vi yeres buryed shyrborne leuynge hym none yssu hys body wherfore rule lande fell brother etheldrede clxix chapiter etheldredus thyrde sonne adeulphus beganne hys reygne ouer west anglis parte englande yere lorde viii hundred lxiii xviii yere charlis ye ballyd kynge fraunce begynnyng kynges reygne dane landed eest england norff suff compellyd forsake countrey toke agayne shyppynge saylyd northwarde landed northumberlande mette wyth kynges reynynge callyd osbryghte ella whyche gaue theym stronge fyghte wythstandynge danys wyth helpe suche enhabyted ye countrey wan cytye yorke helde yt certayne tyme people northumberland varyed self leuer ayde danys reygne vnder kyng westsaxos notyd kynges reygned egbert whyche sayde subdued prouynce reygned trybutaryes kynge westsaxons anglys wherfore etheldredus herynge auauntage danys assembled people sped hym thytherwarde sente vnto foresayd two kynges commaundynge also prepare theyr peple agayne hys comynge howe yt kynge came wyth hys hoste danys prouokyd northumbres batayll met playne feld foughte longe batayll finally danys wan pryce slew foresayd kynges wyth great multytude theyr people whych vyctory subdued myche sayde countrey destroyed ye town aklynt aclynd whyche testyfyeth beda somtime one strongest townes northe etheldrede hadde preparyd thynge warre purposyd towarde north co syderacyon aforesayde worde brought vnto sayde kynge etheldrede dyscomfyture northumbres also dyuerse sayde danys wyth comen mercia hadde wonne towne snotyngham notyngham whyche tydynges lettyd hym forth spedde iourney thys sayenge dysagreable vnto policronicon sayth northumbres yet theyr kynge osbrutus osritus authours chase vnto tyraunt named ella meane wherof great dissensyon grew amog great hurte countrey danys hadde passed countre wonne cytye yorke febly wallyd constraynte fere defence theyr coutrey fayne agree gather strengthe sydes bothe foresayde kynges went agayne foresayd danis slayn whych scomfyture people desolate fledde countrey made peace wyth danys lyued vnder theyr tuycyon danys kepte possessyon coutrey suche wyse angle hadde rule therof tyll time adelstone ethelstone wryters tyl tyme edredus helde possessyon therof ouer terme lx yeres danys beynge thus possessyd northe countrey manned fortyfyed stronge holdes therof came downe mercia myddell englande wanne parte therof wyth forsayde towne nothyngam dwellyd ye parte yere folowynge wherfore kynge etheldrede wyth ayde burdredus kynge mercia layde seage vnto towne whyche danys perceyued shulde wonne refusyd towne toke towre castell defendyd yt stronge maner helde yt tyll pea apoyntement concludyd betwene two kynges theym whyche shulde go free wolde carye wyth theym theyr horse harnesse wythout pyllage whe peace thus made eyther kinges departed theyr owne danys retourned vnto yorke dwelled yere folowynge yere folowynge sayde yere parte sayde danys takynge shyppynge northe entendynge sayle towarde eest englande mette see wyth flote danys wherof captaynes ledars named hynguoar hubba whyche exhortacyon commynge oute north made one course lastly landed eest englande norffolk processe time came vnto therforde therof herynge edmundus kyng prouynce assembled hoste gaue vnto batayll edmude hoste forsed forsake ye feld kyng persones fledde vnto castel framilyngha framyngeham whome danys pursued short whyle yelded hym selfe vnto persecucyon danys blessyd man edmunde wolde renye deny cryste hys lawys therfore moste cruelly bonde vnto tree causyd hym shot deth lastely causyd hedde smytten body caste amonge thycke bush frendes came burye holy treasoure lacked hed made yt busy serche hedde beyng clawys wylde wolfe spake sayde thre tymes dystynctely reason whyche speche came vnto ye place hedde sayde bestys kepyng laye whyche sayde wolfe contrarye kynde anon sawe people fledde hedde suffred theym take yt vp folowyd theym certayn tyme hadde ben rame wyth great solempnyte caryed body hed vnto eglydon eglysdon callyd saynte edmundes bury buryed hym aboute yere lorde wytnessen policronica guydo viii hudred lxix shewyd ye chapyter worke foure score xiv dayly god shewyd many miracle clxx chapiter whan blessyd edmude thus martyred loue bare towarde mayster criste lawes brother named edwoldus settynge parte lykynge pleasure worlde yt hym belongyd ryght kyngdome toke vpon hym habyte heremyte lyued onely brede water abbay cern countye dorset clere welle saynt austyne prayer made sprynge conuertyd fyrst saxon prouynce ye fayth cryste said abbay ceru policronica sayth yt dayes ryche ryght welthy gouernours therof mysspent patrymony therof excesse glotony amonge seruauntes god wherfore sayth farther couetyse pryde hadde chauged thyng england day thynges tyme gyue abbays wasted glotony outrage owner sustenaunce ayde nedy men gestes nedy waygoers albe yt sayth fyrst doer gyuer lose theyre rewarde theyr wyll entent full euenly paysed balaunce hym rewarder good though treuysa yt translatoure boke polycronycon laten vulgare tunge reporte done thys mysorder vsyd thys dayes whyche lyued tyme honorable prynce edwarde thyrde yf lyued wold gouernours munkes blacke yet whyte laye suche outrage nowe dayes pryde glotony clerely banyshed fro theyr monasteryes cellys rome pryde wyth hys frende dysobedyence haue lodgyd humylyte suffer obedyence stede glotonye vnclenesse lyuynge haue nowe newely professyd vnto chastyte temperaunce abstynence auoydynge slowth idelnesse exercyse theym gostely studye preachynge worde god wyth dylygence nowe holy rulys ordynaunces made holy father abbote saynt benet ignorauce haue log tyme slepte nowe grace good gouernaunce newely renyued quyckened ende lest accused dyssymulacyon retourn vnto danys whome haue made longe dygressyon trouth yt hadde sayde martyred blessed man edmunde robbed spoyled countrey toke agayne theyr shyppes landed agayne southerye contynued theyr iourney tyll came towne redynge wanne towne wyth castell policronyca sayth yt thyrd day theyr thyther coming hingwar hubba wente purchasyng prayes slayne place called engelfelde whyche prynces danys thus slayne dele theym kepte hole gyther suche wyse weste saxon myght take theym none auauntage yet wythin dayes danys holden shorte forced yssue castell defende theym playne batayll yt whych coforte kyng etheldrede alurede brother danys dyscomfyted many theym slayne wherof beynge ware fled agayne castell kepte theym wyth certayne tyme kynge comaunded etelwold duke baroke barkshyre attende wyth hys peple vppon castell se danys breke oute large went costes countrey subdue sayde danys danys knewe kynges departure brake daynly anon theyr hold toke duke vnpuruayed slewe hym myche hys people caused drawe farther towne castell danys drewe theyr lordes coutrey enbatelled wyse theym gatheryd stronge hoste long duke ethel wolde slayne kyng ascertayned therof whyche renewed heuenesse made hym full heuy consyder losse frende encreace multyplyenge enymyes ye daye reporte tydynges affermeth olde cronycle worde brought hym landyng dane named osryk whyche policronyca named kyng denmarke whyche shorte tyme assystence danys hadde gaderyd great hoste enbatellyd vppon ashe downe batayll alured forced great nede come brother kynge herynge masse wyth great deuocyon knowynge hasty spede brother ye kynge thus beynge hys medytacyons ye hostes anglys danys strake gyders wyth houge vyolece yt danys hadde hyllande ye crysten men valley yet grace vertue ye kynges holy prayer manhode theym selfe length wanne hyll danis slew theyr duke kynge called osryke englyshe cronycle oseg fyue theyr duke wyth myche theyr people chased ye dele vnto redynge towne wherfore danys resembled theyr people gathered newe hoste wythin xv dayes mette towne called basynge stoke gaue batayll vnto kynge hadde better kynge gatheryd people whych felde chachyd dysparklyd wyth freshe soldyours theym accompanyed mette danys within two monethes towne called merton gaue theym sharpe batayll myche people slayn well crysten danys ende danys hadde honour felde kynge anglys wounded fayne sauegarde hym selfe polycy myght fayled two feldes thus danys obteyned great cyrcuyte grounde destroyed man chyld inobedyet chyrches temple tourned vse stable vyle occupacyons sorowe added kyng hoped well recouer loss ayde subiectes wel te land hys owne westsaxon hadde sent commyssyons northumberland mercia eest anglia small lytell comforte coutre west saxon brought great desolacyon kyng beset wyth enymyes vpon euery syde ouer knyghtes soldyours tyred palled wyth ouer watche laboure whyche manyfolde aduersytyes trouble synkynge kynges mynde wyth brose hurte ensuyng woude take ye batayll besyde merton shortened dayes dyed reygned great persecucion danys wryters viii yeres wythout yssue body reason wherof rule lande fyll vnto hys brother alurede wytnessyd cronycles wythstandynge great trouble vexacion kyng etheldrede hadde wyth danys founded house college chanons exeter buryed abbaye wynbourne wobourne clxxi chapiter aluredus iiii sonne adolfus brother etheldredus laste kynge beganne reygne ouer westsaxons prouynces englande yere lorde viii hundred lxxii xxxi yere charlis forenamed kyng fraunce alured wryters alphred xii yere age set scole spedde well tyme passed brother long set forth hym counsayll neot ordeyned fyrst grammer scole oxenford free scoles fraunchaysyd towne wyth many great lybertyes translated many lawes marcyan lawe bretyshe speche vnto saxon tunge also subtyll mayster buyldyng deuysynge therof excellent connyng huntynge fayre stature moste beloued father chyldren longe tyme wold aske reherse vertue youth dysposed ye syn fleshe thereby letted many vertuous purpose lastely many resystences hym done auoyde ye temtacyon therof besought god enterly wold sende hym som contynuall sykenes quenchyng ye vyce vnprofytable wordely besynesse serue god better goddes ordynauce ye euyll called fyc wyth whych sekenes greued many yeres lastely cured holy virgyn saynt modwenna dwellyng irlande cure done came englande myche monastery chyrch yt dwelled destroyed wherfore adulfus father alured knowynge vertue holynesse mayden gaue ground buylde vppon ii abbays maydens say one arderne place callyd polliswortham another strenesalte northe holy mayden dyed yland andrese besyde burton many yeres buyldynge sayd two abbays vii yeres yt ben closyd within stone walles yle named alurede cured sekynes fyll contynued hym xx yere age tyll xlv yere hys sayed age yt wythstadynge wedded noble woman named ethelwyda receyued two sonnes edwarde surnamed elder egelwarde iii doughters elphleda yt ladye mercia ethelgota mechon nune ye thyrd named elfrida whyche caused well doughters studye arte scyence gramer noryshed wyth vertue alurede admyttyd kynge well consyderyd great daunger yt lande wherfore gaderyd hym lordes suche myghte wyn wythout stryfe wanne wyth great iustyce fayre hostes yt shorlty assembled stronge hoste seconde moneth yt made kynge mette wyth danys besyde wylton yelded batayll wythout great losse men partyes remeuyd pleople sondry place faught wyth ye danys fyrste yere vi tymes meane wherof peple sore mynyshed wekyd forsed take pea wyth enymyes vppon couenaunt shuld auoyde countres prouynces yt domynyon uppon whych agremet fermely concluded danis tyme voyded coutreys drew towarde london rested theym ye coste parte yere folowynge then lyndesey robbyng spoylyng townes village wente holdynge ye comon people vnder theyr seruage contynued ouer terme two yeres thyrde yere endyd yode vnto repindon put slewe burdredus kyng mercia betoke ye kyngdome vnto seruaunt named colwolphus vppon condicyon shulde kepe theyr behofe besegyd town thereby called hambourgth assauted yt right sharpely wherfore people therof beynge great drede fere toke body holy vyrgyne saynt werbourgth vertue whose body enymyes somwhat put backe suerty ye inhabytauntes ye towne hamburgth wyth holy treasure fled vnto westchester daye lyeth honorably shryned kyng made oft pea danys truste wherof rode fewer peple wherof beyng ware layd bushemetes hym set nere hym yt slew great parte copany nyght rode towarde wynchester treason hyng sore amouyd agayne danys secrete maner myght assembled chosen copany knyghtes wytnessyth guydo fyll vpon sodeynly dystressed many lefte tyll chased chester authour exetour kynge alurede kept danys short yt constrayned gyue hym pledge kepe peace dwell lenger myght puruey shyppynge next porte sayle denmarke accorde thus fynyshed kynge returned vnto mercia myddell england harde yt colwolphus dede danys taken lordshyp kepe therfore seasyd yt kyngedome ioyned yt owne west saxon whych reason kyngedome mercia surseasyd ye continued theyr fyrst kyng named penda chapyter worke cxxix precedynge length declared aboute v yere reygne alurede danys affermeth policronica sayled fro warham towarde exetour whyche iourney loste vi score theyr small shyppes tempeste see occupyed towne chepynham countrey therunto adioynynge chasyd ye angle made subiectes ye danys sore power augmentyd angle loste dayly encresyd ye reason landyng prynce danys named gutteron gowthram whyche y named kyng denmarke clxxii chapiter alurede beynge thus ouerset multytude enymyes affermeth policronica ladde vncertayne lyfe vneasy wyth folkes aboute hym wode coutrey somersetshyre ryght scante lyue wyth suche hys peple myght purchase huntyng fyshynge mysery thus certayn tyme contynuynge vysyon hym shewyd saynte cutbert comforted folowyth uppon tyme copany hym departed besyed purchasyng vytayle passetyme redynge boke pilgryme came requyred almes goddes name kynge lyfte vp hys handes towarde heuen sayde thanke god grace vysyteth hys poore man day poore man woll wytsaue aske yt hath gyuen kynge anon called seruaunt hadde one lofe lytell wyne badde hym gyue halfe therof vnto poore man whyche receyued yt thankefully sodaynly vanished syght step hym sene nesshe fenne yt passed thorough also gyuen hym lefte wyse yt hym gyuen shortely company returned theyr maister brought wyth theym great plenty fyshe taken nyght folowynge kynge reste one apperyd hym byshoppes wede chargyd hym shuld loue god kepe iustyce mercyable poore men worshyppe prestes sayd ouer alurede criste knowyth thy coscience thy wyll nowe wyll put ende thy sorowe care morow strong helper shall come whose helpe thou shalte subdue thyne enymyes arte thou sayd kyng cutbert sayd ye pylgryme yt yester day yt thou gauest brede wyne besy thyne wherfore haue thou mynde hereof yt wel pilgryme mynde fredam gaue possessyons vnto durham chyrche yt well euydently sene alurede vysyon wel comforted shewed hym large dayly resortyd hym men wylshyre somersetshyre hamshyre tyll strongly companied kyng put hym great ieodye sayth wyllyam de regibus dyd hym habite mynstrell instrument musyke entred tentes pauylyons danys shewynge enterlude songes espyed theyr slouth idelnesse harde mych theyr counsayll retourned vnto company tolde theym maner danys kynge wyth chosen co pany fyll vpon ye danys nyght dystressyd slewe theym great multytude chasyd theym coste kyng thus chasyd danys cou sayll knyghtes buylded toure named edelyng whyche meane oure speche toure noble men oute whych toure soldyers made many assautes vppon theyr enymyes dyd myche harme scath clerely voyded countrey betwene selwood edelynge ethelyngyssey standeth great mary men may wyn yt withoute shyppe bote conteynyth great grounde yet therin venyson wyld bestes fowle fyshe great plenty thus kynge alurede dayly pursuyd enymyes helpe god subiectes whyche heryng vyctoryes manfull dedes drewe hym dayly costes whose power assistens helde danys shorte wanne wynchester many good townes forced lastly seche peace whych co cludyd vppon certayn couenauntis wherof one principall theyr kynge named sayd guttrun gothram ye englyshe cronycle gurmunde shuld crystyned certayne duke wyth hym ye kyng wold haue danys banyshed west partyes englande graunted hym eest anglia abyde dwell prynce danys accordynge couenauntes crystyned wynchester xx grettest duke sayde danys prynce alurede godfather funte stone named hym athelstane hadde season feasted sayde daues accordynge promys gaue vnto theyr kynge countrey eest anglia whyche conteyned norffolk suffolk parte cambrydshyre also wytnessyth policronica grauted ye danys crystened countrey northumberlande wold crystyned departed land failed frauce restyd theym wyth theyr cosyns kynnesmen dayes wasted lande fraunce frenche story somwhat apparent danys kynge athelstane hadde possessyon countreys ye shall vnderstand yt suche angle dwelled wythin precyncte theym vnder obedyence yt helde sayd prouynce fee ye kyng promysed dwell lyege yet promyse wythstandynge contynued lyke tyraunte terme xi yeres full dyed xii whyche tyme kynge alurede amended cytye septon nowe called shaftesburye townes stronge holdes yt danys sore abatyd enpayred wytnessyth guydo buylded ye house nonnes shaftesbury fyrste founder therof also founded house relygyon aboue named place ethelyngesey nother wynchester named new monastery whiche buryed ouer endowed churche saynte cuthberte doreham touched aboute xv yere reygne alurede ye danys whiche ye haue hard sayled frauce retorned englande landed kent lastly came vnto rochester beseged cytye lay longe buylded towre tymber stone agayne gate cytye strength ye cytesyns towre destroyed cytye defended tyll kyng alurede restowed whyche hadde made suche purueyaunce dystressyng water lande nere trapped fere left theyr horse behynde fled theyr shyppes nyght wha kynge therof ware sent toke xvi theyr shyppes slewe many sayd danys thys iourney kynge retorned london repayred certayne placys therof ben hurte febled wyth danys betoke guydyng therof vnto etheldredus erle duke mercia wyfe gyuen hys doughter elfleda thys tyme dyed dunbertus bysshop wynchester kyng made dunwolfus bysshop hym whyche sayth polycronycon kynge fande wodde kepyng bestes tyme whan hym selfe kepte woddes fere danys xxi yere reygne thys kynge alurede danys landed iiii place thys lande wytte eest england north west ii place ye kynge theyr landynge warnynge deth athelstan kyng danys eest england complayntes ye danys therfore yode thyder whyche tyme hys beynge tydynges came vnto hym clxxiii chapiter whan kynge alurede acertayned tydynges mych sayde dane landed coste knewe well ye ferther drewe vnto partyes shulde ayded strengthed therfore sent messenger haste vnto etheldred erle duke mercia chargynge hym assemble hoste men mercia border make resystens agayne dane whyche landed west done ye kyng sped hym toward hys enmyes pursued sharpely ye ende droue eest anglia whyche landed kent whyther kynge wyth hys people spedde hym lyke maner draue dane then specyall fyghte batayle authours therof leue memory thys agayne dane toke shyppynge sayled north wale robbed spoyled britos then retorned see eest anglia rested mych kynge gone westwarde thys whyle foresayd danys wonne towne chester countrees adioynaut presed sore vppon sayd danys compelled kepe wythin sayd towne cytye defende theym maner holdyng ye towne lasted longe danys compellyd eate theyr horse hunger apoyntement lastely gaue ouer towne went then northumberland whyle kynge hoste spedde hym thyderwarde leuynge stronge holdes castels garnysshed wyth men vytayle toke agayne shyppynge fet theyr course suche wyse landed sussex came vnto towne lewes then toward london buylded towre castell nere vnto ryuer lewes londoner heryng theyr doynges maned certayn nomber men armes whiche wyth assystens men ye countree put danys towre bete downe groud soone ye kyng came downe thyder thoughte ryuer shulde meane brynge enemyes efte soones countre therfore comaunded ye streme deuyded diuers stremes yt reaso therof shyp myght sayle tyme afore passed tha lytell bote myghte scantly rowe presence kynge dane forsed fle countre then toke agayne waye toward walys kept parte ryuer seuerne vppon border therof buylded castell nere vnto walys rested tyme iii yeres thys lande vexed wyth thre maner sorowes wyth warre dane pestylence men moreyne bestes whyche trouble aduersytees wythstandynge kyng knyghtly manfully resysted malyce enmyes thanked god alway trouble euer fyll hym hys realme susteyned greate humylyte pacyence tolde hym yt deuyded ye daye nyght thre partyes yf let warre greate besynes wherof viii houres spet study lernyng scyence viii spente preayer almes dedes wyth charytable dedes viii houres spent natural reste sustinauce body nedes realme whych order kept duely waxen taper kepte certayne person thus thys marcyall knyght contynuyng prowesse vertue lastly dyed whan hadde reygned ouer parte thys lande terme xxviii yeres full fyrst buryed wylto certayne yeres remoued caryed vnto wynchester leuynge hym sonne named edwarde surnamed edwarde elder b called egelwarde dyed hys father francia clxxiiii chapiter lewys second name sonne charlis ye balled began hys reygne ouer frenchman yere lorde viii hudred lxxviii vi yere aluredus kynge parte englande thys named lodowicus balbus whych meane lewys stamerer mych impedyment hys tunge ye haue ye story charlys balled herde charlon neuew charlys foresayd hys hoste entred italy entended towarde rome whyche deth sayd vncle charlys kepte hys waye lastly came vnto rome pope beynge iohn viii name fauoured aboue named lewys balbus entended make hym emperoure therfore refrayned yt enoyntyng sayd charlon whyche dede fynally compelled auoyde towne coutre fled frauce beynge honourably lewys receyued declared admytted hym emperoure sheweth cronycles rome two yeres hys reygne short tyme thys admyssyon dygnyte thys lewys dyed wherfore sayde pope enioye hys papasy reste retorned rome anoynted forenamed charlon crowned hym imperyall dyademe whyche ye roman cronycle named carolus tertius thyrde emperour meane name thys speketh nothyng frenche cronycle excepte testyfyed sayd pope admytted emperour polycronycon sheweth seconde lewys kynge fraunce accursed pope nicolas ye fyrste name myche refused hys lawfull wyfe toke concubine named waldrada vnderstande lewys second emperour name whyche sonne lothayre whyche lothayre eldest sonne lewys mylde story charlys ballyd appereth genelogy charlis conqueroure hys ofspyng may clerelyer appere also ye reder may haue certeyne name whych emperours whych kynges fraunce whych kynges germany shall story lewys v whome tyme surseasyd ye blode make remembraunce euery emperour kynges fraunce germany reygned ye sayd charlis ye grete conquerour tyll hugh capet whyche hugh vsurped crowne fraunce shall appere foloweth story partycyon lande austracy lorayn grudge varyauce contynued alwaye bytwene kynges frauce germany whyche bothe kynges thys daye named lewys albeit kyng fraunce surnamed balbus shewed whych varyaunce laboure frendes two kynges mette ye cytye place called gundeuyle longe comunycacyo fynally agreed sayde prouynce austracy shulde deuyded somtyme ben parted bytwene charlys balled lewys kynge germany theyr bothe father whych pea thus cocluded eyther parted frendely wyse lewys balb yode vnto ardern halowed feste crystmas fro then yode vnto compeyne herde rebellyon marque hys realme called barnarde verely romayn story marque italy thys barnarde wyth one helberde tyme taken chyrche rome certeyne possessyons whyche meane thys lewys sentence chyrche denounced agayne foresayd pope iohn agayn restored partyes also reconcyled newe thys barnarde rebelled agayne wherfore pope lewys defensour chyrch rome sent ayde haue shewed thys lewys sayde pope iohn authorysed emperoure crowned rome wyth imperyall dyademe accopted amonge ye emperours thys newe rebellyon barnarde lewys assembled hys armye copayne foresayd fro then rode ye cytye troyes uincet taken wyth sodayne malady ye whyche dyed shortly wythout suspeccyon venym whan ben kynge fraunce fully two yeres leuyng hym two sonnes saye lewys charlys wryters charlemayne clxxv chapiter lewys charlys sonnes lewys balbus lewys ye stamerer began theyr reygne ouer frenchemen yere oure lordes incarnacion viiiclxxx viii yere ye reygne alurede kynge englande whyche yonge age put vnder tuyssyo gydyng barnarde erle auuergii father hys lyfe commytted wherfore sayd barnarde wyth hys affynyte assembled shortly meaux lorayne thyder called vnto lordes lande treate mater comon weale ye dayes man grete myght frauce named gosseleyn whyche enuyed foresayd erle barnarde certayne harmes hym done tyme fore passed auengynge wherof sayd gosseleyn intended putte hym rule land whych knew well shuld occupye whyle sayd two childern rule thys euyll purpose brynge effecte went vnto conrade erle parys shewed hym moche wyll amonge thynges lette hym wytte yf lewys kynge germany myght hys helpe made kynge frauce shulde hym greatly auaunced whych meanes caused sayde conrade take hys parte hys affynyte whan came vnto foresayde counsayle meaux sayde lewys kynge germany apte rule lande frauce also wryters lewis charlys afore sayde legyttymate sonnes forenamed lewis balb gotten baste concubyne sayd lewys thys mater thus debated argued amonges cousayle lastly moste nomber agreed lewys kynge germanye shulde ambassade requyred come take vppon hym rule lande myddell fraunce whych wyth small request agreable shorte tyme came vnto sayd cytye meaux uerdune soone knowlege come barnarde hys affynyte counceyle hughe terry two noble fraunce bysshop orlyaunce erle sent uerdune vnto sayd kynge germany wyth thys message yf contente take vnto hym suche parte prouynce lorayne charlys balled kepte hys fader lewys wythout clayme lande realme fraunce shuld gladly haue yf nat shulde abyde iugement mar hys batayle wyth whyche offer lewys well contented beyng suertye departed agayne germanye thorough doynge forenamed gosselyne conrade theyr fred yt sore dyscotentyd departure lewys forsayde sayd bernarde syde goodly hast coueyed sayd two chyldren vnto citye ferrer crowned proclaymed theym kynges wytnessyth mayster robert gaguyne forenamed gosselyne conrade leuynge mater sente messenger vnto ye quene germanye coplaynynge theym vnto vnstablenesse tymerousnesse lorde wherby alonely loste possessyon realme fraunce also hadde put theyr frendes great fere daunger wherof herynge quene mynde sore dyscontentyd wyth lorde husbande durste shewyd yt hym reproche dyshonour fynally satysfye myndes sayde gosselyn conrade sent guyan brother named boso whose aydes assystence prouynce proclaymed kynge endurynge whyche trouble danys entred lande came vnto ryuer lyger robbed spoyled countrey wythoute mercy wherfore kynges assembled theyr people gaue batayll nere vnto ryuer uyen dystressyd sayde danys slewe ix thousand drowned ouer grete multytude sayde ryuer whyche vyctory kynges obteyned new vexacyon trouble ascertayned yt lewys kyng germany great puysaunce comen vnto place called ducy hym gone forenamed gosselyn conrade power myghte make theyr ledynge then co ueyed vnto rybemaunt howe yt lacke performaunce promyse made sayde two erles vnto kyng germany obserued herynge kynges fraunce drawynge towarde hym wyth stronge hoste cocluded pea retourned germany two bretherne rode gyder vnto citye damens demeus deuyded lande fraunce betwene theym lewes held hym coutrey nere parys prouince neustria normandye charles vnto part burgoyn guyan promyse made assured eyther partye eyther shulde ayde assyste clxxvi chapiter partycyon betwene two bretherne thus made meanes lewys kynge germany foresayde erles gosselyn conrade vnto sayde bretherne recouncyled agreed theym redy worde brought bose named kyng guyan hadde wonne cytye uyen therin lefte wyfe whyle occupyed ye hylles mountaynes beynge aboute ioyntly assembled theyr knyghtes sped thyther layde theyr seage aboute cytye durynge syege danis often wasted ye land fraunce wherfore lewys elder brother departed fro syege leuynge brother charlys sayde lewis myght wyn sayde danys tyrauntes cruell enymyes crystes fayth hadde spoyled many chyrches temple monasterye saynt peter corby throwen yt downe ground vyle cruell dede theym done lewys gaue vnto batayll slew great nomber chased remanaunt vyctorye ensuyd great wonder crysten hadde sayde chasyd pagan danys retourned confusyd dysparkled lyke hoste danys hadde theym pursued well hym myghte ronne fastest hyde hym selfe daunger enymy yt thought apparent theyr syght theyr enymyes folowed theyr backes wyth kynde wepyn yet folowed man whych fere flyght frenche men sayth myne authour sent theym dyuyne purueaunce myche often tyme pryce theyr enymyes therfore gyuen due thanke vnto god referred yt theyr owne strenghtes vertue danys herynge dysparklyng crysten hoste reassembled theyr power ppayred new fyght wherfore ye kyng called gyther knyghtes sayd dysparkled mette wyth theym nere vnto aboue named ryuer lyger hostes wythin day iourney kynge aduysed cousayll yt shulde fyght wyth whych cause yode vnto compeynge kept feast crystemasse whyle kynge lodged copeynge delyueryd hoste vnto noble man land named theodorych wyllynge hym go agayne danys whose exployt spede myne authoure maketh mencyon sayeth soone foresayde feast kynge spedde turon sent rayse brytos lytell britayn stande foresayde enymyes whyche passetyme taken wyth maladye then lytter caryed vnto saynte denis dyed buried sayth maister gaguyn dyed turon coueyed vnto saynt denys buried wryters ioyne reygn two bretherne one therfore wyll shewe vnto fyne conclusyon brother called charlys charlemayn whyche thys whyle mayntened syege aboute uyenne brother touchyd left hym lordes frau ce sente haste gyuynge hym knowlege deth brother also great daunger land reason danys wherof sayd charlys hadde thus wyttynge lefte parte hys people sayde syege wyth deale sped hym towarde champayne mych enfourmed danys drawen towarde coste hys iourney worde broughte vnto hym uyenne delyueryd vnto suche persones hadde left maynteyne syege thys came nother messenger whyche shewyd hym danys hadde destroyed dyuers chyrches champayne place howe byshoppe meaws agayne theym hadde ladde host people slayne hys people chasyd ouer thys foresayde ryuer lyger hoste danis theyr leder called hastynges assembled whych partyes wasted countrey place dyd whyche somdeale apasled herte kynge charlys beyt comforte hadde dayly receyued lordes fraunce kepte hys iourney made towarde next enymyes drew nere vnto yt cowardyse counsayll lordes fell communycacyon peace fynally concluded godfrey prynce danys cofesse fayth cryste crystened shulde enioye hole prouynce fryse wyth wyth hys danys inhabyte theym whyche condycyon peace begynnynge greate sorowe losse vnto fraunce shall appere yt sayd godfrey deceyue frenchman shewed outwarde countenauce crysten man whyle shortely wyth hoste xl thousande danys entred land wastynge countrey tyll came parys layde hys syege citye arch byshoppe parys named iosselen inhabytaunces cytye manfully defended danys fayne breke hys syege then yode cytye laon wan yt strength yt spoyled robbed brent fro then soysons pyllynge destroyeng countrey went cruell wyse bysshoppes prestys fled theyr chyrches wyth relyques anournamentes ornametes belongyng bodyes saynte germanye saynte remigius dyuers ye tyme persecucyo lyke lande englande great daunger also land fraunce meane pagan myscreauntes danys whyche resortyd one realme releued theym selfe one land whe chased oute one myshappe amonges befell fraunce dayes charlys theyr kynge taken theym suche wyse wryter leueth hym mencyon dyed dyed mencyon made frenche cronycle myne auhoure howe longe whyle hys brother lewys reygned uyncent historyall antoninus whych grouded hym vppon sayde uyncent iacobus philippus saye two foresayde bretherne regned togyder alone terme v yeres wythoute frenche cronycle also myne authour sayen lewys dyed wythoute heyre charlys lefte hym sonne whyche named lewys symple dedes surnamed laten nihil faciens freche ryen fezant whyche meane speche nought doynge lysteth wele aduertyse remeber order thys cronycle shall fynde latter sayenge dyscorde yt sayde thys charlis shulde leue sonne hym yt semeth consyderynge hys youth shulde lawfull age gette chylde lyklyhode conuenyence storye yf veryfyed yt declared coude passe ye age viii yeres moste wherfore yt muste folowe congruence reygned lenger tyme ellys thys chylde heyre lewys aboue named sonne man folowe myne authour shall procede foloweth clxxvii chapiter lewys fourth af name sonne charlis sayde beganne reygne ouer ye frenchman yere lorde viii hundred lxxx vi xiiii yere aluredus kyng englande thys lewys yt y testyfyed dyuers wryters shulde enamoure hym selfe vppon menchon monastery chyell drawe oute force marye vnto wyfe dede purchasyd aboue said name called lewis nought doynge thys tyme
