danys contrary theyr myse made made new warre wythin land frau ce wherfore frenchman hauyng lytell hope theyr kynge sente vnto charlon charlys ye emperour sonne lewys kynge germany shewyd requyryng humble wyse vysyte ye realm fraunce defende yt persecucyon danys dayes also lyuynge fraunce forenamed hugh whych ye haue herd maynteyned quarell lewys charlys last kynges agayn lewys kyng germanye whyche hugh writer called hue le graud hugh great thys man gaderyd hoste frenchman gaue batayll vnto danys slewe great nomber shulde seme wryters frenche storye noble men fraunce thys hugh shulde haue rule spyrytuall possessyons abbayes house relygyon myne authour mayster gagwyne laten named abbates frenche boke abbis whych meane abbottes also yt testyfyed sayd writer hugh robert erle parys fyrst left dystrybucyon spyrytuall goodes vnto theyr knightes gaue ouer name abbotte whyche estate contynued tyll dayes roberte kynge fraunce yt folowyth accordynge request made vnto emperour aboue shewyd gatheryd stronge hoste italyons parced lande fraunce bare hym vyctoryously agayne danys forced theym obey theyr former promyse condycyons eusebi yt wrote actes emperours sayen yt charlis whyche name thyrd name also grossus yt great subdued danys fraunce compellyd theyr leder prynce named rodefredus take habyte crystes relygyon receyued hym coulde wa ter whyche tyme soone wherof ye tyme duely ascertayned dyed forenamed kynge lewys surnamed nought doynge hadde reygned wryters viii yeres leuyng hym sonne named charlis yt whyche surnamed symple yonge take vpon hym charge lordes put hym vnder good conuenyent guydynge chase foloweth guyde ye lande tyll come hys laufull age whyche named eudo clxxviii chapiter eudo sonne robert erle angeowe beganne reygne ouer french men yere lorde viii hundred lxxx xv xxiii yere alurede kynge englande ye shall vnderstand aboue named robert erle angeow tutor guyder vnto forenamed kynges fraunce lewys charlys lastely slayne danys whyche robert left hym ii sonnes eudo robert whych eudo great fame also ye great trouth hym prouyd knowen ye lordes one assent chose hym kynge lande terme lyfe affermeth french boke crowned walter archebyshoppe senys howe yt somdele doutfull gyuen credence vnto dyuers reason therunto myghte made mayster gagwyne sayth hath sene authoures testyfye forenamed charlis symple lawfull son lewys balbus foresayde lewys charlis late kynges fraunce bastarde sonnes sayde lewys balbus folowe mater thys eudo cosyderacyon sayd charlis symple insuffycyet guyde lande putte vnder guydyng sayd eudo made kynge stede whyche myghtly defendyd lande daunger enymyes ouer yt caused sayde charlys symple noryshed broughte vp wyth moste dylygence informed exercysed wyth vertues doctrine thynges necessarye vnto prynces son finally noble vertuous knyghte eudo knew yt shulde dye called hym lordes noble fraunce yt whych charched solemne othe deth immedyatly shulde crowne charlis theyr kyng dyed soone hadde reygned affermeth authours terme ix yeres anglia clxxix chapiter edwarde surnamed elder son aluredus began reygne ouer ye part england ye yere lord ix hundred one vii yere eudo kynge fraunce lower hys father letter connynge hygher honoure worshyp fyrst wife son named ethelstane whych kynge hym seconde wyfe two sonnes edredus edwynus vii doughters ye thyrd wyfe receyued two sonnes edmunde edrede two doughters edburga edgina fyrste iii wyfes hyght edwyna second hyght edgina thyrde named ethleeswyda ye forenamed vii doughters second wife one named alunda almyda maryed fyrst otto emperour nother named algina maryed charlis symple kyng west frauce yogest doughters sayth policronica wedded vnto lewys kyng guyan therof speketh nothyng frenche cronicle set sonnes scole doughters sette woll worke takyng exemple charlis conquestour authoryte formosus pope made vii byshoppes enlande wherof ordeyned v west saxon one southe saxon one mercia dorchester also munkes wynchester sayd father alurede walkyd caused hym remoued vnto new abbay v yere reygne clyto ethelwaldus nere kynnesman rebellyd agayn hym occupyed ye towne wymborne besydes bathe toke then force nunne went then vnto danys dwellyng northuberlande excyted ryse agayn kyng edwarde kynge pursued hym sharpely constrayned leue countrey sayled fraunce lefte nune behynde hym whych kynge caused restoryd agayn house yt taken fro nexte yere folowyng sayd clito wyth copany landed eest englande gaderyd hym ye danys countrey theyr ayde destroyed pylled countrey crekynforde criklade passed ye ryuer thamis spoyled land bradenestoke fro then retourned eest anglia yt norffolke suffolke kynge folowed enymyes spoyled theyr landes whyche helde composycyon ryuer owse bordure saynte edmundus lande commaundynge hys knyghtes hys hoste none shulde dragge tarye hys hoste fere beclyppyd theyr enmyes kentyshe men whych trusted myche theyr owne strength dysobeyed commaundement wherfore danys awaytynge theyr praye fyll vppon bushementes slewe partye theym wherwyth kyng sore dyscontentyd soone bothe hostes mette longe fyght clyto wyth many danys slayne remenaunt constrayned seche peace whyche graunted vppon certayne condycyons shulde holde theym wythin boundes theym lymytted ouer paye yerely certayne money waye trybute whyche peace wyth stablyshed repayred cytyes townes castellys sayde danys shatered broken viii yere reygne kynge edwarde repayred wally also cytye kaerlyon called chester whych great helper etheldred duke mercia elfleda wyfe doughter alurede shewyd suster kynge edwarde done kynge buylded stronge castell herforde ye egge walys enlarged greatly ye walles chester yt castell whych tyme wyth wall wythin ix yere reygn etheldred duke mercia cousayll wyfe traslated ye bone ye holy kyng oswald fro bradony gloucestre buylded fayre monastery worshyp saynt peter xii yere kyng edwardes reygne dane repentynge theyr couenauntes made myndyng entedyng ye breche assebled hoste met ye kynge staffordeshyre place called toten halle soone wodenesseylde whyche ii place kynge slew two kynges two erlys many thousandes danys occupyed countrey northumberlande soon dyed noble man etheldredus duke erle mercia myddell englande whose deth kynge myche hadde often prouyd wysedome toke rule countrey hys wyfe elfleda london alonely exceptyd whyche toke vnder onwe rule clxxx chapiter noble woman elfleda yf shulde shewe vertues yt shuld aske long tyme leasure amonges noble dedes buylded newly repayred many townes cytyes castellys tomworth besyde lychefeld stafforde warwyke shrowesbury watrysbury eldysbury forest besyde chester nowe ouer tourned destroyed also buylded cytye wyth castell northe ende mercia vpon yt ryuer merce dayes named runcofan yt called runcorn also buylded brydge ouer ryuer seuern whyche named brymmysburye brydge stronge virago fauour cytezeyns fere enymyes halpe myche kyng brother gyuynge counsayll buyldynge cytyes told hadde one assayed wo sorowe woman fele suffer berynge chylde hated enbrasynge husband euer toke wytnesse god sayde yt couenyent semely kinges doughter vse flesshely lykynge wherof suche sorowe shuld ensue folowe xiii yere reygne edwarde great nauy danys whych tyme alurede driuen fraunce retourned agayn sayled west cou trey landed dyuers place toke prayes went theyr shyppes agayn one time amoges robbed spoyled place called irchynfeylde toke brytyshe byshop caryed hym theyr shyppes fynally raunsomed hym xl pounde soone kynge edwarde knowlege theyr beyng assembled knyghtes sped hym westwarde lande sent nother hoste shyppe encounter danys vppon see wherof heryng sayd danys fledde irlande course voyded land handes kynge kynge strengthynge countrey made castell mouth water auene nother castell bokyngham thyrd faste therby yt meane vpon eyther syde ye ryuer owseone retourned northamtonshyre bedfordshyre faughte wyth danys coutres length subdued wyth theyr leder duke called turketyllus xvii yere kynges reygned elfleda lady mercia mynded gaderyd knightes brytons walshe men brake lande brekenoke wyth people wythstode theym amonge prysoners prayes toke quene walshemen yere folowynge kynge edwarde buylded newly reedyfyed townes towsetour wygmore destroyed castell danys hadde made temesforde yere noble elfleda wanne towne derby power danys put adueture foure knyghtes whyche called gardeyns corp slayne faste ye xviii yere reygne dyed noble pryncesse elfleda moneth iune buryed monastery saynt peter lorde tyme hadde buylded wythin towne gloucetour aboue touched ouer bone holy kynge saynte oswalde whyche monastery throwen grounde danys aldredus byshop yorke worcetour made whyche chefe house abbay towne cytye elfleda deed doughter named elswyna helde lordeshyppe mercia season kynge cosydered yt great thynge rule therfore dyscharged therof ioyned kyngedome wythout stryfe dyuers townes kepte kyng tyme snotyngham nothyngam tomworth derbye supposynge doughter wold haue defended mother lyfe done finally came kynges subieccyon henry archbyshoppe huntyngdon wrote myche cronycles englande prayse thys noble woman elfleda made dyuers dytyes whyche ben expressyd foloweth cesers tryuphes myche prayse elfleda sheldes ofte dyd rayse agayne enymyes noble ven queresse uirago made whose vertue expresse edwarde hadde reconciled foresayde townes buylded new towne agayn olde towne nothyngham south syde ryuer trent made brydge ouer sayd ryuer betwene sayd ii twones wytnessyth policronica yere folowynge sayde towne cytye notyngham two kinges saye scotlande walys yeldyd vnto kynge edwarde cause warre betwene theym contynued hym expressyd yt dyuers bokes writer cronycles englande marian scot wyllam malmesbury henry huntyngdon yt shewyd edwarde subdued kynges scotlande cubrys aboute ix yere hys reygne sayde authours yt also testifyed xx yere reygne sayde edwarde sayde kynges scottes cumbrys shulde chose kynge edwarde theyr chefe lord patrone whyche shuld season expressyd noble prynce edwarde thynges set hym order northe ende mercia ryuer merce buylded cytye towne named yt thylwall strengthyd yt wyth knyghtes repayred cytye maynchester sore defaced warre ye danys notable dedis ye puyssaunt prynce fynyshed wyth maryage hys chylder many whyche omytte passe ouer length tyme fynally noble man dyed hadde reygned wyth great trauayle terme xxiiii yeres faryngdon then conueyed wynchester enteryd monastery saynt swythyne leuyng hym dyuers sonnes shewed ethelstane eldest francia clxxxi chapiter charlys surnamed symple sonne lewys iiii ryen fayzand began hys reygne ouer frenchemen yere lordes incarnacyon wytnessyth iacob philippus ix hundred iiii thyrde yere edwarde elder kynge englande tyme whose reygne danys whyche contynuelly ouer terme l wynters saye ye x yere charlys ballyd somtyme kynge fraunce vnto ye sayd dayes wasted spoyled lande wythstandyng ye agrementes made bytwene charlys emperour ye story iiii lewys shewed yet wyth greate hostes aryued cou tre neustria normandy robbed spoyled countre slewe people thereof wythout pytye cytye cytye kepte theyr iourney tyll came vnto cytye roan wherof bysshop beynge greate drede subuersyon cytye destruccyon crysten people wyth delyuered cytye appoyntment wyth ye people myghte departe then wythout bodely harme whyche vnto sayde danys greate strength hurte lande fraunce thys hoste danys ruler leder myscreaunt named rollo whyche man lowe byrthe greate strength whyche whan season rested hym hys hoste refresshed wythin cytye roan set forth hys waye co maudyng hys vawnewarde kepe theyr iourney towarde parys ye spede made shypped hys danis ryght one parte sent ryuer sean seconde ryuer lyger leyr thyrde water geronde danys passyd ryuer leyr came length cyte nauntes wan cytye strength slewe therin moche people byshop named guymerte beynge masse slewe aulter whan spoyled cytye countre yode cytye angiers brent robbyd cruelly done yode vnto towres layde syege cytye presens holy body saynt martyne whych tyme wythin ye cytye whyle preserued soone munkes feryng sworde danys fled cytye secretly toke body wyth soone dane towne theyr wyll brent abbay town stadynge without towne spoyled robbed cytye townes thorough countre guyan whan danys thus subdued parte neustria normandy wyth theyr duke rollo ye ryuer seyn drewe towarde parys fyrst entred landes burgoyne auerne effecte senons wherof heryng monkes monastery flory body saynte benet rested toke holy treasoure bare vnto orlyaunce layde chyrche saynt anyan tyll persecucyon ouer passed thys monastery dayes lyuynge defensour promyse made whose name latyne called sigillosus frech sigillophes erle whych taken patrone abbaye nyght folowynge monkes fled sayd saynt benet appered blamed hym yt none wyse defended ye place hys sepulture wyth whych visyon sayd erle beynge feryd gaderyd vnto hym vpon daye folowyng small power myghte make set vpon danys draue backe slewe great nomber ye prayes wan offered god saynte benet whose prayer knewe well opteyned vyctory tyme yt danys thus persecuted countre fraunce kynge power resyst mych charles knew well bysshop roan named franke good fauour rollo therfore sent hym ambassade sayd rollo requyre trewe trewse thre monethes whych grauted trewse ended sayd rollo beseged cytye chartrys duryng whiche syege duke burgoyne named richarde wyth hys retynue assayled danys tyme fyght ebalde erle poytowe present draue backe ye danys wherwyth bysshop cytye beynge encoraged toke wyth hym ye smocke lady whyche dayes kepte wyth greate reuerence wyth cytesyns issued cytye made vpon danys great scomfyture prowesse foresayde two temporall lordes assystens spyrituall man rollo compelled fle forsake siege without huge slaughter rollo hauynge greate dysdayne dyspleasure thys ouerthrowe scumfyture hys danys reassembled abrode scatered comaunded ouer ryde countre destroye myght whych comaundement thus gyuen cruell people slewe man woman chylde apte seruyce brent chyrches temple rauyshed virgyns well religious miserable beholde greate abhomynacyon tyrannous danys brent robbed slewe innocent people wythout mercy lordes comons thus beset cruell fury theyr enmyes assembled sondry copanyes went vnto kynge shewynge vnto hym theyr mysery blamed durste hys ferefulnesse negligence none hym otherwyse wythstode crueltye danys hadde destroyed greate parte hys lande clxxxii chapiter charlys herynge exclamacyon hys subgettes co syderyng hys lacke power withstande malyce hys enemyes ryght pensyfe heuy hys herte castynge hys mynde many sondry wayes lastly determyned sende agayne aboue named frank byshop roan vnto rollo prynce danys shewynge hym yf wolde renye hys pagan lawe become crysten man wolde hym gyue maryage gylda doughter wyth hole countre neustria dowar whan rollo receyued tydynges kyng mouth frende frank somwhat attempred hys fury crueltye condescended trewe counsayle hys lordes ye terme iii monethes whyche tyme myghte haue comunycacyon wyth kynge ferther processe thys mater concluded counsayle bothe prynces theyr metynge shulde vpon ye ryuer flode named ept shortly sayd prynces comunycacyon one wyth theyr people standynge vpon eyther syde sayd ryuer concluded rollo shulde forsake hys pagan lawe take vppon hym lyuerey crystes baptym marye forenamed gylda receyue wyth aboue shewed whyche conclusyon thus taken eyther fro departed shortly cytye roan foresayd couenautes executed fulfylled whan sayd rollo crystened name chaunged called robert erle poytowe whyche receyued hym fonte stone thys rollo robert dyscended lynyally duke wyllyam normandy whych conquered england shalbe clerely shewed robert thus crystened seased coutre neustria kynge created duke named hym duke neustria longe yt name neustria chaunged called normandye name normayns men commyng north meane north men whyche two syllable togyder make norman man north whyche norman danys exposycyon mayster gagwyne shulde descended nacyon called gothes whyche gothes cytye men sithica ben descended whyche gothys dayes grete costantine theyr feersnesse cruelty dryuen theyr countre inhabyted nere vnto ryuer called thamys ye north partyes europe nowe ben inhabyted dacia whych speche called demarke men holde opynyon danys saxon shulde one maner people may congruly folowe saxon ben coutre germany contayne lande sayenge strabo west parte germania flode called uistergus wysera vnto famous ryuer called ryne dacia denmarke north partyes retorne thys rollo robert story sayth yt became good crysten man token wherof affermeth french boke gaue vnto dyuers chyrches monasteryes fraunce greate gyftes well possession mouable goodes contynued hys pea kyng promised whyche pea thus stablysshed bytwene kynge danys robert brother vnto eudo last kyng frauce contrary hys trouth allegyaunce seased certayne cytyes holdes kynges enherytaunce wherfore kynge seynge coude refourme hym errour meanes entreaty lyke wayes assembled hoste met wyth hym playne batayle whych ye sayde robert slayne thys robert hadde suster whyche maryed vnto hebert erle uermendoys whyche erle herynge deth brother lawe enticement hys wyfe story demeth mette kynge retorne felde requyred hym moste humble wyse wolde vouchesafe lodge wyth hym hys manour called castell perone kynge castynge parell thanked hym hys kynde request grauted go wyth hym receyued fested wyth honoure whan thys erle hadde conueyed kynges frendes strength hym tha kepte prisoner murdred hym neuer came large whyche tydynges certaynly knowe algina wyfe vnto sayd charlys symple mystrustynge frenchman wyth fewe accopanyed toke secrete shyppyng wyth yonge sonne named lewys sayled englande comforted fader edwarde surnamed elder thus ended reygne thys charlys symple whan hadde reygned sayeng uynsent hystoryall terme xvi yere full leuynge hym foresayde chylde named lewys clxxxiii chapiter radulphus sonne rycharde duke burgoyne began reygne ouer frechmen yere lorde ix hundred xxii xxi yere edwarde ye elder kynge englande noted mych algina wyfe vnto charlys symple thus secretly voyded ye lande fraunce wyth sonne lewys lande myghte wyth ruler lordes assembled parys toke theyr counsayle admyssyon hed kyng lande lordes longe debatynge mater fynally agreed thys abouer amed radulphus rauf son duke burgoyne aboue sayd nexte heyre crowne shulde admytted kynge admytted whyche lytell hys dedes put memory except tyme hys reygne sarasyns entred lande burgoyne wyth grete armye dyd mych harme duchy wherfore kynge gaderynge hoste met wyth place called latyne carrolas french callo lasse frenchman vyctours nat wythout greate losse theyr people foloweth whanne thys rauff ruled lande frauce ye space xii yeres dyed issue male buryed chyrche saynte calumb prouynce senys anglia clxxxiiii chapiter ethelstan ye son edwarde elder began hys reygne ouer part englande ye yere lorde ix hundred xxv thyrde yere rauff kynge fraunce fyrst yere reygne ethelstan holy chyld dunstane borne coutre glastenbury whose lyfe shone wyth many myracles somtyme abbot glaste bury lastly archbyshop caunterbury whose holynes phecyes shewed length vi chapyter xvi tytle worke called sin antonini legende chyrche also seconde yere reygne ethelstane vnytye peace hadde betwene kyng danis northumberland maryed sithyric theyr kyng suster v yeres sithyricus dyed whose deth seasyd countrey hys owne hande put oute sonne foresayd sythyricus hadde thus accorded wyth danys northumberlande shortly made subiect costantyn kynge scottes sayd co stantyne meked hym lowely kynge restoryd hym hys former dygnytye wherfore sayd constantyne sayde prayse kynge yt honour make kynge kynge whyche acte done affyrmaunce polycronycon yere grace ix hundred xxvi saynge shuld seconde yere reygn ethelstane testyfyed policronica thys ethelstane shuld marye one susters named editha edyth vnto otto fyrst name emperour almayne receyued hym many precyous iewellys relyques speketh nothyng cronicle romaynes howe yt yt shewyd foresayd ottho otto wyfe named alunda whych sayde storye edward elder myght doughter sayd edward edgina seconde wyfe uincentius historialis sayth henry duke saxony whyche father vnto fyrste otto sent vnto ethelstane requyrynge hym hys suster mary vnto sonne otto whych reason maye folowe ottho maryed suster ethelstane edythe foresayde iewelles sent otto one precyouse vessell stone called onechynus whych suche clerenesse also subtily craftely wrought yt apperyd mannes syght grene corne hadde growen wythin yt moued waued corne doth standyng felde ouer yt apperyd vynes burgenyng berynge fruyte men also syght mouynge styrynge also receyued great constantynes sworde wherin grauen wyth great letter golde name owner hyltes therof coueryd wyth great plate golde one nayles fastenyd crosse sayd sworde criste suffred passyon thys reporte saynge polycronycon varyeth former sayng reporteth two sayd nayles spent vppon brydell sayde constantyne thyrde nayle caste daugerous swalowe see rehersed lxix chapiter thys worke also receyued spere charlys gret whych opynyon wryters spere longeus opened wyth crystes syde baner saynte morys relyque greate pryce wyth part holy crosse parte crown thorne sauyoure whych iewellys kyng ethelstane gaue parte vnto saynte swithunys wynchester gaue vnto ye abbay malmesbury haue sene cronycle englad testyfyeth ethilstan ye fyrst kynge euer enoynted land yt fynd therof lytell authorytye excepte guydo testyfyen crowned kynges towne nowe called kyngestone x myles london athelyne archbyshoppe caunterbury proueth argueth hym fyrste reason ryghte fader edwarde crowned plemounde archbyshoppe sayde see guydo aforesayd affyrmeth alurede graund fader thys ethylstane enoyntyd kyng authoryte leo ye v pope wherfore agreeth better shulde fyrste yt foloweth story aboute viii yere reygne thys ethilstane dyed frystane byshoppe wynchester brystane byshoppe hym yt radde sange euery daye masse crysten soules byshoppe brystane went vppon nyght chirch yerde sayde hys deuocyons crysten soules lastly sayde requiescant pace harde voyce yt hadde ben great hoste people saynge amen soone constantyne kynge scottes brake couenaunt wyth kynge ethylstane wherfore assembled knyghtes made towarde scotlande hys way tourned saynte iohn beuerley offeryd hys knyfe vppon aulter sayenge yf retourned wyth vyctorye shulde redeme hys knyfe wyth noble pryce done proceded vppon hys iourney coclusyon scomfyted scottes broughte theym agayne vnto dewe subieccyon accordynge promyse made retourned yorke chyrche corp saynt iohn beuerley laye redemynge knyfe worthely hadde promysed vi chapyter vi boke polycronycon yt remembred kynge ethilstane subduynge scottes beyng wyth hys lordes famylyers nere vnto castell dunbar prayed god saynte iohn yf beuerley countrey myght leue remembraunce token lyuynge also suche shulde come myghte knowe scottes ryghte shulde subiectes englyshmen soone wyth hys sworde smote vppon great stone standyng nere vnto sayd castell whyche stroke stone ryuen elle length tyme edwarde thyrde remaynyng sene whyther daye yt doute ye haue harde kynge ethilstane deth sythericus kynge northumberlande seasyd lande prouynce hys owne handes putte sonne whyche allyed hym constantyne kynge scottes maryed doughter whose styrynge exhortacyon gatheryd company danys scottes entred mouth humber wyth stronge nauy wherof herynge ethilstane goodly haste prepared hys armye length met wyth hym people place called brymforde hadde great solemne vyctorye yt shewyd foresayde chapyter boke kynge helpe god saynt adelyne hadde defended subtyll assaute made vppon hym nyghte enymyes vppon morne helpe hys brother edmunde dodo archbyshoppe chased sayde enymyes slew constantyne kynge scottes v small vnder kynges xii duke wyth partye strauge nacyons ye tyme gaderyd whyche batayll shuld done meanyng sayd policronicon ye last yere reygn clxxxv chapiter also testyfyed dyuers wryters ethylstane vyctory thus obteyned danys scottes scottes danys also subdued northe brytons dwelled herforde compelled theym pay hym yerely tribute iii hu dred pounde syluer xxv hundred hede nete xx pounde gold guydo sayth kynge ethilstane caused come hym herforde cytye ruler north brytayne wyth suche communycacyon forced graunte vnto hym yerely trybute xx pounde gold iii hundred poude syluer heddes nete xxv hundred wyth dogges haukes certayne nomber whych vyctories went vnto exeter repayred yt wally therof suffycyently dane iohn lydgate munke somtyme saynt edmundes bury made goodly treatyse kyng ethilstane shewynge great persecucyon danys yt constrayned call wynchester great counsayll lordes longe debatyng mater dyuers ambassades message sent ye kyng danys fastly cocluded kynge shuld puruey hym champyon fyghte wyth colibronde colbronde geaunt dane danys appoynted theyr cheuetayne wherfore kyng enserchyng thorough landes knyght myght none fynde great daunger dystresse heuynesse mych well perceuyd ye mannes power fayled aduyse lordes spyrituall temporall fyll fastynge prayer cotynued therin certayn time wyth perfyte charitable deuocyon tyme whyche sayde abstynence vysyon shewed vnto ethilstane cofortyng hym also co maundyng hym yt erely vppon next mornynge shuld stand north gate citye winchester shuld fynde amonges ye porayll pylgryme clad palmer wede whome shulde chose champyon whyche vysyon thus hym shewyd dyd accordyngly founde man goodly stature somdeale stryken age clade monyshed vysyon wherof fyrste gaue vnto god thankynges made request pylgryme wold take vpon hym thys batayll defence lande whyche layde hym many reasonable excuse well age otherwise finally grauted ye kyng fullfyll request comaundement daye lymytted assygned met feld forenamed geaunt called colbronde wythoute gate ye cytye medow pasture called hydemede betwene two faughten longe cruell fyghte kynge great fere hys champyon fynally helpe god pylgryme wanne honoure fyghte slew geaunt excedynge stature therunto great passynge strength whyche vyctorye pylgryme thus grace obteyned kynge wyth barony fette hym citye wynchester wyth solemne processyon co ueyed hym vnto cathedral chirch thanked god wyth great deuocyon offryd axe wyth whych slayn danys champyon whych oblacyon dew reuerence obseruances hym fynyshed kynge caused hym conueyed vnto hys courte taryed nyght wyth myche daunger vppon morne erely made suche meanes wolde nedely departe yt apparell yt came thyther kynge aduertysed pylgryme wold hastly departe entendyd haue holden wyth hym courte haue endowed ryche possessyons co maunded hym broughte vnto hys presence sawe coude cause tary required hym shewe name wherof also besought kyng pardon hym wherfore kyng cosyderyng hys hasty departynge wyth many thynges hym consydered desyrous haue hym knowlege effectuose desyre pylgryme perceyuyd coude wyth kynges pleasure departe wythoute dysclosynge hys name sayde myght dyscouer hys name wythin walles cytye wythoute offence hys conscyence wherfore kyng graunted go wyth hym tyll brode feldes uppon whyche graunt thus made kynge commaunded dyuers great gyftes hym presented whyche vtterly refused shortely coclude kyng wyth certayne lordes conueyed sayd pylgryme vnto townes ende thyther co men requyred performaunce promyse thys pylgryme syttynge one kne besoughte kynge especyall grace wolde put parte lordes myghte shewe vnto hym name onely whyche done moste humble wyse besoughte hym wolde kepe hys name secrete space xxiiii oures ye kyng affyrmaunce hym fyrmely made shewed vnto hym hys naturall lyege man subiect name guy warwike whyche tydynges kyng ioyous offeryd hym newe many ryche rewardes gyftes vayne wolde nothynge receyue kynge lastely departed wyth wepynge eyen affyrmeth sayde authoure farre warwyke wyldernesse purchased goddes purueyaunce lodgynge heremytage terme two yeres dwelled kept harde lyfe herynge dame felyce owne wyfe fed dayly xiii poore men cristes sake went thyther sondry tymes fette aimes hys sayde wyfe lyenge castell warwyke knowynge man tyll lastely visited sore sykenes knew well shuld dye wherefore sente hys weddynge rynge vnto hys wyfe requyrynge haste come speke wyth hym whych obeyed humble wyse sped vnto sayd heremytage wyth womanly dylygence fande hym deed commynge besprent many salt tere enfourmed messenger dyed buryed hym ryghte ouer saith sayd authour monyshed sayd messenger shulde prouyde selfe shuld also alter mortall lyfe xv day folowyng also obeyed made suche prouisyon place buryed hym whyche mater sayde dane iohn lydgate affyrmeth toke boke gerarde cambres whyche wrote mych dedes storyes prynces englande policronica authour testyfyen sayde lydgate ende sayde treatyse wytnessyth mater folowynge appereth authorite mater translacyon sentece laten made cronycler called old gerardus cambrece whyche wrote dedes wyth great dylygence weste saxon crowned kynges greatly comendyd theyr knyghtly excellence guy warwyke hys famouse wrytynges al whyche sayde treatyse shewyd length meter viii stauys maner precedentes dylygent labour sayde dane iohn lydgate whyche haue sette mych yt concernyth mater done tyme reygne thys ethylstane whyche accorde moste wryters broughte thys lande agayne one monarchye reygned kynge therof full terme xvi yeres buryed monastery malmysbury leuynge hym chylde wherfore rule land fyll vnto edmunde brother francia clxxxvi chapiter lewys sonne charlis ye symple beganne hys reygne ouer frenchman ye yere lorde ix hundred xxxiiii ix yere ethelstane kynge englande ye haue harde ende storye charlys ye symple elgina quene wyth lewys yonger sonne fledde england father edward elder wherfore ye lordes frau ce knowynge chylde gone chose forenamed rauf theyr kynge whose deth said lordes frauce beynge ascertayned beynge sayd lewys england sent vnto hym archbyshop senys hughe surnamed le graunde desyrynge hym restore fraunce take therof possessyon elgina herynge message lordes trustyng vnto counsayll frendes made redy wyth son sayled shortly fraunce receyued wyth myche honour shortly crowned sonne lewys kynge cytye laon lewys named ye v lewys thyrde yere whose reygne fyll scarcytye corne vytayll reason wherof ensued great famyn myche people voyded realme many dyed defaut wytnesseth frenche cronycle quarter whete worth xx poude ye money value sterlynge money l kyng beryng mynd murder treason done agayn father hebert storye charlis symple declared cast ymagined mynde myght wythout shedynge blood reuenge deth fader many ymagynacyons thought reuolued mynde lastely dyuysed letter whych charged seruaunt brynge hys presence sette amonge lordes counsayll kynge lewys hadde compassed hys mynde nedes hys realme called great cousayll barony laon whyther amonges sayde heberte erle uermendoys warned come kynge ascertayned theyr commynges apoynted secrete copanye harnes secrete chamber nere vnto place sayde counsayll conuenient tyme yode vnto lordes wyth hym hadde season commoned wyth hys lordes suche mater hym lyked sodeynly came one hym sayd man comen wyth letter dyrected hys grace oute englande whych commaunded broughte vnto hys syghte kyng hadde vnfolde letter radde parte therof smyled whereof lordes beynge ware purposed kynge haue receyued iewyllys ioyous nouellys oute englande whyle kynge aboute delyuer letter scribe secretory one hys lordes sayde vnto hym syr truste ye haue iocande mery tydynges oute englade ye haue cause smilyng shall shewe cause sayde kyng dwellyngin england kynnesman myne named harman whych man gret myghte myne especyall frende shewyth letter husbandeman vyleyne badde requyred hys lorde vnto howse dyner vnder coloure therof slewe hys sayde lorde sayde harman thynketh law lande fauourable haynous dede hetherfore writeth haue myne aduyse thys mater wherfore sen ye present praye shewe opynyons mater whych one voyce sayde yt murderer worthy suffer moste shamefull cruell deth hanged strangled rope ye kynge wolde certaynely enfourmed consentes theym began hygest pursued theym tyll came hebert erle uerme doys whych alowed sentece hadde done kynge made token ye walshemen betwene hym appoynted ye anon present sette sure hold vppon sayde hebert kynge sayd hebert thou art husbondman vilayne yt haue spoken whych slew lord vnder colour byddynge gestynge hym hys house traytoursly thou dydeste requyre lorde father vnder thyne house castell peron remembrynge kyndnes hym dayes shewyd thyne allegyauntes trouthe toward hym thou shuldest haue borne kept hym lyke prysoner lastely murderyd hym greate daunger agayne god world shame wherfore accordynge thy desert thyne sentence iudgemet take thy reward guardon whyche sentence thus gyuen kynge sayde hebert executers ladde vnto hylle wythout citye laon shamefully hanged whych hyll cause named hebertes hyll longe tyme thys tyme seconde duke normandy named wyllyam longa spata ye son rollo robert fyrste duke normandy slayne treason one arnolde erle flaudres encheson sayd wyllyam ayded noble man pycardy named herloyn agayne sayde arnolde wyllyam left hym son named richarde whych tyme father deth suffycient age rule gret dukedome wherfore lewys kynge fraunce desyrous prouynce whyche late dayes belonged antecessours progenitours sought besyly wayes meanes haue chylde rycharde vnder tuycyon gydynge brynge effecte spedde hym vnto roan callynge hym lordes ruler countrey hauynge vnto many plesaunt fayre wordes promysyng ayde assystence reuenge deth theyr lorde duke conclusyon desyred yt myght haue noryshynge bryngyng vp chylde tyll came hys lawfull age whyche thynge thus kynge desyred lordes anon coniectured theyr myndes yt desyred kepyng theyr yonge lord ye ende yt myghte ye easely obteyne possession dukedome whych lordes cytye great rumour grudge agayne kynge wherof beynge monyshed appeace multytude kynge toke chylde armes bare hym place assemble people shewyd vnto theym wyth affyrmaunce great othes hys entent onely ye wele child defence hys countrey clayme ryghte tytle duchy excepte onely homage therof whyche belongeth hym iuste tytle meane whyche fayre speche kynge obteyned purpose caried chyld hym frau ce forgetynge vnkynde dealynge norman arnolde erle flaudres vnderstode kynge frauce guydynge ye yonge chyld commytted ferynge yt wyth power norman wolde ronne vppon hym reuengynge chyldes father deth sent vnto kyng x pounde weyghte golde wherof euery pounde coteyneth xii ounce euery ouce value fyne gold xl rate presente shulde value ye summe ii hundred xl pounde yt mayster gagwyne sayth sent vnto hym xl marke besechyng good gracyous lorde gyue hasty credence hys accusours suche wyse wolde declare hym selfe delyuer vnto kynge murderer duke wyllyam meane wherof shulde certaynly know innocete sayd duke deth ouer made frende kynge whyche spake good wordes hym put kynges mynde great hurtes iniuryes progenytours hadde susteyned danys norman meane whereof murdour forgoten kyng malygned agayne norman chylde bare good mynde men thoughte wolde uppon daye kyng retourned hys dysporte huntynge lyght coplaynt brouht hym chylde rycharde offence commytted rebuked otherwyse syttyng honour called hym opprobryously thretened hym greuously caused hym kept straytly hadde vsed chylde rycharde assygned mayster teacher named osmunde whyche osmunde hadde famylyer named iuon two apperceyuynge kynges indygnacyon bare towarde chyld studyed enlargynge lastly cousaylyd hym shuld fayne hym self syke whych done suche wyse suche awayted vppon hym supposed hym syke reason wherof kepers toke lesse cure hym wherof osmunde beynge ware also beynge sure kynge made great trusse herbes grasse wherin wrapped chyld conueyed hym oute cytye laon receyued hym horse redy iourney sped hym vnto cosuy delyueryd chylde captayne town thes rode nyght tyll came vnto senlys shewed hys doynge vnto ye erle coutrey named bernard nere kynnesman vnto ye yonge duke clxxxvii chapiter bernarde hauynge knowlege escape kynnesma rycharde sente haste vnto hugh le graunde erle parys haue ayde assystence whych without taryeng assebled knyghtes conueyed chylde cousy senlys saynlys neuewe bernarde receyued wyth mych ioye honoure lewys ascertayned scape rycharde howe guydynge hughe great graunde anon sent vnto hym gyuynge hym commaundement shulde restore chyld hym whyche excused hym sayde chylde kepynge erle bernarde hys kynge seynge deluded sente arnolde arnulfe erle flaundres whyche co maundement counsayled kynge wynne hugh le graude riche behestes gyftes whose counsayll worchynge kynge lewys wylled sayd hugh mete hym crosse compeyn sayd hugh shortly met kynge whome kynge promysed great parte duchy normandy wyth wolde refuse partye norman take parte agayne meane promise erle hugh ouercome agreed kynge warre vppon one parte countrey whyle warred vpon forthwyth receyuyd armye kynge spedde hym bayon made cruell warre vppon countrey kynge lewys entryd vppon prouynce caux wasted spoyled coste myghte whan barnarde dane also barnarde erle senlys conceyued ye vntrouth hugh le graut also greate hostes beset wyth theyr counsayles sent vnto kynge certayne messenger gyuynge commaundement saye vayne kynge hadde entred countre armye citye roan prouince hys commaundement besechynge hym waste spoyle cou tre ayde helpe defende agayne theyr enemyes thys message kynge ryght fayne forthwith sped tyll came roan wher accordynge hys honour receyued whyche cause sent hast vnto arnulfe erle flauders monassynge hym sease warres bayon tyll receyued farther knowlege kyng thus restyng roan deuysed hys mater hys pleasure normayns obeyed hys requestes ye good aberynge barnarde dane agayne kynge graunted hym gydynge yonge duke whan shulde departe ordeyned hys deputye one named raoull rauf whyche kynges departure behaued hym cruelly norman irke hym ouer thys foresayd barnard ferynge kynges retorne greuous punysshement hadde susteyned sent messenger vnto grolle kynge denmarke beynge chyerbourk wyllyng hym assemble people make two hostes wherof sende ye one lande water entre coutre normandy wastyng spoylynge reason wherof myghte brynge kynge comunycacyon whych done sayd barnarde deuysed whan kynge wyttyng danys wyth grete multytude entred prouynce normandy assembled hys hoste sped hym thytherwarde processe tyme came vnto cytye roane hys counsayle condyscended metynge frendly communycacyon shulde bytwene kynge sayd grolle place called frenche herlycum day appoynted bothe prynces mette wyth bothe hostes standynge hauynge lytell dystauce whyle two prynces communycacyon deth murder duke willm dane markynge herloyne whose cause shewed duke willm slayne spere wounded hym greuously dyed forthwyth whych dede hys brother called lambert wyth ye frenchman entendynge reuenge wyth theyr wepons fylle vppon danys whyche receyued greate vyolence fraye ensued skyrmysshe skyrmysshe sore batayle bothe hostes ioyned bothe sydes faught cruelly eyther longe whyle ende frenchman worse compelled flee kynge saue hys lyfe fledde also whyche reason hys vntrusty horse taken kepte secrete certayne tyme taker lastly discouered brougth cytye roane prysoner kynge thus beynge holde vnder kepynge danys engeberge hys wyfe makynge hym grete dole sorowe toke iourney kynge germany whose doughter besechyng hym prouyde delyuerye lorde husbande hym socour rather dysco fort shewyng trowble husbande susteyned well deserued vnstedfastnesse agayne wyllyam duke rycharde hys sonne vsed wherfore quene beynge thus answered father rode vnto hugh le graunde besechyng hym helpe greate nede request quene sent vnto barnard erle senlys requiryng moue wayes danys enlargynge kynge whose labour meany lastely counsayle kepte saynt clere vpon ryuer ept many argumentes reason made fynally agreed kyng shulde enlarged tyll day comunycacyon layenge pledge hys sonne heyre named lothayr bysshop senlys ye bysshop beauuayze whyche done kynge set large forth wyth rode vnto cytye laon abode daye co munycacyon whyche holden ye foresayd ryuer ept concluded pea whyche lasted shorte whyle thys pea thus confermed grollo kynge danys wyth greate gyftes retorned whens desyred richarde yonge duke toke vpon hym rule hys owne signory grewe encreased forthwardly wherof hugh graunde takyng hede beholdynge hys wyse demeanure conuersacyon made suche labour meanes vnto barnarde erle senlis yt maried doughter named emmacet wherof beynge enfourmed french kynge caste hys mynde thys greate alyaunce bytwene yonge duke two grete perys hys lande thoughte yt iii kn amyte alyaunce shulde dysturbe hym whan lyked wherof called hym arnold erle flaunders whose counsayle sent sayde arnolde vnto ottho kynge germany requyrynge hym ayde warre vpon ye normayns breke thys affynyte thys yonge duke hugh le graunde barnarde erle senlys labour shuld haue hym hys heyres prouynce lordshyp lorayne ottho wyth thys couetous promesse deceyued assebled knyghtes day place appoynted met wyth kynge wyth theyr people sped roan layde siege vnto ye cytye whyle kynges occupyed wastynge brennynge vylages nere vnto cytye put norman fere ottho sent hys neuewe wyth certayne hys people secrete wyse gate cytye whan comen gate opened towarde ryuer sayn thoughte wynne hys enterpryse ye cytesyns issued vppon hym sodeynly gaue hym batayle slewe hym many hys company remenaunt chased fro walles cytye whan ottho wyttyng ouerthrowe hys men deth neuew entyrely loued made inward heuynesse caste minde myght reuenge deth hys neuewe whan approched cytye behelde strength therof wyth also fyersnesse normades repented hym enterprysyng iourney torned hys hatered vnto arnolde erle flaunders whose sterynge counsayle vyage fyrste begon mych sought meanes brynge ye sayd arnolde handes norman wherof arnolde beynge warned trussed stuffe harneys secretly nyght stale away retorned flaunders retynew whych thyng knowen two kynges secrete wise myghte departed also ye siege yet therof theyr enmyes beynge ware pursued slewe many theyr company yere thys done rone hys full compas lewys kynge dyed buryed temple holy bysshoppe saynte remygius wythin cytye raynys whan reygned great trouble xxi yeres leuynge hys heyre sonne named lothayr anglia clxxxviii chapiter edmunde ye brother ethelstan sonne edwarde elder ethelwyda thyrde wyfe sayd edwarde bega hys reygne ouer englande yere lorde ix hundred xl vii yere v lewys tha kynge fraunce fyrste yere hys reygne danys northumberland rebelled agayne hym make theyr party stroger sent prynce danys named aulaffe beynge irlande brought wyth hym prynce ruler danys named reygnald wyth great hoste danys strauge nacyons entred foresayd countre warred vppon next border wastynge spoylynge inhabytautes wherof whan kyng edmund warned anone assembled people sped hym toward ye countre lastly faught wyth two sayd prynces danys leest chaced towne towne tyll forsyd wyth theyr co pany straunge nacyons forsake vtterly prouynce bet countre cumberlande yt mych fauoured ayded sayde enmyes agayne hym toke therin greate prayes deuyded amoges hys knyghtes ye done good seruyce malcolyn kynge scotlande hadde thys vyage done vnto kynge trowth allegyaunce tyme folowyng shulde bere vnto hym bothe kynge gaue sayd malcolyn countre cumberlande seased ye resydue kyngdom lordshyp northumberlande ioyned vnto hys owne kyngdome yet ye danys retorned agayn tyme edredus nexte kynge shalbe shewed yet fyne ende thys kyngdome accompted thys edmundus dayes authour polycronyca sayth whan edmunde hadde ended hys iourney set countree order toke wyth hym bone holy abbot colfrydus holy abbesse hylda brought theym vnto glastenbury shryned theym colfryde abbot beda abbey abbey gyrwye hilda abbesse stenshalt whytby affermeth ye sayd authour place ben ye north partyes england thys kynge edwarde noble woman wyfe named elgina receyued two sonnes named edwyne edgar testyfyeth henry archedeke huntyngdon thys edward ofte warre wyth dane whyche affermeth helde many good townes myddle england lyncoln nothinghm derby stafforde laycetour ye knyghtly manhode wanne helpe holy dunstan ameded many thynges within realm yt loge tyme misordered meane ye danys ende fyne thys edmunde dyuers opynyons marianus scot sayth whyle thys kynge edmunde endeuered hym selfe saue sewer fro dauger hys enemye wold haue slayne hym pulkerchyrche kynge ryddynge fraye wounded deth dyed shortly wyllyam de regibus sayth kynge beynge feest ye foresayd towne place vppon daye saynte augustyne espyed felon syttyng ye halle named leof whych tyme hys felony hadde exyled lept ouer table plucked thefe hedde grounde whych doynge sayd felon wyth knyfe wounded kynge deth also wyth knyfe wounded many kynges seruauntes length hewen dyed forthwyth trewe shulde seme kynges dayes vsed honour nowe haue exercyse whych two meanes vsed kynges deth agreemet wryters thys kynge dyed whan reygned vi yeres buryed glastenbury whyche hadde sumptuously repayred lafte hym two yonge sonnes remembred edwyne edgar yonge rule lande therfore ye rule therof comytted edred theyr vncle brother theyr fader clxxxix chapiter edredus ye brother edmude sonne edwarde elder ethylswyda hys thyrde wyfe began reygne ouer realme englande yere lorde ix hundred lxvii xiii yere fyfte lewys tha kyng fraunce whych towched admytted kyng authoryte hys barony myche two forenamed chylderne edmunde edwyn edgar thought yonge insuffycyent take vpon great charge whyche edrede enoynted kynge oddo archbyshop cau terbury ye towne kyngestowne soone warred vpon danys reentred northumberland wryters dwellynge vnder trybute kynge subdued edmunde hys brother bette theym downe caused theym holde obeye vnto theyr former couenauntes scottes began varye also brought vnto due obedyence certayne terme ye danys northumberlande whyche euer contynued full gyle dowblenesse beyng content holde couenautes made promisses vnto edredus kynge called vnto theym theyr olde accessaryes helper bereuyd kynges subiectes cytye yorke stronge townes castelles great hurte coutrey vtter dyspleasure kynge wherfore beynge therof aduertysed goodly conuenyent haste assembled hys people spedde hym thyther destroyed myche lande fury brent abbey rypon whyche danys kept fortresse strength wan myche strengthes fore wone broughte theym agayne vnder hys subieccyon kynge edrede thus spedde hys iourney retournynge englande nothynge suspectynge sayde danys company excytyng hyrcus kyng prynce danys folowyd kinges hoste thys halfe yorke fyll vppon kynges rerewarde destroyed slew many man whyche doyng kynge sore amoued tourned hys people agayne entendynge haue destroyed ye countrey vtterly wherof danys beynge ware lowely meked theym vnto hym gaue hym suche gyftes kyng refrayned hym great yre purposed theym amonges article yt bounde vnto one shuld banyshe vtterly refuse theyr fore sayde duke kynge called hyrcus whyche thynge dyuers many graunted fermely bounde kepe well hostage taken suertye kynge retourned england ioynyng kyngedome hys rekened ende kyngdome whyche shulde endure shewyd cix chapyter thys worke terme foure hundred ix yeres yere kynge hadde thus subdued danys strong sykenesse toke hym wherfore sent holy byshoppe dunstane come vnto hym whych dunstane goynge towarde kynge harde voyce saye vnto hym restyth kynge edredus peace tyme whych voyce thus sayenge horse holy byshop fyll grounde dyed wythout hurtynge hys mayster holy man continued iourney fande kynge dede commynge whome buryed wyth great reuerence monastery cathedrall chyrche cytye wynchester xxviii yere age x yere hys reygne testyfyeth guydo cxc chapiter lotharius eldest sonne v lewys began reygne ouer frenchemen yere lordes incarnacy ix hundred lv ye viii yere edredus kynge englande thys lothayr meanes thebaude theobalde erle chartres toke partye agayne rycharde duke normandye haue agayn hym som groudely cause sent vnto ye duke monyshynge hym haue mynde fayth allegyaunce duke normandye ought bere vnto kynges frauce maynteynynge mater hadde speke wyth hym wylled hym come place appoynted mater myght haue farther expedicion whyche commaundement request graunted duke kynge receyued answere duke wherof demyd contrary sent arnolde erle flaundres godfrey erle angewe theobalde named whose counsaylles many argumentes made kynge agreed call duke vnto ryuer isayr betraye hym daye place appoynted ye duke couenyent copany came vnto sayd ryuersyde abydyng comyng lothayr vppon ye syde whyche lastly came thyther wyth great people wherof duke ware fered treason whyche cause sent espyes knowe kynges entent wyse espyed purpose hoste shortely retourned shewed duke great daunger whyche shortely apperyd frenchemen began passe ryuer great nomber duke rychard consyderyng litell myght stande great power freche hoste sente parte men defende passage wyth remenaunt retourned vnto cytye roan wherof kynge beyng ware duke hym escaped called agayne people wyth great dyspleasure retourned vnto laon longe yt kyng assembled great hoste burgonyons frenchemen entred normandye beseged cytye bayon lastly wanne treason one gylberde smyth belongynge vnto ye erle theobald aboue named kynge hadde thus wone ye citye bayon betoke kepynge therof vnto sayde erle whyche puttynge therin strength knyghtes yode vnto castell called harmauyle besegyd yt wyth certayn knyghtes whyche season kynge nedes realme retourned fraunce duke rycharde ware kynges departure wyth hys people passed water sayn costed countrey fyll sodaynely vppon erle theobalde lyenge foresayd syege slewe men vi hudred xl person put erle fere scaped great daunger fledde smal company tyll came owne citye charter duke rycharde consyderyng great malice foon stregth sent vnto kynge denmarke named erarde requyryng ayde helpe withstande malyce enymyes whych erarde receyued gladly message promysed theyr request shortely sent sayd duke great army danys sped ye see tyll came place water sayn falleth see wherof duke beynge aduertysed short space drew vnto wyth people entred cou trey ye erle chartris wastyng destroynge wythout mercy entred landes fraunce pyllynge robbynge brennynge wastynge yt slew ye people mercy pytye mysery tyranny thus exercysed danys ye kyng beyng therwyth confused sente bysshoppes land haue theyr aduyce amonges bishop chartris beynge present hole counsayll admitted go duke knowe cause beynge crysten man made suche destruccyon crysten people occupyed land crysten men manyfolde harmes seathes conclude trew trewce certayne tyme sayde byshoppe accomplyssynge kynges pleasure answered duke vexacyon put lande fraunce iniurye yt kyng hadde tyme done vnto hym yet cotynued holdynge hym hys cytye bayon whych hadde gyuen great enymy erle chartris conclusyon restraynte warre graunted vppon condycyon day assygned kynge wold apoynte day communycacyon meane tyme restore vnto hym hys cytye bayon kynge receyued ye answere duke made suche meanes ye duke receyued city bayon dyspeasure forgyuen agayn ye forenamed theobald whych done medyacyon relygyous munke affermeth frenche boke daye metynge appoynted place called gyndolfoss duke made ordynauce receyuynge ye kyng comaunded paynyms danis behaue reuerently agayne kynge people whych obeyed due maner ye kyng receyued myche honour hadde vnto duke many goodly wordes requyrynge hym forget former vnkyndnesse trustynge shewe vnto hym suche pleasure tyme come shulde recompence former displeasure vnkyndnes commytted wyth whyche fayre speche duke takynge yt wythout dyssymulacyon well satysfyed content assuraunce amytye peace betwene theym stablysshed eyther gyuynge vnto great ryche gyftes departed frendes whych pea contynued durynge theyr lyues cxci chapiter lothayre thus beyng loue amytye wyth norman caste mynde howe myght wynne neuewe otthon kynge germany ye prouynce austracy lorayn yt tyme passed belongynge progeny tour brynge effecte gaderyd right secret wyse chosen host frenchemen passed countrey wise entred cytye aquisgrani great fame noyse therof made wherwith ottho beyng dysmade fledde season suffred sayde lothayr tyme execute pleasure yt sayd lothayre spoyled kynges paleys place great enrychinge hym hoste hadde taryed certayne tyme retourned wythout batayll wyth great pompe fraunce shewyd begynnyng story ethelstane kyng england henry duke saxony whyche ment germany sent vnto sayde ethilstane haue suster alunda mary vnto sonne ottho otthon ye shall vnderstande henry wryters admytted emperour sonne ottho forenamed emperour dede whose sonne ottho abouenamed called seconde name emperour hys father son forenamed alunda suster ethilstane second ottho emperour kyng germany beyng thus ye haue hard surprised neuew lothayre kyng west fraunce gaderyd stronge hoste entred realm frauce wytnessyth gerardus wryter hystoryes destroyed coutrey soysons lastly came vnto paris brent ye suburbes cytye hadde great parte wyll sayde lothayre frenche cronycle varyeth saynge sayth lothayr helpe duke burgoyne hugh capet erle paris ye sayd ottho fyred suburbes citye parys issued towne faught wyth emperoure compelled gyue backe fle kynge pursued tyll came ryuer isayr sue eyther hoste encoutred wyth faught cruelly length emperour forced forsake ye feld mych people slayn droned said ryuer grete nomber affermeth frenche storye course water stopped ouerflowed feldes nere vnto sayde ryuer victory wythstadyng wytnessyth mayster gagwyn kynge cotrary mynde duke burgoyne also hugh capet releasyd vnto emperour tytle ryghte lorayne whyche cause couetynge realme sayde hugh vsurpynge affermeth sayde authoure whyche agrement betwene two prince stablisshed ended eyther retourned countrey season notable dede put memory sayde lothayre fynally sykened dyed yere lorde ix hundred lxxx vi ruled pryncypat vygurously full terme xxx wynter buried mynster saynte remigius cytye raynes leuynge hym son named lewys anglia cxcii chapiter edredus edwyne eldeste son edmund brother ethil stane began reygne ouer englande yere lord ix hundred lvi second yere lothayre kynge fraunce edwyne crowned kynge kyngistone kyngestowne besyde london archbyshoppe caunterbury whych selfe daye fessyon coronacion broke sodeynly lordes entred secrete chaber occupyed selfe synfully wyth nother mannes wyfe wherof saynt dustane hauyng knowlege rebuked blamed hym greuously caused woman voyded bed company whose husband one authour testyfyeth slew haue ye vnlawful vse beaute cosideryng ye allyauce affynyte kynred betwene affermeth ye sayde authour guydo writer storyes sayth edwyn cotrary ye lawes ye chyrch held woman cocubyne wherfore holy dustane accused vnto oddo archbishop cauterbury whose power kynge causyd refuse forsake copany woman dede edwyn bare great malice vnto holy man dunstane length extorte power banyshed hym lande forced hym season holde hym flaunders malyce ye bare towarde hym dyd myche dyspleasure blacke munkes englande myche malmysbury put oute moke set seculer prestes theyr stede rad hym also toke chyrch myght specyally blacke monkes myche precyouse iewellys ethylstane hadde receyued othon emperour gyue vnto wynchester malmysbury toke theym then gaue theym vnto alyauntes straungers thus onely vnkynde god also vsyd suche tyranny vnlefull meanes hys subiectes lastely rebelled agayn hym specyally inhabytautes countre mercia myddell englande also northumbers put hym clerely kyngely honour dygnytye reygned wryters full terme iiii yeres buryed ye cathedrall chyrche wynchester leuynge none heyre body wherfore rule lande fyll vnto edgar yonger brother antoninus archebyshop florece worke often mynded amonges many myracles vertues actes ye vi chapiter ye xvi title boke called sm antonini reherseth holy man dunstan sayth vnderstandynge deth thys edwyn reuelacyon otherwyse made hys specyall prayer god know state soule edwyn whome thys prayer made apperyd sayde dustane great company fedes turmentynge soule sayde edwyn ledynge yt vnto place peyne whyche holy man hadde sene fell great wepynge sorowe besechynge god deuocyon haue pytye compassyon soule whyle occupied prayer sayde copany fendes returned wyth yellynge cryenge shewynge hym thorough hys prayer angelles god byrafte soule edwyn cxciii chapiter edgar seconde sonne edmunde brother edwyn laste kynge began hys reygne ouer realme englande yere lorde ix hundred lx v yere lotharius kynge fraunce whyche dyuers wryters wytnessed age xvi yere admytted kynge crowned kynge tyll hadde reygned full terme xii yeres whych terme ended expyred enoynted crowned kynge cytye bathe vppon whytsondaye fallyng vpon xv day may dunstane oswolde byshoppes one caunterburye yorke begynnynge reygn called home holy dunstane exyled kyng edwyne whych dunstane harde aungellys synge peace lande englyshemen made dustane abbot glastenburye byshoppe worceter vnyed knyt one prouynce lorshyppes englande made theym one monarchye kyngedome many place putte away clerkes prestes lyued vycyously sette theym munkes wytnessyth guydo policronica buylded repayred nomber xl house relygyon wherof abyndon peterburgh thorney ramesey wylton parcell theym wynchester newe abbay putte munkes dayes seculer prestes cause wherof myche prestes fled neglygently slowthed dyuyne seruyce god sette vykers theyr place whyle lyued theyr pleasure place spente patrymonye chyrche theyr sensuall wyll kynge edgar gaue vykers lande belonged prebendaryes trustynge therby wolde theyr duetyes yt longe sayd vycares neglygent wherfore fynally kyng authoryte pope iohn xiii name voyded clerely prestes ordeyned moke though hys prelate therwyth contented edgar kepte suche iustyce dyd sharpe execucyon neuer day vsyd lesse felony robberyes wold haue rauenous bestes destroyed thorough hys lande caused ludwallus prynce kynge walys yelde hym yerely way trybute thre hundred woluys meane wherof wythin space iiii yeres englande walys myght scantely founden one wolf lyue wytnessyd dyuers authours kynadus kynge scotlande dispysed edgar lytell stature wherof edgar beynge warned desyred sayd kynadus dyner made good countenaunce whych dyner ended toke sayd kynadus ye arme wyth hym helde company tyll came ye feldes beynge dysseuered bothe theyr seruauntes edgar drew vnder garment two swordes desyred kynadus take chose theym sayd hym nowe thou hast good laysure saye thy strength wyth myne tyme thou haste myche dyspysed lette v nowe proue whyche worthy subiecte syttynge knyghte make great boste borde lytell felde scottyshe kynge hard kyng thus challenge hym knew well wordes spoken disclosyd ye kynge wherof litle abashed apeace ye kynge behaued hym lowely gaue hym suche plesaunte wordes kynge forgaue trespace edgar amonge hys polytyke dedes vsed somer tyme scowre see wyth certayne shyppes warre agayn ye wynter prouyded laye sayd shyppes sure hauens redy owne seruyce hys lordes house certayne nomber dyours alway redy kyng nede shyp maysters wage wyth hym thorough yere euer attedyd vpon shippes se nothyng fayled vnto theym necessary meane wherof kepte hys land great quyete fro outward enmyes wynter vsed ryde ouer land se hys offycers entreated people yf accused extorcyon crymes agayne suffycyently proued dyd vppon suche sharpe correccyon mych day grete multytude danys dwelled dyuers place england vsed many vyces specyally great drynkynge wherof ensued dronkenesse many vice euyll example hurte hys common subiectes therfore ordeyned certayne cuppes pynnes nayles set ordeyned made law person dranke past marke one drought shuld fayte certayn peny wherof one half shuld fall accusour half ruler ye brough towne offence done told edgar dyuers authours yt vpon season beyng chester entred ye ryuer dee syttynge bote toke rule helme caused viii kynges whyche guydo called regul whyche meane small lytell kynges vnder kinges ye whyche commaunded rowe hym vp downe ryuer vnto saynte iohns chyrche then hys owne paleys token yt lorde kynge many prouynces noble edgar two wyues fyrste yt called egelfleda whyte hadde son named edwarde kynge slayne reason hys stepmoder alfrita called englyshe cronycle estrylde vpon seconde wyfe alfrida estrylde gat son named egelredus englyshe boke eldrede kynge edwarde martyr shall shewyd saynte wylfryth whych wryters accopted mechon doughter named saynte edyth cesse ryme bast wedloke guydo policronicon testyfyen virgyne wylfryth knowynge kyng caste vnlawfull loue put vppon habyte nune thynkyng thereby wythdrawe kynges loue wythstandynge length brought kynges bedde whych dede greatly blamed holy byshop dunstane dyd therfore vii yere penauce heste byddynge sayde dunstane forenamed wylfrith ye chyld borne lyued relygyousely yt copted saynt heuen doughter edyth yt radde lawefull age wylton shorne nunne vsyd gayer apparell thought co uenyent religyon ye beynge blamed holy bysshop ethelwolde answered goddes dome maye fayle pleasyd onely wyth conscyence wherfore truste vnder clothes maye clene soule vnder ye ben lasse shewynge many vertues ben rehersed holy virgyn edyth ix chapyter vi boke policronycon passe ouer length mater cxciii chapiter edgar thus rulynge lande deth fyrst wyfe egelfleda worde broughte hym ye beaute alfrida estrild doughter orgarus erle deuenshire wherfore sent knight court named ethelwold espy whether mayde beautye reported chargynge hym yf beautyous shulde aske wyfe kynge knyght hauyng syght mayden wounded wyth darte blynde god cupyde forgate trouth allegiaunce yt shuld owe mayster souerayne retourned shewynge kynge nothynge beaute reported meane fayrenesse woman wherfore besought kynge consyderyng father heyre good maryage wolde good lord hym wryte vnto fader yt myght haue wyfe grace obteyned length maryed vnto processe tyme fame beaute thys woman sprange wyde lastly yt came erys edgar wherwyth kynge mynde beynge sore dyscontentyd wyth ethilwolde whyche hym dysceyued yet kepte good countenaunce made semblaunte though hadde nothynge forced yt mater vpon tyme yt game warned ethilwolde yt erle reason hys wyfe otherwyse wold lodge one nyght house appoynted daye yt shulde wyth thys monyssyon erle beynge nothynge contented ranne home nygh deed fere prayed wyfe helpe tyme nede yt wold myght make self fowle vnsemely coude shewed resydue ye mater ye woman cast mynde great dyspleasure yt might ensue toward agayn god make fowle whych hadde made goodly fayre also lorde husbande agayne kynge thynkyng shuld cause thus ende mocke dysceyue hym wherfore consyderacyon premysses enourned moste costly shewynge aparayll ouer yt yf dame nature hadde thynge forgoten mysprinted left womas helpe might amended refourmed kynges comynge receyued hym wyth ioy gladnesse whyche meanes yonge amorous kyng soon caught dyuylles snare sette reason parte folowed sensualyte bryng purpose better kept forth countenaunce ben well contentyd wyth thynge desyred erle wolde wyth hym ryde huntyng wood welwerley called hore wood awaytynge season tyme strake erle thorough bodye wyth shafte dyed soon maryed elfryda estrylde shortely hadde egelredus haue shewyd whyche dede sayth ranulf elfrida buylded house nunnes warwell authours saye yt slayeng stepson edwarde also englyshe cronycle sheweth ethilwolde slayne meane kyng tyme dyed oddo archbyshoppe af caunterbury nacyon danys hym tolde longe processe x chapyter vi boke polycronycon hym bryglinus byshoppe wynchester made hys successour suffycyent great charge went agayne wynchester holy dunstane byshop london worceter sacryd archbysshoppe caunterbury went rome receyued palle pope iohn xiii name dunstane fyrste abbot glastynbury byshoppe london worceter lastely archbyshoppe caunterbury dayes order munkes religyous full vertues hadde relygyous ruler clere scyence clergy men lad mych wyth dedes good example vertuous lyuynge theyr famous vertuous prechyng edgare y sayde crowned kynge cytye bathe dunstane archbysshop caunterbury oswolde archbysshop yorke whan hadde ruled thys lande xii yeres cause longe edgar enoynted testyfyeth guydo hys vnlefull lechery specyally offence done wyth wylfryde whyche dede dunstane ioyned vii yeres penaunce whyche penaunce durynge kept sayd enoyntement affermeth sayde guydo cause euer agrement dyuers wryters crowned tyll reygned xii yeres also tolde thys edgare beynge vpon season towne uyr enamoured vpon noble mannes doughter whyche passynge beautye made suche meanes force wyse parentes agreed kynge shulde haue hys pleasure moder subtyll wytte bethoughte whyle sent seruaunt whych comely fayre kynges bed mornynge whan daye began waxe clere woman began styrre wolde haue departed kynge kynge refrayned asked cause hasty departyng muste worke wyth felowes sayde woman myne houre kepe taske whan kynge questyoned wyth lerned bonde woman asked kynge fredome nyghtis seruyce kyng good game cherysshed damosell made lady lordes insolent wanton dedes sayde counsayle holy dunstane buylded repayred many abbey house relygyon aboue rehersed thus thys noble edgare passyng tyme vertue medled vyce lastly wyttynge rebellyon ye brytaynes walshmen wherfore assembled hys knyghtes entred lande dyd grete harme waste among prayes spoyled countre glamorgan also toke spoyled countre ono toke bell saynt eltutus serued hys chyrche taken vyolence wyth stuffe hanged horse necke puttynge te porall seruyce dyspleasure saynte vyolent takynge therof ranulf expresseth vndertyde whan kyng edgar layde take hys reste sayd eltutus apered smote kyng vppon breste wyth spere yt kynge awoke wyth stroke charged belle shulde restored chyrche saynt eltutus thynges taken wyth kynge dyed wythin x dayes whan reygned moste wryters full terme xvi yeres buryed glastenbury leuynge hym two sonnes edwarde martyr egelred ii sondry wyues henricus hystographer made hym verse folowynge ayder poore punyssher trespasse gyuer worshyp kyng edgar gone kyngdome heuen whyche lyke prayse salomon wysdome aboue shone fader pea lyone foone founder temple monkes stronge patrone oppresser wronge iustyce guardone willelmus de regibus testifyeth yere lorde mlii whiche deth noble kynge edgar lxxvi yeres abbot glastenbury named aylewarde dygged graue noble man vnreuerently whyche tyme body fouden hole full flesshe body wolde entre newe cheste without pressynge reason wherof fresshe droppes blode issued body abbot foresayd fyll sodeynly madde went chyrch brake hys necke dyed body put shryne tyme gyuen place set vppon ye auter wyth hed saynt apolinare relyques saynt uyncent whych ye kyng edgare dayes brought thyther gyuen ye house wherfore maye well appere rede thys story lyuynge thys man demed yt purged hym suche wyse penauce made seth amendes goddes pleasure cxcv chapiter ye story thys noble prynce edgare fynde wryten story whyche alleged authour yt shulde done kyng syrye named cambyses tyme reygne thys edgare sayenge varyeth fro authours wryters farre uincencius hystorialis antoninus ranulphus sayde acte done ye sayd cambyse forenamed authoure affermeth yet sayd cambyses executed longe incarnacyon cryste thys cambyses sonne cirus kyng parsys medis whyche reygned ouer prouynces yere worlde iiii thousand lxx commynge cryste folowyng accompte thys worke xi hundred yeres xxix myghte yt whyte monke authoure wryter acte story edgare moued greate iustyce radde story thys edgare thynkyng enhaunce reason herof sayth tyme thys cabyses iudge hym accused conuycte vppon accusacyon hadde gyuen wronge sentence meane takynge mede wherfore thys cambyses terrour fere commaunded sayde iudge flayne quycke skynne spred ouer place stole iudgement done made sone foresayd iudge sytte iudge place hys fader sat wyth verse wryten vppon face sayde place iudgement foloweth sede sedens ista iudex inflexibilis sta manibus reuoces munus ab aure preces sit tibi sucerna sex sux pessis que paterna qua recedes natus pro patre sponte datus whyche verse maye englysshed maner fourme foloweth thou syttest thys iudycyall place sytte vp ryght holde thyne handes mede thyne erys prayer fauoure chace let lawe thy gyde kepe iustyce thy rede thy faders skynne whych doth thy chayer sprede haue thy mynde fall lyke offence leste thy faute thou make lyke recompence haue shewed acte put execucyon ye xic yere odde commynge cryste syns sayd comynge incarnacyon haue expyred xv hundred yeres maketh ouer two thousande vi hundred yeres whyche tyme haue nat radde cronycle thys lande iudge hath ben put lyke sentence wherfore presuppose lawes bothe spyrytuall temporall iudges haue wel borne verse mynde exercysed mynystrynge dewe iustyce perfytely theyr cusshons ben fresshely lyned wyth foresayde skinne emprited narowly verse boke theyr coscience theyr iudgementes set asyde parcyalyte fauour holde theyr handes medes rewardes thus wyth ellys thus shulde cxcvi chapiter edwarde sonne edgare hys fyrste wyfe named egelfleda beganne hys reygn ouer thys realme englande yere lorde ix hundred lxxvii xii yere lothayre kynge fraunce ye shall vnderstand deth edgare stryfe arose amonge lordes admyssyon theyr kyng elfryda estrylde alphrede duke mercia made dyuers frendes haue sonne egelredus promoted dygnite chylde vii yeres age myghte haue rule land holy dunstane wyth ayde bysshoppes erle eest englande essex wythstode doynge crowned thys edwarde kynge ye towne kyngestowne greuous dyspleasure hys sayd moder elfryda affynyte tyme thys edward appered stella cometa blasing sterre wherafter ensued many inconuenyences well men bestes sykenesse hunger moreyne lyke myseryes none fyll dayes edwarde hys deth forenamed alpherus duke mercia whyche thynges fauoured mych dedes quene put ye monkes wynchester kyng edgare shewed set brought theym wanton clerkes ranulphe sayth clerkes wyth concubynes dunstane erle essex wythsayde doyng helde agayne duke suche fauoured hys partye whych arose greate stryfe bytwene prestes monkes englande ye clerkes tyme put edgare sayd wretched cursed dede newe comon company vnknowen shulde put olde landysmen theyr place shulde pleasyng god yt graunted ye place olde woner good man ought alowe suche doynge ensample therof myght ensewe monkes sayde yetcryste alowed nother olde dweller yet persone wolde take crosse penaunce vppon hym folow cryste vertuous lyuynge shulde hys dyscyple thys holden generall counsayle bysshoppes clergy land wynchester holy du stane helde wyth vertuous whyle greate argument thys mater dyuers wryters testyfye rode beyng standynge wall spake myraculously sayd dunstanes wayes good trewe thys stryfe seased mych new assemble clergye appoynted place called strete calue counsayle kept vpper lofte thys counsayle du stane greuously despysed rebuked vnskylfull yet kept hys opynyon grounded vpon iustyce vertue whyle thys greate dyuysyon argument whyche waye shulde admytted alowed sodeynly ioystes lofte fayled people fell downe yt many slayne greuously hurte holy dunstane escaped wyth fewe toke hys partye vnhurte wonder caused sylence amonges enteded maynteyne foresayd quarell dunstane hys wyll thus passynge tyme reygne edwarde kynge came vppon season huntyng forest woode wryters nere castell corfe ye west countre losynge hys company seruauntes resorted vnto castell sayd tyme hys moder sonne egelred kept housholde whan quene warned hys commynge anone called seruaut whych mych trusted tolde hym counsayle shewynge hym forther shulde behaue hym accomplysshynge wyll mynde done went towarde kynge receyued hym wyth outwarde gladnesse desyred hym tary wyth nyght curteyse maner excused hym selfe spede desyred drynke vpon hys horse syttyng ye whych shortly brought whyle cuppe hys mouth seruaunt quene enfourmed strake hym herte wyth sworde longe dagger sharpe sydes whiche stroke kynge receyued toke horse wyth spore ranne towarde place comen fro ellys suche waye supposed mete hys company bled sore fayntnes fyll hys horse hys one fote beynge faste styrroppe reason wherof drawen ye horse ouer wayes feldes tyll came place named corysgate founden dede ye maner hys deth vnknowe also kynge knowen buryed vnworthely towne warehm rested terme iii yeres whyche tyme season god shewed hym dyuers myracles syghte blynde helthe syke herynge ye defe wyth dyuers whyche ouer passe wherof herynge hys stepmoder began take repentaunce entended vysyte hym way pylgrymage cause entended inwardly nat saye horse beest yt rode vpon myght nyghe ye place certayne space betynge thynge hym myght done man meanes translated thes septon called shaftesbury buried great honour syn tyme parte bodye translated abbaye leof besyde hereforde edge walys parte therof abyndon yt reported shaftesbury remayne hys lunge ben shewed place called edwardysstowe murder blessed man yt sayde shewed story edgar stepmother fouded two monasteryes woman ye one ambrisbury warwell whyche place warwell latter dayes refusynge pompe worlde helde solytary strayte lyfe ended lyfe wyth great penaunce repentaunce buryed dyed thus ye haue harde vertuous yonge kynge edwarde martyred whe reygned wryters iiii yeres leuyng none yssue wherfore rule lande fyll egelredus brother cxcvii chapiter egelredus sonne edgar alfrida estryld last wyfe beganne reygne ouer englande yere lorde ix hu dred lxxxi xxvi yere lothayre kynge fraunce named wryters etheldredus englyshe cronycle eldrede whose begynnyng grounde waxed bareyne myseryes bodyd apperynge blasynge starre dayes edwarde martyr nowe beganne take place encreace vppon erth genytours crowned kyng kyngestone holy archbysshoppe dunstane oswalde archebyshop yorke whome yt redde lyfe saynt dunstane amonges prophecyes day coronacyon sayd vnto kynge thou comest kingdome deth thy brother whose deth englyshemen co spyred thy wykked moder shall wythout blood shedynge sworde tyll come people vnknowen tunge brynge thraldome thys trespace shall clensyd wythoute longe vengeaunce egelred wryters agreen goodly shappe vysage mynged wyth lechery cruelty also redde holy dunstane shuld crysten hym helde hym ouer fonte felyd holy lyker wyth ye fruyte wombe wherfore holy dunstane sware god hys mother shalbe vnkynde god chyrche whych fayled forth goynge vngracyous begynnynge wretched ye myddell lyfe hatefull men ende therof seconde yere reygn cloude sene englande whyche appered halfe lyke blood halfe lyke fyre chaunged sundry colour dysaperyd laste thyrd yere reygn ye danys aryued sundry place lande yle thanet besyde kente cornewayll sussex dyd costes myche harme theym came london put yt destroyed great part chestershyre ende yere great parte cytye london wasted fyre beganne myne authour myndeth ye shall vnderstand daye cytye london moste housynge buyldynge ludgate towarde westmester lytell none ye chefe herte cytye nowe excepte dyuers place housing stode oute order many townes cytyes caunterbury yorke dyuers englande passed london buyldynge day haue sene knowe olde boke somtyme guyldehal london named domys day coquest yt encreaced shortly passed excelled ye viii yere kynges reygne kynge maryed erle egbertus doughter named ethelgina elgina whyche processe time receyued son named edmunde whyche surnamed ironsyde ii sonnes named edwyn ethylstane doughter named edgina pastyme dyed saynt ethilwalde byshop wynchester borne wynchester noryshed vnder holy dunstane glastenbury shorne monke chosen abbot abyndon tyme reygne kynge edredus tyme edgar sacryd byshoppe wynchester made abbay nunnes translated saynt swythynes body erth whyche sayde ethelwalde holy alphegus abbot bathe sacred byshoppe wynchester whyche archebishoppe caunterbury martyred hastely cruell danys shall shewed ix yere egelredus stryfe yt betwene byshop rochester hym wyth knyghtes beseged sayde cytye wherof holy dustane sent ye kyng amonyssynge hym shulde refrayne hym cruelty suffre ye byshop citye peace oneles offended saynte andrewe patrone citye message mylded nothyng ye kynges courage thys blessed man sent hym hundred pounde gold wyllyng hym refrayne outrage whyche receyued brake syege blessyd dunstane sente message kyng thou haste preferred golde god syluer apostle couetyse right euyll happes shall come vnto whyle lyfe kynge toke lytell regarde wordes contynued insolent cursed dedes xi yere reygne dyed blessed archbyshoppe saynte dunstane ranulff xiii chapyter vi boke policronycon maketh rehersall dyuers vertues myracles whyche passe ouer rather bycause legede lyfe manyfest siricus archbyshop hym hym wulricus wulricus blessed elpheg archbyshop see longe deth holy dunstane danys perced england many sondry place lande suche wyse kynge seke coste shuld go fyrst wythstande enymyes conclusyon auoydynge harme compellyd appeace theym wyth great summes money ye money spent fyll new robbynge people kynge graunted money danys robbed spoyled ye coutrey northuberlad besyeged london laste augmentacyon kynges sorowe elfricus mayster admyrall kynges nauy fled false traytour recocyled fled second tyme danys wherfore ye kyng wreche father commauded eyen sonne algarus plucked done hedde whyle persecucion thus contynued meanes holy byshoppe wynchester elphegus peace concluded tyme betwene kyng danys prynce chefe captayne named aulaff exorted said holy byshop yt became criste man whome kynge godfather sayde aulaff retorned owne without doyng harme whyle warre danys seased whyle rested blody flyx wyth brennynge feuer vexed people thorough lande myche folke therof dyed contynuynge whyche mysery danys agayne assayled lande dyd dyuers place great harme lacke good hed gouernour many thynges land peryshed lordes dyssencyon one assembled speke treate peace betwene one lorde yf good thynge dyuysed hurte theyr enymyes anone danys warned therof counsayll wherof suspected elfricus edricus sorowe ioyned hunger penury amonges common eueryche theym constrayned plucke stele pyllage danys inwarde theuys brybours lande broughte great mysery myschefe cxcviii chapiter egelredus wrapped misery lefte gader hys subiectes myght well vnlaufull meanes otherwyse sayth ranulfe myne authour wold fayned small cause dysheryte theyr possessyos cause men redeme theyr owne great summes money ouer walowed lechery gyuyng hym vycyous incontynent lyfe body whych vngracyous meanes brought land ruyne myght helpe stregth warred wyth money yt fyrst entre danys testyfyeth policronica xviii chapyter vi boke also guydo wyth authours fyrst trybute x thou sande pounde broughte yt laste processe v vi yeres xl thousande pounde whyche yerely durynge lyfe commynge saynte edwarde leuyed subiectes named contynuance therof dane gelt whyche meane money payde danys shortly dane money tyme yt xv yere reygne dyed saynt oswalde archbyshoppe caunterbury soone dyed ethelgina quene body saynte cuthbert translated holy ylande durham whyche yle helde anankers lyfe yt shewyd storye cadwalader thus contynuynge lande vnder greuous tribute danys also susteynynge many villanyes iniuryes englyshe men sayde danys somdele shall appere egelredus counsayll famylyers xxi yere hys reygn maryed emma ye doughter rychard duke normandy mynded storye lewys v lothayre hys sonne kynges frauce whyche rycharde thyrde duke normandy fyrste name also surnamed rycharde wythoute fere hardy hym shall shewyd storye vi lewis kynge fraunce reason maryenge emma whych ye frenche cronycle named flowre normandye thys egelredus greatly enhau ced hys owne mynde presumpcyon wherof sent good burghes cytyes townes lande secrete strayte commyssyons chargynge ruler vppon certayne day say vppon daye saynte bryce houre assygned euery place hys lande danys shulde sodeynly slayne yt done comon fame telleth yt murder beganne lytell towne hertefordeshyre wythin xxiiii myles london called welewyn welwyn whyche dedeyt toke fyrst name wolde wene wele cou trey fyrste wonne well cosydereth sequell thys storye shall fynde lytell wynnynge weale ensuyenge thys dede procede wyll touche somewhat pryde abusyo ye danis exercysed englande parte therof haue sene olde cronycle wherof authoure y vnknowen shewyd danys strength caused husbande men ere sowe lande vyle laboure belonged husbandrye dane helde hys wyfe hys pleasure doughter seruaunt husbandeman came home shulde scantly haue hys owne seruautes dane hys commaundement ete dranke hys fyll beste whe owner hadde scantely hys fyll worste ouer comon people theym oppressyd fere drede called theym euery suche house hadde rule lorde dane processe tyme danys voyded lande thys worde lord dane derysyon despyte danys turned englyshemen name opprobrye called lurdayne whyche dayes y forgotten one englyshema woll rebuke woll rebuke call hym lurdayn retourne fyrste mater treuthe yt danys thus murdred thorugh englande tydynges therof sprange denmarke whyche kyndeled theym suche fury kyng therof named swanus assembled shortely great hoste nauye danys shorte processe landed cornewayll treason norman named hugh whyche fauoure quene emma made erle deuenshyre sayd swanus toke exetour bette downe wally entred lande whyche season kynge sent
