vnto edric chargyng hym assemble weste saxon wythstande entre danys whyche accordynge commyssyon assembled weste saxos made good contenauce wythstand sayd enymyes hostes shulde ioyne fere treason fayned hym syke fled hys people whych lacke hed fayn gyue backe theyr hurte theyr enimyes great auauntage comforte wherfore danys resorted wylton shyrborn anon spoyled townes refresshed theym swanus wittynge kynge co myng towarde hym wyth power lande therfore departed then retourned wyth great pyllage shyppes sayled aboute lande lastely landed norfolke wastynge spoylynge countrey came processe vnto cytye norwyche robbed spoyled yt yode thetforde dyd lykewise towne fyred yt destroyed ye countrey nere soone noble man countrey called duke uskatell mette wyth hoste danys gaue vnto hard sharpe batayll slewe many enymyes put backe huger assailed lande swanus returned ofte vnto shyppes departed agayne denmarke taryed ye wynter folowynge whyche season made great prouysyon reenter lande englande cxcix chapiter xxvi yere reygne egelredus forenamed swanus stronge army landed sandwyche spoyled coutrey nere vnto see syde rested hym tyll harde armye comynge agayn hym ware therof retourned shyppes agayne herynge kyng farre westward landed sussex spoyled yt wonder sore warned comynge batayll englyshemen anon toke shyppynge agayne englyshemen wende haue met wyth one coste wolde sodaynly lande nother ye kyng prouyded mete wyth vppon see wold fayne flee ellys shulde wyth gyftes blynde admyrall kynges nauy whyche subtylytye crafty meanes weryed tyred hoste englyshme euer went slew brent robbed wythout compassyon pytye kynge beyng shrewesbury herynge great sleyght cruelty danys called counsayll rede beste done ye defence enmyes concluded ye kyng haue peace danys shuld pay vnto xxx thousande poud whyle doynge danys destroyed grete part baroke barkshyre peace thus made swanus wyth company retourned denmarke ye yere folowynge kynge made edricus forenamed duke mercia thys edricus lowe byrth ryche tunge false subtyll wyt softe eloquet speche vntrusty false thoughte promyse hym somdeale shewyd shall appere xxvii yere egelredus prynce danys named turkyllus landed kent whyche greuously warred coutrey kentyshemen fayn make theyr peace departed yet persecucyon danys seased one countre englande euer whylys robbed pilled englishman yt coutrey longe coste fro northe parte englande vnto yle wyghte theym destroyed hugely sette backe kynge entended make prouysyon wythstande theym euer edricus wolde counsayll hym contrarye shewynge hym shulde spende hys treasour trauayle people vayne mean wherof danys entred l myles wythin lande brent robbed dyuers tymes many vylages townes encreased waxed passynge ryche enlyshemen nedy bare poore thus contynuynge mysery swanus englyshe swayne beyng denmarke heryng encreace people within englande repented hym former couenauntes thought yt hole domynyon englad shulde belong hym ryght whyche prepared armye nauy moste defensyble wyse sped hym england ryuer humber landed northumberlande erle ruler countrey wyth ruler sware feaute vnto sayde swanus promysed kepe countrey vnto hys vse done hys wyll coste entred agayne water ryuer trent passed gaynysburghe north watlyngstrete subdued inhabytauntes coutrey forced theym gyue vnto hym pledge whyche pledge wyth also nauy betoke vnto canutus sonne whyle wente farther lande done wyth people kepte iourney tyl came mercia kyllynge slayeng men prouynce reserued woman vnclene lyuynge well relygyous toke strength wynchester oxenford dyd lyked hadde thus passed lande drewe nexte waye towarde london passynge ryuer thames loste parte hys people lacke brydge ieopardynge theyr passage vnauysely processe came vnto london tyme kynge egelredus wherfore swanus lefte cytye drewe kente towarde caunterbury wythoute lette weldynge countrey hys wyll lastely beseged cytye whyche manfully defended theyr enymyes space xx dayes whyche syege beganne vpon day saynte mathewe moneth september endured aboue sayde taken treason deken named almaricus whyche beforetyme blessed elphegus archebyshop see hadde preserued deth danys fyred cytye spoyled toke archebyshop put strayte pryson monkes saynt augustynes abbey tythed meane slew ix cruel torment tenth kepte lyue whych solde sette seruyle laboure wytnessyth antoninus uyncent hystoryall slewe broughte seruage ouer summe ix hundred persones relygyon slew men woman chyldren beyonde nober viii thousand myche cruelty yt shewyd vii chapyter xvi tytle worke sayde antoninus fynally blessed man elphegus wolde condescende gyue vnto sayth policronica iii thousande pounde kept hym harde pryson space vii monethes vppon ester eue many vylanyes hym done grenewyche wythin thre myles london stoned hym deth lay feld vnburyed certayne tyme caryed london buryed reueretly chyrch saynt paule afterward tyme canutus taken vp agayne caryed owne chyrche blyssed elphegus antoninus also policronicon shewen many vertues myracles whyche passe ouer lengthynge tyme cc chapiter pastyme kynge egelredus ferynge ende thys persecucyon sent emma quene wyth two sonnes alphrede edwarde vnto rycharde second ye name fourth duke normandy whych brother vnto sayde emma wyth whome also sent byshoppe london xxxiiii yere reygne egelredus danis hadde wonne great part cou trey westsaxon retorned agayn towarde london wherof herynge londoner sent vnto theym certayn gyftes pledge thys season myne authoure maketh mynde euer king gaue vnto denys notable batayll kepte hym holdes place owne sauegarde lytell fruyte profyte lande laste chaced vnto yle wyghte wyth secrete companye helde great parte wynter fynally wythout catall comforte sayled ouer hys wyfe normady held hym certayne tyme whan swanus ascertayned departynge egelredus lande enflamed wyth excedynge pryde arrered excedynge imposycyons people greued wonderfully amonges tyranyes asked great summe money saynt edmundes landes whych ruler denayed myche claymed free kynges trybute thys entred terytory saynte edmunde wasted spoyled countrey ouer despysed holy martyr wyth manassyng place sepulture wherfore men countrey ferynge tyraunt gaue fastynge prayer shortly stycked euenynge amonges knyghtes ye sword saynte edmunde towne shetforde sayth guydo policronicon town gaynesborugh dyed wyth yellynge cryenge thyrd daye fere wherof canutus hys son kynge closed ye land holy martyr depe dyche graunted inhabytauntes therof great fredam quyt kyngly taske trybute buylded chyrch ouer place sepulture ordeyned house munkes endued wyth fayre possessyons yt vsed kynges england crowned sent offerynge theyr crownes vnto saynte edmundes shryne redemed aftewardes wyth condygne pryce egelredus hadde wrytynge deth swanus procurement frendes made meanes retourne hys owne whose meanes sent wyth condycyon shulde refourme olde condycyons ad perfourmauce sent son edwarde englande hym lent folowynge kyng came hym selfe wyth people sped hym towarde lyndesey canutus tyme resseaut prouyded kynges hasty commynge wherfore beynge purueyed wythstande kynge fledde sandewyche kente proued suche persones tyme fader hadde taken pledge fande perseueraunt theyr miss made cutte nose hades sayd englyshe people sayled denmarke retourned nexte yere wyth great nauy sayled ye land toke prayes south countrey wherof kynges eldest sonne named edmunde made prouysyon wyth ye ayde edricus go agayn hym shulde haue met edric place assigned host hym dysceyued wherfore compelled gyue place enymyes yt knowen sayde edricus promysed fauour ayde vnto sayde canutus reason wherof canutus entred countre west saxon forsed swere feauty gyue vnto pledge countreys adioynyng dyd seasan egelredus beyng london taken wyth greuous sykenes dyed buryed chyrch saynt paule day ye north yle behynde quere apperyth wal token hys sepulture whyche reygned say policronicon beseged englande terme xxxvi yeres full leuynge hym sonne named edmunde iron syde ouer alphrede edwarde sonnes emma francia cci chapiter lewys vi name son lothayre began hys reygne ouer fraunce yere lordes incarnacyon ix hundred lxxxvi v yere egelredus kyng england whiche hys youth shortnesse hys reygne lytell hys dedes laft memory excepte ye frenche boke wytnessyth hadde none issue hugh capet story lothayre mynded hys famylyer chyefe cousayler shuld therfore ordeyne admytte sayd hugh hys heyre verely touched aboue named story ende therof thys hugh stronge myghty later dayes lothayre coueted rule lande wherfore deth lewys mych laft chyld hym hauyng ye chyefe rule fraunce strength power made hym selfe kynge promysed story egelredus somwhat shewe rycharde fyrst name thyrde duke normandye shall somdele length thys story wyth story sayd rycharde thys rycharde afferme wryters named rychard wythout fere thys cause foloweth testyfyeth frenche boke vsed mych byd hys bedys cryste soules vpon nyght whan longe watched entred chyrche stode corp vnburyed man watchynge whyle sayd hys orysons soule layed hys gloues vppon deske hym whan ended hys deuocyons went ye chyrche gettynge hys gloues behynde shortly remembred hym retorned towarde chyrche fetche hys sayd glouys whan came chyrch dore founde ye corp standynge wyth hys armes spradde abrode makynge greate noyse crye wherfore duke made ye sygne ye crosse hys forehed coniured corp shulde reste vayne wherof duke drewe hys sword stroke corp hys thynkyng parted hym two peces done entred chyrche fet hys glouys departed chaunce ordeyned thorough hys realme corp shulde watched fyrste nyght lenger men hadde deuocyon gyse somtyme vsed englande begon norman men may coniecture fyrste conquered thys lande polycronycon sheweth vii chapyter hys vi boke thys duke rycharde dremed nyght monke house saynte audoenus roan went towarde hys lemman nyght fyll besyde brydge drowned whose soule stryfe bytwene angell fende whyche longe stryfe condescended put iudgement duke rycharde duke gaue sentence soule shuld restored agayne body ye body set vppon ye brydge fallen fro yf went hys lemman shuld fendes yf nat shulde saued whan thys sentence put execucyon monke fledde vnto chyrche therby uppon morne whan duke awoke called thys vysyon hys memory knowe certaynte therof went vnto sayd chyrche fande monke hys clothes yet wete went abbot place tolde hym thys dede aduertysynge hym take better ouersyght hys flocke narracyons herers may gyue credence lyketh nother pystle yet gospell antonin archbysshop florence whan reherseth lyke narracyons whych thynketh somwhat doutefull ioyneth wordes sayth piu est credere thyrde narracyon tolde thys duke whych presumpcyon regestred woman scrybe thys duke wyth gunnore hys wyfe lyued longe whyle dyshonest lyfe contrary lawes chyrch wherof people murmured sore length holsome doctryne hys clerkes spyrytuall men maryed hys lawfull wyfe fyrste nyght ye weddynge game otherwyse duchesse torned buttocke ye duke lappe tyme hadde neuer done whan duke frayned cause doyng sayd may lyketh myghte lyked upon thys gunnore gate besyde chylder emma wyfe egelred ye haue harde dyed whan ruled normandy terme lii yeres retourne vi lewys kyng fraunce whome haue made longe dygressyon wytnesseth mayster gagwyne dyed yere lorde ix hundred lxxxix whe reygned iii yeres buryed copayne ye shall vnderstande lewys last kynge blode pepyn promysed shewe dyscent sayde pepyn ende ye maye better know thys story also knowe kynges fraunce kynges germany discended thys pepyn hereafter shall clerely set brau ches fyrste woll expresse kynges fraunce reygned lynially ioyne eyther terme reygned maye appere howe longe thys blode continued ye house fraunce empeched hugh capet appereth yeres pepyn xviii charlys xlvii lewys fyrste xxvi charlys ballyd xxxvii lewys balbus ii lewys charlys v lewys fourth viii eudo ix charlys symple xvii radulphus xii lewys vnus xxi lotharius xxx lewys syxte iii whyche kynges ii blode eudo radulphus admytted barony fraunce rule lande tyll two progeny meane charlys symple lewys v comen theyr lawfull age fyrst yere pepyn whyche began reygne yere grace vii hundred l fyrst yere hugh capet began hys reygne yere lorde god ix hundred lxxxix expyred passed ii hundred xxxix yeres pypyn fader charlys greate charlys great emperour lowys fyrste emperour kynges germany lothayre emperour sonne lewys fyrst lowys emperour sonne lothayre lothayre seconde son lothayre charlys iii sonne lothayre lewys kyng germany broder vnto sayd lothayre lewys sonne lewys whyche broder vnto charlys grossu emperour lewys son lewys y compted emperour arnusphus sonne lewys emperour lewys sonne arnulph last emperour fraunce kynges fraunce charlys ballyd sonne lewys fyrst hys ii wyfe emperour lewys balbus son charlys ballyd lewys charlys sonnes lewys balbus lewys iiii son foresayd charlys charlys symple sonne lewys forth lewys v sonne charlys symple lothayre sonne foresayde lewys lewys sonne lothayr last kyng flock ccii chapiter hugh sonne robert tyraunt descended hugh legraunde beganne take rule vsurpe crowne fraunce yere lorde ix hundred lxxxix viii yere egelredus kynge englande thys wytnessyth frenche cronycle erle parys marshall fraunce sayth antoninus maryed one doughters edwarde elder thys also named capet myche hys youth vsed game laye asyde hys felowes hodes whose begynnyng charlys brother lothayre vncle vnto lewys vi laste kynge herynge deth hys neuewe lewys wythout issue nexte heyre wyth ayde lordes fraunce also loreyn whyche lorde gadered army entred fraunce came cytye laone wythin whyche cytye wyth hys wyfe people treason bysshoppe cytye taken delyuered wyth hys wyfe chylder handes hys enemyes whyche sent orleaunce sauely kept thys hugh crowned cytye rayns welded lande wyth suerty erle flaunders named arnulphus arnolde spoken wolde vnder hys obedyence wherfore thys hugh assembled hys kynghtes hys strength toke hym coutre artoys wyth many stronge holdes castels lastly forced sayd arnolde fle normandy aske ayde richarde fyrste name spoken story vi lewys whose meanes wryters wyllyam longa spata fader ye sayd duke richarde slayne wythstandynge frendshyp sayde duke richarde thys arnolde reconcyled vnto kynge contynued hys subiecte cytye rayns arch bysshoppe thys daye noble prelate named arnolde sonne baste lothayre neuewe charlys prysoner touched whyche malyce kynge bare vnto hym cause forenamed charlys called counsayle clergy hys lande layde agayne hym suche obieccyons theyr assent putte benefyce sente hym orlyaunce also kepte pryson set hys place one gylberte frenche boke gerbres connynge man phylosophy whiche tyme ben tutor mayster robert sonne sayde hugh iii yeres pope iohn xvi name sent downe hys maundement vnto guyan archebysshop sen chargynge hym sholde remoue ye sayde gerbers restore sayde arnolde hys proper see whyche done shortely ye sayde gerbers preferred one othons emperour vnto ye chyrche rauenne contynued tyll deth xvii iohn whose deth electe pope rome named secode siluester lyued pope iiii yeres followeth story whan thys hugh reygned full viii yeares dyed yere lorde ix hundred xciii buryed saynte denys leuynge hym sonne named robert cciii chapiter robert sonne hugh capet beganne reygn yere lord ix hundred xcviii xvii yere egelredus kynge englande conynge many scyences man good maner vertue made dyuers hymnes sequence respondes iuda et hierusulem costantia martyrum sit nobis scti spus gratia co gruely sancti spiritus assit nobis gratia wyth dyuers ye beginnyng reygn bowcharde erle meleon kynges court galtyer walter knyghte seruaunt sayde bowcharde sayd bowcharde hadde delyuered castell meleon kepe absence great gyftes sayde walter hadde delyuered sayde castell unto eudo erle carnotens wherfore kyng request sayd bowcharde sente streyghte commaundement vnto sayd eudo chargyng hym goodly wyse restore sayde castell vnto bowcharde whyche commaundement vtterly refused obey ye whych ye kyng beyng amoued sent rycharde seconde name iiii duke normandy wyth theyr armyes besyeged castell vppon euery parte length wan yt toke sayd walter wythin kinge vntrouthe commaunded soone hanged vppon gybet castell restored vnto ye forenamed bowcharde returned euery man owne tyme reygne thys robert dyd henry duke burgoyne whyche lacke yssue body bequethed dukedome vnto kynge robert burgonyons wythstode legacy drewe theym hed captayne lawdry erle neuers wyth hym helde strength strength cytye anxerre wherof herynge kyng robert sente foresayde duke normandye spedde theym towarde burgoyne besyeged forsayd cytye length ye cytye yolden lawdry put kynges grace done kyng hoste besyeged nother stronge cytye called aualon wythout great daunger wanne yt also length receyued countrey wyth dew obeysaunce ordered yt hys pleasure retourned fraunce arnolde erle sen vsed great tyranny amonges byshoppes mynysters chyrche wherfore leophricus byshop see thorough ayde counsayll regnalde byshop parys put oute sayde arnolde delyuered cytye vnto kynge robert brother sayde arnolde certayne knyghtes fled castell yt helde wyth strength wherfore kynge layde syege sayd castel length wan yt toke brother arnolde named fromode sent orleauce prisoned dyed shortly robert saith frenche boke buylded fyrst ye castell mout fort founded also dyuers monasteryes teples orleauce teple saint anyan stamp chyrche lady dyuers dyuers place hys realme endowed chyrche saynte denys wyth many great lyberties hadde especyall deuocyon saynte ypolyte ouer sayntes radde kynge robert vppon season hadde longe whyle lyen syege castell nere vnto orleaunce sawe yt defuse wynne strength vpon ye daye saynt anyan yode vnto orleaunce quere bare cope dyd helpe synge dyuyne seruyce deuocyos masse whyle preste co secracion sayd thryse agn dei walles castell fyll wythout stroke gunne engyne hys enemyes submytted hys grace many vertues myght shew vertuous price passe ouer length tyme conclude thus reygned moste accorde wryters ruled hys lande nobly xxx yeres dyed buryed house saynte denys leuynge fyrst wife constauce sonne named henry one named robert hys seconde wyfe ii sonnes named symonde almaryche yt shulde seme sequele next storye constaunce shuld laste wyfe fyrste deuorced hym cause chyldern shulde legyttymat yt authoure maketh mencyon anglia cciiii chapiter edmunde ironsyde sonne egelredus also canutus ye sonne swanus kyng de marke beganne rule englyshemen yere lorde thousande xvi xix yere robert kynge fraunce ye londoner wyth assystece ye lordes england fauoured edmude party lordes fauoured canut specylly spiritualtye ye tyme sworne feauty hys father beynge southampton swore vnto good trewe iustice entreate people soberly ryghte wysely edmunde beynge archbyshop yorke crowned lodon solemnyte fynyshed ended sped hym westsaxon subdued yt countrey whych tyme canutus whych ye englyshe storye called knough drewe wyth hys people lodon wold haue entred hym forboden londoner whiche layde hys ordynaunce aboute cytye en tendynge haue entred perforce long fayne breke syege depart then canutus put london drewe westwarde mette processe wyth edmunde dorsetshyre besyde gyllyngham betwene theym foughten stronge cruell batayll ende canutus ouercomen compelled forsake felde thys mette agayne worceter shyre fought stro ger batayll strongly bydden ye men coude iudge whych parte better worse wytnessyth policronica eyther theym departed fro eyther werynesse fyghte lak daye vppon morne folowynge hostes ioyned agayne fought egerly contynuynge whych fyght edricus espyenge edmunde auauntage wynnynge feld sodaynly pyght dede mannys hed vppon spere hed cryed hoste englyssmen fle fle ye englyshemen saue selfe loo hedde edmude kyng edmunde therof beynge warned spedde hym towarde parte felde behaued hym comfortably amonges hys men hys knyghtely courage hys people recoueryd loste cotynued batayll tyll nyght suche wyse hadde rather better worse caused canutus refuse countrey retourne towarde london agayne edmunde beyng aduertysed canutus retourned towarde london folowed hym passed ryuer thamys delyueryd cytye daunger danys afterwarde encountred danys place called brentforde cruell fyght scom fyted theym length thys passe tyme emma ye wyfe egelredus ferynge fortune warre sent two sonnes alphrede edwarde vnto brother richarde seconde name fourth duke normandy edricus whyche sayd euer subtyle wyt consyderynge good fortune edmunde hys knyghtely courage thought length shuld ouercome danys wherfore saue hys lande also brynge aboute hys malycyouse treason sought wayes meanes howe myght stande hys grace fauour length obteyned entente swore hym hys trewe subiecte kynge edmunde season soiorned lodon made towarde danys kent met wyth place called okefforde otforde scomfyted chasyd canut yle shepey canutus toke shypyng sayled land entred lastely ye coutrey mercia spoyled parte therof two hostes met soone place called asshedown longe fyghte edricus wyth retynew fledde comforte danys meane wherof kyng edmunde put worse many noble men slayne vppon party amonges whyche byshop lyncoln abbot ramysey two thyther come treate peace betwene bothe prynces whe layde ye charge edric vntrew meanes excused hym man myght charge hym defaut thus contynuynge thys mortall warre betwyxte two marcyall prynces grete desolacyo mortalyte people one knyghtes partye edmunde gatte hym hyghe place myght somwhat harde ye hoste spake thys wyse dayly dye man hath vyctorye edmunde may ouercome great strength canutus may ouercome fauoure fortune shall ye fruyte thys cotynuall stryfe none knyghtes ben slayn eyther partyes duke compelled nede shall accorde ellys shall fyght alone wythout knyghtes syn shall ende one two accorde kyngedome suffycynt twayne yt somtyme suffysed vii theyr couetyse lordshyppes great eyther hath indygnacyon take haue parte wyth ellys one vnder lette fyghte alone woll lordes alone left fyght men slayne meane wherof men shall left vnder theyr lordshyp ledyng duke yet defende kynge agayne stronge enymyes nacyons wordes thus spoken ryght wele alowed hostes affermeth myne author time trewce made betwen prynces far certayne tyme whych peace ended yt occasyon wordes otherwise sayde two duke edmunde canutus agreed trye theyr quarelles betwene two onely thys assygned theyr agrementes lytell yle called olney nere vnto glouceter wryters named olenege bycleped wyth water seuerne whyche place daye appoynted two chapyons met wythoute company assistence wythin ye sayd yle hostes bothe partyes standynge wythoute yle abydynge fortune thys batayll eyther proued fyrste wyth sharpe speres wyth kene cuttynge swordes shall thys make lenger proces eyther hadde well proued assayed receyuynge harde sore stroke fyrste mocyon canutus moste wryters testyfyen lastely accorded kyssed gyther louers great comforte bothe hostes shortely aduyce bothe theyr counsaylles condescended vppon partycyon lande whyche immedyately done bothe theyr agrementes loued two bretherne duryng theyr naturall lyues serpent idre enuy false conspyracye euer burnyd harte edricus kyndeled sore pure force yt must breke vpon lyght flambe myghte accomplyshe owne persone fulfylled sonne testyfyen dyuerse authours affermeth guydo sonne edricus away tynge tyme espyed ye kyng wyddraught purge nature wyth spere strake hym foundement bodye wherof kynge edmunde dyed shortly ox king thus beynge slayne anon edricus thynkynge therby greatly exalted spedde hym haste vnto canutus saluted hym kynge shewed hym thys treason onely hys loue done canutus hadde well vnderstandyng ye confessyon edricus lyke dyscrete ryghtous prynce sayd vnto hym thys wyse thou haste edricus loue thou berest vnto slayne thyne naturall lorde whyche moste loued shall exalte thyne hed aboue al lordes england forthwyth commaunded hym taken hys hedde stryken pyght spere hedde sette vppon higest gate london marianus scot telleth edmunde dyed london naturall sekenesse feste saynt andrewe englyshe cronycle affermeth forenamed treason nother maner doynge howe euer noble prynce dyed trouth yt agrement moste wryters yt ended hys lyfe hadde reygned one yere myche moneth iune vnto ende nouember buryed glastenbury hys graundfather edgare policronica sheweth xviii chapyter hys vi boke canutus deth edmunde gave vnto edricus lordeshyppe mercia hys counsayll exyled brother edmunde called kynge chorles thorough consayle executed many cruell dedes edmude remayned two sonnes wyt edmunde edwarde ccv chapiter canutus knougth englyshe cronycle sonne swanus touched yonger brother appereth ye story folowynge began domynyon alone ouer englande yere lorde thousande xix xxi yere robert kyng frau ce whyche anon deth edmunde assembled counsayll london among thynges cousayll debated questyon put whether composicyon made betwene edmunde canutus speciall remembrauce made chyldren brethern edmunde partycyon parte lande wherunto yt answered lordes naye affermyng farthermore wyth othe kynges pleasure vttermoste theyr power wolde put blood edmunde myght reason whyche answere promyse thought many haue standen great grace fauoure kynge yt turned otherwyse many partye canutus apperceyued knewe beforetyme sworne edmunde heyres also natyue englishe men mystrusted disdaned euer myche exyled slayn goddes punyshement dyed sodaynly amonge edricus wyth sugred wordes contynued kynges fauoure sayth marianus mynded whose counsayll shortely outlawed foresayde brother edmunde surnamed kynge charlis touched afterwarde reconcyled kynges fauour lastely slayne owne seruautes canutus also sayde counsayll sent ii sonnes edmude named sayde edmunde edwarde vnto brother swanus kynge denmarke slayne oppynyon wryters abhorrynge dede sente theym salomon kynge hungarye wytnessyth guydo processe tyme edmunde dyed brother edwarde tracte tyme maryed agatha doughter iiii henry emperour almayne whyche edwarde agatha procedyd margarete quene scotlande crystyane menchon sonne named edgar surnamed ethelynge thys edwarde cronycles england named edwarde outlawe myche neuer returned englande sayth sayde englyshe cronycle hys fyrste exyle returne vnto canus whyche thynges orderyd lande deuyded sayd lande foure partes meane fyrst princypall dayes westsaxon helde vnder hys owne gydyng eestenglande whych coteyned norff suff betoke rule ye erle turkyll dane whome somwhat iii chapyter ye story egelred mercia betoke subtell erle edricus iiii northumberlande vnto dane named hircius lyke man inde tyme chau ged colour edricus chau ged neuer fals maners wythstandynge great benefytes dayly receyued prynces hadde ben false dysceyuable dayes past euen nowe demeaned hym agayne canutus wherfore beynge accused proued wyth defaute commauded kyng haue iudgement whyche done immediatly hedde dyuerse cause smyten yt wyth bodye spyte caste fowle fylthy place ranulf sayth slayne kynges agrement wythin paleys london body wyth hed throwne towne dyche thus wyth shame ended falshode dyssymulacyo contynued myche lyfe aboute ix yere reygne canut called parliament oxenford amonges thynges yt enacted englyshmen danys shuld holde lawes edgar lately kynge pastyme dyed swanus brother canutus kynge denmarke wythout issue wherfore lande fyll canutus cause wyth stronge army sayled thyther take possessyon set countrey order wryters apeas wythstande wandelys yt perced lande done therin myche harme goodwyn erle whose doughter edwarde confessour maryed wyth certayne nomber englyshmen fyll vpon ye wandalys nyght dystressed theym suche wyse canutus pleasure dede kyng erle goodwyn euer good fauoure loued englyshmen specyally returned englande shortely maryed emma wyfe lately egelredus whych receyued processe tyme son named hym hardicunitus hardykynitus englyshe boke hardyknough aboute tyme fyll voyde see lyndesser durham whyche dyuyne inspyracyon knowlege receyued voyce tumbe saynt cuthbert blessed edmude thre yere vacacyon electe see ye shal vnderstande thys saynte edmunde ponteney archbyshoppe caunterbury dayes henry thyrde cxcvi chapiter canutus vii yere reygne exhortacyon egelnothus archbishop cauterbury translated body saynt elphegus late archbyshoppe sayd see martyred danys shewed seconde chapiter storye egelredus shryued hym hys owne chyrche caunterbury foresayde tyme also thys canutus aboute xvi yere hys reygne scottes rebelled agayne hym wherfore great army entred scotlande length ouercame kynge lande named malcolyne brought agayne hys subieccyon recorded bokes marianus scot reason whych vyctory canutus kynge iiii kyngdoms england scotlad denmarke norwaye wytnessyth dyuerse authours betaken lande englande gydynge leofricus egelnothus returned denmarke thes yode rome xv yere reygn made great offerynges saynte peter poule redemed scole saxon fre former trybute graunted storyes iue offa kynges saxon som deale touched whyche redempcyon tribute sayth guydo called rome scot shall seme sayenge douteth myche thys daye dyuers place englad northamptonshyre peter pen yet gaderyd canutus also rome accomplyshed purpose hys returne towarde englande executed wonderfull dedes almes releuynge poore goftly workes payde great good raunsom crysten prysoners amonges dedes wytnessyd shulde agree pope called benet viii name pay hym certayne summes money archbyshoppes yt daye myghte haue pall wythoute payenge money therfore whe comen citye papia italy hys way home warde brought arme saynte augustyne doctour hundred pounde syluer talent golde noted thre maners taletes fyrst grettest weyght vi score pounde weyghte seconde weyght lxxii pounde thyrde leest l pounde weyght yf reken talent leest poude gold troye weyght xii vuces l pounde vi hudred vnces euery vnce fyne golde worth xl whyche reason talent shulde value summe xii hundred pounde precyous relyque ye kyng gaue vnto trusty frende leofricus ye whych myche loued trusted remayned couentre many yeres whyle canutus occupyed thys iourney coplaynt brought vnto hym mysse demeanurs rule occupyed exercysed absence wythin realme wherfore wrote home letter lordes chargynge theym straytely defautes redressed agayne hys comyng home thys kynge wythnesseth guydo great magnyfycence vsed suche iustyce temperaunce dayes weste partes worlde prynce renowne canutus ouer gretly beloued dradde hys subiectes tyme canutus tessyfyeth guillelmus de pontificibus munke glastebury named bryghtwolde whyche bysshop wylton beynge hys contemplacyon prayer bethoughte hym lynage englyshe kynges thought fyll slumber whyche tyme slepe sawe saynte peter apostle standynge hym holdynge hys hande edwarde sonne egelredus normandy whyche thynkynge saw saynte peter saker ye sayde edward kynge englande shewed hym farther holy edwarde shulde hys lyuynge shuld reygne kynge xxiii yeres thys monke frayned saynt peter ofsprynge thys edwarde shulde kynge hym whyche questyon answered peter kyngedome englyshemen kyngedome god wherfore kynges therof shall stande goddes puruyaunce also nother doctour called henry huntyngdon shewyd holy man warned englyshe men lorde whyche thought nothynge vppon shulde come fraunce brynge ryght lowe tyme also thys canut agrement many wryters fyll one thynge worthy mynde memory town saxony named calbis ye dyocesys magburgh parysshe saynt magii xviii men xv woman vppon euen natyuyte lorde began daunce chyrche yarde saynt magu afore sayd person prestes beyng masse wythin ye chyrche beyng troubled wyth noyse mynstrellys also dynne sayde men woman sent vnto monysshynge seace doynge vayne wolde seace theyr dysport commaudement yt gyuen wherwyth preste beynge dyscontented none wyse reuerenced ye sacrament noryed solempne season besought god saynte magii shulde contynue theyr daunce space hole yere whyche prayer harde suche wyse contynued songe daunce tyll daye twelue monethes neuer eate dranke rested ye season moreouer dewe rayne fyll vppon yere garment thyng impayred shoo yeres ende horobertus archbysshop dyocesys came vnto ye sayde place lowsed bonde whych preste bounde awlter chyrche reconsyled whyche prestes doughter two dyed forth wyth remenaunt yode reste slepte space iii dayes iii nyghtes folowynge dyed suche lyued fell lame theyr lymmes one xviii men beyng named ubertus hupertus wrote thys wonder wyth hys owne hande recorde trowth let v retorne canutus redde hys comyng rome beganne somdele presume pryde set hym selfe good wysdome wolde tyme whyche exaltacyo hys mynde went vnto tamys syde behelde howe water swelled flowed standynge nere water water touched hys fete charged water shuld flowe hygher wyse shulde wche hys lordes clothes water kepte course wette length kynges thyes wherewyth ye kyng abasshed sterte backe sayde erthly kynges may know theyr power vayne none worthy haue name kynge hath thynges subiecte hys hestes shewed worchynge hys treature thys water thys wytnesseth polycronycon offered hys crowne ye rode wynchester neuer bare vpon hed also wytnessed sayde authour canutus maryed hys doughter hadde hys laste wyfe vnto henry sonne conradus emperour seconde name also testyfyed authour cronica cronicarum repayred many monasteryes specyally suche tyme hurte throwne downe tyme hys father persecucyon began ended monastery saynt edmundes bury endowed wyth ryche possessyons towched dyed fynally shaftesbury buryed wynchester whan hadde reygned xix yeres leuyng hym two sonnes hys wyues eldest named harolde yonger hardykynytus whyche lyuyng hys fader made kynge denmarke francia ccvii chapiter henry sonne robert bega hys domynyon ouer french men yere lord mxxix x yere canutus kynge englande whyche henry costantyne moder vnkynde meanes wolde haue preferred yonger sonne roberte duke burgoyne rule lande thys henry meanes bothe cytyes castels wyth holden hym suche toke parte ouer lad forced resorte robert duke normandy aske helpe hym wythstande hys enemyes ye shall vnderstande robert vi duke normandy sonne richarde seconde also father vnto wyllya bastard conquered englande thys roberte lyberall noble condycyon defamed ye deth hys elder brother rychard thyrde whyche murder wytnessyth dyuers authours vii yere hys dowchery went iherusalem dyd pylgre mage many honourable liberall actes whyche good order ben remembred xix chapyter vi boke polycronicon robert receyued kyng henry wyth honour gaue vnto hym greate ryche gyftes sent hys frendes knyghtes ye kynge hys ayde greate myghty hoste retorned agayn fraunce short whyle recouered hys sayde moder bothe cytyes townes castelles fautours hym wythhelde fynally agreed wyth contynued frendes theyr lyfe tymes enduryng whyche accorde v yere hys reygne made warre vppon eudo erle champayne vppon baldewine erle flauders processe tyme wan fro certayne cytyes castelles whyche constance moder hadde tymes gyuen tyme dyscencyon thys warre slayne eudo erle champayne wherfore hys ii sonnes stephen thybaud maynteyned warre agayne kynge theyr bothe harmes ye ende stephen loste therby cytyes chartres tower thybaude ye cytyes troyes maulx wyth whan henry hadde ended thys warre set hys lande quyetnesse tha buylded monastery saynt martyne called de chap besyde parys set therin seculer prestes thys passetyme robert duke normandy moued conscyence vysyte holy sepulture oure lorde called hym hys lordes hys lande wyllynge comaundynge owe theyr trewe allegaunce vnto hys yonger sonne wyllyam take hym theyr lord duke yf retorne agayne thys caused swere robert archbysshop roan hys lordes departed vppon sayd iourney dyed cytye bethenia comynge homewarde wherof ye lordes normandy beynge assertayned accepted foresayde wyllyam theyr lorde souerayne thys wyllyams procreacyon yt wytnessed uyncent hystory father passynge cytye towne faloys normandy sawe company maydens daunsynge strete amonges whych one passynge beautye called arlet doughter skynner ye duke robert caste vnlefull loue suche wyse yt caused broughte bed nyght folowyng helde concubyne certayn tyme begat wyllyam whe moder wyth coceyued dremed bowel lys sprad ouer normandye englande borne moders wombe fyll groude closed handes wyth powder flore pauement therfore mydwyfe made exclamacyon sayd chyld shall kynge yt foloweth thys wyllyam thus admitted duke lordes meane ye kyng frauce began wythdraw hym myche ye erle gylbert whome duke robert betaken hys ponge sonne gyde slayne especyall frendes chylde fyghtyng manslaughter countrey fowle faren reason opynyons amonges selfe wherof guy burgoyn one chefe causers adherentes sayde alwayes wolde haue bastarde ruler guy saith freche boke nere kynnesman vnto ye yonge duke descendyd doughter seconde rycharde entended haue ben duke hym selfe ensensed ye kyng frauce agayn hym myght length duke wyllyam toke hym put hym deth thus frenche kynge forgettynge ye kyndnesse shewyd hym duke robert hys father toke partye agayne hym vttermoste ordeyned hym ii hostes wherof one delyueryd brother almaryk warned hym eutre ye countrey caus hym selfe ladde entred cou trey eurour wyllyam ferynge kynges great power beynge growen wele towarde mannes stature lyke luste yonge knyght made towarde kynges brother gaue hym batayll hym ouercame chased frenchemen theyr great bylany wherof heryng frenche kyng wyth people spedde hym toward wyllyam reuenge shame done men coclusyon wan honoure peace made betwene kyng ye duke frenche prysoners delyueryd peace enduryed long frech kyng callynge reme brauce losse hys men mort mere dede see wyth dysauauntages hym sustayned sayde duke wyllyam called hys ayde geoffrey erle aungiers whan hys hoste assembled entred ye prouynce normady co tynued theyr iourney tyll came arme see hoste shulde passe ouer thys new warre duke wyllya beynge warned haste assembled hys norman sped hym ye next waye mete frenchemen thys meane whyle frenche kynge passed water wyth certayne hys hoste trustyng remenauaut shulde haue folowed soone water flowed faste hys people myghte passe thys whyle came duke set vpon kynges hoste bet theym downe cruelly length kynge compelled flee loste great nomber knyghtes consyder ye slayne wyth taken prysoners whan kynge henry well dysgested hys mynde wrongfull trouble enuyous person hadde put duke vnto reme bred yll expedycyon warre recosyled hym selfe made meanes duke myghte agreed accorded whyche dyscrete solycytours shortely brought good effecte contynued fre de durynge theyr lyues henry abstayned hym warre vsed reste hys lyfe pea quyetnesse thys henry two wyues laste whyche doughter kynge russy iii sonnes say phylyp whych made kyng fraunce hys lyfe robert duke burgoyne hughe named hugh le graunde fader raufe erle uermendoyse thys kynges dayes burgoyne ben vnder ye frenche kynges obeysaunce ouer hundred xxx yeres refused frenche kynge aparte torned vnto conradus seconde name emperour parte whyche stretched champayne belonged fraunce parte whyche stretched toward basaynz belonged almayns yere kynge admytted hys sonne phylyp gydynge realme dyed buryed saynt denys leuyng hym issue forenamed whan hadde reygned moste wryters xxxi yeres anglia ccviii chapiter harold sonne canutus elgma ye erlys doughter hampton bega reygne ouer englande ye yere lordes incarnacyon xxxix x yere henry tha kyng frauce thys delyuernesse swyftenesse surnamed harefote whose begynnynge stryfe amonge lordes myche hys byrthe shulde doughte whyther kynges son specyally erle goodwyne dyd vttermoste hys power sette hym put hardykynitus brother honour leo frycus canutus mych loued trusted wyth ayde dane wythstode myghtely goodwyne hys sonnes fayled theyr purpose anone thys harold crowned kynge banysshed hys stepmoder emma toke suche goodes iewelles whych emma sayled flau ders bawdewyne erle reuerently receyued abode durynge lyfe thys harolde whyche contynued hys lyfe lytell fruyte profyte land yet subiectes hym ye vyce clerkes lyste nat put memory rudenesse whyche worthy memory nothynge hym put remembraunce dyed london oxenford buryed westmynster reygned moste wryters agreen iii yeres odde monethes leuynge hym none heyre wherfore hys brother kyng denmarke next kynge hym ccix chapiter hardikynytus sonne canutus emma made kyng england yere lordes incarnacyon mxli xii yere henry kyng frau ce thys wryters named hardykynytus hardyknough anone deth hys brother sent denmarke receyued ioyously crowned londo ethelnotus archybysshop caunterbury suche cruelty sent alfrycus archbysshoppe yorke erle goodwyne vnto westmynster commaundynge iniury hys brother harolde done vnto moder emma shuld drawe corp ye place buryed throwen ryuer thamys done accordynge hys wyll whych corp testyfyeth guydo founden fyssher buryed vnreuerently within chyrcheyarde saynt clement standyng wythout temple barre london polycronycon sayth curelty caused fyrst hed hys sayd brother smyten body throwen sayd ryuer lette herers thys gyue credence lyke semeth though kyng ben suche cruelty bysshop forenamed wolde haue ben executour fowle dede thys kyng also leuyed forenamed trybute named dane gelt spent lytell comforte realme gaue vnto shypmen maryners lewde person greate vnsyttynge fee wage suche prodegalyte bourdes tabelles courte spred iiii tymes daye people serued great excesse mete also drynke wyth leuyeng foresayd try bute comons greatly grudged worceter two hys seruauntes whyche assygned gader money slayne whyche dede kynge sore dyspleased yt brent great parte towne thys hardykynutus authours maryed hys syster named gunylda vnto thyrde henry emperour whych passyng beaute doughter also emma laste wyfe canutus processe tyme thys gunylda falsely accused spowsebrech tryall wherof put champyon wherfore beynge greate agony lastely trustyng god knowyng selfe without gylte offence putte chyld wyth brought englande stede champyon whyche fought wyth man geauntes stature fynally hym slew broughte vnto confusyon gunylda dyuyne power hadde thus clered selfe vtterly refused emperours company ended lyfe seruyce hym onely god hadde defended ryght yt shulde appere polycronycon also antoninus thys mayden maryed ye sayde henry lyfe father canutus also durynge lyfe sayde henryes father named conradus second touched storye sayde canutus thys hardykinytus brother rad kynge betoke rule lande vnto hys moder erle goodwyn whyche maryed wytnessyth englyshe cronycle doughter canutus gotten vppon hys fyrste wyfe elgina whome many thynges mysse orderyd specyally subtylyte erle goodwyn erle many sonnes wytnesseth polycrony con xxv chapyter hys vi boke fyrste wyfe kynge canutus syster hys doughter aboue sayde hadde one sonne whyche vndyscrete strykynge horse throwen thamys drowned mother lastely smytte wyth lyghtenyng dyed whome yt remembred vngracyous vyle condycyon set yonge wome horedome gader vnlefull meane ryches whyche wyfe dyed maryed seconde whome receyued vi sonnes wyt swanus harolde tostius wylnotus sirthe surthe leoffricus doughter named goditha whych maryed edwarde confessour two sonnes egelredus alphredus edwarde whych ye haue hard sent normady emma theyr mother came ye tyme reygne thys kyng englande vysyte se theyr mother brought wyth great nomber norman thys goodwyne ymagyned hys mynde howe myght preferre hys doughter godyth one bretherne thoughte mynde yt eldest wold dysdayne maryage thought ioyne vnto yonger make hym kynge quene compassed deth ye elder mean goodwyn warned lordes englande sayde yt great ieoperdye lande suffer many straungers entre land without lycence wherfore yt necessary punyshed example whych meanes gat authoryte order mater hym semed beste owne power moste myght nexte kynge wherfore yode mette wyth sayde norman slewe theym moste nomber vppon guylde downe slewe alway ix saued x yet thoughte many meane lefte lyue eft agayne tythed agayne sayd tythe slew euery tenth knyght cruell deth wyndynge theyr guttes theyr bodyes sayth polycronycon amonge put eyen elder brother alphredus sent hym ely dyed short tyme ye englyshe boke sayth yt slayne forenamed tormente edwarde conueyed waye broughte hys mother ferynge treason good wyne sente hym soone ouer see agayne howe yt ynglyshe cronycle telleth otherwyse goodwyne accused thys cruell dede sware depely yt forced kynge one cronicle fynde thys dede executed goodwyne tyme harolde harefote beynge kynge yt foloweth story kynge hardykynytus beynge feste lambehyth besyde london mery iocande whyle stode drynkynge fyll downe sodaynly dyed waxed dumbe lay tyll viii daye whyche viii daye moneth iune dyed hadde reygned moste wryters two yeres leuynge hym none yssue bodye lawfull buryed father wynchester thus endeth lyne ofsprynge swanus danys thys kynge blood danys clerely extyncte putte oute kyngly dygnyte wythin thys realme englande also persecution seased clerely thys kynges deth whyche contynued reke theyr fyrst landynge tyme brightricus kyng west saxon ix yere reygne ye storye rehersed ye terme cclv yeres ccx chapiter edward son egelredus emma hys last wyfe began reygne ouer england yere lord xliii xiiii yere henry kynge fraunce whyche deth hardykinitus sente normandye pledge layde hym wythout fraude shulde made kynge came wyth straunges sayth marianus lordes sent edwarde outlaw son edmunde ironsyde theyr kynge affyrmaunce said authour knew edwarde hys neuewe possessyon lande wolde medle hym farther thys edwarde great aduyse goodwyn erle west saxon leofric erle chester crowned kyng westmynster edsius archbyshop caunterbury wedded processe time goditha doughter erle goodwyne whych guydo called editha whych entreatyd suche wyse yt put bed yet delte wyth fleshely whyther yt hate kynne forloue chastite ye trouth shewed wryters agreen cotynued lyfe outen offence wyth woman kyng discharged engleshmen ye great tribute called dane gelt yt whych sundry tyme spoken yt ye daye yt gaderyd also subdued ye brytons walshmen made warre wythin bondes ye land yt theyr duke leder called gryffyn gryffyth ayde ye irysh men entred ryuer seuerne toke many prayes departed agayne wythout fyght tyme reygne thys edwarde emma moder accused familyer ye byshop winchester upo accusacio cousayll erle goodwyn toke many iewellys caused keptsomdele straitly abbay warwell byshop comytted examynacyon correccyon clergye moder sorowynge defame alwyn byshoppe awne estate wrote vnto dyuers byshoppes besought iustyce affermynge yt redy abyde leful sharpest triall dyuers ye byshoppes made laboure kynge byshop robert archebyshop caunterbury beyng wyth theyr laboure dyscontended sayde maner brethern bisshoppes sayd dare ye defende wyld beste woman hath defamed son kynge nempned lecherours lemman goddes owne preste yt woman wolde purge preste shall purge woman accused consentynge deth sonne alphred procured venym poysonyng son edwarde yt gylty gyltlesse yf woll go barefoted selfe iiii steppe byshop v contynually vpon ix plough sharys brennynge fyre hote yf escape harmelesse shall assoyled chalenge also thys graunted daye purgacyon assygned day ye kyng grete part lordes present robert fayled yt pyte otherwyse thys robert monke house normandy came ouer sonde kynge fyrste made bysshoppe london archbysshopppe caunterbury nyght emma shulde make purgacyon went vnto shryne saynt swythune wynchester kneled night prayer receyued dyuyne coforte upon morne blyndefelde ladde vnto place betwene ii men iron laye glowynge hote passed ix sharys vnhurte last sayde good lorde shall come place purgacyon opened eyen sawe paste payne kneled downe thanked god saynte swythune kynge repented hym restored hadde taken asked forgyuenesse archebyshoppe caunterburye fledde normandye thys emma gaue vnto monastery holy confessour saynt swythune ix maners bysshoppe ix affermeth polycronica long kyng edwarde gaderyd stronge nauye southampton verely hauen sandwyche myche warned swanus kynge denmarke entended make warre vppon hym polycronycon sayth gadederyd thys nauy wythstande harolde harfagar kyng north ganys entended haue entred englande letted ye forenamed swan yt shortely made warre vpo ye sayd harold cronycle shewyth danys norgayns whyche meane men norway agreed come ioyntly england whyle kynge shyppyng mne one brought forth bole full mede meth drynke vpon bon vyage came bole bole drynke came dronkenes iangelyng iangelynge tourned stryfe stryfe tourned fyghtynge thorough many slayne turned theyr owne iourney lefte legede hys lyfe chyrche telleth beynge masse chyrche westmynster vppon whytsondaye tyme leuacyon sacrament laught wherof lordes beynge aboute hym meruayled greatly frayned hym cause wheruto answered sayde danys wyth norwayes one assente purposed haue comen thys lande haue taken prayes kynge danys shuld haue entred hys shyp fyll see drowned truste day shall none straungers make warre lande ccxi chapiter tyme thys edwarde fyll passynge great snowe whyche began begynnynge ianuary contynued tyll xvii daye marche saynte patrykes daye wherof great quantyte fyll weste countreys englande ensued great deth men moreyne beftes lyghtnynge corne vpon ground yere wonderfull brent wasted aboute x yere edwarde moueth policronyca moneth september eustace erle bolongn came lande douer whyche erle hadde wedded sayenge sayde authour kynge edwardes syster thys parted frome hys companye secrete wyse hys knyghtes fayne serche hym wenynge hadde ben slayne dweller towne whyche serche demeaned theym vndyscretely slewe cytezyne douer meane wherof people arose questyonynge thys mannes deth ran length vppon erles company slewe xx hys men wounded many mo hastely erle apperyd toke mennys parte conclusyon fayne wythdrawe hym selfe person rode vnto kynge beyng glouceter made vnto hym greuous complaynte men douer erle goodwyne moch hym commytted rule kente charged ryde thyther take wreche inhabytautes towne sayde commaundement counsayled kyng sende wardeyns castell douer ruler towne answere suche mater layde agayne yf gylty punyshe ellys answere goodwyn pleased nothynge kynge suche aboute hym wherfore many mo lordes sent amonge leofricus erle chester sewarde erle northumberland myne authour ben named whych assemble ye lord erle goodwyne suche monycyon ye counsayll yt wythdrewe hym courte gadered hym strength knyghtes dyuers shyres west saxon kent houed beuerston tyl sonnes came vnto peple soone came vnto hym eldest son named swanus brought wyth hym fayre companye hadde arreyred oxenfordeshyre gloucetershyre harolde hys sonne wyth feleshyppe assembled eest englande huntyngdonshyre people made great hoste goodwyn kyng accused gaderynge great hoste excused hym sayde yt done wythstand walyshmen whyche contrary proued comaunded sende awaye people come wyth certayne nomber vnto courte refused kyng wyth hys counsayll beynge london goodwyn harold eft sent charged come courte wyth xii persones wythoute mo render kynges handes knightes fee harolde sonne hadde wythin englande thys theym answered myghte come counsayll treachours gylefull men also wyth fewe men nomber mygthe wythoute parell shame passe countrey thys whyle parte goodwyns knyghtes wythdrewe theym hys power beganne mynyshe kynge thys whyle hadde gaderyd stronge hoste proclamacyons made goodwyne shuld come courte sayd auoyde land fyue dayes wherfore goodwyne consyderyng ieopardy yt toke wyth hym iii sonnes meane swanus tosty gurthe sayled flaundres receyued erle baldwyn wryters whose doughter swanus sonne hadde spoused named iudeth harolde leofricus two sonnes shyppes sayled fro brystow irland kynge ascertayned erle goodwyne wyth hys fyue sonnes thys maner departed oute lande shortly called parlyament authoryte outlowed goodwyne hys iii sonnes gone wyth hym done put owne wyfe doughter goodwyn abbaye warwell wyth one mayden sayth marianus goodwyn hys sayde sonnes contynued two yeres outlawed whyche season hys retynue toke dyuers tymes prayes ye march englande ende drewe hym suche strength purposed haue entred lande wyth force haue warred vppon kynge medyatours fauoured erle goodwyn peace made betwene ye kynge hym processe receyued grace wyth hys sonnes hys doughter restored fyrste former honoure thys peace contynued goodwyns parte delyueryd pledkes sonne hys called wylnotus sonne swanus named hacum hacun whyche ii pledge kynge edwarde sent vnto wyllyam duke normandy kept algarus sonne leofric erle chester whbme kynge gyuen erledome harold ruled yt dyscretely tyme absence hys returne delyuered yt gladly without grudge ccxii chapiter durynge tyme lauwry goodwyne wyllyam bastarde duke normandye came goodly copany land honorably receyued kyng made great chere hadde taryed certayne tyme agrement pleasure retourned hys owne wyth great gyftes pleasure emma kinges moder dyed shortly buryed wynchester swanus eldest sonne goodwyne went hierusalem then towarde lycia dyed waye colde taken goynge barefote norman gyuen kynge euyll counsaylles agayne englyshemen goodwyne frendes exyled among whyche robert archebyshop af caunterbury hadde spoken sore agayne theym one whych went rome complayn pope leon ix uyctour seconde whe receyued letter ye pope directed ye kyng returned abbay gemeticum normandye somtyme ben munke abbot dyed hym stigandus made successoure whyche sayth policronicon tyme lefte byshopryche shyrborne toke see wynchester stregth also vsed fayres holy chyrche thynges lewde vnlettred man part bysshoppes englande dayes ouer passed ryches dyssymulacyon yet neuer ye palle rome though great sale maketh many maystryes openly spoken worthy byshopryche coude vse ye bragge pompe worlde vse voluptuosyte glotony lechery shynynge araye clothynge countenaunce knyghtes gaderynge horseman thynketh full lytell profyte soules yf men sayde theym byshoppe shulde chosen holynesse lyuyng hys good clergye couetyse money wold answere foloweth nunc aliud tempus alii pro tepore more whyche verse maye englyshed thys maner tyme requyreth men done theym vse wynter warme clothes somer lyght lesse tyme sadnesse men done gamys refuse myrthe tyme men myrthes theym dresse tyme passed vsed great sadnesse chyrche nowe men lyghte wherfore maners muste wyth men agree light answere planed excused ye sharpenesse theyr mysse lyuynge tyme whyche shuld ranulff xii yeare ye reygne edward marian scot haue often named wrote myche ye dedes ye kynges england age xxv yeres forsoke world went pylgrymage shorne munke coleyne almayne abbay scottes whyche marianus wryters great fauoure malcolyne kyng scottes xiii yere kynge edward scottes rebelled agayn ye kyng wherfore sewarde erle northumberlande kynges commaundement gadered great hoste entred lande behaued hym manfully processe subdued scottes chased ye kynge coutrey kyng edwarde gaue kyngedome vnto malcolyn sonne kynge cumbrys beholden hym hys heyres kynges chefe lordes scotlande uppon ester mondaye aboute sayde yere goodwyn syttynge kynges bourde wyth lordes ye castell wyndsore yt happed one kynges cuppe berers stumble recouer agayne shedde none drynke wherat goodwyn lough sayde nowe one brother hath susteyned wherby ment one fote legge hathe sustayned ye fallynge wyth whyche wordes kyng marked sayd ryght brother alfrede shuld haue holden ne goodwyn ben erle conceyued kynge suspected hym hys brother deth sayde vnto kynge defendynge hys vntrouth syr perceyue well told yt shuld ye cause thy brother deth mought sauely swalowe mor fel brede yt hold hade giltlesse dede soone receyued brede forthwyth choked kynge commauded hym drawe table conueyed wynchester buryed marianus sayth erle goodwyn sat kynges table wynchester sodaynly taken palsye sykenes vpon ester mondaye dyed ye thyrd day lordshyppes gyuen vnto harold eldest sonne lyuynge haroldes erledome gyuen algarus sonne leofricus whych erledome oxenford wryters longe ye kynge edwarde sent vnto iiii henry emperour almayne aldredus bysshop worceter wyth noble men prayenge hym wolde sende vnto england hys cosyn edwarde sonne edmude ironsyde myche entended make hym hys heyre whyche request fulfylled came englande soone whych ye haue harde named edwarde outlawe witnessyth guydo yere came englande dyed london buryed westmynster thys yere folowynge kynge edwarde thorough yll counsayll exiled wythout gylte algarus sonne leofricus whych assocyat hym wyth gryffyne kynge duke walys destroyed ye countre harforde dyd mych harme ye towne set mynster fyre slew vii chanons therof kyng sent harolde agayn hym whiche chased walshmen theyr boundes recoueryd sayde towne appoyntement holden sayde algarus amended hurtes done walshme lastely recouncyled sayde algarus companye vnto kynges grace ccxiii chapiter aboute xv yere kynge edwarde dyed ye noble duke sewarde ruler northumberland flux whome guydo reherseth dyuers notable actes whyche passe ouer yt radde sawe well shulde dye caused hys armour put vppon hym armed syttynge cheyre hauynge ryghtes chyrch sayde yt became knyght man honour dye lyenge mene man dyed buryed yorke hys erledome gyuen tosty costy son goodwyn yere folowynge xvi yere kynge edwarde dyed also ye good erle leofricus erle mercia chester buryed abbay couentre whyche hadde buylded man purchased many great pryuyleges ye towne couentre made free maner toll excepte onely horse whyche haue also free comen fame telleth longe requeste made vnto hym wyfe named godina grau ted haue yt therof freed wyth wolde ryde naked thorough towne meane wherof yt freed algarus hys son erle hym harolde eldeste sonne goodwyn great authoryte ruled myche kynges armye yere folowyng algarus accused malyce exylded land wherfore fled agayne gryffyne duke walis done ioyously receyuyd maynteyned kynge therof beyng infourmed sent harolde walys make warre vppon gryffyne whyche quytte hym knyghtely wyse chased walshmen brent sayde gryffyns paleys place callyd rutlan nauy returned englande mydlent aboute rogacyon dayes nexte folowyng sayde harolde brother tosty sente thyther agayne wyth stronge army whyche season destroyed great parte walys conclusion brought walshmen vnto dew subieccyon forced gyue pledge contynuance done pursued sore vppon sayde gryffyne ende owne people purchase theyr owne lyues slewe sayde gryffyne sent hed vnto harolde moneth auguste deth thys griffyne commaundement kynge coutrey walys commytted gydynge ii bretherne gryffyne whyche fauoured kynges party tyme foresayd warre theyr brother warre walys thus brought ende harold polycy recouncyled agayne algarus erle mercia ye kyng grace contynued hys fauoure durynge hys lyfe thys tyme woman bakley barkshyre vsed yll craftes sorcery whyche syttynge vpon daye feste great dyner crowe lykyngly fedde brought vp kreked louder accustomed woman harde noyse knyfe fyll hande waxed sodaynly pale yt beganne syghe sorow sayd ala daye soule comen laste sorow spoken wordes messanger came sayde son mayny dede sodaynly conueyed owne full syke wherfore haste sent son monke doughter yt nunne whose comyng sayd thys wyse woman haue vsed yll crafte enyll lyuynge vayne hoped haue ben saued bede prayer praye ye woll releue tourmentes paynes soule iudgement gyuen wherfore case ye maye kepe body tourment sewe harte skyn laye troughe stone hyll wyth lede close iuste bynde wyth barres iron moste strongest sure wise cause ye xl son synge psalmes nyght vppon morne many mass yf lye stylle iii nyghtes burye body iiii daye thys noughte fyrste nyght whyle psalmes sayeng ye stroge bandes sodaynly broke one wyth gresely loke sene vppon horse backe blacke cast thys woman behynde hym rode forth wyth greate crye noyse harde sayth polycronycon iiii myles then thys wolde haue shewed fynde wryten recorded diuers authours retourne fourmer story wytnessyth myne authoure ranulfe ye xx yere ye reygne kynge edwarde harolde sayled towarde normandye vysyte hys brother wylnotus hacun hys neuewe ye haue harde layde pledge pea beholden vppon erle goodwyns syde agayne kynge course saylyng weder dryuen tempeste countre prouynce pontyfe verely puynce poutyth taken prysoner sent vnto duke wyllyam normandy whyche forced hym swere tyme folowynge shulde marye hys doughter deth kynge edward shulde kepe lande england hys behofe accordyng wyll mynde edwarde wryters opynyon nother cronycle wryten latyn sayd harolde fauour duke wyllya shewed hym kynge edwarde presence hys barony admytted sayde wyllyam heyre couenau ted wyth hym yf ouerlyued kyng wold saue wyse kepe lande hys vse whyche tydynges promyse wyllyam grau ted hym hys doughter wyfe yt wythin lawfull yeres maryage wyth greate dower cause harolde stabler hys promyse kepynge delyuered hym hacun hys neuew sonne hys brother swanus whyche myche desyred kepte styll wylnotus brother ye sayd harolde whiche couenauntes suffycyentely stablysshed enacted harold departed duke wyllyam wyth greate ryche gyftes processe tyme landed englande hys comynge kynges presence shewed hym done foresayde mater wyth kynge well cotented affermeth sayd latyne cronycle ccxiiii chapiter xxii yere kynge edwarde testyfyeth ranulfe tostius brother harolde cause shewed disconted kynges courte went vnto harforde marche walys tyme seruauntes harold comaudement theyr mayster besyed make prouysyon receyue kynge whan thys tostius thyder comen cruelly slewe sayde seruautes hys brother hacked small pecys caste meresowce salte done sent worde vnto kynge yt yf wolde come vnto hys feest shulde lacke powdered mete euer hadde besyde thys cruell dede sprange wyde hated mych hys owne tenauntes men northuberland prouynce lorde arose agayne hym toke fro hym hadde lastely chaced hym flaunders wyth fewe person waytynge vppon hym ye vertuouse kyng edward beyng contented wyth comons doynge consyderynge done wythout hys aduyce comaudement sent thyder harolde correccyon vppon heddes capytayns northumbers wherof beynge acerteyned cotynued theyr strength mette wyth harolde hys people sent hym vnderstade frely borne frely nourysshed myght nat suffer cruelnesse duke also lerned theyr elder soueraynes meyntayn fredom suffer deth lyue quyetnesse vnder easy duke whan harolde receyued thys message aduertysed ye strength northubers perceyued well wythout greate effusyon blode myghte correcte mysse doer wherfore semed hym better fauour cou tree take hede synguler profyte hys brother retorned kynge wyth thys answere purchased theyr pardon hym also procured ye kyng ye assygned duke erle named malcarus tostius hys brother wyth hys wyfe chyldern remayned flaunders durynge kynges lyfe kynge edwarde xxii yere hys reygne syttyng mete vpon eester day paleys westmynster sodaynly lowghe whan dyd talke eate whan thys blessyd man dyned entred chamber famylyers asked hym ye cause hys lawghyng answered ye selfe tyme sayd vii slepers mount seleon besydes ephesym asya lasse slepte two hundred yeres vpon ryght syde selfe tyme tourned shall slepe agayne vpon syde lxxiiii yeres though thys tolde ranulphe syth thys sayenge appereth dyscordaunce wyth wryters also wyth former sayenge sayde ranulphe xxii chapyter hys iiii boke polycronyco sayth sayd vii slepers closed ye caue fyrst yere decius sleped contynuyngly laste tyme yeres theodocius youger emperour whyche reason shulde slepe ye season space ii hundred yere aboue sayd arose shewed sayd theodocius emperour many dyed soone wytnessyth uincencius hystorialis antoninus iacobus philippus wherfore stande wyth reaso yt shulde slepe vpon ye syde ye tournyng lxxiiii yeres aboue sayd shulde sterue ye tyme thys holy kynge confessoure hys tyme reygne ye tyme theodoci aforesayd vi hundred yeres yf ment vii slepers spoken ye xxvi chapyter fyrste boke polycronycon hath slepte nother caue many yeres wherfore remytte thys vnto folowe order story wherein founde whan blessed kyng edwarde receyued dyuyne monycyon shulde chaunge thys transitory bryckell lyfe lyfe euerlastynge sykened crystmasse weke tyme whych sykenesse shewed hym vysyon shewed vnto suche hym sayde two men relygion came somtyme famylyer wyth normandye shewed sent god vnto gyue vnto warynynge thynges foloweth fyrste sayde duke bysshoppes abbotes englande goddes seruauntes deuyllys god hath taken thys kyngdome handes enemyes tyme fendes shall walke destroble people besought god people myghte haue warnynge penaunce delyuered people cytye ninyue nay sayde men indurate harte ye shulde worthy penaunce god shall shewe hys mercy forgyuenesse asked wha myghte hope mercy pardo answered whan grene tree hewen downe parte therof cut stocke layde iii fourlonge stocke wythout mannes helpe hande shall retourne stocke rote take agayne hys shappe flouryshe brynge forth fruyte whan thys done maye hope comforte remedy tyme blessyd man shewed thus thys vysyon present wyth stygandus archebysshoppe caunterbury whyche sayde vnto kynge raued ellys doted age sykenesse olde men done accompted wordes foly vanyte longe englande felte conceyued thys prophecye whan subieccyon straungers alyauntes shall shewed desyrous knowe exposycion prophecye grene tree lette hym rede ende lyfe thys gloryous kynge confessoure translated wyllyam caxton boke called legende sayntes shall fynde place haue sene otherwyse interpreted whyche remytte haue experyence suche facultye conclude thys storye trouth blessyd kynge dyed iiii daye ianuary whan hadde reygned xxiii yeres vii monethes odde day buryed monastery westmynster whych gretly augmeted repayred nat maner fourme nowe chyrche nowe standeth reedyfyed buylded newe henry thyrde sonne kynge iohn whiche also wryters translated thys blessyd kynge edwarde lower parte ye chyrche shryned hym lyeth kynge edwarde laft hym chylde accompted vyrgyn whan dyed francia ccxv chapiter phylyp fyrst name son henry began dominio ouer frenchemen yere lorde mlviii xvi yere edwarde confessour kynge englande thys phylyp radde maryed wyfe named berta doughter baldewyne erle holland fryce whyche berta philyp receyued sonne named hym lewis doughter ye called cunstauce processe tyme haunted myche company woman named bertande hated hys laufull wyfe length helde pryson kept stede gatte vppon sayd bertrande two sonnes named phylyp flory doughter myne authour nameth thys aduoutry often monysshed ye pope shulde leue companye yll woman take hym hys lawfull wyfe yt longe holden pryson within hys castell monsfruell wolde obedyent vnto pope cou sayll fynally accused pope urbane seconde name meane wherof reconcyled restored agayne wyfe refused hys concubyne tyme thys phylyp godfrey de bollio many crysten prynces exortacyon peter heremyte sayled holy lande wanne cytye hierusale sarasyns handes whyche prynces lastly crowned sayd godfrey kynge sayde cytye contynued possessyon crysten men ye terme foure score tenne yeres vnder ix crysten kinges lenger myght haue endured hadde discencyon fallen amonges selfe antoninus peter disrey manyfestely shewed thys vyage moste accorde wryters bega yere grace mlxxxvi xxvii yere thys phylyp sayd godfrey crowned kynge sayde cytye hierusalem affyrmaunce ye sayde wryters yere grace thousande foure score xix thys phylyp lytell worthy memory lefte wrytynge lyke hys fader henry made hym kyng lyfe suffered hym haue rule lande ryght thys phylyp certayne tyme co mytted rule lande vnto lewys sonne sette hys mynde huntynge dysportes ladde hys lyfe slowthe idelnesse lewys takynge vppon hym charge realme subdued erle mounte merusy laboured take chyrche saynt denys certayn preuyleges also constrayned restore satysfye hurtes harmes sayde chyrche done thys lewys affermeth frenche cronycle maryed doughter guy erle cotcheforde whyche nerenesse kynne deforced sayde lewys greate dyspleasour sayde erle guy wherfore moued warre agayne sayd lewys toke hym certayne holdes castelles whyche castell gurney one length lewys ye better warre recoueryd diuers sayd holdes amonges prysoners hym knyghtes take toke myghty stronge captayn sayde erle guy named hombolde whyche sente castell stampes sauely kepte durynge whyche warre philyppe kynge sykened dyed yere grace hundred vi hadde rygned full xlviii yere buried saint benet sur loyt ccxvi chapiter harolde ye second son erle goodwyne laste kynge saxon began rule realme englande ye v daye ianuary yere lorde lxvi viii yere phylyp fyrst kynge fraunce moste myghty myche blessyd kynge edwarde dyed wythout yssue myndyng promysse hym made vnto wyllyam duke normady haue shewed toke vpo kyng crowned aldredus byshoppe yorke yt affermeth guydo lordes entended haue made edgare adelynge kynge whyche edgare affermeth ye sayde authours sonne edwarde sonne edmund ironsyde named edwarde outlawe edgare yong specyally harolde strong knightes rychesse wanne reygne howe yt marianus sayth kyng edwarde ordeyned deth harolde shuld kyng hym reason wherof lordes crowned hym therupppon westmynster anon crowned beganne fordoo euyll lawes customes vsed stablysshed good lawes specyally suche defence holy chirch punyshed euyll doer fere example shorte tyme harolde thus made kynges tosty costy hys brother whyche sayde northumbers chased flaundres made hym nauy lx small sayles sayled ile wyght toke prayes wythin sayd yle place kent then sayled lynsey dyd myche harme fyre sworde soon chased then edwyn malcharus erles mercia northumberlande sayled scotland taryed tyll somer tostius thus wyth hys robber chased harolde harfagar kynge northganys norway wyth great nauy iii hundred shyppes mo entred ye mouth ryuer tyne thys harolde harfagar sayth guyde sonne canutus kyng denmarke norway whych heryng deth holy edward purueyed ye sayd great armye wyn englande ryghtfull enherytaunce harolde warned thys great flote danys sent vnto forenamed erles duke mercia northumberland commaundyng wythstande theyr landrynge whyle gadered hys strength foresayde duke spedde theym towarde danys gaue vnto sharpe stronge fyght conclusyon englyshemen put worse fayne gyue backe yt enymyes entred farther lande kyng herynge sco fyture hys people made haste towarde hys enymyes vi day came stemysforde brydge thys whyle tostius named come oute scotlande gone partye danys agayne hys owne brother thys foresayde place bothe hostes ioyned faught sharpe cruell batayll wherin fyll many sturdy knyght vppon englyshe partye mo vppon danys syde ende harolde theyr kynge slayne hande harolde kynge enlande sayth guydo tostius also slayne fyghte olanus broter sayth harolde harfagar paulus duke yles orkeys taken prisoner whyche kynge caused hym sworne kepe promise hym made toke good pledge performaunce suffred theym retourne then comen y also specyally remembred sayd authour one knyght stode vppon foresayde brydge wyth axe defended passage maugre hole hoste ye englyshemen slew xl englyshmen mo wyth hys axe myght ouercomen tyll englysheman went vnder brydge stycked hym vpwarde wyth hys spere thorough hole brydge thys vyctory harolde suppressed wyth pryde also wyth couetouse dyuyded prayes hys enymyes amonge hys knyghtes kepte theym hym selfe gaue parte vnto suche nyghtes fauoured spared well deserued reason wherof loste fauour many hys knyghtes thys passetyme doughter duke wyllyam whych harold shuld haue maried dyed within age wherfore harold thought hi ye discharged mise made fader duke willyam warned harolde couenauntes broken medled menasses wyth prayer sondry tymes wherunto harolde answered nyce folyshe couenaunte ought holden namely ye behest mennys ryght kyngdome wythout hole assent senatours ye land farthermore lewde othe might ought broken specyally yt compelled sworne nede drede uppon answer receyued duke wyllyam harolde whyle messangers went came duke wyllyam gadered hys knyghtes prepared nauy thinges necessary warre assent lordes land ayde assyste hym iourney ouer wise enformed pope beynge named alexander second yt coformed hym takynge vyage sent vnto hym banner whyche willed hym bere shyp hym self shuld sayle beynge purueyed thynges concernyng iourney sped hym see syde toke shyppynge hauen faynt ualery taryed longe tyme myght haue couenable wynde ye whych soldyours murmured grudged sayd woodnesse great dyspleasynge god desyre mann kyngdome strength namely god wythsayde yt workynge element laste duke wyllyam longe bydden houed wynde commaunded brynge forth ye body saynt ualery sette vppon see stronde whyche done wynde shortely came fylled sayles wyllyam thanked god saynt ualery toke shortely shyppynge helde course warde englande vppon thys grounde tytle folowynge fyrste pryncypall chalenge ryghte haue domynyon lande hym gyuen affermed kyng edwarde confessoure hys neuewe seconde take wreche deth cruell murdour hys neuew alfrede brother ye blessyd kynge edwarde slayn erle goodwyne adherentes ye haue harde storye hardykinitus whyche dede ascrybed chefely vnto harolde thyrde auenge wronge done vnto robert archebyshop caunterburye whych enformed exiled meanes labour harolde tyme edwarde co fessour shewed ccxvii chapiter duke wyllyam kepynpe hys course landed processe tyme hastynge sussex place called peuenessey hys goynge oute shyp takyng land hys one fote slode stacke faste sande whych espyenge one knyghtes yt nere vnto hym cryed alowde sayd syr duke thou holdest englande thou shalte soone tourned duke kynge duke made game entred lande made proclamacyons cryes man shuld take prayes force people sayde yt reasonable shuld spare thynge shulde hys owne harolde thys whyle north partes englande wittynge landynge normayns sped hym towarde myghte gatheryd strength countreys came duke made good spede came lodon kynge holden tyll made good suertye hys people shulde passe thorough cytye wythout taryenge whyche obseruyd passyng cytye passed bridge went ouer sussex kynge harolde entendynge know stregth enmyes sent espyes duke hoste whyche made reporte vnto kynge duke wyllyams soldyours prestes theyr ouer lyppes chekes shauen englyshmen dayes vsed theyr ouer lyppes shadde shauen harold answered sayde prestes stalworth sturdye knyghtes gurth surth one yongeste bretherne harolde counsayled hym shulde stande parte suffer hym wyth hys lordes fyght ye norma myche sworne duke aledgynge furthermore yf ouerthrowen yt yet myght defende hys quarell fyghte countrey meane tyme wyllyam sent monke vnto harold proferred hym thre maner wayes chose one thre fyrste accordynge othe shulde render lande delyuer yt vnto possessyons wyllyam ye done take yt agayne hym hold yt hym fee reygne vnder hym terme hys lyfe deth retourne yt sayd wyllyam suche one sonnes wolde assigne vnto secondly leue kyngedome without stryfe thyrdely exchewynge shedynge plenty crysten menes blood wold defende quarell hys owne persone agayne duke two onely trye mater dynte sworde harolde refused offer sayde wolde trye quarell dynt swordis one sworde hys knyghtes wolde defende theyr coutrey agayn strauge nacyons prayenge god deme ryghte betwene twayne duke wyllyam hadde receyued answere harolde well meane fortune batayll charged people yt myght watche occupye theym prayer specylly prestes religious people englyshemen gaue drynke songe vppon morowe beynge saterdaye xiiii daye occtober daye saynte calyxte pope bothe hostes assayled place nowe standeth abbay batayll sussex begynnyge thys batayll banner banneret called thylfer norman splayed hoste norman slewe englysheman knyghte came agayne hym one thyrde slayne laste seltrons smote gyther wyth great noyse crye faughte sore longe season englyshmen defended manfully better kepte theym hole gyther wythoute scaterynge spryngynge brode whyche wyllyam apperceyued gaue sygne vnto hys knyghtes shulde gyue backe make countenaunce dyd flee norman imbatelled fote men sette horse men wynges euery syde whyche wyle englyshemen descueryd soone oute araye norman tourned agayne vpon ye englyshemen slewe theym downe euery syde thys batayll sore foughten englyshemen duke wyllyam thryse felled day reason thre horse daye slayne vnder hym lastely harolde wounded eye wyth arowe fyll grounde slayne hys people scatered well hym myghte saue hym selfe fleynge duke wyllyam buryed hys men slayne fuffred hys enymyes deth thys harolde y dyuersly wryten geraldus crambrens hys boke called itinerarius sayth yt harolde receyued many woundes loste hys lefte eye fledde felde countrey chester lyued longe holy lyfe ancre selle saynte iamys faste saynt iohns chyrch made holy ende ye deth harold knowen erles mercia northumberlande whyche streytnesse waye myght bryng theyr people felde ellys wylfully wythdrew theym selfe harolde bycause none otherwise departed ye prayes amonges theyr knyghtes former feld norgaynes drewe next waye london take agatha harold wyfe sent chester aldredus byshoppe yorke londoner agreed promysed eyther vnto wold make edgare athelynge kynge defende hys ryghte vttermoste theyr power promyse wythstandynge harde great strength dayly fell duke wyllyam hys prouysyons fayne breke appoyntement sayd erles submytted gaue vnto hym pledge became hym lyege men homage feautye thus harolde hadde ruled lande v daye ianuary xiiii daye october slayne reygned ix monethes odde dayes buryed monasterye holy crosse waltham whyche hadde founded set therin chanons gaue vnto theym fayre possessyons endeth time blood saxon whych contynued reken hengestus fyrste reygne space tyme v hundred lxxxxi yeres yf yt rekened begynnyng west saxos yt endureth ye terme v hundred lxv yeres whych cotynued ruler kinges land sayd tyme onely except passed betwene fyrst yeres canutus laste yere hardekynitus whyche season passed flowed vpon xxiiii yeres yt yt persecucyon danys lasted mych lenger fore shewed ye story ye forenamed kynit ccxviii chapiter myche god vnknowen iudgementes man hygh hyd counsayll wolde suffer duke conquere noble lande lord souerayne ouer many noble enherytours thynke yt couenyent shew dyscent sayde duke nere blood vnto blessed kynge edwarde confessour wherfore haue shewed storye charlys symple somtyme kynge frauce myscreaunt pagan named rollo secuted sore realm frauce lastely wan strength citye roan hed chefe cytye normandy conclusyon fynall peace betwene sayde kynge rollo sayde rollo crystened named robert maryed silla doughter ye said charlys ye kyng gaue waye dower ye hole duchy normandy whych robert crystened ruled dukedome good crysten man terme xiiii yeres receyued ye sayd silla son named hym wyllyam whyche surnamed longa spata wold saye wyllyam wyth longe sworde wyllyam duke fader xxv yeres lefte hym sonne named rycharde whych shewed storye lew e ye vi named richard ye hardy rycharde hardy thyrde duke reygned lii yeres hys wyfe son named rycharde good emma wyfe egelredus mother saynte edwarde confessoure hym good rycharde duke reygned xxviii yeres lefte hym two sonnes say rycharde robert fyrste two yeres slayne treason hys brother robert robert duke reygned ix yeres whyche robert yt shewed storye henry kyng fraunce father vnto duke wyllyam thys wyllyam vii duke normandye ruled yt conquered englande moste wryters xxx yeres whereby yt appereth emma aunte duke robert father wyllyam conquerour saynte edwarde duke wyllyam ye father syde cosyn armay ne remoued sheweth thys draught folowynge th fyrste duke rollo robert fyrste duke seconde duke wyllyam longa pata sonne robert second duke thyrde duke rycharde hardy son wyllyam iii duke rycharde ood sonne rychard fyrst emma moder edward confes sour doughter sayd richard iiii duke rycharde ii surnamed ye good son rychard fyrst iiii duke fyft duke rychard ye thyrd son richard ii v duke brethern syxte duke robertus son rycharde ii brother rycharde iii vi duke brethern wyllyam sonne robert vii duke noble conquerour thus ende vi part thys worke myche lande conquered put vnder rule nacyon wherfore haue vsed done gyue thankes vnto moste blessyd vyrgyn lady saynt mary furtherer conductryce thys worke agayn salute hayle wyth vi ioye fornamed vii ioyes thus begynnynge gaude virgo mater christi tu quae sola c hayle gladde moste noble moder dere iesu chryste vyrgyne moste pure clene deseruynge onely grace lyuynge moste clere dygnyte thou celestyall quene perce heuens beeth serene nexte trone hygh trynyte thou arte admytted holde thy see thys vi parte accompted fyrste yere iue vnto laste daye reygne harolde begynnynge wyllyam conqueroure includeth yeres iii hundred lxxx yeres one thys lande conquered fyrst commynge brute folowe thaccopte thys worke force thys duke wyllyam hys norman ii thousande ii hundred two yeres pthus endeth syxt parte vii parte shaketh hade pen waxeth dulle forweried tyred seyng worke log authours rawe farre culle dymme derke straunge vnderstond farre tune make trew songe storyes yeres make accordaunte yt reder myght shew trewe plesaunt vnder correccyon thynge may borne remytte yt suche ben experte prayenge theym haue done beforne fauour correcte vnder couerte theyr proteccyon may shewe parte holsome playne fruytefull profytable reders herers ioyous delectable dueste farther wade streme depe therto daungerous one thynge somwhat doth glade great daunger storyes doughtous ben ouer passed bounteous authours ben manyfestly storyes folowynge done certyfye wherfore dyd promyse thys vii parte nowe wolde take hande
