besechynge alwayes moste humble wyse welle bountye flowre moste adorande whose humylyte man fyrste comforte fande redemed hys captyuyte parte fynyshe wyll myne helper brynge ende thys worke haue take hande wryte onely entent brynge lyght yt shulde shake olde honoure englande ment famous wryters whyche haue theyr duytes sent unto theyr folowers vyces subdue honoure maynteyne exalte vertue folowyth storye duke wyllyam conqueroure ccxix chapiter willya duke normandye surnamed conquerour baste sonne robert ye vi duke said dukedome neuew vnto edward confessour shewed beganne hys domynyon ouer thys realme englande xv daye october yere lordes incarnacyon thousand lxvii ye ix yere fyrste phylyppe kyng fraunce crowned kynge vppon crystmas daye nexte folowynge aldredus archbyshoppe yorke myche tyme stigandus archbysshoppe caunterbury absent durste come psence kynge whome ought great fauour sequele shall appere wyllyam sette quyet great parte thys lande betoke gydyng therof brother byshop bayon lent folowynge sayled normandye led wyth hym chefe ruler england doute sturryng tyme absence amonge whyche two erles marcar edwyne ruler northumberlande mercia two wyth also stigandus edgare ethelynge stigandus wyllyam shewed great reuerence coutenaunce fauoure proued great dissymulacyon shewed depryuynge sayd stigandus prysonment hym wynchester towne longe terme season next wynter whan wyllyam sped hys besynesse normandy retourned england wyth greate pompe sette greuous trybute vpon englyshmen reason wherof partyes lande rebelled agayne hym specyally cytye excetour whyche defended hym certayne tyme lastly force wanne sayde cytye punysshed cytesyns greuously thys sterne dedes wyllyam marcharus erle northumberlande wyth edgare athelynge dyuers hys moder two systers margarete crystyan sayled scotlande another cronycle telleth yt edgare entendynge wyth agatha hys moder hys two systers haue sayled almayne borne tempest see dryuen scotlande malcolyne kynge scottes ioyously receyued processe tyme sayde malcolyne caste suche loue vnto sayd margaret toke wyfe touched fyrste chapyter story canut margaret sayde malcolyne receyued ii doughters vi sonnes wherof thre named edgare alexau der dauyd kynges scotlande nexte folowynge theyr fader molde one ye foresayd doughters maryed vnto fyrst henry kynge englande doughter mary maryed eustace erle bolongii molde fyrste doughter henry receyued ii sonnes named wyllyam rychard whych bothe dyed theyr fader ye story sayd henry shall appere receyued also two doughters named molde mary whych molde mawde maryed ye fyfte henry emperour almayne whose deth agayne maryed godfrey geoffrey platagenet erle aungeowe descended henry surnamed shorte mantell kynge englande called henry seconde doughter mary maryed vnto erle blaynes descended molde mawde wyfe vnto kynge stephen foloweth thys wyllyam thys foresayd trybute leuyed englysshemen knowynge depertynge lordes foresayde kepte streyter longe marcharus reconsyled kynges grace fayled agayn folowynge shall shewed thys cause whyche tedyous shewe wyllyam exalted norman gaue vnto chyefe possessyons lande dayly encreased great honour welth englysh men faste decayed kynge wyllya also made iiii stronge castels two sette yorke thyrde lyndetyngham notynghm manned wyth norman iiii lyncolne thyrde yere reygne harolde canutus sonnes swanus kynge denmarke came lande north humber wyth stronge nauy haste drew towarde yorke norman whyche hadde rule towne castelles feryng englysshemen wolde ayde danys wyth house suburbes towne haue fylled towne dyches sette suburbes fyre wherof ye flame bygge wyth wynde stronge toke cytye brent parte therof wyth mynster saynt peter tyme wherof danys fauour citesyns entred cytye slewe thre thousande norman longe kynge wyllyam chased danys theyr shyppes toke greate dyspleasure wyth inhabytauntes prouynce destroyed land lyenge bytwene yorke durham suche wyse ix yeres lande laye vnlabored vntylled onely taken saynt iohns lande beuerley borne reason wreche done dyuyne power vpon one kynge wyllyams knyghtes whych besyed wastyng spoylynge sayde countre fyll sodeynly wyth hys horse hys horse brake hys necke knyghtes face turned backe famyne people countre susteyned wonder reported shuld eate maner vermyn cattes rattes dogges harde kepte warre kyng yere also molde mawde wyfe kynge wyllya crowned quene england aldredus archebysshop yorke iiii yere reygne thys kynge scottes malcolyne theyr kynge entred northumberlande wasted destroyed sore countre slewe myche people many toke prysoners helde bonde men vi yere hys kyngdome wyllyam made warre vppon scottes lastely forced sayde malcolyne swere hym bothe homage feauty wytnessed wyllyam malmesbery wryters ccxx chapiter kynge willyam counsayle erle hortford caused abbeyes englande serched money season founde caused brought hys treasour whyche dede exposycyo authours sayd erle punysshed shall shewed soone vpon thys tyme twene easter wytsontyde holden solempne counsayle wynchester clergy englande whyche counsayle presente two cardynalles sent ye second alexaunder pope thys cou sayle stygandus archebysshop cauterbury depryued dygnytye thre skylles fyrste holden wrongfully bysshopryche whyle robert archebysshop lyuynge seconde cause hadde receyued paule pope benet v name thyrde cause occupyed sayd paule wythout lycence lefull authoryte ye courte rome stigand proued benyuolence kynge wyllyam made louyng frendly countenauce dyd vnto hym greate reuerence chau ged myldenesse sternesse exceuted hym ye pope authoryte ende stigandus depryued hys dygnytye kepte wynchester prysoner ye terme hys lyfe recorded hym couetous sparyng yt wold take nothynge hys owne vsed swere alhalowes one peny othe proued vntrewe hys deth lytell keye founde fastened hys necke keye founden greate treasour vnder erth mo place one thys counsayle also put downe dyuers bysshoppes abbotes pryours meanes kynge wyllyam entent myghte preferre norman rule chyrch hadde preferred hys knyghtes rule teperaltye myght stande suerty land thys counsayle saynt wolstan bysshop worceter axed besely kynge certayne possessyons fallen hys handes deth aldred laste archbyshop yorke wyth holden ye sayd aldredus kyng myght suche mater hurtyng lyberty chyrche yorke vpon wytsonday kynge gaue sayd archebysshopryche yorke vnto thomas chanon bayon sent lamfrank norman abbot cadomonency gaue vnto hym archebysshopryche caunterbury thys lamfranke italyan borne perfytely lerned ye scyence theologye holy wrytte ryght apte gouernynge thynges bothe spyrytuall temporall upon lady daye assumpcyo kynge made hym archebysshop cauterbury thomas chosen archebysshop yorke came vnto lamfranke sacred vsage wolde lamfranke axed othe professyon wrytynge concernyng obedyence thomas answered sayde wolde neuer yf myghte therof suffycyent authoryte skylfull reason byndynge whyche myght knowen shulde preiudyce hys chyrche lamfranke shewed proued skylfully hys askynge reasonable ryghtfull yet thomas wolde assent sayde went tyme lamfrank vnsacred shewed vnto kyng lamfranke entended wronge hym chyrche yorke kyng callyng lamfrank hym sayd trusted cunnyng dyd good fayth reason answered reasonably vnto ye kyng ende thomas co maundement kyng fayne come agayne lamfranke sacred wrote hys professyo hys owne hande hys obedyence radde whyche conteyned shulde obedyent belongeth worshyp god cryste fayth done sacred deted shortly lamfranke axed toke professyo ye byshoppes englad ccxxi chapiter v yere wyllyam conquerours reygne edwyn marcharus erle mercia northumberlande beynge fere daunger voyded ye kynges court secretly rebelles som tyme length turned bothe theyr harmes edwyne slayn went toward scotlande erle marcharus wyth ye bysshop dorcham named egelwynus toke ile ely theyr sauegarde kynge held shorte processe fayne yelde kynges grace mercy sent bysshop abbey abyndon kept prysoner dayntely fed dyed hunger wryters testyfye hyghe herted knewe shuld remayne prysoner wolde neuer ete mete erle marcharus towre london vi yere hys reygne kyng wyllyam touched went wyth great army scotland subdued malco yne theyr kynge haue shewed precedynge chapyter vii yere kyng wyllyam thomas archebysshop yorke beynge content vnder rule obedyence lamfranke appealed courte rome sayde two archbysshoppes appered proper persone pope alexaunder afore named whose presence lamfranke well fauoured thomas aboue named remigius byshop dorchester skylfull cause depryued theyr croyses rynges hys fauour meanes restored theyr former dygnytees cause thomas holpen duke wyllyam warde hys iourney englande whyche sayd duke promysed hym bysshopryche yf opteyned vyctory ye depriued yt proued prestes sonne thomas moued cause prymacy caunterbury subieccyon hym shuld belonge sayde two see farre asonder meane caunterbury yorke nother constytucyons gregory shulde subiecte vnto one worthy myche elder tyme thys answered lamfranke sayd ye constytucyons gregory made mencyo cauterbury yorke london pope remytted thys mater determyned ye kyng byshoppes england gaue ye palle vnto lamfranke terme word palle many one vnknowen shall therfore shewe vnto thynge palle indument euery archbyshop must haue full authoryte archbyshoppe tyll haue receyued hys palle pope thynge white like ye breded stole nother fassyon ye stole made length worne prestes necke thys ioyned togyder aboue lyeth parte therof vppon shulders one ende hangeth streyght downe grounde behynde garnysshed dyuers place therof wyth cross stole worne nexte vnto albe whan preste reuested masse thys palle worne vpon thys vestymente ouermoste whan archebysshoppe syngeth hys masse whan lamfranke thus sped hys nedys rome wyth ye two bysshoppes retourned englande thys mater hangyng varyaunce bytwene sayde two archebysshoppes comunycacion tryall wherof bedaes story brought forth appered fyrste augu styns tyme bedaes last dayes vppon season hundred xxxix yeres archbysshop caunterbury prymacy bysshoppes england tha called brytayn irlande also archbyshoppes caunterbury kept cousayles nere vnto yorke cleped therunto bysshoppes yorke made byshoppes depryued dyuers theyr dygnytyes adioyned certayne pryuyleges graunted maner doynge thomas harde allegacyons denyed layd hym pystle whych pope gregorye demed chyrche yorke london shulde euen perys neyther theym subiecte answered lamfrank byshop lo questyon moued chyrche london thomas sayde gregory grauted augustyne power haue vnder hym ye byshoppes englande london ye day pryncypall see englande yt yt pope mynde betwene lodon yorke shulde dyuersyte honour archeflamynes theyr vnyte myghte ly e vnder dewe obedyence though augustyne chaunged ye see london caunterbury yet gregory wolde augustyne successours shuld aboue bysshoppes yorke wolde haue set hys epystle wordes folowynge graunte augustyne thy successours wold yt power shuld stretche successours therefore made mecyon successours lamfranke answered sayd authoryte graunted augustyne alone hys successours yt symple gyfte yt pope gaue vnto augustyne famylyer wyth hym namely whyle augustine ordeyned sacred byshoppe yorke whyle lyued ye see full durynge lyfe reason wherof put hys authoryte execucyon pryuyleges pope confermeth dignyte augustynes successours caunterbury demeth yt skyll good reason chyrches englande shulde take lore lyghte place welle place proceded fyrst doctrine cristes fayth thou sayest thomas gregory myght yf wolde haue confyrmed thynge vndowtably wyth thys worde successours soth yet lackynge worde dothe preiudyce chyrche caunterbury cryste sayde peter shall gyue kayes kingdome heuen myght haue also sayd yf wold graunt power thy successours though sayde yet ment successours peter nothynge reuerence yet authoryte dyspensacyon holy chyrche offyce holy theym whyche onely spryngeth vertue cryste peter peter successours yf thou dyscerne betwene false soth loke hath strength hath strength parte hath strength hath also stregth ye lesse chyrche rome yt chyrches chyrches ben membres therof lyke one man kynd synguler men euery synguler man kynd mankynde maner wyfe chyrch see rome yt kynde conteyneth comparyson chyrches yet euery chyrch remayneth full holenes crystes fayth also chyrche rome greattest chirches hath strength chyrche shall haue stregth lesse chyrches power fyrste gyuen euery chyrche shall sprynge successours yf yt specyall thynge excepted taken therfore coclude cryst sayde peter sayde byshoppes rome consequetly sayde augustynes successours gregorye sayde vnto augustyne wherfore yt muste appere lyke caunterbury subiecte rome muste yorke subiecte caunterbury whych sent yorke prechours teache preache vnto ryghte fayth thou sayeste gregory wolde augustyne shuld haue see london yt may stand wyth reason wolde trowe noble discyple augustyn wold wythstande agayn hys maysters wyll agayne holy decree yf yt thou haste alledged bishop london oft haue sayd therfore yf mater may thus sease wythout stryfe yt ended yf thou desyrest contynuaunce plee shall fayle defende ryghte offyce gladly reason length thomas ouercomen grauted gladly farther brynke humber shulde begynnyng hys dioces ouer yt yt demed thynges concernynge worshyppe god fayth holy chyrch archbyshop yorke shuld subiecte archbyshoppe caunterburye yf archebyshoppe caunterburye wolde call cousayll parte englande archebyshoppe yorke shulde therat wyth byshoppes hys prouynce also obediet vnto lawfull hestes season archbysshop caunterbury shuld sacred archebyshoppe yorke byshoppes ye chyrche shulde come cauterbury saker hym yf archebyshoppe yorke shuld stalled sacred shall come caunterburye ellys englande archebyshop caunterburye woll hym assygne sacred hym shall make hym othe professyon obedyence lamfranke harde iudgement gyuen thus reioysed inwardely yt shulde remayne recorde successours shuld newely plede cause caused yt regestred moste substancyall wyse ouer sent pystle cause alexander forenamed pope doenge wyth professyon thomas archbyshop foresayd lamfrank many notable thynges wryten diuers writer admytted saynte ccxxii chapiter aboute x yere kynge wyllyams reygne roger erle hereforde whose counsayl kynge y sayde hadde serched abbayes england whyche erle hadde wedded hys syster vnto rauf erle eest angle saye norf suff agayne kynges mynde wyth sayde raufe made conspyracy agayne kynge caused erle theyr subtyle meanes agreable vnto theyr vntrouth whyche erle name walref length thys erle walref hadde knowen fyne theyr entent went vnto lamfranke shewed hym hole mater whose counsayll shortely sayled vnto kyng beynge normandye dysclosed mater hym putte hym holy hys grace mercye kynge harde tydynges made good semblaunt vnto erle walref sped hym faster englande howe yt forenamed two erles warned dysclosynge mater wyse yt gaderyd theym suche strength ye kyng coude haue pleasure fayne stronge hade chase outlawe theym fayled purpose emprysoned erle walref wynchester lastely caused hym hedded tyranny iustyce affermeth myne authoure whose corp buryed abbay crowlande xi yere holden great counsayll synode clergye lande saynt paules chyrche london amoges many thynges ordeyned rule ye chyrch england dyuers byshoppes see transported one place another selwey chychester kyrton exeter welles bathe shyrbourne salysbury dorchester lyncolne see lychefelde chester whyche thynges thus ordered wyth many chyrche sayde counsayll dyssolued xiii yere hys reygne deth herman byshoppe salysbury succeded osmude ye kynges chaunceller whyche buylded new chyrch brought thyther clerkes garnyshed wyth vertue connynge hym self wrote bounde bokes occupyed dyuyne seruyce chyrche ordynall consuetudynary whyche daye occupyed partye englande wyth walys irlande nowe named salysbury vse ordynary salysbury vse xv yere reygne robert eldest sonne kynge wyllyam whyche surnamed curthose shorthose shorte bote also myght haue duchy normandy whych father hadde somtyme assygned gyuen vnto hym hys wyldenesse hadde agayne resumed yt wyth fauoure ayde ye french kynge phylyppe lewys hys sonne toke prays duchy put hys father myche trouble myche length father sonne met playne felde ii great hostes eyther wyth faught cruell batayll radde durynge thys batayll wyllyam throwe horse great ieopardy hys lyfe wherof hys sonne robert beyng ware moued wyth pytye yt rescowed father delyuered hym free daunger enymyes howe yt betyde kynge trouth yt many men slayn second son wyllyam rede sore hurte ende kynge wylliam fayn refuse felde gatte tyme none aduauntage sayde sonne whiche dede rebellyon thus made sonne ye fader accursed hym opynyon wryters whyle kyng wyllyam thus occupyed normandy northumbers waxte sterne rebell slewe theyr rage walkerus bishop durham cause myne authour expressyth aboute thys tyme warynge erle shrewesbury made two abbayes worshyp god saynte mylborgh wherof one set suburbes shrewesbury ye wenioke xvii yere kyng wyllyam cursed stryfe arered betwene thurstone abbot glastenbury norman munkes wherof part cause abbot despysed wold haue set part songe office pope gregory augustyn dyscyple old tyme assygned wolde haue compelled haue folowed vse one wyllya fescamp ouer thurstone wasted speded goodes ye place inordynatly lechery insolent meanes wythdrew fro munkes theyr olde accustomed dyet whyche cause fyrst beganne great wordes wyth chydyng stroke fyghtes yt abbot gat vnto hym armed men fyll vppon hys munkes slewe two ye hygh alter wou ded theym xviii munkes wyth fourmes candelstyckes defended theym suche wyse hurte many armed men complaynte brought kyng whose iudgemet thurstone agayne returned vnto cadony fro whes brought mukes spredde abrode dyuers house thorough englande yt sayde tyme wyllya rede thurston obteyned rule abbay agayne pryce v hundred pounde xix yere reygne kyng willyam raysed new maner trybute caused gadered thorough england euery hyde lande vi hyde lande conteyneth v yerdes euery yerde conteyneth foure acre hyde lande conteyneth xx acre acre conteyneth xl perch length iiii brede iiii acre make yerde v yerdes make hyde viii hydes make knightes fee whyche reason knyghtes fee shuld welde hundred lx acre demed plough tyll yere longe caused serchyd howe myche lande eche hys baron helde many knyghtes fee many townes nombre men bestes wyth lande wherof commaunded boke made whyche done whyche dede lande greued wyth many sondry plage shall appere xx yere reygne kynge wyllyam canutus kynge denmarke wyth helpe flemmynges whome called wyth great armye came towarde englande prouysyon kynge fered let theyr iourney kyng wyllyam gaue vnto iii champyons iii byshopryches moryce gaue london willyam gaue thetforde robert gaue chester whych robert remoued couentre robert reporteth ranulfe scraped fro one beme chirch couentre v hudred marke fyll wyth ye hande kyng wyllyam erle leofricus yt duke mercia tyme edwarde cof ssour adourned chyrch great ryches golde syluer precyous iewelles thys yere edgare ethelynge whych reconcyled vnto kynges fauoure lycence kynge page duplicate page duplicate sayled apulia beganne forsayde plage sprynge greate morayne fell vppon brute bestes brennyng feuours amonges people also great huger barreynes ye erth also yere great hurt done many place ye lande fyre specyally cytye london vpon vii day moneth iulii sodayne fyre began whyche brent great parte chyrche saynte paule wyth also great parte cytye kynge wyllyam beynge normandye syke kept hamber roan longe time wherfore phylyppe frenche kynge hys game sayde wyllyam lay chyldbedde noryshed hys fatte wombe whyche wordes blowen kynge wyllyas cry greuously dyscontent sayde chyrched shall offer hym thousande candellys lyghte wyth whyche shall holde hym smally contented whyche promyse performed moneth iuly whe corne fruyt grape moste florishynge entred fraunce great army sette fyre many cytyes townes west syde fraunce lastely came cytye meaus fyred yt brent parte therof wyth chyrch lady wherin brent woma beyng closed walle sayd chyrch recluse thynge speketh cronycle fraunce yet parte thynge soundeth theyr dyshonour done vnto theym englyshemen hete wryters haue ye lepyng horse kyng wyllyam toke dysease sykenes yt cause hys deth felt hym thus greued called sonnes hym exhorted theym beste maner shulde charytably loue fauoure euery holde gyder louyng bretherne made testamet therin ordeyned wyllyam ruffus wyllyam rede kynge england normandye beset vnto rober curthose henry yongest sonne bequethed treasour mouable goodes done enfourmed hys two eldest sonnes dysposycyon people warned wyllyam louynge lyberall subiectes robert sterne sturdy vnto moued myldenes delyueryd prison hys brother byshop bayon marcharus erle northuberlande wylnotus sonne harolde sonne goodwyne sent wyllya edwarde confessour remayne pledge sayde fader goodwyn shortely thynges wyth done dyed normandye buryed ye cytye caan reygned kyng englande xxi yeres vppon x monethes moneth iuly yere hys duchery lii wyllyam dede men spake hym prynces sayd wyse gylefull ryche couetous loued well magnifyed praysed fayre speker greatr dyssymuler man skylfull stature somdeale fatte bely sterne face stronge army therwyth bolde therwyth great pleasure huntyng makyng great festes passed al leuyenge taskes whyche condycyon hys subiectes construed iii maner wayes saydeyt entente wolde excell rychesse ellys withstade defende enymyes ellys staunche appetyte couetyse mynde buylded ii abbayes englande one batayl sussex wanne felde agayne harolde thys daye called abbay batail ye sette besyde london vppon south syde thamys named yt barmoundesay normandye buylded two also thys man made newe forest countrey southampton whyche brynge aboute caste downe dyuers chyrches space xxx myles replenyshed yt wyth wylde bestes made harde sharpe lawes encreasyng losyng eyen helde englyshemen lowe hys dayes almoste englyshe man bare offyce honoure rule yet somedeale fauoured cytye london graunted cytezens fyrste charter euer whych wryten saxon tunge sealed wyth grene waxe expressed viii ix lynes ccxxiii chapiter wyllyam rufus wyllyam erede second sonne wyllyam conquerour beganne hys reygne ouer englande moneth iulye yere lorde thousande lxxxix xxxi yere fyrste phylyppe kynge fraunce ranulfe monke chester sheweth hys boke polycronycon yt robert curthose eldest sonne wyllyam conquerour tyme hys father deth absent whyche heryng father hadde preferred hys yonger brother ye kyngdome englande therwyth greatly amoued myche layde dukedome pledge brother henry wyth good gatheryd stronge army landed hampton wherof wyllyam hys brother beynge warned haste sent vnto hym messangers whome gaue comyssyon say maner foloweth thy brother wyllyam prayeth yt take grefe yt hath done clepeth hym selfe kynge vnder kynge reygne vnder helpe arte gretter better rather borne yf thou consyder yt well hath nothynge mysused hym agayn hath taken vppon hym tyme bycause thyne absence nowe authoryte thy sufferaunce prayeth yt may vnder contyue payeng yerely iii thousande marke wyth codycyon ouer lyueth may enioye kyngdome robert harde message ende wagged hys hedde conceyued doublenesse thys reporte lyberall allowed honour dyd hys profyte thynges folowyng dedes yt shall appere therfore lyghtely assented desyred returned shortly normandye wyth pleasaunt wordes wythout profyte thys wyllyam crowned xxvii daye september vppon daye saynte cosma damyan well ayded lamfrak whyle lyued dyuers unstable maners yt betwene hym lordes ofte dyssencyo ye spryngyng somer folowyng hys coronacyon odo byshoppe bayo whych ye haue hard delyuered pryson wylliam coquerour came englad kynge ioyously receyued gaue vnto hym shortly erledome kent toke vppon hym processe tyme rule suche wyse kynge grudged wyth hys doynge thys kynge sayde vncle fyll vnkyndnesse yt withdrew hym fro kynge alyed hym wyth byshop durham erles northuberland shrewesbury otherconfederacy whyche confederyd gyder toke partye agayne kynge dyd thynges dyspleasure hurte amonges damage theym done roger de mount gomoryk erle shrewesbury destroyed countrey endes england vnto worceter town wyth ayde walshemen ende thorough prayer holy byshoppe wolstane walshemen weked febled knyghtes scomfyted great hoste kyng wyllyam conceyued ye well nere norman toke partye agayne hym forced necessyte drewe hym englyshemen fauoured giftes easy lawes theyr strength lastely recouered erle shrewesburye chased hys enymyes shortely occupyed castell strong holdes kent belongynge byshop odo hys forsayde vncle ende copelled hym forswere england yt done besyeged ye citie rochester wherin byshoppe durham erle northumberland noble men gadered wan yt length appoyntement hys enymyes vnto hym reconcyled thyrde yere hys reygne dyed lamfrank hadde ben archbyshop caunterburye xviii yeres whose meanes moke englande brought vse theyr holy relygyon whych hys commynge lyued lyke seculer prestes religious men exercysed huntynge hawkynge auoyde idelnesse dysynge cardynge wynter nyghtes myght redy kepe theyr howres nyghtly seruyce theyr apparel lyke vnto consules vnto mu kes wyth many deformytyes whych ye begynnyng lamfrank policye suffered season lest brought top atones therby myght haue caused scysme varyauce haue rysen chyrche auoydynge wherof wyth inconuenyences lytell lytell refrayned theyr outrage cesse tyme caused constrayned lyue constitucyons rule theyr relygyon aboute thys tyme robert curthose duke normandy entedynge take hys vyage holy lande layde dukedome wedde hys brother wyllyam x thousande pounde leuyenge wherof kynge wyllyam set taske vpon common subiectes reysed farre excidynge vnder colour byshoppes melted theyr vessell lordes spoyled theyr tenauntes kynge scottes also brake peace made wyllyam conquerour wasted toke prayes ut countrey northumberlande kynge prouyded nauy sayled thyther wynter tyme ye tempest see halfe nauy great parte yt drowned many knyghtes loste colde hunger yet ende dyuers conflyctes bykerynges mediacyon frendes peace vnyte concluded malcolyn kynge scottes shuld obedyent kynge wyllyam vnder othe tyme sworne vnto hys father kynge willyam shuld yerely gyue vnto ye way fee xii markes gold fourth yere reygne fyft daye october passyng great tempest wederyng fell soudry place englande specyally ye towne wynchecome tempeste thuder lyghtenyng parte ye steple chyrch throwen downe crycyfyx wyth ymage lady also standynge vpon roode lofte lykewyse ouerthrowen broke shatered folowed contagye fowle stenche ye whych endured tyll munkes gone processyon chyrch house adioynyng abbay place also thys yere lodon great harme done force wynde blewe violence yt yt ouerturned ryued wytnessyth polycronycon ouer nober vi hundred house ye rofe saynt mary bow chepe also ryued wherwith two men slayne also salesburye hurte done wyth ye wynde ye lyke therof v yere wyllyas reygne went northumberlande repayred suche holdes castelles scottes theyr warrys blemyshed apayred caused new castell made caercol ye cytye towne whych danys two hundred yeres passed hadde destroyed ye kyng returned vnto gloucester greuously veryd wyth sykenesse wende shulde haue dyed tyme wherof toke great repentaunce mysed yf myght escape wold neuer sell mo benefice ouer wold amede hys lyuyng become new restored helth promyse shortely forgoten yere gaue vnto anselme archbyshopryche yorke myghte take yt kynges pleasure tyll suche tyme kyng hadde taken trybute therof ouer auouched see lyncoln longed see yorke tyll bisshoppe lyncolne pleased wyth great summe money v thousande marke wrytyng ranulfe vi yere hys reygne excedynge floodes wherof lyke many yeres passed hadde ben sene ensued wonderfull frost whych frose great stremes suche wyse ye horse carte passed ouer ye gret ryuers ende yse melted brake payse therof brake many stronge brydge bothe tymber stone ccxxiiii chapiter thys tyme welshemen theyr kyng duke named rees brake vppon englyshmen bordour standeth castell brekenocke made masteryes ende people chaced slayne wounded deth dyed iii daye folowynge thys rees accompted wryters laste kynge walys thys daye dauted kynges englande suche rule vnder stedfaste obedyence tyme rebellyd full often shall appere yere folowyng kyng wyllyam haue ye countrey quyet hewe downe mych ye wood buylded sundry place strong castels pyle meane wherof plucked obedyece shortely specyally dayes edwarde ye fyrste edwarde thyrde malcolyn kyng scotland came vnto glowcester comon wyth kynge dyuers mater take fynall agremet kyng wyllyam wolde haue demyd hym hys courte therfore malcoline departed kynge great dyspleasur whyche cause warre bytwene england scotlande reuyued vppon saynt bricius daye folowyng malcolyne wyth hys retynewe foughte wyth erle named robert tha erle northumberlande slayne wyth hys eldest sonne edwarde sorowe wherof margaret quene scotlande syster vnto edgare ethelynge fyrste chapyter story wyllya conqueroure shewed dyed soone scottes made dunwalde brother malcolyne theyr kynge put hys sonnes ayde kynge wyllyam edgare whyche wryters named dunkam made kynge eldest sonne malcolyne vii yere reygne kynge wyllyam auncelyne anselme archbyshop yorke remoued caunterbury affermeth one cronycle polycronycon guydo sayen hugh erle chester beynge sycke diseased vi yere wyllyam rufus sent normady anselme abbot barry thre cause fyrste vysyte se hym reconcyled hym man moste trusted seconde cause shuld releue abbays englande kynge vexed wyth greuous trybutes thyrd cause yt shuld foud abbay chester whych place buylded made one rycharde chapleyne fyrst abbot ye place sone made archbysshop caunterbury appereth sayd see voyde ouer terme thre yeres thys sayd vii yere englande normandye greued wyth trybute moreyne men sharply tyllynge erth spared putte yere ensued great huger thys yere also ye scottes slewe theyr kyng edgar restored agayn rule lande forenamed dunwalde many grysly vncouth syghtes thys yere sene england hostes men fightyng ye skye fyre lemys holy bysshop wolstone worceter dyed soone shewed yt sondry tymes warned rebuked englyshmen theyr mysseliuyng sayd theyr offense punysshed norman englyshmen excused selfe sayde norman worse lyuynge vnto byshop answered sayd god vsed wyckednesse englyshmen wycked punysshement wycked punysshed ye wycked doth god suffer deuyll punysshe synners hell hym selfe punysshed wyth thys wolstone radde kynge wyllyam wold haue put hym hys see entente myghte put another hys see wherof thys holy man beynge warned yode vnto kynge sayde hym enfourmed thou wylte take whiche better man tha thou arte gaue vnto wherfore receyued noble gyfte hym wyll gyue agayn take hym yf thou may whan hadde sayde kynge yode sepulture edward confessoure yt made prayer pytched hys crosse ye marble stone laye vppon graue man myghte plucke staffe tyll wolston came thyther hym selfe pulled kynges comaundement wherfore kynge seyng maruayle suffred hym enioye hys benefyce styll x yere willyam rufus stryfe dyscencyon fell bytwene hym anselme bysshop caunterbury anselme myght nat call hys synodys correcte byshoppes kynge wolde kynge also chalenged inuestiture bysshoppes pylled spyrytualtye temporaltye vnreasonable taskes trybutes spent vpon towre london makynge westmynster hall ouer kynges seruauntes greued pylled englysshmen vnreasonably thys mysery ioyned vnsaceable couetous ranulphe somtyme chapelayne vnto wyllyam conquerour whyche thys day kynges procuratour gadered hys taskes ouer couetous euyll dysposed wolde leuye iii taskys two pylled ryche bare downe poore caused many men lose theyr landes smal cause therfore kynge hym hys synguler fauoure hys meanes byshoprykes boughte solde playnly marchaundyses tyme clerkes vsed busshed brayded heddys longe tayled blasynge clothes shynynge golden gyrdels rode wyth gylte spurres wyth vsynge dyuers enormytees whyche vyces anselme wolde haue corrected lacked assystence hys bretherne ye bysshoppes whyche cause departed londe wherewyth kyng beynge mysse contented sente hym suche person robbed spoyled hym entreted hym cruell maner whyche dede raufe bysshoppe chychester blamed kynge also rebuked bysshoppes refused partye anselme fauoured kynge cause co cernynge foresayde varyaunce forthermore wythstode kynge hys offycers takynge fynes prestes cryme fornicacyon whyche cause kyng wyth sayd raufe sore amoued dyscontented opteyned fauour suspeded many chyrches hys dyoses ende raufe demeaned hym suche wyse hadde hys owne wyll chyrches enlarged freed stopped wyth thornes kynge gaue vnto hym ye fynes prestes within dyosis endued ye see chychester many greate gyftes vpon tyme kynge wyllyam rydynge towarde hys dysporte huntynge sodeynly messenger came vnto hym sayde cytye cenemonia normandye beseyged wherfore wythout longe taryenge aduysement toke streyght way syde sent hys lordes chargynge folow whan sayd lordes came hys presence aduysed hym tarye tyll people assembled wolde nothynge theyr counsayle sayd hym loued shortely wyste well wolde folowe hym yode shyp settyng aparte parels mayster shyp afrayde sawe weder darke clowdy counceyled kynge tary tyll wynde wolde blowe fauorably commaunded hym make spede cowde vpon hys lyfe sayenge neuer harde euer kyng drowned passed see landed normandy gathered hym hys knyghtes whan capytayne syege whose name helyas knewe kynges landyng fered anone began breke syege treason taken brought kynges presence kynge shewed suche pytye suffered hym hys lybertye whyche opynyon wyllyam de regibus done pryde compassyon ccxxv chapiter xi yere reygne thys wyllyam rede towne called fynchanster coutrey barke shyre welle caste blode hadde done water space xv dayes great flame fyre sene elemet sundry place tymes thys yere also ye two erles shrewesbury chester eyther named hugh kynges commau dement entred wyth theyr knyghtes ile man anglesaye slewe therin many welshemen gelded many moo amonge whyche preste named kynredus drawe chyrch serued ye wyse also cut hys tunge hys hed put hys one eye preste vertue myracle restored helthe within iii dayes ensuynge whyche season tyme kynge northganys norwaye wan iles called orcades orkeys came wyth hys strength foresayd ile man season sayde two erles bytwene mortall fyght ye whyche hugh erle shrewesbury stryken arowe ye eye dyed wythin viii dayes sayth guydo danys chased englysshemen hadde vyctory kyng wylliam mych normandye myche robert brother thys season holy land whose actes shall deale towched ye story henry fyrste wyllyam myche payne rule norman rebelled often agayne hym xii yere hys reygne came normandye saw hall westmynster yt caused buylded therwyth dyscontented lytell wherfore rehersed wryters entended yf lyued haue made larger yt haue serued chaumber robert losaunge somtyme ben abbot ramsey bysshop thetforde gyfte thousand pounde kyng repented hym bewept vnskylfull dede toke hys waye rome dyd hys enioyned penaunce retorned englande turned hys see thetforde norwyche founded fayre monastery hys owne goodes patrymony crystes chyrch therin dowt consyder fyrste abbot bysshop thys tyme meanes one stephen hardynge munke sherbourne englyshman ye order sisteaux whyte mukes hys begynnynge wyldernesse cystery within prouynce burgoyne wytnesseth ranulf munke chester wryters jacobus phylyppus authour cronica cronicaru matheolus wyth sayen stephen second abbot ye place yt fyrste fouded meanes one robert abbot molynese yere grace mxcviii whyche folow theyr sayeng shuld ix yere reygne kyng order brought englande one called walter espeke fouded fyrste abbay relygyon ryuall ye yere grace xicxxxi whyche shulde xxxi yere fyrste henry kyng england somwhat theyr relygyon towched x chapyter viii boke polycronycon kynge wyllyam sayde retourned normandy many wonderfull prodygyes tokyns shewed england swellyng rysyng ye water thamys suche wyse drowned dyuers townes dyd mych harme passyng boundys dyuers place lo ellys also deuyll sene walke mannes lykenesse wyth dyuers thynges whyche ouerpasse kyng warned tolde famylyers yt god cotent lyuing set nought made scoffe iape xiii yere reygne begynnynge thereof thyrde daye auguste sayenge ranulfe thys kyng wyllyam beyng hys dysporte huntynge wythin newe forest glaunsynge arowe shot knyght named walter tyrell wounded deth xliiii yere hys age whyche dede sayde walter escaped saued hym self hym pursued kynge thus wounded layde vppon horse lytter conueyed wynchester shortly dyed buryed man myghte made myche lenger story yf hys dedes shulde towched whych toke vpon hym great thynges mych gretter enteded yf myght haue lyued daye slayne one axed hym wold kepe hys crystmasse poytiers sayde kynge erle entendeth go towarde hierusalem woll assaye haue hys erledome morgage well knowe must cheuyche money perfourme iourney day wyllya dyed helde hades iii bysshopryches cauterbury winchester salysbury dyuers abbayes whyche let terme also refrayned money olde tyme payed rome called rome scotteroma scotte wyllya reportyth henry hutyngdo sayth yt though lyght som thynges yet stedfast stable promyse yt mysed good euyll shuld formed though named couetous yet shuld seme yt liberall sheweth narracyo folowyng upon season abbot place englande dede two munkes place hadde gatheryd money made theyr frendes kynge willyam offered large offer eyther promoted dygnyte also thyrde munke mekenesse humylyte folowed two entent vppon hym kynge admytted abbot wolde haue gyuen attendaunce chapelayn haue wyth hym returned kynge called hym ii munkys seuerally eyther profered caste hys eye asyde espyed thyrd whych demed hadde comen also cause kynge called hym asked yf wold geue bretherne offered abbot answered kynge sayde wolde nother offer yet gyue yt one peny wold haue great charge meane wrongefull kynge well vnderstanden thys thyrde munkes answere sayde best worthy abbot haue rule holy charge gaue vnto hym benefyce wythout takynge peny thys kynge wyllyam vsed alway lemmans wherfore dyed without yssue legyttymat reyned sayde fully xii yeres odde dayes ccxxvi chapiter henry iii son wyllyam co querour fyrste yt name whyche connynge surnamed beuclerk began hys reygne domynyon kynge englande v daye august yere lorde xi hundred one xliii yere fyrste phylyppe kynge fraunce crowned westmynster ryght shortly thomas archebyshoppe yorke morys byshoppe london henry youth plyed studye instructe vii artes lyberall anon made holy chyrche free vsed saynt edwardes lawes wyth amendemet put courte nyce waton men closed ranulphe byshoppe durham towre lodon ye ye haue harde great wyth wyllyam brother sent anselme archebyshoppe caunterburye whyche fledde fro tyranny wyllyam rufus iustyce cotynence henry chastysed olde vntrewe mesure made yerde ye length hys owne arme wyth dyuers thynges reformyng longe day ben mysse vsed abhorred excesse metys drynkes vsed fyght wyth cousayll wyth sworde seconde yere reygne robert hys brother thys season hadde ben occupyed warres vppon cristes enymyes hauyng worde deth hys brother wyllyam howe brother henry hadde taken vpon hym kynge returned normandy made preparacyon come englande season also broke pryson ranulfe byshoppe durham comen sayde robert normandy whych excyted duke robert myght warre vppon hys brother henry assembled stronge armye knyghtes toke shyppynge landed processe tyme portysmouth medyacyon peace made suche condycion shuld haue iii thousand markes yerely promysed vnto hym willyam rufus brother wyth condycyons successyon thynges whyche ouerpasse length tyme thus robert beynge contented contrary myndes lordes season hadde dysported hym englande retourned normandy lordes thys dedes done shewed lytle lesse lesse setby yt hys father lyfe hadde vyctorye vtterly dyspleased hym deale y touched yet hys manhode manfull dedes fell fauoure people dyd many great notable actes specyally wynnyng cytye acon vppon myscreauntes turkes whyche dedes yt apperyth sequele storye also fauour god eleccyon shuld made kynge hierusalem certayne prynces prynces peeres ordynaunce made stode wyth theyr taper abydynge dyuyne purueyaunce whose taper fyrst wyth heuenly fyre lyghtened shulde admytted kynge taper thys duke robert fyrste onely wherfore dyuyne purueyaunce chosen kynge hierusalem whyche refused payne trauayle shuld haue wyth also couetyse crowne englande soone hadde knowlege deth brother willyam anon parted coutrey sped hym homewarde myght whych dede affermeth myne authour spedde worse dedes thys robert wyse counsayll stronge batayll also ryght lyberall hys retourne hierusalem maryed doughter wyllyam de auersana lorde apulia wyth whome receyued grete somes money dower whych meane liberalyte spent shortly fortune beganne frowne vppon duke robert sette owne lordes agayn hym sent vnto kyng henry hys brother wyllynge hym come normandye wolde delyuer coutrey vnto holde hym theyr chefe lorde ruler wherunto sayth englyshe cronycle kynge henry soone cosented euer thys warre betwene sayde duke robert kyng henry beganne thys henry maryed mawde molde doughter malcolyne kyng scotlande margarete hys wyfe doughter edwarde outlawe begynnyng wyllyam conqueroure thouched whyche molde thys henry receyuyd wryters two sonnes ii doughters yt saye wyllyam rycharde mawde mary also sayd authour wyth saye robert duke normandye came englande fourth yere reygne kynge henry hadde good chere brother syster request sayde syster released brother ye forenamed trybute iii thousand markes yll tale teller couetous signory broderly loue dissolued wise kynge strong army sayled normandy held broder robert sharpe warre chased hym one countrey another wanne hym roan caan faloys good townes normandye lastely constrayned hym aske helpe phylyppe kyng fraunce erle flaudres fayled helpe wyth power could make gaue batayll vnto brother kynge henry whyche taken sent ouer england put castell cardyffe walys remayned prisoner whyle lyued dede buryed glowcester tyme season ye iii yere kyng henry ye chyrch saynt barthelmew smythfeld london begonne founded mynstrell kyng henry named rayer perfourmed ended good well disposed cytezens citye lodon place smythfelde ye day lay stowe al ordure fylth place felon transgressours kynges lawes put execucyon ccxxvii chapiter kynge henry hadde fynyshed warre normandye returned englande robert de bolesyn eldest sonne roger de mount gomeryk erle shrewesburye arose agayne kynge manned castellys shrewesbury brugg arundell tekynhyll incoraged walshmen agayne kyng kyng pursued cruelly sayd robert yt wythin xl day wan tho castellis slew many men gat fauour walshmen gyftes plesaut wordes also compelled sayd robert forsake englad whyche sayled corner normadye kept secretely tyll tyme hym thyther comen willya erle cornewall wyllyam also erle nortom normandye two erles assocyat gaderyd great strength norman dyd great harme wythin prouynce wherfore kynge sayled thyther made sharpe warre vppon whych loste many men ye ende put fro theyr strength toke theym prysoners helde ye terme theyr lyues done sette coutrey good reste peace retourned englande whyche returne kynge henry made sharpe lawes agayne theues vsed vnleful meanes whyche lawes conteyned losynge lyfe eye stone member man gylte requyred soone anselme archbysshoppe caunterbury assembled great cousayll london clergy england authoryte cousayll dyuers abbotes put theyr dygnytie taken tyme theyr abbayes vnlefull meanes prestes wyues amoges decree one ye prestes shulde forgo theyr wyues strife fell betwen ye kyng anselme wold sacre prestes hadde taken inuestyture lewde mennys handes whyche forboden vppon payne cursynge gyralde archebyshoppe yorke pleasure kynge sacred suche bysshoppes wherfore anselme beynge dyscotent departed ye land yode rome shewe thys wyth thynges pope whyche daye moste accorde wryters shulde pascall seconde vi kynge countrey flaudres sore blemyshed hurte meane see flemynges yode aboute haue socoure dwellynge requyred kyng haue lycence might inhabyt eest parte ryuer twede whych graunted certayn yeres remoued ito westwalys remayned longe whyle sprad englande ouer vii yere thys kynge vppon frydaye nyghte fyrste weke clene lent sene vncouth starre betwene ye south weste whyche nyghtely appered one howre cotynued space xxv day fore agaynst oute eest parte appered great leuyn beme bryghtnes whyche stretched towarde sayde starre vppon shere thursdaye nexte ensuynge sene two monys one eest weste thys yere anselme kynges agrement returned agayne rome shortely called conuocacyon london whyche pope authoryte yt newely conformed enacted temporall man daye shuld make inuesture crosse wyth rynge viii yere reygne kynge henry fourth henry emperour almayne whyche maryed molde eldeste doughter kynge henry age v yeres prysoned pope pascall dyuerse cardynallys henry also warred agayne father henry iii lastely caste hym stronge pryson whyche dede assermeth ranulphe wylfully ruled empyre xx yere resygned hys dygnyte handes calixtus ye secode name pope came secretely england vnto chester vnwyttynge hys wyfe hys frendes lyued longe strayte lyfe buryed laste sayeng dysagreeth wryters storyes emperours yt wytnessed henry emperour ruled empyre sayd xx wynter dyed place almayn called spyre buryed wyth scrypture vppon toumbe filius hic pater hic auus hic preauus iacet hic whyche meane vulgare tunge foloweth son lyeth also ye fader belsyre ye great graufader henry emperour thus dede yt shalbe shewed conuenyency tyme requyreth became wife shall declared ix yere ye reygne kyng henry archebyshoppe anselme professed gerarde archbyshoppe yorke yoke hys obedyence taught lore lamfranke predecessour x daye auguste folowynge sacred v byshoppes one tyme wynchester salysbury exeter herforde glamurgan kynge henry ordeyned byshoppes see ely ordeyned henry hadde ben bishoppe bangor besette cambrydge shyre see ely bisshoppes see lyncolne gaue owne towne spaldynge hadde mynyshed see preferment ely x yere dyed anselme archbyshop caunterbury whose deth see voyde v yeres goodes chyrch spent kynges vse whe prayed helpe ye chyrch wythout hedde pastor vsed answere fader also brother accustomed set beste proued men yt might fynd entente myght toke tyme laysure wyth suche mylde answeres put tyme fylled hys cofers wyth great somme ye benefyce desyrous knowe great vertue thys byshoppe anselme lette hym rede xiiii chapyter vii boke polycronycon shall fynde parte therof tyme wytnesseth frenche cronycle cotrauersy began betwene kyng lewys kyng fraunce son phylyp fyrste lewys surnamed lewis great hys bygnesse person ellys greatnesse hys dedes lewys sent vnto kyng henry beynge normandy gaue vnto hym monycyon homage duchy normandy also shulde restore vnto hym bete groude castell gysours also recompence restore hurtes harmes norman hadde done partes kyng henry denyed shortely skyrmysshes cocke fyghtes beganne betwene sayde two prynces kynge henry lyenge sayde castell gysours lewys place called mounte calue thys encreased suche wyse eyther prynce soughte rome place whose knyghtes sundry tymes met notable batayll fynde remembraunce yt sayde warre contynued terme two yeres ende whych two yeres wyllyam eldest sonne kynge henry beynge chyld wythin age contented well mynde lewys refrayned hys warre tyme xiii yere shrewesburye great erth quake nothyngham morne vndertyde ryuer trent fordryed moneth june sayth guydo men wente ouer drye starre called stella cometa blasynge sterre aperyde soone theruppon folowed harde wynter great deth people scarcete vitayll great moreyn bestes thys yere also kynge founded abbay hyde wythoute wally wynchester olde tyme wythin wally ccxxviii chapiter xv yere hys reygne ye kynge entedyd haue moted faricus abbot abyndon vnto see caunterburye counsayll kept wyndesoure bysshoppes ye kynges mynde chau ged see admytted raufe byshoppe rochester yere one thurstone chosen archebyshoppe yorke whyche wythsayde hys professyon obedience shuld owe see caunterbury wherfore lengthe depryuyd hys dygnyte laboure made pascall pope named sayde pope wrote vnto kynge shulde restore thurstone agayne see yorke whyche meane agayne restoryd yet disdayned hys lawefull obedyence vnto raufe archebyshope caunterbury stryfe renewed lamfranke ye haue harde thyrde chapyter wyllyam conquerour dyd appeace brought argument pope whyche kynges request promysed yt wolde nothyng ordeyne shuld derogacion archbyshop caunterbury dygnyte chyrche coclusion pope gaue defuse sentence thys mater lefte stryfe vndetermyned vnassoyled ye kynges procuratours wyth also archbyshop caunterbury absent yt nede fauour pope bowed forsoke ye olde rule vsed hys day sacred sayde thurstone gaue vnto hym pawle dede ye kyng sore dyscontented wyth thurstone warned hym entre lande wherfore pope wrote shortely kynge wyllyng hym suffer thurstone occupye see peaseably shulde accused suspended dygnyte offyce caunterbury thurstone enioyed see yere lorde xi hundred xviii sayth frenche cronicle whyche xvii yere thys kyng henry fyrst warre agayn quyckened betwen kyng henry lewys kynge fraunce wherof occasyon sayth sayde frenche cronycle thybaude erle chartres whych thybaude greuyd frenche kynge necessyte requyred kynge henry ayde helpe whome kynge hys kynnesman sent ayde socoure afterwarde kynge sayled ouer stronge armye sente nobleman named stephan lordshyppe brye defendeyt agayn frenche kynge lewys vnsterstode kynge henry landed normandye wyth great power haste assembled stronge power drewe hym towarde kynge stronge holdes mannyd wyth norman also depe great ryuers frenche kynge myght wynne vnto kynge henry lastely feate warre whyche longe reherse wan town named lyngues cause whyche towne brydge passe ryuer thee normandye certayne knyghtes lewes thus wonne foresayd towne sayd lewes wyth people spedde hym shortly rescued foresayde knightes spoyled robbed towne whyche ryche myche yt hadde ben quyet rest many yeres also slewe toke prysoners ye norman dwellyng put theyr stede frenchme done sped hym towarde kynge henry castell called male assyse made purueyaunce defence frenchman hadde garnyshed yt hys pleasure departed then longe frenche kynge came thyther wyth hole hoste frenchman many sore cruell assautys wan sayde castell bette yt downe euen wyth grounde whych season sayth sayd cronicle fell frenche kynge many dyuerse mysfortunes shortely amonge myssechaunces noble captayn hys named angueran de chanmount whyche done myche harme normandye kynge henry wonne castelles stronge holdes dyed sodeynly shorte tyme baldewyne erle flaudres man great stregth puyssaunce beseaged castell wounded face dyed wyth vi dayes fauques erle aungeos also lewys affyed mych trusted maryed doughter vnto willyam eldest sonne kynge henry refused kynge fraunce parte ayded assysted kynge henry myght dayly power kyng henry encreased frenche kynges mynyshed lastely two prynces met wyth theyr hostes playne feld foughte dedely cruell batayll ende frenche kynge ouercomen loste myche people copelled flee vnto place called audely sauegarde thys ouerthrowe frenchemen excused moste fayrest maner yt excuse selfe saye kynge henry set vppon kynge lewys ware hys knyghtes oute aray order also kyng henry farre excedynge nomber men ouer theyr kyng wordes boste selfe slaunder englyshemen whyche appereth augmentacyon theyr owne shame ranulfe munke sayth shortely kyng henry ouercame frenche kynge royally batayll yt foloweth ye story fynally sayde prynces agreed wyllyam sonne kyng henry dyd homage vnto ye french kyng landes normandye agrement fader kyng thought hym selfe good vnder obeysauce ye frenche kyng kynge henry caused hys free men englande normandy homage vnto sonne wyllyam soone fouques named lefte hys erledome angeer angiers guydyng kynge henry yode hym selfe holy lande wylled testament yf retourned agayne sayde erledome shulde remayne vnto sonne lawe wyllyam son kynge henry whyche hadde maryed hys doughter xx yere reygne kyng henry quene molde mawde hys wyfe dyed normandy whyche youthe set father kyng scottes nunry ware vsed vayle habyte nunne whiche cause kynge henry agreable take vnto wyfe thys mater fell great despucyon anselme archebyshop caunterbury sore agayne maryage season tyme length yt suffycyetly proued fygure woman worynge habyte wythoute professyon order thus ordered father ende put vnworthy wowers thys wryters reputed blessyd holy woman lyuynge worldly woman kynge henry contynued normandy vppon season terme iii yeres toke shyppyng haterflete normandy sayled happely englande day meane ye xxiiii day nouember sayth wryters shortly willya duke normandy wyth rycharde brother notha countesse persye rycharde erle chester wyfe kynges nyce archdekyn herforde nomber hundred lx persones toke shyppynge sayde porte drowned bocher onely excepte whyche mysfortune fell ouersyght maister fell dyssencyon nyghte amonge selfe reason wherof ranne vppon rocke shewed foresayde bocher dauger wyllyam duke normady escaped shyppe bote nere vnto lande harde lametable crye cou tesse notha commaunded rower returne saue sayd countesse whych done mysfortune saye receyued bote tempeste ouer chargynge bote otherwise swalowid see none foude te theyr goodes duke wyllya desclaunderous wordes lefte memory englyshe cronycle also wryters whyche ouerpasse ccxxix chapiter xxi yere hys reygne kynge henry made ye parke wodestoke syde oxenforde plesures fouques erle angiers returned holy land maryed syster maryed vnto wyllam duke normandye vnto son robert curthose gaue wyth erledome conomanna stryfe began kyndell betwene kynge henry sayd fouques wytholdyng dowre ioynture hys fyrste doughter maryed wnto wyllyam kynges sonne xxiii yere kynge henry dyed raufe archbyshoppe caunterbury one named wyllya set ye see hym kynge thys yere beganne foundacyon ye abbay redyng iohn cardynall rome sente calyxte seconde name beynge pope certayne mater co cernynge pope tyme whyche hys beynge cardynall made sharpe processe agayne prestes norysshed crysten moyles rebuked open publyshement otherwyse wan hym small lytle fauoure dyssymuled doctour toke great feruence correccyon iudgement prestes englande forgate lore cousayll famous pope caton whyche boke counsayll wysedome thus sayth quae cuspare sos ea tu ne feceris ipse turpe est doctori cum cuspa redarguit ipsum whyche two verse maye englyshed foloweth auyse ye well let reason thy guyde folke thou arte aboute blame suche defaute espyed yf shalt thou haue shame mannes honoure suche thynges woll reclayme y full foule man woll chese hys dede agayne hys wordes preche cousayll remembred sayd cardynall euenynge lewdely blowen horne sayde detestable synne aryse syde strumpet sacre body cryste taken wyth strumpet open shame rebuke xxv yere kynge henry called counsayll london spyrytualty condescended kynges offycers shulde punyshe prestes cheryshed foresayde mulys sayd offycers toke money sufferyd prestes spurre theyr mulys theyr pleasure whyche offyce daye clerely renouced al spyritual men yt neyther kyng bishop taketh yt synes yet correccyon necessarye done xxvii yere reygne reporteth olde cronycle gray freres procuryng ye kyng came fyrste englande theyr fyrst house buylded caunterbury aboute tyme moste accorde writer dyed henry iiii emperour name whyche touched maryed molde doughter kyng henry whose deth sayde empresse came vnto father normandye kyng henry ascertaynted deth henry emperour myche hadde none heyre male caused soone party hys lordes england well spirytuall temporall swere presence shuld kepe ye land englande vse mawde ye empresse yf dyed wythoute yssue male suruyued xxviii yere kyng henry geffrey platagenet erle angeou maryed molde empresse whyche two descended henry second stephan kyng englande yere also kynge dyuers monycyons vysyons amonge ferefull dremys saw great company clerkys dyuerse wepons whyche manassed hym dette shuld owe vnto passed thought yt manassed deth knyghtes lastely apperyd hym great company byshoppes whych thretened hym wolde haue smytten hym wyth theyr cross monicyon toke remorce conscyence dyd great dedes charyte normandye hadde sene visyons comyng englande satysfaccyon wronges done chyrche affermeth guydo founded abbay redynge spoken ouer releasyd vnto englyshe men dane gelt father brother renewed xxx yere kyng henry dyed erle flaundres kynge henry sayth ranulfe agrement lewys frenche kyng made erle next heyr enherytour sayde erledome expressed maner tytle successyon xxxii yere kyng dyed robert curthose kynges broder whyche hadde kept prysoner castell cardyfe iiii yere reygn whose corp shewed buryed glouceter hyghe alter aboute tyme founded pryorye norton prouynce chester one wyllyam sonne nychelle abbay combremer prouynce also founded aboute tyme xxxv yere kynge henry borne molde empresse henry shorte mantell henry seconde whyche shall shewed consentynge martyrdome saynt thomas caunterburye kynge henry beyng normandy writer fell wyth hys horse whereof cought hys deth ranulphe sayth toke surfet etynge lamprey ther dyet hadde reygned full xxxv yeres odde monethes ye kynges bowellys drawen hys body salted wyth myche salte auoyde stenche whych hadde infected many men body lastely closed bulles skynne yet yt stynted clensed hed dyed stenche brayn lastely body brought england buryed abbay redynge founded ye fame hym blowen abrode yt blowen prynces sayde yt passed men iii thynges wytte eloquence fortune batayll sayde ouercomen wyth iii vyces wyth couetyse wyth cruelty wyth luste lechery one made verys hym folowen kynge henry dede bewte world great dole goddes maken theyr kynde brother sole mercurius speche marce batayll harte stronge appollo iupiter hest egall saturne enymye cupido kyng right man myght glorious raynyng left crowne fell honour downe mysse suche kynge normandy gan lowre losse theyr floure sange wel away englande made mone scotlande dyd grone se daye francia ccxxx chapiter lewys sonne fyrste phylyp beganne hys reygne ouer frenchemen yere lorde xi hundred vii reken begynnynge deth father vi yere fyrste henry kyng england lewys touched admytted rule land certayn yeres hys father dyed surnamed lewes great grossenesse body anon lewys fynyshed obsequy funerallys hys father wythoute taryenge called counsayll hys lordes spyrytuall temporall cytye orleaunce byshoppe see wyth adioynynge solemnly anoynted crowned wythout grudge archbyshoppe raynes mych custome frenche kynges vsed crowned soone coronacyon lewys guy le rous guy de cressy sonne whych tyme hadde ben debate warre lewys lewys taken ye castel gurnaye guy le rous wyth hys sonne seynge might preuayle agayn kyng awayted theyr tyme season espyed endo hys owne broder erle corbueyll went forth huntynge toke hym prysoner kept hym castell bawdum whereof cause myche sayde endo wolde assyste ayde ye sayd guyle rous brother agayne kynge thys knowen anon frendes tenauntes sayde erle shewyd mater vnto kynge besechynge hym wolde ayde assyste theym recouer theyr naturall lorde wherunto kynge granted forth wyth sent knyght captayn named auncelyne accompanyed xl horsmen myche yt shewyd vnto kyng yt ye rule castell wolde receyue suche persones sent hym delyuer castell wyth prysoner vnto uppon whyche appoyntemet thys ancelyne sayd sent entre castell contrary former mise made auncelyne betrayed taken many men slayne hym selfe set prison sayd erle corbuayll wherof kynge enfourmed passynge greuously dyscontent wherfore haste sped thyther compassed ye castell wyth stronge syege wythin defended manfully tyme whyche syege nother guy fader guy hys sonne sayde castell baudum guy ye son lusty iuperdous knyght put hym self aduenture dyuers wayes tymes haue entred sayde castell comfort men vayn fynally kynge made sore cruell assautes wan fyrst warde wyth great dyffycultye hole delyueryd erle auncelyn stewarde ye great doute theyr lyues toke prysoners soldyours put deth prisoned theyr lyues ende terrour fere processe tyme place called roche guy whych one guy olde tyme buylded dwel lyd daye one stocke named also guy whyche hadde wyfe fayre good woman doughter one wyllya norman whyche wyllyam entendynge dysheryte sayde guy lord stronge place vppon tyme sayde guy ye chyrch chapell dyuyne seruyce entred chyrche wyth certayn harnessed knightes vnder theyr man telly fell vppon hym hewe hym wherof herynge wyfe ranne madde woman fell vppon husbande entet saue hym stroke tyrauntes cruell yt forbare nothynge theyr cruel tye wounded wyth husbande slayne done entred castell slew suche found therin willyam fader ye wife guy broder affermeth maister robert gagwyne possessed ye castell guyon thought therby rule countrey enuyron gentylles common rynge thys shamefull murder assembled gither one mynde whyle yode kyng enfurme hym cruell dede prepared abyllementes warre layde syege sayde castell kynge lewys herynge shamfull dede wynnynge stronge holde ferynge rescue englishman norman leste castell meane myghte fall theyr handes sent commyssyon vnto ruler countrey chargynge theym wyth dylygence assaute place yf myght wynne yt put executours murder vnto moste shamefull deth whyche commaundement receyued kynge stronge assaute cruell made manfully yt defended losse ran theym castell processe tyme willyam conceyued well myght contynue defence therof began treate agreed yf myghte haue free yssue hym hys assuraunce wyth knyghtes myght go quyetly vnto place wold chose wold delyuer castell wyth therin whyche requeste dyuerse hedde captaynes graunted sworne soone castell delyuered frenchemen entred multytude wythstandynge former promyse othe fell vppon sayde wyllyam soudyours put vnto deth many cruell torme te fynally caste theyr careyns ryuer sayne vppon brynke wherof sayde roche castell standynge shortely ensued warre betwene lewys kynge henry englande yt shewyd ye x yere ye sayde henry warre ended betwene two prynces hugh puyssake man great myght dayes fraunce rebelled agayne ye kyng warred greuously vppon agayn countesse chartres robbed pylled chyrches ye countrey well place sayd coutesse yonge sonne thybaude fayne seke socoure kynge wherfore kynge called counsayll hys citye meleyne agayne sayd hugh many greuous complayntes put myche ye sayd hugh tyme present make answere vnto thynges layde charge kynge commaunded castell terry thoree haste shulde manned vytayled ende comforte strength castell kynge yf nede requyred myght lay syege castell puyssake mych one nere adioynynge vnto ye whych passe tyme sayd hugh somoned appere kynge counsayll refused appere kynge enfourmed garnyshyng ye castell thorre disobedyence hugh assembled stronge hoste co passed castell puyssake syege set thybaude son countesse vppon syde stode towarde prouynce chartres stronge assautes cruell warre made euery parte shulde make longe processe tell ferefull shot gonnys vppon bothe partyes sharpe shot arowes castynge stonys scalynge wally fyllynge dyches fyryng gate yet mortall cruell fyght bothe partes ye manyfold dede bodyes maymed reason ye sayd assautes yet ye manasses mockes great bosus crake vsed souldyours durynge syege fynally kynge hadde lyen sayd castell certayne tyme wanne yt pure force toke sayde hughe wyth hys accessaryes whyche commaunded kepte prysoners castell thorre season kynge caste downe sayde castell puyssake grounde excepte lytle towre made tymber whyche reseruyd lodgynge done forsayd prysoners put deth dysherityd grefe theyr offence foresayd countesse charter sonne thybaude quyete theyr countrey castell puyssake belongynge sayde erledome howe yt processe tyme folowynge thys thybaude entended haue reedyfyed newe castell wherby kinge enformed wold haue encroched thynges appertaynynge crowne fraunce wherfore kynge wythstode yt grudge fell betwene kynge erle thybaude processe dedely warre made betwen whyche contynued wise theyr damage fynally warre agayne reuyued betwene kynge lewys kynge henry xvii yere reygne sayde henry declared meane thys warre betwene kynge erle thybaude wherof cyrcumstaunce wold axe longe leysure reherse yt shewyd frenche storye fynally erle thybaude loste none honour yt frenche cronycle wonderfully fauoreth ye party frenche kynge reader maye well apperceyue quis pin xit leonem ccxxxi chapiter lewys also hadde great warre wyth henry fourth name emperour whyche maryed molde doughter henry fyrste kynge england shewed whefore occasyon sayth frenche cronycle myche sayd henry emperour hadde tyme ben accursed gelasius seconde name pope raynes citye fraunce whych cause surmytted sayde emperoure assembled huge hoste almaynes italyens entred lande fraunce dyd therin myche harme ende knew great prouisyon ye lewis made mete great power affermeth ye frech cronycle wythdrewe hym auoyded lande frauce wythout stroke strykyng speketh nothyng authour wrote story henry emperour erle flaundres named charlys systers sonne kynge lewys nexte duke baldewyn whych dyed sayd thyrde chapyter story kyng henry woude face foresayd charlys sore hated prouoste brudgys whyche bryng malyce effecte counsayled wyth hys adherentes myght slee sayde charlys whose cousayle meane founde brynge erle brudgys towne flaundres wele sayde towne whose commynge vppon daye beynge chyrche herynge dyuyne seruyce slayne ye sayd prouoste complycys wherof herynge kynge lewys anon wyth great army entred flaundres besyeged town brudges lastely toke sayde prouoste whyche fyrst bounden post eyen wyth reede stryken hys hed shot wyth arowes lastely set vppon whele remayned tyl dyed felowe hys named bartopus ye whyche consentyng murder hanged vppon galos waste army hym amastyfe great curre dogge whyche soon euer smytten bote vppon sayde bartopus processe rent hym dyd hym great payne lastely endyd lyfe great mysery time ye reygn lewys bishop clermode voyded see cruelnes erle auerne wherfore kyng assembled knyghtes strength set byshoppe hys place agayne maugry enymyes agayne second tyme eft put sayde erle kynge restoryd hym toke suche pledge erle remayned good quyet ye later dayes lewys eldest sonne named phylyppe wyth conuenyent company vppon daye dysporte rode certayne stretys cytye parys rode hogge sodeynly starte amonge horse fete chylde wherwyth horse beynge frayde lepte sodeynly cast chylde grounde wyth great vyolence dyed ye nyght folowynge myssehappe kynge toke great heuynesse waxed dayly feble vnweldly reason ouer ladynge fleshe myghte well trauayll therfore aduyce hys lordes admytted hys seconde sonne named lewys rule realme hym crowned lyfe tyme also maryed hym vnto elynoure doughter duke guyan whych inherytoure vnto father shortely kynge sykened hys great payne horse lytter brought vnto saynt denys lyenge season syke knew owre deth nere commaunded suche aboute hym shulde spredde tapytte vppon ground laye hym vppon sayde tappette vppon hym made crosse asshes whyche done accordynge commaundement laye tyll dyed yere hys reygne reken deth father owne endynge daye xxx yeres reygned xxix yeres full odde monethes buryed monastery saynte denys great pompe wyth thys scrypture folowynge vppon tombe illustris genitor lodouict rex lodouicus vir clemens christi seruorum semper amicus institui fecit pastorem canonicorum sella veteri trans flumen parisiorum hane vir magnanimus asmi victoris amore auro reliquijs ornauit rebus honore sancti dionysi qui seruas corpus humatum martyr antisles lodouici solue reatum whyche versys may expowned vulgar foloweth noble father lewys lewys kynge crystes seruauntes ryght meke louynge caused made chanons howse selle paris streme flowes whyche man myghty loue saynte victor wyth golde relyquys enorued great honor wherfore saynte denys whyche kepest hys body graued martyr bishoppe pray soule saued angsia ccxxxii chapiter stephan erle boloyn son erle blesence wyues syster henry fyrst named mary beganne reygne ouer realme englande yere lord xicxxxvi first yere lewes ye viii yt name kyng fraunce noble man hardy contrarye hys othe affyrmaunce wryters made molde empresse toke vpon hym ye crowne crowned vppon saynte stephans daye crystemasse weke westmynster archbisshoppe caunterbury whyche lykewyse made lyke othe vnto sayde empresse presence fader touched punyshment wherof men denied sayde archbyshoppe dyed shortly many lordes whyche dyd accordyng lyke went quyte wythout punyshement great causer periurye rehersyth one authour one hugh bygot stewarde somtyme wyth henry fyrste immedyatly deceace sayde henry came vnto england sayde archbysshop lordes lande toke wyllfully othe sware present lytle kynges deth kynge henry admytted chase hys heyre kynge hym stephan hys neuewe myche molde doughter dyscontented hym wher vnto archbyshoppe wyth lordes gaue hasty credence hugh scaped vnpunyshed dyed myserably shorte tyme kyng stephan crowned sware lordes oxynforde wolde holde hys hand benefyces voyded wold forgyue dane gelt kyng henry hym done wyth thynges whyche passe ouer stephan drad comynge empresse therfore gaue lycence vnto lordes yt euery myght buylde castell strong fortres vpon groud soone agreed wyth dauyd kynge scottes receyued hym homage hym wonne townes holdes towne exetoure rebellyd agayne kynge seconde yere hys reygne ende subdued theym wyllyam archbyshoppe caunterburye dyed yere whose benefyce gyuen thibaude abbot becco normandye fourth yere reygne dauyd kynge scottys repentynge hym hys former agrement made wyth kynge entred newe boundes northumberlande aboute ryuer theyse towarde prouynce yorke brent slewe people moste cruell wyse sparynge man woman chylde agayne whome thurstone kynges comaundement sent whych wyth power quytte hym knyghtly ouer threwe hoste scottes slewe theym great nomber compellyd theym wythdrawe agayne scotlande passetyme ye kyng layde syege castell bedforde wanne yt done made vyage scotlande dyd lytle hys pleasure profyte retourne homewarde toke alexaunder byshoppe lyncolne helde hym duresse tyll hadde yelded gyuen vnto hym castell newerke chased nygellus byshop ely also thys furye toke suche displeasure louynge frende roger byshop salysburye caste hym bondes tyll sayde roger hadde rendred vnto hym two castellys uyes shyrburne whyche thys roger remembrynge great ingratytude kynge toke thought dyed shortely left redy coyne xl thousande marke whyche hys deth came kynges cofers one cronycle sayth kynge stephan obteyned foresayde castellys entent myght fortyfye theym wyth knyghtes wythstande empresse whose cumynge euer fered ye yere folowynge wane wyth strength castellys glowceter herford webley brystowe dudley shrewesburye whyche cause robert erle glouceter began wythdrawe hys allegeaunce kynge stephan robert son henry fyrst reason baste thys dyspleasure sent letter vnto molde empresse hys syster promysynge great ayde wynne ryght meane whyle empresse made prouysyon iourney kynge stephan concluded maryage betwene eustace sonne constaunce kynges syster fraunce doughter lewys great whyche contynued amyte betwene england frauce moneth iuly vi yere stephan molde empresse testyfyeth henry chanon hys ix boke entred land porte portesmouthe kepte iourney tyll came brystowe dyd great harme meane passage countrey whyche tyme sayde landynge kyng stephan laye syege walyngforde castell soone harde landynge empresse anon sente oute commyssyons strength drewe towarde hys enymyes tyme season robert erle glowceter ranulfe erle chester wente vnto empresse wyth power might make empresse herynge great power commynge wyth kynge drewe cytye nycoll called lyncolne helde longe season kyng myght lastely empresse wyth people escaped kynge possessyd cytye bode tyll candelmas whyche season erle robert ranulfe named great power walshmen ye power empresse came agayn kynge bothe hostes nere ioynyng erle ranulfe chester spake knightes sayd requyre cause parell may fyrst shall entre parell answered erle robert sayd yt vnworthy yt axeste fyrst stroke dignyte fyght yt syttynge noblesse blood vertue strength whyche thou passest men kinges false othe moueth men warre fyght muste wynne mastry ouercome yt hath none socour costrayned defende hym knyghtly stronge dedes armes manhode shall agayne theym entryked wyth gyle wyckednesse robert erle mellent erle also albemarll symon hampton man great boste small myght kyng stephan prepayred set forwarde hys people erle baudewyne wordes comfort kynges peplethre thynges requysyte fyght sayde men yt shall fyghte theym behouefull thre thynges fyrst ryght ye cause leste men fal parell soule second quantyte men army leste men oppreste wyth excedynge nomber thyrde effecte corage stregth knightes yt quarel shuld fayle lacke hardy assured fyghtynge touchynge whyche thre poyntes truste well sped ye take hede farthermore enymyes haue fyrste haue agayne v robert erle glouceter whyche vseth great manasses executeth lytle small dedys mouth lyon harte shepe pompous speche darke vnderstandyng also ranulfe erle chester man wythout reason full folehardynesse redy preste conspyracy vnstedfastnesse maner dedes hasty furyouse hart vnware parellys assayeth oft acheue great dedes bryngeth none effecte fyrsly fresshely begynneth cowardely fayntly forsaketh vnhappy vngracyous dedys ouercomen euery place holdeth wyth hym banyshed men sculler mo company soner ouercome weke fyghtyng eyther theym putteth truste felowe whyle hym selfe ouerthrowen myght haue finyshed wordes moste mennys audyence crye enymyes wyth noyse trumpettes gruntyng horsys approched smote gyther forth go arowes gresely cruell fyghte contynued vppon bothe sydes whyle yt yt enduryd grene feld turned perfyte redde many pale wan vysage sene yeldynge gooste wyth army legges disseueryd departed longe whyle thys fyghte stode questyon whyther partye shulde obteyne vyctorye ende kynge stephans partye gaue backe fledde full knyghtly abode felde wyth fewe knyghtes taken brought vnto empresse whyche commaunded hym conueyed vnder sure kepyng vnto brystowe kepte prysoner sayde tyme candelmasse vnto holy roode daye next ensuynge aboute tyme founded abbay stratforth langthorne wythin iiii myles london knyght called syr wyllyam de moutfychet ccxxxiii chapiter empresse hadde wonne vyctorye commytted kyng warde ye haue harde therwith lytle exalted thoughte mynde suerty possessyon hole realme disceyued kent toke partye wyth kynge stephan yet victory thus obteyned empresse came vnto wynchester wyltone oxenforde redynge saynte albonys whyche cytyes townes receyued wyth honoure fynally came london entre state lande whyche beynge quene made assyduat laboure delyuerye kynge husbande promysynge shulde surrender lande possessyon come religyous man ellys pylgryme hys lyues ende vayne myght purchace grace vppon maner condycyons cytezens london also made great laboure myghte vse lawys edwarde confessoure graunted wyllyam conqueroure lawys father whyche straytnesse wherof wyse cousayll myght haue graunte cytezens dyscontentyd knowynge countrey kent wolde strength theyr partye ordeyned haue taken beynge therof warned departed haste lefte behynde hyr store housholde fledde vnto oxynforde abode people whyche deuyded scateryd thys whyle sente vnto dauyd kynge scottes vncle ayde whyche haste came vnto yode wynchester layde syege byshoppes towre whyche kynges brother tyme helde wyth strength quene wyth ayde frendes kentyshemen made stronge hoste wherof capytayne knyght named guyllyam de pre whe empresse harde ye great strength quene saw owne mynyshed rather encreasyd fled secretely escaped vnto glouceter erle robert brother taken soone put pryson dauyd kynge scottes herynge thys returned scotland meanes made vpon eyther syde deliuery exchaunge prysoners fynally yt agreed kynge shulde delyueryd erle robert thys agrement concluded myche sorowe wroughte wythin thys realme empresse pylled spoyled hyr partye quene promyses manaces borowed toke vppo ye syde soudyours stale extorcyoned vpo partyes riche men made nedy poore oppressed thys meane whyle empresse retourned agayne oxynforde vytayled manned yt beste maner lastely kyng delyuered vpon holy roode day haruest soon becleped oxynford wyth stronge syege tyme mychelmasse vnto season crystemas whyche tyme season empresse vsed new gyle constraynte necessyte vytayle tyme great plente snow fallen vppon grounde frost therwyth great thamys wyth great ryuers frosen ouer man horse myghte passe ye water vppo yse empresse constrayned nede sayd apparayled companye whyte clothynge whych farre apered lyke snow vpon plumpe goyng gyther nere myght escaped daunger theyr fone came walyngforde then processe tyme wyth small companye departed retourned fynally normandye vnto husbande soon empresse thus departed oxenforde town yelden vnto ye kynge kyng mich empresse stu e wel harnes stuffe housholde entendyd haue pursued tydyng brought vnto hym yt ranulfe erle chester wyth hoste walshmen commyng towarde hym medyacyon frendes thys ranulfe ende kynge reconcyled wyth hym agreed tyme season yt testyfyed dyuerse authours iewes vpon ester euyn crucyfyed chylde named wyllyam cytye norwyche tyme henry second ye vi yere reygn sayth policronicon crucified glouceter xxii yere reygn kyng stephan agayne crowned lyncolne soon toke fro ranulphe erle chester castell lyncolne robert erle glouceter made also newe warre vppon kynge better kynge wyltone kynge lyke haue fallen robertys dauger yet kynge escaped wyth myche payne taken baron kynges named syr willyam martel whose delyuery kynge gaue sayde erle castell shyrbourne done yt sayd erle robert began foude stronge castell faryngdone wherof kynge beynge enfourmed assembled knyghtes sped hym thytherwarde meane wherof worke tyme empeached let xv yere reygne kynge stephan ryuer thamys strongely ouerfrosen horse carte passed ouer vppon yse xvi yere ranulphe erle chester dyed surnamed gercyous iiii erle conqueste sonne hughe erle hym great strength vertue yere wytnessyth guydo dyed geffrey plantagenet husband molde empresse whose deth henry short mantell son sayde geffrey molde made duke angeous normandye yeres maryed elyanour doughter erle poytow whych elyanour maryed vnto lewys kynge frauce hym deuorced nerenes blood hadde receyued ii doughters named mary alys wytnessyth frenche cronycle henry erle angeous fader duke normandy mother erle poytowse wyfe longe eustace sonne kynge stephan wyth ayde frenche kyng warred vppon henry duke normandye whyche wryters ymagyned stephan father entent let stop hym yt shuld come england clayme enherytaunce duke henry defended hym knyghtly yt sayde eustace wanne therby lytle honour profyte old cronycle sheweth kyng stephan entended haue crowned sayde eustace sonne kyng englande dayes bysshoppes englande refused ye dede comaundement pope xxvii yere kynge layd syege vnto castelles newebery walyngforde warwyke warwell whyche hadde ben kepte empresse frendes tyme departyng vnto daye hoped rescous henry duke normandy ye kynge wan castellys newebery warwell walyngforde defended holder tyl comyng henry duke whyche ende ye sayde yere wyth great armye entred englande fyrste wanne castell malmysburye then yode london wanne towre myche polycy fayre myse stregth suche stuffe vytayle armoure fande therin sent walyngforde done wet towne walyngforde wan holdes kyng stepan wyth power drewe towarde duke fynally meane medyatours thybaude archbyshoppe cauterbury prynces comon peace met nere vnto ye water uryn urn fast laboured haue peace fast laboured haue warre communacacyon peace concluded kynge duke departed kynge yode towarde epyswyche suff duke toke way srewesbury wan castell sayde town then duke wente nothyngham wan towne wherfore soldyours helde castell seynge towne toke tye wyth duke brake vppon nyght fyred town brent great parte therof dyed drowned eustace sonne kynge stephan buried feuersham kent abbay father buylded thybaude archbyshop caunterbury left labour conclude ye peace betwene ye kyng duke endeuored hym selfe therin dylygently wyth assystence yere folowynge peace cocluded vppon dyurese condycyons wherof one ye kyng shulde contynue kynge durynge lyfe immedyatly ye conclusion peace sayd henry shuld proclaymed chefe cytyes townes englande heyr apparant kynge deth sayde stephan kynge shulde take hym hys son adopcyon ryghtefull heyr vnto crowne whyche couenautes iustly holden ye kyng fyrste sworne lordes spyrytuall temporall yode bothe london royally receyued ye kyng fested duke gyuen hym ryche gyftes toke leue kynge returned normandye affyrmeth sayde authour floure historyes howe yt cronycle england sayth accorde made vpon dyuysyon lande betwene theym meane shuld reygne gyther eyther enioye halfe lande dyuysyon made whych parte lande eueryche shulde hold mecion therof made former accorde shuld abue sayde concluded viii day folowynge epyphanye lorde towne oxenford ye kyng dyed moneth october folowyng reygned xviii yeres full odde monethes enterred theforsayde abbay feuyrsham dyuers authours
