ranulfe yt recorded thys stephan lyued great vexacyon trouble terme hys reygne sayde also thys stephan maryed molde mawde doughter mary whyche doughter henry fyrst countesse boloyne whome claymed tytle crowned yonger doughter henry fyrst henry shorte mantell claymed elder certenty wryters stephan sonne eustace erle boloyne mary syster vnto molde maryed vnto henry fyrste whych molde mary doughters margarete wife malcolyn kyng scottes whyche margaret syster edgare ethelynge doughter edwarde outlawe sonne edmunde ironsyde eldest syster molde bare molde empresse henry fyrste molde ye empresse doughter henry fyrst hadde second husbande geffrey plantagenet henry seconde henry shorte mantell henry seconde returneth bloode saxon crowne englande dyd stephan moste conuenyently henry fyrst dyssent mother whych reason yt foloweth blood willyam conquerour continued lxx yeres yf accompted ye fyrst yere wyllyam conquerour vnto laste yere henry fyrste thys kynge stephan request molde hys wyfe buylded yere grace xi hundred xl ye abbey coggeshale essex set therin whyte mukes also tyme founded abbay feuersham kent nowe corporally resteth thyrde founded furneys lancashyre garnyshed wyth munkys cysteaux order dyed sayde wythout yssue body francia ccxxxiiii chapiter lewys viii name son lewys ye great began reygn ouer frenche men ye yere lord xi hundred xxxvi ye fyrst yere stephan kyng englande also called yonger lewys whose begynnynge iohannes de teporibus dyed thys iohn somtyme squyer house charlys conquerour whyche lyued ouer iii hundred yeres whyche cause named iohn tyme yt myght remeber thinges done longe tyme passed lewys ye tyme father deth countrey guyan receyue dower wyfe elyanour storye seconde chapyter kyng stephan touched harde ye deth father sped hym frauce necessaryes weale realme ordeyned maryed wyues syster named alys vnto arnolde erle uermendoze whyche maryage solempnysed tydynges broughte vnto hym crysten people beynge holy lande warryours vppon turkes sarasyns dystressed ouerthrowen dyuerse stronge holdes taken wonne wherfore exhortacyon holy muke bernarde whych day called saynt bernard ye sayd lewys wyth also conradus iii name emperour almayne wyth alphon kynge spayne wyth dyuerse noble fraunce prouynces toke vpon crosse prouyded expedycyon iourney iiii yere hys reygne wryters takyng hys iourney dyuers writer holde diuers oppinyons doute resteth betwene yere lord xi hundred xl yere xi hundred l thynges redy iourney kynge quene wyth floure chyualry frauce set forthwarde vppon iourney came processe tyme vnto constantyn noble met wyth conradus emperour alphons kynge spayne prynce emanuell emperour constantyne noble receyued ioyusly made theym outwarde contenaunce louynge frendely chere promised vnto theym ayde iourney bothe vitayll also guydes nexte surest waye contrary promyse dyd dysapoynte theym nothynge ayded theym delyueryd vnto theym meale myngeled wyth lyme wherof grewe myche harme crysten hoste also assygned vnto suche guydes brought place coutreys sterylyte daunger hastely frenche kyng wyth great dyffyculte losse men came vnto citye dana becleped yt stronge syege whych assauted enpayred sore lykely haue wonne yt yf assauted ye place styll began counsayll false crysten men whyche wytnesseth peter dysroye taken mede turkes kynge theyr counsayll remoued ordynaunce weker place vnto ye stroger dyuers assautes made kyng conceyued well yt dysceyued cause treason sayth ye foresayde peter erle flaudres dyuerse experymetes saw cytye lyke goten made supplycacyon kynge lordes myghte haue rule cytye suche tyme yt wonne hym grau ted wherof beynge aduertysed dyuerse suryons ye coutrey borne dysdayned straunger shuld lorde theyr enherytaunce condesceded agreed treason mean wherof crysten prynces loste theyr trauell crysten prynces seynge yt thus deluded toke theyr aduyce howe myght contynewe theyr pylgrimage vnto holy citye hierusalem counsayl sourded quykened many opynyons eche contraryous vnto mean wherof emperour dyscontented toke leue frenche kynge returned hys countrey frenche kynge taryed costes yere dyd lytle worthye memory yt vyage frenche boke maketh great longe processe touchynge wynnyng cytye anteoche wyth hys beynge counsayllys kepynge wythin hierusalem thinges rehersed se mater dysagreable wryters also thynke myche therof fayned therfore passe yt ouer howe yt persones suche fablys ben full pleasaunte wherfore suche remytte vnto sayde french cronicle somwhat shall folowe authour gyrald yt wyth testyfyen lewys returne towarde fraunce waxed syke ye long forberyng wife wherfore thaduyce phisycyons also byshops cousayled take wenche wyfe farre hym ye kyng wythstode counseyll sayde hym hadde bene leuer syke dye goddes hande lyue spouse brekyngea kynges chas e offende hys lawes kyng put himselfe mercy god receyued helth shortly also told hym vsed faste euery frydaye brede water famylyers counsayled shulde leue faste wekynge hym selfe fede hundred poore men euery frydaye whyche vnto god shuld myche acceptable answered sayde wold gladly fede many poore men mo fastynge woll breke wythout profyte yt doth vnto soule yt profyteth also right myche body purgacyon reste one daye helpeth myche put superfluyte also yt maketh sharper apetyte lewys retourned fraunce happe yt frenche cronycle made doutefull elyanour hys wyfe deuorced whych hadde receyued ii doughters touched whyche processe tyme folowynge maried vnto henry duke normandy whych maryage new occasyon warre betwene englande fraunce landes poytowe wyth gascoyne guyan lewys claymed former possessyon henry reason maryag ye sayd elyanour heyr sayde landes whyche warre shalbe shewed story ye sayde henry folowyng whyche deuorce thus made kynge lewys maryed yongeste doughter kynge spayne named custaunce dyed fyrst chylde myche kynge lewys hadde none heyr male cousayll barony maryed thyrd wyfe whych yongeste doughter thybaude erle bloys named alys sayde erle dyed left hym iiii sonnes v doughters eldest sonne named henry erle troy seconde named thybaude erle bloys thyrd named stephan erle sancorum sauncorer ye fourth named wyllyam archbysshoppe raynes eldeste doughters duches burgoyne seconde countesse barre thyrde maryed fyrst duke puell knyght named syr william de goer fourth countesse perche fyfte sayd quene frauce whych woman garnyshed wyth many vertues storye declareth ccxxxv chapiter processe tyme solemnisacyon maryage complaynte brought kynge erles cleremout puy puyll sonne duke rehersyd erle plomet shuld spoyle wast chyrches landes sayde chyrches belongynge dedys kynge commaunded sayd iii erlys warde warre shedynge blood subduynge ye sayd thre erlys knyght great man myght called wyllyam ye erle chalon wyth company tyrauntes assembled robbe spoyle chyrche saynte peter cluny burgoyne wherof herynge prestes mynysters chyrche entent mytygate appeace cruelty sayde tyrautes dyd vpon ornamentes ye sayd chyrche yode agayne processyon wyth great companye folowynge people towne countrey peseable charytable wyse sayde tyrauntes approched vnto sayde copany compassyon pyty turkes ranne vppon crysten men wyth lesse pytye ranne vppon prestes spoyled sayde ornametes slew copany nomber v hu dred mo spoyled sayde chyrche suche stuffe therin lefte longe kynge lewys wyttynge cruell dede wherfore auengynge chyrche gatheryd conuenyent power spedde hym thyther sayde wyllyam erle chalon herynge kynges comynge fled ye coutrey yt kyng myght haue certayne knowlege became wherfore kyng entred seased landes gaue moyty therof ye duke burgoyn chefe lorde soyle halfe gaue vnto erle neuers whose auncetry tyme passed sayd moyty apperteyned done commaunded inquyry made accessaryes prebensons prebendars whyche punyshed dyuerse maner tormentes dethes great contentacyon countrey kynge hadde thus fynished vyage returned fraunce soon knowlege brought vnto burgonyons men towne uerdeley rebelled agayne hed chyrch abbay towne entedyd haue done vylany abbot munkes wherfore kynge spedde hym thyther haste theyr sauergarde munkes compelled fortyfye chyrche defende force army betwene burgonions many arbalaster stone shot cast kynge myght hastly furnyshe hym soldyours therfore sent vnto erle neuers whose meane kyng shewed ryot began commaundynge hym shuld se ryot appeased chyrch uerdeley restored suche harmys theym done inhabytauntes towne thys co maundement erle set lytle burgeses perseuered theyr erroure wherfore abbot sente agayne kynge besechyng hym moste gracyouse ayde socoure kynge herynge erles dysobedyence therwyth greatly dyspleasyd suspected ye erle partye cause sped hym ye faster thetherwarde erle enfourmed kynges comynge somdeale feryd mette wyth kynge place called moret demeaned hym suche wyse kyng forgaue offense promysed kynges pleasure shulde fullfylled thynge hadde comaunded wyth yt lyked hym dyuyse uppon whych promyse made commaunded burgonyons shulde fyrste refrayne theym rebellyon agayn chyrch shuld newly sworne obedient vnto abbot vnto hys successours theyr pdecessours ben ouer hurtes harmys yt done place season shulde paye sayde abbot couet lx thousand sou sou value sterlyng money id ob lx thousand sou amounteth sterlyng money iii hundred lxxv pounde whych ende thus made kynge retourned fraunce longe ye kyng receyued quene alys hys wyfe sonne named yt phylyppe ye kyng lewys made many pylgrymages vsed many way charyte gyuynge almes otherwyse haue sonne heyre therfore surnamed chylde dieu done chyld gyuen god thys lewys intollerable dedes iewes whiche dayes great inhabytynge wyth lande frauce vsed vsery sleynge crysten chyldren ponyshed many deth many banyshed lande yet many remayned lewys dedes lytle cronacled excepte son philyppe age xiii yeres fader caused hym crowned resygned hym rule lande dyed yere folowynge parys moneth october yere grace xi hudred lxxix whyche reason reygned reken faders deth owne vppon xliii yeres rychely enterred ye meane last wife monastery barbell whyche founded hys yonge day whose deth ye sayd quene alys adorned sepulture moste rychest maner wyth gold syluer precyous gemmys vppon whose tombe grauen two versis folowyng counsayll left vnto sonne phylyppe superos tu qui super e successor honoris degener e si degeneris laude prioris whyche versys vnderstanden foloweth nowe take good hede thou doest ouer lyue hym honoure vertue dyd excelle se thou alter thy selfe depryue folowe hym honoure well yf thou men shall tell thou arte degenerate growen kynde thy progenytours laude hauynge nothynge mynde anglia ccxxxvi chapiter henry second named sonne geffrey platagenet erle angeou molde ye empresse doughter henry ye first began hys reygn ouer realme england moneth october yere lorde god xi hundred lv ye xix yere lewys viii kynge fraunce thys henry somdeale redde face brode breste shorte body therwyth fatte whych aswage toke lesse mete drynkes exercysed myche huntynge resonable speche well lettered orped also noble knyghthode wyse counsayll dred myche distenyes also free lyberall straugers harde holdynge hys famylyers seruauntes whome loued enterely hated harde turne hym contrary slowe answere vnstedfaste promyse gylefull dede open spouse breker hamour holy chyrch alwayes vnkynde god also loued reste peace ende myghte folowe hys delectacyon pleasure wyth mo vyces rehersed gyralde whyche length passe ouer henry yet wytnessyth ranulfe bareyn vertues gret courageousnes wolde often say world suffysyth coragyous harte encreasyd hys herytage myghtyly wanne irlande strength toke wyllyam kynge scottes ioyned kyngdome owne suthe occean north ylandes orkeys closed landes yt vnder one pryncypate spradde largely hys empyre men rede none hys progenytours hadde many prouynces countreys vnder theyr domynyon rule besyde realme englande hadde hys rule normandy gascoyn guyan angeou chynon made subiecte hym aluerne landes hys wyfe obteyned ryghte mountes hyllys spayne called monte pyrany whyche wyfe elynoure name deuorced y sayde viii lewys kynge fraunce receyued vi sonnes thre doughters sonnes fyue named wyllyam henry rycharde godfrey iohn eldeste maydens hight molde maude maryed duke saxon seconde elyanoure kynge spayne thyrd named iane wyllyam kynge scycyle thys henry prosperouse hys begynnynge vnfortunate hys ende specyally last fyue yeres hys reygne fyrst fyue yeres strength beganne mynyshe seconde yere loste vyage irlande thyrde loste aluerne agayne kynge fraunce fourth yere loste butyrycan fyfte yere loste cytye cenomenea turon wyth many holdes theym belongynge thys henry seconde ascertayned deth stephan spedde hym englande crowned sondaye crystemasse daye theobalde archbyshoppe caunterbury westmynster chyrch fyrste yere hys reygne subdued irlande soone thomas beketh whyche byshoppe caunterbury made chaunceller englonde kynge caste downe dyuers castellys tyme kynge stephan buylded dyspleasure owner ellys fere shulde strengthed agayne hym also banyshed many lordes gentylmen kynge stephan hadde hys fauoure aboute thyrde yere hys reygne moneth october sene fyrmament two sunnys mone sene redde crosse thys wonder sheweth authoure cronica cronicaru sayth aboute thys tyme italy moneth nouember appered thre sunnys space thre owres weste yere folowynge appered thre monys whereof myddle mone hadde redde crosse ouerthwarte face whyche y noted prodygy token scysme fell amonges cardinallys eleccyon pope alexader thyrd whyche scysme meane fyrste frederyke emperoure endured almoste xx yeres also aboute tyme adryan fourthe name pope englysheman borne towne saynte albon whome declared begynnynge xxii chapyter vii boke polycronycon also thys yere kynge wente wyth stronge armye walys hadde sette countrey order quyet buyldyd stronge castell rutlande founded abbaye basyngewerke vi yere hys reygne thys henry maryed hys seconde son henry vnto kynges doughter frauce meane lewys viii whyche sayde lewys receyued hys seconde wyfe named constaunce doughter kyng spayne ye haue harde seconde chapyter ye story sayd lewys mayden named margaret reason whych maryage appeased warre begonne betwene fraunce englande landes poy owe whyche kynge henry helde reason hys wyfe ye whych warre mych harme done wolde haue ensued yf yt hadde thys meane haue ben agreed vii yere reygn theobalde archbyshoppe caunterbury dyed thomas beket chaunceller englande archebysshoppe hym whome shall folowe yere kyng henry stronge hoste yode scotlande made cruell warre vppon willyam kynge lande lastely taken dyd sayd henry recompensacyon yeldynge vnto hym cytye carlell castell bamburghe newe castell vpon tyne wyth dyuers holdes great parte northumberlande whyche hadde wonne borderer fewtye homage done sayde wyllyam vnto kynge certayne summe money hym promysed wythin ix monethes folowynge kynge suffred hym go large authour sayth kynge scottys taken strongely besyeged towne castell fynally forced agree foresayde couenauntes viii yere cytye cau terburye fyred neglygence great part therof brente season archbyshoppe thomas beganne replye agayne ye kynges mynde thynges kynge dyd exercyse agayn liberty chyrche ccxxxvii chapiter ix yere hys reygne kynge dyuerse cause cocernyng ye nedes realme called parliament hys towne northampton durynge whyche parlyament dyssencyon fell betwen kynge thomas archbyshop caunterburye dyuerse actes ordinaunces kyng procured passe agayne lybertyes holy chyrch whych thomas gaynstode denyed wherfore kynge toke great dyspleasure thomas myche shortely fayne flee lande processe tyme spedde hym rome complayned hym alexaunder iii name pope contynued fraunce place poore estate terme vi yeres kynge henry hadde certayne vnderstandynge thomas thus departed hys lande seased maners temporall landes hys hande hys mouable goodes spoyled rauenyd amonge kynges offycers xiiii yere reygne kynge crowned henry hys eldest sonne lyuynge kynge englande westmynster whyche done derogacyon harme archbyshoppe thomas yt wytnessyd hys legende doynge roger archbyshoppe yorke whyche crowned hym accursed authour sayth kynge crowned henry hys sonne ende myght haue ful power authoryte rule thys lande people whyle hys father occupyed normandye countreys hys landes laye myche thys season thys blessyd man thomas thus banyshed lande kynge sente ouer byshoppes proctours complayne vppon hym pope well nere bishoppes englande agayne hym yf toke hys parte durste speke displeasure theyr temporall lorde blessed man defended quarell chyrche alone xvi yere ye reygne kyng henry lewys kynge frauce agreed kynge henry archbysshoppe kynge beynge normandye uppon whyche agrement thys blessyd man came hys owne chyrche caunterbury restynge hym sente persones spoyled taken perforce goodes chyrche aduertysynge theym fayre meanes restore sayde goodes reconcyled chyrche trewe crysten men shulde sawe myght reconcyle theym fayre meanes vsed compulsaryes denounced accursed restored goodes chyrche certayne day wherewyth partyes beynge agreued sayled ouer kynge normandye shewyd vnto hym greuous complayntes greuouse cause mater requyred whych kynge hadde yet quenched bronde malyce hys harte whyche bare agayne thys holy man gaue lyght credence vnto complayntes sore feruetly amoued agayne holy man thomas myche vppon daye herynge complayntes blessyd mannes aduersaryes sayd oppe audyence hys knyghtes yf good knyghtes hym ben adueged traytour longe tyme tyme whyche wordes vtterynge present syr wyllyam bryton syr hugh moruyle syr wyllyam tracy syr regnolde fytz urle whych foure knyghtes thynkyng shuld theyr mayster synguler pleasure yf slewe thys blessyd man hastely takynge aduyse eche one wyll mynde toke shyppyng sayled douer haste spedde theym vnto caunterburye v daye cristmasse executed theyr tyrannye martyred blessyd archebysshoppe aulter sayne benet wythin hys owne chyrche yere lordes incarnacyon thousande hundred lxx yt y wytnessyd versys folowyng anno milleno centeno septuageno anglorum prima corruit ense thomas whych vnderstande vulgare thus pthe yere reken crystes incarnacyon thousande hundred seuentye therunto prymate englande wyth great abomynacyon slayne wyth sworde thomas wolde kynges hest whyche erred ryghte fro chyrche lybertyes wherby honoure wanne perpetuall fame cruell dede thus foure knyghtes done wherwyth kynge wryters contented kynges fortune beganne decreace fall hadde thys many aduersyteys knewe lyke trouble xvii yere reygne kynge made iourney irland wyth great trauayle subdued iryshe wyth helpe prymate byshoppe arnache refourmed maner dweller people countrey thre thynges specyally fyrste rulynge orderynge chyrche curate shuld order theyr dy uyne seruyce mynyster sacramente matrymonye yt englande crysten regyons seconde laye people shuld behaue theym theyr curate wyse shulde paye offer god theyr tythes thyrde makyng theyr testamentes thys ordeyned euery man shulde make hys laste wyll psence neyghbours leste cause yt rede theyr presence fyrste shuld reken ought sette myche hys goodes yf wyfe chyldren resydue hys goodes hys dettys beyng payde deuyded thre partes one wyfe seconde chyldren thyrde spente weale soule yf hadde chyldren halfe hys soule halfe wyfe yf hadde wyfe chyldren dyspose hys goodes hys pleasure returne kynge oute irlande wonder thynge shewed vnto hym vppon whytesondaye whyche calender called dominica albys whe kyng shuld take horse sodeynly appered vnto hym man pale wanne colour barefote whyte kyrtell whyche bodely spake vnto kynge langage duche sayde syr kynge criste greetyth wele hys mylde moder mary also iohn baptyst peter commaunde streyghtly markettes seruyle workes holden vppon sondaye landes thy lordeshyppe oute take longeth dressynge mete yf thou thys byddynge assure thynge thou begynnest good entent good purpose thou shalt bryng yt good ende kynge lyked nothynge thys speche sayd knyghte helde hys brydell aske thys chorle whether haue dremed thys telleth wherunto thys man answered whyther haue mette thys tale dreme take thou hede well saynge thou haue aduertysed amende thy lyfe thou shalte shortely suche thynges thou shalte heuy fore thy lyues ende kyng toke game man vanyshed sodeynly kyng knyghtes wonderyd hys departynge wherof kynge warned hys fyrste sodeynly apperynge hys departynge kynge sette yt nere hys mynde entendyd thynges mannys counsayll yt yt forwarde blessed man thomas martyred munkes assent kynge chase rycharde pryour douer whyche man euyll lyuynge wasted goodes ye chyrch inordynatly ccxxxviii chapiter aboute xx yere kynges reygne purchased dyspensacyon vyage hadde solempnely auowed ii cardynallys go holy lande ieoperde hys proper persone agaynst crystes enymyes whyche dyspensacyon grauntyd vppon one condycyon shulde buylde thre abbays englande fulfyllynge wherof kynge put oute howse waltham seculer chanons set theyr stede chanons reguler seconde auoyded munkes oute house aumbrysbury sette menchons hadde brought beyonde see thyrde renewed coursely charter house wytham besyde salysburye whyche thre dedes thought hym selfe excused hys former promyse beganne sonnes make warre vppon hym whyche ayded scottyshe kynge two erles chester lyncolne cause whyche warre declaracyon wryters myche kynge hadde emprysoned elyanoure hys wyfe kepte wenche rosamounde agayne good order say yt certayne landes normandye whyche ayde frenche kynge rycharde iii sonne byrthe seconde lyuynge wolde haue taken hys father thys warre speketh nothynge frenche cronycle testyfyeth ranulfe innaturall warre endured terme two yeres great dysturbaunce kynge hys realme tyll kynge wyth great deuocyon vysyted graue holy martyr saynte thomas whyche pylgrymage hym fynysshed shorte processe wyllyam kynge scottes two forenamed erlys chester lyncolne taken castell anwyke yet lefte company forenamed rosamunde whych wenche hadde made house wonder workyng creature man woman myghte wynne yf instructe kynge suche ryght secrete hym touchynge mater thys house wryters named labyrinthus dedalus worke house whyche y meane moste exposytours howse wroughte lyke vnto knot garden called mase common fame telleth lastely quene wan clew threde sylke delte wyth suche maner lyued longe maner deth spekyth nothynge myne authoure dede buryed howse monasterye goddestow besyde oxenforde versys vppon toumbe hic iacet tuba rosa mudi sed rosa muda non redolet sed olet quae redolere solet whythe versys vnderstandynge may thus folowyth englyshed expowned rose worlde clene floure grauen bewtye lent thys graue full darke nowe y bowre lyfe swete redolent yt fro lyfeblente though swete nowe fowly doth stynke myrrour good thynke longe tyme deth sayde rosamounde sayde abbaye shewed cofer sayd wench length two fote whych apperyd fyghtynge geautes stertlynge bestes swymmynge fyshes flyenge fowlys forsayde xx yere opynyon guydo kynge seconde monicyon mendynge hys lyfe iryshe man yt told vnto hym many secret token whyche kynge supposyd man knowen hym selfe yet kynge toke lytell hede therunto xxii yere reygne forsayde takynge ye scottyshe kynge ii erlys xi day septeber wyllyam kynge scottys assent lordes spyrytuall temporall dyd homage kyng henry hys cytye yorke sayde wyllyam graunted hys letter patentys successours kynges scotland shuld make theyr homage fydelyte vnto kynges englande often shalbe necessaryly requyred sygne token subieccyon kyng scottes offered hys hatte sadell vppon aulter saint peter ye chyrch york whyche remembraunce dede sayd hat sadell kepte many yeres ouer yt lordes scotland swore theyr kynge tyme wold wythdrawe hym allegeaunce wold aryse agayn hym hym enymyes tyll returned fayth kepyng promyse stregth sayd coposycyon kynge scottis came ye kyng henry parlyament holden northapton nother season normandye ranulfe munke chester sayth lewys viii name kynge fraunce delyueryd vnto kynge henry doughter hys haue guydynge haue ben maryed vnto rycharde hys son whyche deth rosamoude defloured vyrgynyte whyche dede affermyth sayde authoure kynge wyll haue wedded damoysell expedicyon wherof made great meanes ta hugucia cardynall beynge land wold make dyuorce betwene hym elyanoure quene thys dyd ende haue fauoure frenchemen theyr ayde myghte better dysheryte hys sonnes fayled purpose also yt turned hys owne harme mean caused sayde rycharde hys sonne shewe hys demeanour vnto frenche kynge hys informacyon vnkyndnesse kyndled betwene two therof ensued mortall warre sayth englyshe cronycle also polycronycon thys warre speketh nothynge frenche cronycle none durynge lyfe sayd lewys daye dyed xxiiii yere thys henry warre betwen two kynges england fraunce betwene thys henry phylyppe sonne thys lewys shalbe shewed xxiiii yere thys kyng wytnessen dyuerse wryters fell wonderfull wederynge tempest thunder myddewynter tyme hampshyre place violence wherof preste amonges slayn somer folowynge mary magdalene tyde fell hayle suche bygnesse yt yt slew men bestes tyme bonys kynge arture wyfe gueynour founde vale aualon whose hed sayde gweynour hole freshe coloure soone yt touched yt fell powder whyche bonys translated buryed wythin chyrche glastenburye founden synger gestis vnder holow oke xv fote wythin grounde whyche fyndynge translatynge obiecte ye fantastycall sayeng walshemen afferme hys commynge agayne reygne dyd hadde kynge henry seconde monycyon knyghte called syr wyllyam chesterby lyndesey whyche warned hym specyally reformacyon vii artycles fyrste shuld sette better dylygence defence holy chyrche maynteynynge seconde shulde se hys lawes executed wyth better iustice day vsed thyrd shuld surmyse mater agayn ryche men mean plucke theyr landes goodes fourth shulde restore suche landes goodes gotten suche vnlawfull meanes fyfte shuld medetarye ryghtfull sentence suffer ryght haue hys processe vi shulde se payment hys subiectes suche stuffe dayly taken vse also payment hys seruauntes souldyours wage whych dayly fell robbynge defaute vii laste shulde haste voyde iewys hys lande whyche dayly wrought great sorowe common leue theym somwhat spende theyr iourney toke monycyons toke thys cotynued hys lyfe hadde done ccxxxix chapiter xxviii yere reygn moste writer dyed henry eldeste sonne lyuynge ye whych sayde crowned derogacyon martyr saynte thomas thys yere whyche shulde iiii yere phylyppe seconde phylyppe surnamed gyuen god warre beganne betwene kynge henry hym wherof occasyon testyfyeth sayd frenche cronycle denyenge deferrynge homage shuld done sayde phylyppe rycharde eldest sonne kyng henry lades poytow cause also certayne couenauntes stablyshed enrolled betwene kynge henry lewys father thys phylyp maryage henry sonne margarete syster phylyppe certayne holdes castellys wherof ye castell gysours one whych delyueryd dower wyth sayde margarete vppon condycyon yf sayde henry hadde yssue ye sayde margarete sayde castellys remayne sayde heyres yf sayde yonge henry dyed without yssue ye sayde margarete sayde castellys holdes reuerted vnto crowne fraunce kynge henry denyed deferred two poyntes wold answere called frenche kynge therfore entred land barry wyth great strength wasted countrey guyan wythout mercy wherof kynge henry beynge warned haste assembled hys people beynge normandye ew hym towarde frenche kynge whyche hadde layde syege vnto castell called frenche raoull castell roaull hostes nere lykely haue ioyned medyatours sente vppon bothe partyes treate peace meane wherof processe trewce taken certayne terme eyther hoste departed wythoute strykynge stroke season thys tyme dyed rycharde archebyshoppe caunterbury hym yt redde voyce vysyon shewed hym saynge hym mouthe cryste thou haste wasted goodes chyrch shal rote ye erthe wordes frayd dyed shortly baldewyn byshoppe worceter admytted see though munkys caunterburye wythsayde yt wyth theyr power xxx yere kynge heraclius patryarke hierusalem came england haue ayde agayne sarazyns wonne great parte landes cristen men holy lande defende holy cytye whyche saladyne prynce surey wonne shortely reporte peter dysroy whyche made boke frenche wynnynge losynge sayde cytye yt appereth yt wone godfrey de bulyon yere crystes incarnacyon thousande lxxx xix cotynued vnder rule ix crysten kynges tyll laste kynge named guyde lesyngham lesynguam loste yt wyth holy crosse yere lorde xi hundred lxxx ix whych maketh yere reygn thys kyng henry xxxiiii yt foloweth story heraclius made besy request vnto kynge ayde profered hym key cytye lordes graue letter luci ye thyrd yt name pope chargyng shuld take vppon hym ye iourney haue mynde othe yt time made kyng deferred answere baldwyne archbyshop preached exhorted men take ye crosse whose meanes many ye auowed iourney lastely kynge gaue answere sayde myghte leue hys lande wythoute kepynge yet leue yt praye robbory frenchemen wolde gyue largely hys owne suche wolde take vppon theym vyage wyth thys answere patryarke dyscontent sayde seke man money welnere euery crysten regyon sendyth vnto v money lande sendyth v prynce therfore aske prynce nedeth money money nedeth prynce kynge layde hym suche excuse patryarke departed hym dyscontentyd comfortelesse wherof kynge beynge aduertysed entendynge somwhat recomforte hym wyth pleasaunte wordes folowed hym vnto see syde kynge thought satysfye hym wyth hys fayre speche patryarke dyscontented myche laste sayde vnto hym hytherto thou haste reygned gloryously thou shalt forsaken yt thou thys tyme forsakeste thynke hym hath gyuen thou haste yelden hym agayne howe fyrste thou false vnto kyng fraunce slewe holy man thomas caunterburye lastely thou forsakeste proteccyon crystes fayth kyng amoued wyth wordes sayde vnto patriarke though men lande one bodye spake wyth one mouth durste speke wordys wonder sayde patryarke loue thyne y meane loue thy goodes temporall fere losse promocyon loue thy soule hadde sayde offeryd hys hedde kynge sayenge ryghte thou dyddest blessyd man thomas caunterburye hadde leuer slayne ye sarasyns thou arte worse sarasyn thy people folowyth praye man kynge kepte hys pacyence sayde maye wende oute lande myne owne sonnes wyll arryse agayne absenta pacyet man wonder sayde patryarke deuyll come deuyll shall departyd kynge great ire patryarke thus departyd kynge sente john seconde sonne irlande whyche vyage spente kynge great goody dyd lytle profyte none xxxi yere kynge henry iewes crucyfyed chylde towne burye suff named robert whome god shewyd many myracles xxxii yere kynge made vyage irlande redresse thynges oute order fortune hym contrarye loste hys trauayle lyke yere hys sonne iohn done xxxiii yere thys kynge henry dunstable ayre sene crucyfyxe cryste nayled theron whyche apperyd vysybly many mannys syghte thys yere kynge loste countrey aluerne hadde spente great goodes aboute defence howe yt warre speketh nothynge frenche cronycle ccxi chapiter xxxiiii yere kynge rycharde erle poytowe arrered warre agayn king henry hys father toke party frenche kynge meane whyche warre suche summys money gatheryd dymys otherwyse helpynge croysye made holy lande sayde rycharde many noble lande spente innaturall warre wherfore kynge sayled normandy stroge armye kynge landed sayde rycharde helpe frenchemen hadde wonne cytyes towres meaus also castellys raoull gysours wyth laste frenche kyng phylyppe second wyth sayde rycharde came vnto cytye cenomanna entendyng laye syege vnto wherof kynge henry beynge warned sette suburbes fyre bycause hys enmyes shuld haue socour flame fyre wynde dryuen cytye sharpely kyng compelled forsake yt wherwyth ye kynge amoued hys departynge cytye sayde wordes thou haste taken thys daye cytye moste loued worlde shall acquyte thys tyme shall bynome thynge yt shuld haue pleased whych y myne harte thys loste dayly hys enymyes preuayled strongely agayne hym rede hym shulde great deale thys warre hastely shuld put hym kynge fraunces mercy honoure hys crowne reserued doutefull credece sure yf frenche kyng suche auauntage hym yt shulde haue fallen throughe boke haue ben regystred moste auauntynge maner frenche cronycle touched word lyke mater trowth yt y fortune contrary wyse wyth anger impacyence fell feuer wherof lastely dyed castell conomeus chynon normandye moneth iuly reygned xxxiiii yeres viii monethes wyth oddes dayes buryed fount ebrade wyth thys epytaphy vppon tombe sufficit hic tumulus cui non sufficerat orbis re breuis est ampla cui fuit ampla breuis rex henricus eram mihi plurima regna subegi multiplici que modo dux que come que sui cui satis ad votum non essent omnia terrae climita terrae modo sufficit octo pedun qui legis haec pensa discrimina mortis humanae speculum conditionis habe quod petis instante operare bonum quia mundus transit inca tos mors inopina rapit whyche versys thus myche meane sentence psuffysyth nowe graue erthly thynge syffysyd mynde hyghe sette tyme shorte name wyde dyd sprynge whyche fame deth shortenesse fette kynge henry called man thought bette whose mynde sometyme erth suffysed viii fote ground hath bodye comprysed thou thys redest parell deth thou mayste beholde course euery wyght erthely wherfore prouyde se thou well maye shortely yt tyght defer tyme ascertayne ryght world transytory vnwarely men taketh cruell deth whome non estate escapeth gerardus cambrens whyche hys boke dystynccyons sette oute lyfe thys henry sayth dredefull yt allege agayne hym maye putte man oute lande descrybe hym wyth many wordes may exyle man wyth one worde wherfore yt notable dede tell sothe prynces dedys offende prynce meane yet prynce y passed gone men wyll talke without fere tyme spared fere folow sooth kyng henry noryshed stryfe amonge hys chyldern wyth dylygece hopyng therby lyue hym selfe reste men wolde aske hym wolde leue great dedes vsed answere worlde shulde fayle courageouse harte shulde sease great dedes pereles chyualry warre lecherye wedded elyanoure wyfe lewys kynge fraunce contrary commaundement hys father hadde shewed hym hadde lyen sayde kynges stewarde reygned xxvi yeres somdeale hys wordely blysse foure yeres somwhat hys payne laste fyue yeres hys great troweble sorow farthermore sayd gerarde descryueth progenye thys henry whyche ouer passe yt common rycharde hys sonne wolde often tell wonder vsed saye meruayle though greued peple comon kynd ye deuyll came dyuyll shall y also redde thys henry chaumber wyndesore caused paynted egle wyth foure byrdes wherof thre theym rased bodye olde egle fourth cratchynge olde eglys eyen questyon asked hym thyng pycture shuld sygnyfye yt answered hym thys olde egle sayde selfe iiii eglys betoken foure sonnes whyche sease pursue deth specyally yongeste sonne iohn whyche nowe loue moste shall specyally awayte imagen deth francia ccxli chapiter phylyp seconde name surnamed dyeu done gyue god sonne vnto ye viii lewys beganne reygne ouer realme fraunce yere lorde xi hundred lxxix xxiii yere henry seconde kynge englonde whyche sayde phylyppe reygned somwhat tyme lyfe hys father tyme accompted vnto reygne hys father thys fyrst yere hys reygne great enormytyes iewes vsed wythin realme fraunce crucyfyenge chyldren exercysynge theyr detestable vsery due profe made put malefactours dethe auoydynge daunger exyled put clere hys realme phylyp also story henry seconde towched excyted sonnes sayde henry make warre vppon theyr father whyche meane thys phylyppe gate many holdes townes sayde henry wythin hys duchy guyon deth henry thys phylyppe gaue ouer sayde holdes townes vnto rycharde eldeste sonne sayde henry receyued hym homage wytnessyth french cronycle sayd rychard token obedyence present coronacion sayd phylyppe ye shall vnderstande kynge englande x yeres yf yt present sayd coronacyon yet duke guyon onely aboute thyrde yere hys reygne eraclius patryarke hierusalem came fraunce requyred ayde thys kynge phylyppe wythstande furye persecucyon whyche saladyne prynce turkes hadde excuted dayly contynued countrey palestina agayne cristen great destruccyon theym vndoyng countrey great ieoperdye losynge holy cytye hierusalem thys kynge assembled great counsayll hys cytye parys sayde eraclius made requeste kynge hadde done henry seconde fraunce yere lorde xi hundred lxxx two englande yere grace xi hundred lxxx vii whyche counsayll holden yt agreed kynge wyth ayde byshoppes spyrytualtye shulde ayde sayde patryarke whyche sette forthe possyble haste reporte peter dysroye whyche made recule lytle boke wynnynge losyng hierusalem mo crysten prynces dryuen tempeste see vnto porte dama vnder coloure fayned trewce taken caste moste parte theym pryson kynge phylyppe hadde thus delyuered patryarke gatheryd hys knyghtes made armye agayne hugh duke burgoyne whyche season tyme hadde beclypped castell uergye wyth stronge syege hadde promysed departe then tyll tyme wonne holde appoytement otherwyse defence rescouse myghte made hadde maned foure castellys towres vnto adioynaunte wyth great strength men army kynge thyder comen wyth hys hoste sayde towrs sone ouertourned ye kynge wyth certayne hys people guy capytayne sayde castell uergy ioyously receyued rendred hym castell became hys lege man wyth sayde hugh beynge ore amoued dyscontented seynge dyspoynted purpose departed then wyth hys ordynaunce people robbed spoyled coutre aboute sparynge nother chyrche howse relygyo cruell greuous maner bysshoppes abbottes partye burgoyne made pyteous request vnto sayd phylyp specyall grace wolde ayde socoure theyr chyrches agayne tyranny sayde duke hugh kynge beynge moued wyth thys pyteous requeste made sharpe warre vppon sayde hugh length wan hym stronge castell named chastelone wyth duke put suche studyall fere forsed seche meanes treaty peace wherof co clusyon shulde paye vnto chyrches hym hurted harmed xxx thousande pownd whyche conclusyon taken surelye sette kynge retorned vnto parys kyng restynge hym certeyne tyme hauynge experyence intollerable foule stench dayly grewe fylthe erthe myre stretes made prouysyon dylygently wyth ayde helpe cytesens whyche hadde londe wythin cytye stretes shortely paued thys tyme whanne cytye thus paued affermen many authours name chaunged lutesse lewcesse vnto parysse ccxlii chapiter vii yere thys kynge phylyp sayth freche boke margarete syster vnto thys phylyp late wyfe vnto henry late deceased eldeste sonne henry seconde kynge day englande maryed vnto belas kynge hungry x yere thys kyng phylyp cytye hierusalem taken saladyne prynce egypte guy de lesyngnan laste crysten kynge cytye wyth holy crosse taken felde whych daye came neuer crysten mennes possessyon thys sorowe heuynesse worde broughte vnto kynge phylyp wyth requeste ayde reskue certeyne cytyes yet rested vnder domynyon crysten tyre tryple antioch wyth small holdes sauegarde wherof many noble fraunce toke vpon crosse duke burgoyn erle flaunders theobalde erle bloyes erle rochfo erle champayne wyth many noble knyghtes whyche lengthe passe ouer also reporte theyr dedys myche cocernyth nothyng mater haue promysed speke iourney also kynge phylyppe enteded haue gone great taskes dymys leuyed oute realme whyche daye called saladynes dymes lette iourney sayth french cronycle rycharde duke guyan father henry seconde made warre vppon frenche kynge touched storye sayd henry duryng whyche warre sayde henry dyed xi yere thys sayde phylyppe thys season tyme iewes whych meane great gyftes agayn purchased theyr dwellynge wythin coutrey frauce wherof wedowe lady mastresse called branous absence kynge toke crysten man surmysed agayne hym felonye murder whyche fauoure sayde lady sayde iewes set crowne thorne vppon sayd crysten mannys hedde scourged hym lastely derysyon crystes relygyon despyte crucyfyed persone wherof kynge enfourmed haste sent sayd coutrey castell brayon surprysed sayde iewys sodaynly none escaped brent nomber lxxx theyr malycyouse abhomynable dede xi yere reygne thys phylyppe dyed isabell quene frauce wyfe woma good fame great vertue xii yere reygne sayth frenche boke thys phylyp toke vppon hym crosse hauynge promyse kyng rychard newly crowned kyng englad kepe company wyth hym iourney kept promyse wherwith thys phylyppe beynge dysconteted sayled layde syege vnto cytye acon acre sayenge varyeth policronica also peter desroy polycronycon sayth kynges englande fraunce hadde made suerty betwen performauce iourney gyther taryed turon fraunce abyde somer tyde spryngynge yere one wyll purpose toke theyr vyage towarde holy lande y wytte one water land mette agayne cecilia freche kynge deted hym sayled sayde cytye acone acre layde hys syege vnto whych pastyme kyng rycharde warred vppon kynge sypres hym wyth land subdued came vnto acon frenche kyng longe lyen syege without gettynge great auauntage enymyes saynge vnto kynge rycharde hadde spared wynnynge towne tyll hys commynge ende commyng myght parteyner well honoure wynnynge vnkyndenesse fell betwene theym hadde woonne sayde towne story kynge rycharde shalbe shewed kyng phylyppe retourned fraunce shortely whych returne sayde phylyppe sykened duke burgoyne dyed kyng phylyppe season soiourned frauce maryed iugebert doughter kynge denmarke whyche maryage sayth ranulfe desyred frenche kynge haue wyth graunted tytle whyche dane vnto crown england wyth also x thousand markes syluer wynne wyth ye sayd ryght tytle yt longe fro hym deuorced cause alyauce gossypred otherwise howe yt processe tyme said iugebert agayn ioyned authoryte pope innocent thyrd name yere grace xii hudred ix yere reygne philyppe xxx sayde iugebert deuorced frome lorde terme xvii yeres theruppon whych tyme season sayd phylyppe maryed doughter phylyppe duke sweuy returned vnto father ccxliii chapiter kynge phylyp dyspleasure whych bare towarde kyng rycharde made sharpe cruell warre vpon norman wan therein dyuerse holdes townes fynally layde syege vnto cytye roan wherof herynge iohn erle huntyngeton erle oxenforde brother kynge rycharde whome frenche boke nameth iohn withoute lande wyth erle arundell noble men spedde hym normandye ayded cytezens soldyours roan testyfyeth freche cronycle french kyng moued wyth warre defence towne passynge fury consyderyng wynter season drewe vppon myght carye awaye gunnes great ordynaunces set vppon fyre wyth great agony departed within thre monethes layde syege vnto castell uernyel whe lyen iii wekes messynger came vnto hym sayde cytye euroux taken norman people therof taken prysoners wherfore haste departed rescued sayd cytye prysoners done retourned foresayde syege assyeged yt strogely lastely yt delyueryd appoyntement thys season kynge rycharde delyueryd handes duke ostryge beganne warre cruell whych passe ouer mych entende shew effecte therof storye kynge rycharde folowynge aboute xviii yere reygn thys phylyppe fell plenty water groude therwith bucked drowned corne frutes reason therof greatly decayed scanted wyse whete shortly xx quarter sterlynge money xx yere reygn phylyppe dyed rycharde kynge england heyre iohn named brother whyche cocluded trewce wyth philyppe certayne yeres storye iohn shall clerely appere soone meanes made kyng phylyp shuld receyue agayne vnto company iugebert hys wyfe renounce mary doughter duke sweuy authours doughter duke bohemy kynge wyth mocyon nothynge contentyd yet agreable folow mocion request wherfore prelasy lande assemled theym counsayll full hole authoryte seynge myghte induce kynge conformyte agrement resume hys lawfull wyfe refuse denounsed hym hys realme accursed wherwith kyng amoued vexed depryued certayne bysshoppes theyr see also toke hys possessyon spyrytuall goodes prysoned many prestes relygyous men ouer closed sayde iugebert wythin castell sampys forthermore greued hys comons wyth greuous exaccyons taxys wythin shorte terme iohn de saynte poule cardynall atha othemon bysshoppe osty legate pope rome wyth archebysshoppe burdeaux commaundement pope innocent thyrde kepte greate counceyle cytye sorsore kynge monysshed apere mych hadde graunted reconcyled vnto hys fyrste wyfe thys mater hynge argument spyrytuall iudges ye space xv dayes wythout sentence gyuynge wherfore kynge beynge wyth delayes dyscontented sodenly wyth hys wyfe departed wythout takynge congye leue sendynge vnderstandyng yet wolde aduysed dysseuered hys wyfe wherof whan sayd iohn cardynall bysshoppes hadde wyttynge accomptynge theyr laboure loste retourned shortely vnto rome shewed vnto pope hadde done soone kyng iohn honorably receyued thys kynge phylyppe story sayd iohn shall playnly shewed yere folowynge shulde begynnynge xxiii yere thys phylyppe dyed mary hys wyfe whyche wrongfully holden cotrary law chyrche terme tenne yeres vppon whyche mary hadde receyued man chylde doughter whyche made legyttymate innocent thyrde though noble men fraunce agayne grudged ccxliiii chapiter longe ye kyng assembled greate people entendyd haue entred landys erle rossell roger de rose whyche hadde broughte hym many greuous complayntes greate extorcyons exaccyos sayd erle roger hadde executed done vppon chyrches nere valey soysons wolde refrayne kynges comaundement wherfore rygged hys armye drewe towarde soone aduertysed kynges comynge anone submytted kynges grace oblygynge selfe make restytucyon accordynge kynges pleasure suche place person hadde offended thys acte thus fynysshed kyng phylyppe returned vnto place bytwene uerdon ile audely whyche place kynge hadde appoynted great counsayle parlyament amonge mater yt concluded iohn kynge englande shulde somoned appere frenche kynges lyege man parlyament holden parys wythin xv dayes ester answere suffycyently kyng vppon questyons shulde purposed vnto hym duchy normandye coutrey aungeou poytyers yt kynge john came day appoynted none hym accordynge monyshement hym gyuen therfore thys kynge philypppe withstandynge amytye trewce confermed assembled hys hoste entred duchye normandye made therin sharpe cruell warre wanne castell therein named bonte bowte brused crased castellys gentylyne gurney seased ye landes whyche hugh de gurney helde gyue theym vnto duke brytayne also gaue vnto hym erledome aungeou two hundred knyghtes prysones norman englyshe wyth great summe money longe duke brytayne departyd kynge wyth suche power myght make entred countrey aungeou take therof possessyon shorte space encountred kynge john fought geder cruell batell whyche ende duke put worse parte hys people slayne hym selfe wyth hugh le bruns godfrey de lesygnan many noble fraunce also brytayne taken prysoners wyth whyche tydynges frenche kyng greuously dyscontentyd tyme becleped ye castell arch wyth strong syege remoued then yode citye towres brent part therof testifyeth frenche cronycle taryed commynge kynge iohn wynter commynge towarde ceasyd hys warrys yere drewe hym fraunce yere folowynge whyche yere phylyp xxiiii kynge iohn iiii yere ye warre newely began whyche ouer passe mych yt shall shewyd storye kynge iohn xxvi yere thys phylyppe almaricus studyent paris held certayne opynyons heresye whyche abiured toke suche thought dyed shortely longe clerkys studyauntys helde erronyous opynyon cocernynge ye vnyon trynyte whyche nomber peter byshoppe parys one garyne man great connynge two whyche degraded cosumyd wyth fyre body forenamed almaricus agayne taken oute erthe brent nere xxx yere reygne thys phylyppe consyderacyon sayth frenche boke iohn kynge englande exylyd dyuerse hys byshoppes taken theyr possessyons goodes whyche kynge phylyp comen ayde socour therfore mouyd pytye assembled great hoste entendyd haue sayled englande haue refourmed mater wyth whyche hoste passed tyll came grauenynge lande appoynted hys nauey mete wyth hym place also ferrande erle flaundres affermely promysyd come wyth ayde hys flemynges kynge hym taryed certayne tyme shortely kynge ascertayned sayde erle alyed wyth kynge iohn hys enymye purposed ayde hys partye myghte wherof occasyon affermeth sayde frenche cronycle myche lewys eldest sonne kynge phylyppe helde sayde farrande two castellys townes named saynte omer kynge phylyppe apperceyued thus erle dyspoynted cousayll baronye putte hys iourney englande assayled countrey flaundres yode vnto cassyle lytell grauelynge wyth sharpe assaute wanne sayd towne then brugys commaunded hys nauy brought vnto haue sluse whyche wythin shorte waye brugys hadde executed hys pleasure brugys leuyng certayn peple strength hys nauy yode vnto gaunte rested hym hys people whyche season regnolde erle boleyne guyllyam longe espe guyllyam wyth longe sworde wyth crewe englyshe men aryued flaundres shortely drewe ferraunde erle wyth great power flemynges whyche shypped theym small caruyles barkes shyppys aduautage wyth fyerse corage sette vppon frenche kynges nauey lyenge sluse shewed foughten stronge cruell batayll ende flemynges hadde vyctorye hadde rule frenche flote whyche nomber testyfyeth sayd frenche cronycle thousande ten sayle whyche nomber greatnesse myghte lye wythin hauyn spradde great parte ryuer besyde whyche lyenge wythout hauen flemynges conueyed then layde ordinaunce towne sluse assyeged yt kynge phylyppe herynge losse hys nauye assautynge towne sluse haste spedde hym thyther suche wyse resysted hys enymyes slew vpon two thousande toke theym dyuerse prysoners rescued towne sawe myght recouer hys shyppes beynge wythin hauyn causyd theym dyscharged vytell necessaryes set fyre towne also done toke certayne hostage brugis gaunte ipre retourned fraunce ccxlv chapiter kynge phylippe returned fraunce yt longe meanes well dysposyd persones reconcyled toke hym lawfull wyfe ingeberta ingebert doughter kynge denmarke whyche great comforte hys people thys yt nowe apperyth sayde ingebert lorde husbande terme xvi yeres yt touched seconde chapyter thys storye yere grace xii hudred xiiii sayth frenche boke whyche maketh yere reygne philyppe xxxv otho iiii name duke saxony whyche electours chosen emperour quarell kyng iohn intred ye prouince henaude beynge accompanyed reygnolde erle boleyne farraunde erle flaundres dyuerse noble well englande saxonye place made prouysyon fyght wyth kynge phylyppe whyche warred flaudres frenche kynge castell peron otho castell ualensyens ualenseus mary madgdaleyns tyde frenche kynge wastyng ye cou trey flaudres came vnto town turney otho returned foresayde castell came vnto castell towne named mortenge whyche vi myle turney wherof herynge kynge entendyd haue set shorte tyme vppon hys enymyes aduyse hys baron letted myche wayes place streyghte narowe towarde hys enymyes whyche consyderacyon counsayll hys sayde barones letted retourned towarde henawde haue larger playnes saynte iamys daye retourned purposynge nyghte haue lyen also hoste castell called lylly letted hys purpose otho whych warned hys remouynge demed hym haue fled pursued vaungarde kynge whyche captaynes vycounte mylyon one named fryer garnye whyche fryer relygyous man man great counsayll hardynesse beynge accompanyed wyth iiii thounsande men rode tyll came hyll lytle mountayne espyed auauntage otho hys hoste wherfore fryer garny retourned gyue kynge knowlege vycounte remayned place houed companye kynge hadde knowlege commynge enymyes good maner kepte hys iourney whyche season otho wyth hys people came vnto ye ryuer somdeale daungerous passe howe yt processe passed yt hoste ouer made waye towarde turney myche uycounte co pany demed haue retourned turney soone fryer garny returned vnto sayde mount anon demed coutrary sayd precysely must gyue batayll theyr enimyes ellys must fle wyth shame thys whyle kynges people came vnto brydge shulde passe ouer cautele hys enymyes kynge wyth parte hys people hadde ben passed brydge wolde haue sette vppon rerewarde haue dystressyd theym haue kepte brydge kynge shulde haue socoured people kynge passed fyght begonne myche hydeous crye came kynges cry army army harneys harnes enymyes come nere vnto kyng chapell halowed honour worshyp saynte peter wherunto kyng yode made hys deuoute prayer done armed hym lepte horse ioyously cryenge baron army oryflambe passed ye brydge countermaunded began trumpettys tabour blowe whyche reuyued palled harte caused theym forgete drede deth kynges people myght hastely retourne passe brydge kynge valyaunt knyghte toke hys horse wyth hys spurrys set forwarde encourage hys knyghtes enymyes herynge hys commynge somdeale dyscoraged gaue place vnto kynges hoste otho herynge kynges retourne enbatayled hys people yt toke northe parte felde reason wherof sonne hys face hys afterdeale excedynge hote ouer batell begonne dyuers partyes felde cruelly many ouerthrowen whyche endured longe space suche wyse harde yt dyscerne whyche partye hadde better eyther prynce enforcyd straytely eyther theym vnhorsed great ieoperdye shulde reherse vyctoryouse dedys frenche kynge hys knyghtes order expressement frenche boke shulde therof make longe storye trouth yt ende otho compelled forsake felde great losse hys people feraunte erle flaunders taken wyth many reygnolde erle boleyn xxviii name one thynge hardely semeth credence gyuen vnto rehersyd frenche cronycle whych sayth frenche hoste myssed one syngle man whyche founde amonge dede almaynes sore wounded cured helyd agayne whyche maye tolde great wonder consyderynge sayde fyghte lasted ouer foure howres testyfyeth sayd cronycle sure authoure wryter ouerseeth hym selfe reporte shewyth dyuysynge fyghte thys batell kynge phylyppe felled hys horse two hys knyghtes slayne ryghte hym one named guyllyam de longe champe gerarde le tirne maister robert gagwyne expressyth thys clerely sayenge felde done emperoure fledde leuynge hys banner splayed egle behynde hym bysshement nomber vii hundred men recoueryd standarde kepte theym gyther wherof kynge enfourmed sente agayne one hys knyghtes called syr thomas ualary accopanyed wyth l fotemen two thousand horse men whych dystressyd ye sayd copany wythout losse one man sayde ouer sayd authour sayth yt vppon partye sayde otho knyghtes gylte harnesse slayne thousande fyue hundred horse men fote men hundred fyfty thousande ye frenche men whych shulde sureste rekenynge maketh mencyon trouth cronycle thoroughe frenche boke rehersed thynge touchynge theyr honour declared shewed vttermoste whyche concerneth theyr dyshonoure losse yt y ouer subtely excused darkely mystly wryten reader therof shall hardely come knowlege trouthe well apparent storyes phylyppe de ualoys kynge john hys sonne expressement theyr faytes done exercysed agayne thyrde edwarde kyng england prynce edwarde hys sonne foloweth ye story whan phylyp hadde obteyned greate vyctory hys enemyes ordered thynges concernynge hys people countermaudynge next waye vnto theyr countrees wyth hys prysoners spedde hym parys hys greate bounte graunted sayde erlys boleyne flaunders theyr lyues prysonement erle boleyne sent vnto castell peron feraunt erle flaunders commytted castell towre louour wythout wally cytye parys tha newly made wythin lesse xv monethes labour wyfe hys lyege men delyuered payenge theyr fynaunces perfourmyng streyght condycyons ccxlvi chapiter longe kynge phylyppe reassembled hys knyghtes spedde hym towarde countrey poytow wherof beynge warned erle thoners chefe ruler countrey vnder kyng iohn seynge feblenesse comons dayly vexed wyth warre also losse kynge john frendes wythstandyng sayd iohn wythin twenty myles yet made suche meanes kynge phylyppe laboure peter duke erle brytayn sayde kynge accepted erle hys grace graunted hym hys trewce iiii yeres wythstandyng kynge kept hys iourney towarde kynge iohn wherof kynge iohn beynge enfourmed also peace bytwene erle thoners frenche kynge meanes one roberte legate rome sought meanes treaty peace processe dylygence sayde robert peace concluded v yeres whyche peace concluded assured eyther kynge returned theyr owne prouynces wythin short whyle ye frenche kyng returned frauce called mynde great vyctory almayns wyth also one whych lewys son ye tyme agayne kynge iohn countre aungeou castell moyne mayne whyche ii vyctoryes kynge edyfyed monastery besyde cyty sayntles honour saynt uyctor endowed wyth fayre ryche possessyons named abbey saynt uyctor xxxvi yere reygne thys phylyppe lewys hys sonne procurynge sturrynge lordes englande sayled sayde prouynces playnely shall shewed xvi yere reygne kynge iohn many mo storyes actes myght brynge set thys story thys kynge phylyppe yf shulde folowe frenche boke maketh rehersayll conteyneth xxxix greate leuys parchemyne whyche haue taken suche semeth moste conuenyent haue ouer passed lengthe tyme foloweth thys phylyp dayes drewe hym quyet reste thys peace trewce cocluded wyth kyng iohn englande authour speketh myndeth noble dede hym done yere lorde xii hundred xxii whyche shulde yere hys reygne xliii sayd authour begynneth sayth foresayd yere apered greate eclypce son wherof lyke hadde ben seen many yeres passed yere folowynge dyed thys phylyppe moneth iunii whan hadde reygned vppon xliiii yeres whose deth apered great comete blasyng starre whyche frenche men wyth also foresayde eclypce adiudged pronostiquys token kynges deth whyche buryed wyth excellent pompe monastery saynt denys yere lorde thousand two hundred xxiii hys age lviii leuynge hym fore named lewys whyche enoynted kyng hym thys phylyppe amonges notable thynges ordeyned hys testament sette aydynge wynnynge holy cytye hierusalem thre hundred thousande pownde parys money hospytall mount forte hundred thousande pownde dystrybuted amonges poore comons hys londe gaue twenty thousande pownde noted great dyuersyte bytwene pownd parys money pownde sterlynge money pownde parys money two shyllynges vi penny sterlynge nere foloweth thousande pownde parys hundred fyue twenty pownde sterlynge whyche accompte foloweth thys kynge gaue ayde holy londe xxxvii thousande fyue hundred pownde sterlynge hospytall xii thousande fyue hundred pownde sterlynge poore people two thousand fyue hundred pownde thus make ende thys volume cause co syderacyon shewed begynnynge nexte volume manyfestely plenuoye prece forth rude volume recomende derest frende experte scyence praye hym leysour ouerse meter prose fyndeth offence congrewe englysshe perfyte sentence humbly hym praye woll correcte whyche hys faytes cyrcumspecte shewe hym forther hys meryt encreace seconde volume y redy hym dyght praye hym woll therfore wyth sursease tyll thy felow haue hys insyght hys scyence brought good plyght reader maye delectable herers frutefull profytable dysdayne malapert rudenesse hys payne shulde thus boldely sende hym wyll suche greate besynesse rude worke correcte amende shew hym sothely entende enhaunce hys prayse grea e laude shall knowe truste wythout frawde pthe seconde volume fabyans cronycle conteynyng cronycles englande fraunce begynnyng reygne king rycharch fyrste vntyll begynnyng reyne moste redoubted souerayne lord kynge henry viii pprentyd london wyllyam rastell cvm privilegio table begynneth table seconde volume whiche denounces sheweth actes done euery kynges dayes conteyned sayde volume euery acte folowes letter nouber ye lefe thys sayd table expressed begynneth wardes london kynge rycharde fyrste whose actes legth thys sayd volume shalbe shewed wyth kinges ensuyng letter sayd table fyrste abc forthe acrys stronge citye holy lad wonne crysten appereth fo iiii actes great cane tartaris folio xxiii abbotte waltham accorded wyth citesyns lodon fo xxviii accorde made betwene kyng henry iii hys baron fo xxxviii actes done hethenes lowys frenche kyng fo xlviii acris acon abouenamed cytye wone agayn turkes fo lxix accorde agrement made bytwene englad scotlad fo xc actes made weryng sylk folio xci actes fraunce done duke lancastre fo ciii actes made frechme occupyeng ye admissio ye enherytour fraunce folio cxxxvii accorde made betwene duke orleaunce burgoyne fo clx accusacyos duke burgoyn agayn duke orleaunce fo clxi accorde made betwene sayde duke folio clxi acte made gyuynge lyuereys folio clxv actes made agayn straungers se folio clxxc actes made halowynge sondaye wythin cytye londo folio cxci abbay bury spoyled fo cxiii adyme graunted kyng hery fyft fo clxxvii quyndecyme grauted king henry iii fo xxi letter deuysed baros sente kyng henry iii fo xxxvii letter sent rychard kynge romayns baros fo xxxvii quarter solde ii folio xc fraye made fletestrete vpo baker seruaunt fo cxlv fray made fletestrete one bottell fo cxcii andrewe trollop dysceyued lordes folio cciii letter sent edward iii vnto kyng fraunce fo xciiii agrement made scottes folio lxiii answere made french kynge kyng edwardes letter fo xcv answere made french kynge kynge henry fo clxxi ambassade sent french kynge englande fo lxxxix ambassade sent agayne sayde kynge folio lxxxix ambassade sent frauce fo lxxxix ambassade sent fro pope fo ccviii parte london brydge fylle thamys fo lxxxix ayde graunted kynge iohan folio cxxiii ayde graunted inhabytauntes countre languedok folio cxxiiii archebysshoppe orleaunce slayne fo lxx archbysshop caunterbury slayne folio cxlii archebysshop caunterbury maketh collacyon folio cliiii archebysshop yorke wyth taken batayle fo clxvii artycles treason layde agayne syr roger mortymer fo lxxxviii artycles peace ratyfyed bytwene kynge edwarde kynge iohn folio cvi artycles dyspleasure shewed wrytynge duke glocester agayne bysshop wynchester folio clxxx archebysshop yorke ouerturneth scottes folio xcix artycles peace concluded bytwen erle flaunders hys subiectes folio cxxxix assembles made lordes fo cxliiii annyuersary honourable fou den poulys chyrche fo cxi auoutry espyed fo ccxiii baron warre began grow xli yere kyng henry thyrde folio xxx baros warre receyued newe kyndeled xliiii yere henry thyrde folio xxxiii baron assembled theyr companyes march wale xlvi yere sayd kynge fo xxxiiii baron entred cytye london folio xxxv baros dyscorded among selfe folio xxxviii baron chasyd xiiii yere edwarde seconde fo lxxix batayle lewys bytwene kynge henry iii baron fo xxxvii batayle called whyte batayle loke xi yere edwarde seconde folio lxxvii batayle burbrydge bytwen king edwarde seconde baros hys xiiii yere fo lxxix batayle cruell agaynste scotte called halydon fo lxxxix batayle swyn sluce vppon see bytwene frenchman edwarde thyrde xv yere hys reygne fo xciii batayle cressey xxi yere edwarde thyrde fo xcviii batayle potyers bytwene kynge edwarde thyrde french kynge folio ciii batayle bytwene kynge phylyp fraunce towne cassile flaunders fo cxvii batayle shrowysbery iii yere henry fourth fo clxvii batayle blak pole vi yere henry iiii fo clxvii batayle agyncourt thyrde yere henry v fo clxxii batayle saynte albons fyrste xxxiii yere henry vi fo cc blore heth felde apperys ye xxxvii yere kynge henry vi fo cciii batayle ludlowe doth appere folio cciii batayle northamton appereth folio cciiii batayle wakefelde apperys batayle sayn albons fo ccv batayle yorke towton shyrborne fo ccvi barnet felde fo ccxix batayle tewkesbury fo ccxx bartra de cleyco warred spayn chasyd kynge fo cix blasynge sterre apperys folio xc fo cxviii fo clix blanke charter v eng fo cli brekyng peace bytwen england fraunce loke xliii yere kynge edwarde iii fo cxi brest stronge towne brytayne besyeged fo cxiii benyuolence fyrste fouded grauted edwarde iiii dayes folio ccxxv bysshop groostehede actes apperyth ye xxxiii yere kyng henry thyrde folio xxvi bysshop exceter beheded apperyth xviii yere edwarde seconde folio lxxxii bysshop norwyche made warre spayne pope comaundement vi yere rycharde seconde folio cxliii bysshop london hath memory cytesyns london fo cxlvii bysshop wynchester lent kyng henry fyfte xx thousand poude folio clxxvii bysshop wynchester foresayd created cardynall folio clxxx bysshop salysbury slayne ende xxviii henry vi playnly shewed fo cxcviii bysshop chychester called reynolde pecok abiured heresye folio ccii boke prophecy founden iewe spayne folio xxiiii blode cryste broughte westmynster kynge henry iii folio xxv bonifacius pope hys codycyons folio lxxi bull pope manyfested poulys crosse folio xxxiii busshe baggot grene theyr actes folio cli brytos resyst ye frenchme fo xxxix charles v name surnamed fayre brother phylyp surnamed longe sonne iiii phylyp began hys reygne ouer realme fraunce yere grace miii hundreth xxii xv yere secod edwarde kynge englande reygned yeres vi folio lxxxiiii cardynalles sent englande pope robbed appereth ix yere edwarde seconde folio lxxvi caen stronge towne normandye besyeged kynge edward thyrde folio xcviii calys besyeged gotten kyng edwarde thyrde folio xcix cardynall sent pope laboured pea folio ciii castell pount yolden vp appoyntement folio cxxv careckes iii taken duke clarence erle kente folio clxvii charyte kynge lewys folio charles de ualoys brother phylyppe le beawe vncle vnto charles v foresayd dyed folio lxxxvi charles de bloys slayne batayle bytwene syr iohn mountforte sayd charlys fo cix charles vi name sonne iohn beganne rule french men yere lorde miiiclxiiii xxxviii yere thyrde edwarde kynge englande reygned yeres xvi folio xxxvi charles vii ye name yonge chylde sonne vi charlys began hys reygne ouer fraunce moneth september yere lorde thousand iii hudreth lxxx thyrde yere secode rycharde kyng englande reygned yeres xlii folio clv charles viii name sonne vnto charles vi sayen frenche authours englysshe wryters sheweth cotrary story thys charles shall appere thys began reygne ouer ye frenchman yere lorde thousande iii hudreth xxii laste yere henry v thenne kynge england reygned yeres xxxvi folio ccvii chauntryes fouded poulys churche london fo cxi cerymonyes coronacyon kynge henry iiii appereth folio clxiii creacyo duke kyng rychard ii fo cxliii clement pope dyspleased myght gyue bysshopryches withi realme englande xviii yere kyng edwarde iii apereth fo xcvi cytezyns london tolle free folio xx cytezyns londn arrested folio xxx clerkes orleaunces wythstande kynge fraunces commaundement fo cxix churche monastery westmynster ended buyldyng apereth fo lviii condycions made boroughmaysters towne burgys agaynst theyr erle fo lxxxvi constable fraunce murdred aduyse charles kyng nauerne fo cxxii constable towre london drowned whose name called syr thomas ramston appereth folio clxviii constantynoble wonne turkys shewed folio cxcix colacyon made archebysshop caunterbury lordes deposycyon kyng rycharde ii folio cliiii conclusyon maryage kynge henry vi fo cxcii condycyons kynge lowys shewed fo ccxxii commynge emperoure fraunce hys honourable receyte folio cxxxvii composycyon made betwene kynge henry syxte duke yorke appereth folio ccv copy letter sent edwarde iii vnto frenche kynge answere made loke folio xcv copy instrument made deposyng kyng rycharde shewed folio cliii copye byll put parlyament house temporaltees shewed fo clxix copy letter sent bysshope wynchester vnto duke bedforde folio clxxxi copy pardon made kyng vnto cytezyns london apereth fo xli correccyon aduoutry shewed folio lxxiii coronacion quene katheryne appereth fo clxxvi course seruyce feest sayd coronacyon fo clxxvi corp kynge henry v great solempnite brought vnto monastery westminster apereth fo clxxi countesse henawde laboured make peace betwene kyng edward thyrd kynge phylyp frauce folio xcv couenauntes betwene regente kynge nauerne expressed shewed folio cxxxi couenauntes maryage betwene kynge henry v frenche kyng beholde fo clxxv crossed treers came fyrste englade iii yere kyng edward ii folio lxxv crucyfix golde belongyng sait denys church fraunce axed kyng monkes ayde folio cxx dame blaunche ayded phylip french kynge appereth folio lii dame elynour cobham arrested treason shewed folio cxci dauyd brother lewyn prynce walys wrought treason shewed fo lvii dauyd aforesayd taken folio lviii daunsynge wonderfull beholde folio lix derthe corne folio lx dede knyght apered one mayster morres walys fo xiii derknesse intollerable fylle paulys churche bysshoppe beynge masse folio xxi deuorce betwene charlys ye french kynge blauche shewed folio lxxxiiii dede corpsys noumbre one yere buryed london fo c depe towne normandy strongly assayled lord talbot folio cxcii denham esquyer toke lorde ryuers sand wyche folio cciiii dyscencyon amonge lordes englande fo xxxii dyscencion fyll amoge lordes normandy fo cxix dyscencion grewe betwene ye freche kynge kynge nauerne folio cxxii dyscencyon fylle amonge frech men cessynge ayde folio cxxiii dyscencyon grewe amonge thre astates realme fraunce folio cxxvi dyuers inconuenyences fyll englande fraunce shewed folio c dyuerse vysyons meruayles sene ayer shewed folio cviii duke ostryche dyed hostage kynge rycharde free delyuered folio ix duke lancaster actes folio ciii duke iohn lacastre made warre fraunce folio cxi duke lancastre passed thorugh fraunce wythoute fyghte folio cxiii duke burgoyn complayneth vppon syr iohn chalous knyghte folio cxviii duke normandy maketh hys oracion cytesyns parys folio cxxviii duke foresayde proclaymed regente fraunce shewed folio cxxx duke lancastre reentred frauce folio cxxxvi duke lacastre warred spayn folio cxlv duke glouceter spake sharpe wordes kyng rycharde secod folio cxlix duke glouceter arested murdered folio cxlix duke herforde northfolke fyll dyscencyon cause shewed folio cl duke lancastre claymed crowne folio cliii duke orleaunce laboured agaist vnyuersyte parys folio clx duke orleaunce slayne folio clx duke orleaunce burgoyn maketh new warre fo clx duke burgoyne slayne folio clxiii duke baron put deth treason folio clxv duke clarence slayn folio clxxvii duke glouceter made protectour englande fyrste yere reygne kynge henry syxte duke bedforde regente fraunce shewed fo clxxix duke bedforde wynneth holdes fraunce se fo clxxx duchesse holad taken prysoner loke fo clxxxi duke alenson delyuered hys raunsom fo clxxxii duke northfolke greate ieopardy drownyng fo clxxxiii duke burgoyne turned englysshe partye ye french partye shewed fo clxxxviii duke burgoyn layde syege calays fo clxxxix duke erles created apereth fo cxciii duke suffolke arrested folio cxcv duke somerset arrested sheweth fo cxcviii duke yorke gathered people apereth fo cxcviii duke yorke dyscharge hys protectourshyp fo cci duke yorke othe attaynted apereth fo cciiii duke bukkyngham many slayne fo cciiii duke yorke taketh kynges royall see fo ccv duke yorke slayn folio ccv duke burgoyne assisteth ye frech kynges sonne agaynst hys father shewed fo ccix duke brytayn conspyred agayne theyr kyng fo ccix duke somerset wyth put deth fo ccxv duke clarence wyth laded dartmouh fo ccxviii duke exceter founde dede see folio ccxxi duke clarence drowned wyne fo ccxxii duke glouceter made protectour fo ccxxiiii duke bukkyngham sheweth tytle kyng rychard fo ccxxv duke glouceter taketh possessyo westmynster appereth folio ccxxv duke bukkyngham cospyreth agaynst kyng rychard taken beheded salysbury fo ccxxv duke orleauce taken batayll shewed fo ccxxviii duke brytayne dyed whereby great warre foloweth shewed fo ccxxviii edwarde fyrste name sonne henry ye thyrde surnamed edwarde longe shanke began hys reygne ouer england xvii daye nouembre morowe saynt edmond archbisshop yere lorde mcc lxxii ii yere iii phylype kynge fraunce reygned nobly yeres xxxiiii fo lv elyanoure mother kyng richard enlarged fo iiii edmounde crouchbak maried doughter ye erle amnarle apereth fo xliiii edmoud wodstocke wroughte treason fo lxxxviii edward sonne henry foresayd distressed baron shewed folio xxxix edwarde forsayd dystressed baron seconde tyme shewed folio xxxix edwarde holy kyng confessour translated shewed folio xliiii edwarde crossed holy lande hys feates done folio xlv edwarde carnaruan apereth folio lviii edward second called edwarde carnaruan sonne fyrst edwarde began hys domynyon ouer englande moneth iuly yere lorde god miiic vii xxi yere iiii phylyppe philip fayre kynge fraunce reygned yeres full xix fo lxxiiii edwarde fyrst maryed hys ii wyfe frenche kynges syster folio lxv edwarde iii name son edwarde secode dame isabell doughter philippe le beawe iiii phylyp late kyng fraunce whych edwarde aboute age xv yeres began hys reygn ouer realme england xxv daye ianuary yere grace miiic xxvi iiii yere charles fayre tha king frauce whyche reygned yeres li folio lxxxvi edwarde carnaruan myserably slayne shewed fo lxxxvii edwarde bayloll made kynge scottes fo lxxxviii edwarde iii sayled braban wyth hys wyfe loke fo xci edward iii chaleged ye hole kingdome fraunce fo xciii edward eldest son duke yorke electe king englad loke fo ccvi edwarde iiii name eldest sone rychard duke yorke whych proclaymed heyre parat crowne began hys domynyon ouer realme englande iiii day marche ye yere grace miiiiclx ii yere xi lowys kyng frauce reygned tyme viii monethes yeres viii fo ccxiiii edwarde iiii beforenamed wan felde barnet vpon ester daye agayne kyng hery vi yere grace miiiiclxxi yere lowys french kyng aforesayd reygned day x monethes yeres xii fyrste laste reygned ouer vii monethes assygned henry vi dayes xxxvi monethes yeres xxi wyth sayde monethes henry vi set edwardes reygne make xxii yeres odde dayes fo ccxx edwarde v name sonne edward iiii age xiiii yeres lasse began reygne kyng englad x daye apryll yere lord miiiilxxxiii xxxv yere xi lowys tha kyng fraunce reygned tyll xx day iuly next folowyng season passed dayes lxxii folio ccxxiiii elizabeth holy woma doughter kyng hungery fo xxi eleanoure quene progenye loke fo lxi emperoure almayne came england fo clxvii emperour forsayd came agayn thys lande fo clxxii enuye frenchman fo v enguerram put deth folio lxxxiii epytaphye rychard fyrste apereth fo x epytaphye frederyke emperour fo xxv epytaphye edward fyrst loke fo lxviii epytaphye edward iii folio cxvi epytaphye kyng rycharde ii loke fo clxvi erthquake fell englad fo xxv erle penbroke ouerset frenchman fo cxiii expressemet grudge atwene kyng rychard fyrst freche kynge fo iiii eugeny pope hys actes folio clxxxvii false cryst crucyfyed shewed fo xix false clerke oxenforde whych fayned hym selfe madde came wodstocke entedyng haue slayne king henry iii fo xxii faytes actes warre done stable fo xcvi fysshes wonderfull take xxxv yere kyng hery vi fo cci floren golde made kynge edward iii fo xcvii fryer mynors came fyrst englande loke fo xix fryer augustynes xxxv yere kynge hery iii buylded theyr house place walys called wodhous shewed fo xxvi fryer put deth loke folio clix frenche kyng sent hys doughter kynge rychardes wyfe folio clix frech nauy dyscofyted fo clxxiiii froste excedyng loke fo clxviii gascoynes make warre agaist frenchme borderer kyng charles v day shewed folio lxxxvi gabell taxe reysed vppon salte fraunce loke fo cxix guynes castell yolde englishman loke fo ci grudge betwene baldwyn monkes fo vii grudge arose betwene kyng iohn hys lordes fo xvi grudge dyspleasure betwene ye bysshop wynchester duke glouceter shewed folio clxxxi grudge murmure toke place amonge noble fraunce appereth fo ccxxviii harme done thonder appereth fo cvii haw e wythout reuerence sacrament slayne churche folio cxli hastynges lord chamberleyne sodeynly put deth fo ccxxiiii henry thyrd name sonn king iohn chyld x yeres began reygne ouer englade moneth octobre yere oure lorde mcc xvii xxxvii yere phylype tha kyng frauce reygned yeres lvi fo xviii henry bolyng broke ye iiii ye name sonne heyre iohn gaunt duke lacastre whyche iohn secod sonne edwarde iii lyuyng theyr father iii sonne rekyn prynce edward henry deposicio rychard ende moneth septe bre bega reygne ouer englade yere lorde miiiclxxx xix xix yere charles ye vii kyng fraunce reygned yeres xiii fo clxiii henry vi name sonn henry v ye name sonne ry iiii began hys reygne ouer realme englad vppon morne saynt cuthbertys day ye xi day marche ende ye yere grace miiiic xiii ye xxii yere charles vii kyng frauce reygned yeres ix fo clxx hery v dame kateryne doughter charles vi vii chylde halfe yere age bega hys reygne ouer englad frauce ende moneth iuly yere lord miiiic xxii ye fyrst yere charles vii viii ye thane amonge frencheme allowed kyng reygned yeres xxxix folio clxxix henry derby wyth landed rauespore shewed fo cli henry fyfte foresayd sayled fraunce loke fo clxxii henry derby forenamed hys issue shewed fo cxliiii henry iiii aforesayd maryed duchesse brytayne fo clxvi heresye iohn wyclyf apereth folio cxlvii heretykes taken saynt gyles feld brent fo clxxi homage done lordes almayne rycharde erle cornewayll brother kyng henry thyrde folio xxxviii homage done kyng scottes kyng e iii fo lxxxix hughe holy bysshoppe lyncolne dyed fo xi iohn brother rycharde fyrste ordeyned kynge englande moneth apryll yere lord mcxcix xx yere second phylyp kyng fraunce reygned yere xvii interdiccion thys lande bega vi yere thys kynge endured tyll xiii yere henry sonne alwyn x yere thys kynge admytted fyrste mayre lodo sayd x yere king iohn london brydge begon made stone fo x iohn fyrst fraunce name sonne phylyp de ualoys began hys reygne ouer lande fraunce moneth august yere lord miiic l xxxiiii yere ye thyrd edward kyng england reygned yeres xiiii thys kynge taken prysoner edwarde prynce englande batayll poytyers frauce folio cxxiii iaphet gotten kynge rychard fo v iakys de artyuyle fauoured englysshe partye fo xciii iacke strawe wyll waw made insurreccyon fo cxlii iacke sharpe taken putt deth folio clxxxv iacke cade hys felowes folio cxcvi iacke cade wroughte moche hys wyll london robbed slayne fo cxcvii iewes banysshed thys lande folio lx iewes spoyled slayne fo clv iohn brother kyng rychard prowd fo iii iohn reconcyled hys brother apereth fo viii iohn duke lancaster dyed shewed fo cl iohn duke bedforde dyed folio clxxxviii inquysycyons made vpon ruler london shewed folio xxix iordan ile gascoyne grewe kynde fo lxxxv inglysshe lordes wanne fyrst vppon frenchman fo xcviii inglysshe soudyours slayne vnder safe conduyt fo cxxii itenerarii plees holden south werke fo xxxi ile ely holdeth banysshed men folio xlii ile rodes fyrst wonne fo lxxv isabell late wyfe vnto kynge rycharde maryed eldest son duke orleaunce fo clx issue dyssent syr roger mortymer fo cxliiii iustyces iuges punysshed fo lx iustes holden hys syege london shewed folio xliii kynge henry chosed shyrefes folio xliii kynge lowys toke vppon hym crosse folio xlviii kynge edwarde fyrst buylde castelles walys folio lviii kynge edwarde sayled frauce folio lix kynge edwarde ii taken also resygned crowne fo lxxxii kynge edward iii came secretly london folio xcvi kynge edwarde warred sharply fraunce folio xcvii kynge edwarde chased spanyardes see fo ci kynge edwarde yode scotlande fo cii kynge scottes delyuered folio ciiii kynge edward spedde hym toward parys fo cv kynge nauerne sodaynly taken shewed fo cxxiii kynge nauerne set large folio cxxvii kynge edwarde warred newly fraunce fo cxxxv kynge iohan receyued fraunce fo cxxxv kynge nauerne became feodory vnto french kynge fo cxxxvi kynge ermonye asked ayde kynge rycharde ii fo cxliii kyng rychard ayded ianuayes folio cxlv kyng rychard maryed frenche kynges doughter fo cxlvii kyng richard sayled irelande folio cli kyng richarde myserably put dethe fo clxv kyng henry iiii maryed kynge henry taken oute towre fo ccxviii kynge edwarde proclaymed vsurper fo ccxix kynge edwarde landed rauynspore fo ccxix kynge edwarde repossessed apereth folio ccxx kyng hery vi dyed towre london folio lvii letter takked vpo crosse chepe folio lxxxi lordes assemble arundell apereth folio cxlix lordes put deth fo clxxii lordes fledde lodlowe feelde folio cciii lordes proclaymed traytours shewed folio cciiii lordes came london fo cciiii lordes fraunce warre vpo theyr kynge fo ccx lordes contynue theyr malyce shewed fo ccxi lordes dyscorde wythin selfe folio ccxii lorde morley appeled erle appereth fo xviii lowys sayled holy lande folio xxv lowys gaue sentence agayne baron fo xxxvi lowys ix name son phylyp seconde beganne hys reygne ouer frenchemen yere oure lorde mcc xxiii vi yere thyrde kynge henry kyng englande reygned yeres iii thys kynge retourned blode charles ye possessyon crowne fraunce folio xlvi lowys x name chylde xii yeres sonne abouenamed ix lowys whyche named saynt lowys began reygne ouer fraunce yere lord mcc xxvi ix yere iii henry kinge englad reygned yeres xliii appereth folio xlvii lowys xi accompt sonne phylyp iiii beganne reygn ouer fraunce yere lord mccc xv viii yere seconde edwarde kynge englande reygned yeres ii folio lxxxiii lowys xii ye name afte accopt thys boke x freche accopt wherof ye cause shewed son laste charles bega rule ye frenchme ye yere lord miiiic lviii xxxvi yere hery vi tha kyng englande reygned yeres xxvi fo ccix lowys refused lordes company counsayll fo ccix lowys rescueth parys fo ccx losse townes castelles normandy folio cxxxvii maruayles sene fyrmament folio xii mayre london presenment loke folio xxvii mayr hys bretherne foud gylty hurtyng comons fo xxix mayre cytezeyns agreed lordes fo xxxi macys syluer fyrste
