grauted offycers london fo xci men norwyche enraged fo xlv manhode mathew de roya foli liiii marchaunte straungers encroched vpo cytezyns lodon punysshed fo lix maddocke walshman rebelled shewed fo lxi mariage ii edward fo lxxiiii malyce sprange amonge lordes flaunders fo lxxxv marueylous heyle fylle fo lx mychaell tony mayre london adiuged loke fo lvi mortmayne fyrst enacted fo lvi mortymer howgely auaunced folio lxxxvii mortymer put deth shewed fo lxxxviii money borowed cytye london folio xcii martyn pysdo parycyen put cruell deth fo cxxxv maner cysme church rome loke fo cxxxviii maner metyng kynges englande fraunce fo cxlvii many knyghtes bathe made folio clxiii maruayles thamys fo clxx mass ordeyned kyng henry fyfte shewed folio clxxviii maner treaty betwene landes englande fraunce loke folio clxxxviii maryage dyspoynted fo cxcii maryage concluded fo cxciii manhode chalons fo cxcv maximilian frenche kynge dyscorden fo ccxxviii margaret syster vnto edwarde iiii departed london towarde see fo ccxvii monycyon dyuyne gyuen frenche kynge fo clviii mountague noble man slayn folio clx mummyng made treason shewed fo clxv murder punysshed fo clxvii noumbre wardes ye citye london fo ii name twelfe perys england folio xxx new tolle brought vp fo xliiii nycholas brembre wyth put deth fo cxliiii nauye frenchemen dystressed shewed fo lv newe coyne syluer stryken folio lvii new dyspleasure kynge rycharde toke agayne ye cytye london fo cl newe coyne golde smitten appereth fo clxx octoboon pope legate pursued clergy englande cause shewed fo xxii occasyon fraye fletestrete folio cxlv occasyon dyspleasure betwene kynge rycharde duke glouceter fo cxlix chere curious receyuyng kyng henry frenche kyng folio xxxii offycers charged dyscharged shewed folio xxxiii kyng iohns pledge fo cviii ordre seruytoures tyme quene katherins coronacio fo clxxvi orleaunce cytye besyeged folio clxxxii othes sworne kynges englande fraunce peace kefolio cvii olyuer daman danyell sometyme chyef counsayllours lowys frenche kynge hanged appereth fo ccxxviii preface thys werke apereth fo peace taken betwene kynges englande fraunce folio xi phylyp kynge fraunce warred vpon kyng iohn fo xi phylyp brake peace fo xii pope innocente sente vnto kynge iohn fo xiii parlyamente holden london folio xix pyers pountfret hys vertue put deth fo xvii parlyament holden mertone folio xxii periurye punysshed appereth fo xxv parlyament holden oxenforde apereth fo xxx parlyament holden westmynster folio xxxi parlyament holden oxenforde shewed fo xxxvi parlyament holden westmynster folio xxxviii parlyament holden westmynster folio xlv peace made betwene kynge gylbert de clare shewed folio xliii punysshement londoner shewed fo xl phylyp thyrde name sonne saynte lowys made kynge fraunce yere lorde mcclxx liii yere thyrde henry kynge englande reygned yeres xv fo li phylyp iiii name son iii phylyp la beawe fayre began reygne ouer fraunce ye yere lorde mcclxxxvi xiiii yere fyrste edwarde kyng england reygned yeres xxxix fo lxviii phylyp v name surnamed longe sonne fourth philyppe brother lowys xi accompt bega hys reygne ouer fraunce yere grace miii c xvii x yere edwarde ii kynge englande reygned yeres v fo lxxxiii phylyppe de ualoys erle ualoys sonne charlys de ualoys brother fourthe philippe nat wythoute stryfe chosen ordeyned protectoure lande fraunce kyng ii daye february yere oure lorde miiic xxviii ii yere edwarde iii kyng englande reygned greate trouble yeres xxii fo cxvi phylyppes actes italye appereth folio liiii parlyament holden westmynster folio lvi plees remoued london shewed fo lvi punysshement murdre appereth folio lviii parlyament holden westmynster folio lix parlyament holden london apereth folio lxxv peace concluded betwene fraunce flaundres fo lxxiii parlyament holden london apereth fo lxxxviii parlyament holden westmynster shewed fo xci parlyament holden northampto shewed folio xli parlyament holde yorke fo lxxix parlyament holden northampton appereth fo lxxxvii parlyament holden salysbury appereth folio lxxxvii parlyament holden burye shewed folio cxciiii parlyament holden couentre beholde folio cciiii parlyament holden leyceter shewed folio clxxi parlyament holden leyceter called battys shewed fo clxxxii paulys steple sette fyre fo cxciii pagentes ordenaunces made lodoners receyuyng kynge fo clxxxv parys loste treason shewed fo clxii peace concluded betwene regent kyng nauerne fo cxxxv peter kynge castyle beheded shewed fo cxi peryn drawe church hanged shewed fo cxxix plees put exercyse countre arthoys folio cxvii plees remoued frome london yorke shewed fo cxlvi pryde frenche kynge shewed fo lxxiii prynce edwarde maryed erle henawdes doughter fo lxxxi quene hythe fyrste let ferme cytesyns london appereth fo xxvi quest passed betwene abbot westmynster cytye londo shewed fo xxxv quene englande sayled fraunce cause fo lxxxi quene englande proclaymed enemye fo lxxxi quene foresayd landed england strength fo lxxxi quene anne speciall good lady cytye london fo cxlvi quene anne dyed fo cxlvii quene margarete receyued londoner fo cxciii quene margarete made voyage englande fo ccxv quene margaret taken shewed fo ccxx richarde fyrst name sonne hery second began reygne englande yere lorde mcxci xi yere second phylyp reygned yeres wyth odde monethes x fyrste yere thys kynge cytye london commytted rule two baylyfes whyche cotynued tyll x yere kyng iohn shewed fo iii rycharde ii name sonn prynce edwarde sonn edward iii began hys reygne ouer englande xii daye iuny ye yere lord miiiclxxvii xiii yere v charles kynge fraunce reygned yeres xxii folio cxlii rycharde iii name brother vnto edwarde iiii beynge duke glouceter protectour england began vsurpe xxvi daye iuny yere lord miiiiclxxxiii yere lowis tha kyng fraunce contynued yeres ii full moche xx day iuny xxii day august dayes lvii fo ccxxv ranulphe erle chester hys doughters fo xxi rayne excedyng fo lxxvii resygnacyon duchye normandy folio xxxii resygnacyon kynge rycharde folio clii resygnacyon shewed parlyament folio cliii robert knollys knyghte hys feates folio ciiii robert knollys toke saynt omiers holdes fo cxi sauoye place honoure london brent co mon folio cxlii saynt mary oueryes southwerke fyrste bylded fo xv sait stephyns chapell westmynster begonne fo cix syege layde saynte omyers folio xciiii syege layde amyas fo cxxxiiii scottysshe kynge dyd homage kyng iohn fo xi scottes brekyng theyr othe fo lxiii scottes subdued fo lxiii scottes peace theyr aduauntage fo lxxxvii scottes agayne ouerturned folio lxxxviii scotisshe kynge taken prysoner folio cii spenser banysshed fo lxxviii spenser bothe father put deth fo lxxxii sone turned coloure blode folio lxxx tanner vyllayne surmysed hym heyre crowne englande fo lxxvi table syluer gyuen kyng rychard fo cxlvii templers knyghtes religyo dystroyed fo lxx ii sentence agayne kynge iohan denounced fo xiii wardys london cessed folio xcii thre fyftenes graunted one tyme folio cxi tytle ryghte whyche kyng englande hath vnto scotlade se folio lxii tytle edwarde thyrde whych hadde crowne fraunce folio cxvi tytle duke glouceter crowne shewed paules crosse fo ccxxiiii wardes church wythin lo fo ii uaryaunce began betwene pope kyng iohn fo xii uaryaunce betwene londo north ampton fo xxxiii warre betwene kynge englad fraunce fo xiii warre concluded betwene sayd landes fo cxxxiiii warre betwene kynge iohn hys lordes fo xvii warre made normandy appereth fo lxii warre made guyan wyth fortune therof fo lxxx warre betwene frenche kynge kynge nauerne fo cxxiii warde maryage heyres graunted kynge fo xx wyllyam walworthe slewe iacke strawe folio cxlii usurer punysshed appereth folio cxxi endeth seconde table prologe mych comen tyme officer chosen chargyd wyth rule cytye london yt necessary shewe offycers name admitted ad gyuen ye shall vnderstand commynge wyllyam co querour thys lande euydently apperyth charter hym cytezens london graunted dayes ruler sayde cytezens named port greuys whyche worde y diriuate made ii saxon wordes port greue port meane town greue ment gardyen ruler wolde meane gardeyn ruler keper town olde tyme wyth lawes customys vsyd within thys cytye regystred boke called domysday saxon tunge vsed later dayes sayde lawes customes alteryd chaunged consyderacyon also sayde boke small hande sore defacyd yt lesse set yt enbefelyd loste remembraunce suche ruler dayes thys rycharde fyrst whose story shall next ensue loste forgoten wherfore nowe shall begynne fyrste yere sayde fyrste rycharde whyche wryters surnamed cure de lyon contynew name offycers well baylyuys mayres shryues tyll laste yeres rycharde thyrde kynge dede ryght whyche baylyues shall appoynt rule mychelmas mychelmas mayres fro suche tyme season nowe y accustomyd vsed saye daye symon iude vnto feste nexte ensuynge vpon whyche daye newe mayre taketh hys charge guylde hall olde mayre dyscharged sayde offyce mayraltye nowe wolde fayne wordes playne honour sayne brynge mynde auncyent cytye goodly se full trewe euer hath also full kynde prynce kynge hath borne iuste rulynge syn fyrste wynnynge thys ilande brute great honour passynge many showre hath euer borne flowre laudable brute euery cytye towne seche worlde rowne neuer yet caste downe many haue rome carthage hierusalem sage wyth many age storye ye maye se thys oldely founded surely groundyd man may confounde yt sure stone yt vppon sette though haue yt thrette wyth manasses grym great yet hurte hadde yt none cryste stone cytye sette vppon whyche hys foon hath euer preseruyd yt meane dyuyne seruyce contynuall wyse kepte deuout guyse wythin mure yt house relygyon dyuerse place thys towne whyche great deuocyon ben euer occupyed one hath done another begyn prayer neuer blyn suche order house wythin wyth vertue allyed paryshe chyrches reken whych nomber shall speken wherin speke many preste deken cryste dayly serue meane whyche sacryfyce truste wyse thys cytye seruyce doth euer preserue citie meane troynouaut honour worshyp doth haute wyth vertue ryches accordaute cytye yt lyke speke euery commodytye fleshe fyshe dentye cloth sylke wyth wyne plentye hole syke brede ale wyth spycys fyne wyth house fayre soupe dyne nothynge lackynke codygne man molde wyth ryuers freshe holsom ayer wyth woman good fayre thys cytye done repayre straungers many folde vytayle herein spente thre housholdes dayly tente betwene rome ryche kent none may theym compare mayre shriues twayne myght iustyce sayne kepte wythin cytye playne longe declare though shulde day tell wyth ryme dogerell myght yet halfe spell thys townes great honoure therfore shortely began pray yt chylde man yt may continue bere floure dwell reste peace good lorde graunt yt sease euer haue encreace yt thy wyll contynue olde fame kynges chauber yt ye right name london kepe wythout blame yt hath hyther tyll hym lyketh vsys rede fauour pray spell let rudenesse theym hym lede despraue thys ryme dogerell som te ye honour doth tel thys olde cytye troynouaunt therof halfe dell conynge maker adaunt though eloquence tully moralytye seneck influence swyte sugred armonye fayre ladye caliope yet conynge perfyght thys cytye prayse eche degre yt shulde duely aske ryght shall declare wardes foresayd citye also ye parysh chyrches yt stande within sayd wardes shal shew ye housys religyo standyng cyrcuyte cytye warde towre wherin thre paryshe chyrches saynt olaue alhalown barkynge saynt dunstane byllyngysgate ii saynt botulphe saynt george podynge lane saynt andrewe estchepe saynt margarete callyd patens saynte mary hyll lande brydge warde iii saynte benet grace chyrche saynt leonarde estchepe saynt margarete brydgstret saynte magne brydgestrete dowgate warde iiii saynte laurence pountenay alhalown alhalown lesse walbroke warde v saynt iohn walbroke saynt mary bothawe saynte swythyne candelwyke strete saynte stephan walbroke saynt mary wolchyrch ye pultry saynt syth boclerysbury candelwyke strete warde vi saynte martyne orgor saynt clement saynt mychaell crockyd lane saynte mary apchyrche langbourne warde vii alhalown stanis lumbarstrete saynt gabryell saynt denys fanchyrche strete saynt edmund saynte nycolas acon saynt mary wolnoth lumbarde strete algate warde viii saynt andrewe vndershaft saynt kateryns crystes chyrch saynt kateryne colman porte sowkyn warde ix saynt botulphe without algate lyme strete warde x saynt mary naxe byshoppes gate warde xi saynt botholphe gate saynt alborgth alhalowns wythin saynt helyns cornehyll warde xii saynt mychaell saynt petyr bradstrete warde xiii saynt martyne owtewyche saynt benet fynke saynt barthelmew lytle saynt crystofer saynt petyr poore alhalowns walle colmanstrete warde xiiii saynt stephan saynte olaff iury saynt margaret lothbery chepe warde xv saynt laurence iury saynt mary bowe alhalowns hony lane saynte mary colchyrche saynt myldredys pultry saynt benet shorhogge saynte martyne ponyers saynt martyn iremongerlane saynt mary cordwayner strete warde xvi saynt mary aldermary saynt ancelyne saynte pancras quene hyth warde xvii saynte mychaell saynt mary somerset saynt mary mouthawe saynt nycholas olaffe saynt nycholas colde abbey saynt petyr bredstrete warde xviii alhalows bred strete saynt myldrede saynt mathye saynt iohn euangelyst saynt augustyne poules gate saynt margarete moyses saynt botolphe saynt margarete fryday strete uyntry warde xix saynt martyne saynt mychell colege saynt thomas apostle saynt iamys garlyke hyth trynyte knyghtryder strete baynarde castell warde xx saynte andrew saynt benet saynt george saynt mary magdaleyne olde fyshe strete faryngedon warde wyth xxi saynt yeuan saynt nicholas ye flesheshablis saynt faythys powlys chyrche saynt martyne wythin ludgate taynt mychaell querne saynt fauster fauster lane saynt petyr crosse chepe saynte gregory ponlys chyrchyarde saynte genyn wythin saynte martyne graunte faryngdon warde wythout xxii saynt dunston saynt bryde saynt andrew holborne saint sepulcre without newgate aldrysgate warde xxiii saynt botolphe wythout gate saynte anne saynt iohn zachary saynt leonarde fauster lane saynt mary stanynge saynt mathew syluer strete bassynges haue warde xxiiii saynte mychaell crepelgate warde xxv saynte mary magdaleyn mylke strete saynt mary aldermanbury saynt mychaell hogynlane saynt albons woodstrete saynt alphy crepulgate saynt olaff syluer strete saynt gylys wythout gate summe paryshe chyrches wythin london cxiii ensue howsys relygyon monasteryes college chapellys beynge paryshe chyrches wythin cytye cathedrall chyrch saynt poule ende chepe pryory saynte barthelmewe smythfelde hospytall spytyll cell sayde pryory charter house standyng wythin warde crepulgate elsynge spytall wythin sayde warde chapell lady bedlem byshoppes gate warde house saynt elyne ye warde nunnys pryory crystes chyrche algate saynte anne abbaye wythin portsokyn warde whyte munkys howse ye meneressys close nunnys wythin warde chapel lady barkyng towre warde howse crossed frerys warde colege saynt antony ye warde bredstrete colege saynte thomas called acrys standynge chepe house frere augustynes brode strete warde house gray frerys standyng warde faryngedon wythin house blacke freres standynge ludgate within ye foresaid warde house whyte freres standynge flete strete chyrche college called temple standynge temple barre chapel standyng pardon chyrch yarde wythin poulys chapell standyng ye chirch yarde poulys ouer charnell house chapell standynge wythin crepell gate saynt iamys wall chapell called pappey stadyng besyde bishoppes gate founded prestes fraternyte chapel corp cristi ye pultry chapell saynt thomas cau terbury stadyng vpon lodonbridge chapell standynge yelde hall yarde lady colege prestes standynge poulys called saynte martyne le graunde summe housys relygyon chapellys xxvii westmynster abbbaye westmynster kynges newe chapell saynte stephans chapell saynt margaretes chyrche chapell totehyll chapell saynt anne totehyll strete saynte iamys felde chapell rauncyuale paryshe chyrche therby saynte martyne chapell lady pewe chyrches monasteryes chapellys housys wherin god dayly seruyd standynge cyrcuyte cytye wythoute wally fyrste wythoute algate paryshe chyrche ladye standynge wythoute barrys called whyte chapell colege saynte katheryne standynge eest ende towre london paryshe chyrch chapell wythin sayde towre saynte peter southwarke monastery bermundsey paryshe chyrch mary magdaleyne standynge faste paryshe chyrche saynt george paryshe chyrch saynt magaret hospitall college saynt thomas paryshe chyrche saynte ola monastery chanos callyd saynt mary ouereys paryshe chyrche saynt mary magdaleyn standynge faste thereby wythout temple barre paryshe chyrch saynte clement chapell saynte spyryte saynte ursula strande wythoute smythfelde pryorye saynte iohn hierusalem house nunys named clerkewel chapell pardon chyrche yarde wythout byshoppes gate shordyche paryshe chyrche saynte mary spytell house nunnys callyd halywell dyuyne house without cytye xxviii summe dyuyne house wythin cytye wythoute hundred lxviii richarde fyrst name seconde sonne henry second beganne hys reygne ouer englad moneth iuly yere lorde x hundred lxxx x xi yere seconde phylyppe kynge fraunce thys rycharde prouyded besely sette good rule normady hadde harde hys father deth spedde england ioyously receyued moneth september folowynge thyrde daye crowned westmynster baldwyn archbyshoppe caunterburye uppon whyche daye iewys englande specyally suche dwellyd within london nere assembled certayn nomber presumyd farther requyred theyr authoryte whyche presumpcyon fyrste rebuked one stryke thyng sene comon people supposyd done kynges commaundement wherfore fury hated deuyll theyr vsury vnhappy condycyons fell vppon theym chased theyr house robbed spoyled wythout pytye brent theyr housis wher rumour ranne westmynster ye kynges audyece wherfore haste sent downe gyuyng strayte comaundement shuld cease ryot people suche ire wodenesse refrayned kinges sonde tyll hadde executed fyne theyr malyce yt thys ryot greuously shewyd agayne common cytye yet yt passed vnpunyshed great nomber transgressours sayde daye coronacyon prysoners lay pryson aboute london kynges sute small fayned accyons frely delyueryd soone kynge gaue many dygnytyes hys brother iohn gaue prouynces notyngham deuonshyre cornewall creatyd hym erle lancaster kynge ordeyned cytye london ruled two baylyues whose name foloweth anno domini mcxc anno domini mcxci henry cornehyll balliui anno primo rycharde fyz ryuer longe ye kynge hadde thus exalted hys brother iohn shewwyd also preferryd hym maryage erle glouceters doughter reason wherof lorde erledome great auaucementis made vnkynde broder pryde therof coueyt afterwarde hole kyngdome thys yere kynge rycharde assoyled offence vsyd rebellyon agayne hys father recompesacyon wherof testyfyeth authour guydo voluntaryly toke vppon hym promysed warre vppon crystes enymyes yt wryters shewe yt hys father wylled hym hys lyfe cause yt preparacyon prouysyon iourney made daye forthwarde thys yere also kynge enlarged elyanoure hys moder whyche long commaundement father husbande prysoner kepte secrete kepynge whych enlargyng ye land mych guydyd counsayll thys yere sayth ranulfe kynge rycharde gaue ouer castellis barwyke rochysburghe ye scottyshe kyng summe x thousande pounde exployte voyage farther sold olde byshoppe durham hys owne prouynce great summe money creatyd hym erle wherfore kynge sayde game wonder crafty man haue made new erle old byshop suche meanes kyng emptyed many byshoppes ryche prestys bagges fylled hys cofers ouer graunted oute annuytyes fee oute crowne though roughte nothynge hys retournynge dede hys famylyers durste blamed hym sayde yt tyme nede good polycy man ayde hym wyth owne ouer ioyned ther yf london hys tyme nede wolde sell yt yf myght gete conuenyent marchaut yt able paye waye hadde also gather money hadde lycence pope innocent thyrd name dyspence wyth suche hym lyked wythin realme takyng vppon theym crosse anno domini mcxci anno domini mcxcii iohn herlyon balliui anno secundo roger duke seconde yere moneth october kynge rycharde betoke guydynge lande vnto byshoppe ely chaunceller englande sayled normandye settynge coutrey vnder sadde guydyng shortly mette frenche kyng phylyp second whych ioyntly yode turon ouer passyd shortnesse wynter whyche passe tyme makynge eyther wyth assuraunce contynuaunce great iourney sprynge ye yere two prince toke theyr voyage towarde holy lande meane kyng rycharde ye see knnge phylyppe lande appoynted mete agayn land scicilia scycyll meane tyme england iewes dyuers place ye realme lyncolne staunforde lynne robbed spoyled yorke nomber foure hundred mo cutte theyr mayster veynes bled deth two kynges accordynge theyr appoyntemet met scycyll grudge beganne kyndle betwene theym correccyon theyr souldyours french kyng departyd agayne kynge rycharde whyche made certayne ordynaunces warre towre castell tymber whyche named mategryffons also prouyded vytayll hostes thys tyme also kynge cyprys hadde taken two shyppes kynge rycharde denyed delyuery theym wherfore sayde rycharde entryd land cypris makynge therin sharpe warre chasyd kynge cytye cytye lastely yelded vnto kyng rycharde vppon condicyon shulde throwen bondes iron wherof kynge rycharde kepynge hys promyse caste hym bondes syluer kynge rycharde hadde dwellyd vppon two monethes hadde taken pleasure cou trey taken amendes wyll hys shyppes departed sayde yle cypris sayled towarde acon acris whyche course kepynge towarde acris encountred great shyppe soudan sury fraughte wyth great ryches toke yt came length ye cytye acris tyme lay ye sayd towne frenche kynge wyth hys hoste lost lytle two thousande hys men whyche partyd hys hoste haue done enterpryse vppon turkes layde dystressed testyfyeth peter dysroy kynge rycharde ioyously receyued frenche kynge whose commynge yt longe sayd cytye gyuen vp appoyntement foloweth affermeth sayde peter also cronycle fraunce fyrste sarasyns shulde departe cytye leuynge behynde theym horse harneys vytayll thynge belongynge warre also shulde cause restoryd prysoners cryste men vnder theyr kepyng wyth couenauntes whyche passe ouer thus cytye acris yelden crysten mennes handes moneth auguste yere lorde xi hundred lxxx xii yt came partyng praye cytye beganne malyce kyndle hys bronde whych lyghtly quenchyd thys varyance betwene two kynges england frauce dyuers maners shewyd polycronica sayth yt beganne reason kynge rycharde denyed vnto kynge phylyp halfe hys wynnynges cypris accordyng couenauntis betwene theym assured turon kyng rychard sayd couencyon made stretched forther suche goodes wonne wythin lymytes boundes holy lande another grudge reason french kyng ayded ye erle champeyne beynge dystresse nede wherfore sayde erle beynge discontent sayde freche kyng syr hytherto haue done accordynge dutye hereafter shall compellyd nede grace hath hytherto cherysshed myn shal go hym yt redy gyue take departed kyng rycharde whyche hys pleasure thyrde cause sayth ranulph mych kyng rycharde hys begynnyng scycyll maryed syster kynge nauerne hadde promysed mary syster sayde kynge phylyppe artycles speketh nothyng french cronycle layeth greate defaute vnto kynge rycharde sayeng sedycyous vyle wordys kyng rycharde falsly brake hys appoyntmentes kepte promesse hym made moreouer sayd cronycle sayth solde ile cyprys vnto templers xxx thousande marke toke agayne fro strength delyuered vnto guy de lesygnan laste crystened kynge hierusalem ouer sayde frenche cronycle sayth toke knyght duke ostrych sayd duke banner despyte sayde duke trade vnderfote dyd vnto despyte myghte ouer thys conradus markes tyre traytorously slayn two owne seruauntes kyng rycharde shulde laye charge therof vnto frenche kynge grudge sykenesse wyth also fere treason wrought bytwene saladyne souda kynge rycharde affermeth allegeth foresayde authoure kynge phylyppe wyth small company shyppes departed aco acris sayled puyll poyll restynge hym season co tynued hys iourney vnto rome lastely hys owne prouynce fraunce anno domini mcxcii anno domini mcxciii wyllyam hauershall balliui anno iii iohn buknot thyrde yere moneth nouember frenche kynge thus departed kyng rychard duke burgoyn french kynge hadde lefte behynde hym haue rule frenche hoste lafte remaynyng acre countre called hym dyuers person pledge turkes perfourmaunce certayne appoyntementes taken wyth ye wynnynge gyuynge vp sayde cytye acris wherof one especiall couenaut certayne daye expyred shulde cause ye holy crosse restored vnto crysten prynces whyche saw well wolde myghte perfourme therfore put execucyon turkes ouer noumber v thousande testyfyeth frenche cronycle agreed beste wyth former sayeng co syderynge cytye delyuered appoyntement shulde many turkes remayne peter dysroye sayth brekynge thys appoyntement kynge rycharde put deth suche turkes wythin cytye acris whyche maye ment hostage pledge longe tydynges brought vnto kyng rycharde cytye hierusalem wythout greate strength soldyours myghte wonne wyth easy labour wherfore kyng rychard assembled lordes haue theyr cousayll cocluded euery capyteyne shuld prepare hym go thyther uppon whyche agrement crysten hoste sped wyse yt within v myles ye sayd city hierusalem toke new cou sayll shuld order theyr people lay theyr syege cytye whyche cousayll concluded yt kynge rycharde wyth hys englyshe men shulde haue vawewarde duke burgoyne rere warde whyche conclusyon taken kynge spedde hym vppon waye towarde cytye myshappe mysfortune saye soone kynge departed duke called lordes fraunce hym sayde yt euydent vnto yt hedde souerayne lorde absent floure chyualry frauce present yf thyng done honour crysten reproche infydels yt lykely done v consyderyng yt insuffycyencye englyshemen yet neuerthelesse someuer honoure grow dedis ye cristen hoste yt shall accompted vnto kyng rycharde hys presence yt shall haue payne trauayll englyshemen shall haue honour wherfore ye wyll counsayll wyll returne vnto acrys tarye tyll se farther agreed counsayll nomber spedde haste kynge rycharde shewed hym duke returne wherof beynge enfourmed returned also vnto acris longe sayd duke taken wyth greuous sykenesse dyed tyme also dyed baldewyn archbysshoppe caunterburye whyche amonge lordes englande accompanyed kynge iourney anno domini mcxciii anno domini mcxciiii nycholas duke balliui anno quarto petyr nowlay season mychelmasse ye iiii yere reygne thys sayde rycharde tydynges brought hym yt town castell iapheth besyeged saladyne lykely soone wonne wythout crysten sooner ayded wherfore kynge rycharde whych peter dysroy calleth good kynge rycharde sped hym thyther army water sent nother hoste frechemen lande yt cristen myght wynne thyther sayd towne castell wonne prysoners therin taken sent water towarde prysones salandyne hadde appoynted vnto wyth whyche good fortune kynge rycharde mette rescowyd done wyth turkes whyche theym conueyed put sure holde helde hys iourney iapheth strength rescuyd towne castell ond restoryd crysten theyr former possessyon left wyth theym strength knyghtes feryd myscreau te kynge rycharde caused hys prysoners hym belongynge slayne solde theym theyr great auautage mean wher hadde wonderfull fere turkes kynge rycharde thys victory hadde iapheth wonne ii strong holdes callyd daron gadres strengthyd wyth crysten knyghtes wyth goodes wane turkes repayred castel ascalon greatly impayred warre turkes thys season tyme ye kyng rycharde thus occupyed holy lande byshoppe ely sayde hauynge rule englande dyd many cruell dedys oppressyd clergy also lay fee wolde comenly ryde thousande horse greued abbey meane hys gestys lodgynge wyth theym also helde hys handes see yorke longe season ye deth balwyne dede shewed holy land also toke see caunterbury vnder hys rule pryued geffrey chosen ee yorke hys mouables caste prisoner ye towre lodon soon called counsayll westmynster kynges procuratour legate pope innocent iii thys counsayll hughe nouaunt byshoppe chester great famylyer sayd byshoppe ely putte forth complaynt agayne ye munkes couentre hadde shed sayde hughys blood hygh aulter theyr chyrche whych cause byshoppe ely demyd sayde munkys shulde putte theyr sayde abbey clerkes shuld set myght munkes put then dysperbled sondry placis clerkes wyth prebendys set theyr stallys thys dede sayth guydo thys hugh byshoppe chester hadde thus causyd munkes couentre lose theyr lande house toke therfore great repentaunce vppon hys deth bed axed god due conuenyent penaunce myght redeme offence lyeng fyre purgatory ye daye deth vnto generall day dome also forenamed byshoppe ely called proper name wyllyam de longe shampe contynuynge hys tyrannyes pryuyd hugh byshoppe durham maner worshippe greued byshoppe wynchester wretched nygh lande faste thys innaturall euyll dysposyd man besyed hym vex greue crysten men england fast besyed good kyng rycharde vexe dere infydels sury yt dayly wanne theym leste putte theym wynnynge suche townes holdes theyr great strength entendyd haue wonne anno domini mcxciiii anno domini mcxcv roger duke balliui anno quinto rycharde fyz aleyn ende september begynnynge fyfte yere kynge rycharde guy de lesyngeman laste crysten kynge hierusalem dyed choras noble crysten man captayne towne called sur shortly slayne turkes whose wyfe mych ryghtfull enherytour crowne hierusale kyng gaue maryage vnto ye erle champayne kynge rycharde perceyued well ye cristen hoste mynyshed dayly well infyrmytyes lacke vytayll otherwyse sought meanes peace trewce tyme yt graunted thre yeres whyche peace stablyshed proclaymed hoste countrey nere kynge rycharde betoke rule guydyng cristen vnto erle champayne promysynge hym ye trewce endyd come wyth stronger hoste wyth goddes myght set hym possessyon cytye hierusalem ryght wyfe hubert byshop salysbury yode forth hym selfe ye kyng holy citye offeryd hoste retourned agayne kynge whose returne ye kynge takynge leue erle champayne toke shyppyng acrys acon whyche y named tholomayda also returned yle cypre cyprys then kynge sent quene hys wyfe syster wyth ye parte hys people vnto scycyll wyth small company myghte endure softenesse see toke shyppynge moneth september sayled wyth stronge wynde towarde coutrey callyd histria dryuen force wederynge betwene uenyse aquinilia aquilegia houyd season costed hyther thyther lastely espyed taken duke ostrychys men anno domini mcxcv anno domini mcxcvi wyllyam fyz isabell balliui anno sexto wyllyam fyz arnolde moneth october vi yere hys reygne thys good kynge rycharde taken fourme folowynge lay thus sayde betwene uenyce aquilegia uynce duke ostrych one meynart gorezeyn ruler countrey vnder foresayde duke made certayne souldyours haue taken hym hys prouydence manhode escapyd ye sayd maynarde maynart yt hys knyghtes takyn kynge rycharde passed ye cou trey secretly tyll came towne named frysake thys towne prouoste ruler knyght called frederyk de saynt soom ye whyche also dyd hys deuoure take kynge toke vi knyghtes prysoners hym selfe wyth remenaunt hys company escaped kynge seynge daunger hys enymyes drewe way towarde almayn thys soone knowen hys enymyes meanes one called duke lymple cosyn emperoure wayes closyd suche wyse ende kynge rycharde taken seruauntes sayd duke nere vnto citye towne called menne meune wythin lande terrytory emperoure brought vnto sayde duke lymple duke ostriche ye spoyled hym yt hadde caste hym prison streyghtely kepte hym space moneth monethes ende sente hym vnto henry vi name wryters v sonne fyrst frederyke emperour almayne whyche helde hym vyle pryson tyme tyll lent couenauntyd wyth duke ostryche haue thyrde parte profyte came kynge rycharde sonday palmys emperour brought forth kynge lordes almayne gyue answere vnto suche thynges shuld layde vnto hym came forth wyth good coutenaunce also answered dyscretely dyrectely mater layde vnto hys charge emperoure alonely bende shewe hym mercy also dyd hym honour worshyppe helde hym libertye daye redde thys rycharde durynge tyme hys imprysonement shuld sle lyon tere harte oute hys bodye thorough shulde deserue name rycharde cure de lyon yt shuld wyth stroke fyst sle emperours sonne also deflorysh emperours doughter fablys ymagined englysh tale teller auaunce theyr kynge rycharde brytons theyr fayned talys auaunced theyr kynge arture passetyme wyllyam longeshamp byshop ely contynuynge crudelyte tyrannye wythin englande lastely strength lordes put oute lande came kynge beynge prysoner shewyd hym self beste coude saw myght begyle kynge wyth sugryd wordes hadde small truste kynges fauour returned fraunce tarye kynges commynge thys yere iohn kynges brother excityng french kyng harde takyng imprisonynge hys brother began make warre within ye lande toke strength ye castelles wyndesour notyngham frenche kyng vpon partye made strong warre normady shewed story second phylyppe kynge fraunce anno domini mcxcvi anno domini mcxcvii robert besaunt balliui anno vii iokell iosne vii yere kynge rycharde hubert byshoppe salysbury whych hadde accompanyed kynge voyage sente wyth quene scycyll retourned came kyng prysoner kynge sente soone englande haue guydynge therof also treate wyth lordes common hys realme howe myghte sette lybertye long comyng home hubert mukes house cristes chyrch cau terburye chase hym archebysshoppes see hadde palle stallyd soone easy mukes well ye sharpnes baldwyne somdeale greued theym though thys baldwyne good man holy lyuynge yet one thyng dyd derogacyon munkes caunterburye purposyd put prerogatiue eleccyon archbishoppe munkes therof beganne buylde great house nere vnto munkes chyrche fauour kynge henry seconde wythout shedynge blood entendyd haue set secular chanons prebendys suffraganes bysshoppes treate wyth sayde chanons foresayde eleccyon put mukes clerely munkes sawe myght lenger resyst baldwyn appealed pope innocent thyrde whose comaundemet worke ceasyd stode vnfynysshed tyll sayde baldwyne dede whose deth munkes made worke playne wyth grounde treuisa translatoure policronycon sayth yt wonder baldwyn wolde maner deale wyth munkes consyderyng fyrst archdeacon white munke abbot byshop worceter last archbysshoppe brynge men imperfyte lyfe ye place men perfyte chaunge religyous men seculer men yet sayde treuisa allowyth baldwynes dede entent good sayth criste hedde holy chyrch callid made apostle bysshoppes none munke yet frere wherfore baldwyne dyd better preferre relygyon whyche cryste made relygyon whyche instytuted ordeyned man anno domini mcxcvii anno domini mcxcviii gerarde de antiloche balliui anno viii robert duraunt moneth ianuary viii yere reygne kynge rycharde sayde rycharde sufferyd harde prysonement vppon terme yere thre monethes deliuered pryson summe hundred thousande pounde sterlynge money pledge wherof lefte kepynge emperoure bysshoppes roan bathe great parte payed kynge delyuerydorname te chyrche folde payment whyche raunsom wolle whyte munkes chanons taken solde rynges cross prelate wyth vessel chalyces chyrches thorough ye land ouer xxvii shrynes scraped spoylyd ye gold syluer vppon theym tyme layd pryuylege holy chyrch persone season sparyd kynge rycharde came vnto swyne flaudres taryed two monethes abyde wynde ellys make prouysyon thynges whych neded emperours men almost taken agayn emperour forthought ye deliuery king rychard pharao forthought delyuery chyldren israel kyng toke shippyng laded ye ende marche sandwyche then came streyghte vnto lodon receyued wyth ioye honour season rested hym wyth certayn nomber knyghtes rode nothyngam wan ye castell castell tykhyll force armes set wardeyns theym warde done called counsayll hys lordes wynchester authoryte sayd cousayll depryued iohn hys brother beynge fraunce honour toke hym al suche landes gyuen hym crowned hym soone agayn kyng england sayd cytye wynchester whych coronacyon called parlyament vertue wherof resumyd paretes annuytees fee grauntes hys voyage hym solde graunted caused partyes contentyd wyth reuenous profytes receyued sayde offyces landes tyme hys absence sparyd persone sufficience wrytyng yt hym made kynge rycharde hadde foresayd meanes gaderyd money moneth iuly sayled fraunce besegyd castell callyd arques spedde wytnessyth polycronyca dyuersly whyche worde dyuersly may well spoken redyth frenche cronycle shall fynde frenche kynge vyctor rede englyshe boke shall fynde kynge rycharde vyctour wherfore thynketh ranulphe sayde well sayde spedde dyuersely yt dyuerse reporte wryters certayntie honoure shulde gyuen harde knowen yt countrey bloys wytnessyth ye sayde frenche cronycle kynge rycharde scaryd frenche hoste toke kynges somer horse wyth parte hys treasour shorte whyle trewce concludyd betwene two kynges yere iohn whyche hadde tourned frenche kyng agayne owne brother seynge fame honoure hys brother feblenesse power made meanes elyanoure hys mother whose medyacyon recocyled hys brother kynge became hys trew knyght kynge hys brother iohn thus agreed rode ouer lande vysyte ye countreys se howe guyded offycers kynge amonge two whyche shewyd wolde many thynges kynges profyte one abbot cadonence wythin normandye named wyllyam wyth longe berde abbot warned kynge fraude hys offycers wherby thought ponyshement hys offycers shulde wynne great fauoure people thys abbot gate warrant kynge london callyd dyuerse offycers hym yelde hym theyr accompte dyed shortly hys purpose came small effecte wyllyam wyth longe berde shewyd kynge outrage ryche men whych sayd sparyd theyr owne pyllyd poore people sayd willyam borne london purchasyd name vse hys berde sharpe wytte somedeale lettred bold man speche sadde countenaunce toke vppon hym greatter dedes coulde welde vsyd cruelly apperyth appechynge hys brother treason whyche burges london hym hadde shewed great kyndnesse youthe willyam styred excyted comon peple desyre loue fredom lybertye blamed excesse outrage ryche men suche meany drew hym many great companyes wyth hys power defended poore mennys cause agayne ryche accused dyuers kynge shewyng theyr meany kynge loste many forfaytes escheatys gentylmen men honour malygned agayn hym coforte kynge kepte purpose kynge beynge warned congregacyons thys wyllyam made commauded hym cease doynges yt people myght exercise theyr artes occupacyos reason wherof left long people folowed hym tyme done made vnto colacyons exhortacyons toke hys anteteme haurietis aqua gaudio de fontibus saluatoris mean ye shall drawe ioye water wellis sauyour added sayde sauyour poore men ye poore haue assayed ye harde handes riche men draw ye therfore holefull water lore wellys wyth ioy tyme vysytacyon comen shall sayde departe water water water vnderstande people shall departe people whychis good meke people y wycked prowde shall dysseuyr good ylle lyght departed ye darkenes thys came knowlege archebyshoppe caunterbury counsayll lordes spyrytualty sent vnto wyllyam commaundynge hym appere lordes kynges counsayll answere vnto suche mater shulde layde vnto hym whyche daye thys wyllyam appered hauyng wyth hym multytude people myche lordes hym adrad whyche cause remyttyd hym wyth plesaunt wordes ye time commaundyd certayne persones secrete maner espye voyde hys company take hym put hym sure kepyng whyche accordynge commaundement tyme conuenyent thought sette vpon hym haue taken hym wyth axe resysted theym slewe one theym fled saynt mary bowe chyrche chepe toke sauegarde defendynge hym strength suffrage chyrche hym drew shortley great multytude people shorte processe meane heddys ruler cytye people mynyshed yt shorte tyme lefte wyth personys fyre copellyd forsake chyrch taken wythoute shedynge blood whyche takynge areygned iudges wyth ix adheretes caste iudged dye hanged wyth hym day folowynge yet rumour seased ye comon peple reysed great cryme vpon archbyshop caunterbury sayd yt theyr meanes willyam whych innocet crymes obiecte put agayne hym defendor poore people agayn extorcyoners wronge doer theym put wrongfully deth approuyng holy martyr tale folowyng sayeng yt man beyng syke feuers cured vertue cheyn whych wyllyam bounde wythin tyme dures imprysonement preste allye sayde wyllyam openly declared preached wherby brought people suche errour gaue credence hys wordes secretly nyght coueyed away iebet haged vppon scraped away ye blood shed taken ellys hedded quarteryd yt made holow place fetchyng away erth sayde yt syke men woman cured dyuerse sykenesse vertue blood erth mean blowynge fame ye place vysyted woman vndyscrete sone whych watched hole nyght prayer lenger thys cotynued dysclaunder anotyd iustyces suche put hym deth wythstandyng processe tyme hys actes publysshed sleynge man wyth hys owne hande vsynge hys concubyne wythin saynte mary chyrche tyme hys beynge openly cofessed houre hys dethe wyth detestable crymes somwhat keled great flame hasty pilgrymage clerely tyll archebyshoppe cau terbury accursed ye preste yt broughte vp fyrste fable also causyd place watched suche idolatry shuld used anno domini mcxcviii anno domini mcxcix roger blount balliui anno ix nycholas duke moneth apryll ix yere kynge rycharde prouided sende forth xx thousand poude emperour full payment hys raunsome pledge whyche lyen came sodeynly england shewed vnto kyng departynge emperour sente vnto duke ostrych remayne tyll money payde forther shewed sayd duke accursed ye pope yt innocent ye thyrde reason wronge done kynge prouynce greuyd wyth many myscheues duke rode forth daye hys disport beyng saynt stephans day hurte fote wyse wyth thorne venym whyche rancled grewe sore ye lastly shuld dye cutte yt hope recouery contynued tyll ende warned shulde dye sent byshoppes axyd assoyled sentence chyrche whyche stode whyche denyed hym excepte wolde swere stande abyde ordynauce dome holy chyrch touchynge wronge hadde done kynge rycharde duke sware assoyled shortly two byshoppes pledgys ye money delyuered theyr lybertye kynge rycharde callyng mynde vttermost daye trewes take betwene hym frenche kynge approched made hym redy sayled normandye commyng frenche kynge occasyon normannis sayth frenche boke entred coutrey burgys towarde kyng rycharde sped hym wyth possyble spede hostes laye partyd wyth ryuer called osson ossyne folowe sayenge frenche boke myche englyshe cronycle spekyth lytle nothynge thys acte lette wyse men thys cronycle constrew yt theyr dyscrecyons yt frencheman wrote yt honour frenchman yet shall rede yt yt soundyth nere vntrouth yt shal rather redounde vnto theyr dyshonour frenche cronicle sayth two hostes thus aboue sayde lyenge gyther wythout skyrmshe assaute kynge rycharde contrary opinyon mynde hys lordes wyth accompanyed vnharnaysed shuld come ye freche kynges tente presence hys lordes shulde homage frenche kynge duchye normandye couteys angeou poytyers swore kynge kepe peace duryng lyfe viii dayes met agayn fynyshed sayde peace wyth assuryd othe vppon eyther partye departed frendes eyther resortyng theyr owne countrey yt semed feynte peace within foure monethes lesse folowynge kynge rycharde wyth hys hoste entred prouynce berry layd syege castell wyersoune gate yt strength yode castell noryncourte whyche delyueryd hym appoyntement kyng phylyppe harde wynnynge ouerthrowe castell wyersoun damagynge kynge rychard layde syege castell aubeuyle yt assayled egerly buy yt stronge well defendyd normannys frenche kynge holden kynge rycharde garnyshed fortifyed castell noryncourte wyth thynge necessarye warre drewe hym towarde aubeuyle remoue kynge phylyppe syege fell vppon frenche men vnwarely frenchemen quyt theym knyghtly chased kyng rycharde hys people toke norman knyghte named guy de thonars man great hardynes kynge phylyppe returned castel towne aubeuyle assauted sharpely ende ye souldyours town yeldyd yt wyth castell certayne summe money hadde possessyon towne threw downe castell playne wyth ground strengthed towne wyth frenche men yode castell gysours thes resorted forenamed castell noryncourte assayled yt cruell maner shortely wanne yt toke therin xv knyghtes xxiiii yemen wyth plente vytayll armour thys tyme season kynge richarde gadered newe strength allyed hym wyth baldwyn erle flaudres renolde erle dampmartyn boleyne whose meanes wytnessyth frenche boke kynge rychard wasted sore countrey fraunce brent therin townes vyllages toke therein many ryche prayes anno domini mcxcix anno domini mcc constantyne fyz arnolde balliui anno x robert le beawe begynnynge moneth october x yere rycharde sayde rycharde entryd countrey unequecyne wyth stronge hoste made therin cruell warre destroyenge countrey assauted castell gysours threwe grounde stronge holde called courcellys brent many vyllages wherwyth kynge phylyppe greuousely amouyd yt wyth small noumber knyghtes percyd hoste englyshemen entryd castell towne gysours men taken certayn ber alayne de russy mathewe de melly guyllyam de mello many wyth whyche prysoners many riche prayes kyng richarde departed leuynge frenche kynge wythin gysours longe kynge rycharde thus departed kyng phylyp callyng mynde great losse dishonour receyued warre kynge rycharde assembled great army entred duchy normandy wasted coutrey nuesbourth beawmot le rogyer done returned fraunce lycecyd hys knyghtes go eche man hys owne countrey kynge phylyppe hadde thus fynyshed hys warre normandye kynge rycharde wyth hys armye entred forenamed countrey unequecyn also beawuoysyn toke wythin theym done ryche many prayes theym departed byshop beawuays beyng good knyghte hardy handes wyth companye knyghtes folowyd haue rescowyd prysoners kynge rycharde taken taken certayne hys company slayne erle flaundres ayde englyshe men toke towne saynt omer ye freche men season innocent pope named sente legate fraunce named peter de capys refourme warre betwene two prynces whyche tyme dysioynte coulde brynge yt frame specyally sayth frenche boke kynge richarde wolde delyuer hostage gagys ye freche kynge wolde kynge rycharde cristmas besyeged castel nere vnto lymogys thys castell ye freche cronycle called chalons englyshe boke yt named gayllarde cause syege saith wryters certayne ryche treasour founden wythin lordshyppe sygnyory kynge rycharde whyche one wydomer vycounte lemonke hadde founden wyth helde kynge rycharde hys sauegarde fledde vnto forenamed castell defendyd yt manfully fyrste weke lent tyll vi daye apryll uppon whyche daye kynge rycharde walkynge vnwysely castell espye feblenes therof one named betrade guedon markyd kynge wounded hedde writer ye arme venemous quarell woude receyued kynge commaunded sharpe assaute made whyche assaute castell made enquery yt wounded brought vnto kynges presence named hym self aboue sayde writer peter basyle kynge demauded shuld lye wayte hurte hym rather felowys thou slew father bretherne sayde wherfore entendyd auenge theyr deth someuer became ye kyng forgaue hym offence sufferyd go lyberte ye soudyours taken castell kynge commaunded hanged polycronycon sayth kynge rycharde dede duke braban whych present causyd sayde bartrande taken flayne quycke hanged kynge rycharde dyed iii daye say ix daye apryll buryed fount eborard fete hys father howe yt wryters say harte buryed roan body sayde hys bowellys carleyll englande hadde reygned ix yeres ix monethes odde dayes leuynge hym none yssue thys rycharde metrycyan made versys folowynge christe tui calicis praedo fit praeda caducis breui reiecis qui tollit aera crucis viscera carleolum corpus fons seruat ebardi et cor rothamagu magne richarde tuum terra diuiditur vnus quia plus fuit vno non superest vno gratia tanta viro versys may englysshyd foloweth cryste whyche ryght hande axyd mercy v thou made praye lyke wyse shulde trespasse axe mercy shewe delay erthly thynges caste self away thy crosse accompteth lyttell store meryte thy passyon losyth euermore thys manfull knyghte thys prynce vyctoryouse whyche toke thy crosse hym wyth great payne folowed thefe axyd mercy thus hys offence warred thy foe agayne shadde theyr blood hyll eke playne loue good lorde hadde wherfore swyte iesu hym thou haue pytye bowellys carleyll trunke fount ebrarde full rychely y dyght harte roan erthe y sunke worthy rycharde thre twyght one whylom myght erthe separate lyuynge one grace founde lyke hym none iohn brother ye aboue named rycharde yongeste son henry seconde ordeyned proclamed kyng england tenth day apryll begynnynge yere lorde xi hundred lxxx xix xx yere seconde phylyppe kynge fraunce thys iohn daye brother deth normandy chynon soon brother rycharde dyseasyd possessyd hym hys brother treasour sent hubert archbyshoppe caunterbury englande make prouisyon coronacyon vppon ester daye folowyng gyrde sworde duchy brytayne sayled soon englad crowned kynge westmynster vppon holy thursday next folowynge forenamed hubert whyche solemnitye done ordeyned hubert chaunceller englande thys whyle frenche kynge helde counsayll cenomannia turon derogacyon kynge iohn arture son geffrey plantagenet neuewe sayde iohn made duke brytayne whyche incontynently wyth great army entryd countrey angeou toke possessyon therof kynge phylyppe wyth hys people entryd duchy normandy layde syege cytye euroux wanne yt wyth stronge holdes stuffyd theym wyth vytayll strengthed owne knyghtes done wasted spoyled countrey tyll came cytye meaus met wyth hym forenamed arture dyd hym homage countrey angiers moneth may elyanour somtyme wyfe henry seconde mother kyng rycharde came fraunce kynge meaus foresayde made hym homage coutrey poytiers enherytaunce soone kinge retourned frauce duke britayne wyth hym whyche yet within age kynge iohn heryng warre normandy losse countreys aboue named assembled cou sayll axid ayde lordes comons wynne agayne ye foresayd landes graunted wryters iii euery plough land thorough englande besyde ye subsydy ye spyrytuall landes hadde made redy belonged hys voyage heruest sayled normandy taryed tyll octobre folowynge spendynge tyme hys losse dyshonoure anno domini mcc anno domini mcci arnolde fyz arnolde balliui anno primo rycharde fyz darty mychelmas moneth october fyrste yere reygne kynge iohn trewce peace concluded betwene two kynges englande fraunce daye tyll mydsomer nexte folowynge lyke wyse betwene french kyng baldwyne erle flaundres thys yere made deuorce betwene kynge iohn hys wyfe erle glocetyrs doughter nerenesse bloode maryed vnto isabell doughter erle engolesym fraunce two sonny henry rychard iii doughters isabell elyanoure iane thys yere dyed london blessyd hugh byshop lyncoln conueyed owne chyrch enterryd god hath shewyd many myracles thys daye y authorysed chyrche saynte mydlent kyng iohn sayled agayne normandy ester mette kynge phylyppe betwene uernon yle audeley peace betwene realmes stablyshed co fermed terme theyr two lyues landes deuyded betwene two kynges eyther shuld holde theym contentyd theyr lyues shorte tyme lewys eldest son kynge phylyppe maryed dame blanch doughter alphons kynge castylle neuewe kynge iohn whyche lewys kyng iohn loue woman shewyd hym great bountye gaue vnto many ryche gyftes moneth iuly folowyng kyng iohn rode frauce receyued freche kynge wyth myche honour coueyed saynte denys receyued wyth processyon vppon morow frenche kyng accompanyed hym vnto parys receyued cytezens wyth great reuerece presentyd prouoste towne name hole cytye wyth ryche presentis kynge phylyppe festyd hym hys owne paleys gaue vnto hym hys lordes seruauntes many ryche gyftes conueyd hym forth citye toke leue hym moste louynge wyse kynge iohn hadde spedde mater normandy returned englande anno domini mcci anno domini mccii roger desert balliui anno secun iamys fyz barth ye moneth december seconde yere kynge iohn ranulphe erle chestre example afore shewed kynge iohn lefte hys owne wyfe named constau ce countesse brytayne whych maried counsayll kynge henry seconde wedded one clemens one cronycle sayth dyd wolde haue yssue sayd authour sayth hys opynyon dyspleased god greatly god wolde suffer hym haue none yssue rather dede dyed wythout thys tyme opynyon moste wryters people nacyon callyd tartares beganne theyr domynyon men dwellyd vnder hyllys inde yt belonged prester iohn chase self capitayn low byrth called dauid wyth wyues chyldren passed next countreys wyth robbynge spoylyng grew shortly great strength subdued partes many vycyne countreys grewe lastely vnto great domynyon lordshyppe eest partes worlde lately theyr prynce souerayne y called great cahan yere wytnessyth polycronycon kynge scottys dyd homage kynge iohn lyncoln sware vpon crosse hubert archbishoppe caunterbury presence legate rome xiii byshoppes trew lyege man hym hys heyres kynges yere one estate called abbot flay came englande amonge myracles hym shewyd blessed well besyde towne wye kent ye men woman drynkyng water curyd dyuerse maladyes lastly dyspleasyd byshoppes england yt glade leue lande sayled normandy anno domini mccii anno domini mcciii arnolde balliui anno iii rycharde moneth december ye thyrd yere iohns reygn prouynce yorke sene v moonys one eest seconde weste thyrd north ye fourth south fyfte set myddes yode vi tymes compassynge yt space howre vanyshed away soone thys yere moneth february kynge phylyp callyd parliamet uerdon yt amonge mater concluded kynge iohn hys lyege man shulde appere parlyamet holde paris wythin xv dayes eester next folowynge myche kynge iohn none hym apperyd shewe lawfull impedymet frenche kynge therfore entryd duchy normandy toke castellys bounte gentelyne gurnay seased hys handes suche landes hugh de gurnay held gaue vnto arture foresayde duke brytayne ouer gaue said arture ye coutye angeou two hundred prysoners certayne money defende sayde countrey agayn kynge iohn kynge iohn vnderstandynge cruell dealynge kynge phylyppe callyd counsayll asked ayde graunted new ayde wythstande frenche kynges malyce lammasse kyng fayre copany sayled normandye spedde hym countrey angeou myche enfourmed arture hys neuew duke brytayne warryd wythin toke hym prysoner certayne knyghtes syr hugh le bruns syr godfrey de losyngham wyth dyuerse whych tyme kynge phylyppe lay syege castell arques herynge thys dyscomfyture brake vp hys syege entent haue rescowyd sayde duke warned shulde come shorte chaunged purpose went vnto cytye towrys wanne yt strength wynter drew nere returned fraunce season also kynge iohn retourned wyth prysoners englande yere counsay l burgeysys cytye london chosen xxxv moste substancyall wyseste myn whyche called counsayll cytye whych yerely bailyuys chosen mayre shryues taken nomber anno domini mcciii anno domini mcciiii balliui normand blondell anno iiii iohn ely thys fourthe yere kynge iohn sene many wonderfull token ouer wynter whyche passyd length hardenesse many yeres gone wonderfull wederynge excedynge lyghtenynges thunder stormes wynde rayne appetyd therwyth hayle bygnesse hennes egges whyche perished frute corne besydes hurtes harmes done vppon house yong catell goynge brode also spyrites sene ayer lykenesse foulys berynge fyre theyr bylles whych sette fyre dyuerse house soone dyed hubert archbyshop caunterbury whose place chosen cotrarye mynde ye kynge partye couent cau terburye mayster stephan langton yt accordynge kynges pleasure named byshoppe norwyche thys eleccyon kynge greuousely amouyd agayne munkes wolde wyse alowe admyt theyr eleccyon wherfore sent theyr eleccyon vnto pope innocynt thyrde ye whyche admytted sayde mayster stephan refused sacryd hym uyterb citye italy sent hym letter comendacyon vnto kyng iohn take possessyon frutes benefyce kynge iohn wyth thys sore amouyd myche yt warned hym lande dyuers munkes caunterbury fauored hys cause aboute ester kynge iohn sayled normandye frenche kynge recommencyd warre countye guyan wanne therin dayly dyuerse stronge holdes castellys alleyd wyth hym erle alenson hadde great ayd portuyns brytons brought countrey vnder subieccyon retourned normandye wanne conket vale ruell yle audeley season forenamed pope sente abbot casmer fraunce refourme two prynces whome also accompanyed abbot cressons whyche endeuored theym nere agreed peace wolde frenche kynge shulde repayre amede suche house relygyon hurte ouerthrowen guyan place belongynge crowne englande therfore forsoke peace withstandyng kynge iohn lyke wyse shuld haue repayred lyke house apperteynynge vnto ye crowne fraunce frenche kynge ende auguste layde syege castell raydepount assauted yt terme xv dayes contynually soundyours wythin defendyd yt manfully slewe many theyr enymyes ye kynge phylyppe fayne gyue backe tyll hadde deuysed newe engynes warre fassyon reason wherof lastely wanne sayde castell toke xx knyghtes hundred vii yomen xxi arblasters hadde fortefyed castell wyth frenche men yode castell gaylarde layde hys ordynaunce hadde done laye moneth myghte yt hurte harme whych season kyng iohn warryd vppon borderer fraunce hys vyctoryes fynde lytle wryten anno domini mcciiii anno domini mccv water browne balliui anno v wyllyam chaumberleyn yere saye v yere kynge iohn reason vnreasonable wederynge last yere fell whete solde xv quarter kyng iohn somer folowyng maryed hys bastarde doughter vnto lewelin price walys gaue castell lorshippe elyngesmere beynge march south walys morgan land walys soon knyght apered deth one callid master moris hys lyues tyme hadde ben specyall louer frende whyche knyght dayes well letteryd vsyd hys recreacyon make versys wyth mayster morys one shulde begynne metyr shulde ende yt whyche tyme apperauce knyght sayde mayster moris mayster morys woll yt thou ende thys verse destruet hee regnum rex regum nay sayd mayster moris ende thou yt thou haste moste made hole thy selfe sayd knyght se thou arte olde slow wyll ende yt sefe destruct hoc regnum rex regum dupliciplage whyche verse maye englysshed foloweth kynge kynges lorde ruleth whose power thynges conteyned thys realme synne destroye shall wyth dowble plage therof ascertayned excepte people refrayned synne vertuous lyfe alye vyce vsyd utterly renye thys yere pope sente letter recommendacyon vnto kynge iohan shewynge hadde fauorablye harde hys proctours suche mater hadde layde agayne archebyshoppe caunterburye hys munkys shulde ryght admyttyd see sayde mater obieccyon hym hys courte thoughte insuffycyent therefore exorted wyllyd hym accepte sayde archebyshopppe hys grace suffre hym enioye frutes hys benefyce munkes hym exyled retourne vnto theyr proper abbay hys lordes frendes aduysed hym folowe pope mynde mouyd contrarye suche maner pope messenger returned wythoute spede theyr message yet haue ye harde frenche kynge laye castell gayllarde myght wynne yt space moneth wherfore sente newe ordynaunce assayled yt fyersly wythin xx dayes wanne sayd castell great losse men partyes toke prysoners wythin xxxvi knyghtes besyde nomber yomen arblasters done seasyd countrey strengthed sayde castell wyth hys owne men wyth great pryde returned fraunce anno domini mccv anno domini mccvi thomas haueryll balliui anno vi hamonde bronde season mychelmas vi yere reygn kyng iohn came downe streyght commaundement pope excepte kynge wolde peasybly suffer archbyshoppe caunterbury occupy hys see munkes theyr abbay thay ye land shulde enterdyted chargynge foure bishoppes folowyng saye wyllyam byshoppe london eustace byshoppe ely walter byshoppe wynchester gylys byshoppe herforde denounce kynge lande accursyd yf ye cumaundement dysobeyed foure byshops wyth assocyate made instaunte labour kynge obseruynge pope commaundement exchewe sensours chyrche vayne wherefore iiii sayed bysshoppes accordyng pope wrytynge sent morow folowynge ladye day annucyacyon xxvi daye marche denouncyd kynge iohn wyth realme englande accursyd shyt faste dores chyrches place dyuyne seruyce vsyd fyrste london placys wente thorough lande kyng thys dede amouyd wyth sayde foure byshoppes seased temporalty belongyng hys handes put theym fere forsoke land sayled archbyshop cau terburye thys yere oxeforde suff taken fyshe ye see forme lyke man kepte vi monethes vpon lande wyth rawe fleshe fyshe coude haue speche yt caste yt see agayne anno domini mccvi anno domini mccvii iohn walgraue balliui anno vii rycharde wynchester moneth noueber vii yere kynge one named hugh oysell treason lon drawen hanged thys yere ye moneth may french kynge entryd normandy wyth stroge power wanne castellys faloys dafyount danffrount seasyd landes sayde castell belongynge tyll came place called saynte mychaell parell see normannes sawe kynge phylyppe thus subdued stronge holdes normandye kynge iohn countrarye made defence ye capytayns co staunce bayoux bayon lyseux anreuches enroux yelded french kyng became hys lyege men possessyon substau ce duchye normandye excepte roan castellys kynge phylyppe seynge stronge holdes thus yeldyd vnto hym layed hys syege cyty roan hadde lyen season capytayne towne desyred respyte xxx day gyuynge pledge hostage yf cytye kynge iohn hys assygnes rescwyd wyth foresayde terme wolde yelde cytye vnto french kynge lyke wyse appoyntement taken castellys named arquys uermeyll whyche tyme socoure came cytye castellys delyueryd frenche kynges handes thus hadde thys seconde phylyppe possessyon normandye whyche frenche kynge hadde sen tyme charlys symple whyche gaue duchye rollo leder normannys wyth gylla hys doughter maryge synne whyche tyme hadde passed ouer iii hundred yeres frenche kynge thus brought subiccyon ye duchye normandye saynt laurence tyde yode countye guyan wanne cytye poytyers wyth castellys townes sayde cytye belongynge hadde sette countrey order rule spedde hym fraunce wyth great pompe glory y affermed authours frenche kynge made thys warre vppon kynge iohn excytynge pope hys contumacye agane chyrche thys yere also communycacyon peace hadde betwene kynge iohn archebyshope caunterbury dryuen nere poynte accorde except restitucyon kynge iohn shulde haue made archebysshop bishoppes offycers hadde taken tyme theyr absence whych restytucyon kynge iohn wyse wold agreable wherfore sayd communycacyon toke none affecte thys communycacyon kynge iohn frette wyth malyce fury let proclayme sondry placys hys realme suche personys hadde landes possessyons wythin englande spyrytuall temporall shulde returne englande mychelmas next folowynge ellys clerely excludyd suche landes ouer streyght commaundement gyuen eueryche officer countrey make besye serche yf wrytynges broughte courte rome prelate thys realme yf suche founden brynge hym wrytynges kynges presence ouer shuld sease kynges vse suche landes person gyuen sayde archbyshoppe pryour caunterbury syn tyme eleccyon sayd archebyshoppe woodes fellyd solde haste anno domini mccvii anno domini mccviii roger wynchester balliui anno viii edmunde hardell uppon fyrste daye moneth october viii yere ye reygne kyng fyrst sonne henry name borne dame isabell second wyfe cytye wynchester thys yere rebellyd irysheme dyd myche harme countrey whych rebellyon wryters myche kynge wolde haue leuyed greuous taskys haue made warre wyth vppon french kynge lengthe greuyd dyspleasyd kyng wyse fayne sette taske thorough hys land oppresse theyr malyce ouer asked whyte munkes england vi thousande marke excused theyr generall hedde kynge toke wyth theym great dyspleasure reason wherof retourne oute irlande vexyd theym sore gatheryd theym hadde desyred caused abbottys forsake theyr house wyth puyssaunte armye wente irelande shortely subdued theym hadde sette countrey rule retourned englande anno domini mccviii anno domini mccix serle mercer balliui anno ix hugh saynt albon ix yere kyng consyderynge great losse whych susteyned freche kyng normandy also angeou poyteau made uysyon thynges belongynge warre mydsomer sayled ouer see landed rochell poyteau wyth myghty hoste whyche season frenche kynge thymon fortyfyed yt wyth also castellys london myrable ye town poytyers whyche lytle wonne wythoute taryenge returned fraunce kynge iohn herynge frenche kynges departynge sped angiers wanne towne wyth lytle payne destroyed ye sayd towne thyther came hym vycout thonars whyche drede become frenche kynges man ayde kynge iohn recoueryd parte countrey thys meane whyle kynge phylyppe gatheryd new hoste herynge vnstedfastnes vycout thonars entryd ye landes sayde vycounte wasted spoyled countrey withoute pyty kynge iohn spedde hym towarde frenche kynge shorte processe tyme two hostys wythin lytle dystaunce meane fortune saye meane therof y expressyd two kynges toke peace two yeres folowynge eyther theym retourned owne countrey yere pope beyng ascerteyned ye cruelnesse kyng iohn executed agayne whyte munkes hys lande also obstynacye perseuered agayne holy chyrche sent done new commyssyon vertue wherof curse enterdytynge newly denoucyd manyfestyd sondry place england ouer pope authoryte sayde bulle assoyled acquyted lordes englad well spyrytuall temporall homage feauty ryght owyd kynge entent shulde aryse agayne hym depryue hym kyngly honour myght moue kynge hys errour feast saynt medard moneth iuny later ende foresayd ix yere forenamed bayllyues admytted ye offyce olde meane roger wynchester edmunde hardell dischargyd myche wythstode kinges purueyour whete wold suffer conuey certayn mesures whete oute cytye tyll cytye storyd thys kynge toke dyspleasure sent downe streyght comaundement vnto xxxv heddes ruler cytye shulde dyscharge sayde two bayllyuys put theym pryson tyll knewe kynges pleasure wherfore sayd xxv person toke aduyse appoynted certayne theym selfe wyth rode kynge beynge langley empeter grace sayde bayllyues shewynge forther season dystresse ye cyty common people lyke haue made insurreccyon whyche meanes frendeshyppe whyche court kynge satysfyed releasyd theym pryson short tyme cytesyns london made sute kyng graunted ye kynges letter patentesfyrst mayred yryffe shuld yerely chose self mayre two shryues whyche graunte theym confermyd amonge self ordeyned two shryues shulde chosen yerely vppon saynte mathewes daye ix dayes mychelmas vppon michelmas daye take theyr charge mayre chosen vppon daye chargyd wyth vppon sayde daye mychelmas yt yt otherwyse orderyd anno domini mccix anno domini mccx primus maior peter duke henry fyz alwyn anno x thomas neell daye saynte mychael archaugell x yere kynge iohn henry sonne alwyne sworne charged fyrst mayre london peter duke wyth thomas neell sworn shryues name bayllyues daye clerely auoyded wyth sayde cytye daye forewarde also thys tyme brydge ouer thamys lodon made tymber ruled guydyd repayred fraternyte college prestes yere great ayde cytesyns london passyng way sayde brydge begonne edyfyed stone thys yere ye monastery saynte mary ouereys south warke begonne buylded thys yere pope sente two legate writer one legate named pandulphus whyche popys name many sore wordes monycyon obedience kynge iohn charged hym suffre archebyshoppe caunterburye wyth pryour munkes enioy theyr ryghtes possessyons wythin englande taryed certayne tyme brynge hys purpose aboute vayne yode agayn rome wythout releasynge enterdytynge ye maner enterdyccyon lande haue sene dyuerse opynyons ye saye lande enterdyted thorouly chyrches housys relygyon closyd vsed masse dyuyne seruyce reason none vii sacrametes terme shulde minystred occupyed chylde crystenyd man confessyd maryed yt streyghte dyuerse place englande whyche occupyed wyth dyuyne seruyce season lycence purchasyd also chyldren crystyned thorough land men houselyd anelyd excepte suche persones excepted name bull knowe mayteyners kynges yll entent anno domini mccx anno domini mccxi peter yonge henry fyz alwyn anno xii wyllyam elande yere whych xi yere kynge iohn mydsomer terme trewce fylly runne kynge phylyppe wyth stronge hoste entryd countye guyan made newe warre vpon vycounte thonars toke hys castell called parteny wyth dyuerse stronge holdes ye sayd vycounte belongynge mannyd theym wyth frenche men ordeyned one guyllyam de roches marshall fraunce chefe ruler countrey retourned fraunce yt longe kynge departed sayd vycount thonars made sharpe warre vpon frenchemen power myght make recoueryd parte hys lande one daye hadde wonne lytle holde taken therin certayne prysoners retourne towarde hys holde lodged supprysed wyth forenamed guyllyam de roches great multytude frenchemen ye whyche longe fyght fynally taken wyth syr hyugh thonars hys brother syr aymery de lesyngnam sonne erle poytyers nomber l persones copany ye whyche prysoners sent vnto ye frenche kyng anno domini mccxi anno domini mccxii adam whetley henry fyz alwyne anno xii stephan le graas xii yere kyng iohn pope sente agayne pandulphe legate monyshed kynge sharpe maner shuld receyue mayster stephan langton hys benefyce see caunterbury pryour wyth hys munkes vnto theyr abbay ye kyng callynge mynde daugers whiche wrappyd wythin hys owne realme also normandy hurtes whyche dayly grew hym made promyse othe wold obedyent vnto courte rome stande obey thynge court woll adiudge hym upon whyche promyse made legate sent knowlege vnto pope commaundement hym shulde bynde kynge artycles folowynge fyrste shuld peasybly suffer ye forenamed mayster stephan langton entre land enioye archebyshopryche caunterburye wyth profytes frutes belongynge secondaryly shulde lyke maner forme receyue pryour caunterburye hys munkys wyth tyme exyled archbyshoppes cause tyme vex punyshe sayde persones spyrytuall temporall cause thyrdely shulde restore vnto sayd archbyshop ye goodes tyme taken hys offycers syn tyme thys varyance growynge fourthly shulde yelde vp handes pope ryght tytle hadde vnto crowne englande wyth reueneus honoures profytes belongyng well temporall spyrytuall hold yt euer hys heyres pope successours feodaryes pope artycles graunted lordes lande sworne mayntenaunce kynge knelyng vpon hys knee toke crown hys hedde sayde wordes folowynge legate delyuerynge hym crowne resygne vp crowne realme englande irlande pope handes innocent thyrd put holy hys mercy ordynaunce rehersall wordes pamdulphe toke crowne kynge kepte possessyon therof v dayes token possessyon sayde realme england whe ye sayd v day expyred kyng resumyd ye crowne pandulphe vertue band instrument made vnto pope ye whyche length sette cronycle englande place wherof effecte yt sayde kynge iohn heyres shuld euer feodaryes vnto forenamyd pope innocent hys lawfull successours popys rome pay yerely chyrche rome thousande marke syluer y saye englande vii h ndred marke irlande iii hundred marke yf hys heyr fayled brake paymet shulde fayle theyr ryghte crowne polycronycon sayth vii hudred marke englande two hundred marke irlande whyche summes affyrmaunce authour guydo money called peter pen peter pen thys daye gatheryd sondry place englande anno domini mccxii anno domini mccxiii iosne fyz pet henry fyz aleyn anno xiii iohn garlonde xiii yere kyng ihon moneth february mayster stephan langton archebyshop caunterbury wyth exylys landed englande processe tyme met wyth kynge wynchester kyng receyuyd hym ioyouse coutenauce assoyled sayde archebyshop yet interdiccyon land releasyd myche kyng day hadde made restitucyon vnto archbyshope accordynge thyrde artycle rehersyd whych testyfyeth englyshe boke payed vnto archbyshoppe thre thousande marke partyculers xv thousande marke whyche thynges performed done interdyccyon adnullyd fordone moneth iuly yere lord xii hundred xii yt standen force full vi yeres mych xxvi daye vnto moneth iuly whyche vppon iii monethes odde dayes anno domini mccxiii anno domini mccxiiii raufe eylande henry fyz alwyn anno xiiii constantyne le iosne thys xiiii yere kyng wolde holde lawes saynte edwarde also displeasure bare diuers wolde fauoure hym agayne pope cause whyche manyfestyd kyng fell dyssencyon hys lordes mych great people reysyd eyther partyes kynges partye stronger erle chester lordes toke cytye london helde therin certayn tyme whych cronycle caxton wyth sayen great parte varyauce betwene kyng iohn baron kynge wolde wythout skylfull dome haue exyled sayde erle chester whyche hym hadde cause myche season hadde often tymes aduysed kynge leue hys cruelnesse accustomed auowtry whych exercysyd wyth brother wyfe meanes archebyshoppe caunterbury prelatys peace taken whyle yere vppon daye translacyon saynt benet ye xi day iuly great parte borough southwarke brent moneth auguste nexte folowynge great myche harme done london fyre soone stablyshe peace betwene kynge hys lordes assemble made berham downe kynge lordes mette wyth great strenght vpon eyther syde charter wrytyng dyuysed made sealyd kynge baronye wyth yt contentyd departyd peasyble wyse eueryche man hys countrey anno domini mccxiiii anno domini mccxv martyne fyz alys roger fyz aleyn anno xv peter batte thys xv yere kynge peace whych laste yere betwene kyng iohn baronyes agreed kynge vyolate broken wherfore lordes assembled great power made sharpe cruell warre vppon kynge myche constrayned sende normandye ayde socoure place shortely came englande norman knyghte whyche brought wyth hym companye normannes flemmynges pycardes knyght capitayn named foukes de brent ye whiche wyth company cruell destroyed well relygyous house wrought mych harme lande putte lordes worse kynge made foukes hys company wardeyns castellys struge holdes englad lordes seyng kynge perseuer hys wronge wolde wyse enduced holde owne grauntes execute thynge pleasure nothynge lawe iustyce cast theyr myndes howe myghte brynge lande better rule state one aduyse consent wrote vnto phylyp kyng frauce wolde sende noble man englande wolde rendre ye lande vnto hym whyle kyng iohn causid drawen hangyd london one pyers pomfrette sayde peter monyshed dyuers mysse happes shulde come hym vycyous lyfe also often warned kynge iohn shuld reygn xiiii yeres whyche ment wythout payenge trybute become feodary pope thought pope reygned pryncypall lorde land whyche malyce putte vertuous man deth ye xxxiii chapiter vii boke policronycon many vertues shewed ouer passe lengthynge tyme anno domini mccxv anno domini mccxvi salomon basynge roger fyz aleyn anno xvi hugh basynge uppon saynt andrewes euen xxix daye nouember xvi yere hys reygne kynge iohn lyen certayne tyme wyth hys ordynaunce aboute castell rouchester kent wanne sayde castell toke therin certayne gentylmen hadde conspyred agayne hym whyche sente dyuers prysons baron helde theym gyther london abydynge commynge lewys son frenche kynge whyche nere ascencyon tyde landed englande wyth stronge armye came rochester layd syege castell wane yt wyth lytle payne mych yt greatly febled wyth assaurys lately made kynge iohn syn tyme suffycyently repayred wonne sayde castell caused straungers therein taken hanged came london certayne allyaunces couenauntes stablished betwene lordes hym receyued homage affermeth policronicon theyr mater betwen fynyshed lordes departed london gatte castellys rygat gylforde frenham then wynchester cytye yelden vnto wyth holdes castellys wolnesey odyham beawmere saynte margaretes daye wyth lordes came agayne london whose commynge towre london gyuen vp theym appoyntement roger fyz aleyn hadde tyll tyme rulyd cytye london mayre myche accusyd lordes fauorable kynges partye dyscarged offyce one called serle mercer chosen hys place cotynued tyll mychelmas folowynge thys passe tyme kynge iohn beynge thus ouer sette wyth hys lordes sent messenger ye pope shewynge hym rebellyon hys lordes laboryd hys destruccyon wherfore pope haste sent legate englande named gualo swalo whyche hys commynge commaunded lewys returne fraunce laboryd vttermost power appease kynge hys baronye hys laboure vayne anno domini mccxvi anno domini mccvxii iohn trauers wyllyam hardell anno xvii andrewe newlande thys xvii yere kynge iohan warre betwene hym lordes styll contynuynge dyed flyxe testyfyeth polylycronycon towne newerke vppon daye saynte calyxte pope xiiii day october yt englyshe boke cronycle sayeth dyed sebynyshede abbay aboute lyncoln impoysonynge munke house daye saynte luke xviii daye october buryed cytye wynchester authour policronycon sayth bowelled crongthon abbaye buryed worceter myddle quyer munkes hadde reygned xvi yeres vi monethis iiii dayes leuynge hym two sonnes henry rycharde wyth sondry doughters thys iohn yt redde founded abbay belewe new forest recompensacyon pa ysh chyrches ouer turnyd enlarge forest abbay blacke munkes cytye wynchester ye sayeng englyshe cronycle shulde buryed kynge iohn also wryters maryed one hys doughters vnto otto fourth ye name emperour almayne duke saxony whyche helde warre agayne kynge phylyppe fraunce v chapyter storye sayde phylyp declared whyche otto hys rapyne extorcyon done chyrch rome accursyd sayd phylyp also kynge iohn theyr dysobedyence chyrche also accursyd whyche warred eyther wyth eyther greuyd vexid great hynderaucis eyther whyche consyderacyon metrycyan made balades foloweth quam mirabilia good lorde thy workes punyshement synners thy myght wondersly old storyes yt playnely seen one synner hath correcte vtterly alexander wyth iulius pompey tholomy many whych thy scourgys punyshe synners theym self also dere lyke wyse nowe reader yf thou lyste take hyde well reuolue mynde thys hystorye thre prynces loke well theyr dede thou shalte conceyue dyd wyckydly meane kynge iohn phylyppe ottony whyche vnto synne made selfe thrall pope innocent accursyd wherfore god sufferyd one greue warre chase wyth dedely hate stryfe glad one mischeue manassynge eche wyth spere sworde knyfe wyth cruell batayll durynge theyr synfull lyfe wherfore maye conclude factis horum multa sunt flagellum peccatoru henry thyrde ye name eldest son kyng iohn chylde age ix yeres beganne hys reygne ouer realm englande xx daye moneth october yere lorde two hundred xvi xxxvi yere seconde phylyp yet kyng fraunce ye haue harde cruell warre whyche lewys son vnto frenche kynge wyth ayde barony englande maynteynyd agayne kynge iohn whyche deth sayde iohn contynued mych lordes hadde maynteyned quarell lewis forsoke hym toke parte henry theyr naturall souerayne lorde wherof chefe erles penbroke chester whych wyth theyr retynewe helde sharpe warre wyth sayde lewys affynyte whych entedyd haue ben kynge englande reason couenautes made wyth certayne lordes lande fyrste sent wherfore forsayd erles wyth theyr partye make theyr partye stroger proclaymed sayde henry kynge englande vppon foresayde xx daye octobre thorough cytye london possyble haste made prouysyon hys coronacyon vppon daye symonde iude next ensuynge crowned glouceter peter byshoppe wynchester lewys frenche kynges son beynge lyncolne yere stode styll gouernoure cytye london tyll mychelmas nexte folowynge anno domini mccxvii anno domini mccxviii iohn trauers wyllyam hardell anno andrewe newlande soone kynge crowned comyssyons sent ouer name place englande gather strength men wythstand forenamed lewys put hym wyth frenche men allyaunces land whych hadde vnder theyr rule custodye castellys berkhamsted hertford dyuers thys lewys wold sease hys warre retourne fraunce therfore foresayd gwalo swalo popys legate accursyd hym fyrste name hym maynteyned fauored thys warre agayne kynge henry forenamed erlys accompanyed wyth wyllyam erle marshall englande wyllyam le bruyz erle ferry wyth many yode lyncolne wanne town vppon straugers slayne french man called erle perch wyth many souldyours take englyshme serle erle wynchester hu ryde bohum erle herforde wyth dyuerse name thys whyle lewelyn prynce walis ayded partye lewys accursyd lande enterdyted towne lyncolne thus wone frenchman lewys wyth parte souldyours drewe towarde london myche word brought hym fader sent hym new company souldyours whyche shulde lande englande shortely trouth yt ayde souldyours made freche kyng comyttyd capytayn whyche cronycle named eustace muke whych encoutryd vpon see capytayn mayster v portis called hubert burgh gaue hym batayll scomfyght hym length sent hed ye sayd eustace vnto ye kynge lewys harde tydyuges consydered howe dayly strength mynyshed inclynable vnto peace ye coclusion toke money sayth policronica yelded vp castellis strengthis held assoyled returned frauce money ye lewis receyued ben diuers opinyons englyshe boke namyth yt thousande marke frenche boke sayth xvm marke anno domini mccxviii anno domini mccxix thomas bokerell robert serle anno ii rafe gylande thys seconde yere kynge henry lande voyded stranger inquysycyons made knowe persones hadde fauored partye lewys agayne kynge whyche kynge pardonyd many lay fee ye spyrytuall put suche fynes ye compellyd laye myghte pledge please kynge ouer sue rome assoylyd thys yere ranulphe erle chester consyderacyons hym mouynge toke hys iourney holy lande one cronycle sayth toke iourney vppon hym myche hadde contrarye
