hys allegeaunce made homage vnto lewis aboue named malyce whych bare towarde kynge iohn entendyd tyme homage doynge haue made sayde lewys kynge englande anno domini mccxix anno domini mccxx benetle ceytur robert serle anno iii wyllyam blounde thys thyrde yere kynge henry parlyament holden london vertue wherof graunted kynge ii euery plough lande thorough england whych ye charge wyth lewys warre also yere saynt thomas caunterbury traslated vii day moneth iuly whyche done wyth great charge vnto mayster stephan langton archibishop caunterbury charge therof contented many yeres ye deth said stephan thys yere wytnessyth polycronycon kynge henry began new worke chyrche westmynster whyche sayenge shuld xii yere hys age anno domini mccxx anno domini mccxxi iohn wayle robert serle anno iiii iosnele spycer thys yere alexander kynge scottes maryed dame iane iohan syster kynge henry yere great harme done englande vyolence whyrlewynde fyry dragon spyrytys sene fleynge ayer yere proclamacyons made london thorough englande ye straungers shuld auoyde lande mychelmasse next folowyng except came wyth marchaudyse make sale vnder kynges saufe coduyt chefely made auoyde foukes de brent complycys whyche kepte castell bedforde agayne kynges wyll pleasure thys yere kynge henry secondaryly crowned westmynster xvii daye may thys yere cytye called dama holy land crysten men gotten turkys thys yere came holy lande englande ranulphe erle chester beganne buyld castellys charteley bestone buylded abbay delartesse ye whyte der charge coste whyche sayde castellys abbay toke toll thorough hys lordshyp passyd ye way wyth chafire marchaundyse anno domini mccxii anno domini mccxxii rycharde wymbeday robert serle anno v iohn wayell thys v yere kynge henry oxenforde holden generall cousayll byshoppes clergye thys lande tyme whyche counsayle man taken whyche shewyd hym selfe cryste preached many thynges errour whyche clerkes dayes vsyd approue iesus sonne god comen refourme errours shewyd carectys token woundes hys bodye handes fete like iesus nayled crosse apposyd approuyd false dyssymuler wherfore dome ye counsayll iudgyd nayled crosse delyueryd executours whyche place callyd alburburye nayled hym crosse tyll dede also yere kynge layde syege vnto castell bedforde fowkys de brent hadde longe holden strength thys syege beganne vppon euen assencyon lorde contynued tyll lady daye assumpcyon whyche passetyme many stronge assautys made great losse men bothe partyes fynally aboute thys foresayde daye assumpcyon yt taken fyerse assaute wherein taken forenamed fowkys de brent vpon nober lxxx souldyours wherof parte put deth sayde fowkys lyen certayne tyme pryson fynaunce delyueryd flemyd lande yere came frere mynors fyrst englande graye freres order saynte fraunces whych yf trewe shulde come englande vppon vi yeres deth saynt fraunces affyrmaunce authoure cronica cronicarum iacobus philippus saynte fraunces dyed yere grace xii hudred xxvii order fyrst confyrmed honorius thyrde name pope rome yere grace xii hundred xxiiii thys order fyrste beganne vnder fewe nomber frerys cytye caunterbury came vnto london restyd theym tyll hadde house foundyd isabell wyfe edwarde seconde shall shewyd storye sayde edwarde yt sayde house begonne margarete wyfe edwarde fyrste anno domini mccxxii anno domini mccxxiii rycharde renger robert serle anno vi ioseus le iosne thys vi yere reygne kynge henry conspyracy made one constantyne sonne arnulphe wythin cytye london whyche drawen haged morow folowynge lady daye assumpcyon conspyracy dysclosed cytezyn named walter bokerell heynous greuous ye king mynde purpose haue throwen downe ye wally cytye well conceyued persones whych enteded cospiracy rascallys cytye none ye heddys ruler therunto consentynge aswagyd hys ire greuouse dyspleasure whych entendyd towarde cytye anno domini mccxxiii anno domini mccxxiiii rycharde iyoner robert serle anno vii thomas lamberde seuenth yere iohan kynge hierusalem came englande requyred ayde kyng henry wynne agayne holy cytye retourned wyth small comforte tyme iohn sonne dauid erle angwyshe scotland nere kynnesman vnto ranulphe chester maryed doughter lewelyn prynce walys yt fynall accorde betwene sayde lewelyne ranulphe euer contynued anno domini mccxxiiii anno domini mccxxv wyllyam ioynour rycharde reynger anno viii thomas lamberte thys viii yere kyng henry parlyament holden among thynges lordes baronye lande graunted vnto kynge heyres kyngesthe graut warde maryage warde mariage theyr heyres dede lerned men called initium maloru meane begynnynge yllys harmes anno pope wherfore soon toke two cardynallys dyuers prelatys goynge generall counsayle kepte sayd pope place callyd spolete cytye italye anno domini mccxxvi anno domini mccxxvii roger duke rycharde renger anno domini mccxxviii stephan bokerell roger duke anno xi henry cobham thys xi yere thys kynge henry shyrywyke london mydd lettyne ferme summe iii hundred poude yere shryues london xviii daye february yere graunted kynge werys thamys shulde plucked vppe destroyed euer xvi daye marche folowynge kynge grau ted hys charter ensealyd cytyzens london shulde passe toll free thorough englande yf cytezyns costrayned cytye borough towne england paye toll yt shryues london attache man commynge london sayde cytye borough towne suche toll payed hym hys goody wythholde kepe tyll cytesyners london restoryd suche money payed sayde tolle wyth costes damagys sustayned xviii daye auguste folowynge kyng grauted ye sayd cytesyns london wareyn meane cytesyns haue free lybertye huntynge certayne cyrcuyte aboute london thys yere towne lymosyn wyth dyuers holdes pyerregot aluerne countye guyan geuen vppe forenamed lewys frenche kynge wherfore kynge sente ouer hys brother rycharde erle cornewayll shortely whyche landed burdeaux wyth iii hundred saylles anno domini mccxxviii anno domini mccxxix stephan bokerell roger duke anno xii henry cobham begynnyge thys xii yere kynge henry mayster stephan langton archbyshoppe caunterburye dyed great deane paulys mayster rycharde wethyrshed hys successour thys tyme fraunchyse lybertyes citye kyng confyrmyd eueryche ye sheryues grauted haue ii clerkes ii officer wythout mo citesyns lodon also grauted thys yere shuld haue vse common seale yere rycharde erle cornewayll besyeged town saynt machayre guyan whan hadde wonne yt strength layed hys syege ye town rochell tyll yt restoryd marshall fraunce anno domini mccxxix anno domini mccxxx walter wynchester roger duke anno xiii robert fyz iohn xiii yere kynge henry vppon trynyte sondaye authour vpon whyt sondaye whyle byshoppe london hygh masse saynte paulys chyrch lodon fell sodeynly suche thyckenesse darkenesse cloudes therwyth suche stenche tempeste thunder lyghtenynge people assemblyd voyded chyrche vycaryes chanons forsoke theyr deskys byshoppe remayned great fere alone excepte fewe menyall seruauntys suche attendyd vpon hym aulter also thys yere fame blessyd woman elyzabeth doughter kynge hungarye beganne spredde whyche deth husbande langraue duke thorynge almayne shamyd crystes sake weshe sorys bylys lazar poore men besyde manyfolde dedes charyte vertue whyche blessyd vertuouse lyfe lyfe thoroughe power god shewed many dyuerse myracles among whyche prayer xvi men deth lyfe arreryd man borne blynde syght restoryd wherfore gregorye ix name pope rome amonge college blessed whyche founde prouyd preiudycyall hurtefull common weale sayde citye anno domini mccxxxi anno domini mccxxxii mychaell saynte elene roger duke anno v walter denfelde xv yere kynge grauted tyll hym quindecim fyftene temporaltye dyme halfe spyrytualty recouer hys lades loste normandy guyan poyteau yere huberte burgth yt daye chefe iustyce englande hadde greuyd dyspleased kynge suche wyse compellyd fle kynges syght strayghtly pursued yt taken chapell brentwood essex cast pryson kynges commaudement labour blessyd byshop edmunde pountenay recocylyd kynges fauour ben prysoned vppon iiii monethes exyled vppon xiii monethis yere done grete harme london fyre whych beganne house widowe named dame iane lambert anno domini mccxxxii anno domini mccxxxiii henry eldementon andrew bukerell anno xvi gerarde batte xvi yere kynge henry vppon complaynt brought hym frendes lewelyn prynce walys ye willyam le bruce brunze shuld cospyre agayne kynge kepte vnlawfully wyfe forenamyd hauylyn longe prysonement hanged yere dyed ranulphe erle chester lyncolne hutyngedon systers son named iohn sonne vnto erle angwyshe ye vii yere kyng declared heyre helde lordshyp hym iohn moste wryters called iohn scot myche father scotte foresayd ranulphe hadde chylde yt hadde iiii systers eldeste hyght molde mawde maryed dauid erle angwyshe moder ye foresayde iohn scot seconde named hawys maryed vnto erle iohn scotte hys heyre wolde haue noble lordshyppe runne amonge dyuyded betwene many dystanys thys yere dyed mayster rycharde wethyrshed archbyshoppe caunterburye whose successour blessyd edmunde daye ianuary edmunde archbysshoppe caunterburye spowsyd kynge eleanoure doughter erle prouynce cytye caunterburye vtas sayde hyllary crowned westmynster quene englande felde westmynster lyenge weste antecessours chester affyrmeth policronycon also sayth dyed wythout chylde foresayd exchaunge made wyth forenamed systers ranulphe expressyd ye xvi yere kyng anno domini mccxxxvii anno domini one daye passed thorough oxenford scolars sought occasyon agayn seruauntes fought wyth slew one put legate suche fere sauegarde toke ye belfray osney helde hym tyll kynges mynysters comynge abyndon wyth strength medelyd fayre wordes deliueryd conueyed hym wyth competente companye vnto walyngford accursyd misdoers punyshed theym suche wyse regentes maysters vnyuersyte lastely compellyd go barefote thorough chepe paulys london aske hym forgyues hadde trespace wyth great dyffyculte forgyuen anno domini mccxxxviii anno domini mccxxxix iohn whylhale rycharde renger anno xxii iohn goundresse thys xxii yere false clerke foresayde vnyuersyte oxenforde whyche feyned hym selfe madde beforetyme espyed secret place kinges court came wyndowe towarde kinges chamber hys maner woodstoke entendynge haue slayne kynge espyed woman taken conueyed couentre arreygnyd dede lawfull prouys hys malycyous entent made drawen hanged thys yere vppon euen saynte botolphe xxvi daye iuny borne one symode fyz mary whych xvii yere kynge ben offyce purchased comaundement kynge dyrected mayre ruler cytye yt shulde cause hym electe offyce yere folowynge mayre wyth heddes cytye consyderynge commaundement derogacyon vnto lybertyes ye cytye wythstode yt chase forenamed rafe ashwy put sayde symonde whyche complayned hym kynge kynge sente mayre ruler city hadde vnto theym many wordes dyspleasure dysobeyenge comaundement fardermore discharged willyam ioynour yere agayne chosen newely mayre yere folowynge chargyd cytesyns procede newe eleccyon theyr mayre whyche satysfye kynges pleasure chase gerarde batte whose meany good polycye sayde mayr wyth cytesyns demeaned theym well kynge obteyned hys gracious fauour causyd forsayde symonde fayle purpose admyttyd offyce tyll hadde submyttyd hym rule mayre ruler cytye whyche symonde behaued well admyttyd alderman short processe demeanyd yll contraryously vnto weale good order cytye dyscharged hys aldermanshyp dyschargyd rule counsayll cytye xxxiiii yere thys kynge folowynge touched anno domini mccxl anno domini mccxli iohn gysors gerarde batte anno xxiiii mychaell tony thys xxiiii yere kynge henry saynte paulys chyrch london newely halowyd great chaan tartary seconde yere kynge iohn myndyd touched theyr begynnynge thys yere turkys wonne myche eest landes sent hoste lande hugary whych held people countrey shorte witnessyth authour policronica constrayned necessyte ete theyr chyldren vnlefull metys authoure cronica cronicarum sayth mysery fell peple hungary yere lorde xii hundred xxi whyche sayenge shulde fyfte yere thys kynge anno domini mccxli anno domini mccxlii iohn uyoll remonde bengley anno xxv thomas duresyne xxv yere kynge henry gerarde batte agayn chosen mayre present yere whose eleccyon worshipfull citye conueyed vnto woodstoke presentyd custome vnto kynge kynge enfourmed hys laste yeres dealynge suche ought hym good wyll sayde wolde admytte hym offyce tyll tyme came westmynster wyth whyche answere sayde gerarde wyth companye returned vnto london longe kyng came westmynster accordynge theyr dutye cytesyns london agayn awayted vppon kynge know pleasurethe presence kynge callyd hym sayde mayre certayne questyons hym put caused hym sworne presence whyche othe hym geuen kynge charged hym vertue shulde take baker bruers vytellars cytye xl pounde whyche predecessours also laste yere hadde taken also incontynently hys commynge london shuld restore vnto sayd vytellars cytesyns suche money hadde wyth wronge precedyng yere taken comynaltye citye sayde gerarde allegyd hym certayne consideracyons sechynge kynge pardon hym restytucyon kynge dyspleasure swore great othe shulde yere mayre tyme common certyfyed kynges pleasure chase place stede reyner de bungaye yere kynge yode walys wherof herynge dauid prynce walys mette wyth kyng ruthlande submyttyd hym kynges grace also yere blessyd edmunde archebyshoppe caunterbury beynge pountnay prouynce burgoyne dyed buryed translatyd ye place within x yeres deth commaundement innocent fourthe pope rome manyfolde myracles whyche god shewyd hym hys deth yt hys legende yt shewyd dyed twentye myle pountnay called soly buryed translated poutnay blessed man polycronycon shewyth many vertuyes xxxv chapiter vii boke whyche ouer passe lengthynge tyme thys yere one wyllyam marshe london treason drawen hanged fyrst older men london thys yere also alder men fyrste chosen wythin cytye london whyche hadde rule cytye wardes yerely chau gyd shryues chauged anno domini mccxlii anno domini mccxliii iohn fyz iohn remonde bongley anno xxvi rafe ashewy xxvi yere kyng henry bonyface sacryd archbyshoppe caunterbury yere kyng wyth fayre company saylyd normandy whyche vyage sayth ye frenche cronycle made styrynge frenche man named erle marche myche ye sayd erle refusyd homage vnto alphons brother vnto lewys x name surnamed saynte lewys kynge fraunce thys lewys yere hadde maryed sayde brother vnto doughter erle tholouse hadde gyuen sayde brother erledome poyteau wyth landes aluerne reason wherof wold haue causyd sayd erle marche haue done homage vnto sayde alphos landes sayd erle held sayde erledome poytyers ye sayd erle marche knew well ryght guyan belongyd kinge england therfore allyaunces made bewene kynge henry hym refusyd doynge homage came kynge henry excytyd hym make warre vppon frenche kynge reason wherof kynge made prouysyon landed stronge power burdeaux affyrmaunce frenche boke erle marchis maryed mother kyng henry folowyth whyle frenche kynge warryd vppon ye landes erle marche hadde wone ii castellys named fouteneys uyllers wyth dyuerse whych passe ouer beten downe storyd new soudyours went vnto castel named maucoune brake brydge myche warned kynge englande nere vnto hym sayd brydge lyttell skyrmyshe lytle harme done frenche kynge toke way ouer ryuer tharent towarde taylbourgh wastyng destroyenge countrey went forth towarde town callyd saynces kynge henry wyth hys hoste made towarde hym al myght kepyng course vawarde kynge encountryd wyth erle boleyne whyche vppon frenche kyngys partye season erle saynces bare banner ye erle march beyng ye vaward kynge betwene two erles sore fyght many man vppon partyes slayn among whych sayde erle saynces slayne came bothe strengthes vppon eyther syde kynges fought batayll great slaughter men vppon sydes ende frenche men vyctours toke prysoners xxii men name knyghtes hygher degre iii clerkes great fame ryches besyde nomber v hudred meane people wytnessyth frenche boke men name yet ryche clerkes none named yet shewyd good payed theyr raosome wherfore lyste wryte farther great victory yt sayd boke sayth farther kyng henry fere tourned backe vnto burdeaux made meanes kynge fraunce peace thys fynde worde englyshe cronycles erle march meane sonne reconcyled vnto frenche kynge amd restoryd hys landes excepte thre castellys whyche named mespyne cretaye estardye whyche frenche kynge retayned owne possessyon soone came vnto frenche kynge lordes castellys myrabell mortaynge submyttynge theym also vnto kynges grace besechyng hym pardon hadde hygh dyspleasure fauored hys enymy kynge englande came dyuerse lordes capytaynes possessyon countrey guyan poyteau vnto ye ryuer gyroude haue rehersyd thys cronycle fraunce entente reders may well apperceyue pryde boste frechmen theyr wrytynge come mater soudyth thynge theyr honour yt wryten lengest shewyng maner theyr honour worshyppe haue sayde v capyter storye ii phylyppe kynge fraunce yf yt sound thynge theyr dyshonour shall yt abreuyatyd hyd trouth shall knowen appereth well theyr wrytynge ye vii yere kyng iohn yt shewyd howe phylyppe seconde kynge fraunce wonne normandy guyan yet thys daye thys kynge lewys warryd agayne countrey euer tell wynnyng touche nothynge agayne losynge yt folowyth storye kynge henry hadde sayde concludyd foresayde peace myne authour terme sette kynge retourned englande anno domini mccxliii anno domini mccxliiii hugh blount rafe ashewy anno xxvii adam basynge xxvii yere kynge returned burdeaux englande thys yere plees crowne kept towre london thys yere gryffyth whych sonne lewelyn lately prynce walys entendyng haue broken pryson fell ouer wall inner warde towre london brake hys necke anno domini mccxliiii anno domini mccxlv rafe spycer mychael tony anno xxviii nycholas batte thys xxviii yere kynge henry testyfyeth polycronycon iew dygged grounde place spayn called tholeet entent make larger vyne yerde tyme dyggynge fande stone closyd partyes perceyued yt holowe brake stone founde therein boke bygge sawter wyth leuys tree boke wryte nthre dyuers languagys greke ebrewe latyne mater therof thre worldes shuld come whyche poyntyd commynge cryste begynnynge thyrde worlde whyche expressyd thys maner wyse begynnynge thyrde worlde goddes son shall borne mayde iewe well beholden contentys boke sawe yt conteyned longe tyme adam anticriste shewyd many prophecyes fulfyllyd paste anon renouncyd hys iudaisme moysen lawe crystyned lyued crysten man anno domini mccxlv anno domini mccxlvi robert cornehyll iohn gysors anno xxix adam bewly thys xxix yere nycholas batte contrary ordynauce xiiii yere thys kynge made agayne chosen shryue london whych conuycte periurye dyscharged punyshed yt mychaell tony whych yere also chosen mayre deposycyon alderman founde gyltye sayde cryme periurye therfore deposyd offyce punisshed hym chosen mayre iohan gysours nicholas batte chosen shryue robert cornhyll yere also testyfyeth ieffrey monmouth robert grosehed byshoppe lyncolne wyth prelatys ye land complayned theym vnto kynge waste goodes patry monye chyrche whyche dayly wasted mysspent alyaunt byshoppes clerkes lande whych straungers one named mayster martyne nere kynnysman innocent thyrde late pope one whyche kynge helpe englyshe bysshoppes auoyded wyth lyke offendours thys realme also thys yere patryarke hierusalem sente vnto kynge neume bloode whych kepte saynt thomas acris lodon tyll yere folowynge anno domini mccxlvi anno domini mccxlvii symonde fyz mary iohn gysors anno xxx lawrence frowyke yere theneume blood sent kynge wyth moste solemne processyon kynge wyth great noumber hys lordes beynge presente conueyed saynt thomas fore sayd vnto westmynster ryght solemne wyse wyth processyon acccordyng obseruaunces suche relyke apperteynynge yere dyed frederike emperour almayn whyche touchyd xviii yere kyng maryed isabell syster vnto kynge whyche rebellyon agayn ye chyrch rome accursyd fyrste ix gregory lastely innocet iiii agayne cursyd depryued imperyall dygnyte gyuynge commyssyon lycece electours emperoure chose new whyche many myndes theyr eleccyon chase duke thoryng erle holande chase kynges brother richarde erle cornewayll whyche causyd stryfe enduryd longe onely emperoure almayne men alowyd tyll radulphus duke erle habspurghe almayne chosen one assente dygnyte therunto admittyd gregory ix name yere lorde xii hundred lxxiii varyaunce enduryd vppon xxvii yeres ye great impoueryshyng italy landes empyre sayd frederyk dyed vnassoyled buryed cytye called ferenciola wyth thys superscrypcyon vppon hys toumbe si probitas sensus virtutis gratia census nobilitas orti possent refistere morte non foret extinctus fredericus qui iacet intus whyche versys thus myche meane englyshe excellente wytte grace good vertue nobylnesse byrth myght vnto deth resyste shuld thys frederyke mortall fate exchewe whych hym hath closyd hys chyste none maye erthly man assyste stryue wyth deth muste pay hym dette noble innoble nothynge maye lette versyfyoure made ii versys folowynge interpretacyon name frederyke frefremit mundo de deprimit alua profundo re rimatur cu cuspide cuncta minatur whyche may maner wyse englyshed fre fretyth thys worlde de confoundyth hyghe thynges honoure depenesse darke r sercheth besyly ye goodes generall thys worlde laye clerke makynge questyon hys moste cruell werke cu sworde thyng doth manace thys frederyke deuoyde grace anno domini mccxlvii anno domini mccxlviii iohn uoyle pyers aleyne anno xxxi nycholas batte thys xxxi yere reygn kyng henry lewys surnamed saynt lewis kyng fraunce conuenyent hoste sayled holy lande warred vpon crystes enymyes wanne cytye dama hys fyrste landynge taryed fro ye begynnynge ye moneth iuny xxii day nouember departyd then towarde babylon entendynge haue layde syege cytye fortune cotrarye sykenesse casueltyes loste myche people ende hym selfe taken prisoner turki playnely shall shewed story sayde lewys folowynge yere myghty erthquake englande lyke yt sene many yeres also thys yere kynge seasyd fraunchyse cytye london vppon euen saynte bartholomew iudgement gyuen mayre alderman agayne wedowe named margaret uyell commyttyd rule cytye wyllyam haueryll edwarde westmynster tyll ladye daye nexte folowynge whyche season mayre shryues agayne theyr offyces admyttyd anno domini mccxlviii anno domini mccxlix nycholas ioy mychaell tony anno xxxii geffrey wynton thys xxxii yere kyng wharfe london callyd quene hythe taken ferme comynaltye cytye paye yerely therefore l pounde whyche commytted shryues charge hath contynuyd euer sen tyme thys daye whereof profytys tollys sore mynyshed thys daye yt lytle worth ouer xx marke xv pounde one yere wyth nother thys yere fell great dystemperaunce wether suche wyse grounde bareyne vppon myshappys folowyd anon theurppon thys yere mater aforenamed margarete uyell wydow well examyned iudgement therof founden good trewe wherfore cytezens enioyed lybertyes wythoute interrupcyon yt kynge wyth theym agreuyd myche requeste wolde exchaunge wyth abbot westmynster suche lybertyes hadde myddelsex kynges graunte hadde place anno domini mccxlix anno domini mccl rafe hardell roger fyz roger anno xxxiii iohn tosalane xxxiii yere kyng henry moneth october dyed robert grosthede byshoppe lyncolne maker boke callyd pety caton many robert mich ye iiii innocent pope greuyd ye chyrch englade taskis paymetes agayn reason therfore sente vnto hym sharpe pystle pope gaue vnto chylde neuew hys chanonry whych fell voyde chyrch lyncolne sent chylde vnto byshoppe chargynge hym admytte sayd chylde sette hym hys place thys bysshoppe boldely denyed resceyt chyld wrote vnto pope yt wold shuld receyue ye cure soule yt could rule self therfore robert somoned apere ye popean appele pope therupon accursyd appealyd fro innoce ti courte vnto crystes owne trone deth thys robert pope laye hys bedde hys reste one aperyd hym clothyng byshoppe sayde hym aryse wretche come thy dome smote hym wych hys crosse vpon lefte syde upon morne pope fouden dede hys bedde blody thys nothynge cronycle storye innocent sayenge polycronycon byshoppe grostehede shuld dye xxxvii yere thys kynge henry whyche sayenge agreeth better storye except sayde pope lyued deth sayde byshoppe vi yere anno domini mccl anno domini mccli humfrey basse iohn norman anno xxxiiii wyllyam fyz rycharde xxxiiii yere excedynge wynde whyche sondry place england dyd great harme whyche begynnynge yere vppon daye symon iude thys tyme duchy burgoyne testyfyeth fasciculus temporu hyll remouyd hys proper place glode many myle lastely ioyned hym vnto hyllys whyche glydynge ronnynge sayde hyll oppressyd slewe v thousande people thys yere symon fyz mary alderman london hys dysobedyence euyll counsaill gaue vnto margarete uyell xxxi yere thys kynge touchyd wyth secret labour mater entendyd hym hurte cytye dyschargyd hys aldermanshyppe put oute counsayll cytye anno domini mccli anno domini mcclii laurence frowyke adam basynge anno xxxv nycholas batte thys xxxv yere kynge henry beganne frere augustynes buylde inhabyte walys place callyd woodhouse yere maryed kyng henry doughter mary wryters margarete vnto alexander kynge scottys cytye yorke dyd receyue homage sayde alexander kyngedome scottes prouynce scotlande lyke maner many progenytours done dyuerse many tymes worke thys tyme also shewyd anno domini mccli anno domini mcclii wyllyam durham iohn toleson anno xxxvi thomas wymborne thys xxxvi yere kynge graunted vnto shryues london shulde yerely alowyed vii pounde certayne pryuyleges grounde belongynge saynte paules chyrche whych daye allowyd baron kynges excheker euerey shryue make theyr accompte offyce pype also thys yere grauted kynge citesens ease tyme vsyd yerely present theyr mayre ye kynges presence place englande nowe thys tyme forthwarde shulde lacke kynges presence beynge westmynster presente theyr mayre chosen vnto baron hys excheker sworne admyttyd tymes kynge anno domini mcclii anno domini mccliii iohn northampton nycholas batte anno xxxvii rycharde pycarde thys xxxvii yere water see aboute daye saynte paulyn moneth ianuary rose suche heyghte yt drowned many vyllagys housys nere vnto yt dyuerse place englande thys yere kynge quene syr edwarde son wyth bonyface archebyshoppe caunterburye dyuerse noble realme sayled normandye taryed burdeaux certayne tyme theyr dedys cause theyr saylynge thyther mencyon made cronycle england yt freche boke yt shewed yt cause ioyne edwarde kynges sonne vnto syster ye kyng spayne maryage yere also water thamys sprange hygh yt drowned many housys water syde meane wherof myche chaundyse peryshed loste thys yere cytezyns hadde graunted kynge cytesyns shulde paye scauage tolle bestes brought tymes hadde vsyd anno domini mccliii anno domini mccliiii robert belyngton rycharde hardell anno xxxviii ranfe aschewye thys xxxviii yere procurement syr rycharde erle cornewayll dyspleasure whyche bare towarde ye citye exchauge certayne grounde belongynge kynge vnder coloure mayre hadde done due execucyon vppon baker lackynge theyr syzys seased lybertyes cytye y vnderstanden mayre comynaltye cytye hadde kynges graunte cytye ferme wyth dyuerse customys offyces astynted ascertayned summe money kyng sette offycers hys pleasure whiche accomptable vnto hym reuenues profytes grew wythin sayde cytye wythin foure dayes folowynge feste saynte edmunde byshop xix daye nouember cytesyns agreed wyth sayde erle vi hundred marke whych agrement wyth hym concluded soone restoryd vnto theyr lybertyes yere syr edward kynges sonne heyre maryed vnto eleanour ye kinges sister spayn cristmas weke kyng landed douer ye quene wyth hym wyth many lordes kynge comen london lodgyd towre sent come vnto hym mayre shryues wyth resoued greuously escape one callyd iohn gate iohn murderyd pryour allyed vnto kynge mayre layde charge mater hym vnto ye shryues myche theym belonged kepynge prysons wyth cytye mayre returnyd home shriues remayned prisoner ye space moneth theyr place theym chosen steuen oystergate henry walmoode old shryues passyd kynges daunger fynde anno domini mccliiii anno domini mcclv stephan oystergate rycharde hader anno xxxix henry walmoode xxxix yere feaste saynte etheldrede dame eleanour wyfe vnto kynges son syr edwarde came vnto london honorably receued cytesyns cytye rychely curteyned garnyshed wyth dyuerse ryche clothes kynge present commynge honorably coueyed cytye saynte iohns wythoute smythfelde lodgyd whyle remouyd vnto sauoy longe yt kyng seasyd lybertyes cytye certayne money whyche ye quene claymed ryght cytesyns saynte martyns tyde noueber gaue vnto grace iiii hundred marke restoryd theyr sayde lybertyes kynges vnder treasourer dischat yd whych ye tyme made custos keper cytye feast saynte scycyle xxii daye nouember ensuynge brought vnto westmynster lxxx xxii iewes lyncoln also accusyd crucyfyenge chyld lyncolne despyte crystes relygyon whyche iewes sent vnto ye towre london whyche processe tyme xviii conuycte hangyd tother remayned long pryson vygyll saynt andrew syr edwarde kynges sonne came london beyonde see kyng scottys quene hys wyfe came somer season vnto kynge hys maner woodstoke dysportyd hym season returned scotlande leuynge wyfe wyth mother tyll lyghted chylde vppon ye day decollacyon saynte iohn kynge quene quene scottes came london honorably receyued conueyed vnto westmynster anno domini mcclv anno domini mcclvi mathew bokerell rycharde hardell anno xl iohn mynoure thys xl yere entryd ye land dyuers lordes almayne whych crystmas weke vppon day ye innocentes made homage vnto syr rychard erle cornewayl brother kynge whych stoode kyng almayne romayns thursdaye nexte folowynge departed kynges courte spedde hym wyth wyfe syr henry sonne vnto see syde toke shyppyng iarnesay xxvii day apryll landed dordreth holande fyrste daye maye nexte ensuynge vppon assencyon day crowned kynge romayns citye aquisgranum thys yere vppon fyrste daye auguste kynge toke hys iourney towarde walys subdue lewelyn sonne gryffyth whyche wyth welshemen rebellyd agayne kynge mych syr edwarde hys son hadde lytle geue erledome chester wolde haue chaunged theyr skyttyshe condycyons bryng hys purpose better aboute sente armye souldiours irlande taryed theyr commynge hys castell genocke yere passed farre hys people gatheryd aduyse hys lordes strengthyd certayne castellys returned yere englande aboute feaste natyuyte ladye concorde peace cocluded betwene ye londyners abbot holy crosse waltham whych hadde ben suyte many yeres certayne dystresses take abbottis offycers lodoners came wyth theyr mercymonyes vnto fayre waltham yt agreed suche dystressys shulde restoryd yf peryshed loste longe kepynge abbot contente pay partyes value money suche distressys peryshed loste cytesyns shulde enioy lybertyes fayre euer wythoute payenge tollage toll anno domini mcclvi anno domini mcclvii rycharde ewell rycharde hardell anno xii wyllyam ashewy xli yere begynnynge founden kynges warderobe wyndesore byll rolle closyd grene waxe knowe whens yt shuld come whyche rolle coteyned dyuerse article agayne ye mayre ruler cytye london theym comynaltye cytye greuously tasked wrongyd whyche byll presentyd length kynge wheruppon anon sent iohn mancell one iustycys vnto london feaste conuersyon saynt paule kynges authoryte callyd paulys crosse folkmot beynge presente syr rycharde de clare erle glouceter dyuerse kynges counsayll sayde iohn mancell causyd sayde rolle redde comynaltye cytye shewyd people ye kynges pleasure mynde shuld rulyd iustyce lybertyes cytye shuld maynteyned euery poynte yf kynge myghte knowe persones hadde wrongyd cominaltye citye shuld greuously punyshed example done sayde iohn mansell chargyd mayre euery alderman hys warde shulde vppon morowe folowyng assemble hys wardemote wardemotys shuld assemble one place chuse theym selfe wythout counsayll aduyse theyr alderme xxxvi person present lordes hym houre ye next day byshoppes paleys paulys vppon morow thynge done accordynge hys commaundement ye sayd xxxvi persones presentyd sayde iohn mansell henry baa iustycys sayd iohn sayde vnto theym vppon theyr othe shuld certyfye persones knewe gylty artycles vnto comynaltye shewyd wherunto sayde xxxvi cytesyns answeryd yt yt contrary theyr lybertyes sworne many mater trespas betwene kynge hys cytezyns wherfore requyred sparynge wyth whych answere sayd iohn mansell beynge dyscontentyd warnyd theym appere kynges cousayll ye guyldehall vppon morowe folowynge kepte theyr daye thyther came sayde iustycys iohn mansell henry baa syr henry wengham chaunceller englande phylyppe louell vndertreasorer dyuerse kynges counsayll sayde iohn mansell exortyd sayde personys sworne many meany daye hadde done vayne excusyd theym alway yt contrary theyr othe lybertye theyr cytye wherfore kynges counsayll departed hall partye dyscontentyd shewyd vnto kynge demeanour sayde cytesyns uppon euen ye purificacyon lady yt mayre beyng warned yt kyng shuld come westmynster wyth parte alderman rode vnto knyghtbrydge houyd salute kynge knowe forther pleasure kynge came nere place harde theyr beynge sent vnto squyre houshold chargyd theym shulde presume come hys syght wyth whyche message beynge greatly dyscofortyd retourned home cytye afterwarde octauys puryfycacyon ladye returned courte mychaell tony adam basynge whyche sente mayre frendes courte knowe cause kynges hyghe dyspleasure whych brought worde kyng well mynded vnto citye full purpose haue suche persones chastised hadde oppressyd comynaltye uppon morow folowynge came vnto ye guyldhall iohn mansell wyth kynges counsayll whych people assembled shewyd many fayre plesaunt wordes amonge whych declared kynges mynde wyll correcte suche persones oppressyd comynaltye deryste belouyd cytye asked common whyther wolde agreable vnto whych incontynently many suche knewe litle mater ment cryed dyscrecyon ye ye ye nothynge regardynge lybertye cytye ye graut thus co mon sayde iohn mansell dyschargyd mayre shryues chamberleyn theyr offyces delyueryd custodye therof vnto constable towre putte rome shryues mychaell tony iohn audryan ouer rollys tollys tallages made delyueryd vnto sayd iohn masell whych sealyd redeliueryd vnto chamberleyne co mon hadde beholden thys besynesse retourned vnto theyr housys confusyd mater thus orderyd sayd iohn mansell wyth dyuerse kynges counsayll kept theyr courtes dayly sondayes excepte tyll fyrste sondaye lent whych yere xxv daye february callyng hym xii wardes ye cytye whyche xii wardes eueryche take thre men xii wardes xxxvi impanellyd sworne enquyre foresayd artycles personys cytye offendyd courte thus kept holden guyldehall man callyd answere questyon put vnto person sayd enquest uppon sayd sonday lent mayre alderman shryues wyth sayd enqueste foure men euery warde chargyd appere westmynster kynge whych apperaunce coutermaudyd tyll vppon nexte morowe whyche season commyng kynges exchekyr fonde syttyng erles glouceter warwyke iohn mansell henry baa iusticys costable towre custos cytye dyuers kynges counsayll callyd name rafe hardell yere may e nycholas batte nycholas fyz iosne mathew bokerel iohn tolesham iohn le mynoure alderman sayde iohn mansell yt kynge lawes inquysycyon cytesyns cytye founden theym culpable wronged hurte comynaltye hys cytye dyuers meanes sayde inquysycyons apperyd forthwyth causyd yt redde whe parte therof redde sayd vnto theym thus may se comynaltye sayde cytye hath ben greuously oppressyd meany counsayll common weale dystroyed alterynge tollys good auncyent customys turnynge synguler auauntage lucre whyche mater sayde rafe company denyed common suche meany none greuyd hurte offryd iustyfyed iudged lawe customys cytye henry baa iustyce askyd whyther wolde byde aduenture enquery hadde harde redde ellys stande vppon sayeng wardes yet ben sworne kepte theym theyr fyrste answere iohn mansell frayned ye mayre theyr lawe custome mayre answered sayde trespace cytesyn done agayne ye kynge shulde defende hym xii sayde cytesyns murder sleynge man xxx cytesyns trespace agayn straunger othe vi hym selfe many reason made sayde iohn mansell also mayre alderman daye gyuen appere vppon morow kynge counsell uppon day folowynge ye kyng wyth many lordes syttynge sayde exchekyr foresayde inquysycyon redde done mayre alderman called name two alderman whyche callyd saye arnolde thedmare henry walmode rafe hardell harde kynge speke mater toke suche fere nycholas batte wythout farther answere put kynges grace sauyd theym theyr lybertyes fraunchyses cytye vi besought kyng ryght wysenes myghte demyd lawes customys cytye layde vnto theyr charge ouer many wronges theym done kynge comynaltye cytye alteryd ye kynges beame orderyd aduauntage selfe ryche men cytye wherun partyes answeryd sayde alteracion beame done onely ye aduyce consente v hundred beste cytye tyme weyer vsyd lene hys draught towarde marchaundyse byar hadde meane x xii pounde draught hys aduauntage seller myche dysauauntage nowe indyfferencye egalytye personys marchautys ordeyned beame shulde stand vpryght ye cle e therof enclynynge neyther partie yt doth weyenge golde syluer byer haue alowed seller thynges iiii poude onely euery draught reason theym made kynge commaunded vpon mornynge folowynge folkmoot shulde callyd paulys crosse courte dyssoluyd mayre returned london uppon morowe folkmoot beynge pawles crosse assemblyd vi alderman heryng murmuracion common people knowynge alderman worshypfull city shuld haue litle sayeng thys mater ferynge theyr cause yode chanons house powlys tyme sayde iohan mansel sent kynge taryed assemblynge people shewyd vnto theym entedyd lenger plede wyth kynge contentyd put fully kynges grace mercy sauyng alway cytesyns theyr lybertye fraunchyse cyte whyche agrement sayde iohan mansell wyth came vnto courte folkmoot vnto people rehersyd fayre pleasaunt tale promysyng theyr lybertyes shulde hooly inuyolatly preseruyd ye kyng wyth many thynges ye great comforte common people lastely axyd wheter law custome aboue rehersyd wherunto lyke vndyscret vnlerned people answeryd cryed rabbyshely nay nay nay wythstadynge sayd law custome hadde tymes ben vsed tyme oute mynde thys nother mayre alderman great cytye myghte impugne make reason vpholdynge theyr auncyent lawys customys wonder though kynge thus hedy greuouse cytye suche euyll dysposyd malycyouse people aboute hym lande yll rulyd mych myschefe vsyd wherof ensuyd myche sorow ye shall sequele storye iohn mansell callyd mayre alderman hym chargyd westmynster morowe folowynge gyue attendaunce vppon kynges grace uppon morow mayre alderman taryenge kynges commynge great hall westmynster lastely kynge came saynte stephaus chapell season helde cou sayll wyth lordes yode chekyr chamber sat hym downe hys lordes aboute hym anon mayre alderman callyd sayde chamber soone callyd name commaundyd stande nere barre henry baa iustyce sayde vnto mayre vii alderman myche fourme kynges lawes founde culpable certayne article touchynge trasgressyon agayn kynge therfore courte awardyd shulde make fyne raunsome dyscrecyon sayde courte hadde put theym kynges grace mercy kynge hath commaundyd fyne put respyte ye payned greuously ye haue deseruyd whyche iudgement gyuen kneled downe mayre wyth wepynge terys thanked kynge bountye goodnesse besought hym good gracyous lorde vnto cytye vnto hys faythfull subiectys whereunto kynge made none answere rose streyght vppe yode hys waye leuynge anon kynge departyd arestyd kepte tyll founden suerty eueryche alderman theym dyscharged warde offyce yt wythin cytye shortly put suertyes returnyd heuely london shortely wyllyam fyz rycharde kynges commaundement made mayre thomas fyz thomas wyllyam grappysgate shryues daye daye chamberlayn callyd accopte sayde iohn mansell suche tollys gadered tyme mayraltie iohn tolesham rafe hardell beynge present sayde accompte dyuerse comynaltie cytye none heddys whyche accompt defaute myght arrectyd vnto forenamed persones conuycte afore kynge reason wherof dyuerse theym admyttyd kynges fauour shortly restored theyr offyces agayne wythout payeng money wher certaynte knowen yere whete scate yt solde london xxiiiis quarter scanter shulde haue ben yf plenty hadde come almayne fraunce normandye yt fayled lykewyse meane derth scarcytie mych poore people dyed hunger many dyuerse countreys englande came vnto citye nere aboute comforte vytayll yt better chepe london many shyres england aboute soone forenamed iohn mansell made knyghte chefe iustyce england thys xli yere also ye kynge feast saynt barna moneth iuny kepte hys hyghe courte parlyament hys towne oxenforde thys wryters named insane parliamentum meane woode madde parlyament counsayll made many actys agayne kynges prerogatyue pleasure reformacion state lande whyche prouyd co fusyon hurte lande deth destruccyon many noble men occasyon therof began famouse stryfe callyd thys day baron warre wherof ensued mych myschefe hereafter shalbe shewyd declared large aboue sayde auoyde enormytes refourme euyll rule vsyd lande suche personys dayly kynge many dyuerse ordynaunces made wherof tenoure sette oute ende boke wherunto kynge somdeale agayne hys wyll wyth syr edwarde hys sonne agreed actys shulde holden ferme stable thys parlyament chosyn xii perys whyche named douze peri authorite gyuen strength parliamet correcte offendyd brekynge ordinauces sayd twelue perys deuysed orderyd touchyng cocernynge ye mater purpose whyche xii perys name ensue fyrste archebyshop caunterburye byshoppe worceter syr roger bygotte erle norffolk marshall englande syr symonde de moutforde erle leyceter syr rychard clare erle glouceter syr humfrey bothumerle herforde warwyke arundell syr iohn mansell chefe iustyce englande syr roger mortymer syr hugh bygraue syr petyr de sauoy syr iamys audeley syr peter de mountforde kynges brother vppon moders syde saye syr eym erle wynchester syr wyllyam de ualauce syr godfrey de lindesey syr guyde lyndesey wold assente vnto foresayde ordynaunces wythdrew toward see syde wyth suche stuffe hadde wold haue departyd ye land yf myght haue shyppynge lacke wherof fayne retourne yode vnto wynchester yt longe lycensyd departe lande wyth certayne companye certayne summe money paye theyr costys theyr daye sette bartylmew tyde auoyde vppon payne prysonement whyche daye kepte longe fynysshynge parlyament stryfe varyauce began kyndle betwene kynge erlys leyceter glouceter meane offycers sayd erles remouyd put theyr romys amonge whyche iohan masell dyscarged offyce syr hugh bygotte admytted hym foresayde pyers harde murmure courte ferynge kynge shuld aduertysed shortely alter promyse therfore entedyng make theyr partye stroger vppon morowe folowynge marye magdaleyns daye kyng beyng westmynster erle marshall erle leyceter wyth dyuerse came vnto guyldehall lodon mayre alderman comynaltye cytye assembled sayd lordes shewyd instrument wrytynge whyche hynge many labellys wyth sealys kynges seale syr edwarde hys sonnes seale wyth many noble lande whyche contente artycles whych ordeyned made oxenforde wyllynge mayre alderman cusyderynge sayd actys made honoure god fydelyte vnto kynge profyte realme wold also vpholdynge sette theyr common seale cytye requeste thus mayre cytesyns made aduyse counsayll amonge theym selfe taken desyred sparyng lordes tyll myght speke wyth ye kyng know pleasure behafe fynally sparynge tyme myghte graunted ende laboure lordes made wyth helpe suche solycytoures hadde wythin cytye common seale put mayre dyuerse cytye sworne maynteyne theyr allegeaunce sauyd kyng wyth preseruacyon lybertyes fraunchyses departed daye daye sayd douze perys assemblyd newe temple kept theyr counsaylys courtes reformacyon olde greuys remoued kynge dyuerse hys menyall houselde sette theyr place offycys suche lyked theym vppon ix daye august proclamacyon made dyuerse accustomyd place sayde cytye none kynges taker shulde take thynge wythin cytye wythout wyll owner excepte two tunne wyne whyche kyng accustomably hadde euery shyppe commynge burdeaux payenge xl tunne meane whyche proclamacyon nothynge taken kynges offycers yt streyght payed fore wythin cytye lybertye whyche vsaunce contynued whyle anno domini mcclvii anno domini mcclviii draper thomas fyz rycharde rycharde hardell anno xlii robert catelyon xlii yere kyng held one parlyamet westmynster nother ellys prorogyd wynchester yere syr hugh bygotte iustyce wyth roger turkelay kept courte saynte sauyours helde plees callyd itinerii wyche meane trauaylynge waye plees ye shall vnderstande dayes kepte dyuerse place englande whyche nowe ben holden westmynster iudgys ordeyned kepe cyrcuyte kepe syzys tyme vacacyo sayde courte iudges ponyshed sore baylyes ycers theym conuycte dyuers trespassys specyally takynge merceamentes otherwyse lawe theym commaundyd whych sayd chefe iustyce prysoned sessyd greuous fynys also somonyd cytesyns london come vnto sayde courte tollys hadde taken vppon farther syde water yt answered tollys toke take lawfully redy proue place court co uenyent whyche wythin precyncte theyr lybertye wythstandynge answere sayde syr hughe chargyd vppon queste xii knyghtes surey enquyre mater whych acquyted sayde cytesyns shewyd sayde tolle belongyd ryghte processe tyme sayd syr hugh wyth came guyld hall kepte hys courte plees wythout order lawe contrarye lybertyes cytye punyshed baker lacke syze tumberell tymes punysshed pyllory orderyd many thynges hys wyll good order lawe thys yere vppon candelmasse euen came vnto lodon beyonde see rycharde kynge almayne erle cornewayll wyth hys wyfe chyldren whyche ben taken possessyon kyngedome shewyd agayne whose commynge cytye london rychely haged wyth clothes sylke ara ioyously receyuyd cytesyns anno domini mcclviii anno domini mcclix peperer iohn adryan iohn gysours anno xliii robert cornehyll thys xliii yere frydaye folowynge feaste symonde iude parlyament holden westmynster radde presence lordes comynaltye sondry tymes actys ordynauces made ye parliament holden oxenforde wyth certayn artycles ye fore sayd xii peer vnto added redyng article beynge reuested archebyshoppe caunterbury wyth dyuerse nomber ix byshoppes besyde abbotes denouncyd accursyd attemptyd worde dede breke sayd actes scutage parilamet also graunted vnto kynge taske callyd scutage meane xl euery knyghtes fee thorough englande whyche extendyd great summe money dyuerse writer englade possessyon spyrytualtye temporaltye dayes ouer beyonde lx kynghtes fee whych rate shuld extede vnto vi score mli yf shuld gadered ye teporal onely yt shulde amounte ouer summe lxiiii thousande pounde kynge vppon daye saynte leonarde vi daye nouember came vnto pawlys commaundement assembled courte folkmoot kynge accordynge former ordynaunces made axyd lycence comynaltye cytye passe see promysed presence great multytude people wolde good gracyous lorde vnto cytye mouth syr hugh bygotte hys chefe iustyce maynteyne theyr lybertyes vnhurte yt whyche people ioye made excedynge showte uppon viii day nouember kynge rode thoroughe citye towarde see syde vppon daye saynte bryce xiii daye nouember toke hys shyppe sayled vnto burdeaux taryed season rode vnto frenche kynge beyng holy lewys tenth lewys vnto paris honorably receyued lodged hym paleys ye space hole weke makynge hym great feast gyuynge hym hys ryche many gyftes then kynge henry rode vnto saynte denys abbot conuent receyued wyth processyon taryed space moneth whyche season maryage concludyd betwene iohn duke brytayne one doughters hys departynge gaue abbot cuppe golde basyn wyth ewer syluer hys consolacyon kyng lewys assygned vnto hym certayne lordes noble men fraunce gyue attendaunce vppon hym conuey hym shewe hym parte fraunce wyth dysporte huntynge haukynge many pleasure countrey whych passe tyme frenche kyng assembled hys parlyament parys shewyd vnto hys lordes hys conscyence grudgyd wyth ye withholdyng landes phylyppe second wan kynge iohn normandye vpon ye whych desyred theyr faythfull frutefull counsayll many reason argumentes made yt concludyd fynall concorde hadde betwene kynge henry hym yf kyng henry wyth agremente hys lordes wolde resygne frenche kynges handes suche tytle ryghte hadde hole duchye normandye angeou poyteau mayne hym heyres euer frenche kynge great bountye grace shulde gyue vnto kynge englande hys heyres kynges lordshyppe guyan angeou mayne byryghtfull tytle callyd euer duke guyan ouer shulde admyttyd pere fraunce whyche condycyons affyrmyth wytnessyth frenche cronycle kynge henry hys retourne hys dysporte agreable wyth consente hys baronye theyr presence wyth also baronye fraunce dyd hys homage vnto sayde lewys duchye guyan made hys othe accordynge great gyftes receyued eyther syde kynge henry retourned vnto burdeaux thys peace concorde speketh cronyculer named guydo guy sayth kyng henry sayled fraunce asked restytucyon forenamed frenche kyng suche landes hys ayle phylyppe seconde wyth extorte power taken kynge iohn hys father fande frenche kynge straunge answere also lytle truste hys lordes haue theyr ayde fell agrement wyth frenche kynge solde hym tytle normandye gascoyn guyan whych extendyd yerely value xx thousande pounde takynge tytle iii hudred thousand poud small turon money whereof pounde value sterlynge money iisiii shulde rate haue sayde tytle value sterlynge money xxxiii thousand seuen hundred l pounde season tyme kyng henry thus occupyed fraunce dyssencyon fell englande betwene syr edwarde kynges son syr rycharde erle glouceter appeasyng wherof parleamet whyche meane counsayll hys lordes callyd westmynster whyche contynued space iii wekes whyche counsayll lordes came wyth greate companyes specyally sayde syr edwarde erle glouceter whyche entendyd haue lodged within city wherfore mayre yode vnto byshop worceter syr hugh bygotte syr phylyppe basset whome kynge wyth archbyshoppe caunterburye taken rule lande hys absence whyche went vnto kynge almayne haue hys aduyse mater concludyd nother sayde edwarde erle shuld come wythin cytye lodgyd none helde vppon eyther partyes forther yt prouyded suche wythin cytye age xv yeres aboue shulde harnes watche kepe cytye bothe daye nyght gate shulde kept shyt vppon daye certayne men harneys kepe euery gate cytye soone sauegarde cytye sure kepynge peace wythin kynge romaynes wyth sayde syr hughe syr phylyppe came cytye lodged theyr companyes suche wolde assygne strength cytye yf nede requyred aboute feaste saynte marke kynge came london beyonde see lodgyd byshoppe london paleys whose commynge assygnement erle glouceter lodged wythin cytye syr edwarde hys sonne lodgyd hys owne palays westmynster soone kynge commaunded hym lodgyd saynt iohns lordes lodgyd place wythoute cytye kyng romayns remoued agayne westmynster whych tyme direccyon take betwene sayd tyes new assemble parlyament assygned kept westmynster quindena saynt iohn baptyst thynge myght sette order yt prorogyd vnto feast saynt edwarde season thyng put reste whyle yere also fell happe iewe tewkysbury whyche fell gonge vppon saterdaye wolde reuerece sabbot day plucked wherof heryng erle glouceter iewe dyd great reuerence hys sabbot daye thought wold myche holy daye whych sondaye kept hym tyll monday season founden dede anno domini mcclix anno domini mcclx adam brownynge wyllyam fyz rycharde anno xliiii rycharde couentre xliiii yere soone feast symonde iude kynge kept royall feaste westmynster made dyuerse knyghtes amonge whych iohn duke brytayne whyche maryed one kynges doughters made knyght soone syr hughe spencer made chefe iustyce ye feast cadelmasse ye kyng commaudyd folkmoot called paulys crosse proper persone wyth kynge almayn archebyshoppe caunterbury many noble came kynge commaundyd vnto mayre euery strypelynge age xii yeres aboue shuld alderma sworn day folowynge trew kyng hys heyres kynges englande gate cytye kepte wyth armyd men kynge romaynes dyuysyd yere also fayre kept northampton varyaunce fell betwene lodoners men towne betwene cytesyns contynued longe sute plee northampton slayne great vexacyon trouble partyes ende cytye better yere also aboute eester baron lande wyth consente perys dyschargyd syr hugh le spencer admyttyd hym syr phylyp basset rome chefe iustyce vnwittyng kyng whych cause grudge dyspleasure beganne newe kyndle betwene kynge hys lordes whyche encreasyd polycy kynge almayne prelatys land yt set quyet whyle hardely ende yere anno domini mcclx anno domini mcclxi iohn northampton wyllyam fyz rycharde anno xlv rycharde pycarde xlv yere shortely alhalowyn daye baron admyttyd made shryues dyuerse shyres englande dyschargyd suche kynge admyttyd named gardayns kepers countyes shyres ouer baron wolde suffer iustyce kynge hadde admyttyd kepe plees lawes callyd itinerarii suche theyr admyssyon wherwith kynge greuously dyscontented mych ye season laboured myght dysanull former ordynaunces statute cause broken myche vppon seconde sondaye lent folowynge kynge commaundyd redde paules crosse bull graunte pope urban iiii name confyrmacyo bull purchased hys predecessoure alexander iiii assoyle kynge sworne mayntenaunce foresayde artycles made oxenforde causyd sayde absolucyon shewyd thorough realme englande walys irlande gyuynge streyghte charge subiectys none hardy wythstade dysobey sayd absolucyon yf fouden dysobedyent commaundemet streyght put pryson raunsomyd delyueryd tyll ye kynges pleasure forther knowen feast saynt albon moneth iuny kynge almayne toke shyppyng sayled almayne kynge folkmoot holden vppon sonday saynt peter daye ye moneth iuly hadde lycence sayle fraunce morowe departyd london towarde see syde wyth quene lordes hys two sonnes syr edward syr edmunde beynge season guyan kyng hadde ben season fraunce returnyd vnto burdeaux fell syke occasyon wherof taryed partyes tyll saynte nycholas tyde nexte folowynge thys yere dyed rycharde clare erle glowceter syr gylbert de clare hys sonne erle hym father gaue great charge shulde vpholde forenamed ordynaunces anno domini mcclxi anno domini mcclxii phylyppe walbroke thomas fyz thomas anno xlvi rycharde tayloure thys xlvi yere feaste saynte martyne xi day noueber iew fell varyaunce wyth crysten man colchyrch warde chepe wou dyd crysten man within chyrche wherfore people citye fury pursued sayd iew hys house slew hym fell vpon iewes robbyd slew many euen saynte thomas apostle folowynge kyng landed englande douer came lodon wednysdaye xii day yere ye froste began saynt nycholas daye contynued ye space moneth feruently thamys ouer froren men passed ouer horsbacke wynter ye kynges lytell halle westmynster house adioynyng peryshed wyth fyre neglygence seruaut kynges yere also vnkyndnesse beganne growe betwene londoner constable towre cotrary lybertye cytye toke certayne shyppes passyng towre wyth whete vytayll toke yt sayde towre makynge price pleasure wherfore great harme ensued ben polycy wyse men whyche shewyd vnto kynges counsayll whose dyreccy matter comytyd vnto syr phyllyppe basset chefe iustyce set order rule betwene sayde partyes hym brought euydeces pryuyleges aduauntage partyes fynally longe plee argument yt fyrmely demyd adiudgyd yf constable offycer towre wold tyme take whete vytayll vse kyng ye towre shuld come vnto market holden wyth cytye haue yt iid quarter wythin ye mayres pryce vitayll rate offycers wold contrarye ordynauce shryues shulde make report vnto kynges counsayll wythstade hym myght kynges peace kepte yere also many murmures grudgis tolde many place land supposynge ye warre shulde shorte processe haue ensued betwene kyng lordes bull dyspensacyon yere shewyd help mediacyon good wyse men murmures grudge appeasyd kynge agreed agayn mayntenauce sayd statute sent hys wryttes wherin sayde artycles comprysed shyres england gyuynge streyght commaudement men obserue kepe suche theym ioyned dyscrecyon erle marshall erle leyceter syr phylyp basset syr hugh bygot whyche shortely reuoked denyed wheruppon archbysshoppe caunterbury feryng myght ensue made hym errande rome lycence kyng lordes departed lande kepte hym tyll trouble appeased seased vppon mydlent sondaye mayre common beynge present folkemote holden paulys crosse syr philyppe basset kynges counsayll mayre sworne trewe kynge heyres kynges vppon morowe guylde hall euery alderman presence mayre toke othe vppon sondaye folowyng euery strypelynge age xii yeres aboue hys alderman hys warde newly charged wyth othe dyspleasure betwene kynge hys baron began appere dysclose whyche longe whyle hadde ben kepte secret myche dyuers theym assembled march walis gatheryd vnto stronge power sent letter vnto kynge vnder seale syr rogyer clyfford besechynge hym haue remembraunce othe manyfolde promyse hadde made obseruynge statute made towne oxenforde wyth ordinauces made honour god fayth allegeauce hys persone weale profyte hys realme wyllyng hym farder stande defye suche persones wyll agayne sayde actes sauynge quene chyldern whyche letter thus sent receyuynge yt none answere sayde baron wyth banner dysplayed wet agayn knew yt helde agayne sayd actys fyrste herforde toke bysshoppe see many hys chanos allyautes born toke treasour catell fande bare yt wyth theym yode sent vnto suche maners sayde byshoppe chanons hadde spoyled robbed theym threw grounde consumed wyth fyre put sayde byshop chanons sure kepyng set theyr place went vnto costes supposyd fynde theyr enymyes kepynge theyr course toward london berynge banner kynges army holdynge theyr iourney myche people drewe vnto whyche progresse euer fande knew agayne mayntenauce ye sayd actes imprysoned spoyled theyr place spyrytuall temporall men dyuers kynges castellys set persones lyked put suche set ye kyng gaue vnto theym othe shulde trew faythfull kyng kepe castelles hys vse weale realme mydsomer drewe nere london sent letter vnto mayre alderme vnder seale syr symonde mountforde wyllynge know theym whyther wolde obserue actys statute made parlyament oxenforde ellys wolde ayde assyste person entendyd breche sent vnto theym copye sayd actes prouiso yf specyfyed hurte realme common weale dyscrete persones lande shulde alteryd amendyd whych copye mayre bare vnto kynge beyng towre accompanyed quene kynge almayne whyche lately retourned beyonde see syr edward son wyth counsayll kynge entendynge knowe mynde cytye axyd mayre thoughte ordynaunces actes knowynge well hys commynge thyther hadde counsayled wyth alderman common cytye mayre abashed questyon besought kynge yt myght comon wyth bretherne alderman shuld shew vnto hym theyr opinyons kynge sayde wolde aduyse wythout counsayll mayre boldely sayde tymes wyth bretherne comynaltye cytye hys commaundement sworne maynteyne actys made honoure god fayth kynge profyte realme whyche othe hys lycence moste gracyous fauour entended obserue kepe ouer auoyde occasion might grow grudge varyaunce betwene grace baron wythin cytye wolde auoyde allyauntes strau gers therof yf grace contentyd whych answere kyng shewyd therwyth pleasyd mayre fauour departed sente answere baron accordynge theyr lybertyes alway vpholden saued shortely myche dyuerse noble men lande whyche helde agayne statute ryden towarde douer entedyd haue taken shyppyng forfere baron kynge sent diuers persones housholde cytesyns lodon refourme enduce theym retourne tarye wyth kyng season allyauntes whych taken suspecte fauour owynge one parte auoyded cytye yt longe syr edwarde kynges sonne sette many office castell wyndesore watche kepte dayly wythin cytye nyghtes certayne assigned ryde ye town wyth certayn fotemen assygned theym serche towne ouer insued harme rydyng watche one place cytye euyll dysposyd persones vnder colour watche men seche straungers robbed spoyled many house within citye remedy wherof standyng watche ordeyned euery ward kynge herynge baron nere commynge vnto cytye departed then shortely baron entryd cytye sonday saynt margarets daye shortely kynge returned westmyster quene counsayll soon consent kynge baron syr hughe le spenser made chefe iustyce keper towre uppon morow folowynge mary magdaleyne daye wryt directed vnto ye mayre alderman chargynge yt kynges peace fermely kepte wythin citye wryt yt also expressyd kynge hys baron louyngly agreed farther sayd wryt comaundyd yf wythin precyncte theyr frauches persone persones knowen wolde wythstande foresayde ordynaunces statute shulde attached put pryson theyr goodes attached kynge tyll knew forther pleasure ye shall vnderstande whyle ye lordes laye thus wythin cytye dyuerse conuenticulis gaderyngis made citesyns robbed dyuerse place cytye dyd myche harme whyche smally corrected borne oute maynteyned theyr maysters commos citye farre oute rule insensyng ryotouse son assembles courtes kepte guyldhall place symple vndyscret person shuld haue voyce worshypfull lytell nothyng regarded wherof ensuyd dayly myche vnhappynes sorow shall appere baron obteyne fauour ye cytye wyllyd shewe yf hadde theyr libertyes wythdrawe myght agayne theym restored also dyuyse new theyr weale profyte wolde laboure kynge myghte haue theym graunted whych comforte lordes mayre called common guyldhall shewed beneuolece sayd lordes willed euery ycer hys offyce deuyse thynges myght benefycyall cytye wheruppon counsaylled gyther made note paper dyuers statute prouysyons ordynaunces graunted whyche myght properly named abhomynacyonssingla profyte deuysed theyr synguler profyte ye great hurt marchau te commynge citye fayres markettes englande also preiudycyall vnyuersall weale realme whyche ouersene heddes cytye yt shewyd vnto sayd comons theyr ordynaunces lefull charytable orderyd therfore knewe well shulde admytted wyllyng deuyse vayne meane wherof ryght necessary comon weale cytye reiected put ye baron vpon morowe folowynge saynt iamys daye departed london towarde wyndesore se gydynge castell theyr commynge putte foresayde allyauntes set syr edward kinges son whyche assocyat wyth yode vnto fulham kynge lay shewyd hym baron spoyled suche goodes hadde wythout cause kynge put season warned sue hym agayne mychelmasse cousayll hym shuld haue iustyce uppon second daye folowyng feaste saynte mathew xxiii daye september kynge quene sonnes noble thys land toke shyppyng sayled fraunce present frenche kynges parlyaament holden bonony morow octabis saynt mychaell landed agayne douer frydaye folowynge came vnto london vppon tuesday folowyng passed queste xii knyghtes mydd sworne vpon iury betwene abbot westmynster cytye certayne pryuyleges cytesyns london claymed wythin westmynster sayde iurye founden gylbert prestone chefe baron kynges excheker ryues london day myght lawfully enter town westmynster tenemetes abbot hadde wythin myddelsex vnto gate sayd abbay make summons dystrayne lacke apparaunce eueryche tenaunte sayde abbot quindena saynt mychaell fourmer complaynt allyauntes whyche aboue ye haue harde shewed kyng ye lordes parlyament holden westmynster lastely yt sentencyd baron shulde restore suche goodes theyr companye hadde taken suche person daye well allyauntes spyrytuall temporall also suche menyall seruauntes shulde dayly kynges house person shulde suche kynge wolde chose admyt hym selfe whyche ii artycles baron vtterly denyed wherfore olde rancoure toke place dyssencyon kyndled fyre malyce agayn betwen kynge lordes feruently anno domini mcclxii anno domini mcclxiii robert moumplere thomas fyz thomas anno xlvii robert de suff thys xlvii yere procurement styrynge baron common cytye london chase vnto theyr mayre yere thomas fyz thomas wythout counsayll alderman sware guyldehall vppon day symon iude made presentement hym vppon morowe folowynge nother kyng yet baron kynges excheker ryght ought haue done whych presumpcyon kynge greuously dyscontentyd agayne cytye soone kynge aduertysynge well yt citye wolde take baron partye causyd syr edwarde son take castell wyndesore trayne wherof knewe possessyon kynge erly mornynge lytell fore crystemas departed westmynster rode vnto sayde castell whyther shortely came also many lordes vppon kynges partye faste lordes knyghtes whych helde wyth erle leyceter drew toward lonlon yt eyther partye mych people assembled whyche passe tyme well dysposyd laboryd concorde betwene kynge hys lordes whose meanes fynally yt agreed bothe partyes mater concernynge fore sayde artycles statute ordynauces made oxenford xii perys frenche kynge shuld deme iudge whych shulde holden whyche demyd partyes promysed assuredly abyde upon whiche agrement copyes made sayde statute wyth letter shewynge effecte fourmer agrement sent vnto sayde kynge fraunce beynge saynt lewys crystmas weke folowynge kyng toke shyppynge syr edward son counsayll sayled fraunce foresayde cause partye sayd baron sent ouer syr peter de mountforde lewys kynge fraunce statute sore argued vppon party yt ende frenche kynge callynge hym party vpon day ye conuersyon saynt paule xxiiii daye ianuary syttynge iudgement gaue expresse sentence eueryche sayde statute ordynaunces shulde ye daye foreward vtterly foredone set noughte suche bandes promyses kyng made mayntenaunce shulde adnulled cancellyd kynge mater concernynge statute set lybertye whyche sentence thus gyuen kynge retourned englande came london xv daye februarye baron beynge sore amoued wyth sentence notynge greate parcyaltye vnto frenche kynge departed london westwarde marchys walys drew great power warred vppon landes castellys syr roger mortymer threw vnto grounde spoyled hys myghte fynde ouer brent hys manours house whose ayde syr edwarde kynges sonne commynge hys people dystressyd almoste taken redresse whyche mater newe parlyamet appoynted holde oxenforde quindena eester nexte folowynge whyche came neuer effecte yt cronicle sayth parlyament holden oxenforde kynge lordes parted dyscorded baron drewe towarde london kynge remayned woodstok newe assuraunce wrytynge endentyd made betwene comynaltye cytye baron wythoute consent many ruler sayde cytye wherfore common men enraged made theym self two capytaynes whych named constable cytye yt say thomas de pyweldon stephan bukerel whose commaundement tollynge great belle paules cytye shulde redy shortely harnes gyue attendaunce vppon theyr sayd capytaynes begynnynge lent constable towre syr hughe le spenser came wyth fayre company men army hym cytye desyred assystence forenamed constable whyche commaunded sayd belle olled meane wherof people shyt theyr shoppes came harneys great multytude whyche proclamacyon made shulde olowe theyr capytaynes wythout knowlege whyther go folowed theyr sayde capytaynes yode vnto thystelworth vppon two myles beyonde westmynster spoyled manour kynge romaynes sette yt vppon fyre done hys water mylles commodity put theym vtter ruyne wyth great noyse crye returned vnto london dede sayth myne authour cause mortall warre folowynge tyme sayde kynge romaynes hadde ben allyaunce betwene hym erle glouceter treatye peace hadde betwene kynge baron dede done enymy vnto vttermoste power kynge herynge thys ry gaderyd vnto great power harde syr peter de mout forde northampton gatherynge people strength baron partye spedde hym thyder wanne towne vppon hym force slewe many hys men fynally toke hym syr symon son erle leyceter wyth dyuers lyue many burgeyses towne hadde take theyr partyes kynge sent vnto dyuers prysons closyd wythin castell ye towne thys passe tyme palmesondaye weke iewes london spoyled robbed nomber v hudred slayn dyuers theyr mansyons brent destroyed suche saued conueyed great mede vnto towre kept fury common wherof occasyon myche iewe wolde haue forced crysten man haue gyue hym iid vsure xx weke ye shall vnderstand dayes lycence graunted vnto iewes kynge myght take vsury euery man yt theym wolde borowe money iid poud weke lendyng greter smaller summes rate soon iewes thus punyshed many house relygyon wythin ye citye nere serched goodes alliautis myche founde wherof parte brought vnto lordis parte stolen brybed whyche season kynge passed diuers coutreys lastely came southsex strong power wherof herynge lordes made preparacyon go towardes hym whyche tyme wardeyns v porte kepte see wyth shyppes straungers shulde entre lande ayde kynge agayne baron ende apryll baron wyth multytude cytye whyche put vawarde departed london takyng theyr iourney towarde kynge well onwarde vpon theyre way worde brought vnto kynge wyth huge power lewys wherfore hole assent dyuysed letter sent yt ye name baron vnto kynge whose name vnder folowe syr symonde de mounforde erle leyceter hyghe stewarde englande syr gylbert de clare erle glouceter syr robert ferres erle derby syr hugh le spenser chefe iustice syr henry de mountford son heyre erle leyceter syr rycharde gray syr henry hastynges syr iohn fyz iohn syr robert de uenpount syr iohn gyuyle syr robert roos syr wyllyam marmyon baldwyne wake syr gylbert gyfforde syr nycholas de megraue syr godfrey de lucy syr iohn de ueysy syr wyllyam de mounthdesey whyche letter sealed wyth seales sayde erle leycester glouceter conteyned foloweth excellent lord kyngea e ter sent kyng henry grace god kynge englande lorde irlande duke gwyan baron faythfull seruauntes theyr fydelyte othe god coueytynge kepe sendyng due salutyng reuerence honour vnder due obeysaunce lyketh yt youre hyghnes vnderstade many beyng haue tymes shewyd vnto lordshyppe v many euyll vntrewe reportes haue founde suggestyons alonely v also selfe brynge realme vnto subuersyon know excellency entende nothyng helth suerty person vttermoste power onely enmyes also youre realme entende vtter greuaunce correccyon besechynge grace gyue vnto theym lytell credece ye shall fynde v trew faythfull subiectes vtter moste power erle leyceter erle glouceter request selfe haue put seales x day moneth may answere vnto foresayde letter henry ye grace god kyng englande lorde irland duke guyan symonde de mountforde gylbert de clare theyr coplyces warre generall turbauce realme begon contynued wyth also brennynges hurtes enormytyes euydently apperyth fydelyte v due ye haue kept ye suerty person ye haue lytell regarded mych lord trusty frendes whyche dayly byde wyth v ye veryn greue theym pursue vttermost power yet dayly entede ye reporte letter haue v ascertayned greue admyt take owne specyally theyr fydelyte whyche v dayly impende stande abyde v oppresse ifidelyte vntrouthe wherfore fauoure assuraunce sette lyttell store enymyes vtterly defye wytnesse selfe towne lewys xii daye moneth may ouer kyng romaynes syr edwarde kynges sonne lordes beyng kynge sente vnto nother letter wherof tenour ensuyth richarde grace god kynge romaynes alwaye augustus edwarde noble fyrst begotten son kyng england baron fermely standynge abydynge wyth souerayne lorde kynge symonde moutford gylbert de clare theyr false felowes letter whych ye sent vnto kynge moste souerayne lorde vnder stande defyed neuerthelesse worde dyffyaunce apperyd vnto v suffycyently depredacyon brennyng manours carienge away goodes wherfore wyll ye vnderstande defye mortall publyke enmyes euer may come reuegement iniuryes yt ye v haue done shal acquit ye vttermost power ye put vppon v nother trewe good counsayll souerayne lorde kynge gyue ye therin say falsely vntrewly yf ye saieng ye syr symonde de mountforde syr gylbert de clare wyll iustifye courte souerayne lord redy purchase suerty safe commynge may proue trew faythfull innocencye false traytorouse lyenge wytnessyd wyth ye seales rychard kynge romaynes syr edwarde forenamed gyuen lewys xii daye may barony receyued letter kyng lordes perceyued well none mean defede theyr cause dynt sword wherfore puttyng theyr trust god spedde theym forth toward kynge vppon wednysday beynge xxiiii daye may erly mornynge hostes met lodoners gyuen fyrst assaute betyn backe began draw sharpe shot stroke discomforte baron hoste ye baron encoraged comforted theyr men suche wyse alonely freshe lusty knyghtes fought egerly also suche scomfyted recoueryd theyr vertue strength fought wythout fere myche kynges vaward lost theyr placescruell detestable batayle felde coueryd wyth dede bodyes gaspynge gronyng hard euery syde eyther desyrous bryng life fader sparyd son son yt fader allyauce ye tyme turned vnto dyffyaunce crysten blood daye shad wythoute pytie thus duryng cruell fyght parte ye day lastely victory fyll baron yt taken kynge kynge romayns syr edwarde kynges son wyth many noble men nomber xxv baron banerettes people slayn great multytude ouer xx thousande sayth myne authours baron thus obteyned vyctorye prouysyon made ye saufe kepyng prysoners sent vnto dyuers castellys prysons except kyng brother kynge almayne syr edwarde son whych baron helde wyth theym tyll came london new graunte made kynge foresayd statute shuld stande strength yf thought vnreasonable corrected amendyd foure noble men realme meane ii spyrytualtye ii temporaltye yf iiii myght agree erle angeou duke burgoyn iudges mater fermely holden obeyed kynge hys brother kynges graunted theyr sonnes heyres shuld remayne wyth baron prysoners tyll thynge fynysshed accordynge former agrement vppon thys parlyament appoynted holden london penthecoste folowynge came neuer purpose tuesday assencyon day peace proclaimed london betwene kynge hys baron vppon daye folowynge kynge baron came vnto london kynge romayns syr edwarde kynge sonne syr edward pledge kyng syr henry sonne vnto kynge almayn sent vnto toure lodged thes vnto douer castell kyng lodged byshoppes palays paules kynge almayne dyuers within towre yt agreed kynge suertye weale lande erle leyceter shuld ressyaut kynges courte uppon whyche agrement many prysoners set large passe tyme felde lewys ye quene kyng romayns sent ouer ye see souldy ayde kynge agayne baron whych comen great nomber vnto douer houed ye see haue laded wherof herynge baron sent kyng romayns castell berkham stede prisoner tyll sayde allyauntes retourned caused kynge henry wyth great power ryde thyder force sayde hoste straungers retourne theyr owne countreys kynge returned sayde straungers shortly wyth agrement baron sayled ouer fraunce retourned agayne wythin short terme anno domini mcclxiii anno domini mcclxiiii osbert wynter thomas fyz thomas anno xlviii phylyppe taylour xlviii yere lordes march feast crystmasse assembled theym costes dyd myche harme vppon lordeshyppes manours erlys leyceter glouceter standynge march walys wherfore kynge rode shortely glouceter called counsayl lordes authoryte whych counsayll yt enacted many ye sayd lordes came octauis saynte hyllary nexte folowynge yelded vnto kynges grace shuld exyled sayd cou sayll also agreed ye sayd octaues shulde parlyament holdyn westmynster whyche daye kyng wyth lordes spyrytuall temporall common hys lande beganne forsayde parlyament durynge whyche yt shewed kynge beynge present syr edward son none theym shulde daye greue cause greuyd erles leyceter glouceter ye baron banerettes knyghtes citesyns london baron v porte none son persones hyghe low degree vpon partye sayd erles mater dyspleasure done agayne kynge sayd syr edwarde sonne tyme day vphold kynge hys lordes sworne shewed rad charter pardon concernynge sayde cause confyrmacyon statute foreste wyth many actes statute graunted kynge feaste saynt gregory folowynge xii daye marche syr edwarde kynges son yt beforne also sworn performe promyses kyng made parliament delyueryd lyberte also syr henry kynges son almayne whych ben kept pledge ye haue harde vppon terme ix monethes odde dayes vpon assurauce made ye sayd syr edwarde shuld dwel abyde kynges courte departe then wythoute lycence kyng certayne baron many instrumentes bandes made kynge syr edwarde son performaunce couenaunts paccyons made betwene kynge baron whyche shortly came small effecte season betwene easter penthecoste orderynge aforesaid statute made oxenford fell deffencyon betwene erles leyceter glouceter wordes dyspleasure vtteryd betweene kynge also beynge glouceter kynge baron laboure set theym vnyte reste vppon see baron v porte robbed spoyled men myght take sparynge nother englyshe marchauntes whych prayes ye comon fame went baron lande hadde good parte whytson weke folowynge ye kynge wyth erle leyceter syr edwarde hys sonne wyth many lordes beynge herforde ye edge walys sayd syr edward secretly wythout lycence departed courte yode vnto chester accopanyed erle glouceter ye lordes march erle warene syr roger mortymer then went vnto glouceter breking brydges went entent folowed tyll assembled power knowlege thys came vnto erle leyceter al hast sent vnto syr symode son yt shuld gather knyghtes vnto hym accordyng ye comaundemet assembled vnto hym myche people drew toward wynchester came cytye vppon euyn translacyon saynte swythyn xiiii daye moneth iulye shyt mych cytesyns knewe whyther came kynges frende also lytell hadde receyued letter syr edwarde wyllynge theym holde theym cytye cause citesyns closed theyr gate agayn sayd syr symonde hys companye yt longe cytye yelden spoyled town slewe partye iewes dwellyd wythin done layd syege vnto castell assauted tydynges fayned comynge syr edwarde hys power departyd shortely then yode vnto kenelworth uppon laste daye iuly syr edwarde wyth hys hoste came vnto kenelworth foresaid fyll sodaynly vppon hoste forenamed syr symonde wyth shedynge lytell blood toke prysoners erle oxenforde wyllyam de mount canyse adam de newmarket syr balwyne wake hughe neuyle wyth dyuers syr symonde fledde castell escaped forenamed prysoners sent vnto glouceter putte suer kepynge meane whyle syr symonde erle leyceter toke leue kynge whyche herforde passed ryuer seuerne yode vnto worceter ye erle great payne passed brydges syr edwarde broken passed coutreys gaderynge people went yt processe wyth hym stronge power wherof herynge syr edwarde costed towarde hym vi daye august met wyth hym euysham worceter shyre betwene theym foughten cruell fyght yt whych length slayn sayd syr symonde syr henry sonne heyre syr hughele spenser syr peter de mountforde many noble men helde vppon baron partye whych scomfyture malycyous dysposed person despyte erle cut hode dimyssaryes fastyned vppon eyther syde hys nose made present therof vnto wyfe syr roger mortymer hys fete also handes cut body sente sondry place trunke hys bodye buryed wythin chyrch euysham erle speketh ranulphe muke chester boke policronycon calleth hym symon ryght wise sayynge god wrought hym myracles deth whyche forfere kynge syr edwarde sonne kept close secret man durste speke soone victory thus obteyned syr edward ye kyng met whose authorytyes prysoners hold dyuers place comaundemet ye sayd syr edward set lybertie many dayly accused set natyuyte lady parliamet holde winchester authoryte ye statute ordinauces made ye baron oxenforde xli yere ye kyng vtterly fordone set nought bondes wrytynges made kyng obseruynge cancellyd broken also thys cousayll ordeyned fauoured baron pryson large shulde disherited ye kyng resumed hande grauntes made gyuen person syr symounde de mountforde myght agree wyth kynge parlyament restored castel kenelworth assured whyche wyth syr henry de hastynges kept longe parlyament ended kyng came vnto wyndesore great power entendynge fame went destroye cytye london great ire dyspleasure hadde vnto yt wherof heryng mayre alderman striken wonderfull fere yt many rabbysh wylde comoners full purpose haue defended cytye agayne kynge thus amonge dyuers many opinyons wonder dayes cytye inhabyted many maner nacyons whyche admytted cytesyns lastely grace sad counsayll beste cytye condescended make supplycacyon ye kynge send yt religyous person made dyuers sent sondry persones auayled ryght nought kynge greuously encensyd counsayll agayne cytesyns yt wold loke vppon none theyr supplycacyons yf man spake theym soone wold make cou tenaunce men whyche fauoure feryd speke cytesyns counsayled theyr fredes yt shuld make writyng seale yt theyr common seale vertue whereof shulde offer theym selfe put theym holly kynges grace mercy touchynge theyr lyues goodes accordynge whyche counsayll deuysed wrytynge sealed yt wyth theyr comon seale done chose viii person cytye fredes courte sent toward wyndesore vi daye october uppon whych day encountered beyonde colbroke knyght kinges callyd syr roger leyborne whych turned sayde viii persones vnto cytye also rode wyth theym tyll came nere vnto cytye departed rode vppon backe syde towne vnto toure departynge wyl led warne mayre wyth certayne cytye mete wyth hym vppon morow berkynge chyrche whyche standeth nere vnto towre uppon morow mayre sayde syr roger met longe processe made shewed kynges greuous displeasure whyche bare towarde cytye meanes hadde vsed theyr frendes louers obteyne grace cytye lastely expressed yt grace myght
