excepte wolde theyr common seale bynde theym selfe fully holly stande ye kynges grace put mercy theyr lyues goodes wherunto ende cytesyns graunted delyueryd forsayde wrytynge vnto foresayd roger prayenge hym good meane ye kynge whych departyd towarde ye kyng vpon morow returned agayne vi daye wylled mayre alderman mete wyth hym agayne foresayd chirch shewyd kynge great instaunce theyr frendes hadde receyued theyr wyrtynge wold fyrste begynnynge cotentacion mynde chaynes whych stode euery strete lane ende wythin cytye shuld lousyd fro theyr postes post also drawen erthe brought vnto towre done mayre wyth certayne ye cytesyns nomber xl persones shuld daye folowynge wyndesore comferme graunt theyr wrytyng yt shuld go come safe suer wise delyuered kynges letter seale ye terme foure dayes whyche done accordynge theyr former deuyse mayre wyth foresayd persones redy wyndesore vppon morow beynge sondaye one clocke taryed tyll iiii daye whyche season kynge commynge dysporte entred castell wythout contenaunce castyng eyen vppon londoner kyng peole entred castell londoner wolde haue folowed warned abide short tyme kyng causyd proclamacyon made man hygh low degre londoner shulde make sayynges dyspleasure make quarell euenynge came vnto foresayd syr roger syr robert waleys knyghtes brought theym castell sayde kynges pleasure speke wyth nyght sayde knyghtes delyueryd vnto costable ye castell closyd large toure nyght hadde small chere worse lodgynge vppon morowe beynge mondaye towarde nyght taken oute toure delyueryd vnto ye baylly sayd castell lodged assygnement except v person mene thomas fyz thomas mayre mychaell tony stephan bukkerell thomas pywellyson iohn de flete whyche v persones kynge hadde gyuen syr edwarde sonne whose commaundemet remayned styll saide toure longe wythstandynge kynges saue conduyte theym shewed made tydynges hereof came vnto cyte london yt fere many auoyded auoyded many mo conueyed theyr goodes secrete wyse dyuers countreys englande many neuer returned anno domini mcclxiiii anno domini mcclxv thomas de la fourdeous thomas fyz thomas anno xlix gregory rokkylse thys xlix yere vppon daye saynt leonarde vi daye nouember ye kyng came vnto westmynster shortly gaue vnto diuers houshold seruautes vpon thre score house housholdes wythin citye yt owner compellyd agre redeme theyr house housholde wyth goodes ellys auoyde suffer person enter ye sayd house gyue vnto alonely also suche landes tenementes goodes catalles sayde cytezeyns place englande made custos gardeyn cytye syr othon constable toure whych syr othon chase bayllyues vnder hym hym accomptable vse kyng iohn adrian walter heruy cytezeyns cytye thys kynge toke pledge best menes sonnes cytye hys pea shulde surely kepte within whiche put toure londo kepte coste theyr parentes shortly great laboure suyte made forsayd persones kepynge ye bayly castell wyndesore iiii onely except saye rycharde bonauenture symo de hadisstok wyllyam de kent wyllyam de grouceter lodoners xxxiili nober delyuered came erondon thursday folowynge feast saynte luke ye xxi day nouember ix kepte styll toure wyndesore dayly suyte laboure made vnto ye kynge haue hys gracyous fauour know hys pleasure fyne wolde haue cytye theyr transgressyons displeasure theym hym done whyche kynge asked xlmli fermely helde hym lm marke cytye layde poore common cytye whereof many auoyded trespassours ouer best men cytye ryotous sone spoyled robbed rouers also see wardeynes yt v porte thys troublous seaso lost great part theyr substance whych cosyderacyons many whyche tedyous wryt cytezeyns besought kynge hys gracious fauour pyte take theym myght bere thys matter thus hangyng kynge vppon seynt nycholas euyn departed westmynster towarde northampton lytell hys departynge ordeyned syr iohn lynd knyght mayster iohn waldren clerke gardeynes cytye toure whyche named kynges writtynge senesshalles stewardes cytye uppon daye folowynge kynge ryden ii forenamed stewardes sent xxiiii mooste notable men cytye warned theym apere day folowynge ye kynges counsayle westmynster theyr apparaunce shewed vnto syr roger leyborne kynges mynde shulde haue rule cytye hys absens vnder foresaid senesshalles se good rule kept wythin ye cytye shuld sworne hys counsayle sworn countermaunded vnto cytye alwaye labour made vnto kynge fyne cytye crystmas weke ende made wyth kyng labour suche frendes cytye hym summe xxm marke transgressyons offence done certayne persones excepted whyche kynge gyue syr edwarde hys sonne beynge sayde tour wynsore paymet summe dayes agremet set syr roger leyborne mayster roberte wareyn clerke assigned take suertyes ye whych suertye theym receyued sente vnto kynge northampto kynge sent immedyatly vnto ye cytezeyns charter vnder brode seale whereof effecte ensueth henry grace god kig englande lord irlande duke guyan al men helth knowe ye fyne xxm marke whyche cytezeyns london v made redempcyon transgression trespaces v quene noble brother rycharde kynge almayne edward fyrst begote sonne done remytte pardone v heyres sayd cytezeyns theyre heyres moche v haue enioye theyre former grauntes lybertees rente profittes feste crystmas laste paste also sayde cytezeyns haue theym forfaytes malefactours ye cytye parturbauce made endyted yet endyted excepte goodes catalles theym whyche haue gyuen bodyes vnto forsayd sonne edwarde except rente tenemetes cytezeyns whyche shalbe eschete reason forsayde transgressyons prysoners whyche prysons remayne freely delyuered excepte sone whose bodyes haue gyue edwarde sonne yt sayd cytezeyns fre sayd transgressyons partes costes thys landes wytnes whereof haue made letter patentes wytnesseth selfe northampton x day ianuarii yere reygne xlix whyche pardone cytezeyns receyued pledge beyng toure londo also iiii toure wyndesore say rychard bonauenture symo de hadistoke wyllyam kente wyllyam glouceter delyuered thanne also dyscharged forenamed stewardes syr iohn lynde mayster iohn waldre cytezeyns selfe chose mayre wyllya fyz rychard shyreffes thomas de la fourde gregory de rokkysley leuyng fyne set well seruauntes couenat men housholders many refuced lyberties cytye quyt charge whyle kynge lay thus northampton syr symo de mountford put hym vpon dome pope legat octobonus yt come thys lade refourme thinges chyrche englande also set vnyte reste betwene kynge hys lordes whose also kynge romayns forsayde syr symond bounden hym stande upon whych promyse bande lybertied large kynges courte contynued season ye ende kyng comme lo departed sodaynly courte rode vnto wynchelsee accompanyed hym rouers see pry taken departed theym sayled fraunce put hym seruyce holy lowis kyng prouynce thys yere also vppon euyn saynt iohn baptyst kynge bega hys syege castell kenelworth mighty power syr hery hastynges suche within defended strogly kynge hys power myght nat wynne sayde castell loge tyme nexte yere shall appere shewed howe ye quene purueiaus caused host straungers prepare come englande ayde lorde kynge agayn baron also purchased curse ye pope acurse sayde baron theyre ayders helper commyssios dyrected certayn bysshoppes englande execute london wynchester chychester fere baron denyed deferred execucyon sentence sayd curse wherfore quene made newe laboure pope urban iiii grau ted sayde bysshoppes theyr dysobedyence shulde corrected thys octobon foresayde legate thys yere counsayl holden hym clergy englande paules chyrche londo suspended sayde bysshoppes theym sente vnto rome assoyled pope beynge thys daye clement iiii anno domini mcclxv anno domini mcclxvi edwarde blont thomas fiz thomas anno l peter aunger thys l yere vppon euyn saynt thomas apostle crystmas yelden appoyntement castel kenelworth whyche kynge hys power lyen sayd fro mydsomer tyll day tha gyuen ouer syr henry hastynges hys complyeys vppon condycyon yt shulde haue lyfe lym horse harneys thynges within castell belongynge certayne tyme leyser cary way thys yere tyme lent ye wardeyns v porte recocyled ye kynge fauour syr edward kynges sonne natwithstandynge greate harmys done rouyng vppon see aswel englysshe marchauntes confermed theyr fourmer pryuyleges ouer theym grauted yt yf man englysshe wolde sewe restitucyon good taken deth theyre frendes slayne suche complayntes shuld sued shewed theyr court haue theyr mater determyned nat ellys cause thys ende thus made atwene ye kyng nat shewed ye comon fame yt day ran yt sayd wardeins ye v porte thys day ye dominio see wherfore ye kyng fayn folowe theyr pleasure feast philip iacob ye kyng helde hys parlyamet nort hapton yt whych cofermed ye olde fraunchyses lybertyes kyng progenytours grauted vnto cytye lodon new graut ye shyre middelsex thys parlyament dysheryted many noble men lande yt tyme taken baron partie whyche cause accompanied theym togyder robbed reuyd diuers coostes lande toke towne lyncoln spoyled raunsomed many ryche burgeyses towne toke ile ely stregthed suche wyse helde longe anno domini mcclxvi anno dni mcclxvii iohn adryan willm fiz rycharde anno li luke badecot thys li yere chosyng mayre certayne contrauersies fyll attwene ruler common cytye london wherfore aduice mayre alderman syr roger leydorne came vnto ye guylhalle beyng harnesed vnder theyr gownes vppon fryday folowyng alhalowyn called common eleccion new mayre best cytye gaue ye nominacyo vnto alei sowch diuerse ye cryed vpon thomas fyz thomas whych tyme prysoner wyndesore castell wherfore sayd roger ye assystence mayre toke sayde rascal euyll disposed persones sent vnto dyuers prysons thys yere also gentylmen helde ile ely brake oute sondry tymes dyd moche harme northfolke suffolke cambrydgeshyre toke cytie norwyche spoylynge thereof caryed awaye theym many cytezeyns beynge ryche fynaunced theym great summes money lyued therein ile lyke vnto lawes thys many hurtes dyuers place lade done theuys yll dysposed people whereof charge euer layde vnto fore name gentilmen legate laboured vnto kynge sayde disheryted gentylmen myght purchase theyr la de hym fyne raunsome whose laboure kynge lastly agreed sayd gentylme shuld haue theyr landes agayne fynes v yere value theyr lande myght dyspende xxli yere shulde paye cli rate except syr robert ferers erle derby syr iohn de la warre hym strake ye fyste kynges purseuaut persones whyche small hauoure shulde fyned discrecyon kynges counsayll toke conclusyon anno domini mcclxvii anno dni mcclxviii thomas basynge aleyn south anno lii robert de cornehylf thys lii yere hap nat expressed syr gylbert de clare erle gloceter refused ye king marche walys gadered vnto hi stronge power whome also drewe syr iohn eyuile company disherited feest crystmasse greate hoost came nere vnto london tyme pope legate octobonus beynge lodged toure lodo whan mayre alderman cytye ware erles commynge stronge power nat knowynge whether kynges frende nat shytte gate agayne hys fore ryders kynge none hys cousayll nere vnto cytye mayre alderman went vnto legate requyred hys counsayl whether shulde suffre erle entre ito cytye nat wherunto legate answered thought nat contrary knewe wele kynges trewe subyect fre de nat loge messanger came erle vnto mayre wyllynge haue lycence passe thorugh cytye southwerke entendyd lodge hym hys people whyche graunted erle passed thorough cytye lodged south werke came shortly southerey syde syr iohn eyuile greate company mayre kepte gate ye brydge shyt watched dayly certayne armyd men euery nyght caused draw brydge drawen water syde dayly nyghtly watched many armyd men lytell processe tyme legate erle agreed suche wyse erle hys aduyce suffered certayne hys people lodged within ye cytye reason wherof dayly drewe hys people cytye fynally many thynges ordered hym many common toke hys partye agayne mayre alderman easter weke toke ye keyes brydge gate offycers cytye delyuered pleased hym receyued cytye many dysherited persones gaue fre lybertye passe brydge houres daye ye nyghte mayre thys sente worde vnto kynge whych gaderyng hys power northfolke made hasty spede towarde london whyche meane tyme erle hys company made bulwerkes barbycanys atwene toure cytye caste dyke trench place ye cytye fortyfyed wonderously many ye cytezeyns feryng newe insurreccyon voyded cytye secretly myght whose goodes erle seased hys owne vse suffred hys men spoyle theyr pleasure commos cytye forgat theyr late punysshment men without drede god theyr kynge toke certayne alderman caste theym prysone sequestred theyr goodes dyspoyled moche therof thervppon ranne guyldhalle chose theyr mayre custos ruler cytye syr rychard de culworth knyght baylyues roberte de lynton roger marshall dyscharged olde mayre sheryffes done suche prysoners newgate ludgate crepylgate prysons within cytie bycause baron warre passed delyuered set lybertye whan legate beheld thys rebellio dyscorde repented hym hys fourmer counsayll gyue vnto mayre sawe might nat refourme erle hys errour thretened hym wyth censurs chyrch accurse hym dysheryted vpon thys commaunded deuyne seruyce sayd without note chyrch dores shytte tyme seruice doynge belle ronge vnto sayde seruyce entent yt disheryted whych stode accursed shuld nat entre ye church deuyne seruyce god vpo iii wekes easter kynge came ham iii myles london lodged hym selfe abbaye whyte monkes stratforde whyther came vnto hym legate soone lodgid also abbay streyghtnes lodgyng horse mule sette wythin closter sayde abbay kynges hoste made dayly assautes vpon cytye gunnes ordynaunces shot cytye whyche lytell nothynge hurte towne yt strongly fortyfyed season ye legate vpon partye kynge romaynes vppon partye allyauce betwene hym erle glouceter labored kyng reformacyon peace spoken durynge whyche treaty souldyours lyenge southwerke made many robboryes southery place rowed ouer westmynster spoyled kynges paleys deuoured hys wyne brake ye glasse wyndowes necessaryes paleys destroyed wasted somtymes came lyke wyse lodon robbyd also whyche taken iiii yt bare conysaunce erle derby whyche erle caused theyr handes legges bounden put sacke cast thamys feast saynt barnabe peace betwene kynge erle glouceter concludyd whyche conclusyon taken erle remouyd cytye lodged agayne south werke kyng entryd citye sondaye mydsomer daye forth wyth kynges proclamacyons made cytye peace betwene kyng erle gyuen liberte ye dysheryted person yt shuld haue xi dayes respyte shyft selfe meane auoyde suche place myght suertye ellys agre former composycyon made legate paye v parte slynte theyr landes certayne persones exceptyd rehersyd touchyng erle suche dysheryted wyth also cytesyns london clerely forgyuen pardoned restoryd theyr offyces aleyn sowch mayre thomas basynge robert de cornehyll shyreffes alderman whych deposyd agayn restored theyr wardes offyces uppon wednysday folowynge legate interdyted cytye endured vi clocke mornyng tyll iii clocke next day none yt dyschargyd vppon othe ii common sworne name cytye cytye shulde stande ordynaunce iudgement holy chyrche cronycle sayth interdyccyon shulde haue contynued longer ne ben sterenesse londoner whyche helde legate streyght enforced hym wythdraw sentence vppon foresayde condycyon bulwerkes barbycans made erle cytye plucked clene vppe dyches fyllyd parte theym sene cytesyns shulde haue theyr newe pardon grauted obstacle made myche yet hadde recompensyd kynge romaynes subuersyon manour thystylworth whyche axed vi thousande marke fynally wyth great laboure frendshyppe thy agreed gyue vnto hym amendes thousande marke payed two yeres longe kynge acceptyd grace syr iohn eyuyle syr nycholas de segraue syr willyam marmeryn mermyon syr richarde gray syr iohn fyz iohn syr gylbert de lucy accorde also made betwene syr edwarde kynges sonne forenamed erle glouceter fortress defence tyme made southwerke place ioynynge pulled vp destroyed erle souldyours clene voyded thynges set order reste excepte yet kept yle ely kynge rode shrowysburye taried season comon mater betwene hym lewelyn prynce walys kynge thus beyng shrowysbury wrytte dyrectyd syr aleyn souch mayre lodon viii dayes mychelmas kynge chargynge hym cytesyns shuld procede eleccyon newe shyreffes tyll commynge london suffer olde abyde styll offyce anno domini mcclxviii anno dni mcclxix wyllyam de durham aleyn souch anno liii walter henry liii yere moneth nouember fyll varyauce betwene felyshyppes goldsmythes tayllours london whyche grew makynge partyes wyth goldsmythes toke partye felyshyp craft wyth tayllours helde ye craft staynersd rf takyng meane thys myche people nyghtly gaderyd stretes harneys length yt prouyded ye thyrd nyght sayde partyes met vpon nomber v hudred men sydes ran gyther wyth violence yt slayn many wouded outcrie made yt shy reffes strength comons came ryddynge theym theym toke certayn persones sent vnto dyuers prysons vppon morowe suche serche made moste chefe causers fray taken put warde vppon freday folowyng saynt katheryns day sessyons kepte newgate mayre laurece de broke iustyce xxx sayd persones arregned felony xiii caste hanged one godfrey de beuerlay holpe arme one sayd person also caste amonge lent folowyng kynge beyng westmynster commauded mayre london present vnto hym vi persones able shyriffes whyche vi presented ye kyng chase ii shyreffes say wyllyam de durham walter henry caused theym sworne shulde gader profytes cytye gyue trewe accompte baron excheker morow saynt iamis daye xxvi daye iuly kynge dyscharged syr aleyn souch mayre made stepha edworth constable toure custos cytye london ruler cytye yere thomas fyz thomas mayre dyuers oppynyons writer yere whyche xlviii yere kynge henry tyll lviii yere hys reygne whyche yere iohan adryan draper mayre custodyes gardeyns mayres ye constable towre lodon also custos cytye tyme also medyacy meanes syr edwarde suche dysheryted persones kepte yle ely reconcyled vnto kynge fortress defence therin theym made plucked away destroyed thys moneth iuly octobonus legat made many good rule chyrche wythoute great charge dymes leuyed toke leue kynge rode towarde see syde great treasour returned processe tyme rome innocent fyft yere lorde xii hundred lxxvi chosen created pope named adryan yt v yt name dyed wythin l dayes ele yon yere also myche many cytesyns london great imposycyon charge sette towarde fyne xx thousande marke forenamed wyth charge voyde cytye wyth theyr housholdes goodes enhabited dyues place lande thynkynge therby acquited sayd sessyng charge cytye whych remayned made instant laboure ye kyng yt graunted suche sayde cause hadde voyded theyr goodes cytye shulde distrayned shyryff ye shyre dwelled forcyd paye suche summes assessyd moneth september forenamed v cytesyns whych remayned prysoners towre wyndefore saye thomas fyz thomas mychaell tony stephan buckerell thomas pywelysdon iohn de la flete ende xlviii yere expressyd made thys season theyr ende wyth syr edwarde kynges sonne great summes money delyueryd anno domini mcclxix anno domini mcclxx wyllyam haddystoke thomas fiz thomas anno liiii anketyll de aluerne liiii yere beganne harde froste feaste saynt andrew enduryd tyll yt nere vnto candelmasse whych feruent thamys aboue bridge betwene london westmynster harde frosyn ye men bestes passed ouer fote lambhyth westmynste vpward dyuers place kyngstone marchaundyse caryed sandwych hauens see vnto london lande shyppes ye season myghte entre ryuer thamys feaste saynte uedast fyll suche plent water ye thamys flowed rose hyghe lyke therof sene men lyuynge wherof ensued mych harme london selers water syde drowned theym great plente marchaundyse peryshed loste yere begynnynge lent ye kynge gaue vnto syr edward son rule cytye london reuenues profytes yt belongynge whyche gyft ye sayd syr edwarde made syr hugh son othon costable ye towre custos cytye vppon ix daye apryll ensuynge syr edmunde kynges sonne surnamed crouch bake maryed westminster doughter erle aumarle solempnyte wherof kynge kept ye great hall great honorable feaste sondaye folowynge vppon daye saynte erkenwalde laste daye apryll nexte ensuynge syr edwarde ye kynges sonne commaunded citesyns london presente vnto hym vi persones able shyreffes london whyche admytted offyce wyllyam de hadestoke anketyll de aluerne sware accomptauntes theyr predecessours vi daye may folowyng psentyd ye guyld hall chargyd new dayes newe custome toll vsed payed cytysyns london vnto kynge whych toll syr edwarde hadde letten ferme marchaunt strauger xx marke yere wherfore cytesysn wyllynge vnder rule strauger made grete suyte vnto sayde syr edwarde lastely agreed wyth hym bye sayde tolle free summe two hundred marke ende yere meane xiii daye october kynge lette translate wyth great solemnytye holy body saynte edwarde kynge confessour laye syde quere monkes nowe synge chapell backe hyghe aulter westmynster abbay layde yt ryche shryne yere kynge hadde graunted vnto hym towarde vyage purposyd hym holy lande xx peny euery mannes substaunce mouable thorough hys lande lay fee spyrytualty assent ye x gregorye pope iii dysmes leuyed thre yeres anno domini mcclxx anno domini mcclxxi walter porter iohn adryan uyntyner anno lv iohn taylour thys lv yere kynge romains cocludid couenaut betwen ye kyng syr gylbert de clare erle glouceter vyage taken holy lande sayd erle kynge whych vyage saide erle shuld haue toward charge viii thousand mark takyng shyppyng iiii thousande marke redy fyrst daye may next folowynge yf erle redy see syde day company take shyppynge shuld forfayte ye kyng iim marke suertie wherof ye sayde erle shuld delyuer kynges possessyon castell henleger standynge vppon ye marche walis cam purpose wherfore ye cause shewyd ye iourney perfourmed syr edwarde kynges sonne shall declared passe tyme cytesyns london contentyd well syr edwardes mynde laboured kynges grace theyr chartour cofermyd shuld theyr auncyent lybertyes chose self mayre two shryues ye sayd shryues haue offyces therunto belongynge ferme fore hadde excepte wheretofore payde fee ferme iii hundred l punde nowe shulde pay iiii hundred l poude whyche confyrmacyon thus grauted passed ye kynges brode seale cytesyns vppon xiiii daye iuly assembled guyldhall chase theyr mayre iohn adryan draper shyreffes walter porter iohn tayller vppon ye xvi daye folowynge syr edwarde beynge present presented vnto ye king westminster admitted sworne syr hugh othon dyschargyd rule cytye citesyns theyr fre wyll gaue vnto kynge c marke syr edwarde v hudred marke whyche gyft kyng well accepted soone receyued theyr chartour confyrmacyon berynge date xxi day iuly yere kynges reygne lv former conuencyon betwene kyng erle glouceter holden syr edwarde toke vppon hym kynges crosse kynge gaue suche money graunted ye lay fee shewyd toke leue kyng toke shyppynge douer xx daye august sayled burbeaux wyfe noble company holy lewys kyng fraunce gone taryed burdeaux certayne season sped hym forsayd company toward ye cytye thunys ye frenche kyng came thyder saynt lewys dede ye peace cocluded betwene phylyppe hys son kynge thunys wherfore syr edwarde entendynge greue goddes enmyes wyth knygtes fraunce whych enteded toke leue frenche kynge syr charl hys vncle kynge scycyle sayled holy lande arryued porte acris acon ye daye holy lande mo cytyes possessyon cristen men cytye tyre wyth certayne castellys wherunto crysten fled often socoure agayne sarazyns syr edwarde come ye cytye acon ye crysten knyghtes receyued hym gret honour gladnesse lodged hym theyr beste maner taryed space yere aftermeth ye french cronycle yt longe commynge thyder soudane sury whych wonne al countreys came thyther wyth great power sarazyns assauted towne vygurously syr edwarde ayde crysten men bare hym knyghtly defended cytye castellys belongynge terrytores soudane hys great multytude power gate lyteil honoure notwytstandynge hadde hys hoste affyrmeth frenche cronycle ouer hundred thousande sarazyns affyrmeth sayde cronycle syr edwarde polycyes manfull actes honorably behauyd neuer dyd acte lyfe folowynge dyd many grete honour none lyke vnto actes accomplyshed brought vnto ende reason wherof name amonge infidelys memory many yeres honoure thys marcyall knyght haue shewed lenger rehersall myche fynde yt testyfyed french men knowe well theyr cronycles make englysh prynces must great authoryte ellys yt shuld specyally haue ben noted ouer assured yf frenche prynce deseruyd suche generall pryce yt shulde haue ben set artyculed euery acte thereof yt shulde haue conteyned large worke specyaltyes therof declared theyre moste laude honour thys noble prynce beynge thus acon dayly puttynge suryens shame great damage seynge might preuayle agayn hym strength vatayll cast myght destroy hym treason sente vnto hym sarazyne name messanger whyche tellynge hys fayned message wou ded hym wyth knyfe enuenomyd whyche wounde laye longe therof cured confessyon made sarazyn hys copassed treason put vnto cruell deth thys yere also fyll downe steple saynt mary bow chepe lodon slew woman chyldren anno domini mcclxxi anno dni mcclxxii gregory rokkysle iohn adryan wyntener anno lvi henry waleys lvi yere moneth nouember parliamet holden westmynster marchau te lodon place englande complayned ye kyng countesse flaundres taken certayne gooddes amountynge great summe uppon whych complaynt kyng sent make restytucyon e kyng comaunded men born ye partyes englande shulde arrested theyr goodes vnder suer kepynge whych meane conclusyon sent ouer embassadours besought kyng marchautes myght vse theyr entercourse flaudres tymes done lossis theym susteyned shulde recompensyd soone amytye betwene kynge concluded de rychard kynge smayne yere ye ende marche dyed rychard kynge almayn erle cornewayle brother kynge buryed haylys abbaye whyte monkes hym tymes buylded hadde ben kynge almayne terme xv yeres rehersall made xxx yere kyng henry shuld reygne xvi yeres moneth iuny ye monastery ye trinite ye citie norwiche consumed wyth fyre reason fraye made betwene seruauntes abbaye cytezeyns cytye whyche grewe great skyrmysshe pryour monkes purueyed sowdyours helde ye belfray chyrch force army threwe stone dartes shotte many arrowes reason wherof many ye towne bothe wounded slayne whyche broughte comons yonge men suche furye madnesse fyrid gate forced fyre rede drye woode chyrche wyth bookes ornamentes house offyce belongynge abbey clene brent throwen downe nothynge preserued excepte lytell chapell wha tydynges thys ryot came ye kyng knowlege therwith greuously dyspleased rode thyder soone commaunded questes charged knyghtes esquyres dwelled countre aboute endyte suche persones occasyoners executours dede reason whyche enquery fynally caste iuged vppon nombre xxx yonge men towne whyche drawen place execucyon hanged brent great dyscomfyture sorowe cytezeyns thought ye pryour place occasyoner myschyef whych borne defended bysshop norwyche beyng named roger yere diuers prodygies strauge token sene dyuers place englande amoge ye whych grenewyche besyde london la yenyda moster hauynge ii perfyte bodyes wyth membres one heed anno domini mclxxii anno domini mcclxxiii rycharde parys syr walter henry anno lvii iohn bedyll thys lvii yere kynge hery begynnynge kynge sykened forcyd kepe bed westminster called hym syr gylberte de clare erle glouceter caused hym newly sworne kepe pea lande behofe edwarde hys sonne dyed vppon daye saynte edmunde bysshoppe xvi day nouembre buryed vppon southesyde saynte edwarde westmynster whenne reygned lvi yeres xxviii day leuynge hym syr edwarde beforenamed hys heyre edmude crowchbak table hagyng vpo tombe sayd henry written verse folowynge tercius henricus iacet hic pietatis amicus ecclesiam strauit istam quam post renouauit reddat ei munus qui regnat trinus vnus whyche may englysshed foloweth frende pyte almesse dede henry thyrde whylome englande kynge thys chyrch brake hys mede agayn renewed fayre buyldynge nowe resteth whyche dyd great thynge yelde hys mede lorde deyite one god reygneth persones thre francia lowys ix ye name sonne vnto seconde phylyp bega reygne ouer realme frauce yere lorde xiicxxiii vii yere thyrde hery kynge englande thys lowys crowned raynes vpon daye saynt sixtus pope vi day august meane thys lowys testifieth freshe cronycle retourned blode pepyn enherytaunce crowne fraunce whose name isabell doughter bawdewyn erle henaut whych bawdewyn discendyd ermengaunte somtyme countesse namoure whyche doughter charles duke lorayne whyche charles lynyally dyscended charles co querour sonne charles martellus sonne pepyn whan thys lowys passed solempnytye hys coronacyon made vyage ye countre poytiers wanne englysshe men certayne castelles townes x yere henry thyrde touched whyche vyage hym fynysshed ye contemplacyon prayer kyng iohan kynge hierusalem toke vpo hym crosse warre vpo turkes thynges vyage made redy passed hys hoost burgys neuers lyon lyon auygnd whyche dysobedyence chyrche rome stande accursed vppon terme vii yeres kynge lowys supposed shulde haue passed hys people passed cytyes ye cytezeyns closed gate agayne hym wolde nat suffre hym hys come within cytye wherfore kynge commaunded assaute made continued hys siege tyll myddell august whyche begon aboute ende nouebre loste many hys men amoge whych guy erle saynte paule man great fame one ye bysshop lemeryk nobre iim theraboute wherewith thys lowys amoued made solempne othe wolde nat departe then tyll wonne towne ruler towne knowlege kynges owe promesse made toke aduysemente shortly sent vnto kynge ii noble men cytye entreate common pea pea vtterly denyed except wolde submytte theym hooly correccyon pope offence done god hys chyrch rome stade kynges dome dyspleasure done agayne hym ende thoughe thys condycyon greatly agayne theyr mynde lastly agreed vnto kynge people receyued cytye restyd hym season cytezens agreed theym pope legate receyued hym absolucio new bysshop named peter corbio pope eleccyon gregory ix thynges done accordinge sayd pope commaundement kynge lowys commaunded fyrste dyches towne fylled playne grounde done caused caste vnto erthe iiic ye fayrest house cytye certayne sumes money hym receyued towarde hys charge departed then towarde tholowse aduyce hys barony moche wynter towarde retourned fraunce sped hym hys iourney vppo euyn saintes came place called moute pauncer prouynce aluerne take stronge sykenesse dyed within iiii dayes whose corp grete honour conueyed vnto saynt denys buryed hys father reygned iii yeres leuynge hym sonne whych nowe named saint lowys ye age xii yeres nere thereaboute lowys x name surnamed saint lowys son ix lowys laste kynge began hys reygne ouer lande frauce moneth nouember yere grace xiic xxvi ye x yere henry iii kynge englande whyche hys tendernesse youthe thought insufficyent take greate charge specyally ye duke brytayne tha named peter mancler whyche encensed styred many noble men agayne sayde lowys length prouysyon quene blanche hys mother lordes subdued hys enemyes raynes crowned moneth dece ber folowyng bysshop soy son moche tyme ye see raynes voyde iiii yere hys reygne hys age xvii buylded house relygyon called royan mount settherin monkes cysteauxe ordre whyte monkes endewed theym ryche possessyons nat longe great varyaunce fyll betwene vnyuersytye studientes parys cytezeyns suche wyse studyentes purpose haue lafte ye cytye haue kepte theyr study ellys ye whych stryfe frenche boke expresseth nat cause saythe kynge made good spede agree theym moche kyng hery englande made laboure sayde studyentes come hys countre enhabyte theym many great pryueleges coclusion ye frenche kynge entreated agreed reste styll congruece myghte dwell lande shulde surely defendedthe ome de lyce ye kyng fraunce bereth floure de lyce one cause saye defende clergy fayth chryste betokeneth myddle leef thyrde betokeneth chyualry chyualry clergy defended whych may teyne faythe holy chyrche aboute thys season kynge lowys maryed hys fere margarete doughter erle prouynce soone ye matrymony solepnysed frederyk secode ye story hery iii mynded emperour almayne set vnto lowis requyrynge hi ye wolde mete hym place called ualcolour ye ende myght commo hym whyche request kynge lowys accepted goodly company kepte hys daye metynge whan emperour ware commen thyder wyth suche company fayned hym syke broke hys appoyntement wherfore frenshmen construyed yf kynge comen thyder small weke company wolde haue conueyed hym hyghe almayn haue kepte hym tyll hym hys pleasure concernynge warre betwene kynge henry hym thynges kynge lowys espyed delucyon emperour retourned fraunce nat longe ye kynge enfourmed obstynacy albygensis whyche longe tyme effected dyuers poyntes herysy many tymes recocyled kynges fraunce yet fallen agayne sayde errour wherfore kynge sent vnto syr iohan beawmount whych ioyned vnto theym chargynge hym enuade countre waste distroy tyll forced theym restore chyrch suche goodes taken frome ouer cause theym make amendes good chrysten people whyche harmed meanes theyr rapynes exorcyos upo whyche commaundement thus fro ye kynge receyued sayde iohan competent nombre knyghtes entred sayd coutre layde syege strog castell named mout royall many forte assautes wanne sayd castell manned frenchemen yode stronge holde named saygos lykewyse ordered wastyng countre wane theym many townes holdes ende forced chyefrules prouynce obey theym hys hest delyuered hym suertyes hostagys perfourmaunce yt retourned frace greate pompe honour receyued kyng hys home comynge great thanke many ryche gyftes aboute xv yere kynge lowys warre quyckened betwene thys lowys hery iii kynge englande cause shewed xxvi yere sayde henry warre shewed ended kynge whyche towarde cytye lyon haue vysyted pope innocent iiii whyche thyder fled fere frederik fore named emperour taken sykenesse named dyssenterya flux wherwith greuously vexed laye longe towne called poyntoyse great ieopardy lyfe lastly many pylgrymages hym done prayer obseruaunces longe accompt lastly came hys mynde yf pleased god restore hym hys helth wolde make vyage holy lande warre vpon chrystes enemyes whyche promyse solemply auowed mended dayly sone restored vnto hys helthe whan kynge recouered retorned vnto parys called cousayll spyrytuall temporall shewed vnto theym promesse whyche made requyryng theyr assystence ayde wherin fonde hys lordes agreable tyme season yt prouysyon made iourney kynge wyth goodly company rode vnto abbey cluny vysyte foresayd pope taryed hym xv dayes hys matter hym sped wyth playne remyssyon hym graunted kept hym vyage retourned fraunce vpo wytsondaye folowynge kepte great courte hys landes meleo presence called hym beatryce doughter vnto erle prouince syster quene hys wyfe gaue maryage vnto charles hys brother made hym knyghte many hys loue ye day folowyng gaue vnto sayd charles erledome amo ye lordshyp mayn soone rode paris assembled many lordes hold hym hys iourney fryday folowynge ye feaste penthecoste yere lorde xiic xliiii xxii yere reygned ye sayd lowys many lordes departed parys vppon hys iournay towarde holy lande croysed also ye archbyshops bourges raynes bysshoppes laon orleaunce beauuais ye erles artoys saynt paule bloy barre marche moutfort many noble men whyche longe reherce whyche company kyng passed thorugh burgoyn lyo vttermost border frauce kynge fonde ye tyme forenamed pope taryed fere emperour frederyke whan kyng season taryed pope sent forth ye bawe warde hys host towarde place called aque mort shortly folowed hym selfe rest hys people certayn hys vawarde passynge castell called ye roche clin spoyled robbed slayne wherof ye kyng beyng enformed charged hys knyghtes assaute sayde castell whych done souldyours hanged castell made playne grounde helde hys way tyll came forsayd porte aque mort ye deed see toke shyppynge sayled forthe vppon bartylmewe euyn xxiiii day august laded prouynce cipre taryed wynter folowyng parte host yet behynde wherof ye kynge ioyously receyued departynge then kept copany hym iourney fortune began frowne vpon kyng lowys tyme hys taryenge moche hys people sykened dyed amonge whyche passed god men name folowynge bysshop bauuais erles mountforde barre uendosme dyuers ye nombre iicxl whan kynge lowys without trouble dyscencions amoge people dauger takynge see passed wynter parte begynnynge yere lastly aboute trynyte sondaye toke shyppynge porte cypre named dommeton domeson landed nere vnto cytye damasse damyet frydaye whan crysten host comyn nere vnto porte damasse kynge caused theym shypped small vessel ordre sayle rowe towarde cytye sarazeyns beynge ware theyr commynge issued oute cytye defended porte vygorously many crysten man slayne recounter ende dyscomfyture tourned vpon saraseyns chyefe capytayne towne wyth ii admyralles slayne many theyr knyghtes gaue backe vnto ye towne suffered crysten lande kynge pyghte hys pauylyons strengthed hys felde sodayne brekynge turkes rested hym hys people sonday moday folowing faste crysten made prouysyon ordre theyr suer lyenge felde faste turkes within towne made purueyaunce conueye suche goodes myghte cytye lastly sette house fyre voyded vnknowynge crysten hoost anone flambe fyre appered cristen men without resystence entred ye cytye quenched fyre possessed cytye passe ouer certayne legacios message sent fro prynce oryet vnto kynge lowys wherin appereth fame wordes thynges trouth temple synagoges cytye hallowed occupyed crysten mennes vse kynge hys hoost rested hym tyll moneth noueber folowynge whych season came vnto hym erle poytyers fayre co pany kynge lowys hys people departed damasse ye xx day nouembre ryuer nilus passynge small vesselles towarde stronge holde called maffour whyther lengthe came greate daunger myght nat come nere vnto towne laye theyr syege therunto bycause ryuer runyng named thanoys thanoes wherfore ye kyng pyght hys pauylyons betwene sayd ryuer ryuer nylus thys whyle ye crysten hoost thus lodged worde broughte kynge sowdan babylon dede whych hys deth prouyded greate host sent egypte wythstade crysten hoost committed rule therof vnto hardy valiaut turke named saphardyn whyche wyth greate people came downe thys towne maffour macour dayly made assautes vpon crysten hoost yt betwene theym many bykerynges skyrmysshes bothe damage lastly kynge aduerty synge hys mynde myghte nothynge dere sarazeyns oute myght passe ye ryuer thanoys cocluded aduyce hys maryners make brydge shyppes fynally cheyned fastened hys shyppes togyder suche wise passage made knyghtes whan turkes espyed thys ordenauce apperceyued well yf cryste hoost passed ryuer shulde theyr greate dysauautage anone ordenauce shot myght make dyd vttermest theyr power let perfytyng thys brydge passage crysten hoost thys fyll contraryte crysten water ryuer whyche brode depe troublous wawe brydge therwith shaken daungerous stande turkes entendynge damage cristen left certayne defende passage whyle forde passage vnknowen ye crysten men came ouer ryuer assauted frenchman egerly ye betwene theym foughten cruell batayle howe thorugh dyuyne power god turkes ouerset many slayne taken whyche batayll foughten vpon daye saynt fabyan sebastyan xx daye ianuarii yet myght nat cryste wyn ouer ryuer dayly strength coutres nere came downe fortefyed hoost sarazyns day folowynge puryfycacyon lady blewe suche tempest wynde dyd moche harme bothe shyppes also tentes pauylyons crysten host scarcite vitayle began appere yt kyng determyned retourne agayn vnto damasse turkes espyed retourne frenchemen ordeyned iiii barge suche lyke vessayles stuffed pytche rosyn grece lyquet brenyng stuffe nyght sodaynly brought borde crysten flote lay cast grekysh fyre ye whyche anone set lyghte fyre reason wherof crysten flote great ieopardy great laboure preserued brenyng thys despyte sarazyns done crysten kyng therwyth amoued sayde promysed wolde nat departe then tyl done turkes dyspleasure vpon enquysycyo made enfourmed passage foorde within iii myles hys pauylion wherupo called counsayll hys lordes shewed purpose gyuyng vnto erle artoyes ledynge hys forewarde charged hym yt whan passed foorde shuld tary tyll ye deale host ouer passed whan al thynges ordered kynges mynde sayd erle hys company set forthwarde passed sayd foorde wythout daunger forgettynge hym commaunded kynge set forth incontynetly towarde turkes whyche weale knewe kepte ye place brydge made faughte theym al vnpurueyed vnknowynge hys sodeyne commynge wherfore slewe many theym chased whyche socoure fledde vnto cytye mafsour foresayd whome folowed egerly ye entryng cytye entred theym slayne certayn hys knyghtes reason wherof ye soldyours towne encoraged issued vpon crysten draue backe tyll sawe kynges power come retourned cytye shytte stregth theyr gate tha kyng lowis ascertayned sayd erles dethe made hym great dole prouysyon made lodgynge hys people made dyuers brydges passage ouer ye ryuer thanoyes crysten host shuld assured fro sodayne vnware assautes reprochys ye infydelies therfore closed theym wythin strength dyche pale theyr enemyes myght waye haue waye named strengthe park whyche crysten host lodged season lent ye whych tyme ye yoge sowda came downe wyth great host people myght nat lodge hys people within towne therfore made lyke parke vnto cristen men closed hys peple betwene crysten many conflyctes assautes somtyme losse one eft losse sowdane made meanes myght kepe vytayll frome crysten hoost stopped passage betwene damasse thes myght haue socour meane wherof dysseases sykenesse fyll amonge crysten dyed hougely kynge lowys ware misery euery syde sente sowdane haue truce certayne tyme conclusion none wolde hym grauted wherfore necessyte forced breke hys felde wyth good polycy myght drewe hym ryuer nylus shyp passed downe sayd ryuer towarde damasse passed nat ferre yt assauted euery syde yt fight contynued styll without seasynge great losse crysten host lastly came sowdane fresshe copany beset ye kyng ende taken wyth hys ii bretherne charles robert erle poytyers ye erle angeou erle flaunders duke brytayne erle soysos ye fyght slayne bysshoppes langrees soysons many whome ye name nat put wryttynge kyng lowys thus take syke wherfore dylygence sowdan comaunded hym conueyed vnto massoure caused hys men slayne many wounded syke excepte men great fame whome great aduauntage myghte ryse reason theyr raunsome thus cristen host take spoyled sarazyns thursday next folowyng feast easter yere lord miicl xxiiii yere ye reygne thys kynge lowys whyche wyth noble fraunce sent vnto babylon cayer kept sodry prysos processe tyme agreed kyng lowis shuld delyuered fro pryson conueyed saufly handes crystedome vpon condycyon shulde fyrst render gyue vp sowdans power cytye damasse wyth suche prysoners turkes sarazyns daye hys power ouer shulde yelde certayne daye certayne summe besauntes whyche frenche boke shulde viiim besauntes sarazyn peter dysroy sayth iiicm besauntes besauntes haue lerned shuld ii one called bezaunde imperyall bezaunte ducall bezaunde imperyall worth l ducates ducal bezaunde worth xx ducates ducate whyche named ducat de camera worth iiiisviiid ducat papall uenyzia lasse value iiid iiiid pece yf hys raunsome estemyd ye imperyail bezaunde payde rate iiiisvid ducate summe viiim bezaundes sterlynge money lxxxxmli thys sowdane promysed delyuer suche prysoners hys prysons cryste men yt brake promyse xii thousande deliuered scarsly iii thys tyme takynge frenche kynge company yonge men assembled theym togyder frauce vnder theyr capytayne whyche toke vppon hym lyke bysshoppe passed parys orleaunce good townes fraunce sayeng wolde restore kynge hys lybertye lastely whan drewe nere porte deed see shulde haue taken shyppynge fyll thefte auoutry wherfore people cou tre sette vppon theym slewe theyr capytayne parte theyr copany thorugh symple feleshyp whyche named selfe shepherdes dysseuered sparkelyd whan thys blessed kyng lowys delyuered dauger hys enemyes broughte egypte syrye executed many dedes charyte mekenes repayred cytye ioppen standyng vpon see syde then went pylgrymage vnto nazareth mount thabor retourned vnto ioppen receyued tydynges deth dame blach mother dyuers obseruances prayer done soule hys mother toke shyppynge sayled towarde fraunce nat withoute trauayle trouble see ende xii wekes landed hauen marcyll martyll sped iournay came parys ye yere lorde xiic liiii vi yere toke vppon hym voyage cytezeyns receyued wyth mooste honoure gladnes callynge cousayl refourmed many thynges weale hys realme made one lawe whych specyally remebred man beyng auctorytye hygh offyce prouost pretour lyke office shuld bye landes rete within lordshype yt rule cause shuld nat extort wronge bye suche landes ye better chepe reason hys myghte power thys day prouosty chyef rule offyce handes ye cytezeyns parys reason seale therof made theym kynges progenytours meane wherof many iniuryes wronges done vnto common people many theuys transgressours fauoure money passed vnpunysshed wherof thys blessed kynge lowys beyng enfourmed vpon suffycyent profe made dyscharged cytezeyns therof assygned man named stephan boyle offyce assygnynge hym yerely certayne stipend executyng office ordeyned euer prouost parys shuld named kynge hys heyres kynges also made ordenaunces auoyde strumpettes cytye punysshement accustomable great swerers wyth many good ordenaunces lawes whyche passe ouer lengthynge tyme tyme season abydynge fraunce place called saynt nicholas de boy iii chyldre borne flaundres whych sent thyder lern ye maner frauce also teche ye chyldre knyghte named syr guyllm de brunz shot chyldre vpon season passed boudes abbey groude entred warrayn lord frauce called enguerran lorde coucy chased shote conyes theyr disport whych take seruautes sayd enguerran presented theyr lorde ye whych hasty cruelnesse caused iii chyldre pyte haged wherof heryng ye abbot saint nycholas coplayned hym assystece ye fornamed syr guillm vnto kyng whych incotynetly set sayd enguerra charging hym apere hys barony answere matter shuld layd vnto charge wher ye ende many reasos hym layde great instace hys frendes pardoned yt greuous offence wyth codicion folowyng meane fyrst shuld pay vnto kynge xmli parys money whych meane xiic lli sterling ouer shuld warre vpo goddes enemyes syria space iii yeres contynually vpon hys owne cost charge thyrdely shulde buylde chapel wherin two preestes shuld synge euer soules sayd infauntes mayster gagwyne forsayd xmli ayde kynge hospytall parys named ye house god pontoyse frayter freer minor gray freers paris made repayred many dedes charite done vertuous prince makynge dyuers house relygyon seruyng poore people owne handes fastinges infynyte dedes pytye lastly xxxiii yere hys reygne honourably receyued hery iii tha kyng englande stablyshed hym pea xliiii yere reygne sayd henry declared done xxxvi yere hys reygne maryed hys eldest son phylyp vnto isabell doughter iamys kyng aragon reason whyche maryage frenshe kyng gaue ouer sayd iamys suche ryght lordshyppes besac dampierre rousselion barsellon sayde iamys acquyted gaue ouer lowys suche ryghte tytle lordshypes carcasson bygorre anilly soone sente charles hys brother request iiii alexaundre pope cicilia great power withstande ye vyolence manfrede sonne frederyke second emperoure whych agayne ryghte withhelde kyngdome frome chyrche rome whome charles longe fyght place named boneuente slewe batayll made kyng sayd countre auctorytye sayde pope alexaunder payenge yerely vnto chyrche rome xlm ducates moch lyke rate sterlyng money viiimviclxvilixiiisiiiid euery ducat accopted iiiisiiiid fyll xlii yere kynge lowys pope clement iiii name sent legate vnto lowys requyryng hym ayde crysten whyche siria greuously warred ye turkes sarazyns whose request kyng called counsayll wherin agreed yt socour shuld made wherfore kynge hys iii sonnes phylyp iohn peter toke crosse fyrste day may yere hys reygne xliii hys sayde sonnes many lordes fraunce well spirytuall temporall departed parys frome then rode vnto cluny rested hym iiii day thes sped hys iourney tyll came forenamed porte yt deed see mette hym cardynall legate rome dyuers bysshoppes fraunce kyng nauarne duke son brytayn alphos erle poytiers erles artoys flaudres many whyle kynge wyth hys hoost laye sayde porte taryeng conuenable wynde dyssencyon fyll betwene catholeynes men prouynce amonge theym foughten suche skyrmysshe betwene theym slayne vpon hondreth men many mo wounded stryfe myght seased soone kynge wyth hys lordes toke shyppynge sayled great daunger tempest tyll lastly came ile sardynes crysten host rested theym season kept theyr cours til came porte thunys cartage xviii day moneth iulii rested theyr shyppes nyght upo morne whan shuld lande porte beset turkes infydeles whych shotte dartes kast stone greuaunce crysten host wanne lande wyth great dyffyculte payne whan kynge landed lodged hys people sent serche fresshe water refresshe hys hooste whyche meane whyle admyrall kynges nauy came vnto kynge requyryng hi haue certayne knyghtes assygned vnto hym trustynge god wyn shortly towne sped hym assauted towne anone capytayne towne ware theyr commyng great company issued oute towne forced crysten hoost gyue backe wherfore kynge lowys sent marshal hys host certayne nombre knyghtes socoure sayd admyrall tyme fyght gatte betwene sarazyns towne whyle faught turkes wanne towne wherof turkes beynge ware fled soone nat without great slaughter fyght many theym whyche escaped fro batayll slayne cauernys hole hyd theym grounde whan towne cartage thunis ye criste thus wonne anone kynge commaunded dede bodyes caste towne clesyd ordours fylthes done kynge commaunded entred towne lodged within many towne wolde holde ye fortyfyed dyches strengthes preserue theyr enemyes taryed comyng charles hys brother kyng cycilia nat loge cytye towne wonne yt kyng thunys great host turkes came nere towne made showys offer abode therby one day erle artoys one company knyghte called syr peter cabellane companye gatte betwene see turkes compelled fyght betwene theym cruell fyghte many slayne vppo sydes ende turkes scomfyted chaced theyr shyppes thys fyghte slayne ii cristen knyghtes named le chastelayn syr iohn de ronssoylyers thys batayll fyght sarazyns made great assautes reason unholsomnes countre sykenes fyll amonge ye crysten hoost people dyed faste shortly kyng take suche flixe therwith agu kept hys bedde ryghtes chryche take certayne monycyons gyuen hys sonne phylyp shulde behaue hym gydynge realme fraunce knowynge houre dethe approched charged suche aboute hym shuld lay hym vpon bed asshes powdre lyeng season prayer expyred day folowyng saint bartholomeus tholomeus day xxv day august reygned xliiii yeres lackynge ii monethes leuynge hym iii forenamed sonnes phylyp iohn peter bowellys buryed cecilia body enbawmed ryche oyntementes recaryed vnto saynte denys frauce therwith greate reuerence entered whych hys myracles ye vii bonyface sette amonge nombre sayntes phylyp thyrde name sonne saynt lowys beganne reygne ouer realme frauce xxvi daye yt moneth september yere lord xiiclxx liiii yere henry iii kynge englande began shewed affrica towne cytye thunys cartage accopanyed charles hys vncle kynge cycyll whych came ye porte thunys day kynge lowys dyed taryed many conflictes wyth turkes bare hym manfully ende forced ye kynge thunys seche hym pea cocluded x yeres certayne condycyos payeng certayne money ye kynge frauces costes certayne trowages old tyme due vnto kyng cycyll ye rely payde many artycles concernynge peace whyche passe ouer whyce pea concluded assured kynges fraunce cycyll toke shyppynge sayde porte thunys sayled towarde theyr countrees great daunger tempest see processe tyme landed cycyll philip greate reuerence obseruauce mount royall buryed ye bowelles father yt done toke iourney towarde fraunce thorughe italy whyche iourney dyed isabell hys wyfe ye kyng nauerne mary hys wyfe many nombre iiim mo lastly kyng came vnto cyty uiterbe cardynalles spyrytuall men counsayll chosyng newe pope ye tyme see voyde deth clement iiii eleccion dyuers ii yeres expyred myght agree vpon new pastor tha agreed vpo theobalde archidiacon landesse named x gregory fro uiterbe kyng rode mout flaston ouer coutre tuscayne mount bergue ye cytye florece then boloyng le greysse fro then cremoygu ye kynges officer nat well entreated recopensement wherof ye mayre burgeyses towne presented kyng vii stedes trapped cloth sylke presetes whych kyng curteys thakfull wordes refused fro then kyng departed milan milan annergeaux susane cytye sauoy passed moutaygnes valys moryen fro then tourned towarde cytye lyos vpon rosne cytye masto burgoyn passed ye coutre tyl came abbey cluny fro then coutre chapayn city trois fro thes passed countrees tyll came lordshype parys cytye parys passe ouer great prouysyon made cytesyns parys receyuynge theyr pryncys yt mene corp lewys theyr naturall prynce phylyppe hys son obseruaunces done great assembles lordes spirytuall temporall welcome theyr prynce doynge theyr duty euery man according honour al ceremony due order fynyshed prouysyon made coronacyon kynge whyche crowned cytye raynes vppon daye assumpcyon lady yere grace xii hundred lxxi shortely solempnyte coronacyon passed kynge phylyppe recreacyon rode countrey uermendoyse derestyd hym season robert erle artoys requyred hym vysyte hys countrey receyuyd burgeysys artoys wyth great honour gladnes feastyd disport gladnes certayne tyme whiche expyryd returned frauce thryde yere reygne erle foys contrary ye kynges pleasure toke partye agayn getarde knyght lorde castell casseboun tasseboun ye slayn ye brother erle armenac specyall fred sayd erle foyz whyche sayde two erles reuenge deth theyr sayd brother pursued sayde gerarde narrowly sauegarde refused owne castell fled vnto castell kynges helde hym wyth wyfe chyldren substauce two erles ware therof sped thyder wyth theyr power layd syege castell ende threwe downe grounde slewe souldyours founde well kynges seruauntes hopynge haue founde theyr enymye gerarde whyche escapyd then secretly rumour dede came vnto kynge dysdayned sore dede toke yt ryght grevously myche called hys lordes theyr counsayll assembled hys knyghtes entred wyth force prouince erle foyz whyche herynge kynges great dyspleasure fortyfyed hys castell helde hym besette wyth rokkes stone kynge myght wynne yt wyth ease wherfore kynge co maunded rokkes cutte mason worke men made solempne othe wold depart then hadde erle castell pleasure erle hadde beholden great power enymyes prouysyon kyng wynne castell wyth ieopardyes made meanes kynge grace fynally putte hym mercy kynge commau ded hym bounde conueyed casrell beauquesu imprysoned hole yere kyng eased hys landes set certayne hys knyghtes kepe hys castell caryed hys wyfe chyldren wyth hym fraunce yere runne kynge laboured frendes sayd erle eularged pryson vppon suertye suffred serue kynges courte bare hym well yt fynally kyng made hym knyght restored hym lades fyll ye erle armenac story sheweth aboute vi yere reygne kynge phylyppe maryed mary doughter erle burbon doughter iohan duke braban whych loued entyerly wherof peter de broshe beynge lorde chamberlayne hauynge enuy disdayn sought wayes meanes mynyshe great loue betwene lord fonde meane sonne ye kynges named lewys prysoned whyche dede subtyle secrete meanes though yt nothyng comen hym layde yt ye charge quene ye kyng made many maner inquysycyons well sorcery al workes found quene gyltlesse wherfore sufferyd mater passe tyll myght haue assured profe mater aboute thys season ferdinandus kynge castyle tyme hadde maryed blanche doughter saynt lewis dyed leuyng hym two sonnes borne ye sayd blanch named ferdinande alphons whych couenaunt mariage made shulde heyres vnto kyngdome spayne castyle father ferdinande beynge dede contrary hys honour promise wrote vnto lordes castyle amonestynge theym shulde admytte theyr kynge hys seconde son named saxyon sanxio swere hym feautye homage whyche done accordyng hys commaundement blanche dyspoynted dower chyldern theyr ryght enherytauce ye kyng phylyppe brother greuously dyscontetyd reforma cyon therof sente vnto kynge spayn chefe boteler wyth desyryng hym perfourme couenautes betwene hym fader cocluded maryage syster blanche laste yf refusyd yt yt wold sende hys sayde syster wyth two chyldern sauely fraunce co clusyon ye mother wyth two chyldern brought sayde boteler vnto kynge wythoute pleasure worde dede whyche yere folokyng gaderyd stronge hoste passed wyth theym poyteau gascoyne tyll came vnto towne ioynynge border spayne named sainterre kyng met another party hoste counsayll lordes kynge concluded retourne fraunce daunger wynter comynge hyd cause rumour hoste went yt kynges counsayll hadde receyued rewardes kynge spayn meane wherof kyng loste iourney returned fraunce great dyshonour damage tyme kynge phylyppes returne fraunce tydynges broughte hym eustace de beau marche kyng appointed haue gydyng countrey kyngdome nauarye besyeged citye pampulyne wherfore ye kyng comaunded ye erle artoys spede hym thyder rescowe sayde eustace whyche behauyd hym manfully rescowed sayde eustace chasyd garsymerans chefe styrrer rebellion brought people countrey agayne due subieccyon whyle erle artoys thus occcupyed sayd countrey messangers came hym kynge spayne requyrynge hym sene nere nere yt wold come disport season wher ye erle artoys sent kyng philip worde hauyng hym lycece yode vnto sayd kyng spayn nere kynnesma disported certayn tyme great co solacio season diuers letter came frauce fro ye kinges cousall reason wherof ye kynge spayne informed mych freche kinges cousayll letter shewed vnto ye erle artoys sayeg yt without fredes frauce wold disclose son whe erle taryed spayn copetent seaso toke leue ye king deted great giftes sped hym ye cesse tyme cam vnto ye king frauce couenient leyser shewed vnto hym letter shewed vnto ye kyng spayn wherof king litle ameruayled loge yt currour messanger vsed bere letter fro pet de brosh vnto ye king spayn fyll syke abbay knew shuld die exortacion gostly fader otherwyse called hym ye abbot hed ye house chargyng yt wold delyuer letter vnto ye freche kyng son dyed whose deth ye said religyous man couenyet hast sped hym vnto ye kinges court presented said letter shewyng vnto ye mynde ye sayd messanger letter kyng vnclosyd anon knew yt chaberlayne peter de broshe discloser cousaylles wherfore forthwith co mauded ye said peter vnder saufe kepyng wherof heryng bysshop bayon fled streyght ye lande yode vnto rome kynge yode vnto paris called cousayl lordes examyne ye sayd peter finally iudged haged iudgemet comytted vnto ward tyll ye morow folowyng season long son rysyng yo duke burgoyn duke braban erle artoys ye prouost paris came vnto gayole receyued said peter saw hanged sonne vp long ye peter thus put deth meanes made betwene ii kynges day metyng appoynted yt said kyng shuld mete haue comunycacion mater cocernyng wroges done dame blanche ii chyldren beforenamed wherfore ye king spayn cam vnto ye citie bayon king philip town prouynce tholouse named mout marchaut two prince beyng comunicacyon ye foresayd mater certayn messangers cam fro ye pope mantyne ye iiii chargyng vpo payn fallyng ye cesures yt chirch agree fall vnto accorde warre betwen theym exercysed reason wherof kyng phylyp remitted mater ye pope returned vnto tholouse mette kyng aragon named peter taryed kyng philip tyme pleasure toke leue ye kynge went catholoyne met costance wife doughter manfred somtyme kyng scycyll pryued lyfe kyngdome charles broder saint lewis ye iiii chapyter storye saynt lewys shortly touched costance yt might exorted husbad togader people enter ye land scicill ascertainyng yt ye scicillyens wolde take patye agayne charles myche well knew rightfull heyre kyngdome thys tyme season whyche x yere kynge phylyppe ryuer sayne rose suche hyght yt compassed cytye parys suche wyse man myght come thyther wythoute bote barge water passed wyth suche vyolence yt brake vi arch great brydge parys one small brydges let v turne ye kyng aragon whych incensyng wyfe gadered peple vnder colour wold haue gone agaynste turkes hadde graunte pope receyue ye dymes owne land certayne yeres whyle doynge sent certayne persones scycyle see state countrey whyche made confederacyes wyth dyuers great men scycylyens ouer brought wyth theym dyuers ruler presence ye kynge wyth sayd peter made certayn appoyntementes retourned scycyle theyr returne cousayled wyth theyr ruler palermo messene cytyes one nyght frenche men scycylle slayne cruell wyse slewe woman wel yt wyth chylde lefte none frenche men chefe cytyes townes scicyll lyue whe tydynges myschyef brought vnto charles beynge countrey angeou sent messangers vnto pope martyne iiii requyrynge ayde defende enymyes whych hast sent vnto palermo ye byshop saynte sabyne charge cytesyns vppon payne cursynge obey vnto charles theyr kyng none ruler palermo also messene wold suffer sayd byshoppe passe farther also sayde peter entred countrey whome wolde holde none wyth whyche answere fayne retourne whyle charles hadde sent vnto neuew phylyppe kynge frauce whyche wyth power reuoke peter scycyll enteryd lande aragon purpunyan toke cytye ieane whyche passe tyme charles entred scycyl besyeged messene towne strongely fortyfyed loste labour wherfore left syege yode playnes saynt martyne taryed comynge hys son prynce salerne pope accursed peter much certayne worde broughte hym hadde proclaymed hym selfe kynge scycyll entent styre people agayne hym gaue lande aragon vnto charlys erle ualoys son kynge phylyp fraunce phylyppe sayde kynge frauce ieane myche way towarde aragon harde passe well prouysyons made enmyes otherwyse kyng therfore sought great aduyse myght lest daunger wyn enymyes many meanes sought russylyan broughte vnto kynges presence whyche assured yt kyng gyde away aragon daunger enymyes wherof kynge beynge glad promysed sayde russylyan fredome lybertye great rewardes whyche stode prysoner frenche men whych promyse made kyng put hym parte hoste vnder ledynge sayd russylyan blynde ye enymyes sent parte hoste towarde mountaynes make shewe though hoste hadde passed waye kynge phylyp orderyd thynge mynde comaunded forewade hys people folowe sayd russilyan whyche brought theym strayte narrow way growen wood busshes kynges great trauayle hys fynally brought playns theyr enmyes lay made prouysyon orderynge theyr people set vppon aragon wherof aragon beynge ware supposynge frenche men myght lyghtly haue wonne vnto theym beynge oute aray dyspurueyed fyght fled vnto next holdes leuyng ye frenche men mych theyr vytayll harneys kynge phylyp sene enmyes forsaken theyr feld restyd season trauayle yode towne named pyerlaat besyeged yt wherof soudyours season defended towne deade night fyred sayd town departed done frenche men wan shortely town quenched fyre kyng manned vytaylled yt went town named goron layde syege lay long ye haue harde precedynge yere howe charles kynge scycyll laye playnes saynte martyne abydynge commynge son prynce salerne whyther lastely cam vnto sayde son duke burgoyn erle alanson peter brother kyng phylyp robert erle artoys erles dampmartyne bolygygne wyth lorde mounte morency many noble fraunce burgoyne commyng lordes charles baner dysplayed sped hym towarde enymyes passed lande calabre wythout fyght sente son naples part hoste hym selfe kept iourney tyll came vnto prouynce heryng great purueyauce peter kyng aragon made shyppes sayle toward lande naples sent certayn letter vnto prynce sonne wise shuld set vppon enmyes kepe hym within cytye naples tyll sent vnto hym shyppes galeys redy maned sent vnto hym hauen marcylle whych messanger letter taken wyth ye aragon reason wherof knewe myche kynge charles consayll longe nauaye kynge aragon wyth great tryumphe pryde came vnto naples prouokyd ye frenche men fyghtto myche cause repetauce lastely prynce wyth suche shyppes companye myght make made vppon fought wyth long fyghte ende frenche men betyn ouercomen prynce wyth partye shyppes taken sent constance quene aragon remayned longe vndelyueryd wyth many prysoners wythin short season sco fiture charlys cam vnto naples whych tyme myche town tourned agayn hym parte french soudyours slayne fled towne wherfore charlys entred punyshed ryght cruelly diuers maner tourmentes hadde done wyll retourned calabre mette wyth hym robert erle artoys toke theyr counsayll howe might passe water phaar laye theyr syege vnto cytye messene dyuers cause counsayled contrarye toke shyppynge hauen called brandyse hys people shyppyd sykenesse toke hym hadde agayn lande dyed shortely wythoute suspeccyon venyme whose corp conueyed naples buried yere lorde xxii hundred lxxxiiii xiiii yere reygne phylyppe neuewe kynge fraunce whyche tydynges peter kynge aragon reioysed lytell word therof hym broughte whyche tyme betaken rule lande scycyll constaunce hys wyfe beynge citye palermo hym selfe wyth stronge nauye sayled aragon rescow cytye geron whych besyeged kynge phylyppe ye haue harde wyth hys people landid toke counsayll myght greue frenche hoste fynally concluded wolde make busshemet wyth certayne nomber knyghtes lye awayte take vytayll brought host porte russylyan whyche porte foure myles fro frech hoste uppon whyche conclusyon taken wyth two thousande chosen lodged pray shulde passe espyed frenche men wherof beynge warned constable frauce syr iohon harcourt marshal ye hoste toke wyth erle march wyth dyuers knyghtes nomber v hundred speres wyth certayne fotemen went towarde theyr enmyes came nere vnto theym saw many nomber feryd set forthwarde tyll comforted wordes knyghte theyr companye called mathew de roya sayeng foloweth ye noble knyghtes beholde syghtes enymyes whych ye haue farre sought lette v remember thys daye assumpcyon blessed lady truste wyll help v agayne yt ben putte holy chyrche cursyng lyke meryte shall v grow reuenge ye iniuries done vnto chyrche though faught agayn enmyes crystes fayth meane whyche wordes encouraged wythoute fere sette vppon theyr enymyes betwene comensed sore cruell fyght cotynuyng longe season yt myght knowen whyche parte hadde auautage laste kyng drawen horse costrayned fyghte wyth fote great ieoperdye haue ben taken owne knighthode good helpe men recoueryd horse agayne yt french men ware ye kyng hys owne persone egre vppon aragon entente haue taken siayne theyr kynge fynally compelled theym forsake felde saue selfe flyght reason wherof kynge parte knyghtes saued dauger theyr enemyes fyght peter kyuge aragone hurte dyed shortly whan foresayd knyghtes theyr prysoners returned vnto frenche kynge shewed vnto hym vyctory reioyced therof greatly wolde haue done yf knowen sore enemy peter wou ded brynge fyne purpose dayly assauted towne ye tyme gereonde gyrode thus besyeged ye freche kynge erle foyz capytayne towne ought great fauour many tymes lycence ye kynge yode towne dyuers comunycacyons hym lastly knowynge sayde towne bare vytayle shewed kynge wolde laboure sayde capytayne named syr raymode de cerdon yt towne myght gyue vp kynges handes soone yt sayde capytayne desyred respyte viii dayes send vnto ye king arago knowe whether wolde rescowe towne nat upon whiche graute made messangers sente returned certaynte kynges dethe upon whiche knowledge sayde capytayne agreed delyuer towne vpon codicion haue suche mouables ye cytezyns sowdyours within towne whiche condicions assured kynge receyued towne geronde possessyon whiche whan manned knyghtes owne cousayle whiche tourned harme diuided nauy sente parte fraunce tholous wher kynge entended tary wynter folowynge spone nauy thus deuyded aragon mette rested hauen russilian gaue suche batayle toke many slewe kynges admyrall many noble men fraunce helde frenchemen shorte moche wolde nat good shyppes shulde come handes theyr enemyes set fyre vpon remenaut brent resorted vnto kynge whe kynge phylyp ascertayned losse nauy toke greuously somoche thynges myght brynge purpose fyll feuer therwith greatly anoyed strengthe enemyes whiche kepte passage mountaynes called latyn mote pireni wekyng hym selfe reason sekenesse passed strayte place tyll came parpynyan sekenes encreased sore dyed shorte tyme thyder comynge yt moneth october wha regned xv yeres lackynge certayne dayes whose bowelles buried nerbon body saynt denys phylyp ii wyues fyrst isabel name doughter kynge aragon iaques iames name iii sone lewes whiche poysoned phylyp whiche beaute fayre shappe named phylyp le beau phylyp fayre charles ualoys mary wyfe doughter duke braban lewes margaret blauche whiche margarete maryed edwarde fyrste kynge englande thus endeth phylyp iii fraunce anglia edwarde ye fyrst name sone henry ye thyrde surnamed loge shake bega reygne ouer englade moneth nouember xvii day ye yere lorde xiiclxxii seconde yere thyrde phylyp kynge fraunce edwarde shewed lv yere father ye holy lade whan father dyed cytie acon acris dyd many feates warre wherof cronycle maketh certayne mencyon beynge exercysed marciall actes tidiges brought vnto hym father deed wherfore hast spedde hym englad came london secode day august crowned westmynster xiiii day december folowyuge whiche begynnynge seconde yere reygne anno dni mcclxxii anno dni mcclxxiii iohan horne syr walter heruy anno primo walter potter fyrst yere kynge edwarde fyrst vpon daye symon iude certayne attemptes made cytyzyns haue made suche mayre lysted dyspoynted theyr accessaryes let tyme whiche yere folowyng vpon day toke effecte begynnynge nexte yere shalbe towched ye ende yere seconde day auguste kynge edwarde came london great iourney ye holy lande cytezyns receyued ioy honour conueyed vnto westmynster kepte great obseruaunces father certayne tyme anno dni mcclxxiii anno dni mcclxxiiii nicholas wynchester henry waleys anno ii henry couentre thys seconde yere kynge daye symon iude whan phylyp le tayloure chose mayre shulde daye haue taken charge guyldehall londo dyuers cytezyns put hym besyde mayres seet set therin syr walter heruy yere mayre whiche great rumour grudge arose amonge cytezyns wherfore mater brought kyng whiche herynge reason bothe partyes somoche coude agre theym putte bothe sayde syr walter sayd phylyp asyde chase henry forwyk custos cytye whych contynued tyll cadelmas whych tyme dyscrete wyse peasyble meanes forenamed syr walter heruy set auctorite mayre contynued full yere thys yere vppon xiiii daye decembre kynge crowned westmynster mayster roberte kylwarby archebisshop cau terbury bonyface hys predecessour dyed yere kynge henry dyed thys coronacio present alexandre kynge scottes whyche vpon morowe folowyng dyd homage kyng edward kyngdome scotlande solempnytie coronacyon ended kyng heryng rebellyon lewelyne prynce walys dysdayned come hys coronacyon anone gathered stronge power wet yt prouince subdued yc sayd lewelyn retourned ordeyned certayne newe lawes ye welth yc realme whych loge reherce amog whych one yt baker makinge brede lackyng weyghte assygned pryce corne shuld fyrst punysshed losse hys brede seconde tyme prysonemente thyrdly correccyon pyllory miller steling corne chastised tubrell thys put execucyon gaue auctorytie mayres bayliffes offycers thorugh englande specyally mayre london anno domini mcclxxiiii anno dni mcclxxv lucas patencourt gregory rokkisle anno iii henry frowyke thyrde yere kyng co fermed lybertyes yc cytie london graunted som newe thys yere helde hys great court parlyamente westmynster gaue monycyon lewelyn prynce walys come vnto whyche presuptuously denyed wherfore kyng easter entred agayue walys warred vppon lewelyne costreyned submyt hym vnto kynges grace opteyned wyth greate difficultye kyng edwarde buylded castel flynt strenghthyd castell rutlande englysshe men kepe walshemem due obedyence toke theyr prynce greate summe money whych wryters named lm lm marke lasse retourned englande thys yere one water haruy whych fyrste yere thys kynge longe contrauersie stryfe yt kept ye alderman lodon folkmote kepte poules crosse made mayre london contynued hurte cytye yere thys yere accused dyuers periuries detestable dedes cotrary hys othe whyche makynge assembles common whiche fauoured hym hys yll dedes depryued hys aldermanshyppe counsayle cytye euer foude suertye twelf honeste persones shulde good berynge kepyng ye kynges pea within cytye terme hys lyfe anno domini xiiclxxv anno domini mcclxxvi iohn horne gregory rokkysle anno iiii rauffe blount thys iiii yere kynge edwarde michael tony whych tyme warre wyth walsh men demeaned hym otherwyse stode trouth alegeauce accused treason therof arreygned iuged dapned drawen hanged quartered statute p maynand thys yere statute mortmayne enacted fyrste whyche meane man shulde gyue chyrch landes rete wythout specyal lycence ye kyng whyche acte syne tyme hath ben strongly enacted deuysed wyth many addycyons thereunto augmented annexyd anno domini xiiclxxvi anno domini mcclxxvii robert bracy gregory rokkisle anno v rauffe fenour v yere reygne kyng edwarde pope nycholas thyrde name made doctour robert kylwarby beynge archebysshop caunterbury cardynal rome admytted see frere named doctour iohan pekham thys yere kyng gaue vnto dauyd brother lewelyne prynce walys lordshyppe froddesham whyche dauyd dwelled kynges court dyd vnto hym plesaunte seruyce entent spye kynges secret cou sayll yf thynge spoken done hurte hys brother therof myghte gyue hym warnynge hys dede appered anno dni mcclxxvii anno dni mcclxxviii iohan adryan gregory rokkysle anno vi walter langely thys vi yere kyng commaunded courtes lawes ye kniges beche yt chaucery yc como place excheker remoued vnto shrewysbury myghelmas terme holde kept agayne hillary terme yt bokes officer cotermauded agayn west mynster holde whych caryeng ye recordes fro reason great plete rayne whiche yt season fyl caught great hurt fore defaced moche yt bokes greatly imperysshed ye clerkes great laboure brynge theyr former state anno domini xiiclxxviii anno dni mcclxxix robert basynge gregory rokkysle anno vii wyllyam mazerer vii yere kyng held hys parlyament london whyche chefely set reformacion kynges coygne clypped suche wyse yt therby wonderfully mynyshed empayred season parlyamet many iewes lodon place taken put holde money clyppyng december folowyng certayn enqstes charged lodon enquyre sayd iewes hadde blemyshed kynges coygne whyche enquestes iewes cytye wyth dyuerse goldesmythes kepte exchange syluer indyted mondaye folowynge purifycacion lady mayre wyth dyuers iustices lande sat london caste ii hundred lxxx xvii persones whych iii englysh men iewes iewes borne yt many theym borne england therfore wryters named englyshe iewes whyche sondry time place put execucyon yere also began foundacyon chyrche freer prechour blacke freres ludgate theyr founder yere town bosten greatly blemyshed wyth fyre anno domini mcclxxix anno domini mcclxxx thomas box gregory rokkysle anno viii rauffe thys viii yere kynge caused syluer halfe peny coygned tyme coygnes metall rane among people theyr great noyaunce losse farthynges syluer also coygned selfe tymef r coygnyng half pen farthynges wynter folowynge aboute daye saynte denys ix daye october fell suche plence snowe thereof ensued myche harme anno domini mcclxxx anno domini mcclxxxi wyllyam faryngdon gregory rokkysle anno ix nycholas wynchester thys ix yere kynge edwarde dauid brother lewelyn prynce walys whych ye haue harde dwelled kynges courte knowe kyuges counsayll therof enforme brother whe wayted secretly gat hym walys brother hym excyted agayn kyng myght caused brother man vytayll dyuers castelles within walys specyally castell swandon wherin mych trusted gatheryd vnto hym walshemen gyftes meanes stronge wherof kynge informed wolde therunto gyue credence tyll sent thyther receyued thes certaynte myche wynter toward myghte nat conueniently go thyder wyth power therfore prouyded send men vytayl strength castelles flynt rutlande holdes whyche wyth prouysyo made warre vppon theym begynnynge nexte yere suffered wynter passe anno domini mcclxxxi anno dni xiiclxxxii wyllyam mazerer henry waleys anno x nycholas wynchester thys x yere ye kyng heryng vnstedfastnes walshe men let theyr purpose greue hys holdes beforenamed sente thyder crewe sowdyours erles northumberland surrey whome amonge went syr rogyer clyfforde syr wyllyam lyndesey syr rycharde tanny many noble knyghtes squyres whyche greate corage entrede walys made walshemen many skyrmysshes tyll lastly vpon palme sondaye dauyd great power walshme met sayde lordes knyghtes place nere towne called hanardyne betwene sore fyght ende losse fyll englysshmen slayne syr wyllyam lyndesey syr rycharde tanny many syr rogyer clyfforde taken whyche ouerthrowe englysshmen sayde dauyd layde syege vnto castelles flynt rutlande brother season warred occupyed landes syr edmunde mortymer wanne towne called lambatre vaure threwe walles therof downe grounde thys towne also called abreswith nat longe brute thys ouerthrowe englysshme came vnto ye towne wherfore sped hym faster thyderwarde anno domini mcclxxxii anno dni mcclxxxiii rauffe blunt henry walys anno xi hawkyn betnell thys xi yere vppon day saynte leonarde syxt daye nouembre whyle kynge edwarde thus occupyed rescowynge hys men whyche besyged dauyd syr rogyer clyfforde wyth whyche entended make reysynge vppon walsh men drowned foly vppon brydge made bargys plankes haue passed water betwene snowdon anglyssey thyrde daye decembre folowynge lewelyne prynce walys slayne syr edmunde mortymer hys company hys hed sente vnto kynge tha beyng rutlande whyche sent vnto london chargynge yt beset vppon toure london thys lewelyne walshe metrycian made foure verse folowynge hic iacet anglorum tortor tutor venedorum princeps wallorum lewelinus regula morum gemma ceuorum flos regum preteritorum forma futurorum dux laus lex lux populorum whyche verse thus meane foloweth englysshmen scourge walshe protectoure lewelyn prynce rule vertue gemme lyuers floure whyche vnto dethe hath payde hys dette due kynges mirrour hym shall sue duke prayse lawe ryght thys graue people lyeth lyght englysshe metrician wrote iiii verse dyspraysynge sayd lewelyn foloweth hic iacet errorum princeps ac predo virorum proditor anglorum fax liuida secta reorum numen wallorum trux dux homicida piorum fex troianorum stirps mendax causa masorum whyche maye thys wyse englysshed lyeth errour prynce yf yewyll ken robbour traytour englysshmen dym bronde sect doer yll god walshmen cruell without skyll sleyng good leder badde lastly rewarded deserued hadde troyans blode drastes nat sede rote falshode cause many yll dede anno domini mcclxxxiii anno domini mcclxxxiiii iordan goodchepe henry waleys anno xii martyn box thys xii yere kynge beynge stylle walys pursued dauyd brother lewelyn towne towne lastly taken broughte vnto kynge aboute natyuyte saynt iohn holden warde tyll kyng sped hys nedes kyng countre hys wyl gaue vnto englyssh lordes townes myddes walys deuyded coutre shyres ordeyned shyryfes offycers vsed englande aberconow made stronge castell house whyte monkes whych remouyd then ordeyned place also made castel carnarua fast snowdon repayred agayne towne lambatre abreswyth lewelyn betyn downe also garuysshed castelles holdes standyng vpon see syde englysshmen made englysshemen lordes groundes belongyng whan ye kyng set coutre rule mychelmasse retourned shrewysbury set parlyament tyme wherof forsayd dauyd chyef styrrer begynner al thys warre deinyd drawen haged quartered shortly ye sayde towne shrewysbury hys hede sent lodon set hed hys brother lewelyn thys yere fyrste son kyng edwarde borne whyle kyng walys ye castel carnaruan reason wherof named edward carnaruan born vpo ye day sait mark ye xxv day april yere also one laurece duket cytezyn lo foude dede hanged within sait mary bow chyrch chepe ye enqueres made lastely yt dede ataynted vii son folowing yt say reygnold lancaster robert pynnot paule stepynhith thomas cordwayner iohn tolanson thomas russell robert scotte whyche dede drawyn hanged woman dede also brent rauffe crepyn iourdan good chepe gilbert clerk geffrey clerke also attait cause repryed sent vnto toure lo remayned loge lastly delyuered thys yere greate conduyte standynge agayne saynte thomas acre chepe begon made yere also stryfe vnkindenes beganne kyndelle betweene kynge erle leycester whych grewe great dysturbauce dyuers townes englande specyally cytye london dele shall appere anno domini mcclxxxiiii anno dni mcclxxxv stephen cornhyll gregory rokesle anno xiii robert rokesby thys xiii
