yere vpon day conuersio saynt paule ye xxv day ianuarii ye kynge ceased fraunchese lybertyes hys handes paragraph discharged mayre london tha beyng gregory rokkisle admytted custos gardeyn cytye stepha sa dewyche whyche contynued offyce tyll moday folowyng puryfycacyon lady whyche season sayd stepha dyscharged syr iohn breton knyght charged resydue ye yere cause thys dyspleasure kyng vnto cytye nat shewed certaynte olde panflete appereth sayd gregory rokkisley toke certayne brybes baker suffered sell brede lackynge vi vnces vii oz peny lofe ye whyche kynge shuld sore dyspleased yet semeth conuenyent cause sease lybertyes cytie offence one man wherfore presuppose yt greuous cause yere fully fynisshed ended new werke ye chyrch westmynster vnto ende quere begonne shewed thyrde yere iii hery whyche reason shuld apere yt thys chyrche shuld edyfyenge vpon lxvi yeres fyrste fundacyon thys chyrche dyuers opinios shewed ye thyrde chapytre story carce v parte thys werke thys chyrche fyrste founded cytezeyne londo reedyfyed saynt edwarde lastly kynge hery iii abbey west mynster lykelyhode ye certaynte regystred thys sayd chyrche temple brytons longe receyued fayth chryste tyme theyr crysten kynge lucius hallowed augustyne hys felowes secundaryly reedyfyed sebertus kynge estsaxons essex aboute tyme whan ethelbert kyng kent buylded saynt paules chyrch londo whyche tyme lucyus receyued fayth chryste vppon iiiic yeres thyrdly buylded saynt edwarde confessoure whiche reygned vpon cccc xl yeres sayde sebertus fourthly lastly foresayd henry ye thyrde whiche began reygne dethe saynt edwarde cl yeres anno domini xiiclxxxv anno domini mcclxxxvi walter blount rauffe sandewyche anno xiiii iohan wade xiiii yere kynge edwarde parliament holden westmynster made yt statute called additamenta gloucestrie whiche meane addicios statute made put suche tyme made ye parlyamet holde glouceter statute made refourme suche sone mysused landes tenementes commynge reason ye dower landes theyr wyues chyldren seconde husbande putt ye ryghtfull enherytoures suche nexte alyed vnto fyrst donours reason whiche statute addicions parliamet made suche mysorder refourmed yere nere aboute towne almayne called traiect many men woman wytnesseth ye auctour cronica cronicarum dausyng vpo brydge whiche lay ouer ryuer called moose whiche tyme theyr dysporte dau synge came preest berynge sacramet towarde seke man wherof sayd men woman beynge reuell toke regarde vnto sacrament dyd honour reuerence wreche god otherwyse shortly preest passed ouer brydge brake meanes wherof nere vnto nombre cc persones drowned aboute season coutre called englysshe swetezers woman delyuered chylde ye nauyll vpwarde ii complete bodyes iiii armes two hedes two bodyes wast downeward ii legges whiche ye fore sayd armes clypped eyther others body woman bare chylde monstre wherof heed face lyke vnto man body lyke vnto lyon tayle fete fetures accordynge yere also cytezyn london named thomas pywylesdon yt whiche ye tyme ye baron warre story kynge henry shewed ben capytayne great styrrer common sayd cytie maynteyne baron partie agayne kynge newly accused euyll dysposycyon shulde make conuentycles assembles newe dystourbaunce cytie wherof reporte made vnto kynge whiche remytted enquery therof vnto syr rauffe sandewyche custos gardeyne cytie sayde thomas putte sure kepynge tyll mater duly enquyred whiche inquysycyon made founde reporte made vnto kynge kyng sent downe wrytte commaunded proclaymed shortly within boundes cytye wherof effecte thus sayde thomas pywelysdo wylyam de heywoode rycharde de coundris rycharde le cofferre robert de derby albyne de darby wyllyam mayo mercer iuo lyng draper diuers ye nobre l persones shuld banysshed yt cytye euer sayd lviii persones tyme proclamacio voyded ye cytye fere otherwyse shuld remayne nat retourne vnto cytie vpo payne lyfe losynge thys yere also olde tyme longe thys season ye marchauntes straugers commynge theyr marchaundyse lodged within cytezeyns cytye london solde theyr marchaundyses procuryng hys host whyche hys sayd hoost certayne euery li meanes sayd marchauntes straugers thys daye brought passe yt myght hyre house dwel stowage theyr ware cytezeyne shulde entermedle hym sayd straugers yet theyr ware meane whereof vsed many disceytes bothe vtterau ce false ware also theyr weyghtes whyche vsed theyr owne house great hurt hole realme englande wherfore sodaynly serche made theyr weyghtes founde proued false ouer yt suche ware shuld weyed kynges beame weyed moche therof theyr sayd house hynderaunce ye kynges custome whyche offeces agayne theym proued nombre xx sayd straungers arrested sent vnto toure lo theyr weyghtes brent consumed westchepe london thursdaye feast symon iude fynally sayd marchauntes delyuered fyne makynge kyng thousande li suffered season harde vyle prysonement anno domini mcclxxxvi anno dni xiiclxxxvii thomas crosse syr iohn bryton anno xv wyllyam hawteyn thys xv yere iewes englande sessed great summes money whych payd vnto kyng one auctour sayd common englande graunted kyng v parte theyr mouables haue iewes banysshe la de whiche cause sayd iewes put common theyr purpose gaue theyr free wylles great summes money ye kyng whych sayeng appereth trewe sayd iewes exyled within yeres thys yere begynnynge may kynge sayled burdeux frome then rode fraunce witnesseth ye fresh boke honourably receyued phylyp le beau philyp fayre kynge fraunce receyued homage sayd edward duchy guyan kynge edwarde taryed season fraunce retourned vnto burdeux whyther came vnto hym certayne ambassadours kyng spayne whych helde longe dalyaunce wherfore ye fresh kyng suspected shuld allye hym kyng spayne agayne frenche kynge thys yere testyfyeth policronycon somer excedyng vote men dyed hete thys yere whete plentuous solde london xlvi quarter anno domini xiiclxxxvii anno domini mcclxxxviii wyllyam herforde rauffe sandewyche anno xvi thomas stanys thys vvi yere kynge edwarde saynt thomas herforde translated thys yere fyll dystauce betwene syr payne tip toft wardeyn certayn castels walys walsh knyght called syr ries ap mordek yt sundry skyrmysshes foughten betwene many men slayne vpon bothe sydes great dystourbaunce ye countre thys yere vpon saynt margaretes euyn xix daye iulii fyll wonderfull great hayle lyke therof nat men lyuynge seen ensued cotynuell rayne whyche dysteperyd groud wyse yere folowyng whete sold xviiid busshel thys yere xiiiid encreased yerely duryng ye reygne kynge hys sone day tyll lastly solde xl quarter aboue anno domini xiiclxxxviii anno domini mcclxxxix wyllyam betayn rauffe sandewyche anno xvii iohn caunterbury thys xvii yere warre yere laste paste betwene syr payn typtoft syr rye contynuynge entente sayd rye myght reuenge hys cause agayne sayd syr payne arrecyd greate multytude walsheme brent wasted dyuers fownes walys kynge beynge normandy sente tle cornewayll beynge kynges lyeu tenaunte englande shuld sende thyder army knyghtes withstande malyce walshmen whych preparyd shortly army yode border northewalys hys copany bare hym knyghtly ende sayd rye take brought vnto porke drawen hanged quartered anno domini xiiclxxxix anno dni mccxc full saynt edmunde rauffe sandewyche anno xviii salaman langforde thys xviii yere vppon lady cuyn assumpcion kyng edwarde honorably receyued cytezeyns london conueyed vnto westmynster shortely broughte hym many greuous complayntes dyuers hys iustyces syr thomas weylande adam stretton whych kynge caused streyghtly examyned lastly founde gylty trespass cause accused wherfore theym outlawed loste suche goodes hadde punysshed longe enprysonemente lastely delyuered payenge greate fynes anno domini mcclxc anno domini mcclxci thomas romayn rauffe sandewyche anno xix wyllyam de lyre thys xix yere kynge ordeyned yt woll whych shuld sold vnto straungers shulde brought vnto sandewyche staple therof longe ye towne caleys thys yere iewes banysshed lande whych cause co mon gaue vnto kyng quindecym fyftene thys yere also syr gylbert de clare erle glouceter maryed dame iane doughter kyng edwarde thys called iohanne acrys born acrys whe kyng edwarde vpon hys great iourney soone yere duke brabannys sonne wedded margarete syster sayd iohanne anno domini xiiclxci anno domini mcclxcii rauffe blount rauffe sandewyche anno xx hamonde boxe thys xx yere begynnynge maryes yere also kynges xx yere meane vpon euyn saynt andrewe xxix day nouebre dyed quene elyanore kynges wyfe buryed westmynster chapel saynt edwarde fete hery thyrde hath ii taper brennyng vpon tumbe daye nyght whyche hath contynued syne day buryenge thys present daye thys gentyll woman towched xxxviii yere kyng henry third syster vnto kyng spayn whome kyng edwarde iiii sonnes saye iohn henry alphons edwarde whych edwarde succeded father reason iii died theyr father also v doughters fyrste elyanore maryed vnto wyllyam erle barre seconde iohan acrys maryed sayde vnto erle glouceter thyrde margarete maryed duke sonne brabat iiii mary name made menchon ambrysbury v named elyzabeth maried vnto erle holande hys deth maryed vnto humfreye boherum erle hereforde thys yere dyed also olde quene elyanore wyfe vnto hery thyrde mother thys kyng edwarde whose herte buryed graye freres london body ambrysbury house nunnes anno domini mccxcii anno dni mccxciii henry bale rauffe sandewyche anno xxi elys russell thys xxi yere kyng helde hys great courte parlyament london whyche dyuers lordes prouince came kyng scottes contynued conuenyente season coueyed dyuers lordes ferre vpo hys iourney towarde hys owne countre thys yere one rychard bagle offycer sheryfes london ledynge prysoner towarde gayole whyche arrested thre men rescowed sayde prysoner toke hym offycer whych pursued taken iugemente lawe vsed broughte westchepe theyr ryghte handes smyten wrestes anno dni mccxciii anno dni mccxciiii robert rokysley rauffe sandewyche anno xxii martyn awbry xxii yere kynge edwarde vpon daye saynt tyburce ualeryan xiiii daye may fyll woderfull snow therwith excedynge wynde vyolence wherof greate harme done sundry place englande remembraunce whereof metrycyan made verse folowynge crastino tiburci sanctorum valeriani nix cadit immanis ventus vehemens boriasis euulsit siluas vulsit quas reperit herbas de dampnose detexit impituose quas clam prostrauit sic plurima dapna para whyche verse may thus englysshed foloweth morow folowynge tiburce valerian blessed sayntes snow fyll suche plentie day lyuyng man myght remembre great quantyte northyn wynde blewe wyth fyerste house tree herbys ouer cast many harmes sande eke see wynde came whyse dyd laste thys yere also ye ende moneth iulu dyed freer pekham archebysshop caunterbury whose see stalled mayster robert wynchester aboute myddes septembre folowynge erle barre frenche man maryed elyanore ye kynges doughter ye towne brystowe ende thys yere dyed alexandre kyng scottes soone ensuyd great warre trouble enherytaunce lande parte shall appere thys yere whete solde london ii busshell yere also wytnesseth frenche cronycle phylyp le beawe tha kyng fraunce made warre gascoyne guyau cause shewed sayeng kyng edwarde vnder coloure haue made vyage holy lande gathered great army sodeynly entred normandy bothe lande water dyd moche harme spoylynge takyng dyuers shyppes fraunce brynnyng spoylyng diuers townes came vnto towne rochell englysshemen made dyuers assautes wherby dweller also towne susteyned moche harme wherof kynge fraunce beynge enfourmed sent vnto kyng edward monisshing hym come vnto hys parlyamente also make satysfaccyon suche harmys hys people done within hys domynyon fraunce normandy kyng edwarde refused therfore ye sayd phylyp le beawe sent rauffe de neell tha co stable fraunce gascoygne greate myghty power whyche made sharpe warre vppon ye gascoynes gascoines helpe englysshemen defended theym suche wyse great hurt done vpon bothe partyes tha fynally testifyeth sayd frenche cronycle entent kyng edwarde myghte make better clayme al hole duchy normady sent frenche kynge worde yt wolde gyue ouer hys handes duchye guyan holde lande kyng fraunce anno domini mccxciiii anno domini mccxcv henry boxe syr iohn bryton anno xxiii richarde glouceter thys xxiii yere walshemen styrryng one named madok rebelled agayne kynge wherfore haste spedde hym vnto westchester feast saynte nycholas wan frome walshmen ile called anglesya ile manne buylded newe cytye castell beau maryse broughte vnstedfast walshemen newe reclayme caused woodes ye countre hewyn downe wherein tymes vsed hyde theym cony dothe hys claper repayred castelles stronge holdes buyldynge newebew beati emen w trapned vanyn caused walshme thryue agayne theyr wylles strengthe castelles kepte theyr olde accustomed rauyns stelynges put execucyon ruler sayd castelles stronge holdes fyll vnto occupacyon byenge sellyng gathered treasoure beganne lyue maner englissheme countre grewe restefulnesse peace thys yere also frenchemen arryued douer wyth certayne shyppes beynge vnder rule syr mathew de mounte morency syr iohan harcourte knyghtes spoyled towne brent parte yt whych skyrmysshe slayne martyred holy man named saynte thomas douer yere testifieth ye frenche cronicle charles de ualoys brother vnto kyng phylyp fraunce sent hys sayd brother gascoygne greate hooste whyche charles layde hys syege vnto castell ryon wherin tyme syr iohan seyn iohn iohn de brytayne whych manfully vygorously defendyd sayd castel agayne frenchman yere next yere shall appere anno domini mccxcv anno dni xiicxcvi iohn dunstable syr iohn bryton anno xxiiii adam halyngbery xxiiii yere kyng great warre yt wyth frenche kyng el co maunded new subsidie leuied vpon sarplers wolle goyng englande felly hydes lyke maner ouer suche money grau ted clergy englande towarde defence holy lande kyng reporte hadde rome pope maners tha bonyface viii comaunded brought vnto hys tresoury couocacio made sayd clergye graunted towarde hys nedes halfe theyr spyrytuall temporall landes begynnyng xx marke benifice ascendyng vpward whych nat payd one yere deuided porcions iii yeres ensuyng lay fee temporall men englade grauted hym x peny theyr mouables payd ii yeres next ensuyng thys yere ye moneth marche drawen hanged london treason done fraunce knyghte called syr thomas turbeuyle aboute ye tyme easter whan charlys de ualoys ye yere haue harde lyen longe castell ryon myght nothyng wynne vpo englyshmen dayly loste best hys knyghtes sent ayde socoure whyche tyme came vnto hym syr rauffe nele constable fraunce fressh company tha assawted new whan lyen season sawe preuayled nothynge agayn theyr enemy yode vnto holde named poudency assauted moche nombre sowdyours norman viii day appoyntemente otherwyse gat sayd holde englisshemen theyr lybertye goodes norman taken prysoners whyche brought vnto castell ryon syghte sowdyours hanged al partye sayde normanscrueltye whan gascoynes beynge wythin towne castell ryons sawe theyr cosyns cou trey men hanged theyr eyen caste theyr myndes yt done treason englysshmen wolde length deale wyth lyke maner reason wherof stryfe varyauce arose betwene englyssheme gascoygnes eyther theym feryd treason whyche cause syr iohan seyn iohan syr iohn de britayn syr robert typtoft syr rauffe ta ny syr hugh bardolfe syr adam cretynge dyuers fledde see maner saued selfe soone sayd towne castell ryons wonne frenchemen inhabytau te sworne vnto frech kynge ye haue harde xxii yere thys kynge howe dethe alexander kyng scottes many questyons fyll amonge sayd scottes ryght enherytauce shulde kynge lande consyderynge sayde alexander lefte hym thre doughters whyche lyuyng theyr father maryed fyrste syr iohan bayloll seconde roberte le bruze thyrde one named hastynges many lordes scotlande wolde haue crowned syr iohan bayloll reason maryed eldest doughters frendes robert le bruze withstode theyr power de hastynges greate stryfe longe varyaunce matter broughte kynge edwarde chyef lord soueraygne lande promysinge hym abyde suche determynacyon iugemente shulde sette therin kynge edwarde ende scottes shulde knowe perfytely kyng englade ought ryghte chyefe hede soueraygne shewed vnto theym suche olde wrytynges lyttell tofore caused serched founde whyche conteyned auctorytye olde cronycles wryters maryanus ye scotte wyllyam malmesbury roger huntyngdon yere lorde ixcxx kynge edwarde elder made subget vnto hym kynges cumbrys scottes also yere grace ixc xxi foresayd scottes cumbrys chase sayd edwarde elder theyr chyefe lord patron ye yere lord ixcxxvi ethelstane kynge englande subdued constantyne kyng scottes admytted sayd constantyne reygne kynge vnder othe obeysaus feaute homage also edredus brother sayde ethelstane subdued newe scottes northumbrys receyued agayne othe homage ouer founde sayd cronycles edgar ouercame alphunius son kynadus kynge scottes receyued hym feawty homage helde hym vnder hys obeysauce done hys father kynadus tyme moreouer wytnessed canutus xvi yere hys reygne subdued malcolyne kyng scottes receyued hym feawty homage furthermore wyllyam conquerour vi yere reygne subdued malcolyne kyng scotlande whyche tymes receyued sayde kyngdome gyfte edwarde kynge confessoure wyllyam rede dyd lykewyse vnto sayde malcolyne vnto hys two sonnes reygned scotlande one also dauyd kynge scottes dyd homage vnto stephane kyng englande wyllyam kynge scottes dyd homage vnto henry thyrde tyme hys coronacyon came vnto hys father henry seconde whan forenamed ry deed normandy made hys homage hym agayne thys henry sonne vnto henry seconde many wryters named henry thyrd moche iii kyng crowned name dyed hys father hys dedes ben lytell spoken wryters nothyng mynded foloweth story howe alexadre kyng scottes yt xxxv yere hery thyrd son kyng iohn maryed yorke margarete doughter sayd henry dyd vnto hym homage realme scotlande boude hym hys heyres kynges scotlande hys letter patentes trewe vnto sayd hery vnto heyres kynges englande lyke tyme wyllyam kyng scottes oblyged hym vnto seconde henry xxii yere hys reygne manyfestly shewed shewed pope bulles whych sent tymes scotlande auctoryte wherof kynges scotlade accursed wolde nat obedyent theyr lordes kynges englande whan presedentes sene ye scottes day assygned metyng norhm march betwene englande scotlande whyther vnto kyng came chief ruler scottes excused boude vnto kyng obseruynge kynges ordenaunce moche lacked kynge hede whome suche ordenaunces shuld maynteyned holde aduyce bothe party agremet made scottes shuld bounde obey kynges iugement wheruppon bondes made vpon bothe partyes meane kyng bounde hondreth thousande pounde yt within ii monethes receyued possessyon lande shulde gyue vnto hym thought ryghtfull enherytour scottes agayne boude vnto hym shuld holde ferme stable suche decre iugement kyng shuld gyue mater also shulde vpholde maynteyne theyr kyng ruler hym kynge shulde admitte chose none whych bondes made delyuered vpon bothe sydes scottes seased kyng edwarde delyuered vnto hym theyr chartours possessio scotlande castelles rightes customes al appertynauces kyngdome belongynge sette wardeynes townes maners castelles shuld saue hym kyng admytted al aduauntages profytes sayde townes meane whyle growyng whan assurauce made fynysshed agrement bothe party kyng called hym hys counsayll partyes made clayme vnto ye kyngdome scotlande theyr reason wele suffycyently argued debated vpon al sydes aduyce aswell lordes scotlande hys owne counsayll fynally admytted kynge syr iohan bayloll moste ryghtefull enherytour crowne scotlande whych receyued hym thankefully presence barony englande scotlande dyd vnto sayde kynge edwarde hys homage sware vnto hym feawty done scottes theyr newe kynge retourned scotlande thys yere take forenamed madok meredok whych ye haue herde xxiii yere caused walshemen rebell drawyn hanged london anno domini xiiccxvi anno dni mcccxvii thomas de suff syr iohn bryton anno xxv adam de fullam thys xxv yere kyng commaunded dyuers shyres englande great quantyte whe e gadered sent gascoyne guyan nombre cm quarter writer soone sent thyder syr edmunde hys brother erle lancastre syr ry lacy erle lyncolne syr wyllyam ueysy baro diuers lordes knyghtes strength suche people redy whyle prepared army haue agaynst scottes ye haue herde precedynge chapytre howe syr iohan bayloll kyng scottes made othe homage vnto kyng edwarde ye kyngdom scotlande whych othe shortly repeted hym meane cousayll abbot menros sayth polycronyco shuld seme wel cou sayll kyng frauce wordes ben wrytten frenche cronycle one full vntrewly forsoke hys former othe promyse arrered warre agayne kynge wherfore kyng edward sped hym thyder great hoost processe layde hys syege vnto towne berwyk scottes defeded egerly bete englysshe men backe brent englyssh shyppes wyth whyche enterpryse enflamyd wyth pryde derisio kyng made mokkysshe ryme folowyng pwhat wenys kyng edwarde hys longe shankys haue wonne berwyke oure vnthankys gaas pykes hym whan hath gaas dykys hym whan kynge edwarde herde ye pryde scottes knewe theyr scornefull ryme somdeale amoued encouraged knyghtes suche wyse wanne dyche towne processe greate laboure daunger bulwerkes came vnto gate made stronge assawte ende wanne towne slewe scottes wytnesseth dyuers wryters ouer nombre xxvm tooke prysoners syr wyllyam douglas syr symon de freysell erle patryk syr robert bruze wyth dyuers shorte tyme wardeyn castell berwyke seynge hym sent socoure yelded vp sayd castell appoyntement wha kyng possession towne castell berwyke strengthed theym wyth englysshe men wanne holdes tyndall exham wyerbyrd lamerstoke wyth dyuers whyle yt kyng edwarde thus besyed wynnyng forsayd holdes set syr hugh spencer syr hugh percy noble men parte host laye siege vnto dunbarre whe layne certayne tyme host scottes came thyder remoue syege whome englysshe men fyers cruel batayle ye ende helpe god saynt george englysshe vyctorye slewe scottes aboue nombre xxm lost englysshe company fewe nombre wherfore englysshe reproche scottes made ryme folowynge scaterande scottes holde sottes wrench vnware erly mornynge euyll tymynge came dunbarre vyctorye towne castell dunbarre wonne whiche take prysoners thre erles vii baron xxvii knyghtes dyuers men churche kynge spedde hym edenborow processe tyme wanne towne castell whiche founde ye regalyes scotlade yt meane crowne septre clothe astate whiche offered kynge edwarde shryne saynt edwarde vpon morowe feast saynt botholfe ye xviii day iunii yere folowynge kynge thus subdued scottes set cou tre rule retourned many prysoners englade whiche tyme season englysshemen susteyned many harde shoures gascoyne gyan among ye whiche one remembred frenche cronycle sayenge edmunde duke erle lancastre dyed bayon whose dethe whyle towne stronge holdes prepared withstande frenchemen robert erle artoys whiche lytel tofore encoutred syr iohn ben hym ouerset resembled copany made hym skyrmysshe whiche slewe vpon hundreth englysshme gascoynes toke prysoners forenamed syr iohan seyn iohan syr wyllyam mortymer nombre lxx whiche sente fraunce vnto dyuers prysones anno dni xiicxcvii anno dni mccxcviii iohn de stortforde syr iohn bryton anno xxvi wyllyam de stortforde xxvi yere kynge edwarde pusaunte armye moneth august toke shyppynge douer sayled flaunders ayde helpe guy erle flaunders agayne ye frenche kynge tyme sore warreyd frenche kynge somoche hadde wonne towne margquet countre theraboute put sayde guy vnto trouble sayd frenche kynge caused robert erle artoys inuade coutre flau dres toward pycardy encountred ye sayd guy nere vnto towne called furnes wher atwene ye said ii erles foughte sharpe bata l many men slayne vpon bothe partyes whiche fyght erle flaunders spedde hym towarde gaunt kynde edwarde soiourned erle artoys drewe hym towarde ye freche kynge whiche shortly receyued towne bruges whiche tyme season whyle ye sayd ii kynges laye thus eyther towne meane pea treated fynally pea cocluded atwene ii kynges atwene frenche kynge guy erle flauders vnto feest sayntes next ensuenge fro day vnto feast sayntes tha ii yeres folowyng whiche pea stablysshed kynge edwarde departed towne gaunte yode burdeaux ye frenche kynge retourned fraunce prysoners delyuered bothe partyes frenche tyme season whyle kynge edwarde thus occupyed flauders scottes entysement frenche kynge entent cause kynge edwarde kepe countre shulde nat ayde erle flaunders beganne make warre vpon kynges soudyours whiche ye kynge lafte dyuers holdes also entred vpon ye border northu berlande made sharpe warre vpon inhabytauntes countre syr iohn bayloll theyr kynge wryters tyme prysoner towre london el voyded coutre fere kynge englande therfore sayde scottes made capytayne whiche named wyllyam waleys man vnknowen lowe byrth obeyed vnto theyr kynge anone ye kynge herde rebellyon scottes hym great wonder consyderynge theyr greate vnstedfastnesse wrote letter vnto syr hery persy erle northu berlande syr wyllyam latymer syr hugh cressyngham tresourer englande goodly haste shulde make prouysyon withstande scottes whiche persones receyte kynges letter spedde spedy maner entred scotlande shortly copelled ye scottes returne backe vnto towne named streuelyn skyrmyssh foughte atwene englysshe scottes syr hugh cressyngham forenamed dyuers englysshemen slayne yet scottes holden strayte englysshe hoost skyrmysshe wolde nat certayne tyme come playne felde kepte theym within theyr castelles stroge holdes yere atwene easter wytsontyde certayne sone londo brake vp tunne warde cornhyll toke certayne persones thyder commytted syr iohn bryton custos gardeyn cytie nyght walkynge whiche ryot sayde persones meane thomas romayne viii afterwarde greuously punysshed fyrst prysonmet fynes yere kynge ye moneth october came englade wynchester cytezyns london made suche laboure vnto grace shortly opteyned graunte theyr lyberties fraunchyses parte kepte ye terme xii yeres vpon daye translacyon saynt edwarde kynge confessour next folowyng chase mayre selfe foresayd tyme theyr custos gardeyn appoynted ye kyng suche ye kyng wold assygne ye shall vnderstande redemed without great summes money wryters cytezyns payde kynge iii marke also yere kyng edwarde put proteccyon certayne alyauntes whiche rychely benefyced england cause sayd alyauntes wolde nat ayde ye kynge theyr goodes ye lande dyd purchased inibicyon pope boniface viii theyr goodes shulde fre kynges dymes taskys therfore ye kyng ceased theyr temporaltyes suffered theyr spyritualtes tyl agreed kynge anno domini mccxcviii anno domini mccxcix richarde reffham henry waleys anno xxvii thomas sely xxvi yere chrystmasse certayne persones made dyggyng serche ye churche saynt martynes le graude lo certayne tresoure shulde hydde reported gardiner theyr labour vayne nothynge founde whiche dede ye deane poules seconde sonday lent folowynge denounced accursed dede doynge consentynge yere aboute ye begynnyng aprell kynge rode towarde scotlande appoynted lordes theyr companyes mete hym yorke hym met great hoost yt whiche ladde scotlande brent spoyled countre went taryed season barwyke then spedde hym wynnynge townes castelles went tyll came nere towne named fawkyrk fankyrk vpon ye day mary magdaleyne ye xxii day iulii met hym ye power scotlande gaue vnto hym sore fyght ende vyctory fyll vnto englysshme scottes slayne ye felde affyrme dyuers wryters ouer nombre xxxiim englysshmen barely xxviii persones whiche scomfyture scottes yelded kynge partye stronge holdes castelles tofore holden agayne hym made vnto hym newe othe promysse yelded selfe vnto grace mercy whan set countre ordre rule tha retourned englade lodon ye aduyce counsayll sodeynly dapned certayn coynes money called pollardes crocardes rosary caused broughte newe coynage great aduautage ye haue herde yere truce pea stablysshed wene kynge ye kynge fraunce space ii yeres whiche fynally concluded yere kynge edwarde pea bytwene regyons shulde take vnto wyfe margarete suster philip le beawe kynge frauce whyche margarete whyle kyng scotlade brought vnto douer vnto caunterbury kyng spoused moneth septembre wytnesseth frenche cronycle receyued processe tyme folowyng two sonnes named thomas edmunde doughter named margarete fyrste sonnes surnamed thomas brotherto seconde edmude wodestoke anno domini mccxcix anno dni mccc iohn armenter elys russell anno xxviii henry fryngeryth thys xxviii yere kynge herynge vntrowth rebellyon scottes made iii vyage scotlade bare hym knyghtly shorte processe hys commynge subdued parte lande sped hym vnto castell estryuelyn wherin many greate lordes scotlande enuyroned sayd castel strog siege laye somwhat oftyme without wynnynge great aduauntage hurte doynge vnto scottes wherfore polycy caused made ii payre galowes ye syght castell comau ded proclamacyons cryed yf scottes certayn day wolde yelde castell kynge shuld haue lyfe lyme yf nat wanne strength many within sayd castel shuld haged vpon gybettes none astate persone excepted processe tyme whan ye scottes well dygestyd thys proclamacyon sawe strength theyr enemyes cosydered theyr owne feblenes lak socoure assented fynally yelde theym theyr castell vnto kyng whyche shortly done wherof kyng edwarde beyng possessed stuffed englissh knyghtes toke newe othe lordes capytaynes whyche founde closed within castell trewe feythfull allegeau ce sufferyd go theym lyked whan wyllyam walys whych sayd pretended rule gouernaunce scotlande harde tell stronge castell estryuelyne yelden vnto kynge edwarde lordes knyghtes therin founden whyche moche affyed sworne kynges allegeaunce feryd sore leste ye sayd company wolde betray hym bring hym vnto ye kyng wherfore hys adherentes withdrewe hym mareyses daugerous place thoughte suertye pursuynge kynges hooste poore common lande presented theym great companyes put theym holy kynges grace mercy kynge thought peasyble possessyon greate suertye lande wherfore caused sworn vnto hym ruler dyuers borughes cytyes townes offycers lande retourned vnto berwyke englande lastly vnto westmynster thys tyme season ye kyng thus occupyed aboute warres scotlande quene co ueyed vnto london agayne cytezyns vpon nombre vic rode one lyuerey rede whyte conysaunce dyuers mysteryes brodered vpon theyr sleues receyued iiii myles without cytie conueyed thorugh cytie whiche garnysshed behanged tapettes arras clothes sylke ryches goodly wyse vnto westmynster lodged whan kynge yere retourned scotlande caused shortly inqui cio de troylbasion inquysycyon made thorugh lande whiche named troilbaston made vpon al offycers mayres shyreffes baylyffes excheters many mysborne theyr sayd offyces extorcioned mystreated ye kynges lyege people otherwyse accordynge good ordre theyr sayd offyces meane whiche inquisicyon many accused redemed theyr offyces greuous fynes kynges great lucre auauntage meanes fou de also forfaites ye crowne whiche broughte great summes money kynges cofers towarde great charge warres yt susteyned wale frauce scotlande shewed yere also kynge coplaynt brought vnto hym mayster walter langton bysshop chester syr edwarde eldest sone pyers gaueston insolent persones broken sayde parke sayde bysshop ryottously destroyed ye game within therfore inprysoned sayd syr edwarde sone complyces processe tyme kynge thorughly enformed ye lassiuyous wanto disposicios sayd pyers gaueston shulde nat enduce forenamed syr edwarde lyke dysposycyon therfore banysshed sayd pyer gaueston englande euer dethe kynge edwarde ye banysshmente soone denulled edward sone wherof ensued moche harme trouble shalbe shewed anno domini mccc anno dni mccci luke hauerynge elys russell anno xxix rycharde champeis xxix yere kynge edwarde dyed edmunde erle cornewayle sonne rycharde somtyme erle sayd coutre kynge almayne without yssue wherfore erledome retourned agayne crowne englande yere kynge gaue vnto syr edwarde sone pryncypate wale ioyned vnto sayd erledome cornewayle anno dni mccci anno dni miiicii robert caller iohn blount anno xxx peter bosham thys xxx yere kyng helde hys greate counsayll parlyamente hys cytye caunterbury anno domini mcccii anno domini mccciii hugh pourt iohn blount anno xxxi symon parys anno domini xiiiciii anno domini xiiiciiii wyllam combmartyn iohn blount anno xxxii iohn de burfforde anno domini mccciiii anno domini mcccv rogyer parys iohn blount anno xxxiii iohn lyncoln xxxiii yere wyllya waleys vnto kyng hadde done many dyspleasures treason agayne trouth allegeaunce hys othe deale shewed take town named saint domynyk scotlad sent vnto london arraygnyd vpon euyn saynt bartylmewe drawen hanged quartered hys hedde set vppon london brydge hys iiii quarter sent scotlande ha ged vpon gate certayne townes lade myghelmas folowynge kynge holdynge hys parlyament westmynster thyder came scotlande bysshop saint andrewes robert le bruze syr symon de frysell erle dunbarre syr iohn cambrees erle atles syr iohn comyn whyce voluntarylye sworne presence kynge hys lordes shuld trewe vnto kynge englande kepe lande scotlande hys vse agayne persones yf rebell malycyous persone distourbed lade breke ye kynges pea shulde cause hym taken sent vnto kynge wyth many article cocernyng theyr allegeaunce whyche full falsely brake contraryed shortely anno dni xiiicv anno dni xiiicvi raynold doderell iohn blount anno xxxiiii wyllyam cansyn thys xxxiiii yere robert le bruze contrary hys othe kynge edwarde made assembled lordes scotlande cousayll thabbot stone fauoured hys vntrouthe sent vnto pope clement v dyspensacyo hys othe made vnto kynge edwarde surmysed hym kyng edwarde vexed greuyd realme scotlande wrongfully whereupo pope wrote vnto kyng edwarde leue suche doynges whyle thys matter thus complayned vnto pope ye sayd robert le bruze made labour myght vnto ye lordes scotlade admytted kyng ye regyon vpon daye concepcyon lady viii day decembre great assemble lordes made abbey stone vpo day folowyng meanes abbot yt place many sayd lordes assented ye wyl sayd robert except syr iohan comyn onely whych defence hys trouthe othe sworne vnto kyng edwarde many reason excuse made fynally sayd wolde nat false hys othe man thys sayd syr iohan comyn great maugre syr robert le bruze many ye noble scotlande helde hys oppynyon fermely began take hys parte counsayll rose suche contrariete opynyons reason sayd cou sayll dyssolued newe sette graye freers dunfrize candelmas next ensuyng whych daye assemble whenne cause theyr meting robert le bruze denouced shewed many great lordes land grauted hym theyr aydes assistence forenamed syr iohn comyn sat styll sayd worde whyche robert le bruze marked well hym sayd syr iohn trust defence weale thys realme ye wyll nat behynde wherunto answered syr wolde ye al lordes present knowe well weale defence ryght thys lande wolde stande vttermost power se ye entede rather subuercyon weale therof wyll therfore ye know shal nother ayde counsayll yet strengthshamfull minder also whose name auctoure myndeth nat whyche allowed sayenge sayde syr iohn wordes admytted hys sadde trewe answere whyche roberte le bruze amoued syr iohn comyn syr rogyer hys brother departed counsayll comyn chyrch freers robert le bruze hym folowyd wounded deth swerde slew syr rogier hys brother whyche wolde haue defended foresayde syr iohn whose deth lytell resystece made agayne vntrewe meane dedes sayd robert le bruze saynte iohns towne crowned kynge shortly nat longe kyng edwarde monysshed vntrouth scottes wherfore prepared hym wende thyder penthecoste helde great feaste hys barony westmyster durynge feast made greate nobre knyghtes ouer cc mooste wryters feast ended set fayre company knyghtes syr aymer de ualaunce erle penbroke syr henry percy erle northumberlande scotlade sped hym selfe wyth hys hoost soone feast assupcyon lady kyng faughte sayd robert le bruze al power scotlandevictory agaynste scottes playne nere vnto saynt iohns towne loge fyght great slaughter scottes ye nombre viim chased scottes whyche chase syr symon de fryseyll erle du barre take also bishoppes saint adrews bastoon abbot stoon scoon syr iohn chambres erle atles bysshoppes abbot kyng edward sent vnto innocet v tha popebyshoppes periured reporte theyr iury taken armed felde shede blode criste men ye te porall lordes sent englade vnto towre londo robert le bruze thys scomfyture losse hys chyef fredes feryng lest ye scottes suche englysshmen kyng edward laft wolde aryse agayne hym comfortles fledde vnto kynge norwaye abode duryng whyle kyng edwarde lyued whan thys noble prynce edward thus subdued ye scottes yelded thankes god hys vyctorye whe ascertayned auoydyng robert le bruze set ye lade quiet ordre retourned englande thys passetyme ye forenamed lordes scotlade areygned londo vpo euyn natyuyte lady put deth theyr heddes set vpo londo brydge shortly iohn waleys brother vnto wyllya waleys whych lyke treason put deth ye preceding yere taken haged quarteryd scottes taken prysoners remayned loge englade myght acquite theyr fynaunce anno dni xiiicvi anno dni xiiicvii symon bolet iohn blount anno xxxv godfrey de la conduyt thys xxxv yere ye kynge certayne cause hym mouyng retourned agayne scotlande wryters taryed berwyke helde hys crystmasse easter partyes came nat englade scofyted ye scottes season somer retournyng englade sykenes toke hym feruetly ye knew wele shuld dye wherfore beyng burgthe vpo sande beyonde carleyll called hym syr aymer de ualance erle pebroke syr henry percy erle northuberlande syr ry lacy erle lyncoln syr robert clyfforde baro caused besworne hym yt shuld crowne hys sonne edwarde conuenyent tyme hys dethe myght kepe lande hys vse tyll crowned othe sayd baron take called hym hys sonne edwarde charged hym dyuers poyntes vpon charge blessynge amonge whyche one specyall yt shuld neuer daye suffre pyers gaueston retourne englande lyke good crysten prynce dyed shortly vpon day translacio saynt thomas caunterbury ye vii day moneth iulii whan reygned xxxiiii yeres vii moneths odde day great solepnite coueyed vnto westmynster buryed ye chapell sait edwarde vpo southsyde playne tombe marble hed hys father noble ii wyfes whych shewed xx xxvii yeres reygne issue sayd yeres appereth thys noble price vercifyer made ii verse folowynge du viuit rex valuit sua magna potestas frau latuit pax magna fuit regnauit honestas whych verse maye englysshed thys maner folowynge pwhyle lyued thys kyng hys power thynge good plyght gyle hydde great peace kydde honeste myghte vercifyer also made verse folowynge caused hanged ouer place hys sepulture mors est mesta nimis magnos quia iungit imis maximum mors minimis coiunges vltima primis nullus orbe fuit homo viuens ne valet esse qui non morte ruit est hinc exit necesse nobilis fortis tibi tu confidere noli omnia sunt mortis sibi subdit singula solo de mundi medio magnum mors impia nouit anglia pre tedio satis anxia plangere nouit corruit edwardus vario veneratus honore rex nuper nardus fragans virtutis odore corde leopardus inuictus ab que pauore ad rixam tardus discretus eucharis ore viribus armorum quasi gigas ardua gessit colla superborum prudens per prelia pressit inter flandrenses fortuna sibi bene fauit vt quo que wallenses scotos subpeditauit rex bonus ab que pare strenue sua regna regebat quod natura dare potuit bonitatis habebat actio iusticiae pax regni sanctio legis et fuga nequicie premunt preconia regis gloria tota ruit regem capit haec modo fossa rex quando que fuit nunc nil nisi puluis os pilius ipse dei quem corde colebat et ore gaudia donet ei nullo permixto dolore whych verse entent yt shuld mynde also yt reder myght haue ye desyre ouer rede haue therfore set baladde royall rude makynge foloweth sorowfull deth whiche bryngeth great full lowe mooste leest ioyneth one thys man whome hys pere nat knowe hath subdued nat sparyng hym alone whyche thys worlde ouergone none spared great equytie noblesse spared shuld therfore thou noble myghty truste none grace thou shalt pay deth thy naturall dette lyke thys worlde dyd chace thys myghty prynce frendes fette whome englande loude mourned grette shalt thou dethes snare fall none shall escape rekyn kyndes edwarde many dyuers grace endowed lyke nardus moost swetest odoure smellynge passeth moost allowed swete odour dyd thys knyghtly floure vertuous actes surmount honoure prince whose herte lybarde lyke without fere hole syke prynce slowe maner stryfe discrete wyse trewe hys worde army geaunt terme hys lyfe excellyng actes doyng dynt sworde subduyd proude prudence bare horde flaunders fate great amyte walshe scottes strength subdued thys good kyng perelesse hys landes fermly gyded nature myght gyue fayled nothynge parte bounte fro hys discided iustice peace law stablysshynge chaser iniquyte hys vertuous lyuyng whome grace innumerable mo fermly roted deth hath tane v fro whylom kyng duste bone glorie fallen thys pytte kepeth kynge yeldeth thyng hys one sonne god whome aboue thynge herte mouth dyd due worshyppyng lorde hys ioy perdurable laste graunt hym sorowlesse euermore taste phylyp iiii name sonne thyrde phylyp whyche surnamed philyple beawe phylyp fayre bega hys reygne ouer ye realme fraunce yere grace mcclxxxvi viii yere ye fyrste edwarde tha kyng englad thys warre duke gelderlande arreryd greate imposycyons thorugh hys lade spyrytualtye also te poraltye iiii yere hys reygne prynce salerne long ben holden pryson kynge aragon delyuered vpon hard condycyon foloweth fyrst shuld vttermoost hys power labour concorde pea betwene chyrch rome aragos done set pea betwene frenche kyng hym ouer paye ende xv monethes nexte ensuynge cm floryns hys raunsome floryn value sterlyng money iisxd shuld pay ye value englisshe money xviim vcli day shuld neuer bere army agayne kyng arago yf within terme iii yeres nexte ensuyng myght nat conclude foresayd pea shuld retourn yelde hym selfe prysoner whyche couenauntes fermely holden fyrst made solempne othe delyuered kynge certayne hostage departed thys composycyon agrement thoughte vnresonable vnto hys frendes counsayled shuld sue vnto pope dyspensacyon hys othe wolde helpe hym recouer hys foresayd hostage whose cousayl yere folowyng made suche labour vnto honorius ye iiii ye name tha pope alonely opteyned nat solucio hys othe also hi declared kyng scicill pope nycholas ye iiii successoure foresayd honorius confermyd thys prynce salerne ye haue herde ye storye phylyp thyrde iii iiii chapyters sonne vnto charles brother saynte lowys kyng scicill forenamed kynge arago hym vppon abouesayd codicios thus delyuered sonne vnto peter kyng arago whych storye ye foresayd thyrd philip helde warre hym ye sayd charles prince salerne also named charles name father whych hys admyssio ye pope crowned kyng scicil ye cytie palermo soone defended lade knyghtly agayne aragos helpe freche men terme v yeres whych termes ende alphos tha kyng arago dyed iaques iames whome foresayd alphons take rule scicill held warre forenamed charles brother next heyre vnto crowne arago admitted kynge ye regyon whych admissio shortly cocluded pea ye sayde charles redelyuered vnto hym suche hostage pledge hys brother alphos tyme hym receyued kepyng former co uencions stablysshemet pea ye sayd iames toke wyfe one doughters sayde charles vi yere reygne philip certayne sowdyours fraunce nombre xv hondreth whyche sent procurement pope nycholas fourth vnto acrys fortifye towne co trary truce betwene crysten sowdan concluded ye terme ii yeres brake oute towne castelles adioynant spoyled robbed suche sarazyns towne dwelling nere dyd vnto sorowe shame myght wherof sowdan hauynge knowlege therwith greatly amoued yet wolde attepte warre agayn crysten sent vnto captayne cytye acone wylled hym sende vnto hym suche persones broken peace done iniurye hys people yf refused sente worde shulde nat blynne tyll dystroyed lately done inhabytauntes cytye tryple sette hys manace noughte moche thoughte able withstande hys malyce upon whyche answere sowdan made great prouysyon besiege sayd cytye whyche passe tyme frauce borne dame iohane iane quene fraunce lowys kynges eldest sonne father kyng fraunce sowdan prepared thyng necessary iournay sped hym wyth innumerable multytude sarazyns towarde ye cytye acon acris whyche iournay taken greuous sykenesse knew well shulde shortly dye wherfore callynge hym hys admyralles charged certayne theym kepe forthe theyr iourney towarde acon whyle remenaunt retourned egypt create hys sonne sowdan whyche creacyon charged shulde cause hys sayde sonne haste hym vnto ye sayd siege soone dyed thynges ordeyned deuysed ye cytie besegyd stronge hoost sarazyns whyche assauted yt cruelly space vi wekes whyche season crysten defended manfully sarazyns myght therof gette none aduautage ende thys vi wekes came yonge sowdan wyth fresshe hoost whyche made dynne noyse wyth theyr tabour hornys mynstrelsy dayes vsed hydous ferefull rested theym ii dayes prepared ryggynge theyr ordenaunce assauted cytye xiiii dayes contynually whyche season moche people slayne vpo bothe partyes nombre cytye vyolence theyr ordenaunce ouer threwe moche housynge within cytye moche people oppressed slayne aswell woman chylde ende thys xiiii dayes ruler cytye seen harme receyued thys fyers cruell assaute aswell losse theyr sowdyours great enpeyrynge theyr wally defence theyr cytye feryd sore whych one asset codysseded sent soone theyr shyppes great nobre olde men wome chyldren vnapt ye warre ye reliques treasours ye cytie sicill nat loge ye sarazyns made newe assaute cotinued iiii day meane wherof cytye sore defaced kyng cyprys whych day one chyef ruler cytye fayned hym lyke wherfore ye nyght folowyng desyryng knyght cytye kepe hys watche cowardly shamefully iiiim toke shipping sayled then leuyng cytye daunger uppon morowe whan certaynte thys knowe patryarke hierusalem laft bre viim therupo sent vnto ye sowda trewce ii moneths none myghte purchase therfore defendyd ye best maner myght shortly lak defece vpon wally sarazyns fylled dyke soon upo xxv day may force entred cytye slewe people therin foude sowdan gaue pray ye cytie vnto hys knyghtes spoylyng paragraph caused wally toures rased vnto groude house aswell church temple clerely bret distroyed thus ye noble cytie acris whych also called tholomayda subuerted whyche chyef porte hauyn towne cryste lande hoste power shuld entre holy lade cotynued partye possessio criste terme clx yeres aboue vii yere thys kynge phylyp erle armenake accused certayne poyntes treason syr raymonde barnade erle foyz vpon day batayll betwene ii erles appoynted foughten gysours kynges presence hys barony great instauce laboure made syr robert erle artoys ye batayll fordone vii yere hys reygne gadered great talke comos yere foresayde feaste holden copeyne made aboue vi score knyghtes x yere ye glorious confessoure saynt lowys grandfather vnto philip day folowynge saynt bartylmew apostle translated ryche shryne monastery saynt denys ye whych yere bonyface viii tha pope hys great myracles wrytten cathologe nombre sayntes xi yere hys reygne syr robert artoys entred towne saynt omers toke therin many burgonions prysoners soone mette wyth guy duke burgoyne towne called furnes betwene theym foughten stronge fyghte many men slayne vppon eyther syde lastly victorye fyll syr robert artoys put duke flight toke prysoners henry erle dabencourt syr guyllyam de uyllers whyche vyctorye hym thus opteyned ye sayd towne furnes yolden vnto hym greate parte vale cassyle thys yere also warre betwene thys kynge phylyp edwarde fyrste kynge englande put vre moche sayde edwarde toke partye wyth sayde duke erle flaundres length sette xxiixxiiiixxvi yeres sayde edwarde wherefore nowe passe xiii yere thys phylyp wha trewce sette betwene kyng edwarde hym erle flaudres expired set syr charles de ualoys brother great power flaudres ye whych made sharpe warre vppon flemynges toke theym townes douay bethune yode towarde haue towne dam dan encoutred robert sonne vnto ye erle atwene foughten cruell fyght great scathe bothe partyes eyther departed without great auaunte bost tha sayd robert company drewe towarde gaunt sayd syr charles departynge sayde robert layd hys syege vnto foresayd towne dame passe tyme archebysshop orleaunce slayne knyghte called syr gautier somoch sayd bysshop ye fame went dyfflorysshed mayden doughter ye sayd syr gautier hym chosen dygnyte mayster barthrade doctour diuinyte retourne lafte foresayd warre flaundres sayd syr charles sharpely assauted towne dam yt short proces yolde vnto hym prepared hym lay syege aboute forenamed towne gaunt wherof whan guy erle flaunders ware consyderynge myght nat shortly ayded kynge englande whiche tha warred vpon scottes xxvii yere edwarde fyrst doth appere made meanes vnto sayd syr charles de ualoys woldc meane kynge myght accepted vnto grace mercy meanes sayde syr guy roberte sonne vpon certayne conuencyons shorte tyme reconcyled vnto frenche kynge whyle conuencyos perfourmed sayde erle sonne robert kepte lyberall pryson countye flaundres assygment af kynge whyle commytted vnto rule iaques de saynt paule knyghte whiche entreated ye comunes lade sternly oppressed imposycyons taskes moche yt ye xvi yere kynge certayne ye towne courtray flaundres certayn skyrmysshes loueday made comune people nyghte slewe ye foresayd syr iaques many frechme myght fynde within towne whiche murder knowen brugys townes flaudres anone yll cousayll also chased al suche frecheme ye foresayde iaques put dyuers offyces within ye sayd townes made stroge make defence agayne ye frech kyng wherof wha ye freche kynge ascertayned sente thyder stronge companye erle saynt poule erle boleygne syr robert erle artoys robert ye sonne erle cleremount dyuers noble frauce whiche sped towarde brugys ye playnes atwene courtray brugys pyght pauylyons tentes myght come nere vnto brugys moche ye flemynges broke ye brydge ouer ryuer yt runeth whiche lastly nat without great slaughter partyes ye freche reedified made yt freche hoste passed ye ryuer layde theyr denauce nere ye towne brugys flemynges garnysshed theyr towne defence sowdyours fered frenche men lytell nothynge one thynge bare theym bolder soo moche hadde within towne one sonnes guy theyr erle whiche scaped ye freche kynges pryso thus frenchemen lyenge towne many frayes bykerynges made atwene flemynges theyr paynes lastly day batayll ye prouocacyon dyspyteous wordes frenchme appoynted holden atwene vpon wednysday beynge vii day ye moneth iulii whiche daye flemynges beynge confessed reconciled god shulde forthwith haue deted worlde sober wyse groudynge vpon ryghtfull good quarel day lyue dye defence ryght theyr countre yssued ye town good ordre beryng certayne relyques sayntes whiche great truste allyance anone noble fraunce behelde countenauce theyr enemyes dysdaynynge vylaynes artyfycers trustynge moche theyr stregthes thought shortly ouer ryde theym bere downe stregthe theyr horse without ordre ran great ire vpon theyr enemyes thynkynge haue oppressed ye fyrst brote flemynges theyr arbalasters theyr longe mareys pykes set aslope wounded theyr horse lay tumbelynge one others necke letter whiche fote myght exercyse theyr feat armes also shotte shotte frenche partye dyd asmoche harme horse dyd vnto theyr enemyes shorte whyle ye felde spred slayne horse clene armed men wherof syr roberte erle artoys beyng ware seynge noble speres thus slayne vpon felde auauced hym company slewe wou ded fleminges great nombre yt fledde hym shepe wolfe put backe hoost flemynges fyrst metyng auauced self yfayde guy de namour sone vnto erle flaunders nat soner comyn vnto sayde erle artoys day wonne renowne felde tha sayd guy fresshe compapany almaynes bolde sowdyours coragyously entred felde bete downe ye frenchemen egerly medle newe begon feruent wyse men horse fyll downe grounde wondersly thycke euer erle artoys euer wente slewe moche people hym flemynges kept hole togyder yt myght neuer dysseuer slewe noble fraunce great plentye whiche mortalite thus contynuynge ye stremes blode ran wonder beholde alway frenche partye weked lastly erles saynt poule boleyn robert sonne erle cleremounte nombre iim horseman seynge rage woodnes flemynges whiche cruelly slewe bet downe frenche men settynge parte honour knyght hode shamefully fled feld leuyng erle artoys ye myddel enemyes whiche lyke vnto lyon rampaunte contynued one sleynge kyllynge flemynges without mercy pyte flemynges lyke wood tygres enraged vpon frenchemen ye wolde neuer leue tyll pure force draue theyr tentes slewe theym great multytude batayll slayne foresayd erle artoys godfray de braban nere kynnesman sayd erle lorde wyrson adam erle dabenmale iohn sonne ye erle henaut rauf de neell costable fraunce guy brother marshal hoste renolde de try esmer chamberlayne cancaruyle iaques ye sonne godfrey de braban pyers floot iohan bruillis maister ye arbalasters knyghtes many mo name nombre cc aboue besyde esquyers men lower degree yomen gromes page nobre xiim whiche vyctorye flemynges dyspoyled suffred caryns lye ye felde wylde bestes fowles myght perysshe deuoure whan yonge knyght syr guy hadde thus opteyned vyctorye frenchman reioyced lytle soone therafter layde syege vnto ile castell soo named gat also trecheri wyse townes iper gaunt douaye diuers countre obeyed hym codyscended agreed take partye eyther agayne frenche kynge kynge phylyp herynge great dysconfyture men made countenaunce mournynge specyally true knyght erle artoys kynge phylyp reuenge foresayd dyspleasure hym doone ye flemynges assembled lady day assumpsion next ensuynge excedynge nombre men armes entendynge haue entred flaundres vtterly haue destroyed great parte countre drewe towarde enemyes pyght ye tetes vanward within ii myles enemyes lay excedynge charge cosiderynge great multytude hoost ye moneth septebre ye nobre hoost haue doubte wryte mayster gagwyn sayth ye nobre great yt may nat byleued yt sheweth wel ye expressemet ye nobre made ye frenche cronycle saythe hudreth tyme cm xl tymes xlm whiche sayeng somdele appereth ye frenchme ca make men souge great excedynge nobre frechme ye flemynges laye styll vnhurte assawted fynally vp great substancyall cause ye shal great hoste dissolued returned euery awne kynge phylyp smal honour frauce wherof ye frechme sayth ye occasion cause thus kynge edward englade whiche vnto ye flemynges bare great affeccion cosideryng ye great daunger ye tyme myght nat ayde socour pollicy cast mynde heuy mornynge coutenaucearyght notable policy shewed vnto ye quene syster vnto kyng phylyp ye heuy sorowfull brother ye kyng frauce wherof whe wherfore frayned cause answered sayde yt certayne knowlege yt suche tyme flemynges shulde mete batayle lordes co pany shulde leaue hym amonge enemyes solde vnto hande wherof whan ye quene thus ascertayned anone possible hast sent letter messangers vnto frenche kynge counfaylynge hym well ware treason daunger whiche gyuynge credence shortely sente frome hym sayd great company people certayne aboue sayd retourned ito fraunce whyche departynge flemynges bolde forthe wyth entred pycardy countre artoys spoyled brent dyuers townes yere folowyng testyfyeth sayd freche cronicle ye flemynges bruges foughten otthon duke burgoyn whome reason maryage frenche kyng gyuen erledome artoys slewe ayde frenchemen xv thousande thys xvii yere mydsosomer phylyp sonne erle flaundres whyche certayn terme passed ben court charles de ualoys hym put truste receyue certayne summes money scicill ye vse pope bonyface viii sodaynely departed stronge company almaynes came flaundres ayde assiste brother whome flemynges brabanders receyued great ioy comforte hym inuaded border landes frenche kyng boldly assautyd castell saynt omers gat none aduauntage loste many theyr men forsoke yode vnto towne belongyng freche kyng called thorouan moryne whyche processe wanne spoyled thys tyme dyed bonyface viii name popeboniface viii pope man euyll name fame whyche hys trechery caused hys predecessour celestyne v good holy man resygne leue papacie thys meane thys sayd celestyne sytte peter chayre short tyme bonyface espyeng hys innocency whyche sette seruice god vsed hym ledyng ankers lyfe thoughte howe myght bryng hym mynde resigne hys hyghe office bring fyrst made hym frendes secretely hyred one cubyclers ye pope dede nyght shuld speke rede saye celestyne yf thou wylt sauyd partyner blysse renounce thys pope worlde serue thou dyd latyn storye yf celestynus wyl sauyd let hym clerely papall dygnyte resygne whych voyce ghostly sundry tymes heryng thought veryly ben deuyne mocyon wherfore myghte laboured dyscharged ye ende v monethes resigned shortly foresayd bonyface admytted whyche nat beynge contented hys synystre opteynyng thys hygh dygnyte ye fere lest ye sayd celestyne shuld repent hym hys insolent dede strengthe prynces restored agayne hys former dygnite therfore wolde nat suffre sayd celestine retourne wildernes contynewe hys olde accustomed lyfe helde hym castell prysoner sorowe euyll kepynge dyed shortly whyche thys bonyface nat vnpunysshed sorow trouble durynge terme hys papacy suffred whyche nat lytell ende viii yeres taken stregth put pryson miserably cruelly entreated dyed madnesse hunger ete hys owne handes mysery ended hys lyfe within xxiiii dayes hys inprysonement retourne laft shewe ferther warre atwene frauce flaundres trouth freche men ye ayde henaudours made sondry many tymes assautes vpon flemynges whiche dyuers chau ce ye warre fyll yf one better one tyme moche aduauntage nexte tyme reformacyon whiche warre syr guy sone beforenamed erle flaundres season cotynued ye freche kynges pryson suffred go flaunders vpon condycyon yf myght pacyfye countre kynges pleasure shulde styll enioye theyr lyberte go large el retourne againe prysoners whiche erle sayd sonne dyd cowde reconcyle sayde flemynges al theyr trauayle vayne day appoynted retourned theyr former pryson wherfore kynge xviii yere reygne assembled mesurable hoste people whiche accompted noble capytaynes vnder kynge syr charles de ualoys brother kyng lewys erle euroux othe brother ye kyng guy erle saint paule iohn erle dampmartyn whiche noble men many mette kyng towne called mount whe season rested meane messangers goyng atwene kynge phylyp flemynges day batayll atwene theym appoynted foughten vppon xvi daye auguste ye aboue sayd xviii yere whiche day ye flemynges brugys ye townes set forthe theyr ordenaunce made stronge felde enbatayled suche wyse frenchemen made daugerous set vpon meanes treatye offered daye passed without stroke strykynge euenynge flemynges thynkynge take auauntage vpon theyr enemyes came sodenly vpon frenchman hardly kynge myght armed slayne two men within tent wherfore hasty spede made kynge goten horsbacke forthwith marcyall power made waye thorough enemyes slewe theym without mercy knyghtly example hym remenaunt lordes quytte theym honorably poore flemynges layde feld bathynge theyr owne blode great nombre lastly costrayned flee shamefully leue theyr ordenauce behynde yf nyght hadde nat fallen deme many mo theym shulde haue ben slayne consyderynge great fyersnesse theyr enemyes excedyng rancour malyce frenchman theym bare yet frenchemen escaped without losse noble men batayll slayne erle ancerre dyuers knyghtes men fame whiche scomfyture chasynge flemynges kynge darknesse set vnto tentes torche lyghte hadde buried dede bodyes slayne felde also garnysshedde stronge castelles knyghtes ende flemynges shulde nat breke toferre abrode knowynge enemyes shulde yere haue mo playne batayles retourned agayne fraunce ye xix yere kyng phylyp meanes enguerra especyall fauoure kynge pea betwene fraunce flaundres concluded whych ye shal dured short whyle nat withstandynge reason thys pea robert de bethune wyllyam hys brother whyche thys seaso theyr father syr guy erle flaundres contynued pleasaunt esy pryson delyuered father dede moneth february co clusyon thys pea passed louse ce french kyng caryed marquet town flaundres buryed paragraph xx yere thys kyng phillip great dyssencyon stryfe fylle betwene ryche gouernours parys ye comynaltie heythyng ye rent dyuers house aparteynyg ye sayd cominaltie wherfore sayd comons secretely accopanyed greate nombre yode vnto house stephan barbet accused occasyoner dede spoyled yode maner counntre named courtile barbet lykemaner spoyled done set fyre brent orcharde whych passynge commodious pleasaunt defaced vtterly dystroyed nat yet thys beyng content retourned agayne vnto house sayde stephan wynes within hys seller dranke tyll wood drunke myght nat wyse deuoure bette heddes let wyne rone strete formys stolys vtensillis house foundyn brake peces federbeddes rypped ye tykys helde theym wynde fethers myght blowyn way lost foreuer vnrypped house dyuers place rayne wederyng myghte entre fyll ye tyme soone crystmas thus contynuyng theyr fury rage dyspoylynge defasyng foresayd house men nat knowynge dyd yode streyght greate nombre vnto place templers nere season kyng philyp certayn hys baros lodged kept entree place suche wyse man myghte yssue entre theyr pleasure suche mete brought thyder kynges vse hys housholde cast myre fylth strete kyng lordes seynge rage thys rude vnresonable people sent vnto prouost ye cytie hys lordes whyche gaue vnto pleasaunt comfortable wordes length retourned theym peasyble maner theyr house vpon morowe folowynge kyng nat forgettyng thys rage ryot people co maunded many sayde comons attached sent vnto dyuers prysons vpon candelmasse euyn folowyng ryot xxviii hanged iiii entree ye cytie parys ye say vii louure vii towarde partyes saynt antoyne vii place toward roule vii place towarde nostre dame notyr dame whych execucyon caused cominaltye ye cytie lyue longe great fere xxi yere reygne kyng philip whyche maketh yere lorde xiiic vii wryters affyrmeth yere grace xiiic xi templers fraunce destroyed theyr goodes possession thorugh crystendom gyue auctoryte synode kept clement v pope cytye narbon fraunce vnto ye relygyo knyghtes saynte iohn baptyst thys ordre templers destroyed theyr detestable heresy whereof couyct x artycles expressed frenche cronycle length passe ouer lengthe matter also rehersall therof nat fruytefull herers reders xxiii yere reygn kyng philippe asmoche electours empyre chosen emperoure therfore great army sped hym toward rome passed thorugh almayne tyll came vnto duchye qua rantayne whyche duchye people receyued hym honoure passed mountaynes came vnto padua also ioyously receyued tarienge season receyued layne ambassadours whyche offered hym cytye couenable seruyce hys people hym plenarli assembled departed padua yode vnto mylayne whome lordes cytye met vpon waye conueyed hym vnto mayster paleys cytye lodged hym within fewe day brought hym great solempnyte vnto cathedrall churche crowned hym kyng lobardy called hym augustus tha departed mylayn spedde hym cytye cremoyne layd siege hym shortly yolde fro thes passed ye cyte bresse holde loge whyle thyder hys ayde came many soudyours ye towne pyze made many sharpe assautes whych assautes guyde namoure yt marshal kynges hoost dyed hurtes yt toke pcesse tyme shortly folowing ye ruler bres offered meanes treaty ye kyng amoued ye dethe hys marshall yt wolde graut codycional pea stade grace mercy wherefore fynally seyng better meane offered vnto hym ye key cytye tha kyng philip othe made excellecy caused anone ye part towne dyche fore agayn hys pauilio fylled walle ye cytye many house stode betwene walle mayster palays cytye throwyn downe yt hys hoost myght entre ye streyght waye go ryde vnto sayd palays whe thyng ordered hys deuyse entred ye way cytye cremo therin taryed certayn season toke hys counsayll ye gebellynys myghte cytye rome wynne wha fynys shed ye cousayl toke certayn hostage thys cytye cremo ye whych set vnto pyze kept sped hym towarde rome gettyng many cyties holdes ye way lastly came vnto ye cytie named bowlon la grasse whyther cam vnto hi car dynall legate sent fro pope clemet v treate ye state ye empyre cotynuauce fyne thys iournay tourned nat honour pleasure frechme metyng kynge thys legate ye matter touched frech kyng agayn frauce legate myght bryng vnto hym answere fro pope also suspect matter speketh nothyng mayster robert gagwyne whyche leueth nothynge hys boke ye may soude auauncemet french nacyon xxiiii yere reygne kyng philip brent dyuers place fraunce vpon lx templers heresy rehersed yere folowynge new rebellyon began flaunders whyche robert erle flauders accused acquyt hym self guy hys sonne attached sent pryson fro whych escaped fere profe haue ben iustyfyed agayne hym retourned vnto gaunt defeded fro hys aduersaries holanders brabaders helde theyr partye agaynst frech kyng also agayne theyr owne erle whych contynued without notary batayll tyll xxvi yere reygne kyng philip yere vpon euyn mary magdaleyn towne courtray brabande bysshops spyrituall men fraunce flaundres peace cocluded wherof condycyons yt flemynges shuld haue pardo forgyuenesse theyr former rebellyon aswell agayne kynge theyr naturall duke thys shuld paye certayne summe syluer wherof summe nat expressed ouer shulde theyr proper costes expense bete downe certayne stregthes holdes freche kynges depute wolde assygne begynnynge gaunt bruges place ouer shulde yelde vnto robert theyr erle ye castell courtray abylemetes warre necessary theruto belongyng al whych codicions obserue shuld deliuer vnto ye kyng frauce good hostage al came small effect shal appere xxvii yere thys phylyp iacob mayster ye te plers greate ruler ye sayd ordre whych named uisytour longe prysonment brent parys yere kynge phylyp arrered taxe thorugh fraunce whyche dayes neuer herde spoken thys greuous al normady picardy champeygne allied togyder vtterly denayde paymet therof wherof heryng countrees toke opynyon greate rumour murmour reysed thorugh ye realme frauce wyse kyng pacyfyeng people fayne repeale sayd taxe xxviii yere reygne kyng philip ye weke easter iii wyfes iii sonnes kynge philip say margarete wyfe lowys hys eldest sonne kyng nauerne iohanne ione wyf hys seconde sonne philip erle poytyers blaunche wyfe hys thyrde sonne charles erle march accused spouse brekyng sent fro place nunnes lay conueyed vnto streyghter kepyng ye whych iii wyfes al iii doughters vnto duke burgoyn tha vppon strayte examynacyon made margaret iohanne gyltye cryme foud wherfore sent vnto castell gaylard normady kept prysoners terme theyr lyues forenamed blanche moche founde gyltles agayn restored vnto lorde charles erle march shorte tyme two paramour sayd margaret iohanne saye philip da noy gautyer danoy waltier dannoy knyghtes men fame goodly personage bretherne kynges commaundement fyrst brent vysage hote ire drawe gybet potoyse hanged whyche mysfortune kynge toke greuously reioysed neuer feast saynte peter begynnyng august kynge herynge rebellyon flemynges engwerram hys mooste secrete cousaylour made assemble cytezyns parys mouth saynd enguerram desyted subsydye sayd cytezeyns mayntayne hys warre agayne flemynges whyche stepha barbet name hole cytye graunted precidece wherof great cyties good townes frauce charged lyke maner whyche caused greate vnkyndnes grudge people towarde ye sayd enguerram prouysyon made newe iourney flaunders kynge sent hys twoo sonnes many noble lande moneth septembre folowynge sayd countre flauders whyche made good spede layde fyrste theyr siege castel ile wanne entred towarde stroge holdes flemynges put gaue vnto frenche hoost sharpe assautes processe constrayned retourne fraunce wyth smal honoure wherof great defaute layde vpo enguerram vpo one sonnes erle flaundres whych lytel tofore meanes ye sayd enguerra made erle neuers moneth nouembre folowyng kynge phylyp beyng foutayne beliaunt prouynce gastenoys taken suche sykenesse dyed shortly reygned xxviii yeres hys body caryed vnto saynt dionise buryed leuing hym ye thre forenamed sonnes lowys philyp charlys doughter named isabell whych tyme maryed vnto seconde edwarde tha kyng englande anglia edwarde seconde yt name sone edwarde fyrst born carnaruan towne walys beganne reygne ouer englande moneth iulii viii day sayd moneth yere lord xiiic vii xxi yere iiii phylip kyng frauce whych crowned westmynster xiiii daye decembre oppinio dyuers wryters ranulph moke chester boke policronicon sayth yt crowned forsayd monastery bisshop wynchester sonday quinquagesima whych xiiii day closyng alleluya bisshoppe wynchester moche robert archebisshope cauterbury englande thys edwarde fayre body great strengthe vnsted faste maners vyle codicions wolde refuse company lordes men honour haute hym vylayns vyle sone also gaue hym great drynkyng lightly wolde dyscouer thiges great cousayl many disalowable condicions exercysed whych tourned hym great dishonour hys lordes great vnrest sequele thys hys story shall appere anone hys father buryed hys exequy scantly fynysshed forgettynge hyghe chargeable commaudement hys sayd father sent haste hys olde compere pyers gau stone whych receyued wyth ioy gladnesse auaunced hym moche honour thus passed season ye olde mayre shyreffes london yt feastes myghelmas symon iude folowyng ye olde mayre shyreffes meane syr iohan blount symon bolet godfrey conduyt dyscharged newe vnder foloweth admytted iuno domini mcccvii anno domini mcccviii nycholas pygotte syr iohn blount anno primo myghell drury thys begynnynge thys mayres yere fyrst yere ye kynge sayd kynge edwarde moneth decembre sayled frauce xv day ianuarii folowynge boleyn pycardy maryed isabell doughter philyp le beaw kyng fraunce soon retourned englande vnto london cytezeyns ioyously receyued conueyed vnto west mynster shewed vpon sonday quinquagesima bothe solemply crowned whyche coronacyon excedynge prease knyghte called syr iohn bakwell thrested deth kynge gaue shortely vnto pyers gauestone erledome cornewayl lord shyp wallyngford ruled hys wanton counsayll folowed appetite pleasure body nothynge orderynge sadnesse yet ordre lawe iustyce thys yere also floured ye holy man called robert chanon house brydlyngtone whyche wrytters accompted prophete verse made thynges come englande whyche passe ouer thys tyme anno domini mcccviii anno domini mcccix wyllyam basynge nycholas faryngdone anno ii iohn butler thys ii yere kyng edward callynge mynde dyspleasure done vnto hym hys famulyer pyers gauestone bysshoppe chester mayster walter lanton towched xxviii yere reygne edwarde hys father commaunded hym vnto toure london streyghtely kepte many dayes lordes lande specyally syr henre lacy syr guy syr aymer de ualance erle lyncolne warwyke penbroke whome ye noble prince edwarde ye gyue great charge yt pyers gauestone shuld come englande sawe rule lade howe kynges treafoure meane sayd pyers wasted assembled counsayll one assent ayde lordes ye realme spake kynge contrary hys pleasure auoyded lande banisshed irelande yere kynge sent vnto hym oftentymes secret messangers comforted hym wyth many ryche gyftes made hym hys chyef ruler countre anno domini mcccix anno domini mcccx iamys saynt edmunde thomas romayne anno iii roger palmer thys iii yere dyuers grudge began moue sprynge betwene kyng lordes exilynge pyers gauestone wherfore contente amyte betwene hym sayd pyers ye feast natiuite lady fette home agayne contynued myschyef ye realme thys tyme testifyeth cronica cronicarum knyghtes ordre saynte iohn baptyste called saynt iohn hierusale theyr knyghtly manhode put ile rodes rodhis ye turkys infidelis day occupyed sayd ile wanne vpon sayd turkys dayly yerely thys day haue theyr domynyon moche landesthe fyrste wynnyng rody whyche day longe power sayd turkes thys relygyo also greatly preferryd fall templers whose possessyons lades gyuen expressed thyrde chapytre xxi yere phylyp fayre thys yere also wryters crowched freres came fyrste englande anno domini mcccx anno domini mcccxi symon croppe rycharde roffham anno iiii petyr blacnay thys fourthe yere rule power pyers gaue stone encreasynge moche hauynge guydynge kynges iewellys treasoure yode vpon day vnto west mynster kynges iewell house toke table payre oftrestyllys golde conueyed wyth iewellys oute lande greate inpouerysshyng ouer broughte kynge meane hys wanton condycyons manyfolde vyces auoutry wherfore foresayde lordes seynge myschyefe dayly encreased occasyon thys vnhappy man toke theyr counsayll togyther lyncolne concluded voyde hym agayne englande shortly exyled flaunders kynges great dyspleasure anno dni mccxi anno dni mccxii symon merwode iohn gysours anno v rycharde wylforde thys v yere vpon day saynt brycebyrth edwarde thyrde xiii daye nouembre borne wyndesore fyrst eldest sonne kyng edwarde yt hys father kynge englande named edwarde thyrde yere agayn reuoked kynge pyers gaueston flaunders whych hys agayne commyng demeaned hym worse dyd moche dysdayned lordes englande many dyspytous sclaunderouse wordes wherfore lordes one mynde assented put pyers deth soone assembled theyr power besyeged hym castell scarburgh proces wan castell toke hym brought hym vnto gauersede besyde warwycke xix daye iunu smote hys hede wherof whan kynge hadde knowlege greuously dyspleased agayne sayd lordes made hys auowe ye hys deth shuld reuenged meane thys rancoure betwene kynge hys lordes kendeled began sprede thys day kyng sought occasyo agayn hys lordes howe myght put theym greuaunce dyspleasure thys whyle dyed syr henry lacy erle lyncolne whych lyeng vpon dethe bedde requyred syr thomas erle lacastre maryed hys doughter wolde stande lordes theyr defence weale englande whyche request sayd erle graunted fermely kepte obserued length wyth many loste theyr lyues story shall shewed anno dni xiiicxii anno dni xiiicxiii iohn lambyn iohn pontenay anno vi adam lutekyn thys vi yere kyng held hys great court counceyl parlyamet lordes spirituall temporall london aduyces theym many good ordenaunces statute made oppresse ryottouse myscheues day vsed kyng sworne kepe ordenaunces lordes theyr power whyche othe takyn robert archebysshope caunterbury blessed theym vphelde sayde statute accursed attepted breke nat longe worde broughte vnto kynge howe robert le bruze retourned scotlande hadde caused scottes rebell newe ye haue harde xxxiiii yere edwarde fyrste howe sayd edward chased forenamed roberte le bruze oute scotland normandy whenne harde mysguydynge realme englande specially dyuysyon betwene kynge hys lordes anone wyth small ayde norgans norwayes retourned scotlande demeaned hym suche wyse lordes scotlade shorte processe agayne made kynge realme warred strongely vppon kynges fre de wanne theym castelles stroge holdes wrought vnto englysshe men moche sorowe tene anno dni mcccxiii anno dni mcccxiiii adam burden nicholas faryngdon anno vii hugh gayton vii yere oppresse ye malice ye scottes ye kyng assembled great power water entred realme scotlande destroyed suche vyllages townes lay stode waye wher heryng robert le bruze power scotlande costed towarde englysshe men vpon ye day natyuyte saynt iohan baptyst mette kynge edwarde hoste place called batayle estryuelyn estryuelyn nere vnto freche ryuer called bannockysbourne atwene englysshe scottes daye foughten cruell batayle ende englysshe men constrayned forsake felde tha scottes chased egerly englysshe men ye many drowned fore named ryuer many noble man englande day slayne batayll syr gylbert de clare erle gloucestre syr robert clyfforde syr edmunde maule kynges stewarde lordes barones noumbre wytnesseth guido de columpna xlii knyghtes baronettes noumbre lxvii ouer xxii name day scottes taken prysoners kynge hym selfe batayll scaped great dauger fewe hoste yt hym escaped came vnto berwyke rested hym season scottes enflamed pryde derysyon englysshe men made ryme foloweth maydens englande sore may ye morne lemmans ye haue loste bannockysborne heue lowe weneth kynge englande soone haue wonne scotlande rumbylow songe many dayes songe daunces ye carolles maydens mynstrels scotlade ye reprofe dysdayne englysshe men dyuers whiche ouerpasse whan kyng edwarde season taryed berwyke sette towne suche suerty myght retourned smal honour englade came secretely westmynster vpon daye saynt magne xix day august anno dni mcccxiiii anno dni mcccxv stephan abyngdone iohan gysours anno viii hamonde chykwell viii yere kynge edwarde vylayn called iohan tanner yode aboute dyuers place englandetraiferous p um yd agn named hymselfe sonne edwarde fyrst sayd yt meane falce noryce stolne cradell edward whiche carter sonne layde ye cradel hym hym selfe hardly fostred brought vp northe par yes walys whan layne layde taken fere fled churche frere carmes whyte freres oxynforde thynkynge suertye kyng edward ye fyrst theyr founder rehersed agayne former sayenge addynge vnto appered well ye kynge carter sonne condycyons accordynge many famylier example customes hym dayly apparent whan thus contynued season without rumoure lande lastely take place caryed felon vnto northampton reygned iuged falsenes drawen hanged whiche ye houre dethe cofessed fende house symylytude catte whiche amonge promessys hym made hadde assured hym shulde kynge englande guydo sayth confessed serued fende iii yeres brynge peruerse purpose aboute thus kynge edwarde beset many aduersytes kepte counsayll london reformacion ye warre scotlande thynges welfare englade syr peter spaldynge knyght sente vnto berwyke crewe sowdiours fortyfye towne somoche kynge certayne vnderstadynge robert le bruze entended hastly laye syege towne anno dni mcccxv anno dni mcccxvi hamonde goodchepe stephan abyndon anno ix wyllyam redynge berwyke lostein ix yere vpon mydlente sonday towne castel berwyke yelden loste treason fore named peter spaldynge comune fame went vnto robert le bruze kynge scottes yere also derth corne encreasyd yerely xvi yere edwarde fyrste yere london solde iiii busshell therwith also fyll suche morayne bestes al vytayle waxed scant dere shull shewed yere also ii cardynalles yt sent englade v clement pope set vnyon peace atwene kynges englade scottes met vpon moore wygylsdone yorke shyre robbed suche stuffe tresure theym broughte whiche robberye great enquery made ye lastly knyght callyd syr robert gylbert myddelton accused sent prison felony london drawen hanged heed set vpon londo brydge cardynalles receyued kynge dowble value theyr harmes yere also fyl excedynge rayne monethes iulii august husbandes myght brynge theyr lytle store corne stode vpon grounde great scarcyte whete beues motons excedyng pryces reason morayne spoken anno dni mcccxvi anno dni mcccxvii wyllyam caston iohan wengraue anno x raufe palmer yere ye scottes entred border northumberlande robbed brent cou trey moste cruelly somoche brent howses woman tyme laye chylde bedde spared nother man woman chylde nother relygyous dyd great harme ye countrey greatly impouerysshed myschefe ioyned another mysery sayd vytayll reason morayne scante dere whete graynes hyghe prysed poore people ete horse flesshe dogges flesshe many vyle bestes whiche wonder byleue yet defaute dyed great multytude people sundry place lade whete solde yere ye next folowynge londo iiii marke quarter aboue derthe scaresytye vytayle ensued mortalytye goddes hade punysshment warre scottes hungre deth mortalite syckenesse people ye lande wonderslye wasted perysshed al monycyons amended kynge inordynate lyuynge anno dni mccxvii anno dni mccxviii iohan pryoure iohan wentgraue anno xi wyllyam furneux xi yere ye kynge assembled newe host went northuberlade resyste malyce scottes whiche dayly made assawtes vpon bordours entred ferre within lande wherfore great dystresse nede fyghting men kynge moch people ye southe east partyes englande amonge whiche contrary theyr lybertye cyte london constrayned fynde theyr costes charge cc men sent theym yorke whan kynge yorke hadde receyued people frome sundry countrees good townes englande conuenyent noumbre rode towarde berwyke sped iournayes lengthe came nere vnto berwyke layde syege aboute ye fame whyle kynge besyed assawtynge towne scottes brake ouer water swale great noumbre leuynge cooste kynges people laye secrete wyse came downe marchis yorke shyre slewe people robbed moost cruell wyse wherefore ye arche bisshop yorke constrayned pure necessyte defende countre gathered vnto hym vnredy dispurueyed hoost ye warre pryours clerkes chanons spyrituel men churche wyth husbande men vnapte people great nombre men fewe warly discrete cheuetaynes yode agayne ye scottes encou tred place called mitton vppon swale xii day moneth octobre gaue vnto batayle lacke wyse warely prouysyon englyssheme beset theyr enemyes vpon euery side slayne great multytude
