remenaunt shamefullye put flyghte reason wherof sayde archebisshop abbot selby preseruyd many spyrytuell slayne thys batayl therfore named many wrytters whyte batayll whan kynge enfourmed ouerthrowe northyrne men drewe towarde wynter therfore brake vp hys siege retourued vnto yorke soone forther englad nothyng done without ye aduyces couceylys syr hughe specers father sonne whose entysemet many thynges done englande great grudge well noble men realme common yt greate hatred indygnacyon tymes pyers ga eston many euyll reportes great extorcyos reported lightly men shall ben oute fauoure common people anno domini mcccxviii anno dni mcccxix iohn pontenay iohn wengraue anno xii iohn dallynge xii yere kyng helde hys greate counceyll yorke cotrary mynde ye lordes syr hughe spencer sonne made hyghe chaumberlayne englade reason wherof bare hym hawtely prowde lorde thys lande myght gaynsaye hym thynge thoughte good wherof grewe occasyon baron warre foloweth thys passetyme asmoche ye foresayd cardinalles might nothyng concernyng peace betwene englande scotlande kynge purchased curse xxii iohan pope accurse robert le bruze suche wyth hym helde maynteyned stande strenght tyll sayd robert recompensed kynge edwarde suche harmys hys lande hym receyued also tyl reedifyed monasteryes church hym hys caste downe englande restored suche spirytuell goodes scottes reued taken thys auayled nothyng putte kyng realme great coste charge ye comons vexed trowbled many maner way theyr possessyons moueable goodes taken vpon surmysed feyned cause many vtterly vndoon fewe synguler mysguyded persones auau ced whan partye barones englande behelde mysery people punyshed hande god also ygnoraunce kynge secrete maner assembled togyder towne called shyrborn condisceded reformacyon myschefe remoue kynge sayd spesers bothe father sonne brynge aboute syr thomas erle lancastre syr humfrey bohum erle hereforde syr iohan moubray baro syr roger clyfforde baro syr goselyn danyell baro syr roger toket roger benefeelde syr roger mortymer syr whyllya sullade syr wyllyam elmynbrydge syr iohan gyfforde syr iohan tyers baron knyghtes dyuers sware eche stade tyll amended state realme soone theyr aduyce agrement syr iohan moubraye syr roger clyfforde syr goselyn danyel stronge company entred vpon manours castelles sayde spenser standynge marche wale spoyled destroyed whiche ryot spesers complayned kynge punysshent wherof kynge callynge hym dyuerse couceyll wyndsore determyned sayde syr iohan moubraye syr roger clyfforde syr goselyn danyell theyr assystentes shulde appere kynges counsayle shortly make answere vpon ryot yf refused shulde auoyde lande shortly banysshed men day apparence theym kepte wherfore proclamacyons made dyuers placys realme london xvi daye marche sayde syr iohan moubray syr roger clyfforde shuld auoyde lande within x dayes folowynge vpon payne dethe wherof herynge ye lordes barones named assembled theym strenger power vpon sent messynger vnto ye kynge besechynge hym humbly remoue frome persone couseyle spenser ye dayly dyd vnto hym great dyshonour comune weale realme great hynderauce kynge herynge humble request nothynge beynge contente ferynge greatly destruccyon owne persone assembled coufeyle reformacyon mater concluded kynge shulde call parlyamente london holden folowynge conclusyon taken sayde counseyle kynge sent letter vnto sayde barones commaundynge theym come vnto sayde parlyament whiche day aboue sayde great hoste men armes came london sute iakettes cote demy partye yelowe grene bade whyte cast ouerthwarte skyll parlyamente loge comune people called parlyament whyte bandes se kynges pea substancyally kepte within cytye london mayre caused dayly thousande men well harnessed watche dyuers wardes dyuerse gate ye cytye ye whiche began foure clocke mornynge contynued tyll vi nyghte whiche season many ordeyned take thanne charge nyght watche contynue tyll houre v mornynge thys nyghte watche shuld surely kept two aldreme nyghtly assygned ryde cytie certayne officer towne see watchemen wele dyscretly guyded gate shyt ix clocke opened agayne vii morow euery cytezyn warned haue hys harneys hym myghte redy shorte warnynge euer called thus ye cytye sayd watche co tynuyng foresayde parlyamente holden westmynster amonge thynges weale lande counceyll coulde thynke determyned one syr hugh spenser father syr hughe sonne shuld banysshed yt realme england terme lyfe soone banysshement put execucion bothe broughte vnto douer take shyppynge syr hugh father made wo derfull great moone shulde take hys shyp cursed hys sonne presence suche guydynge sayng hys meanes banysshed flour landes cristened ye kyng dyssolued parlyament euery man retourned hys owne yt nat longe worde broughte vnto kyng yt syr hugh spenser sonne houyd vpon cooste englande toke prayes marchautes passed hys course kyng let knowe suche thyng suffered wyth many mo euyl dedes go vnpunysshed whyche lengthe repented full soore toke thereof great remors conscyence appereth ende hys reygne anno domini mcccxix anno dni mcccxx symon abyngdon hamonde chykwell anno xiii iohn preston thys xiii yere kynge reuoked actes withstoode whyche made london laste parliament called agayne englande spenser bothe father sonne contrary wyll baron set theym lyke auctoryte great dystourbaunce realme soon vnder colour tytle made quene vnto castell ledys kent whych belonged vnto syr barthen de bladysmore knyght beynge barony partye kynge besyeged sayd castel helpe cytezyns london lastly wanne strength spoyled mouables therof whych greate value sayeng wryters thys passetyme kyng hadde thus called agayne spenser ruled many thynges hys sensuall apetyte pleasure nothyng regardynge comon weale realme baron cosyderyng well spencer shuld processe bryng lande great ruyne kyng great dyshonoure entedyng refourme myschyef therof myght ensu gadered vnto great power whyle syr thomas erle lancastre gatheryng hys people ye ii mortymers yt say syr roger mortymer werke syr roger wigmoore yode marche walys toke strengthe certayne cytyes townes belongynge spencer pursuyd also kynges seruau te wherfore kyng herynge yt rebellyon hys lordes made hasty spede greate hoste came shroysbury nere vnto ware fere sayd mortymers yelded vnto kynges grace mercy whiche forthwith conueyed prysoners vnto towre lo anno dni mcccxx anno dni mcccxxi reynolde conduyt hamonde chykwell anno xiiii wyllyam prodham thys xiiii yere wha ye kyng ordered countre marchys foresayd hys mynde hym gathered strength saynt chaddys day begynnynge marche kyng hys people came downe glowceter hym mette spesers theyr people thense yode vnto lychefeelde whyche season erles lancaster herforde remenaunt theyr hoste burto vppon trent fortyfyed brydge yt kyng myght nat wynne ouer sayde ryuer kynge brought vnto foorde beganne set ouer knyghtes wherof ng sayde erles forsooke sayde towne yode toward towne cytye myght passe farre vppon theyr iournay encoutred syr aymer de ualance erle penbroke spenser kynges hoste vppon xii daye marche ouerset co strayned fle yode proces tyme poutfret thys meane season erle thomas sente knyght hys named robert holad lancasshyre arere hys tenauntes sayde syr robert herde skyrmysshe howe hys mayster fled drewe hym kynge presented hym suche companye tha gathered thus ye kyng power dayly encreased ye baton dyscreased tha barony heryng goyng syr robert holande vnto kynges pattye sumdeale abasshed tooke theyr counsayll freers pountfre many opynyons reason amonge debated argued yt fynally concluded yt shuld goo vnto castel du stanborough holde tyll myght purchase kynges grace spedyng theyr iournay thy derwarde suche people came processe tyme towne called burgh brydge encountred syr andrewe harkeley knyght wyth come ye north stronge company nere vnto sayde towne sette vppon barones ende sconfited chased theyr peple whyche fyght slayne erle herforde syr roger benefeld syr wyllyam sullade taken erle lancastre syr roger clyfforde syr iohan moubraye syr roger tuckettes syr wyllyam fyzwyllyam dyuerse ladde vnto porke thys feelde foughten wytnesseth polycronycon xv daye marche ende yt yere oure lorde thousande thre hundreth twenty nat longe syr hugh daniell syr barthew de bladysmoore taken syr thomas erle lancastre brought agayn owne towne pountfret broughte iugement syr aymer de ualaunce erle penbroke syr iohan brytayne erle rychemounde syr edmunde woodstoke erle kent syr hughe spenser father syr roberte malmestorp iustyce wyth fynally adiuged haue hys hedde stryken whereof execucyon done twelef daye aprell begynnyng yere grace rekenynge chyrche englade mcccxxi erle thomas dyuerse opynyons wryters shew hym seynt policronico ye xlii chapytre hys vii boke sheweth otherwyse euer erthlye men thynges deme farre frome secrete iugemente god hym hys sentence thynges referred thys tyme forthwarde ye terme v yeres ensuyng yt fortune spenser hugely encreased faste quenes dyscreased tyll releued kynge fraunce charles v ye name brother vnto hyr shalbe shewed retourne vnto oure former mater vpon foresayde daye erle thomas thus put execucyon syr roger tutkettes syr wyllyam fizwyllya syr waren iselde isell syr henry bradborne syr willya cheyny barones knyghtes drawen hanged theyr hedes smytren sent vnto london whyche putte deth poutfrete foresayd esquyre called iohan page yorke soone drawen heded syr roger clyfford syr iohn moubray syr goselyne danyell baron brystowe syr hery womyngton syr henry monforde banerettes glowceter syr iohn giffard syr wyllya elmyngbrydge knyghtes london syr iohn tier tryers baron wynchels e syr thomas culpepyr knyght wyndesore syr fraunceys walden ham baron caunterbury syr barthew de bladismoore syr bartholl de asbornham barony cardeeffe walys putte lyke execucyon syr wyllya flemyng knyght vpon whose soules crysten iesus haue mercy whan kyng thus subdued baron soone aboute feast assencyon oure lorde kepte hys parlyamente yorke durynge whyche parlyament syr hugh spenser father made erle wynchester syr andrew harkeley erle carleyle wryters cardoyll dysheryted suche hadde holden wyth erles lancastre hereforde except syr hugh dandell fewe whych syr hugh receyued grace reason maryed kynneswoman kynges also ordeyned soone mayster roberte baldok man euyll fame shuld chauceler englade forfaytes tyne gathered kynges treasoury without sparyng pryui leged place myght foude seased ye kyng reason wherof moche treasoure brought vnto kynges coffer besyde great thynges yt brybed spoyled officer dyuers shyres anno domini mcccxxi anno dni mcccxxii rycharde constantyne hamonde chykwell anno xv rychard hakeney thys xv yere kyng gadered vi peny temporall mennes goodes englande irelande walys hym graunted foresayd parlyamet defence scottes payed wyth great murmoure grudge consyderyng manyfolde myseryes common people dayes wrapped yere also sone appered mannes syght blode continued space vi houres meane moneth octobre laste daye sayde moneth vii clocke mornyng tyll one day wryters thys tyme ye scottes entendyng wynne enterpryse irelande wynne contrey theyr obeysaunce entered stronge hoste vnder theyr capytayne edwarde le bruze brother scottisshe kyng howe ayde englysshe men selfe irysshe quyt well bare manfully vaynquysshed scottes chased countrey ye whych chase fyght yt sayd edward le bruze many noble men scotlande slayne anno dni xiiicxxii anno dni xiiicxxiii iohn grantham hamonde chykwell anno xvi rycharde ely xvi yere ye kyng made greate prouysyon make voyage scotland yt begynnyng august entred countrey scottes consyderyng great multytude hoste drewe mountaynes place englysshemen myght nat wynne entent wery tyre kynges great hoste di erse maladyes fell amonge englysshmen many dyed loste iournay aswel lacke vytayl infyrmyte sykenesse kyng theyse cause constrayned retourne englande ye natyuyte lady scottes beynge enfourmed syr iamys dowglas capytayns ye scottes wyth stronge hooste folowed costed ye kyng suche wyse feest saynte luke almooste taken kynge dyner abbey called bella launde beyghlande thant kynge pure constraynte defended hym withstoode scottes myghte shorte weke fyghte kynge compelled flee meane saue hym selfe thys skyrmysshe taken syr iohan brytayne erle rychemode kynges treasoure spoyled borne away ordenaunce belongynge hoste great parte scottes conueyed scotlande scottes theyr retournyng homewarde wan castell norham robbed towne northallerton thys losse harmes way syr andrewe harkeley put wyte mysledynge kynges hoste nexte yere shalbe shewed anno dni mcccxxiii anno dni mcccxxiiii adam salesbury symon franceys anno xvii iohn oxynforde thys xvii yere kyng beynge enfourmed hys people put vnto dyshonoure precedyng yere touched scottes ye vntrouth treason ye fornamed syr andrew erle carleyl cardoyll sent knyghte named syr antony lucy arest sayd erle brynge hym safely vnto ye kyng presece syr antony sped hym suche wyse vpon daye saynt chadde ye seconde daye marche sayde erle taken kepte pryson loge tyl octobre folowyng whych seaso affermeth geffrey monmouthe cardoyll walys sayd syr andrew arregned conuyete take money scottes betray ye kyng hys naturall lorde whyche treason westchester shrowysbury drawen haged hys hede sente london sette vpon brydgedecasion mor thys yere warre bega que kyn guyan betwene englissh men freche wherof occasyon sayth frenche boke bastyle fortresse made lord mount pesayne pesart lord gascoyne vpon frenche kynges grounde frenchemen sayd gascoynes englissh men iustyfyed within terrytorye guyan thys fyrst began great wordes ass lastly mortall warre yt gascoynes wyth ayde ye kyng stewarde englande slewe many frenchemen came ouerturne sayde bastyle whan charles v charles fayre whych daye kynge fraunce herde ouerthrow frencheme howe gascoynes fortyfyed foresayd bastyle within hys fygnory enfourmed sente spede wyth stronge hoste hys vncle charles de ualoys made sharpe cruell warre vpon gascoynys wanne frome theym townes angeou amyas wyth processe came vnto towne cytye ryoll laye hys syege vnto englysshe wyth gascoynes issued towne gaue batayll vnto frenche men put theym worse slewe vppon fourtene hundreth theym amonge whyche lord called lorde saynt florentyne wyth noble men fraunce slayne constrayned lye forther towne nowe conclusion sayd towne apoyntement yelden ye frech men vpon condycyon suche englysshemen within town shuld go frely theyr good burdeaux wold remayn styll sworne ye frech kyng dwell frenche men whych towne yelden syr edmunde woodstoke ye kyng brother beyng burdeaux kynges deputye made suche resistens agayne sayd charles de ualoys trewce taken ye yere mydlent kyng hauyng knowlege thys warre guyan frenche kynge entended sease gascoyne guyan brekyng certayn couenauntes tyme betwene theym made nat kynge edwarde parfourmed sent ouer quene hys wyfe frenche kynges syster cutreate concorde peace betwene beginnyng august folowynge syr roger mortymer wygmore meane slepynge poyson drynke gaue vnto kepers comon fame went escaped toure london went quene fraunce soone taken within ye castell wallyngforde syr iohan goldyngton syr edmunde ye beche syr iohn sent vnto yorke haged drawe baron quarell hys hede sent vnto londo brydge feast ye natyuytie lady kyng sent ouer syr edwarde hys sonne frauce homage vnto frenche kynge ye duchie guyan whome frenche kyng phylip le beawe receyued ioyously caused hym tary quene hys mother countre potyen lenger kynge edwarde pleased anno dni mcccxxiiii anno dni mcccxxv benet fulham hamon chyckwell anno xviii iohn canston thys xviii yere kynge edwarde beynge enfourmed frenche kynge gyuen vnto syr edwarde sonne duchye guyan cotrary hys mynde pleasure also quene hys wyfe sayde syr edwarde made spede englande nat wythstandyng hys often sendyng hys sayd wyfe sone greuously dyspleased moche proclamacyons made london ye moneth decembre yt yf quene sonne entred nat lande octauys epyphany lord next folowyng peasyble wyse shuld take enemyes kyng hys realme englande quene fered trecherye spesers yt nere vnto kynge abode styll fraunce wherfore kyng edwarde expyracyon ye foresayd day caused seased lades hys sayd wyfe sonne belonged profyttes toke hys owne vse rumour knowe parte englande dyuerse men name landes syr wyllyam trussell syr iohn cromewell wyth dyuerse departed secretely englande saylled vnto quene whan kynge edwarde ware thys sent vnto frech kyng sharpe sore letter monysshed quene hys lande wolde nother ayde hys hyr company sayth iohn froyzarde yt made compendyous werke frenche hole lyfe story thyrde edwarde paragraph therwyth expressed many storyes cronycles fraunce flaunders region thys tyme ye quene thus monisshed auoyd frauce syr iohn de henawde brother erle henawde great fame freche kynges court whych hauynge copassyon quene hyr yoge sonne requyred go hym vnto hys brother court foresayde wherof quene beyng fayne grau ted vnto hys request spedde hyr thyther shortly hyr company ioyously honorably receyued tyme season yt quene hyr sonne lay thus court countrey erle henawde meanes suche hyr maryage cocluded betwene syr edwarde hyr sonne philip sayd erles doughter vpo certayne condy o wherof one sayd erle shuld propre costes set ouer englande ye sayd syr edward crew cccc men army whych prouysyon made dylygence thys fame sprange shortly englande wherfore kynge haste made prouysyon haue ye hauyns porte hys lade surely kept resyste landyng enemyes subdie wherof cytezyns london constrayned fynde theyr propre costes hundred men army whyche contrary theyr lybertyes condycyon daye shulde president sent vnto portchestre thys season passe tyme quene syr edwarde hyr son small company englysshemen crewe henawders whych syr iohn henawde erles brother capytayne toke shyppynge partyes ye wynde fauorable vnto landed englande porte called orwell besyde harwyche suffolke xxv day septebre without resistens warre agayne hyr made whome hyr landyng people coutre drewe great companyes sped hyr towarde london thys tyme quenes thus ladyng kyng hys cytye londo whe harde great people yt drewe hyr countres fered wherfore safegardyng hym self fled wyth small companye towarde walys lefte mayster walter stapylto bisshop exceter behynd hym haue rule cytye london nat longe kynges departyng ye quene sent letter vnto mayre comynaltie cytye requyred ayde subdue oppressours ye como weale realme letter made none answere therefore wrote secode tyme aduertysyng theyr landynge entent refourme ye enormytyes mysgouernauce lande admonestyng theyr ayde socoure tenure ye sayd letter playnly appereth wherof circumstauce haue left thys boke moche fynde varyaunce contentes thereof also copyes ben sette oute cronycles englande dyuers bokes thys sayde letter tacked vpon crosse chepe whyche daye called newe crosse nyght day saynt denys ix day october copyes fastened dyuerse place ye cytye wherof one fastened vpo mayres gate whyche letter thus publysshed cytye bisshop exceter whome sayd kyng commytted rule cytye sent vnto mayre haue keyes gate cytye vertue hys commission whych stode fermely vsed sharpe wordes kynges name varyaunce grew betwene hym cytezyns ferfourth common cytye theyr rage toke sayd bysshop xiiii day octobre hym ii hys housholde esquyers beheded vnreuerently ye standard weschep daye taken spye cytezyn called iohn marshal whych fauoured spenser tye ye place also beheded without processe lawe corp ye sayde bysshop hys ii seruautes haryed thamys syde sayd bysshop begonne edyfye toure rubbusshe sande buryed conueyed thre bodyes whyche dispyte hym done auctoures moche vsurped como grounde cytie settyng sayd toure cause thus vngoodly vnreuerentely delte mencion made thys passe tyme quene easely foote space folowed ye kyng thys season com brystow hauyng hym spesers dyffamed chauceller mayster robert baldocke syr iohn erle arundell theyr counsayls agreed syr hugh speser father shulde remayne haue rule towne castell whyle kynge toke shyppynge sayled frome then walys rayse walshemen kyng syr hugh spenser sonne toke shyppyng brystowe sayled wa y certaynte therof came vnto quene anone sent brystow erle kent kynges brother syr iohn henawde wyth dyuerse take syr hugh spenser father whyche put suche deuour tooke sayde syr hugh lefte certayne holde towne castell tyll quene hyr power came thyther whyche tyme sped walys processe tooke ye kynge hys chaunceller erle arundell syr hughe spenser sonne broughte towne hereforde thys whyle cytezeyns london wan towre londo kept vnto quenes vse anno dni xiiicxxv anno dni xiiicxxvi gylbert moordon rycharde betayne anno xix iohn cotton thys xix yere begynnynge thys mayres charge vppon morowe folowynge feaste symon iude daye mayre rode westmynster take hys charge day brystow syr hugh spenser father putte dethe buryed wynchestre vppon saynte huys daye folowynge xviii daye nouembre syr hugh hys sonne drawe hanged quartered herforde hys hed sent london set amonge vpon brydge comon fame hym went taken wolde take maner sustenauce wherfore sooner put vnto deth hugh versyfyer made two verse folowynge punis cum lignis te miser ensis ignis hugo securis equus abstulit omne decus whiche verse vnder stande latyne maye thys wyse expowned englysshed wyth rope thou bounde galowe honge thy body thyne hed wyth swerde kytte thy bowel fyre throwe burned longe thy body foure pecys eke wyth axe slytte wyth horse drawyn fewe men pytyenge thus wyth turmentys thy synnes sake ye wretched hugh wordly welthe take thys meane tyme season kynge conueyed vnto castell kenelworthe kepte vnder garde syr henry lancaster brother vnto erle thomas lancaster behedyd pounfrette mayster robert baldoke kynges chauncelloure sent vnto london put pryson newgate dyed myserably erle iohn arundell also put deth herforde wythin foure dayes syr hugh yonger spenser ye quene wyth syr edwarde hyr sonne goodly company lordes gentylmen retourned vnto london cytesyns wyth greate honoure ioye receyued vppon daye saynte barbara iiii daye december conueyed vnto westmynster octauys epyphanye lorde parlyament holden durynge whych certayne solepne messangers sent vnto kynge castell kenelworthe saye thre bysshoppes thre erles two abbottes ii baron two iustyces wyth procuratoure parlyament syr wyllyam trussell depose hym kyngly dygnytye agreed lordes spyrytuall temporall comons ye sayd parlyament resygne vnto kynge homage feautyes hym made name barony england forenamed syr wyllyam trussell vppon daye conuersyon saynte poule xxv daye ianuary authoryte hys offyce presence foresayd lordes hadde wordes folowynge vnto kynge wyllyam trussell ye name men lande england procuratoure parlyament resygne edwarde ye homage made somtyme thys tyme forth depryue kyngly power shall neuer attendaunt vnto ye kynge thys tyme thus edwarde seconde deposyd sonne made kynge hadde reygned full xviii yeres vi monethes odde dayes edwarde thus remaynynge pryson fyrst castell kenelworth castell barkle toke greate repetauce hys former lyfe made lamentable complaynte hadde greuously offended god wherof parte haue set leste shulde tedyous reders herers dampnum mihi con tulit tempore brumali fortuna satis aspera vehementis mali nullus est tam sapiens ti aut formosus tam prudens virtutibus ceteris que famosus quin stultus reputabitur satis despectus si fortuna prosperos ertat effectus wyth many makynge haue seen whyche reported hys owne makynge tyme hys enprysonement whych length tyme haue lefte thys worke shewd ye effecte englysh foloweth whan saturne colde isy face ground hys frostys turnyth grene whyte tyme wynter tree doth deface causyth verdure auoyde quyte fortune sharpe stormes alyte hath assautyd hyr frowarde wyll beclypped daungers ryght yll man worlde wyse fayre prudent vertuese famous vnder thayre foose man dispised shalbe take whan fortune hym deuided ala crye man doth mooue sue pytye haue none many gret honour dyd whylom auauce nowe wyth dyshonoure done stynge launce suche somtyme dyd greatly scere dispise let sclauder deere mercyfull god loue dyd shewe detraccion hacke hewe ala moste synfull wretche shulde thus complayne god please shulde thus susteyne great offence doone wherfore good sorde wyll retourne este soone hooly comytte thy great mercy vntyll take pacience may thy wyll onely rue dysygence ala tyme cence good lord e mnipotent behold moste wretched greatly p nitent trespas forgyuenesse thou graunt sorow carkes daunt graunte may sowle remedy sooner maye attayne swete iesu yelde sore wepynge aske pardon greuous synnynge moste blessed iesu roote vertue graunte maye sue humylyte sen thou good lyste shede thy blood stretche vpon ye roode iniquyte thou myld mother virgin pure bareste swete iesu worlde redempture shynyst flouryshest floure moste sine lyke nardus swete odoure passyth thou honoure surmountes sayntes thy great excellence wherfore praye greuouse offence beseche moste holsome leche thou wylt seche suche grace body vyle soule shall cryle thou brynge short whyle reste peace francia lewys x ye name sonne vnto philyppe le beawe ye iiii philyppe began reygne ouer ye realme frauce yere lorde miii hundreth xv viii yere seconde edward kynge englande anone thys lewys crowned enguer ra whyche ye haue herde chyefe moste secrete counccyloure wyth phylyppe iiii laste kynge fraunce called accompte meane charles de ualoys vncle vnto thys kynge moche sayd enguerram gyuen sharpe hastye wordes vnto sayd charles affyrmyng moche kynges treasoure remayned handes sayde charles thys toke great displeasure agayne sayd enguerra bare towarde hym suche racoure malyce lefte nat tyll bereuyd hym hys lyfe processe accused xxxvi artycles concerning treason iniury done unto kyng philip foresayde vnto realme fraunce ye article ordre set ye frech cronicle whych overpasse force wherof thys enguerram lastly conuycte iuged vnto deth euyn assencion lorde hanged vppon gybet parys thys yere also fell greate scarcyte corne frute fraunce meane vnsesonable wederynge englande ix x yeres reygne edward seconde thys day kyng englande reason wherof great famyne deth poore people fell fraunce dyd englande ye haue xxvii yere philip father vnto lewys hard howe flemynges agayne rebelled howe meane enguerram frenche hoste retourned dishonour frauce reuengemet wherof thys lewys assembled ryght stronge armye partye noble men frauce moneth septe bre entred countrey flauders came vnto ye towne nere vnto called courtray lodged hys people nere vnto ryuer lys lyse moche ye brydges ouer ryuer flemynges broke kyng hys host lyege flemynges vpo ye syde laye howge nombre defende passage frenchman whyche tyme season fell suche plenty rayne way waxed noyous foule countrey reason whereof vytayll whyche tha aboue sayd scant scar ouer ye feelde hoste laye wete myry men beastes greuously noyed wherefore conclusyo ye kyng consyderyng great hynderaunces harmes hys lordes comos myght maner wynne ouer hys enemyes retourned time done lytell honour frauce ye great losse ye kynges ordenauce stuffe myght nat caryed thes reason depenes way whych cause cause kyng soore displeased yt made great othe yf myght lyue tyll yere folowyng yt shuld sette flemynges yt shuld nat escape hys dauger yt shuld neuer take treatye ende except wolde fully holy put grace mercy yere folowynge ye feest pentecoste whe sayd lewys scantly reygned ii yeres dyed boy uyncent vi daye iunii honorablye buryed saynt denyse leuyng hym none issue male wherfore hys brother phylype succeded hym kyngdome francia phylyp v name brother forenamed lewys whyche heygth surnamed phylyp longe began hys reygne ouer ye frechme ye yere lorde mccc xvii x yere edwarde seconde kynge englande fyrste reygned regent frauce moche clemence wyfe kynge lewys left sayd husbande chylde whiche processe tyme delyuered man chylde named iohan dyed shortly whose dethe ye sayd phylyp forthwith proclaymed kynge fraunce crowned parys aboute chrystmas folowynge al yt duke burgoyn whyle sayd coronacyon wolde haue preferred doughter lewys last deed lordes noble fraunce wolde agreable yt woman shulde enheryte great kyngdome meane wherof vnkyndnes kyndled atwene kynge sayd duke wyse medyatoures acorded suche wyse sayd duke maryed eldest doughter ye kynge passe tyme suche meanes made flemynges vnyte accorde stablysshed atwene fraunce ye tyme helde whiche peace testyfyeth frenche cronycle laboured ended cardynall named iosselyn sent frome ye xxii iohan pope medyacyon sayd cardynall erle flaudres receyued vnto ye kynges grace parys dyd vnto ye frenche kynge homage sware vnto hym feawtye thyrde yere reygne phylyp prouost parys hauyng pryson pycarde man great rychesse whiche felony lyke cryme iudged hanged sayd prouoste great benefyte hym doone payment great summes ye sayd pycarde toke poore innocent man put hym dethe stede sayd pycarde whiche offence wha due profe made kynges counceyll sayd prouoste dede put vnto lyke iudgment fyfth yere sayd phylyp lazaryes countrey langadocke brente moche accused theyr owne confessyon proued poysoned entended haue poysoned welles countrey many iewes vnto consentynge therfore many suffered lyke iudgment yere also somoche dayes dyuers place fraunce fonde prophecy broughte vp amoge comune people shepherdes herdes shulde wynne holy lande assembled selfe dyuers place companyes lastly came togyder parys many nombre reason comune people fell vnto prouost parys power withstande brake prysones toke suche persones pleased then wente beggynge robbynge tyll came langedocke fel vpon iewes robbed theym suche mouables myght fynde slewe theym also wherfore iewes ferynge sayd comunes gathered theyr wyues chyldren noubre vc towre thought defende theyr wyues chyldren sayd herdes anone hadde wyttynge therof assawted sayd towre egerly ende seynge myght escape despyte threwe theyr chyldren downe theyr hedes slewe eyther shulde fall handes theyr enemyes elles auoyde ye peynes fyre whiche herdes hadde begunne fasten vpon sayd towre wha sayd herdes hadde thus robbed slayne ye iewes langdocke departed then yode towarde countrey called carcasson entendynge lyke robbery vsed wherof ye countrey beynge warned stopped kepte passage withstode suche power strengthe dysseuered selfe small companyes many taken hanged fled saue gardynge selfe folysshe prophecy ended synne shame kynge phylyppe meane yll couseyle sette great taske vpon comunes meane fyfth parte theyr mouable goodes whiche consyderynge charg warres place murmured grudged wonder sore taxe leuyed fell feuer quarteyne great flyx whiche sekenesse fell vpon hym prayer comunes frenche boke leuyenge ye sayd greuous taxe hym made many solempne processyons prayer loge processe dyed whan languysshedde begynnynge august tyl viii day ianuary upon whiche day dyed whan reygned iiii yeres vii monethes odde dayes leuynge hym none heyre male wherfore crowne dysceded vnto brother charles erle march francia pcharles fyfth carolus fyfth charles yongest thre bretherne sonnes philyppe le bewe begane reygne ouer ye frenchme ye moneth ianuary yere lorde mccc xxii xv yere ye secode edwarde yet kynge englande crowned raynes xii day february nexte ensuynge whiche solempnyte fynysshed ended short proces tyme sent vnto xxii iohan pope assertayned hym ye gossyprede yt atwene hym blanche wyfe wherof examynacyon ye sayd pope commytted vnto bisshoppes paris beauuais mayster godfrey de blessys prothonotayr countre rome whiche due perfyte examinacyon mater made founde mawde countesse artoys mother fore named quene blanche godmother vnto kynge charles husbande whiche whan made reporte vnto pope gaue sentece sayd matrymony legyttymat comaunded deuorce separacyon made atwene ii persones whiche shortly executed seconde yere charles dyed robert erle flaudres without yssue wherfore sayd erledam fell ye frenche kynges handes processe thagrement lordes put peasyble possessyon erle neuers made therunto pretece tytle yere kynge charles feest saynt mathewe septebre maryed seconde wyfe named mary syster kynge bohemy beme doughter henry erle lucenbourgh late emperoure almayne named lyne emperours henry viii wryters ye vii also sayd yere one named iourdan ile gascoyne borne man noble lynage lowe vyle condycyons foresaid pope iohn maryage hadde gyuen hys nyese reuerence byrth thys season meane vyle condycyons suche dyshoneste co panye drewe vntyll hym fell many sclauderous vyces lastly accused rape murder felony whych length xviii artycles due profe made couycte lawe iudged hanged kynge request pope honoure hys blode graunted hym charter pardoned hym former transgressyons wythstandynge processe tyme fell retourned vnto hys olde accustomyd condicyons among greate crymes hym executed slewe sergeaunt army belongynge kynge hym sent message whyche murder detestable dedys newely accused vppon somonyd apere parys kynge hys counsayle whych day apparence came sayde cytye wyth great companye noble men whiche hym nere kynne excused vttermost theyr power agayne hym accuse hym came many lordes baron whyche marque ampton dampton wyth hys sonne chyefe put cause complaynt agayne hym made suche prouys declaracyos agayne sayde iourdan comytted vnto chastelet parys remayne prysoner processe tyme suche mater trespaces prouyd vpon hym authoryte parlyament holden compeyng lastly iudged dye soone meane vii day maye drawyn gybbet parys hanged thyrde yere reygne thys charlys gaue vnto erle neuers yt tyme hadde made clayme erledome flaunders sayde erledom whyche flemynges inhabytauntes cou trey wel ioyously receyued shorte whyle gaue vnto townes gaunt brugys ipre dyuers pryuyleges grauntes theyr great auauntage profyte longe wanne mych grudge hatred fore loue good wyll taxe yt set vpon dweller brugys coutrey nere vnto specyally dwelled countrey thought yt theyr charge exceded farre charge ye dweller within towne wherfore secrete meany appoynted daye assemble amonge selfe sodeynly well armed entred towne brugys slewe therin dyuers erles seruauntes borough maysters sayde towne suche suspected counseyle leuyenge sayd taske iiii yere reygne thys charlys dethe mary hys seconde wyfe dyspensacion pope xxii iohn maryed iane cosyn germayn doughter lewys erle euroux vncle vnto thys kynge charlys brother hys father phylyppe le beawe abouesayd iiii yere quene englande syster vnto thys kyng charlys frauce treate vnite peace bytwene hyr lorde hyr brother warre made gascoyne towched xv yere edward seconde hyr lorde husbande taryed retourned aboue sayde yere expressed thys yere also erle flau ders fore named suspeccyon hadde robert flauders hys vncle leste hys synguler auau tage wold supplant hym erle dome made letter vnto gouernours towne ye sayd robert resyaunt abydyng shulde put hym dethe warnyng olde trusty frende erlys chaucellour warned auoyded towne thys greate malyce rancoure arose bytwene robert erle whyche shortly pacyfyed longe nother taske imposycyon leuyed townes gaunt brugys ipre towny flaunders whyche taske leuyed recompensemet suche warres made vpon flaunders phylyp le beawe dyrectely paymet twelue thousand pownde awardyd ioselyn cardynall shewed seconde yere v phylyppe flemynges shulde paye french kyng byenge theyr peace thys taske leuyers gaderers assygned pryncypall men sayde townes yt whiche theyr demeanure leuyenge therof demeaned suche wyse ranne great hatred comon people myche accusyd theym sayde hadde leuyed gatheryd moche sayde taske amounted wherfore desyred erlys counsayle sayde person myghte called accoupt thys requeste myght opteyned whyche caused comons runne grudge murmure thynge also caused suspeccyon erlys counsayle sayde collectours hadde many secrete assembles lengthe whan erlys counsayle apperceyued murmure comons wyth collectours condyscendyd trayne haue taken certeyne capytaynes sayd comos sayde turnaye daye assygned sayd collectours shuld yelde vp theyr accoumpte whych daye erle proper persone came vnto sayde towne tournaye whan ye erle hys counceyle shulde haue executed theyr purposed enter warnyng monycyon comons wythstode erle hys companye ende slewe many theyr enemyes toke erle putte hym sure kepynge wythin towne brugys thys skyrmysshe meane ye erlys party great part foresayde towne brent wherfore towne toke partye flemynges greate cause erle taken putte frome hys entent foresayde comons dyspleasure erle admytted theyr lorde capytayne roberte vncle erle foresayde amonge reputed hym erle flaunders whyche takynge vpon hym delyuered fro pryson hys frende erlys chauncellour whyche aboue sayde delyuered hym former dauger made hym chyefe counceyle thys towne gaunt repugnaut moche mortall warre beganne sourde betwene sayd towne towne bruges farfourth co tynued shortly people gaunt townes met wyth bruges playne batayll fought cruelly ende gaut chased bruges slewe beyonde fyue hundreth men yet erle neuer rather deliuered frenche kyng sent vnto bruges requyryng curtoyse maner wolde set theyr erle lybertye sent messangers agayne wythout spede theyr message thys whyle dyed charles de ualoys brother vnto phylyppe le beaw vncle vnto kyng charles whych languysshed longe consumpcyo dyed moch opynyon people yt punysshed iniury malyce yt bare towarde enguerram whyche ye haue harde fyrste yere thys kyng put vnto deth rather thys fame ran vpon sayd charles moche ye tyme hys syckenes gaue great almesse suche persones gaue sente hys almesse vnto wylled well pray soule sayde enguerram hys owne hele thys charles de ualoyes left hym sonne named philipe de ualoyes whych phylip moch thys charles kyng frauce dyed wythout issue fauoure lordes regyon made kyng fraunce put ryght tytle edwarde thyrde tha kyng englande sonne isabel doughter phylyp le beawe whych isabell dyssent rightful enheritour ye crowne frauce whyche tytle cruell warre betwene sayd edwarde phylyp story sayde edwarde shall appere v yere kyng charles burghmaysters skepyns yt meane ruler towne bruges deliuered theyr erle set hym larg vpon certayne condicions folowyng whych obserued caused hym soleply sworne fyrste day shuld nat punysshe hurt lande flaundres displeasure hym done hys seruauntes councel sen tyme erle concernyng cause theyr rebellion secudaryly yt shuld nat abrydge mynysshe theyr lyberties olde tyme haue hym newly theym graunted thyrdely grose mater concerned gouernaunce hys realme suche knewe well dyuerse expert therein shulde nothynge conclude without theyr aduyces assentys fourthly day shuld neuer vse counsayl abbot uersellay knew theyr dedely enemy moche tyme slayne hys father named petyr floce floze batayll courtray syxtene yere phylyppe le beawe shewed name sayde petyr nat expressed whyche artycles wyth fermely erle promysed kept holden deliuered set large syxte yere reygne thys charles greate dyssencyon varyaunce aroose betwene dolphyne uyen duke sauoy mortall batayll ensued vppon whyche moche people slayne vpon partyes ende dolphyn uyen better toke prysoners feelde duke burgoyne erle ancerne wyth noble men thys yere also gascoynes ye englissh men made warre vppon border fraunce agayne whome kynge charles sent cosyn hys named syr alphons de spayne spet kyng greate good retourned lytle worshyppe fraunce dyed shortely kynge sent agayne sayd gascoynes erle ewe syr robert barthram marshall frauce dyuerse noble men whyche season gascoynes wyth sayd englysshemen gotten castell towne standynge coutre poytyew poytyers named saynt oyngne within whyche towne sayd erle noble frauce lodged yt betwene dayly cruell assautes exercysed great hurte bothe partyes lastly betwene daye batayll playne feelde accorded frenchemen entet haue aduautage sayd feeld enbatayll selfe theyr mooste auautage day sayd appoytemet issued yt towne yode place assygned whyche good dystaunce frome foresayde towne taryed theyr enemyes gascoynes entendyng purpose yode streyght vnto yt foresayde towne knowyng without greate defence assauted shortly gatte set fyre nat sparynge chyrches place relygyon affermeth frech boke done retourned vnto fyresayd castel processe tyme retourned agayne guyan whan kynge charles assertayned thys delusion greuously dyscontented agayne gascoynes manysshed theym sore moneth dece bre shortly ensuynge taken greuouse sykenesse dyed vppon candelmas euyn folowynge boy uyncent entered saynt denyse wha reygned fyue yeres odde dayes leuynge hym none heyre hys body excepte quene wyth chylde whyche chylde dyed soone ye byrthe wherfore question kyngedome moued touched ende fourthe yere thys charles shalbe forther expressed anglia edwarde thyrde edwarde iii name sonn edward seconde isabell ye alonely doughter chylde phylip le beawe phylyppe fayre father charles laste kynge fraunce beganne reygne kynge englande father yet lyuynge syx twenty daye ianuary ende yere grace thousande thre hundreth syx twenty fourth yere charles fyfth last kynge fraunce crowned westmynster vppon daye puryfycacyon oure lady nexte ensuynge hys begynnynge came forthe plentye gracyous happes erthe tooke plentye ayre tempoure see quyetnesse chyrche grewe peace thys fyrste yere confermed lybertyes fraunchyses ye cytye london ordeyned mayre tyme beyng shuld sytte place iugement within lyberty chiefe iustyce kynges persone onely excepte euery alderman hadde ben mayre shuld iustyce peace london myddelsex eueryche alderman hadde mayre shulde iustyce peace wythin owne warde also graunted cytezyns fee ferme london iii hundreth pownde shulde constrayned go cytye fyghte defende land nede also daye fraunchyse cytye shulde seasyd kynges handes onely treason rebellyon done hole cytye southwerke admytted vnder correccyon rule citye mayre london baylyffe southwerke mayre chose ordeyne baylyffe borough hym lyked whiche ordinaunce endureth day moneth apryll mych meanes made frere prechours blacke freres delyuery kynge edwarde ii pryson therfore castell kenelworth coueyed vnto ye castel berkeley saynt mathewys tyde sayde edward meanes syr roger mortimer myserably slayne edward lyke opinyos thomas lancaster whyche referre goddys iudgement certayne hys former wyld insolent lyuynge toke greate repentaunce hadde great cause durynge hys reygne hedyd put deth iugement vppon xxviii baron knyghtes ouer yt noble men slayne scotlande hys infortunyte kynge edwarde yet beynge tender age passing xv yeres heryng great pryde presupcyon scottes howe dayly warred vpon border entryd lande brennynge spoylyng people assembled hys people easter sped hym toward scotland whych meane tyme scottes entred land comen farre sta hop uiridale lodged woddes stanhop parke dyuers bushementys wherof kyng beyng enfourmed made prouysyon beset roude trusted well haue brought vnder hys subieccyon kynge thoughte moste sure treason hys hoste scottes clene escaped retourned scotlande wherof ye fame ranne vpon syr roger mortymer kyng loste iournay retourned englande lytle worshyppe ye shall vnderstand day olde mayre shyry e yt meane hamunde chyckwell benet fulham iohn canston stode offyce tyll ye day folowyng symo iude almost full ye fyrst yere ye sayd edward iii residue fyrst yere party second yere electe charged mayre shyryffes folowynge anno domini mcccxxvi anno dni mcccxxvii henry darcy rycharde betayne anno iohn hawteyne ende fyrste yere thys kynge edwarde begynnyng thys mayres yere kynge crystmas maryed dame phylyppe ye erles doughter henawde cytye yorke euyn ye conuersio saynt paule ye xxiiii daye ianuary parlyamet northamtonand soone kyng ye feast pentecoste helde hys parlyament northampton whych parlyament euyll cousayl wherof syr roger mortymer olde quene bare blame kynge made wyth scottes vnprofytable dyshonorable peace fyrste released theym theyr feauty homage also delyuered vnto theym olde auncyent wrytynges sealed wyth seales kynge scottes dyuerse lordes lande bothe spyrytuall temporall many charter patentes whyche ye kynges scottes oblyged feordaryes vnto yt crowne englande whyche season also delyuered certeyne iewelles whych tymes ben wone fro ye scottes kynges england amonge whych blacke crosse scotlande specyally named relyke accompted great preciosyte nat alonely kyng hys synystre cou sayll lost hys tytle ryght realme scotlande farre sayd cousayl might helpe also lordes barones men england landes rente within scotlande loste theyr ryghte lyke maner excepte wolde dwel vpon sayd landes becomme kynge scottes lyege men soone concluded maryage betwene dauyd le bruze sonne robert le bruze iane kynges syster whyche diuerse writer surnamed iane towre iohan tower anno dni mcccxxvii anno dni mcccxxviii symon fraunces hamonde chyckewell anno ii henry combmartyn thys yere whyche thys daye seconde yere kyng dauyd foresayd son roberte le bruze tha kynge scottes maryed vppon daye mary magdaleyne hys towne berwyke ye fore named iane syster vnto kynge englande nat longe scottes despyte englysshemen called hyr iane make peace also theyr derysyon made dyuerse truffes roundes songes whyche one specially remembred foloweth plonge beerdys hartles paynted hoodes wytles gay cote graceles maketh englande thryfteles whyche ryme saythe guydo made scottes pryncypally deformyte clothyng dayes vsed englysshemen thanne kynge hys parlyamet holden salysbury made syr roger mortymer erle marche syr iohan eltha hys owne brother made erle cornewayll sayd syr roger toke moche vppon hym lordes co tented wyth kynges mother hym thynge ruled guyded suche lordes tyme assygned haue rule guydynge kynge erle kent syr edmunde wodestock ye kynges vncle ye erle lacastre ye erle marshal dyuers bysshoppes baron knyghtes noumbre xii short proces tyme party set allonely rule lande rested quene sayde syr roger meane wherof many great thynges realme grewe ordre whiche tedyous reherce anno domini mcccxxviii anno domini mcccxxix rycharde lazar iohan grauntham anno iii henry gysours thyrde mayres yere aboue sayde syr edmunde wodestoke erle kente entendynge reformacion mysse ordre realme beynge enfourmed brother syr edward lyfe deuysed certayne letter towchynge delyuery sayd brother sent sayd brother whiche dede shortly accused auctoryte parlyamet holden westmynster aboute penthecost folowynge dede iudged haue hede smyten wherof execucyon doone fyue twenty day may folowynge foresayd cytye wynchester soone kyng edwarde sayled frauce dyd homage vnto phylyp de ualoyes newly made kynge frauce duchy guyan towne amyas whiche homage doone rychely feasted frenche kynge solaced dyuerse maner fourmes iustes huntynge hawkynge many pleasure louynge maner toke leue kynge returned englande fyfthtenth day iune folowynge borne kynges fyrst sonne wodestoke crystened named edward whiche proces tyme dyd growe noble famouse man moost comunely called cronycles prynce edwarde whome story excellente dedes shall expressed moneth octobre vpon xvii daye euen saynt luke syr roger mortymer named bi meanes syr wyllia moutague syr rafe staforde syr iohn neuyle bi copased meane take ye castel notyngha withsta dynge yt keyes ye sayde castell daili nyghtly vnder ward kepynge kynge quene olde quene dyuerse noble tha beynge castell lodged maner takyng erle syr roger mortymer passe ouer dyuersyte haue sene therof sundry wryters many agreen syr symonde bedforde nyght taken sente vnto towre london put strayte kepynge kynge shorte processe called parlyament london reformacyon many thynges mysordered realme meane ye foresayde syr roger comune fame went anno dni mcccxxix anno dni mcccxl robert ely symon swaylond anno iiii thomas harworde iiii mayres yere ende thyrde yere kyng duryng foresayd parliamente aboue touched londo foresayd syr roger mortymer accused lordes parliamet artycles whereof v fynde expressed fyrste layed vnto hys charge hys meanes syr edwarde carnaruan mooste tyrrannouse deth castell barkley murdered secundaryly kynges great dyshonoure dammage scottes hys meanes treason escaped fro kyng ye parke stahope whych shuld haue fallen kynges dauger ne ben yt fauour sayd roger tha shewed thyrdely hym layed execucio sayd treason receyued ye capytayne sayd scottes named syr iames dowglas great summes money also lyke mede kynges great dyshonoure hurte hys realme concluded peace betwene ye kyng scottes caused delyuered vnto theym charter endenture called ragman wyth many thynges scottes great aduautage inpouerysshyng realme englad fourthlye layed hym synystre vnlefull meanes contrary yt kynges pleasure wyll assente lordes kynges counsayl gotten hys possessyo moche kynges treasoure vnskylfully wasted mysspent reason wherof kyng necessyte dryuen parforce assaye fredes fyfthlie also enpropered vnto hym dyuerse wardes belogyng kyng hys great lucre kynges great hurt secrete quene isabell kynges mother goddes pleasure kynges honour whych artycles wyth agayne hym proued auctoryte sayd parlyament iuged dethe vpo saynt andrewes euyn next ensuyng london drawen hanged begynnynge august folowyng syr edwarde bayloll sonne syr iohan bayloll tyme kynge scottes meanes purchased opteyned suche fauoure wyth ayde syr henry beawmout syr dauyd stroley syr geffery moubray wyth ayde iim englyssheme entred scotlad water wher short space drew vnto multitude scottes yt sayd edwarde lord greate hoste kepte way tyll came place called gledismore writer crakismoore encountred ye power scotlad fought cruell batayl ye slayn great multitude scottes reason whych victorie crowned kyng scottes yt towne scone shortly shortly mette wyth kynge edward towne newe castell vnto hym made hys homage feawty lande scotlade anno dni mcccxxx anno dni mcccxxxi iohn mockynge iohn pountnay anno v andrew awbrey thys fyfth mayres yere syx yere kynge moneth iuly moche ye scottes busyed theym haue slayne edwarde bayloll theyr kynge hym constrayned auoyde hys lande elles kepe hym somme stronge holde tyll myghte hys frendes lyeges socoured kyng edwarde entent wyth stronge power persed realme scotlande layde hys syege vnto towne berwyke uppon xix daye foresayd moneth iuly scottes wyth greate power purposyng remoue ye sayde syege came towarde sayd towne wherof kyng edward beyng enfourmed made towarde ar place called halydone hyll gaue ye sayd scottes batayll triu phaunte vyctorye moche slewe testifyen dyuerse wryters viii erles ix hudreth knyghtes banerettes iiiic esquyres vpon xxxiim comon people englysshe men slayne onely xv persones whych victory thus kynge opteyned capitayne berwyke vpo ye morew folowynge beyng saynt margarettes day yelded kyng sayde towne castel done kyng edward betoke guydyng therof castelles townes within lande vnto forenamed syr edward baylol kyng scottes shortly retourned englande dauyd sonne robert le bruze beynge sayd kyng scottes constrayned hys wyfe secretely sayle fraunce thyder brought flemyng named marcuell testyfyeth frenche cronycle phylyppe de ualoyes frenche kyng sayd dauyd iane towre wyfe receyued theyr comforte sayde frenche kyng gaue vnto castell gaylarde tyll fortune wolde frendelye thys yere also wytnesseth ye sayd frenche cronycle frenche kynge sente vnto kynge englande ye bysshop beauuays hyghe constable frauce whych shewed vnto kynge edwarde theyr soueraygne lorde entendyd voyage holy lade requyred hym hys ayde copany perfourmaunce sayd iournay whereunto kynge gaue answere vnto request whan frenche kynge perfourmed suche condycions tymes promysed sayd shuld conteted gyue suche answere vnto yt request hys name made theruto shulde couenient added yt maruayled greatly sayd frenche kynge entended suche voyage tyll clerelye acquyted hym sayd promysse couenaunt whyche answere frenche kynge nothynge contented malyce murmour grewe encreased betwene dayly occasyon thys sharpe answere moche kynge edward credyble enfourmed frenche kynge vytayll manned x greate shyppes haue saylled scotlande haue warred whyche tempest wedyr dryuen flaunders sore betyn see sold moch theyr stuffe ye hauyn sluce copelled necessyte retorne without worship fraunce thys kyndelyd suche dedely hate betwene ii crysten prynces moche crysten blode cesse tyme folowing theyr quarelles shadde anno dni xiiicxxxi anno dni xiiicxxxii nycholas pyke iohn preston anno vii iohn husbande thys vii yere wynter season sayeth guydo moneth nouebre kynge yode agayne towarde scotlade helde hys crystmas yorke solempnytie hyghe feast ended sped hym scotlade layde siege vnto ye castel kylbrydge lastely wan strengthe set countrey quyetnesse retourned vnto newe castel vpon tyne taryed certayne tyme helde hys feaste pentecoste wyth great royalte whyther within shorte space came syr edward baylol kyng scottes vpon day saint geruasi prothasi xix day iune made homage vnto kynge edwarde presence many noble bothe lades sware vnto hym feawty fydelyte ye done retourned scotlande kyng edward vnto yorke vnto wyndesore al lordes englande tyme edward secondes dayes disseased suche landes scotlad restored agayne theyr sayd possession theym made theyr homage vnto ye kyng scottes sauynge theyr allegeaunce vnto theyr naturall soueraygne lorde anno dni mcccxxxii anno dni mcccxxxiii iohn hamonde iohan ponteney anno viii wyllyam hansarde thys eyghte yere certayne ambassadours sent philip de ualoyes kyng frauce bysshop thuroyn lorde ferry peynguy coclude certayn artycles variauce betwene theyr lord kyng england theyr purpose toke none effecte except kyng grauted sende vnto frech kyng shortly certayn hys lordes haue forther comunycacion hym towchyng sayd artycles whych promyse fulfylled appereth next yere ensuyng anno domini mcccxxxiii anno domini mcccxxxiiii iohan hynkstone reynolde cunduyte anno ix walter turke thys ix yere fell excedynge plente rayne therupo ensuyed great moreyne beestes moneth decembre kyng entred agayne scotlande helde hys crystmas castell rokkysborough whyche caused newly repayred thynges ordered hys pleasure retourned englande soone sent archebysshoppe cauntorbury syr phylip de moutague syr geffrey scrope vnto frenche kynge entent haue concluded amyte betwene hym sayd french kyng whych moued ye frech ambassade shewed eyghte yere hys reygne wha sayde lordes landed fraunce longe delayed myghte come kynges presence moche sayd playnly vnto suche lordes frauce assygned ye frenche kyng passe tyme wyth theym supposed nat kynges pleasure speke meane whyche wordes shortly broughte vnto kynges presence whome receyued wyth ioyous countenaunce contynued certayne tyme furtheryng theyr ambassade yt processe tyme conclusyo pea betwene englande fraunce accorded ferfourth spedde proclamacio therof shuld haue made parys countrey aboute vppon morowe folowynge came ye kynges mynde englysshe ambassadoures scantlye retourned theyr lodgynges whan agayne sente fore farther enfourmed thanne kynges pleasure mynde haue dauyd late kynge scottes included wythin peace shuld agayn restored vnto hys kyngdome whereunto yt answered englyssh ambassadours theyr comyssyon stretched nat farre theyr prince gyuen vnto suche auctoryte wherefore ye former comunycacyo reuoked adnulled retourned englande wythoute conclusyon takynge anno dni mcccxxxiiii anno dni mcccxxxv walter mordon reynolde cunduyte anno x rycharde upton thys x yere moche conclusyon vnyte pea myght betwene kynges englande fraunce therfore warre proclaymed vpon bothe partyes whyche warre greatly procured meane syr robert artoys story phylyp de ualoyes shalbe shewed eyther prynce sought ye wayes meanes howe eyther theym myghte discontent moche frenche kynge sente soone scotlande crewe frenchemen ayde suche enemyes kynge edwarde reason whereof sayde scottes made sharpe warre vppon kynges seruautes frendes putte lande greate vexacyon trouble moche ye kyng forced assemble hys power spede hym agayne thyther mydsomer kynge entred scotlande see warred vpo scottes frencheme whych notary batayl specified except iournay kyng subdued hys enemyes toke dyuerse prysoners amonge one called erle morreta frencheman chyefe cesse tyme deliuered exchauge ye erle namur another frech lord whych tha take gyle scott comyng towarde saynte iohfis towne ayde partye kynge edwarde wha kyng edward agayn pacifyed scottes take homage suche rebelled testyfyeth frenche cronicle stablysshed ye fore named edward bayloll kyng scottes commytted rule lande vnto hym tymes done scottes greate kyndenesse whyche founde kyng recopesemet great charge whych sundrye tymes defendyng theyr enemyes graunted bounde vnto hym hys heyres kynges england shuld ayde assyste hym agayne prynces whan euer warre kynge englade beynge ryghtfull enherytoure agayn prynce wythin hys lande without ye scottes theyr propre costes expense shuld fynde iiic horseme well armed fotemen well suffycyently arrayed warre whiche xiiic men scottes shulde wage hole yere yf kynge englande ended nat hys warre within yere hyre wage sayde scottes doth hys souldyours whyche grauntes made bondes suertie therof receyued ye kynge wytnesseth frenche cronycle kynge leuynge edenborough certayne hys knyghtes strength yt scottes agaynste frencheme whych compassed wayes myght brynge dauyd sonne robert le bruze possessyon lade shortlye retourned englande anno domini mcccxxxv anno dni mcccxxxvi wyllyam brykelsworthe iohn pontnay anno xi iohn northall thys xi yere ye kynge reme brynge greate charge yt warre scotlade also charge yt dayly guyan contynually shulde haue defedyng ye frechme wynnyng hys right therfore gathered treasour vpo euery syde dyuerse sundry way wherof ye maner nat expressed great plente came hys vse yt scat thorow ye realme reason whyche scarcytie vytayll moche mercimonies exceding good chepe lodo quarter whete solde ii fat oxe visviiid fat shepe vid viiidvi peios peny fatte goo iid pygge peny al vytayl ye rate yere also vpo holy rode day ye xiiii day septebre dyed syr iohn eltha erle corne wayl brother vnto ye kyng without issu wherfore ye sayd erldo fell ye kynges hade lyeth buryed westmynster vpo ye right hade ye hygh aulter yere also apered stella cometa englysshe named ye blasyng starre huge stremyng maner wherof many dyuerse construccios amoge como people whych passe ouer anno dni mcccxxxvi anno dni mcccxxxvii walter neale henry darcy anno xii nycholas crane thys xii yere ye kynge helde hys parlyament westmynster tyme lent durynge whych made erled cornewayle duchy gaue erledam chestre vnto edward hys sonne thys parlyamente made vi erles say derby northampton h tyngdon salysbury glouceter suff henry lancastre created erle derby somme wryters leyceter wyllyam de bothum erle northampto wyllyam de clynton erle hutyngedon wyllyam de moutague erle salysbury hugh audeley erle glouceter robert ufforde erle suffolke thys parlyamente acte enacted man shulde maner sylk gowne cote doublet yf myghte spende good rente hundreth yere whyche acte nat longe holden thys yere also kynge amonge dyuerse pryuyleges grauted vnto ye cytezeyns london offycers mayres sheryfes shulde day forthwarde vse mary syluer parcell gylte kynge fraunce thys yere moche credybly enfourmed kyng edwarde wolde entre lande frauce make warre vpo thesame therfore made great purueyaunce resyste hym comon fame ranne thanne frauce yt kyng edward enteded nat onely clayme gascoyne guyan also fraunce hys propre rightfull enherytaunce ryghte hys mother wherefore french kynge assembled huge hoste commytted rule vnto kynge nauerne erle alenson brother vnto sayde frenche kynge whyche sayde capytaynes wyth theyr people awayted dayly kynge englandes commynge whyche theym yere dyspoynted testyfyeth frenche cronycle kynge edwarde thys whyle sent flaunders knyghte called syr barnarde de brette treate amy e betwene hym flemynges cause erle flaunders whych fast frech kynge called hys counsayll hym haue theyr aduyce howe myght beste ordre hym selfe hys people whych cousayll dyuers opynyons many thoughte better dyuerse consyderacyons whyche longe reherce erle shulde rather preferre amyte kynge englande tha kynge fraunce whyche opynyon greate furtherer promoter knyghte flaunders called countryssye wyth whome erle beynge cause discontent sent hym pryson soone request frenche kynge whyche layed vnto hys charge hadde receyued greate summes money kyng englande procure styre flemynges agayne hym behedded whyche dede dweller gaunte bruges miscontente vtterly refused ye erle hys counsayll made theym stronge withstande hys displeasure ye erle constrayned gather hys lordes knyghtes part ye comons agayne hym short proces met playn batayll place called marchie loge fyghte erle holte put flyghte forced hys safegard take castel named mal malet season kyng edward beynge enfourmed ye amytie yt flemynges bare towarde hym anon sent vnto knyght called syr galtyer walter de magny goodly company archer well apoynted whyche arryued ile called cazater whome erle flaunders certayn hys knyghtes encountred gaue vnto englysshemen batayl ende erle shamefully chased many hys gentylmen slayne take syr iohn rodes syr wyllya gyll syr nycholas chau cy many slayne syr guy bastarde brother vnto erle dyuerse taken yt sent prysoners englande whan frenche kyng vnderstandynge deuysyon betwene erle hys subiectes faythfull ye erle vnto hym entendynge wynne fayre meanes fauour ye flemynges whyche knewe well myght nat wynne rygoure sente vnto gaut bysshop saynt denys whych made vnto ye ruler ye towne bruges townes assembled many fayre behestes promyses amoge ye whych one frech kyng wolde acquyte vnto delyuer vnto theyr vse suche lordshyppes seygnoryes withheld theyrs hys progenytours hym vayn kyng edward sped hys nedes meanes one named iaques de artiuele gaut great substauce passyng boldenes capacyte wytte discrecio yt sayd towne gaut bruges ipre courtryke courtrey cassyle condyssended promysed ioyntly hooly refuse ye freche kynge take kynge englandes partye rather warre whych tyme philip de ualoyes made vpon begynnyng hys reygne ye fyrst yere story sayde phylyp shall appere anno domini mcccxxxvii anno dni mcccxxxviii wyllam pountfreyt henry darcy anno xiii hugo marbre thys xiii yere kynge edwarde quene philip hys wyfe assured stablysshemet amyte betwene hym holanders seladers braba ders passed see begynnyng ye moneth iunii sayled wyth goodly copany coutrey brabat quene tha beynge great chyld erle brabat honorablie receyued whyche season hys beynge kyng edwarde gat vnto hym many frendes amonge whych lewys bauyere whych toke vpon hym emperour tyme xxii iohan pope accursed one thys lewys fauoure vnto kyng edwarde assygned ordeyned hym uycayr ye empyre reason whyche offyce kyng edwarde made oute hys commaundementes dyd many thynges hys aduauntage profyte byrth lyonellin thys season quene phylyppe lyenge andwarpe delyuered man chylde named lyonell phylyp de ualoys hauynge knowelege thys demeanure kynge edwarde gathered vnto hym greate strenthe hym innumerable people taryed amyas ye ende august tyll ye begynnyng octobre wha sawe kyng edwarde came nat deuyded ye great hoste retournyng many theym theyr owne countreys sente vnto stronge holdes castelles let yt passage kynge edwarde hys hoste lade fraunce thys passe tyme frenche kynge sent dyuerse shyppes vnto see wyth men warre take englysshe marchau te came theyr course befelle encountred ii great shyppes englande called edward cristofer whiche testyfyeth frenche cronycle freyght greate rychesse also well manned anone eyther ware gonne shot longe bowes arblasters nat spared nother syde betwene cruell fyghte nat egall frencheme xiii sayles great smal englysshe men fyue meane two foresayd great shyppes two barkys caruyll whyche thre small shyppes escaped theyr deliuer saylynge ii abode fought beyonde ix houres moche slayn vpon partyes aboue vic men ende sayd ii shyppes taken broughte ye frech kynges stremes many englysshemen sore wounded cast see thys yere also sayd frenscheme nauy landed southapton sodeynly spoyled towne brente great parte therof ouer frenche kynge made warre gascoyn wanne dyuerse smal pyle one stroge castell standing countrey gascoyne called agenoys whych castell named pene season kyng edwarde almayne made allyaunce dyuerse prynces coutrey toke assurau ce shulde ayde assyste hym wynne hys ryght tytle crowne frauce returned flauders wher taryed thys mayres yere anno domini mcccxxxviii anno domini mcccxxxix wyllyam thorney andrew awbry anno xiiii roger forsham thys xiiii yere kynge edwarde spedyng hys busynesse almayn flauders ye precedynge yere touched retourned englande called hys hygh court parlyament westmynster ye tyme lent whyche parlyamet kyng axed hys comons mayntenaunce hys warre recouer hys ryghte fraunce ye v part theyr moueable goodes ye custome wolles ii yeres payed afore hade yt ix shefe euery mane corn yt legth grauted ye leuyeng therof caused ye lord euery shyre thorugh hys lade answere hi euery lorde yt cyrcuyte dwelled nere vnto thys graut gadered payed loue poore people tourned ito hatred prayer cursyng ye kyng shuld nede occupye hys prouisios moche money graut myght leuied therfore borowed many notable summes dyuerse cytyes partyculer persones thys lande amonge whyche borowed cytye london xxm marke repayed money comynge foresayd graunt whych foresayd xxm marke leuied wardes cytye fourme foloweth towre warde sessed iiic lxvli wherof wyllyam bryklesworthe lent cli resydue leuyed xii persones warde byllyngysgate warde sessed viiclxiiili wherof iohn de cawston lent iicli aleyn gyll iicli residue let xxvi perones warde brydge sessed viiclxvlivisviiid wherof iohn louekyne bare iicli iohn malwayn rauffe de lenone iicli resydue borne xxxiii persones warde warde dowgate sessed viclxlixs ye whych henry pycarde lent two c marke bartholmewe freslyng wyllyam leglyshe iic marke resydue leuyed xxv persones warde langbourne warde sessed cccliili syxe sviiid wherof thomas horwolde lent cli iohn peche c marke reste lent xv dweller yt warde walbrooke warde sessed ix cxili wherof iohn adam lent iic li iohn de bery symon pystour peperer iicli ada de bery iohn iic marke rest leuyed xxiii persones warde bysshoppisgate warde sessed vclixlivisviiid wherof ada frauncesse lent iicli symonde browne iohn de saynt albone iicli resydue leuyed x persones warde lymestrete warde sessed c xli wherof augustyne waleys lente cli xli leuyed iii persones warde cornehyll warde sessed iiicxvli wherof iohan colyng robert manhale draper bare one cli laste c marke rest leuyed xx persones sayd warde chepe warde sessed vcxviilixs wherof barthilmew thomasyn mercer lent cc poude stepha caundysshe draper wyllya holbech iohan harwarde eyther theym c marke iohn dolsoby goldsmyth cc marke iohan fawkys iamys naware eyther theym cli rest leuyed lxi persones warde bradstrete warde sessed v clxxx viiili wherof thomas legge skynner let cccli iohn harwarde stoke cc marke resydue leuyed eyght persones warde uyntrye warde sessed ccccccxxxiiiilixvisviiid wherof walter turke fysshemonger lent cc marke iohn stoday vyntener cli symonde bolsely iohn rothynge cc marke ye rest leuyed xxiiii person ye warde warde bredstrete sessed cccclxilixvisviiid wherof adam brabesone lent ccli rest leuyed xxx persones ye warde warde nuene hyth sessed ccccxxxvlixiiisiiiid wherof rychard kyslyngbury let ccli iohn gloucetre c marke resydue leuyed xvii persones warde cord wayner strete warde sessed two thousande hundreth lxxxxvliiiisiiiid wherof andrew awbrey grocer lente viii hundreth marke wyllyam de cawstone ccli iames andrewe thomas bra eyther ii hudreth marke willyam worceter iic marke iohan bechamp wyfe iohn halle eyther cli iohn bulle iohn gonwardby wyllya hampstede eche c marke reste whyche vi hundreth lxixvisviiid lent xliiii persones warde warde faryngedone within sessed viicxxxlixvisviiid wherof gylbert staynedrope lent iicli reste leuyed lxvii persones warde faryngdone without wally sessed cxiiiilixiiisiiiid whyche summe leuyed xxi sone warde crepulgate warde sessed iiiiclxiilixs wherof rychard lazar mercer let iic marke symode de bedyngton c marke resydue leuyed xxxvii persones sayd warde colmanstrete warde sessed mlilixvisviiid wherof symo de fraunces lent viiicli henry warre iohn denys ii hudreth marke ye residue lent vi persones warde candelwyke strete warde sessed cxxxiiilivisviiid yt sayd summe leuyed xxiii persones sayd warde warde algate stynted sessed xxxli leuyed syx enhabytauntes sayd warde portsokyn warde sessed xxviilixs leuyed vii persones warde castell baynarde warde sessed lxiiilivisviiid lent xii persones warde bassyngeshawe warde sessed lxxixlixiiisiiiid leuyed syxe persones aldryshe gate warde sette sessed lviilixs layed oute lente v persones warde whyche summe totall foresayd xxv wardes amounteth sume xiii thousande iii hundreth lxxx fyue lixiiis iiiid whyche summe excedeth summe twenty thousand marke lilivisviiid ye shall vnderstade payed leest towarde thys lowne payed l soo ascendyng summes aboue rehersed wherof many sessed xl lilli lxli many dyuerse meane summes thys yere also ye kyng chauged hys coyne made noble halfe noble value syx sviiid whyche thys day worthe viiisixd xd half noble rate yf kepe trewe weyghte prouided dyuerse thynges weale hys realme spede hys iourney fraunce whan kyng edward set lande ordre thyng metely prouided nede aboute lammesse sayled braban helde hys cousayl hys frendes theyr aduyces made clayme ye hole crowne fraunce hys ryghtefull enherytaunce auctorytye entermedeled armes england ye army frauce ye se daye kynge phylyp beyng thynges warned gathered howge hoste came towne called uermendoys kyng edwarde hys people entred ye coutrey called theresse bret wasted ye coutrey hym tha kyng philip drew toward englisshe hoste came vnto place towne called frech buyro fosse entended sayth frenche boke haue set vpon ye englysshemen counsayl hys lordes dyuerse cause let hys dyspleasure ye daye myght fynde conuenyent tyme assayle hys enemyes conclusyon eyther hoste departed fro without batayll fyght kynge edwarde toke hys wey towarde gaunt kyng phylip retourned fraunce kynge edwarde meanes hys frende iaques de artyuele hys pleasure towne gaunt receyued othe homage dyuerse conclusios take leuyng quene testymony wryters retourned agayne enlade left quene tha great chylde ye erles salysbury oxynforde whyche ye kynges absence ayded well ye flemynges agayne frech kyng dyd dyuerse marcyall actes whyche passe ouer ce ye erle salysbury take prysoner diuers englyssh men slayne ye assaut towne called ye ile flauders flauders anno dni mcccxxxix anno dni mcccxl adam lucas andrewe awbry anno xv bartholomewe marres thys xv yere whyle ye kyng busyed englande make prouysyo mete money withstande freche kyng aswell warre sayde frenche kyng made vpo flemynges beyng ye kynges frendes hys owne particuler cause ye quene sayd beyng towne gaunt deliuered sonne named iohn crystmas begynnynge thys mayres yere ende xiiii yere chyld wha came mannes astate surnamed iohn gaut fyrst erle rychemout duke lacaster also fast kyng edwarde uyded abylemetes warre englade fast hasty prouysyo made frech kyng withstande kyng edward lade water yt great stroge nauy vpo see kyng edward tha ye moneth iunii iic sayles tooke shyppynge sayled towarde flauders vpo see met came vnto hym syr robert morley ye north nauye englade yt al aboue iiic sayles myd somer vppon saynte iohns euyn fought frech kynges nauy whyche lay wayte hym nere towne called sluse thys nauy whyche noumber reporte freche boke vpo iiiic sayles wherof chyefe admyralles syr hugh queret syr nycholas buchet one named barbe noyre englysh blacke berde whych capytayns admyralles anone espied ye englyssh flote made towarde begyn fyght iiii galeys set vpo shyppe auautage sayled ye named ye ryche oliuer iiii galeys fore named barbe noyre cunduyt assayled thys sayd shyppe euery parte bet gunneshot men hayl shot excedyngely men within many slayn mo wouded lykely haue ben shortly ne rescous co pany tha sayd foure galeys soone becleped ye english nauy cruelly assayled borded myghte rescowed approched hole flote vpon bothe sydes hydous ferefull dynne noyse gunnes terryble flamynge wylde fyre thycke shot quarelles arowes crusshynge shyppes ye hydous woderfull beholde many soule expelled theyr body shorte whyle mortall cruell fyght cotynued sayth frenche story ye space viii howres suche wyse ye harde knowe whether parte better many deed wounded men cast see water whiche cyrcuyte aboute coloured dyed reedthe mansy co rage edward thyrde ye ende grace great mahode ye kynge whiche sore wouded great conforte ye frenchemen chased many theyr shyppes bowged taken many prysoners amonge whiche forenamed admyralles capytaynes syr nycholas buchet syr hugh queret ii whiche despyte frenchemen hanged vpon ye sayles theyr shyppes take amoge shyppes season taken recouered ii foresayd shyppes named edwarde ye crystofer whiche taken frenchemen shewed ye iii yere kynge batayle also testyfyed many dyuerse wryters slayne vpon noumber xxxm frenchemen al ye frenche boke nameth many slayne vpon bothe partyes excuse mysfortune neglygence syr nycholas buchet whiche kepte freche nauy longe within hauen closed englysh nauy yt great noubre myght neuer stryke stroke shote theyr ordenaunce hurte theyr owne company wha kynge edwarde optayned tryumphaunt vyctory enmyes yelded great thakes vnto god fayne tary season shyppe reason woude ye receyued thyghe whiche season ye quene wyfe came vysyte hym retourned agayne vnto gaut fewe dayes passed ye kynge departed swynne rode vnto lady ardenbourghe sent nauy nexte hauen brugys moche people vnto towne gaut wha accoplished pylgrymage rode vnto brugys thense vnto gaut dweller ioyously receyued kynge edwarde called great counsayle whiche determyned shulde prepare ii hostes wherof yt one shuld ye gaut ye townes aboute ye certayne lordes almayne shuld haue ye rule ye hoste shulde brugys englyssh archer ye host ordeyned syr robert artoys leder capitayne wha ye sayd ii hostes garnysshed thynge nedeful ye fyrst sent vnto ye town turney vnto ye towne saynt omers ii townes ye day lyke stregth vnto frauce calays vnto england wherfore frech kynge suretye sent vnto tournay erle foys syr bartha marshall frauce iiiim men armis vnto saynt omers sent ye duke burgoyn great copany lordes wha sir robert artois lyen certeyn tyme saynt omers many sharpe assautys hym people ben gyuen whiche dyuerse fortune fell chaunces warre tedyous longe wryte fynally vpon morowe saynt iames day xxvi day iulii ye duke burgoyne retynue yssued towne foughte ye sayd syr robert people loge season ye fyght slayne duke partye lorde hamelcourte syr froysard de beaford lorde saynt uran lorde spayne burgonyon lorde called lorde branges dyuerse knyghtes gentylmen nouber liiii sayth ye freche cronycle comune people vpon iiim short tyme power duke encreased suche wyse syr robert copany fayne departe thense yode ipre helde hym aboue sayde kynge edwarde sent forth ye fore named ii hostes rest people yode vnto place within ii englysshe myles tournaye called freche le pount de pree lodged hym people phylyp de ualoys ye freche kynge came people vnto house relegyon whiche called ye priory saynt andrewe two place two sayde prynces thus lyenge great strengthes vpon eyther syde kyng edwarde counsceyll lordes sent vnto ye frenche kynge letter conteynynge foloweth letter sent kyng edward frech kyngedwarde grace god kyng englade frauce lorde irelande syr phylyp de ualoys longe tyme haue exhorted messangers manyfolde maner wayes ye ende yt ye shulde restore vnto v v reason oure ryghtfull enherytauce realme fraunce whiche ye haue longe occupyed great wronge se well ye entende perseuer youre iniuryous witholdynge without vnto v reason ryght demaude entred lade flaundres souerayne lorde passe countre doynge ferther vnderstande haue taken helpe lorde iesu chryst ryght power sayd countrey people allyed beholdynge ryght haue ye herytage ye wythholde frome v great wronge drawe v towarde make short ende vppon ryghtfull demaunde chalenge yf ye wyll towarde v approche moch great power armes came vpon partyes may longe holde togythers without great destruccyon ye people whiche euery good crysten man ought eschewe specyally prynce haue gouernaunce people therfore moche desyre yt shorte dayes may mete eschewe ye mortalyte people quarell apparent atwene v destruccyon oure chalenge maye stade tryal atwene v two whiche thynge offre vnto cause aboue sayd remembre well noblenesse persone great wysedome aduysement case ye wyll therof chalenge set afferme batayll youre selfe hundreth persones party moste suffycyent lyke wyse many yfye wyl one wey ye wyll assygne certayne day cytye tournay fyght strength agaynst stregth within x dayes ye syght letter wolde worlde knewe thynges aboue sayd thys oure desyre nat pryde great presumpcion oure lorde myghte set reste peace amonge crysten enemyes god myght resysted crystendome enhaunced ye way yt ye wyll chose offer abouesayd wryte agayne v bringer letter hym makynge hastye delyueraunce gyuen vnder great seale eschine sur le scaut nere vnto cytye tourney xv day moneth iule upon receyt whych letter frenche kynge aduice hys counsayl wrote agayne vnto kynge edwarde maner fourme foloweth frenche kynges letter philip ye grace god kyng fraunce edward kyng englad haue sene letter sent philip de ualoys brought court ye letter certayn requestes moche sayd letter came nat v sayde requestes nat made v lyke apereth tenoure ye sayd letter therfore make none answer neuerthelesse vnderstonde sayde letter otherwyse ye enbatelled realme fraunce doyng great domage v sayd realme people moued wyll without reason nat regardynge yt lyege man ought regarde hys lyege soueraygne lorde ye entred homage youre selfe knowelegyng reason kynge fraunce promised obeysaunce suche lyege man oughte vnto hys soueraygne lorde lyke appereth youre letter patetes sealed great seale whyche haue v shulde obedyente vnto v entente suche wha shal thynke good shal chase realme honour mageste royall profet people thys doynge haue faythfull hope oure lorde iesu chryste whome good v commyth enterpryse whyche wyll nat reasonable hathe ben lette holy voyage ouer see greate quantyte cristen people put deth ye holy seruyce god lefte holy chyrch vnworshypped vnhonoured wyth many great enormyties ye thynke haue flemynges ayde thynke v assured good townes common wyll behaue theym suche wyse agayne v agayne cosyn erle flaunders wyll saue theyr honoure trouthe haue mysse done tyll nowe hathe ben euyll counsayl suche people regarde nat common weale people theyr owne profyte onely gyuen feelde pryory saynt andrew besyde ayre vnder seale secrete sygnet absence oure greate seale thyrty day moneth iule nat longe frenche kynge hadde thus rescribed vnto kyng edwarde messynger came vnto hym frome tourney hasty rescouse towne dayly sharplye assauted englysshe hoste wherefore haste sente thyther duke athenesse vycounte thonart vycount dannaye dyuerse ye nouber xv men name great nouber peple whych sped streyght vnto ye mount cassyle came sayd mount gotten ye flemynges theyr lodgynge dyspoynted reason wherof fered set vpon englysshe hoste yet trauayll ye remouyng sayd syege tourney toke theyr counceyll swar ed cassyle entred ye lande erle barry dyd moche harme therein hadde executed theyr pleasure retourned vnto frenche kynge thys meane whyle kyng philip counsayled hys lordes whether better hym drawe towarde tourney remoue ye siege go flaunders make warre vpon townes helde kyng edwarde whych cou sayll thought moste honorable shulde endeuer hym selfe remoue ye sayd syege whiche conclusio taken hys hoste drewe towarde tourney ende lodged hym hys people place towne called daye bowyns within iii myles tourney whose copany ye kynge nauerne kynge bohemy beame duke normandy loreyne athenesse athes erles alensone flaunders sauoy nou bre xiiii erles besyde vycountes baronettes knyghtes great noumbre kynge edwarde lordes folowynge erle herford erles northampto derbye southapton oxynforde henawd harflete rondell also straungers duke geldre sclauonye brabant many vycountes banerettes knyghtes whych passe ouer thus laye two prynces two great myghty hostes within fyue myles withoute great batayll fyghte certayne tyme euer meane whyle towne tourney assayled ye englysshe men flemynges whych defended manfully well whyche passe tyme countesse henaude whyche mother vnto quene englade testyfyeth frenche cronycle syster vnto frenche kynge woman passynge discrecyon eloquency ye ayde prynces kyng beame laboured suche meane treaty yt daye dyet betwene two kynges appoynted dyuerse kyng edwardes counsayll sore agayne specyally iakes de artyuele kyng edwardes party assygned bysshoppe lyncolne syr geffrey scrope syr iohn henaude brother erle syr wyllya cheyny wyth freche kyng assygned kynge beame erles armenake sauoy syr lewys de sauoy ende
