thys appoyntement myght take better effecte daye trewce concluded tyll mydsomer folowynge moste wryters testyfyen kynge edwarde lefte syege tourney defaut money neglygece slowe procuratours englade sped nat hys nedes shulde one cause kynge hys hoste departed thense vnto gaunt taryed certayne tyme whych season fore named lordes knyghtes met tournay debated mater chalenge kynge edwarde certayn artycles concernynge countrey flaunders whyche counsayll grauted frenche kynges partye ye frenche kynge shulde frely departe towarde maryage kynge edwardes chyldren hole seygnoryes gascoyn guyan erledome poytyers fre maner offycer french kyng shuld medle haue parte lordshyppes flauders sayd lordes graunted common coutrey customes lawes shuld iuged ruled olde tymes vsed also bondes oblygacyons tymes passed chyefe townes made frenche kynge cause shulde cancelled delyuered theyr erle shulde acquyted lyke wyse offe ce done day also censuryes curse yt wrapped shulde clerelye adnulled reuoked coclusions offer whych passe ouer anno dni mcccxl anno dni mcccxli rycharde berkynge iohan oxynforde anno xvi iohan rokyslee thys xvi yere kynge edwarde vpon saynt andrewes euyn came towre london sent suche lordes hadde made hys procuratours leuye hys money hys absence theyr negligece mysdemeanure cast pryso voyage kyng passed syde see england excedynge tempest wether passed great fere dauger whych tempest opynyon wryters rered negromauncers french kyng ende haue peryshed kyng el gyue hym lesse courage take see agayne thys yere also sent ye xii benet tha pope two cardynalles treate peace betwene kynges englande fraunce whych concluded peace betwene sayd two kynges aswell countreys whych allyed terme iii yeres whyche tyme agreed bothe sayd kynges theyr proctours shulde publysshe declare pope theyr claymes cause ende hym cousayl fynall dyreccion cocorde myght set betwene theym whych agremente sayde cardynalles thus concluded towne called malestrete aboute feaste saynte gregory lente beynge presente kynge englande erles derbye northampton wyth frenche kynge duke burbon burgoyne hys party thys agremente stoode lytle effecte nat wyth standynge warre betwene two kynges contynued eyther fortyfyed theyr frendes allyes soone happened iohan duke brytayn dyed wythout issu variaunce fel betwene charles de bloys iohn erle mountforde tytle dukedome betwene mortall warre exercysed story phylyppe de ualoyes shall playnly declared whyche warre contynuynge kynge englade ayded ye party erle mountforde frech king ayded charles de bloys ouer duryng terme ye sayde treucetinc breche french kyng made warre vpon gascoynes shall apere scotlande styrynge made thys yere excytynge frenche kynge mych kynge fayne sende thyder crewe soudiours strength suche holdes helde thys yere ye quene delyuered man chyld ye towne langeley whyche named edmunde surnamed edmunde langley anno dni mcccxli anno dni mcccxlii iohn luskyn symond fraunces anno xvii rycharde kyslyngbury thys xvii yere kynge edwarde request dyuers hys yonge lordes knyghtes suffered exercysed certayn poyntes feates warre iustys turnamentes whych executyd dunstable kynge quene present wyth partye lordes ladyes lande thys yere dyed forenamed iohn duke brytayne reason whose deth warre precedynge yere touchyd grewe bytwene sayde charlys de bloyes erle mountforde thys charlys de bloyes made claym duchery tytle wyfe doughter guy vycount lymogys seconde brother foresayde iohn duke brytayne iohn erle mountfort claymed tytle thyrde brother vnto forenamed duke thys mater entende shewe playnely ende therof story phylyp de ualoys haue sayde rather bycause fayte therof done englande brytayne wherof sayde phylyppe pretendyd rule chyefe sygnory anno domini mcccxlii anno dni mcccxliii iohn stewarde iohn hamonde anno xviii iohn ayleshm thys xviii yere kynge shortely easter callyd parlyament westmynster tyme wherof edwarde hys eldeste sonne creatyd prynce walys many ordynauces weale ye lande enactyd whych length passe ouer clement popein thys yere also clement vi ye name whyche newly made pope toke vpon hym gyue dyuers bysshopryches benefyces fell voyde englande wherwyth kynge nothynge contented mych sent co myssyons strayte commaundementes man tyme folowynge shulde present inducte suche persone persones pope promoted wythout ye agremente kynge farre towchyd hys prerogatyue sayd pope clement fyrste archebysshoppe roan munke saynt benettes order frencheman byrth called peter man excellent cunnyng waster goddes patrymony promoted ye dygnyte instaunt laboure frenche kyng sent hys sonne iohn duke normandy duke burgoyn vnto cytye auynyon auygno procure eleccyon meane wherof chosen pope aboute vii day may tronysed sayd moneth may begynnynge yere grace thaccompte chyrche englande mccc xliii meanes fauoure whyche pope frenche kynges cause mater betwene kynge edwarde hym deale promoted testyfieth frenche boke french kyng thys yere put deth one mayster hery de malestrete graduat man brother vnto syr godfrey de malestrete knyght lately also put deth sayde frenche kynge theyr fydelyte whyche bare towarde kyng edward hys feodaryes wherof kynge edwarde made hys coplaynt vnto pope thys thynges done contrary constytucyons former peace concluded two cardynalles therof remedye thys yere also kynge edwarde made coyne fyne goldekynge edwardes floryne named floryne say peny value syxe viii halfe peny value thre iiii far thynge value xx whyche coyne ordeyned hys warres fraunce golde therof nat fyne noble whyche hys fourthen yere hys reygne caused coyned anno dni mcccxliii anno dni mcccxliiii geffrey wychyngham iohan hamonde anno xix thomas legge thys xix yere kyng held solempne feaste hys castell wyndsore betwene candel masse lent holden executed many marcyall actes iustes tournamentes diuerse whyche present many strau gers landesthorder garter ye ende therof deuysed order garter stablisshed thys daye contynued yere midsomer kyng edward wyth stronge armye sayled vnto sluse lytle brytayne dyspoynted ayde flemynges reason deth hys trusty frende iaques de artyuele whyche slayn flemynges gaunt co spyracy made agayne hym suche fauoured partye ye french kyng tourned home englande agayne yere leuynge behynde hym erle salysbury stronge company ayde iohn erle moutforde agayn syr charles de bloys whyche iohn ayde englysshme wan diuerse townes holdes brytayne vpo sayd syr charles frenchme ende thys yere taken sykenes yt dyed towne called corentyne whose deth sayd charles posseded parte duchye brytayne thys yere kyng sent ye erle derby strog army guya ayde erle northapton whome ye kynge left burdeaux stregth coutrey agayne french men whome dethe forenamed syr iohn erle mountforde drewe many soudyours partye anno domini mcccxliiii anno domini mcccxlv edmunde hempnale rychard lacer anno xx iohn glouceter thys xx yere later ende xix yere yt wyt aboute saynt nycholas tyde begynnynge thys mayer yere foresayd erles derby northampton towne castel bergarat gascoyne slewe erle ualetynoys chefe capytayne therof toke noble man called ye erle ilys wyth many ryche prysoners apryll ye sayd erles wanne stroge towne called ryall wherof heryng philip de ualoys haste sent hys sonn iohn duke normandy wythstande gyue batayll vnto ye sayd erles whan sayd duke nere vnto englysshemen suche tydinges theyr strength retourned vnto hys father agayn whych dede hys father wyth hym greuously discontented moche yt ye occasio auoyd father displeasure retourned ito gascoyne layed siege vnto ye castel aguyllon remayned tyll ye moneth august folowing without gettynge aduauntage whych season retourned agayn father whose departure erle northapton hys copany gatte stroge towne called french la roche darien meane roche rocke aryen tyme whyche warre thus cotinued brytayne guyan frenche kyng made purueyaunce defende hys lande agayne kyng edward whome awayted dayly kyng edwarde faste gathered money made hys dayly purueyaunce prepare hym thyderwarde anno dni xiiicxlv anno dni xiiicxlvi iohn croydon geffrey wychyngham anno xxi wyllyam clopton xxi yere kyng edward helde hys parlyament westmynster tyme lent moneth iuly folowynge toke shyppynge sayled normandy landed wytnesseth freche cronicle place prouynce named frenche la hougne sent uast xic sayles greate small ye xii day ye foresayd moneth iuly anone laded comaunded hys people waste ye countrey ledyng knyght called syr godfrey harcourte broughte vnto towne called melly then vnto mountboure kynge wythe hys people rested hym season whyche tyme sayde syr godfrey brent spoyled coutrey costantyne nere adioynyng kyng edward departed fro ye foresayd towne went vnto stroge towne called karenten karenton whyche gate wyth castell belongynge continued iourney yt vpo xx day ye sayde moneth iule layed hys syege cytye towne caen wherin ye daye chyef capytaynes bysshop bayen ye erle ewe lorde turnebu wyth dyuerse knyghtes men name kyng edwarde commaunded sayd towne shulde assayled ye whych done great force specyally suche stronge cotynuall shot frenchme forsoke wally drew towarde castell processe longe cruell fyght ye englysshemen entred towne toke prysoners amonge whyche taken ye costable frauce kynges chauberleynecane conquered englysshemen spoyled pylled towne caen bare pyllage vnto theyr shyppes whyche conueyed englande whan kynge edwarde thus spoyled brent parte towne caen forced bysshope bayen capytaynes take castell theyr refuge considerynge strength departed then sped hym towarde cytye roan chefe princypall cytye normandye frenche kynge greate power thys whyle come vnto roan broken brydges stopped passage suche wyse kynge edwarde fayne leue ye way costed toward parys came stronge towne called uernon then towne named amyrlene whych townes resysted loste hys soudyours xii daye auguste came towne named poysy taryed vi dayes thes yode vnto saynt germayn euer syr godfrey de harcourt byeng ye vawarde brent townes spoyled coutrey went lyke kyng edwarde hys hoste thus passed coutrey towarde parys lyke maner frenche kynge hys power passed helde hys way towarde ye sayd cytye beynge nere sundry tymes eyther hoste syght ryuer seyne euer betwene myght nat ioyne batayll whan kyng edwarde comyn towne called saynt clowe set fyre therin sene vnto parys whyche put ye cytezeyns great fere moch wytnesseth frech cronycle frech kyng nat ben present cytye shulde haue yelden vnto kyng edwarde tha kyng edward seynge myght nat passe ryuer seyn towarde ye citie parys occupyed ye chefe palaysys royall manours frenche kynges accustomed soiourne lye dranke wyne occupyed suche stuffe necessaryes fande hys departyng set fyre vpo cosumed parte poyzy one saynt germayne mount ioy thyrde brente towne poyzy reseruyng house nunnes whyche founded phylyp le beawe father vnto kyng edwardes wyfe ye shal vnder stade auctours wryters fauoureth theyr owne nacyonaffeccyo historiographer englysshe wryters say ye frech kyng fledde brake brydges went ende englysh hoste shuld nat wynne french men gyue vnto batayll ye frenche boke sayeth kynge edwarde fled wolde nat abyde batayl frenche men wherefore frech kyng brake brydges entent ye englyssh shuld nat escape hys dauger howe sayth wryter called iohn froysarde common frauce thought greate dyshonoure vnto lande englyssh hoste shuld passe thorough harte myddell fraunce occupye kynges chief lodgynges nat foughten season whych myght nat opinio sayd common people wythout great treason suche nere kyng tha kyng edward closed reason brekynge brydges yt forced drawe backe reedyfye brydge poyzy whiche repayred stronge wyse hys hoste passed ouer withoute parell howe tyme repayrynge french kyng sent thyder iim men let sayde werke archer kept theym wyth theyr shot sharpe maner ye partye slayne werke fyghted aboue sayd kyng edwarde entred cou trey pycardy french kynge remoued frome saynte denys vnto sait germains fro then town called aubeuyle poyteau then antoygne thys whyle kyng edward baner dysplayed came vnto cytye beauuayze assayled towne towne wel garnisshed soudyours defeded theyr enemyes vygourously wherfore kynge edwarde co syderynge myghte nat lyghtely wynne towne sette bulwerkes fyre departed then yode vnto place called frenche soygnouile blake tache passed water sum vpon frydaye xxv daye august lodged hym hys people nere vnto forest called cressy crecy wherof whan french kyng ware anone sped hym frome fore named towne antoygne vnto aubeuyle agayne hadde refresshed hym hys people rode vnto abbey faste forenamed towne cressy thys passe tyme iohn duke normandy sonne phylyp de ualoys whyche precedyng yere towched layd hys syege vnto castell aguyllon herynge hys father thus warreyed wyth kyng englande brake vp syege came hys strengthe vnto hys father ii greate hostes thus lodged within lytle compasse nere vnto forenamed towne cressy vpon saterdaye folowyng feaste saynt bartholmewe beynge xxvi day monethe august eyther cruelly assayled foughte mortall sharpe batayll whereof ende kynge edwarde gloryouslye victoure chaced frenche kynge slewe fyght sayenge moste wryters kynge bohemy beame sonne henry ye emperoure vii eyght duke loreyne erle alenson brother vnto freche kynge charles erle bloys erles flaunders sancer narcourt fyennes wyth dyuerse noumber eyght bysshoppes erles xvii lordes name banerettes knyghtes esquyers beyode noumber xvi hudreth concludeth frenche hystorye batayll slayne floure chyualrye fraunce comons vpo viiim men realme frauce day susteyned confusio lyke therof nat sene many yeres passed yt people men reputacyon archer vyolence theyr importune shot whych hors man myght stande agayne tha frenche kyng small company fledde sore hurte vnto towne called broy lodged ye nyght folowynge kyng edwarde beynge warned hoste enemyes commynge towarde hym abode styll feelde set good watch made great fyres thorough hoste cotynued tyll monday folowynge upon whyche day mornynge apered new hoste frenche men whych gaue batayle slewe noumbre tha slayne vpo saterday capytaynes men name auctor reherseth none kyng edwarde gaue great thankes vnto god tryumphat vyctory departed fro towne cressye toke hys waye towarde moustruell thes boleyne lastlye caleys wherof capytayne vnder ye frenche kyng burgonyo knyght named syr iohn de uyene kyng edwarde sent shuld delyuer vnto hym sayde towne caleys kynge receyued hym comfortable answere immedyatly layde hys syege vnto sayd towne whych vpon thyrde day moneth septe bre abode certayn tyme makynge assautes whyche tyme season erle derby lyenge burdeaux hauynge rule gascoyne guyan wan dyuerse townes holdes frenchemen townes called sayntez poyteaw saynt iohn de angely ye towne poytyers whyche excedyng treasoure rychesse soo hys sowdyours greatly enryched pyllage wan townes coutrey adioynaunt wha sayd erle spoyled sayd townes brent greate parte foresayde cytye poytyers kynges palays within hys pleasure retourned vnto burdeaux thys passe tyme also frech kyng entente haste kyng edwarde englande sent dauyd le bruze tyme kynge scottes ye lande stroge army gathered vnto hym lordes knyghtes scotlande tymes fauoured hys party entred boundes northumberlande spoyled countrey without pyte shall apere auctoures thys dauyd le bruze thys daye hadde recouered crowne scotlande edwarde de bayloll dede whych kynge foloweth whan archebisshop yorke lordes lefte englande herde tell scottes thus entred lande anone sayd archebysshppe syr henry perse syr rafe neuyle syr gilbert umfreyle knyghtes gentylmen aswell spyrytuall apparayled theyin theyr best maner sped towarde ye scottes mette gaue vnto batayll vpon ye euyn saynt luke xvii daye octobre place faste durha called daye neuyles crosse god shewed englysshe men suche grace scofyted ye scottes slew great foyson toke prysoners sayd dauid le bruze syr wyllyam dowglas syr tholyn fowkys ye noble scotlande whyche shortely surely conueyed vnto towre london kepte prysoners wha kynge edward iii day septembre sayd hadde sondry tymes assayled towne caleys sawe well might nat shortly wynne prouyded hi hys people lye ye wynter folowynge yt lodging hym hoste made many house lodge semed caleys wherfore ce tyme duryng yt syege vytelers suche dayly resorted vnto ye kynges hoste named newe caleys ye kyng proper persone abode al wynter folowyng parte next somer shall apere anno dni xiiicxlvi anno dni xiiicxlvii adam bramson thomas legge anno xxii rycharde basyngstoke thys xxii yere kyng edward stormy wynter ouerpassed comaunded certayne shyppes ioyned mo noumbre vnto kept see vytayll shuld come inhabytautes caleys ye sayd towne fayne holde content olde store newe myghte coueyd sent kynges hoste plentuously vytaylled ye flemynges vytayllers dayly commyng englande kynge phylyppe hauynge dayly worde strength enemyes encreace ester lynges nacions kyng edwarde hym allyed sawe well withoute sayde towne shortly rescowed shulde shortly yolden handes hys enemyes great hurte realme fraunce wherfore great counsayll holden parys chaunged hys money hys greate auautage ouer set inposicion vppon hys common theyr great grudge murmure done toke leue saint denys quyndene pasche yode vnto towne called hesdom taryed gaderyng hys hoste longe nere vnto feast mary magdaleyn hys people assembled whych season set forthwarde town caleys remoue ye kynge england syeg spedde hym ende ye moneth iuly drewe nere vnto caleys whyche hys commynge yolden vnto kyng edwarde frenche cronicle sheweth thynge frenche kynges shame full departyng lyke rehersed englysshe cronycle wryters wryte wha calys go e moste wryters ye town caleys yolden kynge edwarde ende septembre kynge contynued hys siege hole yere somedeale receyte wherof taryed towne vppon moneth voyded clene olde inhabytauntes frenchemen stored wyth englysshemen specyally wyth kentyshmen whan sette towne sure ordre gydynge graunted peace ix monethes requeste two cardynalles sente frome forenamed pope clement syxte holden betwene hym frenche kyng sayled wyth great tryumphe englande came london aboute feaste saynte romayne thre twenty daye octobre ioyously receyued cytezeyns coueyed vnto westmynster thys yere also englysshe knyght called syr thomas agorne capytayne roche aryan spoken xx yere thys kyng fiersly warred syr charles de bloys many bykerynges skyrmishes day batayl set betwene sayd charles thomas freche bokes declaration sayd charles assautynge towne vpo one partie sayd syr thomas wyth copany stalworth archer sowdyours issued parte towne beset sayd syr charles hys co pany assayled suche wyse yt ende partye hys copany taken slayne sayd syr charles take amog men name slayne ye vicout roan ye lord dernall ye lord quyntyne wyth syr wyllm hys sone ye lord ye castell bret ye lord roche syr geffrey turneuew many honour whych passe ouer sayd charles healed suche woudes receyued fyght conueyed englande kept prysoner anno domini mcccxlvii anno domini mcccxlviii henry pycarde iohn luskyn anno xxiii symonde dolsely thys xxiii yere fyll great co tynuall rayne mydsomer crystmas whereof ensued excedynge floddes reason wherof grounde sore corrupted dyuers inconueniences ensued vpon sykenes ye yeres folowynge shall apere fraunce thys yere people dyed wonderfully dyuers place realme vehemently cytye parys dyed thys yere lyt tell ouer lm people saynt denys beyonde xiiiim italy many countreys thys mortalytye aboute thys season reygned also inportunely hethenes aswell cristedome ende thys yere ende august thys mortalytye began dyuers place england specyally london continued sayd moneth august next ensuynge vpo ensued sterylite bareynes aswel see lande vytaylle corne scante anno domini mcccxlviii anno dsii mcccxlix adam bury wyllyam turke anno xxiiii rauffe lynne thys xxiiii yere mortalitie beforesayde englande specyally london moost feruetly raynynge treasone appereth conspyred haue broughte towne caleys agayne frenche kynges possessyon kynge edwarde beforetyme hadde commytted one towres caleys vnto ianuay mych trusted wyth whyche ianuay knyght burgoyn named syr godfrey de charny famylyer mych sayd syr godfrey conuenyent leysex brake vnto sayde ianuay betrayenge ye towne caleys gaue vnto hym lykynge answere sayd ianuay agreed certayn money payde hande deliuer vnto sayd syr godfrey suche shulde brynge wyth hym towre hadde kepynge meane wherof shulde shortly haue rule towne tyme dryuynge apoyntynge whiche bargayne sayth frenche cronycle ianuay sent secrete word vnto kynge englande requyrynge hym secrete wyse come vnto caleys whyche holdynge hys crystmas hauerynge bower essex vppon morowe newe yeres daye toke hys shyppynge landed nyght caleys secrete maner fewe towne knewe beyng whan daye apoyntmente delyuery foresayd towre comyn thys ianuay hadde receyued hys payment houre assygned bytwene sayde syr godfrey hym toke gyue thys sayde ianuay frenchman shulde drawe nere vnto ye sayd towre wynne theyr pray sayd syr godfrey wyth certayne noumber came wythin ye dauger towne caleys warnyng ye resydue hys copany shuld tary tyll enterde ye towne sendyng come spedy wyse soone sayde syr godfrey nere vnto towre busshment sawdyoures sente possterne whiche closed hym frenchemen vpon sydes slewe many amonge whiche syr henry de boy knyght syr gautyer de ualence syr robert beuuays knyghtes slayne sayd syr godfrey taken sore wounded lorde mountmorency escaped great dauger whithe gaue warnynge vnto company returned theym fraunce sayd godfrey de charney layde vpon aborde presented vnto kynge edwarde whiche suche pyte hym comaunded owne surgyons loke vnto hym cure hym theyr best maner wha somdeale cured sente prysoner englande yere also kynge caused coyned grotes halfe grotes whiche lacked weyght former coyne ii vid li troya great london aboute ende august sessed mortalyte dethe london ye whiche vehemet sharpe within ye sayd cytie ouer bodyes buried church churcheyerdes monastery accumed buryeng place buryed yere charterhouse yerde london lm persones aboue yere also ye yere iubile clene remyssyon whiche kept rome euery l wynter ende lyke yere iubile grace contynued cauntorbury thys yere laboure two cardynalles sent pope clemet vi peace cocluded bytwene two kynges englande frauce yere nere vnto owne caleys wherefore stablysshynge sayde peace sayde yere assembled two sayde cardynalles kynge englande bysshoppe norwyche treasourer chyefe chanceller kynge vnto hym kynge assygned frenche kynge bysshop laone abbot saynt denys wyth xxiii daye moneth auguste thys yere yere lorde xiii hundreth fyfthty dyed phylyppe de ualoyes kyng frauncedethe pylyppe de valoys anno domini mcccxlix anno domini mcccl iohn notte rycharde kyllyngbury anno xxv wyllyam worcestre thys xxv yere ye feast decollacyon saynte iohn baptyste latter ende august noble man spayne called syr charles whome kynge iohan fraunce newely gyue erledome angolesme entendynge wynne honoure vpon englysshemen wyth stronge nauy spaynardes entrede ye englysshe stremys dyd moche harme vnto kynge edwardes frendes kynge edwardes kyng season abouesayde mette wyth sayde nauy vpon cooste wynchelsee betwene kynge longe mortall fyghte ye greate losse moche people vppon bothe partyes ende god sente vnto kyng vyctory chased hys enemyes wanne frome theym xxii theyr shyppes moost wryters wyth many prysoners thys yere syr thomas agorne whiche xxii yere thys kyng reygne toke prysoner syr charles de bloys slayne chaunce medle knyght fraunce brytayne called syr rauffe de caours thys yere solempne messangers sente vnto rome conclude parfyte peace betwene two kynges englande fraunce kynge edward shulde resygne gyue vp hys tytle clayme made vnto crowne fraunce french kynge shulde clerely gyue vnto hym duchye guyan wyth suche landes tyme taken hys progenytoures kyng edwarde hys heyres kynges shuld freely holde occupye sayde duchye wythout doynge homage frenche kyng day conclusyon thys matyer prolonged deferred popedelayes course rome delayes dayly ben vsed courte rome erle derby wyth whyche appoynted kynge englande retourned wythoute spede theyr cause wherfore kynge edwarde made new prouisyos warre vpon kyng iohn fraunce anno dni mcccli anno dni mccclii iohn wrothe andrewe awbry anno xxvi gybbon stayndrope thys xxvi yere castel guynys yolden vnto englysshmen dwellynge caleys whyche testyfyeth french cronicle done treason frech man named guyllyam de beauco roy whyche treason sayd guyllyam shortely put execucyon towne amyas myddell august vppon euyn lady assumpcyon syr guy de neale marshall fraunce wyth stronge co pany gaue bataylle vnto englysshemen beynge brytayn whych sayde syr guy lord brykebet chaste leyne beaunais many noble men slayne many take prysoners anno domini mcccli anno domini mccclii iohn peche adam fraunceys anno xxvii iohn stodeney somer thys xxvii yere dry many yeres called drye somer latter ende marche tyll latter ende iuly fyll lytell rayne none reason wherof many inconuenyences ensued one thynge whyche specyally noted corne yere folowynge scante whereof pryce thys yere began enhaunce greatly beuys mottons also dere scantnesse grasse pasture aswell expert fraunce ile englade anno domini mccclii anno domini mcccliii iohn welde adam fraunceys anno xxviii iohn lytell thys xxviii yere kynge edwarde holdynge hys parlyament westmynster amonge thynges enacted soone pentecoste created erle derby duke lacastre yr rauffe stafforde created erle stafforde thys duke lancastre sent agayne ouer see wherein ende yere witnesseth iohn froysarde appealed duke bryswyke duke cou tre almayne certayne wordes contrary hys honoure whych waged batayll sayd duke court frenche kyng thys henry whych wryters named henry bolyngbroke duke lancastre purchased hys sauffe conduyte frenche kyng kepte hys day appoynted bataylle felde called frenche la preauxclers ordeyned place lyested cloosed goodly wyse kynge iohan beynge presente wyth parte hys noble frauce came fyrst feld forenamed duke appellaute thys noble duke lacastre great honour englande soone dyuers obseruauces accordyng law army done solempne othes taken eyther set rest haue rone fyrst course kynge iohan hys especyall grace ceased ye mater toke quarell hys handes eyther theym departed felde wythout stroke strykynge pacyfyed appeale honoure duke lancastre wytnesseth frenche boke nat wyth standynge french kynges enemye soone sayde duke lancastre wyth noble assygned hym kyng england wentte auynyon wyth archebysshoppe roan chaunceller fraunce duke burbo appoynted kynge fraunce conclude efte peace betwene theyr two prynces whyche cytye beforesayd harde lengthe newe pope named innocente vi whych also lyke hys predecessour frencheman cardynall lymosyne normady called hys proper name stephan aubert conclusyon great argumete made eyther partye pope hys counsayl fynally agreed ye peace betwene ii kynges shuld kept holden inuiolate tyll mydsomer next folowynge anno domini mcccliii anno dni mcccliiii wyllyam tontynghm thomas legge anno xxix rycharde smert thys xxix yere kynge edward aduyce hys cou sayll moche townes flaunders brake theyr promyse tyme made helde nat ba de amyte theym promysed lyfe iaques de artyuele fauoured freche kynges partye therefore drewe theym markettes staple wolles sondry townes flaunders lately prouycyon foresayd iaques theyr greate aduauntage vsed kept ordeyned sayde staple holden sondry good townes englande westmynster chychester lyncolne brystowe caunterbury shortely easter frenche kynge sent hys eldest sonne charles dolphyne uyenne normandy take rule ye countre specially sease certayne landes castelles whyche ye daye belonged vnto kyng nauerne whyche oute frenche kynges fauour deth syr charles spayne constable lately frauce yt meanes murdered towne called aygle normandy vpo ii yeres passed whyle ye sayd dolphyne thus besyed normady made suche meanes ye ruler therof grauted vnto hym ayde iiim iii moneths theyr proper costes charge thys soone sprange suche tydinges yt kyng englad enfourmed frech kyng gyuen hys sonne charles ye duchy normandy gascoygne guyan howe ye normanes grauted vnto ye sayd charles iiim iii moneths warre theyr costes vpo ye englyshme whych ye frech boke testifieth grauted hym onely defede ye kyng nauerne yt came costatyne shortly repossesse lades sayd dolphyn hys seased wyth bygge armye made warre vpon sayd dolphyn thus otherwyse trouth diuers wryters agree moneth october ende thys yere prynce edwarde wyth great hoste entred gascoyne passed tholouse passed ryuer gerounde geron passed carcassyon brent bulwerkes cytye then rode nerbon pyllyng spoylynge countre went yere kynge edwarde wyth power landed towne caleys rested hi ye tyme mayres yere yere house freres augustynes londo fynysshed whyche reedyfyed syr humfrey bohum erle hertforde essex whose body lyeth buryed quere sayde house chyrche hygh aulter anno domini mcccliiii anno domini mccclv thomas forster symon franceys anno xxx thomas brandon xxx yere kynge ye haue herde beyng caleys shortly feast alhalloyne toke iournay towarde frenche kynge contynued iournay tyll came towne named hesden brake frenche kynges parke toke suche pleasure hym lyked whiche season beynge tydynges brought vnto hym yt ye scottes gote ye towne berwyke made dayly assautes wynne castell wherfore kyng made hasty spede returned caleys englande whiche cause sayth ye frenche cronycle yt kynge edwarde fled frenche kynge yt stroge power came amy vnto saynt omers kynge edwarde sped hym scotlande yt moneth ianuary begynnynge xxx yere reygneberwyke recouered xxvii day sayd moneth layd syege ye towne berwyke yolden vnto hym shorte processe tyme doone entred ferther lande subdued ye cheyf townes holdes went pursued scottysshe kynge narowly ende fayne submytte hym ye kynges grace prysoner resygned power kynges hande whan kynge edwarde set coutre rule returned scottysshe kyng agayne englande called courte parlyament westmynster ye whiche amoge thynges kynges auauntage graunted mayntenaunce warres l sacke woll ye terme vi yeres contynued lenger though marchautes stapler therat grutched let v retourne vnto noble prynce edward fyrst begotten sonne kynge whych thys tyme warred vppon frenchman ye precedynge yere touchyd lastly retourned burdeaux wyth many ryche prysoners pyllages great honoure hym selfe greate auauncement hys soudyours countrees whyche passed erles armenake foyze poytyers cleremount wyth syr iames de burbon many knyghtes whyche hadde dowble people testyfyeth frenche cronycle prynce yet passed tholous nerbon fro nerbon burdeaux wythout batayle prynce hadde whyle rested hym hys people sent dyuers hys prysoners englande wyth hys hoste entred prouynce coutre berry moneth iuly made therin sharpe cruell warre whyche season also ye duke lancaster ayde phylyp brother vnto kynge nauerne entred countre constantyne copany iiii thousand men came vnto place called lyseux vpon see coste remoued syege frech men lyen castell vpo viii wekes repayred sayde castell whan kynge iohn hadde leuyed many great summes money ye great grudge hys comons rebellyon sayd comons story kynge iohn shalbe towched preparyd hys hoste fyrst made towarde duke lancaster sayd duke fortyfyed ye passage myghte wynne hym wythout great ieopardye daunger wherfore lafte waye yode castell named bretnell layde hys syege vnto wan ende viii wekes apoyntement yode castell chartres taryed certayn tyme people fro then toke hys iourneye towarde prynce edwarde whyche prynce thys season passed ryuer loyre leyre ye towne romugtyne encountred diuers noble fraunce hadde wyth sharpe coflycte ende god sent hym vyctorye slewe many hys enemyes toke many prysoners amonge ye whych taken lord craon knyght called syr bouciquat wyth dyuers nomber sayth freche boke liiii persos whan sent sayde prysoners vnder saufe kepyng burdeaux sped hym toward towris duke lancaster wyth hys company repayred foresayd castell lyseux bestowed suche ordenauce frech men haste lafte behynde sayd syege toke way towarde bertneyll then vnto euroux brenyng wasting countre townes went then uermeyll perch toke strength towne castell whan spoyled pylled towne set fyre brent great part therof whan done moch wyll coutre retourned brytayne helde hym kynge iohn aboue sayde holdynge hys waye towarde prynce edward came cytye towrys fortyfye sayde towne agayne sayde prynce edwarde wherof herynge prynce toke hys waye toward poytyers holding whyche way testyfyeth ye frech boke parte hys hoste mette hoste frenchman gaue vnto batayle length chasyd multytude slewe hundreth sowdyours toke vpo lx prysoners amonge whych taken erle saucer ye erle iurrygny lord chastelleyn mayster kynges palayes knyghte named syr guyllyam de daneham whyche prysoners also sent vnto burdeaux soone prynce edwarde lodged hym hys hoste nere vnto poytyers shortely came french kyng lodged hym place called frenche chamgny nere also vnto poytyers frotes bothe hoostes laye wythin quarter myle cardynall pernygourt sent pope innocent vi rode bytwene kynge prynce sondry tymes haue agreed treaty peace bytwen yf myght hys laboure haue ben opteyned whan sawe hys laboure myght preuayle departed poytiers taryed ende batayle whych foughten vpon mondaye xix daye septeber yere lorde xiiiclvi begynnyng vi yere sayd kynge iohns reygne shalbe shewed sayde mych foresayde cardynall myght purchase treaty meane peace bytwene two prynces prouysyo made vpon bothe sydes trye theyr mater mortall batayle yt houre two noone foresayd modayne ye duke athene athes noble hym ye french kynges vaweward set vppon englysshe hostethe batayl poytiers whyche myghtely fensyd wyth wood tree suche wyse ye french speres myght wyn vnto therwyth shotte englyshemen fyers sharp turned ouer horse man whyle ye sayde duke athene wyth syr iohn de cleremount marshall frauce wyth thus assayled prynce people vpo one parte duke normandye kyng iohns eldest sonne duke orleauce kynges brother assayled hym vpon nother part two duke leders two stroge hostes sayth ye freche cronycle thre batayls dyd lytle scathe vnto englysshemen reason theyr shotte wouded many slayne yt resydue fledde great dyscomfort french kynges people kynge iohn myght co forted hys people wyth fresshe company set vpon englyshmen wayes kept hole togyder recyued frenchemen vpon theyr wepens poyntes greate force yt ende french men gaue backe vaynquisshed helpe god saynte george slayne wytnessyth ye sayde frenche cronycle nomber xvii hudreth men army besyde meane sowdyours amog whych noble men slayne duke burbone duke athene syr iohn de cleremout marshal frauce syr reynold camyan baneret whyche daye bare oryflambe specyall relyke frenche kynges vse bere batayls bysshop chalons wyth dyuers ye nomber liiii banerettes besyde knyghtes prysoners taken ye batayle iohn kynge fraunce phylyp hys iiii sonne syr iaques de burbon erle poytyau brother vnto duke burbon slayne syr iohn artoys erle ewe syr charlys hys brother erle longeuyle syr guyffarde cosyn germayn vnto frech kynge syr iohn de meleoun erle cancaruyle syr iohn sonne heyre doctour wyllyam archbysshop sen syr symon melon brother vnto erle cancaruyle erle uandature erles dapmartyne uendosme salysbruche moyson marshall deneha many banerett knyghtes men name nombre sayth frenche cronycle xvi hundreth aboue fro thys batayll escaped flyght charles eldest sonne kynge iohn duke normadye duke orleaunce duke aniowe wyth fewe great fame whyche yode streyghte vnto parys shortly called greate cou sayll mater whyche story kynge iohanne shall shewed whan feelde thus fynysshed prynce edward dewe tha kes louynges gyuen god saynt george thys tryuphaut vyctory sayd prysoners sped hym toward burdeaux ye sayd kyng kept tyll easter anno dni xiiiclv anno dni xiiiclvi rycharde notynghm henry pycharde anno xxxi thomas dosell thys xxxi yere say xvi daye moneth apryll ye noble prynce edwarde tha vppon age xxviii yeres toke shyppynge wyth hys prysoners burdeaux arryued englade shortly xxiiii daye maye great honoure gladnesse receyued cytezyns london conueyed vnto kynges palays westmynster wher kynge syttynge hys astate westmynster hal receyued hym due honour conueyed lodgynge hym prouyded laye certayne season ye sayd french kyng vnto place called sauoy whyche thanne pleasaunt palays fayre lodgynge belongynge tyme vnto ye duke lancastre brente dystroyed iak strawe hys fawtours iiii yere rychard seconde nexte kyng englande ye sayd yere shalbe shewed whyche place sayde frenche kynge laye longe wynter folowyng royall iustes holden smythfelde londoiustes holde smithfelde many goodly knyghtly feates army doon great honoure kyng realm gladdyng beholdours whych dysporte present kyng englande frech kyng ye kyng scottes wyth many noble astates iii prouinces kyngdomes wherof partye straungers prysoners anno domini mccclvi anno domini mccclvii stephyn caundysshe iohn stody anno xxxii bartylmewe frostelynge thys xxxii yere pope innocent syxte name sent englande twoo cardynalles treat peace betwene ye two kyng whyche two cardinalles taryed parte yere london place lande brynge theyr purpose effecte sped lytell theyr cause thys yere moste wryters dauyd le bruze kyng scottes delyuered frome castell odyhm hys lybertye whan put kynge edwarde suerty hundreth thousande markes hys raunsome anno dni xiiiclvii anno dni xiiiclviii iohn berne iohn luffyn anno xxxiii iohn burys thys xxxiii yere wytnessyth frenche cronycle syr robert knollys syr iames pype theyr retynewe warred brytayne testyfyeth frenche cronycle moneth marche x daye sayd moneth sayde capytaynes wyth one whyche frenche boke nameth thomlyn fowke came erely mornynge vnto towne nere vnto incerre called kegennes beynge rule englysshmen sayde capytaynes takyng wyth stregth akyng yode streyght vnto foresayde towne ancerre beyng wythin two englyshe myles scaled walles wyth ladder quyt mafully rule town sonne rysynge castell taken prysoner syr guyllyam de chalon sonne erle ancerre hys wyfe many takynge whyche towne castell fewe folkes slayne armed men aboue two thousande sowdyours defende towne englyshmen serched nere como fame wente fande iewellys hadde ben preuy hydyng theym greate value amonge sayth sayd cronycle fande certayne skynnes whyche valued v thousande motons golde ye shall vnderstande moton coyne vsed fraunce brytayneel moton golde value rate sterlynge money vppon v aboute whan englysshemen hadde pylled spoyled towne space viii dayes raunsomed suche substaunce shewed vnto ruler towne wolde sette vppon fyre excepte wold gyue vnto theym certayne summe money whych longe treaty thys mater ruler ye towne haue possessyon therof haue preserued fro fyre agreed gyue vnto englysshe capytaynes xl thousande motons lx perlys valued x thousande motons whyche l thousande motons shulde amounte rate sterlynge money xii thousand v hundreth pownde nere aboute fande wythin ye towne value bare theym excepte iewellys ornamentes chyrch saynt germayne whyche goodes iewelles toke pledge suche money vnpayde foresayd xlm motons golde rausome towne ye whyche goodes towne ancerre bounde vnto hedes chyrch pay redeme ye sayd good feastes mydsomer nexte folowynge ellys paye yerely inperpetuyte ye sayd chyrch maner quyte rent iiim motos wherof ye value shewed fyrst chapyter phylyp iiii ouer thys dweller towne agreed ye englyshmen shuld brenne gate ye towne dyuers partyes towne throw wally grounde uppon iiii dayes folowynge ende sayd agremente foresayd syr iames pype syr otha holande nombre xvi xviii englysshmen entedyng haue wonne enterpryse layd sowdyours place called great semyre taken holden prysoners moneth apryll next ensuyng towne called frenche dabygny sur le metre englysshemen gotten lyke maner fourme foresayd towne ancerre ii daye maye wonne syr robert knolles hys company towne called chasteleyn sur lounayn pylled dyd wyth theyr pyllage prysoners amoge whyche many woman chyldren iiii fyue yeres age sayd englyshme yode new castell vpon loyre ye shall vnderstande partye englysshemen greately strengthed helpe kyng nauerne syr phylyppe brother playnely shalbe shewed frenche cronycle story kynge iohan folowynge thus sayde syr roberte knolles wyth ayde kynges men nauerne dayly wanne many townes stronge holdes brytayne anno domini mccclviii anno domini mccclix symonde wymondham symonde doffelde anno xxxiiii iohn chychester thys xxxiiii yere veryly moneth nouembre ende xxxiii yere kynge edwardes reygne wyth prynce edward duke lancastre wyth puyssant army landed caleys then passed lande vnto artoys uermendoys ye cytye reynes layde hys siege cytye beclypped suche wyse man might entre go cytye without lycece englysshemen whan kynge edwarde lyen xl dayes siege reynes without great dere hurt vnto doyng remoued hys syege passed countre champayne tyll came towne called guyllone ye kynge rested hym season tyme came vnto hym certayne duchye burgoyne lordes dyuers holdes townes within duchery gaue vnto hym ye entent shuld nat molest hurte ye countre iicm floryns golde whyche value sterlynge money xxxvmli ouer sayd burgonyons couenaunted wyth hym wolde mynystre hym hoste vytayles ye countre plentuously hys money done departed frome then yode vnto neuers passed ryuer dyon ion yode colages vpon ion then moneth marche begynnynge hys xxxiiii yere reygn yode countre gastenoys toward cytye parys prynce edwarde hys company passed moret tyll came hold englysshme kept called tournelles cournelles ye towne holde lay season certayne frenchman stronge bastyle assayled englyshmen dayly remoued nat then monysshed prynces commynge trusted moche strength theyr bastyle whyche disceyued wythin v dayes prince commyng theyr bastyle goten many slayne nombre xlvii persones ye company taken prysoners amonge whyche iiii men name ye saye lorde bouyle bonile lorde daygreuyle aygreuyle syr iohn de barres syr wyllyam de plassyes thus kynge edwarde wyth hys people spedyng hys iourney toward parys vppon tuysdaye beynge laste daye marche weke easter came vnto place called hostell chastelon betwene moutlehery chastes lodged hym wyth certayne hys people ye prince lordes hys hoste lodged townes thereabout then vnto towne corueyll towne called longe iumell thanne charles eldest sonne kynge iohn day regent fraunce made meanes treaty whyche laboured freer called symonde de langres prouyncyal freers iacobynes legat pope whose meanes day treaty appoynted holde vppon good fryday maledery le longe iumel daye place apered kynge edwardes partye duke lacastre erles warwyke northapton wyth syr iohan de chande syr waltyer de manuy syr wyllyam cheyny knyghtes reget apered lorde fewe constable fraunce lorde bocy quant marshall fraunce lord sarancyers lord uyg nay coutre uyenne syr symond bucy syr guychard auglye knyghtes whyche treaty came none effecte wherfore kynge edwarde vpon tuysdaye folowynge easter daye remoued frome sayd hostell lodged hym nere vnto parys place named chastellone nere vnto mountrouge residue hoste lodged uauuys uaugerart getylly townes tha vpo frydaye folowynge beynge x daye apryl meanes ye abbot clugny newly sent pope innocet vi forsayd lordes knyghtes agayne assembled place called balye treate accorde betwene kynge regent theyr labour spent vayne ben uppon sondaye nexte folowynge parte ye kynges hoste came towne parys enbataylled theym felde faste saint marcelles taryed frome mornynge tyll thre clocke noone abyde batayle frenchemen whyche made none yssue oute cytye natwithstandynge testifyeth frenche boke within parys daye greate plentye sowdyours ouer besyde greate foyson enhabytauntes whanne englysshemen perceyued shulde haue batayll parysyens aboute thre noone departed feld toke theyr waye towarde chartres vnto boneuale nere vnto chaceadon kynge edwarde lodged place calle dones whych place came vnto hym parys byshoppe beauuayes chauncellour norma dye behaued vnto kynge new daye treaty appoynted holden bretynguy within myle lytell chartres fore sayde vppon fyrste day may next ensuyng whyche daye apoyntemente foresayd duke lancaster wyth sayde erles warwyke northampton sayde place apperyd kynge edwarde regent appered forenamed byshop wyth many lordes knyghtes spyrytuall men nomber xxii person whose name ouer passe lengthynge tyme whyche dylygently behaued hym space viii dayes agreed vpon vnyte peace whyche comprysed xli artycles length rehersed frenche cronycle wherof effecte thys forme p ace betwene englande fraunce fyrste kynge england hys heyres kynges wyth landes hadde gascoyne guyan shulde haue hym hys heyres euer cytye castell poytyers wyth appertenauces lordshyp belongyng also cytye lymoges wyth lades lymosyne theyr appertenauces cytye castell perygorte wyth landes reuenues lordshyppe belongynge erledome bygorre wyth thynges lordshyppe belongyng erledome poytyau wyth appertenaunces sygnorye beleuyle lordshyp exanctys exaucdoure exancon cytye agen cytye agenoys cyty caours lordshyppe caoursyn cytye tarbe cytye countre gaure angoulesme rodes rouern lordshyppe mostruell wyth reuenues therunto belongynge sygnorye caleys marquell sandgate colyngn lordshyppe hammys walys ouye erledome guynes wyth profytes therunto belongynge whyche lordshyppes honour castels towres cytyes townes kynge englange tha edwarde thyrde hys heyres kynges englande shulde haue holde euermore royall wyse lyke maner done kynges fraunce without doyng homage feawty duety kynge edwarde daye hym heyres kynges englande shulde clerely renouce gyue ouer hys tytle ryght interest hadde vnto crowne frauce specyally name kynge fraunce also hys ryght tytle hadde vnto duchy normandye thorayne aniowe brytayne souerayntye erledome flaunders lordshyppes cytyes castelles honour townes towres manours kynge englande daye ryght vnto wythin realme fraunce holde hym cotente wyth aboue named lordshyppes wythout forther clayme forthermore agreed frenche kynge shulde paye hys rausome thre million scute gold wherof ii shuld alway make noble englysh ye shall vnderstad ye million scute xc thousande scute whych extende ye value sterlyng money vnto summe iiclm marke thre milions amounte vnto vii hundreth lm marke whych maketh iuste v hundreth thousande pounde sterlynge money whych iii millios scute xcm payd caleys fyrste daye iuny next folowynge sayd treaty xc thousande millio payde sayde towne caleys within viii monethes ye freche kynge commyn vnto caleys thyrde million payde lo two yeres halfe saye myghelmasse xii monethes agrement made iiii c thousade scute mighelmas next ensuyng iiiicm scute easter nexte folowynge iic thousande scute ful paymet thre millios xxxc thousad scute agreed frenche kynge comen vnto caleys shuld rest hym iiii monethes wherof ye fyrst moneth shuld ye charg kyng edward iii monethes coste charge sayde freche kynge paye eueryche sayde thre monethes yf longe taryed perfourmauce sayde accorde x thousande royal le frauce whyche tyme value ye rate sterlyng money euery royall xxid xiiii sou parys shulde paye monethes charge eyghte hundreth lxxv pounde ouer accorded ye freche kynge iohn ye tyme beynge kyng frauce hym shuld ayde assist scottes agayne kynge edward agayne hys heyres kynges englade kynge edwarde hys heyres kynges shall allye theym flemynges ayde assyste theym agayne sayde kynge iohan hys heyres kynges fraunce tytle ryghte duchye brytayne whyche questyo betwene erles bloys mountford accorded bothe kynges beyng caleys sayd partyes shulde called theym yf peace betwene theym two kynges myght nat set tha sayd kynges assigne certayne indyfferent person agre sayd erles haue halfe yere respyte quyet mater yf sayde persones kynges assygned myghte nat agree sayd erles terme ye eyther sayd erles make beste puruyaunce hym selfe yt eyther coude make wyth helpe hys frendes otherwyse wherby myght attayne theyr ryght clayme sayd duchye prouyded alwaye nother sayd kynges theyr sone shulde ayde assyste ye sayde erles reason wherof peace betweene theym accorded myghte lowsed broken also prouyded ye whether sayd two erles sayd duchy shuld falle sentence man otherwyse homage shall alwaye done ye kynge fraunce whyche ordenaunces agrementes wyth many mo wolde aske longe leysour wryte ratyfyed confermed instrumentes seales ye prynce walys vpon partye kynge edwarde englandes partye charles regent fraunce partie theyr letter patentes sealed apered beryng date one louuers normandye xvi daye may yere grace xiiic lx parys x daye ye sayde moneth yere ouer eyther sayde ii prynces saye edwarde prynce walys sworne presence vi frenche knyghtes vpon sacrament aulter ye thyrde agnus sayd tyme lowe masse foresayd louuers songe sayd ye vttermoste hy power shuld vpholde kepe foresayd peace euery poynt ferre hym lyke maner charles thanne regente fraunce sworne presence syre englysshe knyghtes perfourme whych treaty thus fynysshed ended kyng edward hys ne noble englade toke shyppyng huflete normady vpo xx day may sayled englad leuyng behynde hym erle warwyke gyde englysshemen remayned guyan place se peace whyche tha proclaymed thorough fraunce kept nat broke whyche endured nat loge wythout vyolacyo sayth frenche boke leue parte greate reioysyng honourable receyuyng kyng cytezyns lodo ceromonyes thys season spare thentent may substancyally shewe vnto fynall ende thys accorde trouth thys season ye kynges beyng frauce kyng iohn hys consolacyo remoued sauoy vnto towre london ye kynges retourne fested kynge hys lordes vpon xiiii day moneth iunii viii daye moneth iule next ensuyng frenche kynge mornynge landed caleys lodged castell abode commynge kynge edwarde upon ix day octobre kyng edwarde arryued caleys went streyght vnto castell vysite kynge iohn whyche welcomed hym louynge frendly coutenaunce whan kynge shulde depart lodgyng ye towne frenche kynge requyred hym yt wyth hys sonnes shuld dyne hym vpon morowe folowynge whyche kynge graunted vpon monday folowynge ye xii daye moneth day kynge edwarde fyrst set kept astate secundaryly ye frech kynge thyrdly prynce walys fourthly duke lancastre without mo ye table tyme whych dyner came ye castell erle flaunders whome frech kyng welcomed moste louyng maner whan sayde dyner wyth honour ended ii ye kynges sonnes englade two ye frech kynges toke leue theyr father rode towarde boleyn tyme regent frauce whyche mette theym myd way betwene caleys boleyn co ueyed vnto boleyn rested wyth theym nyghte vpo morowe lafte theym hym selfe came vnto caleys fyrst hys father hys father came bothe kynges palays dyner whyche kynge edwarde receuyed wyth moche ioye honoure made vnto theym sumptuous feaste uppon fourthtene daye octobre sayde regente departed frome caleys retourned vnto boleyn two sonnes kyng edwarde retourned boleyne caleys vppon saterdaye xxiiii daye moneth octobre kyng beyng ii trauersys one chapell caleys masse sayde offeryng masse nother theym came whan pax borne fyrst french kynge eft kynge edwarde eyther refused kysse fyrste frenche kynge rose vp came towarde kyng edwardea peasyble kysse wherof beyng ware rose vp mette wyth hym refused pax kyssed eyther whyche masse eyther solemply sworne maynteyne article sayd peace assuraunce ye many lordes vpon bothe partyes also sworne maynteyne theyr power ye shal also vnderstande thys season frenche kynge ourned thus caleys bothe paymente hys raunsome also deliuery certayn holdes townes yet nat deliuered putte suerties foloweth duke orliaunce duke burgoyn duke burbone erles angeou poyteau bloys alenson saynte poule escamps ualentynoys brame ew longeuyle cacaruyle ancerre dampmartyne uendature salysbruge uendosme vycountes baudemout beawmount ancuerre lordes craon deruall dabyguy cousy fyers preaux saynt uenant garancyers aluerne mountmorency angest also lord wardeyne forestes kynghtes syr wyllyam de craon syr lowys de harcourt syr iohn de laguy syr galtyerde donehame whyche xxxviii persones dyuers theym touched take prysoners ye batayll poytyers whyche agreed many nat payde theyr fynaunce thyrde daye maye laste past shuld acquited kynges fynaunce wyth dyuers condycyos passe ouer vpo morowe folowyng takynge foresayde othe two kynges say son daye xxv daye octobre frenche kyng freely delyuered sayd day noone departed frome caleys rode towarde boleyn whome kynge edwarde conueyed myle vppon hys waye whyche myles ende de parted kyssynge louynge maner prynce edwarde kept hys waye kyng iohn conueyed hym boloyn taryed nyghte vpon morowe sayd prynce edwarde charles duke normandy wyth ye erle escamps noble beynge psent agayn sworne maynteyne holde sayde peace wythout fraude colour dysceyte done sayde prynce takynge hys leue retourned nyghte vnto caleys yt appereth vnto kynge iohn stode prysoner space iii yeres asmoche frome xix day septembre vnto xxv daye octobre whan kynge edwarde sped nedes caleys shalbe shewed yere folowynge sayled englande also noted yt thys yere whyle kyng occupyed warres fraunce touched erle seynpoule wyth army frenchemen sayled aboute border kent sussex laded sundry place rye wynchelsee hastynges spoyled townes slew many ye men dyd moche harme poore fysshers anno domini mccclix anno domini mccclx iohn denys iohn wroth anno xxxv walter borney upon euyn saynt quyn tyne xxx daye nouembre ende xxxiiii yere kyng edwarde begynnynge thys mayres yere kynge toke shyppynge caleys sayled towarde englande bryngynge wyth hym certayne hys hostage saye lowys secode sonne kynge iohan newely made duke aniou mayn erle angeou iohn hys brother newely made duke aluerne berry erle poytyers whyche erledome nowe belonged kynge edwarde reason foresayde treaty also hadde wyth hym syr lowys duke brabant erles alenson escampes whyche nere frenche kynges blode eyghte erles lordes named frenche cronycle kynge laded douer shortly came london ix day nouembre thys xxxv yere men beastes perysshed englande dyuers place wyth thodre lygh tenynge fende sene mannes lykenesse spake vnto men trauayled waye anno domini mccclx anno domini mccclx wyllyam holbech iohn pecche anno xxxvi iames tame thys xxxvi yere prynce edwarde wedded countesse kent whyche wyfe vnto syr thomas holande wyfe vnto erle salesbury deuorsed fro hym maryed vnto sayde syr thomas secod mortalytein thys yere also great mortalitie men england duryng whyche noble duke henry lacastre dyed thys wryters named seconde mortalitie ye seconde fylle thys kynges dayes whan duke henry dede syr iohan gaunt kynges thyrde sonne whyche maryed sayde duke doughter made duke duchye thys yere also sene two castels ayre whereof one appered south east south west ye sondry tymes noone tyde issued eyther hoste armed men mane syght hoste whyche issued oute castell south easte appered whyte apered blacke two hostes apered though faught eche shewed whyte fyrste vyctoryous lastly ouercomen dysapered thys yere also greate company dyuers nacyons assembled theym brye champayne whereof ledders capytaynes englysshemen whiche dyd moche harme fraunce affyrmaunce frenche cronycle thys company whyche called newe company beganne theyr assembles forenamed countre brye kyng iohn delyuered frome caleys whan ware hys delyuerauce departed brye yode champayne toke diuers holdes spoyled robbed dyuers small townes raunsomed many thys yere sayth frenche boke toke brydge towne saynt sprytes vpon daye innocentes xxviii day decembre affermeth policronycon aboute tyme another company lykewyse assembled italye whiche called whyte company molested countre lyke maner moneth apryll folowynge kynge iohn sente erle cacaruyle erles salesbrugh ye marchez forezstes ioyn guy whyche erles theyr retinue met wyth sayd company place named bruke nere vnto lyo sur rosne whych place foughten cruell fyghte ende frenche men ouerset scomfyted sayde erle cancaruyle take prysoner two erles marchez forestes slayne wyth moche como people anno domini mccclxi anno domini mccclxii iohn saynt albones stephen caundissh anno xxxvii iames andrew thys xxxvii yere vppon daye saynt mauryce xv daye ianuary blewe excedyng wynde yt lyke thereof nat sene many yeres passed began euesongtyme ye south cotynued sterne yt blew downe stronge mighty buyldyng wres steples house chymneys cotynued partye suche sternesse space fyue dayes thys yere xxiiii daye sayd moneth ianuary came iohn kyng frauce vnto eltham besyde grenewych dyned daye wyth kynge vpon noone honorably conueyed thorough cytie london vnto sanoye well ye cytezyns whyche mette wyth hym vpo blakheth wel horsed lyuery one colour whyle sayd kynge iohn laye ye sayde place sauoy ye begynnyng march folowyng greuous sykenesse toke hym whych dyed viii daye apryl folowynge begynnynge yere grace xiiiclxiiii caryed frauce buryed saynt denys vii daye may folowynge thys yere kynge edwarde created syr leonel sonne duke clarence syr edmunde hys sonne erle cambryge ende thys yere xvii day septembre began great frost ye whych endured begynnyng moneth apryl reaso wherof moch harme grew ensued anno domini mccclxii anno domini mccclxiii rycharde croydon iohn notte anno xxxviii iohn hyltoste yere came iii kynges englad speke wyth kynge edwarde fyrst ye kyng fraunce kynge sypres kynge scottes xxxviii yere prynce edward sayled burdeaux receyued possessyon guyan ye kynge edwarde newely gyuen vnto hym whyche dyd hys homage hys father lykewyse maner father kynges england wont sayde duchye vnto kynges fraunce batayle da hey vpon myghelmasse day beynge tha vppon sonday castell danhoy fast cytye uaunes brytayne mette ye hostes syr charles de bloys syr iohn de mountfort whyche longe stryue shewed sayd duchy brytayne foughten cruell batayll helpe god englysh archer victorye fyll syr iohn mountfort fyghte syr charles de bloys slayne many frenchemen brytons toke hys partye whyche victorye natwythstandynge wyfe sayde syr charles laye within countre agayne sayde syr iohn made resystence enioyed countre peasyble wyse tha charles vi name newly crowned kynge fraunce ryght woman sente ye arche bysshop reynes marshal fraunce brytaygne sette vnyte restfull peace betwene sayd syr iohn laste wyfe syr charles whyche endeuored well moneth apryll folowynge sayde batayll agreed enherytaunce duchye shuld remayne sayd syr iohn heyres euermore wyfe syr charles shuld holde conteted wyth ye erledome penyture vycoutye lymoges whyche olde tyme belonged ancetours aboute thys tyme ordenaunce statute made sergeauntes prentyses lawe shulde plede theyr plees theyr mother tonge stode shorte whyle anno domini mccclxiii anno domini mccclxiiii symonde mordon adam bury anno xxxix iohn metforde thys xxxix yere wryters kynge edwarde vppon saynt stephans daye fynisshed hys warres wherfore worshyp god saynt stephan thys yere opynyons sayde auctoursfoudacyo saynt stephans chapell westmynster began ye foudacion saint stephans chapell westmynster whyche fynysshed rycharde ii sonne prynce edwarde next kyng englande thys thyrde edwarde anno dni mccclxiiii anno dni mccclxv iohn brykylsworth iohn luskyn anno xl iohn drelande thys xl yere moneth february borne fyrste sonne prynce edwarde named edwarde whyche dyed whan aboute age vii yeres thys yere one named barthran de claycon norman wyth armye frencheme entred lande castyle warred vpon peter kynge lande behaued hym lesse iiii monethes space chased sayde peter hys owne lande crowned hys brother named henry kyng castyle towne called burges vpon easter daye wherefore sayd peter constrayned necessyte compelled come cytye burdeaux haue aske ayde prynce edward thys peter ryghtefull heyre vnto crowne castyle henry hys brother moste wryters bastarde thys peter vyle condycyons hys subgectes hym lytell fauoure warre contynued season betwene hys brother hym shall appere whych prynce edward wyth hys archer toke partye wyth thys peter frenche kynge wyth hys speres tooke partye wyth henry thys yere kynges co maundement adam bury thanne mayre london dyscharged ye xxviii daye ianuary hym electe chosen mayre iohn loue kyn grocer wytnesseth polycronicon paragraph thys yere co maunded kynge peter pen shulde gadered englande payde vnto rome longe tyme ben vsed grauted tyme iuo iewe somtyme kynge west saxon hys story shewed howe dayes kynge forbode yet neuer thelesse thys present tyme season gadered sondry shyres englande anno domini mccclxv anno dni mccclxvi iohn warde iohn louekyn anno xli wyllyam dykman thys xli yere borne secode sonn prynce edward burdeaux named rychardbyrth seconde moneth apryll thyrd daye sayd moneth sayd prynce edward wyth kyng nauerne foresayd peter kynge castyle mette wyth henry bastarde vsurper sayde kyngdome nere vnto towne called domyng wher betwene cruell long fyght howe ende victorye fyll vnto englysshemen henry hys men chased thys bataylle taken syr barthram de glaycon syr arnold dodenhamme thanne marshall fraunce wyth aswell french brytaynes slayne vppon fyue thousande men vpon partie sayde henry vppon xvi hondreth vppon prynce edwardes partye whyche vyctory prynce wyth sayde peter spedde theym vnto cytye burgys whyche yolden shortly theyr commynge holpe sayd peter wynne cytyes holdes taryed tyll moneth august folowynge whych season sayth cronicle fraunce retourned vnto burdeaux wythout paymente wage hys sowdyours hym sayde peter promysed thys season prynce edwarde thus spayne henry bastarde fledde wyth hys wyfe fraunce abode place coutre called carcasson soone warned prynce edwarde retourned vnto burdeaux gadered hym new copany passed moutaynes forestes entred sayd lande castile xxvii daye moneth septembre folowynge citie called calahore yolded vnto hym whervnto hym drewe moche people countre hys strengthe encreased hougely fro then yode vnto cytye burgys ioyously receyued behaued hym suche wyse yt short whyle hole rule lade castyle hys brother fayne auoyde lade seche ayde sarazyns affermeth ye foresayde cronycle thys yere aboute monethe iuny company mynded xxxvi yere thys kynge entred duchy guyan helde doyng moch harme countre lyke hadde done dyuers place fraunce season iiii yeres passed moneth decembre departed then yode coutrees auerne berry moneth february passed ryuer loyre toke waye towarde marcyll entred countre burgoyne euer passed countrees raunsomed men spoyled many townes wente french kyng appoynted dyuers hys lordes knyghtes go agayne yet suche seasos drewe nere vnto wolde suffre theym departe wythout batayl many nombred lxm theyr capytaynes none named howe englyshmen gascoynes pycardes frenchemen men nauerne many nacyons whych cronycle reherseth nat contynued theyr force strengthe longe greate dammage countrees whyche passed thorough normandy gascoygne guyan burgoyne chyef countrees fraunce lyued rauen pyllage great enpoueryssynge sayde countrees townes passed lodged anno dni xiiiclxvi anno dni xiiiclxvii iohn torgolde iames andrewe anno xlii wyllyam dykman thys xlii yere moneth marche apered stella cometa blasynge sterre moneth apryll next ensuynge saye syxt day sayde moneth leonell ye sonne thys kynge edwarde entred cytye parys duke berry burgoyne honourably receyued theym coueyed vnto theyr brother kyng fraunce vnto louure seaso lodged whome also ioyously receyued logged wythin kynges palays dyned souped wyth kynge hys owne table vppon morowe folowynge dyned wyth quene place kynges nere saint poule quene tha lodged paragraph whan dyuer whyle daunsed passed tyme wyth dysportes wyth sayd ii duke agayne conueyed vnto kynge souped hym agayne nyght vppon mornynge beynge tuysdaye sayd duke fested sayde syr leonell place theyrs parys named artoys vpo wednesdaye dyned souped agayne wyth quene vpon thursday morowe folowynge sayde syr leonell toke hys leue kyng quene whyche gaue vnto hym gyftes suche hys copany ye value xxm floryns aboue coueyed wyth noble men erle cancaruyle tyll comen sen wyth knyght tyll came border frauce gaue vnto theym ryche gyftes wyth great thankes contynued hys iourney tyll came vnto ye cytie mylayne shortly maryed doughter galyace duke sayde cytye coutre greate possessyons reason sayde father dyed shortely ende thys yere erles armenak bret perygort wyth dyuers noble duchye guyan appeled prynce walys frenche kynges courte hadde broken peace wronged theym contrary peace stablysshed betwene englande frauce requyred frech kyng yt sayd appeale myght haue due processe agayne sayd prynce whyche sayth french cronicle kynge charles deferred certayne cause towched whyche longe reherce anno dni xiiiclxvii anno dni xiiiclxviii adam wymbynghm symon mordon anno xlii robert gyrdeler thys xliii yere certaynly ende precedynge yere one walter berne mercer vpon day ye traslation saynt edwarde kyng confessoure xiii daye octobre chosen mayre alderman mayre cytye london howe lacke substaunce impedymente nat noted sayd walter vpon daye symonde iude folowynge wha shulde haue taken hys othe guylde halle apered nat wherfore hys rome eleccyon foresayde mayre alderman admytted yere folowynge symonde mordon fysshmonger mayre cytye thys yere moneth marche peter kynge castyle whyche ayde sarazyns dwellyng border spayn hadde wonne recouered somme parte lande castyle encountrede wyth hys bastarde brother henry beforesayde gaue vnto hym batayll nere towne called sybylle longe fyght sayde peter scomfyted moche hys people slayne hym selfdryuen vnto castell oute whyche shortly treason gotte presented vnto hys brother forenamed whose sentece imedyatly byheded whose deth sayd henry enioyed hole lande castyle whych infortunytie myschauce fylle thys peter dyuers wryters moche cruelly slew hys owne wyfe ye doughter duke burbon thys yere moneth maye kynge fraunce hys hyghe court parlyamente holde parys proceded iugemente vpon appellacyons made erle armenak lorde bret erle perogort agayne prynce edward towched precedynge yere wherupon dyscorde varyaunce began take place betwene ii kynges moche yt meane sayd iii lordes natwythstandyng sworne kyng englade trewe lyege men dyuers townes countre poyteaw yelded frenche kynge albeuyle rue partye sayde townes sayd countre wherupo ambassades sente vppon bothe partyes dyuers meanes treaty comoned whyche conteyneth longe werke wyth resonynge made vpon conclusyo came none effecte breche peace whych betwene ye ii kynges substacially concluded broke eyther kyng partye made prouysio warre moch ye kynge charles spedde hym roan normandy ye moneth iuly rigged nauy set theym forewarde warre vpon englande whyche tyme season ye kyng charles thus occupyed normady duke lacastre laded caleys stroge company archer warryours fro then passed thorouene ayre wastyng countre irne fyre went wherfore ye french kyng defence partyes sente duke burgoyne puyssaunt armye withstade sayde duke lacastre whych duke burgoyne sped hym wyse yt ye xxiiii day august lodged hys hoste vpon moutayne turnehan nere vnto arde english hoste lodged betwene gygowne arde ye frountes hostes within myle betwene whome dayly skyrmysshes small bykerynges without notarye batayll wha sayd duke burgoyn thus kept sayde mount fro xxiiii day auguste vnto xii day septebre remoued hys hoste yode vnto hesde whych dede blamed kyng charles hys brother whych departure frechemen duke lancastre hys hoste tooke ye waye towarde caus caux passed ryuer sume rode toward harflew entendynge sayth freche boke haue fyred frenche kynges nauy theyr comyng thyder ye towne strogly maned yt dyd lytell scathe wherfore sayd duke departed shortly then spedde hym countrye poyteau came vnto towne albeuyle wythout frenchemen encountred hym gaue vnto hym batayll whych taken syr hugh chastelon knyght knyghtes esquyres burgeyses towne vpo xvi score frechmen slayne whyche sayde prysoners nombre fyue fourty sent vnto caleys ye duke hys company yode vnto burdeaux spoylyng frechme went anno dni xiiicxlviii anno dni xiiiclix iohn pyell iohn chychester anno xliiii hugh holdyche thys xliiii yere moneth ianuary dyed erle warwyke caleys retourned duke lancastre whyche man great fame ye moneth august dyed noble woman quene phylype wyfe vnto edwarde thyrdedethe phylyppe whyche greate benefactoure vnto chanos saynt stephans chapell westmynster soon dyed dame blauch somtyme wyfe henry duke lancastre buryed poules vpon thsyde hyghe aulter husbande ordeyned hym iiii chautres euer annyuersarye yerely kept whych ouer great thynges set vnto deane chanons churche ordeyned mayre beynge presente masse shuld offre id take vp xx shyryffes eyther peny receyue eyther marke ye chaberlayn cytie x sword berer visviiid euery officer mayres present xxiid euery offycer nombre viii eyther theym viiid admytted shyreffes whyche obyte thys daye holden reason lande decayed forenamed summes ben greately mynysshed mayre thys daye hath visviiid bothe shyreffes syxe eyghte rate thys yere also kynge helde hys parlyament westmynster whych graunted vnto hym iii fyftenes payde iii yeres folowynge conuocacyon clergye also grauted vnto hym iii dysmes payde lyke maner thys yere iii mortalitie wherof dyed moche people suche morayne fyll also amog beastes lyke therof nat seen many yeres vppon ensued excessiues rayne corne therwith drowned erthe bukked wyth water yere ensuynge whete xld busshell ye ende ye moneth iuly syr robert knollys accopanied dyuers noble men soudyours entred saint omers wha executed theyr pleasure ye countre enuyro rode vnto arras wastynge spoylyng ye cou tre went whan bret bulwerkes sayd town arras passed noyn uermendoys brente house wolde nat gyue due raunsome thus holdynge theyr waye passed ryuers oyse syre came vnto citie raynes passed ryuer rode towarde troyes passed ye ryuers aube sayne helde theyr waye saynt floryntyne passed ryuer ion holdyng theyr cours towarde ioyngny corbueyll esson essoyn vppon mondaye beynge xxii day septembre sayd englysshemen lodged theym vppon mount saynte albone countre vpon wednysdaye folowyng enbataylled felde betwene townes iunye parys whyche season passed wythout batayll thorough foresayd countres spoylyng raunsomyng inhabytautes therof wythout resystens impedymet yt cytye parys day xiic men armes waged frenche kynge besyde sowdyours strengthe cytezeyns cytye yet sayde hoste englysshemen lay sayd enbataylled tyll paste noone foresayd daye tyme moche credibly enfourmed shulde haue batayl brake theyr feld sped place towne called antoygny lodged ye night vpo morowe toke theyr iourney warde normandy iiii dayes labour tourned theyr waye towarde estampys escamps beause gastenoys pyllynge domagynge coutrees done contynuynge theyr iourney tyll came erledome angeau wanne strengthe town uaas ruylly stronge holdes thereabout ye deuyll wold rote enuy dyscorde lorde fytzwater lord grautson fyll variauce wyth syr robert knolles hys companye whyche grewe great hatred dyspleasure syr roberte knolles wyth floure archer sowdyours departed sayd two lordes leuynge theym forsayd townes uaas ruylly tha yode brytayne whereof whanne certayntye broughte vnto frenche kynge anone comaunded syr berthram de glaycon newly made marshall fraunce wyth stronge armye entre sayde countye angeou make sharpe warre vppon sayde englyshmen whych vpo twelf daye octobre folowyng layde syege vnto sayde towne uaas whereof issued oute sayde lordes fytzwater grautson gaue vnto marshall batayl ende dyscomfyture fyl vnto englysshemen theym slayne vi hundreth reste put vnto flyght whyche taken ye sayd lorde grauntson wyth done sayd syr barthra yode vnto towne uaas gat assawte also ayne vpon thre hundreth englysheme put flyght many taken prysoners thys sayd barthram pursued english men fledde vnto towne called uersure assawtynge sayd towne slewe toke prysoners vpon iiiic englyshme thus stryfe dyssenc amonge theym selfe amyte good accorde victours paragraph hatered dyscorde slayne taken prysoners anno domini mccclxix anno dni mccclxx wyllyam walworth iohn berne aonn xlv robert gayton thys xlv yere begynnyng mometh marche archebyshoppe wynchester beynge cardynall presente auynyon wyth pope gregorye xi name put commyssyon wyth archebyshoppe beauuays make treate peace vnyty bytwene two realmes englande fraunce whych sayd cardynall wynchester hys departynge pope came downe toward meleoune sayd archbysshop also cardynall beauuays honourably mette conueyed vnto cytye melcon whan restyd vpon iiii dayes two cardynalles ensemble sped vnto parys wyth kyng charlys communycacyo towchynge sayd peace hys pleasure knowen sayde archbysshop cardynall toke hys leue coueyed toward caleys toke shyppynge sayled englande shewed vnto kynge pope pleasure wyth frenche kynges answere thys yere folowynge somertyde guya made foughten many dyuers skyrmysshes whyche partye englyshemen put vnto worse many slayne taken prysoners dyuers holdes townes taken specyally countre lymosyne fyrste daye moneth iuly cytye lymoges wyth coutre lymosyne forsayde vnder obeysaunce frenche kyng wytnessyth frenche cronycle wherof occasyon affermeth englyshe bokea taske e ynge mych prynce edward lately arreryd inhabytauntes cytye countre greate greuous taske theyr great hurte enpouerysshyng meanes wherof loste loue people whan frenche kynge hadde thus opteyned rule coutre lymosyne immedyately sente syr barthram de glaycon erledome poyteawe poytyers wane many townes castels lastly layde hys syege vnto rochell folowynge yere shalbe shewed mayres ende good merytoryous dedes shuld holden memorye noted mayre thys yere beyng ioha bernys mercer gaue vnto comynaltye cytye london chest wyth thre locke keyes therin thousande marke redy money wyllyng keyes therof yerely kepyng thre sundry persos mene mayster ye felysshyp mercery haue one mayster felysshyp drapars second thyrde kepynge chamberlayne cytye therin sayde thousande marke kept entent tymes cytesyne wolde borowe money shulde haue space yere laye suche summe wold haue plate iewellys suffycyente gayge excedyd summe hundreth marke occupyenge therof yf lerned saye hys pleasure de profundis soule iohn bernys christen soules often tymes hys summe comprysed x markes borowed x marke shulde saye ouer prayer yf xx marke saye twyes rate yf lerned saye often hys pater noster thys money lent gyded thys daye cheste remayneth chamber london wythout money pledge anno domini mccclxx anno dni mccclxxi robert hatfelde iohn berne anno xlvi robert gayton thys xlvi yere moneth february kynge edwarde helde hys parlyamente westmynster whych asked spirytualtye lmli moch ye laye fee whych temporal graunted clergye kepte wyth plesaunt answeres kyng hys cousayll dyscontented moche theyr dyspleasures dyuers offycers chaunceler pryuye seale tresourer remoued beyng spyrytuall men theyr offyces place temporall men set shortly foresayde cardynall beauuays came englande treate peace betwene ii realmes spedde nothyng effect therof wherfore moneth iuly ye frenche kyng sente countre poyteaw forenamed syr barthram de claycon wyth stronge armye wan dyuers holdes fortress englyshmen whyche season kynge edwarde strengthyng coutre specially defende ye towne rochell aboue yere shewed yere besieged sayd syr barthran sente erle penbroke wyth noble men forty fye sayde towne remoue ye syege myght wynne sayd towne encountred flote spaynardes whyche kyng henry castyle sent fraunce strength french kynges partye whyche flote longe cruell fyght sayde erle taken wyth syr guycharde de angle nombre c thre score prysoners partye hys men slayne drowned wyth losse many good shyppes begynnyng moneth septembre folowyng gascoygne borne man good fame whome kyng england admytted hys lyeutenaunt gouernoure countre poyteaw named le captall de bueffe faughte wyth armye frenchman towne named sonbyse conclusyon hys men slayne chased wyth lxx hys partie taken prysoners duke berry burgoyne vppon vi daye septembre came rochell certayne communicacios ye ruler sayd towne delyuery therof passe tyme season kyng edward heryng takyng erle pebroke losse dayly hys men dyuers partyes fraunce also ieopardye ye towne rochell stode made hasty prouysyon entendyd haue passed see wynde co traryous myght haue passage wherfore retourned sayth policronico agayne land vpon viii daye septembre beforesayd captayne rochell hauynge coforte short rescous yelded vppon certayne appoyntementes sayde towne vnto forenamed duke vnto frech kynges vse shortely also yolden theym townes angolesme exactes sait iohn de angely wyth dyuers anno domini mccclxxi anno dni mccclxxii iohn phylpotte iohn pyell anno xlv nycholas brember thys xlvii yere wrestelynge holden vpon blake heth besyde london slayne mercer londo named iohn northwode whyche greate dyssencyon grewe amonge felyshyppes ye cytye houge dystourbaunce good season rancoure thereof myghte duely appeased thys yere also duke la castre syr iohn gaunt syr edmude brother erle cambriged wedded two doughters peter whyche late kynge castyle put deth hery hys bastarde brother haue shewed xliii yere thys kyng reygne ye whyche two doughters syr iohn gaunt maryed eldest named co stance hys brother yonger named isabell maryages ii bretherne claymed enherytours kyngdome castyle spayne thys yere duke brytayne receyued many exortacyons requestes frome frenche kyng haue hym vpon hys partye sente certayne sowdyours englishman strengthed thys castelles holdes wherof heryng kyng charles sent thyder wyth stronge power forenamed syr barthran de claycon warnyng theym make warre vpon enemye vnto house frauce whyche accordynge theyr co mission entred lande brytayn wastyng irne fyre shorte processe yolden vnto hym partye chyef townes excepte brest aulroy deruall ende iuny sayde syr barthran layd syege vnto brest lord craon wyth laye daruall whyche season duke brytayne englande soone hadde sayd bestowed foresayd englyshe sowdyours sayled englande speke wyth kynge edwarde moneth iuly duke lacastre wyth syr iohn de mout forde duke brytayne myghty puyssaunce landed caleys rested certayn day rode vnto hesden lodged within parke season passed dourlos benquesne vnto corbye passed ye ryuer rode vnto roy uermendoys rested space vii dayes whych terme ende set fyre vpon towne toke theyr way towarde laemoys burned spoyled countre wet processe tyme passed ryuers osne marne aube rode thorugh chapayne erledome brame streyghte vnto guy passed ryuer seyn towarde ye ryuer leyr vnto marcynguy ye nery whan passed sayd nonnery kepte theyr waye towarde ryuer ancherre vnto burdeaux whyche iourney passed wythout fyghte batayll natwithstadyng great hurte domage dyd vnto ye townes coutres passed excepte place towne called orchye knyght frauce called syr iohn de uyenne encountred l speres xx archer strayed theyr hoste set vppon theym slew parte theym toke resydue theym prysoners frenche boke sayth moche lacke meate theyr horse paynfull thynges iourney theym happened though iournay vnto englysshemen honorable ryde ferre kynges lade vnfoughten wyth yet theym paynfull cosyderyng manyfolde chaunces fallynge theym losse horse thynges duryng passage anno dni mccclxxii anno dni mccclxxiii iohn awbry adam bury anno xlviii iohn fysshyde thys xlviii yere sente fro pope beyng xi gregory archebysshop rauenne bysshop carentras treate peace betwene ii kynges englande frauce whyche assembled bruges flaundres whyther also kynge edwardes partye came duke lancastre bysshope londo wyth charles frenche kynge appered duke burgoyne bisshop amyens whyche comyssioners spente greate parte lente disputacions thys matter partyes frenche kynge desyred lycence legate myghte ryde vnto parys shewe vnto ye kyng offycers englysshe partye retourne hys pleasur wherupon agreed certayne shulde ryde shew vnto frenche kynge yt englysshemen abode styffely vpon souerayntye kynge englande hys heyres kynges shal enioy former landes comprysed peace made betwene hym iohn kyng frauce shewed xxxiiii yere thys kyng wyth homage duyte doynge thys matter sayth ye frenche cronycle kyng charlys assembled parys great parte ye noble hys realme wyth many wyse doctours dyuynite haue case suffyciently argued debated whyche cousayl plenerly determyned kyng myght nat gyue ouer sayd souerayntye without great peryll hys soule shewed diuers resons whan thys reporte brought vnto bruges ye sayd treaty dissolued wythoute conclusyon takynge excepte peace contynued tyll feast sayntes next ensuynge anno domini mccclxxiii anno domini mccclxxiiii rycharde lyon wyllyam walworth anno xlix wyllyam wodhowce thys yere vnderstande begynnynge thys mayres yere ende xlviii yere kyng edwarde new page missing wyse coplayned vpon kyng yt throwen pryson lay many yeres kyng edwarde created rychard sonn prynce edward prynce walys gaue vnto hym ye erledomes chester cornewayll also kyng waxed feble sykely betoke rule lande vnto syr iohn gaunt duke lancastre ordeyned hym gouernour lande whyche contynued durynge hys father lyfe thys yere also tenautes menyall seruautes erle warwyk made ryot vpon monkes euyshm slewe hurte many abbottes tenauntes spoyled brake hys closure warynnes sewed theyr pondes water dyd vnto many displesures vtter
