ruyne monastery ne kyng soner haue sente downe erle hys letter chargynge hym sease withdraw hys men ryot whych afterwarde pacified without notary punysshement suche person begynners executours ryot anno domini mcccxcvi anno dni mcccxcvii androwe pykman nycholas bembre anno lii nycholas twyforde thys lii yere xii daye moneth apryl syr iohn mynster worth knyght certayne tresons whych conuict mayre iustyces kyng guyld halle thys foresayd daye tyborne put execucion meane hanged heded quartered hys hed sette vpo lodon brydge cause whose dethe moche beynge put trust kyng receyued greate summes money paye wyth kynges sowdyours whyche kepte vnto hys owne vse deceyued kynge hys sowdiours whan therof kyng accused feryng punysshement fledde fraunce conspyred newly agayne natural prynce lastly taken receyued hys meryte hysmein thys yere also began woderfull cysme churche rome deth pope xi gregory chosen ii pope wherof fyrst named vi urba seuenth clement fyrste italy borne frencheman whyche ensued suche dyscorde eleccyon pope terme xxxix yeres euer ii pope suche auctorytye harde doughtefull knowe whether indubitat pope dethe kynge edwarde thyrde vpon xxii daye moneth iuny dyed hys manour shene called rychmout kyng edward ye thyrde name wha reygned li yeres v monethes odde dayes leuyng hym iiii sonnes saye leonell duke clarence iohn gaut duke lancastre edmund lagley duke yorke thomas woodstok erle cambrydge whyche sonnes wyth noble hys realme honourably co ueyed fro sayd manour shene vnto monastery westmynster solempnely wythin chapell saynt edwarde vppon south syde shryne wyth thys epytaphyor superscrypcion table hangyng vpon hys tombe phic decus anglorum flos regum preteritoru forma futurorum rex clemens pax populorum tercius edwardus regni complens iubileum inuictus pardus pollen bellis machabeus whych thus vnderstade mother tuge folowynge englyshe kynges lieth beauteuous floure passed myrrour shall sue mercifull kynge peace conseruatour iij edwarde deth whome maye englysshme knyghtehode due lyberde inuict feate marciall worthy machabe vertu peregall phylyp de ualoys erle ualoys sonne charles de ualoys brother vnto ye iiii philip admitted protectoure realme frauce begynnynge moneth february vpo trynite sonday next ensuyng hys wyfe crowned raynes ye yere lord god miiicxxviii ii yere kyng edward iii tha beynge possessio crowne englande betwene thys philip sayd edward kyng englande deale story iiii yere charles v towched great disputacions argumentes arose betwene theyr cousayles right tytle crowne frauce thought cousayl englade moche edwarde cosyn philip le beaw sonn ye sayd philippes doughter mo chylder edwardes mother shuld rather kyng frauce philip de ualoys cosyn germayn philip le beaw sonne hys brother charles whych dispucios argumentes fynall coclusion olde decre law auctoritye parlyament loge made enacted woma shuld enheryte crowne frauce therfore ye tytle edward myght frechemen put thys philip admytted gouernauce whych direccio thus take specially ye meanes syr robert erle artoys thys philip anone proclamed reget frauce vnto tyme quene wyfe charles v whych tha wyth chylde delyuered receyued rule lande reget tyme wherof peter remy principall tresorer kyng charles last dede whyche peter lyuyng sayd charles accused myspedyng ye kynges tresoure enrychyng hym selfe cotrary ryght reason yt goodes shuld estemed iiiicmli parys money wherof ye value set diuers place werke take pryson areygned parys conuict adiuged vpo xxiiii day marche drawe thorugh cytie hanged vpon como gybet parys vpo fyrst day apryll folowyng old quene wyfe charles laste kyng lighted chyld brought forth doughter boy uincet named blanche wherfore sayd philip de ualoys ruled reget nowe allowed take kyng crowned sayd citie raynesphylyp de valoys ioned kyng fraunce ye quene wyfe vp trinite sonday wha ye solepnyte hys coronacio ended assembled hym hys cou sayll lowys erle flaudres receyued hym homage sayd erledom done besought kyng ayde oppresse certayn townes hys coutre whych rebelled agayne hym wherunto ye kyng grau ted counsayll exortacion syr gautyer walter de crecy co stable fraunce kyng sent oute hys commyssioners chargynge hys lordes theyr assygnes sowdyours mete hym dyffesyble arraye cytie arras mary magdaleyne day next ensuyng whyche day kyng lordes people meting toke forewarde vpon hys iourney sped hym toward cassyle town flau dres within lytell space towne pyght hys pauylyons tetes wasted pylled coutre thereabout flemynges kepynge within sayd towne fered nothyng french kyng dyrision hym hys lordes caused red cok paynted vpo whyte cloth wrote greate letter ye sayd clothe thys tyme folowynge haged ouer walles quant ce quoc chantera e roy troue ca entrera pwhych thus meane vulgare speche whan thys cok lo doth synge shall thys founde kynge hys hoste brynge wha thys redde frech men report made therof vnto kynge therwyth sore amoued specyally yt named hym founde kyng therfore assayled strogly vppon partyes towne defended theym manfully theyr enemyes none aduauntage kynge sente syr robert de flaundres knyghte erles certayne sowdyours commaundyng hym assayle flemynges toward saint omers erle monysshed yt hys people shuld assayle towarde yle comos bruges ipre tourney fourneys cassyle assembled theym prouyded certayne shuld kepe mount cassyle another company shulde kepe coutre towarde tourney thyrde hoste shulde fortyfye countre towarde yle whiche people ordered euery hoste hys lymit hym assigned dayly skyrmysshed wyth frenche men betwene men slayne vpon bothe partyes whan kyng thus lyen towne certayn season flemynges nat feryng theyr enemyes issued oute towne pyght theyr tetes vppon mounte cassyle shewed boldly vnto theyr enemyes tha kyng phylyp seynge boldnesse flemynges howe lytell fered hym toke cousayll hys lord myght cause dyscede hylle longe kepte ye hyll iuperdous perylous stye towarde theym lastly agreed kynge hys lordes syr robert de flaundres wyth shuld assayle holde town thereby called terroner de bergner meane wherof kyng thoughte wolde discende mount rescue sayd towne accordyng ye kynges mynde done bulwerke set vppon fyre kynge neuer rather hys entent kepte theyr gate sure wyse french kyng al hys great power myghte theym scathe moche kynge consyderynge theyr strength condyscended famysshe hunger myght nat wynly stregth toke ye lesse watche regarde hys people suffered play dysport theyr harneys eche others tente thynkyng hym sure hys enemyes assaute warre theym procured attempted agayne hym hys lordes whether hys enemyes warned theyr owne courage pryde wolde assayle frenche hoste vpon xxiiii daye auguste towarde ye nyght sayde hoste flemynges aualed mount secrete wyse men watre myght drewe towarde french men whych tha vnarmed theyr disportes dysynge playeng chesse game uppon whome flemynges came sodaynly yt slewe many theyr enemyes forced many fle toward saynt omers theyr sauegarde flemynges helde theyr waye tyll came nere vnto kynges tent tha also vnarmed noyse crye beynge warned haste armed hym whyche season god wolde frenche hoste certayne marshallys frenche hoste wyth stronge company retorned ye assaute holde therby encountred flemynges helde wyth batayll whyle kynge lordes made redy processe flemynges closed wyth theyr enemyes sharpe cruell fyghte wherin defended theym vygorously ende losse felde iourned vpon flemynges yt capytayne named slaynediscomfyte flemynge wyth many nombre xviiim aboue wytnesseth frenche boke ouer many whyche taken prysoners poore men artyfycers multitude gentylme vpo erles partye whyche victorye thus opteyned kynge anone caused ye sayde towne cassell set vpon fyre yode vnto bruges yolden vnto hym lyke wyse ipre poperynge fournays tournaye terrouer many good townes yolde vnto hym amonge whyche gaut nat named wherfore deme none townes yt thys season rebelled tha short proces folowynge kyng rule hole erledome flaunders delyuered possessyon therof vnto lowys foresayde erle cou tre retourned frauce wyth pompe leuynge erle hys countye flaundres whyche dyd cruell iustyce vppon hys subiectes put deth dyuerse tourmentes rakkynge heddynge hangynge sondry townes place hys lordshyppes vpo nobre xm ouer aboue many dyuers whych banysshed som fewe yeres many som euermore secode yere thys kyng phylyp lyke shewed thyrde yere kynge edwarde sayd edwarde made hys homage vnto sayde phylyp ye towne amyas duchy guyon countye poytyers soone thys phylype sente flaundres dyuers bysshoppes noble men whose meanes ye gate brug ipre courtray townes abated throwen downe fere lest sayde townes wolde oft rebell agayne hym theyr erle thys yere also syr roberte de artoys began hys plee parlyamet agayne iohan countesse artoys erledome claymynge ryght therof certayne endentures couenautes maryage betwene syr phylype de artoys hys father dame blauche brytayne hys mother whyche wrytynges ben longe tyme kept hym newly founden haue better expedicion hys matter brought vnto kynge erle alenson duke brytayne dyuers noble whyche made request hym kyng yt might haue iustyce countesse came duke burgoyne lowys erle flaundres dyuers noble men makynge lyke request ryght syr robert shewed forth wrytynge sealed wyth seale army erle artoys conteynynge whan maryage solepnysed syr phylyp de artoys father sayd robert dame blaunche doughter vnto duke brytayne mother vnto sayd robert accorded sayd syr phylyp hys father gaue vnto ye sayd dame blau che heyres erledome artoys whiche wrytynges instaunce prayer countesse artoys delyuered ye court kept sayeng sayd wrytynges vntrewe couterfeted upon whych sayde countesse brought suffycient prouffe sayd wrytynges falsely made sealed gentylwoma doughter vnto lorde dygnon castell bethune yt whyche lerned astronomy yt toke vpon shew thynges come wherin somtyme happed vpon soth oftener fayled meanes whyche woma olde chartre sealed wyth seale forenamed syr phylip foud whych craftely toke set vpon new writyng made ye auau tage sayd syr robert artoys presented vnto sayd syr robert sayenge yt founde town acras ioyfully receyued made hys tytle clayme vpo matter thus hagyng kyng hys lordes iii yere hys reygne ye cytye parys due prouffe made vpon sentence gyuen agayne syr robert artoys hys great dyspleasure moche sayd openly made kynge shalbe dysmyssed yf maye fered caste pryson ye french kyng therefore conueyed hys horse goodes secretely vnto burdeaux vpon geroude toke shyppyng passed englande hys sayd horse treasour hym selfe yode vnto hys cosyne duke brabat whome bode certayne tyme passed englade excyted kyng edward hougely make warre vpon frenche kynge iiii yere ye reygne phylip sayd syr robert proclaymed open enemy crown fraunce hys landes seased frenche kynges handes banysshed lande euer excepte within moneth easter next ensuyng wolde come ye kynges court submyt hym hooly vnto kynges grace whyche sentece passed agayne hym moche apered nat ye vi yere reygne philip wyfe syr robert artoys yt whych syster vnto kyng philip accused great occasioner offence husbad ye childer sent gastenoys holden strayte pryson ye viii yere hys reygne kyng philip vysyted diuers party realme ye doynge vysyted many place pylgrymages promysed seche restitucio helth eldest sonn iohn tha duke normady whych ye yere meane sekenes great ieopardy lyfe cotynuynge sayd iourney rode vnto auygno vysyted ye pope beyng benet xii ye name wha sped hys nedes wyth hym yode prouynce mercyle se nauy retourned burgoyne duke royally receyued feested season tarieng coplaynt brought hym ye sayd duke agayne syr iohn de chalon clayme certayn lades within duchy whych variaunce apese kyng toke therein somme payne direccion myght set therein yt sayd duke syr iohn departed wordes dyffiauce shortly ye sayd syr iohn accompanyed dyuers noble almayne entred ye duchy burgoyne therin dyd moche harme coutre people gat certayne castelles fortyfyed almaynes tha ye duke hauyng ayde ye kyng nauerne duke normady ye erle escaps flaudres as eged ye castel chausy ye ende vi wekes wan ye yode vnto cytye besenson layd siege also wha leyne loge season fayne coclude trewes host vytayll reason whych pea trewes ye hostes deseuered ende ye warre vnparfyted ende folowynge meane ye frech kyng dyreccio take betwene sayd tyes thys yere kyng philip sent certayne messegers vnto kyng edward vpo certayn demaudes ye castel yautes ye cotrauersie fyrst bega kyndle betwene sayde ii prynces ye x yere edward touched yeres folowyng ix yere philip apered blasyng sterre whych ensued greate mortalytye within realme frauce aswel men beestes yere nother ye prouynce lagedok named arnolde normady heded hanged vpo ye comon gybet parys asmoch hys meanes proued englyshme wonne castell paracoll x yere kynge philip kyng edward englad sent syr barnard de bret flaudres cause touched shewed xii yere sayd edward ye xi yere philip kyng edward sayled brabat alyed hym wyth lowys ye empour whyle frenche kyng taryed hys hoste saint quyntyne uermandoys kyng edward entred fraunce spoyled brent parte treresse nat without note cowardyse arrected frech kyng hys hoste hys owne subgectes yere began towne gaute rebell wyth townes flau dres mocion iaques de artyuyle xiiii yere shewed kyng edward thyrde twelf yere thys philip whych ye frech boke calleth yere confusyon kynge edwarde beynge retourned englande frenche kynge assembled myghty hoste go agayne henauders flemynges brytons came sayde hoste vnto arras sent then part hys people hys sonne iohn duke normandy henaude warre vppon countrey whyche went streyght vnto cambraye layd siege castel called esthandune wythin xv dayes folowynge frenche kynge hys father came vnto sayd syege wyth innumerable people whiche castell thende moneth kynges comynge gyue vp apoyntement done ye kynge remoued hys siege castell bysshoppe cambray named thune standynge vpon ryuer lescaut kynge laye longe tyme withoute harme doynge vnto ye sayde castell lengthe duke brabant erle gerle stronge hoste dyuers nacyons came remoue siege frenche hoste lay vpon one syde ryuer brabanders vpo meane iiii brydges whych made ouer ryuer bothe hostes sondry tymes mette faughte dyuers sharpe skyrmysshes losse people vppon bothe partyes ende castell betyn wyth gonne yt capytayne therof put hys mouables shyp wyth sowdyours lefte entred sayde shyp sette castell vppon lyght fyre wherof whan frenche kynge ware haste caused walles scaled entred stanched fyre nyght hoste brabanders departed also whan kynge ha thus thys castell sente duke normandy burgoyn vnto towne named quesnoy whan ye sayd duke brent parte towne vyllages retourned agayne vnto ye frech hoste shortly kynge retourned fraunce made prouycyon sende forthe hys nauy mete wyth kyng edwarde whych nombre iiii hudreth aboue whyche xv yere edwarde thyrde shewed mette englysshe nauy place called ye swyn ouercommen thys great victory thus opteyned kynge englande frenche kynge wyth great hoste herynge comfortable tydynges discomfiture syr roberte de artoys towne saynte omers xv yere kyng edward also shewed sped hym tyt came pryory saynte andrew taryenge wyth hys people certayne lettres sent hym kynge edwarde wherof tenour answere set forsayd xv yere mater apparteynynge actes bothe prynces whan peace concluded betwene sayde kynges ye sayd xv yere declared ye kyng frauce retourned hys owne ye xiii yere hys reygne dyed iohn duke brytayne whose deth charles de bloys iohn de mountfort claymed seuerally enherytours duchy whyche charles sonn vnto erle bloys neuew vnto frenche kynge reason margare hys syster mother vnto sayde charles whych charles maried doughter guy de brytayne vycount lymoges secode brother forenamed iohn duke brytayne sayd iohn de moutforte thyrde brother vnto forsayd iohn duke brytayn dede thys questyon thys clayme rested vpon thys poynt whether doughter secod brother shuld enheryte ye duchy ye yonger brother consideryng yt iohn eldest brother dyed without heyre hys body guy seconde brother without heyre male wherfore thyrde brother iohn de moutfort claymed duke brytayne whiche case question brought ye frech kynge hys lordes debated argued longe season ye ende sentence passed agayn syr iohn de moutfort charles de bloys put possession ye duchy kyng philip whome sayd charles dyd hys homage thys sentence arose mortall warre betwene sayde syr charles syr iohn whych ii kynges englande frauce toke partye kyng edwarde ayded syr iohn de moutfort kynge philip hys neuew syr charles thanne syr iohanne de mountforte sentence gyuen feryng sequell departed fro court gat hym stroge towne brytayne held hym wherof kyng philip beynge aduertised sente syr iohn sonne duke normady hys brother syr charles erle alenson warre vpon ye sayd syr iohn de moutsort sped theym nobre people brytayn besieged stroge castell stadyng yle ye ryuer loyer wynning therof yode vnto ye citie nautes ye cytezyns yelded vnto without stroke soon testifieth ye frech story vpo certayne codicios couenates ye sayd syr iohn de moutfort yelded hi vnto ye duke normady ye whyche set hym vnto ye kyng father parys sayd kynge imprysoned castell louure fauour otherwyse escaped pryso ii yeres prysonemet wryters ii yeres deliuered vpon certayn codicions wherof one yt shulde nat come brytayne thynge medle haue ye coutre thys prysonemente syr iohn de moutfort nat withstading warre maynteyned brytayn ye fredes sayd syr iohn many town castelles therof holde vse ye sayde syr iohn wherof shew vnto ye circustau ce proces wolde aske loge tyme ye coclusion fyne warre shalbe shewed ye story ye vi charles sonn kyng iohn xv yere philip erle salysbury accopanied syr roberte artoys noble entred brytayn ayded fredes syr iohn de moutfort doyng great domage ye coutre bret moche ye french kynges nauyd th syr robert artoys assaylyng wherof syr robert artoys wouded thygh gunne whereupo laye syke vpo ye ensued flux therof dyed coueyed englade buryed soon kyng edward entred frauce wyth strog army pea wene hym freche kyng condiscended certayne terme laboure ii cardinales ye xvi yere kyng edward declared yere kynge philip arered taske people called gabell freche prouyded yt subiect ye kynges within hys lade shuld bye salt kynge hys pryce ouer arered lowed coynes money hys lande greate auautage hym selfe enpouerisshyng sayd subiectes meane wherof fyll great hatered hys people xvi yere hys reygne great dyscencion grewe amonge noble normady reason partyes takyng wyth iohn harecourt wyth syr roberte barthran marshal frauce couenautes maryge apoynted betwene ye sonne sayde syr robert vpo one partye ye doughter syr roger bacon whose wyfe maydes mother maryed vnto syr godfrey de harecourt brother aboue sayd syr iohn vppon partye varyauce wherof greate warre lykely haue ensued yf kynge sooner nat sent strayt commaudement eyther partye shulde kepe hys peace apere hym hys lordes parys haue theyr greuauce hym hys lordes determyned whyche day apperaunce sayde syr godfrey appered nat none hym cotrary kyng commaudement assyeged syr wyllin berthran bysshop bayn brother foresayd syr roberte beyng castell whan sawe myght nat preuayll agayne hym drewe vnto englysshme ayded agaynst frenche kynge thys yere also kynge phylype entendynge releue duchye burgoyn wyth whete whyche scat ordeyned certayn quarter whete shulde gadered countrees terroner orleaunce gastenoys sent burgoyn ye studyautes orleaunce burgeyses comons cytie toke therwith grefe one mynde wente downe vnto ryuer loyer ye season certayne shippes laye freyght wyth vytayll vnto sayd countre fet grayen spoyled suche wyse moche therof came neuer good done many company beynge nedy poore yode vnto vyllages robbed ye people dyde moche harme wha prouost ruler orleauce behelde thys rage ryot people cosydered multytude theym forbare tyme tyll somdele asswaged wyth suche company hys offycers toke certayne theym put theym sondrye prysons tyll knew farther kynges pleasur nat longe affynyte herynge enprysonement theyr felowes assebled theym newe lyke woode men ranne vnto prysons nat lonely delyuered theyr felowes also many whych laye great cause crymes suche codempned deth theyr transgressyons whan noticio great outrage ryot came vnto ye kyng anone sent thyder ii knyghtes hys court puyssaunt army chargyng take suche occasyoners begynners thys riot many founde culpable put vnto deth whych knyghtes accordyng theyr commission wyth ayde ye prouost orleauce toke suche dempte gylte thys cryme haged vpon common gybet galous cytye amonge whych dyuers clerkes one deaken within order yere moneth auguste noble knyght brytayne called syr olyuer de clycon treason yt hadde conspyred agayne kyng philippe fauoured kyng edward partye taken trayne iustes tournamete holden ye cause parys shortly iudged deth fyrst drawen cytye vnto place iugement theruppon scaffold purposely ordeyned byheded hys body chaynes hanged vpon gybet hys hed standyng ouer vpo stake auctour vnto ye cytye nauntes brytayne pyght vpon gate ye cytye moneth syr godfrey de harcourte whych sayde alyed hym kynge edwarde wolde nat apere certayne sommons opely banysshed traytour enemy ye crowne fraunce moneth syr iohn de moutforte delyuered pryson vppon condicions rehersed ye xiii yere kyng soon put vnto deth parys syr iohan de malestreet syr godfrey de malestreet father sonne syr iohn de moutalbone syr wyllyam de bruys syr iohn de cablat syr iohn de plessys knyghtes esquyres iohn de malestrete neuew ye forsayd knyght guyllm de bruze robert de bruys iohn de senne dauy de senne shortely parys put execucion thre norman knyghtes affynyte fauour whych borne towarde syr godfrey de harecourt theyr heddes sent vnto saynte loup constantyne cytye normady whych sayd knyghtes called sir wyllyam bacon syr roulande de la roche tessone syr rycharde de percy xvii yere thys philip one mayster henry de malestrete clerke deake brother aboue named syr godfrey put execucion whych sayd mayster ry mayster requestes kyng philip moch ye deth hys sayd brother yode vnto kyng edward cousayled hym agayne kyng philip assygnemet kynge edwarde set great auctorite wythin towne uannys brytayne whych towne goten frenchme therin one chefe capytaynes taken imprysoned within castell parys whyche thys season taken then set tumbrell thereunto fastened wyth chaynes yren coueyed bareheded dynne crye thorugh ye hygh stretes parys tyll came vnto ye bysshoppes palays parys deliuered vnto bisshop soon vertue commissyo purchased kynge philip pope haue sayd mayster henry dysgraded depryued degree ordres churche tha deliuered vnto execucioners whyche iii day cotynuall certayn season ye day set hym vpo ladder ye syght people ye entet euery man chyld might throwe hym fylth ordour ye strete whiche done without compassion pyte cruell wyse thyrd dayes ende dede buryed vnreuerently sayde xvii yere kynge philippe also shewed xix yere kynge edwarde thyrde iaques de artyuele whych especiall promoter sayde kyng edwardes cause came vnto ye towne gaunt shewed vnto theym dyuers apoyntmentes holde betwene theym townes flaudresiaques de artyuese murdred vpon xv day iuly diuers cospiratours sayd towne gaunte pursued one house lastly slayne murdred kynges englande great displeasure hurt wherefore sayde kyng edwarde fayne retourne englande wythoute spede hys purpose lyke ye sayd xix yere reygne declared thys yere also moneth decembre dyed syr iohn erle moutfort sayd claymed duchy brytayn lefte hym sonne named also syr iohn erle moutfort whyche lykewyse claymed sayd duchy brytayn maynteyned warre agayn syr charles de bloys hys father done xviii yere kyng phylyp fyrste daye iuly parys putte deth cruel execucio cytezyn compeyn named symonde poylet man greate ryches whych sayd open audience ryght crowne fraunce belonged ryghtfully vnto kyng edward kynge philip fyrste hanged vpon tree lyke oxe haged bochery dismembred fyrst army ye legges cut hys body lastly hys hede stryken trunke hys body hanged chaynes vpo commo gybet parys vppon saterdaye beynge xxvi day august foresayde xviii yere kynge philippe foughten cressy batayll expressed xxi yere kynge edwarde thyrd floure chyualry frauce slayne taken prysoners soone kyng philippe defence charge hys warres asked subsidie monkes saynt denys amog certayne iewelles place demauded greate crucyfyx golde standynge ouer ye hyghe aulter monastery wherunto monkes answered yt mighte nat departe crucifyxe eugenius thyrde name pope accursed al layd hande vpon crucifyxe entent remoue place appereth wrytynge set vnder ye fote sayd crosse whyche answere kyng pacifyed moneth decebre syr godfrey de harecourte wyth towell double folden hys necke came vnto ye presence kyng philip yelded hym holy hys mercy grace whyche graunted vnto hym hys pardon shorte whyle lumbardes vsurers wythin ye realm fraunce taken sente dyuers prysons suche persones stode bouden vnto bargeyn lone money way vsury ordeyned ye sayd persones beyng dettours sayd vsurers shulde paye pryncypall dette vnto kynge theyr dayes payment resydue whyche remayneth vsurer hys lucre gayne lone hys money shulde pardoned dettour sayd lumbardes vsurers delyuered pryson payenge greate greuous fynaunce xix yere thys philippe moche wytnesseth frech cronycle ye flemynges great manacis perforce constrayned theyr erle assured bonde assuraunce vnto doughter kyng edward contrary hys volute wyll sayde erle nat wyllyng accomplysshe maryage easter weke cautele deted flaudres came ye frenche kyng parys whome honourably ioyously receyued yere one named gawyn de belemount aduocate spirituall lawe entendynge betray ye cytye laon acqueynted hym poore dwellyng citie meaus named colyn tomelyn ye whych tyme fled cytye laon tha lacke substauce comyn meaus mayntened poore lyfe ye whyche thys gawyn resorted releued lastely whane thoughte somdele hym assured brake vnto hym hys mynde sayd wolde ruled hym wolde restore hym hys former prosperite welth wheruto thys colyner grau ted tha anone thys gawyn shewed hym lettre wylled hym bere vnto ye kyng englad certayn rewarde hym gyuyng also promysyng moch yt retourned hym shortly ye citie raynes aswere ye wha thys poore indyget man receiued lettre cast many elles hys mynde fynally co trary othe promyse toke hys waye towarde french kyng presented hym ye letter ye whych expressed maner ordre sayd citie lao shuld betrayed whan kyng aduertysed circumstaunce thys treason enfourmed colyner shuld behaue hym selfe beryng hys answere prouyded hys tyme accordynge though ben englad conueniet day came vnto hym raynys accordyng former appoyntmente whych season kynge sent secrete maner vnto prouoste raynes soone sayd colyner shewed sayd gawyn answere yt sayd gawyn shuld attached vnto pryson whyche accordyngly executed short processe folowynge moch within ordres prouost sent vnto ye cytye laon put bisshoppes pryson whan ye comos ye sayd cytye harde suche beyng prysoner wolde haue betrayed theyr cytie assembled great multitude wold haue broken pryso ye ende haue slayn hym paciently answered bysshoppes offycers yt retourned vnto theyr house upon morow folowyng cease ye rumour ye peple brought vnto iugement condempned dymeryte vnto perpetual pryson therunto added yt diffamy shame shulde sette tumbrel vpon hygh bareheded people myght seen moste shamefull instrumentes lad throughe hygh stretes ye cytye brought agayn vnto ye bisshopes pryson remayne terme lyfe nat fer maner co ueyed ye offycers fro ye gaole comons fyl vpon hym crye castyng myre stone halfe way lad hys circuyte progresse stoned deth body buryed within maroys nere vnto sayd cytye shortely parys done cruell deth cytezyn ye sayd citie enteded haue betrayed sayd cytye parys ye treason fyrst dismebred legges armes haged nek vpon gybet parys yere aboute ye feest saynt iohn baptyst ye englyshmen yt holde towne castell called roch aryan brytayn terme two yeres passed season besieged fiersly assauted syr charles de bloys frendes furyous maner yt rent wyth great ordenaunce dyuers place castell walles processe threwe downe rofe cha bre wyfe capytayne castell lay chyld bed ferre put fere ruler towne castell grauted delyuer towne castell ye sayd syr charles wyth myghte departe theyr lyues goodes ye whyche offer hys payne charge refused short tyme syr thomas agorn englysshe knyghte wyth stroge company archer sowdyours rescowed sayd towne castell loge fyght great dauger loge proces declared freche story ye sayd syr thomas toke sayde charles de bloys prysoner slewe many hys lordes shortely touched ende xxii yere kyng edwarde whych victory thus opteyned hys prysoners put suer kepynge toke ye ordenauce duke left ye felde wyth pyllage put wythin towne castell aforesayd ye vyllages coutre ayde duke agayne towne castel therfore sayd syr thomas punysshed sayd vyllages ruralles greuous fynes helde great seruytude daunger ouer ye slewe many theym many helde drudge captyues thys done englysshmen repayred agayne walles suche place tyme beten downe force sayd syege strengthed theyr best maner nat longe ye kyng phylype requeste coutre sent thyder lord caron wyth stronge army whome also great multytude people countre resorted wyth whose aydes sayd lorde assayled sayd town castell ii dayes contynuell englyssheme deffended selfe vygurously threw vpo theyr enemyes hote boylynge oyles gresys fyre cole hote asshes wherwith greued theyr enemy paynfully thus cotynuyng siege meanes treaty offered codyssended yelde towne condicyo mynght saufely depart theyr lyues goodes frechemen brytons wolde nat agreable assaute began new lord caron encourage hys sowdyours henge purse therein l scute golde vpon sperys ende cryed wyth lowde voyce fyrste entred towne shulde haue sayde l scute golde whan ianuays sowdyours cytye ieane cytye italye harde promyse theyr cheuytayne certayne theym longe pycaxses sharpe approched theym vnto ye wally demeaned lesse v houres mynded wall fyll thereof testyfyeth sayde frenche cronycle lengthe l fote reason wherof entred fyrste ianuays hole hoste whych compassyon pyte slewe man woman chylde came theyr waye nat sparynge chylder souked vpon mother brestes spoyled robbed towne euery man gettynge myght owne aduauntage whanne frechme brytons thus miserably slayne many englysshme also brytos inhabytautes towne assayled castel ye fled vpo iic xl englyshme dyuers assautes offered sowdyours castell yt wolde yelde castell theyr lyues goodes saued finally agreed theyr body onely departe coueyed x mile vpon theyr waye towarde place wolde appoynt vpo ye appoyntement ii knyghtes brytons yt saye syr syluester de la fulle syr wyllm de stratton receyued theyr cote coueyed great payne nat without losse theyr enemy ye hoste caste stone theym bete theyr staues dyuers theym dyed remenaunt broughte nere vnto castell power englysshemen named quyntyne whan commos ye town nere harde comynge suche englysshmen vnder saufe conduyt whiche batayl roche arian syr charles de bloys taken slayne theyr lord meane lorde quyntyne anone issued oute towne fonde lytel resystence theyr guydes slew theym excepte one whych capytayne englyshme whych one ye sayd knyghtes caused set vpon hys horse fledde fro peryll wha cruell brytons thus shamefully slayne englyshmen gadered ye cariens vp hepe suffered theym lye ye ende beastes foules myght deuoure shorte tyme ye erle flaudres meanes frech kyng left doughter kynge edwarde maryed vnto doughter ye duke brabant xx yere phylyp ye town calays goten lyke circumstauce thereof declared xxii yere kyng edward thyrd yere mortalite sykenes whych reygned englande reygned nowe feruentely fraunce moste specially cytye auynyon force wherof ye thyrde parte people ye cytye dyed frome then came vnto saint denys vnto parys coost feruent yt dyed ii townes ouer bre lvim within ye space xviii monethes thys yere dolphyne uyen named syr ymberte solde hys dolphynage vnto frech kyng became freer lyon vpo rosne ordre freer prechours blacke freers xxi yere thys phylyp charles fyrste begotten sonne iohn duke normady eldest sonne thys phylip toke possession sayd dolphynage uyen moneth august folowyng dyed ye duchesse normady mother sayd charles moneth decembre folowynge dyed dame iane quene frauce doughter robert duke burgoyn thys yere treason wroughte syr godfrey de charny haue agayne wonne towne calays lyke haue shewed xxiiii yere kyng edward ye iii ye moneth ianuary next ensuynge ix day kyng phylyp spoused hys ii wyfe blau che somtyme ye doughter ye quene nauerne lately dyscesed whyche syster vnto erle foyze whyche espousayles secretely done manour robert erle bray sayde kyng philip wydowe frome xii daye decembre nynthe daye ianuary whyche space xxviii dayes vpon ix day moneth february iohn duke normandy eldeste sonne thys philippe spoused hys seconde wyfe iohanne countesse boloygne towne called miriaux nere vnto meulene morned hys wyfe whych named ye good duchesse normandy terme vi moneths ii dayes lackynge xxii yere kyng philip moneth iuly syr thomas de agorne befornamed chauce medly slayne bryto knyght called syr raufe de cuours vpon xxiii daye august folowynge dyed syr phylyp de ualoys kyng frauce wha reygned ouer ye frechmen great vexacio trouble space xxii yeres lackynge v monethes odde dayes enterred saynt denis fyrste wyfe left hi iohn duke normandy hys heyre pof kynge iohn iohn fyrste name sonne phylype de ualoys began raygne ouer frenchme moneth august yere lord mccc l xxiiii yere edwarde iii kyng englande crowned raynes xxvi day septembre folowynge wyth dame iohanne hys wyfe tyme whych solempnite kyng iohn dubbed hys eldeste sonne dolphyne uyen lowys hys ii sonne erle aleson knyghtes noble men vpon xvi daye noue bre folowynge syr rauffe erle ew costable guynes wha frenche whych newly commen englande ben longe prysoner accused treason commauded vnto pryson parys within whyche pryson shortly byheded ye presence duke burgoyne noble thyrde yere kyng iohn viii day ianuary charles kyng nauerne caused slayne towne aygle normandy syr charles de spayne costable frauce whych murdre sourdyd great warre betwene kynge iohan sayde kynge nauerne whych contynued many yeres natwithstadyng sayd kynge nauerne maryed doughter ye sayd kyng iohn tha meditacio frendes pea dryue betwene theym kyng iohan shuld gyue vnto ye kyng nauerne contetacyon certayne summes money yet owynge vnto hym dower hys wyfe certayne landes within duchy normandy ouer freche kyng shuld pardone suche persones consentynge deth constable murdred whych treaty thus concluded kynge nauerne vnder assuraunce hostage came vnto kyng iohns presence parys taried season departed dyssymulacion eyther partye vsed shall appere iiii yere kyng iohn syr godfrey de harecourt whych wyth hys sonne hadde ben consentynge vnto deth constable fraunce reconsyled agayne kynge whyche ensensed hym agayne kynge nauerne meanes theyr sinister report peace betwene theym cocluded dysapoynted broke soone vpon thys syr robert de loryze chamberlayn vnto kynge iohn auoyded courte fere leste sayde syr godfrey hadde shewed hym thynge kynge yode vnto kynge nauerne normandy whose commyng kynge nauerne departed shortly then sped hym towarde auynyon nat longe kyng nauerne departed normady kyng iohn sped hym thider seased landes kyng nauerne wythin duchy putte offycers ruler hys castelles townes suche hym lyked dyscharged excepte vi castelles saye euroux le pout audemer chirebourt ganeray auranches martaygn whych holden seruau te kynge nauerne men nauerne borne moneth ianuary folowynge syr robert de loryze abouenamed vnder safe conduyte came vnto kyng iohn parys hym proces reconsyled thys yere artycles peace betwene kynges englade frauce prolonged tyll feaste saynt iohn baptyst next ensuynge ye ende xxviii yere kyng edwarde length declared thys v yere kyng iohan moneth apryl sent syr charles hys sonne dolphyne uyenne normandy aske ayde normannes agayne kynge nauerne whyche graunted vnto hym iiim men theyr charge iii monethes moneth august folowynge kynge nauerne accompanyed iim sowdiours came vnto castell constatyne taryed sayd people wyth whose comynge sowdiours forenamed vi castelles well comforted robbed pylled al ye coutre som sayde sowdiours came vnto castell ye frech kynges named co ket wa stregth vytayled maned moste warly wyse dyd many thynges ye freche kyngs great displeasure warre thus cotynuyng medyacio fredes kynge nauarn rode vnto ye dolphyn towne called uale de rueyll metyng eyther shewyng louyng coutenaunce vpo ye xviii day septebre togyder toke theyr way toward parys kyng nauarne brought vnto french kynges presence excused hym trespass done agayn kyng syne ye tyme ye last accord besechyng ye kyng good gracius lorde vnto hym shulde hym sonne oughte vnto fader trew man vnto hys soueraygne lorde kyng ye meanes ye duke athenesse forgaue vnto hym hys offeces promysed stade hys good gracyous lord eyther deted louyng maner soone kyng iohn gaue vnto ye dolphyn uyen syr charles hys eldest sonn ye duchy normady ye whyche dyd vnto hys father homage ye house mayster martyn chano parys ye cloyster mynster called noterdame auctoryte parlyamet holde citie parys grauted vnto kyng iohn thre astates hys realme yt meane spiritualte lord noble ye hedes ruler cytyes good townes hys realme shulde haue xxxm waged yere defede hys auncyent enemye kynge england puruyauce wherof certayne persones sayd iii astates assebled shortly prouide ye leuieng great sume money whyche prouysion sessing agreed concluded sayde persones commyssyoners sente dyuers coostes good townes leuyeng sayde money towne arras fyll dissencyo betwene ryche poore towne poore sayeng ryche men layde burthen vpon poore men self bare lytell charge none thys fyrst began great altercacion wordes en uyed stroke stripe h de chyef burgeses towne xvii men slayne day folowynge slewe iiii mo banysshed dyuers yt tyme absent towne towne arras rested gydynge poore artyfycers towne vi yere reygne kynge iohan moneth marche beynge accopanyed secret meny ye daye departed towne manuyle rode streyghte hys lordes beyng armed vnto castell rouan entred sodaynly fande chyefe hall castell syr charles hys eldest sonne duke normandy charles kynge nauerne syr iohn erle harecourt ye lordes preaux grauyle lorde cleremout syr lowys syr guylliam de harecourt brethern foresayd erle syr fryquet de fryquante lorde tournebu syr manbuc de mamesmares colinet doubliec iohn de pou talu esquyres whych lordes knyghtes kyng toke dyner within ye sayd halle toke sodaynly diuers put vnder sure kepyng soone kyng take small short repaste sonnes noble hys copany toke theyr horse rode felde vppon baksyde castell whether shortly brought bandes foresayde erle harecourt lorde grauyle ye foresayd syr bue colinet doubliet whyche iiii beheded bodyes drawen gybet roan hanged theyr heddes set ouer vpon gybet whyche tyme execucion hedyng sayd iiii persones frenche kyng sayde present proper person whyche execucion ye kynge vpon morowe folowynge delyuered many prysoners yt remayned mo prysoners iii kyng nauerne syr fryquet de fryquant iohn de pountalu whych sent vnto parys kynge kepte castel louure ii chastelet whiche tyme hys inprysonemet syr phylype brother kynge wyth syr godfrey de harecourt vncle erle lately heded helde certayn castelles normandy came theyr power countre constantyne helde maugre frenche kynges wyll pleasure moneth apryll syr arnolde de denham marshall frauce rode ye kynges sond vnto arras without great distourbaunce towne toke vpo hu dreth suche made ye former rebellion within vpon day folowyng caused heded market place vpon lx remenaut sent vnto pryson abyde ye kynges pleasure thys tyme season noble prynce edwarde burdeaux warred vpon frenche kynges landes lyke shewed xxx yere kyng edward thyrde vii yere kyng iohn begynnyng batayll poytyers ye whych kyng iohn taken prysoner prynce edwarde many hys lordes take slayne xxx yere foresayd edwarde declared leght scomfyture duke normandy whyche hardly escaped sayde batayl entred cytye paryz xxix daye septembre called great cousayll ye thre astates ye realme xv daye octobre next ensuynge assebled daye sayde duke wyth sayd iii astates realme beyng ye parlyament chambre peter de la forest archebysshop roan chauceler frauce declared greate mysfortune lande lately falle takyng theyr hed prynce exorted theym loge oracio ayde assiste euery hys power redeliuery theyr prynce agayne whereunto answered theyr clergy spyrytual mouth mayster iohn de carone tha archebysshop raynes noble ye cheualty frauce mouth syr phylype duke orleaunce brother vnto kynge iohn commos good townes frauce mouthe stepyn martell burgeys parys prouost eyther shulde helpe vttermost theyr power prayed myght haue conuenient leyser cou sayll commo prouycio whyche theym graunted sayde thre astates helde theyr cousayll fryer mynours gray fryer parys space xv dayes whyche season appoynted amonge theym bre l persones take vyew make serche certayne thynges tha myslad euyll gyded within realme whyche l persones wha appoynted vi selfe go vnto duke ye name ye made request vnto ye duke wolde kepe secrete thynges entended shewe vnto hym request grauted tha shewed vnto duke realme tyme hadde ben mysseguyded offycers excepte remedye shortlye fouden shulde stade greate parell loste wherfore besought hym dyscharge suche wolde name vnto hym ouer yt forfayte theyr goodes vnto kynges vse fyrst named mayster peter de la forest archebisshop roan chauceler frauce syr symode de bucy chyfe counceloure kyng chyefe presydente parlyament syr roberte de loryze tyme chaumberlayne vnto kynge syr nycholas brake knyghte mayster kynges paleys engueram celer burioys parys vndre tresourer frauce iohn pryll burioys also soueraygn mayster money mayster thaccomptys kyng iohn chanean de charter treasourer kynges warres whyche offycers sayde persones wolde shuld dyscharged royall yces euer also sayd constytuted persones wolde yt kynge nauerne delyuered free fro pryson also hym selfe wolde cotented aduertysed couceyled suche wolde appoynte vnto hym saye iiii prelate xii knyghtes xii burioys whych xxviii person shu shulde haue auctoryte rule ordeyne thynges necessarye realme set put oute offycers apperteynyng realm wyth dyuerse requestes whych vnto duke nothyng agreable upon whyche requestes duke gaue answere yt wolde gladly fele opynyon hys couceyll vpon shape vnto reasonable answere fyrste desyred knowe ayde iii astates wolde gyue vnto hym delyuery hys father wherunto answered clergy grauted dyme halfe payed yere wyth maye haue licence pope ye lordes asmoche leuyed theyr lades ye comos x peny theyr mouable gooddes tha vpo morne folowynge within ye palays louure ye duke assembled hys cousayl shewed vnto desyre requeste iii astates wherupon made many reason many message sent betwene duke refourme parte sayde artycles fermely answered theym excepte wolde reforme sayde defautes coferme hym vnto theyr myndes como welth lande wolde nat ayde hym theyr gooddes lyke hym shewed wherfore duke secrete meanes sent letter vnto father shewyng vnto hym circumstauce hys matter whyche wrote vnto hym agayne wyse shulde agreable vnto sayde requestes tha duke ye ende wolde nat mater shuld towched open parlyamet sent suche persones chyefe ruler sayde iii astates hym came clergy archebysshoppes raynes lyos bisshop lao lordes came syr warayne de lucebourgh syr iohan de comflas marshall champeyne syr iohn de pygueny tha ruler gouernoure artoys comos stephan martell prouost marchautes parys charles cusake good townes duke shewed vnto certayne newes lately receyued kynge hys father done asked theyr aduices whether beste ye daye shewe theyr requestes openly parliament chaumber elles deferre daye lastlye many reason made agreed shulde deferred tyll iiii daye whyche iiii daye ye duke wyth assembled parlyament chambre whyche season duke sayd myght nat entende day argue sayd requestes certayn tydynges lately receyued father vncle emperour almayne tha shewed opely dyssolued daye counsayll moneth octobre ye iii astates prouynce languedocke auctoryte erle armenake tha lieutenaut ye kyng assembled make ayde ye kynges delyuerauce fyrste agreed puruey theyr propre costes vc army wyth seruyture eueryche spere ouer sowdyours horsebacke arblasters wyth iim called pausyers frenche whiche waged hole yere speres haue theyr custrun euery daye halfe floreyn euery sowdyour arblaster viii floryns moneth ye pausiers rate also forther ordeyned sayd thre estate laguedocke man shulde furrys greate pryce woman shulde leue ryche atyre theyr heddys neyther perle golde vppon syluer vppon ther gyrdels longe kynge remayned prysoner also maner mynstrellys ye season shuld put sylence wyth dyuers thynges weale prouince whyche wolde aske longe leysoure wryte upon sowlyn daye seconde daye nouember duke normandye aduyce hys counceyll dyssoluyd couceyll thre estate assembled parys commaunded euery man retourne vnto without effecte growynge theyr longe counceyll assemble wherwith many sayd person greuously myscontent sayeng amonge selfe aperceyued well thys done duke entent requestes deuysed shuld take place olde mysgouernaunce shulde contynue lyke befortymes done wherfore dyuers assembled agayne graye freres made dyuers copyes sayde requestes ende eyther myghte bere theyr countreys shewe vnto good townes duke couceyll thus dyssoluyd asked ayde ye cyty parys good townes maynteyne warrys playnely answered myghte ayde hym without sayd thre estate agayne reassembled graunte ayde myght passe theyr authorite wherunto ye duke wyse wolde agreable moneth noueber aforesayde syr robert de cleremout lyeutenaunt duke norma dy fought wyth syr phylyp brother vnto kynge nauerne syr godfrey de harcourt toke party agayne frenche kyng deth neuewe put deth kynge iohn whych knyghtes wyth helde parte countre constantyne within normandye maugre duke power sayde fyghte vyctory tourned vnto frenche partye sayde syr phylyp chasyd syr godfrey de harcourt slayne viii hudreth men party fourth daye december folowyng castell de la pount nere vnto roan longe season ben rule forenamed syr phylyp gyuen vp appoyntement whyche duke sowdyours ben besyeged moneth iuly daye holder sayd castell departed wyth theyr goodes vi thousande frankes reward yeldyng vp ye sayd castell franke value sterlyng money ii therupon upon ye x day december proclaymed parys certayne coynes value money newly ordeyned duke couceyl wyth whyche proclamacyon comons cytye greuously amouyd reformacyon prouoste marchauntes wyth yode vpon seconde day folowynge vnto castell palays louure treat syr lewys erle angeou brother vnto duke lyeutenaunt whyle sayde duke gone vnto cytye meaus speke wyth charlys bohemye beaume emperour almayne vncle vnto sayde duke sayde prouoste wyth made requeste vnto erle wolde cease vse money yf wolde demeane shuld suffered put forth taken within ye cytye wherupon answered erle wolde take aduyce hys counceyll vpon morowe gyue answere upon daye folowynge sayde prouost wyth greate company ye cytye retourned whyche season erle curteyse maner desyred retourne daye moche yet suffycyentely commonyd couceyll upon morne sayd prouost retourned wyth moche greater company longe debatynge mater agreed ye sayd erle prouost hys company money shuld stopped put fourth tyll hadde knowlege duke pleasure knowlege wherof erle sent forth messegers spedy wyse thys passetyme peter de la forest archebysshop roan chaunceller fraunce made publyshed cardynal xxiiii daye moneth ianuary duke retourned vnto parys wyth ye sayd cardynall hys company whych reuerece cardynall fette cytye wyth processyon ceremonyes well clergy cytesyns xxvi daye moneth ianuary prouoste marchauntes parys cyty apered duke counceyll saynte germayns desyred sayd prouoste shulde suffer forsayde money ronne curraunt thorough cytye whyche sayde prouoste wyth hys company vtterly denyed many greate bolde wordes departed sayde counceyll greate ire theyr retourne vnto cytye encensyd comynalty set parte werkmanshyp occupacyo shyttyng theyr shoppes drewe vnto theym theyr armour harnesse whan duke enfourmed thys murmour comynaltye cytye sent vnto prouoste commaundyng hym strayghtly kynges peace kepte wythin cytye ouer certeyne cytesyns shulde apere hym palayes louure vppon morowe folowynge houre assygned houre sayde prouoste wyth hys company came vnto louure conueyed parlyament chaumber duke wyth hys counceyll present ye duke certayne chalengys made vnto prouoste hys obstynacy thys mater mysledyng comynaltye cytye sayde vnto hym kynge hys prerogatyue myght hys pleasure auautage make money whan wolde suffer curraut thorough realme yet weale ease hys subiectes consyderynge theyr manyfolde late charge cotent thys season thys newe money shulde spared iii estate shuld agayn assembled shulde depryue suche person beryng office shulde thynke preiudycyall realme ouer ordeyne suche money myghte benefycyall ye land whiche grautes ye prouost ye entent myght authoryte shewe vnto comynaltye cytye desyred wrytyng whyche duke appease people though deale co trary hys mynde pleasure grau ted vnto hys request whych graunt dyuers sayd offycers chaunceller cardynall absentyd selfe came parys tracte tyme xxx daye ianuary ensuynge duke requeste sayde prouost sent certeyne offycers vnto house syr symonde de bucy syr nycholas brake enguerran celer iohn prylle whyche wyth accusyd mysgouernaunce realme whose house sayd offycers kepte inuentuaryes made suche goodes remayned wythin sayde house done duke sent commyssyons thre estate shulde reassemble parys xv daye february next folowyng whyche obserued kepte whan ye sayd iii estate agayne assembled parliament chaumber parys presence duke hys brethern wyth dyuers noble frauce mayster robert coke bysshop laon co maundement sayd duke made longe preposycyon mysguydynge kynge lande meane yll offycers well chaungynge money many vnlefull excysys taskys greate inpouerysshynge comynaltye reame greate dysclaunder kynge synguler enrychynge auauncement sayd offycers wherfore iii estate prayen specyally poore comons offycers may remoued theyr offyces shall thought benefycyall kynge hys realme admitted cardynall noted pryncypall ye noumbre xxi wherof ryghte nere vnto duke whyche preposicyon oracyo thus sayd bysshop ended syr iohn de pygqueny name iii astates offered sayde iii astates shuld gyue vnto kyng xxxm hole yere wyth thynges myght daye ordered bysshop deuysed whyche artycles vnto duke grauted inconuenietly offycers named clerely auoyded ye sayd iii astates though moste necessary put chosen theyr roumes excepte olde maisters thaccomptes presydentes maysters requestes holden tyme practes shewe vnto ye new shuld ordre guyde sayd offyces xxvi daye moneth marche newe money proclaymed thorough parys suche sayde iii astates newly deuysed upon vi day apryll proclaymed parys ye people shulde nat paye suche subsydes ye iii astates ordeyned wagynge xxxm men aforesayde kynges fynauce also sayde iii astates daye shulde assemble cause mater touched tyll farther knowlege ye kynges pleasure whych proclamacion cytezyns parys greuously amoued agayne bysshop s erle ewe cousyn germayne kynge agayn erle cacaruyle whose meanes sayde thys proclamacyon purchasyd treuth sayd archbysshop sen wyth sayd ii erlys sent kynge burdeaux yet beynge entent shuld se sayde proclamacyon put vre soone sayd proclamacyon made herynge murmour people cytye sped then shortely vpon ye comons waxed wyld lefte theyr occupacyons drewe couentyculys co panyes hadde many vnsyttyng wordes kynge hys counsayle wherof auoydynge inconuenyency duke commaunded watche kepte wythin cytye bothe daye nyght certayne gate cytye kept shytte remenaunt watchyd wyth men armes upon eyght daye apryll beynge easter euyn nother proclamacyon made contrary vertue wherof charged foresayde subsydie shulde leuyed also thre estate shulde reassemble parys xv daye easter procede vpon mater begonne upon vi day apryll frenche kynge shypped burdeaux conueyed englande lyke shewed ye xxxi yere kynge edwarde aboute mydsomer folowyng ye duke lancaster whyche longe season lyen towne brytayne named rosne brake vp hys syege takyng towne fynauce lxm scutys golde scute worth xid sterling feste mary magdalene moneth iuly controuersy varyaunce began aryse amonge parsos assygned thre estate wherof cause mych sessyng auewed sessed xxxm men wolde nat extede vnto sume large great sumes yt clergy answered yt wolde paye fyrst sessed vnto lyke maner answered apoynted lordes good townes wherfore ye archebysshop raynes whych one chefe ruler refused theyr partye drewe hym duke meanes whyche controuersy many theyr actes fayled suche put theyr offyces agayne restored myddel august duke sent prouost charles cusake wyth iohn de la ile bare ye pryncipal rule within cytye also great sayers doer assembles iii astates take vpon moch rule ye busynes moche ye busynes ruled theyr meanes whome duke gaue strayght commaudemente shuld cease theyr auctorities nat deale rule realme onely good rule gouernauce cytye parys done duke rode aboute vnto dyuers good townes made request vnto ayde also haue money curraut amog whych shewed x daye decembre parys proclaymed sped lytle hys purpose thys meane whyle cytezyns parys one wyl mynde offered saynt remyge taper waxe wonderfull lengthe greatenesse whyche ordeyned brenne day nyght whyle wold laste shortely sent vnto duke plesaunt message yt retourned agayne vnto cytye whome receyued honor reuerence vpon morow hys retourne prouost wyth certayne cytye shewed vnto duke wolde make greate shyfte hym towarde mayntenaunce hys warres brynge mater good conclusyon besought hym yt wolde assemble parys shortly certayn persones xx xxx good townes nexte adioynaunt whych vnto graunted yt shortely assembled parys vpo lxx persones whyche helde theyr counsayll gyther sundry day howe ende shewed vnto duke nothynge myght brynge effecte without assemble iii astates besoughte hym myght efte reassembled trustyng theyr presence duke mynde shulde contente satysfyed upon whyche requeste duke sent hys comyssios chargyng ye sayd iii astates apere hym parys wednysday nexte folowynge ye day al sayntes full fayne thyng citezyns parys hym requyred testyfyeth frenche cronycle bare money hadde nat suffycyente defende hys cotydyan charge viii yere kynge iohn wednysday alhalowen day iii astates reassembled parys helde theyr counsayll within blacke freers durynge whych cousayll kyng nauern longe ben holden pryson wythin castell alleux deliuered meanes syr iohanne pyquygny gouernoure countrey arthoys conueyed sayd iohn vnto ye town amyas whan ye kyng nauerne thus set large anon syster hys frendes made meanes vnto duke normandy vnyte peace betwene meane fou den kyng hys company shulde come vnder saufe conduyt parys common duke wha dyuers iii astates chapeyn burgoyn knewe comyng kyng nauerne vnto parys without leue takyng departed vpon euyn saynt andrew sayd kynge entred parys wyth greate companye men armes amonge wyche bysshop parys many ye sayd cytye upon morowe folowynge daye saynt andrew kynge entedynge shewe hys mynde vnto comynalte cytye caused hyghe scaffolde made ye wall saynt germayn lodged moche people beynge assembled shewed vnto loge processe hys wrongefull enprysonemente mysgydynge lande meanes ille offycers wyth many couerte wordes ye dyshonoure frenche kynge iustyfycacion hym selfe excusynge hys owne dedes retourned hys lodgyng uppon thyrde daye december prouoste wyth cytye yode vnto duke name good townes commynaltyes requyred hym wolde vnto kynge nauerne reason iustyce whome answered ye bysshop laon duke shuld nat allonly shewe vnto kyng reason iustyce shuld also shewe vnto hym frendely brotherhode grace curtesy season many ye duke cousayll present whome gyuyng answere co ueniently apperteyned tha ye sayde bisshop yet tyme suche fere durste nat moue thynge shuld soude cotrary displeasure kynge nauerne prouoste tha agreed vpon ye saterdaye folowynge kynge duke whyche yet nat spoken togyther shuld mete place syster sayd kyng met vnfrendely coutenauce communed loge season departed litle loue charite vpon muday folowyng shewed vnto duke hys cou sayle certayne requestes desyred kyng nauerne whych duke forsed graunt whereof substaunce kynge shuld haue agayn enioye al lades castelles townes mouables belogynge possessyo ye daye kyng iohn taken within castel roan ouer shuld pardoned offence hym done agayne crowne fraunce daye hys adherentes suche taken hys partie yt tyme soone vpon thys ordeyned erle harcourt whyche kyng iohn caused beheded haged vppon commo gybet roan shuld delyuered vnto theyr frendes buryed theyr pleasure whych conclusion taken assuraunces made farre duke auctoryte wolde extende vnto syr almary knyghte menlene knyghte wyth thre foure men honoure mo sente normandye repossesse kyng nauerne lades castelles townes tyme possessio wyth mouables vnto sayd landes apperteynynge sayde kynge duke helde famylyer company dyned souped togyther often sythes manoir lodgyng quene iohan syster vnto sayd kynge place also sayde kynge delyuered prysone prysoners well spyrytuall teporall suche thought thyng fauourable vnto hys cause amonge whyche theyr demerites adiuged perpetuall prysone thys tyme season tydynges sprange within cytye parys kynges englande fraunce agreed kyng iohan shulde shortely returne fraunce reason whyche tydynges kyng nauerne made haste dyspache hym oute parys yt hys company departed parys xx daye deceber rode toward cytye maunte normady soone kyng thus departed dyuers enemyes noumbre x xiic came within iiii v myles parys whyche demyd company syr phylip brother vnto kyng nauerne robbed pylled countrey thereabout moch people cou trey preaux trappes aboute constrayned theyr mouables flee vnto parys wherfore duke sente hys letter comyssyons assemble hys knyghtes withstande sayd enemyes sayde cytesyns parys caste way thought done greuaunce correccion dowte wherof prouost ye gouernaunce cytye caused gate kepte none shuld entre suche lyked thys passe tyme kynge nauerne beyng normady requyred delyuere castelles bretnell euroux hym ye capytaynes denied wherfore thynkyng duke performed nat hym hys promesse gathered vnto hym greate strengthe wynne strength myght nat haue hys former bade promes thys put greate wyte bysshop laon whych ye chefe counceloure duke especyall frende vnto kynge thyng spoken duke cou sayll shortly manifested hym hys meanes vnto kyng nauerne thys also one ye chefe ruler assemble iii astates lefte fell hys greate doublenesse dyssymylacyon duke fauoure became chefe hys counsayll whyche comon people named ye beste ii mouthes cytezyns parys heryng denayeng sayd castelles vnto kynge knewe wel mortall warre shuld growe betwene hym ye duke wolde haue cytezyns knowe strau gers therefore ordeyned theym hodys parted rede blewe chargynge euery man shulde nat passe hys lodgynge wythout ye hood conysaunce upon viii daye ianuary kyng nauerne entred cytie roan great company armes drew vnto hym many englysshe men suche enemyes vnto frenche kynge vppon xii daye ianuary sayde kyng assembled people cytye made lyke sermo vnto done vnto comynaltye parys dyd solempne obsequy done erle harcourt wyth hym put deth aboue sayd kynge iohn thys whyle duke normandy longe whyle taryed parys hope ayde cytezyns euer prouoste dryuen daye daye aduysed hym counsayll shulde shewe hys mynde vnto comynaltye cytye wherof whan bysshop laon ye prouost ware anone shewed vnto hym many doutes impedymentes also parelles treate comynaltye nat withstandynge refused theyr counsayll caused people assembled theyr common hall whyther wyth small company came xi daye ianuary aboute ix clocke mornyng shewed vnto common longe plesaunt oracyon wherof effect yt bare faythfull mynde vnto cytye weale therof wolde put hys lyfe ieopardy hys euyll wyllers reported shulde gather men armes greue citie sayd swore neuer hys entencion onely auoyde suche enemyes dayly pylled robbed theyr neyghbours frendes also knewe well great summes money gathered people towarde kynges fynaunce lete theym vnderstande yt peny thereof comyn hys handes hys mynde suche persones hadde receyued money shulde wyth theyr assystence called due accompte whych oracyon wyth many kynde louynge wordes ended ye people well contented theym wel commeded allowed upon morowe beyng fryday xii day ianuary prouost hys affynyte herynge fauoure many common bare vnto duke ferynge leste duke shuld hys meanes turne comons vpon assembled great parte cytye place called sait iames hospytall specyally suche knewe well fauoured theyr partye whan ye duke ware assemble anone spedde hym thyther hauynge wyth hym bysshop laon mouth hys chauceler caused shewed parte matter whyche hym selfe shewed day vnto comynaltye yt ought vnto hym good wylle reported hym kept nat promyse made kyng nauerne shewed contrary yf thynge nat hym parfourmed contrary hys mynde pleasure hys power lay nat fulfyl soone ye chauceler ended hys tale charles cusake stode vp entent haue shewed hys mynde rumoure noyse amonge people myghte nat harde thanne duke parted suche companye brought excepte bysshop lao whych taryed prouost whan duke departed charles cusake began tale spake boldely agayne kynges offycers couerte wordes somwhat agayne duke whyche tale fynysshed one named iohn de saynte ounde whyche auctoryte ye thre astates newlye made one generall gouernours subsydy stoode vp sayde prouoste persone thre astates hadde peny subsydie theyr hades whiche sayenge prouoste also affermed forthermore shewed ye sayde iohn certayne knyghtes whyche named sent duke receyued sayde subsydye summe l lxm mo ton golde whyche enployed good vse whyche processe ended sayde iohan charles cusake agayne beganne speke made longe comendacio prouydence good dysposycion prouost whyche take vpon hym great payne displeasure spent largely hys owne ye como welth cytye wherefore yf myghte knowe comynaltye wolde nat ayde stande hym furtherauce wolde content leue gete hym shulde quyte al trouble also daunger hys enemyes whereunto anon made greate exclamacyon people sayenge wolde lyue dye wyth hym quarell upo xiii day ianuary duke sent dyuers persones thre astates exorted theym goodlye amyable wordes wolde demeane theym agayne hys father hym faythefull louynge subiectes shulde reporte theym vnto kynge hym shulde haue greate thankes touchynge hym selfe wolde good lord vnto theym shulde thynke theyr kyndenes fydelyte well bestowed bestowed whyche graunted vnto hym theyr trothe seruyce ye vttermoste theyr power aduysynge hym take vpon hym gouernaunce realme thought taryed long toke rule therof soone vppon thys sayd thre estate ordeyned feble money made aduauntage duke ende sholde wythstand enemyes forenamed yet remayned coutre parys pylled vyllages toke prysoners whych conueyed vnto suche holdes tha helde countre thus duryng manyfolde aduersytees amoge frenchman vpon xxiiii daye ye sayd moneth ianuary iohn baylet treasourer vnto ye duke slayne parys yoman uarlet chaunge called peryne marke whyche peryne cursyd dede done fledde vnto saynt mary chyrche nyghte duke sent syr iohn de shalous hys marchall wyth prouost ye cytye named guillyam scayse whyche brake vp chyrche dores toke sayde peryne force ladde hym vnto prison called chastelet whych vpon morne take hys handes smytten drawen vnto gybet parys hanged vpon thyrde daye folowyng meanes bysshop parys taken downe buryed wythin sayd chyrche lady wyth greate reuerence solempnyte whyche obsequy present prouoste marchauntes many burgesis cytye fyrste daye moneth february syr iohn de pyquyny came vnto parys ye kyng nauerne made request vnto duke dyuers couenautes hym perfourmed towarde ye kynge whyche yet nat acco plysshed whyche requeste duke toke vnpacyetly gaue vnto sayd syr iohn many hygh displesaut wordes howe ende ye bisshop laon sayde duke shuld aduysed vpo ye answere ye kynges demaude upon ye iii daye february ye prouost marchau te wyth certayn ye vnyuersyte parys burgeyses yode vnto duke vnto louure requyred sayde persones wolde fulfyll vnto kyng nauerne suche couenautes lately made hym specially castelles euroux named myghte delyuered vnto hym accordyng apoyntemet farthermore shewed vnto duke doctoure diuynyte yf kynge nauerne wolde swarue poynt artycle sayde former agremente iii astates vtterlye determyned ayde assyste hym wolde kepe sayd agrement wythstade wolde nat obey vpholde sayde concorde agrement whereunto duke wel agreable sayeng perfourmed promesse excepte delyuere certayne castelles whyche capytaynes wythhelde contrary hys mynde pleasure layenge theyr excuse kynge hys father theym delyuered hym none wyll delyuer agayne upon xi day february certayne iii astates beyng cou sayll theyr place accustomed ye prouoste ye marchautes assebled theyr craftes ye citie place called sait clowe cloy harnesse whych tyme hys beyng aduocat parliamet called mayster reynolde dacy goyng duke palays toward owne house slayne men towne soone thereafter sayd prouost great company armed men entred palays louure certayne complyces entred duke chaubre withoute salutyng duke sayd vnto hym syr dysmay nothyng whatsomeuer ye se v entende persone harme wordes fully ended copany fell vpon knyght called syr nycholas de coflans tha marshall cha payne vpo syr robert de cleremout leuyng vpon duke bedde slewe hande whan duke behelde thys horryble dede meruelous fere hys owne persone prayed prouoste wyth hys cappe hys hade wolde saufegarde hys persone whych prouost graunted wold hym aduertysed sayd ii dede corse drawen downe steyers withoute pytye layed court men myghte beholde myserable spectacle duke saufegarde prouost toke vnto hys partye hood redde blewe ye whiche put vpon hed prouost receyued duke hood beynge burnet garnysshed frenge golde eyther ware others hode daye done prouoste hys company wente vnto theyr comon hall shewed vnto comynalty ii persones especiall enemyes vnto comon weale false traytours god crowne fraunce hys adherentes enteded preseruacion commo weale realme cytye wolde vnderstade theym whether wolde stande hym doynge nat whyche cryed wyth one voyce ouy ouy saye ye ye whan receyued comforte ye people retourned agayn vnto duke recomforted hym sayd al done done thassent people auoyd ye greater inconueniece slayn great enemyes vnto common welthe traytours vnto crowne wherfore wylled ye duke alowe dede yf pardo requysyte ye dede hadde shulde lyberally graunt thynges duke fayne saye ye vnto prayed hym also cytezyns fre de wold lykewyse theyrs thys agremet prouost sent ii clothes one redde ye blewe wylled duke make hoodes al seruautes duke hys seruautes clothed lyuery towne blewe set vpon ryght syde agayne night wha sayd ii corpsys lyen daye vpon stone palays ye prouost commauded layed cart without preest reuerence coueyed vnto place sait katheryne buryed whanne sayde corpsys thus brought vnto sayde place yt carter toke one theyr garmentes hys laboure departed nat longe messanger came bysshop parys whyche warned bretherne house spare buryenge syr robert de cleremout asmoch bysshope noted hym accursed brekyng vp sait mary church whan force fette oute peryne marke shewed also ye aduocate mayster reynolde dacy buryed secretelye uppon morne folowynge prouost assembled frere augustynes great company cytye wyth suche good townes reason ye foresayde cousayll whych assemble mouth mayster roberte de corby cytye shewed protestacio cyrcumstauce foresayd mater howe duke cous l also ye thre astates many good ynges co cluded deliuery kynge shulde tyme haue comyn good effecte ne ben enpechement iiii person whyche yt season nat named thys busynesse thus cotynuyng kyng nauarne came vnto parys xxvi daye february wyth good company armed men coueyed cytezeyns vnto place duke called neell lodged whome prouost coplyces made request wolde make allyauce theym supporte theym ye hadde done whyche hym grauted quene hys syster made instante laboure agree hym duke whych co clusyon toke effect yt kynge shulde haue recompecement wroges erledom bygorre vynery ramer ye erledo maston landes ye extente xmli parys money yere ouer hys syster called quene blache shuld haue ye lordshyp morette dowry whyche accorde thus concluded kynge duke kepte together fredely louyng familyarite dyned souped eyther many sundry tymes eyther vnto gaue ryche gyftes amog whyche one duke gaue vnto kyng sayd place neell whych lodged upon xii daye marche duke normandye proclamed regent fraunce thorough ye cytye parys thorough fraunce soone departed parys rode ye countre champayne taryed season kynge nauerne retourned maunt normandye regent drewe vnto hym noble champayne prouynce began manace prouost parys put hym dyshonoure slayne vylaynously hys trewe counceyllours promesse taken erle brene noble countrey yt shuld ayde hym agayne hys father rebelles hys enemyes rode vnto abbey ponley monstruell yode vnto castell whych belonged vnto quene blanche syster vnto ye kynge nauerne wyllyd capytayne named tanpyne delyuer hym castell whyche dyuers denayes opened gate receyued regente lodged hym therin nyght upon whyche regent caused sayd tanpyne swere vnto hym yt shulde kepe castell vse made hym styll wardeyne departed then rode meaux hys wyfe laye thys tyme season prouoste marchauntes parys herynge regentes doynge affynyte made champayne fered sequell therof wherfore aduyse fauoured hys cause yode castell louure toke artylery gunny abylyme te warre put ye store house cytye redy whan tyme requered regent spedyng hys iournay returned agayne co peygn appoynted iii astates shulde ye fyrste daye may assemble parys regent tha sent hys commyssios charged ye sayd iii astates assemble thyrde daye sayd moneth may compeyngne aforesayde wherewith sayde cytezyns parys greatly amoued thys assemble graunted vnto regent subsydy bothe ye clergy also laye fee yt regent waxed dayly stroger stronger wherof heryng kyng nauerne remoued towne called merlo stronge company came vnto place towne named domage purposely treate wyth regent cytezeyns parys begynnynge may yt sayd two prynces met eyther hauynge greate strengthe men army whan kynge nauerne ii dayes contynuall made requeste vnto regent cytezyns parys myghte natte spede requeste departed thyrde daye rode vnto parys honorably receyued fested space x xii dayes whyche season warned theym great dyspleasure ye reget bare towarde cytye aduysed make theym stronge myght thys passe tyme bysshop laon beynge regent copeyne lyke haue ben vylonyed regetes counsayll wherefore secrete wyse departed vnto saynt denyse thes fette kyng seruautes nauerne vnto parys whome put great faute thys trouble myddell maye one named guyllyam call gathered vnto hym company prouince beauaysyn townes cerreux norecell cramoysye beyng euyll dysposed slewe dyuers knyghtes esquyers coutrey theyr wyues seruautes pylled spoyled countrey went threwe downe certayn pyle stregthes parte castell beawmout forced duchesse orleaunce forsake castell lodged saufegarde go vnto parys uppon xxx daye may prouost gouernours ye cytye parys caused iohn paret mayster brydge parys mayster carpenter kynges werkes drawen hanged heded quartered put vpon shuld haue broughte cytye certayne noumbre regentes sowdiours haue betrayed cytye fore sayde people beauuaysyne gathered vnto theym dayly peple labourer vylaynes came countrey mountmerencie slewe robbed ye ge tylmen countrey done passed countrey without resystence ye reget thys whyle came cytye sen languedocke honorably receyued yt comons cytye gentyles coutrey greatly lenyng vnto cytezyns parys taryed season expresse hys mynde whyche meane tyme spycer grocer namer gylle parys wyth one iohn uayllaunt prouoste ye kynges money company viiic men harnesse rode vnto cytye meaux wherof ye mayre cytie ioyfully receyued contrary hys promesse made vnto regent assystence sayde mayer cytye entended haue taken wyfe sayd regent noble woman tha soiournyng wyth hyr haue conueyd vnto parys haue kepte tyll cytezyns myghte purchase fauour grace regent wha erle foyse whych thanne hadde rule sayde gentylwomen knewe theyr entente anone gathered vnto hym hys co pany wyth assystece also som sayd cytye made vppon vi viic men harnesse yssued boldly agayne foresayde person skyrmysshed wyth theym skyrmysshe ende parys sconfited chased mayre meaus named iohn soulas taken theyr rebellyo put execucion thys victory thus opteyned reuegemet deth knyghte called syr lewys de chambly slayn gentylmen vntrouth ye cytie foresayd erle set fyre vpon syde cytye bret great parte therof well church fyre scatly stenched viii day thys whyle kynge nauerne herynge greate harme distruccio company guyllyam calley made gentylmen moutmerecy place lyke shewed yode agayne hym nere vnto place called cleremout encountred hym people gaue vnto theym batayll slewe moch people toke hym lyue caused hys hede stryken soone cytezyns parys sente vnto hym requyrynge hym drawe towarde whose requeste sped hym thytherwarde entred cytye vpo xv daye iuny coueyed vnto sait germayne pree lodged vpo morne wete vnto comon halle citie comos beyng assembled made vnto loge plesaunt oracio great kyndenesse founde many ye good townes frauce specially cytye parys whych bounde hym take theyr partye agayne makyng none excepcyo tale hym ended charles cusake stode vp shewed vnto people ruynous poynt lade stode lacke wyse hedde gouernoure wherfore exhorted ye people chose ye kyng theyr gouernour whyche done toke vpon hym rule promysed lyue dye upon xxii day sayd moneth iuny ye kyng nauerne copany vim speres citye departed parys rode vnto towne called gonnesse company cytye taryed hym then rode towarde se lys wha gentylmen hys hoste vnderstode take vppon hym capytayne cominaltye agayn partie noble fraunce contrary partye left hym many specially suche duchye burgoyne wyth congy hym taken resorted theyr coutreys wha regent vysyted dyuers countreys wonne vnto hym beniuolence ye also gathered vnto hym greate strength spedde hym towarde parys lodged hym ende moneth iuny place called frenche le pount de charenton fast boyes uyncent whose co pany noumbred vpon xxxm horseman countre pylled wasted hoste wherof herynge kynge nauerne retourned backe agayne came wyth hys hoste vnto saynt denys wythin ii myles parys cytye parys kepte daye nyght man myghte entre go wythout lycece ye prouoste ruler therof meane whyle sayde two prynces lay thus theyr two hostes cytye quene iohan syster vnto kynge made instaut labour vnto regent grace cytezyns whose meanes comucacio appoynted holde betwene kynge regente eyght day iuly place called ye wynde mylle faste house saynt anthony whyche metynge lastly accorded betwene ye sayd prynces kyng nauerne shulde hys best brynge cytezyns parys vnto due obedyence yf sawe theym suche obstynacy wolde nat theyr dutye gyue theyr rebellyon suche summes money hym regent shuld thought accordynge kynge shuld vtterly refuse theyr partye turne vnto reget hys power ouer kyng demaundes coude aske regent cause ouer agremet betwene laste made shuld haue iiicm floryns gold wherof cm payed daye xii monethes yerely lm tyll fulle payed farther accorded kynge yt daye shulde take partye regente agayne persones excepte onely ye kynge fraunce ende yt thys accorde shulde fermely holde vppon bothe sydes bysshoppe lyseux beynge presente wyth many lordes sage masse within tente thys accorde concluded agnus dei sware two prynces vpon sacrament withoute collusyon fraude shulde obserue kepe eueryche artycle sayde accord whyche conclusyon thus take regent repayred vnto hys hoste kynge vnto saynt denys vppon morowe kynge entred parys conueyed thyther wyth hym certayne taryed daye wythoute reporte sendy ge vnto regent seconde daye ye stregthynge towne sent certayne englysshe sowdyours archer sette towne wagys nother sente retourned vnto regente answere towarde nyght assaut made som regentes people vppo parte town dyuers men slayne vpon bothe sydes mo vppon partye cytye kynge nauerne vpo morowe retourned vnto sait denys leuynge within cytye ye foresayde stregthe englyshmen wyth whan regente ware kynges beynge saynt denys sent vnto hym hym requyred perfourmauce suche accorde lately betwene theym condissended syns hys meanes myght nat enduce cytezyns due obedyence wolde accordynge hys promesse take partye hym wherby enemyes comon welth myght recouceyled whereunto kynge answered sayd reget broke ye sayd accorde hys dylygece laboure brought cytezyns nere poynt recociliacyon submyssio regent meane assaute whyche made vnto towne caused sayd cytezeyns renouce theyr former graunt bynde vpo theyr former wyl fulnesse whyche answere thus gyuen kyng reget caused people passe ye ryuer sayne brydge made botes brenne towne uyttry diuers townes robbed pylled coutrey upo xiiii day iuly dyuers towne parys issued oute towne ayde englyshmen endeuoured haue socoured sayde towne uyttry also haue destroyed ye brydg whych iournay bare well theyr shotte wou ded many theyr enemy toke prysoner regentes marshall named syr reynolde de fountaynes dyuers retourned vnto theyr cytye upon xix day iuly ye quene iohn syster vnto ye kyng nauern archebysshop lyon bysshop parys certayne temporall persones cytye yode vnto place assygned withoute towne met regent certayne hys cousayll lengthe cocluded unyte co corde betwene sayd regent cytesyns without farther payne exaccio put vnto excepte sayd cytesyns shuld humbly submytte vnto regent aknowlegyng theyr offece askyng hym mercy grace ouer yt ordered forther kynge nauerne sayd quene iohn duke orleauce erle el cap wolde deme adiuge graunted reget opyn way passage well lade water al marchautes may passe tymes vsed lykewise cytye opyn gate towne receyue straungers whych agremente thus cocluded agreed made betwene kyng regent maynteyned vpholden reget sent hym moch hys people appoynted sayd bisshoppes towne mete hym ye iiii day folowynge place called laiguy syr marne wolde haue also kynge nauerne perfyghte clerely fynysh sayd agremet vpo thys made proclamacions thorough hoste good perfyght peace agreed wherefore many hoste dyuers cause theym mouynge yode towarde cytye trustyng gladly louynglye receyued vpon ye morne whan came vnto gate fande watched harnessed men whyche wolde none suffre entre suche lyked amog whyche one named macequetta seruaunte regetes mysse entreated nat withstadyng accorde yet mouable goodes suche regent house within cytie disperbled stroyed upon xxi day iuly euyn mary magdaleyne stryfe began kyndell within cytye ye cytesyns complayned vpon englysshemen surmysynge agayne dyuers cause meane wherof comonte fury yode vnto palaye necl yt tyme many capytaynes englysshemen dyned wyth kynge nauerne vpon whome fell sodeynly slewe vpo xxiiii diuers place ye citie toke deale noubre iiiic thereupon closed theym dyuers prysons whych doyng kynge nauerne also prouoste gouernoures cytye right fore discontented wherfore vpo day folowyng kynge assembled comynaltye theyr comon halle entendynge plesaut wordes haue caused haue ben repetaunt murder foresayd capytaynes also haue gotten remenaunte oute pryson kynge spake englysshemen woder dysposed agayne theym sayenge yt whyche within cytye shulde nat alonely putte deth also suche sait denys whyche spoyled towne countrey enuyron suche wordes vnto kynge yt ende wyth prouost gouernoures fayne graunte vnto wolde go theym helpe dystres sayde englysshemen daye agayne nyght comos yssued gate saynt honoure kynge nauerne prouost theyr company went ye wyndemylle sayd asse bles kynge comons noumbred vppon xvic speres foote men vpon viiim whan kynge hys company come feelde sayd wyndemylle stadeth houed well vp halfe houre se ye company wolde whych sent iii speres espye englyshmen espyed theym vpo xl l apered woddes syde nere vnto saynt clow wenynge sayde englysshemen mo retourned shewed sene whereupon sayde comons haste spedde theym thyther wha within daunger theyr shotte ye englysshmen issued oute dyuerse party wode wouded slewe many wherwith beynge fered fled incontinently whome englysshemen pursued cruelly slewe fote men vpon vic whych season kyng nauern also ye prouost theyr peple stode styl neuer moued towarde theyr defence ayde thys scomfyture thus susteyned parysyens kyng lefte cytye rode vnto saynt denys prouoste wyth hys company returned vnto parys receyued wyth hydyous noyse crye aswel wome yt cowardly suffered hys neyghbours wouded slayne reaso murmure people encreased dayly agayne prouost maner party taken betwene prouoste gouernours cytye comynaltye comons wolde haue put deth many prysoners englysshemen ye prouost hys affynyte let preserued theyr fury malyce vpon xxvii daye iuly beynge frydaye sayd prouost beyng
