encopanyed wyth viii score iic harnesse yode vnto louure prysons toke ye sayd englysshemen conueyed vnto gate saynt honoure sent theym vnto theyr felysshyp beyng saynt denys whome ioyously receyued welcomed specyally kynge nauerne whose requeste como fame went yt prouost wyth ruler ye town delyuered thus cyuyle dyscorde began encreace wythin cytie ruler ye cytye great dought fere theyr neyghbours tyme reget knyghtes vpo tuysdaye folowynge beynge last daye iuly ye prouost wyth hys company beyng harnesse dayly vsed went dyner vnto bastyle saynt denys beyng dyner prouost comauded tha kept keyes bastyle shuld delyuer theym vnto geffrey de masto tresourer warres kyng nauerne porter denayed ye commau demet sayde presysely yt wolde nat delyuer keyes hym yet strauger whyche answere many hawte wordes blowen eyther partye people gadered wherof heryng one named iohn maylart beloged watche quarter ye cytye wherein whyche quarter sayde bastyle stode drewe nere gaue ere vnto wordes shortly bolde maner sayd vnto ye prouost keyes shulde remayne styll sayd kepers nat take theyr possessio meane whych wordes prouoste wyth hys company encensed wyth malyce vttered many hyghe dysdaynous wordes fere sayd iohn maylart wherfore sayde iohn maylart feryng prouost lest shuld shortly call hys stregthe hym meane thereof put hym afterdele sodenlye gate hym horsebacke berynge baner ye french kynges hys hande cryed wyth alowde voyce mon ioye saynte denys au roy et duke wha people sawe hym thus ryde aboute cryed ioye kynge duke anone moche people folowed hym cryed wyse lykewyse dyd prouost company whyche toke waye towarde bastyle saynte anthony sayde maylarte rode towarde market place houed wyth company whyche tyme season one called pepyn de essars nat knowynge feat iohn maylart lyke maner gathym horsbacke berynge baner armes frauce rode cryeng ye forsayd crye lastly came vnto whyle commos thus assembled market place prouost came vnto forsayd bastyle sait anthony reported yt kepers bastyle prouost hadde lately receyued letter fro kynge nauerne whyche desyred se wherof prouoste denayed syghte specyally one named guyffarde wherefore som wordes dyspleasure one strake sayd guyffarde throughe hys harnesse wouded hym ye prouost beyng amoued made resyste ce agayn sayd kepers yt eyther ranne wyth theyr wepyns whych stryfe sayd guyffarde fyrst slayne prouoste wyth one hys coperes named symode palmeyr wherof heryng ye fore sayd iohn maylart hys copany haste sped thyder pursued vpo yt tha fled fere streightly serched yt fode one called iohn ye ile giles marcell vnder prouoste marchauntes whych also slewe without pytie ye bastyle saynt martyne foude one called iohn paret yoger whome slew also soone spoyled yt layd naked open strete men loke vpon whan vi corpsys lyen certayne tyme put carte drawen vnto house saynt katheryne buryed vnreuerently vpon morowe folowyng taken charles cusake iosseron geffrey maston put chastelet kept strayte pryson thus seased thys ryot wythin cytye parys contynued partye ye space yere ix monethes begynnynge moneth nouember vii yere kyng iohn vnto thende ye moneth iuly viii yere thys sayd kyng takyng duke hys chaubre deth ye prouost space vi monethes whyche persones thus slayen sayd iohn maylart sent vnto ye regent requyrynge hym yt wolde spede hym vnto ye citie ye meane whyle sende noble man haue rule whyle comos made serche toke many former ruler petyr gylle grocer said capytayne vnto yt sent vnto meaus wyth hym taken syr pyers caylart knyghte wardeyne castell louure also one called iohn prenost wyth petyr blount also vocate named mayster peter puyssour felowe hys named mayster iohan godarde sone shortly put deth sundry tymes theyr bodyes cast ryuer called bone uoycyne vppon xii daye august regent receyued parys honour gladnesse whereof heryng kynge nauerne puttyng deth io ran hys tresourer sente vnto reget wordes defyauce letting hym vnderstande wolde reuenged wronge upon xiiii day august regent caused assembled within commo hall paris cytezyns made log declaracion treason ryottes done persones put deth bysshop laon yet leuyng whych enteded sayde haue made ye kyng nauerne kyng frauce haue yelden cytye parys power englysshemen tha kynge nauerne englyshmen yode vnto meloon fauour stregth occupyed ye yle yt coutrey whych stretched toward byer warred vppon countrey toward gastenoys dyd therin moche harme aswell fyre otherwyse shortly syr iohn pyquegny syr robert brother whych capytaynes vnder kyng nauern made warre vpo towne turnay townes pycardy slewe many common people toke prysoners gentylmen countrey noumbre hundreth aboue amonge whyche bysshope noyen take wyth ladde vnto castell towne called creeyll wherof foresayde syr robert capytayne contynued doynge domage dyuerse place aswell nere vnto parys elles durynge whyche warre thus made kynge nauerne hys accessary moneth septembre begynnynge ix yere kynge iohn foresayde syr iohn de piquegny layd siege vnto cytye amyas wa within bulwerkes cytye lyke haue ben yelde vnto hym ne ben rescous erle saynt poule draue sayd iohn hys people backe sayd syr iohn wyth ayde englyssheme quytte hym fully domynyo coutrey beawuasyne wyne marchaundyse myghte passe tournay townes therabout without hys saufe coduyt lycece lyke maner syr robert knolles capytayne englisshemen brytayne gatte many holdes townes whyche passe ouer upon xxv day octobre dyuers burgeysys ruler cytye parys iohn guyffarde nycholas poret nou bre xix persones comaundement reget arested sent vnto pryson remayned space iiii dayes wherfore fre de sayd prysoners yode vnto prouoste marchautes named iohn culdoe requyred hym make labour vnto regent beyng louure delyuery theyr fredes lest knowe cause theyr inprysonement whyche requeste ye prouost executed answered reget vppon morowe wolde theyr commo halle comynaltye yt cause theyr inprysonement shulde shewed yf cytezyns thoughte good haue sette large wolde therwyth holde hym contented whyche houre apoynted regente came vnto sayde halle shewed one named iohn damyens whyche hadde maryed doughter iohn restable one sayd prysoners hadde caused hys sayd father yt allyed theym kyng nauern cotrary theyr allegeauce wherfore thought deserued dye fauoure owed vnto cytye good substauce wold nat thynge theym tyll enquered theyr neyghbours whyche declaracion thus made reget euery man fered speke theym suffered lawe haue hys course howe ende acquyted treason fynally delyuered ende nexte moneth uppo thyrde daye decebre entred parys cardinalles pierregort urgell treate co corde peace betwene regente kyng nauerne coclusyon nothynge sped came wherefore retourned vnto auynyon whyche retourne robbed great substauce wherof englyshmen bare disclau der thus thys grudge hagynge betwene kyng reget many robberyes harmes done vnto dyuers townes frauce ye greate enpouerysshynge peple lande greate enrychynge suche englysheme tha abydynge dayely warres bothe wyth kynge nauerne also brytayne shortely thys foresayde syr roberte knolles englysshemen wanne towne ancer lyke thre thyrty yere kynge edwarde lengthe declared ye moneth may xix day ye reget tydynges receyued hys father england reporte ye archebysshop s assebled many ye good townes paris ye way stopped warre fayne tary tyll xxv day sayd moneth folowynge whyche season shewed ye people assembled kyng englande haue fynall concorde ye kyng fraunce wolde haue ouer aboue hys raunsome ye duchy normandy ye duchy guya duchy exanctes cytye ageu cytye carbe cytye pierregort cytye lymoges ye cytye caours dyoces sayde cytyes belogyng erledomes bygorre poytyers aniowe mayne thorayn bouloyne guynys poutesses pountyeu ye townes mou struell calays marquet appertenauntes sayde duchy erledomes cytyes townes belongynge enioye holde wythout feawte homage doynge many thynges kyng englandes great aduauntage whyche tydynges ryght dyspleasaunt vnto co pany moch answered sayd treaty neyther honorable profytable rather tha kyng shuld bynde hym hys lande suche inconuenience wolde prepare make sharpe warre agayne englande wyth whyche answere sayde assemble dyssolued upon xxviii day may regent reassembled sayde people condyscended noble realme certayne persones euery man hys astate shuld serue regent hys warres ye space moneth theyr owne propre costes cytye parys grauted fynde hym theyr charge vic speres iiiic archer sowdyours moche ye good townes wold nat graut subsydie tyll spoke theyr comynaltyes therfore liceced dete home brynge reporte agayn within xiiii dayes whych season shewed vnto ye regent yt theyr countreys pylled wasted kynge nauerne englyshemen yt people myght nothyng ayde hym thought haue done wherfore moche payne grauted hi viiim iii monethes begynnyng moneth iuny ye regent stronge power sped hym towarde meleo kynge nauerne laye hys people kyng occupied coutrey toward byeir ye regent coutrey towarde brye hostes thus lyenge withoute notary feate warre treatye accorde yet agayne moued legthe agrement ye parysyens accorded moche lyke vnto former accorde concluded parys yt mediacyo certayn teporall lordes hostes yt sayd prince agreed mete melane coclude sayd peace xx daye august wyth hostage delyuered vpon partyes sayd prynces mette rode vnto pountoyse lodged within castell bothe theyr cousayles assygned mete per fyghtyng thys accorde yt suche lades shuld assygned vnto ye kyng cowde nat agre wherfore ye reget coclusyo set vnto erle staps escamps chargyng hi say yt ye entent haue good wyl offered vnto hym reasonable offer whyche yf wolde accepte wolde fayne therof yf nat let hym vnderstade yt shulde haue peace wyth hym whyle lyued reason whyche message ye cou sayles bothe partyes conceyued none treaty shuld haue concluded amyte peace howe counsayll hys owne lyberalyte whan kyng degested mater mynd nyght folowynge ye morowe sent counsayll regent wylled shewe vnto reget consydered well hys mynde great daunger mysery whyche realme fraunce stode wherfore beyng naturall house frauce one ye flouredelyce ought se ye mayntenaunce honour ruyne sayde realme shulde hym yf fell ted therfore cotented set parte suche great offer promyses hym tyme ben offered promysed holde hym onely contented wyth hys owne righte tymes enioyed ye ende thys hys wyll pleasure myght people knowen wylled regent people towne pou toyse shuld assembled court castell myghte declare propre persone whych accordyng mynde done whyche rehersall made reget comynalte towne promysyng delyuer hys possessio suche townes castelles holdys syn stode enemye crowne frauce become true subiecte vnto kyng louyng neuewe frede vnto ye reget frome yt daye foreward wherof reget comons glad ioyfull trusted lytle accorde yet ye cotinuauce therof consyderynge manyfolde accordes whych tymes ben betwene cocluded accorde thus ended kynge wyth hys people retourned iant ye reget paris appoyntyng betwene meate parys fyrst day septembre next folowyng accordyng ye appoyntmete made pountoyse betwene kyng ye reget vpon fyrste day septembre begynnyng ye x yere kyng iohn sayd kynge regent met parys atwen holden famylyer copany great kyndenesse shewed vppon eyther partye also counceyled shulde withstade kyng englande whych enteded entre fraunce shortely wyth stroge power many amytees frendely dealynges betwen executed ye kyng rode meleo delyuer towne castel regentes possessyon story sheweth wha comyn thyther hys wyl cotrary sowdyours toke greuouse tolles wynes marchaundyses passed waye whyche knowen ye wage sowde nauaroys englisshemen whych helde sayd towne castell yt frenchme constrayned paye wage theyr enemyes whyche greued sore consyderynge manyfolde harmes pyllages theym receyued kyng auoyded sayde sowdyours departed rode vnto maut leuyng creyell possessio englyshmen ouer manyfolde myseryes myschyeues thus fallyng realme frauce fell great habundauce water heruest season ye corne loste rose hyghe pryce greate damage comon people moneth nouembre folowyng kynge englande prynce edwarde many lordes stroge power laded calays perced fraunce artoys pycardy uermendoys subdued coutrees hym tyll came reynes lyke shewed xxxiiii xxxv yeres kyng edward thys mater wyth ye tenoure peace betwene sayde kynges englande fraunce lengthe declared laste daye moneth decembre one marten pysdo burgeyse parys drawe vnto place iugemet vpon scaffolde fyrste hys armes cutte hys legges thyes lastly hys hed quartered hys iiii quarter sette vppon iiii pryncypall gate cytye hys hede sette vpo pyllory cause thys iugemente moche one called denysot palmer whome discouered cousayll caused hym accessary hys workes accused hym sayd marten agreed couenaunted certayne offycers capytaynes kyng nauern tyme appoynted shuld haue entred cytye parys haue slayne regente haue cytye theyr rule pleasure season tha ye x yere tyl yt moneth iuly passed warres treaty touched viii day iuly frenche kyng laded calays taryed prysoner tyl xxv daye octobre folowynge ye xxxiiii yere kyng edward playnly shewed vpon xxix day octobre begynnynge hys xi yere kyng iohn came saynte omers taryed tyll fourth daye nouembre xi day december came vnto saynte denys vnto hym vpo ye xii day came kynge nauerne whyche nat sene hym sen delyuered pryson brought hym certayne hostage whyche frenche kynge sente vnto hym hys saufegarde puttynge hym holy ye freche kynges grace mercy vpon morowe folowyng newly sworne vnto kynge hys trew faythfull sonne subiect kyng agayn vnto hym hys kynde father good gracyous soueraygne lorde forthe wyth sworne duke normandy philip brother vnto sayd kyng nauerne maynteyne couenauntes made made betwene sayd ii kynges fynisshed cocluded xviii day ianuary nexte folowyng soone retourned sayd kyng nauerne vnto maunt kyng iohn vpon xiiii daye december wyth great tryumphe receyued parys whanne comyn vnto hys palays prouost marchauntes wyth certayne burgeyses cytye name comynaltye presented hym present value marke sterlynge upon tuysdaye beyng fyrste day iuly foughten batayll parys betwene two knyghtes wherof appellaunte named syr foukes dorciat defendaut syr maugot mawbert whych appellaut sore vexed feuer quarteyne reason wherof great hete ye day appered longe fyght sayd appellaut lyght hys horse hys refresshemet wherfore hys frendes hym great doute enemye also sore trauayled yt hete laboure also ouercome lykely haue fallen fro hys horse myght taken downe swowned dyed whan syr fowkes ware ye feblenesse hys enemye anon might dressed hym fote toward hys aduersary fande hym starke dede whyche lycece kynge feelde secretlo buryed sayde syr fowkes feblenesse hys fredes ladde vnto hys lodgyng xii yere kynge iohn xxi day nouembre phylyp duke burgoyn erle artoys aluerne boloyngn chylde age xiiii yeres lesse dyed town nere vnto rome called guyo reason whose deth kyng iohn nexte heyre possession al sayd lades toke possio therof shortly xiiii yere reygne kyng iohn thyrd day ianuary specyall cause hym mouyng enlargyng sonne duke orleaunce yet pledge hys rausome toke shyppyng boloyne sayled englad arryued douer vi day sayde moneth yode eltham thes coueyed vnto lodon shewed xxxvii yere kyng edward tyme whose beyng syr barthra de glaycon made warre vpo kynge nauerne wan hym towne maunt normandy duke normady soone wonne sayd kyng towne melece within ye taken dyuers parysyens shortly theyr infidelite put execucio parys thus warre betwene kynges frauce nauerne newly bego kynge iohn beyng sayde englande greuous malady toke hym begynnynge marche whyche dyed london vpo viii daye apryll folowynge wyth great honoure solempnyte coueyed see syde shypped tha processe caryed fraunce vpon vii day may yere lorde god mccclxiiii solempnely enterred monastery saynt denys wha reygned xiii yeres vii monethes odde dayes leuynge hym thre sonnes say charles whych kyng hym lewys phylyp carolus charles ye vi name v som writer ye eldest sonne kyng iohn beganne hys reygne ouer realme frauce ix day apryll begynnynge yere lorde god mccclxiiii xxviii yere edwarde iii kynge englande crowned dame iane hys wyfe raynes xix day may folowynge thys fyrste yere syr barthran de glaycon lyeutenaunt sayde charles normady fought capytayne kynge nauerne named le captall de bueffe nere vnto place called cocherell nere vnto crosse saynte lyeffroy whiche fyght sayd captall scomfited great noumbre people taken slayne hym selfe chased taken whome frenche kynge gaue vnto sayde syr barthra erledam longeuyle wha receyued sent vnto stroge pryson called merchy meaux myghelmas folowynge duke brytayne syr charlys de bloyes syr iohn de moutfort sonne heyre fore named sir iohn mountforde dede whiche longe season bothe father sonne holden warre sayd syr charles met playne batayle shewed xxxviii yere king edwarde sayde syr charles slayne dyuers noble men fraunce moneth iuny seconde yere charlys accorde yet concluded atwene charles kynge nauerne reason whiche accorde captall bueffe clerely delyuered maunt menlene agayne also kynge restored ouer kynge nauerne geuyn recompensement erledome longeuyle whiche aboue sayd frenche kyng gyuen vnto syr barthran de glaycon haue captall prisoner also sayde kynge nauerne gyuen lordshyppe mountpyller moneth february began warre spayne prince edwarde ayded peter kyng ye lande shewed xl xlii yeres kynge edwarde iiii yere peace atwene kynges englande frauce began breke meanes erle armenake xlii yere kynge edwarde shewed moneth decembre sayd yere quene lyghted man chylde hostell saynt paule whiche christened excedynge solempnyte ouer passed churche saint paule parys vi day decembre cardinal parys whome godfather erles mountmerency dampmartyn godmother iane quene euroux bare name charlys erle mountmerency v yere charlys called counsell parlyament parys durynge whiche appellacyons erle armenake purposed ageyne prynce edwarde publysshed radde answeres said prince vpon sayd appellacyons made whiche ouerpasse length mater conclusyon prince broken pea couenauntes demyd wherfore suche townes holdes frenche kyng gotten shulde retayne make warre vpon kynge englande recouery vpon kynge charles moneth iuly folowyng rode vnto roan rygged nauye entendynge sayth frenche historye haue made warre vpon englad haue sent thyther yongest brother philippe duke burgoyne stronge armye whyle besyed purpose duke lancastre arryued strong power caleys passed tyrwyn vnto ayr wherfore kynge charlys chaunged purpose sent sayde brother tie season ye sayd duke prepared hys people englysshemen comyn vnto arde frenche men spedde suche wyse logged xxiiii day auguste vpon mou tayne tournehawe nere vnto arde hoostes lodgyd within englysshe myle atwene dayly bekeringes small skyrmysshes whyche season frenche kyng taryed styll aboute rowan king nauerne whiche longe season dwellyd nauerne came shyppe constantyne sent vnto kynge charlys yt pleased wolde gladly come vnto hym shewe mynde wherfore king sent vnto hym hostagys erle salebruge deane parys ii noble men whyche kynge nauerne wolde nat accepte moneth septembre vpon xii day duke burgoyne lyen sayd nere vnto englysshe hooste day remoued people went vnto hesden englisshe hoost remoued caux place haue shewed xliii yere kynge edwarde thynges apperteyninge vnto mater sayd moneth septembre kynge charles manned vitayled certayne galeys shyppes sent walys haue entred englade retourned lytle worshippe natwithstandynge ii noble men walys named owan iames wynne whiche made faste promesse great thynges reason enemyes vnto kyng englande charge kynge called conuocacyon temporalte spiritualte parys mayntayne hys warres graunted hym thynge bought de excepte vitayle iiii peny thynge solde retayle seller shuld pay exaccion whyche solde greate byer shulde paye sayd exaccion spiritualte graunted dyme payed ii halfe yeres lordes gentylmen stynted certaintye value theyr landes moneth february kyng sent vnto kynge nauerne beynge chierbourgth certayne messyngers perfyght amyte atwene leste toke party agayne hym englysshemen thys treatye contynued longe season vi yere moneth iune kynge nauerne hauyng sufficient hostage came frenche kynge uernon conclusion kynge nauerne made homage vnto frenche kyng became feodary wherof frenchemen made moche ioye whiche accorde sayde kynge nauerne thirde day folowing toke leaue kynge rode vnto eureux season ye warre cotynued englisshemen within realme fraunce prouince brytayne expressed xliiiixlvxlvi yeres kynge edwarde vii yere moneth auguste duke braban many noble fraunce mette playne batayll ye duke iuillers duke guellre batayll cruell fyght duke braban chased vpo syde slayne erle saynt poule many noble men whiche story nameth nat vpon syde also slayne duke guellre many vpon partye xi yere kyng charles moneth maye assembled great cousell parlyament parys amonge many actes made ye weale realme assente lordes co mon assembledat age heyre crown frauce shuld crowned enacted lawe day contynued al heyres ye crowne frauce theyr father beynge dede may crowned kynges fraunce soone attayned vnto age xiiii yeres yere treatye peace laboured two cardynalles sent pope shewed xlix yere kynge edwarde whyche treatye nat concluded kynge englande loste dayly hys landes fraunce moneth august folowyng ye duke berry duke angeo many lordes assygned dyuers place guyan angeo mayne gate wanne englysshemen many coutreys townes castels pierregort rouerge caoursyn bigorre basyndas berregart daimet many townes holdes whyche wolde aske loge leysour reherce noumbre vi score xiiii townes castelles holdes whiche shorte whyle wonne frome englysshemen party fraunce brytayne xiii yere charles emperour rome almayne named charles iiii name came frauce cambray certayne pylgrymages saint denys elles conueyed honorable men lorde cousy vnto saynt quintyne taryed chrystmas daye conueyed towne called e ewe thece noyen compeygne mette duke burbon noble rode senlys mette duke berry burgoyne bretherne frenche kynge many bisshoppes lordes ye shall vnderstande suche rode companyes forsayde duke except bysshops preestes rode theyr lyuereys companye fyrste duke burbon brother vnto quene noumbre ccc men cladde whyte blewe company ii duke noumbre vc men blacke russet meane erles lordes clothe golde knyghtes veluet gentylmen damaske sattyn yemen clothe thanne senlys brought vnto louuris mette hym duke barre companye cc horse company cladde grene redde then saynte denys vpon thyrde day ianuary whither king sent chayre rychely garnysshed moche vexed goute quene sente hym horse lytter ii whyte palfrey also mette great companye bysshoppes spirituall men abbottes priours taryed ii dayes upon v day ianuary beynge monday rode towarde parys halfe myle fro saynte denys mette prouoste marchauntes copany xvc horse yt cytezens cladde whyte violette rodde hym tyll came parys whan kynge warned nere citye lepte vpon whyte palfrey accompanied many lordes noumbre men housholde seruauntes beyng cladde one liuerey browne blewe darke tawny seruauntes dolphyn uyen blewe cremesyne euery man degree kyng company mette emperour mylle without towne called wynde mylle due salute made eyther vnto frenche king put emperour vpon ryght hande toke kynge romaynes sonne vnto emperour vpon lyfte hande frenche kynge rydinge myddes passed thoroughe hygh stretes paris tyll came king palays lodged honoure fested kinge quene space xvi dayes whiche terme endyd like honoure conueyed lande great honour ryche gyftes agayne conueyed lande moneth februarye folowynge vi daye dyed quene fraunce hostell saynt poule parys buryed great solempnyte honoure monastery saynt denys moneth marche kynge receyued letter certeyn lordes hys lande whyche conteygned kynge nauerne imagened conspired one iaquet de rue cha berlayne poyson hym whiche iaquet comyn fraunce execute cursed purpose wherfore frenche kynge layed suche wayte hym taken founden vpon hym byll certayne instruccions howe shulde behaue hym selfe accomplysshyng euyll purpose brought vnto kinges presence whome confessed circumstaunce treason done commaundement counsell kyng nauerne soone eldest sonne kynge nauerne whiche newely commyn normandy sent vnto king charles shewynge hym pleasure wolde gladlye come vnto hys presence speke hym myght haue sure safeconduyt hym suche shulde brynge whiche hym graunted vpo came vnto selys kynge comoned season ye kynge made hym requeste delyuere foresaid iaket de rue layenge hym sondrye excuse whanne kynge hadde caused sayd iaket brought forthe sayde sonne kynge nauerne named syr charlys auouched suche thynges hym coude nat denaye father commytted many sondry treason well agayne kynge iohn nowe agayne kyng charles hys sonne wherfore diuers assembles counsel hadde vpon matter kynge said sir charles agreed suche townes holdes sayd kynge nauerne within normandy shulde delyuered vnto ye duke burgoyne frenche kynges vse messe shulde truely parfourmed ye king firste sware said syr charles many capitaynes whiche rule sayd townes castelles moche sayd syr charles presence hym capitayne named sir fernande de oyens whose guyding many sayde holdes suspected wolde nat perfourme sayd promesse therfore caused hym arested vnto prison tyll holdes beynge vnder hys guydynge clerely deliuered upon agrement thus concluded sworne ye duke burgoyne sayd sir charles sayd syr fernande prisoner sent normandye conuenyent army wyth awe fauoure duke processe tyme hym delyuered suche townes holdes kynge nauerne excepte towne castell chirebourgth whiche passe tyme season also taken towne called bretnell secretary kyng nauerne certayne wrytynges beynge coffer within chambre reason whiche wrytynges also confessyon partye many mo thynges concernyng confessyon iaket de rue manifested approued secretary named maister peter de tertre frenchman borne serued kynge nauerne terme hys lyfe upon confessyon made wryten sayde secretary kinge called court parlyament scysme gonne chyrche rome durynge whiche bothe said maister peter also sayd iaket brought lordes common theyr confessyons redde examyned vpon euery artycle affyrmed theyr former sayenges wherefore shortely auctoryte court demed dye theyr treason hangyd hedyd theyr viii quarter hangyd sondry gate place parys whan kyng receyued possession foresayde holdes belongynge vnto kynge nauerne whiche often rebelled agayne father hym couselled lordes shulde throwe grounde diuers sayd castelles lest ye king nauerne recouered agayne meane theyr force worke vnto hym realme newe dyspleasures reason counsell kynge made euen grounde fortress folowynge fyrst castell bretnell dorlet beaumout le roger pacy damyet cloysters towre castell nogent le roy castell euroux castell pount andemer castell mortaygne ganraux ganray countrey constantyne towne chirebourgth remayned styll poscessyon nauaroys whiche ayde englysshe men kept frenche kynge forenamed syr farnande contyrmauded prison moch captaine ye towne thinkynge hym defaute sayd towne nat delyuered xiiii yere charles moneth august tythinges came vnto scisme whiche begonne churche rome dethe xi gregory whiche dyed moneth apryll fore passed meane frenche cardynalles whyche xi noumbre italyen cardynalles wyth theyr affinite elected chosen napolytane archebysshoppe barre frenche cardynalles election nat beynge contented wyth fauoured theyr partye denounced publysshed one named robert cardynall basyle named hym clemet ye vii fyrst named urban ye vi maner thys scysme haue shewed lii yere edwarde iii expresse ye certaynty thys scysme trouth ye deth forenamed xi gregory cardynalles beyng ye coclau cousayll chaumbre pope accustomed chosen ye romayns beyng harnesse made suche exclamacions vpon cardynalles beyng ye coclaue haue italia pope yt cardynalles fere slayn elected chase one named bartholmew napolytan archebysshop barre named urba vi thys admytted proude cobrous ruled wyll nothynge right goodly ordre reason coscyence wherfore cardynalles beyng repetaunt yt done certayne cytye fo de xx day septembre elected chase named roberte cardyuall basyle named hi clement vii theyr auctorites publysshed hym pope dysalowed chose romaynes wolde nat thereunto agreable helde vnto theyr former pope wyth whome also helde ye prouinces germany panony ye parte italy laste chosen pope helde fraunce spayne cateloyne englad thus began ye scysme whyche contynued terme xxxix yere xv yere kynge charles moche syr iohn de moutforte duke brytayne toke partye wyth englysheme agayn hym wolde nat apere dayes hym assygned therfore ye sayde kyng charles sent duchy brytayn sease ye lande ye kynges hades duke burbo syr lewys de sacer marshall fraunce syr iohanne de uyenne admyrall frauce syr beria de ryuyer hys chaberleyne wyth name great copany armes whych theyr comyng brytayne fade ye countrey otherwyse dysposed tha supposed theyr comyng thought haue receyued ye possessio yt townes castelles peasyble wyse denayed playnly answered yt sworn theyr duke bere hym trew fidelite seruice enteded obserue kepe wyth whych answere ye sayde duke hys company fayne returne vnto ye french kynge whyche shortly sent thyder ye duke angeou stroge army warre vppon coutrey whych season syr iohn de moutfort heryng ye frech kynges entet arryued brytayne wyth copany englyshe archer whome drewe multitude brytone yt duke angeou fayn retourne fraunce without worshyp tha wynnyng moneth octobre flemyng gaut greuous exaccyon vpo set rebelled agayn theyr erle slew hys bayly offycer assigned ye erle gather tolles besyeged townes toke party ye erle agayne audenarde terremonde wherof heryng ye duke burgoyn whose doughter sayd duke hadde maryed assembled hys burgonyos sped hym marchys flau ders layed hys syege vnto tourney flemynges defended duke suche wyse duke agreable fal treaty whyche fyrst accorded agreed erle ye request duke shulde pardo forgyue clerely hys subiectes offence hym done yt day also yt shuld graunt vnto theyr former lyberties pryuyleges ample large wyse grauted hys fyrste comynge maynteyn vpholde theyr auncyent customes rule theym secondarily letter haue ben made sealed cotrary theyr pryuyleges sen ye tyme thys rebellyon erle shall reuoke theym cancell euer thyrdely yt suche capytaynes almayne thys tyme haue ben ye duke erles wagys agayn flemynges shalbe solemply sworne hurt harme thys warre receyued none theyr nacion farre may lette shal nat hurt harme man ye cou trey flaunders tyme aft r reuengemet thys warre fourthly iiii ye best townes flauders xxv men chosen burgesys whych shall haue correccion al defautes nat touchynge lyfe dethe done ye flemynges also haue power correcte foud culpable erles counsayll co playntes offence crymynall fyftly sayde xxv persones shall haue auctoryte power make inquysycyon yere yere gouernaunce lande fawtes ben presented ten xiii theym syttynge togyther one counsayll shal haue full power gyue sentece vppon setece obeyed without interrupcio theym sentesed erle vpholde maynteyne wyth hys myghte power syxtely desyred nat concluded moch ye town audenarde terremoud toke party agayn theyr neyghbours walles theym certayne place shuld euened ye groud toke theyr vnnaturall dealyng seuently lastly cocluded prouost brugys shuld yt daye put erles cou sayll nat therunto admytted wythout cosent forenamed xxv persones whych artycles agreed vnto erle passed auctorysed hys lettre seale thys accorde cotynued whyle shall apere xvi yere moneth octobre inhabytauntes cyty towne mountpyller countrey languedoke inposicio ayde put duke angeou arose one accord agayne ye mynisters counceyllours duke whyche duke lewtenaunt generall vnder hys brother frenche kyng wythout reason dyscrecyo theyr furye rage slewe syr guyllyam poncell knyght chaunceller duke syr guy desseryke stuarde rouerge mayster arnolde gouernour mountpyller mayster iames de chainy secretary duke many offycers seruauntes sayde duke noubre lxxx persones wha slayn tyrauntes natte beynge contente wyth cruelnesse threwe dede bodyes dyuerse foule stynkynge pyttes nat sufferynge buryed cryste men shulde wherof wha knowlege broughte vnto ye duke therewyth greuously amoued made hys othe shulde punysshe theym fere example therupo gathered hys people reuenge thys cruel dede whan rumour thys myscheuouse dede deale apeased ye wyse men auncyent towne degested thys hasty cruel dede loked vpon ende therof appalled theyr myndes repetaunt dede done whan consydered thynges dede detestable selfe great myght duke ouer yt ayde whych shuld hym gyuen kynge coceyued well remedy seche meanes mercye grace opteynynge whereof made dyuers way duke none wold accepted lastely moneth ianuary wha ye duke prepayred thynges necessary warre toke hys iournay towarde sayd towne moupyler ledyng wyth hym stronge hoste men army vtterly entedynge subuerte towne dystroye parte people whereof herynge people towne toke theyr aduyce ordered foloweth fyrst sent agayn hym dyuers offycers kynges suche knewe hys fauoure ordeyned place knelynge aske grace mercy towne secondarily sent cardynall albany thyrdely collage religio well nunnys fourthly sent estudyautes lawe canon cyuyle also medycyne physyke beynge set vpon eyther syde waye ye duke shuld passe knelynge vppon theyr knee shulde crye wythout ceasynge mercy gracyous prynce mercy tha set consul ruler ye towne gownys without theyr clokes vngyrde euery corde aboute hys necke hauynge wyth key cytie entre ye cytye stode woman wyth ye maydes men chylderne whych vnder age xiii yeres betwene age vi yeres set next studyautes foresayd whan innumerable people thus ordered eueryche taughte wyse shuld behaue vpo xxv day ianuary houre iii ye duke wyth people approched towne beholdynge multytude lamentable crye moued wyth compassyo holdyng hys way mette wyth ye sayd cardynall whyche conuenyet salutacio vnto hym made shewed legate messynger sent vnto hym fro pope clemet vii requyryng hym pardo towne peple moutpiller admonestyng hym farther sayd pope behalfe euer punysshemet dyd vnto towne yt shuld absteyne hym ye shedynge cryste blode specyally suche myght knowe innocet yt dede whyche message duke gaue none answer toke cardynall vppon hys right hade rode forth togyder euer people kneled eyther syde ye way cryed lametably mercy gracious prynce mercy passed tyl came ye cosuls stode whiche knelyng offered vnto hym keyes ye towne though regarded nat cast hys loke fro comauded yt senesshal beaucayr receyue ye sayd key passed tyll came vnto ye copany wome whych releted stony hert se great lametacio made theyr wofull crye wherefore rydde called vpon fore ryders passe faster lastly came hys lodgynge whan duke comen vnto lodgynge anon commaunded offycers town consulat ruler ye vnto place called saynt germayne gate place toke watched wyth men armes vpon morowe folowynge commauded armoure artylery belogyng vnto towne broughte place hym assygned kept hys offycers cardinall came agayn vnto duke brought hym dyuers doctours diuinite made vnto hym assyduat labour mercy shewed vnto towne inhabytauntes coude g graut hym yt vpon ye morowe shuld know sentece wolde gyue vpon towne inhabitautes yt sentece myght well vnderstaden people comauded yt afternoone scaffolde shulde made chefe place strete towne wherupo morowe beynge xxvii day ianuary dyuers duke cousayll beyng vpo yt sayd scaffolde people town beynge present well prysoners longe oracion made duke chauceler greate heynous dede lately done inhabytautes towne ye whych correccyon temporall myghte nat greuouse duke commaundemente pope requeste hys legat cardynall present mytygate lessed punysshmet shuld well apere declaracyon sentence folowynge whych protestacion sentece proclaymed foloweth fyrste comynaltye town theyr rebellyon dysobedience agayne theyr prynce done shuld paye vnto ye kyng vi score frankes franke worth ii sterl ye towne shulde charged wyth lxm li terryble execu n ouer paye costes charge duke spent occasyon thys iournay secondaryly vi hundreth persones towne myght tryed moste culpable thys offence shuld suffre deth wytte iic hanged chaynes iic beheded theyr hedes sent vnto dyuers good townes frauce iic suche ye vic shalbe found moste gyltye begynnynge ryot shuld bret also iic whyche shulde haged shuld caryed vnto dyuerse good townes fraunce haue theyr execucio vtter fere terrour theyr goodes forfayted kynge thyrdely two gate ye towne duke wolde appoynt walles towres standynge betwene yt sayd gate made playne grounde dyke towne fylled wyth ye fourthly maner ordenaunce abylyme te warre belonging town forfayted vnto ye kyng fyftely comynalty cytye buylde chapell endowe wyth moche lade myght fynde vi preestes synge euer praye soules persones slayne bodyes whych throwe foule stynkyng pyttes counsayll chyefe ruler towne shuld vppon theyr propre backes brynge theym vnto sayde chappell cause theym solemply enterred syxtly goodes sayde persones slayne hadde wythin town elles spoyled sayde cytezeyns shulde restored vnto wyues nexte kynnesfolkes theym dede whan proclamacyon sentence ended exclamacyo cryenge mercy suche sorowe lametyng made ye peple noyse therof souded heuens brynge thys tragedy conclusyon fynally suche laboure made vnto duke aswell exortacyo sermon al thynges pardoned excepte foudacyon chapell execucyo certayne persones accused occasyoners thys myschiefe also costes iournay ye cessed xxiiii frakys xxiiiicli sterlynges whych ende thus made co sulat ye town restored agayn theyr habyte rule theym admytted former office rule towne except offyce bayly wyke moneth iuly began inhabytauntes gaut flauders rebell agayne theyr erle newe ye cause wherof nat shewed wyth ayde whych ipre courtray townes made great hoste yode streyghte vnto towne flauders called dyxmew entendyng haue take ye erle beyng warned therof wyth ayde bruges frak maned company agayn mette playne felde sharpe skyrmysshe put theym gaut flyght slewe dyuers toke certayne prysoners pursued vnto town ipre layed syege whan heddes towne knew erle propre parsone vnder certayne apoyntement opened gate receyued hym many hys enemyes fled vnto courtray whan erle rested hym towne ii dayes done execucyo departed thes rode vnto bruges helde hym whyche season whych aboue sayd fled vnto courtray fell varyaunce within theym selfe slewe theyr capytayne fled ye towne shyfted euery man hym selfe knyght called syr soyer gaut came vnto towne courtray exorted ruler towne yt promysed hym take hys parte wherupon gate baner erles armes hys hande rydynge aboute towne cryed wolde take erles party hys lette hym folowe baner whome people folowed greate noumber wha ye erle asserteyned dede howe town courtray tourned vnto hys party anone assembled townes also ipre moche hys hoste estemed lxm wyth whiche spedde hym vnto gaunte layed stronge syege deth french kyng whych dyed shortly erle fayne chaunge hys mynde remoue hys syege elles wryters reporte strength sayde towne whyche myght nat lyghtly gotte lacke good vpon ye erles partye maynteyne syegedethe kyng charles tha moneth septembre xxvi daye kynge charles dyed manoyr called playsance sur marne buryed wyfe monastery saynt denys whan reygned xv yeres vi monethes wyth odde dayes leuynge hym iii sonnes charles kyng hym lewys hadde made erle ualoys duke angeowe phylyppe erle poytyers p anglia richard second name sonn prynce edwarde eldest sonn edwarde ye iii chyld ye age xi yeres begane hys reygne ouer ye realme england ye xxii day iuny yere lorde mcccxxvii xiii yere vi charles kyng fraunce rycharde borne burdeaux whose byrthe wryters tell wonder whyche passe ouer vpon xv daye iuly yere abouesayd crowned westmynster beyng daye translacyon saynt swythyn whyche tyme season stoode mayre shryues cytye lodon persones folowynge anno dni mccclxxvii anno dni mccclxxviii grocer andrewe pykman nycholas brembre anno nycholas twyfforde whyche contynued theyr offyces saye ye shryues tyll myghelmas ye mayre tyl feest symon iude whyche season chosen admytted newe offycers anno dni mccclxxviii anno dni mccclxxix grocer iohn boseham iohn phylpot anno ii thomas cornwaleys moneth august begynnynge secode yere kyng rychard varyaunce betwene lorde latymer sir rafe ferrers vpo one partye syr robert hal shakerley esquyer vpon partye prysoner taken beyode see spayne called lorde dene whome sayd esquyers helde theyr possessio contrary wylles foresayde knyghtes sayde cause ye sayd knyghtes entred churche saint petyr fyndyng ye sayd syr robert knelynge masse wythoute reuerence sacrament place slewe hym churche ye hyghe masse seaso named shakerley theyr meanes arested towre london kepte prysoner longe anno dni mccclxxix anno dni mccclxxx grocer iohn heylysd ne iohn hadley anno iii wyllyam baret moneth may later ende seconde yere kynge rycharde certayne galeys shyppes sente charles syxte kynge fraunce whych chefe patron capytayne knyghte named syr olyuer de clycon landed dyuerse place englande dyd moche harme lastly entred ryuer thamis came grauysende spoyled towne brent parte thereof retourned fraunce moche rychesse affermeth frenche cronycle yere also holden parlyamente westmynster graunted men woman beynge age xiiii yeres aboue shulde paye vnto kynge iiiid reason whereof great grudge murmure grewe amonge common shall appere ye money armye prepared thereof made chefe gouernoure syr thomas woodstoke erle cambrydge vncle vnto ye kyng whiche company vii viiim testifyeth frenche cronycle passed ye water summe begynnynge auguste also begynnynge thyrde yere kynge rycharde came soysons passed ryuers oyse marne went troy wanne lodged atwene newe towne sen euer passed countreys toke great fynaunces elles fyred townes went frenche kynge hadde sente agayne armye frenchemen withstande letted nothinge theyr purpose skyrmysshes frenchemen put vnto wors bette toke dyuers prysoners raunsomed theyr pleasure thus holdynge theyr iourneye passed countrey gastinoys brytayne ioyously receyued syr iohn de mountforde duke prouince newly comyn thyther anno domini mccclxxx anno dni mccclxxxi fysshemonger walter doket wyllyam walworthe anno iiii wyllyam knyghthode mayres yere ende thyrde yere kyng rycharde towarde somer season dyuers place lande common arose sodainly ordeyned ruler capytaynes specially kent essex whiche named leders iacke straw wylwawe watte tyler iacke shepeherde tomme myller hobbe carter vnruled companye gathered vnto great multitude common spedde towarde cytie london assembled vpon blacke hethe kent within iii myles lodon vppon corpus christi daye beynge thanne xi daye iune entred towre london kynge beynge thanne lodged toke frome then parforce mayster sudberye archebysshoppe caunterbury syr robert halys lorde pryour saynte iohannes whyte frere cofessour vnto kynge whiche iii persones houge noyse crye ladde vnto hylle sayde towre smote theyr heddes whan hadde done returned suthewarke botes barge slewe robbed straungers tha myghte fynde done wente westmynster toke maner seyntwarymen came vnto ye duke lacasters place standing without ye temple barre called sauoye spoyled therin sette vpon fyre brent then yode vnto ye hede place saynt iohns smythefelde dispoiled place lyke wyse entred citye serched temple innes courte spoyled theyr place brent theyr bokes lawe slewe many men lawe questmongers myght fynde done went saynte martyns graunde toke sayntwary men prisoner newgate ludgate bothe counter distroyed theyr register bokes like maner dyd prysoners marshalsy kinges benche southwerke whan iacke strawe thus done thyng wyll sawe yt resistence made agayne smytten houge presumpcion thought man pere beynge enflamed yt presumpcion pryde rode vnto towre ye kyng beynge smally accompanyed hys lordes caused hym ryde aboute parte cytie conueyed hym smythfelde kynges presence caused proclamacyon made dyd full small reuerence vnto kynge paragraph mysordre presupcyon whan wyllyam walworthe mayre london behelde pure dysdayne pryde ran sodainly swerde wounded hym dethe forthwith strake hede areryd vpo speres poynte therewith cryed kynge rycharde kynge rycharde whan rebelles behelde theyr capytaynes hede anone fledde shepe howe many taken many slayne remenaunt chased cytie subbarbes ye clene voyded yt nyght whiche mondaye xv day iune whan kyng beholden great manhode mayre assystence bretherne alderman anone rewarde dede dubbed sayde wyllyam walworthe nycholas brembre iohn philpot nycholas twyfforde robert laudre roberte gayton alderman knyghtes season also called hurlynge tyme comons norfolke suffolke came vnto abbey burye slewe one kynges iustyces called iohn caundysshe pryour place spoyled bare awaye moche thyng sayd place aswell one rebelles taken dyuers sondry place put execucyon x xii xv xx one accused ye distruction great noumbre anno dni mccclxxxi anno dni mccclxxxii iohn rote iohn northampton anno v iohn hynde mayres yere moneth aprell landed kent dame anne doughter charles iiii late emperour almayne lately dede syster vnto wensyslaus day emperour whiche mayre cytezyns london honorably met vpo blacke hethe conueyed great tryumphe vnto westmynster viii day moneth maye shortely solemply maryed vnto kyng richarde season wryters later ende iune erthequaue englange lyke therof neuer sene englande day sen anno dni mccclxxxii anno dni mccclxxxiii adam bame iohn northampton anno vi iohn sely yere mayster henrye spencer bisshope norwyche great power spirituall men croysed commaundement pope clement vii enduryng scisme touched laste chapyter charles ye vi kynge frauce sayd pope gaue auctoryte sayd bysshoppe make warre vpon kynge spayne wryters haue moche contrarye sayde pope commaundement withhelde certayne possession belongynge ryght vnto duke lancastre syr iohn gaunte specially vnto dame constauce wyfe perfourmaunce whiche acte said bysshoppe entryng countrey flaunders fande ye flemynges dyuers myscreauntes suche foresaid king countrey spayne thyther sent makyng resystence agayne hym wherfore made sharpe warre wanne vpon certayne townes grauelyng burburgth dunkyrke wanne great ryche pyllage souldyours stuffed freight testyfyeth policronycon xli shyppes soone flemynges assembled wyth suche strength dunkyrke gaue vnto hym suche assaute constrayned gyue backe said shippes goodes shulde nat come vnto possessyon enemyes sette fyre within hauen wasted bothe shyppes goodes mysse happe recouered strengthe layed syege vnto ye towne ipre wrought flemynges moche care trouble shortely suche syckenesses fell amonge people flyre souldyours dyed great noumbre whiche compelled leaue hys iourney retourne englade yere also batayle feates armes done kynges palays westmynster atwene one called garton appellaunt syr iohn ansley knyght defendaut whiche fyght length knight vyctor caused enemye yelde hym whiche sayd garton place drawen vnto tyburne hanged false accusacyon surmyse anno dni mccclxxxiii anno dni mccclxxxiiii grocer symonde wynchecombe nycholas brembre anno vii iohn anno dni mccclxxxiiii anno dni mccclxxxv nycholas exton nycholas brembre anno viii iohn frenshe yere king rycharde holdynge christmas eltham thyther came vnto hym kynge ermony whiche chased lande infydels turkes required ayde ye kynge restored vnto dominyon kynge fested comforted according honour cousell taken hys lordes concerninge mater gaue vnto great somme money ryche gyftes whiche taryed englande vpo ii monethes departed glad countenaunce soone ester kynge greate armye yode towarde scotlade whan drewe nere vnto border meanes sought scottes peace concluded atwene bothe realmes certayne tyme whiche conclusion taken kynge returned vnto yorke restyd hym season tyme varyaunce fell atwene iohn holade brother erle kent erles sonne stafforde reason whiche varyaunce conclusion ye sayd sonne erle slayne hande syr iohn holade whiche dede kynge greuously amoued departed shortely company toward london anno dni mccclxxxv anno dni mccclxxxvi grocer iohn organ nycholas brembre anno ix iohn chyrcheman yere kynge rycharde assembled westmynster hys highe court parliamet durynge whiche amonge many actes counsell concluded created ii duke marque v erles whiche firste syr edmonde langley kynges vncle erle cambrydge created duke yorke syr thomas woodstoke vncle erle buckyngham create duke gloucester syr lyonell uere yt erle oxenforde made marque deuelyn sir henry bolingbrooke sonne heyre iohn gaut duke lancastre made erle derby syr edwarde sonne heyre vnto duke yorke made erle rutlande syr iohn holande brother erle kent made erle huntyngdone syr thomas monbraye made erle notyngham marshall englande syr mychaell de la poole made erle suffolke chau celler englade auctoryte parlyamente syr roger mortymer erle marche sonne heyre vnto syr edmonde mortymer dame philyppe eldest doughter heyre vnto syr lyonell ye seconde sonne edward thyrde soone proclaymed heyre paraunt vnto crowne englande whiche sir roger shortely sayled irelande pacifye hys lordeshyppe wulster whiche lorde foresayde mother whyle occupyed aboute wylde irysshe came vpon hym noumbre slewe moche company sir roger hadde issue edmonde roger anne alys elynoure made nunne ii foresaid sonnes died without issue anne eldest doughter maryed rycharde erle cambrydge whiche rycharde sonne vnto syr edmonde langley named rycharde hadde issue sayde anne isabell ladye bouchier rycharde duke yorke father kynge edwarde iiii whiche sayd richarde erle cambridge put deth henry v shall appere yere also syr hery bolingbroke erle derby maryed countesse doughter herforde whome lorde countrey issue henry kynge blaunche duches barre philippe wedded kynge denmarke also thomas duke clarence iohn duke bedforde humfrey duke gloucester anno domini mccclxxxvi anno domini mccclxxxvii goldesmythe wyllyam stondon nycholas exton anno x wyllyam x yere erle arundell sent duchye guyan strengthe suche soudyours king tyme party wryters scoure see rouers enemyes whiche erle kepynge course passage encountred myghtye flote flemynges laden rochel wyne set vpon distressed theyr shyppes broughte vnto dyuers porte englade reason wherof sayde wyne plenteous englande tonne thereof solde marke xx choyse amonge flote taken admyralle flaunders whyche remayned longe prysoner anno domini mccclxxxvii anno dni mccclxxxviii goldesmythe wyllyam uenour nycholas exton anno xi hughe fostalfe xi yere kyng rycharde syr thomas woodstocke duke gloucester erle arundell erles warwyke derby notyngham consyderynge howe king hys lande mysse ladde fewe persones aboute kynge entendyng reformacion assembled haue counsell radecoke brydge arrered great people stronge power came london caused ye king call liament wherof herynge maister alexander neuyle archebysshop yorke sir lyonell uere marque deuelyn syr mychaell de la poole chaunceller erle suffolke fearyng punisshement fledde lande died straunge countreys kynge counsell aboue named lordes durynge parlyament caused taken syr roberte treuylian chefe iustyce englande syr nycholas brembre late mayre cytie london sir iohn salysbury knyghte housholde r iohn beauchap stewarde also kynges house syr symonde burley knyghte syr iames berne syr robert belknappe knyghtes sergeaunt armes called iohn uske whyche auctoryte sayde parlyamente conuycte treason put execucyon tybourne towre hyll iohn holt iohn locton richarde gray willyam burgth roberte fulthorpe iustyce foresayd lordes whiche said voyded lande auctoryte sayd court parlyamente banysshed exyled lande euer anno domini mccclxxxviii anno domini mccclxxxix goldesmythe thomas austeyne syr nycholas twyfforde anno xii adam cathyll xii yere moneth nouembre yet durynge lyament executed smythefylde london marcyall iustes tournement suche persones came vpon ye kynges partye theyr armour apparayle garnysshed whyte hertes crownes golde neckes shorte xxiiii xxiiii ladyes also apparayled aboue sayd ladde xxiiii cheynes golde horse conueyed thoroughe cytie vnto smythefelde frome towre london king quene many great estate beynge present proclamacions herroddes made many goodly marcyall actes warre put vre great recreacion comforte kynge quene beholder dysporte came many straungers amonge whiche erle saynt poule lorde ostreuaunt sonne heyre vnto duke holade yonger sonne erle ostryche greatly commended whan iustes contynued sondrye tymes space xxiiii dayes great comforte recreacyon many yonge lusty bachellers desyrous wynne worshyppe kinges great honoure season kepte open housholde honeste comer fynysshed straugers retourned cou trey many ryche gyftes anno domini mccclxxxix anno domini mccclxxxx grocer iohn walcot wyllyam uenour anno xiii iohn louene thys xiii yere kynge rychard esquier ye prouince nauerne fraunce accused englysh esquyer called iohn welshe certayne poyntes treason tryall wherof day fyght betwene taken foughten kynges palays westmynster eyther theym kept hys daye fought stronge fyght ende iohn welshe vyctoure constrayned yelde hym dyspoyled hys armoure drawen tyburne haged hys vntrouthe anno dni mcccxc anno dni mcccxci iohn fraunces adam bamme anno xiiii thomas vyuent thys xiiii yere kyng rychard syr iohn gaut duke lancastre wyth goodly copany men armes sayled spayn clayme suche landes shulde haue ryght dame co staunce hys wyfe whyche doughter peter ryghtfull kynge spayne xl yere kyng edward thyrde playnly declared whan sayde duke vpon syde see came vnto hym kynge portyngale wyth stronge army entred terrytory spayne whether englishe men longe portyngaleys moche harme done spanyardes robbynge pyllyng countrey whyche cause grudge betwene kyng portyngale duke caused many spanyardes whyche oughte good wyll wythdrawe depart reformacyo ille certayn persones aswel english portyngaleys founde gyltye suche robbery putte vnto deth meane whereof fered meane kynge duke put great afterdeale reaso reformacyon ille gat dayly vppon theyr enemyes processe tyme folowyng ye kyng spayne dryuen necessyte treate wyth duke peace concorde whyche peace wytnesseth polycronycon hys last boke vii chapyter condycio fyrste fynall concorde kynge spayne shuld marye ye duke eldest doughter name costauce done shulde gyue vnto ye duke recopensacyon hys costes many wedge golde shulde charge lade viii charettes ouer yerely durynge lyues sayde duke hys wyfe shuld hys propre coste charge delyuer duke assygneys xm marke golde wythin ye towne bayon thys peace stablysshed suertyes taken perfourmaunce duke departed wyth kynge portyngale whome shortelye maryed hys second doughter named dame anne thys yere also cruel warre whyche turkes made agayne ianueys men ieane requyred ayde kynges englande fraunce whyche cause oute englande sente noble warryour called erle alby wyth two thousande archer fraunce duke burbon erle ewe wyth xvc speres whych kept theyr iournay tyll came vnto cytye barbary named thunys somtyme belongynge sayde ianuays sayd englyshe frenchemen bare manfully wyth ayde ye ianuayes proces tyme wanne ye sayde cytye fro turkes put ye ianuayes agayne possessyon therof toke theym many prysoners whyche exchaunged chrysten prysoners taken ouer forsed sayd sarazyns yelde vnto ianuayes xm ducates gold confyrmacyon peace certayne tyme french cronycle sayth moche duke burbon hadde vnderstandynge yt duke lancaster made warre vpon kyng iohn spayn therfore lefte thys iournay ayded hi agayne sayde duke lancaster hys lytle honour howe euer many englyshme loste countreys reason flyxe sykenesses also antoninus sayeth sarazyns thys iourney nat dyspossessed cytye thunys trewes hadde two yeres graunted vnto chrysten men certayne summe money restytucyon many chrysten prysoners anno dni mcccxci anno dni mcccxcii iohn chadworth draper iohn heende anno xv henry uamere thys xv yere kynge rycharde kepynge hys crystmas hys manour woodstocke erle penbrooke beynge yonge age desirouse lern iuste requyred knyghte named syr iohn saynte iohan renne wyth hym certayne course whose requeste sayd knyght ranne hym woodstoke parke certayne course whyche wyth stroke myshap sayd erle receyued hys dethes wounde dyed shortly yere also moneth iuny baker man berynge basket full horsebrede serue hys maysters customer fletestrete whanne came foreagayn bysshop salysburyes place standynge salysbury aley seruaunt bysshoppes starte vnto basket toke oute one louys baker wolde agayne haue recouered hys horse lofe ye bysshoppes seruaut wyth hys dagger brake baker hed came inhabytauntes strete wolde haue broughte yoman vnto warde brekynge kynges peace rescowed hys felowes hadde vnto bysshoppes palays whyche daye stoode treasourer englande rescous people beyng fury greate multytude gathered aboute palays wolde haue entred parforce haue set yoman agayn whome bysshoppes seruautes made resistece yt ye rumour grewe peple cytye aswell suche yll dysposycion encreased greate noumbre fame thys doyng tha sprage ye mayer haste wyth dyuers alderman shyryues sped hym thyther se peace kepte dyd cowde withdrawe people ye mayer offycers citie comyn thyder comons partyes cytye drewe thyder moche multytude thanne ye noumbre worse rule moche wold nat satysfyed myghte haue ye yoman delyuered whose name walter romayne brynge theyr foly made many assautes gate ye sayd palays bysshop hym selfe beynge wyndesore lastly many showtes lyftes gate made dyscrescio mayre alderman dyscrete comoners cytye people mynysshed sente agayne euery hys dwellynge set quyet reste whan worde came vnto bisshop moch worse maner tha thynge dede gyuing light credece without examinacio made matter assocyat vnto hym mayster arundell archebisshop yorke chauceler englade greuously enfourmed kyng toke agayne cytye ryght greuouse dyspleasure hast mayre sent kynge whose commyng layd vnto charge great heynous mater non otherwyse ruled cytye suffered cytezyns make suche assautes vppo kynges hed offycers kynges great dyshonour ieopardy suche great treasoure kynges custody kepynge broughte vnto kynges presence whome nat wythstadyng hys reasonable excuse made kyng ryght sore blamed greuously sayde vnto tha mayre sheryues dyscharged rule ye cytie liberty seased kynges hades knyghte court called syr edward daligryge good man fauourable ye cytezeyns made gouernoure cytye xxi daye iune contynued offyce fyrste daye iuly next ensuyng whych day beynge begynnynge ye kynges xvi yere hys reygne discharged syr baldewyn radyngton knyght putte hys rome cotynued tyll feest symode iude folowynge dyspleasure cytezyns plees sutes kept tyme westmynster hall remoued holde yorke great noyaunce lande whyche contynued tyll crystmas thys mayres yere also great traslacio bisshoppes thys dyspleasure thus hagyng towarde cytye cytezyns made contynuall labour vnto kynges grace meanes quene doctour grauysende bysshope london whych ought theyr especiall fauoures vnto cytye whose meanes cytezeyns restored vnto theyr lybertyes hadde licence chose selfe mayre two shyryues vppon saynt mathewis daye folowynge chose shyryues gylberte manyfolde manfelde thomas newyngton vppon saynte edwardes daye kynge confessoure chase theyr mayre wyllyam stondon grocer whyche lyeutenaunte towre tyme admytted sworne yet kynges dyspleasure natte reconcyled cytezeyns admytted vnto hys grace fauoure anno dni mcccxcii anno dni mcccxciii grocer gylbert manfeylde wyllyam stondon anno xvi thomas newynghtyn thys mayres yere xvi yere kynge rycharde thys newe mayre wyth worthyest men cytye made assyduat daylye meanes vnto kynges grace haue hys moste bounteouse pardo hys especyall fauoure vnto ye cytye whych lengthe meanes fredes purchased kyng specyally laboure ye good quene anne fornamed bysshop london put good coforte vpo theyr demeanour submyssion kynges commyng londo upon whyche coforte cytyzyns made royall costyous purueyauce receyue kynge theyr best maner hauynge monyssyon kyng entended come vnto hys palays westmynster apparayled one lyuerey ye noumbre iiiic horseman well seen mette wyth hym vpon heth thys halfe hys manour shene moste lowlye wyse accordynge theyr dutyes submytted vnto hys grace besechynge hym hys specyall grace pardon suche thynges tymes offended agayne hys hyghnesse ye entent hys grace myght se coformyte hys subiectes recorder made instauce hym wolde hys great bounte take great peyne vppon hym ryde thorough hys chaumber london whych request graciously accepted helde hys iournay tyll came londo brydge preseted wyth ii fayre stedes trapped ryche cloth golde partyd redde whyte whyche present thakefull receyued helde hys way tyll came standarde chepe cytezyns ye cytye stadynge vpo eyther syde stretes theyr lyuereys cryeng kyng rycharde kyng rychard theyr backes ye wyndowys wally hanged wyth ryche tapettes clothes arasse moste goodlye shewyng wyse sayd standarde chepe ordeyned sumptuouse stage whych sette diuers personage ryche apparel amonge yt whych angell ordeyned whyche set ryche crowne golde garnysshed wyth stone perle vppon kynges hede passed done rode paulys offered rode vnto westmynster mayre hys company takyng theyr loue returned vnto london uppon morowe whyche fyftene daye moneth sayde mayre hys bretherne yode vnto westmynster presented yt kynge wyth two guylte basyns theym two thousande noble golde besechynge hym moste humble wyse good gracyouse lorde vnto cytye whyche accepted ryghte fauourably gaue vnto theym many comfortable wordes thyrde daye folowynge receyued newe confyrmacion theyr olde fraunchyses lybertyes wherfore counsayll theyr frendes ordeyned aulter table syluer ouer gylte therein ymagery grauen enameled moste curiously story saynte edwarde whiche valuyd marke presented also gaue vnto kynge shortely offered shryne saynte edwarde wythin abbay yet stades thys daye great zele loue whych ye fore sayde bysshop londo ought vnto cytye hys meanes theyr lybertyes agayne restored therfore theyr owne goodly dysposycion hys decease accustomed yet thys daye done go yerely vpo feestfull dayes folowynge yt say fyrst morow symode iude whych daye mayer taketh charge westmynster paulys saye west ende ye churche lieth grauen deprofundis hys soule crysten lyke maner vpo alhalowen daye crystmasse daye ii nexte day folowyng newe yeres daye twelf day cadelmas day wyth also morowe myghelmasse day vpon whyche shyryfes yerely take theyr charge westmynster whych ix day nat onely mayer hys bretherne vse thys progresse kepe thys obsequy also craftes cytye theyr lyueryes vse yerely whan kyng wythdrawen aboue sayde hys displeasure fro cytye thanne hyllarye terme folowyng ye feest cristmas kynges courtes plees crowne wytl retourned fro yorke westmynster anno dni mcccxciii anno dni mcccxciiii grocer drewe barentyne iohn hadley anno xvii rycharde whytyngton thys mayer begynnyng xvii yere kyng rycharde yt meane moneth nouebre certayn gentylmen scotlade entendynge wynne honoure chalenged certayne poyntes armes fyrste lord moryf chalenged erle nothyngham marshall englande syr wyllya darel knyght chaleged syr peter courtnay knyght cokborne esquyer chalenged syr nycholas hawberke knyght feates armes done smythfelde london marse frendely vnto englyshmen honoure ye iournay went wyth moche erle marshall ouerthrewe hys appellaunte brused hym returne towarde scotlande dyed yorke syr wyllyam darell refused appellat ronne theyr full course thyrde wyt cocborne throwen secod copyng groud horse man vpon vii day iuny folowyng dyed yt gracyouse woman quene anne lieth buryed westmynster hyr lorde kynge rycharde vpo ye southsyde saynt edward shryne whose soul al criste lord mercyfull thys yere moneth septembre witnesseth frenche cronycle meanes erle derby whych fraunce kynge englandes partye duke burbone erle ewe vpon french partye wyth trewes concluded saynte omers iiii yeres nat wythstandyng peace frenchman englyshemen ranne togyther sundry tymes whanne one espyed haue auauntage vppon anno dni mcccxciiii anno dni mcccxcv mercer wyllyam brampton iohn frenshe anno xviii thomas knolles thys xviii yere kynge rycharde shortly crystmas wyth strong army sayled ireland whych iournay hys charge honoure maner wherof syn souded honoure prynce myne auctor therfore lyste nat boke make loge processe ye mater yere also tyme began heresy iohn wycclyffe sprynge englande whyche greatly auaunced meane scysme churche hangynge dayes betwene two pope sittynge one whyche began shewed xxiiii yere charles vi tha kyng frauce urban vi clement syxt contynued vnder bonyface ix benet xiii whyche erronyouse oponyons sayd heresy desyrouse se contentes let serche cronica cronicarum shall se brefely set thys yere also wonderful tepest wynde space iuly august specially septebre violence wherof sundry place lande greate wonderfull hurte done bothe church house thys yere dyed constance secod wyfe iohn duke lacastre lyeth buryed leyceter anno domini mcccxcv anno dni mccclxcvi uy tener roger elys wyllyam anno xix wyllyam sheryngham begynnynge thys mayres yere xix yere kynge rycharde xviii daye nouembre affermeth ye frenche cronycle kyng rycharde beynge tha calays spowsed toke wyfe wythin churche saynt nycholas isabel doughter charles vi kyng fraunce whych lady isabell wytnesseth sayde frenche story day hyr marryage wythin viii yeres age regestred one ye bokes guyldehalle london frenche kynge propre persone came downe wyth goodly companye lordes knyghtes vnto towne called arde whyche standeth vppon vtter border pycardy wythin hys owne domynyon ryche sumptuouse pauylyon pyght lyke maner litle beyonde guynys wythin english pale another lyke pauylyon pyghte kynge rycharde betwene two sayde pauylyons distaunce lxx pace mydway atwene bothe ordained ye thyrde pauylion ye bothe kinges coming eyther theyr tentes sondry tymes met communicacion eyther wayes distaunce atwene set certayne persones apoynted standynge arme ii ii one syde beynge set englysshemen frenche certeyne distauce eyther ii first sayde pauilyons stode bothe hoostes bothe prynces suche co panyes either appointed bryng shuld brynge dyuers metynges ye sayd prince curyous seruices eyther caused fed serued within eyther theyr tentes theyr dalyaunce pastymes continuynge season metynges dyuersyte manifolde spice wynes whiche ministred ye said season ye ryche apparell sayde pauilyons cupbordes garnysshed plate rich iewels wold aske loge tracte tyme yt desirous knowe cyrcumstauce ye premysses let rede ye worke maister iohn froysarde made frenche shall se euery thynge touched ordre shall shortly touch giftes yt gyuen eyther ye prince lordes fyrst king rychard gaue vnto ye frenche kynge hanap basyn golde ewer ye tha againwarde ye freche king gaue vnto iii stading cuppes golde couers garnisshed perle stone shippe golde set vpon bere rychely garnysshed perle stone theyr seconde meting king rycharde gaue vnto ouche set fyne stone yt valued vc marke sterlynge agayne frenche king gaue vnto ii flaggons golde tablet golde therein ymage saint mychaell rychely garnisshed also tablet gold crucifixe therin well rychely dyght also tablet golde ymage trynite rychely set perle stone also tablet gold ymage saynt george likewise set perle stone whiche valued summe xvc marke king richarde seyng ye boute frenche kinge gaue hym bauderyke coler golde set greate dyamantes rubyes balessys beyng valued vm mark whiche preciosyte thereof excellency fynesse stuffe frenche kynge therfore ware aboute necke often king mette together frenche kyng gaue vnto hym ouche spyce plate golde great weyght valued iim marke many ryche gyftes receyued lordes ladyes bothe prynces amonge whiche specially noted iii giftes whiche kyng richarde gaue vnto duke orleauce receyued agayne duke trebyll value valued marke duke valued thre thousade marke finally whan ye said prince hadde thus eyther solaced concluded mater concernynge abouesayde maryage frenche kyng delyuered vnto kyng rycharde dame isabell doughter sayenge wordes folowynge ryght dere beloued sonne delyuer creature yt loue worlde next wife sonne besechynge ye father heuen may pleasure weale youre realme amyte atwene ii realmes auoydyng effusyon chrysten men blode maye kepte inuyolet terme atwene v co cluded whiche terme xxx wynter expresseth frenche cronycle whiche wordes many thankes giuen vpon eyther party preparacyon made detinge kynge rycharde conueyed frenche kynge towarde arde toke leaue returned vnto wyfe immediatlye great honoure conueyed vnto caleys kyng spoused haue shewed solempnisacion al honour ended kynge yonge wyfe toke shyppyng within short whyle landed douer then sped hym towarde london wherof cytezens beynge warned made certayne horseman well appointed one lyuetye coloure conysaunce brodered vpon theyr sleues whereby euery felyshyppe knowen whyche mayre hys bretherne clothed scarlet met kynge quene vpon blacke hethe due salutacyon reuerente welcome vnto theim made mouthe recorder sayd cytezens conueyed kynge vpon wey tyll came newyngton kynge commaunded mayre company returne cytie hys lordes ladyes appointed nyght lye kenyngton nat longe kenington brought great pompe vnto towre london whyche season exceding prece london brydge reason therof certayne persones thruste deth amonge whyche pryoure typtre place essex one vpon morowe folowynge conueyed throughe ye cytie honoure myghte deuysed vnto westmynster crowned quene vpon sonday beynge viii day ianuary somer folowynge kynge sinistre counsell delyuered vp poyntement towne breste brytayne duke whiche occasyon displeasure atwene kyng ye duke gloucestre hys vncle yere folowyng shalbe clerely shewed anno domini mccclxxxxvi anno dni mccclxxxxvii goldesmythe thomas wylforde adam bame anno xx wyllyam parker xx yere kynge rycharde moneth february kinge holdynge sumptuous feest westmynster halle many soudyours whiche newely comen towne brest foresayd presed hall kepte rome together whiche companye whan duke gloucestre hadde beholden frayned knowen men howe sayde towne gyuen vppe contrary knowlege therewith mynde sore discomforted moche whan kynge entred hys chaumbre fewe nere vnto hym sayde vnto kynge syr haue ye nat sene felawes yt satte great noumbre daye halle suche table kynge answered yes axed duke copany duke answered saide sir ben youre souldyours comen breste nowe haue nothynge take knowen howe shyfte theyr lyuynge rather enfourmed haue benne tyme euyll payed said ye king nat yt shulde well payed haue cause coplayne let shewe vnto tresourer shalbe resonably answered resonynge mater farther duke said vnto kyng syr ye ought put body payne wynne stroge holde towne feate warre ye toke vpon sell delyuer towne stroge holde gotten great difficulte mahode noble progenitours ye kyng chauged countenauce answered sayd uncle say ye tho wordes ye duke boldelye recyted ye foresayd wordes wherunto king beynge discontented said wene ye yt marchaut fole sell lade saynt iohn baptist nay trothe yt cosyn duke brytaine hath rendred vnto v al sumes money progenitours lente vnto auncetours vpon said towne brest whiche reason good conscience yt haue towne restored agayne meane whiche wordes thus vttred duke suche rancoure malyce kyndelyd atwene kinge hym yt ceased nat tyll sayde duke put dethe murdre vnlefully duke apperceyuynge kinges misledynge certayne persones entendyng thereof reformacion ye weale kinge realme called vnto abbot saynte albons abbot pryour westmynster shewed secrete mynde whose counselles made assemble shortely arundell assemble came day appoynted dyuers lordes bothe spirituall temporall selfe erle arundell also thyther came erle notyngham marshall englande erle warwyke spirituall lordes archebisshoppe caunterbury abbottes saynte albones westmynster whyche assemble thus made eueryche theym sworne within castell arundel viii day august toke theyr counsell condiscended yts dyuers lordes king duke lancastre duke yorke shulde putte suche auctoryte rule lande bare offycers suche thought preiudicial vnto weale lande shulde dyscharged punisshed theyr demerytes whan many thynges amonge concluded eueryche theym departed tyll tyme metynge atwene theym appoynted erle notyngham contrarye othe promyse fearing sequell matter yode shortely vnto kynge dyscouered vnto hym premiss wherefore kynge haste called secrete counsell london said erle notynghames place place erle huntyngdone concludyd yt sayd erle huntyngdone shulde strengthe fetche vnto king erles arundell warwyke meane whyle kynge propre sone arested vncle syr thomas woodestoke plasshy essex sayeth englysshe cronycle wryter la yne saythe kyng rycharde propre persone rode vnto manoure grenewyche nyghte tyme toke hym bedde commauded hym vnto towre lodon whiche shortely conueyed vnto calays pyteously murderyd soone foresayd erles arundell warwyke brought vnto towre london also syr iohn cobham syr iohn cheynye knightes erle arundell taken bayle wente large vnder suertie tyll begynnynge parlyament whiche season dyuers brought sondrye prysones kynge sente commissyoners vnto lordes realme come vnto hys parliament began vpon xvii day septembre begynninge xxi yere ye kynge later ende thys mayres yere noted adam bame mayre dyed begynning moneth iune whome chosen admytted viii day ye sayd moneth mayre rycharde whytyngton occupye full yere meane tyll feest symonde iude vpon saynt edwardes day folowyng whan newe mayre accustomed chosen electe agayne yere folowynge stode offyce mayraltye hoole yere v monethes returne fyrst mater whan kyng hadde assembled lordes yt whiche came stronge myghtie companyes cytie suffysed nat lodge people fayne lodgyd small townes vyllages nere vnto ye within short tyme sayde parlyamente begonne erles arundell warwyke broughte lordes parlyamente holden westmynster fynally iudged foloweth erle arudell ladde fote westmynster place iugemet thoroughe highe stretes cytie vnto towre hylle hys hede stryken erle warwyke also iudged dethe great age meane hys frendes iugemente pardoned altered perpetuall prison kyng wolde comaunde hym whiche vnto ye ile man lancasshyre consumed resydue hys olde dayes erle arundelle accordinge sentence vpon gyuen vpon morowe folowyng feest saynte mathewe beynge saterday xxii day septembre ladde fote vnto ye towre hyll beyng accompanyed great strengthe men moche demyd yt shuld haue ben rescued waye none suche attempted peasably brought vnto sayde place execucyon pacientlye mekely toke dethe whose body freres augustynes borne vnto theyr place within warde bradestrete london northe syde quyer solempnely buryed vpon graue sumptuous toumbe marble stone sette edifyed auctoryte said parlyament archebysshoppe caunterbury exyled realme vpon monday folowynge beynge xxiiii daye septembre syr iohn lord cobham sir iohn cheyny knyght iudged drawen hanged quarteryd instaunce labour frendes iugement chaunged vnto perpetuall prison thys done ye kynge ordayned royall feeste helde open housholde honeste comer affirmeth peter pyctauyence wryter historyes prynce kynge rycharde passed progenytours lyberalytie boun ie whiche feest also parlyament yet holdynge kynge created v duke marque v erles fyrste erle derby syr hery bolygbrooke sone heyre iohn gaunte duke lacastre created duke herforde secode whiche erle rutlande created duke amnerle thyrde beynge erle kent created duke surrey fourthe beynge erle notyngham created duke norfolke fyfte erle huntyngedon whiche created duke exeter also erle somerset made marque dorset erles fyrste lorde westmerlande named dane ra neuyll made erle westmerlande lorde tresorer syr wyllya scrope made e le wylshyre syr iohn de mountague made erle salesbury whan busines fynisshed parlyament remoued vnto shrewysbury vnto hyllarye terme fynysshed many mennes dyspleasures dysherytynge many trewe heyres anno domini mccclxxxxvii anno dni mccclxxxxviii mercer wyllyam askeham rycharde whyttyngton anno xxi iohn wodecoke xxi yere kynge rycharde people lande murmured grudged sore againe kynge counsell moche goodes belongynge vnto crowne disperblyd gyuen vnworthy persones occasyon whereof dyuers charge exaccyons put vpon people also chefe ruler aboute prynce lowe byrthe small reputacyon men honoure kepte fauoure also duke glouceter secretely murdred without processe lawe many thynges elles mysordered laste parlyament whereof wyte blame layed vnto kynge persones named well wrongefull dysherytynge sondrye persones sayde parlyamente suche menyall seruauntes foresayde duke gloceter erles arundell warwyke contrarye hys owne proclamacyons made concernynge suche mater also dyuers patentes grauntes passyd kynges great seale well pardon great mater yet kynges singuler auauntage suche fewe persones bare rule hym many theym called agayne also sheryffes offycers shyres englande wonte named iiii discrete sone iuges ye whiche kyng shulde assygne two yere folowynge owne wylle pleasure wolde refuse chose suche ii hym lyked knewe well wolde lene weale comen weale lande subiectes also tymes ye kynges englande vsed sende commyssyons vnto burgeses cyties townes chose theyr fre lybertie suche knyghtes shyre thought mooste wealefull comen weale sayde shyre lande nowe kyng rycharde wolde appoynte persones wylle chose named wherby singuler cause preferred commen cause put also kinge rycharde thoroughe euyll counsell commaunded letter vnto sheryffes shyres fewe excepted persones honoure within theyr countyes well spirytuall temporall shulde make certayne othes generall wordes ouer wryte seale certayne bondes perfourmaunce sayde othes also blanke chartour many men substaunce constrayned seale theyr great charge people contynually murmured grudgyd iniuryes many mo whyche tyme deposynge artyculed agayne hym xxxviii sondry artycles also rumoure ranne vpon hym letten ferme reueneus ye crowne busshey bogot grene whiche caused well noble men realme grudge agayn hym comon people thus co tynuynge mysorder within lande dyed syr iohn gaunt duke lancaster bysshoppe elyes place holborne then caried vnto saint pouls vppon north syde ye quyre honorably buryed whose enterremente chefe lordes englande present foudyd dame blauche hys wyfe honorable anniuersary haue shewed ye xliiii yere edwarde thyrde whiche right ought set place yere also aboute feste saynt bartholomew fell discencyon discorde bytwene ye duke herforde duke norfolke wherfore duke herforde accused ye hadde taken iiii thousande marke kynges suche money shulde therwith haue waged certeyne sowdyours caleys whiche lefte vndone toke money hys owne vse wryter sayth ye sayde two duke rode vppon tyme parlyament towarde theyr lodgynges ye duke norfolke sayd vnto syr se varyable kyng wordes shamefully putteth lordes kynesfolkes deth exileth holdeth pryson wherfore full necessary take kepe truste myche hys wordes without dowte tyme come wyll suche lyke meanes brynge v vnto lyke deth distruccyon whiche wordes sayde duke herforde accused vnto kynge wherfore eyther wagyd batayle kynge daye metynge gyuen eyther vpon xi daye september fyghte within lystes couetre thynge ordeyned whiche place ye day assygned thyder came sayde two duke appered felde kynges presence redy theyr batayle ye kyng anone forbad fyght forthwith exyled duke herforde x yeres duke norfolk euer whiche sentence shortely put execucyon thanne duke herforde sayled frauce taryed season lacke ayde comforte departed then came brytayne duke norfolke passed dyuers countreys lastely came vnto cytie uenyce endyd lyfe soone thys maister roger walden chapeleyne kynges made archebysshoppe caunterbury whyche speciall louer vnto citie london made great labour vnto kynges grace ye greuously newe dyspleased moche enfourmed yt shulde counsell sheriffes withstade certayne actes made laste parlyament yt comynaltie cytie endyted sheryffes redresse wherof cou sell sayd archebysshoppe maister robert braybroke bisshoppe lodon cytezens made lamentable supplicacyon vnto kinge whiche ayde fauoure sayd two bysshoppes louers ye cytie ye kinges yre indignacyon meane lowly supplicacyon parte appeased withdrawen yet contente te ye kinges mynde many blanke chartours deuysed broughte cytie many ye substancyall men fayne seale theyr payne charge conclusyon yt whiche shortely vsed thoroughe countreys englande anno domini mccclxxxxviii anno dni mccclxxxxix goldesmythe iohn wade drewe barentyne anno xxii iohn warner xxii yere kynge rycharde ye comon fame ranne yt kyng letton ferme ye realme englande vnto sir wyllyam ope erle wylshyre treasourer englade sir iohn busshey syr iohn bagot syr henry grene knightes ye whyche returned shortly great cofusyos yere also thomas ye son heyre ye erle arundell lately beheded ye whiche thomas nat pleasure kepte ye house duke exceter passed ye see ye meanes one wyllya scot mercer yode vnto vncle yt archebisshop cauterbury contynued cytie colayne beynge pastyme great purueyaunce made ye kynges iourney irelade yt whan thinges necessarye honoure nede kynge people redy set forthwarde vpon iourney moneth apryll leauyng leutenaunt englange sir edmonde
