langley vncle duke yorke toke shippyng brystowe sayled mighty stronge hoste irelande prosperous spede processe tyme manhode good polycie subdued coutrey whiche voyage acte dyd ye kynges bounte henry sone heyre duke herforde exiled ye kyng made knyght henry father crowned kynge englande named henry v kynge richarde thus beynge occupyed irelande receyuynge capytaynes wylde irysshe subieccyon orderyng countrey set ordre rule henry bolyngbroke duke herforde exyled archebysshoppe caunterbury thomas arundel landed small company rauyns spore northe countrey moneth august vnder colour clayme ryghtfull enherytaunce ceysed people wente whome short processe great multytude people drewe gatherd landyng king rycharde beynge warned hasty spede returnyng englande left irelade behynde hym moche ordenauce landed mylforde hauen begynnyng septembre begynnynge also xxiii yere reygne yode vnto castell flynte wale rested people entended gather vnto hym strength whiche meane tyme foresayd henry hadde proclaymed selfe duke lancaster ryght iohn gaute father comyn brystowe without resystence toke sir wyllyam scrope erle wylshyre treasourer englande syr iohn busshey syr henry grene also taken sir iohn bagot escaped fledde irelande thre iuged put execucyon kinge rycharde styll beynge castell flynte herynge great strengthe yt ye duke fearyd sore selfe lyke wyse dyd suche hym wherfore syr thomas percye erle worcetyr stewarde kynges housholde contrarye allegeaunce brake openly whyte rodde hall commaundyd euery man shifte selfe reason whereof people voyded kynge lefte without co forte shortly taken presented vnto duke whyche put hym vnder safe kepynge shortly spedde toward lodon wha came nere vnto ye cytie sente king rycharde secret copany vnto ye towre safely kepte tyll commyng wherof many euyll disposed persones cytie beyng warned assembled great noumbre entended haue mette without towne haue taken ladde haue slayne great cruelte tyme vsed vnto cytie god wolde mayre ruler cytie enfourmed theyr malycyous purpose gathered theym worshypfull commoner sadde men whose polycyes nat without great diffyculte reuoked frome theyr euyll purpose lastynge rumoure yode vnto westmynster toke mayster iohn slake deane kinges chapell frome then broughte vnto newgate caste hym yrons shortly duke came vnto london consent kyng rycharde lyament begone vpon xiii day ye moneth septembre endurynge whiche lyament many accusacyons artycles mysrulynge lande layed vnto charge thys noble prince kyng rycharde whiche engroced length xxxviii artycles volutarely shuld seme ye copy instrumet shewed shulde renounce wylfullye deposed kynglye mageste monday beynge xxix day septembre feest saynt myghell archaungell yere lordes incarnacyon accom te churche englande mlxxxxix xxiiii yere raygne sayde rycharde copye whiche instrumente vnder ensueth present instrumente made mondaye xxix daye septembre feeste saynt mychaell tharchaungell yere lorde god mccclxxx xix xxiii yere kynge rycharde seconde wytnesseth auctoryte lordes spirytuall temporall present parlyament comons ryght honorable dyscrete son vnder named sayde auctoryte assygned go vnto towre london testifye suche questyons answeres shude said honorable discrete persones harde knowe men whome presente letter shall come sir richarde scroope archebysshoppe yorke iohn bisshoppe herforde henrye erle northumberlande rafe erle westmerlande thomas lorde barkeley wyllyam abbot westmynster iohn pryour caunterbury wyllyam thyrnynge hughe burnell knyghtes iohn markeham iustyce thomas stowe iohn burbage doctours lawe cyuyle thomas feryby denys lopham notaryes publyke day yere abouesayd atwene houres viii ix ye clocke noone present chyefe chaumber kynges lodgynge within sayde place towre rehersed vnto kynge ye mouth forsayde erle northumberlande beforetyme conwey northwalys kynge beynge hys pleasure lybertye promysed vnto archebysshop caunterbury thomas arundell vnto sayde erle northumberlande insuffycyency whyche knewe hymselfe occupye greate charge gouerne thys realme englande wolde gladly leue renouce ryght tytle aswell hys tytle crowne frauce hys mageste vnto henry duke herforde suche conuenyente wyse lernyd men hys lande shulde moste suffyciently deuysed ordeyned whyche rehersall kynge sayde presence answered benyngly sayde suche promyse made howre full purpose perfourme fulfyll sauyng desyred fyrst haue personal speche wyth sayde duke wyth archebysshoppe caunterbery hys cosyns ferthermore desyred haue byll drawen sayde resygnacyon myghte perfyghte rehersall therof whiche copy hym sayde erle delyuered sayde lordes departed vppon noone kynge desyrynge moche commynge duke lancaster laste sayd duke wyth archebysshoppe entred foresayde chaumber bryngynge wyth theym lorde roos lorde burgeyny lorde wylloughby wyth dyuerse due obeysaunce done vnto kynge famylyarly wyth gladde countenaunce v aperynge talked wyth sayde archebysshop duke good season communycacyon fynyshed kynge wyth gladde countenaunce presence v aboue rehersed sayde openly redy renounce resygne kyngelye mageste maner fourme season promised thoughe myght sufficyently haue declared renouncement redyng meane persone yet suretie mater sayd resygnacyon shulde haue hys full force strengthe therfore redde scrowle resignacyon selfe maner fourme foloweth name god amen rycharde grace god kynge englande frauce lorde irelande acquyte assoyle archebysshoppes bysshoppes prelate seculer relygyous dygnite degre state condicyon also duke marque erles baron lordes al myne lyege men bothe spirituall seculer maner name degre frome theyr othe feaute homage dedes priuileges made vnto maner bade allegeaunce regaly lordeshyppe whiche bounden otherwyse constrayned theym theyr heyres successours euermore bandes othes release deliuer acquite let fre dyssolued acquyte harmelesse moche longeth persone maner waye tytle ryght yt might folowe foresayd thynges also resygne kyngely dygnyte mageste crowne lordeshyppes power priuyleges foresayd kyngely dygnite crowne belongynge lordeshyppes possessyons maner wyse pertaynynge name condicyon take landes possessyons myne obyte purchased bought renounce ryghte coloure ryght maner tytle possessyon lordeshyppe whyche euer hadde haue maner meane myght haue lordeshyppes possessyons maner ryghtes belongynge appertayning vnto parte also rule gouernauce kyngedome lordeshyppes admynistracyons thynges eueryche theym hole empyre iurisdiccyon belongeth right wyse may belonge also renounce name worshyppe regalye kyngly hyghnesse clerely frely syngulerly holly mooste best maner fourme may dede worde leaue resygne go frome theym euermore sauyng alwaye successours kynges englade ryghtes priuileges appurtenaunces ye said kyngdome lordeships abouesaid belongynge appertayninge well wote knowlege deme selfe haue ben vnsufficient vnable also vnprofytable myne open desertes nat vnworthy put downe swere vpon ye holy euagels presently handes touched yt shal neuer repugne resygnacyon dimyssyon yeldyng vp neuer inpugne theym maner worde dede selfe none shall nat suffre impugned moche preuely apperte shall haue holde kepe thys renousing dimyssyon leuynge vp ferme stable euer euery parte thereof god helpe sayntes holy euangels bodely touched kyssed recorde openly subscrybe sygne present resygnacyon myne owne hande forthwith presence subscrybed delyuered vnto archebysshope canterbury say ng power assignemet wold duke lancaster present shulde successour ing hym token thereof toke rynge golde fro fynger beynge sygnet put vpon sayd duke fynger desyrynge requirynge ye archebysshop yorke shewe make reporte vnto lordes parlyament hys voluntary resygnacyon also entent good mynde bare towarde cosyn duke lacaster haue successour kyng done euery man toke leaue returned theyr owne upon morowe folowynge beynge tuisday laste day septembre lordes spirytuall temporall also common sayde parlyamente assembled westmynster presence archebysshoppe yorke accordinge vnto kynges desyre shewed vnto seryously voluntary renounsynge kynge also fauoure whiche oughte vnto cosyn ye duke lancaster haue hym hys successoure ouer ye shewed vnto theym cedule byll renouncemente sygned wyth kynge rychardes hande whyche thynges ordre fynisshed questyon axed fyrste lordes yf wolde admytte alowe sayde renouncement whyche whan lordes graunted confyrmed lyke questyon axed common theym lyke maner affyrmed whiche admyssyon declared nat withstandynge foresaid renounsynge lordes common admytted nedefull vnto realme auoydyng suspeccyon surmyses ylle dysposed persones haue wrytynge regestred manyfolde crymes efautes done sayd rycharde late kynge englande ende myghte fyrste openly shewed vnto people remayne recorde amonge kynges recordes whyche drawen compyled sayde xxxviii artycles shewed redy radde cause nedefull preferred redynge said artycles season diff ered put whyche artycles wolde aske longe tyme wryte also wolde reders e small pleasure rede haue therfore lefte theym thys worke lengthe sette ou boke mayres yere drewe barentyne mayre london moche lordes parlyament hadde well consydered voluntary renouncement kynge rycharde behouefull necessary weale realme procede vnto sentence deposayll appoynted auctorytie state sayde parlyament bisshop saynte asse abbotte glastenburye erle gloucester lorde barkeley wyllyam thyrnynge iustyce thomas erpyngham thomas graye knightes shulde gyue ere open sentence kynges deposicyon whervpon sayde commyssyoners leynge hedes together good delyberacion good cousell auysement one assent agreed amonge bishop saint asse shulde publisshe sentence theym name foloweth name god amen iohn bysshope saynt asse assenence iohn abbot glastynbury rycharde erle glocester thomas lorde berkeley wyllyam thyrnynge iustyce thomas erpyngham thomas graye knyghtes chosen deputed specyall commyssaryes thre estate thys present parlyament representynge hole bodye realme suche mater sayd astates v committed vnderstandynge considerynge manyfolde crymes hurtes harmes done rycharde king englade mysgouernaunce longe tyme great decaye sayde lande vtter ruyne shortly haue ben ne especiall grace lorde god therevnto put ye soner remedy also furthermore auertysinge yt sayde kinge rycharde knowyng owne insufficiencie hath owne mere volunte fre wyll renounced gyuen vp rule gouernaunce lande ryghtes honoures vnto ye belongynge vtterly merytes hath iuged hym selfe nat vnworthy deposed kyngely mageste astate royall premysses well consyderynge good dilygente delyberacyon power name auctoryte v aboue sayd co mytted pronounce discerne declare kynge rycharde thys haue vnprofytable vnable vnsufficyent vnworthy rule gouernauce foresayde realmes lordeshyppes thappurtenaunces belongynge cause pryue kyngely dygnyte worshyppe kynglye worshyppe lefte depose sentence ifynityfe forbyddynge expressely archebysshoppes bysshoppes prelate duke marque erles baron knyghtes men foresayd kyngdome lordeshyppes place belongynge realmes lordeshippes subiectes lyeges euer yt none tyme forthwarde foresaid rycharde kynge lorde ye foresayde realmes lordeshyppes neyther obedyete attendaunt whiche sentence thus openlye declared said astates admytted forthwith persones theyr procuratours resygne yelde vp vnto kynge rycharde theyr homage fealtie whyche made oughte vnto hym tymes shewe vnto hym nede thynges done concernyd deposynge whych resygnacyon tyme spared put respite tyll morowe nexte folowynge anone thys sentence thys wyse passyd reason therof realme stode voyde without hede gouernoure tyme said duke lancaster rysing fro ye place sate standing myght beholde hym mekely makynge sygne crosse vppon forhede vpon hys breste sylence officer commaunded sayd vnto people beyng wordes folowyng name father sonne holy ghoste henry lancastre clayme realme englande crowne appurtenaunces dyscended ryght lyne bloode commynge good lorde kynge henry thyrde ye ryght god hys grace hath sente wyth helpe kynne frendes recouer yt point vndone defaut good gouernaunce due iustyce whyche wordes thus hym vttered retourned set place sytten lordes apperceyuynge herynge thys clayme thus made thys noble man eyther theym frayned thoughte dystaunce pau e tyme archebysshope cauntorbury hauyng notycyon lordes myndes stode vp asked common yf wolde assente lordes whych theyr myndes thoughte clayme duke made ryghtefull necessary welthe realme wherunto one voyce cried ye ye ye whyche answere sayde archebysshop goynge vnto duke settynge hym vpon hys kne vnto hym fewe wordes whyche ended rose takynge duke ryght hande ladde hym vnto kynges sete wyth greate reuerence sette hym therein certayne knelynge orison made sayde duke therein sette whan kynge thus set hys trone greate reioysynge people archebysshoppe cauntorbury beganne oracion colacyon maner foloweth u dominabitur populo primo regu capitulo ix ben wordes hygh mooste myghty kynge spekynge samuel hys prophete techyng hym shuld chose ordeyne gouernoure hys people israel whan sayde people asked hym kynge rule theym nat wythout cause maye wordes sayde oure lorde kynge yf inwardely conceyued shall gyue v mater consolacion comforte whan sayde shall haue lordeshyp rule people nat chylde god threteneth nat v sometyme thret people saye sayenge sai et dabo pueros principe corum effeminati dominabuntur eis shall sayeth lorde gyue chyldren theyr ruler prynces weke ferefull shall haue domynyon ouer hys greate mercy hath vysyted v truste hys peculier people sente v man haue rule v putte chylderne yt tyme ruled thys lande chyldysshe condycyons ye werkes theym hath ryght lately appered greate dysturbaunce thys realme want lack man sayeth apostell paule ad coryntheos primo capitulo xiii cum essem paruusus sapiebam vt paruusus soquebar vt paruusus c quam autem factus sum vi euacuani quae erant paruusi meane whanne chylde sauoured spake chylde tyme whanne came vnto state man thanne putte chyldysshe condycyons apostell sayth fauoured spake chylde whome stedfastnesse constancy chylde wyll lyghtely promyse lyghtly wyll breke hys promyse thynges hys appetyte gyueth hym vnto forgeteth lyghtely hath done whych reason foloweth nedely great inconuenyence muste fall people yt chylde ruler gouernour nat possyble kynge dome stande felicite condycyons reygne hede ruler ought reioyse suche defautes ben expelled man nat chylde shall haue lordshyp ouer v whome belongeth haue sure rayne vpon hys tunge maye knowen fronra chylde man vsyng chyldysche condycyons whome truste may say ye wyse man sayeth hys prouerbys prouerbiorum tercio capitulo bea tus homo qui inuenit sapientiam et qui affluit prudentia whyche meane blessed man yt hathe sapyence wysedome haboundeth prudence man ruled sapience must nedes loue drede lorde god loueth dredeth must consequentely folowe muste kepe hys commaundementes force wherof shall mynyster trewe iustyce vnto subiectes wronge iniury shall folowe wordes wyse man whyche ben rehersed prouerbiorum decimo benedictio domini super caput iusti o autem impiorum operit iniquitatem meane blessynge oure lorde god shall lyght vpon hede kyng beyng iuste rightwyse man tunge hym worketh equyte iustyce tunge wycked synners couereth iniquyte werketh mynystreth iustyce due ordre nat allonely sauegardeth hym selfe also holdeth ye people surete restfulnesse whyche ensueth peace plete therfore sayde wyse kyng salomo ecclesiastes decimo beata tetra tex nobilis est principe vescuntur tempore sun whyche vnderstande blessed happy lande whych kynge ruler noble wyse prynces ben blessed lyue hys tyme wolde say may take exaumple hym rule guyde theyr subiectes discressyon noble wyse beyng auctorite many euylles sequestred put parte dyssmilers put vnto sylence wyse man cosidereth noteth well great inconuenyences whyche dayly nowe growe chylde insypyente drynketh swete delycyous wordes vnauysydly perceyueth nat entoxycacion whyche ben mynged myxte tyll inuyroned wrapped al daunger lately experyence therof hath ben apparent syghtes knowleges nat without great daunger realme lacke wysedome ruler whych demed taught chylde gyuyng sentece wylfulnes nat reason whyle chylde reygned selfe wyll iuste reygned reason wyth good conscyece outlawed iustyce stedfastnesse many vertuys thys parell daunger ben delyuered especyal helpe grace god quia vir dominabitur tur populo meane nat chylde perfyght reason commeth natte execute hys owne wyll hys wyll sente hym wytte goddes wyl man whome god hys habundaunte grace hath gyuen perfyghte reason dyscrescyon dyscerne deme perfyght man wherefore nat alonely thys man shall say shall dwell wysedome perfyght man nat chylde shall thynke deme haue suche cyrcuspecte wyth hym shall dylygently foreloke se goddes wyll done nat hys therefore nowe truste wordes wyse man ecclesiastici decimo shalbe veryfyed kynge sayenge index sapiens iudicabit populum suum principatus sensati stabilis erit sayeth wyse man wyse dyscrete iuge shall deme hys people domynyon lordshyppe dyscrete wyse man shall stande stedfast wher upon shall folowe seconde verse chapyter sayenge secundum iudicem populi sic ministri eius c lyke hede soueraygne replenysshed wyth sapyence vertue guydynge hys people admynistrynge theym lawe wyth due conuenyent iustyce shall subiectes agayn warde garnysshed wyth awe louynge drede bere vnto hym nexte god honoure trouthe allegeaunce maye concluded wyth resydue foresayde verse qu ali rector est ciuitatis tale inhabitantes ca whyche meane suche ye ruler cytye suche inhabytauntes consequentely foloweth good mayster maketh good dyscyple lykewyse euyll kynge ruler shall lose hys people cytyes hys kyngedome shalbe left desolate vnhabyted wherefore thus make ende stede chylde wylfully doynge hys luste pleasure wythout reason nowe shall man lorde ruler yt replenysshed wyth sapiece reason shall gouerne people skylfull domys settynge parte wylfulnesse pleasure hym selfe worde beganne wyth maye veryfyed hym ecce quia vir dominabitur populo whyche lorde graunte maye prosperously reygne pleasure god welthe realme amen whyche oracion beyng thus fynyshed people answerynge wyth greate gladnesse amen kynge standyng vpon hys fete sayd vnto lordes common present syrs thanke lordes spyrytuall temporal state thys lande vnderstade nat wyll man thynke waye conqueste wolde dysheryte man hys herytage fraunchyse ryghtes hym oughte haue ryghte putte hym oute whyche nowe enioyeth hath hadde tyme custome good lawe thys realme excepte suche pryuate persones haue ben agayne good purpose co mon profyte realme thys speche thus fynysshed sheryfes offycers put theyr auctorytyes whiche seased tyme kynges see voyde euery man departed noone proclamacions made accustumat place cytye name kynge henry fourthe vppon morowe folowynge beynge wennysdaye fyrste daye october procuratours aboue named yode vnto towre london certified hym admissio kyng henry foresayd iustyce wyllyam thirnynge ye name state lande gaue vppe vnto rychard late kyng homage fealte hym time due lyke maner fourme haue shewed ye xix yere kynge edwarde ii thus noble prynce pryued kyngly dygnyte honour reason hys euyll counsayll suche vnlafull wayes meanes hys insolency realme suffered vsed whan reygned cxii yeres thre monethes viii dayes pcharles vii francia carolus charles vii ye name vi thaccompte ye freche hystory chylde xiii yeres age sonne vnto charles vi began hys reygne ouer frenchemen moneth septembre yere lorde mccc lxxx thyrde yere seconde rycharde kyng englande thys charles crowned kynge wythin age xiiii yeres contrary lawe made xi yere hys father hym commytted vnto rule lewys vncle duke angeou tyme ful xiiii yeres yet deth father suche vnkyndenesse bega spryng betwene lordes realme comon welthe agreed partye thys charles shulde crowned raynes hasty spede whyche done short seaso contynued nat wythoute dysturbaunce malyce whych kyndeled betwene hys two vncles inconueniences space iii yeres ensuyng iiii yere hys reygne cytesyns parys murmurynge grudgynge dyuerse imposycyons taskes leuyed sodeynly arose greate multytude entendynge haue dystressed kynges housholde seruautes men son medyacyon one dyscrete parsone named iohn marsyle assystence prouost marchauntes rumoure somdele appeased mych greate multytude wythdrawen retourned theyr occupacyons euyll dysposed whyche suspycyous congregacyon euer vse exyte styrre people vnto robbynge vnlefull acre reassocyate sayde cryed wolde haue iewys banysshed cytye answered kynge shuld enformed theyr desyre vppon shulde haue knowlege kynges pleasure wherupo rage ranne vnto house iewes entryd force robbynge spoylynge bare awaye myght cary sleynge suche iewes resystece defence made agayn neuer restored ye sayd goodes wythstandynge kyng byhalfe gaue sore strayte co maundementes longe suche ye kynges secrete counsayle consyderynge great charge nedes ye kyng weykenesse treasoure authoryte kynges comyssyons called ruler parys roan good cytyes whyche beynge assembled shewed many importune charge whyche ye kynge dayly defese hys realm subiectes wherfore wyse polytyke meanes myghte vse exorted sayde common graute vnto kynge waye subsydye xiivi poude ware dayes curraut whyche requeste conclusyo aduyse taken theyr neyghbours answered peple sore charged tymes passed myght nat susteyne bere charge tyll theyr necessytie otherwyse releuyd co clusyo thys season kynge hys cousayll dyspoynted vi yere thys charles ye flemynges whych certayne season rested theym frome batayll necessyte synguler couetyze lewys theyr duke asked greate ayde taske knewe well yf myghte wynne fauoure graut towne gaunt shulde soner haue hys pleasure resydue therefore fyrste began meanes fayrenesse wha thereby sawe myght take none aduau tage added therunto manasses thretenynges whyche nat wythstandynge flemynges bode stedfast one opynyon denayed styfly theyr duke request whereuppon lastly departyng gaunt wyth great displeasure sayd shall shewe selfe lorde soueraygne thys towne obstynat people shortly ye duke made sharpe warre vpo gaut lykewise defeded vigurously theyr enemyes wa lytle auautage thys warre hadde season contynued nat wythoute losse many men vppon bothe partyes gaunteners remembrynge obedyence fydelyte whyche shulde bere theyr souerayne lorde duke made meanes myghte harde graunte whereof sente vnto hym certayne oratours whyche hadde vnto hym wordes sentence folowynge mooste souerayne nexte god deny nat accept prynce leder thyne becommeth v obey wyth reason thou agayne arte bounde defende v thyng ouersyght neclygence haue agayn trespassed mekely beseche forgyuenesse furthermore besechynge suche fraunchyses lybertyes v thy noble progenytours grauted thou wyll nat v withdraw abrydge reason wherof thy people gaut maye nat taxe contrary theyr volunte costrayned thy nede warres thou haue necessytye ayde thy common free wyll costraynte sette parte redy ayde helpe fre lyberall thy trewe subiectes reason whyche wordes ye duke hys ire towarde theym apeased theyr departyng duke erles presece yonge knyghtes erles hoste hadde vnto theym many hygh dysdaynous wordes sayeng thrall vnto theyr erle theyr obstynacye shulde vttermoste theyr reproche correccyon coaccion constraynt forced theyr dutye occasyo whyche wordes gauteners retournyng theyr former wylfulnesse kepte styl theyr former opynyo defended erle people hadde done wherfore erle seynge myghte nat streghte preuayle agayne hys enemyes studied wayes meanes famysshe theym hunger meane might draw towne hys subieccyo brynge effecte gyrde ye towne wyth stronge syege gauteners supprysed wyth obduracion herte agayne theyr prynce made capytayne named phylype artyuele sonne iakes de artyuele slayne ye flemynges lyke haue shewed xvii yere philippe de ualoys late kyng frauce whyche furnysshynge hys people wyth habylymentes warre made towne pyghte hys feelde playne ioynynge vnto erles people fought sharpe fyght longe ye ende fortune vnto erle duke frowarde wyth losse vm hys soudyours forced take bruges hys suertye reason thys vyctory thys artyuele beynge nat lytle supprysed wyth pryde exorted wyse dweller wythin towne gaunte suche nere neyghbours vnto set parte occupacyon aswell husbandry gyue theyr hole study vnto actes feates warre erle thus beynge wythin ye town bruges daye greate solempnytie yerelye holden bruges approched whyche wordshypped honoure lordes bloode thys daye solemptye vsed yerely come inhabytauntes vyllages coutrey aboute whyche daye feast phylyp de artiuele callynge mynde appoyntyd vnto hi iim soudiours warned wyth armoure beynge clad vnder theyr clothes ascende ii thre foure lyke small companyes vnto thys feestfull solempnyte tyme gaue warnyng euery man redy wyth swerde hande make rome amoge ye prese ende myght take erle helpe destytute whyche cautele thus prepared day comyn thys sayde feeste towne beynge replenysshed people sayde artyuele vnsuspect persone hys company maner abouesayde entred towne bruges wha sawe best tyme sodeynly cryed asarmis asarmes wyth whyche sodeyn crye erle beynge astonyed manfully whyle wythstode hys enemyes encouraged people agayne gaunteners armoure vnarmed erles party fled soone seynge erle wyth great diffyculte fledde lepyng ieopardously house olde woman escaped went vnto scluse whyle helde hym thys artyuele sayeng ayde theym bruges dispoynted erles takyng felle vpon inhabytauntes towne slewe theym certayn wyth greate pompe pyllage retourned vnto gaunt vii yere charles procuryng hys vncle lewys duke angeou taxe efte axed comons fraunce whych bryng effecte many frendes promoter made aswell cytezyns anone ye common parys vnderstode became wylde assembled thycke company nat regardyng reasonable allegacions theym layed shewed petyr dylet iohn matsyll though great affeccion truste toke theyr affeccion mynde made amonge certayn capytaynes ruler kept watche nyght enemyes lyen ye cytye whyche insurreccyon rebellyon thus begon wythin cytye parys cytye roan takynge therof exaumple arrered lyke murmure sensyd cytye roane wyth lyke prouysyon made theym mamet fatte vnweldy vylayne cytye caryed towne cart named hym dyrysyo theyr prynce theyr kynge ceased nat fall many inconuenyences robbyng holy place nat wythoute shedynge bloode wherof cyrcumstaunce longe telle operacio hath ende thys foly rebellyon frenchemen ceased many trespasse therof caste harde darke pryson whyche kynge entended haue taken cruell correccyon ne hadde ben great instaunt labour made ruler vnyuersyte parys suche nere aboute kynge whose meanes multytude pardoned fewe suche begynners put execucyon testyfyeth myn auctour mayster robert gagwyne appease kynges hyghe dyspleasure hi grauted hudreth thousande frankes whyche sterlynge money amouteth summe x thousande li ye haue harde howe ye erle flauders wyth great ieopardy escaped hades phylyp de artyuele capytayne gaute howe came scluse safegarded hym selfe wyth dylygence gathered vnto hym hys people made new reyse vpo sayd artyuele whyche hym hadde assocyat affermeth sayd auctor xlm betwene erle hym foughte cruell fyghte wherof ye ede artiuele agayn vyctour costrayned erle forsake feelde wyth losse xm hys knyghtes hym self escaped wyth great dauger vnto lande dyuers hys people frechme good noumbre fledde vnto towne called werpe season defe ded agayne malyce theyr enemyes whyche passe tyme artyuele coiecturyng hys mynde frenche kynge wolde take erles patty sente vnto hym ambassad message wyth letter besechynge hym nat entremedle thys warre betwene erle gauteners whyche warre erle onely tyranny nat iustyce entedyng vtterly distroy auncyete lybertye fraunchyse shewyng also farther yf wolde nat theyr cotemplacyon pr yer forbere ayde theyr sayde erle tha defende theyr lyberte ryght wolde seke ayde kynge englade whych requeste none answere made neyther kynge hys cousayll wherfore thys artyuele made stroge prouysyon wythstande ye freche kynge sette certayne hys soudyours kepe syege werpe whyle made p ouysyon nedes thys meane whyle erle went vnto duke burgoyn togyther yode vnto kynge charles shewyng lametably wroges ye erle susteyned ye obstynat gauteners besechyng hym ayde redres ye sayd wroges coplaynt kyng graciously herde benyngly grauted theyr petycyon natwythstandynge ye dede wynter comyng haste assembled hys knyghtes takynge wyth hym oryfflambe wyth myghty stronge hoste perced coutrey flaunders towarde marquet ende ye moneth octobre wherof heryng actyuele made prouisyon stoppe waysthe cou tray brekyng brydges meanes wherby frech hoste greatly empeched let wyth great dyffycultye daunger passed ye riuer lyze brydg longe defended inhabytautes coutrey wyth ayde theyr capytayne named peter wood whiche slayne wyth iiim hys adheretes wynnyng whiche brydge frenche hoste passed ryuer spoyled countrey whyche vnto moche auaylable cyrcuit inhabyted many ryche clothmakers kyng hys hoste made towarde mount ipre whereof dweller ipre beyng ware fet two freers ye ordre prechers beseche kynge accepte town dweller vnto hys mercy whych retourned wyth comfo table answere wherfore forthwyth yode forthe xii notablest ye towne offered towne dweller kynges power whyche offer kyng accepted entred towne whome ye kynge receyued xlm frakes iiiimli sterlynge toward wagyng hys knyghtes shortely vyllages toward see submytted vnto king bryngyng vnto hym certayn capytaynes whyche belonged vnto phylyppe de artyuele wyth also fourthy thousad frankes towarde theyr costes capytaynes kynge commaunded fourthe wyth beheded whanne kynge charles hadde taryed fyue dayes ipre worde broughte hym phylype artyuele commynge towarde hym wyth lx thousand wherfore kyng set forwarde hys hoste folowed fast myght som deale hys payne reaso rayne fowle waye passed fynally approched wythin iii myles enmyes upo morowe folowyng theynge v daye moneth decembre yere oure lordes incarnacion mccclxxx viii begynnyng viii yere thys charles playne nere vnto ye town courtray foughten cruell batayll whereof begynnyng flemynges better forced frenche hoste lose place ende specyall callynge frenche knyghtes vnto ladye sayntes halfe myracle wytnesseth myne auctor frechmen opteyned victory put flemynges f yght chased cruell wy e deth feelde drownyng mareys water slayne fyghte vppon xlm narowe serche made capytayn phylyppe de artyuele lastly flemynge beyng capytayne hys sore wouded sayde sawe hym fall feelde whereuppon serche beyng made hys carye founden oppressed hys owne people fledde anone tydynges came vnto flemynges yt laye andwerpe losynge felde haste leuynge theyr ordenauce behynde fledde fro syege perceyuyng theyr enemyes issued oute towne slewe theym many many drowned fennys marycys whanne frenche kynge opteyned thus glorious victory entred town courtray restynge hym oratours sent hym frome towne bruges whyche hadde newely taken party wyth artyuele wyth ye paymente c xxm frankes xiimii sterlynge money made peace sayde towne bruges whan kyng shuld depart courtray commaunded knyghtes bete downe gate wythoute harme doynge vnto people frenchman berynge mynde rebuke harmes whyche towne susteyned bete downe great parte walles robbed slewe moche people sette fyre vpon towne wha done robbynge thys towne courtray dyuers letter founde ye towne cytye parys whych conteyned rebellyo parysyences declared wyth comforte theym ayde neded whyche letter wha came vnto kynges syght wyth theym parys greuously displeased theym fyne greuously punysshed tyme kyng hadde thus repossessed erle lordshyp flauders gaunt yet remaynynge theyr fyrst errour held theyr towne strogely nother kynge erle myght wynne within theym french kynge retourned fraunce sent certayn oratours vnto whyche wyse wolde suffer come hys syght passed yeres many skyrmysshes fyghtes done betwene frechemen englyshme whyche deale touched begynnynge rychardes reygne nothynge honoure frenchemen theyr cronycles boste auaunce theym selfe many mo rebellyos insurreccyos thys people myght brynge dyuers consyderacions whyche wyse men maye appere thynke better spare also rehersayll wolde aske longe tracte tyme wherefore passe ouer appeasynge inordynate insurreccyos murmures lade deale sette quyetnes kyng charles begynnynge ix yere hys reygne maryed isabell doughter duke bauarydeth charles kynge nauerne thys yere also dyed charles ye kynge nauerne man great age wonderfull happe reherseth myne auetoure hys feblenesse debylyte age counsayll physycyons sowed shete wesshed wyth aqua vite ende rause hys olde body catche naturall hete howe thys shete tacked aboute hys bodye sewer takynge hys candell burne ye ende trede ware fyre fastened shete brente hys flessh myght lowsed fro hym caught therof suche dyssease dyed iii daye folowyng whyche myshappe fell hym ye opynyon myne auctour ye wretche god codygne meryte vnstedfastnesse vntroth hym vsed sundry place storyes kyng iohn charles hys sonn manyfestly shewed thys yere also batayll done parys betwene ii knyghtes duke alenson whereof cause ensuyeth thys sayd duke hys court two knyghtes whereof one named iohn carengo carongyon iaquet gry er whyche bothe good fauoure theyr mayster thys carongon delyte se straunge countreys cause auenture pilgrymage departed frauce leuyng hys wyfe castel fortresse owne whyche wyfe goodly fayer whose departynge beauty woma euyll wyl bare towarde hys felow iaquet gryse entryd castel berynge hys wyfe hande comyn se house whyche shewed fayre outwarde woman castynge parell acceptynge hym husbades frende hyrs shewed cyrcuite ye place contrary awaytynge hys praye whan sawe woma farre company forsed hyr suche maner contrary hyr wyll co mysed wyth auoutry whose departyng gaue vnto hym many rebukeful wordes sayenge playnlye yf hyr husbade euer retourned wolde velany reueged thys dede kepte secrete tyll retourne hyr husbande whose home commyng wyth lametable countenaunce shewed tyll hyr husbande demeanure sayd iaquet whyche complaynte hyr husbande well vnderstanden yode streyght vnto duke alenson requyryng hym correccion vpo auoutrer el yt myghte trye hym ye felde fortune batayll whereof nother duke wolde graunt brought quarell kyng whose agrement commaundemente daye kynge sette fyghte parys wha daye batayll comen carogon broughte hys wyfe vnto place iustyfye hyr former sayenge affyrmacyon whereof eyther fyrste ranne wyth sharpe speres whyche course iaquet wounded hys enemie thyghe wyth hys spere carongon beynge wyth nothynge dysmayed lyght hys horse bare hym manfully ouercame hys aduersarye caused hym confesse hys offence whych streyght drawen vnto gybet parys haged sayd carongon kyng gaue rewarde thousande frakes hundreth poude sterlynge money ouer gaue vnto hym annuall fee rent two hudreth frankes whyche value xx poude sterlynge money dayes wytnesseth gagwynus anker berynge hys hande rede crosse man loke goostlye conuersacyon came vnto freche kynges court housholde seruautes famylyers court loge kept fro hys presence lastelye brought vnto hym whome shewed deuynely monysshed shulde charge hym absteyne hys customable vse leuyenge often taskes subsydyes yt dyd nat shulde well vnderstande wrath god nere hym punysshe hym yf refused hys commaudement whyche message kynge toke small regarde shortly quene delyuered doughter dyed soone wherefore kynge callynge mynde ankers wordes fere punysshement refrayned season frome leuyenge trybutes taskes exortacion hys two vnkylles shorte season tourned hys former custome kynge charles thus passynge hys tyme wyth greate murmure hys common rebellyon duke brytayn wyth many aduersytyes whych longe wryte lastly xiiii yere hys reygne nere made warre vpon people west fraunce called late cenomanni whan charles entred thys countrey whyche domynyon duke brytayn ye duke sent vnto hym messenger sayenge hym shulde nat nede inuade hys coutrey wyth great stre ghte shuld hooly hys commaundement thys message ye king toke regard sayth myne auctour nat wysest prynce ruled hys housholde seruauntes belyued euery lyght tale brought hym ouer lyberal wyse men accompted prodygalyte lyberalitye charles nat wythstandyng message ye duke helde iournay commynge nere vnto woode sodeynly mette man lyke vnto begger whyche sayde vnto hi whither goest thou syr kyng beware thou go farther thou arte betrayed handes thyne enemyes thyne owne meyny shall delyuer wyth thys monyssion thys poore kynge astonyed stoode styl bega muse whyche study beyng one hys folowers whyche hym bare spere sleped vpo horse backe hys slepyng let hys spere fall vpon helmet hys felowe wyth whych stroke kyng sodeynly fered thynkynge hys enemyes commen vnwarely vpo hym wherefore gere drewe hys swerde layed hym geynest slewe iiii knyghtes refrayned toke therewyth suche endelye fere fell therwyth dystraughte wherefore place broughte lay poynte deth longe season moch fame ranne ded prayer greate dedes charyte done hym lastely recouered retourned vnto parys nat yet retourned hys perfyghte helthe two vncles beynge one duke berry duke burgone toke vpon auctoryte estate lande rule realm season whyche season diuers officer altered chauged kyng thus contynuyng lykenes many interlude game deuysed kynges recreacyon comforte vppo season beynge lodged quenes lodgynge subarbes saynte marcell dyuers noble men courte made dysguysynge apparayled theym lynnen clothes glewed vnto theyr naked bodyes wyth pytche florisshed theym wyth dyuerse colour oyles couered excepte face thus apparayled torche lyghte entred chaumbre kyng goodly maner shewed theyr disport kynge therewith wel contented rechelesnesse uyl disposed person fyre put vesture disguysers whyche anone vppon suche flame man coulde quenche wherfore sayd disguysers beynge reason pytche oyles greuously turmented ranne pyttes water whyche myghte sonest attayne nto wyth greate dyffyculte saued theym selfe meane tyme whereof chau ber beynge wyth tyred grewe greate flame shorte whyle parte lodgynge consumed ye great fere ye kynge astates tha beynge presente augmentynge agayne former sykenes certayne appoyntementes holde betwene hym rychard kynge englande tyme put xvi yere thys charles maryage peace betwene bothe realmes concluded fynysshed calays haue shewed xix yere kyng rycharde triumphe fynysshed charles cotemplacyon prayer kynge hungry sent vnto hym phylyp erle arroys wyth dyuers knyghtes good noumber ayde ye sayd kynge agayne turkys whyche hadde season warred capytaynes party frenchemen turkys dystressed slayne many taken prisoner theyr great charge thys charles thus contynuyng hys lykenesse two freres saynte augustynes order beynge desyrous money toke vppon theym cure kyng shauen hys hede mynistred hym medicyns kynge dayly febled suche wyse yt nye dede whiche cosyderacyon examyned phylosophers doctours physyke founden vncunnynge degraded theyr presthode behedded thys folye fretes broughte excytynge duke burgoyne common fame went xix yere thys charles lande fraunce greuously vexed wyth plage ipydymye whyche sykenesse greate multytude people dyed yere also sene blasynge starre wonderfull bygnes wyth stremes apperynge menes syghte moste feruent brennynge thys yere also charles herynge ye subduyng kynge rycharde sente englande two hys housholde knyghtes requyrynge kynge henry fourth newelye made kynge sende home hys doughter isabell latelye maryed vnto kyng rychard wyth suche war wyth hyr promysed doynge whyche message kynge henry toke dyspleasure sayeth gagwinus myne auctour threwe sayde twoo knightes prysone one theym named blanchet dyed englande called henry greate sykenesse retourned fraunce shortely kynge henry sente sayde dame isabell vnto calays ioyously receyued frenchemen conueyed vnto hyr sayde father whyche yet nat hys sykenesse cured reason whereof among lordes frauce eueryche coueytyng haue rule great dyssencion malyce bega kendle specyallye betwene duke orleaunce burgoyne berry duke orleaunce entedyng promote hys cause vnknowyng lordes allyed hym wyth ye duke geldre streghthed hym wyth vc men hys entred feeldes parys lyke maner ye duke burgoyne wyth stronge copany kept cooste ye countrey natwythstandyng meanes lordes two duke kept sunder lenghte yt duke orleyaunce kynges comaundement somewhat amended ordayned regente realme whiche anone sette auctoryte fell rauyne oppressed people cotydyan taskes tallages ye spirituall men dymes exaccyons wherfore reason studyentes parys lengthe discharged dignyte duke burgoyne hym put auctoryte duke orleyaunce beynge discontented yode vnto lucebourgth towne highe almayne sought agayne ayde duke geldre foresayd frendes aduertysed yt owne folkes returned fraunce yet malyce stryfe twene hym duke burgoyne seased nat season soone dyed duke brytayne affermeth auctour afore named kyng henry ye iiii maryed wyfe wherof hering ye duke burgoyne company vim knyghtes entred brytayne strength toke iii sonnes named iohn richard arthure presented vnto kynge charles ye xxii yere charles borne isabell hys wyfe man chylde also named charles deth father vnto ye great aduersyte realme frauce king realme contrary appointment taken twene henry v kynge englande thys charles father nowe fraunce kynge shall appere story sayde kynge henry fyfte yere also dame isabell somtyme wyfe rycharde latelye kynge englande maryed vnto charles eldeste sonne duke orleyaunce iohn eldyste iii forenamed sonnes duke brytayne lately dede toke wyfe margarete ye doughter kynge charles phylyppe duke burgoyne dyed soone leauynge heyre hym named iohn whyche gyrde swerde duchye burgoyne anone euyll entysynge counsell areryd warre agayne duke orleyaunce great dysturbaunce realme sayde duke orleyaunce prynce wonderfull hyghe courage desyrous great honoure sayenge gagwynus coueyted kynge fraunce whyche went auyngnyon sate xiii benet tha pope duryng scisme admytted cardynalles dethe clement ye vi whiche benet said duke made great labour depryue uniuersite parys ye great auctoryte yt dayes stode whiche merueylous auctoryte sayeth forenamed auctour thys whyle thus endurynge lande full myseryes aduersites quene yt moche fauoured duke partie accompanyed sayd duke rode take dysporte huntynge countrey meldon whiche place sente letter vnto dolphyn ye duke bauary brother hys wyfe whiche doughter vnto duke burgoyne shulde come dysporte theym whereof iohn thanne duke burgoyne beynge warned suspected quene wyth ayde duke wolde conueye dolphyn germanye holde hym theyr pleasure e peche purpose ha e sped towarde ye dolphyn contrary mynde duke bauarye whiche vpon waye sayd doulphyne towarde quene retourned hym lodged stronge castell called lupar whereof herynge duke orleyaunce assembled hym copany vi thousande knyghtes came agayne towarde parys tyme duke burgoyne herynge ye duke comyng made stronge receyue hym whome cytezens parys fauourable aydynge euyll wyll bare vnto duke orleyaunce also hoped hym defended taskes tallages thus contynuynge prouisyon vpon bothe partyes mete shortely playne batayle suche polytike meanes foude noble man called mountague concorde vnyte tyme hym sette atwene sayd duke newe occasyon shulde nat presece kyndle atwene therfore ye duke orleyaunce hys company sent guyan warre vpon englysshemen vnto calays lay syege vnto towne prepared wonderfull engyne sette vpon whelys strength wherof thoughte wreke greate dysturbaunce vnto sayd towne sayth myne auctour gagwyne great hoope recouer agayne subieccyon house frauce hope soone dyspayred nat longe sayd duke kynge countermaunded returned duke orleyaunce knewe rescous commyng fro burdeaux remoued siege layde hym burgus towne guyan returned fraunce cofusyon shall appere xxvii yere charles former malyce enuye contynuyng brestes sayd duke orleyaunce burgoyne sayd duke orleyaunce goynge towarde hys lodgynge nyght x daye decembre fell vpon certayne knyghtes whiche one named rafe auctouyle leder slewe hym nere vnto gate cytie parys named barbet gate whyche murder fynysshed ye sayde sir rafe hys adherentes fledde vnto place erle artoys duke burgoyne vsed accustomably resorte ye dede corp soone suche came ye exclamacyo also seruaut slaine borne ye next house whan rumour murder blowen ye cytie anone lewys vncle vnto kynge kynge scecyle duke berry burbon drewe thyder lamentacyon beholdynge corp commaunded prouisyon made buryenge within monastery celestynes vpon seconde day folowynge buryed wyth great pompe whome amoge lordes folowed buryenge duke burgoyne nat without great suspicyon sayd murder enterrement due obseruaunce fynysshed auctoryte gyuen vnto ii knyghtes named roberte tuyller peter orpheuer make enquery murder prince wherof duke burgoyne beynge ascertayned voyded cytie brake brydge saynte maxence hym pursute hym shulde nat made hastely spedde hym nyght folowynge came andwarpe whiche vpon c myle parys whan charles kyng harde escape ye sayd duke feryng leste wolde accuse hym consentyng vnto euyll dede sent vnto hym comfortable message sayde duke without warre restyd wynter sometyme arthoys whyle flaunders pleasure whiche pastyme sente dyuers place fraunce sondry accusacyons duke slayne enteded depose kyng take vpon hym rule gouernaunce realme haue poysoned sayd kyng dyuers token hym affermed perfourmauce also said duke orleyauce cause fyrynge ye disguysers garmentes shewed ende brynge kyng daunger syckenes el consumed fyre sondry distamacyons leuyenge taskes imposicyons people singuler auauntage hougely enrychynge wherby myghte soner attayn vnto said purpose thus contynuyng great vnkyndenes atwene duke burgoyne sonne blode ye duke orleyaunce said duke agayne begynnynge yere herynge king quene departed parys charter assebled hym stroge power holaders came vnto parys cytie moch trusted ende cause kynge ye quene doulphyn whome hadde maryed hys doughter retourne vnto parys strengthe hys partye broughte hym wyllyam erle hanster wyllyam man great strengthe allyaunce hadde maryed hys syster vnto duke burgoyne foresayde hys doughter heyre vnto one kyng charles sonnes gossyppe vnto quene whyche sayde consyderacyons sayde erle entendynge weale realme fraunce laboured suche wayes meanes hym tyme concorde vnytie dryuen made atwene two duke orleyaunce burgoyne wyth assured othes necessary actes concorde belongynge king retynewe agayne retourned vnto parys duke thus appeased duke burgoyne agayne restored gouernaunce realme assocyate vnto hym kynge nauerne whyche varyed nat father vnstable condycyons newe occasyons stry e varyaunce moued atwene sayde duke theyr allyes fyrste soughte occasyon agayne forenamed mountague man great wysedome honoure kynges courte especyall frende vnto duke orleyaunce theyr malyce vntrewe surmyses fynally putte dethe one named peter essayer sayer tha prouoste cytie parys gouernoure admytted rule kynges treasoury dyuers offyces suche thynge fauoured duke orleauce clerely dyscharged whyche theyr relefe comfort resorted vnto sayde duke shewynge ye demeanure aduersaryes addynge thervnto ye suche conuencyons concernynge amyte atwene hym duke burgoyne sworne enacted clerely adnulled broken tydynges duke beyng fyred newe malyce accompanyed hym duke berry burbon alenson erles rychemounte alyberte armenake noble nat fewe whose counsel determyned auenged vpon duke burgoyne fautours wherof sayde duke beynge monisshed drewe towarde parys strengthed fortress yode thys duke burgoyne brother duke brabande named anthony man great polycye wysedome whych forecastynge great shedynge chrysten mannes blode many inconuenyences lykely haue ensued varyaunce atwene two duke made suche affectuous labour great diffyculte pacifyed agayne tyme brought personall communicacyon lastely amyable frendely departynge whiche concorde amyte thus agayn concluded duke burgoyne departed pycardy leauynge behynde fore named peter essayr rule cytie parys whiche shortely drewe hym suche persones tyme vexed distourbed ye duke orleyaunce frendes seruauntes cytie whose meanes sayd peter sought fyrste occasyon agayne knight named uenyt thorney false suggestyon smote fyrste hede dyd hys body hanged vpon comon gybet parys dyspyte ye sayd duke testifyeth myne auctoure wherwith ye duke beynge wondersly amoued resembled knyghtes spedde hym towarde towne named strengthe another towne named sente certayne nombre knyghtes chargyng dweller withstande force enemy hearynge duke burgoyne anone gathered vnto noumbre xvim flemynges pycardes sped hym vnto sayde towne instrumentes warre assayled gate sayde towne whyche leadeth towarde saynt quintyne yt shorte space sayde flemynges wan entre towne whyche meane season dweller wyth soudyours backe way water wherof maner thys auctoure nat expressyd lefte towne yode vnto duke orleyaunce beynge yet foresayde towne whan flemynges entered towne foude deserte people pillage lacked theyr praye cause nat shewed toke suche vnkyndenes agayne duke prayer yet manasses wolde nat hym lenger tary returned home hastely spede towarde theyr owne countrey duke fayne withdrawe suretie aske ayde helpe englysshemen holpen prynces comforte henrye sonne henry iiii shall touched xii yere iiii henry xxxi yere thys kynge charles whiche xii yere iiii henry kynge englande duke orleyaunce seynge enemye turned parys caused suche brydges said enemye broken reedyfyed whyche passed ryuer tyll came saint denys fande capytayne noble man named syr iohn cabylon duke burgoyne lefte hym strength towne whiche syr iohn co sideryng ye wekenes ye said towne also lacke stregth yelded towne vnto duke swerynge solempne othe ye daye shulde neuer bere armes agayne hym pastyme capytayne burgonyons called gancourt secretely night wan vpon frenche men brydge saynte clodalde nat longe duke orleaunce sent thyther certayne brytons whiche agayne recouered sayde brydge helde vnto ye sayd duke vse whyche tyme season duke burgoyne recouerynge hys strength passed brydge melent came vnto cytie parys daye folowynge wyth helpe cytesyns recouered abouesayd brydge saynt clodald dystressed vpon brytons whyche warde duke orleaunce made saynte denys ouer sayne brydge towarde parys wherof duke beynge warned refused cytye kynge beynge present remouyd wyth dolphyne towne called stamp sent ye erle marche named iamys wyth certeyne knyghtes towne named strength ageyne duke orleaunce whyche sayde duke knyghtes encountred taken sent pryson wherof herynge duke burgoyne shorte processe retourned vnto parys wyth kyng dolphyne duke orleauce yode towne called seyntclowe xxxii yere thys sayd kynge charles counceyll duke berry seyng sayde cytye parys let agayne hym wyth also kynge dolphine sent noble man hoste named alberte vnto henry iiii yet kynge englande requyre hym ayde withstande tyrannye duke burgoyne wyth hys complyces entendyd subuerte realme fraunce requeste kynge henry gaue good eare lastely graunted hys petycyon sent thyder sayth frenche cronycle thomas hys sonne duke clarence also ye duke yorke wyth iohn erle cornewayle accompanyed wyth viiic knyghtes sowdyours thousande archer whych company landed fraunce herde yt french lordes treaty peace man gaue wage tofore mysed fell vpon towne called ryffled therin toke prysoners abbot monastery wyth coueyed burdeaux englande theyr fynaunce money due olde frenche kynge affermeth gagwyne remayned many yeres englysh men thus departed albeit englysshe cronycle xiii yere forenamed kynge henry report made lordes fraunce retourned theyr olde discecyon contynued longe stryfe wherof cyrcustaunce longe tedyouse tell shewe vnstablynesse whyle duke orleaunce fauoured kynge dolphyne agayne duke burgoyne cleyne conceyte cotencyo thus enduryng kyng henry ye iiii dyed henry son ye v henry admitted kyng englande hym shortly sent ambassadours vnto frenche kynge arynge doughter katheryne maryage affirmeth frenche boke dyuers wryters shewe yt asked hoole landes due within realme frauce reason composicion made tyme passed atwene progenytour edwarde thyrde iohn king fraunce dysdeynously answered therfore made vpo sharpe warre iii yere ye sayd hery deale dothe appere reason whyche warre cyuyle batayle stryfe ye longe whyle cotynued amonge frenche men dyd aswage iii yere henry whiche xxxv yere charles said henry inuaded ye realme fraunce egyncourte tryumphant victory sayde thyrde yere hery v lengthe declared foloweth story many townes stronge holdes englysshe men sondry place frauce opteined ye xxx viii yere charles frenche man named ye lorde ile adam iohn uyllers proper name gatheryng hym company tyrauntes nombre ccc mo wherof many old seruautes kynges housholde put ye dolphyn rule kynge treason clerke opteyned keyes one gate parys entred cytie nyght watche worde amonge deuysed assocyate many burgonyons beynge stronge yode kyng gate ye rule sone done suche myght fynde bare rule slewe one meane vpon ye day folowyng nombred dede corfes wythin cytie vpon iiiim amonge whiche noble men henry de marle chaunceller frauce graun pre many haue assystence comon people sayd uyllers set ye kyng vpon horse ladde hym cytie small reason guyde hym selfe ruled thyng copany wolde wherfore dolphyn feryng fall daunger wylde copany yode meldune called hym suche lefte lyne withstade tyrauntes ye duke burgoyne beynge within cytie compasser thys myschefe construed demed whyche company hym gathered returned cytie parys assayled one gate whanne sawe ye cytezens toke partye agayne hym thoughte trauayle loste wherfore without great assaute makyng called thence knightes departed agayne place whiche came fro then vnto thuron appeasynge countreys townes went whiche dayes farre frame xxxix yere sayd charles king henry v landed stroge power place called touke normandy layde syege manye stronge holdes townes wanne cane phaleys roan vi yere sayd henrye folowynge lengthe declared tyme whyche warre thus made kynge henry dolphyn duke burgoyne eyther prouyded defende malyce moche testyfyeth frenche cronycle duke aduysed haue taken partie englisshemen sayeng wytnesseth auctour named floure hystoryes toucheth laten many gestes dedes done kynges englade sayeth frenche men bryng excuse theyr infortune cowerdyse reason whereof loste nat onely theyr lande also honoure name lastely duke beynge mynde exortacyon phylyppe iosquyne iohn de tolongn also lady called countesse grat duke reconsyled vnto dolphyne day metynge apoynted monstruell eyther shulde accopanyed x lordes onely without mo whyche day sayd prynces theyr assygned lordes beynge assembled many reason argumetes layde replyed vpon bothe sydes occasyon wherof one dolphyns company sodainly drewe hys knyfe strake duke vnto harte dyed soone whyche murder supposed done knyght called tanguyde de chastell whyche oftyme passed ben famylyer seruaunt duke orleyauce slayne meanes sayde duke burgoyne whiche murder thus commytted lande fraunce broughte moche stryfe varyaunce moche phylyppe sonne sayde iohn duke burgoyne beynge parys hauynge rule ye kynge cytie toke partie englysshe men agayne ye dolphyn reason wherof sondry wryters agre king henryes tie greatly augmented holpen fynally kynge henry opteyned moche wyll shortly maryed dame katheryne doughter charles kynge xli yere reygne assuraunce promyse inherytauce realme fraunce heyres dethe said charles plainly shal shewed viii yere said henry fyfte whyche maryage concluded fynysshed yet ye dolphyn ceased nat make newe mocyons sterynges durynge whiche kynge charles dyed octobre buryed saynt denys whan reygned greate trouble vpo poynt xlii yeres leauyng hym affirmed forenamed auctour gaguyne sonne dolphyn uyenne called charles whiche kyng frenchemen named charlys vii viii wryters henry iiii anglia henry iiii name sonne iohn gaunte late duke lacaster toke possessyon domynion ye realme englande ende story seconde rycharde shewed vpon laste daye septembre yere lorde mccclxxxxix xix yere charles ye vii kyng frauce whyche possessyon hym taken anone made newe officer erle northumberlande made constable englande erle westmerlade made marshall syr iohn serle chaunceller iohn newebery esquyer tresorer syr rycharde clyfforde knyght keper ye priuey signet yt done prouysyon made hys coronacyon agayne day translacyo saynt edwarde confessour nexte commyng parlyament prolonged tyll tuysdaye folowynge sayd daye coronacyo vpo euyn sayd daye coronacyon kynge wythin towre londo made xli knyghtes bate wherof iii hys owne sonnescoronacio henry ye fourth iii erles v lordes vpon mondaye beynge sayd daye saynt edwarde xiii daye october crowned westmynster archebysshop cau torbury whych solempnyte fynysshed honorable feest holden wythin greate halle westmynster kyng beyng set mydde see table archebisshop cautorbury iii prelate set table vppon ryght hade kyng archebysshoppe yorke wyth iiii prelate set vpo hade kyng hery kynges eldest sonne stoode vppo ryghte hande wyth poyntlesse swerde holdyng vp ryght erle northhumberlade newely made constable stode vpo left hade wyth sharpe swerd holde vp ryght eyther swerdes stode ii lordes holding ii scepter ye kyng stode dynerwhyle duke amnarle surrey exceter wyth ii lordes ye erle westmerlade tha newly made marshal rode halle many typped staues aboute hym se roume ye halle kepte offycers myghte wyth ease serue table whych table chyefe vpo ryghte syde halle begunne wyth baron fyue porte table nexte cupborde vppo lefte hande sate mayre hys bretherne aldeme londo whych mayre beynge drewe barentyne goldsmyth seruice hym daye done mayres euery kynges quenes coronacion vse stadyng cuppe golde tha seconde course serued syr thomas dymmoke knyght beynge armed peace syttynge vpo good stede rode hygher parte halle kynge caused herowde make proclamacyon wolde saye kynge hery nat ryght full enherytoure crowne england ryghtfully crowned redy wage wyth hym batayl suche tyme shuld please kynge assygne whyche proclamacyon caused made iii sundry place halle englyshe frenche wyth many mo obseruaunces hys solemnyte exercysed done whyche longe reherse thys feest wyth honour ended vpon morne beyng tuysday parliamet agayne begunne vpon wednysdaye syr iohanne cheyny tyme occupyed speker parlyamet hys owne labour cause infyrmytyes hadde dyscharged squyer named wyllyam durwarde electe roume hym thanne parlyament actes thereof laste called kynge rycharde adnulled sette noughte parlyamente holden xi yere hys reygne holden ferme stable daye henry kynges eldeste sonne chosen admytted prynce walys duke cornewalle erle chester heyre apparaunte crowne uppon thursdaye folowynge putte comon house byll deuysed syr iohn bagot prysonere towre whereof effecte said sir iohn confessed harde kynge rycharde saye dyuers tymes sondry parlyamentes hys tyme holden wolde haue hys entente pleasure concernynge hys owne mater euer betyde resydue yf withstode hys wyll mynde wolde one meane brynge hym lyfe also shewed farther king rycharde shulde shewe saye hym lychefelde xxi yere hys reygne desyred lenger lyue see hys lordes common haue hym great awe drede euer hys progenytours myghte cronycled hym yt none passed hym honour dygnite condycyon deposed put sayde dygnytie morowe yf euer came shulde resygne hys kyngelye magestye sayde mynde resygne duke herforde hym moste ableste occupye honoure one thynge feared leste wolde tyrannye agayne churche ouer shewed ye said byll sayde syr iohn bagot rode behynde duke norfolke towarde westmynster sayd duke layed hys charge ye kynges counsell murdred ye duke glocetyr ye tyme said duke denyed sayd ye day lyue within iii wekes sayde syr iohn ye kynges comaundemente sent sone vnto calays fere owne lyfe sawe ye said murdre put execucion farthermore shewed yt man honour dayes fauour king rycharde tha ye duke amnarle cousell toke ye lordes wrought many thinges ye said duke aduyce also shewed yt harde kynge beynge chyltrynlangley swere many great othes yt duke herforde nowe kyng shulde neuer returne englande rather shulde agayne enheryte hys father landes wolde gyue vnto heyres duke glocetyr erles arundell warwyke laste parliament adiuged farther shewed matter sent said duke knowlege fraunce one named roger smerte admonastynge hym prouyde wysedome wythstande kynges malyce whyche shewed hym hys mortall enemye lastelye shewed sayde byll harde duke amnarle say vnto sir iohn busshey syr henry grene leuer x thousande pound thys man dede whan axed whyche man said duke herforde nat drede haue hys persone sorowe rumour lykely make within realme whiche bylt borne vnto kynges parlyamente chaumbre adde redynge whereof sayd duke amnarle stode vp sayd touchynge suche artycles byll putte agayne hym false vntrewe wolde proue vpon hys body otherwyse kynge wolde commaunde hym upon fryday said syr iohn bagot brought sayd parlyament chambre examyned vpon euery artycle byll whych affermed axed hym coulde saye ye duke exceter unto answered sayed coulde laye nothyng hys charge sayd yoma newgate called halle yt say somwhat sayd duke euer ye lyste say thys trouthe shall expresse trouth last tyme kyng woodstoke duke northfolke ye haue hadde chapel closed dore vpon v ye made swere vpo sacrament present kepe suche counsayll ye shuld shewe vnto ye shewed ye coulde neuer brynge purpose whyle syr iohn gaunt late duke lacastre lyued wherfore ye aduysed haue shortely cousayll lychefelde whyche ye codiscended yt sayd syr iohn shuld arested maner shuld haue occasyo disobey yt areste reason wherof chauce medley shuld slayn wherunto cousayl tha yt kyng shulde calle hys secrete cousayll yf agreed thereunto part wolde agree vnto ye sayeng syr iohn bagot gaue none answere vpo saterday sayd bagot halle bothe broughte parlyament chaubre examined coutrymaunded prysone soone departed lorde fitz water stoode vp sayde moste redoughted souerayne lorde ye duke amnarle hath tymes nowe lately excused hym deth duke glouceter saye wyll iustyfye cause hys deth shall proue vpo hys body yf grace contented cotrary whereof duke wyth sharpe wordes answered gaugys batayll offered bothe partyes sealed delyuered vnto lorde marshall partyes beganne taken amonge lordes moche duke surrey toke party duke amnarle sayde hym done done constraynte rycharde thanne kynge hym selfe consented parforce agayne sayde lorde fytz water replyed wherfore sylence commauded forthwyth fore named halle hadde confessed lordes one theym putte deth duke gloucetyr calays therefore iuged drawen frome towre london vnto tybourne hanged quartered whyche execucion done vppon mondaye folowynge thus wyth cause many thys parlyamente contynued tyll newe mayre named thomas knolles grocer admytted sworne vppon daye folowynge feaste symonde iude anno dni mcccxcix anno dni mcccc grocer wyllyam walderne thomas knolles anno wyllyam hyde fyrst yere king henry iiii yet lastinge foresayd parlyament vpon wednysdaye nexte folowyng feest symonde iude lorde morley appealed erle salesburye treason caste hoode gage trye batayle whiche sayenge replyed caste gloues gauge proue sayeng false vntrewe whiche sealed delyuered vnto ye lorde marshall vpon monday passed act lorde persone degre shulde day laye excuse constraynte coartynge hys prynce executynge wronge iugemente crymynous vnlefull dedes sayenge yt feare durste none otherwyse suche excuse daye shall stande hym none effecte also sheryffes may yelde accompte escheker vppon theyr othes chaunged shyres yerely also lorde man myght gyue gownes lyuereys theyr tenauntes persones excepte onely theyr housholde meynyall seruautes also enacted repyers fysshers rye wynchylsee coostes see syde shulde sell selfe cornehyll chepe stretes london men wolde theym bye excepte fysshemongers wolde bye sayde fysshe make sale agayne vpon wednysday folowynge enacted rycharde late kynge englande shulde hys mys gouernaunce realme holdyn suche prysone kynge wolde assygne durynge hys naturall lyfe kynge graunted persones generall pardones fette chauncerye alhalownetyde nexte folowynge excepte suche persones present murder duke gloucester thys whyle archebysshop caunterbury restored churche caunterburye doctour roger whyche sette kynge rycharde remoued sette see london whyche ryghte well contented thanne erle arundelles sonne restored hys father la de dyuers kynge rycharde dysheryted shortely said parlyament dyssolued euerye man deycence departe hys owne rycharde late kynge vnto castell lede kente kepte prouisyon hade wyndesore kynge epe hys chrystmas whiche pastyme duke amnate surrey exetyr wit erles salesburye glocester theyr affyny made prouisyon dysguysynge mummynge shewe king vpon twelf nyght tyme nere hande thynge redy upon sayde xii daye came secrete ye vnto kynge duke amnarle shewed hym lordes afore named appoynted slee hym tyme foresayd dysguysyng shewynge wherfore aduysed hym pro yde hys owne suretye whoe warnynge kynge secretelye parted frome wyndesore came nyghte london wherof sayd lordes beynge ware theyr counsell bewrayed fledde haste westwarde kynge caused hasty pursute made shortely duke surrey erle salysbury taken syrcetyr streyght behedyd theyr heddes sent london sette vpon brydge oxenforde taken syr thomas blont sir benet sely knyghtes thomas wyntercell esquyre whych hedyd quarteryd theyr hedes sent london brydge pytwell essex taken syr iohn holland duke exetyr brought plasshy place faste behedyd y hedde sent london lette wyth vppon brydge pyght vpon stake tyme bry e taken lorde spencer erle glouceter dyd hys hede sent vnto london brydge yere barnarde brokeys syr iohn se syr iohn maundeley syr iohi fereby knyghtes clerkes wee taken prysoners towre londo soone foriudged nged theyr heddes set vppon london brydge hyche passetyme rycharde late kyng remoued frome castell ledys kent sent vnto pou tfreyt castell yere also towched xix yere vii charlys kynge henry sent vnto c eys isabell late quene england wyfe vnto rycharde lately kynge wyth hyr greate treasour many ryce iewellys te yfyeth englysshe cronycle receyued frenchman undersafe conduyte passynge conueyed vnto hyr father frauce maryed vnto charlys son heyre duke orleaunce haue shewed xxii yere hyr sayde father reygne foloweth story kynge henry whan hadde fermely consydered greate conspyracy agayne hym forenamed lordes person entendyd imagyned hys distruccyon releuynge rycharde late kynge auoydynge lyke daunger prouyded put sayde rycharde thys present lyfe shortely opynyon moste wryters sente knyghte named syr pyers exton vnto pountfreyte castell wyth viii hys companye fell vppon sayde rycharde late kynge hym myserably hys chaumber slewe wythout reuengemente hys dethe felled grounde slewe sayde viii foure men axe theyr lastely wounded deth hande sayde syr pyers exton dyed execucyon whyche dedely dede sayde syr pyers toke great repentaunce myche lamentably sayde ala haue done haue put deth hym hath ben souerayne drad lorde space xxii yeres reason wherof shall reproched honoure thys daye become men shall redounde thys dede dyshonour shame opynyons dethe thys noble prynce lefte wryters waye famyne thys moste wryters testyfyed alleged whan deth prynce publyshed abrode ope vysaged layed ye mynster pou frayt yt men myght know se dede xii daye marche folowynge wyth great solempnyte brought thorough cytye london paules layed open vysaged agayne ende hys deth myght manyfestly knowen whyche doutfull many one specyally suche ought hym fauoure fewe day sayd corp caryed vnto freers langley entred remoued kynge hery v fyrst yere hys reygne wyth great honoure solempnyte coueyed vnto monasterye westmynster wythin chapell saynt edwarde honourably buryed vppo south syde saynt edwardes shryne wyth hys epytaphy vppon hys toumbe foloweth prudens mundus richardus iure secundus per fatum victus iacet hic sub marmore pictus verax sermone fuit plenus ratione corporae procerus auimo prudens vt omerus ecclesiam fauit elatos subpeditauit quemuis prostrauit regalia qui violauit p whyche verse thus vnderstande vulgare englysh tonge foloweth parfyght prudent rycharde ryghte seconde vaynquysshed fortune lyeth nowe grauen stone trewe hys worde therto well resounde semely persone lyke omer one wordely prudence euer churche c ie vphelde fauoured castyng proud groud wolde hys royall state confounde yet ala though metyr ryme thus doth enbelysshe noble prince fame clerke whiche fauoured hym tyme lyst hys connynge thus enhauce name yet story apereth hym blame wherfore prince surest memory theyr lyues exercyse vertuous constancy whanne thys mortall prynce thus dede grauen kyng hery inquyet possessyon realme fande great rychesse yt tyme kynge rycharde belonged wytnesseth polycronycon fande kyng rychardes tresoury iii hundreth thousande li redy coyne besyde iewelles ryche vessel whyche moche value ouer espyed kepyng tresourers hades c lm noble iewels stuffe cuteruayled sayd value shulde seme ye kynge rycharde ryche whan hys money iewelles amuted viicmli moneth octobre ende thys mayer yere brent smythfelde londo preest named syr wyllyam sawtry certayne poyntts heresy anno dni mcccc anno dni mcccci goldsmyth iohn wakele iohn fraunces anno ii wyllyam ebot thys seconde yere kynge henry moneth frebruary drawen hanged treason knyghte named syr roger claryngeton tybourne wyth two hys seruauntes pryour lade eyghte freres mynours gray freres whyche bachelers dyuynyte thys yere began greate dyscencion walys betwene ye lorde gray ryffyn welsheman named howen glendore whyche howen gathered hym greate strenghte welshemen dyd moche harme coutrey nat sparynge kynges lordshyppes hys people lastlye toke sayd lorde gray prysoner helde hym prysoner tyll contrarye hys wyll hadde maryed sayde howe doughter matrymony fynysshed helde sayde lorde styl walys tyll died kynges great dyspleasure wherfore kynge wyth stroge army spedde hym walys subdue sayde howen hys adherentes whan kyng wyth power entred ye coutre hys fawtours fledde mountaynes helde hym kyng myght nat wynne hym dystruccion hys hoste wherefore fynally aduyce hys lordes retourned englande season thys yere also whete graynes beganne fayle quarter whete solde london xvi derer shuld haue nat ben prouysyon marchautes brought rye rye floure spruce wherwyth thys lade greatly susteyned eased anno dni mcccci anno dni mccccii wyllyam uenour iohn shadworth anno iii iohn fremynghm thys yere coduyte standyng vpon cornhylle london begon made somer folowynge syr thomas percy erle worceter syr hery percy sonne heyre vnto erle northumberlande gadered greate power vppo daye saynte praxede vyrgyne xxi daye iulythe batayle shr wysbu mette wyth kynge nere vnto shrowysbury gaue vnto hi cruell batayll theyr owne confusion fyght ye sayd syr thomas percy taken hys neuew foresayde syr henry wyth many stronge man vppon theyr partye slayne vpo ye kynges partie prynce wouded hed erle stafforde wyth many slayne xxv daye iuly folowynge shrowysbury sayd syr thomas percy beheded hys hed caried london set vpo brydge thys batayl many noble man slayne vpo eyther partye noted vengeable father slayn sonne son father brother brother neuewe neuewe moneth august folowynge duchesse brytayne landed fulmouth prouince cornwayll thes conueyed wynchester shorte tyme kyng hery maryed cathedrall churche sayde cytye soone vpo eldest doughter kyng hery named dame blache maryed coleyn duke sonne bayer anno dni mccccii anno dni mcccciii rycharde merlewe iohn walcot draper anno iii robert chichele yere xiiii day moneth septembre ye foresayd duchesse brytayne wyfe ye kyng receyued wyth great honour cytye london mayre cytezyns conueyed vnto westmynster vpo morowe folowyng crowned quene englande wyth greate honoure solempnite cyrcumstaunce wherof passe ouer yere also rupertus deposynge wessenselans electours empyre auctoryte bonyface r pope admytted emperoure rome came englande wyth goodly companye onely se countre commodytyes whyche kynge honourably receyued fested lastely conueyed kynge towarde see syde eyther departed wyth exchaunge ryche precious gyft thys rurpartus named wryters man excellente bounte largesse gaue lyberally moche tyme hys beynge englade laye kynges costes whyle londo lodged house saynte iohann smythfelde thys yere also vpo sait laurece euyn ix day august lorde brytayne named lorde castyle frenche laded within myle plymmouth wyth great copany norma brytons came vnto sayd town lodged night spoyled robbed sayd towne vpon day folowynge whan done wolde retourned agayne theyr shyppes plente pyllage prysoners suche fande anno domini mcccciii anno domini mcccciiii thomas fawconer wyllyam askam anno v thomas pooll thys yere soone cadelmasse foresayd lorde castyle trustynge wynne l ke enterpryse yere passed hadde done beynge accompanyed wyth stronge nauy freche men brytons encountred wyth englyshe floot within ii myles deermouth place called blak pooll loge cruell fyghte ye sayd lord slayne wyth partye people dyuers hys shyppes take wytnesseth englysshe cronycle wyth dyuers englysshe auctours freche boke excuseth thys scomfyture frechmen sayeth treason gascoyne named pe perot de languyle whyche shewed vnto sayd lorde castyle espyed certayne englysshe shyppes greke lyghtly wythout resystence take caused sayd lorde make sayle towarde sayd towne dartmouthe contynued certayne tyme hys course espyed hoteflo e englyshe men whyche made toward hym sayde blake pool encount faughte lastely escaped daunger hys enemyes testyfyeth sayde french cronycle atte unhurt wouded fyght dyed shortly moneth apryll folowynge duke clarence wyth erle ket many lordes toke shyppynge meregate sayled vnto scluce flauders sayde duke refresshed hym hys company toke shyppynge agayne holdynge hys course towarde swyne encoutred wyth iii greate carykes ieane whyche assayled longe bekerynge toke beynge laden wyth marchaudyse wyth pray retourned cambre wynchelsee whyche hauen sayd goodes cated shared varyauce amonge selfe otherwyse one sayde carykes sodeynly fyred cosumed restytucyon whyche goodes shyppes ye marchautes ianuece made great longe sute kyng cousayl whyche passetyme borowed cloth wolle marchaundyses amountyng vnto great notable somme dyuers marchauntes englande whanne sawe myghte haue none hope recouery theyr loste sodeynly auoyded lade lafte ye foresayde notable summes vnpayde great hynderaunce vtter vndoynge many englysshe marchauntes thys yere yoman named wyllyam serle somtyme yoma kyng rychardes robys take march scotlade broughte vnto londo guildhall areygned murder duke glouceter calays upo murder attaynt conuyct vppo xx daye octobre drawe towre vnto tyborne haged quartred hys hed set vpo londo brydg hys iiii quarter sent iiii sondry good townes anno domini mcccciiii anno domini mccccv wyllyam lowfte iohn hyende draper anno vi stephen spylman thys yere moneth ianuary certayne course warre ron smythfelde betwene syr edmude erle kent lorde moryfa baro scotlade vppo ye chalege sayd scottysshe lorde erle ket bare hym valy auntly hym gyue ye price iourney hys great honour yere syr rycharde scrope archebisshop yorke ye lorde moubraye tha marshal englad allied grudge bare agayn kynge gadered vnto theym greate stregth entedyng haue put downe kynge ame wente wherof kyng beyng enfourmed haste sped towarde theym met wyth thys syde yorke askyrmysshe sayd lordes made tha take presented vnto ye king yorke bothe demed suffre deth theyr rebellyo byshop beheded whan bysshoppe came vnto place execucion prayed ye bowcher gyue hym v stroke worshyp christes fyue woundes hys penauce eueryche whyche v stroke kynge henry beynge hys lodgyng stroke hys necke moch demed persone beynge hym present hadde stryken forthwyth stryken wyth plage lepyr knewe hande god repeted hym hasty iugement without auctoryte churche soone god shewed many myracles sayde bysshop whyche called kynge vnto repentaunce anno dni mccccv anno dni miiiicvi henry barton iohn woodcok mercer anno vii wyllyam crowner thys yere dame lucye duke myllanys syster came englande maryed vnto syr edmunde holande erle kent churche saynte mary ouerey southwarke vppon xxiiii daye ianuary kyng present gaue daye vnto preest solempnyzacion maryage fynysshed wyth greate honour conueyed vnto bysshoppe wynchesters palays fast daye holden sumptuous pumpous feaste yere moneth may dame phylyppe yongeste doughter kynge henry accompanyed wyth dyuers lordes spyrytuall temporall shypped northe conueyed denmarke towne cytye called london maryed vnto ye kynge sayde countre thys yere also syr thomas ramston constable ye towre ouersyghte hys botemen wold haue passed brydge toward sayde towre drowned yere greuous co playntes tyme hadde ben shewed euydently proued kynges counsayl also mayre hys bretherne great dystruccion frye yonge fysshe reason werys standynge dyuers place ryuer thamys wherby fysshe sayde ryuer greately mynysshed wasted also yf sayd werys contynued sayde ryuer shuld shorte processe dystroyed wherfore mayre hys bretherne alderman conseruatours ye ryuer made suche laboure vnto kynge hys counsayll opteyned commyssyon pull vp werys stode betwene londo vii myles beyode kynston lykewyse suche stode betwene london grauysende aswell crekes seuerall groundes whyche commyssyon sayde mayre hys offycers thys yere putte execucyon thys yere syr robert knolles knyght whyche fraunce brytayne hadde tyme done many victorious actes ye xxxiii yere edward thyrde yeres hys reygne somdele towched made ende hys werke rochester brydge chapell sayde brydge fote dyed shortely whanne hadde newe reedyfyed body whyte fryer churche standynge fletestrete done house many notable benefytes buryed body sayde churche whyche churche place fyrste founded auncetoures lorde gray cotnore anno dni mccccvi anno dni mccccvii nycholas wotton rycharde whytyngton mercer anno viii godfrey brook thys yere moneth nouembre one named walche clerke apeched knyghte called syr per yuall sowdan treason tryall wherof daye gyuen fyght smythfylde day aboue sayde whych daye eyther apered faught season ende clerke recreaut wherefore immedyately spoyled hys armour layde vpo hardyl drawen tyborne hanged thys yere also syr henry erle northumberlande lorde bardolf commyng scotlade wyth stronge company dyspleasure hurt kynge entended met encountred wyth gentylmen comons northe foughten wyth dystressed strake theyr heddes sente theym london whyche thanne pyghte vppon brydge amonge many anno dni mccccvii anno dni miiiicviii henry ponfreyt wyllyam stondon grocer anno ix henry halton thys yere moneth decembre bega frost contynued space xv wekes therupo byrdes woderly famysshed dystressed violence yere syr edmode holande erle kente kynge made admyrall see scowred skymmed ye see ryght well manfully lastly landed coost brytayne besieged castell named briak wan strength wynnyng therof dedely wounded wyth arowe hede dyed shortly hys corp brought agayn englade buryed amoge aucetours begynnyng thys yere slayne murdered duke orleauce parys lyke legthe shewed ye xxviii yere charles ye vii kyng frauce anno dni mccccviii anno dni miiiicix thomas duke drewe barentyne goldsmyth anno x wyllyam norton thys yere seneshal henaude came thys lande wyth goodly companye henauders straungers parfourme certayne faytes armes agayne dyuers noble gentylmen thys lade fyrste sayd seneshall chalenged erle somerset hys company getylmen thys lade shall apere executyng whyche dysporte place smythfelde kynge appoynted barred fensed entent daye set euery redy xi daye whych daye seneshall chalenger entred ye felde pompously goodly company men honour erle somerset broughte ranne togyder certayne course executed faytes army wherof pryse honour gyuen herawdes vnto erle wanne day great honour seconde daye came knyght henauder chalengeoure whome defendaunt came syr rycharde arundell knyghte whyche ranne certayne course horsebak went togyder ax fote syr rychard putte worse henauder brought hym vpo hys kne thyrde daye came knyght henaude chaleger whome defendaunte came syr iohn cornewayl knyght well bare hym put straunger worse upon iiii daye came felde esquyre henauder agayne whome ranne sonne syr iohan cheyny whych seconde course sette hys stroke egerly ouer threw henauder horse whyche dede ye kyng dubbed hym forthwith knight upon v day played togyder henauder squyre called iohn stewarde whyche daye also englyssheman wan worshyp upon vi daye skyrmysshed togyder henauder englysshe esquyer named wyllm porter whyche gatte suche worshype henauder kynge hys guerdon made hym streyghte knyght upon vii daye lykewyse played insemble henauder one iohn stadysshe esquyer whyche semblably hys prowesse manly dealyng also ye kyng dubbed knyght gascoyn day wan ye pryce straunger immedyatly made knyghte ye kyng vpo viii daye laste day thys chalenger came felde ii henauders unto whome came ii bretherne beyng sowdiours calays ye whyche bekered togyder loge seaso ye eyther tye receyued plentye good stroke tyll
