pea ye kyng co mauded thys chalege fynysshed ye great honour ye kyng whych feasted straungers wyth ryche gyftes sente retourned theym agayne theyr countrees anno dni mccccix anno dni miiiicx iohn lawe rycharde marlowe irenmonger anno xi wyllyam chycheley thys yere moneth marche tayloure london named iohan badby brente smythfelde heresy meanes prynce one mayster courtnay thanne chauceller oxenforde whyle reconcyled promysed leue erroure whan sacrament ye aulter brought tofore hym dyspysed wolde wyse therein byleue wherefore hadde deserued versifier reproche hys errour made ii verse folowynge hereticus credat vt perustus ab orbe recedat ne fide ledat sathan huc baratro sibi predat whych verse thus moch meane englysshe peruerse heretyke though brenne worlde rased vtterly force syn lyst n kenne sacred fayth right pervers yst wyll erroniously reply force thought satha eternall payne hym rewarde syn wyll refrayne thys yere also moneth apryll wythin lystes smythfeld foughte sore fight betwene esquyre named glouceter appellaut esquyre called arthur defendaut whyche acquyted eyther partye fully kynge hys especyall grace seyng bothe well fyghtyng men toke quarell hys handes pardoned offece eyther partye thys yere market howse called stokes stadynge churche saynt mary wolchurch london bego edyfyed thys yere also kyng helde parlyamet westmynstera byll p vppe parlyamet durynge whych ye comons thys lade put vp byll kynge take ye teporall landes fro spyrytuall menes handes possessio effect whych byll yt teporaltes dysordinatly wasted church myght suffyce fynde ye kynge xv erles xvc knightes vim iic esqiers c house almes releef poore people mo tha ye day wythin englad ouer foresayd charge ye kyng myght put yerely hys cofers xxmli prouyded ye euery erle shuld haue yerely ret iiim marke euery knight c marke iiii plough lande euery esquyre xl marke yere wt ii plough lade euery house almesse c marke ouersyght ii trew seculers vnto euery house also wyth prouisio yt euery towneshyppe shuld kepe poore people theyr owne dweller whych myght nat labour theyr lyuyng codicion yt mo fell towne tha towne might maynteyn tha sayd almes house releue townshyppes beare charge alledged theyr sayd bylle yt te poralties beyng possessio spirytuall amounted iiic xxiim marke yere wherof affermed ye see cauterbury abbays cristes church saynt augustyns shrowysbury coggeshale saynt osiys xxm marke yere see durhm abbey xxm marke ye see yorke abbays xx marke see wynchester abbays xxm marke see lo wyth abbays house xxm marke ye see lyncoln wyth ye abbays peterbourth ramsay xxm mark see norwych wyth abbey bury xxm marke see hely wyth abbays hely spaldig xxm mark see bathe wyth abbay okynborne otherxxm marke see worceter ye abbays euishm abyngdon xxm marke see chester precinct see sait dauid salysbury exceter wyth theyr precinctes xxm marke abbays rauens reuans fountaynes geruons dyuers nombre v mo xx thousand marke abbays leyceter waltham gysbourne herton tircetir osney nombre vi mo twenty thousande marke abbays douers batell lewis cowentre dauetre courney xxm marke abbays northampton thortone brystow kelyngworth wynchescob hayles parchyssor fredyswyde notley grymmysby xxm marke whych forsayd sumes amout full iiicm marke odde xxiim marke appoynted herdforde rochester huntyngdon swyneshede crowlande malmesbury burton tewkisbury dustable shirborn taunton bylande ouer thys alledged sayde byll ouer aboue ye sayd sume iiic xxiim marke dyuers house relygion englande possessed many temporaltyes myght suffice fynde yerely xvm preestes clerkes euery preest allowed hys stypende vii marke yere ye byl none answere made kyng thys mater wolde take delyberacio aduycemente wyth answere ended ferther laboure made anno dni mccccix anno dni mccccx iohn penne thomas knolles grocer anno xii thomas pyke thys yere asquyer walys named ryze ap dee whych log tyme rebelled agayn ye kyng rotysfyed partye howan glendore take broughte london vppon ix daye decembre drawen hanged quartered hys hed set vpon brydge amoge yere also guylde halle lo begonne newe edyfyed olde lytell cotage made fayre goodly house nowe appereth anno domini mccccx anno domini mccccxi iohn raynewell robert chycheley grocer anno xiii wyllyam cotton thys yere vpon xii day octobre thre flodes thamys whyche thynge man lyuynge cowde remembre lyke sene thys yere lorde thomas sonne kynge created duke clarence thys yere kynge requeste duke orleaunce sente ouer forsayd duke sonne ayde sayd duke orleauce agayn duke burgoyne whose actes hys company haue made report story charles vii kynge fraunce thys yere kyng caused newe coyne noble made whyche lesse value olde noble iiiid noble thys yere also kynge created iohn hys son duke bedforde hys sonne humfrey duke glounceter made also syr thomas beauforde erle dorset duke anmarle created duke yorke anno domini mccccxi anno domini mccccxii rauffe leuenhm wyllyam waldren mercer anno xiiii wyllyam seuenok thys yere xx daye moneth nouembre great counsayll holden whyte freers london whyche amonge thynges concluded kynges greate iournay entended take vysytyng holy sepulcre lord certayne galeys warre shulde made purueaunce concernynge iournay whereupon hasty possyble spede made feaste crystemasse whyle makynge hys prayer saynte edwardes shryne take hys leue spede hym vpo hys iournay became syke suche aboute hym fered wolde haue dyed ryght wherfore hys comforte bare hym abbottes place lodged hym chambre vpo paylet layde hym fyre laye greate agony certayne tyme length wha commyn hym selfe nat knowynge freyned suche aboute hym place yt whych shewed hym belonged vnto abbot westmynster felte hym selfe syke commaunded aske yf chabre speciall name unto answered named hierusalem sayd ye kyng louyng father heuedethe kyng henry iiii nowe knowe shall dye thys chambre accordynge ye prophecye beforesayd shuld dye hierusale made hym selfe redy dyed shortly vppo ye daye saynt cuthbert xx day marche wha reygned xiii yeres v monethes xxi dayes leuynge hym iiii sonnes meane hery kyng thomas ye duke clarence iohn duke bedforde hufrey duke glouceter ii doughters one beyng quene denmarke duchesse barre shewed whan kynge henry deed conueyed water vnto feuersham then lande vnto caunterbury entered ye shryne saynt thomas anglia phenrici quinti henry v ye name sonn henry iiii bega reygne ouer realm england xxi day ye moneth marche yere lorde ende xiiiic xii xxxii yere charles vii yet kynge frauce ix daye apryll folowynge whych yere passio sondaye beyng day excedyng rayne crowned westmynster thys man deth hys father applyed hym vnto vyce insolency drewe vnto hym riottours wyldly dysposed sone admytted ye rule lande anon sodaynly became new tourned rage wyldnes sobernes wyse sadnes vyce costat vertue wolde cotinewe ye vertue nat reduced thereunto famylyarytye hys olde nyse company therfore rewardes gyuen charged vppon payne theyr lyues none hardy come wythin x myle place lodged daye hym assygned thys begynnyng thys kyng henry olde mayre shryues continued theyr office termes accustomed anno dni mccccii anno dni mcccciii rauffe leuyngham wyllyam waldern mercer anno wyllyam seuenok anone kynge henry crowned solempnyte feest eester passed sent vnto fryer lagley corp kynge rycharde buryed caused take oute erth wyth reuerence solempnyte coueyed vn westmynster vppon southe syde saynt edwardes shryne honourably buryed quene anne wyfe whyche tyme enterred solempne interment holden prouyded iiii taper shulde brene day nyght hys graue whyle world endureth one daye weke solempne dirige vppon morowe masse requiem note whyche masse ended gyuen wekely vnto poore people xi viiid pen vpon daye hys annyuersary ye sayd masse requiem songe yerely destrybuted soule xxliiii heruest tyme syr iohn oldcastell knyghte appreched heretyke comitted pryson howe escaped tyme towre londo yode walys lyned ouer iiii yeres anno dni mccccxiii anno dni mccccxiiii iohn sutton wyllm crowmer draper anno ii iohn mycoll thys yere moneth ianuary certayne adherentes forenamed syr iohn oldcastell entendynge dystruccion thys lande subuercio assembled felde nere vnto saynte gyles great nombre wherof kynge beyng enfourmed toke ye felde theym toke certayne amonge whyche syr roger acton knyghte syr iohn beuerley preest squyer called syr iohn browne whyche wyth xxxvi mo nombre conuycte heresy treason hanged brent wythin ye sayd felde saynt gyles yere iohn claydon skynner rycharde turmyne baker heresy brente smythfelde thys yere kyng helde parlyamente leyceter amonge thynges foresayd bylle putte vp common lande temporaltyes beynge ye churche touched xi yere ye iiii hery agayne mynded fere wherof lest kyng wolde thereunto gyue cofortable audyence testyfye wrytters certayne bysshoppes hede men churche putte ye kyng mynde clayme right fraunce exployte thereof offcede vnto hym great notable summes reason whereof sayde byll agayne put kynge set hys mynde recouery soone sente hys letter vnto frenche kynge concernyng mater receyued frome hym answere dirision affermeth englysshe boke gaguynus sayeth hys frenche cronycle kynge henry sente hys oratours vnto charles vii thanne kynge fraunce haue dame katheryne hys doughter mariage requestes touchynge hys ryght enherytaunce whereunto answered counsayll fraunce kyng hadde leyser entende suche idelnesse wherupon kynge henry made quycke prouision warre vpon frenche kynge appereth thys yere also procuremet sigismunde thanne emperour greate counsayll synod bysshoppes assembled cytye hygh almayne called constaunce vnion churche auoyde scisme whyche began xiiii yere charles vi sayde xiiii yere touched sayd synode generall counsayll xxiii iohn pope put downe resygned hys volunte auctoryte ye cousayll opynyons heresy wyklyf vtterly anulled dampned two hys disciple presente named iohn hus husse ierom herytyke brente many notable actes wele ye church enacted fynally whan sayde cousayl endured nere vpon terme iiii yeres hole asset chase newe pope named hym v martyne whyche occupyed peter chayre xiiii yeres odde monethes indubitat pope hym anno dni mccccxiiii anno dni mccccxv iohn mychell thomas fawcomer mercer anno iii thomas aleyn thys yere kynge made suffycient prouision thynges cocernyng warre made vpon frenche kyng wyth hys lordes honourably acco panyed rode thorugh london vpon xviii daye iuny towarde porte southamton appoynted hys hoste mete wyth hym whyle kyng shyppynge hys people dyuers hys lordes say syr richard erle cambrydge brother vnto ye duke yorke whyche syr rychard beryng name langley hadde wedded dame anne doughter syr roger mortymer erle march wolster whome yssue isabell whyche maryed vnto lorde boucher erle essex rycharde whyche duke yorke father kynge edward ye iiii whome also wasassetyng syr rycharde scrop treasourer englande syr thomas graye knyght arrestyd treason areygned examyned vppon xxix day iuly folowynge thre behedyd whyche execucyon done kynge vpon morowe shortely wyth hys lordes toke shyppynge landed place called kydcaus normandy xvi daye auguste sayde syege vnto towne harflew assayled land water contynued hys syege vnto xxii daye september whyche daye sayth french gaguin delyuered albert tha capytayne vppon condycyon kynge henry myghte sauely wynne passe calayes beyng towne yolden vnto hym frenche wryter gaguinus vpholdeth honour frenchemen maye boroweth hys conscyence sparynge trouth reporte many thynges moste wryters ye sayde towne sondry appoyntementes rescouse delyuered vnto kynge wythout condycyon daye aboue sayde kynge ordeyned syr thomas beauforde hys vncle erle dorser capytayne towne spedde hym towarde calays dolphyn lordes fraunce whyche tyme hadde realme fraunce gouernaunce moche frenche kynge vysyted wyth suche malady haue shewed brake brydge let ye kynge passage ouer ye water sum wherfore costrayned draw towarde pycardy passe ye ryuer peron wherfore frechme beynge ware assembled lodged certayne townes named agyncourt rolandcourt blangy wyth power fraunce whan kyng henry sawe besette wyth hys enemy name god saynt george pyght hys felde playne betwene sayd townes agyncourte blagy hauyng hys companye hoole men myght fyght nat passyng nombre viim dayes yomen hadde theyr lymmes lybertye theyr hosyn fastened wyth one poynt theyr iackes loge easy shote myghte drawe bowes great strength shote arowes yerde longe besyde hedde kyng consyderynge great nombre hys enemyes acte frenchme standeth moch ouer rydyng theyr aduersaryes force spereme therfore charged euery boweman ordeyne hym sharpe stake pytche slope hym wha ye sperys came somdeale drawe bak shote horseman proper requeste duke yorke ordeyned hym haue ye vawewarde ye felde wha kyng hery thus prouydently ordered hys batayll ouer night vpon morowe beyng xxv daye octobre ye daye holy martyr cryspyne cryspinian kyng caused dyuers mass songen nyghte englysshe hoste occupyed prayer confessyon thanne caused bysshoppes spyrytuall men gyue vnto theym generall absolucyon done wyth comfortable chere ordered hys people shuld fyght hauyng vnto good comfortable wordes abode ye commynge theyr enemyes whych dyuers wryters remembred xl thousande fyghtynge men whyche aboute ix ye cloke mornynge wyth greate pryde set vppon englysshe hoste thynkynge haue ouer ryden shortely archer lyke taught pyght theyr sharpe stake whan sawe french galantes approche lytell yode backe receyued ensueth batayll agyncourt meane shotte theym feruently yt wyth shotte goryng theyr horse wyth sharpe stake tumbeled one vpon ranne formest confusyon hym folowed yt shorte whyle great multytude horse men layd vpon grounde theyr shotte spent layde aboute theyr glaynes ax greate grace god comfortable ayde kynge vyctory fell daye englysshemen lytell losse theyr copany opynyon sondry wryters slayne yt daye englishemen duke yorke suffolke ouer xxvi parson moo frenchman slayne daye englysshe wryters ouer nomber x thousande albeit ye french gaguinus sayth englyshe hoste slayne duke yorke hym iiii hundreth men french hoste iiiim men name besyde whiche numbreth also affermeth horsmen felde vppon frenche partye x thousande ouer besyde fotemen englyshemen nombred xvc spere men xviiim yomen archer thys sayde batayle taken prysoners duke orleauce duke burbon ye erle uedosme ewe rychemount bursigaunt thanne marshall fraunce wyth many knyghtes esquyres whych tedyous name nober xxiiii hudreth aboue wytnesseth boke mayres thys batayle slayne noble fraunce duke barre alanson braba viii erles baron aboue lxxx wyth gentylmen cote armour nomber iii thousade aboue reason whyche pyllage englysshemen greatly auaunced frenchman assuryd vyctory reason theyr great nober brought plenty rychesse wyth ende bye prysoners eyther also victory opteyned shewe vnto englysshemen theyr pryde pompous araye god whyche knewe presumpcion pompe tourned thynge contrary theyr myndes entente whan kynge grace power god tha force man hadde thus gotten tryumphaut vyctorye retourned hys people frome chase theyr enemyes tydynges brought vnto hym newe hoste frechmen comynge towarde hym wherfore anone commaunded people enbatayled done made proclamacions thorough hoste euery man shulde slee hys prysoner reason whych proclamacyon duke orleaunce lordes fraunce fere anone lycence ye kyng sent worde vnto sayd hoste wythdrewe kynge wyth hys prysoners vpon morow folowyng toke hys waye toward towne caleys rested hi duryng mayres tyme anno dni mccccv anno dni mccccvi wyllyam cambrydge nycholas wotton draper anno iii aleyn euerarde thys yere xxix daye nouember mayre rode towarde westmynster take hys charge pursyuaut ye kynges came wyth letter vnto mayre gyuyng hym knowlege kynges good spede wherfore byshop wynchester chauceller england hauynge lyke wyttynge came daye poulys caused te deum songe wyth great solempnyte lyke wyse lyke obseruaunce done ye parysshe chyrches relygyous house thorough cytye london poulys sayd chau celler standyng vpon steppe quyerdore sayd tydynges denounced vnto people vpon morow folowynge ye sayd chaunceller wych bysshoppes teporall lordes wyth generall procession mayre comynaltye cytye yode poulys westmynster fote offered saynt edwardes shryne retourned theyr owne house thanne kyng hery wyth hys prysoners shypped calays landed douer ben caunterbury made hys offerynge vnto saynt thomas spedde hym hys iournay tyll came vnto eltham rested hym season upon xxiii day nouembre met mayre hys bretherne vpo blak heth conueyed wyth honour thorugh cytye vnto westmynster wherein dyuers place sayd cytye brydge crosse chepe ordeyned certayn pagentes kynges great comforte maner wherof processyons seremonies passe ouer letthyng tyme thys yere also sigismunde emperour almayn came england moneth may kynges comaundement vii daye sayd moneth mayre bretherne mette hym vpo blakheth saynt george met hym kyng hys lordes great bre conueyed hym vnto westmynster great honour lodged hym hys palays shortly feast saynte george holden wyndesore whyche deferred hys comyng tyme whyche solempnyte durynge ye dyuyne seruyce kynge kepte astate syttyng feest emperour kept ye astate seruice sotyltees whiche feeste syttynge ye lordes theyr degree passe ouer shortly came duke holande lande certayne cause concernynge emperour whome kynge honourably receyued lodged hym bisshoppes palays ely holbourne kynge entreated chered straungers season taryed englande laye kynges coste charge ye emperoure made knyghtes garter also greate duke ye emperours named duke bryga whan emperour hadde taryed vpo vii wekes odde dayes englande wryters thentent set vnyte reste bytwene frenche kynge kynge henry toke mynde retourne almayne kynge hys comforte nedes caleys accompanyed hym thyder eyther wyth gyftes thankes departed duke hollande went wyth emperour hollande countrees whyle kynge thus calys hym came thyder vnder saufe conduyt duke burgoyne hadde wyth kynge dyuers communycacyons retourned hys owne soone ye kyng retourned englande came westmynster vpon saynte luke euyn xvii daye october thys yere season whyle kynge calayes yt mene vppon daye assumpcyon blessed lady duke bedforde accompanyed wyth erle marche lordes hadde greate conflycte batayle wyth dyuers carikkes ieane shyppes longe sore fyght ye honour fyll hym hys englysshemen greate losse straungers bothe theyr men also theyr shyppes drowned iii grettest theyr carykkes taken anno dni mccccvi anno dni mccccvii roberte wodtyngton henry barton skynner anno v iohn couentre thys yere kynge holdynge hys parlyamet westmynster hym graunted auctoryt fyftene conuocacyon clergy grau ted hym dyme mayntenaunce hys warrys wheruppon newe prouysyon made hys seconde vyage fraunce authoryte parlyament also rycharde whyche sonne heyre ye erle cambrydge erle put deth southampton created duke yorke whiche maryed vnto cecyle ye doughter daraby erle westmerlande reason brought wardshyp kynge whiche lady cecyle hadde henry dyed yonge edward kynge edmunde erle rutlande anne duchesse exceter elyzabeth duchesse suffolke george duke clarence rycharde duke glouceter kynge margaret duchesse burgoyne wha thynge redy kynges vyage ordeyned iohn duke bedforde hys brother protectour thys land tyme absence done wyth hys lordes aboute wytsontyde toke hys shyppyng southampto sayled normandye landed vpon lama daye place called toke towke wyth hys hoste landed moche warned certayne shyppes warre ye entendyd harme englande beynge vppon see therfore wythstade theyr malycyouse purpose sent erle marche erle huntyngdon wyth scowre see whyche encountred sayde enemyes loge cruell fyght vequysshed ouercame whyche fyght vpon daye saynt romayne ix day auguste hath frenche cronycle french nauy chyefe capytayne vycount narbon whych fyght taken great plety treasour sayth gaguinus one mountney capytayne ye sowdyours wage comytted one assent theyr synguler lucre wythhelde sayde wage reason wherof whan shuld ioyne batayll many wyth theyr shyppes withdrew last theyr capitayns dauger theyr enemyes lyke fayned excuse ye sayd gagwyne saue honoure frechmen many tymes semblably dothe many place hys boke retourne vnto kyng henry whan thus landed sent vnto ye ruler town towke vnto hym delyuered castell defended agayn hym tyll saynt laurence daye folowyng whyche gaue vnto hys brother duke clarece wyth sygnory therunto belongynge thys done kynge spedde hym toward cane layde syege therunto vpon ye xvii day foresayd moneth august whych contynued tyll feest natyuyte lady vpon ye ty yt duke clarece assawted castel helde apoyntemet yf rescouse tyll xiiii day folowyng whych day ye sayd castel delyuered xiiii stroge holdes take ye apoyntmet kynge made foresayd duke clarence capytayne sayd town castell passetyme dyuers townes stroge holdes goten dyuers ye kynges retynew ye erle marshall erle warwyke ye wan louers faloys newelyn cherburgth argetyne bayons citye many stroge abbays pilys tha king helde saynt george feest dubbyd xv knyght ye bath cotynued warres duryng mayres yere wynnyng vpon frechmen apoyntement otherwyse wherof cyrcumstauce longe declare order yere also vpo festfull day ester tyll chaunce lodo ye fere good cryste men necessary noteda fraye eester day vpo hygh solepne day excytyng ye deuyll yll disposycio ii woman mene wyfe lorde strauge ye wyfe syr iohn trussell knyght vnkyndnes fyll bytwene theyr two husbades yt eyther wold haue slayne within ye parysh chyrch saynt dustanes eest tyng person dyuers men hurt sore wouded one named thom petwarde slayne hand freeman fysshemoger cyty lastly frayers take brought vnto coutour ye pultry sayd lorde strauge demed culpable ye beginyng fray therfore vpo soday folowyng suspendyng chyrche denouced acursyd poulys crosse parysshe chyrches londo fynally demed open penaunce dyd made greate amendes vnto wyfe sayde thomas deth husbad ende thys yere lodo sold ii busshell anno domini mccccxvii anno domini mccccxviii henry rede rycharde merlowe iremonger anno vi iohn gedney syr iohn oldcastell lorde cobham put dethein thys yere syr iohn oldcastell lorde cobhm whyche shewed ende fyrste yere thys kynge escaped towre london moneth sent vnto london lorde powys walys whyche syr iohn heresye treason conuycte moneth folowynge drawen vnto saynt gyles feld hanged vppon newe peyre galowes wyth chaynes consumed wyth fyre season person wortham norfolke whyche longe tyme haunted newmarket heth robbed spoyled many kynges subgettes nowe concubyne broughte vnto newgate lastly dyed kynge henry beynge styll normandy deuyded hys people thre partes wherof one reserued vnto hym selfe seconde commytted rule duke clarence thyrde vnto erle warwyke whyche sayde duke erle employed theyr armes well valyauntly eyther theym encroched sore vppon frenchman wanne many stronge holdes pyle kynge longe syeges hym contynued aboute argentyne cressy saynte launde ye ende thys yere saye vppon ye daye translacyon saynt edwarde xiii daye october layde hys syege vnto cytye roan contynued tyll xii daye ianuary folowynge whych passetyme olde mayre chaunged new foloweth upon ix day october dyed iohn bryan sheryfe hym chosen offyce iohn parnes draper anno dni mccccxviii anno dni mccccxix iohn bryan wyllyam seuenoke grocer rauffe barton anno vii iohn parnesse thys yere foresayde syege aboute cytye roan co tynuynge vpon xii daye ianuary foresayde frenchman offeryd treate whych treaty ye kyng admytted vnto erlys warwike salysbury wyth frenche party appoynted captayne cytye named syr guy de bocyer reason whyche treaty agreed ye sayd capitayne vpon xix day sayd present moneth ianuary houre shuld please ye kynge assygne shulde delyuer vnto suche person kynge wolde appoynte cytye castell roan peasyble wyse excepte sayd cytye castell rescowyd dolphyne fraunce sayd xix daye xxii daye sayd moneth inhabytauntes sayde cytye paye vnto kynge xvc scute golde wherof two shulde alwaye worth englysshe noble xv hudred lyke scute shulde paye vpon xxiii daye february next folowynge whiche couenauntes many diuers coprysed xxv artycles assuraunce partyes surely ratifyed assured rescouse sayde dolphyn frenchman made daye aboue lymytted therfore ye said capytayne accordynge hys bonde promysse delyuered sayd cytye castell vppon xix day ianuary afore sayde beyng daye saynt wolstan wynnynge thys cytye roan ascrybeth gaguinus vnto ye ciuyle dyscord bytwene cytesyns theyr fyrste capytayne named erle danmale expulsyd ye cyty strong power norman yet affermeth cytesyns helde cyty tyll costrayned lacke vytayll eate horse dogges cattes rattes vermyn whan kynge henry set ye cyty roan order passed ye countrees towarde fraunce subdued cityes townes rode xx daye maye came troy chapayne honourably receyued whyche passetyme iohn duke burgoyne tyme ben occasyon murder duke orleaunce slayne presence dolphyn lyke haue shewed ye xxxix yere charles vii wherfore phylyppe hys sonne duke hym refused dolphyns partye drewe hym vnto kynge henry delyuered hym possessyon charlys frenche kynge dame katheryne hys doughter affermyth gaguinus meanes concorde vnyte soughte laboured frenchemen effectuall maner shortely fynall pea hadde bytwene realmes kynge henry troy cha payne forsayde meanes sayde phylyppe duke burgoyn maryed forenamed katheryne vppon trynite sondaye beyng iii daye iuny solempnysacyon maryage treaty conclusyon pea conteynyng xxxvii artycles bytwene bothe kynges concluded wherof ye effecte kyng henry shulde admytted named regent fraunce yt charles shulde kynge terme hys lyfe receyue issue profytes quene isabell hys wyfe enioye dower terme lyfe quenes frauce due accustomed quene katheryne kynge henryes wyfe haue dower englande value xl thousande scute whyche shulde value tenne thousande marke englysshe yf ouerlyued kynge henry haue dower realme fraunce ye value xx thousande frankes yerely beleuyed suche lordshyppes blaunche somtyme wyfe phylyple beaw helde dethe tyme forsayde charlys crowne wyth ryghtes belongynge realme fraunce remayne vnto kynge henry hys heyres kynges b sayde charlys vysyted wyth sykenesse kynge regent shulde haue hole gouernaunce sayde realme defence specyally agayne dolphyne whyche entended dyd hys vttermost power distourbe sayde pea lordes noble fraunce well spyrytuall temporall shall make othe vnto kynge henry obedyent vnto lefull commaundmentes concernynge foresayd gouernaunce defence ye hedes ruler cytyes castelles townes mayntayne vphold sayde pea vttermost theyr power dethe ye sayd charles become trewe subiectes lyege men al suche lordshyppes daye shulde conquered wonne fro dolphyn dysobedyentes shulde remayne vse sayd charles durynge naturall lyfe prouyded yf wonne within ye duchy normandy shulde incontynently remayne kynge henryes vse dyscease sayde charles duchy norma dy lordshyppes therunto belongynge one monarchye vnder crowne frauce also durynge lyfe sayde charles kynge henry shulde nat name wryte hym selfe kynge fraunce sayd charles shulde wrytynges name kynge henry moost derest sonne henry kynge englande enherytour crowne frauce none imposycyon taske shuld put vpon comons fraunce necessary defeuce weale realme aduyce bothe cousayles realmes englande fraunce suche stablysshed ordynauces myght deuysed sayde realme fraunce shulde fall possessyon kynge henry heyres myght suche vnyte ioyne vnto realme englade ye one kynge myght rule kyngdomes one monarchye reserued alwayes eyther pryncypate realme ryghtes lybertyes frachyses lawes nother realme shulde subiecre vnto perpetuall amyte frendshyp famylyer conuersacion aswell byenge sellynge lefull co tonued atwene bothe subiectes euer customes pryuyleges eyther realme payde obeyed kynge charles phylyp duke burgoyne shulde make concorde pea dolphyn uyen without assent agrement kynge henry lykewyse without consent sayde charles phylyp sayd charles duryng lyfe shulde honorably founde entreated haue housholde aboute hym noble men owne nacyon thynges concernynge estate lodged notable place realme wher people hym shulde moste obedyent whiche artycles consentes bothe prynces well nobly ratysfyed confermed solempnyzacion foresayd maryage ended kyng henry people sped hym towarde parys honorably receyued whan newe wyfe rested hym season duke burgoyne dyuers lordes fraunce layde seyge vnto dyuers townes whiche helde vpon dolphyns partye wanne strengthe appoyntment lastly layde syege ordenaunce aboute stronge towne named meldune meleon wherof capytayne noble warryour named barbasan whiche defended towne manfully kynge seynge foresayde sternesse ye capitayne beclipped towne stronge syege lyenge hymselfe syde towarde wood duke burgoyne vpon syde agayne temple monastery saynt peter whiche syege con ued durynge mayres yere anno dni mccccxix anno dni miiiicxx robert whytyngham richarde whytyngham mercer anno viii iohan butler yere continued styll former syege aboute meleon tyll aboute mydle nouembre whiche tyme fore named capytayne sore famysshed sought anes treaty meane wherof agreed shulde sauely auoyde daye lymyted excepte suche persones tyme ben consentynge vnto dethe iohn lateli duke burgoyne whiche cryme forenamed capytayne named barbasan accused many sent vnto parys holden pryson done kynge henry layde syege vnto towne called melden whiche fynally also gyuen vp lyke apoyntment wherin founden certayne persones detected ye foresayde murther whiche due examynacyon made hanged vpon elmen tree standynge ye way ledynge vnto parys whan kynge henry thus wrouthte moche wyll fraunce toke leue father frenche kynge quene wyfe sayled englande landed douer vpon candelmas day leuynge fraunce deputye brother duke clarence kynge sped hym iournay towarde london came thyder xiiii daye february quene came thyder vpon xxi day ye moneth lengthe tyme wyl passe ouer great curyous ordynaunce prouyded cytezyns receyuynge kynge quene aswell theyr ordinate metynge wyth theym vpon horsebacke sumptuous honourable dyuyses prepayred wythin cytye kynges quenes greate ioysynge forthe wyll procede shewe vnto parte greate honour vsed exercysed vppon daye sayde quenes coronacyon whyche solempnysed saynte peter churche westmynster vppon daye saynte mathy apostle foure twenty day february whyche solempnysacyo chyrche endyd conueyed greate halle westmynster set dyner upon whose ryghte hand satte ende table archebysshop cau torbury henry surnamed ryche cardynall wynchester vppon lefte hande quene satte kynge scottes hys astate whyche seruyd wyth coueryd messe lyke vnto forenamed bysshoppes vppon hande syde nere bordes ende satte duchesse yorke countesse huntyngdon erle ye marche holdynge ceptre hys hande knelyd vppon ryght syde erle marshall lyke maner knyled vppon left hande quene cou tesse kente satte vnder table ryght foote countesse marshall left foote duke glouceter syr humfrey daye ouerloker stode quene bare heded syr rychard neuyll day caruer ye quene ye erles brother suffolk cupberer syr iohn steward sewar lord clyfford panterer stede erle warwyk lord wyllughby boteler stede erle arudell lord gray ruthyn ryffyn naperer lord awdeley amner stede erle cambrydge erle worceter daye erle marshall absence erle marshall whyche rode hall vpon great courser wyth multytude typped staues hym kepe roume hall hall baron v porte bega table vpon ryght hande towarde saynt stephes chapell beneth table sat bowchyers chauncery vpon lefte hande next vnto cupborde sat mayre hys bretherne alderme lodo bysshops began table foreagayne baron v porte lady table agayn mayre whyche ii table bysshoppes began ye bysshop london bysshop durham ladyes countesse stafforde coutesse marche ye shall vnderstande thys feast fysshe orderyng seruice therof diuers lordes appoynted hede offycers stewarde controller surueyour honourable offyces whyche appoynted erles northumberlande westmerland lorde fitz hughe lorde furneuall lorde gray wylton lorde ferers groby lord ponynges lorde haryngton ye lord darcy lorde dacre lord delaware whyche wyth orderyd seruyce feest foloweth thus fyrst course brawne mustarde dedellys burneux frument wyth balien pyke erbage lamprey powderyd trought codlyng playes fryed marlyng fryed crabbys leche lumbarde florysshed tartys sotyltye called pellycane syttyng hys nest byrdes image saynte katheryne holdyng boke dysputyng doctours holdynge reason ryghte hande saynge madame le royne ye pellycan answere ce estia signe et du roy pur tenir ioy et tout sa gent esse mete sa entent seconde course gely coloured wyth columbyne floures whyte potage creme almandes breme see counger solys cheuen barbyll wyth roche fresshe samon halybut gurnarde rochet broyled smelth fryed creuys lobster leche damask witw kynges worde prouerbe flourysshed vne sanz plus lamprey fresshe baken flampeyne flourisshed wyth scochon royall therin iii crownes golde plantyd floure delyce floures camemyll wroughte confeccions sotyltye named panter wyth image saynte katheryne wyth whele hande rolle wyth reason hande sayeng la royne fise ceste ile per bon reson aues renount thyrde course date compost creme motle carpe deore turbut tenche perche wyth goion fysshe sturgeon wyth welkes porperies rosted mennes fryed creuys de eawe douce pranys elys rosted wyth lamprey leche called whyte leche flourysshed wyth hawthorne leuys redde hawys march payne garnysshed wyth dyuers fygurs angellys amonge whych set image saynt katheryne holdynge thys reason lest escrit pur voir et eit per mariage pure cest guerre ne dure lastely sotyltye named tigre lokynge myrrour man syttynge horse backe clene armed holdyng hys armes tyger whelpe wyth thys reason par force sanz reson ie ay pryse ceste beste wyth hys one hande makynge coutenaunce throwynge myrrours great tygre whych held thys reason gile mirrour fete distour thus wyth honour fynysshed thys solempne coronacyo whyche quene soiourned palays westmynster tyll palme sondaye folowynge vppon morne toke iournaye towarde wyndesore kyng helde theyr eester hygh feest passed ye kynge made prouysyon hys warre frauce durynge terme thys mayres yere anno dni mccccxx anno dni mccccxxi iohn boteler wyllyam cambryge grocer anno ix wyllyam weston yere vppon eester euyn beynge xxii daye apryll duke clarence brother vnto king departyng frauce hadde laft deputye place called french baugy bauge ouerset slayne frech capytayne named syr iohn de la croyse erlys huntyngdon somerset many mo gentlyme england gascoyne take prysoners ye kynges great displeasure shortly ye king held pliamet westmynster autoryte wherof couocacio ye clergy holden poulys grauted hym fyftene dyme ye money therof shuld hastely called ye comos byshop wynchester fre mynde lent kyng xxmli pentecoste folowynge kyng henry shypped douer say led calays then yode thyrde tyme fraunce warred duryng thys mayres yere anno domini mccccxxi anno domini mccccxxii rycharde gosselyn robert chycheley grocer anno x wyllyam weston begynnyng thys mayres yere vi daye dece bre kyng henry vi borne wyndesore ye ix day ye sayd moneth began parlyament poulys byrthe fy te whych graunted kyng fyftene deme clergy coyne golde dayes greatly mynysshed wyth clyppyng wasshyng great hurte commynaltye therefore thys parlyament enacted agreed paymente thys ayde kyng graunted hys offycers shulde receyue lyght coynes golde wanted nat weyghte ouer rate xiid noble yf noble wated xid pese golde rate tha owner make vp value visviiid reaso thys also syluer grotes pen geson men put forth golde made store syluer yere also easter quene toke shyppyng southampton sayled kynge frauce honourably receyued father mother cytyes good townes cytye parys vpon whytsonday kyng sat crowne dyner whych nat tyme ben sene kyng englande thys mayres yere also x yere kyng x daye august new wedyrcok sette vpo crosse saynte paulys steple london tha kyng hery beyng styll occupyed hys warres fraunce dayly wynnyg vpon frenchme thys sayd moneth auguste x yere hys reygne waxed syke boy uincente dyed lyke good crysten man vpo last daye august whan reyned ix yeres v monethes x dayes leuyng hym hys onely yonge son henry age viii monethes odde dayes hys body enbawmed ceryd broughte vnto westmynster begynnynge nexte mayres yere shalbe shewed moneth octobre folowyng dyed french kyng father vnto quene story declared wolde take vppon hym reherce conquestes triu phaunt victoryes opteyned thys moste vyctorious prynce wyth laudable dedes shulde reherce ceryously make great volume fore haue shewed breuely part famous dedes thys excellente prynce touchynge actuel dedys body nowe wyl breuely touche actes done hym meryte hys soule fyrste asmoche knewe well hys father hadde laboured meanes depose ye noble prynce rycharde second cosetyng deth ye offence hys sayde father sente rome great crime assoyled pope enioyned ye lyke beraft hym hys natural bodely lyfe euer world contynuall prayer suffragyes ye churche shuld cause hys soule lyue perpetually celestyall worlde whyche penauce hys father lyfe dyd nat perfourme thys goostly knyght habudaut maner fourmed fy st buylded iii house relygyon charterhous mo kes called shene house close nonnes called syon thyrde house obseruauntes buylded vpon syde thamys ter let fall hym skyll foloweth testyfyeth boke regyster mayres reported noble prynce thus founded sayd iii house endowed theym wyth copetent landes goostly dysposicion wyth secrete copany vpsyt se kepte theyr dyuyne seruyce wolde dyuers tymes go fro hys manour shene nowe called rychemounte vnto sayde thre place ye cause abouesayde whyche tymes season euer founde twoo house monkes nonnes occupyed theyr statute requyred thyrde hous whyche frenche fryer fande sondry tymes neglygente slacke doyng theyr duety wherefore called hym ye father wyth place reasoned wyth sharply none otherwyse entended theyr diuyne seruyce praied specyally hym bounde duety whereunto pardon requyred lastely sayde father answered conuenyent wyse naturally might nat praye hym hys good spede consyderynge dayely warred vpon theyr father kynnesmen slewe theym spoyled dayly enpouerysshed lade whyche kynde ought loue praye whyche answere thus made kynge auoyded hous turned lande thereof suche vse hym best lyked suffred hous fall ruyne ouer thys great acte foudyng ii religious house ordeyned westmynster brenne perpetually wythoute extinccion iiii taper waxe vppon sepulture kyng rychard ouer ordeyned therto continued euer one day ye weke solempne dirige songe vppon morowe masse masse ended certayn money gyue expressed thynges ye begynnyng kynges reygne ouer thys great besynesse warre natwithstadyng criste price lyfe chase place sepulture within foresayd monastery ordeyned hym songe iii mass euery day weke whyle world lasteth maner forme verse folowyng doth appere henrici missae quinti sunt hic tabulatae quae successiue sunt per monachos celebratae pprima fit assumptae de festo virginis almae poscit pusiremam christus de morte resur gen dominica pprima salutate de festo virginis extat nunciat angelicis laudem postrema choreis unc pesse deum natum de virgine prima fatetur commemora natam sic vltima missa mariam marti pprima celebretur ad honorem neupmatis almi vltima conceptam denunciat esse mariam mercurij psemper prima coli debet de corpore christi vltima fit fata de virgine purificata iouis pconcedet vt prima celebretur de cruce sanctum que salutate fiet postrema mariae veneris pomnes ad sanctos est prima colenda supernos vltima de requie pro defunctis petit esse sabati psemper erit medium de proprietate dei omni die pmissa assumptionis tiae missa dnieae resurrectionis pmissa salutationis mariae missa annuciatiois mariae pmissa natiu tati christi missa natiuitatis mariae pmissa sancti spiritus missa conceptionis pmissa corporis christi missa purificationis pmissa sanctae crucis missa salutationis mariae pmissa omnium sanctorum missa de requie pmissa diei quotidie pwhyche verse may thus vnletteryd englysshed loo noted put memory ouer actes noble marcyall thys excellent prynce thys fyfte kyng henry hys soule endowe memoryall wyth suffrage whyche euer laste shall mass thre folowe ceryously westmynster ordeyned sayde dayly sondayupon sondaye fyrste masse begynne deuoutly sayd assumpcion blessed lady nat thereafter blynne latter resurreccion mondayand mondaye uisitacion fyrste masse ordeyned annunciacion latter masse sayd tuysdayupon tuysday kepe ordre iust fyrste sayd crystes natiuite lady byrth latter folow muste wednysdayeon wednysdaye holy ghost halowed concepcion thyrd wylled thursdayethe thursday synge fyrste corpus xpi purificacion laste lady frydayeupon frydaye masse crystes crosse salutacion latter synge daye tyme shuld losse saterdayeupon saterdaye fyrste mornynge masse sayntes pray kynge masse requiem laste quotidieand euery day day masse amyd mass fall plenuoy p mercifull god prynce whiche short lyfe marciall actes spent honour conquesi wonder howe myght compasse suche dedys excellent yet mynde nothynge detent al ghostly helthe soule prouide cut world fatally shulde slyde though tullyes eloquence ek great moralyte salomon perfyght sapience swete dyties dame caliope yet might nat prose dytte accordyngly auaunce prince fame due honour enhaunce consideringe actes wherof percell appere rude w rke many mo left tyme also whiche lesse ten yere shortly brought thynge diuine grace forthryd without doute myghtfull lorde hal e ghostly knyght grace honour passe worldes sight haue rewarde dowble condigne first marciall actes hym doone auaunced amonge worthy ny e vertues vsed hym efte soone many good dedes erth done aboue hierarch trust stalled erth kyng kynges called anglia p henry syxte henry vi ye name onely sonne henry v quene kathryn doughter charles ye seuenth kyng fraunce began hys reygne ouer realme englande fyrst day september yere lorde miiiic xxii ende laste yere reygne foresayde vii charles kyng fraunce thys henry insufficience hys age whyche y shewed viii monethes odde day commytted vnto rule hys vncles duke bedforde glouceter whyche durynge hys none age ruled realmes englande fraunce honourably duke glouceter protectour englande duke bedforde regent fraunce vpon xxi day october duryng thys mayres yere robert chyceley dyed parys aboue named vii charles kynge fraunce reason whose deth force appoyntemet made betwene ry v hym towched seuenth yere sayde henry realme fraunce right thereof fylle vnto yonge kynge henry whose vse noble fraunce excepte fewe suche helde wyth dolphyne delyuered possession therof vnto duke bedforde regent therof durynge nonage thys kynge anno dni mccccxxii anno dni mccccxxiii wyllyam estfeylde wyllyam walderne anno primo robert tatersale begynnyng thys mayres yere fyrste yere kyng say vii daye ye moneth nouembre corp ye excellent prynce kyng henry fyft wyth great solempnyte honour brought vnto monastery westmynster fete saynt edward wyth due reuerece enterred whose soule iesus mercyfull vpon ix day ye sayd moneth parlyament called westmynster reason whereof kynges gouernaunce durynge hys nonage prouyded wyth rule bothe realmes englad fraunce auctoryte duke glouceter syr humfrey ordeyned protectoure england duke iohn bedforde regent fraunce durynge parlyament grauted vnto ye kyng subsydie iii yeres v noble euery sacke wolle shulde passe lande fyrste daye marche hys preestehode deregraded heretyke named wyllyam tayllour bret asshes smythfeld whose opynyons herynge shulde tedious vnfrutefull therfore wyll nat wyth theym blot boke thys moneth marche also town pout melane deliuered apoyntmente vnto regent fraunce whych apoyntemet one artycle horse abylmetes warre harneys shulde lefte within sayd place also golde syluer iewelles remayne hooly yf persone within ye holde founde whiche tyme ben gylty consentynge dethe duke burgoyne shulde delyuered regent take benefyte pryuylege appoyntment yere west gate cytye called newgate newly buylded repayred executours rycharde whytyngton late mayre londo yere mydsomer fyll great water rayne party euery daye atwene begynnynge iuly ende septembre rayned lytell moche yet withstandynge yere couenyent plentye al grayne whete passed eyght shyllynges lodon malte fyue shyllynges anno dni mccccxxiii anno dni mccccxxiiii nycholas iames wyllyam crowmer draper anno ii thomas wadeforde yere meane begynnge mayres yere xiii day nouembre kynge quene mother remoued wyndesore towarde lo came nyght vnto stanys mo owe beynge sonday whan borne towarde mother chare shyrled cryed feruently noryce brestes nothynge elles quene coude deuyse myght contente hym wherfore quene beyng fered ben dyseased retourned agayne chambre anone good rest quyet wryters noted dyuyne monycyon yt wolde trauayle vpon sonday quene taryed hym ther nyght mo owe borne ye chare glad semblant mery chere came kyngeston nyght vpon ye morow vnto manour kyngeston upon wednysday quene syttynge chare vpon lappe passed great tryumphe thorughe cytye vnto westmynster holden parlyament set kyngly mageste within parlyamet chambre amonge lordes speker parlyament made famous preposicion wherof effecte grace yt god endewed realme presence toward prynce soueraygne gouernour many wordes commendacyon passe ouer xxvi day moneth nouebre kynge ye quene remoued westmynster vnto waltham holy crosse season soiourned moued vnto hertford held crystmasse ye kyng scottes hym ye foresayd parlyamet iourned vnto ye xx daye crystmas ye whiche parlyament amonge actes ordeyned yt prysoner yt graud pety treason comytted warde wylfully brake shulde demed pety treason goodes hym escapynge shulde forfeyted lorde soyle founde moneth februari syr iames steward kynge scottes maried face churche saynt mary ouereys southwerke dame iohane ye duchesse doughter clarence whiche doughter vnto erle somerset fyrste husbande vnto sayde duchesse feest holden bysshop wynchesters place soone vpon xiii day february foresayde parlyament beynge agayne holden westmynster brekynge foresayde acte brekynge pryson syr iohan mortymer accused yoman named wyllyam kynge seruaunt vnto syr robert scot knyght keper ye towre london dyuers poyntes treason folowen fyrst couseyled sayd wyllyam kynge ende breke pryson promysed hym yerely value xlli lande processe erledome also sayd mortymer shulde saye wolde go wale vnto erle march wolde rayse xlm power wolde entre lande stryke heddes lorde protectour bysshop wynchester entent myght tell play money ferthermore accused hym sayde mortymer shulde say erle marche shulde kynge ryght enherytaunce hymself nexte ryghtfull heyre sayd crowne sayd erle marche wherfore yf sayde erle wold take vpon hym ye crowne rule ye lande sayde elles wolde ouer sayd wyllyam alledged sayde syr iohan mortymer shulde say yf fayled purpose myght wyne vnto erle march wolde sayle vnto ye dolphyn ayde take partye wyst well shuld accepted haue good ayde hym brynge aboute purpose whiche mater duely approued sayde wyllyam agayne sayde syr iohan lordes comons sayde parlyament yt whiche treason drawen hanged yere also duke bedforde beynge fraunce regene warred strongly vpon ye dolphyn wanne hym many stronge holdes townes crotey basyde ryol rulay gyroude basyle mermoude mylham femel seintace iensak mauron dura mountsuer la venak palageeu cerneys noelam cusak doual dyuers contynued tyll came vnto uerneyll perche whiche helde streyght lastly gyrande captayne therof agreed delyuer certayne day excepte rescowed whiche appoyntment taken sayde gyrande wytnesseth gaguinus sent worde charles viii ye name ye vii dyuers wryters fautoures accopted kyng frauce possyble hast sent thyder ye duke alanson ye erle turon douglas bowgham boucam daumayll ye vicout nerbon strog power armenakkes scottes frecheme ye host myght approch ye sayd towne make rescouse ye day expired vnto ye duke deliuered wha ye duke alaso asserteyned ye deliuere ye towne toke aduise ye capitaynes whether better retourn consyderyng towne yolden gyue batayll vnto englishe men fynally reproche shuld arected fled fere kept theyr iournany pyght theyr felde playne nere vnto sayd town uernoyl beynge strongely enbataylled vpon vii day moneth august duke bedford wyth hys retynue gaue sharpe cruell batayll whyche endured longe wythoute knowlege vyctory fynally goddes ordenauce power vyctyry fyl englysshe partye greate losse theyr enemyes fyghte slayne testyfyeth french gaguyne erles turon boucam daumayle wyth uycounte narbon dyuers men name common slayne nombree fyue thousande taken duke alanson marshall fraunce ye englysshe wryters affermeth xm slayne mo anno dni mccccxxiiii anno dni mccccxxv symonde seman iohn mychell anno ix iohn bywater thys yere easter ye kynge helde hys parlyamente westmynster whych began vpo daye etkenwalde laste daye apryll ii dayes kynge wyth quene moder came thorugh cytye wyndesore whan came west dore poulys lorde protectour toke chare ladde vpon hys fete betwene ye sayde lorde protectour duke exceter vnto steppe goyng ye quyer fro whes borne vnto hygh aulter kneled trauers purueyed hym whan yode rode ye north dore made hys offerynges thenne borne churche yerde set vpon fayre courser conueyed thorugh chepe stretes cytye vnto saynt george barre helde hys iournay hys manour kenyngton contynuyng foresayd parlyamet kyng sondry tymes coueyed westmynster wythin parlyament chaber kept royall astate auctoryte whereof hym graunted subsidye xiid li maner marchaundyse co myng passing realm iii tunne wyne ye terme iii yeres holden ferthermore enacted marchaunt straungers shuld set englysshe hoste wythin xv dayes theyr commyng theyr porte sale make sale marchaundyse lodged theym wythin xl dayes folowynge make sale brought yf remayned vnsolde sayde xl dayes ende marchaundyse beyng vnsolde forfayted vnto kyng also straungers caryed wolles thys lande shuld pay xliii siiiid sakke custome ye englysshe marchaunte denyzen payde v noble wyth many condycyons penaltyes well englysh marchauntes whyche wolde longe leysour shewe enacted passed durynge thys sayde parlyamente seconde daye moneth auguste yolden vnto erle salysbury appoynted wyth regent cytie man vnder appoyntemente comprysed ix article wherof one specyall yf persones founde wythin cytye whyche ben consentyng vnto duke deth iohan late duke burgoyne shulde stande grace sayde regent also thys yere duke glouceter lord protectour whiche lately hadde maryed duchesse holande woman greate possesio cause rule wherof haue domynyo wyth sayd duchesse sayled towarde coutre thereof subgectes peasybly wyth honour receyued fynally suche chere yt gladde retourne englande leuynge hys wyfe therein towne owne named mounse hys departynge duke burgoyne demeaned hym ruler towne batayll otherwyse deliuered sayde duke forthwyth sente vnto gaunte kepte prysoner frenshyppe one named syr iaques de la grayll burgonyon knyghte owne polecy escaped then mannes clothynge came towne zelande named zyryxe frome then towne zelande called ghwode ghowghowde wythstode duke power duke glouceter heryng escape wyfe malyce duke foresayde haste prouyded stronge company soudyours archer co mytted vnto rule ye lord fitzwater whych processe tyme landed wyth place zelande called brewer haue theyr enemyes encountred dryue backe retourned englande wythoute greate fete doynge leuynge duchesse behynde season thys yere myghelmasse ye prynce portyngale came englande honourable receyued fested kynges vncles taryed tyme thys mayres yere yere also began grudge kyndle betwene lorde protectour hys halfe brother bysshoppe wynchester whyche grewe greate dystourbaunce cytie london next mayres yere shalbe shewed ende thys yere many honeste men cytye apeched treason false malycyous persone belongynge vnto sayde bysshoppe putte theym vnto greate vexacyon trouble whych done procurement sayde bysshoppe comon fame wente nat alonely men cytie thus vexed also burgeyses dyuers good townes leyceter cauterbury northampton anno dni mccccxxv anno dni mccccxxvi wyllyam mylrede iohn couentre mercer anno iiii iohn brokle thys yere xxix daye octobre selfe daye mayre yere folowyng yerely westmynster taketh hys charge suche tyme holdynge hys great dyner ye lorde protectour sent spedy maner whan comyn hys presence gaue hym streyghte commaundemente shulde se cytye suerly watched nyght folowyng vpon morowe folowynge ix clok certayne seruau te forenamed bysshope wolde haue entred brydge gate ruler therof wolde nat suffre great nombre kepte theym force lyke commaunded wherwyth beyng greuously dyscontented gaderyd nombre archer men army assauted gate wyth shot meanes warre moche commos cytye herynge thereof shytte theyr shoppes sped thyder great nombre lykely haue ensued great effusyo blode shortly therupon ne ben dyscrescion ye mayre hys brethern exorted ye people polytyke meane kepe kynges pea passe tyme archebysshop cau torbury wyth prynce portyngale toke greate laboure vpon pacyfye thys varyauce betwene lord protectour bysshope moche rode betwene theym viii tymes might brynge resonable conformyte lastly agreed stade rule reget suche wolde assygne wherupo ye cytye set quiete tha bisshop wynchester wrote letter vnto ye duke bedforde lord reget wherof ye tenure ensueth right hyghe myghty price ryght noble one leuest erthly lord recommaunde vnto grace wyth myne hert ye desyre welfare kyng soueraygne lorde hys realmes englande fraunce owne weale wyth haste hyder trouthe ye tary longe shall put thys lade ieopardy wyth felde brother ye haue god make hym good man wysdome knoweth well profyte frauce standeth welfare england ryght hygh myghty prynce beseche holde mayster iohan estcourt coucellour excused hys taryeng moche agayne hys wyll counsayll hath made hym cotrary hys mynde may lyke gyue credece vnto chamberlayne syr robert boteler blessed trinite kepe wryten great haste lodon laste day octobre upo x day ianuary nexte ensuynge ye sayde duke bedforde wyth hys wyfe came vnto london came also sayd bysshop wynchester mayre cytezyns receyued hym merton coueyed hym thorugh ye cytye vnto westmynster lodged ye kyng palays bysshop wynchester lodged wythin ye abbottes lodgynge vpo morow folowynge ye xi day ianuary mayre presented reget wyth payere basyns syluer ouer gylte marke golde bisshop incenced hym agayn cytye receyued small thake theyr labour coste upon ye xxi day february tha began great cousayl sait albonys adiourned vnto northampton due conclusyons myghte nat dryuen sayde counsayll therfore vppon xxv daye marche ensuynge called parlyament leyceter whyche endured tyll xv daye iuny folowynge thys cleped comon people parlyament battes cause proclamacyons made men shuld leue theyr swerdes wepyns theyr innys people toke great battes stauys theyr neckes folowed theyr lordes maysters vnto parlyament whan ye wepyn inhybyted thanne toke stone plumettes lede trussed secretly theyr sleuys bosomys durynge parliament amoge notable thynges weale realme varyaunce betwene forsayd lordes herin debated argued moche duke glouceter put byll coplaynt agayn bysshop conteynyng vi artycles wherof fyrst lorde protectour wolde haue lodgynge wythin towre london comforte ayde defended let bysshop richard wydeuile esquyer tha lyeutenaunt secod bysshop wolde haue remoued ye kyng elthm haue sette hym hys gouernauce without aduyce counsayle lorde protectour thyrde whan duke enformed bysshoppes entent entendynge accordynge offyce duetie peasyble wyse haue ryde ye kyng haue gyue vpo attendaunce ye bysshop entedynge ye distruccio ye duke assebled great multytude men armes archer southwarke ther drewe cheyne brydge fote set vp pypes engynes stoppe kynges hye way ordeyned stande chambres solers throwe stone theyr ordenau ce pollycy haue destroyed ye duke company iiii artycle kynge henry fyft shulde lyfe tyme shewe vnto ye sayde duke openynge spaynell man taken behynd tapet one kynges chabres whiche man examyned erle arundel confessed sent thyther ye sayde bysshop ende murther kynge henry forth whiche cofessyon sayd erle let sakke man cast hym thamys fyft sayd henry fyft beynge prynce heyre parant crowne sayd bysshop shuld come vnto hym say somoche father vexed greuous sekenes apte come conuersacion people myght conueniently gyde realme therfore shulde take vp hym rule gouernaunce put father kyngly power vi last artycle sediciously sayd bysshop hadde letter sent lately vnto duke bedforde wrongfully accused hym shulde areyse kynges people iuparde lande felde contrary kynges pea comon wele lande article ye bysshop wele suffycyently answered replyed yt layde hym blame fynally prouydent counsayle lorde regent al sayd artycles matiers varyaunce atwene sayd two lordes hangynge put examynacyon iudgmente assystence ye lordes parliamet henry archebysshop caunterbury thomas duke exceter iohn duke northfolk thomas bysshop durhm phylype bysshop worceter iohn bysshop bathe humfrey tha erle stafforde rauffe lorde cornewell mayster wyllyam alnewyke keper preuy seale whych lordes wyth assystence lordes parlyament made decre warde eyther party toke hande wyth fredly louyng wordes none hauyng ame de except bysshope wordes submyssyo vnto duke requyryng hym hys fauoure good lordshyp ye accorde thus fynysshed parlyament adiourned tyll easter uppon whytsondaye folowynge solempne feest holden leyceter forsayde regente dubbyd kynge henry knyghte forthwyth kynge dubbyd rycharde duke yorke father kynge edwarde also dubbyd knyghtes sonne heyre duke iohan duke northfolke erles oxenforde westmerlande wyth lordes gentylmen noumbre xxxiiii feeste wyth honour endyd kynge wyth regente hys lordes drew towarde london regente contynued wyth kynge englande full terme thys mayres yere anno dni miiiicvi anno dni miiiicvii iohn arnolde iohn raywell fysshmonger anno v iohn hyghthm thys v yere moneth february regent hys wyfe housholde meyny passed see vnto calays thorugh pycardy fraunce departed then meane vpon daye annuncyacion lady bysshop wynchester within churche lady calays created cardynall auctoryte ye bulles pope martyne v ye name solepnyte regente toke hym hys ryghte hande conueyed hym vnto hys lodgynge thys yere vnresonable wederyng reyned moste part contynually frome easter myghelmasse thorugh hay corne greatly hyndered thys yere duke ale son taken prysoner batayll uernell perche delyuered raunson iic scute golde testyfyeth gaguinus whyche fyfty marke sterlyng money thys yere also erle salysbury whych dyuers wryters named good erle accompanyed wyth erle suffolke lorde talbot layde stronge syege vnto cytye orleaunce helde cytezyns streyght maugre duke orleaunce marshal fraunce thanne named boussaak englysshemen wanne theym dyuers stronge holdes adioynynge cytye forced brenne greate parte subbarbes cytye sorowe tell doolfull wryte whyle one day sayd good erle syr thomas mountagu rested hym bay wyndow helde compas cytie talked familiers gonne leueyled cytie place vnknowen whiche brake tymbre stone wyndowe suche vyolence pecys therof quasshed face noble erle suche wyse dyed within thre dayes folowyng upon whose soule crysten ihesu haue mercy ame dyuers wryters initium malorum myshappe englysshmen loste rather ther wanne lytell lytell loste theyr possessyon frauce somewhat gate yet one wanne loste thre shall appere anno dni miiiicxxvii anno dni miiiixxviii henry frowyk iohan gedney draper anno vi robert otley vi yere begynnynge kyng helde parlyament westmynster auctoryte wherof graunted hym subsydye maner foloweth fyrst euery tonne wyne yt came lande ye feest saynt ambrose fourth day apryll tyll ende yere kynge shulde haue iii belongynge denyzyn kynges lyege man also marchaundyse passynge co mynge lade shypped denyzon kynge haue euery xxsxiid excepte woll fell clothe also hym graunted parysshens thorughout realme beynge benefyce valewe x marke x sayde parysshons shulde paye theyr mouables syxe shyllynges eyght pe ye rate eyght pen euery benefyces xlix parysshons paye xiii iiiid cytyes borowes excepted rate rate lyke lowest benefyce hyghest inhabytauntes cyties boroughes enacted eueman beynge valewe xx aboue stuffe houshold apparayl wyfes shulne paye iiiid rate vnto rychest yere also day saynt gyles fyrste day septebre cardynall wynchester met mayre bretherne certayne cytezyns horse backe without cytie broughte vnto palays southwerke aboute tyme bryton good wydow honeste woman hadde cherysshed brought vp almes dwellynge whyte chapell paresshe without algate murdred sayde woman nyght slepynge bedde conueyed suche iewelles stuffe myght carye pursued vpon ye fere toke churche estsex forsware ye kynges lande ye constable caused hym brought london entended haue coueyed hym westward soone commen parysshe commytted murther wyfes caste vpon hym moche fylthe ordure strete withstandynge resystence made co stable slewe hym hande anno dni miiiicxxviii anno dni miiiicxxix thomas dushous henry barton skynner anno vii raffe holande yere vpon viii daye nouembre duke norffolke accompanyed many gentylmen toke barge saynt mary ouereys entendynge haue passed thoroughe brydge vnto grenewytche mysgydynge sterysman set vpon pyle brydge ye barge whelmed yt drowned excepte duke fewe persones lepte vpon pyle whiche drawen vp rope saued moneth ny folowynge cardynall wynchester warly company passed see entendynge haue made warre vpon heretykes lollers inhabyted countre prage nede men reget hadde frauce cardynall chauged purpose taryed season sayde regent wryters strengthe replenysshe certayne holdes weked reason co flycte englysshemen hadde frenchemen whiche lorde talbot taken prysoner lorde scalys many nombre iiim englysshe men slayne taken opynyon freche cronycle vyctorye shulde opteyned iane iohan called frenche la puzele de dieu xi yere kynge ye forsayd heretykes prage speketh somdeale auctour cronica cronicarum sheweth chyef capytaynes theym named procapius saplicius lupus preest bothe lerned vnlerned policronico sheweth ye xix chapyter laste boke twelfe yere kynge henry foresayd thre capytaynes slayne one mayster peter clerke beynge englyssheman taken lyue dyuers ye sayd heretykes slayne ii iournayes ouer two twenty thousandes anno dni miiiicxxix anno dni miiiicxxx wyllyam ruffe wyllyam estfelde mercer anno viii raffe holande eyght yere vpon ye day saynt leonarde vi day nouembre kynge henry beynge vpon age nyne yereskyng henry vi crowned solemply crowned saint peter churche westmynster whose coronacyon made syxe thyrty knyghtes bathe solempnyzacyon sayde churche fynysshed honorable feest great hal westmynster kepte ye kynge syttyng astate serued iii course vnder ensueth frument wyth venyson uyand royall planted losynges golde bore hedes castelles golde enarmed befe wyth motten boylyd capon stewyd sygnet rosted heyron rosted great pyke luce rede leche wyth lyon coruyn therein custarde royall wyth lyoparde golde syttyng therin holdyng floure delyce frytour sunne facyon wyth floure delyce therein sotyltye saynt edwarde saynt louys armyd vppon eyther hys cote armoure holdyng betwene fygure lyke vnto kyng hery standynge also hys cote armoure scrypture passyng theym sayeng beholde ii parfight kynges vnder one cote armour vnder fete sayde sayntes wryten thys balade holy sayntes edwarde saint lowice conserue braunche borne blessed blode lyue amonge cristen moste soueraygne price enheritour flouredelice gode sixt henry reygne wyse god graunt may mode may resemble knightehude vertue pray ye hertely vnto lord jesu uiand blank barred wyth golde gely party wryten noted wyth te deum laudamus pygge endored crane rosted byttore conyes chekyns partryche pecok enhakyll great breme whyte leche planted wyth rede antelop wyth crowne aboute hys necke wyth chayne golde flampayne powdered wyth leopardes floure delyce golde frytoure garnysshed wyth leopardes hede ii estryth feders sotyltie emperour kynge arayed matelles garter fygured sigismude ye emperour hery v fygure lyke vnto kyng hery ye vi knelyng tofore wyth balade takkyd hym agayne miscreautes emperour sigismude hath shewed myght imperiall henry v noble knyght founde christes cause actes marciall cherysshed churche lossers gaue fall gyuyng example kynges succede theyr braunche especiall whyle doth reygne loue god drede quynces compost blaud sure powderyd wyth quarter foyles gylt uenyson egrettes curlew cok partryche plouer quayles snytes great byrdes larkys carpe crabbe leche iii colour bake meate lyke shylde quartered red whyte set wyth losynges gylt floures borage frytour cryspyd sotyltie oure lady syttynge wyth chylde lappe holding crowne hade saint george saynt denys knelynge eyther syde psented kyng henryes fygure beryng hade thys balade foloweth blessed lady christes mother dere thou saynt george called art knight holy saint denys marter moste entere sixt henry present syght shedeth grace hym heuely lighte tender youth vertue doth auaunce borne discent title right iustly reygne englande fraunce solepne coronacyon honour ioye finysshed prouycyon made kynges iournay fraunce whyche passetyme meane vpon ye xxiii daye ianuary heretyke brent smythfelde vpon morowe next folowynge felde foughten stronge fyght betwene iohn upton appellant iohn downe defendant quyt theym bothe manfully kynge length relesed theyr quarell pardoned theyr trespas vppon saynt george day folowyng xxiii day apryll kynge toke shyppynge douer landed daye calays hauynge hys company ii duke yorke northfolke thre bysshoppes bathe ely rochester eyght erles meane huntyngdon stafforde warwyke orenforde deuynshyre morteyne ewe urmund xi baron saye lord bowchier beawmounde typtost fytzwater roos arundell awdeley fawcunbrydge gray codnoor lorde scroope lorde wellys thys tyme season kynge laye thus calays many skyrmysshes foughten betwene englysshemen frenchemen dyuers partyes fraunce greately frenchemen preuayled ye helpe woman touched named mayden god lastly wyth company came towne called compeyne entent remoue syege layde thereunto ye duke burgoyne englysshe capytaynes theruppon xxiii daye may gaue batayll vnto englysshmen burgonyons faughte wyth theym longe tyme ende manhode burgonyon knyghte named syr iohn luxemburghe taken lyue company dystressed caryed citie roan kept season moch feyned child whanne contrary knowen foriuged brente thys woman gaguynus maketh great processe parenty fyrste takynge vppon whereof parte entende shewe vi yere charles nexte folowynge kynge fraunce thys tyme season one rychard hounden wolle pakker london conuycte heresy brent towre hylle kyng hery thus lodgynge calays asserteyned takyng foresayd woman letter ye duke burgoyne toke hys small iournayes tyll came fraunce vnto parys whose cytezyns honourably receyued taken soueraygne kynge taryed thys mayres yere whych seaso wytnesseth gaguynus frenchemen wan dyuers holdes englyshemen burgonyos countrey brye capytayne named barbasan scomfited viiim englyshme burgonyos place called latyne cathalamencis affermeth foresayd auctour anno dni miiiicxxx anno dni miiiicxxxi water chertsey nycholas wotton anno ix robert large thys ix yere aboute mydlent preest named syr thomas bagley vycar vyllage essex called manueden lytell frome walden detect heresy uppon whych degrated tha brent place smythfelde soone vpon easter folowynge lorde protectour warnyd assemble heretykes abyndo wherfore sent thyder certayn persones rode thyder self som wryters afferme arrested baylly town named wyllyam maundeuyle weuer whyche appoynted capytayne ye sayd heretykes drawe people vnto hym chaunged hys name called hym self iak sharpe wygmorys lande walys examyned confessed haue wroughte moch sorow agayne preestes wolde haue made theyr heddes chepe shepe heddes wolde haue solde iii peny x wryters season take many hys complycys sent vnto dyuers prysons sayd iak sharpe offence drawen hanged hedyd forenamed towne abyndon vpon tuysday whytson weke hys hede sent london pyght vppon brydge hys fawtours put execucyon dyuers place countrees terrour vppon xiiii daye iuly yere one named rycharde russell wolle man drawen hanged quartered tyborne treason thys yere kynge beynge styll fraunce erle arundell accopanyed wyth iim englyshe sowdyours sente certayne hys companye vnto town called beale mount prouoke frenchemen issue towne whyche smal company whan bossycant seyntrales tha capytaynes beheld anone wyth theyr sowdyoures towne spedde theym forthe take sayde englysshemen whyche lytell lytell gaue bake tyll tolled frenchemen good space town tha sette vppon theym wyth sterne courage helde theym hande tyll sayde erle wyth hys company rescowed theym betwene theym cruell fyghte ende frenchemen chased ye sayde seyntrayle wyth many foote men sayde towne slayne iournay shortly duke burgoyne wyth ayde englysshemen place called barre scomfyted greate company frenchemen toke ii capytaynes belongyng duke barre whyche named renat barbazan whose raunsome duke yelded hym uale cassyle flaundres anno dni mccccxxxi anno dni mccccxxxii iohn adyrlee iohn welly grocer anno x stphyn browne kyng henry vi crowned parysin thys x yere vii day deceber kynge henry vi crowned parys cardynall wynchester whych coronacyon present lorde regent duke burgoyne dyuers noble frauce whose name gaguinus putteth boke reproche frenchman solempnyte fest ended wherof cyrcustaunce shewe order wolde aske longe leysour kynge departed frome parys came roan helde crystmas done sped hym caleys whan soiourned season toke shyppynge retourned englande landed douer ix daye february mette vppon baram downe baram howth y betwene douer cauntorbury wyth greate company gentyls comoners kent cladde wyth rede hodes whyche accompanyed tyll came blak heth mette mayre cytesyns london vpon thursdaye beynge xxi day february cytesyns beynge cladde whyte wyth dyuers werkes conysaunces browderyd vppon theyr sleues facultye theyr mysteryes craftes ye mayre hys brethern clothed scarlet due obeysaunce salutynge kynge rode hym towarde cytye whan kynge comen brydge deuysed myghty gyaut standynge wyth swerde drawyn hauyng thys speche wryten hym tho ben enemyes kyng shall clothe confusion make hym myghty vertuous lyuyng mortall soon oppresse bere downe hym encrease christes champion mischeues hym abridge grace god entry brydge whan kynge passed fyrste gate comen ye drawe brydge ordeyned goodly towre haged apparayled sylke clothes ara moste ryche wyse whiche sodaynly appered iii ladyes rychely cladde golde sylke coronettes vpon theyr heddes wherof ye fyrst named dame nature seconde dame grace thyrde dame fortune whiche vnto kynge speche lady thre one consent thre goostly gyftes heuynly dyuyne sir kynge present thyne hyghnes tyme vtterly shewe determyne grace fyrst thy comynge endowe scyence connynge nature strengthe fayrnesse loued drad euery wyght fortune prosperyte rychesse defende gyue myght longe enioye holde thy trewe ryght vertuous lyfe honour procede thy two ceptours thou may well possede also sayd towre xiiii vyrgyns clothed whyte wherof vii stode vpon ye ryght hade ye sayd iii ladyes vii vpon ye left hande vii vpon ye ryght hande bawderykes saphyr colour blewe ye vii theyr garmetes powdred sterres gold tha fyrst vii presented ye kynge vii gyftes ye holy ghost sapyence intellygence good counsayll strengthe cunnynge pyte drede god vii gaue vnto hym vii gyftes grace maner foloweth god endowe crowne glory ceptre clennesse pytye swerde myghte victorye mantell prudence clad thou shylde fayth defende helme helthe wrought thyne encreace gyrte gyrdyll loue parfyte peace thus saluted kynge anone beganne thys roundell wyth heuenly melodye songe foloweth souerayne lorde welcome cytye welcome ioye harte pleasaunce welcome gladnesse welcome suffysaunce welcome welcome ryghte welcome ut ye syngynge thy royall mageste saye harte withouten varyaunce souerayne lorde welcome fraunce mayre cytesyns comynaltye reioyse comynge newly fraunce wherby cytie rescuyd theyr sorow former greuaunce wherfore saye synge without greuance welcome welcome welcome harte ioye welcome vnto owne newe troye kyng rode forth softe pase tyll came entre corn hylle vpon ye hylle ordeyned tabernacle curyous worke stode dame sapyence vii artes scyences lyberall fyrst gramer logike rhetoryke musyke arithmetyke geometry astronomye euerych exercysynge theyr connynge facultye lady selfe hadde thys speche kynge lo chyefe pryncesse dame sapience shewe vnto sentence scripture kynges ben excellence reygne moste ioye endure helpe besy cure encrease theyr glory theyr hygh renowne shall wysdome haue full possession kynge passed tyll came conduyte cornehylle set pageat made cercle wyse summet toppe therof set chyld wonderfull beaute apparayled lyke kyng upo whose ryght hand satte lady mercy vpon lefte hande lady trouth ouer stode dame clennese embrasyng kynges trone kynge stode two iudges viii sergeauntes coyfe dame clennesse thys speche ye vi henry kynge lo sentence prudent salomon mercy ryght preseruyn euery kynge clennesse obserued reason kepe trone myschyefe fassynge maketh stronge longe abydynge conclude ladyes thre kynge preserue longe prosperite dauyd sayd psalme beryth wytnesse lorde god thy dome thou kynge gyue hym thy trouth ryghtwysnesse kynges sonne erth lyuynge thus declared wrytynge kynges prynces shuld drawe folke ben trewe well lerned lawe hys speche thus declared ye kynge rode forth quycker pase tyll came vnto conduyt chepe ordeyned dyuers wellys ye welle mercy ye welle grace welle pyte euery welle lady standynge mynystred water euery welle wold aske water turned good wyne welles sette dyuers tree wyth flouryshynge leues fruytes orenges almandes pomegarnardes olyues lymones date pepys quynces blauderelles peches comon fruytes costerdes wardes pomewardos rycardos damysyns plume wyth fruytes longe reherse ye cunyngly wrought many appered naturall tree growynge bordour thys delicious place whych named paradyse stode two forgrowen faders resemblynge enocke hely whych hadde thys sayenge kynge ennok fyrste benygne chere prayed god vpholde prosperite none enemyes haue power chylde false iniquyte haue power pertu thy feiycyte olde ennok processe well tell prayed kynge rode welle helias sokkys hore sayde well deuoutely sokynge kynge god conserue kepe euermore make blyssed erth lyuynge preserue maner thynge specyall amonge kynges enemyes handes thou neuer fall speche fynyshed ye kyng rode forthe lytell forther ordeyned tower garnysshed wyth army englande fraunce thys tower wonderfull beholde shewed order tytle whyche kynge hadde vnto crowne fraunce vpryght thys tower stode ii grene tree artifycyally wyth grene leuys garnysshed wrought one verynge genelogy saynte edward saynt lewys garnyshed leopardes flourdelyces ouer ii foresayde tree ordeyned thyrde whyche made forthe spryng iesse wherin shewed genelogy blessed lady sette moste curyous wyse vpo front thys tower wryten verse folowynge ij tree whiche gr vpright saynt edwarde also sent owys rote take palpable eche syght conueyed syne kynges great pryce whiche bare leopardes som flourdelice army excellent honour haue lacke vi hery may bere backe degre iust successiowne olde cronicles truely determine vnto kyng discended downe eyther partye right syne vpon whose hede fresshesy doth shyne two ryche crownes moche soueraygn pleasauce bringe pea betwene englande frauce thys kyng passed tyll came coduyt paulys gate pyghte celestyall trone therein sette personage trinyte wyth multytude aungels playenge syngynge vpon instrumentes musyk vpon front ye sayd trone wrytten verse balades folowynge whych spoken father vnto kyng aungels precept ye assure prince yonge tender age ye entende besy cure kepe saue hym maner damage hys lyfe duryng age renowne may sprede shyne ferre two realmes cease mortal warre ferther shewe hym fulfyll hym ioye worldly habundaunce lengthe many holsome yere shall comfort helpe pleasaunce liege haue faythfull obeysaunce also multiply encrease lyne cause noble thorugh worlde shyne thys done entred churcheyarde mette wyth processyon deane chanos paulys wyth whome also pontificalibus came archbysshop cauntorbury chauceler englande bysshop lyncolne bathe salysbury norwyche ely rochestre whiche conueyed hym churche made oblacyons done toke agayne stede west dore paules rode forth vnto westmynker agayne abbot couent receyued procession coueyed vnto saynt edwardes shryne taryed whyle te deum songe quyer finysshed lordes conueyed vnto palays mayre cytezyns returned ioyusly london vpon saterday folowynge beynge xxiii day februarii mayre alderman yode vnto kyng presented hym hamper golde therin thousande poude fayre noble whiche kynge yelded vnto louynge thankes yere also reason ye sowdyours calays restraynte made wolles cotet theyr wage wherfore regent frauce beynge tha capytayne calays came downe thyder easter weke whiche tyme beynge wednesdaye sayde weke many sowdyoures arested put warde whan done rode tyrewyn meanes bysshop tyrewyn maried ye erle saint paules doughter shortly returned calays caused sayde sowdyours enquyred fynally iiii demed dye whiche iiii yt say iohan maddely iohan lundaye thomas palmer thomas talbot beheded calays xi day iuny hundreth x sowdyours banysshed towne ouer syr score banysshed tyme vpon mydsomer euen folowynge sayd lorde regent newe spouse came vnto london taryed englande tyll later ende august anno dni mccccxxxii anno dni mccccxxxiii iohan olney iohan parneys fysshmonger anno xi iohan pa dystey xi yere wryters auctoryte pope martyn v name countyse basyse ye cousayl basyle gadered duryng whiche heretykes prage otherwyse called bohemy beme somoned thyder whiche vnder suertye saufe coduyte sent thyder englysshe clerke named mayster peter renegate whiche defended styfly theyr erronyous opynyons returned without reconsylyacyon thus hagynge cousayll pope martyn dyed hym w schosen eugeny fourthbugeny ye pope whiche beyng admytted demeaned hym nycely begynnynge put rome dyuers prynces toke partye agayne hym suche wyse lykely deposed bare hym sadly yt recouered loste contynued see space xvi yeres ruled wryters called eugeni gloriosus relygyous men vnto theym hadde specyall zele fauoure vpon eyhgte day iuly kynge henry yere beganne parlyamet westmynster contynued tyll lammas aiourned vnto saynt edwardes daye yere southe weste appered sterre whiche lyke blasynge sterre named erle huntyngdon also yere sente fraunce warly company dyd ther great feates saythe englyssh cronycle yt nothynge towched frenche boke anno dni miiicxxxiii anno dni miiicxxxiiii thomas chalton iohan brokley draper anno xii iohan lynge xii yere ix daye nouembre terment erle saynt pawle father vnto duchesse bedforde solemply holde pawles churche londo partye astates realme present ix day marche folowynge lorde talbot goodly company passed thoroughe cytye london towarde see fraunce wrought moche wo vnto ye frech men wherof partyculers towched contynuynge foresayd warre frauce towne saynt denys within ii englyssh myles parys goten treason practyse one named iohan notyce knyght orleauce mathew gougth thomas kyryell capytayns slewe many englysshemen many toke prysoners soone sayde capytaynes strengthe taken theym parysyens layde suche stronge syege rounde aboute sayde towne saynt denys fynally agreed redelyuer ye towne yf rescowed frenche kynge within fyftene dayes ye sayde dayes expyred retourned englyssheme standynge frenchemen wanne dayly vpon englysshe men partyes also norma dy amog whiche gaynes ye freche gaguyne bryngeth matyer game reherseth ye mockage englysshemen saythe yere feest myghelmas place called fewgeri guyan stronge fyghte foughten bytwene englysshmen fre chemen durynge whiche one named boosaprest frech knyght fere fledde frome fyghte hydde hym couerte busshes stoode styll tyll fyghte ended englysshemen scomfyted scared whiche two aduenture sauegarde selfe fledde sayd thycke busshe cowarde frenche knyghte stode whiche whan hadde espyed lerned theym frenche partye hadde wonne felde became coragyous forced sayde two englysshemen become prysoners theym entredde hoste frencheme bare countenauce hadde wonne theym foresayd fyght lengthe whan demeanoure knowen feate hadde great derysyon chefe capytayne named guylla de saynt albyne pryued prysones season also erle arundell whiche normandy manly borne hym herynge one hyrus frenche capytayne hadde fortyfyed stroge castell named gerborym distroyed englysshe men toke hym certayn sow dyoures gyrde castell stronge syege assawted sondry tymes mafully sayth fre che cronycle gagwyne cronycle sayth syege fully layde castell fully repayred sayd hyrus company yssued castell gaue vnto ye sayd erle cruell skyrmysshe whiche sayde erle receyued deedly wounde dyed shortly vyctory ye freche men optayned castell ye hurte englysshemen reedyfyed place called dyepp also wonne anno dni mccccxxxiiii anno dni mccccxxxv thomas b rnwell
