robertr lay grocer anno xiii symonde eyre xiii yere euen saint katheryne began frost endured vnto feast saynt scolastica x daye february whiche frase thamys feruently shyp bote myght come vytayle london wherfore suche shyppes came yere thamys mouthe burdeux dyscharged wyne marchaundyse theym brought caryed lade cytie latter ende decembre yere ended parlyamente holden westmynster begon myghelmas terme passed yere also meanes pope eugeny iiii ara pycardy holden great cou sayle conclude vnyon pea atwene two realmes englande fraunce whiche cousayle sayd pope comaudment came persone indyfferent nicholas cardynall ye holy crosse syxe romayne bysshoppes hym assygned kynge englandes partye assygned cardynall wynchester archebysshop yorke erles huntyngdon suffolke dyuers frenche kynge duke burbon erle rychemount ye archebysshop raynys chaunceler frauce deane patys many whiche passe ouer also fortherers matyer cardynal cyprys duke burgoyn bysshop cambray nycholas raulyn sayd duke chaunceler dyuers erles baron duchy duke brytayne ther erles alenson barre ouer aboue dyuers oratoures appoynted countye flaundres whiche assemble counsayll thus holden testifieth dyuers wryters many great offer meane ye aboue named cardynal holy crosse ai crosse englysshe lordes offered sayth gaguinus englyssheme obstinately set warre ye reason myght cotet reason whiche obstinaci ye cou sayll deferred tyll day whiche day englysshemen entendynge cotinuaunce warre absentyd theym selfe wherwith sayd cardynall beynge dyscontented made meanes entreaty pea atwene charles toke vpon hym frenche kynge phylyp duke burgoyn wherof sayd charles fayne ye stablysshynge pea satysfye hym ye murther father gaue vnto hym vtter boundes champeyn marching vpon burgoin dyuers cyties seynt quyntyne corbie peron abbeuyle countie poytyaw lordshyp macon wytnesseth ye foresayde gagwyne many mo thynges vnto duke sayde charles mysed whiche theyr bothe dethes broken stode nought whiche pea thus atwene confermed proclaymed sayd duke became vtter enemye kynge englande shall appere soone sayd duke began ordre lyle golden flese ordeyned certayne knyghtes ordre made therunto many statute ordenaunces wherof dyuers lyke vnto statute garter ende yere xiiii day septembre roan normandye died noble prynce iohn duke bedforde regent fraunce great solempnytie buryed within churche notir dame cytie hym founded wonderfull thynges menes reporte fynde therof wrytynge nothynge passe ouer anno dni miiiicxxxv anno dni miiiicxxxvi thomas catworth henry frowyk mercer anno xiiii robert clopton xiiii yere begynnynge duke barre accompanyed burgonyos frenchemen wanne ye towne harflewe dyuers vyllages apryll folowynge sayde duke accompanyed ye lorde teruan mayster kynges chyualry toke towne saynt denys slewe therin aboue iiiic englysshemen toke prysoner thomas beleamounde theyr capytayne many ye freche men assawted towre therby called ueuen toke appoyntment tha one named notyce knyght orleauce stregth knyghtes drewe hym nere cytie parys house relygyon ye charterhouse ordre lodged hym beyonde saynt denys ouer water sayn cofedered certayne cytezen cytie named michaell laylery iohan frountayne thomas pygacen iohan de saynt benoit nicholas lorueyn iaques bergery betraye cytie brynge ye englysshe possessyon whiche persones beynge hedes cytie coueyed theyr purpose suche wyse turned comons cytie vpon englysshe men sodeynly arose agayne force slewe great nombre dyd take many prysoners englysshe men fledde faughte stretes woman feble persones cast vpon stone ho e lycoures theyr great confusyon yt englysshe men passynge mysery desolacyon tyme persecucion bysshop mor whiche named chaunceler englysshe men partyes hardly escaped toke towre saynt denys whiche yet rested englysshe possessyon hoste frenchemen herynge rumour cytie anone drewe nere entred saynt iames gate without moche resystence enioyed cytye theyr pleasure englysshemen beynge towre saynt denys feryng myght longe holde sayd place agayne theyr enemy fyl treaty codyscended passe fre theyr lyues wha shuld passe vpon theyr iournay di ided scorned ye frechenacyon mesure whan cytye parys thus subdued frenche dominion anone ye englyssh people abode vnder fyne raunsom sworne charles seuenth takynge vpon hym frenche kynge anone wonne ye englyssh power holdes named creoll saynt germayne whiche passe tyme season stregthe haue gydynge normady duke yorke encompaned erle salysbury lorde fawcoubrydg sailed frauce erle morteyn beynge tha calays made vyage flaundres skyrmysshed ye bordred vpon pycardy slewe ouer cccc gate great droue beestes brought vnto calays certaynte phylyp duke burgoyn enteded lay syege aboute calays therfore london good townes englade charged sende thyder certayne men wel suffycyently warre apparayled wherof london sente theyr charge men vpon ix daye iuyll duke burgoyn great multytude burgonyons flemynges appered calayscalys besyeged pyght pauylyons tentes euery towne flaudres theyr tentes themselfe whiche season lyeutenaunt calays syr iohn ratclyf knyght castell lieutenaunte baron dudley syege endured vpon iii wekes whiche seson many knyghtly actes done exercysed vpon bothe partyes whiche lengthynge tyme passe vpon seconde day august duke glouceter protectour englade company vc sayles writer haue landed calays entended vpon thyrde day folowynge haue yssued towne haue gyuen batayll ye flemynges testyfyeth englysshe wryters soone ye duke burgoyn ware great power lorde protectour toke hym ordenauce myght lyghtly cary heuy combrous lefte behynde hym amonge whiche one lefte guynes great gunne brasse named dygon ouer dyuers serpentynes great gunnes flemynges lefte behynde great quantyte bere besyde wyne floure vytayle vyage wryteth otherwyse gaguyne sayth ye duke well manfully valyaunte knyght actes cotinued syge calays ouer two monethes dyd many noble actes assaylyng enemyes ye flemynges reason theyr murmure rebellion refused hym maner lafte hym almost company yet withstadynge dayly assayled enemyes suche small company laft hym wha sawe myght preuayle returned cou tre thus alway sayd gagwynus boke wypeth ye englysshemen may honoure excuseth theyr enemyes power whan duke host thus fledde lorde protectoure people folowed hym countre space xi dayes whiche season brent two townes whiche named yet poperynge bell returned calays englande yere castell towne rokkesborouth scotlande besyeged kynge scottes soone wyttyng syr rauffe gray knyght comynge competent nombre remoue siege anone departed leuynge parte ordenaunce behynde hym great dyshonoure anno dni mccccxxxvi anno dni mccccxxxvii thomas morsted iohn mychell anno xv wyllyam gregory xv yere thyrde daye ianuarii quene katheryne mother vnto henry syxte wyfe henry fyfte dyed barmundissey southwarke due solempnyte brought thorughe cytie conueyed westmynster buryed ye myddes lady chapel vnder tobe marbell whan soueraygne lorde ry vii beynge kyng caused chapell taken downe buylded newe without lyke ther vnto men dothe appere corp ye excellent prynces taken vp set tombe lorde husbande durynge ye tyme buyldynge sayde newe chapell buryed sayd lorde within sayde chapell ye xiiii day ye sayd moneth fyll downe sodeynly furthest gate towarde southwarke ye towre therupon ii furthest arch ye sayd brydge god wold creature therwith perysshed meane humayne persones xxi day moneth ianuarii kyng beganne parlyament westmynster whiche purposed haue benholden cambrydge parlyament came ye bysshop turuyn counsayle erle armynak wherof fynde ye cause expressed easter day dyot holde bytwene grauenynge calays mater touchynge ye kynge duke burgoyne kynge appered cardynall englande ye duke norffolke erle stafforde dyuers duke partye appered duchesse wyfe dyuers sayde duke counsayle meanes sayde persones abstynence warre taken certayne tyme duchesse name kynge wolde take none appoyntmet duke somoche gone truthe allegeaunce tyme made ye kynge vpon seconde daye iuly yere dyed quene iane whiche somtyme ben wyfe kynge henry iiii wyfe duke brytayne caryed barmundessey cauntorbury buryed husbade henry iiii yere fell chaunce ben sene many yeres yons dyed towre whiche co tynued longe season yere also ye kyng scottes trayterously murthered seruauntes ownekynge scottes murdred whiche traytours capytayne named robert grame company taken put vnto moost paynfull dethe sayd kynge scottes en prysoner fyftene yeres englande anno dni miiiicxxxvii anno dni miiiicxxxviii wyllyam chapman wyllyam estfelde mercer anno xvi wyllyam halys xvi yere moneth nouembre kynge henry caused kepte solempne obyt terment within churche paules sygysmonde emperour knyght ye garter man merueylous great worthy fame auctour cronica cronicarum expressed whose dethe gydynge ye empyre fyll albert maryed onely doughter ye sayd sygysmonde anno dni miiiicxxxviii anno dni miiiicxxxix hugh dyke stephen browne grocer anno xvii nycholas yoo yere vpon newe yeres daye noone stake woode fyll downe sodaynly baynardes castell vpon thamys syde slewe iii men hurte dyuers bedford yere kepynge shyre day fallynge steyer xviii murthered slayne besyde many sore hurte maymed last day apryll dyed roan syr rycharde beauchamp called comon fame ye good erle warwyke lyeutenaunt ye kynge normandy demened hym full well manfully whose body brought vnto warwyke newe chapell buylded vpon southe syde quyer buryed full honorably yere also great derthea derthe corne englad also frauce somoche yt busshell solde lodon iii iii iiiid frauce parys lyke value also dyed sore sekenesse ipidimie scarcyte whete englande many place people made breed fetch pesyn benes wryters lacke foresayd graynes poore people made breed fe necotes yet prouydence stephen browne yere mayre many shippes freyghte rye pruce dyscharged london eased people nere cytie greatly many wryters named seconde dere yere yere ended counsayle synode holde basyle begon sayde xi yere kyngepope eugeny deposed auctoryte whiche cou sayle eugeny iiii deposed amedeus duke prynce sauoy chosen pope place forenamed eugeny yet suche ayde contynued rome pope lyues tyme whiche named ayders felix v contynued dygnyte place tha arose great scisme ye churche whether ii indubitat pope countrees vphelde ye one therwere alowed none called ye neutralytie scysine contynued vpon ix yeres terme whyle eugeny lyued whose dethe chosen cardynall named thomas sarazan named nycholas v whome sayde felix admitted peter successour owne good mynde renounced dygnyte papacy submytted hym rule obedyence sayd v nycholas tha beynge indubitat pope thus cessed scysme churche whiche contynued terme aboue specyfyed felix deuoute prynce sawe sone sone lyued deuoute holi lyfe lastly chosen pope shewed dyuers wryters accompted happy hadde medled tytle churche therwith blotted olde age opynyon wryters named alowed moche blessed happy yere moneth august lodon two bawdes punysshed werynge ray hodes xl dayes enprysonment banysshed towne dryuen shame yere also conduyte fletestrete begonne syr wyllyam estfelde knyghte late mayre fynysshed good disposicion without cost charge cytie syr lewes iohan estsex made knyghtes bathe yere yere dyed robert chicheley grocer twyes mayre london whiche wylled testament vpon mynde daye good competent dyner shulde ordeyned xxiiiic poore houssholders cytye yf myght foude ouer xxli destrybuted amoge whiche euery man two pen anno dni mccccxxxix anno dni mccccxl robert marchall robert large mercer anno xviii phylyp malpas xviii yere vpon daye saynt botolph xvii day iuny preste degrated prestly dygnyte named syr rycharde brent heresye ye towre hyll wel latter day toke great repentaunce dyed goddes man faythe churche wordes spoken lyfe posterne ye towre shulde synke dyd fantastycall dedes wordes many lewde folkes accompted holy man wherfore dethe came place execucyon made theyr oblacyos prayer arered great hepe stone pyght crosse nyght meanes great dysclaunder ran vpon churche specially vpon suche put hym dethe cease rumoure comaudment sent ye kynge punysshe suche thyder went pylgrymage vertue whereof ye mayre shyreffes dyd suche dylygece shortly ye sekyng offeryng fordone layde aparte yere also ye shyreffes london fette saynt martynes legraunt v persones beynge sayntwary ladde theym countre bred strete remayned certayne dayes day expired ye kynges iustyces restored vnto sayntwary passetyme warre atwene englande frauce endurynge wynter season whan groude couered myghty snowe therewith great frost hadde hardened pondes dyches englysshme whiche laye stroge holde nyghe vnto towne called pountlarge arayed whyte clothes ouer theyr harneys great nombre approched dyke passed vpon yse ye walles scaled watche ye towne slepynge toke towne distressed therin myche people whiche daunger escaped ryghte hardly ii capytaynes towne named iohan de uyllers narabon knyghte burgonyon countre aboute parys also sorevexed ye rauyne wolues proclamacyon made euery grene newe flayn skyne wolfe brought vnto parys ye prouost shulde gyue brynger xx shelynges xx sou countre money whiche amouteth ii vi sterlyngedyf rrcyo wolf longe charles frenche kynge layde vnto ye foresayd towne strog siege ye duke yorke lorde talbot well knyghtly defended somoche ye one tyme put frenchemen rebuke lykely haue take theyr kyng e soner rescous lastly ye duke yorke sayd lord talbot vrgent cause departed thes roan betoke towne ye rule syr gerueys clifto knyght hauynge nombre thousande sowdyours thyrde daye duke departynge frenche kynge fyersly assayled towne ende wanne strengthe slewe therin many englyssh toke many prysoners soone townes meleon corbeyll ebreouse loste englysshmen ye shall vnderstande sondry many tymes ye townes holdes frauce lost efte wonne euer ye losse turned englysshe partye tyll normandy lost landes fraunce appartynynge kynge englande anno dni miiiicxl anno dni miiiicxli iohan sutton iohan paddysley goldsmythe anno xix wyllyam wetynhale xix yere began murmure grudge breke large ben kepte mewe atwene sone nere aboute ye kyng vncle famous humfrey duke gloceter protectour lande agayne whome dyuers co iectures attempted farre whiche sette nere hym yt lefte tyll broughte hym vnto confusyon fyrste yere dame eleanoure cobham familier hym maryed arested certayne poyntes treason therupon examynacion conuict lastly demed dwell outlawe yle man vnder warde syr thomas stanleye knyghte soone arested ayders councelers foresayd duchesse mayster thomas southwell chanon saynt stephyns chapell westmynster mayster iohan hum chaplayne sayde duchesse mayster roger bolyngbroke man experte nygromancy woma called margery iourdemayne surnamed wytch eye besyde wynchester whose charge layde iiii persones shulde request duches deuyse ymage wax lyke vnto ye kyng whiche ymage delte soo theyr deuyslysshe incantacyons sorcery entended brynge lyfe lytell lytell kynges person lytell lytell consumed ye ymage whiche treason fynally couycte adiuged dye mayster thomas southewell dyed towre london nyght shuld haue ben iudged morne nexte yere folowynge shalbe declared ye haue ye preceding yere herde towne pountlarge wonne charles ye toke vpon hym kyng wher mani englysshme taken prysoners sente castell named coruyle beynge pryson laboured vnto ruler holde one myght sette large laboure theyr fredes theyr raunsom whiche persone whan lybertye went vnto strength thereby wherof aragon knyght capytayne vnder duke yorke shewed hym castell coruyle sklenderly maned myght wonne polycy strengthe wherupon sayd capytayne named frauncys nyght folowynge sette busshmente nere vnto sayd castell daunynge mornynge arayed iiii sowdyoures husbandmenes aray sent sakkes fylled dyuers fruytes offer sell occupyers castell whiche whan comyn gate theyr langage taken frenchemen anone without suspicion taken seyng fewe folkes styrryng held ye porter muet whyle one gaue foresayde bushmente knowledge shortly entred toke capytayne bedde spoyled castell delyuered englysshe prysoners coueyed frecheme goodes yt myghte cary castell vnto roan upon day translacyon saynt edward twelfe day octobre vpon whiche daye mayre named mayre bretherne ye yere folowynge day whan comons cytye theyr auncyet custome chosen two alderine suche ben shyreffes london myddelsex wete roberte clopton draper rauffe holad tayllour presented name vnto mayre hys brother syttynge vtter chambre mayres courtes ben kepte entent sayde mayre hys brother myghte chose one sayde two suche thoughte moste necessary worshypfull rome sayde mayre hys brethern chase roberte clopto broughte hym downe vppon hys ryght hande towarde ye hall whereof whanne certayne tayllours beynge ware sawe rauffe holade nat chosen anone cryed naye naye nat rauffe holande wherewyth olde mayre beynge astonyed ode stylle vpon stayer commaunded kepe silence helde waye eest ende ye hall set hym downe brethern hym whyche meane tyme sayde tayllours contynued theyr crye encensed lowe felysshyppes cytye symple persones take theyr parte crye faste wolde nat cease speche mayre oyes made mayres sergeaunt armes wherefore mayre appese rumour sente downe shyreffes commaunded take mysdoers sende vnto pryson whych precept obserued twelf syxten chiefe sent vnto newgate sayde rumour anone ceased whyche prysoners fyned punysshed longe inprysonemente anno dni miiiicxii anno dni miiiicxlii wyllyam cumbys robert clopton anno xx rychard ryche thys xx yere moneth folowyng partyes yere arrested treaso brought vnto guyldhall london arreygned poyntes ben reherced ye fynally mayster iohn hum mayster roger bolynbroke iudged drawen hanged quartered wytche brent mayster thomas sothwell dyed towre ye nyght yt shuld haue iudged tha accordyng sentence court passed mayster roger drawen tyborne hanged quartered ye season toke vpon hys deth nat gylty ye treason put iuged next day folowyng wytch brente smythfelde mayster iohan hum pardoned suyd oute hys charter yere also ye lord talbot layd syege hauen towne normandy named depe set hys ordynaunce vpo hylle called poleet amonge engynes instrumentes warre hadde deuysed myghty towre tymbre whyche shotte hys gunnes ordynaunce therewyth brosyd crasyd wally wrought therby greate dyspleasure vnto towne depe thys towne capytayne charlys mareys frenche knyght knyght whyche manfully defended towne tyll vnto hym wyth rescous came iohn notice orleaunce knyght wyth copany sowdyours came rescous sayde towne ii knyghtes named arthur de lo geuyle syr thomas droynon wyth vic thys charles whyche named hym selfe freche kyng sent thyder thyrde rescous vc men army sowdyours vnder ii leders called theodalde guyllyam rychauyll knyghtes whyche rescous nat wythstandynge sayde lorde talbot well mafully cotynued hys syege assawted towne ryght cruell maner fayne call ayde whereof lord talbot beyng ware thynkynge shortly frenchman shuld constrayned gyue ouer towne left gydyng syege vnto syr wyllyam poyton syr iohn ryppelad tryppelande knyght departyd whose departyng short whyle ye dolphyn uyene lowys name sonne vnto forenamed charles frenche kynge accompanyed wyth erle saynte paule nombre xvic knyghtes came vnto rescous sayd towne day rested hym hys sowdiours sente forenamed theodalde wyth strength iiiic men assayle forsayde towre tymbre lytell hurt dyd therunto sayd dolphyn sente strength vic men assayle englyshemen quyt theym manfully slew viii score frenchman wounded ouer iiic wherwyth dolphyn beynge greuously amoued assembled vttermost strength myght make aswel towne set vpon englysshe men whiche ore brused dayly fyght fewe nombre fynally scomfited slewe theym vpon ccc toke ye rest prysoners amonge yt whiche foresayd two englysshe capitaynes taken kynnesma lorde talbottes veryly one baste sone thus depe rescowed englysshmen dyscomfyted fully maynteyned syege space ix wekes odde dayes also yere ye moneth august great affray fletestrete atwene getters ynnes courte inhabytauntes strete whiche affray began ye nyght contynued assawtes small kerynges tyll ye next day whiche season moche people cytie thyder gadered dyuers men bothe partyes slayne many hurte lastly presence dyscrecyon ye mayer shyreffes affraye appesed whiche chyfe occasyoner man clyfforde ynne named herbotell yere also certayne ambassadoures yt sente englad guyon maryage co cluded begynnynge yere folowynge atwene kynge ye erles doughter armenak whiche conclusion dysalowed put meanes erle suffolke whiche kyndled newe brande brunynge enuy atwene ye lorde protectour hym toke fyre suche wyse lefte tyll bothe partyes many consumed slayne wherof ensued moche myschefe within realme losse normandy shall appere anno dni miiiicxlii anno dni miiiicxlili thomas beaumount ion athyrley irenmonger anno xxi rycharde nordon thys xxi yere foresayde erle suffolke whych touched fordon coclusyon maryage take ambassadours betwene kyng ye erle armenakes doughter wente ouer hym selfe wyth vnto hym assygned frauce concluded mariage betwene kyng dame margarete kynges doughter cecyle hierusalem sayth englyshe cronycle mariage brynge sayd kyng cecyle deliuered ye duchye angeou erledome mayne whych called keyes normandy freche wryter gaguyne sayth hys latyne cronycle yt thys tyme erle suffolke came vnto charles frenche kyng towne lorayn named naunce naut axed hym doughter quene england gyueth name whyche request sayd charles sayde erle grauted also affermeth lytel tofore season peace betwene bothe realmes concluded terme xxii moneths whych peace endured whyle thys yere vpon candelmas euyn steple sait poules church londo set fyre tempest lyghtnynge lastly queched greate dylygence laboure many persones laboured morowe masse preeste bowe church chepe moste commended noted anno dni mccccxliii anno dni mccccxliiii nycholas wyfforde thomas catworthe grocer anno xxii iohn norman thys xxii yere ye erle stafforde made created duke bukkyngham erle warwyke duke warwyke erle dorset marque dorset erle suffolke marquys suffolke whyche marquys suffolke soone wyth hys wyfe honourable personage aswell men woman great apparayl chayres costyous ordenaunce conuey forenamed lady margarete england sayled frauce honourably receyued taryed thys mayres yere thys yere also acte made auctoryte common cou sayll london vppon sondaye shuld maner thynge fraunchyse ye citie bought solde nother vytayll thynge none artyfycer shulde brynge hys ware man worne occupyed daye tayllours garmentes cordewayners shoys lykewyse occupacyons whyche ordenaunce helde whyle anno dni mcccxliiii anno dni mccccxlv stephyn foster henry frowyke mercer anno xxiii hughe wyche thys xxiii yere moneth foresayd lady margarete came ouer englad moneth folowynge maryed vnto kyng ry towne called sowthwyke countre hamshyre fro then honourably conueyed lordes estate thys lad whyche mette wyth sondry place wyth greate retynewe men sondry lyueryes wyth theyr sleuys browdered som betyn wyth gold smythes werkes moste costly maner specyally duke glouceter mette wyth wyth fyue hundreth men one lyuerey conueyed vnto blacke heth vppon xviii day may mette mayre alderman sheryfes cytye craftes brown blewe wyth brawderyd sleuys meane euery mystery crafte wyth conysaunce hys mystery red hoodes vppon eyther theyr heddes daye broughte vnto london ordeyned sumptuous costly pagetes resemblauce dyuerse olde hystoryes ye great comforte suche came wyth ye maner whereof passe ouer lengthynge tyme wyth great tryuphe broughte vnto westmynster vppon xxx daye moneth maye sondaye trynyte sondaye solemply crowned whyche feeste iustes holden thre dayes continual within seyntwary ye abbey thys maryage dyuers wryters lefte dyuers remembraunces sayenge thys maryage vnprofytable realme dyuerse wayes fyrste gyuen vp oute kynges possession duchye angeou erledome mayne costes conueynge thys lande axed playne parlyamente fyftene halfe marquys suffolke reason whereof grewe hatered people fynally coste hym hys lyfe ouer appered god nat pleased wyth mariage thys day fortune worlde beganne fal ye kyng loste hys frendes englande hys reuenewes frauce shortly ruled quene counsayl great dysprofyte kyng hys realme greate maugre obloquy quene whych syn tyme hath ben well prouyd many wrong false reporte made whych longe reherse whyche mysery fyll brekynge promyse made kyng vnto erle armenakkys doughter xx yere kyng touched agreeth moste wryters whyche mysery thys story shall somdeale appere fyrst losyng normandy deuisio lordes within thys realme rebellio ye cominaltye agayne theyr prynce soueraygne fynally kynge deposed quene wyth prynce fayne fle lande loste rule thereof euer anno dni miiiicxlvi anno dni miiiicxlvii robert horne iohn olney mercer anno xxv godfrey boloyne thys xxv yere parlyament holde saynt edmondes bury suffolke ye whiche towne comons coutre warned come theyr moste defecyble aray gyue attendaunce vpo kyng soone thys parlyamet bego lordes assembled syr hufrey duke glouceter vncle vnto ye kyng shortly arrested vycounte beawmode tha hygh costable englande whome accompanied ye duke bukkynghm arest executed owne seruautes put xxxii pryncypall theym also put vnder arest sente vnto dyuers prysons whereof arose great murmour amonge people thus cotynuyng thys parlyament wythin vi dayes duke arrested founde dede hys bedde beynge xxiiii daye february whose murdre dyuers reportes made whyche passe ouer hys corp layd opyn yt myght se hym wonde founde hym honourable fame thys man longe style myght make ye good rule kepte thys lande durynge none age kynge hys honourable housholde libertye passed hys tyme trewe hys allegeaunce coude ryght accuse hi malycyous persones whych hys glorious honour fame lafte nat maligne agayne hym tyll put frome wordly rule specyally thought durynge hys lyfe wolde withstade delyuery angeou mayne promysed thys hys honourable lyberall demeanure surnamed good duke glouceter lyen opyn season yt men myghte assured hys dethe corp honourably prouided coueyed vnto saynt albonys buryed nere vnto shryne saynt albone whose soule god mercyfull amen whan noble prynce thus enteryd fyue persones hys housholde saye syr roger chamberlayne knyght myddelton herbarde arthur esquyers one rycharde neda yeman sente vnto londo arayned iuged drawe haged quartered whych sentece drawynge hagynge put execucio wha cut downe quartered ye marquys suffolke beyng preset shewed ye kynges chartour deliuered great reioysyng ye multytude ye people beyng present thys grudge murmour ye people ceased nat agayne marquys suffolke deth good duke glouceter whose murdre specyally suspected anno dni miiiicxlvii anno dni miiiicxlviii wyllyam abraham iohn gedney draper anno xxvi thomas scot thys xxvi yere concordauce moste wryters nere ye xxiii scisme ye church ceased cotynued betwene eugeny iiii felix v vpon xvi yeres thys scisme touched began reason deposycyo sayde eugeny cousayll basile wolde nat obserue decree made cousayll costauce cause hym layde yet deposyng natwythstandynge perforce cotynued pope terme xiiii yeres sayde felix sayd cousayll admitted lyke maner co tynued pope sayde season lyke haue shewed xvii yere thys kynge exortacyon crysten prynces kynge england whose messangers ye behalfe bysshoppe norwyche lord saint iohns prince sayd pope felix sette perfyte vnyon churche thys yere hys owne volute resigned hys auctorytie papacy submytted hym vnto obediece nicholas v name nat wythstandynge sayde felix man great byrthe allied partye crysten prynces thys nycholas lowe byrthe vnknowe kynred wythin cytie ieane felix made legate fraunce cardynal sauoye lyued blessed holy lyfe ended wryters testifye god hym hath shewed dyuers miracle syns dyed thys scysme thus gracyously ended vercyfyer made thys verse folowynge plux fussit mundo cessit felix nicholao whych verse thus meane englyshe plyght worlde dothe sprynge shyne pfor felix vnto nicholas frely doth resyne also testifieth gaguyne also englyshe wryters yt trewys betwene englad frauce cotynuyng knyght ye englysh partie named syr frauceys arrogonoyse toke town vpo border normady belogyng vnto ye duke brytayne yt coplayned hym vnto charles frech kyng sayd duke request sent vnto ye kyng englad iohn hanart guyllm cosynot knyghtes axe restitucyo ye harme whych answered ye kynges cousayll yt dede ryght displeasaut vnto ye kyng ye sayd syr frauceys enter prysed ye fayt owne presupcion nothyng wyth kyng mynde plesure tha answere thus made agreed duke somerset tha lieutenaut vnder kyng normady yt comynycacio thy matyer shulde hadde towne named louers place day assygned apperyd came certayne persones partyes beyng occupyed trayne copassed french take fro ye englyshmen strog town hold named pout arche wherof maner thys frenche man norman beynge carter whyche dayly vsed entre thys towne wyth vytayll lodynge hys carte seynge neglygence engglysshemen howe lyttel hede toke vnto watche towne warned frenche capytayne named floquet annd sayde wyth lytell helpe town wolde goten expedycyo wherof thys floquet wyth couenaunted wyth sayd carter bryng theyr purpose ordeyned vnto hym ii hardy sowdyours frencheme whyche bare theyr neckes ii carpeter ax shewe carpenter agremet made among shuld entre towne shulde mete carter whych hys olde custome entred gate wythout susspycyon soone wyth axe necke came one sowdyour whyle wyth lytell questyonyng made passed ye gate lastly vnto house ye carter appoynted kept secrete tyll nyght commyn knowynge well hoste hous enemy englysshemen iniury hym englysshe man done shewed hym theyr counsayll whyche promysed assystence ayde myght make thys nyghtes passe tyme fortheraunce thys purpose lord bressy chosen company knyghtes lodged hym busshemet nere vnto ye towne towarde gate saint andrewe forenamed floquet lodged hym wyth chosen company vnder parte towne whych toward louers beig hym syr iamys de cleremont men name ordenaunces prouysyons thus ordeyned forenamed carter ii sowdyours forenamed sprynge mornynge moneth octobre came erely vnto ye gatewith hys carte called porter name fayre maner opyn ye gate promysed hym rewarde hys labour porter knowyng well carter takyng lytell regarde ii whyche came hym opened gate sent felow hys opyn former gate whan fryste opened carter set hys carte selfe gate drewe hys purs gyue porter hys reward mysed tolde money hys falshode let part money fall vpon groude whych whyle porter stouped take vp carter wyth dagger wepyn gaue stroke vnto ye porter yt ne spake cryed soone myschyefe soon porter slayn ye ii sowdiours done one ra forth ye gate gaue sygne vnto lorde bressy whyche forthwith entred towne toke slewe suche made resystece wane short whyle ye castell towne slewe therin moche people toke many prysoners amonge whyche sayeth gagwyne lorde facounbrydge capytayne towne taken prysoner whan towne thus cautele frencheme terme trewis nat yet expyred tha labour made vnto french kynge restytucyon thys towne wronges done wynnyng ye whyche answered yf englysshemen wolde restore towne fogyers wyth harmys done frenchemen shulde restore thys towne wyth harmys treaty wherof daye metyng apoynted place called bouport tyme spente vayne bothe partyes ye metyng came none effecte takynge thys sayde towne fogyers ensuyed moche harme englysshmen occasyon whyche frenchemen gatte normandy page duplicate page duplicate anno dni miiiicxlviii anno dni miiiicxlix wyllyam cantlow stephyn browne grocer anno xxvii wyllyam marowe thys xxvii yere wytnesseth englysshe cronycle knyghte fraunce called syr lowys de bueyil chaleged esquyer englande named rauffe chalos certayne feetes warre whych approue daye theym gyuen mete towne fraunce named maunt maunce french kynge day present fortune chalos frendely ranne frenche knyghte thorugh wyth hys spere whereof sayde syr lowys shortly dyed chalons lyke charytable crysten man mourned hys enemy kepte hym hys obsequy ben hys carnall brother whych dede ye frech kyng greatly allowed boude lawe army anno dni miiiicxlix anno dni miiiicl wyllyam hulyn thomas chalton anno xxviii thomas canynges thys xxviii yere kynge callyd parlyaments westmynster whyche adiourned blacke freers london crystmas london agayne whyche passetyme shyp man west countre named roberte cane wyth fewe shyppes warre toke hole flete marchautes co mynge baye beynge ladyn wyth salte pruce holande zeland party flaunders broughte hampton made hys porte sale whyche pryse marchauntes goodes englad arested dyuers place flau ders bruges ipre good townes myghte nat haue sayd goodes deliuered tyll take appoyntemet paye sayd prise theyr hurtes damage contynuyng foresayd parlyamete duke suffolke arested sent prysoner content myndes vnto towre kept hys plesure moneth delyuered large dyscontented many menes myndes hym layde charge delyuery angeou mayne deth noble prynce humfrey duke glouceter thys grudge ensued rebellyon comons moche assembled theym sondry place made selfe capytaynes named blewe berde counter fayte name enteded haue gadered company anone kynges counsayll thereof warnyd layde taken putte dethe thanne foresayde parlyamente adiourned vnto leyceter whether came kynge wyth hym duke suffolke common common hous made requeste kyng suche persones consentynge laboured gyuynge ouer duchye angeou erledome mayn myght punisshed whiche offece gyltie accused foresayd duke suffolke lorde sey bysshop salysbury one danyell gentylman treuylyan appease comon hous duke exyled v yeres lord sey tresorer englande ye put parte whyle promysed sent vnto kynges gayoll warde duke obeynge ye sentence foresayde sped hym towarde ye see syde moneth apryl toke shyppynge northfolke enteding haue sayled frauce kepyng whiche course mette shyppe warre named nicholas tower whiche toke shyp wha ye capytayne ware duke anone toke hym owne shyp kept course towarde douer wha comen vnto rode anone caused hym confessed owne chaplayne done shypme put hym shypbote vpon syde bote one strake hed whiche hed body soone conueyed lade douer lefte vpon ye sandes sayd shypmen returned see agayne thus one myschefe ensued vpon dystruccyon noble lade vpon fyrst daye may deed corp foude vpon douer sandes conueyed restynge place yere also beynge yere lordes carnacyon xiiiic l iubile plenary pardon rome whiche englysshmen called yere grace yere towne norma dy named uernoyll taken ye treason frenche baker maner wherof loge wryte fynally came ye possession floquet rehersed great dystruccyon englysshmen ye trewes ended mortal warre executed vpon tyes englysshme vnto ye freche wrought moche myschyef dyuers wayes whiche loge wryte fore haue shewed sondry tymes losse turned euer last warde vpon ye englyssh tie seaso also ye townes noget pout andenere wonne erle saynt paule ye moneth iuny yereinsurreccio kent ye comons kent assebled great multitude chase capitayee named hym mortymer cosyn duke york named iak cade kept ye people wonderously togyder made suche ordenau ce amonge yt brought great nobre people vnto ye blak hethe deuysed byll peticios ye kyng ye cousayll shewed iniuryes oppressios poore comos suffred suche aboute ye kynge fewe sone nobre vnder coloure come aboue kynges cousayll seynge byll dysalowed cousayled kynge whiche vii day iuny gathered hi stroge hoste people go agayne rebelles gyue vnto batayll kynge sayd rebelles holde theyr felde vpon blak hethe vii dayes made towarde wherof heryng capytayne drewe backe people vyllage called seuenok enbatayled tha agreed ye kynges counsayll syr humfrey stafforde knyght wyllyam brother certayne gentylmen shulde folowe chase kyng lordes shuld retourne vnto grenewyche wenynge rebelles fledde gone shewed whan syr humfray copany drewe nere vnto seuenok wared ye capytayne abode people whan counsayledde gentylmen lyke manfull knyghte set vpon rebelles fought loge ende capytayne slewe hym brother many caused rest gyue backe al whiche season kynges hoste laye styll vpon blakhethe beyng amoge sondry opinion many fauoured capytayne fynally whan worde came ye ouerthrowe staffordes sayd playnly boldly excepte lorde saye rehersed comytted warde wolde take capytaynes partye appeasynge whiche rumour lorde saye put ye tower tha hande thanne kynge hauynge knowlege scomfyture men also rumour ostynge people remoued frome grenewyche london hoste rested hym whyle soone iak cade hadde thus ouercomen stafforde anone apparayled hi ye knyghtes apparayll dyd hym bryganders set gylte nayle salet gylte spore refresshed people returned agayne blakhethe pyght agayne feld tofore done laye nyne twenty daye iuny beynge saynte peter daye tyll fyrste day iuly whiche season came vnto hym archebysshop cantorbury duke bukkyngham whome longe co munycacyon fonde hym ryghte dyscrete answeres coude cause hi lay downe people submyt hym vnto kynges grace whyle kynge quene herynge encreasynge rebelles also lordes ferynge theyr owne seruautes lest wolde take capytaynes partie remoued frome london kyllyngworth leuynge ye cyte without ayde excepte onely lorde scale whiche lefte kepe tower hym manly warly man named mathewe fowth capytayne kente thus houynge blakhethe ende blynde people brynge hym fame kepte good iustyce heded pety capytayne named parys moch offended agayne suche ordynauce stablysshed hoste herynge yt kynge lordes thus departed drewe hym nere vnto ye cytie vpon fyrste day iuly entred bourgh southwarke beynge wednesday lodged hym nyght myght suffered entre cytie vpon day commos essex great nombre pyght theym felde vpon playne myles ende vpon seconde daye sayd moneth mayre called common counsayle gyldhall puruey withstandynge rebelles matyers whiche assemble dyuers opinion thought good sayde rebelles shulde receyued cytie otherwyse amonge whiche roberte horne stok fysshmonger beynge alderman spake sore agayne wolde haue entre whiche sayenges comons amoued agayn hym ceased tyll hym comytte warde afternoone aboute v clok capytayne people entred ye brydge wha came vpon drawe brydge hewe rope yt drewe brydge sondre swerde passed ye cytie made sondry place therof proclamacyons kynges name man peyne dethe shulde robbe take ony thyng parforce without payeng therfore reason wherof wanne many hertes comons cytie done begyle people shall euydently appere rode thorough dyuers stretes cytie came london stone strake swerde sayd mortymer lorde cytie whan thus shewed hymselfe dyuers place cytie shewed mynde ye mayre ye ordrynge people returned southwarke abode hadde done people comynge goynge lawfull houres whan wolde vpon morne beynge thyrde daye iuly frydaye sayd capytayne entred agayne cytie caused lorde sey fet frome tower ladde vnto guyldhall areygned mayre ye kynges iustyce whiche passe tyme entended haue brought ye sayd iustyces foresayd robert horne wyfe frendes made hym suche instaut labour fynally vc marke set lybertye lorde sey beynge sayde guyldhall desyred yt myght iudged peer wherof herynge capytayne sent company vnto hall whiche parforce toke hym offycers brought hym vnto standarde chepe halfe shryuen strake hed yt done pyght log pole bare aboute tyme season capytayne caused gentylman taken named cromer whiche ben shyreffe kent vsed sayde extorcyons cause fauoured lorde sey reason maried doughter haryed myles ende ye capitaynes presence byheded ye tyme ther also byheded man called baylly ye cause whose dethe haue herd men reporte baylly ye famylyer olde acqueyntaunce iak cade wherfore soone espyed hym comynge hym warde cast mynde wolde dyscouer lyuyng olde maners shewe vyle kynne lynage wherfore knowynge yt sayd baylly vsed vere scrowes prophecyes aboute hym shewyng copany yt enchaunter yll dysposycion yt shulde well knowe bokes bare vpon hym bad serche yf founde sayde yt tha shuld put hym dethe whiche doone accordynge co maundment whan thus heded ii men toke hede croumer pyght vpon pole entred cytie hedes lorde sey croumer passed stretes ioyned pole togyder caused eyther deed mouthe kysse dyuers many tymes capytayne selfe daye wente vnto house phylyppe malpas draper alderman robbeb spoyled house toke then great substaunce warned therby conueyed moche money plate elles ben vndone whiche spoylynge present many poore men cytie whiche suche tymes ben euer redy place harme suche ryottes ben doone tha towarde nyght returned southwarke vpon ye morne reentred ye cytie dyned daye place saynt margaret patyns parysshe called gherstys hous whan dyned lyke vncurteyse gest robbed hym daye malpas ii robberyes porayll nedy people drewe vnto hym partyners yll honest thryfty comoners cast theyr myndes sequele matyer fered leste shulde delte lyke maner meane wherof lost people fauour hertes thought yf executed robbery myghte haue gone ferre brought purpose good effecte yf hadde entended well deme presuppose entent hym good wherfore myght come ony good conclusyon ye mayre alderman assystence worshypfull comeners seynge mysdeanour ye capytayne sauegardynge themselfe cytye toke theyr counsayles myght dryue capytayne adheretes ye cytie wherin theyr feare moche kynge lordes theyr power farre theym yet aduoydynge apparet peryl condyscended wolde withstande entre cytie performauce wher ye mayre sent vnto lorde scale mathewe gowgth hauynge tower gydynge assent perfourme ye vpon v day iuly ye capytayne beynge southwarke caused heded cause dyspleasure hym doone fame went kepte hym southwarke ye day myght haue entred cytie yf wold whan nyght comynge mayre cytezyns mathewe gowth lyke theyr former appoynmtent kepte passage ye brydge beynge sonday defended kentysshe whiche made great force reenter cytie capytayne seynge bykerynge begon yode harneys called people aboute hym set fyersly vpon cytezyns draue backe ye stulpes southwarke brydge fote vnto ye drawe brydge defendynge wherof many man drowned slayne amonge yt whiche men name iohan sutton alderma mathewe gouth gentylman roger heysande cytezyn thus contynued skyrmysshe nyght tyll ix clocke vpon morne somtyme cytezyns better thus soone kentysmen vpon better syde euer kepte vpon brydge cytezyns passed neuer moche bulwarke byrdge fote ye kentysshme moche ferther tha drawe brydge thus cotynuyng cruel fyght dystruccyon moche people bothe sydes lastly kentysshmen put worse trewe agreed certayne houres duryng whiche trewe archebysshop cantorbury chaunceler englande sent generall pardon capytayne hymselfe hys peple reason wherof hys company departed nyght southwarke retourned euery man hys owne thende iacke cade nat longe capytayne wyth hys copany thus departed proclamacyons made dyuers place kent southsex sowtherey myghte take foresayde iak cade lyue dede shulde haue marke hys trauayle whych proclamacion thus publisshed getylma ket named alexander iden awayted hys tyme toke hym gardyn sussex takyng hym sayd iak slayne beynge dede brought southwarke daye moneth left kynges benche nyght vpon morowe dede corp drawen thorugh hyghe stretes cytye vnto new gate heded quartered whose hede sent londo brydge iiii quarter sent iiii sondry townes kent thys done kyng sent hys commission kent rode hym selfe caused enquery made thys riot caunterbury viii men iuged put deth good townes kent southsex dyuers put execucyon ryot thys yere also west cou tree slayne bisshop salysbury common coutrebyshop salysbury ayne wherfore kyng sped besynesse kent sussex rode thyder se also malefactours punysshed anno dni miiiicl anno dni miiiicli iohn myddylton nycholas wyfforde grocer anno xxix wyllyam dere thys xxix yere vpo sait leonardes daye vi daye nouembre began parlyamente westmynster fyrste day decebre folowyng duke somerset whyche newly commyn normandy putte vnder arest goodes comons fowly dyspoyled borne waye blak fryer season moche people cytie reason parlyament specially lordes seruauntes whyche awaytynge vppon theyr lordes maysters great multytude ye shall vnderstande ye temporall lord dayes kepte maner housholdes maner reteyndour housholde seruauntes nombre ferre excedynge lordes dayes done wherefore parlyament tymes great counsayles cytyes townes assembled hougely stuffed wyth people thys ryot thys commytted vpon morowe folowynge proclamacyon made thorugh cytye man shulde spoyle robbe vppon payne dethe day stadarde chepe beheded brekyng sayd proclamacio thus bego rumour malyce spryng betwene ye lord lade specially ye duke somerset ye quenes cousayll great hatered ye losig normady wherof ye chief citie roa lost gyue vp apointemet ye yere precedyng witnesseth gaguynus vpon codycyon duke somerset wyfe englyssh sowyours shulde suche goodes myghte cary departe frely ye cytie whiche fre passage shulde pay vnto ye frenche kynge lvim scute amoute xiiiim marke sterlyng also bounde delyuer frenche kynges possession townes castelles daye possessyon englysshemen within duchy normandy performaunce whiche couenauntes lorde talbot set one pledge one floquet named sayd townes castelles hym frenche kynges vse receyued harflete onely excepted wherof ye capytayne named cyrson curson denyed delyuery assystence one named syr thomas auryngham whiche despyte frenche kynges power layde bothe see lande helde begynnynge decembre tyll moneth ianuary lacke rescouse gaue vp appoynment ye begynnynge mayres yere yeldynge vp normandy moche dyspleasure grewe vnto quene counceyll moche yt duke yorke father vnto kyng edwarde iiii many lordes hym allyed toke partye agayne hyr counsayll mortall warre therof ensued story wall appere anno dni miiiicli anno dni miiiiclii mathewe phylyp wyllyam gregory skynner anno xxx chrystofer warton thys xxx yere xvi daye february kynge beyng accompanied duke somersette many lordes toke theyr iournay towarde marchys walys moche credibly assertayned yt duke york assysted dyuers lordes name partyes gathered great strengthe people entrynge lande helde iourney towarde hym whan ye duke wytyng kynges great power swaued way kynges hoste toke way towarde london receyued knowlege cytie yt myght receyued refresshe hym people therwith went ouer kyngstone brydge kente vpon hethe called brente heth pyght felde wherof kynge houynge knowlege sped hym lastly came vnto blacke hethe pyght felde bothe hostes beynge thus enbatayled meidacio made peace twene hostes furtheraunce wherof duke sente ye bysshoppes wynchester ely erles salysbury warwyke whome answered sayd duke yt none company entended none hurte vnto kynges persone counsayll beynge louers ye comon weale hym lande entet purpose remoue hym fewe euyll disposed persones whose meanes ye comon people greuously opressed comynaltye greatly enpouerysshed whiche named principall duke somerset whome fynally agreed kyng shulde comytted warde abyde answere vnto suche artycles duke yorke wolde lay agayne hym upon whych promesse made kyng fyrst day marche beyng thursdaye duke brake vp hys felde came vnto ye kynges tente cotrary former promyse made fade duke somerset chefe awayter next vnto kyng tha ye duke yorke sence londo holden somedeale maner prisoner streyghter shuld haue ben kepte ne ben tydynges whych dayely sprage syr edwarde hys sonne tha erle ye march commyng toward london wyth stronge power welche men march whych fered quene hyr counsayl ye duke lyberted go wolde departed vnto hys owne countrey peace dyssymuled wyth feyned loue whyle ann odni miiiiclii anno dni miiiicliii rychard lee godfrey feyldynge anno xxxi rychard alley thys xxxi yere ye kynge helde solempne feest westmyster vpon xii day cristmas created ii erles whyche hys bretherne vpo mother syde quene katheryne deth kynge henry v maryed vnto knyghte walys named dwayne whych begate vpo hyr forsayd ii sonnes wherof one thys sayd daye created erle rychemout named sir edmonde yoger called syr iasper creat erle penbroke whych lastly created duke bedforde souerayne lorde kyng hery vii dyed marche folowyng witnesseth gaguyne towne herf ewe wonne frechmen soone cytye bayons gyue vp appoyntment souldyours shuld leue theyr armoure behynde euery woman beyng grauted horse ryde vpon euery horse x scute pay theyr costes euery fote man v wythout theym taken thys yere kynge laye longe syke claryngdowne great ieopardye hys lyfe ye ende thys mayres yere begynnynge xxxii yere kyng meane vpon day traslacyon saynt edwarde ye xiii day octobre ye quene westmynster delyuered fayre prynce whyche greate reioysyng gladnesse made sundry place englande specyallye wythin cy ye london expressemente cyrcumstaunce wolde longe leysoure vtter thys prynce beynge wyth honour reuerence sacred crystened named edwarde grew perfight good lye personage lastly edward fourthe slayne tewkysburye feelde shall shewed whose noble mother susteyned nat lytle dysclaunder obloquy comon peple sayeng nat naturall sonne kynge henry chaunged cradell hyr greate dyshonour heuynesse ouer passe thys yere also whyche yere grace miiii cliii mahumet tha prynce turkes moneth iuny iiii daye sayde moneth beynge thyrde yere hys empyre reygne l dayes co tynuall assaute innumerable multytude turkes cytye constatyne noble excedyng force crueltye made excercysedconstanty noble conquered turkes wan opteyned domynyo rule greate hynderauce shame crystendome enhaucynge power myghte sayd turkes excedynge noumber men woman chyldren cytye daye slayne wyll speke great dyuersyte haue seen wryters amonge whyche emperour named paleogolus many noble cytye beynge taken lyue tha behedyd many preste relygyous man put vnto deth sundry cruell turmentes whych great crueltye wyth many longe reherce put execucyon commau dement passed sayde emperoure turkes chyldren beynge aboue age vi yeres well men woman kynde shulde streyght put vnto deth whyche wryters excedyd nomber iiiim tydeousnesse lamentable processe whyche myghte shewe rehersall abomynacyon moste dampnable accursyd turkys done vnto crucyfyxe image chyrches temple wythin cytye cease paynefull rede paynefull sorowfull fayth chryst shulde vyle maner dyspysed anno dni miiiicliii anno dni miiiicliiii draper iohn walden iohn norman anno xxxii thomas cooke thys xxxii yere iohn norman foresayd vpo morowe symonde iudys day accustomyd day whan newe mayre vsyd yerely tyde wyth greate pope vnto westminster take charge mayre fyrste mayres brake auncyent olde cotynued custome rowed thyther water whiche ye waterman made hym roundell songe hys great prayse yt whiche began rowe ye bote norman rowe thy lemma forth wyth longe processe ye haue remebraunce xxx yere thys kyng shewed apoyntement taken bytwene sayd kyng ye duke yorke brent heth apoyntement sayde soone broken set nought reason wherof greate enuye dyscencyon grewe bytwene ye kynge dyuers hys lordes specyally bytwene quenes counseyll duke yorke hys blode contrary ye kynges promyse meanes quene whiche bare ye cure charge land duke somerset sette large made capytayne caleys greate rule kynge dayes hadde wherwyth onely noble land grudgyd also comons whyche hys counsayll ruler fame went susteyned many greuous imposycyons charge thys fyre rancour enuye ye space xvii xviii monethes smokynge brennynge vnder couert dyssymulacyon day brake greate hote flamys open warre wrath mych duke yorke beynge march walys called hym yt erlys warwyke salysbury wyth many honorable knyghtes esquyres gathered stroge hoste people moneth apryll toke iourney towarde london kynge tha beynge wyth greate retynewe lordes wherof quene lordes aduertysed duke comynge greate power anone cast theyr myndes none theyr profytes yt possyble haste myght gathered authoryte kynges comyssyons strength coulde haue entended haue conueyed kyng westwarde haue encountred duke yorke execucyon purpose kynge accopanyed hym duke somerset buckyngham ye erlys stafforde northumberlande lorde elyfforde many noble men realme departed vpon xx daye maye westmynster helde hys iourney towarde saynte albonys duke yorke hauynge knowlege kynges departynge london costed countrees came vnto ende saynt albons vppon xxiii daye maye foresayde beyuge thursday whytsondaye whyle meanes treaty peace comonyd vppon one party ye erle warwyke wyth marche men entryd towne vppon ende foughte egerly agayne ye kynges people contynued fyght longe season conclusyon ye vyctory fell duke yorke party myche slayne duke somerset erle northumberlande lorde clyfforde wyth many hono ble men knyghtes esquyers whose name tedious write whyche victory thus opteyned duke honour reuerence vpon morne folowynge conueyed kynge agayne london lodged hym bysshoppe london palays soone thereupon called parlyament holden westmynster authoryte wherof ye duke yorke made protectour englande erle salesbury chauncellour erle warwyke capytayne caleys suche person authoryte nere aboute kynge clerely amoued putte quene hyr counsayle dayes ruled vtterly sette parte concernynge rule kynge ye lande whych contynued whyle shall apere yere also affermeth frenche cronycle mysery vnkyndnesse thus reygnynge englande lord talbot beyng normandy defendynge kynges garysos beset french men place named castillyon strongely assayled longe cruell fyghte hys sonne nomber xl men name viii hudreth englysshe soudyours myserably slayne many mo taken prysoners anno dni miiiicliiii anno dni miiiiclv iohn felde stephan forster anno xxxiii wyllyam taylour thys xxxiii yere henry ye vi certayne euyll dysposed persones beynge sentuary men within saynt marten graunde issued ye sayde place frayed cytesyns hurt maymed done reentred seintuary wherewyth common beyng amoued certeyne ruler cytie entred sayd sayntwary force pulled occasyoners sayde fraye commytted prysone mater deane saynte marten suche fauoured hym greuous complaynt made vnto kynge hys counsayle ye mayre cytesyns dyscharge wherof recorder citie wyth certeyne alderman hym assygned sente vnto kyng lyeng ye castell egle herford shyre mater duly debated ye kynges cousayll letter commendacyon retournyd vnto mayre wyllynge hym kepe sayde person sauely tyll kynges comynge london whyche season entended haue ye mater clerely examyned anno domin miiiiclv anno domini miiiiclvi grocer iohn yonge wyllyam marowe anno xxxiiii thomas dulgraue yere moneth may italyans seruaunt walked thorough chepe wyth dagger hangynge hys gyrdell wherof mercer seruaunt tyme ben italy chalengyd punysshed werynge lyke wepen chalenged straunger questioned bold bere warrely wepyn consyderynge straunger natyue countrey also knowynge countre straunger shuld suffered bere lyke wepyn whyche questyon suche answere made italyan mercer toke dagger fro hym brake vppon hede strauger thus beyng delte complayned hym vnto mayre yt whiche vpon morowe folowyng kepynge court guyldhall sent yonge man answere made vnto complaynt agrement full courte alder men sent sayde mercer vnto pryson thys court fynysshed rumour harde amonge seruauntes ye mercery two sheryffes toke way homeward thorough chepe whan nere vnto thende saint lawrece lane toward chepe met wyth suche multytude mercer seruautes coulde passe ought myghte speke tyll hadde co trarye hys wylle mynde delyuered yonge man commytted hym brethern warde forthwith delyuered thys thus done rumour sprange therof lyghtely aboute town mych amonge many cytesyns construed thys done assent maysters housholders mercery ye entet haue straungers punysshed myche toke greate lyuynge reason theyr vtteraunce cloth golde sylkes estate lordes realme vnto men honeste vacabodes loked pylfry ryfflynge great occasyon styrynge appered well afternone sodeynly assembled multytude rascall poore people cytye whyche wythout hede guyde ranne vnto certayne italyans place specyally vnto florentynes lukessys uenicyans toke spoyled theyr place myghte fynde dyd greate hurte sundry place moste iiii house stadyng bredstrete ward wherof thre stode saynt barthelomewys parysshe lytle one saynte benettes parysshe moch wolde haue done bene spedy ayde mayre alderman worshypfull comoners cytye whyche wyth dylygence resysted toke dyuers robbed sent theym newgate fynally wyth shedyng blode maymyng dyuers cytesyns rumour people appeasyd whan yonge man begynner thys busynesse sawe inconuenyence ensue hys wantonesse counsayll otherwyse feryng sequell mater yode streyght vnto westmynster taried sayntwary man tyll mater endyd longe duke buckyngham iustyces noble men sent kynge cytye charged mayre vertue commyssyo yt enquery shulde made ryot vertue sayde comyssyon called oyer determyner day kepte guyldhall vpon day moneth sayde daye sat iudges ye mayre kynges lyeutenaut ye duke buckyngham vpo ryght hande ye chyefe iustyce vppon ye lefte hande wyth many men name whyche passe ouer whyle mayre sayd lordes callyng panel enquestes ye guyldhall comoners cytie beyng cotent order many secretely armed theyr house enteded comon fame went haue ruge bow bell haue reysed gathered ye comynalty cytye force haue delyuered person ye robbery commytted warde thys mater discretely handeled cousayll labour dyscrete comoners whyche appeased theyr neyghbours wyse fyry haste quenchyd came none effecte sauyng ye word brought vnto duke buckyngham comynalty cytye harnysse yf taryed longe lordes shuld great ieopardy whyche vntrew tidinges beyng fered hastely toke leue ye mayre de ted vnto hys lodgyng ceasyd ye enquery ye day upo morow much ye mayre vndersta dynge ye secrete murmur commauded como counsayle wardeyns felysshyppys apere vpo morow guyldhall recorder kinges name mayer hys lyeutenaunt comauded euerych wardeins none folowynge eyther shuld assemble hys hoole felisshyp theyr propre hallys gyue euery cytezyn streyght commaundemente euery man see entende see kynges peace cytye yf fynde person maketh reasonynge wherby myght coceyue espye fauoured gatherynge companyes delyuerey suche persones warde sayd wardeyns shuld fayre wordes exorte hym beste sygne token therof shewynge secretly co bryng name name hym vnto mayre meane whych polycy good order cytesyns brought suche quyetnes day foresayd enquery duely pursued iii persones sayde ryot put execucyon hanged tybourne whereof ii wryters seyntwarye men saynt martyns thyrd shypma boteman quene wyth certeyne lordes whyche fauoured partye dysdayned sore rule whyche duke yorke bare specyally sayde duke bare ye name protectour whych argued kynge insuffycyent gouerne realme whyche thoughte great dyshonour kynge realme wherefore made suche meanes wan hyr polycy frendshyp diuerse ye lordes bothe spyrytuall temporall caused ye duke yorke dyscharged hys protectourshyp erle salysbury hys chauncellershyp cause newe warre shall appere anno dni miiiiclvi anno dni miiiiclvii grocer iohn stewarde thomas canynges anno xxxv raufe uerney thys yere begynnynge quene suspectynge cytye london demyd fauourable vnto ye duke yorkes partye hyrs caused ye kynge remoue lodon vnto couentre helde hym log season whyche tyme duke yorke sent thyther pryuey seale also erle salesbury erle warwyke couyne quene iii great daunger howe monys shemet theyr frendes escaped soone sayd duke erle went northe erle warwyke wyth goodly companye sayled vnto calays shortly taken eryth wythin xii myles london iiii woderfull fysshys whereof one called mors maryne secode sword fisshe ii whalys whyche exposytours pronostycacyons warre trouble ensue soon yere also great fray northe countrey betwene lord egremode sonnes erle salysbury diuers maymed slayen betwene ende lord egremonde taken howe dome kynges counsayll otherwyse sayd lorde egremode founden suche defaute fynally condempned great summes money payed vnto sayd erle salysbury lack payment whereof puttynge suertye sayde lorde egremonde comytted newgyte contynued certayne tyme brake prysone escapyd thre prysoners greate charge sheryffes longe dyscencyon vnkyndnesse fell bytwene yonge duke somerset syr iohn neuyll sonne vnto erle salysbury beynge bothe lodged wythin cytye wherof mayre beyng warned ordeyned watch prouysyos yf thynge styrred able haue subdued bothe partyes haue put warde tyll knowe kynges farther pleasure wherof frendes bothe partyes beynge ware laboured meanes agreed tyme thys also testyfye englyshe cronycle also french nauye flote frenchemen landyd sandwyche spoyled robbed towne excercysed greate crueltye whych flote capytayne frenche knyght named french boke syr guyllyain de pomyers thys yere opynyon dyuers wryters began cytye almayne named magounce crafte enprentynge bokes whyche sen tyme hath wonderfull encreace experyence thys daye proueth yere also prysoners newgate neglygence theyr kepers brake theyr wardes toke ledys towre defendyd longe whyle agayne sheryffes theyr offycers myche forced call ayde cytesyns cytye whose ayde lastly subdued put ye sayd prysoners streyghter kepyng cronica cronicaru sayth thys tyme suche erthquake ye prouynce naples byforce therof perysshed ouer xlm crysten soulys abouesayde spoylynge sandwyche speketh polycronycon sayeth syr pyers de bresy sene shall normandy wyth capytayne depe many capytaynes fraunce came wyth greate stronge nauy downys nyght vpon morowe came certeyne vnto sandwych spoyled robbed towne toke great prayes many ryche prysoners wherby whych sayenge appereth dyuersyte bytwene englysshe wryters frenche anno dni miiiiclvii anno dni miiiiclviii mercer wyllyam edwarde godfrey boleyn anno xxxvi thomas reyner thys yere thyrde daye december reynolde pecoke beynge bysshoppe chychester lambyth archebysshop cot diuyns abiured heretyke hys bokes brent poulys crosse hym selfe kepte mewe euer whyle lyued soone appease thys rancoure malyce bytwene quene tother lorder daye metynge appoynted kyng london whyther duke yorke wyth lordes commaunded come certayne daye obeynge commaundement duke yorke came vnto london xxvi daye ianuary lodged baynardes castell hym xv day ianuary came erle salysbury londo lodged hys place called erber soone came vnto lodon duke somerset exetyr lodged bothe without temple barre lykewyse erle northu berlande lorde egremonde yoge lorde clyfforde came vnto cytye lodged subbarbes xiiii daye february came erle warwyke calays wyth great bande men arayed rede iakettes whyte ragged staues vpon theym lodged ye gray freres lastly saye xvii daye marche kyng quene wyth great retynewe came vnto londo lodged bysshoppe londos palays ye shall vnderstade wyth foresayd lordes came greate companyes moche som vic vc leest iiiic wherfore mayrea good longe kyng lordes lay thus citie dayly harnesse vm cytesyns rode dayly citie subbarbes ye se kynges peace kept nyghtly prouyded iim harnesse gyue attendauce vpon iii alderman kepe nyghte watche tyll vii clocke vppon morowe tyll day watche assembled reason whereof good ordre rule kepte man hardy one attempte brekynge kynges peace durynge thys watche great counsayl holde ye kyng hys lordes reason wherof dyssymuled vnyte concorde betwene concluded token ioy wherof king quene ye sayd lordes vpon lady day annuciacion lent poulys wente solemply processyon soone euery lorde departed hys pleasure moneth folowynge greate fray flete strete betwene courte inhabytauntes sayd strete whyche fray gentylman beyng ye quenes attourney slayne vpon thursdaye whytsonweke duke somerset antony ryuers iiii kepte iustes peace quene within towre london agayne thre esquyers quenes lyke maner grenewych sonday folowynge vpon trynyty sonday monday folowynge certayne shyppes apperteynyng vnto erle warwyke mette wyth floote spanyardes long cruel fyghte toke vi theym laden wyth iron marchaundyse drowned chased noumber xxvi nat without shedyng blod bothe partyes englyshmen slayne c many mo wounded sore hurt thys yere auctours marchaunte brystowe named sturmyn whyche wyth hys shyppe trauayled dyuers partyes leuaunte partyes gest moche ranne vpon hym gotten grene pepyr specys haue sette sowen englande fame wente therefore ianuayes wayted hym vppon see spoylyd hys shyppe full lyke vntrew ianuayes shulde spoyle hym suche cause nacyon englande delyth lytle wyth spycys thys cause trouth nacyo fece done whyche marchauntes ianuayes london arested comytted ye flete tyll found en suffycyent suer tye answere premysses fynally harmys whyche theyr nacyon done sayde sturmyn thys realme vim marke sette theyr payne paye howe payed mencyon fynde thys yere also made ordynaunce auctorytie ye kynge hys counsayll orderynge seyntwary men wythin saynte martyns graunde whereof artycles length sette oute ye boke k wythin chaumbre guylde hall leefe ccxcix wherof execucyon obseruynge necessary vsed pyte fewe poyntes ben exercysed anno dni miiiiclviii anno dni miiiiclix draper rafe iosselyn thomas scotte anno xxxvii rycharde nedeham thys yere aboute feeste candelmasse forsayd dissymulyd loueday hagyng small threde betwene quene yt fore named lordes expressed precedynge yere kynge many lordes thanne beynge westmynster stray happened fall betwene seruaunt kynges seruaunt erles warwyke hurt kynges seruaunt escaped wherefore kynges meynial seruauntes seynge myghte nat auenged vpo partye thus hurt theyr felowe sayde erle warwyke commynge fro cousayll goynge towarde hys barge kynges seruautes came vnwarely vppon hym rabbysshely cooky theyr spyttys offycers wyth wepyns came runnyng madde men entendynge haue slayne hym yt escaped wyth greate daunger toke hys barge haste rowed london nat wythout great maymys hurtys receyued many hys seruauntes thys old ra cour malyce whyche neuer clerely cured anon bega breke oute moche quenes cousayll wolde haue sayd erle arested committed vnto towre wherfore shortly departed toward warwyke polycy purchased soone commyssio kyng yode sayled vnto calays thanne encreased thys olde malyce moche quene hyr cousayll sawe myght nat auenged vppo erle vnto calays departed malygned agayne hys father erle salysbury imagened myght brought lyfe processe tyme rydynge towarde salysbury som hys lodgyng towarde london lorde audeley wyth strog company assygned mete wyth hym prysoner bryng hym vnto londo whereof sayde erle beynge warned gathered vnto hym mo men kepyng hys iourney mette wyth sayd lord audeley place called bloreheth companyes ran together stroge keryng wherof ende erle vyctoure slewe lorde audeley many hys retynew thys skyrmys ii sonnes sayd erle sore wouded named sir thomas syr iohn whyche shortly goynge homeward quenys party taken prysoners sente vnto chestry whan thys knowen vnto ye duke yorke lordes hys party knewe understode yf uyded nat shortly remedy selfe shulde destroyed one assent gathered stroge hoste men marche men moneth octobre yt begynnyng xxxviii yere reygne kynge henry later ende thys mayres yere drewe towarde kynge entent remoue fro hym persones thought enemyes vnto commo weale englande quene hyr counsayll heryng entent strength lordes caused kyng haste sende forthe comyssyons gather people shorte whyle kyng strongely accopanyed spedde hym vppon hys iourney warde duke yorke hys company wherof heryng ye sayd duke tha beyng wyth hys peple nere vnto towne ludlowe pyghte sure stroge feelde none hys foe myght vppon parte entre lyeng came frome calays erle warwyke wyth stronge bande amonge whyche andrewe trollop many ye best souldiours calays duke thus kepynge hys feelde vpon one party kyng wyth hys people vpon vpon nyght precedyng daye bothe hostes shulde haue met forenamed andrewe trolloppe wyth chefe soudyours calays secretly departed frome ye duke hoste wente vnto kynges ioyously receyued wha thys thynge duke lordes asserteyned therewhyth sore dysmayed specyally sayd lordes sayd andrew shewed hoole theyr entente whych thanne knewe well shuld clerelye dyscouered vnto theyr enemyes wherfore cousayll remedye taken concluded flee leue feelde standyng ben presente styll abydyng incontynently sayd duke wyth hys twoo sonnes persones fledde towarde walys then passed sauely irelande erles salysbury marche warwyke wyth secrete company also departed toke waye deuonshyre squyer named iohan dynham whyche lorde hyghe tresourer englande lastlye henry vii dayes xvi yere hys reygne dyed bought shyp c x markes leuen score noble shyppe sayd lordes went sayled gerneley wha seaso soiourned refresshed selfe departed then begynnyng nexte mayres yere shalbe clerely shewed uppon morowe whan thys couyne knowen kynge lordes vpon hys party sendynge runynge wyth spede towarde euery cooste take lordes none myght foude forthwith kyng rode vnto ludlowe dyspoyled towne castell sente duchesse yorke wyth hyr chyldren vnto duchesse buckyngha hyr syster rested loge anno dni mcccclix anno dni mcccclx fysshemonger hohn plummer wyllyam hulyn anno xxxviii iohn stocker thys yere meane vppon fryday next ensuyng alhalowen day sayde erles salysbury marche warwyke said refresshed ile gernesey vpo fryday foresayd laded calays posterne theyr fredes ioyously receyued tha anon vpon foresayd lordes proclaymed rebellys traytours yonge duke somerset made capitayne calays wherfore haste made purueyaunce saylyd thyther take possessyon ye town fayled hys purpose foresayde erles beynge kept ye towne myght haue rule natwythstandyng shewed kynges letter patetys wyth many strayght commau dementes kynge whyche cause sayd duke yode vnto guynys helde hym seaso anone sayd duke la ded shypmen brought hym thyther good wyll owed vnto erle warwyke coueyed theyr shippes streyght calays hauen brought wyth certayne persones named genyn fenbyll iohn felowe kayles purser whyche enemyes vnto sayde erle warwyke whyche presented vnto lordes soone wythin sayd towne calays beheded thys rumoure thus contynuynge dayly came vnto lordes greate socoure englade vppon partye duke sayd lyeng castel guynes gate vnto hym ayde strengthe souldyours made skyrmysshed wyth calays many sundry tymes whych assautes many slayen hurte vppon partyes moste wekyd duke partye lordes lost many men yet dayly came thycke dyuers partyes englade theyr losse nat espyed wantyd money maynteyn theyr dayly charge remedy wher shyfted wyth staple calays xviiimli whyche summes money whan receyued ye sayd lordes one assent made ouer ye forenamed mayster iohn dynham wyth stronge company sent hym vnto sandwyche wynne ye kynges nauye lyenge thynges theyr nedes necessary whyche sped hym suche wyse toke lord ryuers hys bedde wanne town toke lord scalys sonne vnto sayd lord riuers ryche prayes tooke kynges nauy shyppes lyked retourned vnto calays nat without consent agremet many ye mariner whych owyd theyr synguler fauours vnto erle warwyke thys iourney sayde iohan dynham sore hurt may med vpon legge haltyd whyle lyued iourney thus acheuyd sayd lordes tayled maned sayd shyppes sent wyth chefe capytayne erle warwyke irelande speke wyth duke yorke haue hys counsayll mater co cerning theyr charge reentre lande wha happelye sped hys nedys retourned towarde calays bryngyng wyth hym hys mother coutesse salysbury also kepte hys course tyll came west coutrey tyme duke gretyr admyrall see wyth competet nouber shyppes well ned moche erle warwyke prouyded haue gyuen batayll vnto sayd duke yf hadde made coutenaunce toward duke harde suche murmure speche amoge hys owne company whych fouded vnto erle warwykes fauoure thoughte vnto hys profyte suffre hym passe fight thys cause ye commo fame runeth vppo loge wryte certayn trouth sayd erle passed wythout fyghte came sauete calays thys passe tyme parliament great cousayll holde couentre auctoryte whereof duke yorke foresayde lordes wyth many attaynted theyr lades goodes seased kynges vse surer defece shuld nat efte lande ket prouisio made defende haues portys vppon see syde sandwyche ordeyned new stregthe wyth capitayn named syr symode mou forde ouer thys prouision ordeyned marchaut passyng costys flauders shulde passe go calays fere shuld come ye ayde sayd lordes thys prouysyon natwythstandyng comfort sent dayly englad lordes herynge thys prouysyon made vppo see syde wythstade theyr ladynge sent company vnto sadewyche whych skyrmysshed wyth sayd syr symode mountforde ende toke hym broughte hym vnto ryse banke smote hys hede foresayd lordes cosyderynge strengthe whych wyth manyfolde frendes hartys sundry place englad condysceded sayle englande bryng theyr entet purpose whych comon fame went put parte frome kynge suche persones enemyes comon weale lade thys bryng aboute set towne calays order sure kepyng toke shyppynge sayled englade landed douer thes helde theyr iourney thorughe kente came londo ii daye iuly refresshed theym theyr people departed thense sped theym towarde kynge ye tyme theyr ladynge couentry gathered people came vnto paragraph northampton pyght hys felde wherof sayd lordes beynge enfourmed sped thytherward vpo ix day iuly bothe hostys mette foughte cruell batayll long fyght victory fell vnto erle salysbury lordes vpo partye kynges hoste sparcled chased many hys noble men slayen amoge whyche duke buckynghan erle shrowsbury ye vycout beaumoud lorde egremode wyth many knyghtes esquyers kyng taken felde whych victory thus lordes opteyned goodly haste retourned vnto londo broughte wyth kynge kepyng hys estate lodged hym bysshop londo palays spedye knowelege sent premysses vnto ye duke yorke yet beyng irelade parlyamet name kyng called holden westmynster durynge whych parlyament ye duke yorke came vnto westmynster vpo frydaye saynte edwardes day x day october lodged hym kynges palays wherof anone arose noyse thorugh cytye kynge henry shuld deposed duke yorke shulde kynge uppo thys parlyamente thus contynuynge duke came one daye parlyament chaumber boldely beyng lordes present sette hym downe kynges sete sittynge made pretence clayme vnto crown affermyng hys ryghtfull enherytauce certayn bolde wordes iustyfyenge wherewyth lordes presente greatly dysmayed thys great many opynions moued among lordes howe aswell dyuers hys frendes mynde shuld nat admytted kynge duryng lyfe kyng henry appeasynge wherof many great cousayles kepte aswell blacke freres westmynster whych tyme season quene wyth suche lordes hyr affynyte helde north coutrey assembled theym greate strengthe kynges name ende subdue sayde kynges rebelles enemyes thus contynuynge thys vnkyndenesse betwene kynge duke season bothe kynge bothe lodged within palays westmynster yet wolde natte prayer instaunce one bysyte kynge see hym tyll counsayll concluded vppon fynall ende concernyug thys greate matter whyche continued full terme mayres yere anno dni miiiiclx anno dni miiiiclxi grocer rycharde flemynge rycharde lee anno xxxix iohn lambarde thys yere whyche begynnynge xxxlx yere kyng henryes reygne meane vpo euyn sayntes laste day october condyscended lordes spyrytuall temporall hole auctoryte sayd parliament kyng hery shuld cotynue reygne kynge durynge hys naturall lyfe hys deth hys sonne prynce edwarde sette parte duke yorke hys heyres kynges incontynentely duke admytted protectour reget lade yf tyme kynge hys owne free wyll mynde dysposed resygne gyue vp rule lade tha shulde resigne vnto duke yf lyued none hys heyres hys dayes wyth many mater couencyos whyche tedious wryte whyche conclusyons mannes wytte myght assuryd parfourmaunce theym whanne tyme requyred parfyghted kynge wyth duke many lordes tha present came nyght poulys harde euynsong vppon morow came thyther agayn masse kyng yode procession crowned wyth great royalte lay styll ye bysshoppes palays season vppon saterdaye folowynge beyng ix daye nouember duke proclaymed throughe cytye heyre paraunt vnto crowne englade hys progeny hym moche quene margarete accompanyed price edwarde hyr sonn duke somerset excetyr diuers lordes helde hyr northe aboue sayd wolde nat come kynges sendyng therefore agreed lordes tha london presence duke yorke shulde take wyth hym erle salysbury wyth certayne people fetche sayde quene lordes abouesayde whyche duke erle departed londo theyr people vpon secode daye december spedde theym northwarde wherof quene hyr lordes beynge ware hauyng wyth theym greate strength northernemen mette wyth duke yorke vppon xxx daye december nere vnto towne northe called wakelfeld betwene foughten sharpe fyghtthe whych duke yorke slayne wyth hys sonne called erle rutlande syr thomas neuyll sonne vnto erle salysbury wyth many erle salysbury taken lyue wyth dyuerse whanne lordes vppon quenes partye gotten thys vyctory anone sente theyr prysoners vnto pountfreyte whyche behedyd meane erle salysbury man london named iohn narowe capytayne named hason whose heddes sente vnto yorke sette vppon gate whan quene hadde opteynyd thys vyctory wyth retynewe drewe toward london tyme duryng troublous season greate watchys kepte dayely nyghtelye dyuerse opynions amonge citesyns mayre many chefe comoners helde vppon quenes partye comynaltie duke yorke hys affynyte whanne tydynges broughte vnto cytye commynge quene wyth greate hoste northernemen anone suche contrary partye broughte vp noyse thoroughe cytye brought northernemen entente ryfle spoyle citye thoroughe encreasyd enemyes hyr entente wyth hyr people helde hyr waye tyll came saynte albons whyche meane tyme erle warwyke duke northfolke whyche duke yorke assygned gyue attendaunce vppon kynge consent kynge gathered vnto theym strengthe knyghtes mette wyth quenes hoste saynt bata sa te albons albons foresayde betwene stroge fyght foughten vppon shroue tuysday mornyng yt whych duke northfolke sayd erle endewere chased kyng henry take efte vpo felde brought vnto quene ye noone wryters made sonn price edward knyght whych age viii yeres wyth noubre xxx persones whan quene margaret thus commen agayne hyr aboue anon sente vnto mayre london wyllyng commaundynge hym ye kynges name shuld spedy wyse sende saynt albonys certayne carte wyth lentyn stuffe ye vytaylyng hoste whyche commaundement mayre obeyed wyth great dylygence made prouysyon sayd vytayll sent cartys towarde crepylgate haue passed quene wha comyn common many beynge whych harde tydynges erle marche shalbe shewed one mynde stode passage sayd carte sayde nat behouefull fede theyr enemyes whyche entended robbyng cytye nat wythstandynge mayre wyth hys bretherne exorted people theyr best maner shewyng theym many great daungers whyche lyke ensue cytye yf sayd dytayll went nat forthe yet myghte nat tourne theyr obstynat errour coclusyon fayne apoynt recorder wyth hym certayne alderme ryde vnto kynges cousayll barnet make requeste vnto theym northe myght retorned home fere robbynge cytye ouerthys secrete frendes made vnto quenes grace good gracyouse vnto cytye duryng whych treaty dyuers cytesyns auoyded cytye lande amoge whych phylip malpas whych shewed xx viii yere thys kynge robbed iacke cade whyche malpas mette vpo see wyth frechman named columpne hym take prysoner payed iiii marke hys raunsome thus passyng tyme ye tydynges secrete blowe abrode openly tolde ye erles marche warwyke mette cottyswolde gathered vnto great strength marchemen wel spedde vpo theyr waye warde london knowelege whereof kynge ye quene wyth theyr hoste retourned northwarde departyd saint albonis beheded lord bonuyle syr thomas teryll knyghet whyche taken forenamed felde tha duchesse yorke beyng lodon herynge losse thys felde sent hyr two yonger sonnes meane george whyche duke clarece rychard duke glouceter utrych almayne remayned whyle tha foresayd erles march warwyke sped towarde londo suche wyse came thydervpon thursday fyrst weke lent whome resorted getylmen partye south eest partye englad thys whyle thus rested london great cousayl called lordes spyrytuall temporall aboute whyche fynally many argumentes made mothe kynge henry contrary hys honoure promysse last parlyament made assured also reputed vnable insuffycyent rule realme theyr assentes deposed dyscharged kyngely honoure regally incontinently auctoryte sayde counsayll agrement common present edwarde eldeste sonne vnto duke yorke tha elected chosen kynge englande whyche eleccyon admyssyon sayde erle marche gyuyng lawde preyse vnto god vpo iiii day marche accompanyed wyth foresayde lordes multytude comons coueyed vnto westminster toke possessyon realme englade syttynge hys astate royall great halle wyth hys sceptre hand question axed people presente yf wolde admytte hym theyr kynge soueraygne lord whyche wyth one voyce cryed ye ye tha ye accustumed vse kynges swere othe take went abbey abbot munkys mette wyth processyon conueyed vnto saint edwardes shryne offered kyng done receyued homage feaute suche lordes present vpo ye morowe folowynge proclamacyos made accustomat place cytye name edwarde iiii thanne kynge englande vpo whych day kyng came vnto palays poulys dyned restyd hym season makynge prouysyon go northwarde subdue hys enemyes vpon saterdaye folowynge beyng daye marche erle warwyke great puyssaunce people departed oute london northwarde vppon wednysdaye folowynge kynges fotemen wente towarde iourney vppon frydaye nexte folowynge kynge tooke hys voyage cytye wyth great hade men rode forth bysshop pesgate whych selfe day whyche xii daye marche grocer london namyd walter walker offence hym done agayne kynge behedded
