smythfelde hys wyfe whyche maryed iohn norlade grocer lastely alderman suche frendes aboute kynge hyr goodes nat forfayted ye kynges vse kyng holdyng iourney mette wyth enemy vyllage ix myles thys halfe yorke called towto shyreborn vpon palme sonday gaue vnto theym batayll whyche cruell yt felde chace slayne vppo xxx thousande ouer men name whyche ensue saye erle northumberlande erle westmerlande lorde clyfforde ye lorde eyromonde syr iohn syr andrewe trollop noumber xi mo among felde taken erle deuonshyre erle wylshyre whych said erle deuonshyre sente vnto yorke beheded hery whyche lately kynge quene theyr sonne syr edward duke somerset lord rose beynge yorke herynge ouerthrowe theyr people greate losse theyr men haste fledde towarde scotlande vppon morowe folowynge kynge wyth moche hys people entred yorke held hys easter tyde vpon easter euyn tydynges broughte vnto london wynnynge thys felde wherfore poulys te deum songe wyth greate solempnyte thorugh cytye paryssh church thus thys goostly man kynge hery lost wha reygned ful xxxviii yeres vi monethes odde day ye noble moste bou teous princesse quene margarete whome many vntrew surmyse imagened tolde fayne flye comfortlesse lost englade euer whan kyng edwarde greate solempnyte holden feest easter yorke remoued durham hys busynesse fynysshed retourned agayne southwarde lefte partyes ye erle warwyke se rule guydyng countrey kyng coosted vysyted coutreys southwarde eestwarde begynnyng moneth iuny came vnto hys manour shene called rychemout whych pastyme purueyauce made kynges coronacyo accoplysshyng whereof kyng vpo xxvii day iuny beyng fryday departed ye sayde manour rode vnto towre lodon upo whome gaue attedaunce yt mayre hys bretherne cladde scarlet noumbre iiiic comoners well horsed cladde grene vpon morne beynge saterday made xxviii knightes bath iiii moo noone wyth honour coueyed westminster sayd xxxii knyghtes rydyng hym blewe gownes hoodes vpon theyr shulders lyke prestes many goodly honourable ceremonyes yt whych longe reherse due order coronacyon edwarde fourth vpon morne beyng sonday sait peter day wyth great tryu phe archebysshop caunterbury crowned enoynted hygh aulter saynt peter churche westmynster thys solepnysacyon crownyng ye kyng wyth also sumptuous honorable feest holde westminster hall fynysshed kynge soone created george hys brother duke clarence moneth iuly folowynge stadarde chepe ye hade seruaunte kynges called iohn dauy stryken stryken man wythin palays westmynster francia pcarolus viii carolus charles vii ye name accompte boke vii frech hystory sonne charlys vii vi beganne hys reygne ouer frenchme moneth october yere oure lorde miiiic xxii begynnyng henry vi kyng englade thys charlys sundry wryters sunderly wryte moche afferme hym naturall sonne charles vii afferme hym sonne duke orleaunce borne quene ben name hym sonn charles fore named gotten baste vppon hys mooste beauteous paramour named agnes whych testyfyeth gaguynus excelled woman feture beaute surnamed fayer agnes thys hyr myddell age dyed ryche yt hyr testamet amouted ixm scute golde whyche sterlynge money amouteth summe xmli tha retourne thys charlys lykely nat ye naturall sonne forenamed charlys moche hys sayd father ordeyned wylled realme frauce vnto katheryne hys doughter wyfe vnto kynge hery v agreed wyth consente parte ye lordes hys realme bothe spyrituall temporall duryng hys lyfe sayd kynge henry shuld reget frauce hys deth kyng sayd reg lengthe haue shewed vnto vii yere sayd henry v whether hys legyttymat sonne nat uppo purpose leger stande trouth father admitted made dolphyne uyen reason wherof greate auctoryte wan hym fauoure som lordes frauce whych strogly maynteyned hys partye durynge lyfe kyng hery v yt season whyle duke bedforde occupyed regent regyo party frauce reputed kyng howe neuer crowned loge sayde duke bedforde lyued neuerthelesse meane polycy hys fre de defended hym selfe lytle englysheme wonne vpo hym suche lades fyrste possessyon polytykely defended theym lytle lytle preuayled agayne ende onely wanne nat hym possessio prouince yt named frauce also wanne hym ende kynge englandes olde enherytaunce normandy wyth domynyons apperteynynge maner wynnynge woll nat thys story speke moche former yeres kynge henry vi haue expressed maner somme parte therof shall speke shalbe thynges done betwene hym prynces viii yere hery vi promysed vi yere thys charles shewe vnto som mayde pucel ye frech men named la ucesse de dieu la pucelle de dieu messenger god sente reputed shall folow ye saying gaguyne whyche sayeth foloweth vi yere aboute rekyn deth thys charles father weche mayden beyng bred strete vyllage called latyne ualli color thys tyme beynge sproge age xx yeres hauing father poore man named iakes delarch hyr mother isabell also berynge name iane iohan required dyuers sundry tymes vncle hyrs beyng prefecte foresayde vyllage wolde presente hyr vnto freche kynge thynges cocernyng greatly weale hym hys realme whyche sayd prefect many delayes moche hyr wordes lytle truste yet legthe hyr sayd vncle beynge named robert baudryncourt sent hyr wyth couenyent company vnto kyng wyth letter certyfyenge hym maner thys mayde wherof sayd charles beynge asserteyned thought wold vse som meane knowe vertue thys wenche perfyghte experyence tymes thys woman neuer sene hys persone thoughte wolde chaunge hys rome habyte se whether hyr vertue coulde knowe hym frome done standynge amonge familiers one called chaumber demaunded yf euer tyme sene kynge hadde answered nay bydde espye oute kynge whych stode amonge companye whyche anone wythout dyfficulte fande saluted king refused hyr reuerece sayd yt erred hyr choyse yet parseuered kneling fete sayde goddes purueyauce taught hyr soueraygn prince none wherfore kynge hys lordes hyr affyauce hyr lade shulde releuyd whych daye passyng mysery dyuers questyos hyr made cause hyr thyther commynge answered sayd sent frome god stablisshe kynge hys realme hyr beynge leder capytayne hys people dyuine grace onely kynge shulde shortely subdue hys enemyes reaso wordes kyng wyth hys lordes somedeale comforted upon thys armour sword sought mayde whych sayeth sayd auctour fouden myraculously wherof processe appereth darke fatastycall yt therewith list nat blot boke suffre passe thys weche purueyed thinges necessary warre company knyghtes soudyours hyr kynge assygned rydynge man mane habyte contynued space ii yeres dyd many wonderful feates gat englysshemen many stroge townes holdes wherefore amonge frenchemen wordshypped augell messynger sent frome god releue theyr great myserye affermeth sayd auctour hyr prouydence caused sayd charles kynge fraunce crowned raynes yere oure lord foure hundreth xxix nouther frenche cronycle whyche haue sene testyfyeth affermyn nat crowned duryng lyfe duke bedforde almyghty god whyche season suffereth suche sorcery deuelyssh way prospere reygne correccyon synners lastely shewe hys power good men shuld nat fall erroure sheweth clerenesse suche mystycall thynges dyd thysthende lapucelle de dieu lastely knyghte burgonyon taken sent roan bret demerytes viii yere henry vi legth shewed tha tyme forth passyng cotynuall warre betwene englande frauce contynuyng among many trybulacions thys charles susteyned one hys owne sonn named lewys comforted assysted duke burbo aleson wyth name rebelled agayne hys father warred vppon hym strengthe wan frome hym certeyne townes strong holdes remedy whereof sayde charles made warre vppon forenamed duke burbon wasted wyth iron fyre countreyes sayde duke burbon meane whereof thys vnkyndely warre hadde duryd space syxe monethes peace vnyte betwene father sonne treated meanes erle ewe cocorde vnite betwene fynally cocluded ye sayd lewys suche wyth hym reteyned allied thys offece ye sayd charles clerely pardoned one persone excepted named iaket iakis whose treason castell maxente loste taken whyche offence drawen hanged also quartered tha processe tyme folowyng flemynges gaute rebelled agayne theyr duke erle named philyp cause whyche rebellyon areryd greuouse taske vpo salte put people ther greuouse charge wherevppon dedely warre betwene duke hys subiectys arose dystruccio moche people vpo bothe partyes wherof cyrcumstauce log wryte howe ende ye duke erle ayde freche kynge vyctour helde gaute streyghte compelled force bye theyr peace wyth great summes money theyr many folde domages xxxi yere thys sayde charles came vnto hym pope nycholas v name ambassade requyre ayde agayne turkys defece costantyne noble whyche turkys purposed shortly assayle whyche ambassade sayd charlys answeryd hym right greuouse intollerable persecucyo whych ye criste dayly susteyned turkys ye englysh nacyo vexed warred myghte nat leue hys lade wythout hedde co forte lose hys owne entent tymes myght haue warred vppon sayd turkys cause onely offered vnto kynge englande many reasonable offer englysshe party lyke offer myghte hym profered wolde gladly theym accepte turne hys spere incotynetly agayn fore named turkes ouer wolde furtherauce matter sende wyth vnto kynge englade certayne ambassadours se yf yet reasonable peace myght betwene cocluded accomplisshemet wherof testyfyeth myne auctour gaguynus sente archebysshop raynes wyth honorable persones whych whan kyng henry hys counsayll hadde shewyd theyr legacyo shortly answered suche season englyssheme hadde wonne agayne moche lade frenchemen cawtelys wone theym tha good tyme season treate accorde nat reason whiche answere pope ambassade retourned rome wythoute ayde comforte thus ye freche wryters lay euer charge fro theyr prynce put vnto thys ambassade answere fynde memory englysshe wryters aboute xxxiiii yere ye reygn thys charlys lewys hys sonne named beynge greate lyberalitye largesse thought father departed nat wyth hym mouables possessyos hadde cause whych cofort yoge persones aboute hym rebelled thys seconde tyme agayne hys sayde father reason hys largesse lyberalyte drewe vnto hym moche waton wylde people wyth theyr assystence warred vppo hys father fredes entendyd depryue hys father gouernauce realme wherof herynge hys father possyble haste gathered hym greate strengthe spedde hym towarde hys sayd sonn wha lewys warned comyng hys father wyth great hoste consydered hys quarell wekenesse wyth fewe persones fledde towarde burgoyne whereof herynge father sente haste people kepe passage dyd myghte haue stopped hym hys waye prouysyon notwythstandynge sayd lewys escaped came sauely vnto presence phylyppe duke burgoyne whyche hym receyued wyth gladde chere entreatyd hym accordyng estate kepte hym durynge father lyfe nowbeit made hym great sute labour wynne father grace vayne obstynacy yt wolde submytte hym father comme vnto hys presence sente great stomacke father wold condycyoned son thys varyaunce contynued bytwene aboue sayd ye terme father lyfe whyche passe tyme thys charlys concluded maryage bytwene hys doughter called magdaleyne ladyslaus kyng beme hungary polayne whyle bryde wyth great apparayle pompe conueyed towarde husbande maryed sayde husbande taken sodenly sykenesse dyed xxiiii houres fyrste coplayned hym whych force poysone wryters agreen whych tydynges charlys asserteyned therwyth toke pesyffenesse dyed shortely whan ruled parte hole realme reken ye deth hys father xxxvi yeres frenche wryters certeyne terme hys reygne hym assygned myche kyng henry vi longe deth hys father alowyd parys many cytyes frauce souerayne kynge regyon thys charlys thus beynge dede lefte hym two sonnes saye lewys hym kynge yonger named charlys wyth ye forenamed doughter named magdaleyne margarete wyth greate pompe hys corp conueyed vnto saynt denys buryed francia lewys xi lewys xi name accompte thys boke x frenche accompte whereof ye cause shewed sonne charles last dede beganne dominyon ouer realme fraunce moneth october yere grace miiii hundreth lviii xxxvi yere henry vi kynge englande gaguinus called sturdy fel lewys whiche tyme father deth beyng aboue sayd vnrecousyled prouynce burgoyne herynge deth father wyth ayde foresayd duke phylyp shortly entred ye realm fraunce toke vpon hym ye rule euery good cytie town passyd kyng ye yt many lordes hed offycers drewe vnto hym meane wherof stronge put vnto sylence ye wyll purpose father wolde haue preferred yoger son named charlys lewys strengthe frendes shortely raynes crowned kynge fraunce whyche solempnyte fynysshed repayred vnto parys consent hys counceyll made law yt man degre shuld vse hutyng hawkynge without special lycece specially chasynge huntyng woluys kepe wyth hym houndes instrumetes wherby game myghte destroyed done phylyp foresayd duke burgoyne counsayll hym gyuen shulde forgette forgyue dyspleasurs hym ofore done hys lordes honoure cherysshe specyally yonge brother charlys norysshe departe wyth hym louyngly hys father possession toke leue hym departed whose deture contrary foresayde counsayll refused company hys lordes also theyr counsayll drewe vnto hym chyefe counsaylours vylaynes men lowe byrth yt whyche iiii pryncypall named foloweth iohn de lude iohn balna olyuer deuyll odyousnesse name kynge caused chaunged named daman fourth named stephan vssher kynges chaumber dore whithe promoted greate honour dygnytees amonge whome balna beynge preste hys meanes length made cardynall rome thus vsynge counsayle person murmur grudge began sprynge bytwene hym hys lordes myche fyrst duke brytayne began estrauge hym kynge refused come vnto hys presence wha sente wherof herynge erle ewe wyth drewe vnto ye duke whyche party soone ye kynges brother charlys also duke burbon whych maried kynges syster many noble men realme resortyd whan kynge ware hys lordes conspyred agayne hym ferynge rebellyon hys comos sent spedy maner vnto parys forenamed iohn balna wyth certeyne person kepe cytye due obeysauce toward hym thynkynge cytyes good townes hys regyon wolde take ensample therof demeane cytye dyd whose commynge ruler parys amonystement sayd iohn ordeyned good sure watche meane kept cytye good order meane season kynge gathered hym great foyson knyghtes soudyours hoste nombred xxx thousand men lyke wyse partye hadde assembled many mo wythstandyng assyduat laboure meanes made ye duke burgoyne carlota wyfe ye duke burbon syster kyng aboue sayde make vnyte peace bytwene lewys hys lordes yet fynally kynge mette playne batayll place called chartres bytwene theym longe cruell batayll ye losse moche people bothe partyes kynge begynnynge hadde better hys enemyes yet ende ouercomen men chaced forced flye take hys sauegarde castell named mountclere whyche shortely departyd yode castell called corboyll then lastly vnto parys entendyd haue gathered newe people haue reuenged hym hys enemyes wyse good exortacyo bysshoppe parys kyng chaunged hys purpose set quyetnesse tyme maner condycyons ye accorde myne authour dothe expresse whyche accorde thus concluded kynge contynued hys olde maners delyted hym companye symple inreuerent parson eate drynke wyth ende myghte talke rybaudry vayne vycyous fable accompany lordes myghte haue wonne hym myche honour thys lewys also dyuers wanton condycyon wolde go lyker yoman seruyng man lyke prynce whyche regardshyp sparyng good haue shewed also shall appere prynce moste lyberalyte therwith oppressour hys subiectes lewis thus passing time dryuen necessyte lacke money preste cytesyns parys whyche many excusys layd put myghte alowed lastly denayed kynges pleasure wythall beynge greuously dyscontentyd remoued diuerse theyr offyces whych rychest hed men ye cyte soughte agayne theym surmysed cause without prouys iustyce put many deth foresayde cause many whyche tedyouse expresse foresayd lordes agayne assembled theyr people entedyng subdue ye kynge set hys brother hys place cause hym otherwyse rule ye comon weale strength baron party iohn sonne vnto ye duke calabre approched wyth good bande men came also sonne duke burgoyne named charlys whiche baron one assent mette towne called stampys cotynued theyr cousayle space xv dayes cousayle fynysshed toke theyr iournaye towarde parys whych passe tyme spye duke brytaynes called peter gerold taken parys drawen hanged quartered dyuers men woman yt suspected owe fauour vnto lordes sacked caste water seyn strength guyde cytye parys kynge sent thyder erle donoyse whose prouysyon warly ordenaunce defende theyr enemyes preparyd tyme season ye lordes iii partes enbatayled approched cytye wherof ye fyrste hoste ladde charlys brother vnto kynge seconde duke brytayne thyrd charlys sonne duke burgoyne prouyded charlys fyrste named ladde myddleward wha sayd erle donoyse hadde well consydered strength lordes sente vnto theym messanger sayeng mynde maruayled see greate multytude people assembled agayne cytye comon weale ye land consyderyng sette kynge medyatour meane rather make peace warre yf contentyd hym medyacyon myghte laboured hadde thys came none effecte small assautes skyrmysshes ensued lytell domage bothe partes whyche passe tyme kynge sent secrete meanes vnto forenamed iohn sonne vnto duke calabre hym many meanes instaunted leue company lordes offer auayled ryght nought thenne foresayde lordes thus lyenge cytye parys playne standeth monastery saynt antony charlys brother kynge caused iiii letter deuysed wherof one sent bysshoppes spyrytuall men within cytye seconde consulles hed men thyrde ye scolers vnyuersyte ye iiii vnto comynaltye whyche letter entent ensueth none hys company comen thyder enemye cytye make warre agayne comon weale land encreace augmentacyon therof vttermost theyr power receyte whyche letter mater conteyned well vndersta den debatyd certeyne oratours sayde iiii partyes assygned thre spyrytuall men thre consul thre vnyuersyte thre comynaltye whose name ouer passe whyche wyth bysshop parys sent vnto baron longe communycacyon wyth hadde retourned cytie report foloweth fyrste lordes wolde inhabytauntes cytye shulde co syder condycyons kynge yt whyche yerely oppressyth subiectes taskes greuouse seruagys secondaryly despyseth ye noble blode hys realme draweth hym vylaynes men reputacyon whose cou sayls onely comon weale ye land ruled guyded thyrdely ruleth hys subiectes force wyll wythout mynystracyon iustyce hym selfe cousayls parlyaments iudge cause callyth hys selfe counsayls parlyamentes hys synguler weale como weale realme fourthely enhaunsyth men lowe byrthe vnto greate honour causyth noble men obedyent vnto entendynge brynge ignoble men egall wyth prynces lande fyftely lawes delayed bolstred suche stande fauour thorugh thys daye lawe wyll wyll lawe man almoste suerty lyfe goodes moche dayly many ben banysshed put deth vnlefull cause also noble man daye power rome honour belongeth wylde bestes forestes apperteyneth lybertye suertye partye kynges subgettes syxtly greate taskes summes money whych dayly leuyed comos ben spent kynges honourable nedes comon weale realme spent nysely ryottously brybed ye kynges cofers whyche enormytees mysgouernauce many sayde lordes thyder comen defensyble araye ye sauegarde theyr owne person hed pryncypall cytie realme haue ayde counsayle refourme foresayd euyls standynge harme vnto kynges persone yet remoue hym regally kyngly maieste enduce hym aduertyse hym shuld honour weale hys realme lyue welthe honour hys noble genitours haue lyued hym whyche cause consyderacyons wyth many whych passe ouer sayde lordes ye kynges trewe subeittes frendes vnto comon weale lande cytye desyre entre refresshe theyr people pay truely thynge shulde take wythout doyng harme vyolence persone whyche requestes mater lordes shewed vnto inhabytauntes cytye fauour frendes partye well acceptyd thought conuenyent sayde noble shuld receyued cytye longe debatynge thys mater meane forenamed erle donoyse sparynge thys receyte lordes shuld tyll forther knowlege kynges pleasure whyche prouysyon sayd erle fande mych secretely warned kynges thyder comynge vpon thys agremet cytye rested suertye wherof suche within cytye kynges seruauntes frendes rode dayly nyghtly ye cyty wyth stronge company harneys se people kepte due order vppon daye folowynge came vnto parys capytayne ye kynges named mou talbone wyth hym good bend men whyche shewyd vnto cytesyns kyng comyng normandye great host lordes beynge warned enbatayled foresayde playne saynte antoyn shewe strength theyr hoste vnto cytye suche therin theyr enemyes lyenge certayne knyghtes kynges party diuerse sondry tymes brake sodeyne resys skyrmysshed wyth lordes people lytell hurte bothe partyes whych passe tyme kynge lewys comynge normandye receyued cytye hys comynge put execucyon v person named iohn worter eustace arnolde worter iohn coart fraunceys hasle whyche person accusyd hym chyefe occasyoners legacyon made vnto lordes whyche sayde v person thre iohn coart fraunceys hasle arnolde worter messenger assygned sayde legacyon consul parys forenamed eustace worter one thre assygned clergye kynge thus beynge possessyo cytye many dyuers assautes skyrmysshes bytwene hys knyghtes lordes made notary batayle kynge ferre weker ouer thys tyme season sayde lordes gat vnto sondry castels stronge holdes length meanes peace offeryd ye kynge concludyng wherof kynge admytted erle man certayne person baron assygned iohn sonne vnto duke calabre lewys erle saynt poule whyche assembled co moued togyder sondry tymes ix dayes whyche season came vnto kynge newe strength soudyours normandye whych kyng appoynted kepe subarbes saynt marcell thys treaty thus hangyng wythout conclusyo ende takynge vppon xiiii day october vii yere ye reygn thys lewys proclaymed thorough cytye also hoste day lenger treuce thanne lordes wythdrewe theym vnto theyr stronge holdes castels holdynge wyth many soudyours whyche fyll robbynge vnlefull actes greate daunger hurte lande suche season arbytrours met fynysshe great mater among thynges offeryd kynge graunted gyue vnto hys brother charlys hys porcyon champayne wyth lordshyppe brye cytyes melde monstruell meldune therof excepted vnto charlys sonne duke burgoyne contented gyue myche money hadde spent iournay refused fynally obstynacy bothe partyes daye expyracyon trewe approchyd wythout hope accord cocludyng wherfore prouysyon warre vpon bothe partyes deuysed bega grudge murmure bytwen cytesyns kynges sowdyours wherthorough many comons hertes turned lordes fere surer stronger watch kepte kynges great charge shortely tydynges brought vnto kynge yt castell gysons lordes vesyeged also prefecte kynges paleys roan taken cytesyns holden prysone daye folowynge came messengare shewynge vnto kynge duke burbone posterne receyued castell roan lykely haue shortely rule cytye whyche came effecte shorte whyle whan lordes hadde gotten castell cyty roan whyche hed cytye normandy parys hed fraunce maner derysyon sent vnto ye kynge sayenge nother champayne bry hys brother charlys wold contented scantely wyth hole duchy normandy kynge lewys co syderyng great auautage ye lordes strength fauour hys comons whyche dayly drewe vnto sondry co panyes auoydyng daunger concludyd pea perfourmauce wherof grauted vnto charlys brother ye hole duchy normandy takyng hym exchauge county berry charlis sonne duke burgoyne peron roya cytye towne called latyne mondideriu therwith ioyned gwynary ye erledome boloyne lordshyps ye sayd kynge lewys hadde tymes bought duke phylyp father iohn calabre grauted sumes money demaundyd wage soudiours ayde father agayne fardynande kyng aragon iohn duke burbon yt said maryed syster grauted dowar hym mysed ye tyme maryage pencyon wont yerely take graunte charlys last kyng within realme frauce duke brytayne restoryd erledome moutferard great sumes money kyng receyued sayd county ye erle dampmartyne restored suche landes acte parlyamet forfayted ye kyng erle saynt poule restored offyce constablerye frauce name notable thynges passe ouer whyche grauntes fermely fastely assuryd proclamacyons made thys pea thoroughe realme fraunce thys pea thus concluded kyng hys lordes mette whome shewed greate semblaunt kyndnesse specyally vnto hys brother wherin appered great dyssymulacyon shall appere thys lewys suche condycion myght ouer come wyth strength wold wynne wyth dyssymulacyon trechety whyche peace thus concluded lordes departed kynge festyd ruler consul cytye parys gaue vnto due thankes greate trouth fydelyte whyche bare towarde hym duryng troubelous season graunted vnto suche thynges wolde aske weale cytye longe dyssymulacyon fell bytwene charlys duke normandye iohn foresayde sonne vnto duke calabre erle dampmartyne wherof parte cause sayde charlys theyr thynkyng hadde bounteously rewarded deserued whyche dyscorde kyng lewys fayne spedy maner rode vnto towne called argentyne wyth sayd iohn beynge duke calabre reason hys father deth helde wyth hym longe great counsayll ye entent dyspossesse hys brother duchy normandye reason whych dyscorde bytwene sayd two duke kynge lewys ayder duke calabre made warre partyes normandye processe wanne therin dyuers castels stronge holdes compelled hys brother holde cytye roan hys refuge beynge kyng wanne dayly vppon hym myche dyuers townes stronge holdes submytted grace wherof hering cytesyns roan made ambassade vnto kynge purchace grace theyr duke selfe whych duke vnderstode ferynge leste owne cytesyns wolde betraye hym fled then yode humflewe then cadomy whyche passe tyme ye kynge wyth due honour receyued ye cytie roan remoued many theyr office seruauntes lyked hym put theyr place moch ordynaunce abylymentes warre belongynge ye towne sent vnto parys prouost roan named gauyne manuell put deth hys body cast ryuer hed sette vppon pole dyuers colege wyth deane ye place put vnto deth whych tyrannye kynge executyd towne put suertye strength soudyours spedde hym vnto orleaunce sayth myne authour puruayed honorable ambassade sent vnto edward iiii kynge englande ix yere ye reygne thys lewys greate mortalyte men fraunce parys dyed yere ouer xlm people thys yere began grudge growe bytwene lewys phylyppe duke burgoyne kept vnkyndely duryng ye lyfe ye duke dyed shortely succedyd charlys sonne named processe tyme maryed dame margarete syster vnto kynge edward ye iiii shalbe shewyd longe thys lewys assembled great hoste people make warre vpon charlys duke burgoyne whyche people comytted rule charge vnto iohn balna whych daye preste cardynall teporall capytayne toke mustyrs order teporall lordes dysdaynynge erle dapmartyne sayd name vnto kyng moste redouted souerayne lorde hath pleased hyghnesse commytte vnto spyrytuall ye charge puyssaunt hoste ferynge god hath taken vpon hym cure charge effusyon cryste menes blode wherfore may lyke noble grace sende temporall man vysyte dyocese take charge flocke whyche syttynge dede sayeng kyng hadde good game yt dyd hym semyd best warre bytwene ye kyng duke charlys burgoyne entende speke mater somde e long tedyous wryte whyle lewys occupyed thys warre yt brytons excedynge power assayled ye partyes norue hauyng charlis broder vnto lewis theyr leder whych duke brytayn fled ayde socoure wherof herynge kyng lewys hoste sowdyours hadde purposed wayes ladde agayne hys brother whych hoste myth myne authour cm men ouer guydyng ordenauce wha charlys aduertysed greate strength hys brother polytyke meanes soughte peace many delatory communycacyos delayous meanes wroughte vppon bothe partyes lastely kynge sent vnto hys brother iohn balna cardynall wyth shewe vnto hym hys mynde pleasure wherof whan charlys suffycyently instructed gaue answere yf perfyghte concorde shulde stablysshed bytwene hys brother hym shuld authorysed hole concent counsayle barony realme answere kyng beyng contentyd turon moneth apryll x yere hys reygne assembled greate counsayle hys lordes spyrytuall temporall whyche ye demaudys sayde charlys offer kyng shewed sayd cousayle length reasoned sayde demaundes offer fynally determyned yt duchy normandye approuyd vnto kynge fraunce hys heyres kynges wyse myghte dysseueryd ye crowne entent perfyght vnyte myghte bytwene kynge hys brother kyng shall instauted gyue yerely vnto hys sayd brother recopensemet ye sayd duchy xii thousand poude turo money wyth also certeyn lande hym assygned wyth name duke ouer ye kynge instanted gyue vnto hym durynge hys naturall lyfe suche porcyo claymed ryghte wythin realme xlmli annuell rente yerely hym payed foresayd turo money whyche grauntes kynge agreed ouer pardon ye duke brytayne offence nowe newly done agayne hys maieste contrary duke faythe allegaunce lordshyppes kynge hadde wonne wythin brytayne restore vnto duke hys assygnes ye whych offer myght satysfye cousayle sayd charlys clerely set aparte refused foresayd offer charles refused kyng spedy wyse vppon refusayll sent stronge hoste brytayne vnder guydynge knyghte called arnolde meane season kyng vysytyng bordours hys realme put execucyon dyuerse parsones suche accused offende agayne hym passynge whych season greuys whyche foresayd hoste wroughte wythin coutrey brytayne skyll foresayd charlys duke brytayne made newe meanes peace vnto kynge offered contentyd wyth myght stande hys fauoure grace wyth suche proffer cou sayll realme tyme agreed codyssended vpon unto sophystycall answere made kyng sayd charles tyme myghte nat asserteyned peace warre howe yere folowyng instaut labour fore named iohn balna cardynall kynge agreed gyue vnto hys brother charlys duchy guyan onely wyth helde hym coteted ceased warre normady nat loge thys sayde iohn balna forgetynge ye manyfolde great benefytes shewed hi kynge cospyred agayne hym deuysed certayne letter sent vnto charlys duke burgoyne wherin coteyned shulde beware haue hym selfe good gayte vnyte peace whyche lately stablysshed betwene kynge charlys hys brother principally dere warre vppon hym brynge hym subieccyon wherfore auoydynge dauger aduysed hym possyble haste assemble hys knyghtys nat take vnpurueyed whyche letter reaso berer otherwyse came ye kynges presence receyt whyche letter knowlege co tent anone kynge caused sayde iohn balna taken caste stronge prysone done rode vnto thuron whyther hym came hys brother charles hym dyd homage sware vnto feauty duchy guyan knytte duke brytayne fastly hym sente hym sceptre wyth chayne golde whyche duke refused take wherewyth lewys greuously dyscoteted cause whyche refusall sayde duke brytayne lately allyed hym wyth charlys duke burgoyne receyued hys lyuerey golden flees soone whyche xi yere thys lewys carlota hys wyfe lyghted sonn named charles charlys hys brother whych hys father kynge frauce shortly meanes charlys duke guyan duke burbon duke brytayn recoucyled vnto kyng fauoure ye xii yere ye reygn thys lewys dyed force veni aboue named charlys duke guyan whose meanes myne auctour myndeth nat cotynuynge warre betwene thys lewys thys duke burgoyne marchaunt guyan named itery deth sayd duke guyan fledde vnto duke burgoyne wyth hym seaso remayned shewed vnto hym many tedyous talys ye kyng wherfore duke apperceyuynge yt owed frenche kynge fauoure exorted hym poyson ye sayd kynge yf myght brynge effecte hys purpose shuld therefore haue lm florynes golde floryne value sterlynge money iii whyche promyse assuraunce thus made duke thys itery brynge hys euyll purpose made hys seruaunt named iohn de boldy cousayll promysed hym greate thynges yf wolde take vpon hym acte graunt hadde sayde iohn sayd itery prouided ye poyson delyuered vnto hys sayd seruaut whych incontynetly sped hym vnto ambasye frech kyng laye thys iohn de boldy beynge famylyer acqueyntaunce wyth one named popyn ye entent brynge hys entent ye better effecte assurauce othe hi made kepe hys counsayll shewyd vnto hym hys mynde promised hym xxm florynes yf wolde helpe brynge conclusyon hys purpose whyche popyn made vnto hym assured promyse sayde brynge thys mater aboute expedyent haue counsayll kynges mayster cooke named colynet whome knewe well wyn great fauoure eyther owed vnto co munycacyon wyth sayd colynet sayd poysone hym delyuered wherwyth sayd colynet popyn hys felowe went conuenyent tyme vnto kynge shewyd hym compasse ye mater anone sayde iohn de boldy taken confessed cyrcumstauce hoole treason whyche parys drawen hanged quartered soone vpo thys frederyke ye iii ye name emperoure almayne sente vnto thys lewys wyllyng requyryng hym wolde nat endeuer hym peace accorde ye duke burgoyne enteded suche wyse ayde hys partye yt trusted god brynge sayde duke hys due conuenyent obeysauce subieccio kyng regarded nothynge emperours request cocluded trewys wyth duke yere folowynge auctoryte great counsayll parlyament whyche duke aleson iuged lose hys hed hys heredytamentes forfayted vnto kynge foloweth story thys foresayde trewys betwene kynge charles duke fully expyred ye sayd charles made warre vpon sayd lewys procured kynge edwarde englande whose syster maryed make also warre vpon hym expedycyon wherof sayd kyng edwarde landed calays shortly wyth competente noumber soudyours xiiii yere reygne sayd edwarde iiii shalbe clerely shewed wyth co clusyon peace thynges yt pea betwene sayd ii kynges agreed vnyte concorde also stablysshed betwene thys lewys duke burgoyn ix yeres xvii yere thys lewys ye steward normady named lewys brysey yt maryed nece kyng lewys beyng warned ye waton rule wyfe auoutry wyth one named iohn louyr vpo day proue sayde wyfe wet huting retourn feyned hym wery feynt labour wet bedde anone demyng husbad naturall rest yode streyght vnto ye chaber ye sayd iohn louyr wherof ye husbad beyng warned wyth hys swerde hade sped hym vnto ye sayd chaber ye dore broke vp violece fyndyng bedde suspeciouse maner sayde swerde slewe first sayde iohn natwythstadyng miserable lametable cryeg askynge forgyuenes vpo knee also slewher fled tyll made hys peace wyth kyng loge also tediouse folowe myne auctour declaryng euery particuler dede done lewys wherfore shorte story trouth yt thys lewys log tyme exercised warres lastly fell greuouse sykenesse whych cotinued encreased vpo hym yt knewe well shulde nat log endure wherfore disposed caused many dedes alinesse done hym amoge whych within sait iohns church baptist within parys fouded certeyn preestes syng hym perpetuyte sustetacion whome gaue yerely rete mli parys money laguysshyng ye space iii yeres died passed hys tyme wyth great tribulacyon whyche passe tyme oratours sent flemynges conclude maryage betwene charles hys eldest sonne margarete doughter maxymylian sonne frederyke emperoure maximilia day maryed mary doughter charles duke burgoyne whych coclusyon ended fynysshed kyng gaue vnto sayd orator xxxm scute golde whych amou teth vmli sterlyng money ouer gaue plate purposely made value v cli sterlynge xxv yere reygne sayd lewys forenamed margarete chyld tender age wyth great sumptuouse pope broughte vnto parys fro then conueyed vnto ambasye moneth iuly cowpeled maryage vnto forenamed charles sonn vnto kyng whyche solempnyte fynysshed sayd lewys felyng hys sykenesse encreasyng vppon season called hys sayd sonn charles hymthe wordes king lewys dyenge sonne exorted hym thys wyse foloweth mooste deryst chylde feele knowe well yt shall nat tary longe thys countrey nerer myne ende thou knowest contynually greuyd wyth sykenesse medecyne may releue thou art muste rule lade wherfore specyally behoueful necessary haue trewe seruautes amonge many yt haue proued dayes ii ben whych specyally comende vnto meane olyuer damman iohn doyacos whose seruyces haue suche wyse vsed theyr meanes counsayll thynke lyfe hath ben long preserued therefore specially ii kepe nere yt nothynge mynysshyng theyr office possessyons tymes haue gyuen ii take thy counsaylours guyot bochage guyde yt warres phylyp desquyer yt whych featys warre haue wel p oued hath passyng experiece haue auauced offyces within thys realme lette remayne common lande whych occasyo warres haue greuously tarid greatly weked enpouerysshed socoure fauour thy power burgonyos thought euer good shew fauoure elles thought shuld haue sounded dyshonour thynke shalbe good thou kyng lewys thus exorted counsayled hys sonn retourned vnto turon mytygacyon thys paynfull sykenesse whyche myne auctour called latyne morbus elephantie commaunded brought hym cunnyng maysters musyke wythin hys realme melodyous soude theyr instrumentes myghte eased peyne whan assembled best c xx noumber fewe shepardes pypes hym solace parte yt whych helde styll hys court commau ded euery day sayd shepherdes shulde play certeyn dystaunce place laye ouer thys sent ankers relygyous men famed holy parfight men ordeyned place within turo meane theyr prayer myght released hys contynuall paynes haue lenger contynaunce lyfe myne auctour sayeth yt thys lewys greate desyre haue lengthe lyfe moche knewe well realme fraunce shulde great trouble vexacyon shortly nat wythstandynge prouysyons ordenaunces wyth many moo whyche longe wryte fynally thys lewys dyed wha hadde ben kyng frauce terme xxvi yeres vppo buryed churche lady raynes tyme prouyded hys sepulture tyme hys sykenesse l ye certayne season whyle certeyne orysons ouer hym sayde anglia pedwarde iiii edwarde iiii name son rycharde duke yorke touched began hys reygne ouer ye realme englad iiii daye marche ende yere grace reken churche englande miiiic lx ii yere lewys xii thane kynge fraunce whych edwarde hys possessyon takynge westmynster gettyng feelde touto yorke crowned anoynted kynge westmynster foresayde xxix daye iuny shewyd ende laste yere henry vi whyche solempnyte fynysshed kynge august rode cauntorbury frome thes rode sandewyche then longe see syde southampto march walys retourned brystowe wyth honour receyued visited sundry party hys realme whych season soone tyme rychard lee mayre lodon expyred hughe wyche mercer admytted yere folowynge anno dni miiiiclxi anno dni miiiiclxii iohn looke hughe wyche anno george irelande yere beyng later ende fyrste yere edwarde iiii begynnynge thys mayres yere say fourth daye september parlyamente begonne westmynster vpon ye morow folowyng dyed iohn duke northfolke whyche ben speciall ayder kyng vpo alhalowen daye passed ye kyng created rycharde hys yonger brother duke glouceter lorde bowchyer erle essex lorde fawcumbrydge erle kent vpon xii day february erle oxenforde wyth lorde aubry hys elder sonne syr thomas tode ham willya tyrell brought vnto towre lodon vpon xx day sayd moneth ye sayd lorde awbry drawen westmynster vnto towre hylle beheded vpon xxiii daye moneth syr thomas todeham wyllya tyrell iohn mo gomory also beheded vpon fryday next ensuynge xxvi daye sayd moneth erle oxenforde ladde fro westmynster vpon hys feete ye sayd place also beheded whose corp borne vnto ye frere augustynes buryed wythin quyer tyme later ende moneth iuly castell awnewyke yelden vnto lorde hastynges appoyntement whan kynge edwarde thus stablysshed realme great sute labour made hym repayment foresayd xviiimli hym delyuered stapelers ye xxxviii yere henry vi haue shewed wherof laborer agrement sayd stapelers otherwyse one named rycharde heyron marchaunt pregnaunte wyt good maner speche whome length answered kynges counsayll ye sayd xviiim pounde wyth moch whyche couertly kept frome kynges knowlege belonged ryght vnto ye erle wylshyre tyme delyuery sayde goodes hyghe tresourer englande treason done agayne kyng sayd erles landes goodes forfayted vnto kynge wherfore kynge reteyned sayde xviiimli parceyll hys forfayture wolde reteyne hys owne upon whych answere thys heyron seynge kyng myght haue remedy moche moch sayd good belonged hys charge tha resorted vnto stapelers contetacyon sayd money howe fade comfort fynally sued mayer staple hys company put vnto greate vexacyon trouble ende fande suche fauoure courte rome denou ced merchauntes stapelers accursed howe soone purchased absolucyon conclusyon longe beyng westmynster seyntwaryman wythoute recouery hys costes dutye dyed beynge greatly endetted vnto many persones anno domini miiiiclxii anno domini miiiiclxiii wyllyam hampton thomas cooke anno ii barth iamys thys yere begynnyge ye moneth nouember margaret late quene englad came frauce ito scotlad fro thes ito englande wyth strength frech men scottes wherfore kynge sped hym north wyth strog hoste wherof herynge quene brake hyr araye fled toke caruyle therein entended haue sayled frauce suche tempest fell vpon see co strayned take fysshers bote meane therof landed barwyke drewe hyr vnto scottysshe kynge shortly ladyng tydynges came sayde caruyll drowned wythin whyche greate treasoure rychesse daye vpon iiiic frenchemen dryuen vppon lande nere vnto bambourth moche myght nat haue away theyr shyppes fyred theyr sauegarde tooke ilande wythin northumberland assayled one called maners wyth hys company slayne taken prisoner many whan ye kynge ware quenes thus auoydynge enteded haue folowed haue made warre vpon scottes vysyted sykenes pockes yt forced leue iournay weke crystemas folowynge scottes wyth stroge power perced lande entendynge haue rescowed certayne castelles north retourned shortly wythout harme doynge shortly duke somerset syr rauffe percy submitted kynges grace whanne kynge cured retourned southwarde scottes aboute tyme lent entred agayn englande layde syege vnto banbourth castell wanne wherfore kynge moneth auguste folowynge rode agayne northewarde wyth hys power ouer vytayled certayne shyppes west countre manned sent thyder make warre vppon see coost latter ende mayres yere duke somerset herynge kynge henry commynge lande wyth newe strength departed secretly wente agayne hym anno dni miiiiclxiii anno dni miiiiclxiiii robert basset mathewe phylyp goldsmyth anno iii thomas muschampe yere moneth may whyche begynyng iiii yere kyng edwarde lorde iohn mountagu hauynge rule northe partyes beynge warned commynge henry late kynge wyth greate power scotlande assembled northynmen mette wyth hym exhm skyrmysshed wyth ye scottes length wan ye vyctory hys enemyes chased henry nere wan certayne hys folowers trapped wyth blewe veluet hys bycoket garnysshed wyth two crownes golde fret wyth perle ryche stone also toke sayd iourney ye duke somerset lorde hungerforde lorde roos whych sayde duke shortly put deth sayd towne exhm ii lordes soon beheded new castell whyche fyght taken wood fast syr phylyp wetworth syr edmond fiz knyghtes blacke iaquis iohn bryce thomas hunt also put deth exhm foresayd myddelham wryters syr thomas husey knyght beheded yorke moneth iuly next folowyng sayde lorde mountagu wyth ayde hys brother erle warwyke wan stregth forenamed castel bamburgth wherin one said capitaynes taken wyth syr rauffe gray whyche shortly yorke drawen hanged quartered passe tyme moste secret maner vpon fyrste daye may kynge edwarde spoused elizabeth late wyfe syr iohan graye knyghte whyche tyme slayne toweton yorke felde whych spousayles solempnised erely mornynge towne named graston nere vnto stonyngestratforde whyche maryage persones present spouse spousesse duches bedford mother preste two gentylwomen yong helpe preeste synge whyche spousayles ended wet bedde taried vpon iii iiii houres departed rode agayne stonyng stratforde came maner though ben huntyng went bedde agayne wythin daye ii sente graston lorde ryuers father vnto hys wyfe shewyng hym wolde come lodge wyth hym certayne season receyued wyth honoure taryed space foure dayes whyche season nyghtely hys bedde brought secrete maner almooste none mother counsayll thys maryage season kepte secrete tyll nedely muste dyscouered dysclosed meane whyche offered vnto kyng quene scottes oblyquy ran thys maryage howe kyng enchaunted duchesse beforde howe wolde haue refused wyth many thynges concernynge thys matyer paue ouer thys yere kynge henry taken wood north countre one named cantiowe presented kynge sente towre remayned longe anno dni miiiiclxiiii anno dni miiiiclxv iohn tate rauffe iosselyne draper anno iiii iohn stone yere new coyne ordeyned ye kyng yt whyche named ye royall yet value x halfe royal v ferthyng iisvid ouer yt ordeyned ye secod coyne golde named ye angel yet value visviiid half angel iiisiiiid ordeyned also newe coyne grotes halfe grotes pen whych lasse weyght olde grote viiid vnce tha fyne gulde auaused fro xl vnce baser goldes ye rate syluer viii grotes xxxd vunce hyghed xld vunce iiisiid thys mayres yere begynnyng v yere say xxvi day may yere whyt sonday quene elizabeth crowned westmynster wyth great solepnytie whyche season towre nyghte coronacyon amonge many knyghtes bathe made co pany syr thomas cooke syr mathewe phylyp syr rauffe iosselyne syr henry wauyr cytezyns lo thanne made knyghtes anno dni miiiiclxv anno dni miiiiclxvi syr henry wauyr rauffe uerney mercer anno v wyllyam constantyne thys yere saye xi daye moneth february elizabeth pryncesse fyrste chylde kyng edward borne westmynster whose crystenynge done abbaye wyth moste solempnyte bycause kynge assured hys physycyons quene conceyued wyth prynce specyally one named mayster dominyk whose counsayll greate prouysyon ordeyned crystenynge sayde prynce wherfore tolde thys mayster domynyk entente haue greate thanke rewarde kynge stode second chamber quene trauayled myghte fyrste shulde brynge tydynges kynge byrth prynce lastly whan harde chyld crye knocked called secretly ye cha ber dore frayned quene whome answered one ladyes euer ye quenes grace hathe wythin suer fole standeth wythout confused wyth hys answere departed wythoute saynge kynge tyme anno domini miiiiclxvi anno domini miiiiclxvii iohn browne syr iohn yonge grocer henry bryce anno vi iohn stokton thys yere moneth dyed forenamed ry bryce hym chosen immedyatly sheryfe thys yere iohn stokton moneth iuny folowynge certayne actes feates warre doone smythfeld betwene syr antony wy deuyle called lorde scalys vpo one partye bastarde burgoyne chalengour one partye whych lord scalys wan honour sayd bastard fyrste course rennynge wyth sharpe sperys ouerthrowen horse man whyche rage horse sayd bastarde nat violence stroke hys enemy pyke iron standyng vppon foreparte sadell ye lord scalys wherwyth horse beyng blynd bastarde stryken nose thrylles payne thereof mounted hyghe vpon hynder fete fyll bakwarde upon seconde daye met agayne vpon fote faughte wyth theyr ax fewe stroke whan kynge sawe lorde scalys auauntage bastarde ye poynt hys axe vysour enemyes helmet force therof lykely haue borne hym ouer kyng hast cryed rule felde shulde departe spede caste downe warderer whych helde hys hande departed honour lorde scalys bothe dayes upon morow folowynge dayes certayne actes warre done betwene dyuers gentylmen thys lande certayne sayd bastardes seruauntes whyche also englyshmen wan honour thys yere also one named iohn derby alderman moche refused cary paye caryage awaye dede dogge lyenge hys dore vnsittynge langage whyche gaue vnto mayre court alderman demed fyne l poude whyche payde euery peny anno dni miiiiclxvii anno dni miiiiclxviii humfrey heyforde thomas owlegraue anno vii thomas stalbroke thys yere mayre begynnynge viii yere thys kyng edwarde meane vpon saterday next ensuig feest corpus christi dame margarete syster vnto kyng rode thorugh london towarde see syde passe flaunders maryed charlys duke burgoyne named story xi lowys kyng frauce whose departure syr thomas cook late mayre peched treason seruaut lordes wenlokkes called hawkyns request sayd lady margarete vppon suertie suffered go large arrested sent vnto towre goodes seased lorde ryuerse tresourer englande hys wyfe put oute hys house comytted charge mayer whose place laye season sayde syr thomas lyen tyme ye towre brought vnto guyldhal areygned sayde treason quyt sondry enquestes commytted vnto countour bradstrete frome then kynges beche southwark laye wythin sayd pryso tyll hys freendes agreed wyth syr iohn brandon kepar ye sayd pryso take hym home hys place hys great charge remayned prysoner longe whych tyme season lost moch good bothe hys place countre also london vnder gydynge sayde lordes ryuers seruauntes seruauntes syr iohn fogge vndertresourer whych spoyled dystroyed moche thynge ouer moche hys iewelles plate wyth great substaunce marchaundyse cloth sylkes clothes ara dyscouered suche persones hadde betaken sayd goodes kepe came ye treasourers handes sayd syr thomas great enemye fynally many persecucyons loss compelled fyne sette vppon hym offence mysprysyon paye vnto kynge viii thousand poud hadde thus agreed large kynges interest thanne newe trouble agayne quene whyche demaunded hym hys ryght euery thousande li payde vnto kyng way fyne hundreth marke whiche longe sute greate charge conclusion fayne agre gyue greate pleasure besyde many good gyftes gaue vnto counsayll anno dni miiiiclxviii anno dni miiiiclxix symonde smyth wyllyam taylour grocer anno viii wyllyam haryot thys yere xxi day noue bre seruaunt duke exceter named rychard sterys hys iugement drawen thorugh citie vnto towre hyl parted two pesys hede body vpon daye folowynge two persones beyng named one poynys alforde drawe west ward tyborne wha shuld haue ben hanged chartours shewed preserued thys season soon erle oxenford tyme taken surmyse ielosy treason awayted deliuered latter ende mayres yere ix yere ye king marchauntes eesterlynges condempned vnto marchauntes auenturers englyssh longe sumptuous exspences lawe kynges counsayll xiiimvc xxli whereof payment kept secret frome wryters thys yere dyssymuled fauoure whiche betwene kyng erle warwyke styll contynued syne maryage quene beganne appere moche erle wythdrewe hym frome kynge confedered vnto hym duke clarence hadde maryed hys doughter whereupon common north beganne rebell chase theym capytayne whome named robyn ryddysdale whyche dyd many feates lastly bare hym wysely hys co pany pardoned kyng rumour styrryng lord ryuers syr iohn hys sonn maryed old duchesse northfolke lyenge place charynge crosse called muys taken lyncolnshyre men brought vnto northamto beheded anno domini miiiiclxix anno domini miiiiclxx rycharde gardyner rycharde lee grocer anno ix robert drope thys yere soone alhalowen tyde proclamacios made thorugh cytye london kynge hadde pardoned northyrnme theyr ryot aswell deth lorde ryuers dyspleasures tyme done soone vppon thys new styrryng bega lyncoln shyre whereof occasyoner lorde wellys fame went whome kynge sent fayre meanes promysyng hym go safe come safe sayd trouth hys commyng kyng suche promyse nat shortly beheded february folowyng medyacyon lordes treatye vnytie concorde laboured betwene kyng hys brother erle warwyke whyche cause sayd erle came thanne vnto london shortly came sayd duke vpon shrouesonday folowyng vpon thuysday folowyng kynge sayde duke mettte baynardes castell ye duchesse yorke theyr mother laye whyche passetyme ye erle warwyke retourned warwyke gadered stregth myght make reported lyncolnshyre syr robert wellys sonne vnto lorde wellys put deth thys whyle also assembled greate bend men purposed gyue kyng felde whyche tydynges whane kynge assertayned wyth sayd brother duke spedhim north warde whyle sente sayd syr robert wellys wyllyng sende home hys people come hym shulde haue hys grace answered like promysse hys father dysceyued shulde hys example conclusyon whan kynge wyth hys power drewe nere vnto hi toke suche fere fledde soone taken syr thomas dymmok knyght whyche shortly put deth thys season duke clarence departed frome kynge gone vnto erle warwyke take hys parte whome kynge lykewyse sente yt shuld come hys presence wythout fere vnto made fayned answere consyderynge theyr lacke power agayne ye kyng departed wente see syde sayled fraunce requyred xi lowys kyng regyon wolde ayde assyste restore kynge henry hys ryghtfull enherytaunce wherof sayd lowys beyng gladde grauted vnto theyr requeste helde whyle wyth counsayll quene margarete prouyded theyr retourne englande whan sayde lordes thus departed lande kyng comau ded proclaymed rebelles traytours thorugh oute hys realm easter weke folowynge syr geffrey gate one named clapha whyche entended south ampton haue taken shyppynge haue sayled sayde lordes taken lorde hawarde sente vnto warde whych sayde clapham beheded soone sayde syr geffrey gate fande suche frendshyp lastly escaped delyuered yode seynt wary thanne lorde saynte iohns arrested instaunce archebysshop caunterbury went season large vnder suerty fynally commytted towre whych passetyme erle oxenforde gat ouer vnto foresayd lordes thus enduryng thys trouble stirrynge made north partyes lord fitz hugh wherfore kyng sped hym thyderwarde soone sayd lord knewe kynges comyng anone lefte hys peple fledde scotlande kyng whych tha commyn yorke rested hym season moneth septembre x yere kyng forsayd duke clarence accopanyed wyth erles warwyke penbroke oxenforde many gentylmen landed dartmouth deuynshyre made theyr proclamacyons name kyng henry vi drewe ferther lade wherof herynge common coutre drewe vnto theym greate companyes kentyshemen beganne wylde assembled theym great companyes came vnto partyes cytye london rad lyffe saynte katherynes place robbed spoyled flemynges bere house came tha foresayde lordes holding theyr iournaye drewe towarde ye kynge beyng northe aboue sayde wherof beyng warned hauyng wyth hym small strength wherof hym nat trusty wyth secret company toke next waye toward wash lyncolneshyre passed ouer wyth great daunger nat wythout losse dyuers hys company passed coutrees flaunders stynted nat tyll came charles hys brother thanne duke burgoyne wyth whome rested season wha quene towre harde kynges auoydynge anone departed frome then yode vnto westmynster regystred selfe seyntwary woman lyke wyse dyd many kynge edwardes frendes begynnynge octobre syr geffrey gate till tyme holden sayde seyntwary wyth hym wente vnto prysons aboute london suche fauoure vnto toke sette lybertye shypmen euyll dysposed persones drewe sayd geffrey gate robbed agayn berehouses set fyre resorted vnto gate cytye wolde haue entred force cytezeyns wythstode theym wyth suche force compelled departe then upon xii day october towre gyue vp appoyntmet kyng henry take lodgyng laye lodged kynges lodgyng wythin sayde towre whyche passetyme duke forsayd lordes drewe nere vnto cytye vpon saterday nexte folowyng sayd duke accompanied wyth ye erles warwyke shrowysbury lord stanley rode vnto towre wyth honour reuerence fet kynge henry conueyed hym poulys lodged hym bysshoppes palays tha admytted taken kyng thorugh lande readoptio henrici vi henri ye vi name edwarde ye iiii put agayne restored crowne englande daye octobre yere grace miiii clxix x yere edwarde ye iiii xii yere xii lowys kynge fraunce whose begynnyng readopcyon erle worceter whych hys cruelnesse called bochier england taken putte streyght pryson vppon xv daye october sayde erle aregned westmynster whyte hall endyted treason vpon modaye folowyng adiuged shulde go frome place vnto towre hylle haue hys hede smytten commynge sayde place iugemente toward execucyon people presyd inportunatly vpon hym se beholde hym sheryfes fayne tourne flete borowe gayoll hym nyght vpon morowe afternoone beynge saynt lukys day xviii daye octobre ladde towre hylle toke deth full paciently whose corp borne wyth hedde vnto blacke freres honourably buryed chapell standynge body churche whych tyme founded dayly awaytynge vpon see syde landyng quene margaret prynce edwarde sonne also prouysyon made defence landynge kynge edwarde hys company anno domini miiiiclxx anno domini miiiiclxxi iohn crosby anno henrici vi primo iohn stokton mercer iohn warde anno edwardi iiiix thys yere whyche ye ende x yere kyng edwarde beginnyng readopcion kyng henry meane thyrde daye nouembre quene elizabeth beynge sayde westmynster seyntwary lyghted fayre prynce wythin sayd place sayd chylde wythout pope crystened whose godfather abbot pryour sayd place lady scrope godmother xxvi daye sayd moneth folowyng began parlyament frome then proroged paulys cotynued tyll cristmas parlyamente syr thomas cooke trowbeled haue shewed vii yere kynge edwarde put byll common house restored lorde ryuers landes occasyoners hys trowble summe xxiim marke whyche hadde good comforte haue ben allowed kynge henry prospered rather commo house therwyth man great boldnesse speche well spoken syngulerly wytted well reasoned durynge thys parlyament kyng edward proclaymed vsurper crowne duke glouceter hys yonger brother traytour attaynted auctorytie sayd parlyament vppon xiiii daye february came duke exceter london xxvii daye ye sayde moneth rode erle warwyke thorugh ye citie toward douer haue receyued quene margarete dyspoynted wynde contrary laye see syde taryeng conuenyent wynde nouember tyl apryll sayde erle longe taryed see syde fayne retourne without spede hys purpose thus duryng thys queysy seaso mayre ferynge retourne kynge edwarde fayned hym syke kepte hys house great season whych tyme syr thomas cooke whyche admytted hys former rome sette place allowed hys deputye whych tourned hys greate trowble sorowe fynally begynnynge moneth apryll kynge edwarde landed north place called rauynspore wyth small co pany flemynges yt hys company exceded nat ber persones drewe hym towarde yorke makyng hys proclamacyons wente name kyng henry shewed people came none entent onely clayme hys enherytaunce dukedome yorke passed countres tyll came cytye yorke cytezyns helde hym oute tyll knew hys entent whan shewed vnto theym done vnto confermed othe receyued refresshed certayne tyme departed helde waye towarde london passed fauoure fayer wordes dauger lorde marquys mountagu whyche costes laye awayte hym purposely stoppe hys way people dowble bre kyng edwarde fyghtynge men wha kyng edwarde thus passed sayd marquys sawe hys strength greatly amended also dayly peple drewe hym made proclamacyons hys owne name king englande helde hys iournay tyll came vnto london whyche passetyme meane vpon sherethursdaye archebysshoppe yorke beynge londo wyth kyng henry entent moue people hertes towarde ye kyng rode towne wyth hi shewed hym people whyche rather withdrewe menes hertes wyse thys season also syr thomas cooke beforenamed auoyded lande entedyng haue sayled fraunce taken shyp flaunders hys sonne heyre wyth hym sette pryson many dayes lastly delyuered vnto kyng edwarde vpon sherethursdaye noone kynge edwarde receyued cytye rode poulys offered ye roode north dore done yode incontynently bysshoppes palays fande kynge henry almoste alone lordes mornynge hym whan harde king edwardes commynge anone fledde euery man fayne gladde saue hym selfe king edwarde lodged hym kynge henry laye put hym vnder safe kepynge soo rested hym tyll easter euyn upon whyche euyn heryng hys brother comynge ye lordes wyth hym wyth strog hoste vnto saynt albonis sped hym thyderward lay nyght barnet whyche season duke clarence contrary hys othe promyse made vnto frenche kynge refused tytle kyng henry sodaynly wyth strengthe hadde rode streyghte vnto hys brother kynge edwarde wherwith lordes somdeale abasshed whyche wythstandynge sayd lordes specyall comforte exortacyon erle oxenforde sayde helde theyr iournay toward bernet sayd erle oxenford beyng vawarde came vnto ye playne without bernet pyght theyr felde vpon ye morowe beynge easter daye xiiii daye apryll erly hostes mette wherupo one party two knyges present hery vi whych kynge edward brought thyder hym kyng edward iiii vpon partye duke exceter lorde marquys mountagu two erlys warwyke oxenford wyth many men name sayd erle oxenforde company quyt manfully bare ouer parte feeld whyche sette vppon ferforthly ye tydynges came london kynge edwarde loste felde yf hys men kepte theyr araye fallen ryfflyng lykely hadde bene tolde vyctory hadde fallen partye longe cruell fyght conclusyon kyng edwarde optayned vpper hande slewe hys ennemyes marque mountagu erle warwyk hys brother wyth many vppon kynges party slayne lorde barnes comos vppon bothe partyes slayne vpon xvc men mo mystes impedymentes whyche fyll vpon lordes party reason incantacyons wrought fryer bugey ye fame wet lyst wryte trouth thys vyctory thus wonne kynge edwarde sente dede corp sayd marquys erle warwyke vnto poulys chyrche laye two dayes naked ii coffyns euery man myghte beholde se theym none came kyng edwarde agayn vnto london offered ye roode north dore poulys rode vnto westmynster lodgyd hym soone kynge thus passed tho ough cyty kyng henry brought rydynge longe gowne blewe veluet conueyed thoroughe chepe vnto westmynster frome then vnto towre remayned prysoner hys lyues tyme repossessyon edwarde iiii edward iiii named began agayne domynyon ouer realme england xiiii daye apryll ye begynnyng yere lord miiiiclxxi xii yere lewys frenche kynge reposseded thynges hadde done sayde two corp hadde lyen poules openly sondaye tyll tuysdaye hadde then buryed ye kynge wolde assygne kynge beynge authoryte made prouysyon defence landynge quene margaret hyr sonne whyche thys whyle laye see syde taryenge wynde lastely landed came strength frenchme farre within lande vyllage called tewkysbury kyng mette wyth hyr dystressyd chasyd company slewe many whyche batayle taken syr edward sonne brought vnto kynge kynge questyoned sayd syr edwarde hadde answered vnto hym cotrary pleasure thenne strake hym wyth hys gauntelet vpon face whiche stroke hym receyued kynges seruauntes inco tynently slayne vpon iiii daye moneth may whan kynge edwarde thus subdued hys enemyes anone sent quene margarete vnto london restyd season fynally sent home countre goodes syr thomas cook agayne ceasyd hys wyfe put forth commaunded kepte mayer uppon xiiii daye may folowynge bastarde fawconbrydge vnto hym gaderyd ryottous euyll dysposyd companye shypmen wyth also assystence ye comons essex kent came greate multytude vnto cyty london sayd copany denyed passage thorough cytye set vpo dyuers partyes therof bysshoppes gate algate londo brydge alonge water syde shotte gonne arowes fyred gate wyth cruell malyce bysshops gate algate faught fyersly wanne ye bulwerkes algate entred certayne wythin gate cytesyus wyth comfort ayde robert baset alderman assygned gate wythstode sayd rebelles manfully slewe entred gate compellyd ye drawe backe forsoke gate uppon cytesyns pursued chased theym vnto forther stratforde slewe toke many prysoners wherof herynge whyche assayled partes cytie fledde lyke wyse cytesyns pursued farre depforde sleynge takyng prysoners great nomber raunsomed hadde ben frenchemen bastarde hys shypme chasyd vnto theyr shyppes lyenge blackwall chase many slayne sayde bastarde nyghte folowynge stale hys shyppes ye ryuer departed escaped tyme vpon assencyon euyn next ensuynge corp henry vi late kynge brought vnreuerently tower thorough high stretes cyty vnto poulys chyrche lefte nyght vppon morowe conueyed wyth gleyuys wepens thyder brought vnto chertyssey buryed deth prince dyuers tale tolde moste comon fame went stycked wyth dagger handes duke glouceter whyche edwarde iiii vsurped crowne kyng shall appere kyng edwarde thys victory thus hadde tewkesbury retourned vnto london vpon mondaye folowynge assencyon daye toke hys iournay kent hauyng hym strength people sette hys iustyces made inquysycyons ryot done bastarde hys accessaryes whyche caunterbury good townes kent dyuers put execucyon hedes sent vnto london set vpon brydge lyke maner inquysycios made essex also put execucyon whyche capytayne named spysynge hanged hys hede set vpon algate many ryche common kent set greuous fynes selfe theyr seruauntes kyng hadde thus spedde iournaye retourned came londo vpon whytson euyn done soone bysshop neuyll archebysshop yorke sent vnto guynes kepte prysoner longe thys brother lorde marquys mou tagu erle warwycke also ende thys mayer yere forenamed bastarde fawconbrydge taken southamton put execucyo whose hed sent london pyght vpon london brydge among anno dni miiiiclxxi anno dni miiiiclxxii iohn aleyn wyllyam edwarde grocer anno xi iohn chelley thys yere erle oxenforde whych syn season barnet felde hadde holden saynte myghellys mounte appoyntement taken then shortely sente castell guynes remayned prysoner tyl last yere rycharde thyrde whyche vppon xii yeres whyche season lady hys wyfe myghte neuer suffered come hym hadde thynge lyue vpon people theyr charytees wold gyue myghte get wyth nedell suche connyng exercysed anno domini miiiiclxxii anno domini miiiiclxxiii iohn browne wyllyam hampton fysshemonger anno xii thomas bledlow thys yere vpon syxt day october beganne parlyament westmynster authoryte wherof ayde grauted kynge towarde greate charge hys warres whyche leuyed mennes landes well lordes mayre aboue corrected sore bawdes strumpettes caused theym ladde aboute towne raye hoddes vpon theyr heddes dyuers many spared none mede fauour yt lawe attayned withstandyng myghte haue taken xl redy money hym offered haue spared one ye iugemet anno dni miiiiclxxiii anno dni miiiiclxxiiii wyllyam stocker iohn tate mercer anno xiii robert byllysdon thys yere duke exceter fouden deed see bytwene douer calays drowned certaynte knowen thys mayer yere also one wyllyam oldhall condempned vnto draper londo called chyrstofer colyns whych condempnacyon remayned prysoner ludgate wherupo season went large wyth keper brake hym escaped taken broughte agayne sayd prysone wythstandynge sayde chrystofer sued sheryffes caused spende great money defendyng hys accyon fynally fayne way compremyse gyue vnto hym hundreth marke hys duytye lxxx odde thys yere one iohn goo loller brent ye tower hyll heresye whyche dy er delyuered robert byllydon one sheryffes put execucyon none wherfore lyke charytable man hadde hym home house exorted hym shulde dye crystenman renye fals errours longe exortacyon herde requyred sheryffe myghte haue mate sayde sore hungred sheryffe commaunded hym mete wherof toke ayled nothynge sayd suche stode hym eate good competent dyner shall passe lytle sharp shower go souper dyned requyred myghte shortely ladde hys execucyon anno dni miiiiclxxiiii anno dni miiiiclxxv edmonde shaa robert drop draper anno xiiii thomas hylle thys yere kynge entendyng make vyage ouer see fraunce called hym lordes seuerally bothe spyrytuall temporall know theyr good myndes theyr free wylles wolde ayde depart wyth hym towarde sayd vyage hadde knowen theyr good dysposycion hym warde sent mayre london hys brotherne alderman seuerally examyned exorted ayde assyst hym toward sayd iournay whyche mayre hys parte graunted xxxli alderman xx marke leest xli done sent trusty comoners wythin sayde cytye exorted lyke maner whyche party grau ted hym wage halfe man yere whyche amounted iiiilixisiiiid yt rode parte lande vsed people fayre maner reysed therby notable sumes money whyche waye leuyeng thys money named benyuolence kyng thus hauyng greate substaunce goodes made purueyannce sayd iournaye vppon iiii daye iuly folowyng xv yere reygne rode goodly copany thorugh cytye towarde see syde spedde hym caleys frome then fraunce wherof herynge lewys french kynge assembled hys people greate nomber spedde hym toward kynge bothe hostes met within shorte space suche offer pea proferyd frenche kyng fynally bothe prynces agreed vpon pea terme theyr lyues yere wryters haue perfourmaunce whyche sayde pea bothe prynces met vpon ye day decollacyon saynte iohn baptyste xxix daye auguste place named frenche pynyak iiii daye noue ber affermeth gaguinus yt stande wyth kynge edwarde receyued agayn lo retourne frauce xxviii daye september thys place ryuer vppon whych brydge made wyse bothe prynces theron myght mete wyth suche company eyther appoynted also ordeyned place partycyon bytwene prynces yt nother myghte entre vnto made wyth lowpe eyther myghte se take eyther hande daye lymyted eyther mette wyth hostes standynge certayne distaunce ryuers syde conuenyent araye sayde kynges salutacyon due made eyther longe comunycacyon conclusyon wherof sayth gaguyne pea co fyrmed bytwene bothe realmes vii yeres perfourmauce wherof affermeth sayde authour frenche kynge gaue vnto kyng edward incotinently lxxvm crownes golde yerely durynge ye sayde vii yeres lm crownes receyued hande accomptyng euery crowne iiiisxvmli yerely xmli whych sayde xvmli sayd freche kyng borowed cytesyns parys thys treuce pea thus concluded bytwene two prince anone theyr sonderyng ploclamacios made therof thorough bothe hostes commaundement gyuen capytayns shulde prouyde theyr retourne homewarde soone vppon french kynge sent vnto duke clarence glouceter lordes kynge edwardes fauour greate costyous gyftes nyse wanton dysgysed apparell kyng lewys ware vppon hym tyme metyng myght make longe rehersall shulde sownde dyshonour suche noble man apparayled lyker mynstrell tha prynce royall therfore passe ouer yt newfangyll clothynge yet many vertues wherof largesse one appered sondy gyftes gaue vnto sodry straugers story somdeale haue towchyd also bounty apperyd gyfte yt gaue vnto ye lorde hastynges lord chaberlayn xxiiii dosen bollys wherof halfe gylt half whyte weyed vpo xvii noble euery cup retourne vnto kynge edward trouth yt ye coformacyon ye foresayde pea kynge edward returned calys shypped sped hym yt vpon xxviii day septeber folowynge great tryumghe receyued mayre cytesyns londo blakheth honour conueyed thorough cytye vnto westmynster mayre alderman beynge cladde scarlet comoners ye nomber vc murrey anno dni miiiiclxxv anno dni miiiiclxxvi hugh bryce rober basset salter anno xv robet colwych thys yere mayre dyd sharp correccyon vppon baker makynge lyght brede moch set dyuers vpon ye pyllory amonge whyche moneth iohn mondue baker punysshed moneth one named wyllya hubbard also shryned lyke offence woman named agnes deynty also punisshed selling false myngyd butter anno domini miiiiclxxvi anno domini miiiiclxxvii rycharde rawson rauffe iosselyn draper anno xvi wyllyam horne yere mayre hauyng great mynde haue walles cytye repayred cosente benche comyn cou sayle caused felde serched prouyded bryk lyme fyrste caused erthe dyggyd tempred sette men werke moolde thenne sent west countre purueyed wode bren done sente kent purueyed chalke shortely brought sayde felde ryght kylle whych season hadde prouyded brent made lyme great fortheraunce werke mayre beynge purueyed bryk also lyme whyche brent within sayd caused consent comen counsayle graunted euery parysshe chyrche euery sondaye euery parysshon shulde paye toward charge vd ensample felysshyppes caused owne company make mych walle strechyth frome chyrche alhalowen wythin sayde walle vnto bysshoppes gate whyche presydent caused worshypfull felysshyppes make parter appereth newe made part therof done thys yere hys procurynge callynge vppon hym whych wonderfull myche shulde spedde one yere consyderynge puruyaunce stuffe whych ben suffycyent man haue purueyed hole yere anno dni miiiiclxxvii anno dni miiiiclxxviii henry colet humfrey heyforde goldsmyth anno xvii iohn stocker thys yere meane xvii daye february duke clarence seconde brother kynge thanne beynge prysoner towre secretely put deth drowned barell maluesye wythin sayde towre thys mayre thys yere pursued also reparacyon wally dylygently hys predecessour dyd wherfore sped myghte haue bene also syke feble man sharpe quycke mynde one cause whych ensueth generalyte partye one mayre wyll fynysshe thynge whych begynneth thynke dede neuer good profytable honoure therof shalbe ascrybed begynner fynyssher whyche lacke charyte desyre veyn glory causeth many good actes dedes dye growe mynde ye greate decaye comon weale cytye anno dni miiiiclxxviii anno dni miiiiclxxix robert hardynge rycharde gardyner mercer anno xviii robert byfelde thys yere great mortalyte deth london many partyes thys realme whyche began latter ende septeber precedynge yere contynued thys yere tyll begynnynge nouember whyche passe tyme dyed innumerable people sayde cytye many place ellys yere also mayre beyng poules knelyng hys deuocyos saynt erkenwaldys shryne robert byfelde one shyryffes vnauysedly knelyd downe nyghe vnto mayre wherof mayre resonyd hym layde hys charge beynge somdele rude lacke connynge answered mayre stubbernly wolde aknowe hys offence wherfore mayre shewed hys behauour worde dede vnto benche authoryte wherof ye mater ben length debated sayd robert fyned l pounde payed towarde reparacion conduytes anno dni miiiiclxxix anno dni miiiiclxxx thomas ilam bartylmewe iamys draper anno xix iohn warde yere one called robert deynys presumed mary orphan wythout lycence ye mayre alderman offence demyd paye chamber fyne xxli yere moneth iiii felowes hanged towre hylle incontynently theyr bodyes wyth gybbet brent vnto asshes whych execucyon robbed chyrche entreated sacramet aulter inreuerently anno domini miiiiclxxx anno domini miiiiclxxxi wyllyam danyell iohn browne anno xx wyllyam bacon thys yere kynge edwarde requyred great sumes money hym lent ye cytesyns london dyuers assembles grauted lende vnto hym v thousande marke leuyenge wherof man chosen euery ward meane xxv men whych xxv person assembled guyldhalle sessyd cyty ouer wyth two person euery parysshe assygned whyche sayd v thousand marke repayed yere folowynge anno dni miiiiclxxxi anno dni miiiiclxxxii robert cate wyllyam haryat draper wyllyam wykyng anno xxi rycharde chawry thys yere moneth february ende ianuary dyed wyllyam wykynge one sheryffes imedyately chosen rycharde chawry moneth iuly folowynge ye kyng rode huntynge forest waltham commauded mayre wyth certayne hys brotherne come gyue attendauce vppon hym wyth certayne comeners cytye com kynge caused game brought yt sawe course course many der bothe rede falowe slayne goodly spo passyd kynge commaunded hys offycers brynge mayre hys company vnto pleasaut lodge made grene bowys garnysshed wyth table thynges necessary set dyner serued wyth many deynty dysshes dyuers wynes good pleynty whyte rede claret caused set dyner seruyd hys owne ouer caused lorde chamberlayn wyth lordes hym assygned chere sayde mayre company sondry tymes whyle dyner theyr departynge gaue vnto venyson greate pleynty ye moneth august folowynge kynge hys greate bounte sente vnto mayresse systers aldermennes wyfes two harte vi buckes wyth tonne wyne drynke wyth sayd venyson whyche venyson wyne hadde vnto draper halle whych place day assygned mayre desyred alderme theyr wyfes wyth sondry comoners venyson wyth many good dyshes eryn sayd wyne merely dronken cause whyche bounty thus shewed kynge moste men toke mayre marchaut wonderous auentures many sondry countrees reason wherof kynge yerely hym notable summes money hys customes besyde pleasure yt hadde shewed kynge tymes anno dni miiiiclxxxii anno dni miiiiclxxxiii wyllyam whyte edmonde shaa goldsmyth anno xxii iohn mathewe yere meane ye mayre begynnynge xxiii yere kynge westmynster vppon ix daye apryll dyed noble prynce edwarde iiii late kynge englande whose corp conueyed wyth due solemnyte vnto wyndsore honourably buryed hadde reygned reken hys begynnynge lande tyme full xxii yeres moch iiii daye marche vnto ix daye apryll leuynge hym ii sonnes say prynce edward hys eldest sonne rycharde duke yorke iii doughters elysabeth quene cecyle katheryne edwarde v edward v name sonn vnto edwarde ye iiii beganne hys reygne ouer realm englad ye xi day apryl beginnyng yere lord god miiiiclxxxiii xxiiii yere xi lewys kynge fraunce anone kynge edward iiii dede grudge vnkyndnesse beganne take place bytwene kynges quenes allye ye lorde marquys dorset brother vnto quene hys affynytye hadde rule kepyng thys yonge kynge whyche tyme hys father deth age xi yere beyng hys guydyng ye marche walys coueyed hym toward london make prouysyo hys coronacyon necessary thynges hys weale duke glouceter brother vnto edward iiii entendynge otherwyse shall appere wyth competent nober gentylme north clad blacke met ye kynge stonyngstratforde dyssymuled countenaunce made bytwene hym forsayd marquys dischargyd rule ye king toke vpon hym rule fro then beynge accompanyed duke buckyngham broughte kynge honour toward londo wherof heryng quene elysabeth moder vnto kyng feryng sequele thys besynesse went toke sentwary within westmynster wyth yonger sonne rycharde duke yorke kynge drawynge nere vnto cytie vpon iiii day maye mayre hys cytesyns mette harnesey parke ye mayre hys bretherne beynge clothed scarlet cytesyns vyolet nober v hondred horse then conueyed vnto cytye kynge beynge blewe veluet hys lordes seruautes blacke clothe coueyed vnto byshoppes palays london lodgyd shortely sayd duke glouceter inueleged archbisshop cauterbury named bowchyer went wyth hym quene elysabeth made suche assured promyse sayde quene vppon sayd archbyshoppes promyse delyuered vnto yonger sonne duke yorke sayde duke caused kynge remoued vnto towre hys brother hym quene fayre promyses made kept doughters wythin foresayde seyntwary duke lodged hym selfe crosbyes place bysshoppesgate strete prouision made kynges coronacyo whyche passe tyme duke beynge admytted lorde protectour caused syr antony wydyuyle called lorde scalys brother vnto ye quene vertuous knight wyth lorde rycharde quenes sonne syr rycharde hawte syr thomas uaghan knyghtes beheded pountfreyt wyll iustyce lorde protectour furtheryng purpose cuyll entent sente partie noble lade behaued hym couertly hys matyers fewe vnderstode hys wykked purpose dayely kepynge holdynge lordes counsayll felynge theyr myndes sodaynly vppo xiii daye iuny beynge wythin towre counsayll chambre wyth dyuerse lordes wyth hym duke bukkyngham erle derby lord hastynges tha lord chaberlayne wyth dyuerse owte crye hys assent treason made vtter chambre wherwyth sayd lorde protectour beyng warned roose vp yode hym selfe chaumber dore receyued persones appoynted execute hys malycious purpose whych incontynently set hande vpon forenamed lord chamberlayne whyche styrrynge erle derby hurt face kept whyle vnder holde comaundemente sayd lorde protectour sayde lord chamberlayne haste ladde court playn chapell towre stadeth wythout iugemet loge tyme co fessyon repentauce vpo ende loge great tymber logge whyche laye wyth repayrynge sayd towre caused hys hedde smyten knewe well wolde nat assente vnto hys wycked entent whose body wyth hed caryed vnto wyndesore buryed tombe kyng edwarde whyche cruelte thus done shortely set sure kepynge suche persones suspected agayne hym wherof bysshoppes yorke ely ii said erle derby fere hys sonne lord strange lest shuld haue arered chesshyre lancastershyre agayne hym set large began loge couert dyssymulacion whyche lord protectour ben craftly shadowed breke large moche vppo sondaye folowyng poules crosse hym selfe wyth duke bukkyngham lordes beyng present mouth doctor rafe shaa tyme hys sermon shewed openly ye chylderne kynge edward iiii nat legytymat ryghtfull enheritours crowne wyth many dyslaunderous wordes preferryng tytle sayd lord protectour dysanullynge greate abucion audiece excepte suche fauoured mater whyche fewe noumbre yf trouth playnesse myghte haue ben shewed whyche declaracyon fame wente sayde doctour shaa toke suche repentaunce lyued lyttell prosperytie wondered wolde take vppon hym suche besynesse consyderynge famous man bothe hys lernynge also naturall wytte vppon tuysdaye folowynge assemble comons cytye appoynted guyldhalle beynge present duke buckyngha wyth lordes sente downe frome sayde lorde protectour presence mayre comynaltye rehersed ryght tytle lorde protectour hadde preferred hys hys brother kynge edwarde ryght crowne englande whyche processe eloquent wyse shewed vttred wythout impedyment spyttynge countenaunce longe whyle wyth great sugred wordes exhortacyon accordynge sentence many wyse man day merueyled commended hym good orderynge hys wordes entent purpose whyche theruppon ensued uppon thursdaye next ensuynge beynge xx daye iuny sayde protectoure takynge vppon hym kynge gouernour realme went wyth great pompe vnto westmynster toke possessyon beynge sette greate halle see royall wyth ye duke norffolke called lorde hawarde vppon ryght hande duke suffolke vppon left hande royall othe taken called hym iudges lawe gyuynge vnto long exhortacyon streyght comaundemet ye mynystryng hys lawes execute iustyce delaye whyche possessyon takynge ceremony done conueyed vnto kynges palays wythin westmynster lodgyd whyche passe tyme prynce ryght kynge edwarde v wyth hys brother duke yorke put vnder suer kepynge wythin towre suche wyse neuer came abrode thus ended reygne edwarde v borne name kynge space two monethes xi dayes vppon frydaye beynge xxii daye iuny sayd lord protectour proclaymed thorough cyty kyng england name rychard thyrde soone fere quenes blode whyche ielousy sent strength men north came shortely london lytell
