hys coronacyon mustred feldes well vppon iiiim men theyr beste iackes rusty salattes wyth fewe whyte harneys burnysshed sale shortely hys coronacyon countermaunded home wyth suffycyent rewardes theyr trauayll whyche foresayd passe tyme ye marquys dorset brother vnto quene elysabeth yt fled escaped many wonderfull daungers bothe london ely place wherof wryte maner cyrcumstaunce wolde aske longe great leysour rycharde thyrde richarde ye thyrde name son rycharde late duke yorke yongeste brother vnto edwarde ye iiii late kynge began domynyo ouer realme englande xx day mydsomer moneth yere lorde god mcccclxxxiii xxv yere xi lewys kynge frauce tedyous wryte tragedyous hystory excepte remeber good wryte put reme brauce punyshement synners ende may exchew fall lyke daunger foloweth anone thys man taken vpon hym fyll great hatred party noble hys realm mych suche loued praysed hym wolde haue ieoparted lyfe good wyth hym yf hadde remayned styll tectour murmured grudged agayne hym suche wyse fewe none fauoured partye except drede great gyftes receyued hym meane wherof wanne dyuers folow hys mynde whiche deceyued hym coronacyon solepnysed whyche holden westmynster vi daye iuly also ye daye crowned dame anne hys wyfe shorte processe folowynge rode northward pacyfye countre redresse certayne ryottes lately done passe tyme iournay beynge yorke created hys legyttymat sonne prynce walys ouer made hys bastarde sonne capytayne caleys whyche encreaced grudge hymwarde shall appere anno dni miiiiclxxxiii anno dni miiiiclxxxiiii thomas norland rober byllysdon haberdassher anno ii wyllyam martyn yere ye foresayd grudge encreasynge myche comon fame wente kynge rycharde hadde within towre put vnto secret deth ye two sonnes hys brother edwarde iiii whych cause hadde within breste duke buckyngham sayde duke secrete maner conspyred agayn hym allyed hym dyuers gentylmen ende brynge hys purpose entente espyed shewed vnto kynge kynge haste sent take hym beynge small acco panyed hys manour brekenok marche walys wherof sayd duke beynge ware hast fled fro hys sayd manour brekenok vnto house seruaunt hys owne called banaster secret maner fewe none housholde seruauntes knewe become whyche passe tyme kynge rycharde thynkynge duke wolde haue assembled people haue gyuen hym batayle gathered hym great strength toke iournaye westwarde haue mette wyth sayd duke whan kyng infourmed fledde anone made proclamacyons myght take sayd duke shulde haue rewarde mli money value hundreth pounde lande yere hym hys heyres euer wherof herynge foresayd banaster mede ye sayd reward fere losyng hys lyfe good dyscouered duke vnto sheryffe shyre caused hym taken brought vnto salysbury kynge laye sayde duke made inportune labour haue commyn kynges presence yet natwythstandynge beheded vpon daye moneth wythout speche syght kynge suche gentylmen apoynted mete wyth ye said duke dysmayde knewe nat myghte fled lande toke seyntwary place myghte wynne vnto theym kyng ende let theyr purpose sente see costes stopped theyr waye myght wyth certeyne strength rode vnto exceter season take syr thomas selenger knyght ii gentylmen one beyng named thomas ramme whyche iii persones shortly beheded soone kent take syr george browne knyghte robert clyfforde esquyer brought vnto towre london vpon daye octobre sayd syr george roberte drawen westmynster vnto towre hyll beheded daye iiii persones lately yomen crowne wyth kynge edwarde iiii drawe southwarke thorugh ye cytie vnto tyborne hanged whan kynge sped hys iournay west coutre hasted towarde london whereof mayre cytezyns hauynge knowlege made prouysyo receyue vpon made puruyaunce horse violet clothyng necessaryes anno dni miiiiclxxxiiii anno dni miiiiclxxxv rychard chester thomas hylle thomas bretayne anno ili raffe astry begynnyng thys mayres yere seconde yere kyng rycharde meane vppon ix daye moneth nouembre mayer hys brethern beyng cladde scarlet cytezyns nombre vc mo vyolet met kynge beyonde kenyngston sutherey brought hym thorugh cytye warde robe besyde blacke fryer tyme lodged short tyme syr roger clyfforde knyght taken aboute southampton then sente towre londo areygned iuged westmynster fro then vpon daye drawe vnto towre hylle whan came fore agayne saynt martyns le graut helpe fryer whiche hys cofessour one theym yt next cordes lowsed cut put hym deuoyr haue entred ye seyntwary lykely ben yt shuld haue done nat ben quycke helpe rescous sheryffes theyr offycers whyche constrayned hym lye downe vppon hardyll newly band hym haryed hym sayde place execucion deuyded two pecys hys body wyth hede conueyed fryeres augustynes buryed saynte katherynes aulter moneth february folowynge dyed rycharde chester one sheryfes whome immedyatly chosen raffe astry contynue yere folowynge kynge rycharde ledynge hys lyfe great agony doubte trustynge fewe suche aboute hym spared nat spende greate treasour whych kyng edward iiii hadde gadered guynge great large gyftes meane wherof alonly wasted nat ye great treasour sayd brother also suche daunger borowed many notable summes money ryche men thys realme specyally cytezyns london wherof leest summe xlli suertye wherof delyuered good suffycyent pledge whyche passetyme many sondry gentylmen diuers sheryffes departed ouer see frauce allyed wyth vertuous prynce henry sonne vnto erle rychemonde dyscended lyneally henry iiii lately kynge thys realme conuenaunted hym wolde mary elizabeth ye eldest doughter edwarde iiii wolde goddes help strength hym kyng england ayde hym suche maner also myght possessed theyr ryghtfull enherytaunce amonge whyche gentylmen syr iamys blount keper castell guynys one hym conueyed erle oxenford longe tofore ben prysoner wythin sayd castell upon whiche agrement thus concluded prouysion theyr frendes made sayle englande thynges prepared sayd prynce wyth small co pany englysshe frenche brytons toke shyppynge fraunce brytayne landed lastly porte mylbourne moneth august whose defence landynge kynge rycharde moche fered lytell made smal prouision whyle foresayde gentylmen dyuers coostes englande escaped abouesayde ouer see affynite one named wyllya colyngbourne taken ben holden season pryson wyth another gentylma named turbyruyle brought vnto guylde hall areygned ye sayd turbyruyle repryed pryson caste sondry treason tyme whyche layde hys charge shulde make derysyo kyng counsayll foloweth pthe catte ratte louell dogge ruleth england vnder hogge whych ment catysby ratclyffe lorde louell ruled land vnder ye kyng whych bare whyte bore conysaunce whyche vppon day put ye cruell deth towre hyll made new payer galowes vpon whych hanged shorte season cutte downe beynge lyue hys bowellys ryped hys bely cast fyre hym lyued tyll boucher put hys hand bulke body moche sayd instat lord iesu yet trouble dyed great compassyon moche people retourne vnto noble prynce hys company whanne commyn vnto lande inco tynently kneled downe vpon ye erth wyth meke countenaunce pure deuocyon began thys psalme iudica deus decerne causam meam c whyche whan fynysshed ye ende kyssed groude mekely reuerently made signe crosse vppon hym commaunded suche aboute hym boldly name god saynte george set forewarde whan landyng thys prynce blowen lande many man drewe vnto hym aswell suche sondry seyntwaryes abrode hys stregth encreased shortly kyng gadered hys power haste spedde hym suche wyse vpon xxii daye august begynnyng thyrde yere hys reygne mette wyth said prynce nere vnto vyllage leycetershyre named bosworth nere vnto leyceter betwene theym foughten sharpe batayll sharper shulde haue ben kynges partie ben fast hym many towarde felde refusyd hym yode vnto partye stode houynge ferre tyl saw whyche partye vyctory fyll conclusyon kynge rycharde slayne vppon hys partye ye duke northfolke tyme named lorde hawarde wyth brakyngbury lieutenaunt towre many amonge taken lyue erle surrey sonne foresayde duke northfolke sent vnto towre london remayned prysoner longe tyme corp rychard late king spoyled naked borne caste behynde man caryed vnreuerently ouertwharte ye horse backe vnto fryer leyceter season lyen men myght beholde wyth lytell reuerence buryed thus misery ended thys prynce whych ruled rygour tyrannye whan great trouble agony reygned vsurped space ii yeres ii monethes ii dayes noble prynce henry admytted kynge proclaymed kyng name ry vii whych sped hi shortly london vpopn xxviii daye sayd moneth auguste mayre citesyns met good araye mayre alderman scarlet cytesyns vyolet harnesey parke frome then conueyed thorugh cytye vnto bysshop londos palays tyme lodged vpon xi day octobre next folowyng beyng swetynge sykenesse newe begon dyed sayd thomas hylle london mayre hym chosen mayre syr wyllyam stokker knyght draper whyche dyed also sayd sykenesse shortly iohn warde grocer chosen mayre whyche contynued tyll feest symonde iude folowynge francia charles ix karolus charles ye ix viii ye name sonn vnto xi lowys bega reygn ouer ye realm frauce fourth daye septembre yere oure lorde god miiiiclxxxiiii secode yere rycharde thyrd ye tyme kyng englande thys charles noble wytte meke condycyo father wolde nat set lernyng letter hys youth leste suche study shulde hys lawfull age haue therby refrayned hym knyghtly marcyall actes whan came mannes astate ryghte sory wolde saye full often hys famylyers prynce greatly blemysshed whan lakketh connynge lecture also hys youth weke impotet lakked natural stregth accordynge hys age moche myght nat go whan shuld ryde alway eyther syde hors ii men stay hym gyue hym lyke attendaunce solempnytie hys coronacyon ended cytye raynes whyche solempnised wyth great pompe vpo ye sonday nerte ensuyng feast saynt denys commission sent coostes hys domynyon enquere superfluous giftes gyuen tyme hys father whyche shortly resumed kynges handes season olyuer damman whome lowys many greate rome offyces set hys dayes hadde hym synguler loue fauoure moche haue shewed ende story sayd lowys made specyall request vnto thys charles hys sonn shuld specyally cherysshe thys sayd damman appeched treason wyth one danyell flemynge whyche inquisycyon theym made bothe lawe lande iuged deth put execucyon hangynge whose deth noble astates realme lytell ruyd consyderyng rome bare kynge lowys dayes ignobilitie byrth handcrafty barbour whose deth metrycyan compyled verse folowyng svnt tua criminibus ridetia tepora tosor currere quae subito uida parc vetat hoc poteras osim soge prenoscere damma vt saltem horr re tollere cede pios te natura humilem cum mater flandra tulisset arte vna noras radere cesariem hunc talem seruum te saepe lutetia vidit tutu ab hac poteras ducere sorte dy raptus ad excelsam lodowici principis aulam mox herebifur surias moribus ante venis et caput huic tendeus du suffers singere ficos pre ducibus regi regulus alter era quid tibi nen sicuit sobeles tam dira neronis nemo non vixit te reserente reus nemo deisacra censuram nemo gerebat gaudia qui renuit premere dona tibi protenus exilium vel mors vel mulcta negantem pressit era iudex lictor exicium regnasti satis est surgunt n ua sedera mundo turba coelestorum territa luce sugit agnosce sor quo te scoelus extulit atrox et te praecepitem depulit laqueos te daniel te dira cohors te menimius odit et scelerum auctorem dampnatet insequitur nescio quid de te superi velfata deponunt seu lictore cades seu cruce liber ea vna tamen vulgi constans sententia furcas expedit vt faciet te periunte odium interea vinctus culpas absterge gemendo peccasti morte est nunc redimenda salus whyche metyr verse theym haue none vnderstandyng latyne maye expouned maner foloweth laughynge tymes wyth theyr crymes spent thou barboure ronne whyche sodayne fate nowe forboden wherof clere entent thou myght haue knowen damma ryght well state whan thou meanes whyche inordynat put vnto deth many innocent man cruell malyce well remembred lowe byrth flaundres thy mother fledde taught crafte well shaue lutecia cytye thou thy lyfe ledde wytnesseth seruaunt therin thy lyuynge craue thy dayes honest lyfe haue whan thou lowys court vp brouht thou mynde thou come nought lyke helle hounde thou waxed full furyous expressynge thy malyce whan thou honour styed thynkynge moche prynce bounteuous hys hed berde nought denyed wyth worldly pleasure also allyed hys prynces makynge hys gouernour thy selfe thou blyndest wyth wordly vayne honour whyche made proude thou sonne harde neron none myght lyue thou accused cryme man cursed none punyssyon wolde thy hande wyth golde gyftes lyme nat hys gyfte offred tyme deth exyle hym soone applyed iuge hangman thou thynge excercysed thou reygned longe ynough spronge newe sterrys worlde fled nowe clerely scelerat flokke wherfore thou barbour yet rewe thyne odyous actes whyche haue sodaynly cast downe welth snare vytterly also daniell thy moste odyous fere dampneth cryme whyche wyth dyeth knowe nat vpper bodyes aboue haue defyned whether sworde gybet thou shuld ende lyfe one thynge approue sentence hooly people sette galowe thou shuld paye deth hys dette inwardly therfore bewayll thyne offence thys deth god thon mayste make recompence thus execucyon thys damman hys felowe ended fynysshed lytell compassion people wythin fewe dayes another affeccionat seruautes kyng lowys named iohn doyacon trespasse hatered hys occasyon deserte vnto common people wyth shame brought vnto ye market place parys beraft bothe hys erys whych vylony hym done ryght banysshed court euer thus two moste special derest beloued seruauntes counsayllours kyng lowys shortly hys deth broughte vnto confusyon reason wherof affermeth myne auctoure gaguyne arose prouerbe among frenche men sayeng principibus obsequi haereditariu non e e whyche meane seruyce prince nat hereditable thys tyme thus passed wyth many matyers whych ouer passe season approched variaunce nny began moue amog noble lade moche ye duke orleaunce dysdayned anne syster kynge wyth suche wolde call counsayll hadde rule kyng wherfore entendyng haue sayde rule moche maryed doughter lowys gadered vnto hym strength knyghtes purposely remoue kyng lyked sette aboute hym suche persones thought conuenyente lacke wyse orderynge hys people neglygence place called saint albynys taken hys aduersaryes kyng commaunded pryson castel byturicece remayned loge tyme nat longe marymylyan whych maryed duke charles doughter burgoyne gathered hys soudyours haue releued foresayd duke orleaunce pryson preuayled nat durynge whyche warre fraunceys duke brytayn dyed whose doughter named anne enherytour duchye maxymylyan hadde trouth plyted hys lawfull wyfe wherfore herynge deth ye sayd fraunceys shortely entred terrytory brytayne seased hys charles frechmen wythstode hym suche force yt constrayned axe helpe soueraygne lord kynge henry ye vii whyche moste bounteous maner ayded assysted hym bothe wyth men money kynges excedyng great charge coste howe ende french kyng entent maryed ye said anne duchesse brytayne refused margarete ye doughter imylyan whyche maryed ambasy haue shewed ende story hys father lowys whych vyctory thus opteyned thys charles brytayn made clayme pretence vnto lande scicilia scicilie exortacion styrryng pope alexader vi wyth strong hoste entred ye bothe lande water whome great ayde duke mylayne whose meanes shortly wan stroge citie towne named campania diuers townes processe naples chyef citie belonged vnto kyng naples moche constrayned alphounce kynge naples scicile forsake countre dominio parte bothe sayde countrees whyche set suche order thoughte conuenyent toke hys iournaye home warde frauce thorough italy whyche passage thys charlys beset uenecyans italyans whyche entendyd haue stoppyd hys waye metyng wyth hym place called latyne fornouiences gaue vnto hym batayle wherof sayth myne authour wan vyctory hys greate honour consyderynge fewe sowdyours agayne theyr multytude strength thys sayenge repugne italyans dwellyng london say yf sayd charlys spedde hym fastly fraunce comen yere eetourned home sauete soone pope alexader foresayd toke dyspleasure agayne ye sayd charlys styrred almost crysten prynces worlde agayne hym hadde hatred great honoure ye freche kynge sayth myne authour gagwyne yt whyche hys werkes extolleth dedes frenchemen forther tha maye veryfyed moch wrytynge wryte pope demyd wolde take great partye agayne charlys exite prynces excepte hadde ben great vrget cause malyce affermeth onely thus sayde gagwyne endeth story sayd charlys yere lorde god miiiic xcv xi yere reygne charlys thanne presently reygnynge guydyng realme fraunce whyche x yere redoutyd prynce kynge henry vii henry seuenth henry vii ye name sonne vnto erle richemout began domynyon ouer realme englande xxii daye auguste ye yere lorde god miiiiclxxxv secode yere viii charlys kynge frauce xxx daye october folowynge great solempnyte ye sayd henry crowned westmynster accordynge fyrste sayenge begynnynge thys rude worke make ende vii parte hole worke vii day nouember yere lord iesu crystes incarnacyon mvc iiii xx yere moste crysten drad soueraygne lorde kynge henry conquest ye name vii whyche expedycyo good exployt haue hadde accomplysshyg thys work wherin included rekyn landynge brute thys ile albyon vnto fyrste yere begynnyng reygne dead sayd souerayne lord iimvic xx yeres agayne salute gyue thankes vnto moste excellent vyrgyn lady saynt mary last vii ioye foresayd vii ioyes begynnynge gaude virgo mater pura c ioyfull glad virgyn moder pure ferme stedfast thy ioye shall abyde vii ioyes shall euermore endure neuer hereafter minishe tyme tyde euer shall encreace ory e abyde worldes euer one laste tyme come tyme preset tyme past thus endyth thys seuenth part fyrst yere wyllyam conquerour ye laste yere rycharde thyrde includeth iiiicxvii yeres lenuoy lima adest praecessit opus ne li idus assis lector habent mendas denia presa suas quoduis ingenium quadam vel parte redundat vel rudu vel mancu est vel graue vel fluidu concio rebra tibi culpatur furta maronis est cicero elumbis pe tibi naso ceser non satis historiae crispi praefatio quadrat nil adeo cultum liuor iniquus habet non minus hoc poterit tantillum capere morsor laeserit illustres cum fera lingua viros sed quid aga residem taxabit inertia mutum scriptorem risor extenuabit inners audendum tamen est spernendi lle latratus occidet busto murmur inuidia whyche verse ben vnlettered may englyshed maner fourme foloweth ende thys boke thys rude warke fyned wherof sence precedyth thou shall rede thou laye clerke enuyous consyder ledyth reygne prynces mendement nedyth thou experte fawtes therof amende hym ascrybe sclaunder dyd well entende consyder euery scyence parte suche rude curyous breef longe blamyn liuins wrote moche uyrgyle cicero amonge scarse salust dytyes songe excelently yet vnblamed men nothynge duely framed syn olde wryters whyche excellent myghte men please wyth theyr famous wrytynge maruayll though whyche neuer connynge h nt myghte order thys mater euery mannys lykynge specyally suche haue theyr delyghtynge euer wyth dysclaunder moste wryters lacke barke whyle maye sette good wryters backe though ignoraunce derysyon ben mette reproue maker shulde good worke theyr malyce lette though grudge scorne yet euery wyse good man wyll take entent prayse maker hym allow hys laborous dede requyre god maye haue hys mede anno domini miiiiclxxxv anno domini miiiiclxxxvi iohn tate hugh bryce goldsmyth anno iohn swan thys yere prest made kynge iimli whyche mercer grocer draper lent ixcxxxviili vi coronacyo holden westmynster xxx day october yere whete iii ye busshell baye salt pryce anno domini miiiiclxxxvi anno domini miiiiclxxxvii iohn percyuall syr henry colet anno ii hugh clopton thys yere kynge maryed kyng edwardes eldest doughter named elizabeth yere slayn stookfelde erle lyncolne moneth septe ber borne prynce arthur anno domini miiiiclxxxvii anno domini miiiiclxxxviii iohn fenkyll wyllyam horne anno iii wyllyam remyngton thys yere quene crowned westmynster vpon saynt katheryns daye yere prest iiiimli wherof mercer grocer draper lent xvic xvili thys yere prest two thousad thys yere iohn ashley wyth two putte execucyon towre hylle anno dni miiiiclxxxviii anno dni miiiiclxxxix wyllyam isaak robert tate mercer anno iiii rafe tynley thys yere comons north slewe erle northumberlande chamberlayne theyr capytayne wyth dyuers yorke hanged thys yere taske tenth peny mennes landes goodes yere felde dykysmew flaunders foughten lorde dawbeney anno dni miiiiclxxxix anno dni miiiicxc wyllyam capell wyllyam whyte anno v iohn brook yere one named roger shauelok slew hym selfe whose goodes besynesse bytwen kynges amner sheryffe amner optayned anno dni miiiicxc anno dni miiiicxci henry coot iohn mathew mercer robert reuell anno vi hugh pemberton yere dyed robert reuel shyryffe stede chosen hugh peberton march syr robert chaberlayne knyght behedyd thys yere great benyuolence graunted vnto ye kynge iournay frauce vnto felysshyp draper graunted felysshyp cytye euery alderma london tyme beynge payed volente nolente two hundreth pound ouer whyche somme comoners somme extedyd ixmviclxxxii lixviisiiiid yere busshell whete xxiid anno domini miiiicxci anno domini miiiicxcii thomas wood hugh clopton mercer anno vii wyllyam browne thys yere yoman crowne named put deth tybourne treason thys yere cytye garnad gotte ye kyng spayn yere syr iamys parker knyght slayne iustynge rychemont gentylman named hugh uaghan also moneth september kynge toke hys vyage towarde fraunce anno domini miiiicxcii anno domini miiiicxciii wyllyam purchase wyllyam martyn skynner anno viii wyllyam welbek thys yere vpon ix daye nouember red letter guyldhall yt shewed pea cocluded bytwen kynges england frauce xvii day december folowynge kynge landed douer saterdaye cristmas came westmynster uppon xvii daye maye iiii men put deth tyborn treason thys yere moneth october ende thys mayres yere fray made vppon eesterlynges comons cytye specyally mercer seruauntes anno dni miiiicxciii anno dni miiiicxciiii robert fabyan rafe astry fysshemonger anno ix iohn wyngar yere ye beginnyng enquery made ye ryot forenamed many yong men punysshed long imprysonment also vpo xxii day february regnyd ye guyldhall iiii person named thomas bagnall iohn scotte iohn heth iohn kenyngton taken saynte martyns seyntwary wherof iii put deth tyborne thomas bagnall vnto towre london xxvi day sayd moneth ye foresayd iii person put execyon willya bulkley yoman kynges chaber duche man thys yere whete vid busshell bay salt iii ob thys yere doctor hylle bysshop lo pursued greuously persy pryour crystes chyrch londo thys yere royall feste kept westmynster halle ye kyng yere ende apryll brent smithfelde olde woman heresye whych called moder lady yonge thys yere xv day august reyned guyldhalle one named iohn norfolk named iohn white couict baudry set vpo ye pillory anno dni miiiicxciiii anno dni miiiicxcv nycholas alwyn rycharde chawry salter anno x iohn warner yere daye ye mayre toke hys charge ye afternone came thorugh cytye henry duke yorke chylde iiii yeres age towarde westmynster rydynge vppon courser many goodly gentylmen conuey hym vpon ix daye nouember folowyng holden goodly iustyse within paleys westmynster wherof chalengeours syr wyllya de la pool duke suffolk therle essex syr robert curson iohn pechy esquyre also yere cristmas sir robert clifford whych fled land came agayne appechyd syr wyllya stanley chamberlayne kynge treason syr wyllyam vpon xvi day february folowynge sayd treason behedyd tower hylle ye season adiudged deth guyldhall deane poulys famous doctour precher prouyncyall blak freres ye pryour langley person saynt stephyns walbroke named doctour sutton syr thomas thwatys knyght robert ratclyffe wyllyam dawbeney willya cressener esquire syr simond mouford knight mo wherof ye part pardoned yere whyte heryng xld barel yere began fyrst trouble syr wyllya capell alderman iuly perkyn rebelles ariued kent named hym selfe rychard seconde sonne edward iiii ye moneth doctour draper perforce borne poulys ladde labehyth varyaunce bytwene bysshoppes canterbury londo soone hanged sundry costes englande c odde person forenamed rebellys thys yere perlyamente holden westmnynster also moneth october excedynge thunder anno dni miiiicxcv anno dni miiiicxcvi thomas kneysworth syr henry colette mercer anno xi henry somyr thys yere xvi daye noueber holden sergeautes feste within bysshop elyes place yere body rychard hakendyes wyfe takyn vp saynt mary hyll chyrche hole yt lyen groud ouer c xx yeres thys yere great bysynesse entercourse bytwene england flaunders yere kynge scottes made sharp warro vppon march yere many lollers stode wyth fagottes poulys crosse anno domini miiiicxxvi anno domini miiiiccxvii iohn shaa iohn tate mercer anno xii rycharde haddon latter ende october great cousayll holden westmynster graunted kynge fer defence scottes cxxmli xviii daye nouember poulys chyrch suspendyd fraye two yonge men moneth grauted ye kyng prest cytye iiiimli moneth calys behedyd lord fitzwater xxi day ianuary parlyament beganne wherby graunted two dymes halfe two aydes two fyftenys leuy foresayd cxxmli moneth iuny xvii day cornyshmen dyscofyted blakheth paragraph vpon xxviii daye iuny smyth gentylman named flamok two capytaynes ye sayd rebelles put execucyon tybourne shortely lorde audeley hed capytayne sayd rebelles put deth ye towre hylle yere concluded maryage bytwene lorde prynce kynges doughter spayne thys yere also kynge sent scotland army vnder ye guydyng erle surrey lord neuyle whyche made sharpe warre vpon ye scottes ye moneth october perkyn landed cornwayle assayled towne exceter townes fynally toke seyntwary beawdely pardoned hys lyfe anno dni miiiicxcvii anno dni miiiicxcviii bartholomewe rede wyllyam purchace mercer anno xiii thomas wyndowght yere vpo xxviii day noueber sayd parkyn brought thorugh cyty vnto towre left prysoner hym tall yoma somtyme sergeaut ferrour kyng whych ferrour one named edwarde shortely put deth tibourn upon saynte nycholas daye proclamacyo made thorugh ye cytye pea bytwene realmes england scotland terme kynges lyues december carpenter called godfrey toke downe wedercok poulys slyple set vp agayne yere crystmas weke part kinges palayes rychemout brent yere vppon ix daye iuny forenamed parkin beyng large kynges court went secretely awaye lastly went fader syon second pardon hym kynge graunted shewed westmynster chepys syde moch wonderment fynally towre keped anno dni miiiicxcviii anno dni miiiicxcix thomas bradbery syr ion percyuale anno xiiii stephyn ienyns thys yere vpo xxx daye octobre came lord price ye cytye wyth honorabell copany toward westmynster vppon shroue tuysdaye put execucio saynt thomas warrynge strepelyng xx yeres age whych auauced hym selfe sonn heyre erle warwykes landes sonne cordyner londo thys yere mayster iohn tate alderma bega ye new edefyinge saynt anthony church yere vpo xvi day iuly beynge sonday vpo sonday folowyng stode xii heretykes poules crosse shryned wyth fagottes anno dni miiiicxcix anno dni mvc iamys wylforde nycholas alwyn anno xv rychard brond yere xvi day noueber areyned ye whyte halle westmynster forenamed parkyn iii whych parkyn one iohn awatyr put shortly execucio tyborne soone erle warwyke put deth towre hylle one blewet astwood tyborne thys yere may kyng quene sayled calays thys yere babra northfolke bret iuly olde heretyke bret smythfelde thys yere great deth londo whereof died ouer xxm age yere dyed doctour morto cardynall chaunceler englande moneth october anno dni mvc anno dni mvci iohn hawys wyllyam remyngton anno xvi wyllyam stede yere xxi daye deceber nyght hydyous thuder yere name kyng palays shene chauged called ye day rychemout yere august departed secretly lade duke suffolke iiii daye october laded plymmowth kateryn doughter ye kyng spayn thys yere fynysshed mayster tate church saynt anthony anno domini mvci anno domini mvcii syr laurence aylemer syr iohn shaa anno xvii henry hede yere began mayre hys bretherne ryde barge place upo sait erke waldes day lord prince maryed kyng spaynes doughter season duke bukkyngham wyth chief chalegeour royall iustyce turney holde palays westmynster thys yere came greate ambassade scotlad reason wherof coclusion maryage made betwene king scottes dame margarete eldest doughter oure soueraygne lord also thys yere excedyng great fysshe taken nere vnto quynbourgh marche syr wyllyam deuynshyre syr iamys tyrell eldest son one named welborne arested treason apryll olowyng dyed ye noble prynce arthur towne ludlow upo ye last day april set vpo ye pyllory ii yogmen defamyng ye kynges cousayll erys cut also aboute thys tyme yt gray fryer copelled take theyr old habit russet ye shepe doth dye vi day maye iamys tyrell syr iohn wyndhm knyght beheded ye towre hyl shypma treason day drawe tyborne haged quartered soone purseuaut named curson yoman called mathew ionys put execucio guynys aydyng syr edmod de la pool also thys yere mydsomer take felowe whych hadde renewed many robi hodes pagetes named selfe greneleef yere bega new werke ye house offyce wythin guyldhall london ende october proclaymed pea betwene king archeduke burgoyne ye sonday saint symod iude shewed bull vertue wherof denouced poules crosse accursed syr edmod de la pool late duke suffolke syr roberte curson knyght v persones ayded agai ye king anno domini mvcii anno domini mvciii goldsmyth henry kebyll bartholmew rede anno xviii nycholas nynys yere bega new werk kynges chapell westmynster vpo xi daye february dyed quene elizabeth within towre lieng chyldbed vpo fyrst sonday let solemply accursed poules crosse wyth bel candell syr edmod de la pool syr robert curson yt ayded agayn kyng thede moneth marche ye pryour ye charterhous shene sinfully murdered wyth muk house synyster meanes munk place named good wyne mischeuous sone yere felisshyp tayllours lo purchased graut king called marchaut tayllours ye viii day august kynge scottes maried vnto ye eldest doughter ye kyng also iuly areyned guyldhall olyuer saynte iohn robert simpson wellys orfi named pool bayly thorok amp iiii beyng cast treason whereof sayde olyuer pool wyth hyppemen putte execucion tyborne pardoned anno dni mvciii anno dni mvciiii draper chrystoffer hawys syr wyllyam capell robert wattes anno xix thomas granger thys yere xiii day noueber palays ye archebysshop cauterbury labehyth holde sergeautes feest xxi day noueber begynnyng ye nyght dredeful fyre vpo north ende londo brydge vppo vii daye ianuary certeyne house cosumed wyth fyre agayn saynt botulphis churche thamys strete upo xxv daye ianuary bega parliamet westmynster ye xxvii day march house bret agayn saynt mattyus le graut day hurt done wyth fyre paryshe faynt peter pore forenamed parlyamet ordeyned new coyne syluer grotes half grotes shyllynges half face forsayde parlyamete graunted kynge ayde xxxvi thousand li correccyon dyuysed clipped grotes anno domini mvciiii anno domini mvcv grocer roger achylley iohn wyngar anno xx wyllyam browne thys yere cytezyns lodon grauted kyng vm marke confermacio theyr lybertyes wherof marke payde hade iiiim mark iiii yeres next ensuyng upo sat george day ye kyng went procession poules church shewed legge saynt george closed syluer whych newly sent kyng vppo xxv day apryll money maker one coyners towre drawe tyborne hanged ye later ende thys yere came thyrde cappe mayntenaunce pope anno domini mvcv anno domini mvcvi fysshemonger rycharde shore thomas kneysworth anno xxi roger groue thys yere vppo xii euyn kinges chaber rychemout bret vpo euyn saynt maury bega hidious wid endured vppo xi dayes folowynge lasse cotynuall blowyng meane whereof wedercok poules blowe downe moche harme done force thys tempest archeduke burgoyne dryue lade west coutre vpo second sonday let stood poules crosse pryour saynt osyes v heretykes ye ende ye moneth march syr edmod de la pool conueyed citie vnto towre left prysoner maye moneth lord burgeueny comytteth towre certayn displeasure whych cocerned treason thys yere new bylded galerey fyll nyght rychemout thys yere ende iuly gracyous myracle shewed oure lady image barkyng mayden chylde carte laden wyth stone yode ouer anno domini mvcvi anno domini mvcvii mercer wyllyam copynger syr rychard haddon thomas iohnson anno xxii wyllyam fytz wyllyam thys yere crystmas baker house warwyke lane bret thys yere wonderfull easy softe wynter stormys frostes yere kyng hys goodnesse delyuered prysons lodo many prysoners laye xl vnder yere thomas kneysworth late mayer hys ii shyreffes condepned kyng great somme money ouer paynfull prysonement theym marshalsy susteyned anno domini mvcvii anno domini mvcviii mercer wyllyam butler wyllyam browne anno xxiii iohn kyrkby thys yere ende april dyed sayd wyllyam browne hym immedyatly chosen syr laurence aylemer resydue yere anno supradicto anno supradicto draper wyllyam butler syr laurence aylemer anno predicto iohn kyrkby thys yere vpon last daye iuny house southwarke nere vnto brydge consumed wyth fyre thys yere syr wyllyam capell agayne put vexacyon sute kynge thynges done hym tyme hys mayralte anno dni mvcviii anno dni mvcix tayllour thomas exmew stephyn ienyns anno xxiiii rychard smyth begynnyng mayres tyme syr wyllyam capell prysonement coutour shyreffes house kynges counsayll commauded towre remayned tyll kynge dyed shortly delyuered wyth many lykewyse syr laurece aylemer dalt comytted warde house rychard smyth shryfe remayned prisoner ye space aboue saydthys yere vppo saterdaye next saynt george day nyght whych saterdaye xxi daye apryll dyed kynge oure soueraygne lorde hys manour rychemount vpon whose soule chrysten iesu haue mercy amen thys foresayd noble prince reygned xxiii yeres vii monethes one daye therof lakkynge thys magnyfycent excellent prynce hery vii thus payed deth dette nature sayd whome suffycient laude prayse nat put wrytyng cosyderyng ye cotynuall peace traquylete whyche kept thys lande comons wyth also subduynge hys outwarde enymyes realmes fraunce scotland hys greate polycy wysedome tha shedyng criste bloode cruell warre euer ruled myghtly hys subgectes mynystred suche iustyce yt nat allonely loued drad hym crysten prynces heryng hys gloryous fame desyrous haue wyth hym amyte allyaunce teporall polycies prouisions exceded prynces hys tyme reygnynge dyuers pope alexander syxte pius iii iulius ii nowe beynge pope theyr tymes eyther sunderly wyth auctorytie co sent theyr spyrytuall deuyne cousayll elected chase thys excellente prynce admytted hym chyefe defensour chrystes church crysten prynces confermacio sente vnto thys inuyncibyll prince iii sundry famous ambassades thre swerdes iii cappes mayntenaunce myght wryte stedfaste contynecy great iustyce mercyfull dealyng thys prynce myght report hys excellete wysedome moste sugred eloquence hys inmouable pacience wonderfull dyscressyon shuld tell beautyfull byldynges excedyng charge manifest reperacios ouer thys hys excedynge treasoure rychesse innumerabyll wolde saye consider order notabyll actes wolde aske loge tract tyme also lyberall somptuous endowemet monastery westmynster wryte myghte conclude yt hys actes passed noble actes hys noble genytours syne conquest may moste cogruly aboue erthly prynces belykened vnto salamo kyng ye israelytes called seconde salomon hys great sapience actes done hys lyuys tyme executed whyche premysses tenderly considered euery naturall englysshma lyuyng hath cause ought deuoutly pray soule moste excellent prynce henry vii maye atteyne celestyall mansio whych trew crysten soules enheritours vnto god hym graunt amen rather exellet vertuous bryngyng leuynge vnto v goddes ayde prouysyon moste gracyous moste ad soueraygne lord henry ye viii name tyghtfull enherytour vnto ii crownes englande fraunce whyche began hys moste gracyous reygne ye xxii day apryll yere oure lord god mvc ix henry viii name second sonne forenamed excellente prynce henry seuith began moste gracyous reygn ouer realme englande xxii daye apryll yere lord god mvc ix whome honour reuerece ioyfull contynauce prosperous reygn pleasure god weale thys hys realme amen thus endeth fabyans cronycle printed w rastell fynysshed laste daye december yere lorde mv c xxxiii cvm privilegio
